Chapter 439: Millennia of Changes

"The fact that you could easily obtain even the entrance exam questions, not to mention other more confidential information..."

The words of the Five Elders Association's cultivator gradually became low and contemplative, clearly lost in thought and speculation.

After a moment, he snapped back to reality and looked at "Zhou Qing'ang."

"Although there were some minor flaws, overall, being able to connect with the organization behind He Zhenghao is a great achievement on your part."

He tossed over a storage ring.

"Inside, you'll find the **Heaven-Devouring Earth-Eating Technique** you wanted, along with some Enlightenment Pills."

"In addition, there's also fifty thousand contribution points worth of spirit stones as a reward for your achievement."

Upon hearing this, Li Fan received the storage ring and checked its contents, his face showing delight.

"Fifty thousand contribution points? Why is the boss being so generous!"

The Five Elders Association cultivator snorted, "Since there is merit, there will naturally be rewards. From now on, while you continue to stay undercover, make sure to maintain your relationship with He Zhenghao."

"If possible, try to extract some information from him about the mysterious organization behind him."

"Of course, if that's not possible, don't force it. Just being able to connect with them and exchange spirit stones for secrets is enough."

Li Fan nodded repeatedly.

"Alright, you can go back now."

"You've been in contact a bit too frequently lately. For the time being, avoid meeting with the boss to prevent any slip-ups."

"If anything unusual happens, you'll be contacted again."

After carefully instructing him, the other person left Youlan Island.

Only then did Li Fan's clone leisurely make his way back.

On Tai'an Island, Li Fan's main body had been waiting for a long time.

"Five hundred and fifty thousand contribution points, three bottles of Enlightenment Pills, the Heaven-Devouring Earth-Eating Technique..."

"This harvest isn't bad at all."

After tallying the items from both the main body and the clone's storage rings, Li Fan nodded slightly.

"With such a large amount of contribution points, whatever I plan next will be much easier."

After just a glance, Li Fan no longer paid attention to the pile of spirit stones.

Once it reaches a certain level, even more just becomes a string of numbers.

Moreover, for someone like Li Fan, who can continuously **reincarnate** and start over, the more cycles he goes through and the more information he gathers, the easier it becomes to acquire contribution points.

Li Fan first began reading the **Heaven-Devouring Earth-Eating Technique**.

To be safe, his clone Zhou Qing'ang inspected the jade slip.

The language style was vastly different from the techniques that could be exchanged in the Tianxuan Mirror of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance.

It wasn't so straightforward and to the point, focusing directly on key cultivation aspects.

Instead, it was filled with many mysterious and obscure phrases, making it somewhat difficult to understand.

"A distinct ancient style..."

Fortunately, Li Fan had already practiced several techniques passed down from ancient times, so he spent half a day thoroughly understanding it.

The Heaven-Devouring Earth-Eating Technique is not a primary cultivation technique to enhance one's realm.

Nor is it merely a secret method to alter the way a cultivator absorbs spiritual energy.

Rather, it functions more like a divine ability.

It allows the cultivator to aggressively absorb the earth's veins and spiritual veins, converting them into their own spiritual energy for cultivation.

At the same time, it accelerates and enhances the cultivation of their primary technique.

Generally speaking, the amount of spiritual energy a cultivator can absorb has a certain limit.

Once they reach their capacity, forcibly absorbing more could result in their body exploding.

However, after practicing the **Heaven-Devouring Earth-Eating Technique**, this concern no longer exists.

The excess energy absorbed transforms into an accelerator that propels the cultivation technique.

The more you absorb, the faster the technique operates on its own.

This continues until you break through your realm, allowing you to devour even more.

This cycle repeats endlessly until you have devoured heaven and earth.

Of course, the prerequisite is that you don't get discovered and then beaten to death.

Undoubtedly, this parasitic cultivation method is even more malignant than the immortal ancestor's New Method.

It would cause almost irreversible damage to the world in a short period, making it the enemy of all other cultivators.

But as long as it improves his cultivation, Li Fan doesn't care about being the enemy of the world.

After carefully understanding it, Zhou Qing'ang's clone attempted to operate the **Heaven-Devouring Earth-Eating Technique**.

In an instant, his eyes turned blood red.

The entire world in his field of vision changed.

There were no longer distinctions between people, landscapes, and objects.

Only the difference between what was delicious and what was not.

The clone stared at the main body for a while before turning his gaze toward the ground beneath Tai'an Island.

A yellowish earth vein extended from beneath the island, reaching all the way to the seabed.

It was connected to the earth in all directions.

It looked exceedingly appetizing.

The clone placed his hands gently on the ground, and a suction force erupted from his palms.

"Hmm?"

To Li Fan's surprise, according to the technique's description, the earth vein's energy should be absorbed into the body without resistance.

But it remained unmoved.

"What's going on?"

Li Fan carefully checked again and confirmed that he had not made any mistakes in his cultivation. He then attempted it once more.

This time, he unleashed more power, increasing the suction force.

The earth vein's energy trembled slightly but seemed to be an interconnected whole, unmovable.

The delicacy was right in front of him, but he couldn't enjoy it.

The clone's eyes grew even redder.

He became anxious and relentlessly intensified the Heaven-Devouring Earth-Eating Technique's suction.

The earth vein continued to resist.

As the two forces clashed, the entire Tai'an Island began to tremble slightly.

If this continued, the disturbance would undoubtedly arouse suspicion from others.

But the clone didn't care at all and showed no signs of stopping.

It wasn't until the main body, who had been observing, intervened and slapped "Zhou Qing'ang" unconscious that the shaking on Tai'an Island ceased.

"This Heaven-Devouring Earth-Eating Technique is a bit sinister..."

Li Fan frowned slightly.

The main body and the clone share the same consciousness, so theoretically, there shouldn't be a situation where the clone loses control.

But just now, under the influence of the "eating" desire, Li Fan's consciousness felt as if it had split in two.

When the clone looked at the main body, there was even a fleeting thought of devouring it.

But at that time, it was still controllable.

When the "eating" was obstructed, and the desire was not satisfied, the clone became completely bewitched.

Even though he knew the consequences of forcibly absorbing Tai'an Island's earth vein, he just couldn't stop himself.

"No wonder the creator of this technique couldn't restrain himself; it's not that he didn't want to, but that he simply couldn't."

Li Fan couldn't help but feel a bit regretful.

Not for the creator's fate, but for the fact that this secret technique couldn't be fully utilized by him.

"But there's no need to be overly concerned. I have the **Mountain Sitting Technique**, and Heaven-Devouring Earth-Eating Technique would only be an added bonus."

"Besides, I could still let others practice this technique and then reap the benefits."

...

After pondering for a moment, Li Fan set the matter aside.

His gaze penetrated through layers of obstacles and looked at the earth veins beneath Tai'an Island.

"The original Mountain and River Formation had already interconnected the earth veins of the world. Although the formation has now been replaced by the **Heavenly Origin Vitality Formation**, the effect remains."

"Even if I wanted to devour heaven and eat earth, it wouldn't be as easy as it was in ancient times."

"The once terrifying forbidden technique from thousands of years ago, after the passage of time, now seems so weak."

"No wonder the Five Elders Association handed it over so easily to a Foundation Establishment spy."

Li Fan shook his head and sighed.

Chapter 440: The Rain of Heaven Revives My Rain

"Come to think of it, this Heaven-Devouring Earth-Eating Technique is quite similar to the [Returning Origin Shell]."

"Both can consume the earth’s veins and have no sense of restraint."

"It seems that many techniques from ancient times were created by mimicking mythical beasts."

Li Fan recalled the sights he witnessed in the [Clash Of Ten Thousand Laws] section of the Divine Treasures Museum, lost in thought.

"Unfortunately, while deriving techniques from the traits of mythical beasts, their flaws were also inherited."

"However..."

"If the flaw of losing one's mind could be eliminated through improvements using the Dao Derivation Stone, it could still be considered a powerful divine ability."

Thinking of this, Li Fan shook his head.

"I fear there is no chance in this world. I am about to break through to the Nascent Soul stage, and the 'Sitting Mountain Art' has reached its limit. Pushing it to a higher level is the most urgent task."

The image of a young cultivator's carefree face suddenly surfaced in Li Fan's mind.

It was Han Yi from his previous life, who, with the help of the Heavenly Feather Pill that extended life by 800 years, successfully earned the qualification to derive the Derivation Law Beads into the Dao Integration Stage technique.

"If I want to elevate the 'Sitting Mountain Art' to the Dao Integration Stage in one go, I need to steal this person's fortune."

"However, something seems off about this person. No matter how I look at him, he doesn't seem like someone blessed with great fortune."

"In my previous life, my clone explored the Heavenly Capital Ruins with him, and not only did we find nothing, but we also encountered constant danger, almost losing our lives."

"I could say that even my clone, which had almost no fortune, was far superior to him."

"But it is true that he obtained the Heavenly Feather Pill and treasures like the fixed fish head lottery."

Li Fan frowned slightly.

"I remember that before his sudden wealth, he was once deceived by a Foundation Establishment master."

"When the time comes, I should pay extra attention to him."

"Let’s see how he turned his life around from being penniless to prosperous."

After contemplating for a long time, his clone finally awakened.

Li Fan put away all the spirit stones and Enlightenment Pills, leaving the clone to continue guarding Tai'an Island.

He then changed his appearance again and headed to the north-eastern most corner of the Congyun Sea through the teleportation array.

His destination was naturally Yin Yin Island, where the Master Yin resided.

In the entire Congyun Sea, there weren't many people Li Fan cared about.

Master Yin was definitely one of them.

It wasn't just because of the [Foundation Establishment of Self] technique he comprehended, which was verified by Su Changyu in his previous life and was indeed feasible.

It was still slightly flawed and needed to be perfected.

What intrigued Li Fan the most was that after more than a decade of researching the Immortal-Mortal Miasma, Master Yin eventually chose to end his own life.

Even ants cling to life.

Theoretically, someone as obsessed as Master Yin would be even less likely to give up their life easily.

But he did, which could only mean one thing.

He finally discovered the secret of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma, and the result was so unbearable that it drove him to despair.

In his utter desolation, he lost the will to continue living.

Only then did he choose to self-immolate.

Li Fan was also very interested in this secret.

After three days, Li Fan quietly arrived outside Yin Yin Island.

From a distance, the cries of mortals rose and fell continuously.

Li Fan didn't intend to alert Master Yin; he only planned to release the Formless Killing Intent to monitor him.

But the result shocked him.

The moment the Formless Killing Intent locked onto Master Yin, the perspective suddenly split into hundreds of fragments.

Besides the one on the ground who was concentrating on conducting an experiment,

All the others were broken and mutilated corpses in the basement, all looking exactly like Master Yin.

From the heavenly perspective, Li Fan discovered that these dismembered and seemingly dead corpses were actually still alive!

As they quietly lay in the basement, they would occasionally make barely noticeable movements, like turning their bodies or rolling their eyes.

Looking into their eyes, Li Fan even had the thought that these corpses seemed to be "thinking."

This eerie scene sent a chill down Li Fan's spine.

"The splitting of the Formless Killing Intent's perspective means that, in the eyes of Heaven and Earth, these living corpses are actually the same person as Master Yin."

Li Fan thought this, becoming even more solemn.

He remembered that Master Yin had mentioned he dissected hundreds of corpses in this basement to finally comprehend the [Foundation Establishment of Self].

Given the current situation, it's highly likely that he dissected "himself" one body at a time while still retaining consciousness.

"A true madman..."

"No wonder he was able to comprehend a technique as heaven-defying as [Foundation Establishment of Self]."

"If he were focused on cultivation, he could have easily reached the Dao Integration Stage."

"Unfortunately, he was obsessed with studying the Immortal-Mortal Miasma."

Li Fan couldn't help but sigh in admiration as he stared at the only Master Yin who could still move normally.

Throughout his reincarnations, Li Fan had encountered countless so-called geniuses.

Even Brother Zhang's wish to suppress the ancient times with his Dharma Body and Mr. Bai, who ascended to godhood as a mortal in an instant—these were all figures capable of being remembered for a hundred lifetimes.

But none of them gave Li Fan the same eerie feeling as this Foundation Establishment Master Yin.

Li Fan spied on Yin Yin Island for several days.

Master Yin was like an unrelenting machine, experimenting, recording, thinking.

Then repeating the experiments.

There was no sign of fatigue on his face, only deep immersion.

Li Fan also noticed that whenever Master Yin was deep in thought,

The expressions of "contemplation" on the faces of the hundreds of corpses in the basement became more pronounced.

"It's like having hundreds of versions of himself pondering the same problem simultaneously..."

Li Fan realized.

"Perhaps that's why he was able to unravel the mystery of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma."

Li Fan then recalled the words of Master Yin to Su Changyu in his previous life when he was possessed.

"Yes, where did these corpses come from?"

"Ah! I remember now!"

"It was a huge rainstorm! Countless corpses fell from the sky like raindrops, and I took the opportunity to collect a few..."

Li Fan squinted slightly: "So, these hundreds of corpses picked up from the rain were all versions of himself?"

"Truly a bizarre matter."

After pondering for a long time, he couldn't find any related examples from the secret records of the Xuanhuang Realm he had read.

Li Fan had no choice but to put the matter aside for now.

He continued to observe from the outside for a few more days until Yin Yin Island ran out of mortal materials.

Master Yin needed to go out to find more mortals as test subjects.

Only then did Li Fan quietly leave.

"I'll keep monitoring him for now. With the [Transformation of Unified Divine Dao] secret technique, it won't affect my regular cultivation."

Li Fan took one last deep look at Master Yin hurriedly departing figure, returned to his "Heavenly Mechanism Sect Cultivator" appearance, and made his way back to Ten Thousand Immortal Island.

He consumed an Enlightenment Pill and entered the [Spiritual Enlighten] state.

Li Fan temporarily secluded himself to focus on cultivation.

With the dual boosts, even though Li Fan was practicing the extremely difficult "Mountain Sitting Art," his progress was swift.

More than two months later, with a surge of pure cultivation feedback suddenly appearing in his dantian,

Li Fan finally awoke from his seclusion.

........................................................................

Read extra chapter on >>> patreon.com/SpiritStonetranslation

Chapter 441: The Empire’s Hidden Saint Master

Chapter 441: The Empire's Hidden Saint Master

"This is..."

"Has He Zhenghao broken through to the late Foundation Establishment stage?"

Li Fan was somewhat surprised after sensing this.

"In just over two months, this speed is even faster than in his previous life."

"What happened?"

After reviewing the surveillance images of He Zhenghao stored in the Transformation Dao Stone, Li Fan couldn't help but smile.

Recently, He Zhenghao has indeed been riding high.

The news that he had changed his fate through the guidance of a 'senior from the Heavenly Mechanisms Sect' had spread like wildfire throughout the Congyun Sea.

Previously, due to practicing the "Mountain Sitting Art," He Zhenghao had begun establishing connections and developing his network early on.

And because of his natural talent in formations, he maintained decent relationships with the formation masters in the Formation Strategy Hall.

So even though He Zhenghao was just a Foundation Establishment cultivator, his network of connections was not to be underestimated.

In his previous life, it was He Zhenghao who helped Li Fan secure a position in the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance!

This time, through a stroke of luck, He Zhenghao switched to a Nascent Soul technique that was extremely compatible with him.

It was clear to anyone with eyes that, barring any major mishaps, He Zhenghao's achievement of the Nascent Soul stage was practically a certainty.

A formation master at the Nascent Soul level, and one skilled in social interactions.

With this, He Zhenghao's status in the eyes of others changed dramatically.

People came to visit him constantly, and He Zhenghao welcomed them all with a warm smile.

He received so many gifts that his hands grew tired, and he felt incredibly happy.

His cultivation advanced rapidly, and he soon broke through to the late Foundation Establishment stage.

During this process, the visiting cultivators inevitably began to inquire about the so-called 'ancient Heavenly Mechanisms Sect cultivator.'

After all, who wouldn't be envious of such an opportunity to double one's fortune overnight?

If they could also latch onto this person...

At first, He Zhenghao managed to brush them off with excuses like, "I haven't been in contact for a while" or "I haven't seen this senior again."

But as more and more cultivators of increasingly higher status asked, He Zhenghao began to feel the pressure.

Because he refused to reveal any information about the Heavenly Mechanisms Sect cultivator, some cultivators began to express dissatisfaction.

Accusations that He Zhenghao was 'hogging the benefits' began to spread.

Even Chu Ming, the Nascent Soul cultivator from the Administration Hall who had helped Li Fan join the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance at He Zhenghao's request, began to question He Zhenghao after being unable to reach Li Fan.

Heaven knows, He Zhenghao truly didn't know where Li Fan had gone!

He couldn't contact him through the Tianxuan Mirror.

Li Fan hadn't even left him a single communication talisman.

Faced with increasing pressure from these cultivators, He Zhenghao was on the verge of tears.

He wished he could slap his two-month-ago self.

Why did you have to go around bragging for no reason?

Watching the repeated messages from He Zhenghao on the Tianxuan Mirror, Li Fan's lips curved slightly.

"Let it simmer a little longer; the atmosphere is almost ready."

"Five million contribution points are enough to support the first phase of the plan."

"But for now, let Fellow Daoist He bear the brunt a bit longer."

Li Fan then sensed the situation on the side of the Foundation Establishment master.

Li Chenfeng had already returned.

With him was a veiled woman in a blue dress.

Li Chenfeng and the other two showed great respect towards this woman, addressing her as the'Saint Master.'

Since arriving in the Xuanhuang Realm, this Saint Master hadn't left the chamber on the island.

When Li Chenfeng exited the chamber, Li Fan managed to see that she was fiddling with a machine resembling an armillary sphere.

"Saint Master?"

"Interesting. The agreed three-month period has passed, so let me, as the envoy of the Messenger of the Federation of All Worlds go meet her."

Li Fan didn't sense any danger from this woman in blue.

Instead, he faintly felt a sense of familiarity.

This familiarity was so faint that even after searching the memories stored in the Transformation Dao Stone, he couldn't identify its source.

This only made Li Fan more intrigued.

He resumed his previous appearance and swiftly flew towards the target location.

Before long, he arrived in the sky above the island.

Looking closely, he saw that Li Chenfeng and the other two were already waiting at the door.

"Senior, please follow us," Li Chenfeng said softly, leading Li Fan into the chamber.

Li Fan's expression remained calm, but he was somewhat cautious inside.

He stared at the veiled woman sitting not far away and asked, "Who is this?"

"I am here at the request of the Imperial Princess to see if this so-called'Immortal Ruins'are real." The woman in blue referred to herself as old, but her voice was clear and youthful, like that of a teenage girl.

"Oh? In that case, what have you found?" Li Fan asked with interest, eyeing the device in front of her.

In the center, a golden sphere remained still, while many differently colored spheres moved in irregular orbits around it.

The woman in blue sighed and shook her head, "Something seems to be concealing the existence of the'Immortal Ruins,'making it impossible to detect."

"However, it's true that this place has become even more unusual."

Li Fan narrowed his eyes slightly, "More unusual?"

The woman in blue waved her hand, putting away the device.

"This is the'Void Coordinator Locator,'a device the Empire spent thousands of years crafting. It can mark and lock the position of one's location within the endless void and map the surrounding environment."

"It was originally intended for navigation through the void after leaving the Xuanhuang Realm."

"Now, using it to detect the'Immortal Ruins'can be considered putting it to good use."

Li Fan listened quietly as the woman in blue explained.

"In this place, the Xuanhuang Realm's main world..." A hint of nostalgia flashed in the woman's eyes.

"The Locator's data is all scrambled."

"It's as if there's a massive distortion field nearby, affecting space-time and interfering with the mapping results."

"From a theoretical standpoint, the observation results align with what you've said about the existence of a devouring 'Immortal Ruins.'

Li Fan coldly replied, "I have no reason to deceive you in this matter."

The woman in blue smiled gently, "No, you did deceive us."

Li Fan's eyes narrowed as his heart tightened.

"What do you mean?"

The woman in blue gazed at the Xuanhuang Realm's sky and slowly said, "Because even if the'Immortal Ruins'do exist, ourEmpirewill not be swallowed by it after leaving the Xuanhuang Realm."

"Not just us; all the small worlds captured by the Ten Great Immortal Sects back then won't suffer that fate either."

Li Fan remained silent.

The woman in blue continued, "Because we aren't in the same space-time as the Xuanhuang Realm at all."

"We're only connected by theImmortal-Severing Passage."

"If we sever the connection with the Xuanhuang Realm, we will gain complete freedom."

"And the Xuanhuang Realm wil eventually meet its end."

Readextra chapter on >>>patreon.com/SpiritStonetranslation

Chapter 442: Enlightenment breaks through the mist

Is the Small World not located in the same space-time as the Xuanhuang Realm?

As the woman in the green dress looked at Li Fan with a half-smile, his thoughts were racing.

Is it true, or false?

Is this a test, or a fabricated lie used as a bargaining chip?

In a flash, Li Fan quickly analyzed the situation.

If the other party had already figured out that he was a complete fraud, they wouldn’t waste time explaining anything.

Instead, the logical choice would be to either run away or set a trap to capture him and force a confession.

This meant that, to a large extent, the woman in green was still unsure of his identity.

After all, in the history of the Xuanhuang Realm, there really had been instances where the Small Worlds united to launch a counterattack against the Cultivation Realm.

If the Small World and the Xuanhuang Realm were not in the same space-time, and if he were truly an emissary of the"Messenger of the Federation of All Worlds", he would definitely be aware of this.

Given that the future of the empire was at stake, theSaint Masterwould not fabricate a lie that could be easily exposed.

Therefore, what she said might very well be the truth.

At the very least, it was true in the eyes of the woman in green.

A question naturally arose.

Since the Small World and the Xuanhuang Realm are not in the same space-time, then why, when faced with the threat of theImmortal Ruins, didn’t the cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm choose to escape to the Small World through thePath of Immortal Severanceand sever all ties with the Xuanhuang Realm?

If Nascent Soul, Soul Transformation, and Dao Integration stage cultivators might struggle due to the lack of spiritual energy in the Small World and inability to cut off the passage, then forLongevity Immortal, these limitations should be negligible.

So why didn’t the Longevity Immortal escape?

The answer to this question could only be one of three possibilities: they were unafraid, unwilling, or unable.

Unafraid?

In his past life, theThe One Unified Heart Heavenly Sovereignretreated in the face of the spirit-locking formation’s threat of mutual destruction. This indicates that even Longevity Immortal couldn’t survive the Immortal Ruins.

Thus, this possibility could be ruled out.

Unwilling? Righteous and resolute, they would rather die than leave. Following the Xuanhuang Realm to fall into the Immortal Ruins?

Judging from the current cultivation paths of the cultivators in this realm, this wouldn’t be the choice of the present Longevity Immortal.

This leaves only one answer.

The Longevity Immortal are unable to leave the Xuanhuang Realm?

As this thought crossed his mind, Li Fan found it absurd and laughable.

The strength of Longevity Immortal-stage cultivators was terrifying.

How could it be possible...

But Li Fan suddenly froze.

What if... What if it were true?

For a long time, Li Fan had a question.

Why does going against the principles of heaven and earth lead to achieving longevity?

All living beings have a finite lifespan.

Even the so-called "Longevity Species" in legends only live a bit longer than ordinary creatures.

If there’s anything in the Xuanhuang Realm that truly deserves the term "longevity," it would likely be the world itself.

Why does defying the principles of heaven and earth lead to a complete transformation?

Allowing cultivators to live as long as the heavens and earth?

"Principles of heaven and earth, going against the principles of heaven and earth..."

Suddenly, an image flashed through Li Fan’s mind.

In his past life, when Ji Hongdao faced Senior Sister Zhao’s aggressive questioning, he once said, "After a Heavenly Sovereign establishes aDao Law, they should no longer engage in mundane disputes."

"Dao Law."

These two words were like a bolt of lightning, cutting through the fog.

They made Li Fan notice something he had overlooked for a long time.

All beings live without worry and enjoy life.

All beings must respect and follow the cultivation methods of the Heavenly Sovereign who transmits the Dao Law.”

These rules, which defy common sense, now truly exist between heaven and earth.

In other words...

After reversing the original principles of heaven and earth, the Dao law established by Heavenly Sovereign replaced them, becoming new principles of heaven and earth and thus becoming part of the world.

It was for this reason that the Heavenly Sovereign have gained a lifespan as long as that of the heavens and earth.

Likewise, it was for this reason that the Longevity Immortal couldn’t leave the Xuanhuang Realm.

Before reaching the Longevity immortal stage, cultivators were like bandits who entered a house and plundered its furniture and treasures, stuffing them into their pockets.

But some greedy individuals set their sights on the house itself.

They wanted to take over the house and claim it as their own.

They succeeded, but in doing so, they triggered the house’s ultimate countermeasure.

The door slammed shut, and while they became the owners of the house, they were also forever trapped inside.

"Is this the world's retaliation?"

Li Fan suddenly had an epiphany.

He had understood one principle earlier.

When faced with cultivators who sought to plunder the heavens and the earth, the world itself was not entirely powerless to resist.

Apart from the suddenly established law that immortal techniques cannot be cultivated simultaneously, and the descent of the Spirit of Heaven and Earth to perform its duties, which are measures targeting ordinary cultivators. the world also took extreme measures against those powerful enough to threaten it.

That measure was: "If you can’t beat them, recruit them."

This tactic was indeed effective.

Because after achieving the Longevity immortal, the Sovereign’s allegiance shifted from that of cultivators to that of the world itself.

If cultivators recklessly plunder the heavens and earth without restraint, it could eventually lead to the world’s exhaustion and decline.

And the Longevity immortals, who had become one with the world, had to intervene to prevent such a catastrophe.

Therefore, the number of cultivators had to be controlled.

This was one of the reasons why the number of cultivators couldn’t be too large.

Li Fan thought back to when the Ten immortal Sects offered a reward for theXuantian Treasure Mirror.

They claimed that anyone who possessed this mirror could exchange it for a seat as a Longevity Immortal.

"It seems that in ancient times, the Longevity Immortal stage might also have been achieved by some means of stealing the original principle of longevity from the world."

Li Fan mused.

After this line of reasoning, Li Fan felt a slight sense of disappointment.

The Longevity Immortals of the Xuanhuang Realm seemed to fall short of his ideal of "longevity."

They merely borrowed the power of the world to gain a lifespan that wasn’t truly their own.

"Fake longevity, huh..."

"But strictly speaking, it’s not something particularly unacceptable."

"After all, the 'Longevity Immortal Stage' in this realm was merely an attempt by cultivators to extend their lives after theImmortal Pathwas severed in the Xuanhuang Realm."

"And it might not be impossible to go further."

Li Fan thought of the Dao Transmission Heavenly Sovereign who disappeared in his past life.

"This pioneer of new methods might have already broken free from the world’s constraints."

"No wonder in the last life, the Heavenly Sovereign Of Dao Transmission didn’t appear for thousands of years. And even when wars broke out from time to time, the Sovereigns of theFive Elders Associationnever intervened."

"Because in the eyes of the Five Elders Association’s Sovereigns, if the Longevity Immortals stage can’t leave the Xuanhuang Realm, then the Dao Transmission Sovereign must still be somewhere."

"They were held back merely by an agreement on a piece of paper."

"Until later, when they realized something was wrong, they became desperate to act personally..."

The effects of theEnlightenment Pillhadn’t completely faded.

In a sudden flash of insight, through a fact inadvertently revealed by the woman in green, Li Fan deduced a possible and logically consistent truth about the Xuanhuang Realm.

...................................................................

[New TL Notes: I'm disappointed to see that "My Longevity Simulation" has been dropped again, this time by another translator. As one of my favorite ongoing xianxia novels, it's disheartening to see it without a reliable English translation. Many of you have been eager to read this story in well-translated English but were forced to rely on mtl or raw chapters. I believe this story and our community deserve better!

I'm Taking on the Challenge!*

I'm thrilled to announce that I'll be translating "My Longevity Simulation"!

But Please note that I'm already working on another novel, "The Path of Immortality: Starts with Creating Water Bear Gu." I hadn't planned on adding another project until I caught up with the raw chapters, but my love for "My Longevity Simulation" won me over, and I also think of this as opportunity to reread and refresh my memory as I read it many months ago.

Some Important Details To Note*

As the third translator of this novel, I would like to bring to your attention that there may be slight variations in wording, terminology, techniques, and naming conventions compared to previous translations. This is a natural consequence of the translator's changing midway, where different interpreters may choose to express using different terms and styles.

In the event that you notice any discrepancies or have differing opinions on specific translated words or phrases, please do not hesitate to share your feedback in the comments section below. Your input is invaluable in helping me refine the translation and ensure its accuracy.

Just a heads up - you might notice some weirdness with names and stuff at first, but don't worry, it gets easier as you keep reading! The more you dive in, the more familiar everything will feel.

Since many chapters have already been translated by previous translators, I'll start translating from chapter 439, right after the previous translation ended. For those wanting to start reading from the beginning, you can visit:

1st translator Venguis' page (chapters 1-332): (https://www.scribblehub.com/series/851465/my-longevity-simulation/)

2nd translator UntoldChaptors' page (chapters 333-438): (https://untoldchapters.com/my-longevity-simulation/)

Your Support Means Everything!*

To keep myself motivated and post daily chapters, I need your support. You can help me by visiting my Patreon page: (patreon.com/SpiritStonetranslation) and of course, Patreon supporters will receive an extra chapter.

Thank you for your support, and I look forward to sharing this amazing story with you!]

Chapter 443: The Essence of survival

Back in the Fallen Immortal Realm, the wise Beast Emperor Sanmo once told Lu Ya, "Even when you see something with your own eyes, it may not always be the truth."

Similarly, the conclusions Li Fan has deduced now may not be absolutely correct.

It's like the story of the blind men feeling an elephant—what they perceive might not be the whole picture.

But it's still part of the truth.

In his mind, the crystal of the Dao Derivation Stone emitted a bright blue light, instantly recording all the countless thoughts that crossed his mind.

Next, Li Fan needed to consider how to deal with the woman in green.

Shortly after she finished speaking, Li Fan shook his head and replied, "The power of the [Immortal Ruins] is beyond what ordinary people can imagine."

"A force that can even distort space-time brings consequences that are hard to predict."

"You say that once the Immortal Realm Passage is severed, you will be free from all restraints and completely liberated."

"But that's only in theory. Who can guarantee what will actually happen?"

As Li Fan spoke slowly, he subtly observed the woman in green's expression.

"After all, those places that left the Xuanhuang Realm before have all gone silent, and there's no way to contact them anymore."

"Are they truly free, or have they already been destroyed in the Immortal Ruins? Who knows?"

"Otherwise, why would our [Federation Of All Worlds] be able to recruit so many members?"

"Even if there's only a one in ten thousand chance of failure, it's still too risky for an entire civilization."

Li Fan spoke with a slight tone of sarcasm.

The woman's smile gradually faded as she stared at Li Fan, seemingly trying to discern something from his face.

But Li Fan remained composed, showing no signs of weakness.

The woman in green finally said, "You're right. That's also why I've returned to the Xuanhuang Realm this time."

"Currently, very few people within the Empire know about the existence of the Immortal Ruins. But there's no such thing as a secret that can't be discovered. Once the conservatives learn of this, the resistance to the plan to leave the Xuanhuang Realm will only increase."

"At that time, even the thousand years of prestige accumulated by the Imperial Family may not be enough to peacefully implement this plan."

Li Fan asked, "So, are you here to seek help?"

The woman in green nodded, "The Imperial Princess's determination to carry out the plan to leave the Xuanhuang Realm hasn't changed. Even though there are risks, we believe it's worth it."

"However, the despicable nobles within the Empire may not share this view."

"To avoid internal conflict, the Empire must accelerate the pace of the plan."

She paused for a moment before continuing, "While we speed up the acquisition of the Path-Fusing Techniques, we also need to expedite the resources for nurturing the Rift Whale."

As she spoke, she handed over a jade slip.

A quick scan with his spiritual sense revealed a long list of resources.

Searching his memory, Li Fan found that while most of these resources weren't individually expensive, the sheer quantity required was staggering.

The total cost was likely beyond the five million contribution points he currently had.

His eyebrows slightly raised as he said, "If you join the [Federation Of all Worlds], the organization might consider assisting with what you need."

"But since you've already decided to leave, our organization isn't a charity."

The woman in green replied, "As you said, there's a chance that leaving the Xuanhuang Realm might lead to destruction."

"Although the Empire's resolve remains unchanged, it doesn't hurt to hedge our bets."

Li Fan's eyes flickered, "You mean..."

"That's right. The Empire will allocate a portion of its forces to join the Federation Of all Worlds."

"As an alternate seed of civilization, they will remain in the Xuanhuang Realm. If the Empire does encounter catastrophe in the future, they can continue the Imperial legacy as a separate branch." The woman in green spoke with burning eyes, revealing her true intentions.

Hearing this, Li Fan couldn't help but sneer, "Aren't you overestimating yourselves? To avoid arousing suspicion within the Empire, the forces you divert can't be too significant. Relying on them alone to exchange for the resources on this list is far from sufficient."

The woman in green replied calmly, "Your Excellency, you misunderstand. As the seeds of the Empire's civilization, all the technology the Empire currently possesses will naturally be preserved. After joining the association, these technologies can be shared with the organization."

"Let's not even mention the rest, but the value of the [Beast God Armor] alone is enough to cover most of the resources on this list."

Li Fan hadn't expected them to be so bold, willing to use all the technology at their disposal as bargaining chips.

Even if the "all technologies" they spoke of were slightly exaggerated, the various elements of the Empire that Li Fan had seen in Li Chenfeng's mind were enough to make him tempted.

Indeed, these technologies might not directly benefit Li Fan's cultivation.

But the Empire's system, so different from the current Xuanhuang Realm, could greatly enhance Li Fan's foundation.

As the saying goes, "The more skills you have, the fewer worries you'll face." Perhaps in some future cycle, this ability to control exotic beasts would come in handy.

Without much hesitation, Li Fan quickly made up his mind.

He would trick the Empire into handing over all its technology.

Feigning a hesitant yet interested look, Li Fan pondered for a moment before saying, "This is a significant matter, beyond my authority to decide."

"Allow me to report back, and I'll give you an answer."

Li Fan's response was within the woman in green's expectations.

"The sooner, the better," she urged.

Li Fan cupped his hands in farewell and quickly left.

In the secret chamber, only the Empire's group remained.

"Saint Master, do we really have to use the core technologies the Empire has developed over so many years as bargaining chips?" Li Chenfeng asked reluctantly.

The woman in green did not immediately respond. Instead, she frowned and looked up at the sky.

After laying down several layers of restrictions, she turned to Li Chenfeng and scolded, "Have you forgotten what I taught you?"

"Survival is the primary objective of civilization."

"Only by surviving do technology and culture have meaning."

"If the civilization itself is destroyed, what use are these achievements, no matter how glorious?"

Li Chenfeng was still somewhat dissatisfied, "But..."

The woman in green cut him off with a wave of her hand, "We've already discussed this with the Imperial Princess and reached a final decision. No more arguments!"

Seeing this, Li Chenfeng had no choice but to bow his head in resignation.

"That person just now, I couldn't see through him. And he's just a messenger. It seems that this [Federation Of all Worlds] truly has some depth," the woman in green murmured as she watched Li Fan's figure disappear into the distance.

Li Chenfeng was startled, "Saint Master, even with your cultivation, you couldn't discern his background? What is that man's true strength?"

The woman in green was also puzzled, "On the surface, his realm doesn't seem very high, but I could always sense a faint trace of danger from him."

Chapter 444: Self-taught Mastery

“Besides, it seems that he has many secret techniques concealing him, making it difficult for others to see through him, like looking at flowers in the mist,” the woman in the green dress said slowly.

Hearing this, Li Chenfeng and Zhu Shaotang exchanged glances, their hearts filled with shock.

They were well aware that the Empire's two Saint masters, [Qing] and [Hong], were powerful beings who had survived since ancient times.

The two Saint masters had personally witnessed the Empire's development from a mere gathering of mortals to the vast Empire it is today.

Their guidance had been indispensable in this process.

In the eyes of the Empire's people, the two Saint masters were the absolute embodiments of power and wisdom.

But now, the Saint master [Qing] actually said that she couldn’t see through the envoy who had just arrived?

Recalling their previous rash behavior in front of this person, Li Chenfeng couldn't help but feel a wave of fear.

“Perhaps it's because I haven’t returned here for so long. I’m somewhat unaccustomed to it,” Qing sighed with a hint of sadness, allowing Li Chenfeng to breathe a little easier.

Hundreds of miles away, Li Fan was secretly surprised as he sensed the intermittent, blurry images transmitted by the Formless Killing Intent.

"It seems this Saint master is not simple. She can vaguely sense and counteract my Formless Killing Intent."

"Fortunately, my skills are superior."

Li Fan was more than willing to exchange contribution points for the Empire's technology, such as the [Beast God Armor].

But if a true collaboration were to be established and the play continued, he feared he alone wouldn't be able to hold the stage, making it easy for others to see through him.

Moreover, managing five million contribution points was somewhat difficult.

"It seems it's time to advance my original plan."

With that in mind, Li Fan sensed the location of He Zhenghao.

While heading toward Liuli Island, he once again transformed into the appearance of an [Ancient Heavenly Mechanism Sect Disciple].

…

He Zhenghao had been feeling troubled lately.

He had locked the communication talisman, which was constantly receiving inquiries, inside a storage ring to gain some peace.

At present, he didn’t even dare step out of Liuli Island.

As the legend of his overnight wealth spread, more and more people wanted to gather information about Li Fan through him.

Some were skeptical and wanted to personally verify the Master's credentials.

Others merely wanted to latch onto him and replicate He Zhenghao's meteoric rise.

Some even approached him with bizarre propositions, attempting to engage in strange deals.

He was overwhelmed and exhausted by all the attention.

He had to pretend to be in seclusion, hiding within the mountains and stars formation on Liuli Island, unable to meet anyone.

He Zhenghao was deeply troubled.

It wasn’t that he was deliberately avoiding people, but ever since joining the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, that Heavenly Mechanism Sect Senior had vanished, and he hadn’t been able to see him again.

He Zhenghao was utterly helpless!

As he was frowning, wondering how to explain himself to his close friends, a faintly familiar aura rapidly approached.

It passed through the mountain and star formation's defenses and immediately landed boldly before him.

“Hahaha, He boy, long time no see!”

Li Fan laughed heartily, his voice full of spring-like cheer.

He Zhenghao was first stunned, then overjoyed.

It was just as he had wished.

“Senior, you’ve finally come!” He nearly wanted to hug Li Fan's leg and weep in gratitude.

“Hm? What’s wrong with you, boy?”

With a slight wave of his hand, Li Fan kept He Zhenghao several feet away and asked knowingly.

After He Zhenghao finished pouring out his troubles, Li Fan immediately collected his smile and scolded him, “You deserve it!”

“You’re a Foundation Establishment cultivator, and yet you don’t understand the principle of getting rich quietly?”

“You obtained a Nascent Soul cultivation method; you should have practiced diligently instead of showing off to others!”

“If only your close friends knew, it might have been okay, but you made it public knowledge?”

“If you die, that’s one thing, but you dragged me into it too!”

Li Fan’s beard and hair stood on end, and he appeared extremely furious.

He Zhenghao trembled, too afraid to speak.

Li Fan shook his head, looking at He Zhenghao with a gaze full of disappointment, like one who sees a child with no hope.

He made a gesture as if to fly away.

He Zhenghao panicked immediately, “Senior, please wait! Senior, save me!”

He cried with a mournful face, explaining, “I didn’t intentionally want to show off. Perhaps it was the result of fulfilling a long-held wish, and I couldn’t control my emotions that day.”

“By the time I realized it, the news had already spread, and it was too late to regret.”

In truth, He Zhenghao’s willpower wasn’t so weak.

While excitement and impulsiveness played a role, much of it was due to Li Fan’s subtle manipulation and guidance that day.

Seeing He Zhenghao’s deep regret, Li Fan laughed inwardly but kept a stern face.

In a cold voice, he said, “Save you? How can I save you? As the saying goes, ‘Mercy does not save those who seek death.’ If you’re determined to court death, how can I help you?”

He Zhenghao’s expression grew more miserable, but seeing that Li Fan hadn’t flown away immediately, he knew there was still hope.

So he quickly said, “The reason these friends are pestering me is merely because they want to gain the Senior’s guidance, just as I did, and profit from it.”

“Senior, you can use your divine ability to sense the secrets of the heavens and then…”

Li Fan’s face turned cold, “Nonsense! Why should I help them when they are neither kin nor acquaintances?”

“Moreover, using divine abilities comes with the risk of heavenly backlash. What’s in it for me?”

With a wave of his sleeve, Li Fan looked dissatisfied and was about to leave.

He Zhenghao hurriedly blocked his way and had a sudden inspiration, saying repeatedly, “Mountain Sitting Technique! Mountain Sitting Technique!”

“When I broke through to the late Foundation Establishment stage, did you sense the feedback in your cultivation?”

Li Fan was slightly stunned and, after a while, slowly said, “It does seem like there was something like that.”

He Zhenghao slapped his thigh, “Exactly! Senior, think about it: in the current Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, all techniques are exchanged for contribution points.”

“And when you help us earn contribution points, we use them to purchase techniques and cultivate.”

“Doesn’t this mean you’re indirectly bestowing us with techniques?”

“You must know, in the current cultivation world, nothing is more significant than bestowing techniques!”

“As you practice the Mountain Sitting Technique, such a blessing will surely yield strong cultivation feedback.”

“Furthermore, there are many who have come to seek your aid.”

“If you help them all…”

“Accumulating bit by bit, how much cultivation power would that add up to?”

“With this, Master, you should soon recover your strength from before your slumber, right?”

He Zhenghao seemed to have an epiphany and became more excited as he spoke.

Li Fan slowly nodded, “There’s some logic to that!”

“But…with so many people, my ability to use divine power is limited. How can I help them all?”

After thinking it over, Li Fan still rejected the idea.

At that moment, He Zhenghao had a sudden flash of insight.

He blurted out, “We can pool together the contribution points of those who want your help and manage them collectively.”

“Then, when Master uses your divine power to find suitable investment methods and earn contribution points, you can return them.”

Li Fan was very pleased, thinking to himself, “Very good, He Zhenghao, you’ve learned to respond quickly.”

........................................................................

Chapter 445: The Cultivators ask for Wealth

However, Li Fan's face was full of doubt. "Would others really transfer their contribution points so easily? I don't think so."

"It would be better if they don't! This way, we can use it as an excuse to get rid of some of them, so they stop pestering me!" He Zhenghao thought to himself, but he said aloud, "Senior, don't worry. Too many cultivators have been chasing me recently to ask about this. Even if only a small portion is willing to transfer their contribution points for you to handle, it will still be a considerable amount."

"Moreover, once Senior displays his divine abilities and returns the contribution points with interest, the results will speak louder than words. Afterward, there will definitely be more and more people willing to rely on Senior."

He Zhenghao was full of confidence.

Li Fan pondered for a moment, pretending to think it over.

Not long after, he slowly nodded, "It just so happens that I've been seeing many new and interesting techniques in the Tianxuan Mirror recently, and I'm itching to try them out. Moreover, in this era of cultivation, it's true that everything relies on contribution points."

"If you can really gather a significant amount of contribution points, I don't mind making it grow several times over."

Hearing Li Fan's casual words, He Zhenghao's eyes lit up.

He thought for a moment and quickly urged, "No need for so much, no need for so much!"

"You must know, if it can increase by half in a year, people will flock to hand over their contribution points to Senior!"

"As for the rest, Senior can keep it for yourself as a reward."

"Of course, if you could share some of the profits with me as a token of appreciation, that would be even better!"

He Zhenghao said happily.

"Satisfied with just a 50% return in a year?" Li Fan was initially surprised, then nodded, "That works too."

"Let's tentatively decide on this for now. You go and contact your friends."

"Remember, you must choose those who you know well. Contribution points from cultivators with unknown backgrounds should not be accepted."

After giving a few more instructions, He Zhenghao excitedly took out the sealed communication talisman and began replying to each person.

"Fellow Daoist Zhang, there's a great opportunity for wealth in front of you. Would you like to give it a try?"

...

"The first batch of contribution points probably won't be much, but that's okay."

"If they don't believe it the first time, they might hesitate the second time."

"By the third or fourth time, when they see others making a fortune while they miss out on the opportunity."

"By the fifth time, they'll be begging to hand over their contribution points."

Watching the busy He Zhenghao, Li Fan thought to himself.

Don't misunderstand.

Although what Li Fan is doing in this world looks very much like some kind of scam, in reality...

Li Fan really does have the ability to lead everyone to make big money.

Not to mention the huge profits he could easily gain by speculating on Lingwu grass.

Simply using the information he gathered during his endless cycles of reincarnation, buying low and selling high, making a 50% profit each year was child's play.

If certain gifted individuals can do it, there's no way Li Fan, an anomaly in this cycle of reincarnation, couldn't.

If that were the case, Li Fan might as well give up on seeking immortality and obediently return to Great Xuan to be a mortal Grandmaster for the rest of his life.

In short, increasing assets is not difficult at all for Li Fan, who holds so much advanced information.

Of course, there are certain limitations.

For example, the overall scale of assets he controls shouldn't be too large.

And he shouldn't attract the direct intervention of powers on the level of the Tianxuan Mirror.

But in reality, Li Fan never planned to make too much noise.

His goal was simply to gather a manageable group of followers while improving his cultivation through the [Mountain Sitting] technique.

And when the expansion became too overwhelming and was beyond Li Fan's control...

Crimson flames will engulf the ocean, and Ink-like darkness will consume the world.

That would be the end of it.

With all the creditors dead, naturally, there would be no debts to settle.

He could then rightfully claim all those contribution points as his own.

This is the preliminary plan.

As for the details, he'll take it step by step.

After contacting his friends, He Zhenghao went to Ten Thousand Immortal Island to meet with his fellow Daoists.

It wasn't until most of the day had passed that he returned with a beaming face.

He also brought back over 200,000 contribution points.

As expected, when He Zhenghao stated his request, most of the cultivators backed out.

After all, no one's contribution points are easy to come by.

It's one thing to receive guidance from an 'Ancient Heavenly Mechanism Sect Cultivator', but to actually hand over their contribution points...

Few were willing to do that.

The 200,000 contribution points gathered this time mainly came from a cultivator named Zhou Peng, who alone contributed 50,000, taking up the majority.

Excluding him, the rest of the contributors averaged less than 5,000 points each.

Even so, He Zhenghao was extremely excited at this moment.

He solemnly transferred the 230,000 contribution points to Li Fan through the small Tianxuan Mirror.

He also didn't forget to transfer another 100,000 contribution points from his own small vault.

"Senior..."

He Zhenghao opened his mouth to say something but eventually held back.

He simply looked at Li Fan with a burning gaze.

"50,000 contribution points in a year is no big deal. Rest assured!" Li Fan said as he tossed a communication talisman to He Zhenghao. "If there's anything urgent, I'll contact you. Otherwise, don't disturb me!"

He Zhenghao nodded repeatedly, excitedly holding onto the communication talisman.

Li Fan waved him off and returned to Ten Thousand Immortal Island.

"There shouldn't be any problems..."

He Zhenghao muttered to himself.

Now that the initial excitement had passed, a more rational He Zhenghao couldn't help but feel uneasy.

But now that the matter has been settled, he can only pray that this senior from the Heavenly Mechanism Sect won't make any mistakes.

Inside the Tianxuan Mirror.

Li Fan released several scrolls of Lan Xiao's posthumous works.

While procuring the necessary materials for the empire, he patiently waited.

Sure enough, three days later, the Oracle contacted Li Fan to express his gratitude.

"I still have some rare books here, but I need Senior to do me a small favor." Li Fan said with a smile.

"Oh?" The Oracle was slightly surprised but still listened with interest to Li Fan's request.

"Interesting." It seemed that this fellow was involved in something shady.

But the Oracle didn't care about that.

In this world, who doesn't have some secrets?

With a gentle wave of his dust whisk, the Oracle concealed his aura and quietly arrived at Ten Thousand Immortal Island.

After meeting with Li Fan, the two flew directly toward the island where the empire's people were located.

In a secret chamber, the Empire's imperial Saint Master, [Qing], who was concentrating on drawing something, suddenly stood up and looked in the direction where Li Fan was coming from, her expression serious.

When Li Fan and the Oracle landed on the island, her face changed slightly.

"The Federation Of All World's indeed has some weight."

Chapter 446: A Thousand Years to Summon Tian Yang

Before [Qing] could speak, the Oracle swung his dust whisk.

The sky darkened, and a talisman filled with golden characters appeared instantly above the island.

It blotted out the sky and the sun, as if it was about to suppress everyone in the Empire the next moment.

Qing's expression changed drastically. Two blue beams of light shot up into the sky like sharp blades.

They collided with the massive talisman.

The golden talisman was torn apart, revealing the sky once again.

However, the golden characters on the talisman didn't disappear.

Instead, they floated down, drifting towards the ground.

Blades of light continuously emerged from Qing's body.

One by one, the characters were dispelled.

It was clear that both sides were extremely restrained in their exchange.

The phenomena they triggered were confined to the area around the island, not affecting bystanders like Li Fan, Li Chenfeng, and others in the slightest.

After a moment, when Qing had fully suppressed the Oracle's golden talisman,

She forced down her anger and was about to question his intentions.

But she noticed that the mysterious person who had cast the talisman had already spoken something to Li Fan and left on his own.

Qing narrowed her eyes slightly but did not stop him.

She watched as Li Fan approached boldly.

"What does your Federation of All World's mean by this?"

Only then did Qing ask coldly.

Li Fan shrugged. "We mean no harm. But since we're going to cooperate, it's only natural to test your strength and see if you're worth it."

"Fortunately, you've barely gained recognition from above."

Qing snorted coldly, staring at Li Fan.

Li Fan remained unfazed, smiling as he said, "The Federation has agreed to your previous proposal for cooperation."

"We'll help the Empire accelerate its plan to break away from the Xuanhuang Realm, but in return, you need to allocate some of your forces to join the Federation."

"However..."

Li Fan paused slightly. "Considering the current situation of both sides, the organization believes that we can gradually implement the cooperation plan."

"How do you plan to proceed gradually?" Qing's tone softened.

Li Fan tossed a storage ring over. Qing caught it and, after checking it, was taken aback.

Inside were all sorts of resources the Empire needed.

Green Spirit Crystals, Ten Thousand Flower Jade Silk, Arm of Profound sage...

Although the quantities were small, each type was present.

Having been away from the Xuanhuang Realm for thousands of years, she didn't know the current market prices.

But Qing also knew that the value of the materials in this storage ring was certainly not insignificant.

So, her expression gradually softened.

"This is the first batch of supplies."

"The quantities you require are enormous. To avoid attracting attention from the forces of the Xuanhuang Realm, we're only purchasing them in small batches."

Li Fan explained.

Qing found the explanation reasonable and nodded slowly.

"At the same time, we're also looking for a future foothold for the Empire's branch."

"Both safety and secrecy must be absolutely guaranteed. In the current Xuanhuang Realm, such a place is hard to find. So, it will take some time."

Li Fan continued.

"To alleviate your concerns and demonstrate the organization's sincerity, these materials are provided to the Empire for free."

"Around a year from now, when the next batch of materials is procured, I'll come back."

"But by then, the Federation of All Worlds, hopes to see the Empire's attitude."

"Then we'll discuss the next steps of our cooperation."

Li Fan cupped his hands, and without waiting for Qing's response, he left directly.

"Saint Master..."

Li Chenfeng looked at Qing, wanting to speak but hesitating.

Qing frowned and carefully examined the storage ring again. After finding no tricks, she cautiously put it away.

"For now, it seems their intention to cooperate is quite sincere."

"He wasn't wrong; we can gradually start cooperating. First, exchange some of the less important technologies with them."

"If anything goes wrong, we can stop the losses in time."

Qing said to Li Chenfeng and the others.

"I need to return and discuss this further with the Imperial Princess and Hong."

What she didn't say was that, for some reason, she always felt there was something strange about the messenger from the Federation.

It seemed far more complicated than it appeared on the surface.

Ten Thousand Immortal Island.

After thanking the Oracle again, Li Fan, as usual, began searching for information in the Tianxuan Mirror.

The results of the entrance exam had been gradually announced, with some rejoicing and others lamenting.

There was still considerable controversy over some of the positions' selections.

However, the disputes quickly disappeared.

In the southwest sea of Congyun sea, a storm ravaged the area, causing the disappearance of more than a dozen mortal islands.

The price of the specialty product, Bixuan Dew, saw a slight fluctuation. Li Fan bought low and sold high, making a small profit.

In Taihua Prefecture, one of the ten veins of the Taihua Mountain, the Taixu Mountain Range suddenly collapsed for unknown reasons.

When Li Fan skimmed over this piece of information, his gaze sharpened slightly.

"Hmm? The ten veins of Taihua Mountain? I remember in previous lives there were only nine veins of Taihua."

"It seems the casualties this time were quite severe."

Li Fan pondered but didn't delve deeper.

He simply marked it as a priority and continued browsing other important news.

Afterward, Li Fan separately searched for the latest information on "Old Fisherman," "Martial Madman," "Zhong Shentong," and "Shuo feng."

The Old Fisherman was still wandering near the central four prefectures of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Martial Madman and Zhong Shentong had not yet made a name for themselves.

Shuofeng had not yet restarted his cultivation, still renowned as a Nascent Soul True Lord.

Li Fan, based on his experiences from previous lives, speculated on the likely timing of their encounters with opportunities.

...

A month later, Li Fan woke up from his seclusion.

Feeling that the time was right, he directly transferred 500,000 contribution points to He Zhenghao.

"This time, I was lucky. I quickly sensed the opportunity and completed the goal early."

Li Fan spoke lazily.

A moment later, He Zhenghao's voice, filled with ecstatic surprise, came through.

"Senior's divine abilities are truly incredible!"

"Heh. The sect's secret technique still carries unavoidable backlash. The next recruitment will still be at the previously agreed time. Make sure to explain this to them clearly."

After giving some instructions, Li Fan stopped paying attention to He Zhenghao and swallowed a Enlightenment Pill, going back into seclusion.

Time flew by quickly, and in the blink of an eye, it was year 9 since the starting of Anchor.

During this period, Li Fan's plans began to show initial results.

More than twenty strands of feedback, of varying amounts, began to appear in Li Fan's dantian one after another.

Coupled with nearly a year's worth of arduous cultivation under the dual effects of the Spirit Awakening and Dao Enlightenment Pills,

Li Fan reached the peak of the mid-stage Golden Core and, fortunately, was only troubled by the 'Heaven's Calamity' bottleneck for a little over ten days.

Then, he smoothly advanced to the late stage of the Golden Core.

Li Fan slowly exhaled, pausing his cultivation.

"From now on, whether it's to intimidate the people of the Empire or to explore the void of Tianling Prefecture, it's hard to manage everything alone."

"Perhaps it's time to find some assistance."

Li Fan pondered for a moment, then quietly left Ten Thousand Immortal Island.

He headed straight for Tian yang Cave Mansion.

Along the way, he tried dozens of times and finally managed to barely create a face that resembled the Second Senior Brother of Tian yang, Ling Xiao.

........................................................................

Read extra chapters on >>> patreon.com/SpiritStonetranslation

Chapter 447: Reestablishing the Body and Transforming into the Dao

Nine years have passed, and the Tianyang Cave Mansion has yet to be revealed.

It remains deeply hidden within an underwater volcano, known to no one else.

After much effort, Li Fan was able to determine the location of the cave mansion using the "Earth Fire Return To Origin Array" he acquired from Tianyang's remnant thoughts.

After activating several protective talismans, Li Fan carefully infiltrated the cave mansion.

Currently, Lord Tianyang is in a peculiar state, neither fully alive nor dead.

From the Eternal Remnants Memories, Li Fan learned that when the Reestablishing the Body and Transforming into the Dao was initiated, everyone except Tianyang participated in an ancient battle and never returned.

Tianyang, however, firmly believed that his master and senior brothers would return. Afraid they wouldn't find him upon their return, Tianyang stayed in the cave mansion, refusing to leave.

But years later, outsiders broke into the cave mansion. Tianyang wanted to resist but was no match for them. He barely managed to survive thanks to the magical artifacts left behind by his senior brothers before they departed.

After that, young Tianyang began a wandering life in the world of immortal cultivation.

Through trials and tribulations, he gradually realized that his potential was far from being as exceptional as his senior brothers had claimed. He wasn’t the hope for the revival of the Reestablishing the Body and Transforming into the Dao.

He couldn’t even match ordinary Golden Core cultivators, let alone his senior brothers.

But despite this, his master and senior brothers placed their last hopes in him.

Whenever he remembered their words—"Tianyang, your potential is not inferior to anyone in this world. Recover quickly, as the 'Reestablishing the Body and Transforming into the Dao' depends on you"—he couldn't help but feel immense hatred toward his own incompetence.

But reality doesn't change with emotions.

Tianyang estimated that without any extraordinary encounters, reaching the Golden Core stage would be his limit.

To fulfill the expectations of his master and senior brothers, Tianyang decided to risk everything and use a method of discarding his physical body to fully transform himself into a puppet, in an attempt to defy fate.

His entire later life was spent preparing for this.

He searched for suitable locations to set up the "Earth Fire Return To Origin Array", collected materials, and crafted puppets...

Once everything was ready, Tianyang resolutely completed his transformation into a puppet.

He then entered a deep sleep within the earth's veins, intending to use the power of the earth fire to temper the puppet, allowing it to evolve.

If everything went as planned, Tianyang would have completed his transformation within five hundred years, becoming a powerful entity on par with Soul Transformation True Monarch.

But fate had other plans...

Over five hundred years, the world changed drastically. Shifting earth veins caused the Earth Fire Return To Origin Array to lose much of its effectiveness, and the materials Tianyang initially used to craft the puppet were ordinary at best.

This resulted in the puppet's evolution process being exceptionally slow.

The anticipated five hundred years turned into several thousand years.

As time passed, even in his sleep, Tianyang's consciousness gradually eroded. He lost most of his will, leaving only the obsession of "Tianyang's Life is Not Weaker Than Others."

Li Fan guessed that the "Heaven-Flipping Palm", which had turned the Congyun Mountain Range into the Congyun Sea, might have been the cause of Tianyang's failure.

"Tianyang's life was unfortunate..." Li Fan shook his head and arrived at the plaza outside the cave mansion.

After carefully observing for a moment, Li Fan's figure became as elusive as a ghost. He transformed into a thin line, twisting and turning, safely passing through.

Without triggering any traps or mechanisms, Li Fan successfully reached the depths of the cave mansion.

There, sitting was a small child's skeleton.

In reality, due to Tianyang's congenital deficiency never being remedied, he remained the size of a child.

Li Fan approached cautiously, keeping his guard up.

Suddenly, creaking sounds echoed from the ground below.

Li Fan's heart stirred, and he quickly retreated.

Seventeen black-and-red puppets emerged and charged toward him.

Li Fan activated the Dao-Transforming technique and shouted, "Little Junior Brother, don't you recognize me?"

The puppets ignored him, attacking relentlessly.

They all launched their assaults on Li Fan.

Fortunately, they had the characteristic of becoming weaker when facing a weaker opponent and stronger when facing a stronger one.

A sword light forced the puppets back. Li Fan moved between them, continuously calling out Tianyang's name.

Gradually, the puppets' movements became hesitant.

At this moment, Li Fan took out a projection stone and projected Ling Xiao's last work into the air.

Finally, the puppets stopped attacking.

They looked up at the text and images in the air.

"Second..."

"Senior... brother?"

A slightly sluggish mechanical voice rang out.

Li Fan laughed, "Little Junior Brother, it's been a thousand years. How have you been?"

"Second... Senior Brother!"

Bang!

Cracks appeared on the seventeen puppets' bodies, and then they shattered like broken porcelain.

The scattered fragments dissolved and squirmed, eventually forming a small Tianyang puppet.

It flew in front of Li Fan, tilting its head and examining him.

Seeing the somewhat unfamiliar man before him, Tianyang appeared confused.

Li Fan patted Tianyang's shoulder and said, "Come on, let Senior Brother take you home!"

The Tianyang puppet was stunned.

A roaring sound came from the depths of the sea, and the ground trembled as if something was about to break through.

Li Fan chuckled, "Junior Brother, don't be so excited. The outside world is still full of bad people."

"It wouldn't be good if they found us."

As if understanding Li Fan's words, the puppet nodded after a long pause.

In an instant, the seabed returned to silence.

With Li Fan's help, it took three days for Tianyang to retrieve all the broken body components buried deep underground.

They were reassembled into one, and he quietly followed Li Fan.

Li Fan used a secret technique to conceal their auras.

He also took Tianyang's remains, which carried Eternal Remnant Memories, from the cave mansion.

The two of them traveled quickly and arrived at the nameless deserted island where the people who left the world in the previous life lived.

It took more than ten days for Li Fan to create a simple cave mansion, modeled after the original Reestablishing the Body and Transforming into the Dao sect.

After setting up concealment and protective formation, Li Fan looked at Tianyang and instructed, "Little Junior Brother, wait for me here. I'll be back soon."

Tianyang obediently nodded.

After Li Fan left, Tianyang went to his original room and quietly sat down.

Inside the Tianxuan Mirror.

"Waking up Tianyang a few years earlier does have some drawbacks."

"He hasn't fully completed his tempering, so there's still a bit of a gap before reaching the peak of Soul Transformation."

"But I can help him complete it."

After researching for a while, with the purchase of rare materials, contribution points were spent like flowing water.

Two days later, Li Fan returned to the nameless island with several storage rings full of supplies.

"Gray Mysterious Diamond, Willow-Touched Mysterious Stone, Scarlet Spirit Copper..."

"Little Junior Brother, these are materials your body can absorb to strengthen yourself."

"As for your daily routine, stay within this Return to Origin Formation. It will aid in your tempering..."

Li Fan carefully guided Tianyang.

Tianyang listened attentively.

Chapter 448: Resolving Deviations According to Plan

At this moment, the Tianyang Puppet was still acting purely on instinct.

It took Li Fan quite some effort to teach it how to use the Return to Origin Formation to temper and strengthen itself.

Fortunately, Tianyang was entirely obedient to his senior brother, Li Fan.

Even the most clumsy student will eventually learn with enough practice.

Seeing Tianyang gradually become more proficient, Li Fan felt a sense of relief.

"If someone comes to disturb you, don't kill them. Just capture and imprison them, and wait for me to return to deal with it."

"If you encounter someone you can't defeat, don't be reckless. Slip away quietly and meet up with me later to discuss our next move."

...

After giving Tianyang a few instructions, Li Fan flew out and sealed the cave.

"The strongest combat forces on the surface of Congyun Sea are just a few Soul Transformation True Monarch."

"Now that I have Junior Brother Tianyang backing me up, I can do a lot more."

Looking down at the unnamed island below, Li Fan smiled faintly. "From now on, I'll call you Shenhua Island."

"Once Tianyang completes his own repairs, I can also have him help refine mechanical puppets."

"If materials aren't scarce, creating a few Nascent Soul-level puppets shouldn't be too difficult."

"Although mechanical puppets can't be compared to true Nascent Soul cultivators, they are advantageous in that they don't tire and can overwhelm with sheer numbers."

The more Li Fan thought about it, the happier he felt.

After a while, he calmed himself and retrieved Tianyang's remains from his storage ring.

He still received the prompt that [Truth] could absorb it, but that familiar hunger was no longer there.

After considering it, Li Fan ultimately decided not to absorb it.

"I've already obtained everything I can from Tianyang's remnant memories. Absorbing it again wouldn't be very meaningful."

"It's better to keep it. Who knows, it might come in handy later."

Cultivators in the Xuanhuang Realm surely have ways to utilize Eternal Remnants Memories.

However, even in his previous life, when he reached the Level Thirty authority level, he hadn't found any relevant information.

Speaking of Eternal Remnants, Li Fan couldn't help but think of the skull of the first cultivator infected by the Mortal-immortal Plague that he had seen in his previous life.

"Maybe it was precisely because it was attached to an Eternal Remnant that it was placed at the center of the Divine Treasury Museum."

Collecting his thoughts, Li Fan did not return to Ten Thousand immortal Island but instead quietly arrived outside Liuli Island.

Finding the giant Liuli Fish, Li Fan concealed his aura and descended to the seabed.

He didn't act immediately but waited for something.

Time passed slowly, and when the moment arrived, matching the node in previous lifetimes when Li Fan re-entered the cultivation world and used the Formless Killing Intent to kill the Giant Liuli Fish, he replicated the process and retrieved the exquisite Luminous Azure Pearl.

With an ample supply of Enlightenment Pills now, the Liuli Pearl had become somewhat redundant.

But Li Fan didn't kill the giant Liuli Fish for the pearl.

He did it to ensure the attack on Lingwucao Island and the series of subsequent chain events would occur.

The reason for waiting until the anchor of the 8th year to act was to avoid the impact of any deviations from the time node.

Everything in the world is in a constant state of dynamic evolution, interconnected with one another.

His early arrival in the Xuanhuang Realm was like a stone falling into a pond, affecting many things.

Li Fan couldn't guarantee that the events from previous lifetimes wouldn't change in this one.

All he could do was minimize the deviations as much as possible.

"Stirring up the Spirit Mist Grass incident is critical to the Tianling Continent war, True Monach Jicheng's bounty, and the emergence of the Tianxuan Spirit Lock Formation."

"It must not fail."

"If it really doesn't work..."

The giant Liuli Fish was reduced to nothing in an instant, with streams of blood drifting upward.

A hint of ruthlessness flashed in Li Fan's eyes.

After finishing this task, Li Fan made another trip, collecting two blue-blooded corals.

Although that bit of contribution was insignificant to Li Fan now, it allowed him to connect with Chen Ying, a Nascent Soul cultivator from the Medicine Hall.

And this person would soon head to the Five Elements Great Cave Heaven.

As long as he used the *Formless Killing Intent* to monitor him, Li Fan would be the first to know when the Tianling Continent war erupted, giving him the opportunity to take advantage of the chaos.

Returning to the Tianxuan Mirror, Li Fan chose to submit the task.

He also inquired whether the other party was refining the Ice Intent Heartless Pill.

"Can you infer what pill I'm refining with just one main ingredient? Are you, by any chance, skilled in this field?" Chen Ying asked, curious.

As expected, his interest was piqued, and Chen Ying sent an inquiry.

"Haha, I don't know much about alchemy. I just know a bit about deducing and calculating." Li Fan replied with a smile.
