"Otherwise, how could I have known such a private matter!"

Li Fan chuckled and didn't dwell on this, instead discussing with Jiao Xiuyuan the feasibility of striking against Tantai Can's group.

"In this case, my previous concerns are no longer an issue."

"No matter what, they will have to recover the Samantabhadra True Leaf. Even if it means losing everything, they must do so."

"Otherwise, if the truth comes to light, not even the backers behind them will be able to protect them."

"At that point, it won't just be a matter of bankruptcy. Death and complete annihilation will be the least of their worries."

Jiao Xiuyuan's face turned cold as he spoke with unwavering determination.

"Excellent!" Li Fan applauded, his face showing approval.

"My only concern is that we are two against many, and we might not be able to match them."

"If we can't deliver a decisive blow and they catch wind of our plan, we might lose everything."

Jiao Xiuyuan suddenly said.

Chapter 459: Ten Thousand Cultivators Hear My Name

"This is the time, Daoist friend, when your countless puppets will prove their worth."

Li Fan smiled mysteriously and whispered for a moment.

Upon hearing this, Jiao Xiuyuan's eyes lit up, and he nodded repeatedly.

At the same time, in the fortified cities of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and within the various sect ruins in the wilderness, countless identical faces began to tell stories to those around them.

The protagonist of the story is an ancient cultivator from the Heavenly Mechanism Sect, who had been asleep for a thousand years and had just awakened.

This person possesses the secret techniques of the Heavenly Mechanism Sect, holding a treasure called the Heaven-Earth Divination Dice. This artifact can communicate with yin and yang and understand the mysteries of creation.

It can even see through time and foresee the future.

If one were to receive guidance from this person, countless opportunities would be within reach.

Not to mention defying fate, becoming rich overnight would be a trivial matter.

He Zhenghao from Congyun Sea is a living example.

If you don't believe it, just inquire, and you'll know!

In Jiao Xiuyuan's description, Li Fan was portrayed as possessing god-like skills, comparable to the ancient, all-powerful beings.

Such exaggerated words were naturally met with skepticism by most cultivators.

They shook their heads, dismissing it as just another attempt by some young immortal to create a name for themselves.

However, a small number of cultivators became intrigued by Li Fan.

They began to inquire about the details from Jiao Xiuyuan.

But at this point, Jiao Xiuyuan stopped talking.

Having their curiosity piqued, they couldn't easily let it go. Their curiosity became unbearable, leading many cultivators to inquire with their friends from Congyun Sea.

They were shocked to discover that perhaps this was not just baseless talk.

In Congyun Sea, there really was a group of cultivators who had made huge profits under Li Fan's guidance.

Unable to contact Li Fan, they turned to He Zhenghao and other cultivators who had participated in Li Fan's first recruitment.

At this point, He Zhenghao was a bit overwhelmed, as countless inquiries flooded in, leaving him at a loss for how to respond.

He could only reply instinctively.

The other cultivators who participated in the recruitment did the same.

Thus, the information was confirmed.

Some were greatly disappointed, as the first round of recruitment had only a mere 200,000 contribution points.

This seemed like an obvious scam, just a simple scheme to rob Peter to pay Paul, something they themselves could easily pull off.

But others, after researching the list of participating cultivators, were secretly delighted, thinking they had found a rare opportunity.

They discovered that one of the cultivators on the list was named Zhou Peng.

Although Zhou Peng's cultivation was not high, he had a close relationship with Elder Gongsun of the Tianji Hall in Congyun Sea.

Even cultivators outside of Congyun Sea had heard of Gongsun Qixuan's name.

If Li Fan were truly a scammer, would Zhou Peng have fallen for it so foolishly?

Considering that Zhou Peng had nearly bet his entire fortune on each recruitment, it seemed that this ancient Heavenly Mechanism Sect cultivator was indeed extraordinary!

After another round of filtering, although the number of cultivators inquiring about Li Fan's contact information decreased, their enthusiasm grew stronger.

In the Qianli Hall, Li Fan sat calmly, listening to the feedback from Jiao Xiuyuan without showing any emotion.

After letting the rumors brew for more than ten days, as public discussion about Li Fan began to decline, Li Fan said in a deep voice, "Daoist Jiao, it seems we can proceed with the next step."

"Indeed, Daoist friend. Watch my methods," Jiao Xiuyuan replied with a chuckle, his aura once again becoming subdued.

At the same time, throughout the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, whether it was cultivators watching from the sidelines or those desperately seeking Li Fan's contact information, they all received new information from Jiao Xiuyuan.

Recently, too many cultivators have been seeking out Li Fan, causing him great distress.

Facing numerous accusations of being a "fraud," Li Fan decided to prove his abilities.

So, he entrusted Jiao Xiuyuan to relay a unified message.

The time was set for three days later.

As soon as this news broke, it caused a sensation.

Those who believed in Li Fan were quietly excited.

Those who had always thought Li Fan was a fraud were full of disdain, waiting for him to make a fool of himself.

Regardless of belief, the topic was on everyone's mind.

Including those who were merely curious bystanders.

For a time, the vast majority of mid- to low-level cultivators in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance were looking forward to Li Fan's performance in three days.

As for those at the Soul Transformation stage or above, they were not very concerned with these small matters.

Only a few who were extremely bored paid any attention.

Amidst the discussions of countless cultivators, the appointed time finally arrived.

The once-desolate area outside the Qianli Hall was now crowded with people.

They all waited eagerly, watching Jiao Xiuyuan, anticipating Li Fan's speech.

Numerous Jiao Xiuyuan puppets moved in unison, their expressions identical.

He scanned the crowd with a solemn look.

Clearing his throat, Jiao Xiuyuan spoke in a deep voice: "Daoist Li Fan has said that to prove he is not a fraud, and to defend the honor of the Heavenly Mechanism Sect, he is willing to sacrifice his lifespan to activate a secret technique. He has successfully foreseen the future once again!"

Jiao Xiuyuan paused slightly, holding the crowd's attention.

After a moment, he loudly declared: "He saw that, not long from now, an item called Samantabhadra True Leaf will experience a massive price increase!"

"It will even cause a stir throughout the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance!"

As soon as he finished speaking, the surroundings fell silent.

Before the crowd could react, Jiao Xiuyuan swiftly retreated into the Qianli Hall.

With a bang, the doors slammed shut.

No matter how much the crowd outside called out, there was no response.

"Samantabhadra True Leaf? What is that? A price surge? Is this for real..." Most of the onlookers were puzzled, unsure whether to believe it.

However, some quick thinkers had already rushed back to the Tianxuan Mirror to check its price.

They were astonished to find that at the moment Jiao Xiuyuan made his declaration, the price of the Samantabhadra True Leaf had suddenly surged from 265 points.

"Everyone, stay rational! The price surely rose because too many people bought it at once," one knowledgeable cultivator analyzed calmly, trying to persuade the others.

"But this guy named Li Fan is obviously a scammer who must have hoarded a large stockpile of it beforehand. He’s just waiting for everyone to drive the price up so he can sell!"

However, the price increase was happening right before their eyes.

If the price were to drop later, as long as they sold before it fell, they could still make a small profit, right?

More people, seeing the rising price of the Samantabhadra True Leaf, couldn't resist and bought a small amount.

Though individual purchases were not large, the number of cultivators was considerable.

As a result, the price increase of the Samantabhadra True Leaf accelerated.

In a short time, it had risen from 265 points to 300 points.

Li Fan and Jiao Xiuyuan were frantically buying up the stock

In a courtyard Somewhere in the Tianxu State:

"Daoist Tantai! Disaster! Look at the price of the Samantabhadra True Leaf! It's 310..."

"No, it's 320 now!"

And by the time Tantai Can realized it, the price had already reached 340 points.

"This is bad!"

"Forget the price! Quickly buy up all the Samantabhadra True Leaf available on the market!"

He shouted in frustration.

Chapter 460: Another Crisis Settled

To better manipulate prices and reap profits, Tantai Can and his associates released nearly half of the Samantabhadra True Leaf into the market, creating a false impression of supply. This was done to attract unsuspecting cultivators, who would then be harvested by them.

However, at this moment, the Samantabhadra True Leaf, which once brought them profit, had become their death warrant.

The moment the Samantabhadra True Leaf were snapped up by frantic cultivators, Tantai Can realized that if they didn't take immediate action, they would soon face a disastrous situation.

Thus, Tantai Can made a decisive order: to spare no expense in retrieving the Samantabhadra True Leaf.

Stimulated by this, the price of Samantabhadra True Leaf skyrocketed, reaching an incomprehensible level for the cultivators.

In an instant, the price surged from over 300 points to 400 points, and it seemed to have no limit in its rise.

This extremely abnormal situation left the observing cultivators speechless.

"Something is off!" This thought involuntarily surfaced in everyone's mind.

"Could it be that Samantabhadra True Leaf has some unknown use?"

Caught up in their imaginations, the cultivators who had already bought in were secretly celebrating, excitedly watching the price continue to soar.

Those who previously believed that Li Fan's prediction was merely a scam, although still skeptical, were tempted to join the buying frenzy as they saw those who took action getting rich in an instant.

As Tantai Can and his group watched the madness unfold, many of them began to look grim.

If this continued, they might lose all the profits they had gained over the years!

"Tantai Daoist..."

Tantai Can waved his hand: "We have no choice but to take the loss this time! Keep buying!"

"As long as we survive this ordeal, we can always find a way to recover..."

A hint of ferocity flashed across his handsome face.

The others, hearing this, could only grit their teeth and continue competing with the increasingly frantic cultivators.

As time slowly passed, their contribution points were spent like flowing water, but the deficit they faced was enormous.

It was like trying to fill a bottomless pit.

Even though they were all wealthy, they gradually found themselves running out of resources.

But seeing that Tantai Can still hadn’t changed his mind, they wiped the cold sweat from their foreheads and nervously continued to repurchase the leaves.

The tension in the air was palpable.

At this moment, Tantai Can took out a flashing communication talisman. After checking it, his expression eased slightly.

After sending a message, he regained his calm and composed demeanor.

Seeing this, the others thought that there had been a turning point and also breathed a sigh of relief.

Meanwhile, in the Qianli hall...

In the previous mass purchase, Li Fan and Jiao Xiuyuan had already bought a large number of Samantabhadra True Leaf at a low price.

They were now smiling as they watched the price skyrocket.

However, out of caution, Li Fan decided to sell a portion of the Samantabhadra True Leaf to secure his gains.

Under Li Fan's persuasion, Jiao Xiuyuan also gradually sold some of his stock.

As they were discussing their next move, Jiao Xiuyuan suddenly froze.

A moment later, he smiled and said to Li Fan, "Tantai Can has sent a message asking for a favor. Would you like to hear it?"

"No harm in listening," Li Fan said casually.

"Ahem..."

Jiao Xiuyuan cleared his throat, mimicking Tantai Can's voice: "Brother Jiao, it's wise to leave room for future encounters. How about doing me a favor this time?"

Li Fan chuckled.

However, he didn’t respond rashly but instead asked Jiao Xiuyuan, "Brother Jiao, what do you think?"

Jiao Xiuyuan sneered, "It's just a junior from the Tantai family, does he really think he can talk about favors with me?"

"Maybe if his ancestor came, it would be more appropriate!"

Li Fan's heart stirred but didn’t press further. He clapped and praised, "Daoist Jiao, you are truly formidable!"

Then, he suddenly said, "However, there's no harm in agreeing to their request!"

This statement greatly surprised Jiao Xiuyuan.

Jiao Xiuyuan looked at Li Fan in disbelief, "You don't seem like someone who would suddenly grow a soft heart. Why are you showing mercy now?"

"Not at all!" Li Fan shook his head, "It’s just another opportunity to make a profit!"

Talking business piqued Jiao Xiuyuan’s interest. He quickly asked, "What do you mean?"

"In my earlier calculations, I saw not only the price surge of Samantabhadra True Leaf. I also foresaw that the impact of this turmoil would be so great that the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance would eventually be forced to intervene to stabilize the situation," Li Fan explained slowly.

"And it won’t be long before this happens."

"Oh? You mean that soon, the price of Samantabhadra True Leaf will fall back down?" Jiao Xiuyuan quickly understood.

"However, the exact timing is hard to predict; it could be at any moment. If we haven’t sold all our Samantabhadra True Leaf before the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance intervenes, the extra stock might end up worthless," Li Fan continued.

"Therefore, it would be wise to negotiate a favorable price with Tantai Can and sell all our stock to them."

"This way, we reduce our risk, make another substantial profit, and even gain a favor from Tantai Can."

Li Fan’s explanation was clear.

Jiao Xiuyuan's eyes lit up, and he laughed heartily, "Daoist Li Fan, you are truly a business genius!"

"Let’s do it your way!"

He immediately closed his eyes, clearly eager to reply to Tantai Can.

Li Fan, meanwhile, stared at the price of Samantabhadra True Leaf still climbing in the Tianxuan Mirror, calculating how to respond to the upcoming turmoil.

A short time later, Jiao Xiuyuan emerged from his trance.

"It’s done. Tantai Can has agreed to buy all our Samantabhadra True Leaf at 1,300 contribution points per leaf."

"Moreover, he promised to fulfill three of our requests within his capabilities."

"I believe that’s the limit of what he can bear, so I took the liberty of signing the contract," Jiao Xiuyuan explained.

"No problem, it’s a minor issue," Li Fan replied nonchalantly, handing over the Samantabhadra True Leaf to Jiao Xiuyuan to complete the deal.

Li Fan glanced at the price of Samantabhadra True Leaf in the Tianxuan Mirror.

930 points per leaf, and it was still rising, with no sign of stopping.

"On the surface, it seems Tantai Can and his group have profited. But..."

Li Fan smirked inwardly, waiting for the final result from the Tianxuan Mirror.

Shortly after Jiao Xiuyuan reported the completion of the transaction, a familiar, cold, and mechanical voice echoed in the minds of all cultivators in front of the Tianxuan Mirror.

It was exactly as Li Fan had heard in his past life.

"Due to the abnormal and significant price fluctuations of Samantabhadra True Leaf in recent days, to ensure the stable and harmonious development of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance, the following announcement is made."

Chapter 461: The Subtle Power of Samantabhadra True Leaf

What happened next was entirely predictable.

Amid the chaos caused by cultivators desperately fleeing for their lives, the price of Samantabhadra True Leaf leaves plummeted rapidly.

After just surpassing the thousand-point mark, the price dropped like a waterfall.

This spectacular sight left Jiao Xiuyuan in awe.

"Your prediction skills are truly remarkable, fellow Daoist!"

"If it weren't for your warning, I might have ended up just like them."

"I can already imagine the countless cultivators whose Dao hearts have been shattered!"

Jiao Xiuyuan said with a tone of schadenfreude.

Meanwhile, in Tianshu Prefecture.

Tantai Can, who had just completed a transaction and was secretly congratulating himself on his good luck, suddenly turned pale when he heard the announcement from the Tianxuan Mirror.

He watched helplessly as the price of the Samantabhadra True Leaf he had just bought for the astronomical sum of 1,300 points crashed.

Many couldn't bear the shock, spitting blood and fainting on the spot.

"Fellow Daoist Tantai!"

The remaining conscious cultivators looked at Tantai Can with resentment, hoping the leader of the Tantai family could come up with a solution.

Tantai Can's face turned ashen.

From the very beginning, it felt as though an invisible hand had been manipulating the situation from behind the scenes, leaving him no time to react.

He even began to suspect that this whole event might be a conspiracy targeting the Tantai family.

Perhaps Jiao Xiuyuan and that Heavenly Mechanism Sect cultivator Li Fan were nothing more than distractions orchestrated by the enemy.

As various possible targets flashed through his mind, Tantai Can started to actively think of ways to salvage the situation.

The loss this time was too great.

Even though his position in the family had become increasingly stable over the years, he might still face punishment.

His brothers might even use this as an excuse to attack him.

"No, I must recover some of the losses."

Gritting his teeth, an idea formed in Tantai Can's mind.

"Spread the word about our recent discovery!"

He said in a deep voice.

"What?"

"No! Tantai, stay calm!"

"We haven't reported this to the Immortal Alliance yet..."

The others were shocked and quickly tried to dissuade him.

But Tantai Can's mind was made up, and since he was responsible for most of this secret discovery, they had no choice but to comply.

Using their own methods, they spread the news into the market.

Meanwhile, on Ten Thousand Immortal Island, where Li Fan and Jiao Xiuyuan were tallying their recent gains, they noticed that the decline in Samantabhadra True Leaf had begun to slow.

Although the price was still gradually decreasing, the collapse had started to stabilize.

"Hmm? What's going on? The price of Samantabhadra True Leaf is more resilient than I expected," Li Fan said, glancing at Jiao Xiuyuan.

Jiao Xiuyuan paused for a moment, then replied with a strange expression, "Word is spreading that crafting artifacts from large quantities of Samantabhadra True Leaf can reduce the lifespan absorbed by the "Devouring White Mist..."

"Moreover, it can also guide one through the maze of white mist."

Jiao Xiuyuan narrowed his eyes, clearly surprised by this revelation.

Li Fan was taken aback, "Is it true?"

"Judging by the market's reaction, it doesn't seem to be a baseless rumor," Jiao Xiuyuan said solemnly.

"It seems Tantai Can leaked this secret to minimize his losses. Who would've thought Samantabhadra True Leaf had such a use? If they can resist the Devouring White Mist, this could change the landscape of the Xuanhuang Realm," he muttered, seemingly planning to quietly buy back the leaves.

"So that's why its price steadily increased in the previous life," Li Fan realized.

Having spent years in the Abyss, Li Fan was all too familiar with the terror of the Devouring White Mist.

If he had known about the power of the Samantabhadra True Leaf back then, the Tianxuan Spirit-Locking Formation within the mist wouldn't have been so painstaking to build.

"With these leaves, it's even possible to explore deeper into the maze..."

"And in the previous life, until I turned into an object and completed the Tianxuan Spirit-Locking Formation, Tantai Can never disclosed anything about this..."

The news was shocking.

Both Li Fan and Jiao Xiuyuan fell into deep thought, and the hall was silent.

"The Tantai family is interesting—discovering such important information and not reporting it in time," Jiao Xiuyuan eventually broke the silence.

"What kind of background does the Tantai family have?" Li Fan asked, continuing the conversation.

"The head of the Tantai family, Tantai Liruo, is a Dao Integration Immortal Sage and one of the three leaders of the Bureau Hall headquarters of the Immortal Alliance."

"Because of their low-key conduct, the Tantai family has remained relatively unknown to outsiders."

"Only when you reach a certain level do you realize how terrifying the Tantai family truly is."

Jiao Xiuyuan explained to Li Fan.

"However, the Bureau Hall isn't solely under the control of the Tantai family. Given the scale of this mistake, Tantai Liruo will have to provide some explanation."

Jiao Xiuyuan's tone suddenly turned curious, "I don't think Tantai Can is a fool, so why did he make such poor decisions this time?"

"Logically, this kind of critical information could have helped the Tantai family secure an even stronger position."

"But he threw it away for a little profit."

Li Fan pondered for a moment before analyzing, "Perhaps, this person isn't really that foolish."

"After all, the Tantai family is the Tantai family, and Tantai Can is Tantai Can."

Though it sounded convoluted, Jiao Xiuyuan seemed to grasp the meaning behind Li Fan's words.

Afterward, the two chatted casually for a while before agreeing to collaborate again if the opportunity arose.

Li Fan then used a secret passage within the hall to quietly return to the Tianxuan Mirror, avoiding the angry crowd of cultivators outside.

Calming his thoughts, Li Fan began to assess his gains.

He had acquired the Samantabhadra True Leaf at around 300 or 400 points each and sold most of them to Dantai Can for 1,300 points.

Even after accounting for a small portion sold in between, his overall profit had quadrupled.

Subtracting the unexpected losses from purchasing Spirit Mist Grass, Li Fan's wealth had grown from just over 5 million contributions to a staggering 18.6 million.

However, Li Fan was no longer a naive newcomer to the cultivation world.

Facing such enormous wealth, he remained calm and composed.

He skillfully opened the Tianxuan Mirror's shopping list, continuing to purchase items needed for trading with the empire and selecting objects that might be useful for future cultivation.

Unfortunately, his current access level was still limited, leaving him lamenting over the treasures he couldn't yet obtain.

The days of lavish spending didn't last long.

As expected, a voice soon echoed from the Tianxuan Mirror, summoning him to the Martial Arts Hall for an investigation.

They wanted to determine whether he had maliciously manipulated the market, potentially destabilizing the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Chapter 462: Trial at the Martial Hall

The last time Li Fan was investigated by the Tianji Hall due to the "Green Ox Cart Incident" was still fresh in his mind. Now, he found himself once again in the central core area of the Ten Thousand Immortal Island.

Passing by the Formation Hall, he continued inward until he reached a building with a stone monument inscribed with the word "Martial" at its entrance. He paused in front of it.

The moment he saw the word, Li Fan felt a suffocating, oppressive atmosphere descend upon him. It was as if several illusions appeared before his eyes, and the next moment, it seemed that blades and swords would be drawn upon him.

"The calligraphy is good, but it still lacks a certain essence compared to the 'Chaos' stone I saw before," Li Fan thought to himself, suppressing his instinctual urge to fight back.

With a stern expression, he walked into the Martial Hall without showing any emotion.

Unlike the Formation Hall, which was known for its overlapping spaces accessed via teleportation arrays, the main feature of the Martial Hall consisted of numerous giant stones floating in the air.

The jagged stones, scattered like stars across the sky, varied greatly in shape—some resembled humans or beasts, others like mountains or rivers.

On top of these giant stones, one could vaguely see pavilions, plants, and even the occasional figure flying by. However, the flying stone on which Li Fan stood was particularly special.

It was barren and smooth, almost like a mirror. Faint lines of light seemed to flow beneath the surface of the stone. As soon as Li Fan stepped onto the stone, a formation was activated, and he felt himself being uncontrollably moved to the center of the floating stone.

An inexplicable energy surged up from beneath his feet, binding him like invisible chains.

At the same time, as Li Fan looked up, the surrounding flying stones, like stars, began to undergo mysterious changes.

Initially, the area where Li Fan stood was an inconspicuous corner of the starry sea. But once he was restrained, the scenery above shifted, as if the stars were revolving around him.

In an instant, Li Fan seemed to be at the center of the starry sea, becoming the absolute focus of this space.

He also sensed countless gazes hidden behind the giant stones, all converging on him.

This was true "attention from all sides"! Each gaze was as heavy as a mountain. If it were any other cultivator, unaccustomed to such a scene or lacking strong mental fortitude, they would have collapsed to their knees on the spot.

Yet, Li Fan remained calm and collected, his expression unchanged.

After a brief standoff, a solemn voice echoed through the stone sea.

"Li Fan, cultivator, due to the abnormal price fluctuations of the Samantabhadra True Leaf, you are summoned here to undergo investigation."

"This investigation will be conducted by the Martial Hall of Congyun Sea, with the cooperation of the Tianji Hall and the Administrative Hall."

"Due to the significant impact and extremely malicious nature of this incident, the headquarters of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance has dispatched a special envoy to oversee the entire process."

"In the spirit of fairness, justice, and transparency, this investigation will not be kept confidential and will be subject to the supervision of all members of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance."

...

After a long preamble, the booming voice finally got to the main point.

"Li Fan, during the investigation, you are allowed to defend yourself."

"But you will be held accountable for the truthfulness of every word you say. If any concealment or deceit is discovered, you will be punished according to the severity of the offense, in line with the Immortal Alliance's laws."

The words echoed in his mind, and Li Fan nodded to indicate his understanding.

"Now, I declare the investigation officially begins."

"Martial Hall, please have Jin Chongcheng recount the details of this incident."

A flash of light appeared, and a cultivator wearing the uniform of the Martial Hall of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance appeared in mid-air above Li Fan.

Standing above Li Fan, he looked up at the countless floating stones in the sky and began to speak.

"The abnormal price fluctuations of the Samantabhadra True Leaf began sixteen days ago, triggered by a statement made by this cultivator, Li Fan."

"He spread the message through Jiao Xiuyuan that the 'price of the Samantabhadra True Leaf would skyrocket.' Afterward..."

Jin Chongcheng concisely summarized the events leading up to the incident. As he spoke, scenes began to appear on the sky screen: a graph depicting the price fluctuations of the Pu Xian True Leaf, images of cultivators frantically buying it, and the aftermath of the Tianxuan Mirror's stabilization, showing countless cultivators suffering heavy losses.

"Furthermore, we noticed that before the price of the Samantabhadra True Leaf rose, cultivator Li Fan had already purchased a large stock. He sold it at the peak, making a substantial profit."

"Based on this, we suspect that cultivator Li Fan disseminated false information, exploited the herd mentality of the public for profit, and maliciously disrupted the stability of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance," Jin Chongcheng added.

After he finished speaking, the Martial Hall fell into silence.

Li Fan felt the weight of the gazes on him increase.

If it were any ordinary cultivator, they might have already paled and confessed under the pressure.

However, Li Fan raised his head and interrupted Jin Chongcheng, "I have an objection!"

"Spreading false information? Where does that accusation come from? Yes, I did make a bit of money in this incident..."

Ignoring the killing intent in the gazes directed at him, Li Fan continued, "But as cultivators, pursuing profit is only natural. I have the ability to predict the future, and I used it to make a profit. What's wrong with that?"

"And the subsequent price trend of the Samantabhadra True Leaf matched my predictions. Doesn't that just prove the accuracy of my foresight?" Li Fan argued righteously.

Whispers spread through the Martial Hall.

"Silence!"

"As for whether using predictive techniques for profit is legitimate or not, we ask Elder Gongsun Qixuan of the Tianji Hall to speak."

A flash of light replaced Jin Chongcheng with a young scholar who appeared to be in his early twenties.

Despite his handsome appearance, he looked somewhat listless.

"It's him..." Li Fan narrowed his eyes slightly as he recognized the person and nodded in acknowledgment.

This Gongsun Qixuan was the very same cultivator Li Fan had encountered during his previous investigation by the Tianji Hall. The mysterious aura emanating from him had left a deep impression on Li Fan.

After exchanging polite greetings with Li Fan, Gongsun Qixuan lightly coughed and began to speak slowly, "The stance of our Tianji Hall has never changed."

"The results of predictive techniques can certainly be used as a reference for future actions. If not, why would our Tianji Hall even exist?"

"We do it, so naturally, there's no reason to forbid other cultivators within the alliance from doing the same."

Gongsun Qixuan's words were quite fair and made sense.

Li Fan nodded repeatedly as he listened.

However, at that moment, Gongsun Qixuan's tone changed, and he fixed his sharp gaze on Li Fan.

"But, I question whether this cultivator Li Fan truly possesses the ability to predict the future!"

"If he genuinely predicted that 'the price of the Samantabhadra True Leaf would skyrocket,' then our Tianji Hall believes he is innocent."

"But if..."

A cold glint flashed in Gongsun Qixuan's eyes.

"If this was fabricated out of thin air by him."

"We suggest that he be sentenced to death."

Chapter 463: The Revelation of the Mysterious Net

Gongsun Qixuan's tone was filled with undisguised killing intent.

“Well then, please prove yourself, Daoist friend!” he said coldly, staring at Li Fan.

Now, all the pressure shifted to Li Fan.

More and more eyes from all directions focused on him.

“Since Daoist friend claims to be able to deduce future events, why not demonstrate here and now?” Gongsun Qixuan demanded, his voice leaving no room for Li Fan to refuse. “If you can accurately predict the rise and fall of specific item prices, deducing something else should be a simple task.”

Li Fan hesitated for a moment, but had no choice but to agree.

“In that case, I shall make a humble attempt!” He clasped his hands in salute and took out the [Heaven-Earth Divination Dice] that he had prepared. Closing his eyes, he stood motionless.

The entire venue instantly fell silent, and everyone stared intently at Li Fan's next move.

Within the jade slips he had obtained from the relics of the Heavenly mechanism Sect, there were indeed a few future-deduction techniques. However, these were low-level spells, with a success rate so low that even hitting one out of a hundred would be considered lucky.

After studying them carefully, Li Fan roughly grasped their mechanics. They were enough to put on a show but certainly not capable of actually predicting anything.

He knew that with countless eyes watching him, he couldn't be too bold. He was prepared to flee immediately if his act was exposed.

Simultaneously, he activated the secret technique [Sky Shrouding Palm], and a mysterious aura instantly enveloped his body.

The Heaven and Earth Divination Dice floated in front of Li Fan and began to spin rapidly. The twenty facets of the dice flashed with fragmented, fleeting images.

Li Fan knew that even if these scenes passed by in a blink, they would not escape the eyes of the skilled cultivators present. Therefore, the images shown by the Heaven and Earth Divination Dice weren’t just random—they were real events from his past life, ones he would experience in the future.

Truth mixed with lies, falsehood hidden within truth. Only then could he deceive the onlookers.

However, no matter how realistic it appeared, Li Fan knew that this fake act couldn’t withstand close scrutiny.

As the Heaven and Earth Divination Dice spun faster and faster, a scene of utter darkness began to emerge. Li Fan made his body tremble uncontrollably, his face growing paler by the second, with fear spreading across his features.

Using the [Creation Furnace Art], he suddenly spat out a mouthful of blood and exclaimed, “The Tianxuan Lock of Spirit, the union of Xuan and Huang?!”

At that moment, the Heaven and Earth Divination Dice lost all its brilliance and stopped spinning, with all twenty facets now pitch black.

Li Fan collapsed weakly to the ground, looking utterly drained.

The crowd in the Martial Hall erupted in shock.

No one could remain calm after hearing the words "The Tianxuan Lock of Spirit, the union of Xuan and Huang." The implications were simply too terrifying.

At that moment, a figure dressed in black, whose face was obscured, appeared out of thin air. He ignored the gravely injured Li Fan and instead looked at Gongsun Qixuan.

“Daoist Gongsun…” The figure clearly sought Gongsun Qixuan’s opinion.

He suspected that this cultivator, Li Fan, might just be putting on a show. But, not being proficient in deduction arts himself, and with Li Fan allegedly being an ancient cultivator who had fallen into slumber in ancient times, there was a possibility that ancient methods differed from modern ones.

Moreover, the conclusion Li Fan had deduced was indeed alarming.

To be cautious, the figure decided to defer to an expert’s judgment.

Gongsun Qixuan’s lips moved as he silently repeated the words Li Fan had just deduced. His expression grew increasingly grim.

A painting appeared in front of him, slowly unfurling. The canvas was originally blank, but as Gongsun Qixuan waved his hand like a brush, colors began to fill the scene. Something seemed to be forming on the painting.

However, the act of creating this painting seemed to be a huge drain on Gongsun Qixuan’s strength. Already looking a bit sickly, his condition worsened as his back began to hunch under an invisible weight, slowing his movements.

Finally, as the image on the painting became clearer, Gongsun Qixuan’s hand trembled violently. He seemed to encounter an immense force, unable to complete the final stroke no matter how hard he tried.

A look of frustration crossed Gongsun Qixuan’s face. He bit his tongue and spat out a mouthful of blood. As the blood splattered into the air, he clenched his fists and forcefully completed the painting, using his blood as ink and his fists as brushes.

When everyone in the Martial Hall, including Gongsun Qixuan himself, turned to see the content of the painting, a brilliant green light burst from the canvas, flooding the hall and spreading in all directions.

The first to be hit was Gongsun Qixuan himself. Already exhausted from forcibly completing the deduction, he had no strength left to defend himself. Caught off guard, he was struck head-on.

"Ah!"

A scream of agony escaped from Gongsun Qixuan as his body dissolved into the green light. Only a trace of black mist remained, drifting away to an unknown destination.

“Damn it, a backlash from the Heavenly Mysteries?!”

“Elder Gongsun?!”

The sudden turn of events left the cultivators in the Martial Hall in utter shock.

But soon, they had their own problems to worry about.

The green light spread like a tide, and everything it touched—whether strange boulders or living creatures—disappeared without a trace, as if melting into water.

The black-robed cultivator’s face darkened as he tried to stop the green light’s spread, but to no avail. The source of this green energy was mysterious and impossible to resist. Left with no other choice, he was forced to retreat.

In mere moments, the public trial had turned into a race to see who could escape fastest.

Amidst the desperate screams of the cultivators, the scene grew more chaotic and terrifying.

The moment Li Fan saw the familiar green light from Gongsun Qixuan’s deduction painting, he knew something had gone terribly wrong.

Although he wasn’t sure what had triggered it, or why Gongsun Qixuan’s deduction had summoned the power of the [Mysterious Net], Li Fan didn’t hesitate to slip away unnoticed, blending in with the panicking crowd as they fled from the Martial Hall.

The strange phenomena at the Martial Hall on Ten Thousand Immortal Island quickly caught the attention of other cultivators on the island. The once magnificent building trembled before collapsing in a series of violent shakes.

Just as the green light threatened to continue spreading outward, a rainbow beam of light shot down from the sky, descending upon Ten Thousand Immortal Island.

Countless transparent runes surged from the rainbow light, forming a massive net that captured the dispersing green light.

The crisis was swiftly resolved.

Amidst the fleeing crowd, Li Fan bowed his head slightly, for the newcomer was none other than Lu Xichan, the chief formation master of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s Strategy Formation Hall!

Chapter 464: Sealing Ten Thousand Immortal Island

Lu Xichan gazed at the now obliterated Martial Arts Hall on Ten Thousand Immortal Island, her brows slightly furrowed.

Faint green threads appeared, twining around her fingertips.

She stared at this familiar yet strange green glow, a trace of surprise flashing in her eyes.

Even though the Congyun Sea was a remote place, very few cultivators knew of Lu Xichan's true identity.

However, under her overwhelming aura, she remained silent, and the entire Ten Thousand Immortal Island was eerily quiet.

The cultivators did not dare to look at her directly, all bowing their heads in deference, much like Li Fan.

At the same time, they were guessing in their hearts the identity of this female cultivator.

Finally, two figures flew out from the island's central Administrative Hall to greet her.

A man and a woman, none other than Ziyun and Hongxi, the only two Soul Transformation True Monarchs in the Congyun Sea.

"Greetings, Chief Lu!"

They bowed in unison, a trace of nervousness evident on their faces.

For both leaders of the Congyun Sea to show such deference, it was clear this was an extraordinary figure!

The other cultivators, who had bowed their heads in submission, were both shocked and filled with curiosity.

They secretly wondered why such an important figure like Chief Lu had come to this remote corner of the world.

Was it for this mysterious green light?

“No need for formalities. There is urgent business at hand.”

Lu Xichan glanced coldly at the cultivators on Ten Thousand Immortal Island and said, "From now on, the island is under lockdown. Without my orders, no one is permitted to leave."

As she spoke, she pointed toward the sky.

Transparent patterns spread from the center, quickly enveloping the entire island.

"I have already applied to cut off the connection between this place's Tianxuan Mirror and the outside world. Conventional communication methods have also been blocked by me."

"Until the matter is thoroughly investigated, you are responsible for maintaining order on the island."

Hongxi, hearing this, immediately grasped the gravity of the situation and nodded in agreement.

The cultivators on the island exchanged bewildered glances.

It seemed something serious had happened!

The entire island was sealed off, allowing no one to enter or leave.

This was likely the first time such a large-scale lockdown had occurred since Ten Thousand Immortal Island was established!

Hidden among the crowd, Li Fan felt uneasy.

The course of events in this world had far exceeded his expectations.

Initially, he only intended to play a charlatan to fool the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's investigation.

But who would have thought that Gongsun Qixuan's reputation was well deserved? He actually deduced something based on the principle of "Tianxuan Locking Spirit, Union of Xuan and Huang."

He even triggered green energy similar to the Tianxuan Network.

What he had not expected even more was that the anomaly from tens of thousands of miles away had immediately caught Lu Xichan's attention.

She crossed states in an instant and sealed off Ten Thousand Immortal Island.

"Let's take it one step at a time. If I can get through this safely, things might return to my control," Li Fan thought, narrowing his eyes and adjusting his plan.

After Lu Xichan took over Ten Thousand Immortal Island, black-robed cultivators began arriving on the island via teleportation arrays.

They carried an overwhelming aura of killing intent that lingered and patrolled various areas of the island.

The cultivators were divided into groups and interrogated one by one in sequence.

The first to be interrogated, naturally, were the survivors of the mutation at the Martial Arts Hall.

As the instigator of the incident, Li Fan was also the first target of the interrogation.

Fortunately, he did not have to face Lu Xichan directly.

However, he could faintly feel a gaze falling on him now and then, making him cautious.

Feigning weakness, with a pale complexion, he pretended not to have fully recovered from his injuries.

Li Fan truthfully recounted the events that had taken place in the Martial Arts Hall.

"After deducing the phrase, I was immediately hit by a backlash from the heavens."

"As for what Elder Gongsun saw or how he triggered that terrifying green light, I have no idea."

Li Fan coughed and put on an innocent expression, shifting all the blame onto Gongsun Qixuan.

The three cultivators in charge of the interrogation asked a few more details before taking Li Fan into a small, dark room deep within the Administrative Hall, where he was detained.

Li Fan cooperated fully throughout.

Inside the isolated dark room, cut off from the outside world, he could not know what was happening on Ten Thousand Immortal Island.

So, Li Fan closed his eyes and began meditating.

Meanwhile, on Tai'an Island.

The clone "Zhou Qing'ang" quietly left the island's protective formation, heading to the agreed meeting spot with the stone-faced man.

"Boss, something big has happened!"

Before the other party could say anything, Li Fan spoke first.

"Uh... what's the rush? Speak slowly!" the stone-faced man scolded.

"It seems there’s been a major incident on Ten Thousand Immortal Island. Since just now, all contact with the island's cultivators has been lost!" Li Fan's anxious tone was mixed with a hint of excitement.

"Before I came, I made some inquiries. Just before the island was sealed off, someone saw a rainbow light descending from the central headquarters of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, arriving at Ten Thousand Immortal Island."

"This lockdown must be related to that rainbow light!" Li Fan said hurriedly.

The stone-faced man was taken aback by the sudden news.

He remained silent for a long time, seemingly verifying the accuracy of the information.

After a while, he spoke in a somewhat shocked tone, "It’s true!"

"What is the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance up to?!"

"Wait... that rainbow light..."

"Lu Xichan!"

His voice immediately rose several notches.

"Boss, who's Lu Xichan?" Li Fan feigned curiosity and asked.

"She's the Chief of the Strategy Formation Division of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, a truly significant figure. But why would she come to Congyun Sea?" The stone-faced man's voice was filled with both confusion and excitement.

Like a hungry wolf encountering prey, he sensed that there must be some earth-shattering secret involved in this event.

If they could uncover it...

"Boss, could this be a great opportunity for us to make a name for ourselves?" Li Fan asked, pretending to suddenly realize something.

"Indeed! We must find out the reason for her visit to Congyun Sea!" the stone-faced man said in a serious tone.

"But Ten Thousand Immortal Island is now sealed off, and even communication has been blocked. It seems almost impossible to figure out what's going on inside..." Li Fan frowned, appearing troubled.

Suddenly, as if remembering something, he exclaimed, "Boss, I have an idea."

"Oh? Let's hear it."

"Do you remember He Zhenghao, the one who sold us the entrance exam questions for the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance? Maybe he can help!"

"He Zhenghao..." The stone-faced man pondered for a moment before nodding slightly.

"Go ahead and try. I'll also think of other solutions."

"If you find anything, contact me."

"If he can’t help, then you’ll have to lay low again," the stone-faced man instructed.

"Understood." As the light on the stone face dimmed, Li Fan quickly left.

After having tea with He Zhenghao on Liuli Island, Li Fan swiftly returned.

"Boss, there's a way!"

"What?" The stone-faced man was surprised at how quickly "Zhou Qing'ang" had found a solution and even more surprised that He Zhenghao had information about the sealed Ten Thousand Immortal Island.

"What did he say?" the stone-faced man asked in a serious tone.

"One million contribution points, flat rate!" Li Fan hesitated for a moment, then said in a low voice.

Chapter 465: The Five Elders Association Takes Action

"Ten million contribution points?! Is he crazy?" The human face exclaimed in shock.

However, it quickly regained composure.

"Hmph, his appetite is really growing larger by the day. But is he certain that what happened on the Island of Ten Thousand Immortals is worth that much?"

Li Fan cautiously added after observing the other’s expression, "He has other conditions too."

"Payment first, delivery after."

"And he also said that whether we proceed with the trade is entirely up to us, he’s not forcing us. But he guarantees that this piece of information is worth far more. He's offering this price because he's risking his life and considers us old customers."

Hearing such outrageous conditions, the human face no longer appeared as agitated as before.

After thinking deeply for a moment, he said, "This is a serious matter. I'll go seek instructions first. Stay here and don't move."

With that, the image on the stone vanished instantly.

Li Fan patiently waited. A stick of incense later, the human face reappeared.

"Agree to his terms!" he said decisively.

"Boss?!" Li Fan was shocked at the other’s bold decision.

"Earlier, He Zhenghao said that the risks of this trade are too great, and it would be inconvenient for him to show up directly, so a middleman is required. If we want to trade, we are to send the spirit stones to this island. Just tell them you are from the 'Federation of All Worlds,' and don’t worry about anything else. Just hand the spirit stones over." Li Fan gave a set of coordinates, which pointed to the island where Li Chenfeng and the others from the Empire were located.

"Once he's sure the spirit stones have been received, he’ll send us the information," Li Fan quickly added.

"The 'Federation Of all Worlds'—what is that?"

"Could it be..." The human face seemed to have realized something and suddenly fell silent.

"At the latest, the spirit stones will arrive the day after tomorrow. Go keep an eye on He Zhenghao, and don't let him escape," the human face instructed.

"Yes, boss," Li Fan replied obediently.

"This is quite a gamble. If we win, we’ll have achieved great merit. But if we lose..." The human face muttered to himself, clearly anxious.

Such a large amount and such an unreliable transaction method were things the human face had never encountered before, and it showed in his expression.

"Boss, don't worry. Based on my interactions with He Zhenghao over this time, I believe he is trustworthy," Li Fan reassured.

"Let’s hope so. Go now."

After ending the communication, Li Fan hurried back to Tai'an Island, while also using the sensor of the "Formless Killing Intent" to monitor Li Chenfeng's situation.

Two days later.

A cultivator in black robes appeared above the Empire's island, looking around cautiously as instructed.

A woman in a blue dress suddenly appeared in front of him.

The two faced off, their expressions both somewhat tense.

According to the transaction procedure, the black-robed cultivator reported his identity: "I am a cultivator from the Federation Of all Worlds."

With that, he threw over a storage ring.

The woman in blue caught it and inspected it, her pupils narrowing sharply.

"You..."

She was about to say something, but the black-robed cultivator simply waved his hand and left without a word.

The blue-dressed woman stood there in disbelief, frozen in place.

"Master!"

Li Chenfeng, sensing something was wrong, quickly flew over to investigate.

The blue-dressed woman handed him the storage ring, and after Li Chenfeng inspected it, he too was left in a daze.

"Master, what on earth...?" Li Chenfeng was full of confusion.

"It seems we weren’t as prepared as we thought." The woman in blue smiled bitterly.

...

"The Five Elders Association really is efficient, never dragging their feet!" Sensing how smoothly the transaction was proceeding, Li Fan couldn't help but praise inwardly.

He then headed to Liuli Island, had a cup of tea with He Zhenghao, and quickly set off to the rendezvous point.

Activating the communication with the human face, Li Fan appeared somewhat bewildered and anxious.

"What about the information He Zhenghao was supposed to deliver?" The human face wasted no time with pleasantries and asked directly.

"He quietly told me already," Li Fan said softly. "Just one phrase."

"Hmm?"

Li Fan placed his palms on the stone and focused his mind, transmitting the message.

"Tianxuan Spirit Locking..."

"Xuanhuang Returns..."

"Union?"

On the other end, silence descended completely.

Moments later, faint chaotic noises could be heard, the commotion growing louder.

"The transaction is complete. Continue to lay low. If anything unusual happens, I'll contact you again." Despite trying to remain calm, Li Fan could still detect a hint of fear in the human face’s voice.

The stone disintegrated into dust, and the communication was cut off.

"Zhou Qingang" still wore a confused expression as he returned to Tai'an Island.

It wasn’t until he reached the secluded depths of the island's protective formation that he returned to his normal self.

"With the interference from the Five Elders Association, even if the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance tries to set up the Tianxuan Spirit Locking Formation, they may find it beyond their capabilities."

"How things will unfold still remains to be seen."

Li Fan narrowed his eyes as his attention shifted back to his true self on Ten Thousand Immortal Island.

After some investigation, Li Fan was released from confinement.

His testimony matched that of the surviving cultivators at the time, with nothing out of the ordinary.

The Immortal Alliance's primary focus remained on the whereabouts of Gongsun Qixuan.

It was his deduction that triggered the strange and terrifying green light.

Although Li Fan had deduced some results beforehand, the actual situation showed that Gongsun Qixuan's deduction ability was superior.

Figuring out what Gongsun Qixuan had seen at the time became the most critical task.

Ten Thousand Immortal Island remained on lockdown.

However, those cultivators who had been interrogated were allowed to move freely on the island after signing confidentiality agreements.

Although the events of that day couldn’t be discussed in detail, Li Fan's extraordinary deducing ability, as demonstrated in the skyrocketing price of Samantabhadra True Leaf and the strange events at the Martial Hall, was widely acknowledged.

As a result, many cultivators began to flock to Li Fan.

Unable to access the Tianxuan Mirror and seeking peace, Li Fan decided to hide at the Qianli Hall.

Qianli Hall had been closed since the day it was blocked, its doors tightly shut.

Li Fan used the secret passage from before to re-enter.

Once inside, he found that although Jiao Xiuyuan was present, he appeared dazed and expressionless.

No matter how much Li Fan called out, Jiao Xiuyuan didn’t respond at all.

It was as if the puppet had lost control due to the destruction of the Dao Stone in his previous life, but this time, it seemed even worse.

Li Fan observed carefully for a moment, then nodded thoughtfully.

"It must be Lu Xichan’s seal that severed the connection between the puppet and its original body."

"As expected from the chief of the Strategy Formation Hall, her methods are extraordinary."

"However, she would never imagine that the world still holds a divine technique like the 'Profound True Spirit Transformation.'"

Li Fan couldn't help but feel a little sense of pride.

With nothing else to do, he strolled around the deserted Qianli Hall.

Chapter 466: No Regrets in the Way of Puppetry

Jiao Xiuyuan transformed himself into thousands of puppets, single-handedly supporting the vast commercial organization known as Qianli Hall, which spanned across various locations of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

In various ruins and desolate wildernesses with few people, one might catch a glimpse of his presence.

He even had the power to stir up great disturbances in the Xuanhuang Realm.

There was a certain flavor of "entering the Dao through business" about him.

However, his luck seemed to be somewhat unfortunate.

Though he claimed he never made a losing deal, from Li Fan's experience with him, it appeared Jiao Xiuyuan often lost money in business.

For instance, when Li Fan first met him, he had stockpiled a large number of Concealment Talismans, but due to the incident with Five Elements Grand Cave Heaven, the price of the talismans plummeted.

Later, he painstakingly unearthed a few Minor Medicine King Cauldrons, and if he had waited for the return of the "True Medicine King Cauldron", he would have surely made a fortune.

But it was as if he was destined not to be that lucky. He sold all of those minor cauldrons early on at a low price.

"Perhaps he truly never made a loss, but it seems he always missed the big opportunities to get rich."

"Even in the previous life, when he partnered with me in the business of Spirit Mist Grass, a moment of greed caused him to hesitate too long, and the vast wealth he had in hand vanished in an instant."

"Only in this life has he truly profited. I wonder if something is going to change for him."

As Li Fan pondered, he carefully examined the items on Jiao Xiuyuan's shelves, hoping to find something valuable, like the Minor Medicine King Cauldron, to make a small gain.

The items on the shelves were diverse: talismans, formation diagrams, pills, and more, all available.

Li Fan paid special attention to the older-looking items.

Most of them were badly damaged, filled with the marks of history.

Scrolls, various ornaments, and artifacts that had long lost their spiritual energy filled the shelves.

Li Fan's gaze swept across them one by one.

Suddenly, he stopped at an ancient painting.

His expression became slightly serious as he carefully removed the scroll and slowly unrolled it.

It wasn’t that the painting itself was special, but rather its content that caught Li Fan's attention.

The painting depicted a grand and magnificent sect entrance.

The sky and earth seemed boundless, with dozens of cultivators standing in the clouds, pointing into the distance.

Among the sea of clouds, the towering buildings at the mountain's peak were faintly visible.

"Luan Birds" and "Jiaolong Dragons", along with other exotic beasts, wandered among the mountains.

In the square at the foot of the mountain, hundreds of young disciples, still innocent in appearance, stood.

They looked up at the cultivators in the sky, their faces full of excitement and admiration.

It truly depicted a thriving scene of a flourishing sect!

But...

Li Fan had seen this sect before, and it was the complete opposite of the prosperity in the painting.

The ground was littered with corpses, rivers of blood flowed.

The sect's entrance was in ruins, reduced to rubble.

It was the very scene he saw at the bottom of the Void Abyss after the dense fog had cleared during his time in the Great Xuan.

The words "Immortal Dao is dead" carved on the cliff had deeply shaken Li Fan at the time.

Now, Li Fan knew that this was undoubtedly the aftermath of the great calamity that occurred when the disciples of the sect slaughtered each other after the arrival of the Disaster of incompatibility Of cultivating same technique.

"Which sect was this? Why did I see this place back then?"

It was known that the scene each person saw at the bottom of the Void Abyss was different.

The fact that Li Fan saw this ruined sect might have been a coincidence.

But Li Fan believed there might be some kind of guidance in it.

After carefully storing away the painting, Li Fan continued to browse the shelves but found nothing else of value.

He then approached Jiao Xiuyuan.

"Daoist Jiao? Daoist Jiao!"

Li Fan called out symbolically a few times. When Jiao still did not respond, Li Fan reached out and began to feel around him.

It wasn’t due to any strange habit, but rather to take this rare opportunity to study Jiao Xiuyuan's Thousand Puppet Dao.

Although Profound True Spirit Transformation was already an astonishing divine art, it still had some small flaws.

Derived from the Stealing Sky and changing the Sun Technique, it could only maintain one clone at a time, which was a bit disappointing.

If he could combine it with the Thousand Puppet Dao and take it a step further...

"Thousands of avatars, indistinguishable from the real."

As Li Fan's imagination ran wild, his hands moved without hesitation.

"Completely identical to the real body, even using divine sense to penetrate and perceive would find no difference."

"The control core seems to be in the head, glowing with a blue light similar to the Dao Derivation Stone."

"I’ve seen the remains of puppets before—dry and yellow like decaying wood. Could it be that Jiao Xiuyuan’s puppet avatars are made from some special type of wood?"

...

As Li Fan continued to examine the puppet in front of him, combining it with what he had learned, he felt he was beginning to grasp something.

Just as he was secretly pleased with himself, he suddenly noticed that Jiao Xiuyuan's eyelids were twitching slightly.

His heart skipped a beat, and Li Fan instantly moved away.

Moments later, he noticed that Jiao Xiuyuan's previously lifeless eyes were becoming lively again.

"Daoist Jiao, you’re awake?" Li Fan asked, feigning concern.

"Hmm? Daoist Li? Why are you here?" Jiao Xiuyuan suspiciously eyed Li Fan.

Li Fan originally wanted to explain the events that had taken place after he was questioned, but he had signed a non-disclosure agreement, leaving him unable to speak.

He had no choice but to tell Jiao Xiuyuan that he was simply avoiding the crowd and came here to hide.

"I lost contact with this puppet shortly after Lu Xichan arrived. I knew then that something big had happened, and sure enough..."

"That non-disclosure agreement, huh..."

Jiao Xiuyuan glanced at Li Fan and guessed the reason for his silence.

"No wonder things seem unsettled over in Tianquan and Tianyuzhou Prefecture..." Jiao Xiuyuan squinted, about to delve into his thoughts, but his gaze swept over his shop, and his expression immediately changed.

In a flash, he was at the shelves, checking things over, and exclaimed, "Why does it look like a painting is missing?"

"That was something I painstakingly dug out from a pile of junk!"

Li Fan was about to tell him that the painting was with him.

But before he could, the puppet in front of him suddenly exploded with a "bang," shattering into pieces.

Fortunately, it wasn’t flesh and blood flying everywhere, but just scattered wood shavings.

"Daoist Jiao!" Li Fan was momentarily stunned by the sudden event.

"I'm fine!" In an instant, another puppet emerged from under the counter.

His face full of gloom, Jiao Xiuyuan grabbed a broom and began cleaning up the scene.

"What just happened?" Li Fan couldn’t help but ask out of curiosity.

"I made a losing deal, so the puppet couldn’t be sustained." Jiao Xiuyuan didn’t offer much explanation, merely shaking his head and sighing.

"How strange. How could that painting have disappeared? Who would have the nerve to steal from me?" After cleaning up, Jiao Xiuyuan stroked his chin, angrily muttering.

"Uh, Daoist Jiao, I forgot to mention earlier. When you lost consciousness, I noticed that the painting was quite nice, so I put it away." At this moment, Li Fan finally spoke.

---

Chapter 467: The One Destined for Calamity

The Qianli Hall fell into an eerie silence. Jiao Xiuyuan stared at Li Fan with a look of disbelief, his face full of shock.

"Don't look at me like that. I originally planned to pay, but no matter how I called out to you, you didn’t respond."

Li Fan shrugged. "And by the time you woke up, before I could say anything, you had already exploded on your own. Can you really blame me?"

Jiao Xiuyuan's face twitched as he looked at Li Fan's innocent expression. After thinking for a moment, he realized that Li Fan didn’t seem like someone who would take without asking. Resigned, he pretended to be generous. "Forget it. It was just a puppet, after all. Let it blow up! I have plenty of puppets!"

"Daoist Jiao, how generous!" Li Fan clapped and praised him.

"I remember the scene in that painting depicted the Heavenly Sword Sect from ancient times. Daoist Li, could it be that you're recalling the past from seeing it?" Jiao Xiuyuan suddenly sized up Li Fan and asked with a strange look.

Li Fan looked at Jiao Xiuyuan, his thoughts racing.

After a moment, Li Fan shook his head, his tone doubtful. "Heavenly Sword Sect? You must be mistaken. Although I’ve lost part of my memory after thousands of years of slumber, I still vaguely remember the two stone tablets inscribed with 'Halt' and 'End the War' outside the Heavenly Sword Sect’s gate. The sect in this painting doesn’t quite resemble that."

Jiao Xiuyuan slapped his forehead. "Haha, look at my memory. Maybe losing a puppet messed with my recollection."

"It must be the Taishang Sect!" Jiao Xiuyuan said again.

"Taishang Sect..." Li Fan squinted slightly, as if recalling something.

After a while, he shook his head slowly. "No, I’ve visited the Taishang Sect before. Their thirty-three floating peaks don’t match the scenery in the painting either."

Li Fan looked at Jiao Xiuyuan with suspicion. "Daoist Jiao, are you..."

Jiao Xiuyuan chuckled awkwardly and quickly said, "I remembered wrong again! Let me think... it must be the Du'e Sect! This time, I’m absolutely sure!"[1]

"The Du'e Sect?" Li Fan’s heart stirred.

Jiao Xiuyuan's previous two tests had failed, so this mention of the Du'e Sect might finally hold some truth.

In his previous life, outside the Great Five Elements Cave Heaven, when the Five Elements merged, Li Fan had once glimpsed a mirage of a master and disciple from the Du'e Sect.

At that time, among all the cultivators on the Dust-Crossing Boat, only he had been able to see it.

Originally, Li Fan thought it was due to his unusually strong soul.

But if what he saw beneath the Abyss of Ruin was also related to the Du'e Sect...

Li Fan remembered when he once peered into the Abyss of Ruin, he had almost been bewitched by its power, nearly losing his mind and foolishly attempting to explore the abyss before, the [Truth], had fully charged.

At that critical moment, light suddenly burst from the bottom of the Abyss of Ruin, and the four characters "The Immortal Dao is Dead" appeared before his eyes, snapping him back to his senses and saving his life.

"It seems this Du'e Sect has some deep connection to me. Strange..."

Despite pondering over his past experiences, Li Fan couldn’t find the reason for this connection.

"The Du'e Sect... I’ve heard the name, but I don't think I’ve ever visited. Daoist Jiao, how much do you know about this sect?" Li Fan asked Jiao Xiuyuan.

"For some reason, the scenery from the Du'e Sect feels familiar. Could my memory be scrambled as well?" Li Fan mused, showing a puzzled expression.

Ignoring the teasing tone in Li Fan’s voice, Jiao Xiuyuan, surprised, said, "Is that so? If that’s the case, it’s truly extraordinary!"

"Oh? How so?" Li Fan asked eagerly.

"Daoist, you might be the 'One Destined for Calamity' that the Du'e Sect cultivator who left this painting was waiting for!" Jiao Xiuyuan said solemnly, his gaze deepening as he looked at Li Fan.

"Destined for Calamity?" Li Fan repeated the phrase several times, "What does that mean?"

"The sect’s name is telling. "Du'e" Sect cultivators use calamities as their cultivation resource. Their technique, 'Eternal Calamity,' draws power from various disasters. Each time they survive a catastrophe, their strength improves drastically."

"The greater the disaster, the more power they gain after surviving it."

"But conversely, for their next advancement, they must seek out even more dangerous calamities."

"However, disasters in this world are innumerable, and even heaven and earth may perish in a calamity. How can Du'e Sect cultivators guarantee they will always survive?"

"When they sense they may not survive their next catastrophe, they use a secret method to hide themselves from the world temporarily."

"They leave behind various means, waiting for someone capable of resolving the calamity to appear."

"That person is known as the 'One Destined for Calamity'!"

Jiao Xiuyuan slowly explained.

Upon hearing this, Li Fan frowned deeply. "Such a cultivation method exists? So, I’ve been marked by some Du'e Sect cultivator? Jiao Daoist, is there any way to break this?"

Jiao Xiuyuan waved his hand dismissively. "Don’t be so tense! Thousands of years have passed, who knows if the Du'e Sect cultivator who left this painting is even still alive?"

"Besides, even if he is, there’s no need for concern. To survive his calamity, he will have to rely on you completely. Until he has passed through it, he won’t harm you."

"And if you help him survive the disaster, he will owe you a great debt. The Du'e Sect has always adhered to this rule. Otherwise, who would ever help them play such a game?"

"Moreover, think about it. The disaster he couldn’t overcome, yet you can. By then, your strength will surpass his, and he’ll be too relieved to survive to even think of opposing you."

Jiao Xiuyuan dismissed Li Fan's worries, but began studying him with renewed interest.

"Li Fan Daoist, to be sensed as the 'One Destined for Calamity' by a Du'e Sect cultivator, your future must be boundless!"

Jiao Xiuyuan’s words brought some comfort to Li Fan, but a sense of unease still lingered in his heart.

Judging from the aid provided in the Abyss of Ruin, that Du'e Sect cultivator was likely still alive.

Though it was unlikely they were monitoring his every move, long-term observation might reveal something eventually.

"It seems I’ll need to find a way to resolve this hidden threat," Li Fan thought to himself.

"Daoist, your knowledge is truly vast, even understanding these ancient sect secrets so thoroughly. I am deeply impressed!"

"By the way, how many contribution points for this painting? I’ll buy it. I can’t let you make a losing deal!"

Though his mind was elsewhere, Li Fan's demeanor remained perfectly calm as he spoke to Jiao Xiuyuan.

1. The “Du’e Sect” can be translated to “Sect of Calamity” or “Sect of Tribulation” in English. This name implies a group focused on overcoming significant challenges or adversities.

Should I keep the name Du'e or translate from now with the English term?

Chapter 468: As If an Old Friend has Arrived

Jiao Xiuyuan’s face lit up with joy: "Fellow Daoist, your way of handling things is to my liking! As they say, even close brothers keep clear accounts. Though you previously helped me make billions with your strategy, rules cannot be broken."

After a moment of contemplation, Jiao Xiuyuan said, "I'll give you a significant discount, just transfer 200 contribution points to me."

Li Fan chuckled lightly: "Fellow Daoist Jiao, you're being too polite!"

Of course, Jiao Xiuyuan wasn’t truly concerned about the contribution points but about completing the necessary transaction process.

Without any fuss, Li Fan transferred the 200 contribution points immediately.

After the transaction was completed, Li Fan vaguely sensed something indescribable and inexplicable about the puppet in front of him. It was a change he had never noticed before.

A thought flashed through Li Fan's mind, and he couldn't help but voice his guess: "Fellow Daoist Jiao, could it be that you're about to break through?"

Jiao Xiuyuan seemed slightly surprised, as if he hadn’t expected Li Fan, who was in the Golden Core stage, to notice something.

"Good eyes, Fellow Daoist! The ancient Heavenly Mechanism Sect’s reputation is truly well-deserved."

After a sigh, Jiao Xiuyuan nodded and said, "Indeed, but the technique I cultivate is special. My breakthrough is different from the usual realms. The specifics... I'm afraid I can't say much more. I hope you understand."

Jiao Xiuyuan spoke with rare apology.

Li Fan nodded, showing his understanding.

"However, I, Jiao Xiuyuan, am not one to forget kindness. Thanks to you, I’ve profited greatly."

"If you ever need anything, just let me know! I’ll make sure to help you out!" Jiao Xiuyuan said, pounding his chest with heroic spirit.

"Speaking of which, I do have a favor to ask. Do you know of the Ancient Medicine King Sect?" Li Fan took the opportunity to ask for help in unearthing the Small Medicine King Cauldron.

"I have a premonition that these small cauldrons will be involved in many karmic consequences in the future, and the matter is of great importance. However, returning to the old site of the Medicine King Sect could be a fatal risk for me, so I cannot go myself. I’ll have to trouble you, Fellow Daoist."

Jiao Xiuyuan readily agreed.

"By the way, since Head Elder Lu came to Ten Thousand Immortal Island, she hasn’t been seen again. You have many sources of information, so could you help me investigate her whereabouts? As someone involved in the events, I’m still very curious about how this matter will impact the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance."

Due to the confidentiality agreements, Li Fan could only speak vaguely.

Jiao Xiuyuan agreed without hesitation.

After thanking him, they chatted for a while longer.

When the cultivators who had been surrounding Li Fan outside gradually dispersed, he quietly left the Qianli Hall.

Lu Xichan had already lifted the blockade of Ten Thousand Immortal Island, and now cultivators were free to move about.

No one knew what exactly she had discovered, but it was said that even the two Immortal Monarchs, Ziyun and Hongxi, had been summoned back to the headquarters of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

At the same time, sharp cultivators noticed that a series of highly unusual orders were issued.

The Tianji Hall and the Formation Hall—every cultivator at or above the Nascent Soul stage—was being summoned to the headquarters of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

"Such a large-scale mobilization—are they preparing to research and construct the Tianxuan Spirit Locking Formation ahead of schedule?"

"Hopefully, the Five Elders Association will step up their efforts. I don’t want to see that eerie green sky again in this lifetime."

This was Li Fan's thought as he awaited Jiao Xiuyuan’s return with information. He quietly left Ten Thousand Immortal Island, disguised as an emissary from the Federation Of all World, heading straight to the island where the Empire and its group were located.

He hadn’t forgotten that the Five Elders Association still owed him 10 million contribution points.

Though these points were in the form of standardized spirit stones, which could be exchanged for contribution points via the Tianxuan Mirror, the amount was enormous and its origins unclear.

If Li Fan exchanged them alone, it might attract unwanted attention from certain cultivators, especially after having already exchanged 5 million points.

Since he needed to acquire technology for controlling exotic beasts from the Empire anyway, he figured he might as well hand this hot potato over to them.

Rushing ahead, he soon arrived over the island.

Sensing Li Fan’s arrival, Qing instantly flashed over to greet him.

Compared to her previous cold attitude, she was now much more courteous.

It seems that no matter the era, the power of wealth is always astounding.

"So, Fellow Daoist, were you satisfied with the gift from the Federation Of all World?" Li Fan asked with a smile.

"Heh, satisfied? More like shocked," Qing said with a hint of laughter, leading Li Fan to a private chamber.

"A contribution of 10 million points, that’s quite a sum, Fellow Daoist. But why send someone suddenly? Wasn’t the deal meant to happen at our next meeting? If the emissary hadn’t identified themselves, I might have attacked."

There was a slight smile in Qing’s voice, along with a hint of confusion.

Li Fan shook his head: "There’s been a complication. In the coming days, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance will likely increase its domestic surveillance, so we need to complete our transaction quickly."

"I’ve been delaying my visit because I’ve been searching for a safe place for you to settle..."

Here, Li Fan intentionally left a gap, pausing briefly.

"I believe we’ve shown enough sincerity. Now, it’s up to your Empire to decide."

Li Fan took a sip of the tea that Qing had prepared for him and spoke slowly.

"Hmm? This tea is quite good." The sky-blue tea went down, and Li Fan was somewhat surprised.

Unlike the spiritual teas he usually drank, this one didn’t benefit his cultivation, spiritual power, or divine sense. Instead, he felt a warm current flow through his body, improving and strengthening his physique.

As someone who cultivated the "Creation Furnace Technique," Li Fan was naturally very familiar with such sensations.

It was strikingly similar to the hidden power of the human body.

"This is Supreme Dragon Whisker Tea. If Fellow Daoist likes it, I’ll send you some," Qing said with a smile.

After handing a storage ring to Li Fan, Qing straightened her expression.

"That was personal business, now let's discuss the trade between the Empire and the Federation Of all World."

"We believe the Federation truly intends to aid the Empire, so we will reciprocate by intensifying our cooperation."

"First, here is the first part of the transaction."

As she spoke, Qing handed over a uniquely designed storage ring.

The ring was engraved with a lifelike Qingluan bird, its eyes even moving.

Li Fan looked at the Qingluan bird on the ring and found it somewhat familiar.

But with so many similar bird species in the world, he couldn’t be sure.

He simply accepted it and began to inspect its contents.

Unexpectedly, his divine sense was blocked, and he failed to examine it.

Only when the Qingluan bird lazily glanced at Li Fan and flapped its wings did he manage to see inside.

Chapter 469: The Three Great Treasures of the Empire

In a storage space ten zhang long, four zhang wide, and three zhang high, rows of redwood shelves were neatly arranged.

On the shelves, items resembling books were categorized and piled up.

Li Fan, with a thought, took one of them.

After observing it in his hand for a moment, Li Fan realized that these so-called “books” were alive.

Although they remained still, Li Fan keenly sensed the unique aura of a living being from them.

Li Fan instantly understood that while they were inside the storage ring, they were in a dormant state similar to death. But once they left the storage ring and came into contact with the outside world, they regained their vitality.

Opening the "book," rays of light shot out from the pages and gathered in the air.

In the light, there were dense characters and illustrations.

It was written in the common script of the Xuanhuang Realm. Li Fan carefully examined it and discovered that it contained information about the exotic beast "Dark Ancient Mantis". From its body structure, living habits, the value of each part of its body, to the methods of breeding and reproduction—everything was detailed. It was an all-encompassing encyclopedia.

Li Fan turned another page, and the light shifted and reformed.

This time, it was information about the exotic beast Ink Spirit Fish.

Li Fan switched to another book and found that it also recorded information about different exotic beasts.

“In our world, there is a type of exotic beast called 'Bookworms'. They feed on words and images. Through special means, they can be made into books, which allow them to reproduce the texts and images they have consumed, achieving large-scale data storage,” Qing explained to Li Fan.

“This storage ring contains the empire’s millennia of research on exotic beasts. It includes all the information about the exotic beasts in our world—except for a few rare species, whose data will be supplemented during the final transaction.”

Li Fan nodded slowly and carefully examined a few more books before solemnly putting the storage ring away.

“Having data alone isn’t enough; it must be matched with physical entities. This is the second part of the empire’s transaction.” Qing took out a red square wooden box and handed it to Li Fan.

Slightly sensing it with his spiritual sense, Li Fan understood the function of the wooden box.

It appeared no bigger than the size of a palm, but inside it was divided into countless separate spaces.

In each space, there were ten exotic beasts of the same kind.

They seemed to be frozen, all motionless.

Li Fan could tell that these exotic beasts still retained their life signs.

Aside from the adult beasts, Li Fan also found many sleeping juveniles in the spaces.

There were embryos, eggs, or tiny young creatures.

“This is the Sealed Life Treasure Box, containing the exotic beasts corresponding to the data in the first storage ring.”

A trace of pride flashed across Qing's face. “With these two storage rings, as long as you find the right environment, large-scale cultivation of exotic beasts can be achieved again.”

“With enough resources invested, it wouldn’t be difficult to recreate the empire’s current grand scene.”
