Li Fan stored the Sealed Life Treasure Box away, saying with satisfaction, “With the contents of these two storage rings, I can report back to the organization. However…”

Li Fan’s tone shifted. “Although these items are indeed valuable, they don’t contribute much to actual combat strength. Our Federation Of all Worlds still hopes you can provide some technical support that would be useful in the ongoing battle against the Xuanhuang Realm.”

“For example, the beast-like armor that this young brother demonstrated earlier.”

Li Fan pointed at Li Chenfeng, his eyes intense as he looked at Qing.

Qing smiled and said, “I figured that’s what you were after with such a generous exchange.”

“This just so happens to be the third part of our transaction, and the final portion for now.”

Qing extended her right hand, and a blood-red, pulsating round bead instantly floated above her palm.

“This is the Beast Soul Bead. Even an ordinary mortal, as long as they can withstand the beast soul sealed within, can absorb it and summon the Beast God Armor, unleashing combat power equivalent to that of the exotic beast.”

Qing handed over another storage ring.

This one, however, bore no special patterns—it was just an ordinary ring.

“This ring contains a thousand Beast Soul Beads. Five hundred of them contain exotic beasts with strength equivalent to the Foundation Establishment stage cultivators. Another four hundred and ninety Beads house beasts with Golden Core-level strength.”

“As for the remaining nine, they seal the souls of Scarlet Mystic Whales, beasts comparable to Nascent Soul cultivators.”

“And the last one…”

Qing hesitated for a moment before continuing, “It was made from the essence of the Nine-Headed Divine Bird.”

“In theory, it can unleash power equivalent to a Soul Transformation stage cultivator. But the Nine-Headed Bird is inherently ferocious. Even after thousands of years of death, its violent aura remains. Although the empire succeeded in using it to craft a few Beast Soul Beads, no one has survived the refining process so far. Those who tried either went mad or died.”

“If the Federation wants to attempt it, I suggest choosing someone with extraordinary willpower.”

“Oh, and one more thing. The power of the exotic beasts clashes with a cultivator’s spiritual energy. The stronger the cultivator, the more resistance they face when refining the Beast Soul Beads. To maximize its potential, it’s best used on ordinary mortals.”

Qing added.

“Excellent!” A hint of joy appeared on Li Fan's face.

“Our Federation Of all Worlds appreciates your sincerity! I’m sure once I report back, deeper cooperation will soon follow.”

“Haha, the organization is eager to learn the method of crafting Beast Soul Beads and the art of controlling beasts,” Li Fan said.

Qing’s expression remained unchanged as she replied solemnly, “Once the final transaction is complete, and the empire has fully withdrawn from the Xuanhuang Realm, all of that will be handed over to your Federation.”

“I can’t wait for that day!” Li Fan put away the storage ring containing the thousand Beast Soul Beads.

He left the secret chamber and flew into the sky.

“When I’ve found a suitable base for you, I’ll return for another transaction.”

“I hope that aside from technology, the empire can also provide some manpower support.”

“At that time, we will handle the personnel’s reception and transfer.”

Li Fan transmitted his voice as he looked down at the people of the empire.

“No problem,” Qing readily agreed.

Li Fan nodded and immediately soared into the sky.

Instead of returning to the Ten Thousand Immortal Island, he headed straight to Shenhua Island.

“Junior brother, please stand guard for me.”

The cultivating Tianyang, who was struggling to practice the Sky-Shrouding Palm Secret technique, immediately stopped when he heard Li Fan’s words.

He stood up and began scanning the surroundings with vigilance.

Chapter 470: The True Ten Thousand Forms of the World

"The Sealed Life Treasure Box... It seems that the empire indeed inherited the legacy of the Beast Taming Sect back in the day."

Now that Tianyang had reached Soul Transformation stage strength, Li Fan felt reassured enough to review the rewards from this trade with the empire.

Detailed information on various exotic beasts, along with the frozen beast entities in the Sealed Life Treasure Box, might not be of much use to other cultivators. However, for Li Fan, who practiced the Creation Furnace Technique, this was an undeniable treasure trove.

Li Fan could harness and transform the unique abilities of these exotic beasts, one by one, using his technique.

"The beauty of living creatures—nothing surpasses this!"

"The records in the Heavenly Doctor's immortal Codex probably don't capture the full essence of the living beings of this world either!"

With a light flick of his finger, Li Fan summoned all the bookworms from his storage ring.

His spiritual consciousness flipped through the books, and in an instant, countless rays of light and shadows projected into the air of his cave dwelling.

The Dao Derivation Stone in his mind emitted a deep blue glow it had never shown before. Li Fan narrowed his eyes, focusing on engraving the words and images into his memory.

A flood of information rushed in, organizing itself and being stored in the Dao Derivation Stone.

Amid the continuous sound of flipping pages, the light and shadows constantly shifted.

After recording everything in a few pages, Li Fan felt a slight headache in his temples.

Taking a short rest and consuming a Dao Enlightenment Pill, he resumed his “reading.”

Over the course of several thousand years, the empire had birthed many unique species. Most of them were creatures that Li Fan had never encountered in the Heavenly Doctor's Codex—nor did they exist in the present Xuanhuang Realm.

Their various strange abilities amazed even the well-traveled Li Fan.

For example, the Wisdom Worm that resided in the human brain and could enhance cognitive abilities; the Mimic Beast, which could perfectly disguise itself after devouring other beings; and the Thousand Spirit Bird, which fed on human emotions.

Each of these creatures opened Li Fan’s eyes to new wonders.

"The All-Encompassing Furnace—this is the true myriad phenomena of living beings!"

Amid Li Fan's amazement, the pages of the books continued to flip.

In a short time, he absorbed the knowledge accumulated over thousands of years by the empire into his mind.

Ten days later.

Li Fan let out a long breath, massaged his aching forehead, and returned the bookworms to his storage ring.

Sensing the concerned gaze of Tianyang, Li Fan waved his hand, signaling that he was fine.

After resting for half a day and recovering some of his energy, Li Fan took out the red wooden box.

According to the information he'd previously seen in the Tianxuan Mirror, this Sealed Life Treasure Box was an exclusive artifact of the Beast Taming Sect from ancient times.

It was said to be crafted from Ten Thousand Transformation Spirit Wood, capable of sealing and preserving living demonic beasts.

With the passage of time over thousands of years, the Ten Thousand Transformation Spirit Tree had nearly gone extinct, making the Sealed Life Treasure Box an exceedingly rare item.

"It seems my intuition was correct."

"The familiar feeling I sensed from that woman in green must have come from the Azure Luan Bird that Xu Ke once encountered in the Fallen Immortal Realm."

"I wonder if that Red-Crowned Crane is still alive."

"Could it be that the founder of the empire, the first to comprehend the Beast Taming Technique, was Xu Ke?"

"According to Li Chenfeng's memories, he has long since passed away. But things may not be as simple as they seem."

Li Fan pondered silently.

"Based on the information currently known, it appears that Xu Ke was the only member of the Beast Taming Sect to enter that small world, thus establishing the empire’s legacy."

"But where did the other members of the Beast Taming Sect go? What about Lu Ya?"

"And why did Emperor Sang Mo come to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and become the curator of the Museum Of Divine Treasure?"

"How does all this relate to Mr. Bai's mission from back then?"

There were too many questions that remained unanswered for now.

"Perhaps the next trip to the Fallen Immortal Realm will resolve some of these doubts."

"Soon," Li Fan calculated the time in his heart.

After putting away the Sealing Life Treasure Box, Li Fan took out a Beast Soul Bead at the Foundation Establishment level.

One could say that the empire's generosity this time far exceeded Li Fan’s expectations.

Five hundred Foundation Establishment level, four hundred ninety Golden Core level, and nine Nascent Soul level Beast God Armor warriors—if used wisely, they could certainly cause quite a stir.

Although these were only theoretical combatants, in the current Xuanhuang Realm, the actual combat strength of cultivators was shockingly low.

Aside from a few rare cultivators who specialized in combat techniques, most people would already be considered exceptional if they could use a few offensive and defensive techniques.

The Beast God Armor, with its ability to influence spiritual consciousness, resist most spell attacks, and move with incredible speed, was definitely a deadly weapon to ordinary cultivators.

"The question now is how to use them for maximum benefit. I need to think this through carefully."

Li Fan temporarily set aside this thought, holding a Beast Soul Bead in his hand and pressing it against his forehead.

Suddenly, his vision turned blood-red. In a daze, Li Fan seemed to see a fierce one-eyed hunting leopard lunging toward him.

"Hmph!" Li Fan's mind sharpened like a needle, stabbing toward the leopard.

The leopard let out a mournful cry, and the illusion quickly vanished.

The Beast Soul Bead dissolved into a red liquid, which seemed to have a life of its own, flowing from his forehead toward his limbs and bones.

Li Fan sensed a strange energy trying to infiltrate his body, attempting to modify it.

Unlike the pure enhancement from his Creation Furnace Technique, the Beast God Armor felt more like grafting the power of an exotic beast onto a human.

Although it temporarily strengthened his abilities, his physical body became tainted by the beast’s power and lost its purity.

"Crooked paths, not of the true way."

Li Fan shook his head as the hidden power within his body surged like a flood, instantly expelling the invading beast energy.

The hunting leopard’s wail echoed in his ears again, and the red liquid from the Beast Soul Bead evaporated in an instant.

"It seems this armor is only suitable for mortals who cannot cultivate."

"Or perhaps..."

Li Fan's eyes gleamed with a peculiar light.

He thought of Ye Feipeng from his previous life, who had awakened the Kunpeng bloodline.

"If one already possesses a beast bloodline, they would naturally not fear this kind of contamination."

"In this life, He Zhenghao has been profiting handsomely by following me. He probably no longer cares about that smuggling business."

"As for Su Xiaomei and the others, they are still in the Outer Realm. Without me, they likely wouldn't have had a chance to come here."

Li Fan smiled faintly.

"This life’s grand show wouldn’t be complete without these little ones."

With that, Li Fan rose, bid farewell to Tianyang, concealed his aura, and quietly made his way to the Outer Realm.

First, he arrived at the central volcano of the Outer Realm and observed it for a while.

"Strange..." Li Fan shook his head.

Ever since he first came to the Outer Realm, he had felt something unusual about this volcano. However, each time he carefully investigated, he found nothing out of the ordinary.

As his cultivation grew deeper, his sense of foreboding became stronger.

But he still couldn't pinpoint the cause.

"Perhaps after I reach the Nascent Soul stage, I'll discover something."

Li Fan made a mental note of the matter and then headed straight for Dali Capital City.

Chapter 471: Who Dares to Sever the Path to Immortality

Early Morning, Ye Mansion.

The chubby Ye Feipeng was sound asleep, seemingly dreaming of something particularly pleasant, as his lips curled slightly. He was completely unaware of the black shadow that suddenly appeared beside him.

The shadow waved a hand gently, causing Ye Feipeng’s head to tilt as he instantly fell unconscious. The figure's right hand formed a claw and hovered above Ye Feipeng's head.

After a brief moment, the hand slowly withdrew.

A drop of thick, blackish-red blood appeared in the figure’s palm.

Ye Feipeng, who had looked healthy moments before, suddenly seemed as though he had contracted a severe illness, his face drained of energy.

The drop of blood in the shadow's palm seemed alive, possessing its own consciousness as it continuously squirmed, attempting to escape the figure's grasp.

As the shadow tightened its fingers, the space in which the blood could struggle grew smaller and smaller until, eventually, the blood was entirely absorbed into the figure's body.

The shadow stood still in the night for a long while.

“Pff!”

Two menacing bone wings suddenly tore through the figure's back, stretching out behind him.

Threads of flesh clung to the wings, emitting a faint sizzling sound as the flesh grew along the bone spurs, swiftly covering the bare bones.

The bone wings became fuller.

However, under the moonlight, one could still clearly see the constantly writhing flesh on the edges of the wings, giving off a sinister and eerie aura.

“The Kunpeng bloodline…”

A low voice escaped from the shadow’s mouth. Moments later, the figure ripped the wings off from his back.

Surprisingly, there was no blood spurting from the wounds. The struggling flesh at the injury site was swiftly expelled by a surge of pure, vast vitality.

In an instant, the shadow was fully restored to its original state.

“Ancient demon beasts truly possess some mysteries.” The figure murmured as he looked at the still-twitching wings he had torn off.

This shadow was none other than Li Fan.

Upon arriving in the capital of the Da Li Kingdom, the first thing he did was extract a portion of the Kunpeng blood from Ye Feipeng’s body.

While he stored the majority of the blood in a storage ring, he absorbed a small part into his own body.

The power of this bloodline was far more domineering than the beastly forces Li Fan had encountered in the Beast Soul Bead.

If those beast forces were infectious and grafted, then the power of the Kunpeng bloodline was all about devouring and complete assimilation.

“No wonder in my previous life, Ye Feipeng’s behavior and even his thoughts gradually became more like those of a true demonic beast.”

“This is the inevitable consequence of using the power of the Kunpeng bloodline.”

“But…”

Li Fan smiled slightly. “By mimicking it with my Furnace of Creation technique, I don’t have such worries.”

“Kun Devour, Peng Soar, Peng Transformation…”

As Li Fan muttered quietly to himself, his figure in the night twisted and changed. Sometimes he transformed into a whale, other times into a peng, and occasionally into a human with peng wings.

After a long time, Li Fan returned to his original form.

“The Kunpeng blood I used for comprehension is too little. Right now, I can only mimic its form and cannot fully replicate the Kunpeng’s divine powers.”

“But no worries, I have a ready-made blood bank right here.”

Li Fan looked at Ye Feipeng, a peaceful smile spreading across his face.

He grabbed the chubby youth and shot into the sky, disappearing into the night.

The next day, chaos erupted in the capital.

Children from prominent families, such as the Su, Ye, and Han families, mysteriously went missing.

Even after these influential families searched the entire city, they couldn’t find any trace of the children.

Panic spread, and rumors began circulating.

The affected families gathered in secret to discuss the situation. They concluded that only two entities could be responsible: either the rumored immortals or the Da Li Emperor himself.

It was clear that immortals wouldn’t stoop to such stealthy actions. That left only one possibility—the emperor had acted.

The aristocrats and ministers couldn’t help but recall various rumors they’d heard before, and resentment began to grow in their hearts.

Thus, undercurrents began to stir within the capital.

Meanwhile, the instigator of all this, Li Fan, had already left the Realm.

After returning to the Xuanhuang Realm, he didn’t stop for a moment.

Instead of heading to any particular region of the Xuanhuang Realm, he passed through the Immortal Extinction Passage and returned to his homeland, the Great Xuan.

The Taiyan Boat sailed swiftly through the air, carrying sixteen frightened children huddled together in the cabin, trembling in fear.

Li Fan stood at the prow, gazing below.

Like the Outer Realm, the Great Xuan was a complete miniature world, but it was over ten times larger.

Since the Outer Realm could produce cultivation geniuses like Su Xiaomei and Xiao Heng, there was no reason the Great Xuan couldn't as well.

His first destination was Hangguang City, the wealthiest city in Great Xuan.

As his immense divine sense swept over the mortals below, Li Fan searched for suitable candidates.

Soon after, Li Fan frowned deeply.

“How is it that so few have better potential than I did?”

Shaking his head, the Taiyan Boat sped up and headed for the next city.

But the result was the same.

After spending nearly half a month, Li Fan had almost searched through all the citizens of Great Xuan, yet those suitable for cultivation were exceedingly rare.

“It seems that my difficulty in stepping onto the path of immortality wasn’t entirely coincidental.”

“People and Heaven…”

Soaring into the sky, Li Fan closed his eyes and sensed the very essence of the Xuan Realm.

“Humans are the spirits of all living beings, blessed by the heavens.”

“Those favored by the heavens can sense the Dao, cultivating in harmony with the Way, and step onto the path of immortality.”

“This is what should naturally occur.”

“Given the vast population of Great Xuan, there should theoretically be many so-called geniuses favored by the heavens.”

“But strangely enough…”

Li Fan recalled the void ripper whales that lingered outside Great Xuan, trying to sever the entire Xuan Realm from the Xuanhuang World.

“When the heavens offer no favor, who dares to tread the path of immortality?”

“But why is the (Li)-Outer Realm so unique?”

With doubts swirling in his mind, Li Fan sighed softly and temporarily gave up on his original plans.

He only made a detour to the area near Jieli Mountain, taking the two boys he had noticed with extraordinary potential.

He then left Great Xuan and returned to the world of cultivation.

“I knew it! Immortals do exist!” Sun Erlang exclaimed excitedly, pacing back and forth.

Beside him, the burly Wang Xuanba looked worried and uneasy.

“Erlang, what do you think the immortal wants with us? When do you think we’ll be able to go back? I miss home…” Wang Xuanba whispered to Sun Erlang.

“Have some ambition! How can you return home without mastering the ability to fly through the clouds and split mountains?” Sun Erlang scolded.

Wang Xuanba opened his mouth to say something, but suddenly noticed a figure appear beside them.

“Immortal Master!” Wang Xuanba was startled and hurriedly knelt down to kowtow.

“Immortal Master, please teach me how to cultivate!” Sun Erlang also knelt and bowed.

Li Fan’s gaze swept over the two but he didn’t reply.

Instead, he led them to the cabin where Su Changyu and the other sixteen children were.

The children, many of whom hadn’t seen their families, were lost in fear and confusion, crying uncontrollably.

“Keep them quiet. This will be your first test,” Li Fan said to Sun Erlang.

“Remember, you can’t hit them.”

Li Fan disappeared immediately after.

Sun Erlang, who prided himself on his martial prowess, stared at the group of snot-nosed brats before him, stumped.

Chapter 472: The Greedy Fei Peng

Sun Family's Second Young Master scratched his head in frustration, but after much effort, he finally managed to calm the restless children from the separated realm.

Li Fan then led them to the path of transformation into Dao. The cave dwelling he had previously opened wasn’t large, but it was more than enough to accommodate these children.

Li Fan made a trip back to the Ten Thousand Immortals Island and purchased the Spring of Spiritual Life and Scarlet Fruit Tree from the Tianxuan Mirror, solving their food problem.

Only then did he gather the children. They looked at Li Fan with innocent and bewildered eyes.

"Do you know what immortality is?" Li Fan asked.

Most of the children instinctively shook their heads, including Ye Feipeng, who was completely puzzled. Only Sun Erlang, who was slightly older, had a flash of desire and longing in his eyes.

He eagerly responded, "I know! Immortals can fly through the sky and burrow through the earth, move mountains and fill seas, summon wind and rain, and do anything!"

Sun Erlang's words seemed to embolden the previously timid children.

Another child quietly said, "I know too. My father taught me a song: 'To be like an immortal, riding a crane to the heavens, turning stone into gold, miraculous and beyond words!'"

Li Fan chuckled when he heard this. He recognized this child as the future father of Han Wu You. This time, Li Fan had also captured him along with Han Wu You’s mother, wanting to see whether Han Wu You would still be born under such drastic changes.

The significance of the possible differences was crucial to Li Fan.

With a wave of his hand, the children, who were chattering away, immediately quieted down.

Li Fan solemnly taught, "The so-called immortals are merely people who are a bit more powerful."

"But for a mere mortal to become as powerful as an immortal, how easy could that be?"

"Some people are skilled in literature, others in martial arts. The most important thing is to find a method that suits you to become stronger."

Li Fan deliberately paused, waiting for the children to reflect. After they seemed to be deep in thought, he continued, "I have three methods that can make you as strong as immortals."

"First, the Rebelling Against Heaven Method. Mortals follow the natural order, while immortals go against it. By defying the laws of heaven and earth, you can attain the path to eternal life. This is the highest method."

The children, though not understanding much, grasped the basic idea, and their eyes widened in amazement.

"Second, the Hidden Furnace Method. The human body contains a hidden furnace, and by refining it, you can tap into your potential. At advanced stages, sheer physical strength alone can move mountains and fill seas! This is the mid-level method!"

Upon hearing this, only Sun Erlang and Wang Xuanba had a spark of interest in their eyes.

"If neither of the first two methods works, I still have a third!"

"Although it cannot compare to the other two, it is still one of the many paths to greatness."

"It is the Beast-Taming Method!"

"The world was once filled with various exotic beasts that possessed incredible powers. By harnessing their strength, you too can accomplish the feats of immortals with a mortal body!"

Li Fan spoke loudly.

The children grew excited with anticipation.

"Everyone is different. Only a few will be able to master the highest method. I will teach you according to your strengths."

"You may choose how to cultivate voluntarily."

"Think carefully. Three days later, I will return to this place!"

With a sweep of his hand, Li Fan activated a Memory Stone, which played a continuous loop explaining the three methods in the air. The children were captivated by the various dazzling scenes displayed and immersed themselves in them.

Three days passed quickly.

When Li Fan reappeared, they immediately fell silent from their discussions.

"Those who wish to cultivate the highest method, step forward!" Li Fan commanded.

Su Changyu, Sun Erlang, and three other children boldly stepped forward.

After scanning them, Li Fan solemnly said, "None of you have exceptional talent. If your cultivation becomes difficult in the future, don’t regret your choice!"

Su Changyu and the others showed no signs of hesitation.

Li Fan flicked his fingers, and several streams of light flew into their minds.

"Thus, I have passed on different methods to you. Remember, immortal cultivation is rare, and you must not practice multiple methods simultaneously. In the future, if you encounter difficulties, you must figure them out on your own and never reveal your cultivation method to others."

Upon hearing this, the children’s expressions changed slightly.

But Li Fan ignored them, summoning a gentle breeze to lead them to another room.

He then turned to the remaining children and said, "Those who wish to cultivate the Hidden Furnace Method, step forward!"

Wang Xuanba was the first to move.

Most of the other children, after some hesitation, also stepped forward.

Without saying much, Li Fan transmitted the Creation Furnace Technique into their minds.

After sending them away, Li Fan looked at the remaining three children, his eyelid twitching.

Among them were the nonchalant Xiao Heng and the cunning-eyed Ye Fei Peng.

"Why did you choose the lowest-level Beast-Taming Method?" Li Fan asked coldly, pointing at Xiao Heng. "You answer first!"

Startled, Xiao Heng scratched his head, embarrassed. "Master Immortal, I feel like I’m too dumb to learn the first two methods. So I’ll just honestly learn the Beast-Taming Method."

Li Fan sneered. "Are you sure? No regrets?"

Seeing that Li Fan wasn’t reprimanding him, Xiao Heng breathed a sigh of relief and nodded quickly, "No regrets!"

Li Fan didn’t say anything more and handed him a Nascent Soul Beast Soul Bead.

"This is a Beast God Bead, containing the soul of a powerful beast. It’s too strong for you now, so keep it by your side, day and night. When you feel ready, try to refine it." Li Fan instructed.

"Thank you, Master Immortal!" Xiao Heng happily accepted the Beast Soul Bead.

"Master Immortal, I think the same way as Xiao Heng!" The other child, Zhao Wen, who seemed simple and honest, also spoke up quickly.

Li Fan examined Zhao Wen’s body carefully, and after some thought, gave him another Nascent Soul Beast Soul Bead.

"Don’t push yourself," Li Fan advised.

Zhao Wen gratefully knelt and bowed.

"And you?" Li Fan looked at the last one, Ye Fei Peng.

Ye Fei Peng scratched his cheek, hesitating.

Finally, he gathered his courage and asked tentatively, "Master Immortal, why can we only choose one method?"

"I want all three. Is that possible?"

Li Fan paused, gazing at the eager Ye Fei Peng. Suddenly, he burst into laughter.

"Since you’ve asked, I shall grant your wish."

The Sea-Stabilizing Divine Sword, the Creation Furnace Technique, and a Beast Soul Bead made from the essence of the nine-headed divine bird flew toward Ye Fei Peng.

"Thank you, Master Immortal! Thank you!" Ye Fei Peng was overjoyed, bowing repeatedly.

Xiao Heng and Zhao Wen, stunned by the unexpected outcome, were left speechless.

Chapter 473: Hidden Currents of the Immortal Alliance

Xiao Heng opened his mouth, wanting to say something. However, his lips only moved slightly, and when he looked at the stern face of Li Fan, he ultimately remained silent.

On the other hand, Zhao Wen, who had a simple and honest nature, didn't think much. After his initial shock, his eyes were filled with pure admiration.

Thus, the cultivation path for this group of children was temporarily set, except for Su Xiaomei, who was still in swaddling clothes. Although Su Xiaomei had extraordinary talent, she was simply too young. Being at the stage of babbling, it was unrealistic to expect her to start cultivating yet. However, with the protection of numerous spiritual items purchased by Li Fan, along with the care of Xiao Heng and Su Changyu, there was no need to worry about her health. In fact, she was growing even faster than in her previous lives.

Seven days later, as the children's cultivation journeys were beginning to take shape, Li Fan gathered them together once again.

"Do you know where you are right now?" Li Fan asked.

After becoming more familiar over the past few days, the children were no longer as reserved as they had been. "It's the Immortal Realm!" they answered eagerly.

"Correct," Li Fan nodded. "But do you know that your ancestors originally came from this Immortal Realm?"

"Immortal Master, our ancestors were also immortals?" the children asked, wide-eyed and chattering in excitement.

Li Fan then told them the story of how, in ancient times, their ancestors had been forced to leave their homeland due to being afflicted by a curse that separated mortals from immortals.

"They were merely stronger humans who relied on their power to act recklessly, treating their former comrades cruelly."

"Why should they monopolize this vast and beautiful world full of spiritual energy, while you are left to live in a small, desolate world with no spiritual energy and even the risk of total annihilation?"

"It's because you are not strong enough!"

Li Fan's gaze swept over them as he subtly used the power of his Seven Apertures Exquisite Heart to manipulate their thoughts.

"When you become strong enough, this world will respect and accept your opinions."

"All the humans of the small worlds should unite!"

"Everything that was lost must be taken back by your own hands!"

With these words, full of passionate rhetoric, the children became filled with a shared sense of hatred, eager to strike back at the Immortal Realm as soon as possible.

"Of course, we must also recognize the gap between us and the Immortal Realm. Not only is our overall strength too weak, but the number of cultivators we have is far too small."

"So..."

"We must endure and lay low!"

"We must seek out fresh blood to strengthen our organization!"

Unconsciously, the dialogue between Li Fan and the children had shifted from "you" to "us."

"It's been some time since you left home, and I know some of you miss your parents," Li Fan said.

"But don't worry, I'm not an unreasonable person," he added, pointing to Tian Yang, who was standing quietly to the side. "As long as you succeed in your cultivation and can defeat him, I will allow you to return home."

"And I will even grant you the authority to recruit people from your homeland to join our Federation Of All World's!"

Upon hearing this, the children became excited. Who wouldn’t want to return home with newfound power, boasting their immortal techniques? Moreover, the strange man, Tian Yang, seemed a bit dim-witted and didn’t appear to be that difficult to deal with.

With newfound hope and a spark of ambition, the children began cultivating even more diligently.

In secret, Li Fan watched these future pillars of the Federation Of All World's and nodded in approval.

Of course, he didn’t truly expect to launch a counterattack against the Immortal Realm or overthrow the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance. However, his recent profitable dealings with the Empire had given him some new ideas.

Using the banner of the Federation Of All Worlds, he could continue to make contact with small worlds that possessed unique power systems and profit greatly from these exchanges. The value of power at the same level was not equivalent between small worlds and the Xuanhuang Realm. Take, for example, the thousand beast soul beads—500 Foundation Establishment, 490 Golden Core, and even nine Nascent Souls. Assembling a team of this strength in the Xuanhuang Realm would cost more than ten million in contribution points.

But due to the Empire’s urgent need for contribution points to detach from the Xuanhuang Realm, Li Fan was able to easily secure significant gains.

The same applied to other small worlds. However, since these pocket dimensions and small worlds were all hidden away, to connect with them required a large number of personnel.

Therefore, raising these children was quite necessary. Besides, with the Mountain Sitting Technique in their possession, the stronger they became, the greater the benefits for Li Fan.

He quietly instructed Tian Yang not to hit them too hard, and as long as they reached the combat strength of Golden Core cultivators, he should let them win.

After leaving behind a Formless killing intent to monitor them, Li Fan quietly returned to Ten Thousand Immortals Island.

While he had been away, the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance appeared peaceful on the surface, but hidden currents were already surging underneath. After deploying a large number of cultivators, they issued a Call for Recruitment.

Any cultivators with achievements in the field of formations were summoned. They didn't need to pass the usual entrance exams and could immediately receive the benefits of a formation master in the Strategy Formation Hall. Those who performed exceptionally well could even be rewarded with Dao Integration techniques.

In no time, talented formation masters from all over the world gathered at the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance headquarters. Such a grand assembly naturally didn't go unnoticed by the Five Elders Association.

On the border, the Five Elders Association continued to provoke and probe the Alliance. From time to time, news of exposed and executed spies from the Five Elders Association would surface.

Both sides remained cautious about war. However, beneath the strange calm, a massive storm seemed to be brewing.

Li Fan sensed something unusual. If they only wanted to construct the Tianxuan Spirit Locking Formation, there was no need for so many formation masters. The deduction of the formation diagram wasn’t something Nascent Soul-level formation masters could even participate in.

"Chief Lu, what are you up to?" Li Fan muttered to himself, his eyes flashing as he quickly reviewed recent events in the Tianxuan Mirror, trying to find some clues.

After a long time, his eyes suddenly stopped on a seemingly ordinary piece of news.

Foundation Establishment cultivator Guo Yezhong died unexpectedly while attempting to break through to the Golden Core stage.

"Guo Yezhong? How did he die so early?"

Li Fan remembered this person clearly from his previous life. Guo Yezhong had relied on contribution points to win first place in the Spirit Locking Formation Competition, so Li Fan had a strong impression of him.

Now, his sudden and unexplained death seemed suspicious. Li Fan decided to investigate the events leading up to Guo Yezhong's death to see if he could uncover anything unusual.

After several days of effort and spending contribution points like water, Li Fan finally found a potential lead from one of Guo Yezhong's friends.

Chapter 474: The Fate of Heaven Conceals Human Fate

Guo Yezhong was a person deeply obsessed with the Dao of formations.

His mind was often imaginative, with sudden flashes of inspiration. He also loved drinking, and after becoming thoroughly intoxicated, he would share his wild and unrealistic ideas with his friends.

His friends would just laugh it off as drunken talk.

Not long ago, Guo Yezhong once again drank himself into a stupor.

He told his friends about a vision he had in a dream: the sky of Tianxuan hanging above like a spider's web, covering the world and binding all beings.

Because it was so bizarre, his friends again didn’t take it seriously and dismissed it as a joke.

After Guo Yezhong sobered up, they even mocked him for it.

Who knew that as soon as Guo Yezhong heard this, his expression changed dramatically. He warned his friends not to speak of it, then left in a huff.

For the next several days, he locked his doors and refused all visitors.

Then, suddenly, he claimed to have gained some insight and left to seek an opportunity to break through to the Golden Core stage.

He never returned.

A few days later, a strange heavenly phenomenon occurred, leading others to discover his body.

…

“Bad wine brings misfortune!” Li Fan sighed softly, then fell into deep thought.

Was this the work of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance to prevent leaks by silencing him?

For the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, which was in urgent need of talent in the Dao of formations, there was no need for such drastic measures.

A simple recruitment order would have been enough to make him devote his life to the construction of the Tianxuan Spirit Locking Formation. There was no need to go to such extremes.

"Then the remaining possibility is that the Five Elders Association took action."

"After I revealed the secret of the 'Tianxuan Spirit Locking, Xuanhuang Unification' to the Five Elders Association, they must have been trying everything to gather information related to it."

"But due to the strict secrecy measures of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, they had little success."

"Until they discovered that an unremarkable Foundation Establishment cultivator, Guo Yezhong, had openly described a vision related to the Tianxuan Spirit Locking Formation while drunk."

"That's when disaster struck Guo Yezhong..."

Li Fan stroked his chin, piecing together what might have happened.

"Guo Yezhong, despite his immense talent in formations, probably didn’t know much about the Tianxuan Spirit Locking Formation. At most, he had some vague concept."

"And the Five Elders Association's knowledge of formations is not inferior to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance. With Guo Yezhong as a lead, what happens next is anyone's guess."

"The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is going even bigger this time compared to the last life, just for the sake of the Tianxuan Spirit Locking Formation."

"It's almost certain that with both sides vying for control, either the Tianxuan Spirit Locking Formation will never come into being, or it will evolve into something far more terrifying than in the last life."

"I can only hope the Five Elders Association holds their ground. If necessary, I can lend them a hand."

Li Fan pondered over the structure of the Spirit Locking Formation for a while before setting aside his thoughts.

As for this matter, which could alter the future course of history in the Xuanyuan Realm, the vast majority of the cultivators in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance were completely unaware.

For them, life was as peaceful as ever, with no difference from usual.

They did missions, accumulated contribution points, exchanged them for cultivation techniques and resources, and then secluded themselves for cultivation.

Occasionally, they would take a break to relax and play.

This was their daily life.

The topics of casual conversation among the cultivators were nothing more than the latest genius to break through, or who had incredible luck and found a technique in some sect ruins.

But this year, one name had become a frequent subject of discussion.

Li Fan, a cultivator from the Heavenly Mechanism Sect.

He had accurately predicted the sharp rise in the price of Samantabhadra True leaves.

Though most of the participants in this event suffered heavy losses and hated Li Fan for it, they did not doubt his ability to predict.

In fact, at some point, a group of fanatical cultivators started praising Li Fan’s predictive abilities.

They swore by his name, claiming that Li Fan's skill in divination was on par with the well-known masters of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

It seemed as though, apart from the Samantabhadra True leaf event, Li Fan had other accomplishments.

But when pressed for details, these people would clam up and adopt a “believe it or not” attitude.

Li Fan's rise to prominence wasn’t just due to his predictive ability.

The real reason behind his fame was that Li Fan could help people get rich.

The whole sect knew that He Zhenghao of the Congyun Sea had handed over his contribution points to Li Fan for investment, and a year later, he received both principal and interest.

Although it looked like a pyramid scheme on the surface, Li Fan's reputation as an expert in divination gave it credibility.

Accumulating contribution points was incredibly difficult! A 50% return in one year was irresistible!

Driven by temptation, more and more cultivators approached He Zhenghao, eager to join the next round of investments.

There were so many inquiries that even He Zhenghao, who considered himself worldly, was overwhelmed.

He ended up hiding on Liuli Island behind the protective formation, too scared to come out.

Only after contacting Li Fan and receiving his approval did he relax.

Following Li Fan's advice, he issued a statement.

Due to the overwhelming number of requests, which far exceeded Li Fan’s ability to manage, He Zhenghao was forced to make a difficult decision.

This time, they would only accept contribution points from 500 cultivators, sorted from the highest amount offered to the lowest.

This announcement caused many cultivators to curse silently.

Most hesitated briefly, then ultimately gave up.

However, a small number of people placed their trust in Li Fan and invested their contribution points.

With the introduction of this competitive system, the third round of contributions swelled to over 15 million.

An average of 30,000 per person.

And that was with everyone holding back and adopting a cautious approach.

He Zhenghao was overwhelmed with joy as he collected the funds.

Since Li Fan promised him 1% of the profit as a reward, he worked even harder.

He even encouraged the investors to dig deeper into their pockets.

While Li Fan was busy amassing wealth, the Empire's Foundation Establishment Masters were not idle either.

Although the 10 million contribution points gifted by Li Fan allowed these lawbreakers to complete their tasks early, they continued to accumulate contribution points and resources to quietly transport them back to the Empire.

One day, a special guest arrived on the island.

"I've saved for so long; it should be enough."

"With the help of this renowned Foundation Establishment Master, I’ll surely break through to the Foundation Establishment stage this time."

"Then, I will take control of my fate, defying even the heavens. The cultivation world may be vast, but I, Han Yi, will be able to roam freely!"

A disheveled young man, slightly crazed, stood outside the courtyard of the Foundation Establishment Master, muttering to himself.

Chapter 475: Extreme Misfortune Turns to Fortune

"You brat, what are you muttering about over there? You've been standing there for so long, are you coming in or not?" Li Chenfeng leaned against the wall, squinting at Han Yi with a hint of impatience in his voice.

"I'm coming, I'm coming." Startled by his own muttering, Han Yi reluctantly handed over a storage ring.

"Two thousand low-grade spirit stones, all inside," Han Yi said with a pained expression.

"Alright, follow me." Li Chenfeng, who had witnessed contributions worth tens of millions, was already unimpressed by mere contributions in the thousands.

Still, even small gains are gains, Li Chenfeng thought as he pocketed the storage ring and led Han Yi to the presence of the Foundation Establishment Master.

Upon seeing the venerable master, who radiated a celestial and scholarly aura as he lectured, Han Yi's face lit up with excitement.

He dared not disturb the master, carefully finding a seat and attentively listening to the lecture. Though some of the content was difficult to understand, Han Yi remained focused, not daring to miss a single word.

After a long discourse, Han Yi, like the other students, closed his eyes and began to attempt his Foundation Establishment.

Unbeknownst to the people on the island, the moment Han Yi stepped foot on the island, a gaze from across the majority of the Congyun Sea landed on him.

"Daoist Han, I've been waiting for you for quite some time."

Using a Heavenly perspective locked on Li Chenfeng, Li Fan watched Han Yi, who sat cross-legged with closed eyes, with great interest.

"Has he accumulated this much?"

"After breaking through the Foundation Establishment stage, will he control his fate, not leaving it to the heavens?"

Li Fan pondered over the meaning of Han Yi's words and recalled the strange moments in his past life, where Han Yi's fortune sometimes soared beyond comprehension, and at other times, was mediocre.

A bold hypothesis began to form in Li Fan's mind.

"Could it be that Han Yi can control his own fortune? Moreover, after reaching Foundation Establishment, his control over luck will undergo a qualitative transformation?"

In that instant, Li Fan recalled his connection with the Heavenly Fate Mystical Bird from his past life.

"Could it be this similar? Interesting!"

Fixing his gaze tightly on Han Yi, Li Fan saw that in Han Yi's Dantian, a black feather was slowly taking shape.

"This is…"

No matter how Li Fan looked at it, that feather was almost identical to the one that had once grown on his own body—the feather of the Heavenly Fate Mystical Bird.

"Even his Foundation Establishment treasure is the same. It seems there's no doubt about it—this really is connected to the Heavenly Fate Mystical Bird."

Li Fan felt a slight tremor in his heart.

If his previous guess was correct, the founder of the Empire was Xu Ke, and the Saint Master was none other than the Azure Luan bird from those times.

What puzzled Li Fan, however, was that in Li Chenfeng's memories, there had been no trace of the Mystic Black Bird in the Empire.

In theory, the Heavenly Fate Mystical Bird had a much closer connection to Xu Ke than the Azure Luan bird that had appeared out of nowhere. So why had the Black Bird, which should have been Xu Ke's companion spirit beast, disappeared?

If Li Fan could uncover the source of Han Yi's strange abilities, he might also learn the fate of the Mystic Black Bird from those years ago.

…

As time slowly passed, just as the Heavenly Fate Mystic Bird "Feather" in Han Yi's dantian was about to fully form—

"Hahaha! I did it!"

A cultivator sitting beside Han Yi suddenly stood up and shouted excitedly.

Han Yi, deep in concentration, was distracted. The black feather in his mindscape began to scatter again.

He furrowed his brows.

Just as he calmed his mind and was about to attempt forming his foundation once more—

Another cultivator succeeded in forming his foundation. His aura surged, and he let out a long howl.

"Today, I realize who I truly am! Thank you, Master!" The man laughed heartily, bowed to the Foundation Establishment Master, and flew away with pride.

Han Yi's brows knitted even tighter as his foundation crumbled a bit further.

"After ten years of hardship, I have finally succeeded. From this day forward, the heavens and the earth may be vast, but I, Nangong Qian, shall tread upon them freely." A scholar-like cultivator recited a poem before departing gracefully.

Inside Han Yi’s dantian, the image of the black feather from the Mystic Black Bird shattered completely.

"Enough is enough!"

In a burst of anger, Han Yi spat out a mouthful of fresh blood, leaping to his feet and glaring around.

But to his dismay, he realized he was now the only one left in the courtyard.

The Foundation Establishment Master looked at him with pity and offered comfort: "Young man, don't be discouraged. Although you failed this time, I can see you're very close to success."

"I'm certain you'll achieve Foundation Establishment next time."

Hearing this, Han Yi was overwhelmed with emotion and spat out another mouthful of blood.

The master kindly handed him a pill. "The path of cultivation cannot be forced. I suggest you go home and recuperate."

"Next time, I'll only charge you a thousand contribution points."

Han Yi opened his mouth but said nothing.

Though his heart was full of reluctance, he couldn't argue with the powerful Foundation Establishment Master.

Swallowing the pill, Han Yi staggered out of the courtyard and flew away from the Foundation Establishment Island.

"He's truly out of luck, that Han Yi."

"It seems it's not yet time for his reversal of fortune."

Li Fan's eyes flashed as he quietly left Ten Thousand Immortal Island, heading straight for Han Yi, who had been locked onto by his Formless Killing Intent.

Li Fan had made up his mind to use the Soul Searching Spell on Han Yi, to discover what secrets were hidden within him.

After leaving the Foundation Establishment Island, Han Yi seemed severely shaken.

Without direction or goal, he flew aimlessly.

When he finally came to his senses, he found himself in an unfamiliar sea region.

"Damn it, just one tiny bit more…"

"This cursed heaven!"

With no one around, Han Yi pointed angrily at the sky, venting his frustration.

At that moment, the calm surface of the sea suddenly surged with enormous waves.

It was as though something was rising from the depths of the ocean.

Han Yi stared at the water with a strange expression.

After looking around for a moment, he dove into the water.

He continued to descend, deeper and deeper into the ocean.

Eventually, he discovered the source of the disturbance—a massive hole had appeared in the ruins at the seabed.

Countless gallons of seawater were being sucked into the hole, forming a gigantic whirlpool.

Han Yi gazed at the whirlpool, his expression shifting.

Finally, gritting his teeth, he was about to plunge headfirst into it.

But at that very moment—

"Insect Binding!"

A faint voice echoed in his ears.

Han Yi was horrified to find that he had completely lost control of his body, unable to move even a muscle!

A shadowy figure appeared slowly behind him, exuding a dangerous aura that made Han Yi's heart sink.

Just as the figure was about to place a hand on Han Yi's head—

Suddenly, several golden lights shot down from the surface of the water, not aimed at Han Yi, but at the shadow before him!

The golden lights were incredibly powerful, forcing the shadow to dodge.

"Master Li, we've been searching for you everywhere!"

Four black-clad cultivators, their forms concealed, appeared out of nowhere and surrounded the two.

Chapter 476: Nascent Soul Are Selling Heads

"Mm?"

Li Fan was slightly surprised as four cultivators suddenly appeared before him.

Ever since he started using the title of "Ancient Heavenly Mechanism Sect Cultivator" to stir up the world, Li Fan had been extra cautious and vigilant.

Whenever he went out, he would always use the secret technique "Shrouding Sky Palm" to hide his whereabouts.

The secret technique, which had once been able to block even the Tianxuan web's detection in his previous life, was truly extraordinary. Even in the vast Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, many cultivators desired to see Li Fan, yet none had succeeded.

But today, it seemed that a few uninvited guests had finally arrived.

"Who are you?" Li Fan asked, not expecting them to answer honestly, but merely trying to buy some time.

Sensing the aura emanating from the four black-clad cultivators, Li Fan felt slightly at ease. They were far weaker than Tianyang, likely at the Nascent Soul stage.

"What do you want with me?" Li Fan asked, feigning ignorance.

"You'll know soon enough!" one of them replied coldly. "Form the formation!"

They stood in four corners, and each shot a golden light from the magical tools in their hands. The golden lines twisted and turned in the air, swiftly forming a dazzling array around Li Fan.

It was like a massive golden bell, trapping Li Fan inside.

Li Fan's eyes shifted slightly, and he tried to escape, only to find that the surrounding space seemed frozen, making it impossible to break free.

"Seal!" the four shouted in unison.

The golden bell shrank rapidly, getting smaller and smaller. Its golden outline was on the verge of binding Li Fan completely.

"Splitting Light Dragon-Trapping Formation..."

Although trapped within the formation, Li Fan remained calm and composed. After several lifetimes of bitterly studying formations, he immediately recognized the formation that the four black-clad cultivators had deployed.

This was one of the top restraining arrays in the world today, typically cast by at least three cultivators working together. The more cultivators involved, the more powerful the formation. Capturing someone of a higher realm was no difficult feat with it.

Under normal circumstances, the combined strength of four Nascent Soul cultivators could easily capture even a Soul Transformation cultivator.

But...

Li Fan sneered inwardly. Though he couldn't move, dozens of "Great Five Elements Annihilation Swords" shot out from various parts of his body, unleashing destructive black light.

Sensing the terrifying aura emanating from the black light, the four black-clad cultivators' expressions shifted slightly. Instinctively, they tried to dodge.

But they soon realized in horror that the target of the black swords wasn't them—it was the critical nodes of the Splitting Light Dragon-Trapping Formation!

"Not good!"

One of the cultivators cried out in alarm. He finally realized that the black light emitted from Li Fan had struck each of the formation’s key points with pinpoint accuracy.

"Boom!"

Golden and black lights clashed violently, and the once-solid golden bell dimmed slightly in an instant. The unbreakable array had loosened.

"You dare show off your insignificant skills in front of an expert?"

As the light flickered, Li Fan's figure suddenly disappeared from the Dragon-Trapping Formation.

"He not only excels at deduction techniques, but also at formations?"

"How is this possible?"

In that instant, the same thought flashed through the minds of the four black-clad cultivators.

"Our intel was wrong! Retreat!"

The lead cultivator shouted, but as they prepared to flee, they noticed something strange—the sky had suddenly darkened. It was as though a massive black cloud had blotted out the heavens.

Then, dozens of golden lights shot out from the cloud at lightning speed, drawing an even larger golden bowl in the air, trapping the four cultivators inside.

"Splitting Light Dragon-Trapping Formation?!"

The black-clad cultivators' bodies trembled, their eyes filled with disbelief.

Not only had their own technique been used against them, but the formation now trapping them seemed far more refined than the one they had originally cast, despite being slightly weaker in power.

The formation was enhanced with an unknown improvement, making it even harder for them to break out.

At this point, the four black-clad cultivators knew they had to give it their all.

Inside the massive golden bowl, four unique Cave-Heaven visions appeared: an isolated snow peak, a misty forest, a towering mountain, and a vast plain.

Above them, beneath the black cloud and golden bowl, Li Fan stood, gazing down at the four Nascent Soul cultivators with a heart full of killing intent.

These cultivators were not all experts in formations; they had relied on magical tools to assist them. Thus, the formation they had set up in haste naturally had flaws.

Against ordinary cultivators, these flaws might not matter, but to Li Fan, the Splitting Light Dragon-Trapping Formation they had cast was riddled with weaknesses.

After breaking out of the Formation, Li Fan immediately retaliated.

First, he activated the "Shrouding the Sky-Palm" secret technique to conceal the sky, isolating the area from any outside detection. Then, using the "Deception" artifact he had purchased from the Tianxuan Mirror, he disrupted their talisman communication.

Next, he set up the "Explosive Method: Shocking Divine Formation", temporarily boosting his techniques to the Nascent Soul stage. He then used the Splitting Light Formation to trap them.

"When I was at the Foundation Establishment stage, I could already slay Nascent Soul cultivators."

"Now, with my cultivation at the late Golden Core stage, you four are nothing but easy prey!"

"Sky-Flipping!"

A massive hand descended from the sky. Trapped within the golden bowl, the four cultivators were like fish in a barrel, with nowhere to run.

The snow peak emitted a biting chill, the misty forest filled with ghostly wails, the towering mountain rushed towards them, and smoke rose from the plain…

The Cave-Heaven visions evolved as the four cultivators unleashed all their powers.

Four beams of light intertwined and merged, colliding with the Sky-Flipping Palm.

But it was futile!

Like paper, it was instantly torn apart.

The giant palm pressed down, and amid their screams, the four cultivators' bodies shattered inch by inch.

The Cave-Heaven visions reappeared, and their blood and flesh wriggled, reforming their bodies.

The residual force of the Sky-Flipping Palm ignored their bodies and instead smashed into the four Cave-Heavens.

"Boom!"

The Cave-Heavens shook violently, and it seemed like the end of the world had come. Massive cracks appeared in the Cave-Heaven domains as mountains collapsed, trees in the misty forest fell, and the plain split open...

It seemed as though the four Cave-Heavens were about to be completely destroyed in the next moment.

However, the black-clad cultivators were highly coordinated. In this life-and-death moment, none of them hesitated.

They pushed their powers to the limit and, working together, they barely managed to withstand the Sky-Flipping Palm.

The giant palm's shadow dissipated, and the trembling Cave-Heavens slowly began to stabilize.

The four cultivators, still pale and shaken, quickly absorbed the surrounding spiritual energy to heal their injured Cave-Heavens. They also consumed medicinal pills as they searched for Li Fan's whereabouts.

"The power of that technique was immense. Li Fan must have expended a great deal of energy as well. We should seize this opportunity to break the Dragon-Trapping Formation!"

"This person is not as simple as he appears. He may have already recovered from his injuries."

"Exactly. We must send this information back. He could be the bait set by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance!"

As they hastily healed themselves, they communicated with their spiritual senses.

Chapter 477: The Fate of Fortune

"Strange, where did he go?" As their injuries slowly healed, the four individuals searched around but couldn't find any trace of Li Fan.

"Could he have exhausted his energy, realized he was no match for us, and retreated first?"

A hint of confusion flashed across the faces of the black-clad cultivators from the Five Elders Association.

"Judging from the power of that palm strike just now, it's very likely. One strike almost shattered our Four Cave-Heavens. Even if he is incredibly strong, using such a technique should have caused considerable backlash."

"That might not be the case. Ancient cultivators are skilled in battle, and it's clear Li Fan was hiding something earlier."

"Either way, let's be cautious. First, we need to break this formation!"

The four exchanged glances and began to attack the Splitting Light Dragon-Trapping Formation that Li Fan had set up.

It seemed as though the formation was no longer controlled by a cultivator, and its previously impenetrable defenses had become incredibly weak.

The massive golden bowl wobbled precariously in an instant.

Overjoyed, the four accelerated their attacks.

Just as the formation was completely shattered, a golden rain began to fall from the sky.

The four were enveloped, and dazzling rays of light reflected off the falling gold.

As the golden light shone brightly, they couldn't help but squint.

"Be careful!"

At that moment, the leading cultivator suddenly shouted a warning.

Before the words even left his mouth, accompanied by a booming sound, some of the golden rain around them suddenly exploded.

A terrifying energy surged from the center of the explosion, sweeping in all directions.

There were as many as sixteen or seventeen sources disguised as golden light.

They completely surrounded the members of the Five Elders Association.

"Sky-Shattering Gilded Thunder?!"

Amidst their angry and shocked voices, the spots of gilded thunder instantly transformed into rings of light, completely engulfing them.

"Boom! Boom! Boom!"

The earth-shattering explosions echoed across the sea.

It was unclear how long had passed before everything settled.

In the shattered remains of their Cave-Heavens, the bodies of the few cultivators began to slowly, painfully regenerate.

"Truly despicable..."

"I knew he hadn't gone far!"

Their faces were full of lingering fear as they quickly scanned the surroundings, but still, there was no sign of Li Fan.

"Don't get tangled up with him anymore. We need to retreat!" The leading cultivator gritted his teeth.

Collecting their Cave-Heavens powers, they no longer cared about anything else and swiftly fled toward the outskirts of Yongliang State on the edge of the Congyun Sea.

They flew for a long time, and the coastline of Yongliang State was already in sight. Li Fan did not reappear.

It seemed as though he had given up chasing them.

The four finally let out a long sigh of relief.

However, recalling their brush with death, something still felt off.

"Sixth Brother, don’t you think Li Fan was deliberately toying with us?"

"......"

The black-clad cultivator, codenamed Sixth Brother, remained silent for a moment before speaking in a deep voice: "I hate to admit it, but based on what happened, something indeed feels strange."

"After that one palm strike, he could have easily used the gilded thunder to end our lives. But he waited until we recovered before attacking again."

"It’s as if he was deliberately giving us a chance to breathe."

Another black-clad cultivator chimed in: "We were severely injured just now. If he had attacked even casually, he could have killed us. But instead, he let us go..."

"What is he up to?"

The four looked at each other, completely baffled.

"This Li Fan is an ancient cultivator who has been in slumber for thousands of years, having only recently awakened. It’s clear that someone like him wouldn’t have much loyalty to the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance," Sixth Brother mused aloud.

"You mean..." The other three’s eyes lit up.

"He figured out that we are from the Five Elders Association and wants to build good relations, so he spared our lives?"

"Very possible."

"So that's it!"

"Does that mean we can convince him to defect and join the Five Elders Association?" Sixth Brother suddenly had a clever idea.

"According to the information we gathered, he was the one who first derived the prophecy of the Tianxuan Spirit Locking and the Unification of the Xuan-huang Realm. If we can win him over, not only will we avoid punishment for failing this mission, but we could also claim a great reward."

Hearing this, the others were tempted.

But in the end, reason prevailed over their desires.

The leading cultivator said, "Let’s return and report this first."

"This person exudes strangeness, and we can't take any chances," another black-clad cultivator nodded in agreement.

Sixth Brother sighed, feeling a sense of loss: "It’s a shame. This person’s whereabouts are unpredictable. Tracking him will be quite difficult."

Another person added: "Yes, if it hadn’t been for this mission and our coincidental encounter with him, we might never have gotten the chance."

"After all, he is a cultivator from the **Heavenly Mechanism Sect, proficient in the art of deduction. It's normal for him to counter and block deduction spells."

As they spoke, they drew closer to Yongliang State.

Gradually, they sensed something was wrong with their surroundings.

Although the coastline seemed just within reach, no matter how much they flew, they remained over the Congyun Sea, unable to close the distance.

Even more terrifying, the scene of Yongliang State appeared blurry upon closer inspection!

It was as if it wasn’t real, but merely an illusion.

The four stopped flying, their faces growing solemn as they stared ahead.

Moments later, the leading black-clad cultivator gasped in shock: "No! It's an illusion!"

"What?" The others were stunned, and after a moment of realization, they began to re-examine their surroundings in horror.

The clouds, wind, and waves...

Everything around them suddenly froze.

Then, like a cracked glass mirror, the entire scene shattered.

The sound of the Sky-Shattering Gilded Thunder echoed faintly in their ears, and their Cave-Heavens and bodies remained utterly wrecked, still drenched in blood.

Time had not moved since the moment Li Fan had ambushed them with the gilded thunder.

"He took advantage of the moment when our Cave-Heavens were under attack and our minds were confused to pull us into an illusion!"

Sixth Brother finally realized and cried out in shock.

"Deduction techniques, formations, illusions..."

"As expected of an ancient cultivator."

The leading cultivator coughed and remarked through gritted teeth.

He tried to draw on his Cave-Heavens, absorbing the surrounding spiritual energy, but was horrified to find that an array had already been set up, turning the entire area into a spiritual vacuum.

There was no way for Nascent Soul cultivators to quickly restore their bodies using their Cave-Heavens power.

"Impressive technique!" He stared into the sky.

There, Li Fan's figure slowly appeared.

There, Li Fan’s figure slowly emerged.

“Was it just a coincidence…” Li Fan frowned slightly, muttering softly.

With his skills, he could have easily slaughtered the four cultivators from the Five Elders Association long ago.

The reason he had gone through so much effort was to use the Cloud and Water Illusion Technique to probe their minds and discover how they had noticed him this time.

However, what he hadn’t expected was such an absurd answer.

Without further hesitation, the Five Elements Annihilation Sword swept out continuously.

The four cultivators from the Five Elders Association, already seriously injured, resisted briefly before meeting a tragic end under Li Fan's sword.

An ominous phenomenon of fallen cultivators appeared above them, but Li Fan paid it no mind.

Because he had just realized that during his fight with the Five Elders Association cultivators, a powerful suction had erupted from the giant whirlpool at the bottom of the sea, pulling Han Yi, who had been restrained by the Insect Binding, into a deep hole within the ruins.

“Fate…”

Li Fan stood before the whirlpool, a contemplative look in his eyes.

Chapter 478: Financial Power Overwhelms Martial Arts

"I’ve always been careful, but this time I was accidentally discovered by a spy from the Five Elders Association."

"And Han Yi, who was originally doomed to have his soul searched, managed to escape because of it."

"Those with favorable fortune find everything goes smoothly; those with unfavorable fortune find everything goes wrong."

"This is the power of Fate…"

Li Fan finally began to understand the pain Song Yang experienced in the Fallen Immortal Realm when he sought the Heavenly Fate Mystic Bird from Xu Ke.

Gazing at the rapidly rotating vortex amidst the ruins, Li Fan hesitated for a moment but ultimately decided not to pursue it.

A deep sense of foreboding told him that forcibly chasing it would lead to no good outcome.

The depths of the vortex were absolutely not ordinary small mortal worlds, devoid of extraordinary power, like the worlds of Outer Realm or Great Xuan.

"Forget it, the monk may run, but the temple won't disappear."

The target was locked by the formless killing intent, but he had temporarily lost track of Han Yi.

Once Han Yi returned to the Xuanhuang Realm, Li Fan would immediately be alerted.

He returned to the surface of the sea, where the four cultivators from the Five Elders Association had been utterly annihilated by the Five Elements Annihilation Sword, leaving not a trace behind.

Li Fan took out the Image Recording Stone, capturing the scene in the sky before leisurely heading back to Ten Thousand Immortal Island.

The simultaneous fall of four Nascent Soul cultivators was a spectacular sight, and the strange phenomenon lingered for a long time.

Even though this part of the sea was remote, it still attracted many cultivators who came to observe.

After seeing the vision, they were shocked.

Four Nascent Soul True Lords had fallen at once!

What shocked them even more was that the culprit was the same person.

And that person was none other than the famous deduction master of Congyun Sea, an ancient cultivator of the Heavenly Mechanism Sect, Li Fan!

Their hearts were filled with even more confusion.

Wasn't Li Fan said to have had his cultivation drop to the Golden Core stage after being in slumber for thousands of years?

How could he single-handedly kill four Nascent Soul cultivators?

Wasn't he only skilled in deduction? How could his combat strength be so terrifying?

These four Nascent Soul cultivators were unfamiliar; no one had ever heard of them. Who were they?

And what kind of enmity did they have with Master Li, leading him to kill them?

With countless doubts, they hurriedly spread this explosive news to their friends and acquaintances.

Soon, word of Li Fan's slaying of four Nascent Soul cultivators spread throughout Congyun Sea.

At the Martial Hall on Ten Thousand Immortal Island:

"Are you here to claim a reward?" The receptionist cultivator looked at Li Fan, puzzled. "What reward?"

"I remember that there is a reward for successfully killing spies from the Five Elders Association, right?" Li Fan patiently asked.

As he spoke, he took out the Image Recording Stone and played the footage he had just recorded.

"I killed four Nascent Soul cultivators from the Five Elders Association," Li Fan said seriously.

"Cough, cough…" The cultivator at the Martial Hall immediately coughed violently.

He snatched the Image Recording Stone, watching it repeatedly in disbelief.

After a while, he looked at Li Fan, shocked, and said, "You… please wait a moment!"

With that, he staggered and hurried into the depths of the Martial Hall.

"What did you say?" Voices of astonishment could faintly be heard.

Not long after, Li Fan was respectfully invited into the reception hall of the Martial Hall.

Li Fan sat down casually.

Before long, a group of cultivators poured into the hall.

"Master Li, we have just confirmed that the images in the recording are authentic," said a Nascent Soul cultivator dressed in yellow robes, still with traces of blood on him, standing before Li Fan with some trepidation.

"May I ask, have you recovered your former cultivation level?" he asked, looking at Li Fan expectantly.

Li Fan took a sip of spiritual tea, savoring it before putting down the cup. He shook his head slowly and said, "Recovered my full cultivation? No, of course not! I'm still at the late stage of Golden Core, isn't it obvious?"

The hall fell into sudden silence.

"This…" The yellow-robed cultivator was dumbfounded.

After a moment, he asked somewhat irritably, "Then how did you kill those four Nascent Soul cultivators from the Five Elders Association?"

Li Fan slammed his hand on the table, startling everyone. He swept his gaze over them disdainfully and said, "What era are we living in? Do you think killing someone requires personal combat?"

"During ancient times, sects guarded their resources selfishly, raising prices for their own gain. High-level artifacts, talismans, and such were extremely expensive, and difficult to obtain."

"But now, with the Immortal Alliance controlling half of the Xuanhuang Realm, and the Tianxuan Mirror coordinating everything, there’s no more hoarding of treasures by greedy merchants."

"Nowadays, high-damage, disposable artifacts, formation, and talismans are as cheap as dirt!"

Li Fan shook his head, saying, "Having just woken up from slumber, naturally, I needed to secure my survival. It's only sensible to buy some of these items for emergencies, right?"

After Li Fan's explanation, the yellow-robed cultivator finally understood. He was dumbfounded and said, "So, you relied on external objects to kill these four Nascent Soul cultivators?"

Li Fan raised an eyebrow. "What, you don’t believe me?"

With a casual gesture, he pulled out several Sky-Shattering Gilded Thunders from his storage ring and placed them on the table.

The Martial Hall became chaotic in an instant.

Li Fan, however, didn’t stop.

Furious Flames Annihilation formation, Eight Desolations Silent Thunder, Soul-Fixing Needle, Demon Sealing Banner...

One by one, valuable and powerful killing tools were taken out and piled before the crowd.

The Martial Hall fell completely silent.

The cultivators present turned pale as they stared at the pile of single-use weapons, stacked like a small mountain.

"And with these, is it enough?" Li Fan asked casually.

"If not, it’s fine, I’ve got even more powerful ones," he added indifferently.

The yellow-robed cultivator wiped the cold sweat from his forehead and quickly said, "That’s enough! That’s enough! Master Li, please put these things away! If they accidentally went off here, it would be a disaster!"

Hearing this, Li Fan nodded in satisfaction and waved to store his weapons back.

Seeing this, the cultivators in the Martial Hall finally breathed a sigh of relief.

Although these weapons were mass-produced by the Tianxuan Mirror and their power reduced, their high quality and sheer quantity made up for it.

If these were unleashed, not even a Nascent Soul cultivator, maybe even a Soul Transformation True Monarch, would survive!

"It’s said that this man, with his deduction abilities, can easily accumulate wealth. Now I see it’s true."

"Being rich is truly a blessing. This pile of items is worth more than our team’s half-year budget."

"I heard you can invest through He Zhenghao? Maybe we should consider it."

…

For a while, the crowd in the Martial Hall was lost in thought.

"Now that everything's clear, let's discuss my reward."

"I spent quite a bit of money dealing with those black-clothed cultivators from the Five Elders Association. I shouldn’t be left at a loss, right?"

Li Fan took another sip of tea and glanced at the group slowly.

Chapter 479: Searching for the Rift Whale

In the Martial Hall, the cultivators exchanged glances, suddenly finding themselves in a bit of a predicament.

Indeed, according to the rules, any cultivator affiliated with the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance could apply for certain rewards from the Martial Hall if they managed to kill a member of the Five Elders Association.

Killing four opposing Nascent Soul cultivators was a significant achievement no matter which region it occurred in.

However, this young master before them had gone too far. The four cultivators from the Five Elders Association were obliterated to the point that not even their remains were left.

Not to mention the valuable bodies, limbs, or remnants of their souls.

While the battle results were impressive, the actual significance wasn’t as great.

If they didn’t give a reward, the news would spread, tarnishing their reputation.

If they did reward him, the Martial Hall in Congyun Sea was already tight on budget this year.

If they allowed Li Fan to take such a large sum, how would the rest of the brothers survive for the remainder of the year?

Moreover, Master Li Fan didn’t seem to be someone in need of contribution points.

Even if the Martial Hall gave a generous reward, it likely wouldn’t satisfy his appetite.

More importantly, this person was now quite renowned, and trying to suppress or force him to "voluntarily" give up the reward wasn’t an option.

Thus, how to structure the reward in a way that satisfied both parties was indeed a challenging issue to discuss.

Li Fan sat there, calm and composed, giving the impression that he wouldn’t leave until he received a satisfactory result.

The cultivators of the Martial Hall frowned slightly, secretly transmitting messages to discuss.

After several rounds of negotiation and probing, they finally reached a conclusion that pleased everyone.

With this outstanding achievement, Li Fan was appointed as a Special Deacon of the Martial Hall, officially entering the system of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

All his rewards were given in the form of contributions points.

After the cultivators of the Martial Hall calculated, they determined that this was enough to raise Li Fan’s authority level to Level 16 in one go.

To put it into perspective, a typical cultivator within the system would need at least thirty-four years of hard work to reach this level.

Yet Li Fan achieved it in an instant.

The number of contribution points no longer mattered to Li Fan; receiving contribution points was an outcome he couldn’t have hoped for more.

Thus, Li Fan readily agreed.

What followed was completing the necessary procedures in collaboration with the Martial Hall.

The Martial Hall submitted the request, and the Political Hall swiftly approved it.

After going through the formalities at the Jade Platform of Heart Inquiry, Li Fan officially became a member of the Martial Hall in Congyun Sea.

Then came the distribution of merit points.

After Li Fan left the central core area of Ten Thousand Immortal Island, apart from the aura of being an Ancient Cultivator from the Heavenly Mechanism Sect, skilled in deduction, he also gained another layer of identity: A member of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance system, with Level 16 authority.

"Now that I’m under the protection of an official title, even if someone wants to act against me, they can't do it openly."

As Li Fan walked along, he felt much safer.

Having gone through several lifetimes within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, Li Fan had come to deeply understand the importance of order and rules in the current Immortal Alliance.

Even a Dao Integration Immortal Sage, if they violated the rules, would face consequences.

The case of Guan Xingxiu, who lost a layer of cultivation and was exiled to Lanlin Prefecture, was a vivid example from the previous lifetime.

Having an official position in the system was undoubtedly an additional protective talisman.

However, to temporarily extricate himself from the commotion caused by killing four Nascent Soul cultivators, Li Fan immediately secluded himself in the Tianxuan Mirror.

A Golden Core cultivator slaying Nascent Soul cultivators, especially in a four-on-one situation, was an extraordinary feat.

Such an event would cause an explosion of discussions.

There was no need to intentionally stir the pot; the cultivators themselves eagerly discussed and spread the story of this miraculous event.

Some doubted it, others were curious.

And some, itching for a fight, wanted to challenge Li Fan themselves.

But when they learned that Li Fan had purchased a "Sharp Weapon" from the Tianxuan Mirror to kill the four Nascent Soul cultivators, their reactions were strikingly unanimous.

"Money really is a wonderful thing!"

Yes, for some reason, the secret of the assassination, which should have been highly classified and known only to the cultivators in the Martial Hall, spread just as quickly as the news of Li Fan’s achievement.

The truth behind the incident had spread across all the regions of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, along with Li Fan’s reputation.

Regardless of their opinion on Li Fan, cultivators admired his ability to lead everyone toward wealth.

As a result, the number of cultivators seeking advice from He Zhenghao surged.

Even Daoist He became somewhat famous among the cultivators.

But amidst all the external chaos, Li Fan paid no attention.
