He cut off all communication with the outside world and immersed himself in cultivation within the Tianxuan Mirror.

Time flew by, and before long, the end of the ninth year arrived.

The August period of the previous year, when Li Fan last entered the Fallen Immortal Realm, had passed, and he was suddenly awakened from seclusion by a premonition.

"Mr. Bai, the Creation Furnace Technique…"

A glimmer of anticipation flashed in Li Fan’s eyes. After a bit of preparation, he chanted, "Blessings to the Heavenly Venerable Of Xuanhuang"."

In an instant, the scene before him blurred.

When he regained clarity, he found himself once again in the Fallen Immortal Realm.

The first thing Li Fan did after entering the Fallen Immortal Realm was not to observe his surroundings but to recall the teachings of Mr. Bai’s Creation Furnace Technique in his mind.

The brilliant words immediately resurfaced, allowing him once again to witness the Supreme Path and Profound Art.

Li Fan was captivated, completely immersed.

"Marvelous!"

He sighed once more in admiration.

"Little Black, you’re finally awake?"

At that moment, an ill-timed voice dragged him out of that wonderful state.

It was Xu Ke’s somewhat foolish voice.

Feeling a wave of annoyance, Li Fan swiped at Xu Ke's head with a claw.

Scanning the surrounding environment, he noticed that it was different from the landscape of the Beast Taming Sect where he had previously been.

"What happened after I fell into slumber?" Li Fan asked Xu Ke through telepathy.

"Eh? Little Black, you can finally talk?" Xu Ke, looking surprised and a bit slow-witted, asked cheerfully.

After scratching his head a few more times, Xu Ke finally recounted the entire story to Li Fan.

It turned out that after Li Fan swallowed Song Yang's Ink Immortal Tiger and fell into a deep slumber, Xu Ke followed the jade token’s guidance from Senior Brother Lu Ya and successfully met with Lu Ya and the Wise Beast Emperor Sanmo.

When the Emperor Sanmo saw the sleeping Heavenly Fate Mystical Bird, he said some cryptic words and then inserted a strand of white hair into Li Fan's body.

After that, Li Fan fell into an even deeper sleep atop Xu Ke’s head.

He only woke up now.

"So, you're saying I've been asleep for three years?"

"And you've come to this valley world to search for a creature called the Rift Whale?"

Li Fan asked in a deep voice.

"That's right! Little Black, you wouldn’t believe how hard it is to find this big guy. Even though it's massive, it hides in the clouds and can even conceal its form."

"Normal detection spells and magic tools are completely useless. It’s really hard to find," Xu Ke complained.

Chapter 480: Difficult to Judge Good and Evil

“To encounter them, it's entirely up to luck. You have to fly into each patch of cloud and investigate personally.”

Xu Ke sighed, touching a colorful pouch hanging at his waist, muttering, “Even finding them isn’t enough, we still need to figure out how to catch them.”

“These creatures, despite their large size, are actually more agile than eels.”

“If there’s even the slightest movement nearby, they’ll vanish into thin air. Several times, I was so close to catching them, yet they still managed to escape.”

“Sigh, I don’t know when I’ll be able to complete the task that Senior Brother Lu Ya assigned to me. It’s the first time he’s entrusted me with something this important. I can’t afford to mess it up.”

...

As Xu Ke rambled on, Li Fan listened quietly, deep in thought.

According to Xu Ke’s description, the Rift world Whales at this time were quite different from the ones Li Fan had encountered thousands of years later.

Not only were they several times larger, but their temperament had also changed, becoming less timid and even highly aggressive.

“They seem more like a subspecies with different traits.”

“With Xu Ke’s luck, capturing a group of Rift Whales shouldn’t be too difficult.”

“Once he catches enough of them, using the techniques of the Beast Taming Sect for selective breeding…”

Recalling a conversation he had overheard between Lu Ya and Emperor Sanmo in his past life, Li Fan’s mind began to ponder.

“Is capturing Rift Whales actually something Mr. Bai requested?”

“Could it be that the group of Rift Whales roaming outside the small world was also his doing?”

Li Fan tugged on Xu Ke’s hair in frustration, feeling increasingly confused.

When he first saw the group of Void Rift Whales pushing the mortal small world away from the cultivation world, Li Fan had once lamented, “Just how much did those ancient cultivators hate mortals?”

From his then single-minded pursuit of immortality, separating mortals from the cultivation world and cutting off their path to immortality seemed like a punishment.

But now, after experiencing many things in the cultivation world and understanding how cultivators treated mortals, Li Fan had begun to have different thoughts.

Cultivators saw mortals as ants, taking what they wanted from them at will.

They even treated them like livestock, using formations to extract their life essence.

And that was now, when mortals carried the Immortal-Mortal Plague, which restrained some of the cultivators’ behaviors.

In the ancient cultivation world, mortals’ suffering was even worse.

They were used as ingredients for refining [Longevity Fruits], and when cultivators fought each other, they wouldn’t care at all about the lives of mortals...

Escaping the control of immortals might not be such a bad thing for mortals after all.

“Could it be that, as the orphans of Ningyuan City said, Mr. Bai is truly a great benefactor with the world in his heart?”

This thought couldn’t help but emerge in Li Fan’s mind.

“Whatever the truth is, I can’t draw conclusions yet.”

“I need to gather more information.”

With that, Li Fan scratched Xu Ke hard again, urging him to hurry up and find the Rift Whales.

Meanwhile, Li Fan nestled in Xu Ke’s hair, practicing the “Creation Furnace Technique” while also using the [Heaven's Mandate is Mine] secret art.

He helped Xu Ke consolidate his luck.

Despite repeated failures, Xu Ke, usually carefree, started to grow anxious.

“Rift Whales, Rift Whales, where are you?!”

He kept mumbling, his eyes filled with desperation.

Li Fan suddenly lifted his head.

He noticed that the purple aura of luck above Xu Ke’s head had dispersed slightly with his murmuring, though where it went, he couldn’t tell.

The disappearance of luck had an immediate effect.

Whereas before they might have seen traces of the Rift Whales once every ten days or so, now sightings became more frequent.

Through repeated attempts, Xu Ke slowly figured out a way to approach the Rift Whales without being detected.

However, capturing a mythical beast with the [Ten Thousand Beasts Bag] was no easy task.

Especially for someone like Xu Ke, who was a novice.

After a prolonged struggle, the whale still managed to escape.

Drenched in sweat and nearly exhausted, Xu Ke slumped to the ground, filled with frustration.

But soon, he regained his spirit and set off again to find the next Rift Whale.

With his relentless efforts, the pillar of purple-gold luck continued to dwindle.

The depletion was much faster than what Li Fan could replenish using the secret technique.

Eventually, it appeared slightly dimmer than before.

But it wasn’t all in vain.

Four months later, after enduring countless hardships, Xu Ke finally managed to capture a Rift Whale.

The [Ten Thousand Beasts Bag] floated quietly in the air, no longer shaking violently.

Xu Ke grabbed it tightly, shouting in excitement.

“I’ve finally completed the task! Now I can go back and report to Senior Brother Lu Ya!”

“Xiao Qing! Let’s go home!” Xu Ke called out his Azure Luan Bird, joyfully hopping onto its back.

Li Fan’s gaze sharpened as he focused on the bird, carefully examining it.

The Azure Luan Bird, however, completely ignored Li Fan, affectionately rubbing its neck against Xu Ke instead.

It then spread its wings and flew off toward the heavens.

“To think that, thousands of years later, it would be transformed into the empire’s [Holy Master],” Li Fan mused, sensing the familiar aura around Xiao Qing and confirming his earlier suspicions.

After more than three years apart, the Azure Luan Bird seemed even more majestic than when Li Fan had last seen it in the Immortal Falls Realm.

Not only was it's flight speed several times faster, but during the journey, a faint blue light radiated from it, enveloping both Xu Ke and Li Fan, blocking out the sound of the wind, making the ride more comfortable.

Xu Ke, who hadn’t rested in a long time, fell into a deep sleep on the bird’s back.

Xiao Qing continued to fly diligently.

After watching for a while, Li Fan slowly retracted his gaze.

As the Azure Luan Bird flew higher and higher, Li Fan stood atop Xu Ke’s head and looked down.

Only then did he realize that this small world wasn’t so much a canyon shaped like a thread of sky.

Rather, it looked more like a scar, forcibly carved by a sharp weapon.

Yet, this scar also brought life. Apart from the long fissure, the rest of the world was nothing but scorched earth.

Scarlet flames scorched the ground, and molten lava flowed savagely.

All of these destructive forces were held at bay, unable to cross the fissure.

The power that carved out the canyon lingered, preventing the flames from encroaching.

Thus, amidst this hellish small world, a lush and vibrant paradise had been created.

“Your perspective shapes your answers.”

Li Fan recalled the issue of mortals separating from the Xuanhuang Realm and had a moment of insight.

Passing through an invisible passage in the sky, they returned to the Xuanhuang Realm.

The pale white light slowly faded, and when Li Fan could finally see clearly, he was surprised.

Because they had just flown out of a painting.

Chapter 481: The Past of the Divine Brush Sect

A somewhat worn ancient painting hung on the wall.

The scene depicted in the painting was exactly the canyon world where Xu Ke and Li Fan had previously been, capturing the Rift Whale.

In this room, there were over thirty other scrolls hanging on the walls.

What surprised Li Fan was that some of the paintings seemed to be enveloped in a layer of mysterious energy, preventing outsiders from peering into them.

Even with his powers as the "Heavenly Fate Mystical Bird," he could not discern the contents of these paintings.

A Azure luan bird flew out from one of the scrolls, gently placing Xu Ke on the ground. Afterward, it transformed into a streak of green light and disappeared into his embrace.

“Xu Ke is back!” A young cultivator who had been dozing off in the room immediately brightened up and rushed outside, shouting.

In no time, the already cramped room was flooded with a crowd of cultivators.

“It’s good that he’s back. He must have successfully found that Rift Whale, right?”

“The hard days are finally over!”

“Yeah, once Xu Ke returns, that guy Lu Ya should head back too, right?”

“That jerk, always bullying people because he has a strange beast! Too outrageous!”

“Senior Brother Liu, last time you sparred with Lu Ya, he didn’t even summon his beast, the ‘Tian Wu,’ and you still ended up begging for mercy!”

“That was a mistake! If I had another chance…”

“Shh! Lu Ya is here!”

“Ah…”

The noisy group instantly fell silent.

They even made way for him, allowing Lu Ya to walk in smoothly.

Lu Ya, with yellow hair and a cold expression, walked straight towards the sleeping Xu Ke, ignoring the varied reactions from the other cultivators around him.

He glanced at Li Fan briefly before his eyes softened when they landed on Xu Ke’s face.

With a gentle wave of his hand, he lifted Xu Ke along with Li Fan.

Striding out of the room, a beast with the body of a tiger and the face of a man appeared in an instant.

“Tian Wu…” The aura emanating from the beast made Li Fan slightly uncomfortable, causing him to instinctively shrink deeper into Xu Ke’s hair.

The tiger-bodied, human-faced beast let out a roar, and Lu Ya leaped onto its back.

The beast Tian Wu glanced around in a show of might before soaring into the sky.

“Three years of hospitality from the Divine Brush Sect, Lu Ya is deeply grateful!”

“One day, I shall repay you all handsomely. For now, I bid you farewell. There’s no need to see me off!”

Lu Ya cupped his hands towards the ground below and spoke in a loud voice.

Without waiting for a response from the Divine Brush Sect, he flew off on Tian Wu, disappearing quickly into the sky.

“Such arrogance! He’s only relying on the power of the Beast Taming Sect!”

“Hmph, Lu Ya’s cultivation is already at the late Nascent Soul stage. With that Tian Wu beast, even our Senior Brother might not be his match.”

“Yeah, but it’s not like we can compete. We can’t just ask the elders to step in, right?”

“Forget it. With our Sect Leader in his current state, our Senior Brother is better off handling things.”

…

Before leaving, Li Fan faintly overheard some of their discussions.

Lu Ya, however, paid no attention and continued flying away with Xu Ke.

The landscape below constantly shifted as they traveled, passing through plains and mountains.

After more than twenty days of travel, the surroundings finally began to look familiar.

They had returned to the territory of the Beast Taming Sect.

“Without the White fog barrier, it was much easier for those in ancient times to travel freely.”

As Li Fan thought this, he sensed that his time in the Fallen Immortal Realm was nearing its end.

Finally, after sleeping throughout the journey, Xu Ke was woken up by Lu Ya.

“Huh? Senior Brother Lu Ya?”

Xu Ke groggily rubbed his eyes and, seeing Lu Ya standing tall with his robes billowing in the wind, asked in confusion.

“Where are we?” Still thinking he was dreaming, Xu Ke glanced around.

Li Fan gave him a sharp claw strike, jolting Xu Ke awake.

“Wow! Beast Taming Sect! I’m back!” Recognizing the familiar surroundings, Xu Ke jumped in excitement.

Lu Ya smiled faintly.

He patted Xu Ke’s head and began asking about his three years of searching for the Rift Whale.

Xu Ke, of course, complained endlessly about his hardships.

After comforting and praising him, Lu Ya’s expression turned serious as he brought up an important matter.

“Next, I have a task of even greater importance for you.”

Hearing that he had to head out again right after returning, Xu Ke's face fell.

However, seeing Lu Ya’s solemn expression, Xu Ke nodded and agreed.

“Senior Brother Lu Ya, what is it?”

“I need you to go to Nanming and deliver something for me,” Lu Ya said gravely.

“Nanming? I think I’ve heard of that place…” Xu Ke scratched his head, pondering for a moment before realizing.

“Oh! It’s the place with lots of demonic beasts, right?”

Just as Li Fan was about to listen more closely, he suddenly noticed the surrounding scenery and sounds becoming blurry.

“This…”

Despite his reluctance, he could not defy the rules of the Fallen Immortal Realm.

In the next moment, after a dizzying sensation, Li Fan returned to the Tianxuan Mirror.

“Divine Brush Sect, Nanming…”

Li Fan reflected on his experiences in the Fallen Immortal Realm. After a brief pause, he began searching within the Tianxuan Mirror.

The Divine Brush Sect was a mid-tier sect during ancient times.

They practiced a unique path, using brushes as their primary tool. It was said that both their calligraphy and paintings could communicate with the divine.

The disciples of this sect were all highly skilled in calligraphy and painting, and there were even legends of them bringing creatures to life through their art.

Unfortunately, after several great calamities in the world, very few of their works survived.

Even when Li Fan had visited the Divine Relic Museum, he didn’t find any surviving works from the sect.

In today’s cultivation world, there are few records of Divine Brush Sect cultivators. Most of those mentioned were obscure figures with little fame.

The only notable figure in history was a former Sect Leader, Chu Youhong.

Chu Youhong, at the Nascent Soul stage, took over as Sect Leader on the deathbed order of his predecessor.

Due to his low cultivation level and weak strength, he was often looked down upon by the sect's disciples.

However, out of respect for the Sect Leader’s title, there was no open rebellion.

Chu Youhong didn’t seem to mind and treated the disciples kindly, never displaying the authority of a Sect Leader.

Despite this, he diligently fulfilled his duties as Sect Leader.

He managed all sect affairs personally, no matter how small.

Externally, he maintained good relations with many neighboring sects.

Thanks to his tireless efforts, the Divine Brush Sect gradually recovered from the leadership crisis that followed the sudden death of the previous Sect Leader.

Through these accomplishments, the disciples slowly began to recognize Chu Youhong’s leadership.

And when one of Chu Youhong’s mortal disciples surpassed him in cultivation, becoming incredibly powerful, Chu Youhong’s position as Sect Leader was finally secured.

Just as things were looking up for the Divine Brush Sect, a disaster struck.

The talented disciple, the Sect’s Senior Brother, was actually a spy sent by another sect—the “Pointillism Sect.”

His target was the Divine Brush Sect’s most prized artifact, the “Heavenly Painting Brush.”

One night, with inside help from the spy, the Pointillism Sect launched a surprise attack on the Divine Brush Sect.

The Divine Brush Sect suffered heavy casualties, nearly facing total annihilation.

Chapter 482: A Sudden Year Passes

Just as the disciples of the Divine Brush Sect were falling into despair, an event occurred that filled them with even greater anger.

Sect Leader Chu Youhong, disregarding the lives of his disciples, fled with the treasured [Heavenly Painting Brush] and a significant portion of the sect's treasury, escaping into the void.

While his departure did divert some of the attention from the attacking Pointillism Sect, as the head of the sect, such a lack of responsibility was unforgivable.

Those who were still alive and desperately fighting for their lives felt immense hatred towards Chu Youhong.

Had the enemy not been so ruthless, leaving no survivors, many of them might have surrendered on the spot and switched sides to join the Pointillism Sect.

In this battle, almost the entire Divine Brush Sect was annihilated, with only Chu Youhong and a few lucky survivors escaping with their lives.

Although the Pointillism Sect failed to seize the Heavenly Painting Brush, they annexed much of the Divine Brush Sect's lands and resources, greatly strengthening their position. They quickly rose to become one of the most prominent sects in the region, their reputation growing significantly.

As for Chu Youhong, he disappeared from the world along with the Heavenly Painting Brush, seemingly vanishing without a trace.

Twenty years later, one of the surviving disciples from the Divine Brush Sect encountered Chu Youhong and furiously confronted him, demanding to know why he abandoned the sect and fled alone.

Chu Youhong, without any hint of remorse, spoke words that would be remembered throughout the history of the Xuanhuang Realm:

"Even if all of you died, it wouldn't matter."

"As long as I'm alive, the Divine Brush Sect still exists."

"My master entrusted the Divine Brush Sect to me before his death, and I will not allow it to be destroyed in my hands."

Chu Youhong's expression was one of complete righteousness.

The disciple, hearing this, was left speechless. Though he wanted to argue, no words came out.

The disciple's earlier resolve for revenge was forgotten as he stood there in a daze, watching Chu Youhong leave gracefully.

Because of these shocking words, they quickly spread throughout the cultivation world at that time.

Some laughed at him, while others saw his statement as profound wisdom.

There were even those who couldn't stand Chu Youhong's actions and wanted to personally confront him.

But after this incident, Chu Youhong disappeared completely, as if he had evaporated from the world. No one ever saw him again.

It wasn't until much later, when a great calamity descended upon the world, and the Pointillism Sect mysteriously collapsed overnight, that people began to suspect that it might have been Chu Youhong's doing.

...

"To be so selfish for the sake of the greater good is indeed something beyond the understanding of ordinary people."

Li Fan pondered deeply, and couldn't help but sigh.

"Perhaps that's why the Pointillism Sect's spy, who had risen to the position of Senior Brother, chose to betray them and seize power."

"Once he recognized the true nature of his master, he realized that inheriting the Heavenly Painting Brush through normal means would be impossible. He had no choice but to take drastic measures."

"Dealing with such an eccentric individual, there really weren't many other options."

Li Fan shook his head slightly and began to search for information about the term "Nanming."

He managed to find some scattered details about "Nanming Demonic Mountain."

However, when he tried to dig deeper, he discovered that his access level wasn't high enough.

"Demonic Mountain..."

"It seems to be related to the lingering demonic beasts in the world."

Li Fan's eyes flickered as he noted it down for later.

Time passed quickly, and soon, ten years had gone by.

This year, aside from occasional minor skirmishes between border states and the Five Elders Association, most regions remained peaceful.

The Congyun Sea was no exception.

As a special associate of the Martial Hall, Li Fan didn't have any specific duties to fulfill.

All he needed to do was drop by the Martial Hall occasionally, have some tea, and check in.

If he was too busy, he could even spend some of his contribution points to have another cultivator handle things for him.

As a result, he lived a fairly leisurely life.

After turning in the third collection of 15 million contribution points—amounting to a total of 23 million points—he handed it over to He Zhenghao.

He Zhenghao stared at the astronomical number of contribution points in disbelief, stunned for the better part of half a day before he finally regained his composure, his eyes red with emotion.

For a brief moment, He Zhenghao entertained the thought of absconding with the points.

However, the thought of whose contribution points these were made him shiver, and he quickly abandoned the idea.

Unless he defected directly to the Five Elders Association, there was no way he'd live long enough to enjoy the wealth.

Regaining his senses, He Zhenghao began returning the contribution points to the investors who had participated in the plan.

The cultivators, pleased with their profits, were ecstatic.

However, what He Zhenghao said next left them feeling both frustrated and disappointed.

"Due to unforeseen circumstances, Master Li's contribution plan will be temporarily suspended."

With a sigh, He Zhenghao explained, "Everyone, please return home. Once the situation settles and Master Li decides to reopen the plan, I will notify you all."

These vague words left much to interpretation.

But it was precisely this ambiguity that fueled their imaginations.

Unforeseen circumstances? Waiting for things to calm down?

This Master Li had been able to defeat even Nascent Soul cultivators with sheer wealth.

Yet now, he was forced to halt the plan due to some external pressure.

"It must have threatened someone's interests. Hmm..."

The gathered cultivators exchanged knowing glances and then fell silent.

Though they were frustrated at missing the chance to get rich, they also felt sympathy for Li Fan.

"Once things return to normal, be sure to notify me first."

In private, each of them made this request to He Zhenghao.

Having received many gifts and made a small fortune, He Zhenghao naturally agreed.

Li Fan's decision to pause the collection of contribution points was partly due to the rapid growth of the points' total, which was becoming a bit overwhelming. He wanted to slow things down temporarily.

But he had also received a warning from within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

"Very well, let's let them wait for a while. I'll resume the plan when it's closer to the Crimson Flame will Burn the Sea."

Li Fan didn't pay much attention to the matter.

As the cultivators who had profited from the fourth investment began spending their contribution points to strengthen themselves, a steady stream of feedback flowed back to Li Fan, enriching his cultivation like rivers flowing into the sea.

Even without actively cultivating, his cultivation level steadily increased each day.

Not to mention that Li Fan had almost never stopped using both Awakening Pills and Enlightenment Pills.

In just one short year, he had made as much progress as an ordinary cultivator would in decades of hard training.

Li Fan felt that his Golden Core was nearly perfected, and it wouldn't be long before he was ready to form a Nascent Soul.

This year, every three months, he made a trip to Shenhua Island to extract some Kunpeng blood essence from Ye Feipeng for his research.

His understanding of the power of Kunpeng bloodlines grew deeper with each visit.

During this time, Li Fan also made another trip to the Fallen Immortal Realm.

Xu Ke, acting on Lu Ya's behalf, needed to deliver a wooden box to the South Ming region.

This wooden box was of great importance, sealed with several different powers.

Li Fan even sensed the aura of the Longevity Beast Emperor, Sanmo, on it.

Thus, Li Fan accompanied Xu Ke throughout the journey, riding the Qingluan Bird.

It seemed that the South Ming region was extremely far from the Beast-Taming Sect.

Time ran out before they could reach their destination, so their journey to the Fallen Immortal Realm had to be cut short.

And so, time moved forward to the eleventh year.

This year, the long-sealed Cloud Water Heavenly Palace would reappear in the world.

Chapter 483: The Plague God’s Unwelcome Visit

Chapter 483: The Plague God's Unwelcome Visit

Congyun Sea, on a deserted island.

Sikong Yi and Bai Li Chen cautiously surveyed their surroundings. After confirming that no one had followed them, they finally entered their hidden cave abode, which they had carefully constructed.

The interior was small and quite simple. Despite this, Sikong Yi felt unusually secure inside.

Bai Li Chen's clone stood at the entrance, vigilantly on guard. Meanwhile, Sikong Yi himself relaxed completely, lying on the bed and contemplating his future plans.

"If my guess is correct, the strange phenomenon at the center of Congyun Sea should be the precursor to the appearance of the Cloud Water Heavenly Palace."

"And the 'Cloud Water Atlas' should be located in these ruins."

"100,000 contribution points," Sikong Yi's eyes glimmered with a hint of desire.

However, a moment later, hesitation clouded his expression.

"The Cloud Water Heavenly Palace likely still has descendants in the world. If I impersonate a disciple and am discovered..."

Just thinking about this made Sikong Yi feel uneasy.

Recently, while his clone was practicing the 'Sea-Stabilizing Divine Sword' technique, it had unexpectedly sensed that someone else in Congyun Sea was also cultivating the same technique. This was surprising, as he had obtained this Golden Core technique from the remains of a Cloud Water Heavenly Palace disciple many years ago. By all rights, no one else should know of it.

And yet, here it was.

His first reaction was that there must still be descendants of the Cloud Water Heavenly Palace alive. He had originally intended to investigate further, but the closer he got to the target location, the stronger the feeling of dread became.

If he had gone, he would have been walking into certain death!

Realizing this, Sikong Yi fled immediately in fear. After narrowly escaping, he found himself unable to eat or sleep peacefully, constantly worried that the person who shared his technique would track him down.

"The Golden Core technique may be precious, but compared to my life, it’s not worth the risk."

After much hesitation, he decided to temporarily suppress the 'Sea-Stabilizing Divine Sword' technique, leaving only his pure cultivation power in his dantian. As a result, the strength of his clone significantly weakened. During this time, he acted with extreme caution, rarely leaving the safety of either the Tianxuan Mirror or this secret cave abode.

But now, as the day of the Cloud Water Heavenly Palace’s opening approached, his thoughts began to stir again.

"100,000 contribution points, 100,000 contribution points..."

He muttered under his breath, a decisive glint flashing in his eyes.

"That old turtle Taiyi is not in his right mind. I'll hurry to him first, then re-cultivate the 'Sea-Stabilizing Divine Sword', disguise myself as a Cloud Water Heavenly Palace disciple, and steal the Cloud Water Atlas."

"Once I leave the Cloud Water Heavenly Palace, I'll quickly disperse my cultivation and head to the Tianxuan Mirror to claim my reward. By the time that descendant realizes something's wrong, it will be too late to find me."

"All I need to do is be faster than them."

"Fortune favors the bold!"

Having made up his mind, Sikong Yi let out a long breath and was just about to take a well-deserved rest before his adventure when he suddenly noticed movement at the entrance of the cave.

His face changed dramatically, and he quickly got up, rushing to the entrance, where he and his clone stood on high alert.

"Is Daoist Bai Li present?"

The voice caused Sikong Yi's heart to leap into his throat.

"Who is it? How do they know my identity? And how do they know about this cave abode?"

A flurry of faces flashed through his mind, but he quickly dismissed each one.

Narrowing his eyes, neither Sikong Yi nor Bai Li Chen responded. Instead, they took out their magical artifacts from their storage rings, secretly gathering their strength.

Seeing no reply, the voice outside spoke again, "Hehe, Daoist Bai Li, there's no need to worry. I mean no harm."

"I’ve come uninvited this time simply for the 100,000 contribution points related to the Cloud Water Atlas."

Sikong Yi was shaken to the core by these words. His hands trembled, nearly dropping his magical artifact.

His expression fluctuated wildly, and after thinking it over for a long time, he finally spoke. He controlled his clone to ask in a hoarse voice, "What do you mean?"

The person outside chuckled, "Daoist Bai Li, you don't need to play dumb. Did you really think that no one else besides you knows the origins of the 'Sea-Stabilizing Divine Sword'?"

Realizing that the person wasn’t bluffing, Sikong Yi fell silent for a long while before speaking in a low voice, "What do you want?"

"What do I want? That's a funny way to put it." The voice outside laughed, "Naturally, I want a share of the profits. Who wouldn't be tempted by 100,000 contribution points?"

Now that he knew the other person’s intentions, Sikong Yi actually felt somewhat relieved. After pondering it for a while, he finally disabled the entrance's restrictions and, with his clone at his back, stepped out cautiously.

Outside the cave stood a plain-looking middle-aged cultivator with a thin face and a small goatee.

"There's no need to be so tense. I mean no harm. I am Han Wuyou," the middle-aged cultivator said, cupping his hands with a faint smile.

"Say what you came here for!" Sikong Yi was no longer as tense upon seeing that the man only had Qi Condensation cultivation.

After some back-and-forth, Sikong Yi learned the truth of the situation. It turned out that Han Wuyou had accidentally witnessed the battle in which Sikong Yi's clone had used the 'Sea-Stabilizing Divine Sword.' Although Han Wuyou's cultivation wasn’t high, he was well-read and had recognized the technique as originating from the Cloud Water Heavenly Palace.

Recently, the strange phenomena at the center of Congyun Sea had caught his attention as well. After observing the scene briefly, he speculated that the Cloud Water Heavenly Palace was about to reappear. He connected this to the mission offering 100,000 contribution points and deduced that Bai Li Chen, having inherited the Cloud Water Heavenly Palace’s legacy, was certain to acquire the Cloud Water Atlas.

This was why he had followed them secretly and came to visit.

"Getting the Cloud Water Atlas is my own skill. Why should I share the profits with you?" Sikong Yi said angrily.

"Hehe, Daoist, you're joking. You wouldn’t want news of your obtaining the legacy of an ancient sect to spread across Congyun Sea, would you?" Han Wuyou stroked his goatee, his eyes flashing with a cold gleam.

Killing intent rose in Sikong Yi’s heart, but before he could act, Han Wuyou continued, "But I don’t intend to take your benefits for nothing."

"You have your path to wealth, and I have my way to the heavens."

"If you're willing to share some of the 100,000 contribution points with me, I also have a good opportunity to offer you."

"With the three of us working together, 100,000 contribution points will just be the beginning!"

Sikong Yi’s interest was piqued. "Explain yourself clearly!"

Han Wuyou smiled slightly and said, "Even if we earn 100,000 contribution points, we’re still small fish. We would burn through it quickly. Isn’t that true?"

Sikong Yi thought for a moment, then nodded. "The speed at which Qi Condensation cultivators can earn contribution points is indeed slow. But once I break through to Foundation Establishment..."

Han Wuyou waved a hand dismissively. "So what if you reach Foundation Establishment? Are there few Foundation Establishment cultivators in Congyun Sea? Aren’t they all still struggling for those meager contribution points? Even for a Foundation Establishment cultivator, earning 100,000 contribution points would take 10 or 20 years, even without eating or drinking."

"Then what brilliant plan do you have?" Sikong Yi asked skeptically.

Han Wuyou raised his head proudly, "Have you ever heard of Master Li Fan?"

Sikong Yi’s body shook as he exclaimed, "You mean, the ancient Heavenly Mechanism Sect cultivator, the one renowned for his divination skills and wealth, rivaling nations?"

Han Wuyou nodded, a hint of pride in his voice. "Indeed! I am acquainted with Master Li’s..."

He paused for effect, then added, "friend, Senior He Zhenghao!"

Chapter 484: Wuyou Solves Worries

Sikong Yi skeptically eyed Han Wuyou, his face full of disbelief: "I've heard of He Zhenghao. Nowadays, he's quite a prominent figure in the Congyun Sea. You're just at the Qi Condensation stage—how could you have any connection with him?"

Han Wuyou stroked his goatee with pride and said, "My methods are far beyond what you can imagine, Daoist friend. How exactly I accomplished it is not convenient to explain, but there's no need for you to doubt its authenticity."

Seeing that Bai Li Chen and Si Kongyi still appeared unconvinced, Han Wuyou sneered, "Well, I knew you wouldn't believe me so easily."

With that, he tossed over a communication talisman. "This is a communication talisman from Senior He Zhenghao. You can try it yourself and see if I'm exaggerating."

Si Kongyi held the talisman with a solemn expression and gently sensed it.

Sure enough, it displayed the image of He Zhenghao.

He tried sending a greeting, but unfortunately, Senior He Zhenghao seemed busy and only responded with an automated reply.

Even so, it confirmed that Han Wuyou wasn’t lying.

Han Wuyou retrieved the talisman and continued his persuasive speech, "The 100,000 contribution points in your hands will be squandered in no time. How much will be left after one year? Two years? Three years?"

"But if entrusted to Senior He Zhenghao, who will pass them to Master Li Fan, it will be a different story. Perhaps you're unaware, but investments handled by Master Li Fan yield at least a 50% return annually."

Sikong Yi's breath caught.

Bai Li Chen’s clone couldn't help but exclaim, "50% annual return? How is that possible!"

He quickly calculated, "Doing nothing would earn at least 50,000 points in profit annually."

"And if the profits are reinvested with Master Li, in just six years, 100,000 contribution points will grow to 1,000,000 contribution points..."

"Hiss..."

A million contribution points.

The thought of such a vast number made Sikong Yi feel dizzy.

At one time, he believed that 100,000 contribution points would be the ultimate goal of his life. Who could have imagined that he might one day possess a million?

Once the desire took root, it became impossible to suppress.

Although logic told him such explosive returns were highly unrealistic, the many tales of Master Li Fan’s feats across the cultivation world weren't fabrications.

Master Li was currently at a level that Sikong Yi could not even hope to reach. Who’s to say that such incredible abilities weren’t real?

Sikong Yi’s heart was stirred.

Han Wuyou, noticing the expression on Sikong Yi’s face, knew he had won him over.

"Daoist Han, please come in and explain the details," Sikong Yi invited Han Wuyou into his cave abode, eager to inquire about the specifics of the investment.

As Han Wuyou explained, Sikong Yi listened with increasing excitement, regretting that he hadn't met Han Wuyou earlier, lamenting the missed opportunities for wealth.

"Although I’m eager to immediately hand over the 100,000 contribution points to Master Li for investment, it's still premature."

After a moment of contemplation, Bai Li Chen sighed, "The Cloud Water Heavenly Palace relic has been sealed for thousands of years. The dangers within must be unimaginable. I’m not confident I can successfully retrieve the Cloud Water Atlas."

"Moreover..."

After hesitating for a while, Bai Li Chen decided to tell the truth: "I fear there may still be descendants of the Cloud Water Heavenly Palace in the world!"

Han Wuyou's expression changed slightly upon hearing this: "Is that true?"

Bai Li Chen then explained what he had sensed while cultivating the Sea-Stabilizing Divine Sword.

Han Wuyou pondered for a moment before slowly saying, "In my opinion, the person may not necessarily be a descendant of the Cloud Water Heavenly Palace. It's quite possible they stumbled upon this technique by chance from some relic."

Bai Li Chen smiled bitterly, "Even if that's the case, it can't be proven. To be honest, Daoist Han, I didn't even dare approach the island."

Han Wuyou paced back and forth, seemingly deep in thought.

After a long pause, he spoke, "If you trust me, Daoist, point me to the location of the island. I will take care of this matter for you!"

"However, if I succeed, I want 40% of the 100,000 contribution points!"

Sikong Yi and Bai Li Chen both looked up sharply, staring at Han Wuyou.

After a while, Bai Li Chen said in a deep voice, "If you can truly eliminate that cultivator of the Sea-Stabilizing Divine Sword, then what’s the harm in giving you 40%?"

"Deal!"

Afterward, Sikong Yi took Han Wuyou to the vicinity of the island.

"What do you think?"

"There’s indeed a dangerous aura lurking on the island." After observing for a while from afar, Han Wuyou frowned.

"However..." Han Wuyou's tone suddenly changed, "It's not a big problem!"

Si Kongyi was surprised.

Han Wuyou coldly remarked, "In today's cultivation world, the lives of cultivators may not be as valuable as you think."

"Daoist, return to your cave and await my good news!" With that, Han Wuyou cupped his hands and departed swiftly.

Si Kongyi watched him leave, his expression unreadable.

Instead of returning to his cave, he hid near the island, waiting in ambush.

Three days later, a shadow moved swiftly toward the island.

Simultaneously, a cultivator flew out from the island to confront the figure.

After a brief standoff, they engaged in an intense battle.

The terrifying power of the fight stunned Sikong Yi, who was observing from the shadows.

"Han Wuyou really has some skill. Judging by this level of power, at least a Nascent Soul stage cultivator is involved!" Sikong Yi’s excitement grew.

After watching for a while, he feared being discovered by the powerful combatants and quietly left, returning to his cave.

Two days later, Han Wuyou visited again.

"Daoist Bai Li, you can resume cultivating the Sea-Stabilizing Divine Sword now!" Han Wuyou declared proudly.

"I spent a fortune enlisting a senior to handle this matter. Don't let me down during the expedition to Cloud Water Heavenly Palace!" Han Wuyou’s tone was full of meaning.

Bai Li Chen, thrilled, immediately began cultivating again.

His foundation from the 'Taishang Primordial Sutra' was still intact, and within half a day, he had returned to his pre-scattering state.

After sensing his surroundings, he found that the other cultivator who practiced the same technique had indeed disappeared!

"Daoist Han, you truly have impressive methods!" Si Kongyi was overjoyed and grew even more convinced of Han Wuyou's abilities.

Han Wuyou stroked his goatee with satisfaction and said, "In today's cultivation world, brute strength alone won't get you far. You need connections and backing!"

Si Kongyi nodded repeatedly in agreement.

The three of them carefully discussed the plan, and as the day of the Cloud Water Heavenly Palace's opening drew closer, their preparations were complete.

Together, they set off for the center of the Congyun Sea.

By then, many cultivators had already gathered outside the Cloud Water Heavenly Palace, eager to witness the event.

Chapter 485: Li Fan, the Heavenly Doctor

“With Fellow Daoist Bai Li here, those cultivators are bound to have come all this way for nothing,” Han Wuyou swept his gaze around and said with a smile.

“You can’t say that for sure. Apart from the Cloud Water Talisman, there must be other opportunities within the Cloud Water Heavenly Palace,” Sikong Yi remained calm, staring straight at the increasingly spectacular phenomenon in the sky.

“No matter how great the opportunity, it can’t compare to the Cloud Water Atlas,” Han Wuyou shook his head.

Sikong Yi was a bit surprised, “Why do you say that?”

“Heh, people are only focused on the 100,000 contribution points, blinded by it. They’ve overlooked the true opportunity,” Han Wuyou smiled faintly.

“What’s the most important thing in cultivation? Background! Connections!” He repeated.

“In my view, the true value of the Cloud Water Atlas lies in the chance to establish a connection with the senior who issued the mission.”

“To be able to offer a reward of 100,000 contribution points so casually, this person must be at least at the Soul Transformation stage. Even just having a conversation with him would be hugely different for an ordinary cultivator,” Han Wuyou explained softly.

“If one could obtain a stable way to contact him, it could completely change their fate.”

Sikong Yi, hearing this, seemed lost in thought.

After a while, he nodded slowly.

While the three of them were chatting, a blue light swept across the Congyun Sea, signaling the official opening of the Cloud Water Heavenly Palace.

Sikong Yi, Bai Li Chen, and Han Wuyou followed the crowd of cultivators and flew inside.

After overcoming several obstacles, they passed the test set by the Qin Hall without much trouble.

However, during their journey deeper inside, for some unknown reason, the three of them caught the attention of another group of cultivators.

In the ensuing chaos, they ended up fighting.

The opponents were numerous and overall stronger.

In the end, Han Wuyou fell under their siege, dying with his eyes wide open in disbelief.

Sikong Yi, relying on the powerful life-saving abilities of the “Stealing the Sky and Changing the Sun Technique,” managed to survive by a stroke of luck.

Barely escaping, he headed towards the location of the Taiyi Hall, feeling utterly cold inside.

“Such is the unpredictability of life. Someone like Fellow Daoist Han, with such promising prospects, died so inexplicably here.”

Recalling Han Wuyou’s confident demeanor from not long ago, Sikong Yi felt a sense of loss.

Though they hadn’t known each other long, Sikong Yi had already regarded him as a close friend.

Alas, the heavens are jealous of outstanding talents!

Sikong Yi subconsciously touched a storage ring in his hand.

It was something he had snatched from Han Wuyou’s body when he saw him beheaded.

Han Wuyou was indeed wealthy, as the ring was filled with various formation diagrams and magical artifacts.

There were also about 10,000 spirit stones worth of contribution points, and most importantly, dozens of communication talismans.

“Connections, background…”

Sikong Yi kept repeating these words in his mind as the sadness in his eyes gradually faded.

“Fellow Daoist Han, rest assured. I will live well on your behalf!”

With Han Wuyou’s death as a sacrifice, the subsequent events unfolded much more smoothly.

After passing the Insect Daoist’s test and enduring the excruciating pain of being pierced by ten thousand swords, Sikong Yi reached the square in front of the Taiyi Hall.

At that moment, there was only silence around him; he was the only one present.

Suppressing his excitement, Sikong Yi controlled his doppelganger and activated the “Sea-Stabilizing Divine Sword.”

“Direct disciple of the 165th generation of the Cloud Water Heavenly Palace, Bai Li Chen, requests an audience with Patriarch Taiyi!”

He shouted loudly.

The ground trembled, and he finally succeeded in tricking the half-conscious tortoise-snake monster into giving him the Cloud Water Atlas.

After requesting to be teleported out of the Cloud Water Heavenly Palace, Sikong Yi maintained a composed expression and headed straight for the Ten Thousand Immortals Island.

With a series of narrow escapes, he successfully returned to the Tianxuan Mirror.

The Clone, Bai Li Chen, chose to submit the mission.

“Unable to verify the authenticity of the ‘Cloud Water Atlas,’ please wait.”

The Tianxuan Mirror’s response made Sikong Yi’s heart skip a beat.

“Even the Tianxuan Mirror can’t verify it? Besides the miniature landscape, what else is the Cloud Water Atlas used for?” Sikong Yi didn’t have time to ponder further, as the next message from the Tianxuan Mirror shook him to his core.

“The task issuer… requests to visit your space. Do you accept?”

“It’s here! It’s happening!” Sikong Yi was stunned for a moment, then his heart started pounding violently.

His blood boiled, and Han Wuyou’s words resurfaced in his mind.

“The real opportunity is in connections!”

His mind raced with countless thoughts.

Taking a deep breath to calm himself, Sikong Yi said in a low voice, “I accept.”

Moments later, an elderly man with graying hair and a kind face appeared before him.

Sikong Yi bent over respectfully, nervously handing over the seven-colored model with trembling hands.

The elder took the Cloud Water Atlas, observing it closely, and sighed deeply.

His cloudy eyes kept shifting, as if recalling something.

“What is the current state of the Cloud Water Heavenly Palace?” he asked.

Sikong Yi swallowed, stammering as he answered.

The elder, seemingly unbothered by Sikong Yi’s nervousness, occasionally nodded as he listened to the description.

After Sikong Yi finished speaking, the space within the Tianxuan Mirror fell into a long silence once more.

Looking at the still, contemplative elder before him, Han Wuyou’s words echoed again in Sikong Yi’s mind.

“In today’s cultivation world, mere bravery and combat prowess are useless. You need background, you need connections!”

His heart beat faster and faster until he couldn’t hold back any longer.

Summoning his courage, he asked, “Senior, is there anything else I can do to serve you?”

The Heavenly Doctor looked up, glancing at Sikong Yi.

Sikong Yi felt as if his heart was suddenly gripped tightly, halting its beat.

His entire body seemed to freeze, his mind ceasing to function.

He didn’t know how long it took before he heard a soft laugh from the other party: “Very well, I do have one more task for you.”

“Go to the Cloud Water Heavenly Palace again and place this item there.”

As he spoke, the elder took out a small white jade statue and handed it to Sikong Yi.

Hearing this, Sikong Yi was ecstatic inside.

But he dared not show any excitement on his face, carefully taking the statue.

Upon closer inspection, the white jade statue didn’t seem to have anything special, except that it looked exactly like the elder before him.

“I will not fail your trust, Senior!” Sikong Yi took the statue and said solemnly.

“As for the reward…” The elder stared at Sikong Yi for a while before speaking slowly, “Another 100,000 contribution points will do!”

With that, Sikong Yi received a notification of 200,000 contribution points being credited to his account.

Sikong Yi’s mind went blank.

It was only long after the elder’s figure had disappeared from the Tianxuan Mirror that he regained his thoughts.

“Just a simple errand, and another 100,000 contribution points!”

“This senior is probably far beyond the Soul Transformation stage!”

“Opportunity, true opportunity!”

“If I relied solely on myself, who knows how long it would take to accumulate 100,000 contribution points! Now, a few words from an influential figure, and they’re mine for the taking.”

“Fellow Daoist Han didn’t deceive me!”

With his heart surging, Sikong Yi seemed to glimpse a bright future ahead and couldn’t help but let out a long, loud laugh.

After calming down, he didn’t dare neglect the old man’s instructions. He immediately headed back to the Cloud Water Heavenly Palace.

The statue in his storage ring emitted a burst of white light, flying straight into the sky.

It dissolved and disappeared.

With the task completed, Sikong Yi exhaled a long breath of relief and quietly left, seeing no one around.

Shortly after, outside the Cloud Water Heavenly Palace, a hidden figure slowly appeared.

It was Li Fan.

“Heavenly Doctor…”

“Hmph!”

Watching Sikong Yi’s departing figure, he sneered inwardly.

Chapter 486: Setting the Reincarnation Stage

Previously, the "Han Wuyou" who visited Sikong Yi was, of course, a clone of Li Fan.

After considerable effort—pretending to demand 40% of the contribution, helping resolve the cultivation technique issue for the fellow cultivator, and strategizing together to explore the Yunshui Celestial Palace—the ultimate goal was to implant a suggestion in his mind.

This suggestion was to prompt him, after completing the first task of the Heavenly Doctor, to voluntarily trigger the mission to transport the white jade statue.

Judging by Sikong Yi's recent actions of shuttling back and forth to the Cloud Water Heavenly Palace, it appears that Li Fan's scheme has succeeded.

In this life, he intends to push for a battle between Old Fisherman, Sage, and the Heavenly Doctor.

But all his plans have a major premise: someone needs to deliver the statue of the Heavenly Doctor into the Cloud Water Heavenly Palace.

Only then would the Sage sense the presence of the Heavenly Doctor within the palace and drive his ox cart across the sea.

Such a dangerous mission was certainly not something Li Fan would undertake personally.

The "Four Techniques of Observation, Listening, Inquiry, and Pulse-taking" of the Heavenly Doctor were truly terrifying.

Even a prepared clone might not be able to deceive the Heavenly Doctor.

The previous handover of the [Cloud Water Atlas] and gaining 100,000 contribution points made Sikong Yi the ideal candidate for the task.

However, Li Fan wasn't certain if Sikong Yi had received the same request from the Heavenly Doctor to help transport the statue.

To ensure the plan proceeded as intended, the visit of "Han Wuyou" took place.

Even if Sikong Yi or the Heavenly Doctor suspected this mysterious Han Wuyou, Han Wuyou was already dead.

He died within the eerie Cloud Water Heavenly Palace.

Li Fan believed that even for the Heavenly Doctor, tracking this matter might not be straightforward.

Besides, in the eyes of the Heavenly Doctor, Sikong Yi would at most be a greedy cultivator, blinded by profit and eager to latch onto a powerful figure.

He might not even be inclined to investigate further.

Overall, Li Fan's plan was flawless, leaving no trace and eliminating the possibility of being discovered.

It was a perfect scheme.

This was the result of multiple reincarnations, experiencing various possibilities, and mastering a wealth of information.

Others could not replicate it.

Even a strong figure like the Heavenly Doctor had unknowingly fallen into the invisible web Li Fan had woven.

Although the impact was minor, the very act of manipulating a expert even stronger than Dao Integration to act according to one's own expectations was significant in itself.

The gloom in Li Fan's heart was completely dispelled, and the long-standing shadow that had been weighing on him finally began to dissipate.

"No matter how powerful you are, you're still under my control!"

Despite his excitement, Li Fan didn't let this small victory go to his head.

He deeply understood that this minor success was built on the premise of collecting enough possibilities.

Moving forward, his advantage had been exhausted.

What he faced next were unknown variables, requiring him to tread cautiously and carefully.

"It’s better to abandon than to force."

"The Heavenly Doctor is already in place. The next step is to inform Old Fisherman of the Heavenly Fiend Sword being trapped in the Cloud Water Heavenly Palace during the 16th year, when the Sage reappears in the world."

"This, too, needs an agent."

In an instant, Li Fan had thought of a suitable candidate.

"Han Yi..."

Sensing the locking force of the Formless Killing Intent, it had been more than a year since Han Yi had returned to the Xuanhuang Realm from the Sea Swirl.

It seems his adventures have yielded substantial gains this time.

"No worries, he won't escape my grasp."

Li Fan gazed for a moment at the towering Cloud Water Heavenly Palace in the sky, then collected his thoughts and quietly returned.

...

Shenhua Island.

Ye Feipeng had been feeling quite pleased recently.

The Immortal Master, who had brought them to this island and then ignored them for a long time, suddenly reappeared.

Moreover, he even checked the cultivation progress of the children on the island.

Those who cultivated diligently and made unexpected progress were rewarded with spirit stones and elixirs.

Those who were lazy or stagnant in their cultivation were punished by having to fight the "Evil Puppet" for three days and three nights.

Although it was called a fight, it was actually a one-sided beating.

The "Evil Puppet" was what the children privately called the puppet that looked dull and foolish.

Initially, they thought the puppet would be easy to handle.

After cultivating for a while, some children became eager to challenge it.

The first one to step forward was Sun Erlang, who was naturally talented and proficient in martial arts.

Within half a year, he had advanced from an ordinary person to the mid-stage of Qi Condensation.

Coupled with his martial prowess, he could exert double his combat power.

In their usual sparring sessions, almost no one on the island could last a single round against him.

Gradually, his confidence swelled, and in front of everyone, he was the first to challenge the Tianyang Puppet.

The result was predictable.

Tianyang, following Li Fan’s instructions, beat him senseless without causing fatal injuries or harming his cultivation foundation.

While being extremely precise in his attacks, he made Sun Erlang truly understand what it meant to be deceived and outmatched.

It seemed that Tianyang was just slightly stronger than Sun Erlang, and that with a little more effort, he could be defeated.

Tianyang continuously lured Sun Erlang into attacking again and again.

But every time, at the critical moment, Sun Erlang failed.

With a strong desire to win, Sun Erlang fought until he was exhausted and passed out before the fight ended.

The next day, after waking up, Sun Erlang had an epiphany.

He went into seclusion for seven days and nights, and actually broke through to the late stage of Qi Condensation.

Overjoyed, he decided to regain his dignity and challenged Tianyang again.

The result...

He still lost by just a little!

The children on the island all noticed something was off.

This seemingly honest and simple puppet was actually toying with them!

Angry, Sun Erlang fainted again from the beating.

In the following days, no matter what level of cultivation the children displayed in their fights against Tianyang, the puppet only used slightly superior strength.

Some children, unable to accept it, called Tianyang a big villain.

Others gradually realized that Tianyang was the perfect sparring partner.

They began seeking him out for continuous battles.

Ye Feipeng was naturally one of them.

In truth, fighting wasn’t his preference, but as the only one on the island practicing "Three Methods Simultaneously," he couldn’t allow himself to be weaker than others.

Unfortunately, his talent wasn’t top-notch. Initially, he could rely on his dual cultivation of physical and spiritual powers to gain an advantage.

But as others' realms gradually increased, Ye Feipeng’s performance in fights against Tianyang also lagged behind.

Just as he was becoming anxious, the Immortal Master appeared.

While being strict with rewards and punishments, he gave Ye Feipeng special attention.

After examining his cultivation progress and conducting a comprehensive check on his body, the Immortal Master concluded that the "Sea-Stabilizing Sword" he was practicing might not be suitable.

So, he removed his cultivation and taught him a new technique called the "Sea Dragon Wandering Technique."

Chapter 487: All Paths Originate from the Same Source

Cultivating the "Sea Dragon Wandering Technique" proved to be much smoother for Ye Feipeng than practicing the "Sea-Stabilizing Divine Sword."

On the second day of switching cultivation techniques, he successfully broke through to the mid-stage of Qi Condensation.

Moreover, the elixir provided by the Immortal Master helped him unlock a sliver of hidden power within his body.

After strengthening his physical body, even Sun Erlang, who was at the late stage of Qi Condensation, was no match for Ye Feipeng in actual combat.

Having solidified his position as the "leader of the children" on the island, Ye Feipeng finally felt somewhat relieved.

At the same time, he understood a crucial lesson: to cultivate faster, aside from one's own talent and hard work, it was even more important to please the Immortal Master.

From the Immortal Master’s casual words, Ye Feipeng learned that the Immortal Master seemed to place great importance on the refining progress of the [Beast God Bead].

Thus, in addition to his cultivation, Ye Feipeng never forgot to keep the Beast God Bead with him at all times, carefully comprehending its mysteries.

One day, after falling into a deep sleep while holding the Beast God Bead, he seemed to have a dream.

In the dream, he saw a terrifying nine-headed bird suspended above the sky.

Its colossal body nearly filled the entire sky.

Each of its nine heads was devouring something.

With Ye Feipeng’s current knowledge, he recognized struggling and twisted dragon limbs, an entire intact mountain range, and branches of a giant, ash-gray tree...

All around, there were despairing and painful wails, and the world was bathed in blood.

Ye Feipeng’s young mind was deeply shocked by this doomsday-like scene.

He stood there dumbfounded, unable to move.

At that moment, one of the nine-headed bird's heads seemed to notice his presence.

Its eyes slightly moved, casting a gaze upon him as if looking at food.

Terrified by being stared at by this fierce beast, fear instantly overwhelmed Ye Feipeng’s mind.

Under the shadow of the nine-headed bird, it seemed that in the next moment, he would be swallowed whole.

Just then, a loud and distant cry echoed in his ears.

It seemed to come from the deep sea, yet also from the sky.

The cry was full of defiance and anger.

With his eyes turning blood-red, Ye Feipeng’s previously frozen body immediately returned to normal.

Attracted by this inexplicable cry, the nine heads in the sky simultaneously turned towards the source.

Ye Feipeng woke up from his nightmare.

Panting heavily, he wiped the cold sweat off his forehead and recalled the scenes he had seen in his dream.

“That nine-headed bird must be the mythical beast sealed within the Beast God Bead.”

“But what was that cry I heard afterwards?”

Ye Feipeng’s little face was filled with confusion.

However, he knew very well that anything that could catch the attention of the nine-headed bird was definitely not ordinary.

Without mentioning it to anyone else, Ye Feipeng firmly kept this matter in his heart.

In the following days, Ye Feipeng found that his cultivation of the "Creation Furnace Technique" became much more effortless.

The hidden power within his body that used to require cautious effort to tap into was now easily accessible.

He could even ignore some side effects, like dizziness or surging blood, that he previously had to be wary of.

His physical strength was increasing at a frightening pace that even he found alarming, filling his heart with both secret joy and a touch of fear of the unknown.

Therefore, in sparring with his companions, he never used his full strength.

Like the Tianyang Puppet, he only defeated his opponents just enough each time.

And so, more time passed.

One day, the Immortal Master visited the island again.

As usual, he inspected everyone’s cultivation progress. After regarding Xiao Heng, who had been particularly lazy, as an example and scolding him severely,

The Immortal Master brought Ye Feipeng to a secret chamber alone for a closer look.

During the long silence, Ye Feipeng felt somewhat nervous.

In the end, he couldn’t hold back and told the Immortal Master about the dream he had and the changes in his body recently.

After a moment of contemplation, the Immortal Master decided to perform a comprehensive examination on him.

Thus, Ye Feipeng fell into a deep sleep.

When he woke up, he felt slightly weakened.

The Immortal Master, with great concern, handed him another elixir.

After swallowing it, Ye Feipeng immediately felt much more energetic.

“You were too impatient, and in your haste, you were contaminated by the violent energy of the nine-headed bird,” the Immortal Master said in his cold voice.

Ye Feipeng was startled, but hearing the Immortal Master’s next words, he felt a bit relieved.

“Rest assured, I have already expelled it from your body.”

“Thank you, Immortal Master,” Ye Feipeng said gratefully.

The Immortal Master waved his hand. “Although you were reckless, you’ve benefited from this misfortune and even awakened a trace of your ancestral bloodline.”

“Ancestral bloodline?” Ye Feipeng was both surprised and delighted.

“Indeed. Have you ever heard of the ancient mythical beast, Kunpeng?” As he spoke, the Immortal Master pointed forward.

A massive beast, sometimes appearing as a bird, other times as a fish, appeared in the air.

After explaining the power of this Kunpeng beast to Ye Feipeng, the Immortal Master sighed with emotion, “I didn’t expect you to have such a power of an ancient fierce beast in your bloodline.”

“If you can harness this power, your cultivation speed will surpass even those so-called prodigies.”

Seeing the look on Ye Feipeng’s face, the Immortal Master added, “However, everything has its pros and cons. Advancing too quickly could also impact your state of mind. If you can’t control it, it might bring you disaster instead of fortune.”

Ye Feipeng quickly promised, “Immortal Master, rest assured, I will certainly remember your teachings. I will not become arrogant or impatient, and I will cultivate diligently, step by step.”

The Immortal Master nodded slowly, seemingly satisfied with his response.

After receiving a storage ring filled with spirit stones and magical artifacts as a reward, Ye Feipeng left, overjoyed.

Watching Ye Feipeng’s jubilant figure as he left, Li Fan revealed a smile that was neither genuine nor fake.

“I didn’t expect this kid’s awakening of the Kunpeng bloodline in this lifetime to be even faster than I anticipated.”

“The Nine-Headed Divine Bird, huh…”

Li Fan stretched out his right hand.

A wisp of blood-red murderous aura coiled around his fingertips, lingering for a long time.

If you listened carefully, faint cries and wails could be heard coming from it.

Li Fan absorbed the red aura and closed his eyes to carefully comprehend it.

After a while, he suddenly opened his eyes.

In that instant, a strange red light flashed in his pupils.

Li Fan looked at the stone stool in the chamber.

In just a moment, the originally hard stone surface turned pitch-black under Li Fan's gaze.

“It seems that the Nine-Headed Bird's beast soul bead released this unique murderous aura due to the influence of the Kunpeng bloodline.”

“It appears to be the power of the Nine-Headed Bird’s innate divine ability. Unfortunately, the murderous aura is too weak to grasp more than this.”

The strange red light in his eyes faded, and Li Fan felt a tinge of regret.

“Although the beast power cannot be used because of Senior Brother Zhang’s Grand Aspiration Dharma Body,”

“There are still things to learn from it. The divine abilities of mythical beasts may be harnessed by cultivators.”

“All paths originate from the same source, different routes lead to

the same destination.”

“Like Han Yi’s technique of controlling fate, which seems to be derived from the Heavenly Fate Mystic Bird.”

Li Fan pondered silently.

Chapter 488: Learning from Kunpeng

Li Fan has undergone a hundred reincarnations, mastering extraordinary divine abilities beyond the imagination of ordinary cultivators.

The Chaos Sutra, Silent Annihilation Sword, Sky-Flipping Palm, Cloud Cluster Sword...

Each one of these techniques has the power to slay enemies far above his own level.

Ordinary demonic beasts' divine abilities did not interest Li Fan, but this nine-headed bird was clearly an exception.

Li Fan had a hunch that the grade of this fierce nine-headed bird might even surpass that of Kunpeng.

"Let’s see what surprises Ye Feipeng can bring me."

After testing the malevolent aura of the nine-headed bird, he took out a mass of Kunpeng blood essence from his storage ring.

Every so often, he would extract a wisp from Ye Feipeng’s body to use for enlightenment.

By now, Li Fan’s research into Kunpeng’s power had achieved initial success.

When he operated the 'Creation Furnace Technique', he still appeared human, but his stomach quietly transformed into the structure of a Kunpeng beast.

Sensing the miraculous use of his newly formed Kunpeng stomach for a moment, Li Fan smiled and took out several high-grade spirit stones worth a hundred contribution points each and swallowed them.

Almost instantly, the highly concentrated spiritual energy in the spirit stones was absorbed and consumed by Li Fan.

Compared to the methods of ordinary cultivators, the efficiency was several times higher.

Although not as extreme as the 'Heaven-Devouring and Earth-Eating Technique', it was still extremely astonishing.

"No wonder Ye Feipeng’s cultivation speed accelerated in the previous life. With such a unique ability, it’s truly remarkable."

As the Mountain Sitting Technique circulated, and all the spiritual energy was converted into his own spiritual power, Li Fan took out a pile of supreme-grade spirit stones to test the current limit of his [Kun Devour] divine ability.

One stone was worth a thousand contribution points, and this pile alone amounted to fifty or sixty thousand.

Without hesitation, Li Fan devoured them all. The spirit stones vanished into his belly like a river flowing into the sea.

"Boom!"

A pure stream of spiritual energy erupted from within his stomach.

Li Fan’s expression changed slightly as he desperately tried to circulate his technique to consume it.

But the spiritual energy flow was like a torrential flood, surging endlessly.

Li Fan’s attempts to consume it were like trying to quench a blazing cartload of firewood with a cup of water.

Fortunately, practicing the Creation Furnace Technique had strengthened Li Fan’s physique to some extent, so his meridians weren't damaged by the overwhelming spiritual energy.

However, letting it run rampant inside his body wasn’t a viable solution either.

To avoid drawing attention, Li Fan's clone approached Tianyang and converted the nearly uncontrollable spiritual energy into blue Cloud Cluster Swords, slashing towards the puppet’s body.

After several slashes, the rampaging spiritual energy was finally exhausted and gradually subsided.

However, the seemingly powerful sword light didn’t leave even the slightest trace on Tianyang’s body.

Tianyang tilted his head, looking somewhat puzzled at his "senior brother," thinking Li Fan wanted to spar with him. He raised his fist.

"Hehe, junior brother, don’t misunderstand. I just made a mistake during my cultivation," Li Fan said with a smile, stopping Tianyang.

Tianyang then showed a worried expression.

After comforting Tianyang for a while, Li Fan returned to the secret chamber.

"Although I’ve simulated the Kunpeng stomach, achieving such astonishing devouring speed, a human body cannot be compared to ancient demonic beasts."

"I still can’t convert the absorbed energy into a powerful resource for myself in time."

"However, if I corroborate it with the Heaven-Devouring and Earth-Eating Technique..."

Li Fan narrowed his eyes and came up with an idea.

Improving techniques isn't something that can be done overnight. After splitting a part of his consciousness with the the Hua Dao Divine Technique of Transformation to focus on this matter, Li Fan tried the [Peng Flight] divine ability again.

This time, there were no abnormal bone wings sprouting from his back. Instead, he constantly flickered and maneuvered within the small space of the secret chamber.

His speed increased, almost becoming a blur in the air, beyond what the naked eye could perceive.

After a while, Li Fan finally stopped the experiment, satisfied.

"Good. The method of [Peng Flight], combined with the incomplete Purple Heaven Divine Thunder Escape, has increased my escape speed by more than double."

"In the future, as my research into Kunpeng blood essence deepens, it will become even faster."

Next, Li Fan didn’t try the divine ability of [Jing Peng Transformation].

This kind of divine ability, which completely transforms into the form of a demonic beast, was something Li Fan still chose to avoid.

Although its power was formidable, if it accidentally triggered Senior Brother Zhang’s Grand Aspirations dharma Incarnation, it would be a disaster.

In fact, among the many divine abilities displayed by Ye Feipeng in his previous life, the one Li Fan was most concerned with was the so-called [Bloodline Crossing].

Judging from Ye Feipeng’s later behavior, this [Bloodline Crossing] could not only change a person’s physique, slowly transforming them into a pure demonic beast but also unconsciously alter their mind.

Ye Feipeng’s transformation from “demonic beast” to “holy beast” clearly illustrated this point.

It’s not hard to imagine that if Ye Feipeng, influenced by Kunpeng essence blood, encountered the Kunpeng itself, he would definitely exhibit “loyalty” stemming from the depths of his bloodline.

What Li Fan currently lacked was this method of controlling people.

Now, he was merely using foreknowledge and coercion to force or entice people to his side.

Although effective, there were bound to be failures occasionally. It wasn’t as reliable and reassuring as this kind of secret technique.

"[Bloodline Crossing] might require Ye Feipeng’s Kunpeng bloodline to become even purer before I can comprehend it."

"Hmm, it’s time to purchase more pills to replenish blood and energy."

After handing over the remaining pills and the task of regular blood extractions to Tianyang, Li Fan leisurely returned to Ten Thousand Immortal Island.

Instead of going back to the Tianxuan Mirror, he headed straight to the Qianli Hall.

Nearly two years had passed, and there was still no response from Jiao Xiuyuan regarding the task he had assigned him to unearth the Small King of Medicine Cauldron.

Li Fan found it strange and decided to visit personally.

Jiao Xiuyuan was slightly taken aback upon seeing Li Fan suddenly appear.

His eyes flickered, and his expression showed a bit of awkwardness.

"Fellow Daoist Jiao, have you forgotten something?" Li Fan asked.

Jiao Xiuyuan chuckled and hurriedly pulled out a chair from somewhere, inviting Li Fan to sit down.

"What’s going on?" Seeing Jiao Xiuyuan’s demeanor, Li Fan already had an idea.

Not in a hurry, he just stared at Jiao Xiuyuan for a long time before speaking again.

Jiao Xiuyuan, feeling uncomfortable under Li Fan’s gaze, closed the store door and whispered, “It’s not that I deliberately stalled you, but I’m in a difficult situation!”

"With your abilities, Fellow Daoist Jiao, is there anything in the Medicine King Sect’s ruins that can trouble you?" Li Fan was skeptical.

"After thousands of years, even if there were any restrictions, they would have failed by now." Jiao Xiuyuan shook his head and said, "The problem is, someone else got there first!"

"Oh? What do you mean?" Li Fan's expression turned serious.

Yet another unforeseen variable had appeared.

"Just as I was about to pinpoint the location of the Small Medicine King Cauldron, people from the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s Protectorate Institute suddenly showed up."

Chapter 489: Sudden Raid on Ten Thousand Immortal Island

“They sealed off the ruins, drove out the cultivators inside, and even inspected their storage rings.”

“It’s as if there’s some incredible treasure hidden in there.”

Jiao Xiuyuan’s eyes gleamed as he whispered.

“Although I’m not afraid of them, harmony brings wealth, so I didn’t start any conflict and obediently left.”

Upon hearing this, Li Fan rubbed his chin thoughtfully.

“The Protectorate institute...”

As an elite armed organization that only operates in a few states within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's core territory, it’s truly unusual for them to seal off and excavate the ruins of the Medicine King Sect.

Could it be that the phrase I mentioned back then, ‘The Tianxuan Lock union of Xuanhuang Realm,’ has caused the cultivators of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance to compete in deducing the future, thereby foreseeing the imminent return of the True Cauldron of Medicine King to the Xuanhuang Realm?

“What do you think, Fellow Daoist Jiao? Does this have anything to do with my earlier prediction and the possible opportunity related to the Small Medicine King Cauldron?” After pondering for a moment, Li Fan looked at Jiao Xiuyuan and asked.

To Li Fan's surprise, Jiao Xiuyuan shook his head in denial.

“After returning, I made some inquiries. It’s not just the ruins of the Medicine King Sect. The same goes for the ruins of the Heavenly Sword Sect, the Taishang Sect, and other ancient sects within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s territory. All of them have been sealed off by the Protectorate institute cultivators.”

“They’re not allowing anyone to approach, but they themselves are vigorously searching for something inside.”

Jiao Xiuyuan’s tone was filled with some resentment.

“I lost several puppets sneaking in, and discovered that they weren’t so much searching for objects as they were looking for someone!”

“Looking for someone?” Li Fan was stunned. “How can you tell?”

“All the cultivators inside the ruins are holding [Spirit-Sensing Beads]. This type of artifact is extremely sensitive to the breath of life. Even if a cultivator is in deep slumber with only a sliver of life remaining, it can still detect them.” Saying this, Jiao Xiuyuan couldn’t help but glance at Li Fan.

Li Fan’s expression grew thoughtful: “So, you’re saying they might be searching for an ancient cultivator who, like me, fell into deep slumber thousands of years ago?”

“There’s a ninety percent chance,” Jiao Xiuyuan asserted.

“That’s quite odd…” Li Fan narrowed his eyes slightly.

The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance wouldn’t do something meaningless.

This large-scale operation clearly has a specific purpose.

“So, they’re certain that there’s such a dormant ancient cultivator, but they’re unsure of their exact location.”

“They’ve determined only that the person is within the ruins of various ancient sects, so they’re using this needle-in-a-haystack method to search.”

“This person must be extremely important to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, and…”

“The reason they’re looking for him is definitely related to my phrase, ‘The Tianxuan Lock.’”

Li Fan thought for a while but couldn’t figure out anything.

“Fellow Daoist Jiao, you really didn’t unearth a Small Medicine King Cauldron?” He glanced at Jiao Xiuyuan and abruptly asked.

Jiao Xiuyuan hesitated for a moment and then chuckled awkwardly: “It seems I can’t fool your discerning eyes, Fellow Daoist. It’s true that I didn’t come away empty-handed.”

“Unfortunately, my luck wasn’t great. Just as I unearthed one, the cultivators of the Protectorate institute showed up.”

“And due to this incident, all the items recently excavated from sect ruins have skyrocketed in price.”

“Quite a few cultivators have come to inquire about that Small Medicine King Cauldron, so…”

Jiao Xiuyuan looked at Li Fan, his eyes practically spelling out “higher price.”

However, Li Fan just waved his hand: “Since this item is so sought-after, let’s just forget about it. You, Fellow Daoist, can decide when to sell it!”

Without waiting for Li Fan to haggle, he directly gave up.

Jiao Xiuyuan was completely stunned by this response.

“Um, Fellow Daoist Li, aren’t you going to reconsider...”

“A gentleman helps others achieve their goals without coveting their treasures! It’s just a minor opportunity, how could I possibly be lacking?” Li Fan dismissively refused, clearly uninterested.

Seeing Jiao Xiuyuan’s dumbfounded expression, Li Fan added, “Instead, I’m much more interested in what you said about the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance searching for an ancient cultivator.”

“Maybe, this person is an old acquaintance of mine.”

“I know your information network is extensive, so please investigate this matter for me!” Li Fan’s gaze turned sharp as he looked at Jiao Xiuyuan.

“As for the small Medicine King Cauldron, forget about it. You won’t keep any secrets from me about this, will you?”

Li Fan’s gaze swept over the three characters “Qianli Hall” hanging outside the room as he spoke in an eerie tone.

“Rest assured, rest assured! I, Jiao Xiuyuan, would never ruin my own reputation!” Jiao Xiuyuan hurriedly promised, knowing he was in the wrong.

“Well then…”

Just as Li Fan was about to nod and continue speaking, a commotion suddenly erupted outside.

The two exchanged a glance, sensing that something unusual was happening, and tacitly stopped their conversation to step outside.

On Ten Thousand Immortal Island, the towering statue of the Immortal Venerable of Dao Transmission was emitting beams of light that shot straight into the sky.

The island’s protective formation had been activated at some point.

Beyond the protective barrier, a massive purple door stood tall.
