Numerous cultivators were constantly flying out of the door.

“The Five Elders Association?”

Li Fan and Jiao Xiuyuan exclaimed in surprise simultaneously.

“Are they insane? Are they declaring an all-out war against the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance?” Jiao Xiuyuan’s voice was full of shock.

It was clear that this surprise attack by the Five Elders Association had been extremely secretive, catching even Jiao Xiuyuan, whose ears and eyes were spread throughout the entire cultivation world, off guard.

What has happened?

Why has the Five Elders Association suddenly initiated a war?

And the target isn’t the Grand Cave-Heaven of the Five Elements, but instead, this Ten Thousand Immortal Island?

Li Fan’s thoughts raced.

“Fellow Daoist Jiao, have other cities and states been attacked by the Five Elders Association as well?” After a moment, Li Fan asked in a deep voice.

“No. Only Ten Thousand Immortal Island in the Congyun Sea is the target of the Five Elders Association’s strike this time.” After pausing for a moment, Jiao Xiuyuan replied, still filled with confusion.

Li Fan frowned slightly, feeling somewhat puzzled as well.

The two fell silent, simply raising their heads to watch the battle in the sky.

The two True Monarch of the Soul Transformation stage on the island had been deployed to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s headquarters, leaving the island’s defense forces clearly insufficient.

They didn’t dare engage in a direct confrontation, relying only on the formation to hold on bitterly, while hoping for reinforcements to arrive as soon as possible.

But it was clear that the Five Elders Association had come well-prepared. Not only had they rendered the teleportation formation useless, but even communication seemed to be blocked, making it impossible to send messages.

Ten Thousand Immortal Island was gradually losing ground, and the faces of the many cultivators watching the battle on the island turned pale.

Having lived in peace for so long, they had never seen such a scene.

As time slowly passed, to everyone’s surprise, when the Five Elders Association finally gained an absolute advantage and broke the protective barrier, they did not choose to attack the island directly.

Instead, they began setting up a formation in the sky above Ten Thousand Immortal Island.

Threads of light descended from the central formation above and shot towards the edges of the island.

“The Heaven and Earth Displacement Formation?”

Li Fan and Jiao Xiuyuan exclaimed in unison once more.

“Is the Five Elders Association planning to move the entire Ten Thousand Immortal Island away?”

The doubt in their eyes grew stronger.

The formation was completed in no time, and the threads emitted a faint white light.

The ground of Ten Thousand Immortal Island began to shake violently.

Chapter 490: Surprisingly Obtaining the Method to Achieve Both Goals

The ground trembled more and more violently, to the point where it was nearly impossible to stand.

The vast Ten Thousand Immortal Island began to rise from the ground, slowly ascending towards the sky.

Some cultivators attempted to make a desperate escape, trying to break through the encirclement.

But they all met the same fate.

Anyone who left the Ten Thousand Immortal Island was immediately pierced and killed by beams of light descending from the sky.

Cries of alarm and agony from cultivators could be heard continuously.

The surrounding space seemed to be completely sealed off, and even the falling images of cultivators from the sky appeared strangely distorted, layered upon one another and squeezed into one place.

The fierce attacks from the Five Elders Association temporarily calmed down the cultivators who were panicking like headless flies.

They realized that as long as they stayed on the Ten Thousand Immortal Island, the Five Elders Association seemed to have no immediate intention to attack.

So, they could only tremble in fear, looking up at the purple gate that was getting closer and closer to them.

“Could it be that the Five Elders Association made such a grand display just to come after me?” Li Fan, witnessing the scene, couldn't help but recall the earlier incident when several Nascent Soul cultivators came to capture him. This thought surfaced in his mind.

“That place is not easy to deal with. If I get captured and taken to the ‘Country of Truth,’ where lying is impossible, wouldn’t my secrets about traveling through time and the truth about my Identity be completely exposed?”

Li Fan had a clear understanding of his current strength; he knew he was not yet capable of resisting the principles of a Heavenly Sovereign.

“Should I use the truth…” A hint of hesitation flashed in Li Fan's heart.

After pondering for a moment, Li Fan decided to wait and see for the time being.

After all, the situation had not yet deteriorated to the point where his life was in danger.

The originally flat horizon in the distance had now disappeared from view.

The entire Ten Thousand Immortal Island was floating in mid-air, and the faces of the cultivators from the Five Elders Association above were clearly visible.

At that moment, a commotion suddenly broke out on the island.

Unexpectedly, a large number of cultivators appeared out of nowhere.

There were so many of them that they seemed to overflow the Ten Thousand Immortal Island, making the island itself almost unable to accommodate them all.

A clamor arose from among them.

“What’s going on? Where is this place?”

“I remember I was meditating in the Tianxuan Mirror! How did I suddenly end up here?”

“Look! The Tianxuan Mirror has turned into a stone!”

Hearing their exclamations, Jiao Xiuyuan muttered under his breath, “This is bad. Even the Tianxuan Mirror has been stripped of its power. It seems we can't count on these reinforcements anymore.”

Only then did Li Fan realize that these people were actually cultivators who had been meditating in the space within the Tianxuan Mirror on Ten Thousand Immortal Island.

Now that the island was about to be captured by the Five Elders Association, the Tianxuan Mirror, for its own safety, had canceled its so-called ‘empowerment.’

The wondrous sub-mirror on the island had been turned into an ordinary stone.

The cultivators who had awakened from their meditation looked at the overwhelming number of enemies and finally realized the precariousness of their situation.

“Fellow Daoists, I’ve heard that the Five Elders Association has something called a ‘Soul Contract.’ Once you sign it, your soul will be completely under their control. You’ll lose your freedom, and by then, living will be worse than death!”

“That’s right, they definitely want to capture us alive and force us to sign the Soul Contract!”

“If we’re going to be enslaved, we might as well risk everything in a fight. With so many of us, we might still have a slim chance of survival!”

After the initial shock, someone quickly rallied the others to break through the blockade of the Five Elders Association.

It is said that strength lies in numbers.

With the sudden addition of so many reinforcements, the cultivators of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance on the island grew bolder.

Soon, under the leadership of a few cultivators, they launched a desperate charge.

Li Fan, however, did not follow blindly. He pulled at the sleeve of Jiao Xiuyuan, who was darting his eyes around, and asked through voice transmission, “Daoist Jiao, is there any way to escape?”

Jiao Xiuyuan chuckled, held up his hand, and signaled with five fingers.

“Easy! Just fifty thousand contribution points, and I'll transfer them to you right now!” Li Fan nodded.

Jiao Xiuyuan's face darkened. “Is Master Li Fan's life worth so little to you?”

“Five hundred thousand contribution points! And that's because of our life-and-death friendship!”

Li Fan looked at Jiao Xiuyuan and smiled faintly.

He didn’t haggle with him and immediately made the transaction for five hundred thousand points.

“Brother, I’m not greedy for money. Fair is fair; even blood brothers have to settle accounts clearly.” Jiao Xiuyuan explained for himself.

Then he whispered, “Currently, the only possible way to escape from this Ten Thousand Immortal Island is through that ancient tree in the Qingfeng Hall.”

“Qingfeng Hall…” Li Fan’s eyes flickered.

In his 113th lifetime, he had once contacted Qingfeng Hall, a loan organization hidden on Ten Thousand Immortal Island, through He Zhenghao.

The ancient tree with a human face inside had left a deep impression on him.

The place where the ancient tree was located seemed to be a separate space.

Moreover, it could gather a significant amount of Spirit Mist Grass in an instant, indicating that, like the Tianxuan Mirror, it was connected to other spaces in the outside world.

“Thank you for the advice, Daoist Jiao!”

Li Fan cupped his hands in gratitude and was about to leave.

He suddenly thought of something and returned shortly after.

Li Fan stared closely at Jiao Xiuyuan, making him feel uncomfortable all over.

“Daoist Li Fan, why are you looking at me instead of running for your life?” Jiao Xiuyuan asked, feeling bewildered.

“Daoist Jiao, would you consider selling your current body?” Li Fan asked in a faint voice.

Jiao Xiuyuan was startled, and with a flicker, he widened the distance between himself and Li Fan.

“You…” Jiao Xiuyuan looked at Li Fan with disbelief, as if recognizing his true nature for the first time.

Ignoring Jiao Xiuyuan’s wild thoughts, Li Fan continued, “I’ve been awake for so long, and I’ve always stayed within the territory of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.”

“Now, I have a basic understanding of the alliance as a whole, but I’ve never had the chance to see the Five Elders Association, which can rival the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.”

“And the information about them within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is pitifully scarce. I’m really curious about the Five Elders Association.”

Li Fan’s gaze swept over Jiao Xiuyuan’s puppet body.

“My true body must escape, of course. But I’d like to take this opportunity to see the other side.”

“Daoist, is there any method that would allow me to temporarily control your puppet body?”

Li Fan asked slowly.

Jiao Xiuyuan finally understood Li Fan’s intentions.

After a moment of thought, he muttered in a low voice, “You should have said so earlier; you scared me.”

“As long as the price is right, it’s not impossible.”

Li Fan was overjoyed upon hearing this.

“Great! Name your price!”

Jiao Xiuyuan once again signaled with five fingers and, not giving Li Fan any room for misinterpretation, said, “This is my first time letting someone possess me!”

“Fifty thousand contribution points, no less!”

“Fifty thousand, it is. I, Li Fan, am not a stingy person.”

Chapter 491: Human Dao Refining Heaven Realm

“Hold your breath and focus. Split a strand of your consciousness and bring it to my hand!”

Outside, the sound of wailing grew louder. Jiao Xiuyuan, who had just received his contribution points, spoke to Li Fan in a deep voice.

As he spoke, a newly formed branch extended from his palm. A single green leaf stood proudly at the tip, solitary and independent.

Upon hearing this, Li Fan immediately split a small part of his consciousness and directed it towards the branch in Jiao Xiuyuan's hand.

As soon as he approached, he felt an inexplicable pull from the green leaf at the tip of the branch. Unable to control himself, he plunged straight into it.

His vision gradually became clear, and in an instant, Li Fan felt that apart from his true self and his clone, he now had an additional body.

Fortunately, he had the secret technique of Dao Transformation, which allowed him to be accustomed to multitasking over the years. Otherwise, it might have been difficult for him to adapt.

Controlling the puppet body felt almost the same as using his clone technique in terms of perception. However, he could clearly sense the separation between consciousness and the physical body, unlike the seamless unity of his clone.

It felt more like he was “driving” rather than inhabiting a living body.

“The transaction is complete. This body is now at your disposal,” Jiao Xiuyuan’s voice echoed in his mind. “As long as you don’t deliberately do anything disgusting, it’s fine even if you destroy it.”

“Oh, and when the puppet body is damaged, a forced self-destruct mechanism will activate to prevent the consciousness from being captured. You might experience some shock to your soul…”

His voice gradually faded until it became barely audible.

As the split consciousness familiarized itself with the puppet body, Li Fan's true self rushed towards the location of Qingfeng Hall from his memory.

By this time, the entire Ten Thousand Immortal Island had already been drawn to the front of the purple door in the sky by the “Heaven and Earth Displacement Formation.” It was continuously being devoured by the teleportation Formation entering the territory of the Five Elders Association.

The cultivators who had just attempted to break through the blockade with their numbers were all reduced to ashes.

After this bloody lesson, the remaining cultivators, who were still alive, sat on the ground in despair, waiting for their unknown fate to unfold.

Meanwhile, Li Fan strode into the inconspicuous shop of Qingfeng Hall. It was now empty, with no sign of the sloppy old man.

He called out a few times, but no one responded.

After a moment of contemplation, Li Fan took out a pile of top-grade spirit stones from his storage ring and placed them on the floor of Qingfeng Hall.

“Are these enough to buy a way out?” Li Fan asked loudly.

There was no response for a long time. Li Fan then took out another pile of top-grade spirit stones and added them.

The total value was now close to a million contribution points.

This time, the seemingly empty Qingfeng Hall finally reacted. A wisp of green ripple spread through the air, forming a familiar green door.

Li Fan’s heart stirred, and he stepped through it.

After a brief blur of his vision, he found himself back in the space he had visited before. The ancient tree mentioned by Jiao Xiuyuan stood before him.

However, the human face on the tree had disappeared, making it look no different from an ordinary tree.

“What a generous move, Daoist friend,” a crisp female voice suddenly rang out just as Li Fan was about to speak.

“Ah Liu, since we’ve accepted his offering, let’s help him leave.”

“Yes, Miss,” the human face appeared on the ancient tree, glanced at Li Fan, and responded in a muffled voice.

“Honored guest, please step inside.” The ancient tree opened its giant mouth, revealing a passage.

“Thank you, young lady!” Li Fan cupped his hands in the direction of the voice and then stepped into the hole in the ancient tree.

As soon as Li Fan’s figure disappeared, the ancient tree closed its mouth and returned to its original appearance.

“Miss…”

“Hehe, the way ancient cultivators speak is quite interesting,” a silvery laugh echoed in the air as the branches and leaves of the ancient tree quivered in response.

…

The experience felt similar to using a long-distance teleportation formation. The surrounding scenery shifted from darkness to a kaleidoscope of colors, and then everything brightened.

After adjusting to the discomfort in his body, Li Fan looked around and found that he was still in Qingfeng Hall.

However, there were now one or two other cultivators present in the hall, and the distant sounds of the market, calm and unhurried, indicated that he was no longer in the dangerous territory of Congyun Sea.

After discreetly scouting the area, Li Fan finally figured out his current location.

He had already reached the heartland of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, in Xuanwei Prefecture, near Tianyun Prefecture.

It seemed the news of the fall of Ten Thousand Immortal Island had not yet reached this place. For now, Li Fan redirected his attention back to the puppet body on the island.

Amid the desperate cries of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance cultivators, the island was finally completely engulfed by the purple teleportation formation.

After a long period of darkness, when the sky lit up again, what unfolded before their eyes was a strange scene.

It had been daytime moments ago, but after passing through the purple door and arriving at the territory of the Five Elders Association, it was now night.

There was no bright moon in the sky, but countless brilliant stars sparkled, competing with each other in radiance.

Rivers of stars flowed across the sky, with mesmerizing light and shadows, creating a breathtaking spectacle.

For most of the people present, it was the first time they had ever seen such a magnificent starry sky, and nine out of ten were so captivated by the sight that they lost themselves in it.

The once wailing Ten Thousand Immortal Island fell silent in an instant.

“Members of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, welcome to the Humane Heavenly Land.”

A middle-aged cultivator in a white robe flew above the crowd and spoke loudly.

“I know you may have many misunderstandings about our Five Elders Association. But don’t worry, it won’t be long before you completely dispel these misunderstandings.”

“By then, I’m sure you will make the right choice to abandon the darkness and join our Five Elders Association.”

The white-robed cultivator said with a smile.

Seeing that the Five Elders Association didn’t seem as vicious as rumored, everyone breathed a sigh of relief. However, they didn’t believe a word of the “misunderstandings” he mentioned.

“First, I ask you all to leave this island.”

As the white-robed cultivator spoke, a group of burly cultivators flew out.

They were armed with sharp weapons and clad in heavy armor. They looked more like soldiers than cultivators.

Sensing their aura, each of them had a cultivation level of Nascent Soul.

All the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance cultivators present turned pale, not daring to resist, and allowed themselves to be escorted off Ten Thousand Immortal Island.

“It seems they’re not here specifically for me, but just for the island.”

“That’s strange. What’s so special about Ten Thousand Immortal Island?”

Blending into the crowd, Li Fan watched with a serious expression as the white-robed cultivator flew onto the island.

Then, dozens of other powerful cultivators appeared one after another and entered the island.

Explosive roars echoed as building after building on the island collapsed.

They seemed to be searching for something.

Chapter 492: The Origin of the Five Elders Association

“Move quickly! Stop looking around!”

Ten Thousand Immortal Island had almost been leveled to the ground, and the cultivators of the Five Elders Association began excavating the underground area.

Li Fan wanted to continue observing, but an armored cultivator rebuked him and forcibly relocated him from the area.

Several squads of armored cultivators formed a formation and drove the members of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance like a herd of sheep, forcing them to the entrance of a small cave at the bottom of a canyon.

At the entrance, there was a sinister wind blowing, exuding an eerie and terrifying atmosphere.

“Get in there! What are you waiting for?”

The leading armored cultivator struck the ground with his weapon, shouting like a thunderclap.

Among the group, there were some who looked resentful. They exchanged glances, seemingly plotting a resistance in secret.

However, the situation was against them, and after hesitating for a while, they ultimately yielded.

One by one, they entered the dark cave.

Li Fan, using a puppet body, naturally felt little fear.

However, to avoid drawing attention and to survive a bit longer, he pretended to be extremely fearful, following the group inside.

As soon as he stepped into the cave, the light vanished from sight.

The next moment, a scene completely different from what they had expected appeared before everyone.

It wasn't a winding, dark passage inside the mountain; instead, they inexplicably found themselves in a lush, verdant valley.

In the distance, a wooden pavilion seemed visible.

Dozens of people were sitting cross-legged in front of the pavilion, listening to a scholar-like cultivator lecturing about something.

Seeing that it didn’t appear to be an interrogation or torture, the previously agitated cultivators of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance also calmed down.

They decided to observe the situation before taking further action.

Under the escort of the armored cultivators, the group slowly approached the pavilion.

Meanwhile, hidden among the group, Li Fan keenly noticed a peculiar change occurring to his body during the process, causing him to slightly change his expression.

As they continued to approach the scholar in the pavilion, their bodies seemed to be shrinking.

This change only affected the detained members of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance. The armored cultivators, the scholar, and even the surrounding scenery of the valley remained unchanged.

Although their speed of progress was not reduced, it felt as if they were getting farther away from their target.

This strange phenomenon caused a slight commotion among the members of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, but it was quickly suppressed.

“Move faster!”

In their eyes, the armored cultivators had already swelled to the size of small mountains.

Without the slightest mercy, they continued to urge them on.

For the first time, experiencing what it was like to see people from the perspective of ants, the members of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance found it difficult to remain calm.

Their faces gradually turned pale, and they subconsciously followed the orders of the armored cultivators.

As they continued moving forward, their bodies kept shrinking.

After spending nearly ten days, they finally arrived in front of the pavilion.

In their eyes, the scholar now looked like a towering mountain, reaching up to the sky.

“Sit down,” the scholar said gently.

But in their ears, it sounded like a great bell, filling the heavens and earth.

It echoed continuously in their minds.

It seemed to resonate deep within their souls, and even though they tried to block their senses, they couldn’t help but hear the scholar’s words in their minds.

So, they all lost control of their bodies and obediently sat down on the ground.

“What kind of Divine power is this?”

Everyone was horrified.

The armored cultivators all saluted the scholar, and seeing that the members of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had already sat down, they quietly left.

The scholar glanced at the crowd and sighed softly, “Another group of lost lambs.”

“However, since you are fated to be here, I will not let you stray further.”

The crowd, who considered themselves part of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, naturally felt indignant upon hearing this.

“In your eyes, what do you think of our Five Elders Association?” At this moment, the scholar asked softly.

“Using soul contracts to control cultivators, absolutely evil!”

“Struggling on the brink of extinction. Within a thousand years, they will surely be destroyed by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.”

“Ignorant and backward!”

“Though not virtuous, they have managed to contend with our Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance for so long, so there must be something commendable.”

…

Under the scholar’s questioning, everyone spoke out, giving their own answers.

But the horrified expressions on their faces clearly showed that their responses were not voluntary.

However, not all the cultivators lost control and responded to the scholar’s question.

At least the puppet body Li Fan was inhabiting wasn’t affected.

Some Nascent Soul cultivators also furrowed their brows, resisting the scholar’s control.

“Isn’t this just a group version of the Heavenly Doctor’s ‘Interrogation’ technique?” Li Fan was also deeply shocked.

“Although its power seems inferior to the Heavenly Doctor’s personal execution, the number of targets is vast.”

Li Fan remained highly vigilant, ready to abandon the puppet body at any moment.

Fortunately, the scholar did not pay much attention to Li Fan.

The crowd continued answering one by one.

The scholar smiled, listening attentively.

After a long time, the voices subsided, and the area outside the pavilion gradually quieted down.

The scholar shook his head and said, “Utter nonsense!”

“Do you know where our Five Elders Association originated?”

Everyone shook their heads.

“After the Immortal Venerable of Dao Transmission created a new path, the terrifying cultivation speed of unaffiliated cultivators led them to launch an assault on the immortal sects.”

“Meanwhile, the sects themselves were divided into two factions, fighting and killing each other.”

“However, before we could reach a conclusion…”

The scholar didn’t directly answer but began to recount history.

“The great calamity of heaven and earth descended, making it impossible to practice the same Dao.”

“The immortal sects suffered devastating blows, with less than one percent surviving.”

“Yet, having ruled the Xuanhuang Realm for ten thousand years, they were deeply rooted.”

“Some surviving sects escaped this catastrophe. They secluded themselves, waiting for the storm of bloodshed to pass.”

“When the killing ended, and darkness faded, they united once again on the ruins.”

“This was the embryonic form of the current Five Elders Association.”

Disregarding the stunned reactions, the scholar continued to speak slowly.

“The struggle between the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association is, in essence, still a battle between the old and new forces of cultivation.”

“All conflicts in this world largely stem from the oppression of the newcomers by the predecessors.”

“That’s why this battle has lasted for thousands of years and continues endlessly.”

“It will never stop until one side is completely defeated.”

“You are members of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and have been deceived, so I do not blame you.”

The scholar showed a look of compassion.

The members of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, who were seated and listening to the scholar's lecture, were all stunned.

Although they had long been accustomed to the existence of the Five Elders Association, it was their first time hearing about its origins.

Li Fan, however, was not as surprised as the others.

One of the Five Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereigns of the Five Elders Association, Senior Sister Zhao, was once the head of the Grand Dao Sect, one of the ten great immortal sects.

So the fact that the Five Elders Association was formed by the surviving members of the ancient sects was something Li Fan had already suspected.

Chapter 493: Everyone Can Become a Heavenly Sovereign

"It's nothing more than a struggle for interests, so why distinguish between good and evil?"

"If we were truly as evil as they say, how could we have withstood the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's assaults for a thousand years without being defeated?"

The scholar raised a powerful question again.

Many of the cultivators from the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance looked thoughtful after hearing this.

However, more of them appeared confused, as if their values were being deeply challenged.

"Very well, let me first give you an introduction to the current situation of the Five Elders Association."

The scholar's enormous figure stood towering between heaven and earth, filling everyone's view as he began to speak.

"Now, the territory of the Five Elders Association is divided into five parts."

"Each of the five Heavenly Sovereigns governs their own domain."

"I can't casually comment on the other Heavenly Sovereigns' territories. If you have the chance in the future, you can explore them on your own."

"Let me speak only of the current place you find yourselves in—the [Humane Heavenly Domain]."

The scholar's words drew the attention of all the cultivators present, including Li Fan.

"Each of the five Heavenly Sovereigns defies the natural order and creates their own unique region."

"In our [Humane Heavenly Domain], the most important principle is the way of the Heavenly Sovereign's Dao."

"It is also the cosmic law, which everyone must follow and none can defy."

The scholar paused and revealed the origin of the name [Humane Heavenly Domain].

"Compared to heaven and earth, human beings are but insignificant creatures."

"The body and name may perish, but the rivers and mountains will endure for ages."

"Even cultivators who can stir seas and rivers, seemingly altering the shape of heaven and earth, will find that the rivers flow anew once more. After their death, everything becomes empty and their past achievements vanish like bubbles, no longer existing."

"Only the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign, who defies the laws of heaven and earth, can truly change the heavens and earth!"

"Why is it that only the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign can accomplish such a grand feat?"

"In our [Humane Heavenly Domain], changing the heavens and earth is something anyone can achieve!"

The scholar's words resounded forcefully.

Hearing this, everyone felt a surge of courage, yet many were puzzled.

Several cultivators, emboldened, asked, "Sir, what do you mean by saying that anyone can change the heavens and earth?"

The scholar smiled faintly, "When you arrived, did you see the vast and radiant starlight?"

Everyone nodded.

"In truth, those are not real stars but former cultivators." The scholar's words echoed like thunder across the heavens and earth.

With a wave of his massive hand, the originally bright sky instantly dimmed.

The darkness lasted only for a moment, then was illuminated again by countless stars.

"In the Humane Heavenly Domain, regardless of cultivation level, as long as one possesses sufficient faith and courage, they can transform into a star and ascend to the firmament."

"While eternally shining upon the world, they can also alter the original shape of the heavens and earth."

"A long time ago, in the Humane Heavenly Domain, there was a young man born between two great mountains."

The scholar began telling a story again.

"The mountains were obstructive, making it very difficult to come and go. The villagers lived in extreme poverty because of this. The young man, seeing such circumstances, made a grand vow in his youth to completely level these two mountains and carve out a path for his kin."

"The place was remote, and few people visited. The young man did not know there were immortals in the world; he only tried to dig the mountains with human effort."

"Though he faced misunderstanding and ridicule, he never wavered or regretted his resolve."

"With persistence, even metal and stone can be split. A hundred years passed, and when the young man had become an elderly man, nearing death, he still did not change his will."

"After his death, he transformed into a star and ascended to the sky. Under the light of his star, the two mountains vanished without a trace."

"This is an example of a mortal body completely changing the heavens and earth."

"If a mere mortal can do so, how much more could a cultivator? In the Humane Heavenly Domain, there have been countless examples of altering heaven and earth!"

...

While Li Fan's puppet body was immersed in the scholar's narration,

his true self had already arrived at Shilin Prefecture through a teleportation array.

The Ten Thousand Immortal Island had been abducted, and all teleportation points leading to the Congyun Sea had been rendered ineffective.

He had no choice but to settle for the next best option and travel through the teleportation array to the neighboring Shilin Prefecture.

When he attempted to fly into the Congyun Sea, Li Fan suddenly discovered that the entire Congyun Sea was enveloped in an invisible barrier.

It was sealed off, preventing outsiders from entering.

"It seems they finally reacted and imposed martial law." Li Fan narrowed his eyes but did not force his way in.

Instead, his true body returned to the nearby Immortal City, and his attention shifted to his clone, Zhou Qing'ang.

Ignoring the continuous notifications from the communication talismans on his body, the clone flew straight to the place where the Ten Thousand Immortal Island used to be.

Along the way, many fearful cultivators, unsure of what had happened, were also heading towards the Ten Thousand Immortal Island.

Only after losing the teleportation formation did they realize how precious instantaneous travel was.

It took more than ten days for the clone to reach his destination.

By then, a large number of cultivators had already gathered here, pointing and whispering among themselves.

At the center of the crowd was a massive black void.

The surrounding seawater seemed to be obstructed by some force, unable to flow into the black hole.

In the blue sea, the black hole's presence looked so strange and out of place.

Seeing this, Li Fan couldn't help but frown slightly.

"This appearance, how does it resemble the time when I first saw the Sea of Crimson Flames?"

"Could it be..."

A thought surfaced in his mind, causing Li Fan to be momentarily stunned.

When he had initially seen the disappearance of the Ten Thousand Immortal Island and the lingering, intense energy around the void,

he had instinctively thought that Crimson Flame must have acted and completely destroyed the Ten Thousand Immortal Island.

Indeed, it looked very much like it.

But since he hadn’t witnessed the island’s destruction firsthand, there was always the possibility of a second explanation.

That was, like the current world, the Ten Thousand Immortal Island had been completely relocated through some method.

Moreover, later, when Crimson Flame was killed and Ink Death appeared in the world,

he still hadn’t seen the destruction of the Ten Thousand Immortal Island with his own eyes.

Because before the island completely disappeared, he had been consumed by the black particles.

Thinking about the Five Elders Association forcibly abducting the Ten Thousand Immortal Island this time, Li Fan couldn't help but be stunned.

"Could it be that the Ten Thousand Immortal Island really harbors some secret?"

Recalling the various secret histories he had read, none of them mentioned anything about this.

Li Fan began to doubt his own judgment again.

"This doesn't make sense either. If the Ten Thousand Immortal Island really hid something, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance would certainly be aware. They should have guarded it strictly. How could they have allowed the Five Elders Association to take it so easily?"

While Li Fan was racking his brain, he overheard a cultivator among the onlookers sigh, "Truly, the world is unpredictable. Who would have thought that the original place where the Dao Transmission Immortal Venerable spread his teachings would disappear like this?"

Li Fan was slightly taken aback.

He quickly stepped forward and greeted the cultivator.

Then he asked, "Fellow Daoist, just now you mentioned the 'original place where the Dao Transmission Immortal Venerable spread his teachings'—what do you mean by that?"

Chapter 494: The First Dao transmitters

The other party's attitude was initially friendly, but upon hearing Li Fan's question, his expression subtly changed.

"Hehe, fellow Daoist, you must have heard wrong. I don’t know anything about the original place where the teachings were spread!" He quickly waved his hand, as if trying to dismiss the conversation, implying Li Fan had the wrong person.

Without waiting for Li Fan to respond, he immediately flew away at a rapid speed, even faster than most Nascent Soul cultivators.

Li Fan had finally encountered someone in the know; how could he let this clue slip away so easily?

He quickly followed but maintained a safe distance, trailing far behind.

At the same time, he transmitted his voice, saying, "Fellow Daoist, don't misunderstand. I mean no harm. I'm just very interested in what you mentioned earlier."

The person ahead gave no response and instead accelerated, trying to shake off Li Fan.

However, Li Fan continued to follow closely, persistently trying to persuade him.

After more than half a day, the other party, seeing that he couldn't shake off Li Fan, finally began to slow down.

He looked around, ensuring no one was nearby, his face fluctuating between uncertainty and frustration.

After a moment of hesitation, he whispered, "This is not a suitable place to talk. Follow me, fellow Daoist."

Li Fan smiled slightly and cupped his hands, "In that case, thank you in advance, fellow Daoist!"

Following the man, they flew westward for hundreds of miles before diving into the depths of the ocean.

They arrived at a building resembling a crystal palace.

After inviting Li Fan into a room deep within the palace, the man sighed slightly and said, "It's not that I didn’t want to tell you earlier, but I feared speaking recklessly could bring disaster."

"What should I call you, fellow Daoist?" Li Fan nodded, not probing too deeply yet, but instead asking for his name first.

"I am Sima Changkong!" the man said, waving his hand, summoning a servant with a human upper body and a fish tail lower body.

The servant poured two cups of tea for them before bowing and leaving.

Li Fan glanced at the servant.

"Just a beast species, a personal preference, forgive me for the oddity," Sima Changkong said nonchalantly, sipping his tea.

"Beast species..." Li Fan's eyes flickered.

He had once discovered similar half-beast, half-human corpses in Mr. Bai’s basement in Ningyuan City. Senior Brother Zhang had also referred to them in the same way.

Li Fan had thought they were extinct, but it seemed they still existed.

However, Li Fan had no intention of making a fuss over it. He simply nodded slightly and steered the conversation back on track.

"Fellow Daoist Zhou, correct?" Sima Changkong bluntly exposed the identity of Li Fan's clone.

"Now that we're in my private residence, feel free to speak your mind."

"Do you know why the Ten Thousand Immortal Island is called by that name?" Sima Changkong asked.

Li Fan had indeed wondered about this before.

Because the capital cities of the various regions were all named after their provinces, such as Daoyuan City, Shilin City, and Tianyun City.

Yet the base in the Congyun Sea was not called Congyun Island or City but was instead called Ten Thousand Immortal Island.

He had searched through records and found no special explanation, assuming it was merely a customary name.

But now it seemed there was a hidden reason behind it.

"I’d like to hear more," Li Fan said, his face solemn, listening intently.

"A long time ago, when the Congyun Sea was still a vast plain, there was a large lake."

"In the middle of the lake was an island. This was where the first Immortal Venerable of Dao Transmission gave his teachings to the people."

"At that time, thousands of cultivators and mortals gathered to listen to the Immortal Venerable’s teachings."

"They all comprehended the Immortal Laws of the Immortal Venerable, laying the foundation for the original Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance."

Sima Changkong spoke slowly.

"Perhaps due to the Immortal Venerable's blessing, even after the landscape changed over the centuries, the island never altered its shape."

"Several thousand years later, when the current Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance was established and selecting a capital city, they chose this island to honor the Immortal Venerable who had spread the teachings."

"In a sense, it wouldn’t be wrong to say this island is the origin of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance. Hence, people call it ‘Ten Thousand Immortal Island.'"

Sima Changkong succinctly explained the history to Li Fan while secretly observing his reaction.

Li Fan pondered Sima Changkong's words and furrowed his brow. "If this is the origin of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the place where the Immortal Venerable first spread his teachings, why is it so little known today?"

"Why is it so hard to find any relevant information?"

"Moreover, how was it left so unguarded that someone managed to seize it?"

Li Fan shook his head, seemingly skeptical of Sima Changkong’s story.

Sima Changkong sighed deeply. "That’s exactly why I was hesitant to say too much earlier."

He paused for a moment, then continued in a low voice, "Tens of thousands of pioneers sacrificed their lives, spreading the new Dao method of the Immortal Venerable. That’s how the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance we see today came to be."

"This should have been a heroic tale, something all current cultivators should remember."

"But now, it has been downplayed, even sealed away."

"The reason is that the Immortal Venerable has not appeared for many years, and the ones in control of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance are no longer the original Tens Of Thousands Of Transmitters."

Sima Changkong drank the rest of his tea in one gulp and said, "The struggle between the old and new teachings was far more brutal than we can imagine. The sects at that time, facing something that threatened their rule, didn’t hesitate to use the sword."

"Almost all the true, pure Dao transmitters perished in the fight against the sects."

"Those who survived are merely opportunists who seized control of the Immortal Venerable’s legacy."

Sima Changkong's tone carried a hint of disdain.

...

Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

This explanation was barely acceptable.

In the mortal world, the rise and fall of power often led to the distortion or erasure of the achievements of former heroes, which was not uncommon.

The same principle seemed to apply in the cultivation world.

"An island that can survive the test of time without changing its shape might indeed conceal some secrets."

"The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance must have thoroughly investigated it before. Not finding anything, they probably left it alone."

"But the Five Elders Association must have recently uncovered something, risking a full-scale war to seize the island."

Li Fan’s thoughts raced.

Before long, he looked at Sima Changkong, who was still brooding over the injustices, and asked, "Daoist Sima, you seem to know a lot about the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's secrets."

"But according to what you've said, the symbolic significance of Ten Thousand Immortal Island seems greater than its actual value."

"Doesn’t it seem unworthy of the Five Elders Association to take such a risk and seize it by force? What do you think?"

Sima Changkong's expression grew serious.

After thinking for a moment, he said slowly, "I have a theory."

"The first Dao transmitters progressed quickly in their cultivation, so their customs and habits were still very similar to mortals."

"Mortals have a tradition of returning to their roots after death."

"Thus, after the Dao transmitters were killed in their battles with the immortal sects, their remaining bodies were often brought back to Ten Thousand Immortal Island for burial by their companions."

Chapter 495: Bloodline Recorded in History

"I believe the Five Elders Association may have come specifically for these remains," Sima Changkong said solemnly.

"Remains? What would they want with these remains?" Li Fan was shocked to learn that beneath the ordinary surface of Ten Thousand Immortals Island, there could be the buried corpses of numerous ancient cultivators. At the same time, he was puzzled by Sima Changkong's response.

"I cannot know for sure. Maybe the Five Elders Association has the ability to resurrect the dead? If those original transmitters of the Dao were to awaken and see the current state of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance, they would likely storm the headquarters, battling to the death," Sima Changkong sneered.

"Careful with your words, fellow Daoist," Li Fan diverted the conversation without addressing it directly.

"Mount Congyun’s changes, the original transmitters, the origins of Ten Thousand Immortals Island...”

"All of these are deeply hidden secrets. Based on what I know of today's cultivators, even those who have reached the Soul Transformation True Monarch stage might not be as well-versed in such secrets as you are."

"Who exactly are you?" Li Fan couldn’t help but ask curiously.

"What background could I possibly have? I'm just an ordinary cultivator," Sima Changkong dismissed it lightly.

Seeing Li Fan’s doubtful expression, Sima Changkong proudly said, "Let me tell you, once something happens in this world, it always leaves a trace."

"Erasing a cultivator's memory doesn’t mean you can completely bury the truth of history."

Sima Changkong suddenly stood up. "I have nothing to hide from you. I, Sima Changkong, am a historian!"

As he finished speaking, his entire body’s blood and energy seemed to surge intensely.

Li Fan, who was very familiar with the power of blood and energy due to his cultivation of the Creation Furnace technique, was shocked to find that the energy in Sima Changkong's body was incredibly complex.

Some of it was incredibly vibrant, like that of a newborn infant.

But some of it felt ancient, as if it had existed for thousands or even tens of thousands of years.

Blood energy burst from Sima Changkong’s body, forming a vast river of blood over his head.

As Li Fan observed closely, each drop of blood contained countless images and sounds.

The higher up he looked, the older the recorded scenes became.

The blood river was magnificent and vast, and the sheer amount of information recorded made even someone as mentally powerful as Li Fan feel dizzy after a brief observation.

Shocked, he quickly averted his gaze.

Sima Changkong, noticing Li Fan’s reaction, slowly withdrew the external manifestation of his energy.

He calmly explained, "This is the "Bloodline Historical Archives", a work compiled and cultivated by the Sima family for generations."

"Since our ancestor, Sima Pei, created the 'Blood History' technique, our Sima family has taken it upon ourselves to meticulously record the history of the Xuanhuang Realm."

"Even if we die, we have no regrets. This has been passed down through fifty-six generations."

"Fifty-six generations?" Li Fan was momentarily stunned and was about to ask more when Sima Changkong nodded and said, "Indeed. Although cultivating the 'Blood History' shortens our lifespan to that of a regular mortal, our Sima family has never retreated."

"Why fear death? As long as there are descendants of the Sima family, the "Bloodline Historical Archive" will find a suitable heir to awaken and continue the great work of recording history."

Sima Changkong spoke with a face full of righteousness.

Li Fan couldn’t help but feel deep respect upon hearing this.

He had always admired historians.

Back when he was the Grand Preceptor of the Great Xuan Empire, wielding power over life and death, the entire court cowered under his tyranny, not daring to voice opposition.

Only the historians of Great Xuan feared neither his sword nor his wrath.

Even when he threatened to execute their entire families, these historians insisted on recording Li Fan’s crimes of disrupting the court and oppressing the empress dowager in their records.

After executing a few of them, Li Fan found that their successors remained just as stubborn, so he left them be.

Unexpectedly, even in the Xuanhuang Realm, historians still existed.

While feeling a newfound respect, Li Fan’s thoughts stirred.

The history of the Xuanhuang Realm was shrouded in mystery, with much of it intentionally concealed. To try and uncover what happened solely by reading ancient texts was a fool's errand.

However, having Sima Changkong, a living embodiment of history, was a completely different matter.

Li Fan realized the importance of this historian in front of him and eagerly continued chatting with him.

Sima Changkong, being straightforward by nature, began to reveal more as he grew more familiar with Li Fan.

Li Fan gradually learned that while the Sima family could use their "Bloodline Historical Archive" to record history, the Xuanhuang Realm was vast, and no single person could know everything.

Thus, the Sima family had also mastered the technique of "Blood Splitting Clones" , which allowed them to split off parts of their blood to create clones.

These many clones traveled across the world, recording history as accurately and comprehensively as possible.

This explained why the Sima family members generally had short lifespans.

The river of blood recorded countless pieces of information from the Xuanhuang Realm's past.

To prevent unforeseen events from wiping out decades of accumulated knowledge, the Sima family's ancestors painstakingly devised a secret method called "One Is All".

As long as there was still a trace of Sima family bloodline in the world, the Bloodline History Archive would never be broken.

Li Fan then asked about the definition of the "Sima family bloodline."

Sima Changkong smiled proudly.

As long as there was even a trace of Sima blood in someone’s ancestry, no matter how diluted, the Bloodline History Archive could still be passed down.

After thousands of years, the descendants of the Sima family’s mortal lineage had spread throughout the Xuanhuang Realm.

In other words, unless all mortals in the Xuanhuang Realm were exterminated, the Bloodline History Archive could never be completely eradicated.

"Sima family, truly extraordinary! What a remarkable method and divine technique!" Li Fan exclaimed in admiration.

Li Fan then asked Sima Changkong for a communication talisman and carefully stored it in his storage ring.

"Daoist Sima, we must keep in close contact from now on," Li Fan said warmly, continuing to chat with this historian of the cultivation world for quite some time before reluctantly parting.

Upon returning to the old site of Ten Thousand Immortals Island, Li Fan’s true body, located far away in Shilin Prefecture, noticed that the communication talisman issued by the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance was flashing continuously.

Puzzled, Li Fan took out the talisman and sensed the message.

After a moment, his expression became somewhat strange.

"I've been ordered to act as the acting island lord of Ten Thousand Immortals Island, responsible for rebuilding the Immortal City of Congyun Sea."

"The location is right above the former Ten Thousand Immortals Island."

"Execute immediately, without error."

Li Fan read the message several times, finally confirming it wasn’t a joke.

Chapter 496: Xuantian Locks the Nether

The order came directly from the headquarters of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s Governance Hall, accompanied by a deputy island master's talisman and detailed handover instructions, making it unmistakably official.

The stated reason was due to the recent [Assault on Ten Thousand Immortal Island] incident, and within the surviving system cultivators in the Congyun Sea, Li Fan held the highest rank.

Since the two Soul Transformation True Monarchs, Ziyun and Hongxi, were unable to return for various reasons, it was natural for Li Fan to take over as the acting island master by default.

However, Li Fan felt no joy from this sudden "gift" falling from the sky.

After carefully reading the transfer instructions, his brow furrowed tightly.

Although the role of Special Steward of the Martial Hall was largely ceremonial, only Nascent Soul cultivators or higher could hold such a position based on rank.

The position itself wasn’t low in rank. There was no issue with that. However, in the vast Congyun Sea, there were certainly many cultivators of a similar rank within the system who had not been captured by the Five Elders Association.

So why was this "heavy responsibility" specifically handed to Li Fan?

In this life, he had no hidden backing or powerful connections.

Was it a test, a warning, or perhaps an appeasement?

Li Fan had no way of knowing.

But since the order had been issued, there was no point in overthinking. As the saying goes, "When soldiers come, you block them; when water comes, you dam it."

A cold glint flashed in Li Fan's eyes as he flew towards Congyun Sea.

As he neared the edge of Shilin Prefecture and approached the Congyun Sea, he was once again blocked by an invisible barrier.

Li Fan took out a communication talisman and injected spiritual energy into it.

A radiant "(萬)-Ten Thousand" character shot towards the barrier.

Ripples spread across the shield, and Li Fan reached out with his right hand. He felt as though an invisible substance clung to his arm, changing shape as he pressed forward.

Finally, it was like popping a sticky bubble. With some thought, Li Fan propelled his body through the invisible barrier.

In the next moment, Li Fan found himself back in the Congyun Sea.

Following the coordinates listed in the instructions, Li Fan flew at full speed. Four days later, he reached his destination.

A giant dust-ferrying ship, very familiar in appearance, quietly hovered in the air.

On the deck, the vague silhouettes of numerous black-robed cultivators could be seen.

After a moment of contemplation, Li Fan flew towards the ship.

It seemed the black-robed cultivators were already aware of Li Fan’s arrival, as they did not move to stop him.

“Daoist Li Fan, please come here!” As soon as he set foot on the deck, a voice came from within the ship.

Li Fan headed towards the voice, all the while discreetly observing the black-robed cultivators around him.

A familiar aura of coldness and bloodlust.

They were likely members of the [Era], those responsible for handling special matters.

They were the predecessors of the [Heavenly Artificers] who emerged after the establishment of the Tianxuan Net in his previous life.

Not wanting to stir up trouble for now, Li Fan merely took a quick glance and then retracted his gaze, continuing towards the inner chamber.

Soon, he reached a room deep in the corridor and pushed the door open.

A white-haired youth sat at a long table, his expression grim.

Characters and images flashed rapidly across the long table, as if equipped with some sort of anti-snooping mechanism. Everything Li Fan saw appeared distorted and blurry.

“Island Master Li, you’ve already received the appointment document, so I won’t repeat the details.”

Without looking up from the table, the white-haired youth continued, “I want to emphasize three main points.”

“First, the reconstruction work must be completed within six months.”

“Second, the budget for this project is limited. You need to strictly control the expenses for materials. If the actual cost exceeds the approved limit and delays the construction, you will be held responsible. However, if you can complete the task on time, you will be duly rewarded!”

“The third point, and the most important…”

At this point, the white-haired youth finally lifted his head and stared at Li Fan.

Li Fan’s heart skipped a beat as he realized that the white-haired youth's eye sockets were completely hollow, filled with an eerie darkness.

“The talisman appointment doesn’t officially state this in writing. Once you leave this room, I will not admit to having said this. However, it’s something you must do. If there is any failure…”

The white-haired youth let out a cold snort and lightly tapped the table.

A stream of light shot out from the long table, heading straight for Li Fan.

Li Fan raised his hand to block it. As soon as the light touched his body, it vanished.

At the same time, new information appeared in his mind.

“This is…”

Li Fan frowned slightly.

“It’s the formation diagram for the [Xuantian Nether-Lock Formation],” the white-haired youth explained, noticing Li Fan’s confusion.

“When the Ten Thousand Immortal Island was relocated, the [Nether Passage] beneath it was exposed. You are required to inscribe the Xuantian Nether-Lock Formation into the foundation of the new Congyun Immortal City while constructing it.”

“With the formation diagram as a guide, you don’t need to be particularly proficient in formations. As long as you’re not completely ignorant of them, it should be manageable. As an ancient cultivator, this shouldn’t be a problem for you.” The white-haired youth spoke before Li Fan could refuse.

“How should I address you, Fellow Daoist?” Li Fan asked, furrowing his brow and not immediately agreeing.

The white-haired youth gazed at Li Fan with his hollow eyes before finally speaking, “Diyi Jinglun”

Li Fan’s eyes narrowed slightly.

He had heard of this name before.

A mortal formed a Golden Core in three years of cultivation. A Golden Core that could cut down Nascent Souls and defeat Soul Transformation cultivators.

Decades ago, he had already reached the peak of Soul Transformation, yet he gave up the opportunity to integrate with the Dao, simply because the soul of heaven and earth was too weak and did not meet his expectations.

A legend among cultivators, known as Lord Jinglun.

Li Fan had long admired his name. He hadn’t expected to meet him in person today.

However, Li Fan remained composed, neither humble nor arrogant, and cupped his hands, “So, it's the esteemed Lord Jinglun!”

“Although the order comes from the Governance Hall of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, asking me to be the acting island master and set up this Xuantian Nether-Lock Formation…”

“I’m afraid I cannot comply!”

Li Fan’s tone was firm.

Lord Jinglun frowned.

Feeling the space around him gradually becoming heavier, Li Fan’s expression remained unchanged.

He continued, “This situation is far too suspicious, filled with conspiracies at every turn. Who can guarantee that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance won’t cast me aside once I’ve served my purpose?”

Lord Jinglun was taken aback by his words.

Then, with a slight smile, he withdrew his oppressive aura.

“So, that’s what you’re worried about…”

“There’s no need for that.”

Lord Jinglun stood up and walked to the side of the room.

As he moved, the walls of the ship became transparent.

It was as if they were standing in the clouds, with the vast Congyun Sea stretching out before them.

“Island Master Li comes from ancient times, so you may not know this. After the Great Calamity descended, strange entities called [Aberrations] began to appear across the world.”

Lord Jinglun spoke slowly.

“And there are a few places where they appear most frequently and densely.”

Chapter 497: Rebuilding Ten Thousand Immortal Island

“Congyun Sea, Luo Yan Province, Cangwu Abyss, Qianling Prefecture…”

As Lord Jinglun spoke, he mentioned some names that were either familiar or foreign to Li Fan.

“The reason behind it all is that these locations harbor the 'Passages to the Nether'.”

“We haven't yet concluded what exactly the nature of these Nether Passages is. However, based on our research, if these passages remain exposed, the frequency of strange occurrences in that province will drastically increase.”

“Therefore, we must use the 'Xuantian Nether-Lock Formation' to suppress them.”

The answer Li Fan received from Lord Jinglun was completely unexpected.

“When Ten Thousand Immortal Island was still around, we never discovered this Nether Passage beneath the island. However, based on the annual reports from the Tianji Hall of Congyun Sea regarding the number of strange events, we determined that there must be one here.”

“Who would have thought it would be at the bottom of the location where the Immortal Venerable of the Dao Transmission once preached.”

“Even a trace of the Immortal Venerable's power, after a thousand years, could still effectively seal the Nether Passage. But now that Ten Thousand Immortal Island is gone, this passage must be blocked.”

“Although the existence of these strange phenomena is no secret, few know that they can spread. To prevent panic and ensure the stability of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, strict confidentiality is required.”

Lord Jinglun spoke unhurriedly.

“All this secrecy... just because of this?” Li Fan couldn’t help but feel speechless at the unexpected connection between the bizarre request and the strange occurrences across the world.

“You think it's only because of this?” Lord Jinglun glanced coldly at Li Fan.

“Island Master Li, don't underestimate the strangeness. They are not as easy to deal with as you might imagine.”

His words carried a deeper meaning, but he chose not to elaborate.

Hearing this, Li Fan put away his disdainful expression and nodded slightly.

Changing the subject, he asked, “Then why was I suddenly appointed as the Acting Island Master? And what about this Congyun Sea…”

Lord Jinglun interrupted Li Fan's question, shaking his head slowly: “It seems that in ancient times, sects were riddled with internal strife. Island Master Li, you’re being overly suspicious.”

“Rest assured, everything is proceeding according to protocol.”

“As per ancient regulations, when the entire structure of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance in a certain region is destroyed, the highest-ranked surviving cultivator in that area automatically inherits the primary administrative position.”

“If there are multiple cultivators with the same rank, the one with the higher combat power will be selected.”

“You, my friend, have slain four Nascent Soul cultivators. Even if you claim to have done it with external help, such explanations may fool others, but trying to deceive us, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, is a bit too optimistic.”

“We have meticulously evaluated the power of every tool sold from the Tianxuan Mirror.”

“While it's possible for a Golden Core cultivator to defeat a Nascent Soul, doing it as cleanly and without leaving a trace like you did—impossible.”

“Among the surviving cultivators of Congyun Sea, your combat power is unmatched. Who else but you could be the Acting Island Master?”

Lord Jinglun looked at Li Fan with a half-smile as he explained.

Li Fan felt a heavy weight in his heart, and on his face, he forced a look of embarrassment, as if his secret had been exposed.

“It seems I've been overthinking it.”

“In that case, I accept the responsibility!”

He calmly replied.

Regardless of how much truth there was to it, Lord Jinglun’s words had reached this point. If Li Fan refused any longer, he feared he wouldn't be leaving that room alive.

Seeing Li Fan’s compliance, Lord Jinglun nodded in satisfaction.

“The blockade of Congyun Sea will not be lifted until Congyun Immortal City is fully rebuilt.”

“Of course, the headquarters will also send cultivators to assist in the reconstruction of Congyun Sea.”

“However, due to certain reasons, the number of reinforcements won't be large. They will only provide limited support in specific areas like the long-distance teleportation formation.”

“The main responsibility will still rest on you.”

“I will also assign a deputy to help you complete the reconstruction of the Immortal City.”

“You can request any materials needed for the construction from him.”

“The detailed list of required resources will be given to you shortly. Your primary task is to coordinate and oversee the surviving cultivators of Congyun Sea to expedite the rebuilding of Congyun Immortal City.”

...

After giving these instructions, Lord Jinglun finally allowed Li Fan to leave.

Later, a cultivator named Zhou Kebao found Li Fan and brought the approved materials list.

“Island Master Li, this is the detailed list of approved materials for the project. Please review it.” The chubby Zhou Kebao smiled as he handed the list to Li Fan.

Li Fan took the list and carefully examined it.

It was a long and detailed list. Even a rough scan would take considerable time.

The various items, both familiar and unfamiliar, were dizzying.

Only their names were listed, with no explanation of their specific purposes.

It left one feeling lost and confused.

Li Fan was no expert in most areas, but anything related to formations did not escape his sharp eye.

One of the most important functions of Congyun Immortal City was its network of teleportation formation.

The original Ten Thousand Immortal Island had 11,687 teleportation formation, including the long-distance teleportation formation.

Li Fan found the special material needed to construct these teleportation formation: 'Darkvoid Stone'. Based on the quantity listed, he did some quick calculations.

Moments later, Li Fan indeed found something amiss.

The materials listed were insufficient even to construct the small teleportation formation, let alone the long-distance one.

Li Fan's face darkened immediately: “Daoist Zhou, did you make a mistake with this list? Please check it again.”

His eyes flashed with an unmasked killing intent.

Zhou Kebao was initially stunned, then quickly took the list and rechecked it.

As he examined it, he muttered under his breath, “A mistake? Impossible... Could it be that Island Master Li…”

Before he could finish, he heard Li Fan coldly say: “Daoist Zhou, I made an oath before Lord Jinglun.”

“If the task isn't completed on time, my fate will be grim.”

“I’m a small-minded person who holds grudges!”

“If there’s no hope of completing the task, I won't mind dragging down those who sabotaged it.”

Zhou Kebao wiped the sweat from his forehead and quickly pounded his chest: “Island Master Li, no need to be so agitated. I'll check it thoroughly again!”

With that, he hurried away, not daring to meet Li Fan’s gaze.

Li Fan snorted coldly and closed his eyes, waiting.

It took nearly half a day before Zhou Kebao returned with a brand new list.

“Hehe, Island Master Li, your sharp eyes are truly impressive! There was indeed an error!”

“The previous list was only a preliminary budget. The final list includes significantly more materials.”

Li Fan took the new list and saw that the amount of resources was indeed over 50% more than the previous one.

Chapter 498: Li Fan Discovers the Scheme

Li Fan squinted his eyes.

Seeing the vast discrepancy in the itemized list that Zhou Kebao, this chubby man, sent him, Li Fan suppressed his initial urge to act out and instead calmed himself.

A slight adjustment had led to a 50% discrepancy in quantity.

This only meant that the actual number of materials was far greater than what he had in hand.

Although there had been some corruption and embezzlement within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance recently, everyone at least made an effort to cover it up—putting on a facade to conceal their actions.

But to be this blatant, to the point of being utterly shameless?

Rebuilding a whole Immortal City is a huge task. Yet, for someone like Zhou Kebao to skim off the top so blatantly, right in front of Li Fan, the acting Island Lord, and with such large quantities...

There could only be one explanation: the people behind this were targeting Li Fan directly.

That’s right. Li Fan’s appointment as the acting Island Lord may have been legitimate and lawful.

However, that doesn’t prevent someone from exploiting this, launching a conspiracy against him the moment they learned of his appointment.

Perhaps it was for him personally, or perhaps for the massive amount of contribution points associated with him.

Up until now, everything Li Fan had done—from trading rare Samantabhadra True Leaves to gathering and reinvesting the contributions of other cultivators—had been in the open, not intentionally concealed.

Except for his dealings with the empire, every transaction he had made was traceable.

It didn’t take precise calculations; even a rough estimate would reveal the staggering amount of contribution points currently in Li Fan’s possession.

With so much at stake, it was no wonder someone had taken notice of him.

Aside from wealth, there was also resentment.

Tantai Can, who suffered a loss during the Samantabhadra True Leaf speculation incident, might also be fanning the flames in this situation.

People often act only after thorough planning. As his thoughts raced, Li Fan’s gaze swept back over the list.

After a while, he nodded slightly and carefully put the list away.

At the same time, he asked casually, "Fellow Daoist Zhou, besides this list, is there anything else you need to hand over?"

"No, nothing more." Zhou Kebao smiled broadly and shook his head repeatedly.

Seeing this, Li Fan sneered inwardly.

However, he didn’t confront him yet. Instead, he cupped his hands and said, "Rebuilding the Immortal City is a matter of great importance, involving many aspects. It’s extremely complex. I need to carefully consider the specifics."

Li Fan pretended to ponder for a moment, then said, "How about this: I’ll make some preparations first. When it’s time to officially start the work, I’ll contact you, Fellow Daoist Zhou!"

Zhou Kebao patted his chest and readily agreed, "No problem! Acting Island Master Li, whatever you need, just say the word. I’ll fully cooperate to ensure we carry out the task entrusted by Master Jinglun perfectly."

Li Fan didn’t respond to his flattery. He merely gave Zhou Kebao a cold, piercing look for a moment.

Then, with a sweep of his sleeve, he left, flying away from the Dust-Crossing Boat.

As Li Fan’s figure gradually disappeared into the distance, the smile on Zhou Kebao’s face slowly faded, replaced with disdain and mockery.

"Let’s see how you handle things in half a year..." he muttered coldly. He took out a communication talisman, and after contacting someone, he relayed everything that had transpired.

Zhou Kebao, thinking he had Li Fan tightly in his grasp and victory within reach, would never have imagined that his every move was being monitored by Li Fan through a heaven-wide omniscient view granted by a formless killing intent.

"As expected, there’s a traitor..."

"It seems I can’t count on help from Jinglun’s faction. If I want to rebuild the Immortal City, I’ll have to rely on the people under my control."

Returning to the Island of Shenhua, Li Fan glanced at Tian Yang, who was standing by and watching the children from Outer realm, and felt slightly reassured.

"With Tian Yang, who possesses Soul Transformation strength, guarding the area, at least we can keep petty troublemakers at bay."

"But it’s still not enough..."

Li Fan took out a glowing jade token, engraved with the character "Ten Thousand," and began to sense it carefully.

This was the Island Lord’s token, given to him alongside the letter of appointment as acting Island Lord.

Aside from symbolizing his authority, its most significant function was that it allowed him to view and contact all the official cultivators under his jurisdiction.

A vast network of interpersonal relationships instantly emerged in Li Fan’s mind.

At the top, of course, was himself.

Below him, the cultivators were divided into various departments: the Formation Hall, Martial Arts Hall, Tianji Hall, and the guards of various islands, as well as external personnel from different departments.

Each node represented a cultivator.

By focusing on a single node, Li Fan could view the basic information of the corresponding cultivator and directly contact them.

"So, the number of official cultivators in the Congyun Sea is actually this large..."

Li Fan couldn’t help but feel slightly amazed.

Aside from the usual positions, there were some strange and obscure roles he had never heard of.

For example, the "Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance Congyun Sea Cultivator Feedback Collection Specialist," the "Shilin State Liaison to Congyun Sea," and the "Earth Vein Supervisor."

One face after another appeared in his mind.

Li Fan had encountered many of these people before. He had always assumed they were just ordinary wandering cultivators, not realizing they held official positions.

Most of the nodes had dimmed, indicating that these cultivators had either perished or were out of contact.

But the number of active cultivators remaining was still quite substantial.

"It seems the main force for rebuilding the Immortal City will have to come from this group."

"However, the quality of these people varies greatly, and I only know most of them in passing. How can I select the right ones?"

Li Fan frowned, eliminating from consideration the cultivators who had already been captured by the Five Elders Association.

He carefully reviewed the remaining cultivators.

Suddenly, his gaze paused on one of the cultivators.

"Hmm, this person..."

An idea instantly formed in Li Fan’s mind.

---

In a hidden cave somewhere in the Congyun Sea.

Gao Yuan, who had been in seclusion, suddenly woke up from a nightmare.

The other day, the Five Elders Association had attacked the Congyun Sea, forcibly taking the Ten Thousand Immortals Island and causing the deaths of hundreds of cultivators.

Gao Yuan had narrowly escaped the disaster by being away on business at the time.

However, the terrifying scene of those cultivators’ deaths had burned into his mind, becoming his inner demon.

"I didn’t expect the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance to be so incompetent. They couldn’t even defend an Immortal City from being taken, and instead, they locked down the Congyun Sea and vented their frustrations on their own people."

"And to think I’ve been loyally guarding the gates of the Ministry of Governance for decades..."

"Maybe I should join the Five Elders Association instead..."

Wiping the cold sweat from his forehead, Gao Yuan couldn’t help but think this way.

Just then, the official communication talisman, which he had assumed would never activate again, suddenly lit up.

Gao Yuan’s heart raced. He thought his treacherous thoughts had been discovered so quickly.

But when he nervously picked up the talisman and checked it, his face showed an odd expression of excitement.

"Acting Island Master Li Fan?"

Chapter 499: The Taste of Power

Li Fan briefly explained the matter of rebuilding the Immortal City of Congyun Sea to him and invited him for a meeting. His tone was friendly, without any hint of the authority of an island lord. This made Gao Yuan feel a bit flattered.

Having spent most of his life working hard on Ten Thousand Immortals Island, Gao Yuan knew that these so-called "acting" or "deputy" roles were often harder to deal with than those officially appointed. Although he didn’t know why this well-known cultivator from the Heavenly Mechanism Sect had chosen him, Gao Yuan knew he was currently his top direct superior and dared not neglect him.

Quickly tidying up, Gao Yuan hurried to the agreed meeting location. As for defecting... that was nothing but idle complaints. Defecting was impossible. Not to mention the immense risk involved, Gao Yuan was, after all, a part of the system within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance. If he were to defect to the Five Elders Association, would his life really be better without any special skills? Most likely, after all the valuable information in his head had been extracted, he would be discarded, ignored, and forgotten.

He wasn’t that foolish.

Suppressing his scattered thoughts, Gao Yuan pondered the reason this newly appointed acting island lord wanted to meet him as he made his way to the location. After a while, he finally arrived.

Tai'an Island.

The island's protective formation opened, revealing a passage, and Gao Yuan flew inside.

As he entered, he saw the acting island lord, Li Fan, sitting in front. Next to him, the guard of Tai'an Island, Zhou Qingang, stood nervously, sweating profusely, looking visibly tense.

The two seemed to have been discussing some sensitive topic but stopped when they saw Gao Yuan arrive. Seeing this, Gao Yuan couldn't help but feel a pang of apprehension.

The guard of Tai'an Island had a position one rank higher than Gao Yuan. Yet even he was so flustered in front of Li Fan. It seemed that this ancient Heavenly Mechanism Sect cultivator was not going to be easy to deal with.

Gao Yuan, who had seen many people in his life, immediately became more cautious. He stepped forward, bowed, and greeted Li Fan.

"Greetings, Island Lord!"

"You're here," Li Fan said, smiling kindly at Gao Yuan.

"Do you know why I called you here?" Li Fan asked.

Gao Yuan was puzzled but respectfully replied, "I do not know, my lord."

"I heard you were stationed at the gates of the Administrative Hall before?" Li Fan asked after a brief silence, just as Gao Yuan was starting to feel uneasy.

"Yes, my lord," Gao Yuan answered respectfully, though he knew it was a rhetorical question.

"How long have you been in service?"

"Ninety-eight years and counting."

"A hundred years pass by in the blink of an eye. You've worked hard."

"After a century in the same post without any transfers, have you ever felt any resentment?" Li Fan asked.

"I dare not," Gao Yuan said, feeling a twinge of anxiety as he quickly shook his head, expressing his loyalty.

"Good," Li Fan nodded in approval, then got to the point.

"Every cultivator in the system must undergo the test at the White Jade Heart-Questioning Platform in the Administrative Hall when they join. Routine tasks also often require going to the Administrative Hall. So, you must have some understanding of the cultivators within the Congyun Sea system, right?" Li Fan asked.

"I wouldn't dare boast, my lord. But I am familiar with the basic information," Gao Yuan replied, carefully observing Li Fan before adding, "At the very least, I won't mistake anyone's identity. Also, I know who has a good temper, who has a powerful background, and who shouldn't be offended. These things I make sure to understand."

"In our lowly positions, if we don't watch our step and offend the wrong people, the consequences won’t be pleasant."

"Good. I want you to help me identify which of these cultivators are useful!" Li Fan ignored Gao Yuan's complaints and with a wave of his hand, a mass of cultivators' portraits, like a cluster of stars, appeared densely in front of Gao Yuan.

"Useful people?" Gao Yuan was momentarily stunned.

But remembering that Li Fan had mentioned the grand task of rebuilding the Immortal City, his heart began to race.

"You know, I've only just awakened recently, and I'm not familiar with the personnel in Congyun Sea," Li Fan said quietly from the front. "Being suddenly entrusted with such a great responsibility makes me nervous. I'm afraid of messing things up.

"As the saying goes, to accomplish great things, you must first sharpen your tools. To successfully complete this task, I need a strong team.

"Since you're somewhat familiar with them, why not give me some advice?

"Once the Immortal City is founded, your contributions will not be forgotten!"

Hearing this, Gao Yuan felt his throat go dry. Looking at the cultivators he once had to carefully serve, now standing before him, he realized he could decide their fates with a single word.

Once, he could only look up to them. But now, he could easily determine their futures. Just one word from him, and they could join the new island lord’s team for achieving greatness.

...

"So this is the taste of power?" His heart began to race uncontrollably, his face flushed, and he was filled with a sense of exhilaration. However, he did not let this fleeting sense of false glory cloud his judgment.

He knew full well that the little "power" he held was all granted by the island lord in front of him. Until the Immortal City was built, all of this was just a castle in the air—beautiful, but fragile and prone to collapse at any moment.

But if the Immortal City was successfully built, then this power would become real. The feeling of being able to control destiny at will was so intoxicating that Gao Yuan found it hard to resist after tasting it for the first time.
