He silently swore to himself that he would do everything he could to seize this rare opportunity and transform his career.

He then proceeded to review the list of cultivators one by one, introducing each of them in detail to Li Fan.

Time passed slowly.

Li Fan listened patiently to Gao Yuan's detailed introductions, feeling more and more surprised as time went on. This seemingly ordinary gatekeeper, whom he had only encountered by chance during his entry into the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, was far more capable than he had expected.

Not only did he know every cultivator’s basic details, but he was also aware of their temperaments and the complex relationships they might have behind the scenes.

"Turns out I’ve found a real treasure," Li Fan thought.

As Gao Yuan's introduction deepened, Li Fan grew increasingly satisfied with him.

"Even small figures have their uses. This could be the key to breaking the stalemate," he thought.

One by one, the suitable cultivators were selected and remembered by Li Fan.

...

Half a month later.

All surviving cultivators within the Congyun Sea system received a message from the acting island lord.

Seven days later, a ceremony for the rebuilding of Congyun Sea Immortal City would be held at the original site of Ten Thousand Immortals Island.

Everyone was required to attend on time.

Chapter 500: Congratulations to Island Lord Li

The name of Li Fan was one that everyone had heard of.

However, very few people knew that he had been appointed as the acting Island lord.

Thus, when they received the notification, everyone was taken aback.

Then, a sense of dissatisfaction grew in their hearts.

Although Master Li had the ability to deduce the workings of fate, at the end of the day, he was only at the Golden Core stage. There were many Nascent Soul cultivators who had survived in the Congyun Sea, so why was he made the Island lord?

The public knew that Li Fan was quite wealthy—could he have bought his way into this position?

And with such high profile behavior, organizing a grand reconstruction ceremony...

Various thoughts surged through their minds.

However, regardless of their thoughts, the position of acting Island lord was issued and certified by the headquarters of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance. Even if some held disdain in their hearts, they dared not defy the order.

So, most people awaited the day with a sense of curiosity, ready to see what would happen.

Soon, seven days passed, and the cultivators of the Congyun Sea gathered at the old site of the Ten Thousand Immortal Island.

Even some who were not part of the formal system heard the news and came to join in the excitement.

As people conversed with each other, they gazed at the bottomless black hole in the sea, reminiscing about the past events of Ten Thousand Immortal Island, feeling deeply moved.

As time passed, more and more cultivators arrived to witness the ceremony.

But Li Fan, the star of the event, was still nowhere to be seen.

Naturally, this stirred some murmurs among the crowd.

At that moment, a beam of light flew in from the distance, catching everyone's attention.

“To congratulate Daoist Li Fan on his appointment as acting Island Lord of Ten Thousand Immortal Island, (Oracle)-Shen Yuzi of Tianyun Prefecture presents a scroll of the 'Tianyun Pill Scripture' as a token of goodwill!”

A handsome boy, holding a dust whisk, floated in the air above the crowd and announced this.

He tossed the scroll upwards, and as the crowd gasped in awe, the scroll expanded into a long dragon-like figure, spiraling through the sky.

Seven-colored light continuously radiated from the scroll, and then, in front of everyone, the 'Tianyun Pill Scripture' disappeared.

The boy bowed slightly toward the void, ignoring the crowd below, and turned into a beam of light, flying off into the distance.

“Fellow Daoists, look quickly! Doesn’t this place seem different from before?”

“Of course! It's said that the Tianyun Pill Scripture can gather luck and change one's fate. With this treasure's blessing, the reconstruction of the immortal city is bound to succeed!”

“Wow... But who is this Shen Yuzi? Such a precious treasure, and he gave it away so casually?”

The onlookers started discussing excitedly.

Before they could calm down, another beam of light came from the horizon.

“To congratulate... Daoist Jingxuan of Tianyun Prefecture presents the 'Sea-Calming Azure Bull' as a token of goodwill!”

A young Daoist appeared before the crowd, leading a blue ox.

The ox let out a soft cry, and its body instantly grew to the size of a massive mountain.

“Moo!”

Its cry echoed across the Congyun Sea, transforming into green light that spread out to the farthest corners of the sea.

“Such a grand gesture! With this treasure, the Congyun Sea will be calm for at least three years!” A knowledgeable cultivator couldn't help but exclaim.

“And what’s the relationship between Daoist Jingxuan and Island Lord Li?”

As the crowd was filled with surprise and curiosity, more beams of light continued to arrive, delivering various gifts.

Guangwu from Tianquan Prefecture, Huangfu Song from Tianyu Prefecture...

These were all powerful cultivators from the core regions of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance.

“At the very least, these people are at the Soul Transformation stage...” After some investigation, the cultivators present couldn’t help but be secretly amazed.

“It seems that our Island Lord has some deep connections. No wonder he was entrusted with this position, despite only being at the Golden Core stage.”

“Not necessarily. These people didn’t show up in person; they just sent subordinates to deliver gifts. Maybe our Island Lord paid for them to come and put on a show!” However, there were still those who remained skeptical.

As the continuous flow of gifts gradually subsided, the crowd began to think that Li Fan would soon make his appearance.

Suddenly, a magnificent flying ship broke through the sky.

Thirty-six Nascent Soul cultivators cleared the way, as a young cultivator with sharp features and an extraordinary aura, dressed in white, slowly descended.

“Tianshu Prefecture’s Tantai Can congratulates Island Lord Li Fan!”

The thirty-six Nascent Soul cultivators spoke in unison, their voices reverberating through the air.

This sight left the cultivators of Congyun Sea completely speechless.

“Tantai Can? From the Tantai clan?!”

Those familiar with the Tantai clan's background were utterly shocked.

Even those who didn’t know who Tantai Can was were awestruck by the spectacle of thirty-six Nascent Soul cultivators leading the way.

From a distant skyship, Zhou Kebao stood up in disbelief as he witnessed the scene unfold.

“Tantai Can? Why is he here?” His eyes were filled with confusion. “This doesn’t make any sense!”

After a long pause, a flash of fear crossed Zhou Kebao’s face.

“Could it be that this is all part of a bigger plot?”

With growing unease, Zhou Kebao quickly took out a communication talisman to inform his allies of the sudden development.

...

With Tantai Can's arrival, the atmosphere reached its peak.

At this point, it was time for Li Fan to finally appear.

“Boom!”

“Boom!”

Loud booming sounds echoed from the distance, as if a colossal beast from ancient times was rapidly approaching.

“Look over there! What is that?” A sharp-eyed cultivator noticed something unusual in the direction of the noise.

A towering stone giant appeared on the horizon.

Standing in the middle of the Congyun Sea, the water barely reached its lower legs.

Despite its massive size, the stone giant moved with astonishing speed.

Crossing the sea in just a few steps, it caused tremors throughout the Congyun Sea with each step.

In no time, the stone giant had arrived at the old site of Ten Thousand Immortal Island.

The cultivators, unsure of what was happening, assumed it was a sneak attack by the Five Elders Association and immediately tensed up.

Sensing the immense aura radiating from the stone giant, their faces turned pale.

“A peak Soul Transformation cultivator?”

As the stone giant drew closer, the overwhelming pressure caused some cultivators to pull out their magical artifacts in preparation.

At that moment, led by Gao Yuan, He Zhenghao, and Zhou Qingang, over a hundred cultivators flew out in perfect synchronization, as if they had rehearsed this many times.

They all bowed toward the massive stone giant. “Welcome, Island Lord!”

“Hahaha, no need for such formalities!” A hearty laugh rang out from atop the giant's head.

Only then did the crowd realize that a cultivator stood atop the head of the Soul Transformation-stage stone giant.

That cultivator was none other than Li Fan!

To have a Soul Transformation True Monarch willingly let a Golden Core cultivator stand on his head...

This was definitely not something that could be achieved with mere contributions.

The fact that powerful cultivators from the core of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance would help him, and even Soul Transformation cultivators would bow to him...

Just what kind of background did Island Lord Li Fan have?

Even the usually calm Tantai Can, who had maintained a composed expression throughout, now showed a flicker of emotion in his eyes as he gazed at Li Fan from above.

---

Chapter 501: Skillful Use of Influence to Resolve Crisis

The enormous stone figure extended its right hand, and Li Fan flew into its palm.

Afterward, the stone figure held him up, presenting him before the crowd.

Li Fan surveyed the vast number of cultivators gathered, his expression solemn, and said, "Not long ago, I was honored by a senior and entrusted with the position of acting Island Lord, tasked with rebuilding Congyun Immortal City."

"I am naturally inclined toward a carefree life, but this sudden heavy responsibility has left me feeling overwhelmed."

"However, I dare not betray the trust of the Immortal Alliance and the senior. Thus, I made a military pledge before Lord Jinglun to rebuild the Immortal City within six months."

"The time is short, and the task is heavy. But I believe that with the collective efforts of us cultivators in Congyun Sea, we can certainly complete this mission successfully."

"To have an Immortal City of an entire region captured is truly unheard of!"

Li Fan pointed to the massive empty pit below and said, "As long as this ruin remains, it is a mark of shame on the faces of us Congyun Sea cultivators!"

"I hope all of you will join me in washing away this disgrace!"

After speaking, Li Fan bowed deeply to the crowd.

The cultivators were visibly moved. Whether out of genuine respect or forced courtesy, they returned the gesture.

"When the rebuilding of the Immortal City is complete, I will be here again, to reward merit and punish wrongdoing, and to celebrate with you all!"

Li Fan stood up straight and spoke aloud.

His voice echoed far and wide, lingering in the air for a long time.

The crowd gazed at Li Fan, their expressions varied.

"Gao yuan!"

After a moment of silence, Li Fan suddenly called out.

"Here I am!" Gao yuan, his face flushed with excitement, flew out.

"Announce the personnel orders for the reconstruction of the Immortal City," Li Fan instructed.

"Yes!"

Gao yuan proudly glanced around, cleared his throat, and took out a scroll from his storage ring, imbuing his voice with spiritual power to read aloud:

"Liuli Island's Warden He Zhenghao is appointed Chief Inspector, overseeing all matters related to material allocation and consumption in the rebuilding of the Immortal City."

"Haitong Island's Warden Pei Tuo is appointed Chief Commander, responsible for all security matters during the rebuilding of the Immortal City."

"Tai'an Island's Warden Zhou Qing'ang is appointed Chief Coordinator, handling communication between various departments during the reconstruction."

...

As the personnel orders were read one after another, the expressions of the cultivators present subtly changed.

They realized that the individuals named were precisely the group of people who had just stood up to greet Li Fan.

Everyone suddenly understood.

So, these people already knew that Li Fan had been appointed as acting Island Lord, and had pledged their allegiance early on?

And Li Fan was being blatantly biased in his appointments, not even trying to hide it!

Look at He Zhenghao, Pei Tuo, and Zhou Qing'ang—at best, they are only at the peak of the Golden Core stage.

Their status is even higher than some Nascent Soul cultivators—does that seem right?

Though many were silently grumbling, they couldn't help but feel a sense of regret for not acting more shrewdly and earlier.

After the announcements were complete, Gao yuan returned to the crowd, and Li Fan smiled and said, "Rebuilding the Immortal City is an enormous undertaking. I am sure I have overlooked many things."

"Moreover, Congyun Sea is rich with talent, and some may have been missed. Therefore, I appoint Gao yuan as the Chief Attendant. Anyone willing to volunteer and contribute to the reconstruction can seek him out."

With these words, the cultivators, who had been somewhat displeased with missing out on the earlier opportunities, suddenly became eager again.

"Everyone!" Li Fan concluded.

"The Five Elders Association's raid has dealt a devastating blow to us in Congyun Sea."

"The Island’s Administrative Hall, Formation Hall, Martial Hall..."

"Almost everything was wiped out! This has left numerous positions vacant, and we can't even handle our regular affairs properly."

At this point, Li Fan paused briefly.

He sighed and scanned the crowd, speaking with hopeful anticipation, "I look forward to seeing all of you work hard to restore the former glory of Congyun Sea!"

The cultivators weren't sure if Congyun Sea had any "glory" to restore, but Li Fan's meaning was crystal clear:

Due to the Five Elders Association's attack, there are many vacant positions on the island! I only have about a hundred people under me, and they can't fill all the gaps! If you have the ability, now is your chance! Don’t wait—once the Immortal City is rebuilt in six months, it’ll be too late!

Everyone had a moment of realization.

Indeed, the current positions are nothing more than temporary "titles" created for the sake of rebuilding the city.

What’s a Chief Commander or Chief Inspector? They sound impressive, but their authority is granted solely by Li Fan, the acting Island Lord.

When the Immortal City is rebuilt, these positions will lose all significance.

It’s Li Fan’s talk of "rewarding merit and punishing wrongdoing" that’s the real deal.

If one can make a notable contribution during the reconstruction process and secure a position within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's formal structure...

At this thought, many cultivators felt their hearts race with excitement.

The entrance exams for the Alliance are notoriously difficult, and once in, advancing through the ranks is even harder.

Island Lord Li is right! This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity!

Many cultivators quietly turned their gaze toward Gao yuan, already calculating how to curry favor with this close confidant of Li Fan.

After some more words of encouragement to the crowd, Li Fan announced the end of the ceremony and that the official rebuilding of the Immortal City would commence the next day.

Tantai Can, who was aboard the flying boat, saw this and left without waiting for the crowd to disperse or even saying goodbye to Li Fan, flying away directly.

Judging by his expression, he seemed quite upset.

However, most cultivators were too engrossed in their ambitions to notice.

Li Fan watched Tantai Can’s figure disappear into the distance and sneered inwardly.

The cultivators present had guessed right—Shen yuzi, Jing Xuan, Guang Wu, and Huangfu Song had all been invited by Li Fan through his contributions.

As for this rising star from the Tantai clan, Li Fan had no personal relationship with him, and there was even some hidden animosity. He certainly couldn’t be swayed by mere contributions.

The only reason Tantai Can had come to celebrate Li Fan today was because of a contract he was forced to sign with Jiao Xiuyuan during the recent Samantabhadra True Leaf incident.

The contract required him to agree to three requests within his ability.

So, even though Tantai Can tried to hinder Li Fan behind the scenes, he had no choice but to show up and offer his congratulations.

For someone as proud as him, this must have been humiliating.

Naturally, he wouldn’t tell anyone about it.

Thus, in the eyes of certain people, Tantai Can’s actions seemed quite contradictory and strange.

As for his deteriorating relationship with Tantai Can, Li Fan didn’t care at all.

After all, he would have to abandon his identity as a cultivator of the Heavenly Mechanism Sect sooner or later. One more grudge wouldn’t matter.

What mattered now was the successful rebuilding of Congyun Immortal City.

Although he had managed to use influence to gather support and resolve the issue of having no one to rely on...

There was still a pressing problem, one that could prove fatal.

Li Fan recalled Jiao Xiuyuan’s words: "The materials on the list are sufficient to successfully construct a floating Immortal City."

"But..."

"That's assuming everything goes perfectly, with no mistakes."

"In reality, the construction process almost always involves some material losses due to errors."

"Some materials are easy to deal with; I can sell them to you through certain channels at a lower price."

"But some special materials are strictly controlled by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and can’t be bought, even with contribution points."

Chapter 502: A Chaotic, Disorganized Mess

"Even Jiao Xiuyuan said so. It seems that obtaining these strategic resources from the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance through regular means is truly impossible," Li Fan thought to himself.

He was well aware that rebuilding an entire floating immortal city was an immense project, and it was impossible to achieve without any losses. The city itself was like a massive, intricate machine, where missing a few key components might prevent the whole thing from functioning properly. Even if he could find a way to cover it up, those lurking in the shadows would likely report him.

So...

"Only the one who tied the bell can untie it," Li Fan's eyes narrowed.

Those behind this plot had targeted him for either revenge or profit. However, they surely didn’t want the situation to escalate to the point where it attracted the attention of higher authorities. The reconstruction of the Congyun Immortal City was a top priority for the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, and no one could defy that order.

However, who handled the actual work was a matter that concerned Li Fan and his followers’ future prospects.

"The missing materials from the resource list must still be with Zhou Kebao and his group. Now, I need to figure out a way to make them cough it up," Li Fan thought, activating his hidden killing intent as he fixed his gaze on Zhou Kebao.

---

In a dim room aboard the Dust-Crossing Boat.

Zhou Kebao was pacing anxiously back and forth. In front of him, a shimmering light flickered, its shape unclear. Soon after, the light stopped moving, and a few figures appeared.

"So, what did Tantai Can say?" Zhou Kebao asked urgently.

"The message was sent, but there was no response."

"No reply at all."

"It was outright rejected!"

Different voices spoke up immediately.

Zhou Kebao's face flushed deep red with anger, almost as if he were about to explode. However, after trembling slightly, he managed to hold his tongue.

After a moment of silence, one of the figures across from him couldn't help but ask, "What is Tantai Can up to?"

"Yeah, he was the one who incited us to act earlier. Why has he suddenly changed his mind and sided with Li Fan?"

"Enough! Stop arguing!" A deep, commanding voice suddenly interrupted the bickering.

The speaker seemed to hold considerable authority, as the other cultivators immediately fell silent when he spoke.

"From what I can see, it seems we've fallen into Tantai Can's trap," he analyzed calmly. "First, he used the tens of millions of contribution points on Li Fan as bait to lure us in. After we spent a fortune to clear the so-called ‘connections’ he provided, thinking we could force Li Fan into submission, he then turned around and betrayed us."

Zhou Kebao slammed his hand down on the table. "That doesn't make sense! What does Tantai Can stand to gain from this? We may not be able to compare to the Tantai clan, but united, we're not easy to mess with either! Why would he deliberately make so many enemies?"

His words were met with nods of agreement, as everyone clearly struggled to understand Tantai Can’s actions.

"Maybe he doesn't want to oppose us; maybe he's trying to completely subdue us!" A figure suddenly interjected.

"I heard that not long ago, during the Samantabhadra True Leaf incident, Tantai Can was publicly criticized by the Immortal Lord Li Ruo. Recently, his status within the family has been very shaky. Some of his former advisors have even switched allegiance to other members of the Tantai clan."

"Given that, he must be trying every possible way to secure his position. And so, he’s set his sights on us."

The room fell into deep contemplation as everyone considered this new possibility.

"Indeed! Looking at it now, his plan has been quite successful. We've gotten ourselves into a situation where we can't back down. Our plan to use the Congyun Immortal City's reconstruction timeline to pressure Li Fan has clearly failed. Li Fan and Tantai Can are in league with each other, and the materials we've siphoned off probably aren't something he’s lacking."

"Dao Transmission Spirit Bones, Tianxuan Crystal Shards, Nether Transformation Ancient Wood..."

"These are items strictly prohibited for personal use. It's fine if we hold onto them for a short time, but if we're caught with them later..." Zhou Kebao shuddered.

"We'd like to sell them, but these materials have no use outside of city construction!"

"And aside from the Congyun Sea, where else is there a suspended city under construction?"

"That sly Tantai Can! It won't be long before he comes knocking on our door to threaten us."

"Ugh, that’s likely. After all, skimming construction materials and bribery are things that can't be exposed."

The more they discussed it, the more anxious everyone became.

Once again, the authoritative voice spoke up to calm the group.

"Don't panic. The situation isn't as bad as we’re imagining. This is all just speculation for now. We might be scaring ourselves over nothing."

"Let's do this: since we can't get in touch with Tantai Can, let's start by probing Li Fan. See if we can figure out what’s really going on."

Zhou Kebao nodded upon hearing this.

"Even though this man is an ancient cultivator, he's quite mysterious. Despite only being at the Golden Core stage, he's stirred up quite the storm and gotten involved with many long-established Soul Transformation cultivators. We can't take him lightly," the person cautioned.

"Don't worry, Daoist Long, I understand," Zhou Kebao promised.

The light gradually dissipated, and Li Fan withdrew his gaze.

"So, just a disorganized rabble," he chuckled to himself.

He began contemplating how to peel another layer off these people.

---

Zhou Kebao's patience exceeded Li Fan's expectations.

As the reconstruction of Congyun Immortal City proceeded in full force, and more than ten supporting cultivators from the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance headquarters had arrived, Zhou Kebao still hadn't tested Li Fan.

He merely went about his daily routine, greeting Li Fan as if nothing were amiss.

If it weren’t for the clear records in the Dao Stone in his mind, Li Fan might have thought it was all an illusion.

But Li Fan’s patience was equally unyielding.

"No rush. I'll play along for now," he thought.

With over four months left before the deadline for the city’s completion, Li Fan could afford to wait.

Through Jiao Xiuyuan, he replenished the necessary materials, so the basic construction of the city proceeded without delay.

The primary buildings, such as the long-distance teleportation formation, the Tianxuan Mirror, and the Hall of Administration, would be constructed last.

And there was still enough material for at least one trial-and-error attempt.

So, Li Fan was in no hurry.

At the same time, he hadn't forgotten the task given to him by Lord Jinglun: to build the Xuantian Nether-Lock Formation into the foundation of the city.

Li Fan's skills in array formations had improved considerably, and he had even participated in the construction of the Tianxuan Spirit Locking Formation, giving him far greater insight than the average cultivator.

In the formation diagram of

the 'Xuantian Nether-Lock Formation', he could clearly see traces of the Tianxuan Spirit Locking Formation's design.

Chapter 503: Constrained in Body and Mind

The underlying structure of the formation differed, but the sense of confinement and sealing everything off was identical.

Li Fan could even make a bold assumption: the inspiration for the Tianxuan Spirit-Locking Formation might very well have come from this 'Xuantian Nether-Locking Formation'.

The term "Xuantian" was hard for Li Fan not to associate with the Xuantian Sect, which had long disappeared in the annals of history.

"Could it be that the strange occurrences in the world can be traced back to the time when the Xuantian Sect still existed?"

"Does this mean that even in the Fallen Immortal Realm, one could encounter strange anomalies?"

Li Fan pondered while studying the formation diagram, his thoughts wandering.

The formation diagram was crafted using some special technique and was encrypted with several restrictions, making it impossible for outsiders to view the complete structure of the Nether-Locking Formation.

It allowed those who were not skilled in formations to operate the formation in a simplified manner, outputting its effects externally.

"This is quite ingenious!" After studying it for a long time, Li Fan temporarily gave up on understanding the full structure of the Nether-Locking Formation and sighed in admiration.

During his routine checks on the progress of the construction, when no one was watching, Li Fan carved the 'Xuantian Nether-Locking Formation' into the gradually forming Congyun Immortal City.

While Li Fan was exhausting his efforts to build the floating city, far away in the "territory of the Five Elders Association", a trace of consciousness attached to a puppet's body was enduring some suffering.

Since arriving at the bamboo hut to listen to the scholar's lectures, more than two months had passed.

He hadn't gained much more insight into the specific situation of the Five Elders Association, but instead had been forced to memorize many legends about cultivators altering the world in the 'Humane Heavenly Domain'.

Wang Linlang loved beauty and swore, "No one in the world shall see white hair." As a result, in the Humane Heavenly Domain, even the elderly mortals had shiny black hair.

Yue Chengjin, abandoned by his lover, grew resentful and cursed, "All lovers shall become siblings." This led to decades of tragic, forbidden love stories. Fortunately, the rule was reversed through the sincere wishes of a truly loving couple.

Qu Su loved fishing but often returned empty-handed, so he made a grand vow: all fish in the world would bite the bait upon seeing it. Thus, everyone became a master angler.

…

There were countless such tales. Initially, they were amusing, but after hearing them continuously for three months, it became unbearable.

Like the other cultivators in front of the bamboo pavilion, Li Fan found that he couldn't control his body.

He couldn't block out the scholar's words and was forced to listen.

Li Fan even realized that everything the scholar said seemed to be deeply engraved in his mind, impossible to forget even if he tried.

Thus, everyone had a resentful look on their faces as they unwillingly accepted the scholar's brainwashing.

Finally, one day, the scholar, who had been lecturing for so long, seemed to feel a bit fatigued.

He stood up and stretched lazily.

"As the saying goes, 'Seeing once is better than hearing a hundred times.' No matter how much I talk, it won't compare to you experiencing it yourselves."

The scholar looked at the cultivators of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance present and smiled kindly. "I will give you three years. During these three years, you may freely visit any place under the jurisdiction of the Five Elders Association."

"After three years, you will return here. At that time, I hope you will tell me your thoughts on the Five Elders Association."

After speaking, the scholar turned and slowly walked into the bamboo house.

As the bamboo door slammed shut, the restrictions binding everyone vanished.

"What does this mean? Are we really free to leave?"

The cultivators of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance were puzzled and hesitant.

"Could this be some kind of trap?"

"You're too jumpy, friend. We are already like fish on the chopping board, ready to be slaughtered. Do they even need to use tricks on us?"

"Hmph! Why belittle ourselves and boost the enemy's morale?"

"Heh, in my opinion, as unpleasant as Brother Lu Fan’s words were, they made sense."

…

Despite their chatter, none of them dared to move or leave the valley.

Li Fan shook his head slightly and ignored them.

He headed straight in the direction he came from, attracting the attention of everyone.

As he moved further away from the bamboo house, his compressed body slowly returned to normal.

Other than that, there was no obstruction.

After exiting the long tunnel and reaching outside the cave, Li Fan noticed that the armored cultivators guarding them earlier were nowhere to be seen.

He soared into the air, trying to locate the Ten Thousand Immortals Island.

But the area where the island once was was now completely empty, without a single trace left behind.

"I wonder if the Five Elders Association has found what they were looking for."

Li Fan scanned the surroundings and couldn't help but feel a sense of loneliness, as vast as the heavens and earth, not knowing where to go.

While feeling melancholic, he suddenly realized something was wrong.

He wasn't the type to indulge in sorrow and sentimentality, so why was he having such thoughts now?

A flash of the scholar's image crossed his mind.

Was it him?

Just as Li Fan was inwardly startled, he suddenly heard someone calling out from afar: "Brother Jiao! Brother Jiao!"

Startled, Li Fan realized they were calling him.

Looking towards the voice, he saw that it was the cultivator named Lu Fan.

"Brother Jiao, where are you headed? Why don’t we travel together?" Lu Fan had exited the cave and quickly found Li Fan, hurriedly catching up.

Seeing that Li Fan was staring at him without responding, Lu Fan explained, "The Five Elders Association’s territory is vast, no less than that of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance. In a foreign land, it would be better to have someone to watch your back."

"I heard that within the Five Elders Association’s domains, the "Carefree Paradise" is the most desirable place. Not only are there incredible pleasures, but there’s also a rare item called the 'Carefree Crystal Grid', which makes you feel as though you're floating like an immortal, ascending to paradise..." Lu Fan spoke excitedly.

Li Fan stared at him for a moment and asked, "As I recall, Brother Lu was once a clerk in the Congyun Sea Administration. Having received the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance’s pay, now that you’re free again, why not think about returning home? Why do you seem so eager to join the Five Elders Association?"

Lu Fan froze at the question.

Cold sweat began to drip from his forehead, and his face turned deathly pale.

Seeing this, Li Fan knew the answer.

"So, it’s the scholar’s doing."

"The Five Elders Association sure knows how to manipulate people’s minds."

Lu Fan muttered to himself, "What a clever trick. If Brother Jiao hadn’t reminded me, I wouldn’t have realized it."

After a moment of reflection, Lu Fan sighed deeply.

"No wonder the Five Elders Association is so confident in letting us go. Even though I now know my thoughts have been influenced, I still can’t change them."

"Even though I know the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance is my home, I can’t bring myself to want to return..."

Lu Fan was rambling, but suddenly realized that Li Fan had already flown far away.

"Brother Jiao, where are you going? Take me with you!"

"To the One-Heart Immortal Sect!" Li Fan replied without looking back.

Chapter 504: First Exploration of the Five Elders Association

The known territories of the Five Elders Association include the four major regions: "Carefree Paradise", "Realm of Reality", "One Heart Immortal Sect", and "Humane Heavenly Domain".

As for the last location, it remains unknown for now.

The scholar who teaches classes has never mentioned it, adding to its mystery.

Currently, it seems that exploring the "Realm of Reality" and "One Heart Immortal Sect" carries the greatest risk. Meanwhile, "Humane Heavenly Domain" and "Carefree Paradise" pose no significant threats.

Li Fan, knowing the danger ahead, deliberately chose to venture into the perilous terrain. Naturally, his actions were influenced by his longstanding admiration for Senior Sister Zhao…

Well, the truth is that the real reason was Li Fan wanted to take advantage of this rare opportunity to control a puppet with a strand of his consciousness and explore the territory of One Heart Heavenly Sovereign.

From his experiences in his previous life, Li Fan learned that under Senior Sister Zhao’s control, individual entities were connected into a unified whole.

This is known as "One Mind, Many as One".

Undoubtedly, when an individual is absorbed or consumed and joins Senior Sister Zhao, their past experiences and memories are shared with the entire collective.

For Li Fan, who possesses the power of the [Truth], this was completely unacceptable.

Thus, from the perspective of his true self, the 'One Heart Immortal Sect' was even more dangerous than the 'Realm of Reality'.

However, if he used this puppet body of Jiao Xiuyuan to explore, the risks would be greatly reduced.

This decision was based on several considerations: according to the scholar’s teachings, not all cultivators within the One Heart Immortal Sect had become part of Senior Sister Zhao. As one of the most formidable hunters in the world, Senior Sister Zhao was quite “picky.” Only the most elite cultivators, selected through rigorous processes, were eligible to enter the so-called 'Immortal Sect'. Even ordinary cultivators were not easily accepted, let alone a puppet body made of wood. Thus, the likelihood of Li Fan being targeted was very low.

Secondly, this puppet was one of Jiao Xiuyuan’s avatars and had a self-destruct mechanism. Even if Senior Sister Zhao, bored with her usual luxurious prey, decided to consume the puppet, what she would ultimately get would only be a piece of dead wood. The consciousness attached to it would have long since dissipated.

However, one should never underestimate the terrifying power of the 'Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign'.

Li Fan rushed northward, reducing the memories in his consciousness along the way. He removed all previous memories, leaving only the thought of "going to the 'One Heart Immortal Sect'."

Naturally, this had a side effect. The consciousness that was already barely controlling the body became even weaker, and the movements became less coordinated. As a result, the puppet of Jiao Xiuyuan appeared extremely wooden and somewhat dull-witted.

However, as long as he could relay his observations to his true self, that would be enough.

Li Fan controlled the puppet body and continued hurrying towards the One Heart Immortal Sect.

“Daoist Jiao, wait for me!” Before long, Lu Fan finally caught up, panting heavily. “After some thought, I’ve decided to go with you.”

“Although there are many rare treasures in Carefree Paradise, seeing the unparalleled Senior Sister Zhao with my own eyes would be quite the experience,” Lu Fan’s eyes flickered with longing.

Li Fan glanced at him indifferently and asked flatly, “Who are you?”

Lu Fan was taken aback.

However, after closely observing Li Fan, who seemed not to be joking, Lu Fan assumed there was something wrong with Jiao Xiuyuan’s puppet. So, he reintroduced himself.

Li Fan only nodded slightly without reducing his speed.

Lu Fan, feeling slightly annoyed, thought it would be rude to go back on his word now that he had already spoken.

The two proceeded silently toward the territory of the One Heart Immortal Sect.

Within the Five Elders Association’s territory, there were naturally teleportation formation, but they were located only in towns within the region. As cultivators of the 'Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance' who hadn’t yet submitted to the Five Elders Association, they had no access to these teleportation formation.

Unlike the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance, the Five Elders Association did not have a centralized immortal city in each state. Instead, they had scattered large towns where both mortals and cultivators coexisted.

These towns were divided into two zones: inner and outer. A circular wall separated the inner city, where cultivators resided, from the outer city, where mortals lived, ensuring that they wouldn’t disturb one another.

Apart from the towns, various mountain caves and sects built by cultivators could be found scattered in the wilderness.

The overall structure was quite similar to the ancient cultivation world.

Though customs differed greatly, the one constant was the 'White Mist Barrier' that separated the states.

Li Fan’s current position was in Humane Heavenly Domain, in the state of Wuding.

Beyond the White Mist Barrier ahead lay the adjacent state of Xuanyin.

To Li Fan’s surprise, there were many people gathered near the White Mist Barrier, shouting as if they were street vendors selling goods.

“Samantabhadra True Boat, 30,000 soul points per boat, buy two, get one free—no worries for large purchases!”

“If you want to cross the White Mist Barrier, come take a look! Only 100 soul points to ride the Samantabhadra True Boat, saving 15 years of lifespan! Just 100 soul points—no scams, no losses!”

“Offering plenty of True Boats for rent, contact us now!”

...

The shouts rose and fell, creating a lively scene much like a mortal market.

Their words caught Lü Fan’s attention.

“Daoist Jiao, come and see! It’s a flying boat entirely made from Samantabhadra True leaves!” Lu Fan exclaimed after inspecting it. Seeing the confused look on Li Fan’s face, he patiently explained, “After the recent craze over the Samantabhadra True Leaf, rumors spread that magic tools made from this material could prevent lifespan loss from the White Mist Barrier. This is why its price didn’t collapse completely.”

“But I’ve never seen such a functional tool before. I didn’t expect the Five Elders Association to have them in abundance...”

Lu Fan hoped for a response from Li Fan, but was met with a blank stare.

Sighing, Lu Fan stopped talking and turned to inquire more from the merchant.

The "soul points" they mentioned were the common currency of the Five Elders Association, similar to the 'contribution points' of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance.

By joining the Five Elders Association, one could receive free cultivation methods, but in exchange, they had to sign a soul contract.

It’s said that after accumulating enough soul points, one could dissolve the contract and regain their freedom.

However, few cultivators ever achieved this.

Most cultivators opted to exchange their soul points for higher-level cultivation methods to strengthen themselves and earn even more soul points.

In the Five Elders Association, contracts governed not just trade but every aspect of life.

Chapter 505: The Sect’s Martial Vault

Chapter 505: The Sect's Martial Vault

In ancient times, cultivators acted without restrictions.

They slaughtered entire regions of living beings to refine magical tools; they destroyed mountains, boiled seas, burned forests, and sank lands; they broke promises, acted deceitfully, robbed, and killed purely for profit...

Such behaviors were commonplace.

The reason for this lay in the fact that as a cultivator's realm increased and their strength grew, the fewer restrictions they faced.

For instance, a Soul Transformation cultivator might covet a rare treasure that a Foundation Establishment cultivator had obtained by chance. It would be incredibly easy for them to kill the Foundation Establishment cultivator and claim the treasure for themselves. In such cases, how many would opt to obtain the treasure through "trade"?

Similarly, when a Foundation Establishment cultivator is confronted by a Soul Transformation cultivator, who is exponentially stronger than them, would they dare refuse a "trade"? If the Soul Transformation cultivator were to break their promise, there would be nothing the weaker party could do except swallow their anger, and perhaps even be thankful that their life was spared.

When the two parties are so unequal, fairness in trade cannot even be discussed.

However, within the Five Elders Association, and throughout the entire Xuanhuang Realm, this dynamic has changed completely.

This is due to the existence of various contracts.

The 'Soul Contracts' signed by cultivators of the Five Elders Association, the 'Trade Contracts' that Li Fan has used many times, and the special golden contracts for buying and selling cultivation methods...

These omnipresent mysterious powers truly restrain cultivators.

Even cultivators at the Dao Integration stage cannot defy the power of these contracts. Once signed, they must be obeyed.

Under the drive of these contracts, order has been established.

If the "Tianxuan Mirror"  and the "Law Derivation Jade" form the foundation of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, then "contracts" are the lifeblood of the Five Elders Association.

Now, let's talk about 'Soul Points'. Soul Points are essentially a special form of energy hidden deep within the soul, sustained by the power of contracts.

Besides being used for everyday transactions, Soul Points have a special purpose: they can be spent to access the "Immortal Sect's Martial Vault".

In this vault, you can exchange for a vast array of ancient cultivation methods, texts, and treasures, which originated from ancient immortal sects.

What's even more noteworthy is that within the vault, there are authentic recreations of ancient sects from the distant past.

These real-life recreations are created by a force similar to the "Fallen Immortal Realm". Here, cultivators can explore and visit many ancient sects that have long since perished. These sects also contain the images of many ancient cultivators. Though most of these figures lack their original consciousness, they still possess bodies. In combat, their every move carries power nearly identical to that of a real person.

Cultivators of the Five Elders Association can consume Soul Points to spar repeatedly with these ancient figures, enhancing their own combat abilities. In the 'Immortal Sect's Martial Vault', any injuries sustained will not affect the physical body in reality, only causing minor soul injuries. The beauty of it is that these soul injuries can also be healed by spending Soul Points.

In theory, if someone had enough Soul Points, even a mortal who has just started cultivating could become incredibly powerful after participating in many such battles.

Thanks to the binding power of the Soul Contracts, the Five Elders Association doesn't need to suppress the combat strength of ordinary cultivators, unlike the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Of course, none of this comes for free—it’s up to the cultivator to earn it.

At the border of Wuding Prefecture, near the White Mist Barrier, Lu Fan gazed longingly at the various 'Samantabhadra True Boats'. Unfortunately, he wasn't a member of the Five Elders Association and had no Soul Points, so he could only look on with envy.

At that moment, a vendor approached and struck up a conversation: "Fellow Daoists, you must be from the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and haven’t joined our Five Elders Association yet, right?"

Lu Fan’s face changed slightly upon hearing this. He scanned his surroundings cautiously, lowered his voice, and nodded: "That's right. How should I address you, and how did you figure that out?"

The vendor led the two to his stall and said, "No need to be so nervous. I’m Gu Binliang, and I specialize in trading."

"As for how I knew..." Gu Binliang smiled slightly, "The feeling is entirely different between those who have and haven't signed a "Soul Contract". And I recently heard that a batch of Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance cultivators was captured and is being 'converted.' That's why I made this guess."

Seeing Lu Fan still tense, Gu Binliang continued, "In fact, most members of the Five Elders Association don’t harbor any ill will toward you Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance cultivators. After all, there have been plenty of cases where captured cultivators were 'converted,' had a change of heart, saw the reality of things, and eventually became members of our Five Elders Association."

"And these individuals are often more loyal than ordinary members!"

Lu Fan’s expression turned sour upon hearing this.

Gu Binliang, an expert at reading people, immediately changed the subject: "Are you perhaps interested in a Samantabhadra True Boat but frustrated by the lack of Soul Points?"

"That's correct," Lu Fan admitted.

"That's not a problem. While you may not have Soul Points, surely you have some standard spirit stones on hand, right?" Gu Binliang said with a smile.

"I do have some," Lu Fan said with a trace of excitement, but a moment later, confusion flickered across his face. "Does the Five Elders Association also accept these spirit stones?"

Gu Binliang chuckled. "Since they are standardized spirit stones, they are jointly produced by both the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association. However, most Five Elders Association cultivators don’t use them, as converting them to Soul Points is a bit troublesome. So they don't accept them."

"But for me, it doesn't matter. As a true businessman, I need a fair amount of these spirit stones for transactions," Gu Binliang explained.

"A true businessman..." Lu Fan immediately understood Gu Binliang's meaning. "Then, please get me a Samantabhadra True Boat."

With a wave of Gu Binliang's hand, dozens of miniature flying boats appeared before Lu Fan.

He enthusiastically explained the differences between them.

Before long, the two completed a smooth transaction.

Just as Lu Fan was about to leave, Gu Binliang stopped him: "Do you happen to have any items lying around? In the Five Elders Association’s territory, lacking Soul Points can be quite inconvenient. I can exchange Soul Points with you."

As he spoke, Gu Binliang pulled out a small, indistinct figurine.

"This is an 'Manifested Worldly Heavenly Sovereign Statue' It can store Soul Points, and even if you’re not a member of the Five Elders Association, you can use it to trade with other cultivators."

Lu Fan was intrigued.

He began rummaging through his storage ring. Gu Binliang was willing to buy anything Lu Fan offered for sale.

When the Manifested Worldly Heavenly Sovereign Statue had accumulated fifty thousand Soul Points, Lu Fan finally ran out of things he was willing to part with.

"If you need anything in the future, feel free to find me," Gu Binliang said with a cheerful smile, handing over a communication talisman.

Chapter 506: Where to Find the Immortal Sect

The style of this communication talisman is almost indistinguishable from those of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance.

Lu Fan carefully put it away and then, accompanied by Li Fan, who seemed to be in a daze, piloted the Samantabhadra True Boat and charged into the white mist barrier.

Surrounded by a blanket of whiteness, no matter how fast they traveled, their vision couldn’t penetrate the mist.

Inside the flying boat, Lu Fan had his eyes slightly closed, as if sensing something.

When the Samantabhadra True Boat finally broke through the Essence-Devouring White Mist, he excitedly opened his eyes: “The loss of life force has been reduced from about fifteen days to just one day. It's almost negligible! This is truly worth more than its weight in gold!”

“With this item, the white mist barrier will no longer be an obstacle for us cultivators. The world is vast, and now we can explore it freely without worrying about losing our lifespan.”

Lu Fan couldn’t help but show a trace of regret: “It’s a pity that the principle behind this thing was first discovered by our Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance, but it was the Five Elders Association that managed to spread its use first!”

“It’s certainly a great item. But we've already delayed long enough. We should hurry to the One Heart Immortal Sect,” urged the puppet body, whose body was sustained by a mere fragment of its original will.

“Heh, seems like Daoist Jiao is even more anxious than I am,” Lu Fan was momentarily startled, then revealed a knowing smile.

He immediately accelerated again, flying northward without stopping.

The territory of the Five Elders Association, like that of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance, was vast and sparsely populated.

As they traveled along the road, it was common not to encounter any other cultivators for half a day. Even if they saw the light of a distant cultivator's flight, both parties would consciously avoid each other.

What Lu Fan feared — that the cultivators of the Five Elders Association would come looking for trouble — never happened.

Thus, they peacefully crossed more than a dozen regions. When they flew out of the white mist barrier once more, however, the Samantabhadra True Boat suddenly lost control and plummeted toward the ground.

Fortunately, Lu Fan reacted in time, flying out of the boat and storing it in his storage ring before it crashed.

“This place…”

He looked up at the sky, his brows tightly furrowed.

This area seemed somewhat different from the place they had just been.

He couldn't quite put his finger on what was different, but the strange feeling was undeniable.

“Is this the One Heart Immortal Sect?” Li Fan also looked around, his tone returning to its usual liveliness.

“Let’s scout out the situation first,” Lu Fan suggested.

“Sounds good,” Li Fan nodded in agreement.

Thus, the two began exploring Wangyu Prefecture. The general layout was similar to that of the Human Realm, with most of the population concentrated in small, scattered towns, where cultivators and mortals lived separately.

However, during their journey, both Li Fan and Lu Fan noticed something unusual.

In this One Heart Immortal Sect, things seemed strangely…

Harmonious?

Fighting and arguments, which were common in human interactions, seemed nonexistent in Wangyu Prefecture.

Even the haggling between buyers and sellers during business transactions was absent.

As they traveled, everyone was courteous and exceptionally friendly to one another.

While these scenes appeared heartwarming and touching on the surface, to outsiders like Li Fan, they felt a bit eerie.

Out of caution, both maintained smiles and tried to blend in with the crowd without standing out.

At the same time, they quietly gathered information about the true One Heart Immortal Sect.

In this land, the existence of the 'Great Immortal Sect' was no secret.

However, the answers they received from the locals left Li Fan and Lu Fan somewhat astonished.

Everyone here had known from a young age about the existence of the 'Great Immortal Sect' in the heavens and the earth.

The highest honor they could imagine in their lifetime was to be able to join the "Great Immortal Sect".

However, they had no idea where this sect was located or what method was required to enter it.

There was only one thing they firmly believed in.

As long as one's heart was sincere and they were exceptional enough, they could catch the attention of the great "Heavenly Sovereign" and be chosen to join the "Great Immortal Sect".

This belief was somewhat abstract.

Li Fan and Lu Fan both felt a little confused.

After leaving Wangyue Prefecture, they had been traveling through various other states within the One Heart Immortal Sect for over a month. They discovered that everyone's statements were shockingly consistent.

This inevitably left the two, who had been holding high expectations, a bit disappointed.

“Fellow Daoist Jiao, we’ve crossed dozens of states, yet are we still not considered sincere enough?” Lu Fan asked dejectedly, downing a cup of spirit wine in a tavern in the inner city of Weichang, Canghong Prefecture.

Li Fan sat silently, not responding.

“Or perhaps it’s because our strength isn’t sufficient, and we haven’t met Senior Sister Zhao’s selection criteria?” Lü Fan muttered in a daze.

Although Li Fan was merely a remnant thought, he had noticed the subtle changes in Lu Fan’s mentality along the journey. Lu Fan seemed to be losing his way.

At the beginning, Lu Fan had a casual attitude, merely deciding to follow Li Fan on this journey.

When it came to the stunning and peerless 'Senior Sister Zhao', Lu Fan mostly jested about her, not genuinely admiring her.

After all, to a cultivator, beauty was far less important than one's cultivation level and realm.

But ever since they arrived in the territory of the One Heart Immortal Sect, Lu Fan had undergone a quiet transformation.

He grew increasingly fascinated with the existence of 'Senior Sister Zhao' and the Great Immortal Sect.

The more he learned, the more he became consumed by a desire to obtain something he couldn’t have, making him restless and obsessed.

Now, his thoughts had turned almost mad, nearly losing himself.

In contrast, the puppet body that only held the obsession of entering the One Heart Immortal Sect was less affected.

However, Li Fan did not awaken Lu Fan.

It wasn’t because he didn’t care about their bond, but because Li Fan knew that the subtle influence of the Heavenly Sovereign’s power wasn’t something that could be changed with a few words.

Even if he told Lu Fan about his changes, Lu Fan might just feel prideful about it.

As the two sat silently—one with a troubled look and the other expressionless—suddenly, a commotion arose from the streets outside.

“Wan Zailai from Canghong Prefecture, with just a Golden Core cultivation, defeated thirty-six Nascent Soul cultivators from Yilü Prefecture, finally catching the attention of the 'Heavenly Sovereign' and successfully joining the Immortal Sect!”

“No doubt about it, he’s the pride of Canghong Prefecture, finally giving Yilü Prefecture a taste of defeat!”

“Haha, now the number of Immortal Sect disciples from Canghong Prefecture will surpass Yilü Prefecture! Let’s see how they’ll flaunt their arrogance now!”

…

Hearing the discussions outside, Li Fan and Lu Fan exchanged a glance and immediately began to inquire about the details.

“I get it! As long as we do something extraordinary to catch Senior Sister Zhao... no, the Heavenly Sovereign's attention, we can enter the Immortal Sect!” Lu Fan exclaimed in sudden realization.

Chapter 507: Wealth Can Lead to Godliness

It was as if a sudden realization hit Lu Fan, and he muttered to himself with extreme excitement, "So that's how it is... that's how it is!"

But moments later, his excitement turned into frustration, "Golden Core stronger than Nascent Soul... I can't do that!"

He stared at his own hands, feeling a bit lost, and mumbled, "No, I must meet the Heavenly Sovereign... I need to figure out a way..."

Seeing Lu Fan’s increasing obsession, Li Fan couldn’t help but remind him, "fellow Daoist Lu..."

Before Li Fan could finish, Lu Fan suddenly stood up and, without sparing Li Fan another glance, flew out of the restaurant, shouting loudly, "I am Lu Fan of the Martial Hall of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance from the Congyun Sea! Who dares challenge me?"

Li Fan was stunned on the spot.

The once-bustling streets of Weichang City instantly fell into an eerie silence.

Only Lu Fan's proud figure stood in the sky.

After a brief silence, the crowd erupted.

"A mere Golden Core cultivator dares to speak such nonsense!"

"Are the cultivators of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance all this bold?"

"When did the dogs of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance dare to be so arrogant in front of our Five Elders Association?!" A burly Nascent Soul cultivator with a thick beard shouted in anger, flying in front of Lu Fan, ready to teach him a lesson.

But Lu Fan, though reckless, hadn’t completely lost his mind. He shouted, "I am at the Golden Core stage, and you are Nascent Soul. Does the Five Elders Association always bully the weak?"

"If you want to fight, send a Golden Core cultivator to face me!"

Lu Fan's voice, intentionally amplified, quickly spread throughout Weichang City.

"You..." The Nascent Soul cultivator was momentarily stunned, his expression flickering with uncertainty before he coldly snorted and refrained from attacking.

Landing back on the ground, he turned to the crowd and angrily roared, "Where are the Golden Core cultivators of Canghong Prefecture? Have they all died?"

The crowd quickly responded.

A young cultivator in green robes flew forward, "I am Qiu Juemo of the Luoyan Gang. Daoist Lu, please enlighten me!"

He cupped his hands respectfully but wasted no time in attacking, sending a flying sword straight towards Lu Fan's face.

The sword's blue light appeared without a sound, arriving in an instant.

Luckily, Lu Fan reacted swiftly, dodging the flying sword's attack just in time.

"You sneak attacked me!" Lu Fan's face showed a hint of anger.

"In a life-and-death battle, one must go all out. There's no such thing as sneak attacks! Be careful, Daoist friend!" With a loud shout from Qiu Juemo, thirty-three beams of sword light separated from the flying sword that had circled behind Lu Fan, forming a sword formation shaped like a fierce tiger, charging towards him.

Lu Fan snorted coldly. A faint bronze light emanated from his body, which instantly expanded several times.

A wooden abacus suddenly appeared in his hand, and as he lightly flicked the beads, a crisp "clack" sound echoed.

"The world bustles, all for the sake of profit!" Lu Fan chanted, and with each flick of the abacus bead, a round copper coin appeared out of thin air.

In a flash, thirty-three copper coins took shape, slicing through the air with green light, one after another heading towards the flying tiger sword formation.

Qiu Juemo's expression shifted slightly, sensing something was wrong. He tried to control the sword formation to avoid the strange copper coins.

But the green light was unbelievably fast. In an instant, each of the thirty-three copper coins collided with one of the flying swords.

There was no earth-shattering explosion. As soon as the copper coins touched the swords, they disappeared.

The next moment...

"Not good!" Qiu Juemo hadn't even finished saying "good" when the thirty-three flying swords suddenly reversed direction.

The tiger sword formation, once under his control, now turned back and charged towards him at an even greater speed.

Before he could react, thirty-three beams of sword light pierced through his body.

Blood splattered everywhere as Qiu Juemo's body trembled before finally collapsing to the ground.

The tiger sword formation, now uncontrolled, scattered onto the ground.

The crowd watching gasped in shock.

"Thank you for the fight!" Lu Fan, with his abacus now behind his back, said proudly.

"Brother Qiu!" Qiu Juemo’s friends rushed forward to check on him, relieved to find that Lu Fan had spared his life at the last moment.

"Shameful! Get him out of here!"

"Yeah, that was way too quick!"

...

Despite his severe injuries, Qiu Juemo’s defeat earned him no sympathy from the crowd. Instead, they taunted him, their eyes filled with scorn.

Qiu Juemo’s friends, faces flushed with embarrassment, quickly helped him away, not daring to stir up more trouble.

"I'll fight!"

A grey-robed cultivator, his voice filled with anger, soared into the air.

This time, he learned from the previous failure, opting not to use any magical artifacts. Instead, he summoned a blazing fire, constantly attacking with flames.

"Wealth can lead to godliness!"

As Lu Fan flicked his abacus, a copper coin fell into the fire.

The originally red flames suddenly turned an eerie green.

Soon after, the flames, born from the grey-robed cultivator's own abilities, lost control and turned against him.

Amidst a cry of pain, the grey-robed cultivator also suffered a miserable defeat.

The swift defeat of the second challenger quieted the noisy crowd.

"This fellow Daoist Lu... he has some real skill," Li Fan, watching from the sidelines, couldn't help but be surprised.

After a brief moment of silence, another challenger stepped forward.

"I am Ou Qianye of Canghong Prefecture. fellow Daoist Lu, please enlighten me!"

This time, Lu Fan didn’t immediately strike. Instead, he raised his voice and asked, "Since the Five Elders Association can’t defeat me, are you planning to fight me one after another in turns?"

Ou Qianye hesitated, holding back the attack he was about to launch. He replied in a deep voice, "Daoist friend, why don't you rest for a while, and then we will fight again when you're fully recovered."

Ignoring him, Lu Fan closed his eyes and began meditating to regain his energy.

Soon after, the two resumed their battle, clashing fiercely.

In the end, Lu Fan once again emerged victorious. However, Ou Qianye was no easy opponent, with his techniques and spells continuously overwhelming Lu Fan.

It took Lu Fan considerable effort to barely secure a victory.

"Excellent techniques, Daoist friend!" Acknowledging his loss, Ou Qianye cupped his hands and conceded defeat.

"Mutual respect..." Lu Fan’s tone had softened significantly this time.

One after another, the Golden Core cultivators of Weichang City challenged Lu Fan.

But without exception, they all failed.

Even with breaks in between, Lu Fan, who had been fighting non-stop, began to look a bit pale.

Yet, despite his exhaustion, a glimmer of excitement remained on his face, which he couldn’t hide.

As all eyes in Weichang City were drawn to Lu Fan’s challenges, Li Fan, having lost interest in the spectacle, wandered over to a small stall by the street.

He picked up a scroll titled "The Secret History of Ancient Cultivation" and began to flip through its pages.

Chapter 508: Finally Entering the One Heart Sect

"This book, I think I’ve read it before."

"However, the content inside seems to be somewhat different."

As scenes from the book flashed through his mind, Li Fan was filled with a vague sense of familiarity, furrowing his brows slightly.

"Fellow Daoist, are there other versions of this book?" He looked toward a cultivator at the stall who was focused on the duel in the sky and asked aloud.

The cultivator selling books was initially a bit impatient, but when he turned back and saw the booklet in Li Fan's hand, a strange look flashed in his eyes.

"Fellow Daoist must be joking. This 'Secret History of Ancient Cultivation' was personally authored by the Heavenly Sovereign. How could there be other versions?" However, he flatly denied it.

Even though the body he controlled was merely a wisp of divine sense, stripped of most memories, the ability to read people remained instinctual.

With just one glance, Li Fan was sure of his suspicion.

"Name your price." He lowered his voice and spoke directly. "A mutual friend introduced me."

The book-seller hesitated for a moment.

After glancing around and seeing that all the cultivators were focused on the battle in the sky, he transmitted a message: "Ten thousand Soul Points, or the equivalent in spirit stones. No bargaining."

Li Fan instinctively reached for his storage ring, ready to pay.

But he realized he had no money on him—not even a storage ring.

"Fellow Daoist, please wait a moment."

He apologized and returned to the crowd.

Once Lu Fan finished his battle, Li Fan flew forward and explained his situation.

Lu Fan, who had just won another fight, was in high spirits and was no longer as stingy as before during their prior transactions.

He generously handed over a storage ring filled with standard spirit stones to Li Fan: "It’s just some material wealth. Fellow Daoist Jiao, take it as you need!"

After expressing his thanks, Li Fan floated back under the gaze of everyone.

Seeing this, the book-seller immediately realized he had been tricked. His face turned slightly green, and he began packing his things, ready to leave.

"You really have no business integrity at all, huh? Fellow Daoist, if you leave like this, I'll have to shout!" Li Fan transmitted a threat.

The book-seller immediately froze, looking around nervously before shuddering.

"Fine…" After hesitating for a long time, he finally pulled out a pink-glowing booklet and quietly handed it over.

Li Fan took the booklet and handed over the spirit stones.

Transaction complete, the book-seller was about to retreat when he saw that Li Fan intended to open the booklet right there.

His face turned as pale as paper, and he rushed forward, grabbing Li Fan's hands.

"Are you crazy?!"

His body trembled uncontrollably, his face filled with terror.

"It’s fine!" With a slight force, Li Fan pushed the book-seller’s hand aside and insisted on opening the pink booklet.

Beads of cold sweat instantly appeared on the book-seller’s forehead, dripping down like soybeans. Seeing that he couldn’t stop him, he looked around and realized that no one had noticed anything unusual yet.

With a gust of wind under his feet, he quickly fled using the teleportation formation in the city.

At that moment, Li Fan had already been drawn into the vivid, overwhelmingly real illusion within the booklet.

---

[Qin Shou repeatedly pursued Senior Sister Zhao but was repeatedly rejected. Furious, he harbored malicious intentions.]

[Senior Sister Zhao was affected by the Yin-Yang Harmony Powder, her consciousness becoming muddled…]

---

Li Fan’s expression constantly shifted, and his breathing grew more rapid.

The eerie pink glow of the booklet seemed to pulse in sync with Li Fan’s breathing, flickering nonstop.

Li Fan was completely absorbed in the scene, completely oblivious to the noise around him.

He muttered to himself, whispering continuously.

"Such a beauty exists in this world…"

"Such a useless fool! He’s already had one intimate encounter, yet he doesn’t seize the opportunity..."

"Idiot! Isn't her intention obvious?"

"If you don’t act now, when will you?!"

---

The plot in the booklet was clearly not to Li Fan’s liking. He often frowned and muttered curses under his breath.

"Ugh, how could the protagonist be such a coward!"

"If it were me, Senior Sister Zhao would have already submitted to me at my..."

His words abruptly stopped.

Everything within a small radius around Li Fan’s puppet body seemed to freeze in place.

Even the eerie pink glow from the booklet stopped in mid-air.

Above the sky, a pure white beam of light suddenly appeared and shot down.

It enveloped the motionless Li Fan completely.

The previously bustling Wei Chang City, filled with excitement over the battle, fell into absolute silence.

The white light grew brighter, and an intense suction force emanated from the sky.

Li Fan, like a statue, was slowly lifted into the air.

"It’s the Immortal Guidance Light! That’s the Immortal Guidance Light!"

"Who is it? Who from our Canghong Prefecture has caught the eye of the Heavenly Sovereign so quickly?"

"Hahaha! In just one month, three disciples have been chosen by the Immortal Sects! Our Canghong Prefecture’s prestige is truly soaring now!"

---

No one paid attention to Lu Fan's duel anymore.

Every cultivator's eyes were fixed on the white pillar of light that pierced the heavens, their eyes full of reverence and envy as they stared at the blurry figure within the light. They were abuzz with excitement.

Even Lu Fan stopped fighting.

He stared dumbfounded at the pillar of light, overcome with the feeling that the person he cherished had been taken from him before his eyes.

His heart ached as if cut by a knife.

Victory, cultivation, realms...

In that instant, all these things seemed meaningless.

"Why, why…" Lu Fan muttered, utterly lost and devastated.

As the figure within the white light rose higher and higher, Lu Fan suddenly found the figure somewhat familiar.

His pupils dilated sharply, and he quickly lowered his head, scanning the surroundings.

Sure enough, "Fellow Daoist Jiao" was nowhere to be seen.

"How is this possible?" Lü Fan’s face was filled with disbelief.

"I’ve defeated over twenty Golden Core cultivators from the Five Elders Association! Did you not see that?"

"Why was he chosen, and I was ignored?"

An overwhelming surge of resentment, unwillingness, and rage erupted within Lu Fan.

"No!"

He roared and, in a frenzy, charged toward the light pillar without hesitation.

But it was useless.

Just as he was about to touch the light, he passed right through it.

The pillar of light was like an illusion, seemingly right in front of him but impossible to grasp.

With Li Fan in tow, the light pillar slowly disappeared into the heavens.

A look of despair crept into Lu Fan’s eyes.

---

"Junior Brother, you’re awake."

A crisp voice rang in his ears, and Li Fan opened his eyes.

"Cough, cough..." The sharp pain in his chest made him gasp for air.

"You’ve just joined the sect. I told you not to act on impulse, but you wouldn’t listen." A graceful figure appeared beside him, gently helping him sit up against the headboard.

"This is a medicine I prepared for you. It will help with your recovery. Drink it quickly." Concern was written all over her face as she ladled a spoonful of medicinal soup and brought it to his lips.

His mind was a blur, unable to recall anything.

Li Fan simply opened his mouth instinctively and drank the medicine.

Chapter 509: Soft Rice Must Be Eaten Hard

A surge of warmth rose from his abdomen, spreading through all his limbs and bones. Li Fan instantly felt much more comfortable.

Especially the injury on his chest—under the effect of this warm current, the pain miraculously eased considerably in an instant.

"Senior Sister, what kind of medicine is this? It’s so effective..." Li Fan asked instinctively.

At the same time, some fragments of memory surfaced in his mind.

He and this Senior Sister Zhao were both from Changfeng Village, Daqing Mountain, and had known each other since childhood.

Half a year ago, a group of bandits attacked Changfeng Village, brutally slaughtering most of the villagers. Only he and Senior Sister Zhao were spared, as they happened to be playing outside at the time.

When they saw the smoke rising from the village and rushed back, they stumbled upon the bandits, who were just about to retreat with their loot.

Despite her young age, Senior Sister Zhao’s breathtaking beauty caught the attention of all the bandits.

At this critical moment, an immortal master happened to pass by. Upon seeing the bloodstained scene below and the two trembling children before the bandits, the immortal master instantly understood the situation. He killed all the bandits on the spot, saving Senior Sister Zhao and Li Fan.

Moreover, the immortal master saw that Senior Sister Zhao had extraordinary talent and decided to take her back to his sect.

However, Li Fan’s aptitude seemed mediocre and didn’t catch the immortal master’s eye. It was only after Senior Sister Zhao’s earnest pleas that the immortal master reluctantly agreed to take him along.

After flying for over ten days, the immortal master brought them back to the sect. What they saw were towering mountains surrounded by clouds and mist. From time to time, they could spot immortals flying between the peaks, leaving streaks of radiant light. Amid the sea of clouds, many majestic and awe-inspiring structures stood tall, exuding a divine and sacred aura.

The celestial scene left Senior Sister Zhao and Li Fan utterly speechless. From the conversations of the immortal disciples who had brought them, Li Fan learned the name of the sect: "Grand Dao Sect".

The Grand Dao Sect had nine branches and seventy-two peaks.

The main branch was always personally passed down by the successive sect leaders, while the other eight branches were managed by various elders.

The immortal master they thought so highly of was actually only a fourth-generation disciple of the Yuehua branch of the Grand Dao Sect, named Zhang Rong, with a cultivation at the Nascent Soul stage.

Under Zhang Rong’s guidance, they naturally joined the Yuehua branch and became outer sect disciples of the Grand Dao Sect, settling at Qingning Peak.

They were given a cultivation technique called

'Taiyuan One Qi Technique'.

Zhang Rong instructed them that as long as they mastered this technique, they could successfully advance to become inner sect disciples. From then on, they wouldn’t have to toil with menial chores and could focus on their cultivation. Their status in the sect, as well as the resources they could receive each month, would be vastly different.

The two of them began studying and practicing the technique together during their free time.

Senior Sister Zhao, being a bit older, had much greater comprehension and talent than Li Fan.

Half a year later, she had already mastered the Taiyuan One Qi Technique, passed the tests, and caught the attention of Zhang Wangshuang, a Soul Transformation Immortal Lord of the Yuehua branch. She was accepted as his disciple, instantly becoming a fourth-generation disciple of the Grand Dao Sect, now addressing the former immortal master Zhang Rong as her senior brother.

In contrast, despite Senior Sister Zhao secretly teaching him cultivation insights and occasionally gifting him medicinal pills, Li Fan’s progress was slow, and he couldn’t break through.

Moreover, Senior Sister Zhao’s frequent visits to check on him sparked jealousy among the other disciples. Although they treated Li Fan with respect on the surface, even flattering him at times, they secretly looked down on him, often mocking him behind his back, calling him nothing but a useless freeloader.

Not long ago, Li Fan overheard one of their conversations and, filled with shame and anger, couldn’t help but pick a fight.

However, his skills were lacking, and the opponents were many. He ended up being beaten half to death.

Fortunately, they were wary of Senior Sister Zhao’s influence, so they didn’t take his life.

...

The memories faded, and he returned to the present.

"This is the 'Heaven Essence Powder'. Not only can it help you recover from your injuries quickly, but it also enhances your sense of Qi," Senior Sister Zhao explained as she wiped the remaining medicine from the corner of his mouth with a smile.

"I had to gather the ingredients with great difficulty. Since you haven’t built your foundation yet, many pills would harm you instead of helping, so I asked my master for this prescription," she added.

The warm current in Li Fan’s body was like spiritual energy, lingering and even circulating on its own. Within moments, he felt fully recovered, as if he was brimming with boundless strength.

"Senior Sister, you are so kind to me..." Li Fan grabbed her fair, jade-like hand, looking into her eyes with deep gratitude.

"You..." Senior Sister Zhao’s cheeks flushed slightly, and she tried to pull her hand away. But Li Fan’s grip was too tight, and she feared using too much strength, worried about hurting him. So, for a moment, she could only let him hold her hand, her fingers unintentionally brushing against his palm.

The warmth from Li Fan’s hand felt even hotter than the earth’s flames, causing her body to soften slightly.

An unusual atmosphere began to fill the room.

At that moment, Li Fan suddenly spoke, "By the way, Senior Sister, there are still many parts of the Taiyuan One Qi Technique I don’t understand. Could you explain them to me again?"

Senior Sister Zhao paused for a moment, feeling a little disappointed, but also relieved.

She had wanted to teach him the key points of the Taiyuan One Qi Technique before, but perhaps out of pride, he had refused, saying he wanted to figure it out on his own.

She had no choice but to let it go.

But now, it seemed he had finally come to his senses.

Senior Sister Zhao began to carefully explain the technique to Li Fan.

"Brilliant, brilliant! I didn’t realize this sentence could be interpreted this way. Senior Sister, you’re so smart!" Li Fan praised continuously as he listened, his eyes gleaming with admiration.

As the day grew late, Senior Sister Zhao reluctantly stopped.

"My master instructed me to return before dark, so I have to go now!" she said carefully, afraid Li Fan would be displeased.

"The master’s orders come first. Senior Sister, you should go back. You can visit again when you have time," Li Fan said, nodding without the slightest hint of displeasure.

Senior Sister Zhao softly acknowledged and was about to leave when she realized that during their conversation, Li Fan had long since loosened his grip on her hand. Yet, for some reason, she had continued holding onto him.

Her face instantly flushed with heat, and fearing that Li Fan would notice, she hurriedly bid him farewell and left in a flustered rush.

Her heart raced, but she also felt a sense of joy, her steps much lighter as she walked away.

Meanwhile, Li Fan had already put aside the ambiguous moment between them.

He was entirely immersed in the mysteries of the Taiyuan One Qi Technique.

"So that’s how it is, so that’s how it is!" With Senior Sister Zhao’s guidance, all the difficulties he had encountered in practicing the technique were now resolved.

He had fully comprehended it.

"I’m not far from building my foundation!" The spiritual energy in his body flowed without any obstruction, as if it was innate.

He couldn’t help but feel immense joy.

"If only I had asked Senior Sister for advice earlier, I wouldn’t have wasted half a year!"

"How strange, why did I feel so ‘ashamed’ before?"

Li Fan shook his head, finding his previous self somewhat unreasonable.

Chapter 510: Dao Companion’s Fate-Changing Path

Chapter 510: Dao Companion's Fate-Changing Path

The next day, when Senior Sister Zhao came to visit Li Fan again, she was astonished to find that he had already mastered the "Taiyuan One Qi Technique", needing only some final polishing to perfect it.

While she was genuinely happy for Li Fan, she couldn’t help but feel a strange sense of loss in her heart.

"Senior Sister, let’s spar!" Li Fan suddenly suggested.

“Huh?” Senior Sister Zhao was momentarily taken aback.

“What’s your current cultivation level?” Li Fan asked again.

“Late-stage Foundation Establishment. Why?” She hesitated for a moment but answered truthfully.

Li Fan wasn’t shocked by her rapid progress in cultivation. Instead, he applauded and praised her, "It seems Senior Brother Zhang was right. Your cultivation talent is truly rare in this world."

Hearing Li Fan’s praise, her face flushed slightly.
