But then she heard him continue, "However, you can’t use your superior cultivation to bully me. When we spar, you can only use late-stage Qi Condensation strength at most!"

"Senior Sister, be careful!"

Before she could even react, Li Fan rushed toward her.

Caught off guard, Senior Sister Zhao fumbled a bit. However, being an entire major realm higher in cultivation than Li Fan, her control over spiritual energy and combat reflexes were far superior to his.

After just over ten exchanges, Li Fan was soundly defeated.

Climbing up from the ground and coughing lightly, Li Fan complimented, "Senior Sister, you’re really amazing!"

"Are you alright?" Her face was full of concern and a bit of regret. She hurried forward to check on Li Fan’s injuries.

After a thorough examination, she finally breathed a sigh of relief.

"Let’s go again!" After resting for a bit, Li Fan said in a deep voice, and the two resumed their sparring.

With the help of Senior Sister Zhao, who was a patient sparring partner, Li Fan’s combat skills improved rapidly.

Senior Sister Zhao even taught him some techniques like "Void-Splitting Blade" and "Wind Flash", which greatly enhanced his combat capabilities.

Unfortunately, this peaceful time didn’t last long. Senior Sister Zhao, who had been spending almost all her time with Li Fan at Qingning Peak of the outer sect, was eventually discovered by her master, Zhang Wangshuang.

After a scolding, she was placed under house arrest.

Luckily, after much pleading, she was granted one last chance to see Li Fan.

Seeing the beautiful woman in front of him on the verge of tears, heartbroken, Li Fan felt a pang of regret.

Stepping forward, he embraced her, gently stroking her back to comfort her. "Senior Sister, don’t be sad. Since your master won’t allow you to visit me in the outer sect anymore, I’ll come to the inner sect to see you."

"No matter what, I won’t abandon you," Li Fan promised with unwavering determination. "Senior Sister, focus on your cultivation. I’ll come to you soon!"

Senior Sister Zhao gazed at Li Fan with misty eyes, her heart racing.

Li Fan then kissed her deeply, not parting for a long time.

Only when the time granted by her master was nearly up did Li Fan reluctantly let her go.

She lay in his arms, whispering sweet words before finally leaving, full of reluctance.

After regaining his composure, Li Fan sealed the room and used the magical artifact gifted by Senior Sister Zhao as a protective barrier. Then, he began his attempt at Foundation Establishment.

Unfortunately, his cultivation talent was far from ideal.

After three consecutive failures, he realized that further attempts might damage his spiritual foundation. Left with no choice, Li Fan reluctantly consumed the Foundation Establishment Pill given to him by Senior Sister Zhao.

This time, with the aid of external power, he finally succeeded in establishing his foundation.

At last, he officially became a disciple of the Grand Dao Sect.

However, because he relied on external help for Foundation Establishment, his future potential would be limited. His cultivation aptitude was also quite mediocre, unlike Senior Sister Zhao, who was noticed by the sect elders.

Following the standard process, he was taken as a disciple by Nascent Soul stage cultivator Zhuang Yunxuan.

As a fifth-generation disciple of the Grand Dao Sect, he was technically one generation junior to Senior Sister Zhao.

But she was overjoyed when she saw him and didn’t mind the generational difference. She just told him to continue calling her Senior Sister when no one else was around.

Now that they were both in the inner sect, their interactions became much more convenient.

Even though Senior Sister Zhao had already broken through to the Golden Core stage, it didn’t stop Li Fan from visiting her frequently.

Although his cultivation was weaker, Li Fan never lost his manners. He was always polite and greeted everyone with a smile.

Even when faced with ridicule and mockery, he calmly accepted it and humbly nodded in agreement.

Over time, this won over even those who initially sneered at him.

Moreover, Senior Sister Zhao’s master, Zhang Wangshuang, didn’t object to their relationship, so gradually, everyone in the sect tacitly accepted Li Fan’s presence.

Seeing how Li Fan resolved a potentially difficult situation without causing her any trouble, Senior Sister Zhao was pleasantly surprised.

Her worries dissipated, and she looked at Li Fan with increasing warmth.

Time flew by, and in the blink of an eye, three years had passed.

With no lingering concerns in her heart, Senior Sister Zhao’s cultivation advanced rapidly. She had already reached the late Golden Core stage and was preparing for Formation of the Nascent Soul.

With Senior Sister Zhao’s assistance, Li Fan lacked nothing in terms of cultivation techniques or elixirs, so his progress wasn’t slow either.

He had perfected his Foundation Establishment and was now on the verge of forming his Golden Core.

As the saying goes, "Swallowing a single Golden Core can change one’s fate; my destiny is in my own hands, not the heavens." The gap between the Golden Core and Foundation Establishment stages was immense. Once crossed, it was like defying the heavens, forever altering one’s life.

Knowing that his own aptitude was limited, Li Fan anticipated that forming his Golden Core might not be easy. To be fully prepared, he decided to enter seclusion, solidifying his foundation and waiting for the right moment.

Two months later, when he finally sensed the right opportunity to form his Golden Core, a piece of news forced him to leave seclusion early.

Senior Sister Zhao’s junior apprentice brother, Jiang Ningjun, the youngest disciple of Zhang Wangshuang, secretly sent him a message.

Recently, Senior Brother Qin Shou from the 'Lianshan Lineage' had been aggressively pursuing Senior Sister Zhao.

At a young age, Qin Shou had already reached the Nascent Soul stage, and his master, Qu Hanfeng, had a close relationship with Zhang Wangshuang.

Zhang Wangshuang was also happy to see Qin Shou and Senior Sister Zhao form a Dao companion relationship.

Qin Shou was handsome and dashing, seemingly a perfect match for Senior Sister Zhao.

In just a few months of Li Fan’s absence, Qin Shou’s popularity and support within the 'Yuehua Lineage' had far surpassed Li Fan’s.

Only Jiang Ningjun, who had always had a good relationship with Li Fan, was displeased with Qin Shou’s pretentious demeanor.

That’s why, at this critical moment, he sent Li Fan a warning, informing him of the situation.

Upon hearing the news, Li Fan immediately decided to postpone forming his Golden Core.

The Golden Core could be formed at any time.

But if Senior Sister Zhao were to be stolen away, she’d be gone forever!

Even though Li Fan had great faith in Senior Sister Zhao, he knew life was unpredictable.

And he was well aware that his smooth journey in cultivation thus far was thanks to her help.

"Anyone who dares to take away my soft meal is blocking my path to the Dao!" [1]

"I don’t care who you are, we will fight to the death!" A cold glint flashed in Li Fan’s eyes.

1. Soft meal/rice (chī ruǎn fàn) also has another meaning of, man who lives off a woman.

Chapter 511: Harboring Malicious Intent

When Li Fan found Senior Sister Zhao, she was watching Qin Shou spar with the other disciples of the Yuehua lineage.

This Senior Brother Qin's cultivation was indeed exceptional, using his earthy yellow divine light skillfully for both attack and defense.

Despite being only at the mid-stage of the Nascent Soul realm, he effortlessly fought against Nascent Soul peak cultivators.

His spiritual energy flowed smoothly, and he battled for hours without showing any sign of fatigue.

He had sparred against many disciples of Zhang Wangshuang’s sect, yet not a single one could defeat him.

Qin Shou, however, was respectful to Zhang Wangshuang. Each match either ended in a draw or in a hard-fought victory, never overwhelming his opponent.

Though Senior Sister Zhao's fellow disciples had been defeated, they bore no ill will toward Qin Shou. On the contrary, they admired his demeanor and how he carried himself.

Even Senior Sister Zhao herself, watching Qin Shou’s graceful demeanor, couldn’t help but have a sparkle in her eyes.

Li Fan, observing from afar, quietly cursed in his heart, "Luckily, I came just in time, or someone would’ve stolen my thunder."

Without making a scene, he calmly approached Senior Sister and gently held her delicate hand.

Senior Sister was momentarily stunned, but when she saw that it was Li Fan, she did not pull away.

"Is this the famous Senior Brother Qin of the Lianshan lineage? He’s truly formidable! I wonder when I’ll be able to match his prowess," Li Fan said with a hint of admiration in his tone.

Senior Sister Zhao, having initially been worried that Li Fan might get jealous after hearing rumors, realized now that her concerns had been unnecessary.

Strangely, alongside a sense of relief, she also felt a tinge of disappointment.

However, she didn’t show it and instead smiled gently, comforting Li Fan, "Junior Brother, your dedication to cultivation is rare in the world. Catching up to Senior Brother Qin isn’t out of reach for you."

Li Fan didn’t respond but shook his head slightly, letting out a quiet sigh.

Noticing this, Senior Sister Zhao grew concerned and quickly sent him a message through their telepathic connection, "What’s wrong? Did you encounter any trouble during your recent closed-door training?"

Li Fan finally spoke slowly, "Originally, during my seclusion, I intended to break through to the Golden Core stage in one go. But each time the thought crossed my mind, a strong warning would surge in my heart, as if a great disaster awaited me if I proceeded."

Hearing this, Senior Sister Zhao furrowed her brows. After a moment of contemplation, her expression relaxed as she reassured him again, "You can’t force the formation of a Golden Core. If your intuition is warning you, it must mean the time isn’t right yet."

"Yes, I think so too," Li Fan nodded.

Then, suddenly changing the subject, he continued, "Since I joined the sect, it’s been several years, and I haven’t left the mountain even once. The world of cultivation is vast, yet I’ve stayed cooped up in the sect all this time. Perhaps it’s making my progress stagnant. Now that I’ve hit a bottleneck, I’ve decided to venture down the mountain in search of an opportunity for a breakthrough."

"Junior Brother, you..." Senior Sister Zhao was visibly shocked and quickly tried to dissuade him, "The world outside isn’t as peaceful as it is within the sect. Aside from the rampant beasts, even rogue cultivators are dangerous. For the sake of spiritual stones or techniques, they’ll stop at nothing."

"Even some disciples of our Grand Dao Sect have mysteriously disappeared while traveling down the mountain..."

Li Fan interrupted her, his gaze resolute, "My mind is made up, Senior Sister. There’s no need to persuade me further. The path of immortality is long and treacherous. If I don’t have the courage for this, how could I hope to walk this road with you by my side in the future?"

Hearing Li Fan’s straightforward words, Senior Sister Zhao blushed slightly, gripping his hand even tighter.

Meanwhile, on the sparring platform, Qin Shou, who was once again gaining the upper hand in his match, glanced over at Senior Sister Zhao and saw her gazing affectionately at Li Fan. His concentration faltered, his aura wavered, and his opponent seized the opportunity, nearly defeating him.

A shadow of gloom passed through Qin Shou’s eyes as he quickly refocused on the match.

After much effort, he finally turned the battle in his favor and emerged victorious.

But by the time he had finished, Senior Sister Zhao and Li Fan had already left, their destination unknown.

Though Qin Shou smiled outwardly, jealousy was burning fiercely within him.

Seven days later, Li Fan left the Grand Dao Sect in search of an opportunity to break through to the Golden Core stage.

Worried for his safety, Senior Sister Zhao soon followed after him, claiming she was also seeking a breakthrough.

Her intentions were obvious to anyone who cared to notice, yet for some reason, her master Zhang Wangshuang did not stop her. Instead, he gifted her a “Heavenly Guide Talisman,” which could direct her toward opportunities at critical moments.

After leaving the sect, Senior Sister Zhao quickly found Li Fan, following the pre-arranged method of communication.

Using the Heavenly Guide Talisman, the two journeyed southwest, crossing several mountain ranges before arriving at an ancient ruin hidden deep within a dense forest.

The pair decided to rest and explore the ruins the next day.

That night.

"Senior Sister, did you notice something odd? It feels like someone has been secretly following us this entire time," Li Fan transmitted his thoughts to her while feigning sleep.

After a brief pause, Senior Sister Zhao replied, "Are you being overly suspicious? I didn’t sense anyone following us."

Li Fan was adamant, "My instincts are rarely wrong. Remember when we were in Daqing Mountain? On the day the bandits attacked the village, I felt uneasy, and you accompanied me outside to relax. That’s how we avoided the disaster."

"This time, the feeling is exactly the same."

Hearing this, Senior Sister Zhao became more convinced.

"What do you plan to do?"

Li Fan sneered, "We lure the snake out of its hole."

The next morning, as the two prepared to set out, they quarreled over a trivial matter.

Their argument was fierce, and Senior Sister Zhao even hurled hurtful words like, "You wouldn’t be where you are today without me! And now you’re showing me attitude?"

Li Fan's face darkened as he stormed off, entering the ruins alone.

In her anger, Senior Sister Zhao didn’t immediately follow.

At that moment, a small, inconspicuous insect quietly trailed after Li Fan into the ruins.

As Li Fan battled a beast within the ruins, a sword light slashed out from the shadows, attempting to kill him on the spot.

At the critical moment, a cold moonlight radiated from Li Fan's body.

Within the faint light, the graceful silhouette of Senior Sister Zhao could be vaguely seen.

However, the beautiful figure now bore a chilling killing intent.

In the explosion that followed, Qin Shou was forced to reveal himself.

"Senior Brother Qin, it’s really you?!" The real Senior Sister Zhao and her moonlight avatar surrounded Qin Shou, shock and disbelief on her face.

"It’s a grave offense for fellow disciples to harm one another! Why would you do this, Senior Brother?"

Now that he had been exposed, Qin Shou dropped all pretenses.

He spewed vulgar words and stared lecherously at Senior Sister Zhao, no longer bothering to hide his lustful intent.

Chapter 512: Dual Cultivation of Heaven and Earth

“After I torture your little lover to death, I’ll slowly deal with you!”

“With the Moonlight Physique as a furnace, it will surely help me ascend to the Soul Transformation stage!”

Revealing his true face, Qin Shou launched an attack on Li Fan and Senior Sister Zhao.

Senior Sister Zhao, though at the peak of the Golden Core stage and a prodigious talent, had no trouble dealing with ordinary Nascent Soul cultivators.

However, faced with a genius like Qin Shou, she was clearly struggling.

Li Fan was more of a burden in this situation.

Every one of Qin Shou's strikes targeted Li Fan, hiding behind Senior Sister Zhao. Already strained, Zhao had to hurriedly defend in order to protect her lover’s life.

Seeing that they were about to be defeated, Senior Sister Zhao and Li Fan had no choice but to rely on a magical artifact granted by their master, fighting while retreating into the depths of the ruins.

Using the hidden traps and strange beasts within the ruins, they temporarily managed to shake off Qin Shou.

Unable to find them, Qin Shou set up a formation outside the ruins, vowing to capture them alive within it.

“This is the Central Void Formation. Once it's complete, we’ll have no chance of escape,” Senior Sister Zhao said, a trace of resolve flashing in her eyes.

“In a moment, I’ll go out and fight him to the death. You must escape and return to the sect. Reveal his true nature to our master.”

She drew her sword and was about to fly out when she suddenly noticed that the Heavenly Guide, a treasure from their master, was glowing once again.

“Wait, Senior Sister! It seems there’s still a way out!” Li Fan called out excitedly.

Following the light from the Heavenly Guide, the two of them found a secret chamber deep within the ruins.

Inside the chamber, there was a bizarrely large skeleton, several times the size of an ordinary human, with more than a thousand bones.

Though the bones appeared intact, there was a subtle sense of discord, as if they had come from different individuals.

Beside the skeleton, Li Fan found a storage ring.

Inside the ring, aside from a unique token inscribed with the word "Xuan", there were several cultivation manuals.

“Heaven and Earth Converging Manual, Eternal Dominance Art…” Li Fan skimmed through the books, a glint of joy in his eyes.

“Senior Sister, look! This Heaven and Earth Converging Manual is a rare dual cultivation technique. According to its description, both parties will experience significant improvements after their first practice session. If we cultivate together, we might both break through…” Li Fan rambled on, but suddenly noticed that Senior Sister Zhao’s expression had darkened.

“Senior Sister Zhao, what’s wrong?” Li Fan asked, puzzled.

“This place must be a stronghold of the Xuantian Sect,” Senior Sister Zhao said gravely, staring at the enormous skeleton. “And this person was likely one of their so-called ‘Heavenly Kings’.”

“Xuantian Sect?” Li Fan frowned. “I’ve never heard of them. Why does it matter?”

Patiently, Senior Sister Zhao explained, “The Xuantian Sect was an ancient, evil sect that once ruled the world. Their leaders called themselves Heavenly Kings. They usurped the heavens' mandate and committed all manner of atrocities. They were eventually overthrown by a coalition of cultivators. Though the Xuantian Sect was destroyed thousands of years ago, their remnants still persist."

"The Ten Immortal Sects, including our Grand Dao Sect, remain highly vigilant against the Xuantian Sect."

“The remnants of the Xuantian Sect must be eradicated without mercy.”

Li Fan understood her point, but he remained unconvinced. “The Xuantian Sect is the Xuantian Sect, but a technique is just a technique.”

“Can a cultivation technique even be categorized as good or evil?”

“We’re orthodox disciples of the Grand Dao Sect, not some Xuantian Sect remnants. What’s wrong with using their techniques to save our lives?”

Senior Sister Zhao remained frowning. “It’s not the same…”

Li Fan glanced outside, noticing the formation’s growing intensity.

“No matter what, it’s better than dying here. Besides, if we fall into Qin Shou’s hands, death would be a luxury,” Li Fan argued.

“At worst, once we survive this ordeal, we can abandon the technique.”

After much deliberation, with the formation's pressure increasing, Senior Sister Zhao reluctantly nodded in agreement.

The two of them began studying the 'Heaven and Earth Converging Manual' together.

In the profound and exhilarating process of dual cultivation, they felt as if they were becoming one.

Their thoughts intertwined, merging seamlessly, with each moment surpassing the passage of countless years.

Their auras resonated in harmony, growing stronger together.

In the end, aided by the power of dual cultivation, Senior Sister Zhao successfully advanced to the Nascent Soul stage.

Li Fan, too, formed his Golden Core.

With her breakthrough, Senior Sister Zhao’s combat strength underwent a qualitative leap.

Taking advantage of the final moments before the formation fully took shape, the two of them broke through the array and confronted Qin Shou.

Qin Shou, exhausted from days of formation-setting, was visibly shaken by their dual breakthroughs, realizing his plans were about to fail.

Disoriented, he fumbled under Senior Sister Zhao’s relentless attacks.

Meanwhile, Li Fan’s taunts, delivered through soul transmissions, further incited Qin Shou’s rage.

“Senior Brother Qin, aren’t you curious how we managed to break through so quickly?”

“Hahaha, it’s all thanks to you!”

“At the brink of death, we found a dual cultivation technique inside the ruins.”

“You do know what dual cultivation means, don’t you, Senior Brother?”

“Tsk, tsk, tsk…”

“If it weren’t for you, I might’ve waited forever to fulfill my wish!”

Li Fan continued to mock Qin Shou, further unbalancing his mind.

As the two coordinated their attacks perfectly, Qin Shou couldn’t accept what he was seeing.

“You… deserve to die!”

Driven to madness, Qin Shou launched a suicidal assault on them.

Though initially overwhelmed, Senior Sister Zhao and Li Fan gradually adapted to his frenzied attacks.

Eventually, the balance shifted in their favor.

Realizing his injuries were severe and escape impossible, Qin Shou was filled with despair.

“Curse you both!”

With a venomous gaze, Qin Shou’s head was severed by Senior Sister Zhao’s sword, his eyes remaining wide in death.

Seeing their enemy defeated, Li Fan finally breathed a sigh of relief.

“I was only trying to provoke him earlier. If my words offended you, please forgive me, Senior Sister,” Li Fan said apologetically.

“We’re already like husband and wife. No need for such formalities,” Senior Sister Zhao replied, frowning slightly.

Li Fan slapped his forehead. “How foolish of me!”

After cleaning up the scene, the two of them returned to the secret chamber.

Exhausted, Li Fan held Senior Sister Zhao and fell into a deep sleep.

When they woke, they hesitated before deciding to abandon the 'Heaven and Earth Converging Manual'.

There were many other dual cultivation techniques; they didn’t need to stick to this one.

However, after a few attempts, they exchanged glances, their expressions slightly uneasy.

Chapter 513: Deep Into the Bones, Difficult to Change

In less than a day, the power of the Heaven and Earth Converging Manual had already become as if it were innate, deeply ingrained in the marrow.

It fused completely with his cultivation power, becoming inseparable.

It felt like the original technique that his cultivation had always drawn from. If it were forcibly removed, losing several realms of power would be a mild consequence. There was a great possibility it would damage his Dao Foundation, leaving him forever cut off from the path of cultivation.

“This…” Li Fan sat cross-legged on the ground, trying for a long time, but in the end, he gave up dejectedly, his expression dark.

Senior Sister Zhao furrowed her brows slightly and said, “The demonic arts of the Xuantian Sect are indeed strange. It seems that we cannot easily rid ourselves of it right now.”

“It is said that the 'Original Scripture of the Taishang Sect' allows cultivators to freely change their cultivation methods. If we are fortunate enough to view it, we might be able to abolish this Heaven and Earth Converging Manual.”

“The 'Original Scripture of the Taishang Sect'?” Li Fan frowned slightly. Although he had never heard of this technique before, for some reason, he felt a vague sense of familiarity.

Senior Sister Zhao shook her head, abandoning this unrealistic fantasy, “Unfortunately, like our sect's 'Heaven-Slaying Dao Scripture', it’s a sect-guarding secret, a mystery not passed down.”

“Only the direct line of the sect leader can cultivate it within our sect. As for us outsiders, there's no chance at all.”

Seeing Senior Sister Zhao looking troubled, Li Fan pulled her into his arms and gently comforted her, “Things have come to this; we can only take one step at a time.”

“The Xuantian Sect has been extinct for a long time, and the 'Heaven and Earth Dual Converging Manual' is merely a dual cultivation method. I doubt the elders of the sect will notice anything strange.”

Although Senior Sister Zhao nodded in agreement, the worry in her eyes remained.

The two of them rested in the secret chamber of the ruins for half a month. During this time, they used the power of dual cultivation to fully stabilize their cultivation realms.

Only then did they set off to return to the Grand Dao Sect.

Before leaving, Senior Sister Zhao destroyed the ruins with her sword light, completely obliterating the site.

Upon returning to the sect, the shattering of Qin Shou’s life lamp had already caused a great uproar.

After a secret discussion, Senior Sister Zhao and Li Fan concluded that they couldn’t hide the truth.

They decided to face their master together and confessed that Qin Shou had secretly followed them with malicious intent, and they had ultimately joined forces to kill him.

They left out certain details, avoiding any mention of the Xuantian Sect.

They only said that they had made a breakthrough in the face of life and death, which allowed them to successfully counterattack and kill him.

Master Zhang Wanshuang, however, seemed to have known this all along and was not too surprised.

The two of them got punished with ten years of confinement, placing them under protective custody in the back mountain.

Ten years passed in a flash.

The storms of the Grand Dao Sect had nothing to do with the two confined in the seclusion chamber.

In the beginning, they were somewhat apprehensive about practicing dual cultivation within the sect.

But by the third year, both of them hit bottlenecks. Summoning their courage, they resumed practicing the Heaven and Earth Converging Manual together.

Perhaps it was due to long drought meeting a timely rain, or perhaps their cultivation had improved, but this time, the effect of dual cultivation was even better than three years ago.

Senior Sister Zhao broke through to the mid-stage Nascent Soul, and Li Fan's cultivation reached the mid-stage Golden Core.

The speed of their cultivation left both of them secretly astonished.

Unavoidably, their concerns also grew.

They knew that an occasional breakthrough could be explained as a stroke of fortune, but advancing so quickly, beyond the scope of their natural talents, would surely arouse suspicion.

If it were discovered that they were practicing the demonic arts of the Xuantian Sect, their fate would be miserable beyond imagination. Being stripped of their cultivation would be the least of their worries.

After a difficult discussion, they agreed that unless absolutely necessary, they would never engage in dual cultivation again.

The plan was ideal, but…

Another five years passed, and the strange bottleneck reappeared within them.

No matter how they cultivated, they couldn’t advance a step.

They struggled for a year.

For an entire year, they rested not a moment, dedicating all their energy to breaking through the bottleneck.

But it was all in vain.

The despair of their cultivation remaining stagnant tormented them.

Both Li Fan and Senior Sister Zhao were wholeheartedly devoted to the Dao and could not tolerate being stuck at their current levels forever.

Thus, in the ninth year of their confinement, they could no longer resist and engaged in dual cultivation for the third time.

Like dry wood catching fire, the blissful experience was even more intense than before.

As expected, after dual cultivation, the bottleneck disappeared, and their cultivation advanced once more.

Although they didn’t immediately break through, they were very close.

After the passion subsided, the two of them felt fear.

First, they feared their secret practice of Xuantian Sect’s arts would be discovered.

Second, they feared that the Heaven and Earth Converging Manual was so strange that they might be controlled by it for the rest of their lives.

Both of them were proud individuals, unable to bear such a fate.

In the final period, they ceased cultivation altogether, choosing instead to live simply, like a mortal couple, and devoted their time to researching a way to break free from the technique.

“The heavens give birth to all things, and so there is the concept of the Heavenly Father and Earthly Mother in the world. Every living being in this world is born with a 'Mark' left by Heaven and Earth.”

“It is said that the Xuantian Sect stole the authority of Heaven, controlling the power to bestow and change such 'Marks'.”

“Even an ordinary person, once bestowed by the Xuantian Sect, could become like us cultivators.”

“Furthermore, it is rumored that the Kings of the Xuantian Sect possessed a 'Longevity accomplished Position'. Whoever obtained it could achieve eternal life and live as long as Heaven and Earth.”

Senior Sister Zhao shared with Li Fan the secrets she had heard from various places.

“Achieving eternal life…” A strange glint flickered in Li Fan’s eyes.

“Senior Sister, are you suggesting that the Xuantian Sect’s techniques also carry this 'Mark' ability?”

Senior Sister Zhao sighed softly, “It’s just my speculation. The remnants of the Xuantian Sect’s teachings are scattered fragments, but even from those, one can sense how terrifying the sect was in its prime. Its laws were strict like divine edicts, suppressing all beneath Heaven, with none daring to defy them.”

“Though it is now but a ghost of its former self, breaking free from it won’t be easy.”

Li Fan held Senior Sister Zhao’s hand, his gaze firm. “Don’t worry, we will definitely overcome this.”

Time flew by, and soon their ten-year confinement was over.

The sealed doors opened with a rumble, and with nervous hearts, they walked out of the confinement chamber.

They had been worried that their rapid progress over the ten years would arouse suspicion.

However, upon returning to the sect, they were shocked to find that their progress now paled in comparison to others.

It turned out that in the second year of their confinement, a so-called "New Method" had quietly begun to spread.

Absorbing the spirit of Heaven and Earth, borrowing the wonders of Heaven, peering into the laws of Heaven…

Even defying the principles of Heaven.

Unlike the current method of sensing the Heavenly Dao and cultivating in harmony with it, this method involved seizing from Heaven and Earth, using any means necessary.

But its actual results far surpassed the current cultivation methods.

Chapter 514: The Immortal Desire to Execute the Dao

At the very beginning, the elders of the sect regarded the "new method" as a shortcut, a lesser path, and dismissed it with disdain.

However, as some disciples secretly practiced it in the shadows, their progress accelerated rapidly.

Soon, disciples began to surpass their masters in cultivation in a very short period.

As a result, the situation started to change.

Seeing the disciples below them making tremendous strides in their cultivation, the elders of the Grand Dao Sect started to feel uneasy.

Even though the Grand Dao Sect still placed great importance on the hierarchy of positions and seniority, the rule of the cultivation world since time immemorial—survival of the fittest—was hard to change.

In the past, the elders relied on their cultivation and status to firmly control the power of the sect. But now, they were still in their prime, yet they could see their disciples catching up with them in cultivation, or even surpassing them.

With their ruling positions under threat, how could they remain indifferent?

Thus, the upper echelons of the elders split into two factions.

One faction believed that the "new method" was a force that seized from heaven and earth, progressing rapidly but deviating from the true path. Over time, it would cause irreversible damage to the world and must be completely banned.

The other faction argued that the heavens and earth were vast and boundless, essentially inexhaustible. Although cultivators might endlessly plunder the world for their own cultivation during their lifetime, not everyone could reach the realm of eternal life. Once they perished, everything they had taken would return to the world.

Therefore, there was no need to worry excessively about this.

At present, the "new method" was spreading across the world, and many scattered rogue cultivators had risen because of it. Even disciples from other sects had been practicing it, gaining significant strength in the process.

If the Grand Dao Sect refused to adopt the new method, it would inevitably fall behind.

Both factions had their reasons, and neither was willing to yield. However, as those supporting the new method secretly cultivated and improved their strength, they gradually gained the upper hand in this internal struggle.

...

When Li Fan and Senior Sister Zhao emerged from their retreat, they witnessed this chaotic scene.

"Defying the laws of heaven and earth?" Senior Sister Zhao muttered under her breath, a strange light flickering in her eyes.

As for Li Fan, while he felt an intense longing for the new method, he was also inexplicably filled with dread.

It was as if this new method contained some great catastrophe.

"No matter what, the peculiarities in our cultivation of the 'Heaven and Earth Converging Manual' should go unnoticed," Li Fan said.

"Senior Sister, what do you think of this so-called 'new method'?"

Senior Sister Zhao chuckled softly. "Just a trick. No matter how fast it is, can it be faster than our dual cultivation method?"

"Still, it might serve as a good cover."

After pondering for a moment, Li Fan nodded in agreement.

Thus, on the surface, they also adopted the new method, while secretly continuing to use the power of dual cultivation to seize this rare opportunity and rapidly improve their own cultivation realms.

Another ten years passed.

The struggle between the old and new methods became increasingly intense.

It was no longer just internal conflict; outside the sect, the rogue cultivators across the world formed the 'Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance', attempting to challenge the authority of the Ten Great Immortal Sects.

Internal power struggles were one thing, but when outsiders tried to take a share of their power, it became another matter entirely.

To maintain their rule, the Ten Great Immortal Sects—despite their claim of unity—were in fact full of internal scheming and competition. Yet, after many years, they joined forces once again.

They formed an allied army to suppress and eradicate the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Initially, it was believed that these scattered rogue cultivators, lacking any deep foundation, would quickly collapse under the combined might of the Ten Great Immortal Sects.

But the outcome was rather unexpected.

At first, the so-called Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance was easily defeated by the sects' cultivators, suffering heavy casualties.

However, there were simply too many of them.

Even after wiping out one group, a new batch of cultivators soon emerged.

Moreover, in every battle, some of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's cultivators managed to escape by luck. After surviving one blood-soaked battle after another, their combat prowess gradually transformed. Even the elite cultivators from the Ten Great Immortal Sects found it increasingly difficult to kill them.

There were countless mortals in the world. With the support of the new method, they could quickly be transformed into fresh forces for the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

In contrast, the Ten Great Immortal Sects, with their pride and strict standards for selecting disciples, found it difficult to replenish their losses after each defeat. It often took years, even over a decade, to recover from a fallen disciple.

As a result, the balance of power between the two sides gradually leveled.

The battle reached a stalemate.

Moreover, with the varying degrees of casualties among the sects, cracks began to form within the previously unified coalition of the Ten Great Immortal Sects.

Some sects even deliberately avoided participating in battles to preserve their strength.

Everyone knew that by this point, the rise of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance was unstoppable.

Yet the leaders of the Ten Great Immortal Sects remained unwilling to accept this. They were not ready to hand over the world they had worked so hard to control to these mortals whom they had once dismissed.

Thus, a plan was born: "Capture the leader first."

[TL : Decided to Keep the name "Immortal Ancestor" instead of Venerable or Sovereign as a reader explained the intricacy and intentions behind the word of - 'Chuān Fǎ Tiān Zūn']

The rapid rise of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance was largely thanks to the so-called "Dao transmitters". These individuals were fiercely loyal to the Dao Transmission Immortal Ancestor, following his lead without question.

If the 'Immortal Ancestor' could be killed, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance would lose its spiritual leader and collapse from within.

The Immortal Ancestor was merely at the Dao Integration stage, while the Ten Great Immortal Sects had several Longevity-stage experts among them.

As long as they could find him, the decapitation plan could be executed, ending the stalemate.

The Ten Great Immortal Sects reached an agreement and dispatched their strongest experts to form a small task force, vowing to assassinate the Immortal Ancestor.

However, because the Immortal Ancestor was as elusive as a dragon, constantly moving, the sects also sent elite disciples to scour the world for any trace of him.

Naturally, Li Fan and Senior Sister Zhao were among those sent on this mission.

This search took over twenty years.

Thanks to the aid of dual cultivation, Senior Sister Zhao had successfully advanced to the Soul Transformation stage, while Li Fan, though slightly slower, had also reached the Nascent Soul stage.

They traveled all across the Xuanhuang Realm, slaying countless rogue cultivators.

But they still hadn't found any trace of the Immortal Ancestor.

"Senior Sister, what do you think of this Dao Transmission Immortal Ancestor?" Li Fan asked.

"The Dao Transmission Immortal Ancestor…" Senior Sister Zhao pondered for a moment before shaking her head slightly.

"I don't know."

Li Fan was taken aback.

Then Senior Sister Zhao continued, "To single-handedly overturn the entire structure of the cultivation world—there has never been such a monstrous figure in the Xuanhuang Realm in millennia."

"But all the information about him is based on rumors. Who he truly is and why he is doing this remain mysteries."

"Perhaps only by seeing him in person will we get our answers."

"I wonder if the other brothers and sisters have had any luck."

...

Just as the two were chatting, they suddenly received a message from the sect.

After reading it, their expressions became quite colorful.

It turned out that the "Assassination plan," which had been going on for over twenty years without any progress, had been canceled.

Li Fan and Senior Sister Zhao exchanged a glance, knowing that something significant must have happened.

Chapter 515: The Sudden Disappearance of the Longevity Immortal Sovereign

Rushing back to the sect after a long and exhausting journey, Li Fan and Senior Sister Zhao were utterly shocked by the sight that greeted them.

The sect was draped in white mourning cloth, and the disciples were all filled with grief.

After quickly inquiring, they finally learned what had transpired.

The sect master of the Grand Dao Sect, Fang Dingge, a powerful cultivator at the Longevity Realm, had fallen.

Li Fan and Senior Sister Zhao were both deeply shaken and filled with countless questions.

The Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign was considered the strongest in this world. As the leader of one of the ten great immortal sects, Fang Dingge's cultivation had reached unfathomable depths, his power almost godlike.

Even among the Longevity Sovereigns, he was a prominent figure.

How could such a person fall so suddenly?

As they delved deeper into the matter, it only grew more bizarre and mysterious.

Not only was the cause of Fang Dingge's death unknown, but even his body was missing.

Rather than "fallen," it seemed more like...

He had vanished.

However, the shattered remains of his life lantern within the sect stood as irrefutable proof that this Longevity Sovereign had indeed passed away.

No matter how many doubts or regrets they harbored, they could not change this fact.

In fact, the public announcement of the sect master’s death had only been made after intense deliberation among the elders of the sect.

This was too significant to keep secret, even if they had wanted to.

After all, Fang Dingge wasn't the only Longevity Sovereign to have fallen.

The Taishang, Heavenly Sword, Du'e, and Beast Taming sects...

It was rumored that each of these sects had also lost their Longevity Sovereigns.

This news was terrifying.

Though the ten great immortal sects tried to seal off this information, it quickly spread.

How could so many Longevity Sovereigns fall at once?

Who could have done this?

Li Fan and Senior Sister Zhao immediately thought of the mysterious figure known as the 'Immortal Ancestor'.

After all, these fallen Longevity Sovereigns were precisely the ones who, over twenty years ago, had vowed to unite and kill the Immortal Ancestor.

Now that they had all suddenly perished, the Immortal Ancestor, a powerful figure in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, was the most likely suspect.

But this didn't make sense.

The Immortal Ancestor had not yet reached the Longevity Realm. If he had the power to kill Longevity Sovereigns, he should have already rallied all the cultivators under his banner and overthrown the ten great immortal sects.

Yet, since the beginning, the Immortal Ancestor had only appeared at the start to spread his teachings, and very rarely thereafter. For most of the time, he had vanished without a trace, shrouded in mystery.

Could it be that, after killing the Longevity Sovereigns, the Immortal Ancestor himself had been severely wounded and was now forced into hiding?

Even so, he should have informed the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance of his victory to boost morale.

But according to Li Fan’s knowledge, even the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance was shocked by the simultaneous deaths of the Longevity Sovereigns.

It seemed they were just as unaware.

This entire event, from start to finish, was shrouded in mystery and absurdity.

After hearing the news, Li Fan and Senior Sister Zhao took a long time to process it.

The Longevity Immortal Realm they had so desperately sought... was it really so fragile? Could they fall so easily, just like ordinary cultivators?

Was there still any meaning in their cultivation?

In the midst of their confusion, the two spent several days cultivating together before finally recovering.

"This matter is certainly not as simple as it seems. Rather than saying they've fallen, I believe they’ve broken free of their shackles and ascended beyond this world," Senior Sister Zhao said calmly.

"Shackles?" This was the first time Li Fan had heard of such a concept, and he couldn't help but ask.

"A long time ago, Master once mentioned it to me in passing," Senior Sister Zhao said, frowning slightly as if trying to recall.

"At the time, I asked, 'What does true freedom mean? Is reaching the Longevity Realm true freedom?' Master was silent for a long time before sighing, 'Heaven’s shackles bind all beings; no one can escape. Even those at the Longevity Realm are still trapped. When the ten great sects overthrew the Xuantian Sect, they didn’t completely overthrow everything.' I wanted to ask more, but Master refused to say anything further."

Li Fan was deeply shaken by what he heard. "Even those at the Longevity Realm aren’t free?"

Seeing the dazed look on her lover's face, Senior Sister Zhao gently comforted him, "Their disappearance this time might actually be a good thing. At the very least, it proves that there is a possibility of breaking free from the shackles and truly transcending."

After thinking for a long while, Li Fan finally nodded. "Senior Sister, when the time comes, let’s break through together and ascend beyond this world, leaving behind a beautiful tale in the Xuanhuang Realm."

Senior Sister Zhao blushed at his words.

As their emotions deepened, the two resumed their cultivation together.

---

The disappearance of the Longevity Immortal Sovereigns had a profound impact on the current structure of the Xuanhuang Realm.

After the mourning ceremonies were completed, the Grand Dao Sect fell into a power struggle for the position of sect master.

The suddenness of the event meant that even Fang Dingge himself had not foreseen his disappearance, and thus, no successor had been chosen.

Fang Dingge's direct disciple was only at the Soul Transformation stage, far from qualified to take on the responsibility of sect master.

When the two remaining Longevity Sovereigns within the sect declared that they had no interest in the position, the other elders began to eye the position greedily.

A power struggle was inevitable.

Senior Sister Zhao’s master, Zhang Wangshuang, had already broken through to the Dao Integration stage in recent years. Naturally, he had ambitions for the position of sect master.

Power struggles are often brutal.

A year later, the dust settled.

Due to a lack of sufficient backing within the sect, Zhang Wangshuang was regretfully defeated.

The position of Grand Dao Sect master was inherited by Ji Changxi from the Tianchen lineage.

Although the internal strife did not result in deaths, it greatly weakened the sect.

After becoming sect master, Ji Changxi didn’t implement any drastic reforms. Instead, he focused on recovery and regrowth.

In response to the dwindling number of disciples, he issued a decree relaxing the requirements for outer disciples to advance. He also instituted a sect-wide competition every three years, making the cultivation and performance of disciples a critical factor.

Under these circumstances, Senior Sister Zhao, who consistently performed well in these competitions, became the brightest star among the younger generation of Grand Dao Sect disciples.

In contrast, Li Fan, who had more defeats than victories, became increasingly ordinary.

The most beautiful gem should belong to the strongest hero.

Li Fan’s lackluster performance, combined with his constant presence at Senior Sister Zhao's side, caused dissatisfaction among some disciples.

Many young talents began to ignore Li Fan and pursued Senior Sister Zhao fervently.

Even Zhang Wangshuang, who had once been somewhat supportive of Li Fan, began to change his attitude.

Sensing the impending crisis, Li Fan made a decisive move.

On a sunny afternoon, he proposed to Senior Sister Zhao.

There were no precious treasures or rare artifacts.

He simply looked into her eyes and said, "Senior Sister, be my Dao companion. From now on, let’s walk the path of immortality together."

Without a moment's hesitation, Senior Sister Zhao agreed.

Chapter 516: Defying Heaven and Earth with the Transmission of the Dao

In the face of nearly unanimous opposition from the entire sect, Senior Sister Zhao resolutely decided to marry Li Fan.

The wedding was very simple, even somewhat crude.

But her master, Zhang Wangshuang, still attended. He looked at the newlyweds below and sighed softly, a faint smile reluctantly appearing on his face.

That night, countless heartbroken disciples of the Grand Dao Sect drank themselves into oblivion, with many fights breaking out as a result.

It is worth mentioning that the reason why so many young disciples of the Grand Dao Sect were infatuated with Senior Sister Zhao was not only due to her unmatched beauty and strength among her peers.

More importantly, after practicing the "Heaven and Earth Converging Manual," Senior Sister Zhao inadvertently exuded an irresistible feminine allure that was almost impossible to withstand.

Furthermore, in the eyes of outsiders, Senior Sister Zhao's primordial yin remained intact, giving the impression that she was still a virgin.

Thus, even though she had always been close to Li Fan, she still attracted countless suitors who pursued her tirelessly.

After the wedding, following a reminder from Li Fan, Senior Sister Zhao dispelled her disguise.

Many hearts were broken again, yet there were still a few hopeless romantics who refused to give up.

Because after shedding her youthful aura, her mature charm was even more enticing, making her even harder to resist.

Fortunately, Senior Sister Zhao was utterly devoted to Li Fan, which eased some of the pressure on him.

However, whether for the sake of longevity or to protect Senior Sister Zhao, Li Fan became even more diligent in his cultivation from then on.

With no shortage of spirit stones and pills, combined with the dual cultivation of the "Heaven and Earth Converging Manual," Li Fan's cultivation level increased day by day.

In the blink of an eye, thirteen years had passed.

On this day, a heavenly phenomenon occurred.

All living beings in the Xuanhuang Realm saw an elderly man with a kind face and a high crown, standing tall and holding up the sky with his hands.

The phenomenon did not last long.

But in the hearts of all cultivators, a complex and indescribable emotion surged—grief, confusion, anger—all these emotions intertwined, creating a mix of feelings.

After the image of the elder disappeared, all cultivators gradually understood.

Today, the Immortal Ancestor had achieved eternal longevity.

From this day forth, he was to be revered as the "Immortal Ancestor of Dao Transmission."

He single-handedly altered the cultivation path of the world. From now on, cultivators could only practice the method of seizing the heavens and the earth that he had established.

Although many years had passed, and most cultivators had already adopted the new method, there were still some who clung desperately to the old "Heaven-Man Unity" cultivation path.

Now, he had cut off the old path entirely.

Some of the "old antiques," as these ancient cultivators were mockingly called, committed suicide in despair.

Others left in anger, disappearing from the world.

Chaos spread across every corner of the Xuanhuang Realm, including within the Grand Dao Sect.

The new method was unstoppable.

These disturbances were mere ripples in the grand tide, unable to change the overall course of the river.

After the turmoil subsided, the world entered a rare period of peace and explosive growth.

The number of cultivators, and the quality of their realms, increased at an alarming rate.

Even someone like Li Fan, who was of average talent, managed to ascend to the Soul Transformation stage in just over twenty years after switching to the new method, given that he lacked no resources.

Not to mention the other elite disciples within the sect.

If not for the scarcity of Heaven and Earth Essences, and the unpredictable nature of their appearance, there would likely be an explosion of Dao Integration cultivators.

Senior Sister Zhao, as one of the most outstanding disciples of the Grand Dao Sect, passed countless tests and eventually succeeded in integrating the Dao.

She became one of the few true disciples of the Grand Dao Sect.

"Congratulations! Congratulations! The tide has risen, and where once a Soul Transformation cultivator could become a true disciple, now only Dao Integration can qualify." Li Fan kissed Senior Sister Zhao and embraced her in congratulations.

However, her face showed little joy. Instead, a rare trace of worry appeared.

Having spent decades together, Li Fan knew her well and was surprised to see this unusual expression on her face.

Concerned, he asked, "Senior Sister, what are you worried about?"

"When I was breaking through, I had an inexplicable premonition." Senior Sister Zhao waved her hand, sealing the surrounding space.

Then she quietly transmitted her voice, saying, "The current prosperous and bustling cultivation world, which seems to be flourishing like a blazing fire, is actually hiding a certain crisis."

"Once it erupts..."

Li Fan was shocked.

He knew that at the moment of breaking through to the Dao Integration stage, one came close to achieving the ancient "Heaven-Man Unity" state of cultivation. The insights gained at that stage were never without reason.

Although he did not know where the crisis would come from, it did not stop the two from preparing for it in advance.

Having cultivated together for many years, the two were already inseparable and had become a unified front.

Without alerting anyone else, the couple continued their normal cultivation while secretly gathering resources, preparing for the possible cataclysmic change that could descend at any moment.

They did not expect that this preparation would last over thirty years.

Time flew by, and the crisis never materialized. The couple began to think that their past premonition had been nothing more than an illusion.

During those thirty years, Senior Sister Zhao's cultivation became increasingly profound, and her crushing battle prowess elevated her to the status of Dao Child, the heir apparent of the Grand Dao Sect.

She was bestowed the "Heaven-Slaying Dao Scripture."

If nothing unexpected happened, in a few years, once the current sect leader passed, she would be the next in line to become the sect leader of the Grand Dao Sect.

Senior Sister Zhao was filled with excitement, and Li Fan was genuinely happy for her.

But their joy was short-lived.

One day, the long-forgotten cataclysmic change in heaven and earth suddenly arrived.

It came so unexpectedly, so incomprehensibly, and so unacceptably for cultivators.

All the preparation they had done over the years turned out to be a joke.

Li Fan and Senior Sister Zhao were the first to sense the anomaly during their dual cultivation.

"Hmm?"

After one of their usual intense dual cultivation sessions, Li Fan voiced his confusion.

"What is it?"

Senior Sister Zhao, still not fully recovered from the blissful experience, asked curiously.

"Why does it feel like the effect of this dual cultivation session wasn't as good?"

Li Fan furrowed his brows.

"Could it be another bottleneck?"

After reaching the Dao Integration stage, the improvement from dual cultivation had become less noticeable, so Senior Sister Zhao hadn’t initially noticed anything wrong.

But after Li Fan's reminder, she checked and her expression subtly changed.

"There's no bottleneck, but the effectiveness has significantly diminished."

"Let's try again."

Li Fan nodded in agreement.

After a long while.

Li Fan's expression grew heavy. "Why has it suddenly stopped working?"

"Could it be that the 'Heaven and Earth Converging Manual'..."

Before he could finish, they suddenly heard a commotion and uproar outside.

"It's not just dual cultivation techniques—it's all cultivation methods..."

"They've all malfunctioned!"

Senior Sister Zhao finally realized what was happening, her face turning pale as she stood up abruptly.

Chapter 517: Switching to Cultivate Xuantian Art

Senior Sister Zhao's reminder made Li Fan's heart skip a beat, and he quickly attempted to activate the cultivation technique he had been practicing, "The Nine Revolutions of the Void Truth".

This technique, "The Nine Revolutions of the Void Truth", was what he had switched to after advancing to the Soul Transformation realm.

Although its power couldn't compare to the "Heaven-Slaying Dao Scripture", it was still highly formidable.

It directly pointed toward the Longevity Realm and could be considered a supreme method.

The nine revolutions of the void involved understanding oneself thoroughly with each revolution, gaining insight into a unique divine ability. In any other sect, this would be regarded as a treasured legacy, reserved only for elders or a few core disciples.

Li Fan had only been given the opportunity to cultivate this technique because he had benefited from Senior Sister Zhao's promotion to Dao Child.

However, at this moment...

After circulating the technique for several cycles, not only did his cultivation fail to increase, but he also vaguely sensed the locations of a few fellow disciples who were cultivating the same technique.

Moreover, the more he focused on sensing, the more an uncontrollable murderous intent surged in his heart.

"What is going on?!" Li Fan was both shocked and terrified, his face instantly darkening.

"Multiple people cannot cultivate the same technique... this is the backlash of heaven and earth..." Senior Sister Zhao looked up at the sky and muttered to herself. "I never expected the calamity I foresaw to manifest in this way."

"Multiple people cannot cultivate the same technique."

Hearing these words made Li Fan's heart race. As he pondered the situation, he seemed to envision an inevitable, unstoppable bloodbath sweeping across the cultivation world.

Since embarking on his path of cultivation, he had never felt such bone-deep fear.

But Li Fan was now a Soul Transformation cultivator, a prominent figure in the outside world. Though alarmed, he didn't panic. He paced back and forth in the room, frowning as he pondered the situation.

"The Heaven and Earth Converging Manual" was cultivated only by you and me. Although its effectiveness has been greatly reduced, it's not entirely ineffective."

"So, does this mean the more people cultivate the same technique, the stronger the limitations?"

"It's almost certain that this strange phenomenon will have devastating effects on every sect in the world. Tens of thousands, even hundreds of thousands of disciples—where would they find so many techniques for all their members to practice?"

"Even the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance won't fare well. In fact, they might suffer even more than we do! After all, they are a newly established organization, unlike our Ten Great Immortal Sects with deep foundations. Their number of techniques is limited, and it's said that most of their lower-level members cultivate the [Heavenly Net Divine Art]." A shadow flickered in Li Fan's eyes.

"This is a calamity for all cultivators."

Li Fan turned to Senior Sister Zhao and, after hesitating for a moment, reminded her, "Multiple people cannot cultivate the same technique, so some sacrifices will be necessary. The 'Heaven-Slaying Dao Scripture' you cultivate conflicts with the sect master’s..."

A cold light appeared on Senior Sister Zhao's face.

Just as she was about to speak, a series of urgent and crisp bell chimes suddenly rang out from outside.

"The sect master is summoning an emergency meeting, likely to discuss how to deal with this calamity. I'll go first."

After she disappeared, her faint voice reached Li Fan's ears.

"Don't worry, I know what I'm doing."

Li Fan looked toward the sect's main hall at the mountain peak, his expression unreadable.

"Multiple people cannot cultivate the same technique..."

Alone, he entered a secret chamber and began recalling the techniques he had obtained from the ruins of the 'Xuantian Sect'.

Besides the Heaven and Earth Converging Manual, there were also Sole-Eternal Dominance Art, 'The Soul-Severing Divine Radiance Art,' and 'The Scripture of Heaven’s Sorrow and Earth’s Grief.'

Li Fan and Senior Sister Zhao had privately studied these techniques together.

However, the cultivation methods and their effects were drastically different from the current techniques, and they might even carry unclear marks or restrictions, much like dual cultivation techniques.

Thus, over the years, they had only memorized them and destroyed the original texts without actually practicing them.

"If there's no other option, I'll have to switch to these unique techniques from the Xuantian Sect." Li Fan was well aware that his position within the sect could never compare to that of the core disciples. He would undoubtedly be the first to be sacrificed. "Fortunately, the new techniques are fast to cultivate. Even if I have to start over, I can quickly return to my previous level."

"Fate works in mysterious ways. Who would've thought that a chance encounter in my youth would play such a decisive role many years later? With these unique techniques, I can survive this great calamity as long as I'm careful." Li Fan's eyes gleamed as he immersed himself in the contents of the techniques.

The highest-level meeting in the sect didn't last long. Soon, Sect Master Ji Changxi issued a decree to stabilize the disciples' minds.

He instructed them not to panic, saying that the Ten Great Immortal Sects had already begun researching a solution.

He also ordered all disciples of the sect who were outside to return immediately, as the sect would soon activate its protective barrier and close its gates.

At the same time, the pill room was ordered to work at full capacity to produce life-extending elixirs in case of emergencies.

…

As orders were issued, the disciples' panic gradually subsided.

The Ten Great Immortal Sects had stood for thousands of years. They should be able to find a way to respond, right?

Most disciples thought so.

Three years passed in this oppressive atmosphere.

Despite various attempts by cultivators, no solution to the issue of 'multiple people cultivating the same technique' had been found.

In fact, rumors began circulating about sects large and small fighting to the death over techniques, leading to the destruction of countless sects.

The only good news was that the mysterious 'Immortal Ancestor of Dao Transmission' had suddenly appeared.

He forcibly broke into the 'Taishang Sect' and obtained the 'Art of Dissolving Cultivation' from the 'Primordial Scripture of Taishang' for all cultivators.

With this wonderful technique, even if someone was forced to abandon their cultivation method, they wouldn't lose much of their power.

"I have to admit, I'm a little grateful to him," Li Fan said as he circulated the 'The Soul-Severing Divine Radiance Technique,' feeling his pure cultivation rapidly improving.

"Hmph, grateful to him? If it weren't for his introduction of the new methods, where would this heaven and earth backlash and great calamity come from? His intentions are vile and he deserves to die!" Senior Sister Zhao snorted coldly.

"According to the sect master, when he first began spreading the new methods, the Ten Great Immortal Sects investigated his background."

"Unfortunately, they couldn't find anything suspicious."

"They were too arrogant at the time, not taking him seriously. And there were..."

"And there were other matters to attend to, so they simply overlooked him."

"By the time they realized, the new methods had spread like wildfire, unstoppable!"

"Damn him!"

Having also switched techniques, Senior Sister Zhao spoke coldly, a hint of killing intent flashing in her eyes.

Chapter 518: The Mysterious Escape of Holy Envoy

Li Fan noticed the deliberate omission in Senior Sister Zhao's words, and a thought crossed his mind.

However, he did not pursue it further.

Although they were Dao companions, she, being the Dao Child of the Grand Dao Sect, was destined to come into contact with highly classified secrets. It was natural for her not to reveal everything.

"Regardless, the act of seizing and publishing the 'Primordial Scripture of Taishang' indirectly saved countless cultivators. It could be considered a great merit," Li Fan sighed.

Suddenly, as if a thought struck him, Li Fan froze slightly.

"What's the matter?" Senior Sister Zhao noticed his unusual behavior and asked, a bit surprised.

"The logic against heaven..." Li Fan turned his head, staring directly at Senior Sister Zhao.

"Isn't it the natural law that one cannot cultivate multiple techniques at once? But if there is a cultivator who reverses this law and achieves eternal Dao, wouldn't that mean the Xuanhuang Realm could be saved?"

Senior Sister Zhao was silent for a moment, then gently shook her head. "You're not wrong, several seniors did try to do this."

"But without exception, all of them failed."

"The stronger the law of heaven, the harder it is to reverse. The law against cultivating multiple techniques is something the heavens imposed to counterbalance us cultivators, a natural alteration."

"If you think deeply, this law was already reversed once. To reverse it again... the difficulty is far more than doubled."

"Otherwise, why do you think the countless geniuses within the Ten Great Immortal Sects haven't attempted to defy the Dao of Transmission of the Immortal Ancestor, completely eradicating the foundation of the new methods?"

Senior Sister Zhao explained to Li Fan.

Li Fan pondered the meaning behind her words, sinking into deep thought.

After three years of chaos, cultivators seemed to have gradually adapted to a life where they could no longer cultivate multiple techniques.

It was simply that their cultivation realms could no longer advance. However, this allowed them to avoid the daily grind of cultivation and instead idly wandered around the sect, enjoying leisurely days.

Life was not too bad.

As for those with exceptional talent, they were arranged by the sect elders to practice one technique alone.

Senior Sister Zhao was no exception.

The technique she was cultivating now, 'The Eternal Scripture of Impermanence', although not as powerful as Heaven-Slaying Dao Scripture, was still sufficient for her to cultivate to the Longevity Realm.

However, with her lofty aspirations, Senior Sister Zhao would not be content with mediocrity.

As the saying goes, after experiencing the best, it’s hard to settle for less. Having personally practiced the most profound techniques in the world, switching to a lesser technique felt like chewing wax — tasteless and dull.

Thus, she turned her attention to the two remaining techniques of the Xuantian Sect.

After much deliberation, she chose 'The Scripture of Heaven’s Sorrow and Earth’s Grief.'

"Heaven’s sorrow, earth’s Grief's, the world mourns. This technique is only half a step below Heaven-Slaying Dao Scripture," Senior Sister Zhao remarked.

"The Xuantian Sect was indeed once the ruler of the entire Xuanhuang Realm. Even a Heavenly King carried so many profound and exquisite techniques. I wonder how many more treasures were on that escaping Holy Envoy," Senior Sister Zhao casually sighed.

"An holy envoy? The envoy of the Xuantian Sect?" Li Fan asked curiously. "He managed to escape the pursuit of the Ten Great Immortal Sects?"

"Yes, not only did he escape, but he also took the Xuantian Sect’s most precious treasure, the Xuantian Mirror, with him. Since then, he's vanished without a trace. Even though the Ten Great Sects have scoured the entire Xuanhuang Realm, they haven’t found a sign of him."

Senior Sister Zhao shook her head, glossing over the matter.

"Junior Brother, it’s been a while since we’ve dual cultivated..." A slight blush appeared on her cheeks as she whispered.

"Heh..." Li Fan, understanding her intentions, pulled Senior Sister Zhao into the secret chamber and sealed the surrounding space.

——

The peaceful days didn’t last long.

Li Fan didn’t know what was happening in the outside world, but when the first disciple of the Grand Dao Sect died because they could no longer break through their cultivation realm and exhausted their lifespan, a wave of anxiety and unease began to spread among the people.

Li Fan attended the funeral of the deceased cultivator named Zhu Jun.

It was very simple, just a quick cremation of the body, and according to Zhu Jun's wishes, he was buried on a mountain.

The funeral wasn’t filled with deep sorrow, but Li Fan could clearly see the grief in the eyes of the cultivators attending—a shared sense of fate.

Not long after, a saying began circulating within the Grand Dao Sect: "Yesterday it was Zhu Jun, today it’s all of us, tomorrow it will be the Sovereign's turn."

The Grand Dao Sect had Longevity Realm cultivators suppressing the situation, so even if there was rebellion, nothing could overturn the balance.

Rather than dying in vain in the mountains, it was better to go down and search for a glimmer of hope!

Affected by Zhu Jun's death, several disciples held this belief and voluntarily abolished the sect's techniques, applying to leave the sect in search of survival.

Sect Master Ji Changxi was not a heartless person and agreed to their requests.

He also promised that if they found no way out and regretted their decision, they could return at any time.

Some disciples were so moved that they shed tears on the spot and decided to stay in the sect, ready to live and die with it.

However, a few cultivators still insisted on leaving.

Ji Changxi did not stop them.

With these unstable elements gone, the Grand Dao Sect returned to peace.

Yet, it was clear to any discerning person that beneath this calm surface, a terrifying storm was brewing, ready to explode at any moment.

Just half a year later, some of the disciples who had left returned to the sect in tears, begging for the Sect Master to let them come back.

When they returned and recounted the situation outside, the surviving cultivators in the sect realized how lucky they were.

Due to the inability to cultivate multiple techniques, the outside world had turned into a horrific slaughterhouse.

The former peace had completely disappeared.

Walking on the road, one could be randomly attacked by a cultivator intent on fighting to the death, all for the possibility of gaining a technique.

The disciples who left the sect had abolished their techniques and only had a few magical tools for protection. How could they survive such chaos?

Severely injured, those who returned alive were the lucky ones.

These people had lost their courage and no longer mentioned cultivation, simply waiting for death within the sect.

The remaining disciples of the Grand Dao Sect also felt a deep sense of foreboding.

They no longer mentioned leaving.

On this day.

"Senior Sister, have you noticed anything strange?" Li Fan found Senior Sister Zhao, his expression serious.

"Hmm? Is there something wrong with the cultivation technique?" Senior Sister Zhao was unusually distracted.

It took her a long while to respond, frowning.

"Why do I see many disciples coughing?" Li Fan noticed her strange behavior, but his eyes flashed, and he didn’t ask more.

Instead, he mentioned the bizarre phenomenon he had observed.

"Coughing? Impossible. Even though they abolished their techniques, their cultivation realms are still intact. How could cultivators fall ill like mortals?"

As she said this, Senior Sister Zhao extended her divine sense outward.

Upon seeing the situation, her expression changed dramatically.

Without a word to Li Fan, she flew out to find a sickly disciple.

Chapter 519: The Might of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma

Li Fan saw that something was wrong and hurriedly followed.

Sister Zhao stood some distance away, her expression grave as she inspected the state of the cultivator before her.

“Cough, cough…” This disciple of the Grand Dao Sect was stuck at the Nascent Soul stage, but at this moment, he looked no different from a dying mortal, his eyes hollow, his consciousness muddled, his breath as faint as a wisp.

He coughed violently from time to time, as if he were about to cough his lungs out.

A trace of deathly grayness was faintly visible on his face, and his body appeared weak beyond belief, completely unfit for someone at the Nascent Soul stage.

Li Fan felt a chill run down his spine.

Just a moment ago, this cultivator didn’t seem this severe. In the short time it took to find Sister Zhao, the situation had worsened dramatically.

“Could it be some kind of evil curse?” Li Fan squinted, trying to analyze the situation.

“Cough… Dao Child?” In his confusion, the cultivator recognized the two standing before him. He instinctively struggled to stand and offer a salute.

“No need, if you’re feeling unwell, don’t move. Rest well,” Sister Zhao stopped him, speaking gently.

“Ugh…” This disciple of the Grand Dao Sect had never seen Sister Zhao display such warmth and gentleness in his entire life.

For a moment, his face regained a slight glow, as if he had experienced a brief resurgence of life. He stared at Sister Zhao, filled with infatuation, as if his soul had been captivated.

“After you descended the mountain, where did you go? What encounters did you have, and whom did you meet?” Sister Zhao asked again.

Despite his failing body, the cultivator, coughing and gasping for breath, struggled to recount everything to her in meticulous detail.

Gradually, his breath weakened.

But seeing Sister Zhao’s eager expression, he persevered, speaking in halting, broken sentences.

Finally, when he uttered his last word, his breath ceased abruptly.

Yet his eyes remained open, staring at Sister Zhao with an unyielding, reluctant gaze.

“Let’s go!” Sister Zhao quickly grabbed Li Fan and swiftly left the scene.

At the same time, she handed him a purple-gold pill, instructing him to swallow it.

“The Creation Purple-Gold Pill?” Li Fan was shocked.

This pill was a secret treasure of the Grand Dao Sect, usually crafted only by longevity realm experts. No matter how severe the injury, as long as one wasn’t already dead, consuming it would instantly restore the body to its peak. It was practically a second life.

It was incredibly rare, and the sect had very few in reserve.

Yet now, Sister Zhao had unhesitatingly given him one…

Li Fan immediately realized the gravity of the situation and swallowed the Creation Purple-Gold Pill.

“Don’t waste it. Wrap it in your spiritual energy and slowly absorb its medicinal power,” Sister Zhao instructed while simultaneously casting spells, constructing layers of protective barriers around them.

“Could the cause of that disciple’s death still be contagious? What kind of curse is this powerful? Is it targeting our Grand Dao Sect?” Li Fan couldn’t help but feel alarmed.

“Rather than a curse, it seems more like a disease. A deadly disease that even cultivators cannot escape or avoid,” Sister Zhao’s expression was more serious than ever.

Even during the great upheaval when the laws of heaven could no longer be practiced, she hadn’t been this worried.

“Its target is not just our Grand Dao Sect but the extermination of all cultivators in the world… This must be reported immediately!”

Li Fan was stunned. “Could this be another backlash from the heavens? Damn it, is the treacherous heavens really trying to wipe us out completely?”

“Cough… cough…” As the two flew toward the sect’s main hall, Sister Zhao’s face suddenly turned an eerie pale color.

Then, uncontrollably, she began to cough softly.

But soon, a purple-golden light appeared, suppressing the paleness. The coughing stopped, and her complexion regained its rosy hue.

“How could it manifest so quickly? Sister, you’re at the Dao Integration stage!” Li Fan’s heart filled with a terrifying disbelief.

If even a Dao Integration expert was affected, what hope was there for him, a mere Soul Transformation cultivator?

Not daring to wait for the symptoms to show, he quickly circulated a sliver of the Creation Purple-Gold Pill’s medicinal power from his dantian, spreading it throughout his body as a defense.

Sure enough, not long after he finished, a wave of exhaustion swept over him.

It felt as if he had battled Sister Zhao for seven days and nights straight, his entire body aching as though his bones were about to break.

His throat burned as if cut by a blade, but his body, like a drowning mortal, desperately yearned for air, struggling to surface and take a deep breath.

Fortunately, the Creation Purple-Gold Pill’s reputation was well-deserved.

As its power circulated, the abnormal symptoms disappeared in an instant.

“Hiss… This disease is truly ferocious!” It felt as though he had brushed against death, and Li Fan looked at Sister Zhao with lingering fear. “Thankfully, I had your pill. Otherwise, I’d have ended up just like that junior brother!”

“Don’t let your guard down. This only suppressed the symptoms temporarily. The true culprit causing all this still remains inside us,” Sister Zhao reminded him at the right moment.

As if to validate her words, she quickly coughed again, though softly.

Even though the Creation Purple-Gold Pill soon neutralized the illness, it made Li Fan’s heart sink further.

They had miraculous pills to protect them, yet they still couldn’t shake off this mysterious disease. How much worse would it be for the ordinary disciples of the Grand Dao Sect, not to mention unaffiliated cultivators?

It was unimaginable.

The two fought off the illness as they swiftly arrived at the sect’s main hall.

There, the sect leader, Ji Changxi, having received Sister Zhao’s message in advance, had already gathered all the elders.

Though Sister Zhao had done her best to explain the severity of the disease, Ji Changxi and the elders gave it proper attention.

But…

It wasn’t enough.

In their eyes, although Sister Zhao had recently broken through to the Dao Integration stage thanks to a new cultivation method, she couldn’t be compared to them, who had been at the Dao Integration stage for centuries.

They possessed countless secret techniques and methods. What could harm this young Dao child might not necessarily harm them.

Besides, they believed they were fully prepared.

The space within the main hall was surrounded by numerous restrictive spells, layers upon layers of sealing barriers.

They had even activated the [Profound Abyss Dao Breakthrough Formation], which seemed close but was actually separated by several worlds.

It was absolutely secure, and they were completely confident.

“You two, stop suppressing the disease and each release a drop of your own blood,” Ji Changxi instructed.

Li Fan and Sister Zhao obeyed.

With soft coughs, two droplets of blood, each exuding an ominous aura, floated before the crowd.

Everyone observed from a distance, and the hall fell into silence.

Suddenly, a fleeting, almost imperceptible look of surprise crossed Ji Changxi’s face.

Chapter 520: The Heavenly Sovereign Slaughters Ten Thousand Immortals

Without knowing exactly what he had discovered, he suddenly took out Senior Sister Zhao's drop of blood from the isolated space and began to carefully examine it nearby.

"Master, you—!" Senior Sister Zhao couldn't help but exclaim in surprise.

"No worries!" A layer of black light emerged from around Ji Changxi's body, enveloping him entirely.

In that instant, Senior Sister Zhao recognized it—it was the unique divine light exhibited by the magical power [The Dao Is Mine Alone] from the Heaven-Slaying Dao Scripture.

All foreign energies, in the presence of this magical power, would be transformed into something the practitioner could control.

She had also briefly cultivated this divine technique! But now…

Lowering her head, Senior Sister Zhao carefully concealed the ambition and dissatisfaction in her eyes.

Fortunately, all the senior members of the Grand Dao Sect present had their attention focused entirely on the continuously swirling drop of blood in Ji Changxi's hand. It seemed no one had noticed her anomaly.

Black light surged endlessly from Master Ji’s body, surrounding the blood drop.

While the black light churned, the blood drop was gradually being consumed.

However, before Ji Changxi could analyze what was happening, a sharp cough suddenly echoed beside him.

A trace of surprise appeared on his face.

And this was only the beginning.
