As if triggered by a chain reaction, soon after, uncontrollable coughing echoed throughout the grand hall of the sect, where the elites were gathered.

"How is this possible?!" After experiencing the severity of this unknown illness firsthand, the elders' expressions changed dramatically.

"Interesting, interesting…"

"Wait, this seems to be…"

However, those present are after all the elites of the elites who have survived from the Xuanhuang Realm for thousands of years.

Very quickly, each of them used their own methods to suppress the abnormalities in their bodies.

Some even began to study it on the spot with great interest.

Seeing the elders respond in this manner, Li Fan and Senior Sister Zhao exchanged a glance, feeling slightly relieved.

"The contagiousness and virulence are extremely terrifying. This is something rarely seen in my life! I fear that even the [Absolute Immortal Edict] released during the dying struggle of the Xuantian Sect might not compare." An elderly man with white hair said slowly.

Li Fan only knew that this person was named Mo Zhiren, one of the elders of the Grand Dao Sect and an expert in pharmacology. He usually kept a low profile and refrained from sect affairs. However, it was said that the pills he refined were of the highest quality. Even the 'Creation Purple Gold Pill' Li Fan had taken before—Mo Zhiren could produce a flawed version with 70-80% efficacy despite only being at the Dao Integration stage.

Once Mo Zhiren spoke, the other elders immediately began to voice their opinions.

"This illness, once contracted, grows autonomously within a cultivator’s body. Mild symptoms are manageable, but if not suppressed in time, it will worsen into a severe condition..."

"At best, one's cultivation will regress; at worst, they will perish, body and soul!"

As soon as this was said, the expressions of everyone present became grim.

"I just tried over ten different methods, and while I could quickly eliminate the symptoms caused by the disease, the source of this affliction seems to linger, still hidden deep within the body. What is its host medium? Strange, truly strange..."

"We elders have strong cultivation and can easily suppress the symptoms, but what about the disciples? Without medicinal aid, they might…"

"First, we had the 'Law of Incompatible Cultivation', and now we face this bizarre disease..."

"The immortal path is severed, the future bleak! Perhaps it’s time to retreat, perhaps it's time to retreat!"

"Lei Fanzi, stop your nonsense in front of the juniors!"

...

The grand sect hall, usually the most solemn place, now resembled a noisy marketplace.

Li Fan and Senior Sister Zhao kept their heads down, not daring to show any abnormal expressions.

"Everyone!"

At this moment, a voice rang out, drawing everyone’s attention.

The hall fell silent instantly.

"I have an idea," said Ji Changxi, the Grand Dao Sect Master, with a serious expression.

"Some of you may have already realized it—the reason this strange disease is so hard to defend against is that it is one of the newly born laws of Heaven and Earth."

"The so-called law of nature. But unlike the 'Law of Incompatible Cultivation'..."

"This... was caused by a cultivator!"

The words thundered through the hall, and Li Fan and Senior Sister Zhao immediately looked up, shocked, staring at Ji Changxi as waves of disbelief surged in their minds.

A cultivator did this?

Defying the laws of Heaven and Earth?

Since the Immortal Ancestor Achieved Longevity, where only the new laws of Heaven could be cultivated, no one had ever defied Heaven's will to break through to the 'Longevity' realm.

The Ten Great Immortal Sects had countless heroes.

But despite decades of attempts, no so-called genius had succeeded.

This showed just how difficult it was to defy Heaven’s will!

However, according to Sect Master Ji, a cultivator had silently succeeded in attaining Longevity?

Who was it?

The Ten Great Immortal Sects, though full of intrigue, still maintained communication. If someone had broken through to the Longevity realm, even if there was no prior announcement, once the breakthrough was made, news would have been shared with the other sects.

Moreover, this new Longevity Immortal seemed to defy conventional law that the 'cultivators   are immune to diseases'.

This kind of action, which essentially made enemies of all cultivators, could not possibly have come from one of the Ten Great Immortal Sects.

Who would dig their own grave?

So, who was this person that had not only reached the Longevity realm but also sought to eradicate all cultivators?

This was an outright provocation and declaration of war.

It wasn't just Li Fan and Senior Sister Zhao who were stunned.

All the elders and Ji Changxi in the hall had expressions filled with restrained killing intent.

"Investigate! We must find out the truth!"

"Even if this person is a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign, such actions cannot be forgiven!"

"I will immediately meet with the other heads of the Immortal Sects and pass on this information. As for the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance..." Ji Changxi paused.

"We’ll send someone to inform them as well and gauge their response."

"The strongest forces in the Xuanhuang Realm must unite. I refuse to believe that this individual can continue to roam free!"

"While tracking down the culprit, we must also take precautions against this illness. From today on, the medicine hall will operate at full capacity, ensuring the Grand Dao Sect has an adequate supply of medicinal pills."

"As for those outside the Grand Dao Sect…"

Ji Changxi hesitated for a moment.

"After numerous calamities, our Grand Dao Sect has suffered greatly. We may barely have the strength to protect ourselves…"

"So, let them fend for themselves."

The elders all nodded slightly in agreement with the sect master’s decision.

"I will also try to find a way to alleviate the symptoms of this strange disease," Mo Zhiren said, his eyes gleaming with desire.

"If I can completely neutralize its harm to cultivators, it would mean defying the laws of Heaven once again."

"In that case, perhaps 'Longevity' might still be within my reach."

He muttered to himself.

Chapter 521: Emperor San’s Surprising Strategy

Chapter 521: Emperor San's Surprising Strategy

Ever since the conclusion of the high-level meeting at the Grand Dao Sect, this mysterious plague has spread throughout the mountain gates at an alarming rate.

Even though an official decree was issued early on, ordering the disciples to be vigilant, practice self-isolation, and avoid contact with others, the situation spiraled out of control. Various pills were distributed to the disciples as needed, but...

None of the measures worked!

The speed at which the plague spreads and its lethality toward lower-level cultivators far exceeded the expectations of the Grand Dao Sect leadership.

In less than a month, almost every disciple of the Grand Dao Sect had contracted this strange illness. The miraculous Creation Purple Gold Pill, a divine medicine, wasn’t available to all disciples. Ordinary pills proved to be more of a psychological comfort than an actual remedy in the face of this plague.

It all depended on individual luck.

Those with milder symptoms gradually recovered after enduring some pain, though their cultivation levels dropped. At least they survived. However, more disciples experienced severe symptoms, and despite using all kinds of life-saving techniques and secret arts, they couldn’t escape death.

The situation grew even grimmer, with everyone in the Grand Dao Sect living in fear. No one dared to handle the bodies of the dead. From a safe distance, they would use spells to completely disintegrate the corpses, serving as a makeshift funeral.

The Grand Dao Sect, once filled with life, now was shrouded in sorrow, with cries of despair echoing throughout. It was hard to believe this was one of the most powerful sects in the cultivation world.

Given how the Grand Dao Sect was faring, one could only imagine the devastation in other places.

On this day, Sect Leader Ji Changxi once again summoned Senior Sister Zhao and Li Fan to the main hall to discuss the strange plague.

"Cough cough..."

As soon as they entered the hall, the sound of coughing echoed from all directions. The elders and Sect Leader Ji Changxi no longer had their former vigor, appearing weak and sickly, barely keeping up appearances. Some elders even lay down, with puppets around them gently massaging their bodies, their occasional groans breaking the silence.

Despite being in the same hall, Li Fan noticed that everyone was isolated from each other with barriers and formations.

“How have you two been feeling lately?” Sect Leader Ji asked.

“Thank you for your concern, Sect Leader. Over the past month, we each took three Creation Purple Gold Pills. Both Li Fan and I are now fine. Most of the symptoms have disappeared, and we should fully recover soon,” Senior Sister Zhao replied with her head lowered.

*Cough cough*, “That’s good to hear, but you must remain cautious in the future and continue to prioritize personal protection. Based on the current situation, even if someone recovers from this plague, they could face a second or even multiple infections,” Ji Changxi said with a serious expression.

Senior Sister Zhao’s face paled slightly.

Before she could respond, Ji Changxi continued, “The reason I called you here today is to assign you a task.”

“After a period of investigation, we’ve come to some initial conclusions regarding the origin of this strange plague.”

Li Fan immediately focused, listening intently.

“Previously, we suspected that this illness was caused by a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign reversing some natural law of the world. Recently, we’ve confirmed which natural law was altered.”

“In the eyes of cultivators, mortals are like ants. However, this illness allows even mortals to kill immortals!” A trace of uncontrollable anger flashed in Ji Changxi’s eyes.

“This plague actually originated from a plague that spread among mortals years ago.”

“It originally posed no threat to us cultivators, but after this manipulation by a Heavenly Sovereign, it underwent a fundamental change, becoming a threat to our very lives.”

“Heh, it could now be called the ‘Immortal Plague.’”

“I don’t know what this Longevity Sovereign was thinking or what their ultimate goal is, but it seems they are determined to drive us to destruction. The situation is starting to spiral out of control.”

“Out of control?” Senior Sister Zhao asked in shock, “Has this Immortal Plague really reached that level?”

Ji Changxi shook his head, “You’ve been in the sect this whole time, so you don’t know what’s been happening in the outside world over the past month.”

“The source of the Immortal Plague is mortals, and this fact has spread among the cultivation world.”

“Those cultivators who are dying from the plague have begun to take out their anger by slaughtering mortals. The world outside is now a scene of hell.”

“They are too cowardly to confront the Heavenly Sovereign, so they vent their frustration on the weak. It’s disgraceful!” Senior Sister Zhao’s eyes flashed with cold fury upon hearing this.

Ji Changxi, however, said, “It’s understandable that those who are on the verge of death lose their sanity. We can’t completely blame them.”

“But the indiscriminate slaughter of mortals is excessive. The Immortal Plague lies dormant within the mortals, and even if they die, the plague won’t disappear. In fact, it will spread even further.”

“Moreover, if they truly wipe out all mortals, how will the world be sustained…”

Ji Changxi paused slightly.

“That’s why this madness must be stopped.”

“All the elders are currently focused on finding a way to counter the Immortal Plague, and they cannot leave their duties. So, I’m entrusting this task to you two.”

“Of course, the 'Xuanhuang' Realm is vast, and the two of you alone won’t be enough. Other sects will also send disciples to help save mortal lives.”

Senior Sister Zhao bowed and accepted the command but raised a concern: “Under normal circumstances, those cultivators might fear the reputation of the Ten Great Sects and stop the slaughter of mortals. But now, many of them are so far gone…”

Ji Changxi waved his hand to cut her off and said, “Those who have completely lost their minds, you needn’t waste time trying to reason with them. Just kill them. As for the others, tell them that the Ten Great Sects have devised a way to deal with the Immortal Plague. Have them wait patiently and stop committing senseless slaughter.”

Senior Sister Zhao’s expression turned strange. “Have we really found a way to counter the Immortal Plague?”

To her surprise, Ji Changxi nodded slightly. “The idea came from the Longevity Immortal Beast of the Beast Taming Sect. Since the source of the Immortal Plague is mortals, and we can’t kill them all, the solution is to exile them to the various 'Cave Heavens' and minor worlds attached to the Xuanhuang Realm.”

“Without mortals, the concentration of the Immortal Plague in our realm should significantly decrease. Afterward, completely eradicating it won’t be difficult. At the very least, it will allow us cultivators to live normal lives.”

“Although the feasibility of this mass migration is still under discussion, it seems like the best option for now.”

“The Great Migration Plan…”

“Relay this to the other cultivators. With a sliver of hope, they shouldn’t be as crazed.”

Chapter 522: A Sudden Century Passes

And so, Li Fan and Senior Sister Zhao received their orders and descended from the mountain.

Due to the mass deaths of mortals, the concentration of 'Immortal Plague' in the environment skyrocketed.

To prepare for this, before their departure, Sect Master Ji provided them with a generous supply of resources, including the Creation Purple Gold Pill.

However, this wasn’t enough to entirely ease their heavy hearts.

After confirming that 'Immortal Plague' could infect multiple times, they realized that no matter how well-prepared or protected they were, constantly being in contact would inevitably lead to reinfection.

The painful memories of being infected just a month ago were still fresh in their minds.

As cultivators, it had been a long time since they experienced something worse than death.

If this torment were to repeat again and again…

That kind of suffering might be worse than simply ending it all.

Of course, this was merely a moment of frustration.

Both Senior Sister Zhao and Li Fan were wholeheartedly dedicated to the Dao, seeking Immortality, and wouldn’t easily give up their lives.

But orders were absolute, and even though Senior Sister Zhao held the esteemed position of the future sect master of Grand Dao Sect, she could only obediently follow instructions.

"This situation seems a bit odd. I’ve made inquiries, and although the other nine sects have also sent their disciples out into the world, at most, they sent True Desciples . I haven’t heard of any sect, like our Grand Dao Sect, sending out someone of 'Dao Child' status!" Li Fan slightly shook his head, his eyes full of confusion.

"Senior Sister, you are the next in line to become the sect master, an incredibly noble position. Especially in these turbulent times, what you should be doing is staying in the sect, in secluded cultivation, striving to raise your strength. Not participating in some absurd mission. What if, just what if…"

Li Fan glanced at her before continuing, "I mean, if something were to happen to you, and you fall, how much would it cost the sect to cultivate another Dao Child?"

"All the resources they’ve invested in you up until now, would they all be wasted?"

"Sect Master Ji’s decision this time is truly hard to understand. And none of the elders even voiced any objections…"

Senior Sister Zhao glanced at Li Fan and said calmly, "Junior Brother, you’re overthinking it. Our Dao Sect is representing of all Immortal Sects. Sending a Dao Child to represent us shows how seriously we take this matter."

"Besides…"

Her voice suddenly became slightly somber, "Junior Brother, in the past, your assumption might have been correct. But now…"

"The times have changed."

Li Fan was suddenly startled.

Indeed. He was still stuck in the mindset of the prosperous era of 'Great Immortal Cultivation', unable to adapt to the current reality.

In today’s cultivation world, each person held their own irreplaceable position.

The quicker a Dao Child increased their cultivation, the more of a threat they became in the eyes of the sect elders.

In the past, one could cultivate together with the sect. If someone didn’t want to become the sect master, they could simply retire as a Grand Elder and pass on the position.

But now, not interested in being the sect master? Fine, but you can’t continue holding onto the 'Heaven-Slaying Dao Scripture', right? You’ll have to switch your cultivation method!

Who could accept that?

Therefore, suppressing the growth of 'Dao Children' had become the logical outcome.

Realizing this, Li Fan fell silent.

The two followed the trail of blood-red light in the sky, arriving at a desolate ruin.

They remembered that just a few years ago, this was a thriving mortal city, with a population of at least 500,000.

But now, there was not a trace of life left.

Scanning with their divine senses, they saw that the ruins were filled with the corpses of mortals.

Men, women, young, old—no one was spared. The horrific scene was something that even the most terrifying nightmare couldn’t conjure.

"What utter madness…"

Murderous intent flashed in Senior Sister Zhao’s eyes as she cautiously protected herself from the Immortal Plague still lingering below, casting a spell to trace the perpetrator’s tracks.

"Let’s go!"

Moments later, after finding their target, Senior Sister Zhao transformed into a beam of light and flew away swiftly.

Li Fan hurried to follow.

He lagged slightly behind, and when he caught up, he found Senior Sister Zhao standing there, somewhat lost and at a loss.

It turned out that the cultivator who had massacred the city had already succumbed to the Immortal Plague and died.

The culprit was already dead, leaving Senior Sister Zhao with no outlet for her burning rage.

"Were they wrong? If we didn’t have so many pills to save our lives, wouldn’t we do the same when facing death?" For a moment, Senior Sister Zhao couldn’t help but question, feeling lost.

Li Fan was about to respond when he noticed a strange phenomenon in the sky above them.

"Qu Xinfeng, a cultivator of fifty-six years, who established his Dao foundation with the 'Mountain Stone Sword'…”

“Now dead, his Dao returns to heaven!”

As the scene in the sky unfolded, a message instantly flashed in Li Fan’s mind.

“What is this?" Li Fan was stunned.

"Hmm?" Senior Sister Zhao also noticed the strange sight above and looked up.

Moments later, her expression darkened.

She unleashed a sword slash, trying to scatter the phenomenon.

However, it seemed that the vision was engraved upon the heavens, and her attack was futile.

"What is this supposed to be? A joke from the heavens?"

Li Fan remained silent.

No shared cultivation methods, Immortal Plague.

And now, these eerie "death declarations" had appeared. Who knew what else might happen in the future?

He sighed lightly.

"Let’s go, Senior Sister. There's no point staying here. The sooner we finish the mission, the sooner we can return to the sect." Li Fan advised.

After a long pause, Senior Sister Zhao didn’t respond.

She simply obliterated the body of Qu Xinfeng, who had committed the massacre but had now fallen victim to the 'Immortal Plague'.

Only then did she turn into a streak of light and fly off.

The next two years were spent traveling across the Xuanhuang Realm, preventing countless tragedies.

They killed numerous insane cultivators and saved many mortal lives.

Once news of the 'Great Migration Plan' spread, the remaining cultivators gradually calmed down, no longer slaughtering mortals so recklessly.

Of course, some sporadic incidents couldn’t be avoided.

There were places the two couldn’t reach, where their efforts fell short.

Having completed the sect master’s task, the two were preparing to return to the sect as planned.

However, an unexpected order caught them off guard.

Sect Master Ji Changxi declared that the 'Great Migration Plan' had officially begun.

They were not to return just yet.

They were to remain in the Xuanhuang Realm and assist in coordinating the various sects, helping to carry out this crucial plan for all cultivators.

Li Fan, seeing Senior Sister Zhao’s face darken to the point where it almost dripped with anger, didn’t dare to speak.

He had no idea how to comfort her, so he simply stood silently by her side.

After a long while, Senior Sister Zhao’s expression returned to normal.

She smiled gracefully. "Let’s go, Junior Brother."

"Orders are orders, after all."

For some reason, seeing Senior Sister Zhao’s smile filled Li Fan with an indescribable sense of fear.

“Heh, yes, Senior Sister.” He responded cautiously, hurrying to comply.

In the blink of an eye, a hundred years had passed.

With the collective efforts of all cultivators, the Great Migration Plan was successfully completed.

All the mortals had been relocated to various 'cave heavens' and 'small worlds', and the Xuanhuang Realm was left empty.

After being away from their sect for over a century, Senior Sister Zhao and Li Fan were finally able to return.

Chapter 523: Old Friends’ Hearts Easily Changes

“Senior Sister...” Li Fan looked at Senior Sister Zhao, whose expression was complex as she was about to be summoned alone by Sect Master Ji. He wanted to speak but stopped himself.

“Hm? What’s wrong, Junior Brother?” She glanced at Li Fan and said softly, “We’ve lived and died together for over a century. What is there that we cannot be honest about?”

“Nothing.” Li Fan smiled freely, “Go ahead, Senior Sister. Just remember, no matter what you do, I will support you.”

Senior Sister Zhao smiled and walked into the grand hall of the sect.

“Boom!”

The heavy doors slammed shut, and Li Fan watched her disappearing figure, a trace of emotion flickering in his eyes that was hard for others to notice.

Instead of waiting outside the hall as he was supposed to, Li Fan returned to the Penglai Peak where he and Senior Sister Zhao resided, gathering all valuable items from their cave dwelling.

Then, pretending to patrol, he made his way near the exit of the sect’s protective formation.

On the surface, he acted no differently from an ordinary disciple, but in truth, Li Fan had already prepared to flee at any moment.

It wasn’t that Li Fan wanted to betray the Grand Dao Sect, but rather because...

During their century together at the foot of the mountain, Li Fan had accidentally discovered that Senior Sister Zhao was secretly collecting the blood of cultivators—and even mortals—who were infected with the "Immortal Plague".

Although she only took a single drop each time and was extremely discreet, how could her actions escape the eyes of someone who had spent so much time with her?

At first, after each sample was taken, Senior Sister Zhao would fall gravely ill.

Thanks to Li Fan’s attentive care and a supply of medicinal pills to protect her, she managed to recover each time.

When Li Fan asked her about it, she would jokingly say she wanted to attempt reversing the "Immortal Plague" and directly achieve eternal life.

Li Fan, of course, didn’t believe her.

However, knowing her nature, once Senior Sister Zhao made up her mind about something, even a partner of a hundred years like Li Fan couldn’t dissuade her.

So he simply stopped trying, telling her only, “Take care of your health.”

Later, it seemed that she had indeed listened to his advice and gradually stopped collecting blood samples.

The intervals between her illnesses grew longer, and the symptoms became milder each time.

But Li Fan knew it was all a façade.

Senior Sister Zhao had never truly abandoned her reckless behavior.

The reason she no longer showed signs of abnormality was that she had likely mastered a method to shield herself from the effects of the Immortal Plague...

Over the years, though they had always been together, Senior Sister Zhao’s cultivation had advanced to a level that even Li Fan couldn’t fathom.

The various auras that occasionally emanated from her made Li Fan secretly alarmed.

Even though he was sure she had no intention of harming him, Li Fan couldn’t shake the nagging sense of danger in his heart.

Although Senior Sister Zhao didn’t say it outright, Li Fan could guess her intentions. She had been collecting so much blood infused with the. "Immortal Plague" to likely deal with Sect Master Ji Changxi.

A century of deliberate suppression had pushed Senior Sister Zhao’s resentment toward the sect master to its limit.

As the saying goes, “Those who block my path to the Dao shall not live.”

Li Fan believed that his increasingly fanatical Senior Sister might very well carry out such a rebellious act.

Not long before, when she entered the sect’s grand hall, a flash of murderous intent in her eyes was no illusion.

“Ji Changxi may have been at the Dao Integration stage for over six centuries, with powers and abilities that are unfathomable. But after all, he hasn’t yet reached the Longevity stage.”

“Considering Senior Sister Zhao’s displayed talent and her real combat strength, combined with the help of the Immortal Plague, she might stand a chance.”

“But even if she wins by a narrow margin, what’s the point? Even if she kills Ji Changxi, there are still a dozen Dao Integration elders, not to mention the two hidden Heavenly Sovereign who rarely appear.”

“What, will she kill them all?”

Li Fan couldn’t understand why Senior Sister Zhao would make such a decision.

Whether she succeeded or failed, the entire Grand Dao Sect would know.

At that point, not only would she face the entire sect’s attack, but Li Fan, as her Dao companion, wouldn’t be spared either.

Thus, Li Fan, always planning ahead, had long prepared to escape.

As for why he hadn’t fled yet, he was simply hoping that a miracle might happen.

Time passed bit by bit.

Because Ji Changxi had previously ordered that he had important matters to discuss with his Dao child, no one was allowed to disturb him.

As a result, the grand hall remained sealed.

Li Fan gazed at the mountain peak from afar, growing increasingly anxious.

Seven days later.

The grand doors slowly opened, and Li Fan’s breath instantly hitched.

However, what happened next was completely unexpected.

Ji Changxi walked out first, followed by Senior Sister Zhao.

The two of them exited together.

“They didn’t fight to the death? Was I overthinking things?” Puzzled, Li Fan squinted slightly.

Not only had the expected deadly clash not occurred, but the relationship between the two seemed to have improved.

In fact, when Senior Sister Zhao left, Ji Changxi even patted her on the shoulder as if offering encouragement.

And Senior Sister Zhao accepted it without any unusual expression on her face.

Seeing this, Li Fan’s heart trembled, filled with confusion.

In the past, aside from him, Senior Sister Zhao had always been extremely averse to physical contact with others.

But now...

Feeling that something was amiss, countless thoughts flashed through Li Fan’s mind.

But he didn’t have time to ponder them all.

First, he remembered that there was something he hadn’t yet done.

He hurried back to Penglai Peak and, before Senior Sister Zhao returned, placed everything back where it belonged.

When she returned, Senior Sister Zhao didn’t notice anything unusual in the cave.

After all, the two hadn’t been back to this “home” in a century.

“Senior Sister, we’ve been busy with trivial matters for a hundred years and haven’t spent much time together. How about...” Li Fan tentatively suggested dual cultivation.

A trace of nostalgia flashed in Senior Sister Zhao’s eyes, and with a coy smile, she agreed.

After a passionate encounter, Li Fan’s suspicions gradually faded.

“What did the sect master summon you for this time?” Li Fan asked casually, holding her flawless, jade-like body in his arms.

“He said that soon, the position of Grand Dao Sect master will be passed on to me. He wants me to prepare in advance,” Senior Sister Zhao said flatly, without the slightest fluctuation in her tone.

It was as if the position she was about to inherit, as the leader of one of the top ten sects in the immortal world, was merely a child’s toy.

But those words, spoken so casually, struck Li Fan like a thunderclap. His mind went blank, and he temporarily lost the ability to think.

“And the Heaven-Slaying Dao Scripture?” Li Fan asked reflexively, his brain still in a daze.

“Hehe, the sect master’s exclusive technique? Of course, it will be handed over to me for cultivation,” Senior Sister Zhao laughed softly, tracing circles around Li Fan’s heart with her finger as if she had just reclaimed her favorite toy.

Chapter 524: The Beautiful Dream Will Eventually End

"Before I tell you, Junior Brother, this matter is known only to the Sect Master and me—no third person has ever heard of it."

"So you must help me keep this secret well."

Senior Sister Zhao said this with a faint, mysterious tone.

Suddenly, a wave of deadly crisis surged into Li Fan's heart.

In an instant, countless thoughts flashed through his mind. His body tensed for a moment but quickly returned to normal.

Gently stroking Senior Sister's smooth, pale back, he said as though it were natural: "Of course. I was stunned when I first heard this news. It felt a little unbelievable."

"Not to mention the elders. If they knew, they would certainly unite to stop it."

"Even with the Sect Master's support, compared to that group of old monsters, Senior Sister, our power is too weak. We still need to gather strength, stay low, and bide our time, striving to strike decisively when the moment is right," Li Fan thoughtfully advised.

Senior Sister Zhao remained silent, lying quietly in Li Fan's arms, unmoving as if she had fallen asleep.

"By the way, Senior Sister, why did Sect Master Ji suddenly want to pass the position of Sect Master to you?" After a long silence, Li Fan finally couldn't help but ask.

"Who knows? These old geezers are always so unpredictable. Maybe he's close to achieving Longevity realm and doesn't want to bother with the mess of our sect anymore?" Senior Sister Zhao shifted her position lazily as she spoke.

"After all, the world is getting more chaotic. In the eyes of those at the peak of cultivation, these so-called Ten Great Immortal Sects are more of a burden than a benefit..."

Her voice grew softer and softer until it was barely audible.

Seeing that she had no intention of continuing, Li Fan dared not press further.

Instead, they once again engaged in dual cultivation.

A fleeting moment of indulgence.

---

Li Fan knew that ever since that day when Senior Sister Zhao walked out of the sect's main hall, she had changed somehow.

It was just an inexplicable feeling, without any concrete evidence.

In the days that followed, as they spent every moment together, he didn’t notice any obvious abnormality in this senior sister, who had accompanied him for over a hundred years.

But...

Li Fan was still convinced that some subtle change was happening to her, bit by bit.

Yet, where did this persistent sense of impending danger come from?

Even if Senior Sister Zhao was hiding something from him, it didn’t seem like her feelings for him were fake.

If she became the Sect Master of the Grand Dao Sect, he would become her Dao companion.

This wasn't just some ordinary small sect—it was the illustrious and renowned Grand Dao Sect, famous across the entire cultivation world.

At that point, he would truly be second only to one, above ten thousand others.

Even in his wildest dreams of ambition, he had never dared to aspire to such a position.

Now, thanks to Senior Sister Zhao, wealth and glory were within his grasp!

So, what went wrong?

Li Fan instinctively felt that he had forgotten something important.

But no matter how hard he tried, he couldn’t remember it.

All he could do was carry on with his life as usual while secretly investigating.

Time flew by.

Another three years passed.

During this time, thanks to the combined efforts of many brilliant cultivators from the Ten Great Immortal Sects, they finally found a way to eradicate the lingering "Immortal Plague" that had permeated the world.

Thus, large-scale eradication operations began.

For the sake of future survival, every surviving sect had to send cultivators to various parts of the Xuanhuang Realm to carry out the eradication of the Immortal Plague.

Originally, Li Fan and Senior Sister Zhao had always been given the hard labor, but since Senior Sister Zhao had been confirmed as the next Sect Master, Ji Changxi naturally no longer sent them out.

Instead, another group of five core disciples was sent.

Li Fan was able to enjoy some leisure, staying within the sect.

As time passed, even within the sect, Li Fan could sense that the environment in the Xuanhuang Realm seemed to be gradually improving.

"Great peace follows great calamity. Hopefully, the world's tribulations will end soon, and we can once again welcome the golden age of cultivation!"

Occasionally, Li Fan would hear fellow disciples wishing aloud in the sect.

As the Immortal Plague gradually dissipated, Senior Sister Zhao became increasingly busy.

She seemed on the verge of officially assuming the position of Sect Master of the Grand Dao Sect and was constantly attending various meetings.

Those in attendance were all highly respected elders of the Grand Dao Sect.

It was certainly not easy to convince them.

Li Fan often saw elders storming out of meetings with angry expressions.

But Senior Sister Zhao assured him that there was nothing to worry about.

More and more elders were being convinced to support her in taking the position of Sect Master.

"Very soon, I'll truly become the Sect Master of the Grand Dao Sect," Senior Sister Zhao smiled and said.

Regarding this matter, not only did Li Fan have no worries, but the fear that had always lingered in his heart grew stronger.

It wasn't just about Senior Sister Zhao anymore.

It felt like something strange was happening throughout the entire Grand Dao Sect—something eerie and unsettling, but impossible to describe.

Although he could sense the unusualness, Li Fan couldn’t figure out what it was.

Feeling powerless, Li Fan grew more restless and angry with each passing day.

Naturally, Senior Sister Zhao noticed these emotions in him.

Fortunately, Li Fan brushed it off as being caused by the increasingly frequent celestial phenomena—the falling stars in the sky.

Originally, people had thought that once the Immortal Plague was eradicated, cultivators could enjoy a brief period of peace.

But who could have predicted that not long after, the world would change again?

Previously, Li Fan and Senior Sister Zhao had witnessed the "Death Declarations" appearing randomly in the sky when a cultivator fell.

But now, this "randomness" was becoming something of a "certainty."

Even more terrifying, the range and power of these celestial phenomena were growing.

When a cultivator at the Dao Integration stage fell, the phenomenon would nearly cover the sky within tens of thousands of miles.

More frightening still, every cultivator who witnessed these "Death Declarations" felt an increasing sense of dread and unease in their hearts.

Those who had long given up on cultivation, content to live out their remaining years, began to feel a strange mixture of sorrow, frustration, and anger.

When a cultivator within the Grand Dao Sect fell due to reaching the end of their lifespan, a peculiar atmosphere began to spread within the sect.

It was in this context that Senior Sister Zhao officially assumed the position of Sect Master.

Seventeen elders unanimously agreed with the decision of the former Sect Master, Ji Changxi.

This shocked many disciples who had been expecting a show of dissent.

At the same time, Li Fan’s unease reached its peak.

Chapter 525: No Escape

Li Fan walked within the Grand Dao Sect, his mind swirling with countless thoughts.

The sect was decorated everywhere with lanterns and banners, finally lightening the gloomy atmosphere caused by the recent calamities.

Whenever disciples encountered Li Fan, they would stop in their tracks and bow in respect.

Li Fan nodded in return each time.

As the Dao companion of the Sect Master, Li Fan had gained access to an abundance of cultivation resources—something that most cultivators could only dream of. Even if the respect shown to him wasn’t always sincere, it was a necessary pretense.

However, at this moment, Li Fan had already made up his mind. He needed to find an opportunity to escape from the Grand Dao Sect as soon as possible.

"Senior Sister Zhao has just been promoted to Sect Master and is busy handling various matters within the sect. Representatives from other sects are also visiting to offer congratulations, and she has to make time to meet them," he thought.

"Right now, she's at her busiest, so she’s less likely to notice me."

"If I miss this opportunity, when she has more free time…”

As this thought crossed his mind, Li Fan resolutely made his decision.

Two days later, he seized a moment when no one was paying attention and quietly made his way to the sect's exit, alone.

Looking back at the Grand Dao Sect, Li Fan’s mind flashed with memories of Senior Sister Zhao, with whom he had spent more than a hundred years side by side. He hesitated for a moment.

But in the end, he gritted his teeth and flew away.

He raced eastward at full speed until he finally left the boundaries of the Grand Dao Sect.

The ominous feeling of danger that had been weighing on Li Fan's heart finally began to fade.

"My intuition was right!" he thought to himself.

Just as he was feeling secretly relieved at having escaped, two beams of light suddenly appeared behind him, catching up in an instant.

In the blink of an eye, the lights landed in front of Li Fan, blocking his path.

"Where do you think you're going, junior nephew?" an elderly man with long eyebrows smiled as he looked at Li Fan.

"Uncle Dong, Uncle Jiang..." Li Fan's face darkened.

These two were elders of the Grand Dao Sect, part of the sect's seventeen core cultivators who had reached the Dao Integration stage.

It seemed that his plan to escape had already been discovered.

Despite this, Li Fan wasn’t ready to give up.

"Haha, well, let me explain to you two elders. Although I am honored that Senior Sister has been promoted to Sect Master, I've been feeling a bit troubled."

"Senior Sister Zhao's status is now exalted, and her power is growing every day. As her Dao companion, I'm still only at the Soul Transformation stage, and people are bound to gossip. The pressure has been unbearable."

Feigning a look of deep distress, Li Fan slowly approached the two elders. "The sect is rebuilding, and everyone has their roles. But I find myself idle every day, which is truly..."

Without warning, a chaotic gray light shot out from Li Fan’s eyes, striking Uncle Dong and Uncle Jiang directly in the face.

It was an attack from the sinister technique Li Fan had mastered, the Soul-Cutting Divine Light, part of the 'Soul-Severing Divine Radiance Art'.

This technique directly targeted the divine soul of a cultivator, and even though his opponents were at the Dao Integration stage, Li Fan was confident that, caught off guard, they would suffer greatly.

Without waiting to see their reactions, he immediately activated the 'Godlight Escape Technique', attempting to flee at top speed.

But to his horror, Li Fan quickly realized that the space around him had been completely sealed at some unknown point.

Even though his escape technique was swift, it had no place to work.

Uncle Dong and Uncle Jiang had anticipated Li Fan’s sneak attack. Each held a treasure mirror in their hands, which reflected the Soul-Cutting Divine Light and nullified its effect.

As they looked at Li Fan, their eyes filled with ridicule.

"How the Sect Master treats you, junior nephew, is clear to the entire sect. And yet, you still chose to betray her..."

"If the Sect Master were to hear of this, I wonder how heartbroken she would be."

Before Li Fan could attempt anything else, the two elders combined their strength to subdue him, leaving him unable to move.

"My life is over!" Li Fan thought, despair flooding his mind.

When they brought him back to the sect, he didn’t see Senior Sister Zhao.

Instead, his cultivation was sealed, and he was thrown into a secluded chamber—essentially a prison.

Although called a "secluded chamber," it was no different from a cell.

At first, Li Fan thought he would soon meet with Senior Sister Zhao, and he rehearsed countless words in his mind, hoping his eloquence could save his life.

But what he hadn't anticipated was that Senior Sister Zhao—and indeed the entire Grand Dao Sect—seemed to have completely forgotten about him.

No one came to visit him.

In the isolation of the chamber, there was nothing—nothing but Li Fan himself.

He couldn't cultivate. Every time he tried to focus his mind or contemplate divine abilities, mocking and derisive voices would echo from the walls, breaking his concentration.

This, it seemed, was to prevent him from breaking free from his sealed cultivation.

At first, Li Fan maintained his composure. But as time passed, even his resolve began to waver.

Eventually, boredom gave way to agitation and anger.

In the end, he went mad.

He threw himself at the hard walls of the chamber, over and over again, his body becoming a bloody mess. But it was futile.

Finally, Li Fan’s eyes grew dull and lifeless.

He sat motionless on the floor, as though he were a soulless statue.

It was impossible to tell how much time had passed, but one day, the long-sealed door of the chamber suddenly swung open.

For a long time, no one entered.

Li Fan, however, acted as if he hadn’t seen it. He remained unresponsive, ignoring the open door.

It wasn’t until more than ten days had passed that a flicker of life returned to his eyes.

With great effort, he pushed himself up, his body trembling as he took shaky steps toward the exit.

Because he hadn’t walked in so long, his body was weak, and he immediately fell to the ground.

He struggled to stand up and took another step, only to fall again.

In this manner—crawling and stumbling—he finally made his way back outside.

The Grand Dao Sect before him looked exactly as he remembered.

Disciples wandered between the mountain peaks, cultivating.

It was even more lively than before.

But...

It was eerily quiet.

Not a single voice could be heard within the entire sect.

It was as if all the cultivators living within had become mute.

Or perhaps...

They all shared the same thoughts and no longer needed the "lowly" method of communication known as speech.

Not even eye contact or divine sense was required. They understood each other perfectly without such means.

Li Fan stumbled through the sect.

After being imprisoned for who knows how long, his appearance had become utterly disheveled.

Yet no one seemed to notice him.

They simply carried on with their own tasks as if he didn’t exist.

The feeling of being rejected by everyone around him gnawed at Li Fan’s mind.

Eventually, after wandering through the entire sect and still not finding the person he sought, Li Fan couldn’t hold back any longer.

"Senior Sister!"

"Where are you, Senior Sister?!"

It took him a long time to remember how to speak.

Then, with a hoarse voice, he roared in anger.

His voice grew louder and louder, echoing throughout the entire sect.

And then, every single cultivator in the sect turned to look at him.

Chapter 526: I Am the Dao Sect

Even though he had already become somewhat deranged, at this moment, when suddenly being stared at by these cultivators who had previously ignored him, Li Fan's body stiffened instantly.

He stopped his meaningless low howling, moved slightly, trying to escape the spotlight that was on him. But he soon realized that all the cultivators' gazes followed him wherever he went.

This eerie scene made Li Fan's dead heart feel a chill, which turned into rage.

Overcome by desperation, Li Fan picked up a stone and ruthlessly hurled it at a nearby disciple of the Grand Dao Sect. Even though the opponent was only at the Golden Core stage, Li Fan’s cultivation was completely sealed at the moment, making him no different from a mortal. Logically, he should not have been a match for the disciple.

However, the disciple didn’t dodge or avoid the sudden attack, allowing the stone to smash his skull. With a thud, the disciple collapsed, and blood slowly trickled from his deformed head.

But the death of a life brought no change. The entire Grand Dao Sect continued to operate as before.

"Senior Sister, come out and see me!" Li Fan shouted angrily. The only response was the countless gazes still fixed on him.

Li Fan went berserk, picking up the stone again and attacking another Grand Dao Sect disciple. He killed over a hundred people in a row before finally collapsing to the ground, exhausted and breathless.

At this moment, lying on the ground, Li Fan was horrified to discover that the cultivators he had smashed into pieces were somehow alive again. Their faces were calm, as if his earlier rampage had been nothing but an illusion.

Li Fan looked at his hands, then at the stone now soaked in darkened blood, feeling utterly confused.

"Monsters… they're all monsters..." he muttered softly.

"Haha, how could they be monsters?" A familiar, melodious voice rang out suddenly. Li Fan jerked his head up in the direction of the sound.

But what he saw made his scalp tingle, and he even felt a wave of nausea.

The voice that was identical to Senior Sister Zhao's came from a middle-aged, overweight cultivator. Startled, Li Fan scrambled back in fear, putting distance between them.

"Junior Brother, don't you think I look beautiful like this?" the voice called again from behind him.

Li Fan turned, and this time, it was a beautiful young female cultivator, gazing at him with affection. She softly said, "You've been looking at my old face for hundreds of years, surely you're tired of it. Isn’t a change refreshing?" Another alluring woman approached, her curvaceous body pressed tightly against Li Fan as she whispered in his ear, "The taste of the Sect Master’s wife... haven’t you longed for it? Didn’t you once ask me to transform into her? But this time, it’s the real deal. Doesn’t this excite you, Junior Brother?"

Li Fan trembled as she explored his body. After a moment, he suddenly shoved her away and fled in panic. Yet, many more stunning female cultivators quickly surrounded him, their eyes brimming with affection, eager to ascend to bliss with him. All their voices were filled with the seductive charm that Senior Sister Zhao used to have.

"Hehe, I see, Junior Brother. You want something more exciting."

"No worries, I can have all the female cultivators of the Grand Dao Sect join you."

"Among them, there are many sisters, sisters-in-law, even mothers and daughters, or masters and disciples..."

As Li Fan was about to be drowned in a sea of female bodies, he suddenly gave up struggling. He collapsed helplessly on the ground, pounding the earth with his fists, sobbing loudly.

"I don’t want any Sect Master's wife, I don’t want any sisters."

"I just want my Senior Sister."

"Give me back my Senior Sister..."

Like a child who had lost everything, Li Fan was devastated.

As his cries echoed, the surroundings gradually grew silent. One by one, the female cultivators disappeared. Eventually, only a single figure in white remained, standing solitary and graceful.

She approached Li Fan and gently squatted beside him, cradling his trembling, sobbing body in her arms.

"Junior Brother, you will always be a child who never grows up."

Li Fan's body stiffened. He lifted his head sharply and saw the face before him.

"Senior… Sister."

"Shhh…"

Li Fan hugged Senior Sister Zhao tightly, desperately seeking solace in her. She didn’t mind the dirt and odor clinging to him after being trapped for so long.

They became one in body and soul.

"The Heaven and Earth Converging Manual."

"Back then, when we found the four cultivation techniques in the Xuantian Sect ruins, apart from the Heaven and Earth Converging Manual, I practiced the Soul-Severing Divine Radiance Art, and you practiced the Heaven's Sorrow Earth’s Grief Sutra, which made up only three techniques."

"What was the fourth technique? I just can’t seem to recall it. And over the years, I’ve unconsciously ignored its existence."

"Senior Sister, you transformed into this because of that technique, didn’t you?"

After their passionate moment, the desire in Li Fan's eyes suddenly vanished, replaced by cold indifference.

Senior Sister Zhao wasn’t surprised. She lazily stretched, and said, "So you’ve finally figured it out, Junior Brother?"

"What a pity."

After a pause, she spoke the name of the technique: "Eternal Sole-Dominance Art."

"Eternal Sole-Dominance..." Li Fan tasted the words as he looked at the mountain range, now teeming with Grand Dao Sect disciples once more. His gaze grew complicated.

"Senior Sister, was it worth it?"

Senior Sister Zhao scoffed, "Worth it? What’s wrong with how I am now?"

"I am one, and I am all. A thousand bodies, yet one mind!"

"I have never felt better in my entire life!"

She stood up suddenly, and Grand Dao Sect's Sect Master’s robes automatically appeared on her. With a commanding tone, she declared, "I alone am the Dao Sect!"

As if in response to her, every disciple in the Grand Dao Sect, in unison, proclaimed:

"I am the Dao Sect!"

Li Fan felt his heart tremble, but his face remained unchanged.

"When did it all begin? Was it Ji Changxi?" he asked.

"It was him." Senior Sister Zhao nodded softly.

"Do you remember when we reported the Immortal Plague, we submitted blood samples?"

"At that time, he already sensed the trace of the Xuantian Sect techniques we were practicing."

Chapter 527: A Desperate Strike

As Senior Sister Zhao spoke, the figure of Ji Changxi, the former head of the Grand Dao Sect, suddenly appeared before Li Fan, recounting his story to him.

“We were still too young back then, thinking that we had hidden ourselves well enough. But we never imagined that true experts could see through our cultivation techniques with just a drop of blood.”

“The Xuantian Sect's techniques are divided into four levels: (Xuan) Mysterious, (Tian) Heaven, (Di) Earth, and (Huang) Yellow, from the highest to the lowest. The four techniques we obtained from that ruin were all of the highest 'Mysterious' level.”

“Not only were they mysterious and divine, but they were also on par with the true teachings of the Grand Dao Sect. Furthermore, there was something even more enticing about them, something that even moved the heart of Ji Changxi, the head of the Grand Dao Sect.”

“It was said that the Xuantian Sect's techniques all originated from the sect’s ultimate treasure, the Xuantian Mirror. Those who cultivated to a high level could even establish a connection with this treasure.”

“Though at the time, Ji Changxi wanted nothing more than to capture us on the spot and thoroughly interrogate us. However, he knew that the Xuantian Sect’s techniques carried their own secrecy measures. Even if others tried to forcibly pry into them, all they would obtain would be distorted and incorrect versions of the techniques.”

“To learn the real techniques, they had to be willingly written down by the cultivator. Besides, at that time, his cultivation level was only at the late Dao Integration stage, not much stronger than mine. Forcing the issue wouldn’t guarantee success.”

“So, he decided to play the long game, setting a trap.”

Suddenly, Ji Changxi sneered, “On one hand, he deliberately sent us out to perform various tasks, suppressing our cultivation growth. Meanwhile, he used his position as sect head to access resources and elevate his own cultivation.”

“On the other hand, he combed through countless ancient texts, trying to find a way to break the encryption of the Xuantian Sect’s techniques.”

“In fact, he almost succeeded. From the hidden archives of the Grand Dao Sect, Ji Changxi found a relic from when the Xuantian Sect was destroyed.”

“There was a secret technique called ‘Seize the Heaven and Replace It’. It was a method used by the Xuantian Sect to deal with their own members. It could completely strip someone of their cultivation and techniques, transferring the realms and power gained from cultivating Xuantian Sect techniques to oneself, like grafting flowers onto a tree.”

“And so, the day we returned to the sect, he eagerly summoned me for a meeting...”

Ji Changxi’s face shifted, his form twisting in light and shadow until he reverted to the stunning appearance of Senior Sister Zhao.

“Unfortunately for him, he miscalculated. He never expected that I wasn’t just cultivating a single Xuantian Sect technique.”

“He also didn’t realize that I had long grown tired of him and wanted to replace him.”

Senior Sister Zhao reached out and stroked Li Fan’s cheek, her expression dreamy. “Junior Brother, do you know the kind of pain it is to be drenched in tens of thousands of drops of blood infected with the ‘Immortal Plague’?”

“Even our mighty Sect Head Ji couldn’t withstand it.”

“The only regret is that the damage caused by the ‘Immortal Plague’ was so severe that I had to give up part of him.”

Senior Sister Zhao lightly licked her lips, as if savoring a pleasant memory.

“The technique ‘Eternal Sole-Dominance’—when fully cultivated, nothing in this world remains except me. Because of how evil this technique is, you didn’t choose it back then, Junior Brother.”

“Now, do you regret it a little, Junior Brother?” she asked softly.

A hint of regret did indeed flicker through Li Fan’s heart.

However, he remained stubborn and replied, “Hmph, what’s the use of regret? The past is the past, and there’s no going back…”

Suddenly, Li Fan paused.

In that very moment, a strange feeling surged within him.

It was as if, if he wished, he could truly reverse everything.

But…

Upon deeper contemplation, he couldn’t quite grasp where this feeling was coming from, leaving him with a faint sense of loss and confusion.

Senior Sister Zhao didn’t notice the change in Li Fan’s heart.

She continued speaking, seemingly to herself: “What goes around comes around. So, Junior Brother, everything was destined.”

“I vaguely sensed Ji Changxi’s malice. To protect you and myself, I secretly cultivated the ‘Eternal Sole-Dominance’ technique, hoping to find a slim chance of survival within his schemes.”

“This technique is truly overbearing, fully embodying the essence of ‘Sole.’ After I began cultivating it, it even erased your memories of the technique from your mind, Junior Brother.”

“And when I succeeded in turning Sect Head Ji into a part of me, I finally understood.”

“This is our destiny, the fate that belongs to me.”

“This world is filled with too many irrelevant people.”

“So, I alone am enough.”

“The so-called many, but all heart.”

As she spoke, the faces of everyone in the Grand Dao Sect all shifted, becoming identical to Senior Sister Zhao’s.

“Junior Brother, do you still love me?”

“Let’s merge into one and never be separated again.”

They all looked at Li Fan with deep affection, speaking in unison.

Li Fan did not answer but instead stood solemnly.

A black light tinged with iridescence appeared above his head, eventually taking the shape of a flying blade.

At the same time, Li Fan’s aura exploded outward.

From an ordinary mortal, he ascended rapidly.

Qi Condensation, Foundation Establishment, Golden Core…

He didn’t stop until he reached the pinnacle of Soul Transformation.

It turned out that Li Fan had long since broken the seals and restrictions on his body.

He had accomplished this through the recent dual cultivation with Senior Sister Zhao.

“I thought, Junior Brother, that you missed me so much that you couldn’t wait to cultivate with me,” Senior Sister Zhao teased. “But it turns out you had other intentions.”

Though her words were playful, Senior Sister Zhao seemed to have already anticipated Li Fan’s small scheme, showing no surprise in her tone.

“What’s this? Do you think that now that your cultivation has been restored, you can challenge me?”

She looked at Li Fan with amused interest. “Who gave you the courage?”

“That ‘Soul-Extinguishing Blade’ from the ‘Soul-Severing Divine Radiance Art’?”

Faced with her mockery, Li Fan didn’t respond directly.

He remained serious, as the black and iridescent ‘Soul-Extinguishing Blade’ flickered, ready to strike.

This blade was the ultimate killing move of the ‘Soul-Severing Divine Radiance Art’. Despite its unremarkable name, it was a desperate attack that sacrificed one's soul.

“A unity of all minds—when fully realized, it can defy the laws of heaven, can’t it?”

“Senior Sister, you’re truly a peerless genius. But…”

“Your path is not my path.”

“I once said I wished to become eternal Dao companions with you, to live forever in freedom and happiness.”

“I meant it with all my heart, and that hasn’t changed.”

Li Fan’s eyes were filled with memories as he sighed.

Just as Senior Sister Zhao was caught in a moment of slight surprise—

An incredibly intense light suddenly surged from within Li Fan, illuminating the entire sky above the Grand Dao Sect.

Even the thousands of bodies of Senior Sister Zhao couldn’t help but close their eyes at that moment.

Chapter 528: Different Lifespans of Heaven and Earth

“But Senior Sister’s path to Immortality, wanting to use me as the price…”

“I refuse!”

“I will not allow Senior Sister to be so lonely from now on!”

Li Fan’s loud laughter echoed through heaven and earth.

“Over the years, Senior Sister has comprehended ‘The All as One’ Although I am slow-witted, I have not been idle either.”

“I have one move. Senior Sister, please teach me!”

Amidst the blinding light, Li Fan's voice, as firm as iron, resounded.

“Heaven!”

“Earth!”

“Shared!”

“Life!”

Li Fan’s body was completely annihilated in a radiant flash of light.

At that moment, Senior Sister Zhao’s expression finally changed for the first time. No longer indifferent and fully in control, she now had a mix of frustration and amusement: "No wonder you've made such slow progress over the years, Junior Brother. You've been putting all your thoughts into finding ways to restrict me?"

"You and I have cultivated the ‘Heaven and Earth Converging Manual.’ We are practically inseparable now. This move of ‘Shared Lifespan of Heaven and Earth’ indeed poses a threat to me…"

"If only your cultivation level were higher, Junior Brother."

Countless versions of Senior Sister Zhao watched as endless streams of white light emanated from Li Fan's body, and together they extended their arms to absorb it.

“Junior Brother, don’t resist anymore. Become one with me!”

Cracks began to appear on the faces of her countless bodies, but they quickly healed. Meanwhile, the white light dimmed and gradually vanished between heaven and earth.

When all traces of Li Fan’s presence disappeared from the Grand Dao Sect, it felt as though everything had come to a halt.

“Heh, Junior Brother Li Fan.”

“I really have to thank you. That was quite the entertaining game.”

“It’s been years since I’ve had such an interesting experience.”

Senior Sister Zhao looked into the sky, her expression dreamy, mumbling to herself.

——

“Immortal Guidance Light! That’s the Immortal Guidance Light!”

“Who is it? Has another cultivator from our Canhong State caught the eye of the Heavenly Sovereign so soon?”

“Hahaha, in just one month, three disciples from the Immortal Sect have ascended! Canhong State’s reputation is truly about to soar!”

Noisy voices seemed to come from afar, and suddenly Li Fan woke up.

Looking around, somewhat confused, he realized his surroundings were both familiar and unfamiliar.

After a brief moment, memories that had been sealed for ages, as if from a different lifetime, surged back like a tidal wave.

The Five Elders Association, the One Heart Immortal Sect, Canhong State.

The Immortal Guidance Light.

So, he was still in the moment of being summoned by the Immortal Guidance Light.

But what were those hundreds of years of experiences that felt so real just now?

An illusion?

Li Fan couldn’t help but look up.

Through a rift in the sky, he could faintly see a vast mountain range with a sect nestled within.

It was none other than the Grand Dao Sect, one of the ancient Ten Great Immortal Sects.

At this moment, it seemed that the disciples of the Grand Dao Sect were also looking in his direction, perhaps to welcome him as a new member.

Unlike in the illusion, this Grand Dao Sect was full of life. The expressions on each disciple’s face were no longer stiff and lifeless; they were varied, as real as any human.

They conversed with each other, discussing enthusiastically.

It wasn’t the dead silence that Li Fan had encountered in the illusion.

While ascending in the Immortal Guidance Light, Li Fan’s body gradually became rigid and numb.

He also felt his consciousness slowly fading.

“So, this is a wooden puppet…”

Li Fan thought as he slowly dissipated into the wind.

All that remained was a decaying wooden puppet body, drifting toward the Grand Dao Sect.

The disciples of the Grand Dao Sect reacted in various ways upon seeing this scene.

Some were furious.

Some were thoughtful.

Some clapped their hands in joy.

Some smiled faintly.

…

It was impossible to discern where exactly the so-called "All as One" lay.

Who made the final decision, no one knew.

A white light shot out from the rift, completely annihilating the puppet body.

Then, the Immortal Guidance Light was retracted, the rift slowly closed, and the image of the One Heart Immortal Sect faded from the world.

All that remained were the puzzled cultivators of the Five Elders Association, silently sighing.

Meanwhile, in the Congyun Sea.

Li Fan’s true body, overseeing the reconstruction Immortal Congyun City where the Island of Ten Thousand Immortals once stood, was stunned.

“What is it, Lord Island Master? Is something wrong?”

“I’ll have them correct it right away!” Gao Yuan quickly said.

After a moment, Li Fan waved his hand.

“It’s nothing. You’ve done well. Keep up the good work!”

He continued his inspection with a calm expression, and after half a day, returned to his temporary quarters.

After sealing the area around him, Li Fan’s expression turned solemn.

“Heh, Junior Brother, I’m very much looking forward to our official meeting.”

Senior Sister Zhao’s soft laughter seemed to still linger in his ears.

Was it the last message from that wisp of divine consciousness, or had Li Fan’s true body actually heard it?

He couldn’t tell for the moment.

“Senior Sister Zhao… quite the illusion.”

Li Fan reflected on the countless experiences he had in the Grand Dao Sect over the past century.

Though some details were fuzzy, most of the events felt as real as if he had lived through them, indistinguishable from reality.

It even made Li Fan believe that he had indeed been Senior Sister Zhao’s junior brother and a member of the ancient Grand Dao Sect, only to reincarnate and regain his memories after decades.

He even entertained the idea of seeking out Senior Sister Zhao for a reunion.

If he only had memories of one lifetime and didn't have the [Truth] he might have actually done so.

Li Fan shivered at the thought.

Even with just a wisp of divine consciousness, being immersed in Senior Sister Zhao’s illusion had such a profound effect on his true body…

No wonder the cultivators of the Five Elders Association were so utterly loyal to her.

He activated his 'Xuanhuang Heart Refining Mantra', using the occasional thoughts of "submitting to Senior Sister Zhao" as fuel to strengthen and nourish his Dao Heart.

After three days and nights, Li Fan finally seemed to have eradicated the influence of his trip to the One Heart Immortal Sect.

At least, on the surface.

Having freed himself completely, Li Fan began to analyze and organize his gains from the experience.

Without a doubt, his time in the Grand Dao Sect had been a fabrication by Senior Sister Zhao.

In fact, from beginning to end, Li Fan didn’t even know her real name.

Yet within the illusion, he hadn’t felt the slightest inconsistency.

But amid the falsehoods were truths.

At the very least, figures like Ji Changxi and Mo Zhiren, disciples of the Grand Dao Sect in the illusion, had truly existed once.

The cultivation techniques, 'Heaven and Earth Converging Manual' and 'Soul-Severing Divine Radiance Art', might not be fakes either.

It was a pity that, just like after returning from the Fallen Immortal Realm, the specific details couldn’t be remembered clearly.

Then, there were the world-altering events he had experienced as “Junior Brother.”

“So, the Immortal-Mortal Miasma was really the handiwork of a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign, not a natural evolution of heaven and earth.”

Li Fan thought of Yin Shangren of Yin Island.

“Could it be that

this person discovered the hidden Heavenly Sovereign and was silenced as a result?”

Recalling Yin Shangren’s inexplicable suicide in past lifetimes, Li Fan couldn’t help but speculate.

Chapter 529: The Subtle Use of Spies

Once one’s strength reaches the Longevity stage, even if it’s just a fake Longevity expert trapped in a corner of the Xuanhuang Realm, their power and abilities are beyond the comprehension of ordinary cultivators.

Just like Senior Sister Zhao, who during the guiding process, created a vivid illusion that felt like a "romantic simulation."

But for her, what was the true significance of it all?

Li Fan believed that with her strength, even without the confusion of the illusion, she could easily devour and merge with other cultivators.

Yet she chose not to do so.

Instead, she insisted on playing this game with Li Fan, a game spanning several hundred years.

Could it be that she was truly bored to the extreme?

While this possibility couldn't be ruled out, Li Fan was more inclined to believe that there was some hidden secret behind it.

The “ants” trying to spy on the Longevity Immortal Sovereigns thought they were doing so discreetly, assuming they hadn’t been discovered.

In reality, everything might have already been under their watchful eyes. From the moment the gaze fell upon them, they had already been noticed.

It was like Senior Sister Zhao's final reminder, or perhaps more accurately, her warning.

Li Fan, trying to uncover the secret of the immortal-mortal miasma, might be in the same position as Master Yin.

A thought stirred in his mind, and Li Fan activated his formless killing intent, focusing his gaze on Yin Yin Island.

After observing for a while, Master Yin seemed to be as engrossed as ever, conducting experiments on mortals.

"So many years have passed, yet the lethal power of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma doesn't seem to have weakened at all. Only its transmission ability has lessened compared to the original version..." Watching the mortals in the experiment groaning in pain, Li Fan recalled the scenes he had seen in Senior Sister Zhao’s illusion, comparing the two in his mind.

Master Yin remained deeply focused, unaffected by the horrific cries of the mortals. It was as if the lives before him were nothing more than disposable resources.

After watching for a while, Li Fan grew bored.

"It seems it will take him more time to truly figure anything out." Thinking this, Li Fan withdrew his gaze.

His thoughts returned to the construction of Congyun Immortal City.

Now, most of the six-month deadline had already passed.

The basic structure of the immortal city had been mostly completed. What remained were critical installations like the "Statue of the Immortal Ancestor" and the "Long-Distance Teleportation Formation."

In this regard, with help from the cultivators dispatched by the headquarters of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance, there was no need to worry too much.

However, with the extended construction period, material shortages had inevitably started to appear.

After all, the resources Li Fan had received initially were only sufficient to build one floating city, assuming there were no mistakes.

Thanks to the coordination of He Zhenghao and Gao Yuan, the shortfall hadn't been immediately exposed.

Meanwhile, Zhou Kebao, who had been secretly causing trouble, was surprisingly patient.

For all this time, he hadn’t contacted Li Fan or tried to feel him out.

"It seems I can’t rely on him making the first move. I have to come up with a solution myself."

"Common materials can be purchased through Jiao Xiuyuan's channels using contribution points."

"But as for strategic resources, those aren't easy to acquire through ordinary means. However..."

Li Fan smiled slightly, taking control of the current "Commander of the Congyun Immortal City Rebuilding Project," Zhou Qingang.

In the rebuilding project, all the cultivators had their own responsibilities. Being the commander wasn't actually too busy of a role.

When there was no one around, "Zhou Qingang" quietly left Congyun City.

To avoid being followed, he even hid in the deep sea for three days and three nights.

Only after confirming that he was safe did he contact the Five Elders Association.

A flicker of light appeared on the broken stone, and after a moment, a blurry figure emerged.

"Hmm? Why did you suddenly contact us? Did something happen?" Perhaps due to his past achievements, the figure's tone was much warmer than before.

Even though "Zhou Qingang" had broken protocol by reaching out first, the figure wasn’t angry but instead asked with genuine concern.

"Haha, don’t worry, boss. It's not trouble at all—in fact, it’s a golden opportunity!" Zhou Qingang said excitedly.

"Oh?" The figure sounded intrigued.

"Boss, you probably know that thanks to He Zhenghao, I became the commander of the Congyun City rebuilding project." Zhou Qingang lowered his voice.

"But recently, we’ve run into some difficulties..."

He then briefly explained how someone within the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance was plotting against Li Fan by withholding resources and putting pressure on him.

The figure on the broken stone frowned as he listened.

"This is intolerable. How could someone like Master Li be subjected to such humiliation?"

"He’s mentioned privately that he’d rather defect to the Five Elders Association than submit to those people."

Before Zhou Qingang could finish, the figure was overjoyed. "Oh? So, does that mean Li Fan intends to defect?"

However, he quickly became skeptical. "But what if it’s all part of a scheme by the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance to lure us into a trap?"

Zhou Qingang felt a bit awkward. "Ahem, boss, it was clearly just an angry remark..."

"Er..." The figure fell silent.

Zhou Qingang quickly continued, "Although the chances of defection are slim, we still have a great opportunity on our hands."

"Li Fan made a military pledge to the Chief Administrator. If he fails to complete construction on time, he could lose his head. Lately, he’s been nearly driven mad trying to acquire the missing resources."

"So, you mean...?" The figure immediately understood.

"A trade?"

Zhou Qingang nodded repeatedly and placed his palms on the stone, transmitting a list of materials.

"Exactly! Boss, take a look—can we acquire these resources?"

There was a brief pause.

After a moment, the figure spoke slowly, "No problem."

"Good! With these materials, not only can we secure information about the protective formation, but we could even obtain the entire blueprint of the immortal city!" Zhou Qingang said confidently.

The figure remained silent, but it was clear he was tempted.

"The importance of the formation diagram has already been downgraded by two levels. It’s not a very lucrative trade now..." After some thought, the figure instructed, "If possible, try to find out from Li Fan what really happened on the day of the 'Anomaly of Ten Thousand Immortals Island'."

"And if you can get him to record the scene with a memory stone, even better."

Zhou Qingang's expression shifted, and he asked curiously, "Boss, was it us who took the entire Ten Thousand Immortals Island?"

"That was terrifying! I regret not being there. If I had been, I could’ve returned home by now!"

"By the way, what was the big commotion all about? What were we trying to find?"

The figure snorted coldly, "You’re asking about things you shouldn’t know. Just do your job."

Chapter 530: Profound and Unrecordable

Zhou Qingang shrank his neck, indicating that he knew his mistake.

Seeing this, the face in the air softened a little: “This matter is of great importance. Even I cannot fully grasp all the details.”

“However, one thing is certain: we have reaped significant rewards this time.”

His tone carried a trace of excitement: “Even those above us have shown us more favor lately.”

“The funding has been remarkably generous, more than doubled.”

“And what about my share?” Zhou Qingang hurriedly asked.

“Hmph, why are you so anxious? When have I ever shortchanged you?” the face scolded.

“When we finalize the deal, the materials you need from Li Fan will be handed over to you along with your share.”

“Thank you, boss!” Zhou Qing’ang said gleefully. “Although I'm doing quite well these days, frequently receiving gifts from cultivators, no one ever complains about having too much money...”

“Enough, don’t get carried away. I didn’t expect you to become the commander this time. It seems like choosing He Zhenghao back then was indeed the right move.”

The face pondered for a moment, then added, “He Zhenghao and Li Fan both have strong backgrounds. You must maintain good relations with them.”

“When Congyun Immortal Island is rebuilt, even if Li Fan doesn’t become the true lord of the island, his status will undoubtedly be high. By staying close to him, you’ll advance much faster than if you struggled on your own. Your future prospects are limitless. By then, you will have thoroughly infiltrated the enemy ranks.”

“This time, we stepped in and helped them overcome their difficulties. Next time, they won’t be able to refuse when we need them.”

The face let out a low, sinister laugh.

“You’re brilliant, boss!” Zhou Qingang praised.

The two discussed the details of the transaction for a while longer, after which the face ended the communication.

Zhou Qing’ang, acting nonchalantly, made his way back to the bustling construction site of Congyun Immortal City, walking around as if showing off his authority.

“The image from the day of the anomaly on Ten Thousand Immortals Island…” Li Fan thought for a moment and took out a memory stone.

In his mind, the Dao Stone emitted a flowing light, capturing every detail of what had transpired that day.

In an instant, it was complete.

Out of habit, Li Fan double-checked it.

Upon reviewing it, however, he noticed something unusual.

The recording couldn’t capture the “green light” that destroyed the Martial Hall.

When he reviewed the recording, all that could be seen was the entire structure and over a dozen cultivators inexplicably vanishing into thin air, while the surviving cultivators were in utter panic, scrambling to escape.

Later, when Chief Lu arrived to prevent the situation from spiraling out of control, the scene appeared somewhat comical.

“Unrecordable, huh…” Li Fan tapped his fingers and fell into deep thought.

After spending several centuries in the illusionary realm of the Grand Dao Sect, Li Fan had learned many secrets that ordinary cultivators could not.

Some of these had faded from memory upon his return to reality, but others still lingered in his mind.

“Just like "It" hovering over Yuandao Prefecture, there are indeed terrifying existences in this world that cannot be recorded.”

“Whether with pen and paper, jade slips, or any other method, it’s impossible to document them.”

“If the restriction is strong enough, they may even disappear from people’s memories.”

“But all of this is based on the premise that these things truly exist…”

A gleam of insight flashed in Li Fan’s mind.

“It seems that a year ago, such unrecordable phenomena had not yet occurred.”

“So, could it be that the Mysterious Web has already appeared in the world?”

Li Fan was slightly startled.

“If the massive Tianxuan Spirit Locking Formation hasn’t been fully constructed yet, it’s likely still in its early stages.”

“For years, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance has been drawing its elite forces. Clearly, they’ve been busy. Even the unprecedented grand actions of the Five Elders Association must be connected to this.”

...

After a long period of contemplation, Li Fan looked at the memory stone in his hand and decided not to tamper with it further.

It had been a long time since the anomaly with the Mysterious Web on Ten Thousand Immortals Island. Now, with the Five Elders Association bringing up the matter again, Li Fan suspected their goal was likely the missing Elder Gongsun.

Not only the Five Elders Association, but even the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had been searching for him.

To evade detection from the two most powerful forces in the Xuanhuang Realm for so long, Elder Gongsun Qixuan must be quite formidable.

“It’s possible he’s not intentionally hiding but is severely injured and has lost consciousness,” Li Fan thought as he shook his head, dismissing the idea.

Li Fan took the opportunity to hand the recording stone and the blueprint for Congyun Immortal City’s reconstruction to his clone, Zhou Qingang.

Ten days later, Zhou Qingang delivered these highly confidential items to the stone-faced man.

After verifying them, the man was ecstatic and didn’t go back on his word, handing over a storage ring filled with strategic materials.

With that, the crisis was easily resolved by Li Fan.

With sufficient materials, the construction of Congyun Immortal City sped up once more.

Li Fan made frequent appearances to show his dedication to the project.

The cultivators under him were full of enthusiasm.

There was, however, one group that couldn’t sit still.

In a dark room aboard the Dust-Crossing Boat.

“Zhou Kebao, this was your brilliant idea!”

“Yeah, why are you putting on airs now? Don’t you see that Congyun City is almost finished?”

“Weren’t you so confident that Li Fan was just pretending to be calm? What do you have to say now?”

...

Zhou Kebao’s face alternated between pale and flushed as he listened to his companions’ constant rebukes.

“There’s something fishy here! Definitely something fishy!” he defended.

“Not long ago, the information I gathered clearly stated that they were running out of resources.”

“How is it that they suddenly have an abundance of materials?”

“These are tightly controlled strategic resources. You can’t just buy them!”

Zhou Kebao’s face was full of confusion as his eyes darted, trying to unravel the secret.

But his words clearly didn’t convince everyone present.

“Forget all that. What do we do now?”

“When Li Fan finishes building the Immortal City, our materials will be worthless.”
