“We’ll lose everything, not to mention that if Li Fan reports us, what then?”

“Zhou Kebao, you caused this mess, so you fix it. Go find Li Fan and negotiate!”

...

Amidst the cacophony of voices, Zhou Kebao was overwhelmed, the flash of inspiration he had felt slipping away before he could grasp it.

Seeing no other option, Zhou Kebao sighed deeply and yielded.

The next day, Zhou Kebao approached Li Fan.

Instead of playing tricks, he sincerely explained the entire situation.

“Daoist Li, your move was brilliant. We lost fair and square.”

“But this whole thing was Tantai Can’s idea from the beginning. We were just momentarily blinded…” Zhou Kebao said in shame.

Li Fan smiled but didn’t speak.

“So, what do you want now?”

Chapter 531: Immortal City as a Cave Residence

Li Fan's expression remained unchanged as he took a slow sip of tea and glanced at Zhou Kebao. "You're not expecting me to step in and buy back the materials you’ve embezzled, are you? Although I'm relatively well-off, my contributions didn’t just fall from the sky. Besides, these materials are only useful for building the Immortal City and nothing else."

Zhou Kebao quickly shook his head. "I wouldn't dare be so ungrateful."

He cautiously glanced at Li Fan, bowing slightly in a flattering manner, "In fact, I came to you with the intention of resolving things peacefully..."

Suddenly, Li Fan slammed his teacup down on the table with a loud bang, instantly stopping Zhou Kebao in his tracks, his body stiffening.

Li Fan's expression turned cold, his eyes flashing with killing intent. "Resolve things peacefully? That’s not what you had in mind before."

"Embezzling so many materials, especially after I pledged a military order. You're pushing me, Li Fan, to the brink of death."

Zhou Kebao waved his hands in a panic, trembling as he explained, "That was never our intention! I swear! From start to finish, all we wanted was some financial gain..."

Li Fan remained indifferent, responding calmly, "Things have come this far, and I won't argue with you any further..."

Upon hearing this, Zhou Kebao’s face lit up with disbelief.

But before he could breathe a sigh of relief, Li Fan continued, "However, once the Congyun Immortal City is completed, everything will need to be reported to the higher-ups. Not a single detail will be left out."

"After all, completing the Immortal City without wasting a single bit of material is proof of my exceptional ability, isn’t it?"

"This accomplishment should be broadcasted far and wide. If every city lord in the world were as efficient as I am, wouldn’t the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's conquest of the Five Elders Association be just around the corner?"

"What do you think, Daoist Zhou?" Li Fan boasted without shame.

"Heh, you're joking, Daoist," Zhou Kebao replied, wiping the cold sweat from his forehead, fully understanding the threat behind Li Fan's words.

"If you have any demands, just say them. We'll meet them, but please don't escalate the situation."

Zhou Kebao thumped his chest in assurance.

"Don't focus on what I want; focus on what you have," Li Fan stepped forward and patted Zhou Kebao’s shoulder.

"Contribution points? Do you think I lack those?"

Li Fan's face was filled with pride. "My reputation for deduction techniques is known throughout the world. Wealth accumulates upon wealth, and I can easily handle simple matters. Contribution points are nothing but a string of numbers to me."

Upon hearing this, Zhou Kebao’s body shook slightly.

"Besides, once the Congyun Immortal City is completed, the rewards from above will be significant. At that point, as a major figure, my level of authority will soar."

"With contribution points and authority, what in this world will be beyond my grasp?"

"And what do you think you can offer me to win me over?"

Li Fan’s eyes gleamed, locking onto Zhou Kebao.

Zhou Kebao felt the pressure of Li Fan's gaze, realizing that what Li Fan said made complete sense. His mind was a whirl of confusion, and for a moment, he couldn't come up with a suitable answer.

"Think it over and come back to me. I still have official matters to attend to, so I'll have to ask you to leave," Li Fan said coldly, issuing his order to depart.

Zhou Kebao, with a troubled expression, retreated.

Li Fan's meaning was clear.

He was willing to overlook their meddling, but they needed to offer enough compensation of value.

"The demand for no specific request is the hardest to fulfill," Zhou Kebao sighed softly.

He glanced back at the room where Li Fan was staying.

In the short time since he had left, seven or eight different cultivators had already come and gone, each with a solemn expression.

"His influence is already solidified. There's no point in opposing him."

"If that’s the case, we might as well use this opportunity to turn foes into allies. From what I can tell, he’s not the kind of person who holds grudges as long as he gets what he wants."

With his mind made up, Zhou Kebao quickly returned to discuss things with his associates.

Five days later, Zhou Kebao appeared before Li Fan again, exuding confidence.

"Daoist, take a look at this."

He pointed into the air, and a miniature floating city appeared before them.

"What does this mean?" Li Fan looked at it for a moment but couldn’t discern its significance.

Without revealing anything, he asked.

Seeing Li Fan’s reaction, Zhou Kebao grew even more confident, flashing a mysterious smile.

"It’s a cave residence, modeled exactly after the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s floating Immortal City—only better."

"I wonder if this interests you, Daoist?"

Zhou Kebao asked in a low voice.

"Hmm?" Li Fan’s eyes narrowed as he turned his gaze back to the floating model, deep in thought, before inhaling sharply.

"The materials you embezzled... you took more than double what was allocated to me? That’s quite bold, isn’t it?"

Zhou Kebao quickly replied, "Heh, you’ve misunderstood, Daoist."

"Though we did skim off quite a bit while scheming against you, it still wasn’t nearly enough to build an entire floating city."

"In truth, the materials we used were left over from various repair and renovation projects in different Immortal Cities across the states."

"You know, Daoist Li, that when the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance allocates materials for projects, they take all sorts of contingencies into account, so the budgets are usually quite generous. Since we’ve been doing this for so long, we’ve become proficient at minimizing actual losses."

"Thus, there’s always a surplus of materials, and naturally, we couldn't return the leftovers, so they ended up in our possession."

...

Zhou Kebao smiled faintly and stopped speaking, leaving the rest unsaid.

"After so many years, we’ve accumulated these materials. Instead of letting them sit and collect dust in storage, why not put them to use and resolve our misunderstandings with you?"

"Using public resources for private purposes, turning an Immortal City into a cave residence—heh, I can assure you that even in our Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, this kind of thing is rare."

Li Fan stared intently at the constantly rotating image of the Immortal City, clearly tempted.

Seeing this, Zhou Kebao redoubled his efforts to promote the idea.

"This Immortal City cave residence will have facilities identical to any regular Immortal City, except it won’t be connected to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance headquarters."

"And if you find it too ostentatious, we can install a concealment function. Structures like the administration hall and martial arts arena can be hidden from view and only revealed when needed."

"We’ll also leave plenty of room for future modifications to the cave residence."

"If you ever want to reinforce the protective arrays or restrictions, it’ll be no problem at all."

"Of course, if you’re willing to part with some contribution points, we can handle everything for you."

"And if you're generous enough, we could even discuss installing a long-distance teleportation formation or a virtual mustard seed miniature formation."

"A cave residence that you can carry with you, equipped with teleportation functions, capable of both attack and defense..."

"Are you satisfied, Daoist?"

Zhou Kebao asked, enticing him further.

Li Fan responded with a hearty laugh.

Chapter 532: Heading to the Nanming

"You're the one who truly understands me, Daoist Zhou!"

Li Fan's previously stern expression softened into one of extreme kindness.

"You modern cultivators really know how to innovate. I guess I'm still a bit of an old fossil."

He patted Zhou Kebao on the shoulder, his admiration evident.

"If you can actually pull this off, all past grudges will be wiped clean!"

"We might even work together more closely in the future; it's not impossible."

"Your background is strong, but I'm not lacking either."

Li Fan's face showed a hint of pride as he painted a grand picture for Zhou Kebao, who couldn’t help but believe him.

After all, gathering such a large amount of strategic resources in such a short time was not something an ordinary cultivator could manage.

As someone who benefited from power and influence, Zhou Kebao was well aware that in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, connections and background were sometimes more important than cultivation strength.

"Come, come, explain the details more thoroughly." Li Fan pulled Zhou Kebao closer, clearly very interested in the mobile immortal city cave residence.

Seeing how smoothly the negotiation was going, Zhou Kebao was overjoyed.

He didn’t dare delay and began pointing to the images in the air, enlarging each part and explaining it in detail.

After a long time, Zhou Kebao was parched from all the talking.

Finally, Li Fan nodded in satisfaction.

"If someone finds out, will the higher-ups blame us?" After a moment of silence, Li Fan asked.

"Haha, don't worry, Daoist Li. The law says that anything not explicitly forbidden is allowed. There are no rules or regulations in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance that prohibit cultivators from mimicking immortal city structures to build cave residences." Zhou Kebao assured repeatedly.

"As long as you stay low-key and don’t show off, who would bother causing you trouble?"

"Of course, if someone does report it and things get out of hand, we can just demolish it. Once the storm passes, we’ll rebuild it for you."

Zhou Kebao’s face was full of smug confidence.

"Excellent! I feel more and more like you, Daoist Zhou, are a kindred spirit!" Li Fan smiled faintly.

He took out a blank jade slip and held it in his hand for a while before handing it to Zhou Kebao. "This contains my additional requirements for the immortal city cave residence. Go back and calculate the costs, then quickly send me a quotation."

"If there aren’t any major issues, we’ll finalize the deal."

"However, if you still think you can take advantage of me, then it’ll be a fight to the death." A flash of murderous intent briefly appeared in Li Fan's eyes.

"Rest assured, Daoist Li, I understand!" Zhou Kebao, overjoyed, accepted the jade slip and took a quick glance before eagerly excusing himself.

"What a bunch of parasites..."

Watching Zhou Kebao leave, Li Fan sneered softly.

"But what does it matter to me?"

"I should be thanking them. Without these parasites, how else would I get benefits out of this strictly regulated Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance?"

With a cold laugh, Li Fan gently pointed forward.

A miniature version of the immortal city cave residence reappeared, perfectly replicated from what he had just seen, combined with the real Congyun Immortal City.

"A floating city of my own..."

"This is a treasure that came to me effortlessly."

Li Fan squinted slightly, adding annotations to the floating city model according to his own ideas.

Time passed quickly.

Three days later, Zhou Kebao hurried back with a prepared quotation.

"Eighteen million six hundred thirty thousand contribution points..."

Li Fan muttered.

Afraid that Li Fan would think it was too expensive, Zhou Kebao quickly explained, "This only covers the cost of your additional requests and some labor. The materials for the immortal city construction are entirely at our expense."

"We’ve really gone all out to reconcile with you, Daoist."

Li Fan was unimpressed. "Spare me the talk. In the entire Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, who besides me, Li Fan, would dare to use an immortal city as a cave residence?"

"If I don’t proceed with this, those materials of yours will just sit in a warehouse as dead stock."

"But now, you can convert them into contribution points."

Zhou Kebao dared not argue, only nodding in agreement.

"Eighteen million six hundred thirty thousand is a bit steep."

"Let’s settle on fifteen million." Li Fan boldly proposed.

"If that works, great. If not, let’s pretend we never discussed this."

Zhou Kebao's face changed dramatically upon hearing this.

After much hesitation and internal struggle, he finally gritted his teeth and agreed.

He then took out a golden contract, made some adjustments, and handed it over.

Li Fan reviewed it carefully. In addition to Zhou Kebao’s name, it also listed eight other cultivators, including Gou Zihao and Qu Dailong.

Once he confirmed everything was in order, Li Fan signed his name.

As two beams of golden light flew into their bodies, Zhou Kebao finally breathed a sigh of relief.

According to the agreement, Li Fan first transferred five million contribution points.

"When will the immortal city cave residence be completed?" Li Fan asked Zhou Kebao, whose face could barely contain his joy.

"It will be ready the day Congyun Immortal City is completed," Zhou Kebao promised.

"So soon?" This time, Li Fan was surprised.

After all, he had gathered all the available cultivators from the Congyun Sea, working day and night, just to meet the deadline set by the First Ordinance Diyi Jinglun.

Now, less than two months remained before the city's completion.

To finish the cave residence within such a short time seemed impossible.

And yet, Zhou Kebao spoke with such confidence.

Their efficiency must be much higher than Li Fan’s hastily assembled team.

Seeing Li Fan’s rare expression of surprise, Zhou Kebao felt proud but said nothing.

"Alright, in that case, I’ll wait for the day of double celebration."

"You may go now."

Li Fan dismissed Zhou Kebao, who bowed and left without delay.

---

Time flew by, and the day of Congyun Immortal City’s completion drew nearer.

The busy cultivators couldn’t help but show anticipation on their faces.

After all, they had been working so hard, looking forward to the reconstruction of Congyun City, the rewards from Island Lord Li Fan, and the appointment of positions.

Li Fan had not forgotten the Diyi Jinglun’s task, fully integrating the "Xuantian Nether-Lock Formation" into the foundation of the immortal city, without drawing any attention.

As the grand ceremony for the city’s foundation approached, Li Fan found himself alone in a secret chamber and suddenly felt a spiritual resonance.

It turned out that the Fallen Immortal Realm, which he hadn’t entered for a long time, was now open to him again.

"Blessings to the Heavenly Venerable Of Xuanhuang!"

Li Fan performed the ritual and re-entered the Fallen Immortal Realm.

The story picked up from last time: he and Xu Ke were entrusted by Lu Ya to head to the Nanming Beast Mountain.

"Xiao Hei, why do you think Senior Brother Lu Ya entrusted me with such an important task?"

"This Nanming Beast Mountain is no easy place. According to the other senior brothers, it's full of terrifying demon beasts…"

"Wouldn’t a more powerful senior brother be a better choice?"

Xu Ke tilted his head, his big eyes filled with confusion.

Li Fan gave him a playful slap.

"Can you be quiet? This is the tenth time you've asked that question on this trip."

"I don’t understand why you didn’t just ask your Senior Brother Lu Ya. Why keep bothering me?"

Xu Ke pouted, "That’s not true! This is only the ninth time…"

As they were bantering, a loud dragon roar suddenly echoed from the distant sky.

It interrupted their conversation.

Chapter 533: Dafeng and Manman

Gazing into the distance, the horizon seemed to blur where the sea met the sky, making it difficult to distinguish between water and heavens.

The thunderous roar, like that of a dragon, seemed to come from the clouds above.

Through the gaps in the clouds, one could faintly glimpse a part of the blue dragon's scales and claws.

Its body stretched endlessly, seemingly extending to the edge of the sky.

The dragon's tail, revealed by chance, appeared as large as a mountain in the eyes of the two onlookers.

Xu Ke stared in shock, his head tilted upwards, his body wobbling slightly: "How is this dragon so huge?"

"I’ve seen Azure Dragons in the sect before, but compared to this one..."

"Those can't even be called dragons. More like little mud eels!"

Xu Ke, not entirely clueless, knew that this was the territory of demonic beasts, and quietly whispered to Li Fan.

"The divine dragon reveals its head but not its tail..." Li Fan ignored him.

He kept his gaze fixed on the Azure Dragon in the sky, searching his memories linked to the bloodline of the Xuan Bird.

This Azure Dragon had existed for ages, almost comparable to the lifespan of the Longevity Emperor Sanmo.

Unlike Sanmo, who served as a prophet to guide the demonic beasts, this Azure Divine Dragon never interfered with the internal affairs of the demonic beasts.

It played more of a "guardian deity" role, rarely appearing in the world.

Only when the demonic beasts faced an existential threat did it lend its aid.

"The Azure Divine Dragon usually conceals itself in waves or clouds. Why has it suddenly let out such a roar today?"

"It seems something major is happening in the Nanming."

"To arrive just in time… truly the fate of someone destined."

While Li Fan pondered, he gave Xu Ke a light slap.

Xu Ke, feeling puzzled, wanted to retaliate, but was quickly suppressed by Li Fan.

The Luan Bird beneath Xu Ke seemed to let out a helpless sigh.

Its speed did not diminish, continuing to fly south at full speed.

The Nanming area was vast and boundless.

Apart from the sky overhead, all one could see was the endless blue ocean.

After flying for over ten days, the scenery remained unchanged.

Not only had they not seen the Beast Mountain, but they hadn’t even encountered any ordinary demonic beasts.

Instead, they occasionally saw schools of strange fish surfacing, laughing playfully.

Some of these fish even chased the shadow cast by Xu Ke and his group, following them along the water.

However, these fish were clearly not demonic beasts, relying solely on instinct as their intelligence had not yet developed.

"Xiao Hei, where exactly is this Beast Mountain?" Xu Ke propped his chin on his hands, looking bored.

"Senior Brother Lu Ya didn’t explain clearly, he just told me to keep heading south."

"I actually believed him... How frustrating."

Just as Li Fan was about to respond, his expression suddenly changed.

From behind, a wave of killing intent mixed with a strong scent of blood rushed toward them.

He immediately turned, spitting out a black light to counter the attack.

"Huh?" A voice of surprise came from the attacker.

"Boom!"

Amid the explosion, the Luan Bird finally reacted.

It let out an angry cry, spreading its wings to shield Xu Ke.

Li Fan flew into the air, observing the attacker from afar.

It was a two-headed bird.

Its feathers were pure white, and one of its heads was wide-eyed, its gaze shifting rapidly between Xu Ke's group.

The other head seemed to be asleep, eyes tightly shut, nodding off in a rather comical manner.

"So, it's from the Xuan Bird tribe. I haven’t seen one in so long, and it’s turned into this?"

"Truly ugly beyond belief."

The two-headed bird sneered in a sharp voice.

"Manman..." Li Fan immediately recognized the bird.

It had some family ties to the Xuan Bird tribe.

Named Manman, though its name didn’t sound impressive, its origins were quite extraordinary.

Its left head was said to be able to see the cause and effect of all things, while the right head remained in a perpetual state of sleep.

Once it sensed disaster, it would awaken suddenly.

However, most Manman Birds had green feathers with a hint of red. This pure white one was extremely rare.

No wonder it found Li Fan ugly; it was the complete opposite of Li Fan, who was entirely pitch black.

Although, in terms of seniority within the demonic beast tribe, this bird might be considered Li Fan's "elder."

Yet, faced with the sudden attack and ridicule from this white Manman Bird, Li Fan certainly wasn’t about to show any respect.

"Strange, why does it sound like a duck quacking?"

"Quack quack, how annoying and noisy."

Li Fan pretended not to see the Manman Bird, looking around in confusion and disdain, then turned to Xu Ke.

Xu Ke blinked for a moment before clapping his hands and laughing: "You’re right, I heard it too."

"They say the Beast Mountain of the Nanming is sacred ground for demonic beasts. How could it allow such a rude duck to wander in? Truly odd."

Hearing their mocking banter, the Manman Bird was furious.

"You two little brats! Who are you calling a duck?"

"I am the noble and revered Manman Bird! A rare pure white variant, you..."

But no matter what it said, Li Fan and Xu Ke just kept shaking their heads, looking at it with disgust.

The white Manman Bird was about to explode with rage, preparing to attack again.

However, as if it had suddenly thought of something, it held back.

"Xuan Bird tribe, I’ll remember you!"

It glared at Li Fan and flapped its wings, flying off ahead.

Li Fan and Xu Ke exchanged glances, quickly urging their own bird to follow.

Not long after, the Manman Bird noticed they were still following.

"Why are you still tailing me? Do you think I’m easy to bully?"

Li Fan sneered: "Strange. The world is vast, and all beasts roam freely."

"Since when did your Manman Bird tribe claim ownership of the skies? Are others not allowed to follow the same path?"

Before the white Manman Bird could respond, a strange laugh suddenly echoed from the horizon, arriving in an instant.

"Hahaha!"

"That little one makes a good point! It seems your Manman Bird tribe has grown too arrogant!"

The white Manman Bird's eyes gleamed with fury, murderous intent brimming.

But when it saw the newcomer, its ferocity immediately subsided.

The creature before them was a bird, yet it had the body of a dog and the face of a human.

As it flew, the sound of rushing wind followed.

It was none other than one of the famous "Dafeng" birds.

"Hahaha!"

The Dafeng Bird landed, laughing heartily once again.

Its gaze lingered briefly on Li Fan before finally resting on Xu Ke.

A flicker of interest crossed its eyes.

"A human child? What brings you to the territory of demonic beasts?"

Chapter 534: The Nanming Emperor and the Beast

“Could it be that you are also here to attend the Ten Thousand Beasts Conference?”

The giant bird, Dafeng, ignored the nearby Manman bird and asked in a friendly tone.

“What Ten Thousand Beasts Conference? I have no idea.”

“I was entrusted by my senior brother, Lu Ya, to deliver this wooden box to you.” Xu Ke's eyes shifted around as he stared at Dafeng, pretending to be innocent as he spoke.

“Lu Ya?” Dafeng tilted its head, thinking for a moment, seemingly unable to recall anyone by that name. “Sounds somewhat familiar...”

“What wooden box? Let me take a look…” it said nonchalantly.

“Sure!” Xu Ke, appearing carefree and defenseless, pulled out a vermillion wooden box.

An ancient and desolate aura immediately emanated from the box.

“This is!” Dafeng's body shuddered uncontrollably, almost losing its balance and nearly falling into the sea.

The white Manman bird, at first, didn’t recognize it either. But after carefully examining the wooden box, it soon let out a sharp screech.

Its feathers stood on end, as if it had been greatly agitated.

Just as it was about to say something, Dafeng swiftly flapped its wings, sending a gust of wind to silence it.

“Hehe, so it was sent by 'that' person…”

“Quick, little one, put it away. If others catch sight of it, there will be trouble.”

Without further questioning the contents of the box, Dafeng awkwardly coughed and hurriedly advised Xu Ke.

“Okay!” Xu Ke obediently put the wooden box back.

“Senior, we're heading to the Nanming Beast Mountain, but we’ve lost our way. Could you take us there?” He blinked his eyes, rubbing the back of his head, looking a bit embarrassed.

“Ahem, young one, didn’t your elders instruct you before setting out? It's not called the Nanming Beast Mountain, that sounds so crude. It's the Nanming Sacred Beast Mountain!” Dafeng corrected him sternly.

“To show such disrespect for the Sacred Beast Mountain, you're lucky you met me, someone with a good temper. If you ran into one of the more violent ones, you’d be captured on the spot, have your stomach cut open, your heart devoured, and your liver eaten!” Dafeng warned, trying to scare him.

Xu Ke tilted his head, thinking for a moment, confused. “But Grandpa San said not to worry when we get here, to feel at home. That's how everyone at home talks.”

“Grandpa San…” Dafeng choked on its words, unsure how to respond.

The once-arrogant Manman bird also shrunk its head back, pretending it had heard nothing.

“Hehe, as long as you’re happy, kid.” In the end, Dafeng could only smile wryly and say no more.

The group continued heading southward.

Along the way, Xu Ke kept chattering, constantly asking Dafeng for information.

“Senior, what exactly is the Ten Thousand Beasts Conference you mentioned?”

Dafeng initially didn’t want to answer, but Xu Ke's persistence left it no choice.

Reluctantly, it whispered, “Not long ago, Lord Emperor One announced to the world that the Ten Thousand Beasts Conference would be held.”

“All beast clans must send representatives to the Nanming Sacred Beast Mountain to participate.”

“It’s said that this concerns the life and death of the beast clans, and it’s the first time in hundreds of years that Lord Emperor One has called such a gathering. It’s extremely important.”

“Even usually reclusive beings like Lord Azure Dragon, Lord Scarlet Nine-Head, and Lord Purple Headless are coming.”

“The last time we had such a grand gathering was during the public trial of Emperor San…”

Dafeng stopped mid-sentence, its expression suddenly changing as it quickly fell silent.

Li Fan and Xu Ke exchanged glances, understanding instantly.

It seemed that even someone with Emperor Sanmo’s status faced serious consequences when interacting too closely with humans.

No wonder both the Manman bird and Dafeng were so cautious about even mentioning Emperor Sanmo.

However, it was clear that the public trial had not been successful against Emperor Sanmo.

Otherwise, when Xu Ke took out the sealed wooden box bearing Emperor Sanmo’s mark, Dafeng and the others wouldn’t have shown such a mix of fear and respect.

Moving away from this topic, Xu Ke continued pestering Dafeng with questions about the beast clans.

He asked where they usually resided, how they interacted with humans, their future plans, and their views on the Beast Taming Sect.

After the earlier slip, Dafeng became more cautious, only sharing trivial and irrelevant information with Xu Ke.

Thus, more than ten days passed.

Finally, the legendary Nanming Sacred Beast Mountain came into view.

From a distance, at the junction of the blue sky and sea, a towering conical mountain appeared out of thin air.

It stood in the middle of the sea, like a mirage, incredibly mysterious.

The mountain’s peak was crowned with a thick layer of white snow.

At the snow-covered summit, a magnificent city could faintly be seen.

Li Fan, with his keen eyes, also noticed that the Nanming Sacred Beast Mountain marked the boundary of the entire Nanming Ocean.

It was a sight beyond words.

The vast, endless sea abruptly stopped at this point.

Beyond it lay a dark abyss, like a black void.

The Nanming Sacred Beast Mountain stood at the boundary between light and dark, reality and illusion, separating the real world from the dreamlike realm.

Dafeng, seeing Xu Ke awestruck by the magnificent view, couldn't help but feel proud.

“How does it look? Never seen such a wondrous sight, have you?”

“The so-called ends of the earth, the world’s frontier, the source of all life, this is our Nanming Sacred Beast Mountain.”

Dafeng sighed with emotion.

“It’s said that the first beasts in the world originated here before spreading across the world.”

“This is a sacred place for all beasts, not to be desecrated. Even though you were sent by an important figure, your human identity cannot be changed. You may not be allowed to enter.”

“Hehe, Dafeng is right. Even you, little black bird, though a beast, have been tamed by humans and serve as a companion spirit beast. You too are not qualified to enter the Sacred Beast Mountain.” The previously quiet Manman bird suddenly perked up and mocked.

With a strange cry, it flapped its wings and flew towards the distant mountain peak, leaving Xu Ke behind.

Xu Ke didn’t seem to mind. He waved a jade token hanging around his neck.

“No worries, before I left, Senior Brother Lu Ya told me that if I encounter any trouble, just show them this token.”

“Senior Brother Luya would never deceive me.”

“Xiao Qing, let’s go!”

Dafeng was about to advise him further when it suddenly realized something, its eyes widening in shock, even more so than when it sensed Emperor Sanmo’s aura.

For it had clearly seen a fleeting glimpse of the jade token, which bore a symbol that only beasts could recognize: the character “One.”

Dafeng finally remembered where it had heard the name Lu Ya before.

It was over a decade ago, when a lone human had entered the Sacred Beast Mountain, and then left unscathed.

Chapter 535: Red Snake Encircles White City

This event caused quite a stir at the time, creating a huge uproar throughout the entire world of beasts.

No beast wanted to believe that a human could come and go freely within the Sacred Beast Mountain.

But the fact was undeniable.

This cultivator named Lu Ya not only ventured into the Sacred Mountain but also took away a junior from the Tian Wu tribe with the purest bloodline.

What made it even harder for the beasts to accept was that at the time, Lu Ya was merely at the early stage of the Nascent Soul level.

This made the whole situation even more absurd.

Forget about the early Nascent Soul stage, even if he were at the Nascent Soul perfection stage, what of it? Any adult beast on the Sacred Beast Mountain could easily crush him with just a flick of a claw.

How could they allow such arrogance from a human cultivator?

Although there were rumors later on that Lu Ya was able to freely enter and leave the Nanming Sacred Beast Mountain due to the tacit approval of the 'Emperor One', it still didn’t sit well with the beast clan.

As the nominal ruler of the entire beast race, Emperor One held a status of utmost reverence. Many young beasts with pure bloodlines and exceptional talent couldn’t even catch his eye.

What right did this mere human cultivator have?

It took over a decade for the waves stirred by this event to gradually calm down.

And the name Lu Ya became etched into the memories of many beasts.

Although the Dafeng Bird was known for its forgetfulness, when both the name "Lu Ya" and the Emperor One's jade token appeared simultaneously, it instantly remembered the events from back then.

"It seems the rumors were indeed true. Lu Ya really had a close relationship with Emperor One..." The Dafeng Bird let out a strange laugh, flapped its wings, and followed Xu Ke as they flew into the Sacred Mountain.

The Nanming Sacred Beast Mountain seemed to contain some sort of special energy that greatly benefited the beasts.

The closer they got to it, the more energized Li Fan felt.

It was as if something deep within him was joyfully stirring, making his blood boil and filling him with boundless energy.

Even the Azure Luan Bird beneath Xu Ke felt the same.

It let out a loud, joyous cry, its speed increasing noticeably in an instant.

In no time, they had arrived.

Xu Ke's group had entered the bounds of the Sacred Beast Mountain, but just then, Little Qing suddenly stiffened in mid-air, motionless.

At the same time, Li Fan felt a fatal sense of danger surge in his heart.

Yet Xu Ke seemed completely unaware of the danger, still shouting excitedly, "Xiao Hei, look! What is that?"

Li Fan's body felt petrified, unable to move. He could only barely turn his eyes to follow Xu Ke's gaze.

What he saw was a massive snake coiled around the Sacred Beast Mountain.

Its body was fiery red, incredibly striking and demonic.

The red snake’s body was enormous, and what they could see seemed to be only part of its seemingly endless form, with most of it hidden beneath the blue waters of the Nanming Sea.

It was a sight that inspired fear in all who beheld it.

What was even more shocking was that before entering the Nanming Sacred Beast Mountain, no one had noticed its presence.

It was as if it had appeared out of thin air.

The red snake’s single eye was now coldly staring at the Azure Luan Bird and the human passengers it carried.

The immense pressure forced Li Fan to instinctively close his eyes.

Yet Xu Ke remained completely unfazed, staring boldly back at the red snake.

After a tense standoff, a faint glow emanated from the jade token in Xu Ke’s hand.

The red snake’s eye shifted slightly before it slowly closed.

In an instant, the Azure Luan Bird regained its mobility.

Li Fan felt the pressure on his body lift abruptly and let out a small sigh of relief.

But when he looked again, the massive red snake, larger than a mountain, had already vanished.

It was as if that terrifying moment had been nothing more than a hallucination.

However, Li Fan knew that the one-eyed red snake was still coiled around the Sacred Beast Mountain.

They just couldn’t see it anymore.

"If it weren’t for that Emperor One jade token, even a cultivator at the Dao Integration stage would be dead or crippled here," Li Fan thought to himself in shock.

Xu Ke, however, remained carefree and oblivious, urging the Azure Luan Bird to descend into the mountain.

"Wow! It feels so comfortable here," Xu Ke exclaimed as he landed, taking a deep breath and savoring the atmosphere.

It was well known that staying on the Sacred Beast Mountain brought some mysterious benefits to beasts.

This time, he didn’t bother to put Little Qing away, instead letting her shrink down to a small size and settle next to Li Fan.

Li Fan glanced at her, and for a moment, a vision of the Azure Saint Master from thousands of years in the future flashed in his mind.

He smiled but said nothing.

Little Qing seemed a bit frightened of Li Fan, the Heavenly Fate Mystical Bird. Occasionally, she cast a nervous glance his way, her eyes filled with fear.

She instinctively kept her distance, not daring to get too close.

Xu Ke, for the moment, ignored the two birds perched above him. He dashed along the mountain path toward the grand city ahead.

Along the way, they encountered many strange and bizarre beasts.

There were horse-bodied, bird-winged creatures; human-faced, snake-tailed beings; some resembling tigers with howling dog-like cries; others like black crows with three heads and six tails; and some like deer with white tails, horse legs, human hands, and four horns...

Some of the beasts were even plants or trees that had gained sentience, radiating divine and ethereal auras.

But no matter how fierce or malevolent these beasts appeared, all of them moved cautiously and respectfully along the mountain path, not daring to act out of line.

Thus, Xu Ke’s reckless running stood out.

Some beasts looked at him with killing intent, wanting to teach this reckless brat a lesson.

But sensing the aura of the Emperor One on him, none of them dared to make a move.

So Xu Ke continued sprinting, finally arriving at the base of the grand city atop the mountain.

This city, atop the Sacred Mountain, was made from some unknown material. Its entire body was pure white, exuding a sacred and majestic presence under the sunlight.

Beyond the white city was originally just a high wall, without any gate.

But as the group approached, a face suddenly appeared on the wall.

The face opened its mouth, revealing a pitch-black passageway.

Xu Ke stopped in his tracks.

He stretched out his neck and peered inside but couldn’t see anything.

While he muttered to himself, a strange beast walked past with a mocking expression and entered the passage.

Xu Ke pouted but quickly gathered his courage and followed the beast into the white city of the Sacred Mountain.

The light vanished, then reappeared.

"Follow me!"

A soft, childish voice suddenly sounded in Li Fan's ear.

Ahead of him stood a small child, around five or six years old, with an adorably delicate face, making it impossible to tell their gender. The child stood with his hands on his hips, addressing Xu Ke.

Chapter 536: The Emperor of All Aspects

The small child immediately caught Xu Ke's attention.

His eyes widened as he stared at the child, curiously approaching and reaching out to pinch the child’s cheek. He asked with great curiosity, “Are you also human? How did you end up on this Beast Mountain?”

The child tilted his head and raised his hand to pinch Xu ke's face in return.

"Who says humans can’t live on Beast Mountain? Aren't you a mere mortal, yet you arrived here safe and sound?" the child replied seriously.

Xu ke was momentarily stunned but then quickly agreed with the child’s words.

Clapping his hands in delight, he said, “You’re right! Humans and beasts can live in harmony.”

“That’s how it is in our sect.”

“I imagine it must be the same here in the Nanming Beast Mountain.”

The child looked at him with a hint of innocence in his eyes and shook his head. “The Beast Taming Sect? I’ve heard that the human cultivators in your Beast Taming Sect rely on the Beast Control Technique to forcibly bind and control the beasts.”

“Many beasts don’t willingly become their companion beasts. They are just controlled by techniques and have no choice.”

“Is that what you call harmonious coexistence?” the child asked seriously.

Xu ke, hearing this, quickly waved his hands in protest, flustered, "It's not like that..."

He opened his mouth to refute, but for a moment, he didn’t know where to start.

Suddenly, something occurred to him. He grabbed the small black creature perched on his head and proudly presented it to the child like a treasure. "Look, this is Xiao Hei-(Little Black) We have a great relationship!"

“Even though he became my companion spirit beast due to the Beast Control Technique,” Xu ke continued, “our bond is real. Isn’t that right, Xiao Hei?”

Xu ke shook his hand, trying to make Xiao Hei show approval.

However, Xiao Hei merely flew back to perch on Xuke’s head and gave him a sharp claw to make him quiet down in pain.

Ignoring Xu ke’s antics, Li Fan kept staring at the child, who was as exquisitely beautiful as jade, with growing suspicion in his heart.

His intuition told him that this child had a significant background and was not as simple as an ordinary mortal.

Yet, there was no trace of a beast’s aura on the child.

Even when Li Fan used his innate powers to observe, the child’s fortune pillar looked as ordinary as that of a mortal, which left him perplexed.

Seeing how well the master and servant in front of him were getting along, the child giggled, seeming very happy.

“Follow me; the paths in the city are complicated. Be careful not to get eaten,” the child reminded again.

With that, the child turned and walked inside.

Xu ke hurriedly followed.

The surroundings were eerily quiet, with no trace of other beasts.

The beasts that had been with them earlier had all disappeared without a trace.

Only the sound of two pairs of footsteps echoed in the empty city, one pair ahead of the other.

They climbed several dozen flights of stairs, and after an unknown amount of time, the child led Xuke into a room.

As they entered, the walls instantly became transparent.

It felt as if they were suspended in mid-air.

The view was magnificent, with the surrounding scenery laid out before them.

Below, the space was densely packed with countless beasts of various shapes and sizes.

They seemed to be engaged in a heated debate.

“Silence!”

Below where Xuke stood, several large orbs of light hovered.

Within the light, faint silhouettes could be seen.

The speaker was a Crimson nine-headed bird.

Its voice was harsh and grating, like metal scraping against metal. However, its status among the beasts appeared to be high, for as soon as it spoke, the beasts fell silent.

“Everyone, let us welcome the great Emperor One, who, after many years, has once again summoned the ten thousand beasts to convene the council!”

Boom!

At its words, the entire space erupted as all the beasts simultaneously roared with excitement, expressing their joy.

In the sky, a massive shadow descended.

A wriggling mass, with heads intermittently emerging and disappearing, like a grey "flesh mound," loomed over the gathered beasts like a cloud.

All the beasts present fell silent, bowing their heads in respect.

"This... this is Emperor One Beast?" Xu ke stuck out his tongue as he stared at the flesh mound below.

“Why does it look… so ugly…”

He lowered his voice, cautiously whispering.

The child next to him heard this and wasn’t angry. Instead, he nodded in agreement with a giggle, “Hehe, I think so too. It is quite ugly!”

Li Fan’s heart skipped a beat.

To dare call the most revered beast in the heart of the Beast Mountain ugly, in the heart of the beasts’ territory—this child…

Before Li Fan could think further, the words of the Emperor One Beast below drew his attention.

"My fellow kin, I have summoned you here today because the time has come to decide the life and death of the beast race."

Emperor One’s voice was peculiar.

It came from all parts of the flesh mound, as if it was made up of thousands of overlapping voices. Yet, when carefully listened to, the voices were indistinguishable, merging into one seamless tone.

It sounded mechanical, yet lively, a strange combination.

Emperor One continued, “The great calamity of the Xuanhuang Realm is approaching. This disaster will be more brutal than any before.”

“Not only humanity but we beasts, and even the entire world, face an existential crisis. Even though our bloodline memories hold abundant experience in dealing with calamities, I fear we will not escape this one unscathed…”

Hearing this, the beasts below erupted into another uproar.

The flesh mound shifted, and light and shadow flickered above the heads of the beasts.

The beasts quickly quieted down again.

“So, for the future of our race, I need to hear your thoughts.”

From the orbs of light below the flesh cloud, a beast that bore a striking resemblance to Emperor One, also a round ball-shaped creature without facial features, spoke up. “Emperor One, whatever you say, we will follow.”

“I, Zi Wushou, will always be your most loyal subordinate!”

With Zi Wushou’s declaration, many beasts below chimed in, echoing their support.

“Oh? What if I decide to lead you away from the Xuanhuang Realm in search of a new home?” Emperor One suddenly asked coldly, surprising the beasts.

“What?” Zi Wushou was clearly caught off guard by Emperor Yi’s statement and stood there dumbfounded.

Before it could respond, an elderly Azure Divine Dragon beside it quickly spoke up.

“Emperor One, why would you do that? With the strength of our beast race, are we really unable to survive this so-called great calamity?”

“Exactly. We’ve survived countless disasters. Besides, even if we leave, where would we go?”

Chapter 537: The Infinite Future

At this moment, the speaker was a pitch-black qilin, majestic and imposing in form but with a voice as crisp as a child's.

On top of the gathering of myriad beasts sat Emperor One, who let out a low, rumbling laugh upon hearing the black qilin’s doubts.

"Experience, as they say, is a double-edged sword. It grants us the confidence to face crises, yet subtly pushes us toward the abyss."

A black, amorphous mass stirred, seemingly expressing its discontent.

“This calamity is unlike any of the ones we’ve faced in history."

"Its origins lie in..."

At this point, a grotesque multitude of fierce beasts began to emerge from Emperor One’s mass.

"Shut up, you!"

"Why waste breath on these useless creatures! Those who don’t obey, devour them all!"

"What ‘Ten Thousand Beast clan’? With only me, 'Emperor One,' it’s enough!"

...

This unsettling scene silenced all attending beasts, though none of them seemed surprised by the outburst. There was fear in their eyes, but no shock.

The black mass churned once more, swallowing the snarling heads back within itself, as Emperor One resumed, unfazed, "As such, this catastrophe surpasses what the Xuanhuang Realm itself can resolve."

"If no additional factors intervene, everything in this world will end in extinction."

Emperor One's serious tone commanded the full attention of the assembled beasts, who all grew solemn.

"However, since I said I would lead you to survival, I naturally have a way out."

Emperor One's voice, as if resonating from countless forms, echoed through the space.

"Among the human cultivators, there is a sect called the Heavenly Sword Sect. In the face of this great catastrophe, they hope to seize a chance of survival by creating a 'Void-Breaking Divine Weapon,' a tool capable of shattering space-time itself, allowing them to escape from Xuanhuang."

"Setting aside the feasibility of their plan, it has inspired me."

"This mountain beneath us happens to be a natural ‘Void-Breaking Divine Weapon.’ With some modifications, it could lead us to escape as well," Emperor One declared confidently.

"Mount Nanming stands at the edge of the world, at the land's end and sea’s edge. Thus, it has accumulated a great deal of energy from the world's natural overflow..."

Di Yi began to explain the principles to the beasts. None dared to slacken their attention; regardless of their true thoughts, each wore a serious expression.

In the transparent room above, Xu Ke yawned as he listened.

"How boring. Why do these powerful beasts love to drone on? Not impressive at all," he muttered quietly.

Turning to the child beside him, who was even smaller than himself, he asked, "Why did you bring us here? Isn’t this an internal meeting of the beast clan? Isn’t it bad for us to eavesdrop?"

"It’s fine. It won’t mind." The child looked down at the speaking Emperor One beast and said lightly.

Although Xu Ke was naturally carefree, he was no fool. He glanced around cautiously and whispered, "From the way you talk, you seem pretty familiar with Lord Emperor One."

"Could it be... that you’re its illegitimate child?"

"Think that if you wish," the child replied openly, much to Xu Ke’s surprise.

Xu Ke froze in shock.

"Or rather, 'I' am Emperor One. But 'I' am not Emperor One," the child added.

Xu Ke’s eyes widened in disbelief.

Li Fan, too, shifted his attention from Emperor One’s speech below to the child in front of him. Though he had his suspicions, it was shocking to think that the supreme beast lord would take on a human form.

Emperor One, seeing Xu Ke and Li Fan’s astonished expressions, flashed a mysterious smile.

“What’s the matter? Surprised?”

Xu Ke nodded repeatedly.

"There’s no need for that. All life, at its essence, is ultimately one."

"Beast or human, there is no fundamental difference," Emperor One continued, casually stating something shocking.

Li Fan thought that, in this sacred land of beasts, if anyone other than the beast lord himself said such a thing, they’d likely be devoured by the furious beasts on the spot.

"It’s almost amusing that it took me so long to realize this," the child-like Emperor One said, looking down at the gathered beasts with an air of ancient wisdom.

"Back then, Lu Ya once told me that the strength of beasts lies in the inheritance of bloodline power. But over generations, the purity of that bloodline weakens. Although rare cases of atavism can occur, overall, the strength of the beast clan has undeniably been diminishing."

At the mention of Senior Lu Ya, Xu Ke's eyes lit up, and he listened intently.

"Meanwhile, our opponents, humans, have grown stronger through generations of learning and accumulation. Cultivation methods, talismans, tools, formation, elixirs—their sources of power are things that can be passed down through generations."

"The gap continues to widen. What, then, lies in the future for the beast clans?"

"I thought about this question for three days and nights, but still found no answer."

"Forcing those without brains to learn alchemy or artifact refining?”

"Even I couldn’t achieve that. If lying around, eating, drinking, and resting makes them stronger, why would they strive for anything else?"

"This is the beast clan’s dilemma. Although there may be some exceptional individuals, it can’t change the entire clan’s ecology."

As though he were explaining to Xu Ke and Li Fan, or perhaps just talking to himself, Emperor One continued.

"So, you plan to turn beasts into humans? Like what you’re doing now?” Xu Ke asked, astonished at the realization.

Li Fan’s feathers ruffled slightly, sensing a chill.

"Yes."

"And no."

Di Yi shook his head, then nodded.

"As the leader of all beasts, I must consider the future of the entire beast clan, not just act based on personal preferences."

The child-like Emperor One gestured to the ten thousand beast gathering below.

"That other version of me has decided to lead the beasts in fleeing Xuanhuang."

"Even though I have utmost confidence, I can’t deny that this plan may fail."

"Even if there’s only a minuscule chance, I have to account for it."

"I don’t want the beast clan to be doomed by one decision, so I need an alternative plan."

"I understand! This is what my seniors often say—you need a backup plan for everything!" Xu Ke said excitedly.

“No, you don’t understand,” Emperor One said bluntly.

"‘Two options’ would spell self-destruction for such a vast clan."

"How many beasts would accept the plan of transforming into humans? Not many, that much is certain."

"Enforcing such an order would only bring harm to an already divided clan, so I need to carry this plan out in secret."

Xu Ke scratched his head, looking perplexed. "What are you trying to say? The more you explain, the more confusing it gets."

Emperor One waved his hand, and suddenly, a lush tree appeared before them.

At the tip of one of its branches, Xu Ke saw his own reflection.

“This is…?” he asked, puzzled.

"This is the future," Emperor One replied solemnly. "One possible future."

"The fate of the beast clan is intertwined with you," Emperor One said, gazing at the small Xu Ke, his eyes filled with an ancient sadness.

Xu Ke watched the tree’s branches, each branch displaying different visions of the beast clan’s future—some filled with blood and complete extinction, others thriving and recalling the grandeur of ancient times.

There were scenes of beasts and humans coexisting in harmony, creating a glorious civilization, and others of desolation and ruin.

"An infinite future holds infinite possibilities."

"This means that no matter how slim a possibility may seem, under the concept of ‘infinity,’ everything is bound to occur."

"As the leader of the clan, I must consider every possible outcome for the beast clan's fate."

In that moment, Emperor One, despite his childlike form, spoke with a weight as heavy as mountains.

"This is my answer to Lu Ya’s question."

"Humans may have infinite potential, but you are divided, unable to unite the clan's power, exhausting yourselves in endless internal conflict."

"During a catastrophe, humanity would suffer greatly."

"Even if they survive by chance, the odds of extinction increase as disasters accumulate over time."

"But for us beasts, it’s different. As long as I exist, I’ll think everything through for my kin."

"Though they may have individual thoughts, when it comes to life and death, they must follow my command."

"As long as I live, the beast clan won’t face total extinction."

"If we can’t compete with humans, we just have to outlast them until they destroy themselves."

Emperor One's tone carried a hint of faint irony.

Xu Ke frowned, wanting to retort, but found no suitable words.

After a long pause, he finally asked, "Then how can you guarantee that you won’t die before the beast clan’s extinction?"

Emperor One gave Xu Ke a dark look but remained silent.

Chapter 538: The Skilled Warrior Dies in Battle

"An infinite future means infinite possibilities. As long as there’s a sliver of chance, it means it will inevitably come to pass…”

In Li Fan’s mind, the words Emperor One had just spoken echoed repeatedly.

Possessing the [Truth] ability, which allowed him nearly limitless resets, he understood the meaning of these words more profoundly than anyone else.

Moreover, Li Fan’s heart surged with emotion. He had a premonition that hidden within these words was an even deeper secret.

Something related to his path of the future, or perhaps to the [Truth].

Yet, it was as if he were gazing at flowers in the mist—unable to see its entirety.

Li Fan was lost in a storm of introspection, while the child Emperor One remained silent after finishing his statement.

Xu Ke, under Emperor One’s gaze, involuntarily shuddered and closed his mouth.

The normally fearless Xu Ke now realized the precariousness of his earlier words and dared not ask any further.

After a long silence, perhaps to break the awkwardness of the moment, he chuckled and changed the subject, “Right, since you are the ‘Emperor One’…” Xu Ke tapped his forehead as if just remembering and took out a vermillion wooden box, passing it over.

“This is from Senior Brother Lu Ya, who asked me to bring it here. He didn’t specify who it’s for, but since you’re the one in charge, it’s safe to say it should go to you.”

Xu Ke looked at Emperor One, somewhat relieved.

“What is this…”

Emperor One’s gaze fell on the wooden box, and a hint of solemnity appeared on his small face.

As he took the box, a dark glow flashed across his hand, instantly dispelling the seals placed upon it.

“Roar!”

A ferocious killing aura, laced with resentment and anger, burst out of the box, soaring into the sky.

The murderous energy took shape, swirling into a violent tornado.

An overpowering scent of blood erupted from within, sweeping across the surroundings like a shockwave.

In the midst of this, the shadow of a ferocious beast seemed to emerge, roaring in fury.

Caught off guard, Xu Ke fell to the ground in fright.

And Li Fan, deep in thought, was also startled by the terrifying scene, his feathers standing on end, his body trembling instinctively as if facing a natural enemy.

Fortunately, Emperor One’s small hand formed an impenetrable cage, containing and sealing off the malicious aura.

No matter how violently it struggled or attempted to escape, it couldn’t break free.

“Even in death, that foul temper of yours hasn’t changed.” Emperor One scoffed, his hand emitting a faint black glow.

Gradually, as if sensing Emperor One’s presence, the fierce beast inside the box began to calm down.

The roaring subsided until silence returned.

It was only then that the still-shaken Xu Ke and Li Fan got a clear view of the box’s contents.

Inside was the severed head of a fierce beast, eyes wide open and filled with hatred.

Its surface was covered in cracks, like shattered porcelain, etched with battle scars.

At the wound on the head, the flesh seemed to writhe, as though the beast hadn’t yet fully died.

Seeing what Senior Brother Lu Ya had entrusted him to transport to the Nanming Beast Mountain, Xu Ke turned pale with fright.

He hastily waved his hands in defense, exclaiming, “I didn’t do it!”

The child Emperor One was stunned for a moment, then broke into a chuckle.

“Relax, even if you claimed to have killed it, no one in the world would believe you.”

“The Lord of Demon Beasts, known as the unrivaled ‘Emperor II of Wrath’…”

“There aren’t many who could kill him. You’re certainly not among them.”

Emperor One’s face showed no grief or rage, merely offering a faint explanation as he continued to scrutinize the head of [Emperor II of Wrath], as if searching for clues.

“Emperor II of Wrath?” Though relieved of suspicion, Xu Ke was even more alarmed.

Swallowing hard, he muttered, “If he’s number two, then doesn’t that make him stronger than Grandpa San-(Third)?”

“How did he end up like this…”

Xu Ke couldn’t help glancing at the head in the box, asking the question with difficulty.

Li Fan was similarly shaken.

From Emperor Yi’s words, it seemed that this ‘Emperor II of Wrath’ was likely the strongest among the demon beasts, second only to Emperor One.

In human cultivation terms, he would probably be on par with someone at the Longevity Realm.

And now, he had been decapitated...

Who could have done this?

Considering that the box came from Lu Ya of the Beast-Taming Sect, and though Lu Ya himself didn’t possess the power to accomplish such a feat, he knew someone who could.

Mr. Bai.

In an instant, an unparalleled figure flashed in Li Fan’s mind.

Could it be him?

Li Fan and Xu Ke exchanged a glance, seemingly thinking the same thing.

While the two of them pieced together the perpetrator, Emperor One, too, seemed to discover something in the wounds on the head.

“A skilled warrior dies in battle.”

“I warned you many times, yet you refused to listen. Now you suffer this fate, brought upon yourself.”

Emperor One’s expression was stern, his voice cold as ice.

From within the severed head of 'Emperor II of Wrath', a faint, angry roar seemed to echo in defiance.

“It’s good you returned.”

Emperor One murmured mysteriously.

Then something happened that sent chills down Xu Ke’s spine.

Emperor One placed his hand on the severed head of Emperor II of Wrath. His small, white hand began to swell and distort, expanding in strange ways.

Chunks of black, mud-like flesh oozed from his hand, covering and engulfing the beast’s head.

Instinctively, Xu Ke pulled Li Fan back several steps.

They distanced themselves from the seemingly innocent child Emperor One.

Within just a few breaths, the undulating black mass retracted.

Emperor One returned to his innocent childlike form.

The head of 'Emperor II of Wrath' was now gone.

“Thank you for bringing this fool back.”

“I won’t let him go again for a few tens of thousands of years.”

Emperor One said seriously.

Xu Ke scratched his head, at a loss for words.

“I also understand Emperor III’s intentions…”

Emperor One glanced at Xu Ke with a faint smile.

Instead of reproach, he simply continued.

His belly suddenly swelled, distending until it was several times larger than his childlike body, grotesquely so.

Inside, something seemed to be forming, shifting restlessly within him.

With a tearing sound, a round creature emerged from his body.

“Take this little one back and give it to Lu Ya.”

“He’ll know what to do.”

Back in his childlike form, Emperor One looked at Xu Ke, pausing a moment before speaking again.

“This is your reward for delivering Emperor II of Wrath.”

“Additionally, I have something else to give you.”

Chapter 539: Fate Decides to Stay or Leave

This time, there was no grand commotion. Emperor One merely pointed lightly at Xu Ke’s brow, making no further movement.

Xu Ke touched his forehead, but it felt like nothing had changed.

"When the time is right, you’ll understand its purpose," Emperor One said.

"Mysteries again, always speaking in riddles… It’s driving me crazy," Xu Ke muttered under his breath. He glanced at Emperor One but ultimately lacked the courage to speak up.

He had no choice but to bear it.

"With things here resolved, it's clear that Nanming is no place for humans to linger long. Let me take you out of here."

Meanwhile, in the space below, the Assembly of Ten Thousand Beasts had come to a final decision.

"We firmly support and uphold His Majesty Emperor One’s great decision!"

"Under His Majesty’s leadership, our Beast Clan will usher in a brighter future!"

"To stay in the tiny Xuanhuang Realm is pointless!"

The beast tribes roared in unison, their voices like crashing waves, already in unanimous agreement.

As for how genuine this enthusiasm was, one might catch a hint from the faint, mocking smile that appeared on Emperor One's young face as he looked down upon them.

Leading Xu Ke, Emperor One took him through a winding, deserted passage, arriving back at the door they had first entered through.

"You may leave now."

Emperor One halted and instructed.

Xu Ke hesitated, as if he wanted to say something.

"Rest assured, we’ll meet again someday," Emperor One added, with a knowing look.

As his voice echoed, Emperor One's figure disappeared.

Xu Ke felt a pang of emptiness.

Holding onto the sphere with a pulsating core, Xu Ke summoned Xiao Qing and left with Li Fan.

On the journey back across the Nanming Sea, possibly due to Emperor One's influence, they encountered no other beasts.

Their journey was peaceful, and they drew ever closer to the Beast-Taming Sect.

Li Fan, standing on the sphere Emperor One had given Xu Ke, seemed deeply interested in it, his gaze revealing a glint of greed as if he wanted to devour it.

"Hey, Xiao Hei, what are you doing?"

Seeing Li Fan’s predatory look, Xu Ke clutched the sphere tightly, eyes full of caution.

"This is something I need to bring back to Senior Brother Lu Ya. Don’t even think about eating it out of curiosity."

Li Fan rolled his eyes at Xu Ke and swiped at him with a claw, offering no explanation.

He had been staring at the sphere because he sensed a faint, familiar aura from it.

After carefully discerning it, he realized this familiar sensation originated from the Rift-World Whales that roamed outside the Immortal-Severing Formation in the future.

"The Rift-World Whales that Xu Ke and I found before were clearly different from those I encountered later."

"Not only in size, but more importantly, according to Empire records, the later Rift-World Whales could reproduce simply by absorbing void energy."

"Only this trait could allow them to thrive in the vast void, multiplying to an extent that they could separate small worlds from the Xuanhuang Realm."

"The ones we found before obviously lacked this ability."

"But this little guy..."

Li Fan pondered.

It seemed the Beast-Taming Sect had crossbred the Rift-World Whales with this spherical creature to cultivate a new subspecies that met the desired criteria.

"So all this work has still been because of Mr. Bai’s mission?"

Li Fan couldn’t help but feel a bit confused.

This adventure in the Immortal-Fallen Realm was dragging on.

Even now, he hadn’t figured out the attachment sustaining this time-space segment.

Nor had he found a way to break it.

However, Li Fan had a feeling. Maybe returning to the Beast-Taming Sect would reveal the answer.

The journey back from Nanming to the Beast-Taming Sect was long.

About halfway there, the time in the Immortal-Fallen Realm ran out.

With a dizzying flash, Li Fan returned to reality.

"The Emperor One Beast..."

Recalling the Immortal-Fallen Realm events, a question crept into Li Fan’s mind.

Did the beast tribe later succeed in relocating completely?

If they had, such a massive undertaking couldn’t have escaped the notice of cultivators at the time.

And if there were a precedent for escaping, the cultivators would surely have tried to emulate it.

They would have attempted various methods to shatter time and space, to break free of the Xuanhuang Realm.

"The Grand Dao Sect once had three Longevity-stage cultivators hidden away. Not to mention the other sects; the Xuanhuang Realm was not lacking in Longevity-level cultivators."

"Yet they’ve all disappeared now. Maybe, some of them left back then."

Li Fan suddenly remembered Emperor One’s words.

"Within the beast tribes, there were many divisions on whether to leave the Xuanhuang Realm altogether."

"And even more so among us human cultivators."

"For each who wanted to leave, there were others who wished to stay."

It was simply a matter of personal choice when faced with the unprecedented catastrophe of heaven and earth.

Li Fan pondered.

---

Back in the real world from the Immortal-Fallen Realm, the foundation ceremony for Congyun Immortal City was about to begin.

As agreed, Zhou Kebao brought over the Immortal City abode.

"Fellow Daoist, behold!"

He extended his right hand, revealing a miniature city radiating five-colored light.

Its appearance was identical to the Immortal Cities in each state of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance.

"There’s no room to display it here. Please, follow me," Zhou Kebao said with a smile, handing over a white jade statue in the form of a exquisite pagoda.

"This is…" Li Fan examined the small object, finding it somewhat familiar.

"This is the key to the Advance Realm. Simply use it as the core of the formation, and you’ll be able to enter the Advance Realm as planned," Zhou Kebao explained.

"I see." Li Fan, who had once rented the White Bone Advance Realm and deceived many from outer realm, was naturally familiar with this.

After a brief pause, he activated the ritual with the Exquisite Pagoda statue in hand.

Following a faint dizziness, Li Fan opened his eyes again, finding himself in a heavenly palace amidst clouds.

In addition to Zhou Kebao, a group of cultivators had been waiting for some time.

"An honor to finally meet you, Daoist Li. A true privilege for us all!"

"Haha, Daoist Li, I guess we can say we've become acquaintances in a unique way!"

Seeing Li Fan, they warmly came forward to greet him.

Li Fan responded with a smile.

"All right, let’s allow Daoist Li to inspect the goods," one of them, a square-faced cultivator with a naturally authoritative presence, said.

Zhou Kebao nodded, then controlled the Immortal City abode, expanding it to its full size.

In an instant, an immense floating city appeared above the palace.

"Daoist Li, please!"

With that, Zhou Kebao led the way into the suspended city.

Chapter 540: The Conferment of the Secret Emissary

"Fellow Daoist Li, please proceed!"

The square-faced cultivator stepped forward, speaking to Li Fan in a deep tone.

Earlier, when Li Fan had eavesdropped on this group discussing their plans, he had overheard from Zhou Kebao that this man’s surname was Long.

In their group, he seemed to naturally hold a leadership position.

Furthermore, on the contract that Zhou Kebao had signed, only one person with the surname Long had left his name.

Thus, Li Fan was able to determine the identity of the cultivator before him.

Long Yueyou.

The surname Long was not exactly common.

Back when he was in Tianquan Prefecture, Li Fan had heard of the famed Long Clan at the Heavenly Pole Institute of the Extreme Heaven Sovereign.

Although not as prominent as the Tantai clan, which had high-ranking elders in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, the Long clan was very cohesive, with its members spread throughout the Alliance.

Even though most of them held basic positions, when united, they were a force not to be underestimated.

Whether Long Yueyou was connected to that Long clan was still unclear to Li Fan.

This thought flashed through his mind, but Li Fan pretended not to recognize Long Yueyou and asked, "And who might this be?"

Long Yueyou gave a slight, proud smile but did not speak. Instead, one of his followers quickly introduced him to Li Fan.

Just as Li Fan had guessed.

"An honor! Truly an honor!" Li Fan clasped his hands in greeting, feigning surprise.

Internally, however, Li Fan’s evaluation of Long Yueyou had already dropped by a few notches.

Long Yueyou nodded as a response.

Li Fan didn’t mind and, surrounded by cultivators, followed Zhou Kebao as they flew into the suspended city in the sky.

The protective formation had not been activated, allowing free movement throughout the city.

This was the first time Li Fan had an overhead view of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s Immortal city.

The perspective was different, lending a unique flavor to the experience.

Zhou Kebao began explaining the various facilities within the city to Li Fan.

Li Fan could see that this Immortal city’s cave estate was indeed almost identical to the usual city layouts of the Immortal Alliance.

After a tour of each building, Li Fan nodded in satisfaction.

When the time seemed right, Zhou Kebao took out a seven-colored command token and handed it over.

"This is the control hub for this cave estate. Just refine it with your blood, and you’ll be able to control the city’s formations at will."

"In addition to the standard functions that every Immortal city has, we added special features based on your requirements, such as long-distance teleportation, illusion mirages, and the virtual mustard seed storage function."

"Of course, you can also distribute certain control permissions of the cave estate to other cultivators."

…

Zhou Kebao diligently showcased the strengths of this Immortal city cave estate to Li Fan and even offered helpful reminders.

"Long-distance teleportation requires a lot of energy. Besides premium spirit stones, you’ll need resources like [Void Splitting Sand] and [Fixed Orbit Mystical Crystal], which are rare and quite expensive in the market. If you need, you can get them from us at a reasonable price." Zhou Kebao whispered, causing a round of chuckles from the cultivators around.

"By the way, there’s something important to note. Long-distance teleportation requires precise spatial coordinates of the destination. Otherwise, minor location errors are manageable, but if it sends you into endless void, that would be a problem." Zhou Kebao added gravely.

Li Fan nodded in acknowledgment.

"Lastly, the self-destruction function you specifically requested." Zhou Kebao's tone grew slightly tense.

"We put in a lot of effort to accommodate this request."

"During the city’s construction, we embedded special materials capable of triggering [Silent Obliteration Thunder]."

"Additionally, since this Immortal city cave estate was crafted using the artifact refinement method, it has a self-destruct feature for offensive purposes."

Zhou Kebao paused.

"Our calculations show that if this cave estate were to explode suddenly, even a Dao Integration cultivator would be severely injured without precautions."

At these words, the surroundings fell silent.

All the cultivators present, including Long Yueyou, glanced at Li Fan with strange expressions.

However, none asked further.

After all, as Li Fan himself had said, he had been ambushed by a spy from the Five Elders Association and possessed significant wealth. Carrying such a powerful weapon for self-defense was quite reasonable.

Whatever Li Fan’s true intentions, as long as they sold the Immortal city to him and received their contribution points, it was enough.

At most, they would avoid crossing paths with him unnecessarily in the future.

This was the shared thought among Zhou Kebao and the others.

The cultivators, amidst awkward laughter, let the matter pass without further discussion.

Once Li Fan completed the contribution point transaction, he refined the seven-colored control token of the cave estate in front of everyone.

Looking down at the vast city below, he felt an empowering sense of control.

Simultaneously, the methods of activating various functions surfaced in his mind.

With a thought, the Immortal city cave estate transformed into a small bead of light and entered Li Fan's dantian.

"What a treasure!"

Li Fan clapped, clearly impressed.

"If you ever need anything else, you’re always welcome."

"As long as you have enough contribution points, anything is possible," Zhou Kebao replied with a big smile.

"Then I’ll surely have to trouble you all often!" Li Fan said, glancing around with a smile, drawing a round of laughter.

After a few more polite exchanges, Li Fan took his leave, using the nearing completion of Congyun City as an excuse for his busy schedule.

"This man is truly daring; if avoidable, best not to make an enemy of him." Long Yueyou said, watching Li Fan’s fading figure.

"Indeed, no ordinary cultivator would carry such a terrifying weapon. If he ever loses his mind and detonates it in a Immortal city somewhere…"

"Tsk, tsk…"

"Ancient cultivators are unpredictable. If he really had anything against our Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, then it would be strange."

"Anyway, we got our contribution points, and it’s none of our business," they all joked and laughed.

—

At Congyun Sea.

Li Fan inspected the Immortal city cave estate resting peacefully in his dantian, feeling much more secure.

With this destructive power for self-defense, along with the [Ten Thousand Essence Blood] in the [Truth] bonded space, Li Fan felt confident that he now had enough power to deter even Dao Integration cultivators.

As for Zhou Kebao and the others, whether they’d left any hidden triggers in the estate didn’t bother Li Fan.

After all, its fate was already sealed.

Before his identity as "Li Fan, an ancient Heavenly mechanism's Sect cultivator" disappeared, this cave estate would shine one last, brilliant display within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s territory.

Different future scenarios flashed in his mind, and he let out a cold smile.

Settling his thoughts, Li Fan then headed back to the Dust Crossing Boat, requesting to see the Lord Diyi Jinglun before the official Congyun City foundation ceremony.

"Young Master Jinglun, after months of hard work, the Alliance mission is complete. I’ve also carried out the tasks you assigned."

"You see…"

Li Fan spoke tactfully, confident that the perceptive Diyi Jinglun would understand the meaning behind his words.

Frowning as he reviewed the glowing, shifting documents on his desk, the Diyi Jinglun didn’t even look up.

"Don’t worry, the Alliance never shortchanges those who contribute."

"The appropriate reward has been decided. Originally, I intended to announce it at the foundation ceremony, but since you’re in such a hurry, take a look."

Diyi Jinglun tapped the desk lightly, and a beam of light shot towards Li Fan.

Unable to dodge, the light entered his body, and an announcement appeared in his mind.

"This is to commend Li Fan, Acting Island Lord of Congyun Island, for his diligence and exceptional efforts in supervising the construction of Congyun City."

"We hereby promote him to the position of [Secret Envoy] of Congyun City’s Administrative Hall, with full authority over all governmental affairs in the absence of the Island Lord."

"In addition, we award him a contribution of 100,000 points and an A-rank superior merit."

...

"Heh, ‘the Alliance never shortchanges those who contribute’—I’ve heard that one before."

"But the reward for this mission truly lives up to those words."

Li Fan thought to himself.

Upon carefully reviewing the order from the Administrative Hall, he found that his upcoming position as a [Secret Envoy] granted substantial authority.

In reality, within the actual operations of regional governance, many matters were ultimately decided by these Secret Envoys of the Bureau of Governance. Only special events that reached a certain level required approval from the City Lord of the Immortal City.

After all, in a single state, there are countless minor affairs, and if the City Lord had to personally address everything, no matter how trivial, even several clones might not suffice to manage it all. Moreover, the City Lords of the various Immortal Cities are often at the Soul Transformation level of cultivation.

At this level, who wouldn’t aspire to go further and achieve Dao Integration?

One must understand that once one steps into the realm of Dao Integration, their status becomes entirely different from that of a Soul Transformation cultivator.

In a smaller sense, one would become the true ruler of a single state; on a larger scale, they could be transferred to the core of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance, reaching the center of power in the near future.

Therefore, they must ensure ample time for cultivation.

As an aide to the City Lord, the Secret Envoy helps shoulder the burden of handling administrative matters. Generally, a single state will have three to five Secret Envoys.

However, the situation in Congyun Sea is unique.

The upper echelon has been temporarily reassigned elsewhere by a single command, while almost all of the mid- and lower-level cultivators were captured in a single sweep by the Five Elders Association.

To expedite the operations of the newly rebuilt Congyun City, the Bureau of Governance headquarters has, for the time being, appointed only one Secret Envoy, while also granting Li Fan extensive authority.

He now has the right to recommend candidates for one-third of the vacant positions. As for the remaining posts, they will soon be filled by cultivators transferred from other states.

“With both Immortal Lords Hongxi and Ziyun of the Soul Transformation stage absent, it can be said that I am solely in charge of Congyun City.”

“These past few months of relentless effort were well worth it,” Li Fan thought, his face revealing excitement.

“Thank you, Young Master, for your support! From now on, I shall serve you with unwavering loyalty, repaying your kindness!”

Li Fan vowed with conviction.

Chapter 541: Old Matters Resurface

For Li Fan's pledge of unwavering loyalty, the Diyi Jinglun merely gave a noncommittal nod.

"Go on now. Prepare well for the inauguration ceremony. No mistakes are permitted," he said indifferently, eyes still focused on the documents before him.

Li Fan bowed deeply and took his leave.

Back at his temporary quarters, he summoned Gao Yuan.

"Lord City Master, you called for me?" Gao Yuan greeted him with a flattering smile, bowing deeply.

"The reward from the Alliance Headquarters has arrived. I will assume the post of ‘Secret Envoy of the Administrative Hall.’ From now on, address me accordingly," Li Fan replied coolly, mirroring the tone of the Diyi Jinglun.

Gao Yuan was stunned for a moment. Before he could react, Li Fan continued, "The Immortal City’s reconstruction is ongoing, with many tasks left unfinished. With Lords Hongxi and Ziyun away, I will temporarily assume full responsibility over all affairs in Congyun Sea."

Gao Yuan, finally regaining his composure, could barely contain his delight and said repeatedly, "Congratulations, Lord Secret Envoy! Everyone has witnessed your competence over these past six months. With you overseeing matters, the cultivators of Congyun Sea are indeed fortunate!"

"My lord, you might not be aware, but every cultivator I’ve encountered has nothing but admiration and faith in your abilities."

…

Li Fan smiled knowingly.

Though aware of Gao Yuan's flattery, who doesn't enjoy hearing praise?

Waving a hand to interrupt Gao Yuan's enthusiastic speech, Li Fan took a thin sheet of paper from his sleeve and handed it over.

"This is a list of cultivators ranked roughly by their contributions to the reconstruction of Congyun City."
