"Of the available positions in the new city, I hold one-third of the nomination quotas. Aside from those cultivators who pledged allegiance on the first day, several positions remain vacant. Review the list and see who is suitable," Li Fan instructed, hands folded behind his back.

The list in Gao Yuan's hand, though thin as cicada wings, felt as heavy as a mountain. His hands trembled, and his breathing grew rapid.

This was why he had sworn loyalty to Li Fan—to reach this day, to wield the power to shape others’ fates with a single word.

Recognizing this as Li Fan's final test for him, Gao Yuan took a deep breath to steady himself.

Scanning the names, he quickly formulated a plan.

"Of these cultivators, I recommend Fang Weihou first. Though only a Golden Core cultivator, he's diligent and meticulous. Every task assigned to him over the past six months has been completed flawlessly ahead of schedule. What's more, he has no family background and has advanced purely on his own."

"And this cultivator, Jia Jun, is highly capable as well..."

Gao Yuan spoke fluently and with confidence.

The past six months had not been idle for him.

Though he seemed to wander aimlessly each day, his watchful eyes took in the actions of every cultivator.

Li Fan silently matched Gao Yuan's evaluations against scenes from his memory stone, which had recorded and monitored these cultivators' actions over the past half-year.

After making a detailed comparison, he nodded slowly.

For someone who had stood guard at the Administrative Hall for so long, Gao Yuan's judgment of people was indeed exceptional.

Even Li Fan had to admit that he might not have done better.

"Excellent," Li Fan finally praised.

"I have all I need," he said, gesturing with his finger. A dozen names on the list in Gao Yuan's hand were circled.

"Inform these individuals in advance so they can prepare themselves mentally. Tomorrow's ceremony must go without a hitch," Li Fan instructed.

Gao Yuan nodded solemnly, accepted the command, and departed.

---

The Next Day

The Immortal City of Congyun hovered high in the sky. From afar, the glow of its protective barrier shimmered, clearly activated.

Almost every cultivator from Congyun Sea had gathered below, gazing up at the newly built city with a mix of wonder and reflection.

Amidst the expectant crowd, Li Fan stepped forward, riding on a Soul Transformation puppet.

"Welcome, Lord of the Island!"

Some cultivators below suddenly shouted in unison.

Li Fan smiled and waved a hand. "Today, the reconstruction of Congyun Immortal City is officially complete, and my role as Acting Island Lord ends here."

"Fellow Daoists, from now on, please address me differently."

Looking up at Congyun City in the sky, he sighed, "For all of you to unite and rebuild this city within half a year is no easy feat. I am honored to be a part of this achievement!"

"Fellow Daoists, please allow me to salute you!"

With that, Li Fan actually bowed deeply to the crowd of cultivators.

This caused a stir among the Congyun Sea cultivators.

Some looked panicked and hastily returned the salute.

Others accepted it calmly, feeling it was only proper.

And, of course, many simply watched, amused by what they saw as a mere show.

But just as Li Fan straightened and prepared to speak again...

From the distant horizon, a streak of light shot toward them.

"Acting Island Lord of Ten Thousand Immortals Island, Li Fan, hear your command!"

A thin cultivator, clad in the Immortal Alliance's official attire, appeared, holding a yellow scroll with a solemn expression.

Though he spoke quietly, his words boomed like thunder, reaching every cultivator present.

In an instant, silence fell around the Immortal City.

"Here it is!" Li Fan moved forward, unhurriedly bowing slightly.

"To Acting Island Lord Li Fan of Congyun Island, who has worked tirelessly to supervise the reconstruction of Congyun City, commendations are bestowed."

…

Just as he had seen the previous day in the presence of the Lord Jinglun.

But this time, as the representative from the Alliance’s Administrative Hall officially proclaimed the commendation, the scroll transformed into a golden glow that shot toward Li Fan.

As it neared him, the golden light turned into a close-fitting black robe, which automatically draped itself over him.

Intricate patterns woven in gold adorned the robe, exuding an aura of prestige.

"Congratulations, Lord Secret Envoy!"

As Li Fan donned the robe, a group of cultivators in the crowd—having arranged this beforehand—shouted together.

Some of the quicker-witted cultivators now realized that, just like Li Fan's appointment as Acting Island Lord, this too had likely been prearranged.

Only they had been left in the dark.

Those who had previously ignored Li Fan’s gesture of respect now looked regretful.

In a bid to make amends, after a moment of silence, they joined in the cheering.

"Congratulations, Lord Secret Envoy!"

After a second round of cheers, more joined in.

Eventually, even those who had remained silent were pressured to join the chorus.

The collective cheers of "Congratulations, Lord Secret Envoy!" echoed through the Congyun Sea, spreading in all directions.

Chapter 542: Disciples Across the World

The cheers of the cultivators continued until Li Fan flew to Congyun City and personally opened the entrance to the protective formation. Only then did the celebration gradually quiet down.

"Everyone, from this day onward, this will be our new home," Li Fan said with a smile.

The cultivators all responded in agreement.

"All the facilities on the island are as they were, including the teleportation formation and the Tianxuan Mirror. Feel free to explore them; there’s no need for further explanation," Li Fan announced loudly.

Some cultivators could hardly wait and began leaving immediately.

Seeing this, Li Fan smiled slightly and suddenly spoke again, “The following friends, please come with me to the Administrative Hall.”

“Zheng Hao, Gao Yuan, Zhou Qingang…”

“Fang Weihou…”

“Jia Jun…”

Li Fan listed over a hundred names in one breath, as if reciting a menu.

The cultivators who had initially intended to leave stopped in their tracks, realizing something important was happening. Their faces were tense, listening attentively.

Those called were overjoyed, while those who were not didn’t dare show discontent, only casting envious looks at those chosen.

Having secured Li Fan, who was officially a Secret Envoy but effectively the acting Island Lord, they saw a boundless future.

After speaking, Li Fan led a grand procession of over a hundred people to the Administrative Hall at the center of the city.

Only the cultivators left behind exchanged thoughts silently.

“What’s so impressive about him? The rise and fall of fortune is uncertain. Don’t forget, if the Lord Hongxi returns to the Island, it could all come to nothing for Li Fan.”

“I wouldn’t be so sure. The Secret Envoy clearly has strong backing. Otherwise, there’s no way he’d be granted authority over an entire region.”

“Isn’t that obvious? How many ordinary cultivators could subdue a Soul Transformation puppet? Even if the Island Lord Hongxi and Ziyun returned, they’d have to treat the Secret Envoy with respect. Fellow Daoist Zhu, I suggest you recognize the situation before provoking the Secret Envoy.”

“Hmph! You may fear him, but I, Zhu Yongshou, do not fear Li Fan!”

Similar conversations echoed throughout Congyun City.

It’s impossible to be liked by everyone. Li Fan was no exception.

However, Li Fan was entirely unconcerned with the opinions of the Congyun Sea cultivators.

At that moment, he began assigning positions to fill vacancies, then reported the personnel appointments to the headquarters of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance for approval.

After a full day’s work, Li Fan finally had a moment of rest.

Thanks to the help of assistants like He Zhenghao and Gao Yuan, managing city affairs was much easier.

Sitting in a specially prepared room within the Administrative Hall, Li Fan closed his eyes slightly, sensing the different degrees of cultivation feedback flowing from his dantian.

A look of mild surprise crossed his face.

“I didn’t expect some of my people to break through so quickly?”

“Most of these individuals came from humble backgrounds in Congyun Sea. Following me for the past six months, they finally attained their dreams, advancing not only within the Immortal Alliance system but also securing substantial positions.”

“Given their excitement, breakthroughs in cultivation are natural.”

“As they say, ‘When one rises, those around them rise as well.’ All of them have received my assistance and favor.”

“This has resulted in feedback cultivation through the ‘Mountain Sitting Technique’.”

“And this feedback…”

Li Fan carefully sensed it, feeling increasingly delighted.

“Though not as potent as the merit gained from teaching a technique, it’s still akin to rebirth.”

“And this path of cultivation is safer and more discreet than spreading techniques. It’s also protected by the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance’s system, legitimizing the process.”

“I may only be a mid-level Secret Envoy, with no strong foundation.”

“But if I were the ruler of a region, with disciples and former aides spread throughout the Alliance…”

“The benefits are unimaginable!”

Li Fan’s eyes sparkled as he realized he’d discovered a promising new cultivation path.

“As long as I hold the Secret Envoy position, I can swiftly advance my cultivation through these hundreds of loyal followers.”

“I can even consider forming a Nascent Soul.”

“The Five Elements Great Cave Heaven…”

Thinking of his initial goal, Li Fan frowned slightly.

This life’s trajectory had far surpassed his expectations, diverging from the events of his past life in many ways.

The battle in Tianling Province that forced the Five Elements Great Cave Heaven to relocate might not happen at all.

However, without a war between the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance and the Five Elders Association, it would be extremely difficult for Li Fan to achieve anything under the radar.

"Training troops for a thousand days, to use them in a single moment."

“It’s time for you to take the stage again, Daoist Zhou Qingang.”

After a moment of contemplation, Li Fan smiled, focusing his attention on Zhou Qingang.

At that moment, Zhou Qingang was surrounded by a group of cultivators.

It was clear to any observer that Zhou Qingang, with his close relationship to He Zhenghao and his favored position with Li Fan, was on the path to rapid advancement.

If one didn’t seize the opportunity to establish good relations with him now, then when?

As a result, numerous cultivators kept visiting and offering gifts.

It took “Zhou Qingang” a good deal of effort to finally extricate himself.

Late at night, he slipped out of Congyun City, heading towards the meeting point.

——

“Administrative Hall, Inspector of Surveillance. Chief, how about this position?”

“It grants significant authority, allowing one to patrol all four corners of the region and deal harshly with any unlawful acts.”

“Far more imposing than merely guarding a small island!”

Zhou Qingang spoke to the stone face on the shattered rock, looking smug.

“And now, all the secrets I couldn’t access before are within easy reach. I’ve truly infiltrated the enemy’s core!”

“Chief?”

“Hm? Why aren’t you responding, Chief?”

Seeing no reaction from his counterpart, “Zhou Qingang” felt something was amiss.

An ominous feeling crept into Li Fan’s heart.

He fell silent as well.

After a long while, the stone face finally spoke, its voice cold and filled with murderous intent.

“You are not Zhou Qingang. Who are you?”

Li Fan’s heart sank.

However, he continued to feign confusion, saying with a hint of surprise, “Chief, what are you talking about? Look at this face of mine—absolutely genuine!”

“How could you doubt me, given my merits for the organization?”

“Those entry test questions for the Immortal Alliance, the classified information on the Union of Xuan-huang…”

Zhou Qingang recounted his accomplishments with an air of grievance.

“So, you replaced him much earlier than I thought…”

“Impressive!”

The stone face showed no signs of being swayed by Li Fan’s arguments. Its tone was as cold as ice.

The previously flustered “Zhou Qingang” suddenly grew calm, as if transformed into someone else, and asked quietly, “Oh? What was my flaw?”

“Hmph!”

The stone face sneered, “Your disguise is flawless, but you overlooked one crucial detail.”

“When Zhou Qingang first accepted the infiltration mission into the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance, he was given a final directive.”

“If he were to secure a significant position within the Alliance, he was to immediately sever all ties with us.”

“To remain entirely hidden, avoiding any contact with us to prevent exposure, until he was needed for a critical operation…”

“So, the fact that you came to contact me right after your appointment proves you are not the real Zhou Qingang.”

The stone face’s voice was low and severe.

Chapter 543: The Desire to Destroy the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance

"Is that so?" Li Fan nodded slightly, his face as calm as still water, but there was a faint tone of regret in his voice. "A minor oversight, not a sin of war."

“Hmph, the fact that you deceived us for so long… truly, quite a skill!” The face on the smooth broken stone appeared and disappeared, indicating a significant inner turmoil.

"I should have noticed something amiss much earlier. For someone as mediocre as Zhou Qingang to achieve so many feats within just a few years..."

"Initially, I was blinded by his abundant successes, thinking he’d somehow defied fate and changed his fortune."

"But in retrospect, a single instance can be chalked up to luck. However, for it to happen time and again, with fortune so overwhelmingly in his favor..."

“Hmph, he’s hardly someone destined by heaven," the face remarked with a hint of remorse, staring intently at Li Fan, searching for any sign of smugness.

But Li Fan’s expression remained completely unchanged, not even the slightest hint of unease after his identity had been repeatedly exposed. This, in turn, left the face on the stone in a state of doubt, and he gradually fell silent.

The undersea ruins grew quiet.

After a moment, unable to contain himself, the face asked in a grave tone, “Who exactly are you?!”

"Entry exams for the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, the events on Ten Thousand Immortal Island the day it was sealed..."

"These are absolute secrets that only someone in a high position within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance could know. For you to betray all of this for a few contribution points..."

“Is it to gain our trust and infiltrate us in reverse?”

After a round of careful deduction, the face concluded that Li Fan was one of their own.

"Relax. I’m no spy from the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance," Li Fan replied calmly. "Quite the opposite, actually; my goals align with yours and those of the Five Elders Association."

“We both seek…”

“To annihilate the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance!”

"What?" Although Li Fan’s tone was light, to the face, it landed like a thunderbolt.

“You…” The face seemed stunned, gazing at Li Fan in disbelief.

A moment later, he regained his composure but was filled with skepticism. "Trying to fool me again, are you?"

Li Fan, ignoring the reaction, continued, “The Immortal Alliance is tyrannical, treating all cultivators like cattle, exploiting them at will. It may appear that the Alliance’s rule is unbreakable and that all beings submit, yet…”

Li Fan’s tone shifted, sharp and proud. “We cultivators walk the path of defiance against heaven. We fear not the heavens, so why would we fear the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance?”

"Among all beings, there will always be those who would rather die than submit, who would prefer death on the battlefield over being herded like livestock!"

"Give me liberty, or give me death!"

…

The conviction in his words was so powerful that even the face on the opposite side couldn’t help but be moved.

At that moment, Li Fan’s tone shifted again. “However, the Alliance is mighty. Acting recklessly without a sound strategy would be akin to suicide.”

“We may not fear death, but neither do we wish to waste our lives meaninglessly without achieving anything.”

“So…” Li Fan cast a meaningful look at the face on the stone.

Hearing this, the face on the stone fell silent, seemingly deep in thought. "So, you’ve set your sights on us, the Five Elders Association?”

Li Fan admitted frankly, “Indeed. Judging by current intelligence, your Five Elders Association isn’t exactly noble either. But, the enemy of my enemy is my friend.”

He continued without hesitation, “Or perhaps, when two tigers fight, one must fall. We’ll let you tear each other apart, fight to the death, and when the dust settles, we’ll emerge to restore the heavens and rebuild the world!”

The face on the stone almost appeared to hear the most absurd thing in the world, too disdainful even to mock, simply scoffing, “So, a bunch of lunatics, then.”

Li Fan didn’t mind, replying earnestly, “When the legendary Immortal Ancestor of Dao Transmission' sought to establish a new order and change the world, the majority of people back then must have also considered him a complete madman.”

“After all, the strict rule of the Ten Great Immortal Sects back then was in no way inferior to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance today.”

“And where are those Ten Great Immortal Sects now?”

“If the Immortal Ancestor could achieve that, who’s to say we, the Heaven-Suppressing Society…”

Seemingly catching himself, Li Fan paused, then corrected, “...who’s to say we couldn’t do the same?”

The face squinted, casting a long look at Li Fan without further comment.

“In a way, you could say we’re natural allies at this point, don’t you think?” Li Fan continued.

“In fact, with our current strategy, we don’t have any plans to oppose your Five Elders Association.”

“We mean no harm, as you can see from the intelligence I provided earlier. If we’d intended to hinder you in secret, we could have easily caused you a substantial loss without you even realizing it.”

"Approaching you through Zhou Qingang’s identity was a necessity. In the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s domain, neither of us could afford to be exposed. If someone had approached you directly, you would’ve thought your cover was blown and vanished immediately.”

"Heh, people like you, I know all too well."

“Speaking of Zhou Qingang, I just remembered. He’s still alive. I could even consider sending him back to you.”

Li Fan spoke fluently, as if reciting a monologue.

However, the face on the stone didn’t look too pleased. “That fool can die on his own.”

After a pause, suppressing his anger, the face asked in a deep voice, “So, you’re telling us all this because you want to cooperate?”

Li Fan chuckled, responding with a question, “Why ask when you already know? Realizing that Zhou Qingang’s cover was blown, you didn’t cut off communications immediately but instead kept chatting for this long. Isn’t it because you’re uncertain of my identity and still interested in the confidential information I might provide?”

“Surely, the spies of the Five Elders Association aren’t this idle?”

The face sneered but did not refute, tacitly acknowledging Li Fan’s words.

"Good, since we’re being forthright, let’s speak plainly. We’ve recently acquired new top-secret information," Li Fan said, watching the face’s reaction.

As expected, the face showed a slight change in color, and a hint of desire flashed in his eyes.

“To him, it doesn’t matter if I’m truly Zhou Qingang or a real agent of the Five Elders Association. What matters is whether I can provide secrets about the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance,” Li Fan thought to himself, as clear as a mirror.

“No spy wants to keep this identity forever. To achieve glorious feats and retire with honor, free from fear, living a peaceful life—that’s their dream.”

“And I… can help him achieve that.”

Chapter 544: Pushing the Bloody Battle with a Single Hand

While his mind was racing, Li Fan didn’t stop speaking.

He said with a solemn expression, “This matter is extremely important. Based on our assessment, its significance surpasses even that of the ‘Tianxuan Spirit Lock’ and the unification prophecy of the ‘Xuan-huang.’”

He paused, glancing at the stony face of his counterpart, whose composure had clearly been shaken. Li Fan smiled subtly and continued, “If we let the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance complete this unchallenged, it could completely tip the power balance between your Five Elders Association and the Immortal Alliance.”

“The strength between the Five Elders Association and the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance has always been on par. However, because of the presence of the Immortal Ancestor, the Immortal Alliance has had a slight upper hand. If the Immortal Alliance's power were to increase further, the Five Elders Association might forever remain underfoot, unable to regain ground.”

“This is something we don’t want to see,” Li Fan stated frankly.

“That’s why I’m here to find you so urgently. I understand that frequent communication from a spy to superiors may raise suspicion. However, the situation is pressing, and I had no choice but to reach out this way.” He sighed, shaking his head.

“Is this true?” The face in the stone grew even more serious. He didn’t believe Li Fan would deceive him on such a matter; surely, he must have some solid evidence.

But more important than the prophecy of ‘Xuan-huang’?

That was difficult to believe. Since he was the first to report the prophecy within their organization, the Five Elders Association had been taking significant action.

His superiors had also treated him more kindly, even promising that if he could perform a similar deed again, he could retire honorably from the front lines, redeem his soul contract, and become a “free cultivator”—the most enviable status among the Five Elders Association.

...

This illustrated the depth of the secrets tied to the unification prophecy. Yet now, this mysterious cultivator, hiding behind the guise of Zhou Qingang, claimed to know of something even more critical?

His heart pounded wildly, an unfamiliar sensation.

Could this be his chance to change his destiny?

“What is it?” he asked impatiently.

Li Fan held up one finger. “The usual price—ten million contribution points.”

Before the stone face could reply, Li Fan explained, “The development of any organization requires ample funding.”

“Though we too wish to prevent the Ten Thousand Immortals from becoming dominant, and you from losing your power balance, our first priority is to ensure our own survival and growth.”

“Don’t think it’s too much. Since you were willing to pay ten million contribution points last time…”

“Believe me, this time it’s worth it.”

Li Fan looked at the stone face earnestly. “Go on and request it from your superiors. I’ll wait here for your answer.”

After hesitating briefly, the face vanished from the stone.

Li Fan stood still, closed his eyes, and waited.

About the time it would take to burn an incense stick later, the face reappeared. “They approved it. How will we proceed with the transaction?”

Li Fan opened his eyes. “Soon, Li Fan, the Secret Envoy of Congyun Sea, will relaunch the contribution collection.”

“All you need to do is transfer the ten million contribution points to He Zhenghao, who will be in charge of the collection, within three months.”

“Hm… let’s use the alias Han Wuyou,” Li Fan suggested.

“Wuyou?” The face reacted with surprise, shaking his head quickly. “Better use a different name. That one is a bit… sensitive.”

Li Fan fell silent for a moment.

“Alright, let’s go with Liu Yihang,” he said.

“That’ll do. Now, about what you mentioned earlier…”

Before the face could finish, Li Fan interrupted.

“There’s no time to waste. Since you've agreed, I can tell you now.”

“But if you plan to renege on this over a mere ten million contribution points…” Li Fan chuckled darkly, “then we’ll know we misjudged you. The Five Elders Association isn’t fit to contend with the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.”

“Consider this piece of information a free gift from us.”

“I trust you’ll make the right choice.”

Li Fan pressed his hands on the smooth stone and transmitted the carefully crafted information through secret arts.

“There are four more hidden cave heaven, beyond the Wood Elemental Cave Heaven?”

“They form a Five Elements formation, and each cave heaven is filled with abundant resources, resembling a complete new world?!” The face exclaimed in astonishment after a moment.

“Remember, within three months, ten million contribution points.” Li Fan reminded him in a timely manner, snapping the face out of his shocked state.

Without waiting for a response, Li Fan slammed his hand down, shattering the stone into dust.

Then, he thoroughly destroyed the underwater ruins, erasing all traces, before swaggering back to Congyun City.

Meanwhile, back in the administration hall, Li Fan’s true self stood up.

“If nothing goes wrong, the Five Elders Association will certainly not sit idle now that they know of the Five Elements Cave-Heaven’ existence.”

“Most likely, as in my past life, they’ll send Dao Integration cultivators to launch a raid on the Five Elements Cave Heaven.”

“The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance will likely respond fiercely, setting the stage for a massive battle.”

“I remember that in my previous life, the battle was brutal once it reached a deadlock. Every state’s Nascent Soul cultivators were pulled to the battlefield in Tianling State.”

“The death toll of cultivators was staggering. Though I officially have only a Golden Core cultivation, I did manage to kill several Nascent Soul cultivators. Given my true combat strength, it’s quite likely I’d be drafted.”

“The Tianling State battlefield… it’s best to keep my distance.”

With that in mind, Li Fan immediately summoned Gao Yuan and He Zhenghao and announced two things.

First, he claimed he felt an enormous, rare opportunity approaching. As the ruler of Congyun Sea, he was committed to ensuring the prosperity of all its cultivators, so he decided to relaunch the contribution collection plan.

This time, the upper limit of fundraising would be…

One hundred million.

Upon hearing this, He Zhenghao’s eyes widened in shock, frozen for a long moment.

Meanwhile, Gao Yuan looked at Li Fan with a fervent gaze.

Before they could regain composure, Li Fan announced the second matter.

The upcoming contribution collection was critical and had to be handled flawlessly.

So, effective immediately, he would enter deep seclusion.

All channels of communication would be closed to prevent any disturbances.

He would not emerge until everything was ready.

“This…” Hearing these seemingly contradictory orders, Gao Yuan and He Zhenghao frowned slightly, puzzled.

However, Gao Yuan reacted quickly and bowed. “As you command, my lord.”

“You can trust us—we won’t let you down!”

Chapter 545: Gao Yuan’s Insight

[TL: Hey guys sorry about the wrong chapters uploaded, this is the correct one after 544, I've deleted the chapters for now, sorry for the late update]

Chapter 545: Gao Yuan’s Insight

He Zhenghao glanced at Gao Yuan briefly, then quickly expressed his loyalty to Li Fan.

Li Fan was noncommittal. He simply took out two small metallic figurines, somewhat resembling himself, from his storage ring and handed one to each of them.

“These are Divine Spirit Jade Slip. Each contains a fragment of my divine consciousness, similar to a partial clone.”

“While I am in seclusion, I will sever all contact with the outside world. If there’s ever an urgent situation, you may use this to reach me.”

Li Fan’s tone was calm as he spoke.

Gao Yuan and He Zhenghao carefully put the metallic figurines away, feeling both honored and slightly overwhelmed.

The Divine Spirit Jade Slip was not unfamiliar to them. Cultivators usually entrusted such artifacts only to the closest and most trusted of disciples, using it as a personal tool for teaching and guidance.

For Lord Envoy to entrust us with something so significant—it truly shows his complete trust in us!

Feeling deeply moved, Gao Yuan and He Zhenghao bowed in gratitude once again.

“You may go,” Li Fan said expressionlessly with a slight nod, effectively dismissing them.

---

In the Bureau of Administration’s council chamber, He Zhenghao was organizing the list of relevant cultivators.

Since Li Fan suddenly announced the temporary suspension of the contribution-gathering initiative, many cultivators who had hesitated and chosen to wait on the sidelines were filled with regret.

After all, Li Fan’s funding initiative had already run for several phases. Each time, the contributions were returned with interest as scheduled, and sometimes even early. The feared scenario of Li Fan taking the funds and disappearing had never occurred.

These previously doubtful cultivators had gradually started to trust Li Fan, especially now that they had heard he’d been appointed Acting Island Lord of the Immortal Alliance.

The responsibility for handling the contributions rested with He Zhenghao, which led cultivators of all types to approach him with small tokens of goodwill, requesting that if Li Fan resumed the initiative, he would prioritize them.

If even the observers were acting this way, then it was no surprise that those who had reaped benefits in the earlier rounds had long since spoken to He Zhenghao.

“Initially, I was worried that there’d be too many people and I wouldn’t be able to manage it all. But now, with a 100 million contribution points, there’s plenty for everyone.” He Zhenghao grinned as he listed names and began sending out messages.

“Fellow Daoist, the matter you asked about has come to fruition! I’ve received reliable information…”

While He Zhenghao was full of excitement, Gao Yuan, on the other hand, appeared somewhat perplexed.

He tapped his fingers on the table, eyes half-closed, seemingly lost in thought.

After a while, as He Zhenghao finished his task and stretched to relieve his fatigue, he finally noticed Gao Yuan’s odd demeanor.

“Brother Gao, is something on your mind?” he asked, slightly puzzled.

“I’m pondering the significance behind the two tasks the Lord Envoy assigned us,” Gao Yuan said, his expression serious.

“Significance? Wasn’t it all quite clear…” He Zhenghao initially laughed, dismissing it as Gao Yuan overthinking. But then, he paused.

Looking around, he leaned in and whispered, “Brother, what’s your insight?”

Gao Yuan’s tone grew thoughtful. “The Lord Envoy always plans thoroughly before acting and does nothing without purpose.”

“Yet these two tasks he gave us feel a bit peculiar.”

He Zhenghao was baffled. “Peculiar? How so?”

“Fellow Daoist, would you say that a 100 million contribution points is a lot?” Gao Yuan didn’t answer directly but asked in return.

“Of course, it’s a fortune,” He Zhenghao replied, taken aback by the seemingly obvious question.

Gao Yuan chuckled. “A 100 million contribution points is indeed an astronomical amount for most.”

“But…”

“Do you recall, when the Lord Envoy mentioned the sum of ‘a 100 million,’ did his tone or expression show any reaction?”

He Zhenghao was momentarily stunned.

After frowning in contemplation, he eventually shook his head.

Gao Yuan continued, his voice calm and deliberate. “Exactly. He spoke of it as if it were no more than a routine matter, like eating or drinking. He merely mentioned it in passing without much emphasis.”

“Yet he repeatedly reminded us of his upcoming seclusion and how he would sever all contact with the outside world.”

“Would a mere 100 million contribution points warrant such solemnity from him?”

He Zhenghao was about to refute, but after some thought and recollecting Li Fan’s dismissive attitude toward wealth, he began to waver.

Upon further reflection, He Zhenghao nodded slowly, “It does seem odd. During my first meeting with him, he demonstrated his incredible ability to amass wealth.”

“In less than seven days, he’d doubled the contributions. With such skill, I doubt a 100 million contribution points would be of much significance to him.”

Gao Yuan nodded heavily. “Exactly. Even back when he was just an independent cultivator, he probably didn’t value a 100 million points all that highly.”

“Not to mention that now he is essentially the ruler of the Congyun Sea territory.”

“I’ve never heard of a regional leader going into deep seclusion over a mere 100 million contribution points.”

“So his claim that ‘the matter is critical and requires meticulous preparation’ is nothing but an excuse!”

Gao Yuan’s eyes flashed, his tone resolute.

He Zhenghao pondered this for a moment before nodding in agreement.

“But then, what is his true purpose? The city has just been restored, and much needs to be done. Why would he choose this moment to go into seclusion?” he asked in confusion.

Gao Yuan, brimming with confidence, replied, “In my view, this is the Lord Envoy’s way of testing us.”

“Testing us?” He Zhenghao was baffled.

“Precisely,” Gao Yuan said with certainty.

“You know I’m known for my ability to read people. I can understand someone’s character and temperament after only a brief interaction.”

“As for the Lord Envoy…”

“I wouldn’t claim to fully understand him, but one thing is beyond doubt.”

Lowering his voice, Gao Yuan continued, “He is inherently free-spirited and would never submit to the constraints of mundane affairs.”

Chapter 546: Mistakenly Regarded as a Heavenly Sovereign

"Unlike us ordinary folks, the lord surely has far grander ambitions," Gao Yuan said slowly, his tone pensive.

"What we crave—those official positions in the Immortal Alliance—he may not even care about," he continued. "Even though he hides it well, you can tell when someone is truly enamored with power."

He Zhenghao listened intently, his expression serious as he nodded in agreement.

"From what I know, Lord Envoy was actually forced to accept the position as acting lord of Ten Thousand Immortal Island. His mission to rebuild the Immortal City was, in fact, a task thrust upon him," Gao Yuan unexpectedly revealed.

He Zhenghao looked stunned, his eyes wide with surprise. "Is that really the case?"

Gao Yuan nodded. "I’m not sure of the underlying complexities, but thankfully, Lord Envoy managed to complete the task."

"He even changed the fates of many of us along the way."

"Currently, he serves as the 'Secret Envoy,' governing the affairs of the Congyun Sea region. But I suspect he has little interest in directly managing things," Gao Yuan speculated.

"I also believe that, given his remarkable talent, it would be a true waste for him to spend time on mundane tasks."

"He has a much larger stage to shine on. As for the minor affairs, naturally, there are others to handle those."

"What he needs," Gao Yuan analyzed carefully, "are people who can keep things running smoothly in his absence, without him having to worry."

"The two tasks he assigned us this time—these are tests," he continued. "And that 'Divine Spirit jade Slip'—that’s a trap."

"If we lose control of the situation and need to consult him…"

"Perhaps our positions wouldn’t change, but in his heart, we’d certainly be branded as incompetent," Gao Yuan said gravely.

He Zhenghao was startled. "Is it really that bad?"

Gao Yuan gave a cold hum. "Haven’t you ever noticed the way he looks at us?"

"His gaze? What about it?" He Zhenghao asked, puzzled, eagerly seeking clarification.

"Though he appears friendly, sometimes even humble… beneath the surface…" Gao Yuan’s eyes showed a hint of fear.

"Deep down in his eyes, the way he looks at all of us is the same."

"It’s like how we cultivators view ordinary mortals… no, that’s not quite right," Gao Yuan shook his head, frowning as he searched for the right words.

After a pause, he pointed to the tables and chairs in the council chamber and spoke in a low tone. "That’s it. In his eyes, all of us are like these—mere tools."

"It’s as if we’re not even on the same level of existence. To him, we are likely nothing but tools."

"Back when I was on guard duty outside the Provincial Affairs Hall, I had the chance to see a Dao Integration cultivator. But even that Dao Integration Immortal Sage didn’t look at me with such detachment."

"I’ve heard that the lord hails from the ancient Heavenly Mechanism Sect and was forced into deep slumber due to certain events, causing his cultivation to fall to the Golden Core stage."

"There are even rumors of him slaying several Nascent Soul cultivators at the Golden Core stage," Gao Yuan murmured, his voice growing softer, a glimmer of fear flickering in his eyes.

He Zhenghao shuddered slightly, sensing the underlying implication in Gao Yuan’s words.

Gao Yuan suspected that in ancient times, Li Fan might have been a cultivator at the Longevity Immortal stage.

It’s well known that reaching the Longevity Immortal stage marks a genuine transcendence. The very essence of life changes, setting these cultivators apart from those at the Dao Integration, Soul Transformation, or Nascent Soul stages.

Only those at the Longevity Immortal stage could view all beings with such detachment.

When combining this notion with Li Fan’s countless legendary feats, everything suddenly seemed to make sense.

Many cultivators are adept at the art of divination, but none have used it like Li Fan, turning it into a tool for fortune-building, effortlessly doubling his wealth.

If the art of divination were truly so miraculous, every cultivator would be clamoring to learn it.

For thousands of years, the art of divination has remained tepid, for a reason.

Only a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign, one who has mastered divination to its pinnacle, could so easily see through the future.

Rumors in the Congyun Sea whispered that the sudden lockdown of Ten Thousand Immortal Island and the Five Elders’ assault to seize the entire island was all due to a prophecy.

Although everyone credited this prophecy to the famed Gong Sun Qixuan, some privately believed that he was, in fact, influenced by Li Fan’s divination.

If Li Fan were indeed a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign, then his feats—slaying Nascent Souls at the Golden Core stage, and even possessing a Soul Transformation puppet as his mount—would all be unremarkable.

If he couldn’t achieve such things, could he truly be called a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign?

...

Within the council chamber of the Administration Hall, an eerie silence fell.

An odd tension brewed between He Zhenghao and Gao Yuan.

The more they thought about it, the more they felt their speculation was reasonable and well-founded.

Their bodies began to tremble slightly.

Firstly, from their natural awe of a Longevity-stage powerhouse.

Secondly, because…

Being considered a close confidant by a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign, even if only temporarily and in appearance… is a tremendous honor.

As their minds swirled with thoughts, they both silently pondered for a long time.

Finally, He Zhenghao broke the silence.

Clearing his throat, he spoke softly, "Brother Gao, this matter is all just your speculation."

"It’s best not to mention it to outsiders lightly."

"Let it be known only to you and me."

Gao Yuan glanced at He Zhenghao, nodding slightly. "Of course, I am well aware."

They exchanged a meaningful smile, everything understood without a word.

There was an unspoken thought between them.

If Li Fan truly were a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign, then serving him now…

Once he fully recovers his strength…

Their stage would no longer be confined to the small realm of Congyun Sea.

He Zhenghao also recalled his former wife, and a long-extinguished flame of ambition subtly reignited in his eyes.

—

Deep within the Administration Hall, Li Fan refocused his attention and summoned a water mirror.

Stroking his chin, he examined his reflection in the mirror.

"An indifferent gaze…"

He stared blankly into his own eyes.

Chapter 547: A Genuine Weakness

Li Fan couldn't remember how long it had been since he last truly looked at himself.

The image of himself that lingered in his mind was still that of a slender scholar in his twenties.

After all, regardless of how his appearance aged, whenever he activated [Truth], he would revert to his original look at the anchor point he had chosen.

Thus, for Li Fan, aging was merely an illusion.

The common fears of all living beings—aging, illness, and death—were merely temporary states that he could escape at any moment.

Even the changes occurring in his own body were something he viewed with a certain indifference.

If he didn’t care much about the transformations within himself, then the vast populations of the Xuanhuang Realm mattered even less.

Kou Hong, Dao Xuanzhi, He Zhenghao, Zhang Zhiliang, Xiao Heng...

These people, in each cycle of reincarnation, had their fates altered by Li Fan's actions.

A mortal enemy in one life might become a close friend, sharing drinks with him in the next. In yet another life, they might become his loyal followers.

And in the future?

Perhaps they would become mere collateral, innocent souls lost in one of Li Fan’s battles.

Yet...

No matter their fate, whenever Li Fan activated [Truth], their "state" would reset to the anchor point Li Fan had selected.

So, for them, were these lifetimes just illusions?

People often mock the extremely selfish by saying, "The world doesn’t revolve around you. Why should others cater to your whims?"

But for Li Fan, at least within the Xuanhuang Realm, the world did revolve around him.

With a single thought, the world could reset.

All past events would vanish like smoke.

In such circumstances, how could Li Fan possibly regard the people of this world as equals?

Even if it was the artifact [Truth] that allowed him to do this, Li Fan, with his power over time, could not treat the beings of the Xuanhuang Realm as his "equals."

Li Fan scrutinized his reflection for a long time, but he didn’t notice the "indifference" that Gao Yuan had mentioned.

This perhaps suggested that even Li Fan himself was unaware of some subtle changes taking place within him.

Just like how his *psychological age* continued to grow with each use of [Truth].

Li Fan wasn’t as unchanged as he thought.

[Truth] could reverse time, but as the vessel of [Truth], Li Fan had gained a unique ability—to retain "change" even within this reversed timeline.

"I thought my acting was flawless..." Li Fan chuckled to himself.

He closed his eyes briefly, and when he opened them again, his gaze seemed subtly different.

It looked more lively and vibrant, as if he now held a newfound love for everything around him.

After adjusting for a long while, Li Fan finally stopped.

"For now, I’ve covered it up."

"But acting is still just acting. No matter how convincing, it’s never real."

"This world has many individuals with unimaginable abilities. Even a regular guard in Congyun Sea can have such keen insight."

"To deceive everyone in the world—it seems that’s still beyond my reach."

"But it doesn’t matter; it’s just a minor flaw."

"There are plenty of 'cold-hearted' people in the world, after all."

This small episode didn’t weigh heavily on Li Fan's mind; he made a minor adjustment and moved on.

Moreover, Gao Yuan and the others speculating that he was a fallen Longevity Immortal Sovereign made him feel both amused and helpless.

"In truth, I have no hidden intentions. I just wanted an excuse to avoid the impending great battle on Tianling Prefecture."

Alone, Li Fan quietly left Ten Thousand Immortals Island and dove into the ocean’s depths.

He continued descending tens of thousands of meters into the trench, ensuring he wasn’t being followed.

Only then did he activate the [Mysterious True Spirit Transformation] to return to his original appearance.

He buried all the items he had acquired from the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance under his guise as an "ancient cultivator from the Heavenly Mechanism Sect," concealing them with [Sky-Shrouding Hand].

Then, stripped bare, Li Fan transformed his attire and resurfaced.

He borrowed some suitable clothes from a nearby mortal island and then headed straight for the island where the people from the [Empire] were located.

Before long, he reached his destination.

He hadn’t concealed his aura, so as he approached, the Empire’s Imperial Saint Master, a green luan who once accompanied Xu Ke, sent him a warning via divine sense.

"What business do you have here, fellow cultivator?"

Li Fan stopped mid-air, smiled slightly, and responded with a single word: "Federation."

Soon after, the green luan, Xiao Qing, personally came to welcome him.

She carefully observed Li Fan before leading him to a secret room on the island.

Li Chenfeng was apparently not on the island; it was unknown where he had gone.

Even the soul-locking ability of the Formless Killing Intent was temporarily inactive.

Li Fan replayed a scene recorded by his Dao Deviation Stone, discovering that Li Chenfeng had left the Xuanhuang Realm.

But the departure point differed from the place where he had returned to the Empire before.

"Not the Empire, but another small world?"

This thought crossed Li Fan's mind, but he said nothing, merely noting it.

"So, you are also from the Federation of all World's?" Xiao Qing asked directly.

"Correct. I was sent by our lord to inform you that, unfortunately, our collaboration must be temporarily halted," Li Fan replied calmly.

"What?!" Even with over a thousand years of experience, Xiao Qing was taken aback, staring at Li Fan with her phoenix eyes.

"What does this mean?"

She scrutinized Li Fan with suspicion, her eyes narrowing. "Are you truly from the Federation?"

She was already beginning to doubt Li Fan’s identity.

The killing intent in the air began to grow, but Li Fan raised his hand to indicate that she needn’t worry.

He explained, "It’s not that the Federation Of All World's intends to break our promise; there are unavoidable circumstances."

"We’re not only cutting off contact with your [Empire] but also with all other small worlds."

"Our higher-ups have instructed us to lie low for a while and wait until the situation calms down."

Xiao Qing's furrowed brows remained tense, and as she was about to respond, Li Fan added, "I understand you’re eager to leave the Xuanhuang Realm."

"But the situation truly is complex; we have no choice."

"After all, we also gained a great deal from our last exchange. We’re just as eager to complete the remaining part of our deal."

Chapter 548: Doubts Reveal Heaven’s Secrets

Chapter 548: Doubts Reveal Heaven's Secrets

"Ha ha, that Beast Soul Bead you provided last time was truly useful."

"Especially the one that sealed the remnant spirit of the 'Red Nine-Head'. It's extraordinary. That guy Lan Yuchang was originally just a slightly stronger mortal who knew some martial arts."

"But after absorbing it, his combat power skyrocketed. Even our ordinary Soul Transformation cultivators aren't his match in sparring."

"According to Lan Yuchang, he was still holding back."

"If he were to fight with all his strength… tsk tsk…"

Li Fan spoke without restraint, completely unguarded and talking endlessly.

Upon hearing the name 'Red Nine-Head', Xiao Qing's expression changed slightly.

Then, when she heard Li Fan say that someone had managed to withstand the overwhelming hostility of the nine-headed bird and successfully absorbed the Beast Soul Bead, she trembled and blurted out, "Impossible! How could a mere mortal endure that beast's vicious aura…?"

Li Fan immediately showed a look of disdain. "You're ignorant. Our Federation Of All World's has no shortage of talents. We have all sorts of extraordinary individuals."

"Just because your empire couldn’t find a suitable candidate doesn’t mean we can't."

"Do you really think that trading with us once puts you on our level?"

Li Fan, seemingly inexperienced and reckless, spoke whatever was on his mind, without a hint of subtlety.

He sneered, "Federation of All World's only trades with you to help you."

"There are countless small worlds around the Xuanhuang Realm, so one less of you makes no difference."

"You’re the one who needs the Federation of All World's, not the other way around."

…

Hearing Li Fan’s unbearably harsh words, Xiao Qing's face turned exceedingly dark.

But in the end, she held back and didn’t lash out.

Li Fan continued his rambling, but noticing her lack of response, he grew a bit embarrassed and eventually stopped.

Xiao Qing now looked at Li Fan with a hint of displeasure.

After this episode, however, she no longer doubted Li Fan’s identity.

Returning to the previous topic, she asked softly, "Since we all agree that our transactions are mutually beneficial, why did you decide to suddenly halt them?"

Li Fan sighed and spoke truthfully, "We encountered some insurmountable factors."

He leaned in closer and whispered, "According to our intelligence, a major war is likely to break out soon between the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association."

"As you know, the period leading up to a war is often the tensest for both sides."

"As the saying goes, 'settle internal issues before external ones.' If the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance discovered any traces of our Federation Of All World's, they might prioritize eradicating us as a threat before engaging the Five Elders Association."

Li Fan shook his head, unabashed. "To be fair, while we’ve always proclaimed the slogan of counterattacking the Immortal Cultivation Realm, the truth is our organization’s strength is still lacking compared to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association. We can’t deny that."

"We need more time to build our power, so we have to avoid direct confrontation for now."

Suddenly, Li Fan's face lit up with excitement, "Besides, this is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity. It’s been ages since the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association clashed on such a scale."

"This battle is bound to be unprecedentedly fierce and chaotic. While they fight like dogs, we’ll lurk in the shadows, taking advantage of the situation."

"Who knows, we might even gain something from this mess, a bit of profit on the side."

Xiao Qing watched Li Fan's smug expression, feeling doubtful about his talk of an "impending war."

The empire also had its intelligence sources.

In recent years, although few, outlaws had spread across the Xuanhuang Realm.

During her recent return to the Immortal Cultivation Realm, Xiao Qing had established contact with most of them.

Thanks to their presence, Xiao Qing actually had some understanding of the current situation in the Xuanhuang Realm.

A great wind always starts from a gentle breeze.

The outbreak of war must have some cause, right?

If the coming war is truly as catastrophic as he says, there should already be signs of it by now.

"Perhaps they’ve overlooked some details…"

As Xiao Qing fell into contemplation, Li Fan didn’t care at all about her thoughts.

Instead, he thick-skinnedly started asking her for a Beast Soul Bead.

"Ah, the brothers back home are all quite envious. They asked me to bring back some souvenirs."

"Master Qing, Saint Master Qing."

"Anyway, these things are abundant in your empire, so just give me a few to bring back. That way, I can report back."

Seeing his cheeky smile, Xiao Qing nearly laughed in exasperation.

But dealing with someone like him wasn’t worth getting upset over.

With that thought, she took out two Beast Soul Bead equivalent to the power of Golden Core-stage cultivators and handed them over.

Yet he was still unsatisfied, shamelessly asking for even more.

This time, Xiao Qing had enough and immediately issued an order for him to leave.

"I really don’t have any more Beast Soul Bead with me, so please go, Daoist Friend!"

Li Fan's expression changed quickly.

Moments ago, he was all "Master Qing," but upon hearing her refusal, his face instantly darkened.

With a cold huff, he flew off without a word of farewell.

"How could someone like him even be in the Federation of All World's?"

"If he were in our empire, he’d have been fed to the Rift Whale by now!"

Xiao Qing gritted her teeth in frustration.

"That previous Daoist Friend was much better."

She recalled the earlier transaction, where both sides were highly satisfied.

The subsequent exchanges of resources also went smoothly.

"Too bad, he’s likely busy and unable to come," Xiao Qing thought with regret.

She collected her thoughts and began contacting the empire’s covert agents to inquire if there were any recent unusual activities in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Any signs of impending war?

Soon, responses came pouring in from her outlaws.

Everything was as usual; there was no word of any upcoming war.

Now, it was Xiao Qing’s turn to feel uncertain.

"Is it true or not?"

---

Meanwhile, He Zhenghao was busy counting money until his hands cramped.

Grinning from ear to ear, he recorded each contribution he received and promptly replied to the creditors.

"Rest assured, Daoist Qin, your contribution has been received. You just wait to get rich!"

"Wei, little brother, I’ve recorded your ten thousand contributions. Ah, I know it’s everything you own. Who isn’t in the same boat? Just relax. The Lord Envoy wouldn’t shortchange you!"

Chapter 549: The Investment Genius

The pace of contributions for this funding round was far faster than He Zhenghao had anticipated.

When he hinted to the cultivators of Congyun Sea that Li Fan would soon restart the funding campaign, they, eager to seize this rare opportunity to profit, rushed to transfer their contributions to He Zhenghao without hesitation.

He Zhenghao was swamped, feeling both the strain and the thrill.

In less than seven days, half of the target was already achieved, with nearly 53 million contribution points collected.

Handling such a large volume of contributions brought about a subtle shift in He Zhenghao's mindset.

"Ah, what kind of life was I living before I met the Lord Envoy?"

"For the sake of a mere two or three hundred thousand contribution points, I used to scrimp and save, living every day in fear."

"How stifling!"

Reflecting on the past, He Zhenghao couldn’t help but shake his head and sigh.

"Fortunately, those hard days are gone for good!"

Looking at the ever-rising numbers on the statistics board, He Zhenghao felt an uncontrollable surge of excitement.

If everything went as planned, when this round of fundraising concluded, the Lord Envoy would likely, as he had in previous times, allocate a small share of the profits to him...

Even if it was just one percent…

No, even one-third of one percent would make He Zhenghao more than content.

After all, with the Lord Envoy's abilities, making a profit equivalent to the principal was no great challenge.

By that calculation, he would at least receive a reward of 300,000 contribution points…

Thinking of this, He Zhenghao couldn't help but grin foolishly.

After a while, he finally snapped back to reality from his daydreams.

He prepared to transfer the contributions to the Lord Envoy.

But then, something unexpected happened.

The Tianxuan Mirror notified him that it could not locate the recipient, and the transfer failed.

Large beads of sweat instantly dripped from He Zhenghao's forehead.

This situation only had two possible explanations.

One, he had entered the wrong recipient, and the target person didn’t exist.

Two, the other party had temporarily suspended all functionality and permissions on their Tianxuan Mirror.

He Zhenghao quickly realized what the issue was.

The first explanation was obviously impossible. The Lord Envoy was an honored member of the Immortal Alliance, overseeing an entire region.

So…

Recalling how Li Fan had hinted before that he would be entering deep seclusion and was not to be disturbed by anyone, he also remembered the backup Jade Slip he had left him, to be used in emergencies.

"Damn it!" He Zhenghao slapped his thigh in frustration.

"It seems that this is indeed, as Gao Yuan suggested, a test from the Lord Envoy."

Looking at the astronomical figure in his account, He Zhenghao's face turned pale.

What had once seemed like an incredibly promising contribution amount now felt like a death sentence.

"This is bad… very bad. While my investment skills are indeed exceptional, it depends on the situation!"

"I can handle a few thousand or even tens of thousands of contribution points."

"But handling over a hundred million—how could I dare manage that?"

"If, by sheer luck, I make a profit, that would be fine, but if I incur a loss, wouldn’t I have to cover it myself?"

The more He Zhenghao thought about it, the more frightened he became.

He knew very well that the cultivators who had come to him so eagerly, calling him "Daoist He" or "Brother He," were only friendly because they hoped to make money.

If these cultivators, who had scraped together all their contribution points for this funding campaign, suffered losses, they would be the first to tear him apart.

A wave of dizziness hit him, his legs went weak, and he almost collapsed to the ground.

At that moment, a fleeting thought crossed his mind—to flee with the funds.

But fortunately, he managed to regain his composure.

Shaking his head to dispel this self-destructive idea, He Zhenghao steeled himself and urgently sought out Gao Yuan.

When Gao Yuan heard the news, his expression also turned serious.

However, instead of giving advice immediately, he habitually tapped his finger on the table, sinking into deep thought.

He Zhenghao didn’t dare interrupt, waiting anxiously on the side.

After a while, Gao Yuan's frown relaxed, and the cloud lifted from his face.

He reassured He Zhenghao, saying, "Daoist He, you need not act rashly. Just wait patiently for the Lord Envoy's instructions."

He Zhenghao was surprised. "Brother Gao, what do you mean?"

Gao Yuan smiled confidently. "Who do you think the Lord Envoy is?"

"Although he might not particularly care about a billion contribution points, even I know that a sum this large is beyond the control of ordinary people."

"While you’re renowned, it’s clear that even you aren’t certain of turning a profit with this."

He Zhenghao nodded in agreement.

Gao Yuan continued, "Exactly. Since we both understand this, how could the Lord Envoy not know?"

"Remember the talisman he left with us? The Lord Envoy mentioned that we could use it to contact him."

"But conversely, as a talisman carrying a trace of his consciousness, he could also use it to contact us."

He Zhenghao suddenly understood.

"The decision on how to handle this billion in contributions—surely the Lord Envoy has a plan in mind. Daoist He, just complete the fundraising and await his command."

"Remember, as subordinates, the greatest mistake we can make is acting on our own or being overly clever," Gao Yuan advised.

"You were wise to come to me for advice instead of panicking and using the talisman to report to the Lord Envoy."

"Otherwise, you might have failed this test." Gao Yuan’s words were earnest.

He Zhenghao thought it over and took a deep breath, standing up and bowing to Gao Yuan.

"Thank you, Brother Gao, for saving me. If there’s ever anything you need from me, just say the word!"

"Heh, Daoist He, you're too kind. Working under the Lord Envoy, we need to support each other," Gao Yuan replied graciously.

With Gao Yuan's guidance, He Zhenghao finally felt reassured.

He hurried back to continue with the fundraising campaign.

Watching He Zhenghao's departing figure, Gao Yuan’s gaze turned unreadable.

The reason he kept pulling He Zhenghao closer was because he had noticed that the Lord Envoy regarded him with a special status.

Though both of them were mere "tools," there was no doubt that tools could still have varying levels of favor.

Tools that fit well were often reused.

And He Zhenghao seemed to be one of those favored tools.

Chapter 550: Accumulate and Dwell in Unusualness

Shifting focus from Gao Yuan's subtle scheming and insight into human nature, the story returns to He Zhenghao.

In a state of unease, he took about ten more days to finally complete the collection of 100 million contribution points.

Afterward, he followed Gao Yuan's instructions closely, quietly awaiting Li Fan's next orders.

This period of waiting was indeed challenging.

Even though Gao Yuan’s reasoning sounded plausible, it was still just his personal conjecture.

As for what the Lord Envoy himself was thinking…

Who could say with any certainty?

Perhaps the Lord Envoy was even considering entrusting He Zhenghao to manage that hundred million contribution points?

On the surface, He Zhenghao appeared calm, but his mind was racing, filled with an overwhelming sense of apprehension.

He felt as if he were a prisoner awaiting execution, enduring the agonizing passage of time as he awaited his fate.

This was a vivid taste of what ancient cultivators described as "demonic heart invasion."

Fortunately, He Zhenghao’s luck seemed to hold.

Just when he felt he was reaching his limit, a peculiar vibration came from his storage ring.

Overjoyed, he quickly composed himself, then eagerly took out the small metal figurine.

“Sir, do you have orders for me?” He asked respectfully, placing the figurine on the table.

“You’re to use the collected hundred million contribution points to purchase the items on this list,” Li Fan's voice issued from the metal statue.

“There’s no need to buy everything from the Tianxuan Mirror. You may prioritize items of slightly lower quality if they come at a more affordable price.”

“A short time from now, when these items' prices go up, sell them off.”

After giving these instructions, Li Fan’s voice gradually faded.

He Zhenghao was left stunned, his mind a blank as if thunderstruck.

“Gao Yuan was wrong!”

“This time, the Lord Envoy really intends for me to manage the 100 million contribution points!”

After a brief moment of pause, He Zhenghao gradually recovered.

But this time, instead of fear and helplessness, he felt an inexplicable sense of excitement and fervor.

He knew he couldn’t accomplish this on his own, but with the Lord Envoy’s guidance, none of that mattered!

When it came down to it, investing was quite simple.

It was all just a matter of having insider information.

As long as you knew what others didn’t, even a pig could make a fortune by just sitting on it!

He Zhenghao’s hands trembled slightly as he eagerly reviewed the list Li Fan provided.

"Sky Recovery Pills, Violent Burst Powder, Berserker Killing Pills…”

“Standardized Tiangang Armor, Divine Thunder Weapons…”

“Hundred Battle Formation Diagram…”

The more He Zhenghao read, the deeper his frown grew, his face etched with confusion.

It was nothing like what he had expected.

Initially, he had thought Li Fan would instruct him to purchase rare minerals, spiritual woods, medicinal herbs, and other raw materials.

With the Tianxuan Mirror's comprehensive view, the price fluctuations for such items would be fairly moderate, typically within twenty percent.

Even if he bought at a peak price, he could simply hold onto them and wait for the next price hike.

He would, at worst, lose a small fee when selling them.

If he reached a high enough merit level, even these transaction fees would be negligible.

But this time, the items on Li Fan’s list were all finished products.

And they were all combat-related goods like pills, magical weapons, and formation diagrams.

Pills were understandable, as cultivators often carried them when exploring ancient sect ruins to be prepared for unforeseen dangers.

But items like Tiangang Armor and Divine Thunder Weapons—unless one was in life-or-death combat, most cultivators wouldn’t need them.

Not to mention the formation diagrams.

He Zhenghao searched for market data on these items and found only sparse records of their transactions.

Their prices were stable and seldom fluctuated, with a large stockpile available since they were mass-produced.

Would the prices of these items really go up?

Even though Li Fan had demonstrated his incredible predictive abilities in the past, He Zhenghao couldn't help but harbor deep doubts.

Was he truly supposed to purchase large quantities of these items?

He hesitated.

But just then, Gao Yuan’s warning resurfaced in his mind.

“We, as subordinates, don’t need exceptional abilities. The most crucial quality is loyalty.”

“If the Lord wants us to do something, we must complete it without hesitation.”

“After all, with so many cultivators in the Congyun Sea and us not being exceptionally talented, why else would the Lord favor us?”

Steeling himself, He Zhenghao made up his mind.

“Even if I don’t understand, I just need to follow the Lord’s instructions.”

“Besides, these pills and magical weapons are widely known. When people think of affordable, useful items, these are what first come to mind.”

“Even if the Lord’s prediction doesn’t come true, it shouldn’t be a complete loss.”

He reassured himself with this reasoning.

Once resolved, He Zhenghao wasted no time and began consulting with his friends.

Currently, he was quite a sought-after associate.

As soon as people heard he needed assistance, several cultivators were eager to offer advice.

After comparing prices from over ten sources, He Zhenghao began his large-scale purchasing endeavor.

His suppliers were delighted, as he was buying items that had been sitting in storage for quite some time.

To expedite the deal and prevent him from changing his mind, they even offered considerable discounts.

Though a 100 million contribution points was a substantial amount, it wasn’t so large when divided across various types of pills and magical artifacts.

Most sizable production workshops could meet He Zhenghao’s demands.

The speed at which his procurement was completed exceeded even his expectations.

After he had exchanged the collected points for what appeared to be a pile of “useless” items, He Zhenghao couldn’t help but feel a sense of emptiness.

A lingering sense of unreality filled his heart and wouldn’t go away.

Despite his caution, He Zhenghao’s unusual behavior hadn’t escaped the notice of certain individuals.

To the public, He Zhenghao’s actions were seen as indicative of Li Fan’s intentions.

Everyone knew he was Li Fan’s trusted aide, and a procurement effort of this scale would certainly be at Li Fan’s direction.

Could it be that the ancient cultivator from the Heavenly Mechanism Sect had foreseen something once again?

Were the items He Zhenghao purchased about to see a price surge?

Some were immediately tempted.

However…

With the tragedy of the Samantabhadra True Leaf still fresh in their minds, many cultivators, having learned a hard lesson, suspected that this might be another of Li Fan’s tactics to manipulate the market.

So, most chose to wait and see.

Chapter 551: Blessings and Misfortunes are Hard to Foresee

In an unknown space.

A group of cultivators, led by Long Yueyou and including Zhou Kebao, had gathered together to discuss Li Fan's recent actions.

Ever since they suffered a hidden loss at Li Fan’s hands and were forced to collaborate with him, there had been a silent resentment simmering among them. After all, they were all influential figures in their own right. Being outmaneuvered by Li Fan was a blow not only to their finances but, more importantly, to their pride.

Although they had outwardly formed a “friendly cooperative” relationship with him, this didn't stop them from secretly waiting for a chance to give Li Fan, whom they saw as a "fat sheep," a hidden blow at the right time to vent their frustration.

As such, they were keeping a close watch on Li Fan’s every move, and his recent commission of He Zhenghao to amass massive resources had not escaped their notice.

"Everyone, what do you think? Should we follow Li Fan’s lead and join in the purchases, or…?"

"Hah! You think we’ll profit by following him?" One person sneered disdainfully. "Everyone knows he’s as sly as they come. Just look at his past actions—every time he makes a big move, it’s always part of some scheme to take advantage of others."

"Remember how the loss from the Samantabhadra True Leaf incident wasn’t that long ago. Have you all forgotten already?"

"Fellow Daoist Zhu, you can’t put it that way," someone countered. "Things aren’t as they were before. Now that Li Fan holds an official position as the Secret Envoy of Congyun City, he can’t act as recklessly as before. If he were to disrupt the market or destabilize the Immortal Alliance maliciously, headquarters wouldn’t let him off easily."

This statement gained nods of agreement from many of the cultivators present.

"Exactly! In my opinion, he must have foreseen something significant to make such a large-scale move. Let’s not forget that the fundraising project hosted by He Zhenghao was something Li Fan established right after his rise. His early reputation owes much to it. I don’t believe he would tarnish his own reputation."

"Let’s follow him! With our combined wealth, surely those unruly gangs can’t compare to us!"

…

The group chattered noisily, and most of them seemed inclined to follow Li Fan’s actions, even if they harbored grudges against him. Despite their misgivings, they had to admit their respect for his abilities.

As the discussion grew lively, Zhou Kebao remained silent, frowning all the while.

Seated at the center, Long Yueyou, maintaining a dignified expression despite his faint smile, noticed Zhou Kebao’s expression and asked, "Fellow Daoist Zhou, what are your thoughts on this matter?"

Without hesitation, Zhou Kebao replied, "Without a doubt, we should purchase the same items listed by Li Fan."

Long Yueyou was slightly surprised at Zhou Kebao’s decisiveness but listened attentively as he continued.

"The prices of these items are likely to see a significant increase soon."

Zhou Kebao’s frown deepened. "But what puzzles me is this—if everything on this list goes up in price, there’s only one possible explanation."

"And that would be… a large-scale war is about to break out."

Zhou Kebao flicked his fingers, and a light screen appeared mid-air, displaying a list identical to the one Li Fan had handed to He Zhenghao.

Following Zhou Kebao’s words, the group fell silent, staring at the fluctuating characters on the screen with expressions of shock and doubt.

"A war? With the Five Elders Association? That seems unlikely. It’s been years since there was a real battle. Although tensions along the borders have risen recently, it hasn’t escalated to the point of open conflict, has it?"

"Exactly! Not long ago, the Five Elders Association blatantly seized all of Ten Thousand Immortal Island, and we still endured it. If war does break out, it would have to be an event of unimaginable magnitude," most of the cultivators present responded skeptically.

"Has anyone heard any suspicious rumors lately? If war were imminent, we would have seen at least some preparations," Long Yueyou asked, his tone serious.

Silence fell momentarily.

Then, the cultivators each took out their communication talismans and started to gather information through their own channels.

But one by one, they shook their heads, finding no unusual intelligence.

"Strange…" Zhou Kebao murmured, his confusion deepening.

The cultivators looked to Long Yueyou, awaiting his final decision.

Long Yueyou narrowed his eyes, pondering. He recalled his past dealings with Li Fan and sensed that he could never quite see through the man.

With a plan forming in his mind, Long Yueyou spoke, "Better safe than sorry. Li Fan does have some skill."

"He must have foreseen something important. Let’s follow his lead this time."

Seeing some lingering hesitation among the group, Long Yueyou smiled reassuringly. "Feel free to go ahead and make your purchases. I’ve reviewed the list. While these items aren’t commonly needed, their prices are stable, and they can be stored for long periods."

"Even if this turns out to be another trap set by Li Fan, we won’t suffer much loss."

"Of course, if any of you still have concerns…"

"If any unexpected situations arise, our Long Clan will buy all of your items at your purchase price."

"I assure you, you won’t suffer any loss," Long Yueyou declared solemnly.

The crowd was stunned.

Long Yueyou had spoken on behalf of the Long Clan, not just himself. This indicated…

Seeing their surprised and delighted expressions, Long Yueyou, full of pride, continued, "Indeed, my elder brother recently broke through to the Dao Integration realm."

"After some maneuvering, he will soon be appointed to the headquarters of the Administrative Hall."

"The official order will be issued shortly, so even if I hadn’t mentioned it, you would have known soon enough."

Hearing Long Yueyou confirm this personally, the cultivators erupted with joy.

This small group of theirs had grown intricately connected over the years, operating as a unit. Their fortunes were intertwined, with Long Yueyou at the helm.

The Long Clan wielded considerable influence, with ties spanning various states within the Immortal Alliance.

Their only shortcoming had been the absence of a true pillar of strength.

But now, with Long Yueyou’s brother ascending to Dao Integration and soon to be stationed at Immortal Alliance headquarters, this lone weakness was about to be resolved.

An Administrative Hall Dao Integration cultivator would occupy one of the highest positions in the Immortal Alliance’s power structure.

The cultivators offered their sincere congratulations to Long Yueyou.

"The Tianling Prefecture is known for its harsh environment. Brother Jiuyuan’s long-awaited rise to prominence is truly worth celebrating!"

Chapter 552: The Return of the Heavenly Calamity

Long Jiuyuan was, naturally, the elder brother of Long Yueyou.

Gifted with exceptional talent, he was the most outstanding individual among the younger generation of the Long Clan.

It took him just over a century to advance from Qi Condensation to the peak of the Soul Transformation stage. Unfortunately, due to the scarcity of the 'Spirit of Heaven and Earth', such a genius remained stuck at the Soul Transformation level.

After more than another century, today he finally saw the dawn of hope.

"Fellow Daoist Long, may I ask where Brother Jiuyuan found the Spirit of Heaven and Earth required for his Dao Integration?"

After a lively celebration, one of the cultivators present couldn't help but ask out of curiosity.

Long Yueyou hesitated slightly, but then remembered that everyone here was close. With his brother now successful in Dao Integration, the existence of that Essence of Heaven and Earth was no longer a secret.

Seeing the eager, expectant eyes of the crowd, Long Yueyou couldn't hold back his pride and began to explain slowly, "It was truly destined for my brother!"

"He guarded Tianling Prefecture for over thirty years. During a certain mission, he stumbled upon a strange sight deep within a mountain range."

"Although the mountain appeared to be ordinary, its originally solid rocks had all turned into a pitch-black, viscous swamp."

"The swamp emitted an ominous aura, and any creature that wandered into it, even magical artifacts or attacks, would be absorbed, assimilated, and disappear without a trace."

"Generally, such a dangerous area would instinctively make any creature with a sense of spiritual awareness feel uneasy and avoid it."

"But my brother discovered something peculiar."

Long Yueyou paused here, as if trying to heighten the suspense. Seeing the eager expressions of the surrounding cultivators, he continued with a satisfied look, "Around the black swamp, all creatures behaved like moths to a flame, rushing in and sacrificing themselves without hesitation."

"Even cultivators were no exception. My brother's Dao heart is incredibly firm, but after staying near the swamp for some time, even he almost couldn't resist the urge to enter."

Some of the cultivators immediately grasped what was happening and gasped, "A fatal allure..."

"Could it be that this black swamp is the Spirit of Heaven and Earth?"

Long Yueyou nodded slightly. "Exactly! My brother guessed as much. Trapped at the Soul Transformation stage for years, he was naturally ecstatic."

"However, he knew that the Spirit of Heaven and Earth is a manifestation of the laws themselves, making it challenging to handle. He forced himself to resist the temptation and retreated."

"After sealing off the entrance with a secret technique, he quietly returned to Tianling City."

"He kept it to himself and began to prepare in secret."

"It took him half a month to prepare before he found another excuse to return to the mountains."

"After setting up a formation to seal off the mountain and prevent outsiders from noticing, he began to attack the black swamp."

"But just as before, every attack vanished without a trace, like a stone sinking into the sea."

Long Yueyou narrowed his eyes, recalling his brother Long Jiuyuan's description: "For three days, my brother tried every possible method, but nothing could damage the black swamp."

"At that moment, he remembered all the scenes of being trapped at the Soul Transformation stage over the years. Finally, he made up his mind."

"With a determination to either succeed or die, he leapt into the black swamp!"

The cultivators present gasped in shock.

They asked themselves if they would have the courage to do the same.

Who knew what lurked within that swamp? Jumping in was like embracing death.

Even if Dao Integration failed, a Soul Transformation cultivator could still command respect and power.

But once life was at risk, there was nothing left to discuss.

But Long Jiuyuan did it anyway!

While the crowd marveled, they couldn't help but feel a deep admiration for him.

"I've heard that Long Jiuyuan is courageous beyond compare. It seems the rumors were not only accurate but even underestimated him!"

"No wonder Brother Jiuyuan, with just his Soul Transformation cultivation, can be on friendly terms with many Dao Integration Immortal Sages!"

"Haha, it's a great honor for us to call him Brother Jiuyuan!"

Listening to everyone praise Long Jiuyuan, Long Yueyou was filled with pride and satisfaction.

After all, he and Long Jiuyuan were brothers, deeply bonded.

Praising Long Jiuyuan was like praising himself!

After a moment, Long Yueyou cleared his throat and continued, "After entering the black swamp, my brother's protective artifact began to be consumed at a frightening rate."

"Mind you, this artifact was specially crafted by a Dao Integration friend skilled in refining."

"If it had been an ordinary protective artifact bought in the Tianxuan Pavilion, it would have long since been eroded."

"With only a limited amount of safe time left, my brother stayed calm. Instead of wandering aimlessly, he closed his eyes, focusing on the changes within the swamp."

"The black swamp was like a deep, dark ocean, with no signs of life besides my brother."

"But my brother could vaguely sense waves of vibration occasionally rippling through the swamp."

"It felt like something was stirring deep within."

"So, my brother followed the source of this vibration, heading deeper into the swamp."
