"Just as he was running out of protective artifacts, he finally discovered the source of the disturbance!"

At this crucial moment, Long Yueyou suddenly paused.

His eyes flashed with a strange light before he lowered his voice and said to everyone, "In the center of this swamp, a shadowy, humanoid figure could be faintly seen."

"Not a cultivator, but a distorted figure made from the murky, dark swamp."

"The Spirit of Heaven and Earth!"

"But that wasn't the most shocking part. Besides the swamp, there was something else."

Long Yueyou took a deep breath and revealed the answer.

"It seemed to be a broken sword, exuding a fierce, murderous aura that even my brother, who has killed countless Five Elders Association cultivators, found terrifying."

"The broken sword was struggling violently, and the swamp was containing it like a cage!"

---

The black swamp, transformed into a sea, held the sword within its depths!

This eerie, surreal scene left everyone in awe, speculating about the origin of this broken sword.

Meanwhile, far away, Li Fan, who was flying towards a certain destination, suddenly halted.

"The Heavenly Calamity Sword?!"

Chapter 553: Han Yi Re-enters the Trap

“Or rather, a part of the Heavenly Calamity Sword.”

A glint of sharp insight flashed in Li Fan’s eyes.

The spirit of heaven and earth had become a cage, entrapping the remnant sword filled with fierce, fiendish energy.

The scene described by Long Yueyou immediately reminded Li Fan of the battle in the skies above Congyun Sea, where the Azure Wind had sealed a sword.

But unlike what Li Fan had witnessed before, Long Jiuyuan’s chance to achieve Dao Integration had arisen in Tianling Prefecture.

The spirit of heaven and earth was also represented by the Black Marsh, rather than the Azure Wind.

But…

The protagonist in both cases was, remarkably, a remnant sword brimming with fiendish energy.

Li Fan was almost certain that whether it was the one in Congyun Sea or in Tianling Prefecture, each must be a part of the original, complete Heavenly Calamity Sword.

“The Heavenly Calamity Sword, once wielded by the old fisherman, had shattered and scattered across various locations.”

“Yet, even these fragmented swords are powerful enough to contend with the spirit of heaven and earth.”

“Moreover, the hilt of the Heavenly Calamity Sword later managed to break through the Azure Wind’s confinement. Even in the Cloud Water Heavenly Palace, the tortoise-snake Taiyi could barely suppress it, forced into a state of deep slumber.”

“If the fragments alone are this formidable, how powerful would the complete Heavenly Calamity Sword be?”

Li Fan’s heart trembled.

From what he knew, there were already three pieces scattered across different locations. Could there be more elsewhere?

What was the true secret of the Heavenly Calamity Sword that made the spirit of heaven and earth repeatedly manifest to suppress it?

And the master of the Heavenly Calamity Sword, the old fisherman—what level of cultivation did he possess?

“The fisherman, the Heavenly Doctor, the Sage…”

Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

These three were evidently old acquaintances, yet their pasts remained shrouded in deep mystery, as though covered by an impenetrable fog.

Li Fan had a subtle feeling.

Their shared secrets might be crucial to him!

“When enemies meet, their eyes blaze with hatred. I hope that soon, when the three of them clash, I can gain a glimpse into their mysteries.”

While locking onto Zhou Kebao’s presence and monitoring Long Yueyou’s movements, Li Fan resumed his journey to his original destination.

According to Long Yueyou’s account, when Long Jiuyuan saw the stalemate between the Heavenly Calamity remnant sword and the Black Marsh, he too was deeply shocked.

Yet he didn’t let the easily attainable chance for Dao Integration cloud his reason.

Long Jiuyuan understood that the balance between the remnant sword and the Black Marsh was delicate and that attacking recklessly would likely break it.

That might lead to backlash from both the remnant sword and the Black Marsh.

After all, for a Soul Transformation cultivator to interfere with a Dao Integration struggle would be nothing short of a provocation.

Thus, Long Jiuyuan quickly made up his mind; despite the destruction of his protective artifact and serious injuries, he fled from the sea of the Black Marsh.

After a brief recovery, he set up the “Heavenly Severing Earth-Isolating Formation” in the surrounding area.

This formation had one purpose: to sever the connection between the spirit of heaven and earth and the world itself.

Though the spirit of heaven and earth manifested the laws of nature, if isolated, it would weaken like water without a source or a tree without roots.

The Black Marsh, initially on par with the Heavenly Calamity Sword, started to weaken, giving the sword an opening!

Long Jiuyuan lay in wait, observing the changes in silence.

As expected, a few months later, the Black Marsh in the mountains began to boil, surging with violent energy.

The phenomenon lasted for almost half a day, until finally, a sword shadow broke free from the Black Marsh’s prison, soaring into the sky and disappearing from sight.

The marsh sea melted away like snow, rapidly contracting into the humanoid form of the **Black Marsh**.

Determining the direction in which the Heavenly Calamity Sword had fled, the Black Marsh was just about to pursue it when…

Long Jiuyuan made his move!

He struck with full force, holding nothing back.

The outcome of the battle was already determined.

The Black Marsh was annihilated.

Long Jiuyuan successfully achieved Dao Integration!

“I recall that in the great battle in Tianling Prefecture in my previous life, a newly integrated Dao powerhouse fell. I wonder if this newly ascended Immortal Sage will escape such a fate.”

This thought flickered through Li Fan’s mind as he approached his destination.

It appeared to be a deserted island.

The island itself wasn’t important; it was the man on it who was Li Fan’s true target.

It was none other than the long-missing Han Yi!

After narrowly escaping death from Li Fan and retreating into the ocean’s depths, he hadn’t surfaced since.

Only recently had Li Fan sensed his return to the cultivation world.

He hadn’t returned through the previous underwater cavern but had emerged from ruins a thousand miles away.

Han Yi looked quite haggard, his clothes torn and bloodstained.

He seemed severely injured and had chosen a nearby island for rest.

Upon detecting this scene, Li Fan decisively pursued him.

Concealing himself, Li Fan watched Han Yi from a distance.

They hadn’t met in a long time, and Han Yi was still at the peak of Qi Condensation, yet to achieve Foundation Establishment.

However, a new, inexplicable aura clung to him.

Li Fan hadn’t noticed it before.

But now, due to Han Yi’s injuries and resulting unconsciousness, the aura emerged naturally, assisting in Han Yi’s recovery.

His pale face regained color, and his weak breathing grew steady and strong.

A strange glint flickered in Li Fan’s eyes.

After a moment’s thought, Li Fan revealed himself and first used the “Binding Insect” spell to immobilize Han Yi.

Then, he activated the “Cloudwater Dream-Illusion Technique” to enter Han Yi’s dreamscape.

Perhaps due to the recent calamity he’d endured, Han Yi’s mental defenses were surprisingly fragile.

It didn’t take long for Li Fan to break through.

In the dreamscape, Li Fan gained insight into Han Yi’s experiences over the recent period.

That day, after being drawn into a sudden underwater vortex, Han Yi lost consciousness.

When he awoke, he found himself bound tightly, stripped of all clothing.

Surrounding him were terrifying creatures with human bodies and beastly faces.

They danced in a circle, seemingly engaged in some ritual.

At the center blazed a fierce fire.

It looked like Han Yi was being offered as a sacrifice to the flames.

Horrified, Han Yi struggled to break free.

But to his despair, there was no trace of spiritual energy in the area.

For some reason, his spiritual power had also dried up.

As helpless as a mortal, Han Yi could only watch as the beast-faced creatures chanted and prepared to throw him into the flames.

Just as Han Yi thought he was doomed, the sky darkened.

Suddenly, torrential rain poured down, quenching the fire in moments.

Han Yi’s heart leaped with joy.

The monsters, however, were terrified.

They threw Han Yi aside and began kowtowing in terror.

The rainstorm continued for half a day.

The creatures remained kneeling in the rain, pleading for mercy.

Only after the rain stopped did they slowly disperse.

Han Yi, intended as a sacrifice, was then imprisoned once more.

Chapter 554: The Black Bird and the Fate of the World

During his captivity, Han Yi had attempted to escape. However, the monsters seemed to place great importance on him, maintaining a seamless, constant watch. They never gave Han Yi the slightest opportunity.

Faced with the relentless, predatory stares of his monstrous guards, Han Yi could only swallow his frustration and abandon his escape plans. Fortunately, the conditions in this prison weren’t too unbearable; the monsters would bring him food and water on time each day, so he wasn’t overly uncomfortable.

After about ten days, the monsters once again tied Han Yi up tightly and brought him to the stake for another sacrificial ritual.

“My fate is sealed! If I’d known it would end like this, I might have preferred to die at the hands of that other cultivator!” Han Yi thought to himself.

Just as he was despairing, something unexpected happened. Thunder rumbled across the sky, and soon a torrential downpour fell, instantly extinguishing the fire that had taken so much effort to ignite.

This turn of events left not only the monsters shocked and terrified, but Han Yi was also stunned. He stared in bewilderment, barely registering when he was brought back to his cell.

The third sacrifice was particularly delayed. Among the monsters, it seemed some internal conflict was brewing. Even from within his cell, Han Yi could hear faint sounds of fierce arguments coming from outside.

After a full thirty days, they finally brought him out again. This time, the day seemed carefully chosen—clear and bright. Each monster wore an expression of grave seriousness, and there was no trace of the noisy scene from the previous sacrifices.

In contrast, Han Yi felt utterly calm. Not only was he unafraid, but he even found himself anticipating something.

The monsters chanted a mysterious hymn in unison and began dancing wildly. Amid the singing and dancing, Han Yi was brought closer and closer to the fire.

Just then, a strange wind swept through, throwing the previously orderly monsters into disarray, scattering even the carefully stacked firewood. Flames burst forth, setting the monsters’ village ablaze, yet Han Yi stood miraculously untouched.

Seeing this, Han Yi couldn’t help but laugh aloud, while the chaotic monsters looked at him with fearful glances, carefully observing his figure among the flames.

From that point on, Han Yi’s status in the monster village changed dramatically. Not only was he no longer imprisoned, but he was given the most comfortable house in the village, and his meals were now the best the village could offer. When the monsters saw him, they no longer glared menacingly but instead bowed their heads in submission, avoiding his gaze.

Despite his improved treatment, Han Yi, a proud Qi Condensation stage cultivator, found it difficult to accept this almost primitive lifestyle. He considered escape again but ultimately decided against it. This world was vastly different from the cultivation world and lacked spiritual energy. Here, he was no different from an ordinary, powerless human. In the monster village, he was safe; attempting a reckless escape could lead him straight into danger and cost him his life.

Thus, Han Yi decided to temporarily settle in the village. He began learning the monsters’ language, hoping to communicate with them. Over time, Han Yi slowly came to understand his situation. This village was called “Zhu,” located in an endless wilderness inhabited by similar human-beast hybrid creatures.

The fewer human traits a creature had, the stronger it was. Villages like Zhu, with human bodies and beast-like faces, were among the weakest. In the depths of the wilderness, it was said that fully beast-like supremes possessed the power to split mountains and rivers.

Han Yi, fully human in appearance, was seen as an “aberration,” a being that offended the divine. He was destined to be burned alive as a sacrifice to appease the gods’ wrath. Yet, after three failed sacrificial attempts, the monsters of Zhu village sensed that Han Yi, this aberration, was extraordinary and reluctantly abandoned their plans to burn him.

In the village's central altar, Han Yi saw a statue of what the monsters called their god. It was a majestic, proud mystical bird, standing tall. Seeing the statue, Han Yi was deeply moved, confirming his suspicions. This deity strongly resembled the fabled black bird of destiny recorded in the "Heavenly Fate Sutra" he practiced.

“Though there is no spiritual energy here, preventing me from cultivating, the ‘Feather of the Black Bird’ I prepared for Foundation Establishment in my dantian feels as though it has returned home,” he thought, feeling an inexplicable energy flowing through the air, allowing the feather to undergo a gradual transformation.

According to the "Heavenly Fate Sutra", the Black Bird Clan’s powers, cultivated to the utmost, could achieve a state where “Heaven’s fate aligns with my fate, and my destiny is Heaven’s mandate.” Heaven and self would become one, indistinguishable. Achieving such a state in the Xuanhuang Realm was virtually impossible. Not even a beast lord could reach that level.

Thus, the Sutra suggested an alternative approach: to find a small world as a personal sanctuary. Merging with the small world’s fate would be much easier, and once achieved, the Black Bird would become akin to the very essence of Heaven’s Way within that small world, capable of transforming landscapes with a mere thought.

“What the Feather of the Black Bird is absorbing must be this world’s fragmented, wandering ‘Heavenly Fate,’” Han Yi pondered. “The heavenly fate of this world should have belonged to the Black Bird that once ruled here. Under normal circumstances, an outsider like me shouldn’t be able to absorb it—even with the Sutra and the Black Bird’s feather.”

“The only possible explanation…” Han Yi’s eyes gleamed with excitement.

“…is that the Black Bird that once fused with this world’s fate has perished!”

“And it couldn’t have been too long ago, for the world’s original fate has yet to recover. The Heavenly Fate remains broken, scattered like unclaimed treasure.”

“The path of fate is incredibly subtle; most cultivators can’t detect it. Even if they do, it would be useless to them,” Han Yi thought, a glint of ambition and greed flashing in his eyes.

“This place is nothing short of a treasure trove for me!”

“By instinctively reaching out for survival, I can manipulate the dispersed Heavenly Fate to summon wind and rain. If I could fully absorb the Heavenly Fate of this world…”

Han Yi’s eyes glowed with a fierce determination and boundless ambition.

“I narrowly escaped death, and now fortune favors me!” He looked out over the vast, unknown world with a surge of boldness.

“When I return to the Xuanhuang Realm with control over the Heavenly Fate of this world, I shall soar like a dragon, unstoppable!”

Imagining the scenes awaiting him, a faint, uncontrollable smile crept onto Han Yi’s lips.

Chapter 555: The Star of Fallen Wilderness

However, things rarely go as one wishes in life.

For a period after this, Han Yi lived quite comfortably in this “Zhu” village.

With no worries about food or clothing, he spent his spare time using the "Mystic Black Bird Feather" within his dantian to absorb the drifting Heavenly Fate in the world around him.

Whenever the Zhu village was attacked by monsters from other settlements, he secretly activated the "Authority of Heavenly Fate," conjuring winds and storms, shifting sand and stone to help them repel waves of foreign enemies.

As a result, Han Yi’s standing in the Zhu village rose significantly.

The monsters of Zhu village went so far as to build a towering stone structure as his palace residence. They also assigned him ten strong and formidable guards for his protection. They even intended to offer him the village’s most sacred “maiden.” Seeing her cat-headed, humanoid form made him shiver with discomfort, and he swiftly declined.

Just when Han Yi thought he would play the role of “Son of God” in Zhu village for a long time, an unexpected event occurred.

One night, he suddenly awoke from a deep sleep, inexplicably filled with a sense of dread.

Rising quietly to inspect the area, he was shocked to find that the ten personal guards, who should have been guarding him day and night, had all disappeared without a trace.

Realizing something was wrong, he barely had time to gather his belongings before attempting to flee the palace.

At that moment, he discovered that while he had slept, nearly a hundred masked soldiers in black had surrounded his palace.

In the flickering firelight of the palace, Han Yi could vaguely make out that these soldiers had a higher degree of beastification than the inhabitants of Zhu village. Although they retained human forms, their limbs were robust and their hands had transformed to resemble those of beasts.

This group was clearly targeting him.

Sensing the danger, Han Yi steeled himself and activated all the Heavenly Fate he had accumulated over recent days.

As the soldiers searched for his whereabouts, a stream of light suddenly brightened the sky, illuminating the night. A massive fireball plummeted directly toward Zhu village.

The black-clad soldiers were momentarily stunned by the sight, and the villagers of Zhu, awakened from their slumber, looked up at what seemed like the arrival of an apocalypse, bewildered and terrified.

Meanwhile, Han Yi, sensing the depletion of the Heavenly Fate he had amassed, hid himself in a corner made of solid stone.

Initially, Han Yi thought that the meteor he had summoned with all his strength would crush all of the black-clad soldiers to death.

Unexpectedly, as the fatal threat approached, one of the soldiers let out a thunderous roar, and his body expanded several times over. He launched himself into the air, charging directly toward the meteor.

“Boom!”

With a violent explosion, the figure fell back to the ground even faster than he had ascended, drenched in blood and mangled beyond recognition.

Yet the meteor Han Yi had summoned veered slightly off course, falling instead toward the village center, where the houses were densest.

“Boom!”

The ground shook.

In the blink of an eye, Zhu village was reduced to ruins, with cries and wails echoing through the air.

The black-clad soldiers, although they avoided a direct hit from the meteor, couldn’t escape the aftermath, suffering heavy casualties.

Having prepared in advance and with a trace of residual Heavenly Fate shielding him, Han Yi was unharmed.

Knowing he couldn’t stay any longer, he used the cover of night and chaos to escape Zhu village alone.

After fleeing more than ten miles, just when he thought he was safe, he sensed a breeze approaching from behind. Panicked, he tried to dodge but was a fraction too slow, failing to avoid it completely.

A blade-like gust sliced a deep wound across his back.

Enduring the searing pain, Han Yi turned to find his assailant—and to his shock, it was a familiar face.

The Zhu village high priest, Si!

Feigning anger, Han Yi demanded to know why Si had attacked him, all the while secretly gathering Heavenly Fate, hoping for a chance to survive.

Si, perhaps believing that Han Yi was already cornered and destined for doom, didn’t rush to strike again. Instead, he revealed the reason behind the attack with bitter resentment.

It turned out that since Han Yi had repeatedly performed “divine miracles,” Si, who had once held a revered position and enjoyed the villagers’ respect, had gradually been “pushed out.”

It was easy to understand.

As the village priest, his primary duty was to represent the villagers in communicating with the gods—praying to the gods on their behalf and delivering divine decrees to the people.

But with Han Yi’s presence, performing miracles almost akin to a god incarnate, why would the villagers seek out a mere “spokesperson” when they had a living divine presence?

Losing his role as the interpreter of divine will, Si’s former honor was all but overtaken by Han Yi.

Watching Han Yi reside in the grand palace, witnessing villagers bow in reverence whenever he appeared, jealousy festered in Si’s heart like a venomous snake.

Even though Han Yi displayed godlike power, Si harbored thoughts of “killing a god.”

But clearly, no one in Zhu village would support such a plan.

So, he set his sights on Kang village, more than ten miles away.

Kang village was much stronger than Zhu village, with inhabitants at a higher level of beastification. Yet despite this, the two villages had never had serious conflicts. The boundless wilderness offered nearly inexhaustible resources.

Even if Kang and Zhu occasionally clashed, they usually resolved it peacefully through negotiation.

Si’s secret visit, however, changed everything.

Si informed the Kang village leader about the “divine descent” in Zhu village. He warned that with divine assistance, the Zhu village chief’s ambitions were swelling. He intended to use the power of the god to sweep through the wilderness and become the “Emperor” uniting it all.

Such a course would inevitably lead to a bloody slaughter.

Unwilling to see so many lives lost, Si had secretly come to enlist Kang’s help in eradicating Han Yi, whom he deemed a fraud exploiting the name of the divine.

After a round of persuasion, the Kang village leader agreed that allowing Zhu village to control a “divine entity” was too dangerous.

Thus, after more than ten days of planning, with Si as the informant, Kang waited for the perfect moment and led a hundred elite warriors to encircle Han Yi’s palace.

Although Si had told him of the divine’s power to summon winds and rains, Kang remained confident.

His elite force had fought through mountains of corpses and rivers of blood, unafraid of swords—how could mere wind and rain faze them?

That is, until the falling meteor shattered Kang’s worldview.

Chapter 556: Repeated Encounters with New Life

Back to the present moment, the people of Kang Village have suffered heavy casualties.

In the shadows, Si watched with bloodshot eyes, barely containing his rage.

He could hardly believe that Han Yi was truly capable of summoning heavenly starfire like some kind of god.

Not only had the plan to ambush Han Yi failed, but his childhood home and beloved Zhu Village were nearly destroyed in the calamity.

Familiar faces had become nothing more than burnt corpses, fragmented and broken.

Anger, jealousy, resentment...

All these emotions surged in Si’s heart, finally converging into a single thought.

"Kill him! Kill him!"

In the dim night, Han Yi's figure had completely vanished.

But Si, who had served as the High Priest for decades, possessed methods of communion with the gods that were not mere illusions.

Although the energy surrounding Han Yi was different from that of the deity Si worshipped, he was still able to follow the faint residual traces in the air and ultimately catch up to Han Yi.

"Die! Such so-called deities should never have set foot on this land!"

With a twisted expression, Si voiced the suppressed words that had been buried in his heart.

As he chanted, Han Yi suddenly realized with shock that the wind around them was gathering in Si's hands.

Compressed to the extreme, it shot towards Han Yi.

"So, the heavenly fate can be used in this way?"

Han Yi was both surprised and delighted.

Though another wound was carved into his body, his eyes grew brighter.

He dodged while simultaneously sensing and studying Si’s method of controlling the wind blades.

Until, at the brink of collapse, covered in blood, he finally succeeded.

When he summoned his first wind blade, its color was deeper than Si’s, and the momentum far more imposing.

It tore through the air with a sharp whistle, crushing Si’s wind blade and continuing forward.

In Si’s stunned, unwilling gaze, it pierced through his body, reversing the situation and ending his life.

Han Yi, wounded all over, let out a relieved breath and collapsed into a deep sleep.

When he awoke, he found that all his injuries had healed in just a single night.

Unable to determine the reason, Han Yi didn’t dwell on it and instead continued his escape into the wilderness.

But soon, he noticed that small search parties were scouring the land for him everywhere.

The falling stars that night had been such a grand spectacle.

The destruction of one village and the severe damage to another could hardly be kept a secret.

Rumors of a "god descending" quickly spread throughout the wildlands.

Regardless of whether Han Yi’s claim to being god was true or not, his ability to summon storms and stars was beyond doubt.

If he could be controlled, unifying the wastelands under both law and strength would no longer be just a dream.

With ambitions to seize the title of “Emperor,” nearly every tribe began to pursue Han Yi.

In the wilderness filled with monstrous beasts, his human appearance was also far too conspicuous.

He had no choice but to constantly flee in disgrace to save his life.

Fortunately, he was protected by Heavenly Fate, which sharpened his senses to danger.

And ever since the battle with Si, besides wind blades, Han Yi had also mastered the technique of wind manipulation.

While not as swift as a cultivator's flight technique, it was much faster than simply walking.

Thus, although constantly hunted, Han Yi managed to avoid capture.

---

"Wind, water, fire, lightning..."

"They are all part of the world. By harnessing Heavenly Fate, I can control these elements to kill enemies without any problem."

"According to the *Heavenly Fate Sutra*, the earliest cultivators seemed to wield power in this way—petitioning the heavens for authority and manipulating all things."

"Back then, they apparently called themselves ‘Warlocks’."

Having grown accustomed to a life of hiding, wandering in the wilds for what seemed like ages, Han Yi lay in a freshly dug earthen cave, murmuring to himself.

A faint flame danced on his fingertips, illuminating the dark space around him.

Even in this world without spiritual energy, he managed to perform feats that only cultivators could typically achieve.

"If I fully integrate with this world’s fragmented Heavenly Fate, then my powers here may rival even the Longevity Immortal of the Xuanhuang Realm."

As hope rekindled in Han Yi’s eyes and he began to look forward to the future again, he suddenly felt the ground trembling slightly.

"Boom!"

"Boom!"

Thunderous footsteps echoed from a distance, growing louder as they drew closer.

Han Yi's expression shifted as an overwhelming sense of danger flooded his mind.

Cursing under his breath, he broke through the earth, quickly oriented himself, and used the wind to flee.

Behind him, a colossal white elephant the size of a mountain was in hot pursuit.

The massive creature ignored all obstacles in its path, charging toward Han Yi with its four powerful legs.

Even with his wind manipulation pushed to the limit, Han Yi couldn’t shake off the white elephant.

The chase attracted the attention of nearby beasts, who soon spotted Han Yi and joined in the hunt.

With more and more beasts surrounding him, Han Yi's escape routes were rapidly narrowing.

Feeling cornered, a fierce light flashed in Han Yi’s eyes.

Over time, he had absorbed a substantial amount of Heavenly Fate.

If he unleashed it all at once, he could trigger a disaster on the scale of a mountain collapse, burying all these beasts.

But doing so would nullify all his efforts, subject him to backlash, and leave him gravely injured.

Just as Han Yi hesitated, he suddenly sensed a faint trace of spiritual energy around him.

Though weak, Han Yi, who hadn’t felt the nourishment of spiritual energy in a long time, knew he wasn’t mistaken.

Where there is spiritual energy, there is the possibility of performing spells.

Even the weakest spells from the Qi Condensation stage would be beyond the capabilities of these beasts, who relied solely on their physical might.

Overjoyed, Han Yi immediately followed the spiritual energy’s direction and ran.

He finally stopped at a deep ravine.

"Could this be..."

Sensing the faint flow of spiritual energy, which halted just outside the ravine’s bounds, Han Yi was overjoyed.

"This seems to be a pathway back to the Xuanhuang Realm!"

Since arriving in this small world, Han Yi had relentlessly searched for a way back to the Xuanhuang Realm.

He had scoured the area around Zhu Village but had not found the entrance.

This small world was vast, and for him to find a way back alone was akin to searching for a needle in a haystack.

But by a stroke of fate, today, while at the edge of despair, he had stumbled upon the path home.

"Indeed, heaven hasn’t forsaken me!"

Han Yi cast a cold glance back at the horde of beasts hot on his heels.

A sneer crossed his face: "Once I return, master my skills, and make all the necessary preparations, I’ll come back here to settle accounts with you all!"

With this thought, Han Yi dove into the depths of the ravine.

Chapter 557: Hard to Escape from the Palm

Han Yi thought he had finally escaped from danger, but he had no idea that deep in the valley below, where spiritual energy flowed, there were still some demonic beasts living!

These creatures, unlike those in the smaller realms, could absorb and cultivate with spiritual energy.

White snakes, flying falcons, and two-headed monkeys…

They resembled the traditional images of ancient demonic beasts.

Caught completely off guard, Han Yi plunged right into the midst of this demonic beast horde.

Fortunately, these beasts had lived in this secluded valley, cut off from the world, and had never seen humans.

While Han Yi was terrified out of his wits, more than half of the beasts, equally frightened, scattered and fled.

As for the rest, well, they weren't so easily deterred.

Seeing an unknown intruder in their territory, their innate ferocity was triggered, and they attacked Han Yi without hesitation.

Han Yi took a deep breath of spiritual energy, casting a protective spell on himself while condensing energy into a sword to slash at the beasts.

Blood sprayed like mist, and in an instant, more than a dozen beasts were decapitated.

However, the scent of blood only drove the beasts into an even greater frenzy.

Fearless, they charged forward like a tidal wave.

And in the distance, it seemed like an endless number of demonic beasts were rushing toward him.

Han Yi knew he couldn't linger here, so he fought while retreating, moving deeper into the valley.

The closer he got to the valley's depths, the richer the spiritual energy became.

The denser energy allowed Han Yi to wield his full strength, the culmination of his Qi Condensation cultivation.

But correspondingly, the demonic beasts inhabiting this area also grew stronger.

Gritting his teeth, Han Yi used every ounce of his strength and finally carved out a path through the beasts.

He found an obscure, chaotic-looking cave at the very bottom of the valley and escaped back to the Xuanhuang Realm.

Taking a deep breath of the familiar, sweet air, Han Yi was still rattled and hadn’t even had a moment to rest.

Yet, he felt an inexplicable sense of danger creeping over him, as if someone were watching, his heart racing uncontrollably.

Already as jumpy as a frightened bird, Han Yi ignored his injuries and hurriedly took flight again.

It was only after a long time that the lingering unease in his heart slowly faded.

Physically and mentally exhausted to the extreme, Han Yi found a nearby deserted island.

Barely managing to land, he collapsed, fainting on the spot.

---

Back to the present.

Through the Cloud Water Illusion Technique, Li Fan had observed all of Han Yi’s experiences over the past few years, a look of interest flickering in his eyes.

"This kid’s experiences are truly colorful."

"Life-and-death crises that ordinary cultivators might never encounter in a lifetime, he’s faced them all in a single adventure."

"Logically speaking, if he were an ordinary person, he should have died countless times by now."

"But somehow, he narrowly escaped death every single time."

"The Heavenly Fate Sutra, the Feather of the Mystic Black Bird… are these the sources of your confidence?"

Looking at the peacefully sleeping Han Yi, Li Fan stroked his chin.

“‘Misfortune hides in fortune, and fortune lies in misfortune.’ No wonder in your last life you managed to win the fish-head prize, obtained the lost treasure of the Blue Feather, and acquired the Heavenly Blue Feather Pill. With such incredible luck, yet when exploring ruins with my clone, you often met setbacks.”

Li Fan paused, then gave a slight smile.

"You’re not wrong, though. With perfect Qi Condensation cultivation, you’ve managed to break through to the Golden Core stage within a decade. Then you even found a Dao-complementing skill at the Derivation Law Jade suited to your path..."

“It’s truly worthy of being called ‘Soaring Dragon in the Sky, Unstoppable Momentum.’”

“Too bad you encountered me.”

Li Fan's eyes were devoid of emotion, icy and cold.

With a light touch of his finger, he pointed at Han Yi's forehead.

"In this life, your path of fate will still follow my design."

After making Han Yi experience certain scenarios in his dreams, Li Fan finally withdrew his supernatural powers.

"The *Heavenly Fate Sutra*, interesting."

"But for now, it can remain with you."

With a faint gaze sweeping over Han Yi’s face, Li Fan's figure gradually faded away.

A long time after, Han Yi slowly awakened.

"Hiss..."

"It felt like a dream. I was reminded of the troubles in that small world again." He felt a faint throbbing in his mind and instinctively massaged his temples to relieve it.

After a while, the pain subsided, and Han Yi let out a gentle sigh.

"I really don’t know if I’m lucky or cursed!"

Lying on the ground, he recalled his experiences in that small world and couldn't help but laugh with a mix of anger.

"It must be because my 'Heavenly Fate Sutra' has yet to reach perfection, causing backlash."

After a long reflection, Han Yi seemed to have an epiphany.

"Earlier, I narrowly escaped death at the hands of that mysterious figure; it was a stroke of heavenly luck."

"But immediately afterward, I suffered backlash and was captured by a creature in a muddled state."

"Relying on my fate protection to survive once more, I faced another backlash and was hunted down by Si."

"And even at the brink of despair, I found a sliver of hope. But soon after, I encountered yet another life-and-death crisis, besieged by demonic beasts."

"..."

Han Yi’s eyes lit up, and he suddenly felt a breakthrough in his thoughts.

"Blessings and misfortunes go hand in hand, indistinguishable from one another."

"If I only take without giving, it’s hard to endure long-term. Only by balancing calamities with fortune and using my destiny at the most crucial moments is the true path!"

With his thoughts fully aligned, a surge of spiritual power suddenly emanated from Han Yi’s body.

The spiritual energy from all directions was drawn toward him.

Above the deserted island, a faint tornado seemed to form.

And within Han Yi’s dantian, the black feather of the mystic black bird began to disintegrate, completely merging into his dantian.

This scene marked Han Yi's successful enlightenment upon returning to the Xuanhuang Realm after facing life and death ordeals.

He had directly succeeded in establishing his Foundation.

After years of bitter striving with no success, today he finally achieved his long-cherished wish.

Han Yi felt all the resentment in his chest swept away.

He let out a long howl to vent the frustration pent up inside.

However, his howl lasted only a moment before he abruptly stopped.

He instinctively scanned his surroundings and, seeing no immediate danger lurking nearby, finally relaxed a little.

"Forget it, there’s no need to be too arrogant."

"It’s only the Foundation Establishment stage; my future path, Dao Integration is set, and Longevity is within reach!"

A hint of self-satisfaction filled Han Yi’s heart.

After a while, he began to contemplate: "Now that I've established my Foundation, but all my possessions were consumed by that Foundation Establishment master."

"Truly, I’m left with nothing. I need to find a way to earn some contribution points."

Narrowing his eyes, he quickly came up with an idea.

"I heard that in the Congyun Sea, there’s a trick called the 'Fish Gambling'. Those with good fortune could get rich overnight."

"This is just made for me!"

"Hmph, watch my skill!"

With this thought, Han Yi rose into the air and flew towards the location of Fish Gambling Island he recalled from memory.

Unbeknownst to Han Yi, in the sky, a gaze was constantly watching him.

Chapter 558: Once More Entering the Immortal Alliance

After watching Han Yi leave, Li Fan shifted his gaze southwest.

Looking into the distance, his sight seemed to cross thousands of miles, reaching a deep trench at the bottom of the sea.

This was the location where Han Yi appeared after fleeing from the small world in a panic.

"A small world devoid of mortals, populated entirely by *Beastkind*…" Li Fan frowned slightly.

Based on Han Yi’s memories, Li Fan thought that the creatures in that small world resembled Beastkind he had encountered several times before—existences that were half-human, half-beast.

Yet, there were subtle differences.

While both combined human and demonic beast characteristics, *Beastkind* leaned more toward the "human" aspect.

On the other hand, the creatures in the small world Han Li experienced were closer to "demonic beasts."

This distinction could be discerned from whether their heads resembled humans or beasts.

Even more interesting was a legend that Han Yi heard about this world.

At the dawn of recorded history, most inhabitants of the wilderness were half-human, half-beast. There were even some pure "humans."

But over time, highly beastified mutants occasionally began to appear among the descendants of these residents.

Initially, these mutants were viewed as deviants, abandoned, or even hunted.

However, when some of these mutants tenaciously survived and displayed immense power, things began to change.

They slaughtered the original villages and migrated deeper into the wilderness, establishing a new order.

In this new order, the more beastified an individual was, the higher their status and respect.

The stark difference in ideologies inevitably led to war.

In the wilderness, the strong commanded respect. The beastified, atavistic mutants were clearly stronger as individuals than the ordinary Beastkind.

Although they initially had fewer numbers and could only fight evenly with the other side, over time, their numbers grew, and they began to display overwhelming power in the war.

After the bloodshed, the opposition naturally disappeared.

Thus, the wilderness transformed into the scene that Han Yi witnessed, where "the beast is revered, and humans are the deviants."

"Perhaps this is related to the backup plan that *Emperor One* prepared for the demonic beast race. But from the looks of it, his plan seems to have failed."

"The bloodline of demonic beasts, once activated, is vastly superior to ordinary humans."

Li Fan then thought of the deity of that world—the "Mystic Fate Black bird."

Although there were other beings within the Mystic Black Bird clan, Li Fan felt an inexplicable sensation when he saw the deity’s statue.

This Heavenly Fate Mystic Blackbird was, in fact, "Little Black," the creature he had once possessed in the Fallen Immortal Realm and who had once accompanied Xu Ke.

There was no concrete evidence, just a mysterious feeling possibly due to his previous possession.

"Did it really fall?"

"Strange."

"Even a mere Azure Luan bird is still alive. It doesn’t make sense that the Black Bird, fused with the fate of an entire small world, fell first."

Li Fan’s brow furrowed, puzzled.

After pondering for a while, he felt relieved.

Among humans, strength often corresponds to longevity.

However, among demonic beasts, this principle doesn’t necessarily apply.

Although he was very interested in that small world, Li Fan also knew that now was not the right time to explore it.

Just because Han Yi was only at the peak of Qi Condensation and unable to use spiritual energy, yet could still stir up storms there, didn’t mean that small world was devoid of danger.

It’s important to understand that Han Yi, by using the 'Heavenly Fate Sutra' to control ambient fate, essentially acted as a half-destined child of fate.

Naturally, this allowed him to turn misfortunes into blessings and avert disasters.

If Li Fan recklessly barged in without using similar fate-manipulating techniques, who knows what sort of bad luck he might encounter?

He could very well run into a thousand-year-old demon lurking in the wilderness the moment he stepped in.

After all, the sense of impending danger he had when he wanted to follow Han Yi into the undersea cave that day was no illusion.

Without mastering fate-control techniques, Li Fan wasn’t willing to take on unknown risks.

“No matter; soon enough, I’ll learn what exactly happened back then in the Fallen Immortal Realm,” he thought, as he withdrew his gaze and headed to the nearest outpost island.

Before long, he arrived at Chongwu Island.

The guard of Chongwu Island, named Huang Ranqi, was at the late Foundation Establishment stage.

As his nominal subordinate, Li Fan knew a bit about him.

He was petty about minor issues, but clueless in major ones—constantly making small mistakes and insatiably greedy.

He was, in fact, the perfect candidate.

Li Fan concealed his true cultivation, displaying only the aura of peak Foundation Establishment as he went to pay his respects.

“What’s your name, fellow Daoist?” Huang Ranqi asked warmly, handing him a cup of tea with a friendly smile.

At the moment, Li Fan looked like his real self, not the “Ancient Heavenly Mechanism Cultivator” appearance, so naturally, Huang Ranqi didn’t recognize him.

Li Fan cupped his hands and said, “I am Li Fan.”

*Cough, cough...* Huang Ranqi, who had been sipping his tea with a relaxed look, almost spat it out upon hearing that.

He coughed a few times, trying to ease his embarrassment.

After a moment, he asked in surprise, “You’re also named Li Fan?”

Li Fan was taken aback and asked curiously, “Why would you say that, Daoist Huang? What do you mean, ‘also’?”

“Could it be, you know another cultivator named Li Fan?” He quickly realized and seemed genuinely surprised.

“Heh, fellow Daoist, have you been in closed-door cultivation for many years? Do you not even know the name of the Secret Envoy?” Huang Ranqi squinted his eyes, scrutinizing Li Fan closely.

“You’ve guessed right! I used to be a wandering cultivator in the Congyun Sea. A few years ago, I ventured out to find a breakthrough opportunity. Who would’ve thought I’d accidentally stumble into a dangerous small world and only recently manage to escape by pure luck,” Li Fan shook his head with a look of deep emotion.

As he spoke, he vividly described his experiences in the small world to Huang Ranqi.

“No spiritual energy, but filled with strange beasts?” Huang Ranqi was indeed captivated by the strange scenes Li Fan described.

“It’s quite impressive that you made it out of such a dangerous place alive,” he remarked with a sigh.

Li Fan nodded in agreement and replied, “You’re absolutely right, Daoist. Near-death experiences often bring insight. Not long after I returned, I broke through my bottleneck and reached peak Foundation Establishment.”

“As I mentioned, I used to be just a wandering cultivator. For the sake of so-called ‘freedom,’ I didn’t want to join the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and endure endless toil. But after this life-threatening ordeal, I’ve come to understand—if you’re alive, freedom doesn’t mean a thing!”

Li Fan spoke sincerely, “So, I humbly ask for your introduction, Daoist!”

Huang Ranqi pondered for a moment and observed Li Fan from head to toe, but he didn’t agree immediately.

“I’ve heard the Five Elders Association and our Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance have had some tense encounters recently, with frequent skirmishes. You’re not a spy from the Five Elders Association, are you?” Huang Ranqi suddenly asked.

Chapter 559: Blossoming of the Heavenly Spirit Flower

Li Fan maintained a calm expression and said, "Friend, you must be joking."

"I just heard you mention that the newly appointed Secret Envoy is also named Li Fan."

"If I were truly a spy for the Five Elders Association, why would I choose such a conspicuous name and draw unnecessary attention?"

Huang Ranqi thought this made some sense and nodded slightly.

Li Fan continued, "I also heard that before a cultivator joins the alliance, their identity is thoroughly verified. With the extraordinary abilities of the Immortal Alliance, if anything were amiss with me, it would surely be detected on the spot. In that case, you'd be the hero who exposes a spy and earns great merit."

"So, why worry?"

After some consideration, Huang Ranqi was finally convinced by Li Fan’s words. He took the lead in applying for a talisman of passage on Li Fan's behalf and then escorted him through the teleportation formation on the island, arriving at Congyun Immortal City.

Seeing the city floating amidst the clouds, Li Fan showed a hint of surprise. "I heard that the Immortal Alliance's base in the Congyun Sea was an island. Why is it now a floating city?"

"That's ancient history. If you're interested, you can ask around once you join the alliance," Huang Ranqi replied, clearly unwilling to elaborate.

Li Fan didn’t pursue the matter further.

Soon, the two arrived at the entrance of the Tianxuan Mirror.

"This is the Tianxuan Mirror," Huang Ranqi introduced.

Li Fan appeared to listen attentively, but he was actually tense inside. As he pretended to focus, he secretly activated the "Sky-Shrouding Palm" Secret technique and prepared his [Truth] to make a swift escape if necessary.

Based on his past-life experience of merging with objects and traversing countless eras, Li Fan knew that the Sky-Shrouding Hand Technique, which had been refined repeatedly in the struggle between the Covering Heaven Alliance and the Mysterious Net, could evade the Tianxuan Mirror's perception.

In addition, the 'Mysterious Transformation of True Spirit'—derived from the Derivation Law Jade—was a mystical technique capable of altering one's aura, fate, blood, spiritual consciousness, and soul essence.

Thus, the Tianxuan Mirror shouldn't detect that he and the Secret Envoy Li Fan of Congyun Immortal City were actually the same person.

Still, one could never be too cautious.

With a multitude of thoughts flashing through his mind, Li Fan followed Huang Ranqi and entered the Tianxuan Mirror.

To his relief, what he feared did not happen. The Tianxuan Mirror didn’t recognize him as the Secret Envoy Li Fan; instead, it assigned him a new identity. Huang Ranqi, who received an introductory reward applicable to a Foundation Establishment cultivator, had no reason to suspect him further.

After some brief conversation, Huang Ranqi took his leave, and Li Fan was able to rejoin the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance under his true identity.

"It seems my guess was correct: the mirrored version of the Tianxuan Mirror, created by the 'Empowerment' process, is far weaker than the original."

"While part of this is due to my Sky-Shrouding Hand Technique being ahead of its time, infiltrating was still surprisingly easy."

"No wonder the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is filled with spies from the Five Elders Association."

Li Fan felt a sense of irony.

On the day the Five Elders Association attacked the Ten Thousand Immortal Island, the Tianxuan Mirror inexplicably ceased to function, turning into a mere stone. This had inspired Li Fan to make this bold attempt, which ended as he had anticipated.

Not lingering in the Tianxuan Mirror, he used his contribution points to purchase a storage ring. Then, he traveled through the teleportation formation to Tianling Prefecture.

Without leaving Tianling City, Li Fan quietly waited there. If the Five Elders Association did indeed assault the Five Elements Great

Cave Heaven, his past-life experience indicated that a Dao Integration cultivator would fall in the brutal battle.

And the spectacle of a Dao Integration cultivator’s death would encompass the entire region.

This would allow Li Fan to confirm the event as soon as it happened.

Naturally, to avoid suspicion, Li Fan did not simply idle but wandered around the shops in Tianling City.

"Heavenly Spirit Flowers? Yes, yes, please take a look at these," the shopkeeper said eagerly, displaying several potted flowers for Li Fan.

The Heavenly Spirit Flower was a unique product of Tianling Prefecture. Each flower bloomed with a different number of petals, and each petal would display a unique scene—whether a lush green mountain, a mighty river, or a snow-covered landscape. One flower could encapsulate the beauty of various places in the world, as if blessed by heaven itself.

If you were to ask the flower’s purpose... the answer would be, none.

Its only use was ornamental. Unfortunately, the flower had a short lifespan; once in bloom, it only lasted seven days, or about a month if stored in a specially crafted wooden box.

Moreover, it was extremely sensitive to any form of energy. Exposure to spiritual energy fluctuations or spatial teleportation could blur or even erase the scenes on its petals, rendering it worthless.

Thus, cultivators who wished to admire the Heavenly Spirit Flower had no choice but to come to Tianling Prefecture to see it in its prime.

This rarity made the Heavenly Spirit Flower even more precious outside of Tianling Prefecture.

In his past life, during the great battle in Tianling Prefecture, the Heavenly Spirit Flower almost went extinct. But with everyone’s attention on the unprecedented conflict, no one cared to speculate about its price. Once the war ended and Tianling Prefecture began to recover, the flower gradually returned.

However, cultivators later discovered that due to the lingering bloodshed in its growth environment, the scenes on the flower’s petals no longer depicted natural beauty but rather horrifying images of cultivators slaughtering one another—a truly tragic sight.

People longed for the once-beautiful Heavenly Spirit Flower, but the scenes on the petals were beyond control. Attempts to transplant the flower to other regions failed, as it would instantly wither.

Thus, the Heavenly Spirit Flower, once a unique spectacle of Tianling, vanished from the world.

Recalling this past-life anecdote, Li Fan carefully selected a seventeen-petaled Heavenly Spirit Flower in the shop.

"This one."

"Just one? Won’t you choose more?" The shopkeeper seemed disappointed.

"One is enough," Li Fan said with a smile.

"Three hundred contribution points," the shopkeeper replied, quoting the price.

Li Fan paid gladly and carefully took the sealed wooden box containing the Heavenly Spirit Flower.

In the box, the Heavenly Spirit Flower bloomed vibrantly. With special treatment, it would stay in bloom for about thirty days.

Chapter 560: The Dao Integration Life-and-Death Battle Begins

However, Li Fan knew of a way to completely seal it in ice.

Since the extinction of the Heavenly Spirit Flower, many formerly secret techniques have gradually spread.

One such technique, named *Collection of Flowers*, uses painting to permanently seal the Heavenly Spirit Flower within a canvas.

Originally, the *Collection of Flowers* wasn't intended specifically for the Heavenly Spirit Flower; rather, it was meant to immortalize every beautiful flower in the world.

The author of the *Collection of Flowers*, Zhao Chong, was deeply passionate about flowers. He vowed to see every flower under heaven.

So, he set out to record all flowers using brush and ink. Unfortunately, his talent for painting was mediocre, and his depictions were so far from reality they bordered on sacrilege.

After racking his brains, Zhao Chong eventually pioneered a unique approach—a "painting" technique that directly sealed real flowers onto paper. Though it lacked artistic spirit, it was lifelike and extraordinarily realistic.

In his previous life, Zhao Chong’s *Collection of Flowers* did not include the Heavenly Spirit Flower. Although he had long heard of its legendary beauty, he had intended to save the best for last. Consequently, he hesitated too long to capture it.

After the war that ravaged Tianling Prefecture, its natural wonders were no more. Zhao Chong deeply regretted his delay, crying his lament to anyone who would listen.

---

At this moment, Li Fan put the box containing the Heavenly Spirit Flower into his pocket and continued wandering around the shop, feigning casual interest. Only after receiving a hostile glare from the shopkeeper did he reluctantly leave.

After exiting the shop, he made his way to the City Discourse Tower Hall in the city and rented a room. Using the Tianxuan Mirror, he purchased three items: *[Ice Dew]*, *[Image Capture Seal]*, and *[Thousand Colors Silk]*. Though not particularly valuable, they cost nearly all his contribution points.

Taking out the Tianling Flower’s seventeen petals, he placed them onto the [Thousand Colors Silk] and then soaked them in [Ice Dew]. As cold air gradually spread across the petals, he pressed down with the [Image Capture Seal].

Following the process Zhao Chong had described in his previous life, Li Fan carefully executed each step. The [Thousand Colors Silk] emitted a rainbow of lights, reflecting through the Tianling Flower and onto the [Image Capture Seal]. Like threads being woven together, the sealed Tianling Flower fused with the [Thousand Colors Silk] and [Image Capture Seal].

The light slowly faded, and soon a thin, transparent “paper” appeared in Li Fan’s hands. Although it felt flat, the flower on it looked just like a real, blooming flower. Every petal’s detail was vivid, and it seemed even to tremble slightly.

“That’s it,” Li Fan breathed a sigh of relief.

“All that remains is to add a protective layer of spiritual consciousness to prevent anyone from maliciously damaging it. But there’s no rush.”

Li Fan looked at the “artwork” in his hand, knowing it would soon become one of a kind in the Xuanhuang Realm. Its value would be incalculable, far beyond mere wealth; its unique appeal could accomplish tasks contribution points alone couldn’t.

With a smile, he admired it a bit longer before carefully storing it away.

He left the City Central Tower and wandered around Tianling City for three more days.

On that day, a wave of exclamations arose in the city.

“Look to the sky!”

Li Fan looked up, finally seeing the long-awaited scene.

A rolling black swamp resembling dark clouds filled the sky, blocking out the sun. Though it seemed imposing, it was actually dry and lifeless within.

At the same time, a voice emerged in Li Fan’s mind:

“Dao Integration cultivator Long Jiuyuan, after 286 years of cultivation, reached Foundation Establishment with the Scarlet Dragon Molt and achieved the Golden Core stage with the Four Techniques: Hidden Potential, Rising Dragon, Spell Breaking, and Life-and-Death Battle.

“By devouring the *Hundred Abyss Cave Heaven*, he achieved Nascent Soul and transformed his spirit with the *Thousand Waters of Tianling*. He offered the *Spirit of the Black Marsh* and united with the Dao in body and spirit. In Tianling Prefecture, he was gravely injured by the cultivator Xu Huating. His spirit perished, and he returned his Dao to the heavens.”

“...It really is him.” A sharp glint appeared in Li Fan’s eyes.

The fall of a Dao Integration cultivator meant an unavoidable battle was imminent. Soon, the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance would issue a war preparation announcement, and all provincial borders would be sealed.

Li Fan had to leave this perilous place before then and return to the relative calm of Congyun Sea which had been relatively calm during the battle of Tianling Prefecture.

As other cultivators stood frozen, Li Fan had already slipped into the teleportation formation. Only after he vanished did murmurs fill Tianling City.

“Long Jiuyuan? When did he achieve Dao Integration?”

“No way! How did he die?”

“Who is Xu Huating? He could actually kill a Dao Integration cultivator?”

“The most promising junior of the Long family has fallen just like that. This will certainly cause a stir.”

---

As the people of Tianling Prefecture processed their shock, disbelief spread across the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance.

A tremendous storm was forming, with Tianling Prefecture at its epicenter, spreading to engulf the entire alliance.

Shortly after:

In Congyun Sea.

He Zhenghao, anxiously monitoring his newly acquired supplies, was sweating bullets at every slight price fluctuation. Suddenly, the crisp mechanical voice of the Tianxuan Mirror echoed in his ears.

"Starting from this moment, the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance enters a Class B state of readiness."

"All regional protective formations are to be activated."

"All cultivators are prohibited from moving across states."

"All members of the alliance's internal system must return to their state cities as soon as possible and await orders."

"Once any foreign cultivators are detected, they are to be killed on the spot, regardless of life or death."

The announcement repeated three times before ending.

He Zhenghao was initially stunned, then his eyes widened in shock as he jumped to his feet.

The Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance was preparing for war with the Five Elders Association?

Terror seized his heart. He was about to contact Gao Yuan to discuss countermeasures when he remembered something and quickly looked down at the list of items on the Tianxuan Mirror.

Speculative traders are astonishingly quick to react.

While most cultivators in the alliance were still reeling from the impending war, prices for survival-related items were already skyrocketing.

The *Heavenly Healing Pill*, standardized Big Dipper Armor, Divine Martial Thunder, and Hundred Battle Formation Diagram—all the materials Li Fan had ordered He Zhenghao to stockpile—were rising in price at breakneck speed.

Not only these items, but anything related to survival and combat in the Tianxuan Mirror had surged in price.

Everyone knew that the current supply couldn’t possibly meet the cultivators’ demand.

With war looming, who could guarantee they wouldn’t end up on the battlefield? The more protection and preparation one had, the better one’s chances of survival.

Compared to one’s life, contribution points were inconsequential. Even at double the price, cultivators would pay willingly.

In a flash of insight, He Zhenghao realized, “The Lord’s foresight is truly uncanny!”

Looking at the soaring prices of his stockpile, He Zhenghao was both delighted and terrified.

The joy came from seeing his 100 million contribution points' worth of goods increase by a third in such a short time. But he feared that hoarding goods might lead to punishment by the Immortal alliance.

Chapter 561: Shared Sorrows and Joys Unfelt

He Zhenghao’s worries naturally disappeared once the prices for stockpiled resources doubled.

"One hundred million contribution points, that's a hundred million contribution points!" He Zhenghao’s eyes were bloodshot, and he trembled uncontrollably.

The continuous surge in prices was a mental stimulus that made him feel as though he was soaring, almost reaching the heavenly realm.

He Zhenghao swore that he had never been this exhilarated in his life.

"When the secret envoy handed me the list of resources, he casually mentioned that, since I’m in charge of this fundraising, my profit share would rise from one percent to ten percent, unlike the previous three times..."

"In just one day, I earned more contribution points than I ever could in a lifetime."

His blood rushed to his head, and He Zhenghao felt his body nearly boiling over.

Courage surged within him; even the strict laws of the Immortal Alliance that he usually revered seemed less intimidating.

"Raise it! Let the price soar! Surely, I’m not the only one doing this. The law won’t hold us all accountable!"

"Besides, if the heavens fall, the secret envoy will take the hit. I’m only following orders!"

"There’s no way I’ll be blamed!"

He Zhenghao mumbled to himself, quickly convincing himself and erasing any remaining fear.

All he felt was ecstasy at the immense profit.

Throughout the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, there were quite a few cultivators like He Zhenghao, celebrating in high spirits.

In an unknown location…

"A great harvest, an absolute windfall. This profit directly covers all our past losses, with extra left over!"

"See? I told you, that guy Li Fan has some real skill, and we bet on the right horse this time! Following his lead, we’re eating well!"

"Haha, Fellow Daoist Lü, didn’t you staunchly oppose this plan last time?"

"Don’t spout nonsense! You must be mistaken!"

...

Zhou Kebao watched his companions’ expressions of excitement, feeling a thrill himself.

To date, he had already earned nearly two million contribution points.

Although he didn’t know the exact profits of the others, judging by their reactions, it must have been considerable.

"Li Fan’s ability to predict events is truly terrifying. To foresee this sudden and unprovoked outbreak of war…"

As for the reason behind the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s sudden declaration of war, Zhou Kebao and the others were still inquiring.

So far, no clear answer had surfaced.

"Ah, I was too cautious. If only I’d invested a bit more back then."

This thought suddenly flashed in Zhou Kebao's mind.

Just then, a voice rang out.

"Hm? Where’s Fellow Daoist Long?"

The room fell silent for a moment.

"Yes, I remember him being quite decisive this time, investing at least five million contribution points in advance to stockpile resources. He must be making a fortune!"

"Could he still be in seclusion, unaware that prices have skyrocketed?"

"I’ll contact him to share the good news!"

To their surprise, all their messages went unanswered, as if they’d disappeared into the void.

The group exchanged puzzled glances.

Just as they were filled with confusion, Long Yueyou appeared before them.

He was disheartened, eyes bloodshot, his face pale.

Everyone present felt a chilling premonition in their hearts.

Finally, Zhou Kebao was the first to speak. "Fellow Daoist Long, what happened? You look…"

Long Yueyou seemed absent, lost in thought.

It took several calls from Zhou Kebao before he snapped back to reality.

Looking at the people around him, Long Yueyou’s lips trembled, and, using all his strength, he finally whispered, "My elder brother… has fallen."

Boom!

Everyone felt like their brains had been struck hard, leaving them dazed.

Long Jiuyuan, who had just ascended to Dao Integration as an Immortal Sage, had fallen?

In an instant, the room fell into dead silence.

The joy from earning so many contribution points vanished without a trace.

To them, losing a Dao Integration cultivator was a loss that no amount of contribution points could ever replace.

While stunned, they also felt a chill run down their spines.

The war had just begun, and already a Dao Integration cultivator had perished.

The scale of this war was far beyond their imagination.

How many lives would it claim?

For a moment, even these profit-driven cultivators felt a sliver of fear.

Meanwhile, in the administrative hall of Congyun City, chaos reigned.

The Immortal Alliance had issued a war preparation notice, yet they could not reach the secret envoy no matter what they tried.

A month ago, Li Fan had announced his plans to enter deep seclusion.

But now, in the face of such a critical crisis, he had abandoned his post and left the mess to his subordinates...

Wasn’t that going a bit too far?

The cultivators grumbled inwardly.

"Everyone!"

Gao Yuan, looking at the varied expressions on their faces, knocked on the table to get their attention.

"With the secret envoy absent, it’s time for us to step up," he said solemnly.

"Although the situation is unclear, there’s no doubt this war won’t end easily. We must prepare ourselves mentally."

"Especially since Congyun Sea borders the Five Elders Association. We must maintain constant patrols and guard against enemy cultivators."

Gao Yuan paused, seeing the worry on everyone’s faces, and tried to reassure them. "But don’t worry too much."

"After all, if the heavens fall, there will always be someone taller to hold them up. Since the Five Elders Association was completely defeated by us last time, they haven’t fully recovered yet."

"Even Nascent Soul cultivators are scarce among them. Their strength isn’t likely to force us to risk our lives."

The others found some comfort in his words and relaxed slightly.

However, Gao Yuan kept one thought to himself.

If it came to the point where the remaining cultivators of Congyun Sea had to fight on the front lines, the brutality of this war…

He shivered at the thought.

—

While the entire Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance was thrown into chaos by the sudden war notice, Li Fan was quite relaxed.

He drank from his cup filled with wine glowing with a faint blue light, raised his thumb in appreciation, and praised, "Excellent wine!"

"Such a fine brew, and with Fellow Daoist Sima here recounting thrilling tales from millennia ago. Life like this, what more could one ask for?"

Sima Changkong, his face flushed, replied, "Though we’ve only recently met, I feel like we’re old friends. The concept of ‘fate’ truly is a wondrous thing!"

"Come, let’s have another drink!"

With that, Sima Changkong tilted his head back and drank the wine.

"What story of the Xuanhuang Realm would you like to hear next?" he asked proudly.

"Though the ancient period is beyond record, I’m quite familiar with the history of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance since its re-establishment."

"I heard that about five hundred years ago, there was an uprising where small worlds united and launched a counterattack against the cultivation world."

"Please, do tell me about it!" Li Fan replied, half-dazed from the wine.

Chapter 562: A Discussion Over Wine on Ancient History

“Counterattack against the Immortal Cultivation World, huh…”

Sima Changkong squinted slightly, as if recalling something.

After a moment, he slowly spoke: “Mentioning this now, most cultivators refer to it as a farce. But in reality, the coalition of the small worlds was far more than just a trivial spectacle.”

“Otherwise, why would the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association, which have always been adversaries, be forced to join forces?”

A faint gleam flashed in Li Fan’s eyes. Moving closer, he asked in an uncertain tone, “Alliance? You mean they united just to deal with the coalition of the small worlds?”

“Sima, could it be that you’re mistaken? Wasn’t it said that the people of these small worlds are mere exiled mortals?”

“Why would we cultivators struggle so much against this bunch of ants? Besides, we have the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign overseeing everything. Could they really have defeated us?”

Sima Changkong was unperturbed by Li Fan’s disbelief.

Instead, he smiled faintly and flicked his finger, sending a drop of blood between them.

The blood drop hovered mid-air, pulsing as if alive, then spread outwards to form a canvas of misty blood.

On this blood canvas, scene after scene of thrilling battles appeared.

One side of the battle seemed to be the cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm.

But the other side, capable of flight and other supernatural feats, clearly wasn’t mortal either.

Their fighting techniques varied, yet they could go toe-to-toe with the cultivators.

Some relied purely on physical strength, enduring attacks from flying swords and spells with their bodies. They would approach swiftly, tearing cultivators apart with their bare hands.

Others stayed in the distance, manipulating strange energy from afar, striking down from the heavens, targeting cultivators with pinpoint accuracy.

Most disturbingly, some were not even humanoid, appearing as transparent, white, human-like skins. They drifted through the battlefield, and whenever they encountered a severely wounded cultivator, they attached themselves to them.

To the amazement of all, those who had been near death would spring back to life as soon as these white skins adhered to them.

Even those missing limbs would experience regeneration and recover their combat strength once possessed.

Li Fan stared intently at the constantly shifting scenes in the blood screen, his expression growing graver.

“Where are our higher-ranking cultivators from the Xuanhuang Realm? Did the Dao Integration and Longevity Immortal stage experts just sit back and watch this slaughter unfold?” Li Fan asked, his voice tinged with frustration.

Sima Changkong shook his head slightly. “Not at all. Naturally, they had their own adversaries.”

“Although our ancestors couldn’t witness the battles of the stronger cultivators firsthand due to their limited cultivation level, it’s said that we in the Xuanhuang Realm suffered devastating losses as well.”

With a sigh, Sima Changkong continued, “For nearly 500 years, neither side has been willing to reignite the conflict. They both chose to focus on recuperation.”

Li Fan was astonished. “Were they really that strong? Were these people truly from the small worlds?”

“Yes, and no.” Sima Changkong summoned a fish-like spirit beast, poured another drink for the two of them, and continued.

“They were nothing more than pawns under someone else’s control.”

“The true mastermind behind them lies elsewhere.”

Li Fan perked up, intrigued. “What do you mean by that?”

“It seems their origins trace back to the time just after the ancient calamity descended. The details are sparse, even in the records of our ancestors.”

“However, from scattered post-war accounts, we know that they appeared to be a group of those who had ‘left and returned.’”

Sima Changkong looked puzzled as he spoke slowly.

“Not only did the Dao Integration cultivators of our Xuanhuang Realm refer to them as traitors, but even cultivators who didn’t know their identities would feel a deep-seated hatred at the sight of them.”

“During the battles, bolts of lightning would even descend from the heavens, striking these people directly.”

“It’s as if the entire Xuanhuang Realm despised them.”

“Left and returned…traitors…” Li Fan murmured, sinking into contemplation.

Sima Changkong’s descriptions, combined with his previous experiences in Senior Sister Zhao’s illusion, stirred some guesses within him.

In the past, when various calamities like the incompatibility of different cultivation methods and the immortal-mortal miasma descended, the ten great sects initially planned to unite and face these crises together.

But as the situation deteriorated too quickly, each sect had to fend for itself, let alone assist each other.

When disaster loomed, each sect made its own choice.

Some vanished completely in the annals of history due to internal strife.

Others sealed themselves off, hiding from the world, clinging to life.

But some, like the Nanming Demon Beast Mountain and the Heavenly Sword Sect, chose to flee from the Xuanhuang Realm altogether.

“As Emperer-One once said, within any group, individuals will make their own choices. Without an absolute leader, it’s impossible to act with a unified will.”

“Each cultivator chose differently, which is only natural.”

“When they left, they may have taken something with them. Perhaps that’s why even the Xuanhuang Realm itself holds a grudge against them.”

“It’s uncertain why they returned, but for them to return unharmed despite the immense pull of the ‘Immortal Ruins,’ they must be extremely powerful.”

Li Fan’s mind gradually settled as he turned to Sima Changkong with even greater admiration.

As expected of the Xuanhuang Realm’s historian.

Over the past millennium, countless forgotten or hidden stories could be traced back to Sima Changkong.

Ever since Li Fan returned from the Tianling Prefecture, he had come to Sima Changkong’s underwater crystal residence to avoid the war’s impact.

Thanks to his previous interactions with Sima’s projection, coupled with his extensive knowledge of obscure facts, he quickly earned Sima’s favor.

The two enjoyed daily banquets, freely discussing the Xuanhuang Realm’s history, thoroughly enjoying each other's company.

To prevent outside disturbances and gather more information, Li Fan even volunteered to help set up stealth and protective formations for Sima Changkong’s crystal abode.

Impressed by Li Fan’s enthusiasm, Sima felt he’d found a kindred spirit, and their bond deepened.

“Peace is temporary, while war is the eternal theme of history.” After a long silence, Sima Changkong sighed, setting down his raised cup, his enthusiasm waning.

“Why do you say that…” Li Fan trailed off in sudden realization.

“Has the war between the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association begun?”

Sima Changkong nodded heavily. “Who knows how many cultivators will perish on the battlefield.”

“This is the way of the heavens; we are not the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereigns. How could we resist? Drink, let’s drink!” Li Fan poured another drink for Sima, consoling him.

“You’re right.” Sima Changkong drained his cup, swallowing both the fine wine and his sorrow.

Li Fan then smoothly shifted the topic elsewhere.

…

Time flew by, and a year passed in the blink of an eye.

The war between the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association had reached a fever pitch, and Li Fan had fully settled in Sima Changkong’s residence, not leaving once in the entire year.

Chapter 563: All Fall for Profit

“Out of wine?”

On this particular day, just as Li Fan was about to invite his friend for another round of drinks, he received this unexpected response.

He was utterly stunned.

Sima Changkong’s face turned slightly red, as if he wanted to say something but held back. After a moment, he scratched the back of his head awkwardly and explained, “Here in this Congyun Sea, I don’t have many close friends, so I didn’t prepare much.”

“Brother Li, you’ve been my guest for quite some time…”

Li Fan calculated quickly and remarked in surprise, “I hadn’t realized time passed so quickly; it’s been a whole year already.”

Apologetically, he continued, “Since Brother Sima finds my presence a burden, it’s time for me to take my leave.”

“But before I go, please let me know the ingredients used to make that wine. I’ll collect some for you…”

Before he could finish, Sima Changkong’s face flushed even more. He quickly waved his hands and said, “Brother Li, no, it’s not a complaint. It’s just…”

Sima Changkong seemed ready to explain, but for some reason, he stopped, shook his head, and sighed in defeat.

“Never mind. Brother Li, please stay here for a few days. I’ll be back soon!”

Without waiting for a response, he left in a hurry.

Li Fan watched Sima Changkong’s departing figure with a wry smile. “What an interesting person.”

Though he hadn’t gone out all year, Li Fan wasn’t entirely unaware of the outside world.

His clone, Zhou Qingang, had been running himself ragged.

Setting aside numerous trivial matters, the most urgent task was the 'Monthly List of Recruited Cultivators'.

Even though the Congyun Sea’s forces were severely weakened, the Immortal Alliance Headquarters continued to issue conscription orders.

However, given the Congyun Sea’s current state, most recruited cultivators were spared from direct combat.

They were primarily assigned to logistics and support roles.

Still, no one could guarantee that the war wouldn’t expand, eventually involving them in the crossfire.

As a result, no one wanted to be sent to the Tianling Prefecture.

Compiling the recruitment list had become a challenging task.

Initially, it was Li Fan’s duty as a Secret Envoy to finalize this list.

But with Li Fan in “seclusion,” the task technically fell to his trusted associates He Zhenghao and Gao Yuan, who had been authorized to make decisions in his absence.

Yet, He Zhenghao was known as an easygoing person, while Gao Yuan was skilled at diplomacy and careful to avoid offending anyone.

Neither wanted to be responsible for sending people to possible death.

If the individuals sent to battle perished, that was one thing. But if they survived and returned with accolades, it could create lasting enmity.

Therefore, they secretly approached the more reclusive “Zhou Qingang” to ask for help.

Naturally, “Zhou Qingang” declined.

There was no reason for him to take on such a troublesome task.

But soon enough, He Zhenghao brought out his trump card.

“Fellow Daoist Zhou, take a look.” He took out a scroll and spread it out before “Zhou Qingang.”

“Liu Yihang, ten million contribution points.”

“Zhou Peng, eight hundred thousand contribution points.”

“Sikong Yi, three hundred thousand contribution points.”

…

Li Fan’s gaze swept across several familiar names on the scroll, and he asked, knowingly, “What is this?”

He Zhenghao cleared his throat. “This is the record of contributions from last year’s investment plan.”

“The year is up, so it’s time to return the capital and profits. Thanks to the guidance of our Secret Envoy, I sold off all our accumulated supplies when prices soared over three times their original cost.”

“The final profit was about…”

He Zhenghao paused, his face revealing a barely concealed pride. “Three hundred and fourteen million contribution points.”

Li Fan gasped in amazement. “That much? I had heard that supplies were scarce on the battlefield, but I didn’t realize prices had skyrocketed so much. Doesn’t the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance regulate this?”

“Regulate it? How could they? Business is about mutual consent. If you don’t want to buy, you don’t have to. But the more prepared you are, the better your survival chances on the battlefield. If you don’t buy, someone else will!” Unlike his hesitant demeanor from a year ago, He Zhenghao now appeared quite nonchalant in the face of “Zhou Qingang” reaction.

Li Fan simply shook his head, refraining from further comment.

“So, what’s the point of showing me this?” Li Fan asked, feigning confusion.

He Zhenghao exchanged a look with Gao Yuan, glanced around, and then set up a concealment formation.

Feeling assured, he marked five names on the scroll and struck through each one heavily.

Realization dawning, Li Fan gasped, “These cultivators… died in the Tianling Prefecture battle?”
