“Quiet, quiet!” He Zhenghao jumped, quickly gesturing for silence.

“Please, don’t spread this around. I’m only telling you because you’re one of us.” He added with a hint of reproach.

Li Fan nodded repeatedly, showing his understanding.

“So, no one is left to claim these people’s contributions?” he asked quietly.

He Zhenghao spoke with a tinge of excitement, “Exactly. I secretly confirmed it; these five indeed fell on the battlefield in Tianling Prefecture.”

“Moreover, they didn’t leave any wills.”

“The five total a principal of three hundred thirty thousand contribution points, along with a bonus of another three hundred thirty thousand…”

Li Fan interrupted, “Didn’t you say the profit was three times? Why only a thirty thousand bonus?”

He Zhenghao snorted, “Thirty thousand is already generous. The Secret Envoy adjusted the bonus ratio out of compassion.”

“According to the original agreement, we only needed to pay fifty percent of the principal as interest each year.”

“But the Secret Envoy is benevolent, so I won’t argue.”

“In short, these six hundred sixty thousand contribution points are unclaimed now.”

“All I need is for you to help handle this matter, and they’ll be yours,” He Zhenghao said enticingly.

“Zhou Qingang” was clearly tempted.

Yet he hesitated, showing a hint of reluctance.

“Will this go unnoticed? Taking the contributions of the dead feels taboo.”

“Also, does the Secret Envoy know about this?” Li Fan asked deliberately.

He Zhenghao’s eyes flickered as he patted his chest in assurance. “Don’t worry, Fellow Daoist Zhou. The list of contributors is confidential, known only to a few of us. There’s no risk of exposure.”

“I even asked the Secret Envoy, and he said I could handle this as I saw fit,” He Zhenghao stated confidently.

“I see…” Li Fan studied He Zhenghao for a long moment.

Only when He Zhenghao started feeling uncomfortable did he look away.

“Alright, I’ll take care of it,” Li Fan agreed.

He Zhenghao and Gao Yuan exchanged a look, their faces lighting up with joy.

Chapter 564: Unrest in Tianling Prefecture

“Thank you for your help, Fellow Daoist!” He Zhenghao smiled warmly and clasped his hands as he left with Gao Yuan.

Watching their receding figures, Li Fan’s expression was unreadable.

“In just one year, they’ve been corrupted into this...”

“Not long ago, these two still believed I was a fallen Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign and hoped to follow me for a prosperous future.”

“Now they even dare to deceive and disrespect me.”

A cold glint flashed in Li Fan's eyes.

After all, the battle in Tianling Prefecture was initiated by him. He had foreseen that some cultivators participating in the investment plan would likely fall in the conflict there. However, he never mentioned this to He Zhenghao.

It was all to see how He Zhenghao would handle the unclaimed capital left behind by those who perished.

And the result…

“The human heart truly cannot withstand temptation.”

“Especially when faced with such significant contributions. When one becomes accustomed to astronomical figures in the billions, how could one be content with a meager salary?”

“It's inevitable that they'd seek side earnings.”

Li Fan shook his head slightly. He wasn’t particularly disappointed, only that he had once considered providing He Zhenghao a way out when the Crimson Flame will burn the sea and would eventually erupt—partly as recognition for his hard work and his contribution to the "Mountain Sitting Technique."

But now…

"Perhaps in the next life."

Expressionless, Li Fan began selecting personnel from the Congyun Sea System for the upcoming recruitment.

Indeed, as the war commenced, the first to be summoned were members within the structure of the Immortal Alliance.

After all, those who enjoyed the benefits of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance also had to bear corresponding responsibilities.

“Zhu Yongshou…”

“This one spoke disrespectfully before—mark him down.”

“Qi Yan. Hmm, I don’t recall much about him. He wasn’t present at either the reconstruction ceremony of Congyun City or the foundation ceremony of Immortal City. Mark him down as well.”

“Zhao Kuo, feedback officer for the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance Congyun Sea?”

Li Fan raised an eyebrow, momentarily puzzled.

He had spent many cycles in the Congyun Sea and governed its affairs for some time now, yet he had never had the pleasure of meeting this individual.

“Who will die if not you?” With a stroke of his brush, Li Fan marked him down.

...

Before long, the "Cultivators Drafted List" that had left He Zhenghao and Gao Yuan in a bind was completed.

Overall, Li Fan’s selection of cultivators was quite casual. To him, even if they survived the Tianling Prefecture battle, they wouldn't escape the Crimson Flame Burning the Sea. It was merely a question of sooner or later.

The recruitment order bore the seal that Li Fan had specifically left before entering seclusion, marked with the "Secret Envoy Sigil." All that remained was for “Zhou Qingang” to add his stamp to officially issue it.

Shortly after, Zhou Qing’ang completed the final step.

“Injustice has its perpetrator; debts have their collector. It was all Zhou Qingang’s doing, nothing to do with me, Li Fan.”

Li Fan felt no pressure.

“Daoist Zhou is truly efficient! Haha, looks like I’ll need your assistance again next time!” He Zhenghao’s praise soon came through.

Li Fan responded with a faint smile.

Meanwhile, at the Crystal Palace beneath the sea.

After only half a day, Sima Changkong, who had been gathering ingredients for brewing, hurried back.

“Oh? Brother Sima, you’ve returned so quickly?” Li Fan asked in mild surprise.

“Ah, Daoist Friend, you misunderstand.”

Sima Changkong shook his head, explaining, “Something urgent came up, so I had to rush back.”

“Gathering the ingredients for the 'Heavenly Green Brew' isn’t easy, and I haven’t had time to prepare them yet. You’ll have to wait a while longer if you want to drink heartily.” He looked a bit apologetic.

“No worries!” Li Fan waved dismissively, indicating he didn’t mind.

“What’s happened to make you return in such a hurry?” Li Fan asked curiously.

“Something remarkable has appeared on the battlefield in Tianling Prefecture, and my 'Blood Split Clone' was unfortunately destroyed. So, I had to return to craft a new one,” Sima Changkong replied, looking a bit weary.

“Remarkable?” Li Fan’s eyes narrowed as he led Sima Changkong back into the Crystal Palace to sit.

“Yes, when I saw it, I was taken aback.” Sima Changkong, evidently fatigued from using his teleportation technique to return, sat to rest.

After a short break, he took out a small black canister.

With a hand gesture, he crushed it, and a torrent of blood poured out, fresh enough to still carry a sharp metallic scent.

The blood coalesced midair, gradually forming a vaguely human shape.

Without concern for Li Fan’s presence, Sima Changkong touched his brow with his finger, extracting a drop of prismatic blood, which he merged into the blood figure.

A soft glow emitted from it, and before long, a replica of Sima Changkong stood before them.

After dressing his clone, the replica clasped his hands in respect to the two of them before departing toward Tianling Prefecture.

Only then did Sima Changkong exhale, though now visibly weaker, his face ashen, barely able to stand.

Seeing this, Li Fan quickly helped him to a seat.

After a while, Sima Changkong regained some strength.

“How are you feeling, Fellow Daoist?” Li Fan asked, prioritizing his well-being over immediate questions about the battlefield in Tianling Prefecture.

“No problem. Just need to rest a bit,” Sima Changkong replied weakly, shaking his head.

“That’s good. I initially thought this was merely a 'Blood Split Clone' rather than your original form.”

“After cultivating the 'Bloodline Historical Archive', there’s hardly such a thing as an original form anymore,” Sima Changkong said with a bitter smile. “The Congyun Sea is the only place that has enough blood essence left for me to immediately craft a new clone.”

Hearing this, Li Fan nodded in understanding.

Soon, he frowned. “Brother Sima, crafting these clones seems to drain your energy substantially?”

“You’re correct, Daoist Friend. I need to drink Heavenly Green Brew regularly to replenish my lost vitality,” Sima Changkong admitted.

“Oh no! I've been drinking so much of Brother Sima’s brew without realizing…” Li Fan exclaimed with exaggerated regret.

“Haha, Brother Li, there’s no need to feel bad!” Sima Changkong reassured him.

“As I’ve said before, cultivating our Sima family’s 'Bloodline Historical Archive' makes our lifespans similar to mortals.”

“Life is fleeting, just a few short decades, gone in the blink of an eye.”

“In such a short existence, having a true friend like you is worth it. So live for today! I’m grateful you drink with me daily; how could I blame you?” Sima Changkong chuckled in reply.

Chapter 565: The Descent of the Mysterious Net

“However, I was worried that spending days drinking with me might delay your cultivation, so I initially wanted to advise you against it.”

“But observing your open-minded nature, I believe you know your limits well. Thus, I’ll refrain from saying more.”

Sima Changkong rested briefly, recovering some of his vitality before continuing.

Li Fan’s gaze flickered but said nothing more, only pretending to be remorseful. “Brother Sima’s heartfelt words truly shame me!”

“Haha! If you keep acting this way, you’re treating me as an outsider!” Sima Changkong feigned anger.

Li Fan could only sigh in silence.

After this heartfelt exchange, the bond between the two grew even stronger.

After a short pause, Li Fan brought the topic back to the battlefield in the Tianling Prefecture.

“Brother Sima, what exactly did you witness on the battlefield?” He frowned as he asked. “Given your comprehensive understanding of the history of the Xuanhuang Realm, to receive such high praise from you, it must have been an immensely terrifying force.”

Sima Changkong sighed deeply. “You flatter me, my friend. However, your latter statement is indeed correct.”

“The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance has deployed a truly devastating weapon this time.”

As he spoke, he activated a drop of his blood, attempting to create a blood screen to show Li Fan what had transpired, as he had done before.

Images indeed began to appear on the blood screen.

But then, Sima Changkong’s expression abruptly changed.

“How can this be?!” he exclaimed in shock, his face full of disbelief.

Li Fan fixed his gaze on the blood screen.

It showed the overwhelming Five Elders Association cultivators forming a formation and encircling a group of Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance cultivators.

The Alliance’s side, despite being surrounded and numbering only about a hundred, showed no trace of fear. Each was incredibly valiant, as if empowered by some mysterious force.

They charged fearlessly toward an enemy outnumbering them a hundredfold.

This seemingly one-sided battle with a foregone conclusion suddenly shifted dramatically.

At the center of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance cultivators, one individual raised something high.

And then…

Without warning, swathes of Five Elders Association cultivators fell from the sky.

They crashed to the ground, bloody and immobile, groaning in agony.

The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance cultivators appeared to have anticipated this. They swiftly and mercilessly harvested the lives of their enemies.

For a moment, the sky was filled with a strange, overlapping phenomenon of falling bodies, forming a bizarre and grim tableau.

“How could this happen?” Sima Changkong murmured in disbelief as he stared at the recorded scene on the blood screen, his expression dazed.

Seeing Sima Changkong’s strange reaction, Li Fan suddenly thought of something and asked, “Brother, does the scene on this blood screen differ from what you witnessed with your own eyes?”

“Precisely!” Sima Changkong nodded immediately.

“What I saw was a cultivator holding a small, square mirror aloft.”

“From the heavens, countless green threads descended.”

“It was precisely these inexplicable green threads that instantly disabled the Five Elders Association cultivators.”

“But why…”

Even after explaining, Sima Changkong remained unsettled, clearly struggling to accept what had happened.

For someone like Sima Changkong, whose purpose was to faithfully record historical events, this inability to document the truth was a significant blow.

“Unrecordable… green energy…” Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

“So, it’s really the Mysterious Net. I had speculated before that the net had descended upon the world. Indeed, once the war escalated, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance couldn’t resist using it.”

“However, the current Mysterious Net differs from the Tianxuan Spirit Locking Formation I encountered in my previous life.”

“It’s surprising that a single handheld mirror can summon it.”

“Is it an incomplete prototype, or…”

Li Fan fell into deep thought.

“No, I must find a way to document it,” Sima Changkong muttered, still visibly shaken, seemingly on the verge of obsession.

“You’re overthinking this, Brother Sima. Even if you can’t directly record it through images or language, you can still indirectly describe its existence,” Li Fan reminded him.

Sima Changkong froze momentarily.

Then he lit up with joy. “How foolish of me!”

He smacked his forehead, forced out a few drops of blood, and fused them into the blood screen.

The blood merged into distorted text that became part of the screen.

> “The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association clashed in the northeast of the Tianling Prefecture…”

> “Threads of green light descended from the heavens…”

> “Those affected lost their spiritual powers and fell to the ground.”

...

As the characters on the surface gradually stabilized, they seemed about to merge completely with the blood curtain.

Suddenly, a faint green line emerged from the distorted blood characters.

"Not good!"

Sima Changkong’s face turned pale instantly as he cried out in alarm.

Before he could finish his sentence, the green line had already transformed into a torrent of green light.

The green light wreaked havoc, distorting the scenes recorded within the blood curtain beyond recognition. Then, it abruptly withdrew and condensed into a single point of light.

For a moment, there was silence.

The green point suddenly erupted.

"Retreat—"

The moment the green line appeared, even before Sima Changkong could shout his warning, Li Fan had already pushed the *Purple Cloud Divine Thunder Escape* to its limit.

At the same time, two bony wings emerged from his back, augmented by the 'Soaring Peng' technique.

Using the fastest speed he had ever achieved since stepping into the world of cultivation, Li Fan fled into the distance.

However, Li Fan hadn’t anticipated that the Mysterious Net’s reaction would be this intense—more violent than the uproar it caused previously in the Ten Thousand Immortal Island's Martial Hall.

The green point exploded, and the shockwaves swept out in all directions in an instant.

As the green light neared his body, Li Fan felt a pang of unwillingness but still prepared to invoke his protective technique, [Truth].

However, he quickly swallowed the remaining "Truth" part of the chant.

Because he realized that the charging energy of [Truth] for body protection hadn't changed at all.

"Hmm? Was it just a false alarm?"

Li Fan stopped fleeing immediately and hovered in mid-air.

After waiting for a while and finding nothing unusual, with the surroundings as calm as before, he hesitated briefly but decided to return and investigate.

Inside the Crystal Palace, everything appeared as it was before.

But an eerie silence pervaded the space.

Sima Changkong remained in his spot, the expression of terror frozen on his face, his body utterly motionless.

"Brother Sima?"

Li Fan called out from a distance.

There was no response.

After a moment, Li Fan cautiously approached. "Brother Sima?"

Although he could still faintly sense the vitality within Sima Changkong, for some reason, there was no reaction from him whatsoever.

Moreover...

That trace of vitality seemed as though it had solidified.

Feeling that something was amiss, Li Fan began to back away slowly.

"Pop!"

At that instant, Sima Changkong’s entire body suddenly burst from within.

What sprayed out was not fresh blood and flesh but pools of viscous green liquid.

The green fluid splattered all over the floor of the 'Crystal Palace'.

Li Fan narrowly avoided the green liquid's assault.

Staring at the obliterated remains of Sima Changkong, his face twitched slightly.

Chapter 566: The Five Elders Association Seeks Aid

The green slime covering the ground seemed to retain some form of self-awareness even after Sima Changkong's death.

Like a writhing worm, it crawled slowly toward the surrounding area.

The hard surface of the Crystal Palace emitted a *sizzling* sound as it was corroded by the green slime.

Witnessing this terrifying scene, Li Fan couldn't help but take a deep breath.

“What a domineering Mysterious Net!”

“It can even trace the medium trying to record it and obliterate the target.”

“Wait…” Realizing something, Li Fan’s expression changed.

He pulled out a blood-red talisman from his storage ring and concentrated his mind on it. “Daoist Sima, are you alright?”

He waited for a long time but received no response.

“This is bad. Even all his clones are gone,” Li Fan muttered, his face twitching.

The Mysterious Net’s pursuit ability was frighteningly powerful.

Initially, Li Fan thought only the clone in the Congyun Sea was destroyed. But now, it seemed...

Sima Changkong’s fate was sealed.

The blood-red communication talisman was crafted with Sima Changkong’s own blood essence, a unique refinement.

As long as any of Sima Changkong's Blood-Split Clones existed in the world, Li Fan could contact him through it.

But now, all his attempts to communicate were met with silence.

The outcome was clear.

The image of Sima Changkong's laughter, discussions over wine, and philosophical debates with Li Fan remained vivid in his mind.

But life is unpredictable—here one moment, gone the next.

“Sima Changkong, farewell! I’ll find you in the next life for a drink!”

Li Fan didn’t feel overwhelming sadness; instead, he shook his head lightly, wielded the 'Five Elements Annihilation Sword', and destroyed the underwater Crystal Palace, creating a makeshift tomb for Sima Changkong.

“To achieve this level of destruction…”

“The Mysterious Net's offensive power is even stronger than I remember from my previous life.”

“This is no half-finished product,” Li Fan said grimly.

Since the anchor point nine years ago, many Nascent Soul and higher-level cultivators from various states’ Tianji and Formation Halls were summoned to the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance headquarters.

After that, there had been no news from them.

Later, the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance issued a 'Recruitment Order', gathering the most talented formation masters from across the land.

Four years had passed since then, and now it seemed they had produced results.

“The Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance has revealed their trump card. Let’s see how the Five Elders Association responds next.”

“With my earlier warning, they shouldn’t be entirely unprepared.”

“Unfortunately, the battlefield in Tianling Prefecture is too dangerous. The only one capable of live updates, Daoist Sima, has perished.”

“The detailed battle situation is still unclear,” Li Fan thought with a trace of regret.

However, one thing was certain: with a weapon like the Mysterious Net, the war in Tianling Prefecture was nearing its conclusion.

“It’s progressing faster than expected.”

“But for me, this is good news. I’ve already achieved Golden Core perfection. Everything is ready.”

“Once the war ends and the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance relocates the Five Elements Great Cave Heaven to their stronghold, I’ll explore Tianling Prefecture Void.”

Feedback from his many subordinates in the Congyun Sea continued to flow steadily into Li Fan’s dantian, stored within his 'Calamity Body.'

The first Calamity Body was nearly complete.

At his current cultivation speed, Li Fan estimated, “If I break through to the Nascent Soul stage, I’ll likely reach mid-stage Nascent Soul shortly after.”

Shaking his head, he put aside his fantasies.

Before the war ended, caution was still the priority.

Li Fan decided not to seek a new location. Instead, he used the 'Five Elements Annihilation Sword' to carve out a cave dwelling deep in an ocean trench.

With formations and the 'Sky-Shrouding Hand' secret technique sealing the area, he finally felt secure.

Over the past year, Li Fan had also visited the Fallen Immortal Realm.

However, returning to the Beast Taming Sect from the Nanming Beast Mountain was a long journey.

Most of his time during that trip was spent on the road.

While cultivating the improved 'Creation Furnace Technique' taught by Mr.Bai, Li Fan, inhabiting Little Black, felt calm and focused.

But when he returned to the sect on Xiao Qing with Xu Ke, he discovered that Lu Ya and Emperor Sanmo were nowhere to be found.

Even when Li Fan left, they still hadn’t reappeared.

“There’s still half a year before the next entry.”

“Let’s prepare for forming my Nascent Soul first.”

As Dao Deviation Stone’s brilliance flickered in his mind, insights from countless Nascent Soul manuals resurfaced.

Revisiting them, comparing, and validating, Li Fan felt he gained even more.

Time flew in cultivation.

In the blink of an eye, three months passed.

While Li Fan’s true body immersed itself in meditation, one of his clones, Zhou Qingang, suddenly received an invitation card.

“Liu Yihang?” Li Fan's expression shifted.

The 'True Cauldron of Medicine King' hadn’t returned.

Clearly, this Liu Yihang wasn’t the adopted son of the Medicine King Sect’s Master Liu Ruchen.

“In that case, he must be from the Five Elders Association,” Li Fan deduced.

In their previous transaction, Li Fan had asked the Five Elders Association to donate ten million contribution points under Liu Yihang’s alias to He Zhenghao.

Sure enough, Liu Yihang’s name appeared in the fundraising records.

“Something urgent must have happened.”

“They didn’t leave contact details before, yet now they risk exposure to seek me out.”

Li Fan opened the invitation card, memorized the meeting location, and then destroyed it with spiritual energy.

Late at night, he quietly set out alone.

The meeting point was on a mortal island 500 miles northwest of Congyun Immortal City.

At the island’s center stood a bamboo forest.

Within the forest was a humble hut.

Li Fan stepped inside and, upon seeing the figure within, his eyes narrowed.

“It’s him.”

Though the man concealed his appearance with secret techniques, Li Fan instantly recognized him as the Five Elders Association’s contact from their previous transaction regarding the 'Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance Entrance Exam'.

“What should I call you?”

“During our last meeting, I didn’t even notice you weren’t the real Zhou Qingang.”

“Heh, when my boss told me, I was truly shocked,” the man said sarcastically.

“Did you risk so much to find me just to ask that?”

“Ridiculous!” Li Fan snorted, turning to leave.

The Five Elders cultivator’s expression changed instantly. “Wait!”

He hurried to block Li Fan, softening his tone. “Fellow Daoist, let’s talk things through…”

Li Fan gave him a sidelong glance before returning to his seat.

The Five Elders cultivator heaved a sigh of relief and explained his purpose for the meeting.

“The Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation Diagram?”

Li Fan squinted and immediately refused. “I don’t have it!”

Instead of being disappointed, the Five Elders cultivator seemed encouraged. “Daoist, you didn’t ask what the formation was but declined outright.”

“That only proves you know of it.”

“Please, you must help us!”

His tone was sincere and pleading.

Chapter 567: The Vast and Formless

Although Li Fan wasn’t entirely sure what the opponent meant by the so-called “Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation”.

However, it wasn’t hard to infer that the term referred to the Mysterious Net, which had begun to demonstrate its extraordinary potential on the battlefield of Tianling Prefecture.

Without betraying any emotion, Li Fan probed, “Based on our calculations, even with the assistance of the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation, the Five Elders Association shouldn’t be losing ground so rapidly or finding itself in such a dire position, correct?”

The other party sighed and admitted, “We truly underestimated them this time. Who could have imagined that the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance would be able to recreate this ancient formation so quickly?”

“And it seems to be even more formidable than the recorded descriptions.”

The Five Elders Association cultivator spoke with frustration: “Our countermeasures haven’t been fully prepared yet. That’s why the situation on the Tianling Prefecture battlefield has become rather precarious for now.”

“That’s why we urgently need a method to weaken their formation.”

Li Fan remained silent, rhythmically tapping his fingers on the table as if deep in thought.

“To acquire the formation diagram for the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation, even for us, would come at an enormous cost. Some comrades who have infiltrated the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance would likely need to sacrifice their lives.”

“And even then, success is far from guaranteed…”

After a long pause, Li Fan finally spoke, his tone hesitant. “This matter is of great significance. I cannot make a decision on my own. Let’s do this—give me three days, and I’ll return here with an answer.”

Although the Five Elders Association cultivator was anxious, he recognized the validity of Li Fan’s reasoning and reluctantly nodded in agreement.

“By the way, let’s meet at a different location next time. These are turbulent times, and it’s better to err on the side of caution.” With that, he gave Li Fan the coordinates of another island.

Li Fan clasped his hands in farewell and left swiftly, returning to the Congyun Immortal City.

“Tianxuan Spirit Locking, Xuantian Sealing Spirit.”

“Ancient times, Tianxuan Mirror…”

“Xuantian Sect, huh?”

In his secluded chamber, Li Fan’s gaze flickered as he sank into contemplation.

“That scene on the battlefield, where countless cultivators plummeted from the sky to the ground in an instant—it felt oddly familiar…”

“That’s right—Nine Mountains Prefecture!”

Within Nine Mountains Prefecture, the nine mountain ranges had the peculiar property of preventing cultivators from flying over them.

In his previous life, Li Fan had traveled to the Ten Thousand Laws Chamber of Commerce in Nine Mountains Prefecture for procurement. There, he had witnessed the tragic fate of several defiant cultivators who fell to their deaths.

“Could there be some connection here?”

Li Fan sifted through his memories, recalling various documents he had read in the past.

According to legend, the nine great mountains of Nine Mountains Prefecture were formed from the meridians of a 'beast of immense size' that had perished in ancient times.

The nine mountains were named: Tianchang (Heavenly Length), Tianduan (Heavenly Shortness), Tianxu (Heavenly Void), Tiancu (Heavenly Promptness), Tianjie (Heavenly Knot), Tiandai (Heavenly Substitution), Tianlao (Heavenly Prison), Tiandong (Heavenly Movement), and Tianxi (Heavenly Fineness).

These mountains were said to secretly form a formation, destabilizing the space in Nine Mountains Prefecture and making even teleportation formation ineffective.

---

This information was something Li Fan had known for some time.

Back then, he dismissed the idea of a beast’s meridians transforming into mountain ranges as a fanciful ancient tale befitting mythology.

However, after personally visiting Nanming Mountain, the sacred ground of ancient beasts within the Fallen Immortal Realm, and witnessing many fearsome creatures from ancient times, Li Fan began to notice certain discrepancies in the legend.

The issue was simple: if the legend were true, the size of this beast was 'unfathomable'.

Nine Mountains Prefecture spanned an area that had taken Li Fan half a year to traverse. A beast large enough to have its meridians cover an entire prefecture—what kind of terrifying existence could that have been?

Compared to it, beings like the Scarlet Nine-Head, Purple Headless, and Azure Divine Dragon were mere ants.

While size doesn’t necessarily correlate with power, Li Fan couldn’t believe that a beast capable of forming the Nine Mountains would be weak.

“Perhaps, this unknown beast holds clues to the origins of the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation.”

Although the name alone suggested a connection to the ancient 'Xuantian Sect', Li Fan couldn’t rule out the possibility of mere coincidence. Being meticulous wouldn’t hurt.

Thus, Li Fan began searching the Tianxuan Mirror for information about the “beast that formed Nine Mountains Prefecture.”

Given the passage of time, records were fragmented and unverifiable. Opinions varied, and no definitive answer could be found.

Li Fan combed through all the records but found nothing credible.

Just when he was reluctantly preparing to give up, a painting titled "Dream Encounter with Ancient Beasts" caught Li Fan's attention.

This painting was not created by anyone in modern times but was a casual sketch by a disciple of the ancient 'Divine Brush Sect'.

After the Divine Brush Sect was annexed by the Pointillism Sect, its artifacts were scattered far and wide.

This particular painting was accidentally obtained by a wandering cultivator. However, during a catastrophic heavenly disaster, the wandering cultivator perished, and the contents of his storage ring were looted.

Only the seemingly worthless items, too cumbersome to carry, were left behind, quietly lying in place.

The abandoned storage ring, deemed useless, was discarded by the roadside like old trash.

After being buried in dust for thousands of years, it was rediscovered by a passing cultivator.

According to this cultivator, named Tang Bowen, he understood the past events through a lingering thousand-year-old resentment within the storage ring.

Of course, this claim might have been fabricated by Tang Bowen to inflate the value of "Dream Encounter with Ancient Beasts."

Regardless, the painting indeed dates back thousands of years.

It depicts over a hundred beasts in various forms, some of which Li Fan had encountered in the Fallen Immortal Realm.

What truly captivated Li Fan about the painting, beyond these obvious beasts, was the hidden presence of another creature.

At the very edge of the painting, it appeared that these hundred beasts were all standing on the body of a colossal being.

However, due to its immense size, it could not be fully depicted.

Instead, the hundred beasts on its back served as a frame of reference.

"Vast and formless, its name is Heaven."

This phrase was inscribed in a corner of the painting.

This minimalist creative style naturally attracted much commentary from cultivators.

An insightful observer revealed the truth with a single remark:

"I know this. Isn't it that giant tortoise that transformed into the Nine Mountain Province after its death?"

The tone was somewhat mocking but not unfounded.

Indeed, the creature’s name consists of the characters for "King" (王) and "Eight" (八).

It is named *Tiān* (兲).

It is called Heaven.

"The *Heavenly* Beast..."

A sharp light flashed in Li Fan's eyes.

Chapter 568: A Dark Transaction

The exact appearance of the Heavenly Beast, whether it truly resembles a tortoise, is now impossible to verify.

However, with a specific name, it becomes much easier to search for related information.

Though most of the records are fragmented, it can generally be confirmed that the Heavenly Beast was a "totemic" existence in the distant ancient era, seemingly tied closely to a certain form of faith.

Li Fan mused, "The Heavenly Beast likely belonged to the Xuantian Sect."

"During the war in which the Ten Great Sects of the Immortal Dao annihilated the Xuantian Sect, the Heavenly Beast fell and transformed into Nine Mountains."

"Senior Sister Zhao once mentioned that the Xuantian Sect usurped heavenly authority and could grant mortals [marks], enabling them to wield supernatural powers that only cultivators possess."

"And if they could grant such powers, naturally, they could also revoke them."

"Perhaps on the battlefield of Tianling Prefecture, the reason those cultivators locked onto by green light lost their ability to fly and plummeted from the skies was due to this very mechanism."

"In my past life, the 'Mysterious' Net' I remember hardly exhibited such [revocation] abilities. To suppress rebellious cultivators, they often had to dispatch the black-robed [Heavenly Sorcerers] instead."

"The network was far more focused on monitoring and bestowing than on stripping away powers."

After a moment's thought, Li Fan frowned to himself. "The Tianxuan Spirit Locking Formation and the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation might just be two facets of the Xuantian Sect's divine power."

"The so-called [Bestowment] and [Revocation] are essentially wielding heavenly authority, acting in place of the heavens."

With this thought in mind, Li Fan took out a blank encrypted jade slip. The Dao Deviation Stone in his mind hummed faintly as it activated.

The complete formation diagram for the Tianxuan Spirit Locking Formation, deeply etched in his memory from his past life, was imprinted onto the jade slip.

However, Li Fan made a few deliberate omissions, concealing the fine details of the central core formation.

It took him half a day to complete engraving the formation diagram.

Holding the jade slip, Li Fan's expression fluctuated. "While the Tianling Prefecture has achieved a great victory, and the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance appears to have the upper hand, all of this perceived advantage is but an illusion."

"The Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereigns of the Five Elders Association have refrained from taking action solely because of the agreement made with the Dharma Transmission Immortal Ancestor in the past."

"In truth, the Immortal Ancestor has already..."

Suddenly, Li Fan froze mid-thought.

Previously, he believed that the Immortal Ancestor had left the Xuanhuang Realm. If this became known, with the Five Elders Association boasting the strength of five Longevity Heavenly Sovereigns, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance would be nearly defenseless. If he were to leak the 'Spirit-Locking Formation Diagram' to the Five Elders Association, it might accelerate the collapse of the alliance, exposing his own fragile position.

But soon, Li Fan realized a flaw in his assumptions.

In his past life, it was only in the 41st year, when Senior Sister Zhao tested the waters, that they confirmed the Immortal Ancestor had indeed departed.

However, no one knew exactly when the immortal ancestor had left.

The only hint lay in the 24th year, when the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance decided to universally implement the Tianxuan Spirit Locking Formation, which might reveal some clues.

Still, Li Fan recalled that in the initial stages of training talents in formation techniques, the alliance showed no urgency.

Perhaps this was because they were unaware of the Immortal Ancestor's departure, or perhaps the Ancestor had genuinely not yet left at that time.

"Should I add fuel to the fire and test the situation?"

For a moment, Li Fan hesitated.

After pondering for a long while, he ultimately chose to set aside the idea for now.

In this life, his main goal was still to achieve Nascent Soul.

Only if the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance triumphed in the Tianling Prefecture War and successfully relocated the Five Elements Great Cave -Heaven would Li Fan have the opportunity to explore the mysterious void continuously birthing these cave-heavens.

If the alliance were to fall, everything would crumble, and he would lose his freedom of action.

"Still, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance cannot be allowed to feel entirely unpressured. Otherwise, if the Five Elders Association faces defeat after defeat, and the alliance grows complacent, feeling no need to relocate the cave-heavens, it would be problematic."

After a long contemplation, Li Fan crushed the encrypted jade slip in his hand.

He took out another blank slip and began engraving once more.

This time, he omitted even more details, leaving only the outermost formation structures.

"Even a fragment speaks volumes. The Five Elders Association surely has its share of geniuses in formation techniques. With the portion of the formation I reveal, they may not fully dismantle the 'Spirit-Locking Formation', but countering it should not be an issue."

After completing his intricate work, Li Fan’s eyes gleamed as he stored the encrypted jade slip in a separate storage ring.

---

Three days later.

Li Fan met again with the Five Elders Association's spy.

"Daoist Zhou, what’s the verdict?"

As soon as Li Fan appeared, the spy impatiently asked.

"We can obtain the diagrams," Li Fan replied bluntly.

The Five Elders Association cultivator froze in shock before his face lit up with joy.

However, Li Fan quickly doused his enthusiasm. "But it’s only the outer structure diagrams."

"And it’s the initial version. The Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation has undergone countless iterations and advancements since then; it’s likely unrecognizable now."

"It can only serve as a reference."

Li Fan spoke indifferently.

Hearing this, the spy’s initial excitement dimmed, but he soon regained his composure.

Acquiring even the original formation’s outer structure was a major breakthrough.

It was also a reasonable outcome within expectations.

After all, the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation was one of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s most closely guarded secrets, ranking among their top confidential assets.

The Five Elders Association had lost several deeply embedded spies without obtaining even a shred of information.

If Li Fan had promised the complete formation without reservation, the spy would have suspected a trap—or even questioned whether Li Fan himself was the Dharma Transmission Immortal Ancestor.

"No matter. Even the original diagrams are excellent."

The Five Elders Association cultivator looked at Li Fan with anticipation. "What are your terms?"

Li Fan’s tone turned grave. "The value of these diagrams is beyond any contribution points or measurements. But our terms are simple."

Li Fan’s eyes gleamed, his expression unreadable. "The Five Elders Association must cooperate with our actions at certain critical moments."

The spy froze, frowning. "What does that mean?"

Li Fan ignored the question and continued, "With the power of contracts, I trust you won’t renege on the deal."

"Rest assured, our requests won’t be excessive."

"At key moments, all we ask is for your association to lend its support within one prefecture."

The spy fell silent.

"Wait a moment."

Turning his back, he closed his eyes as if consulting with higher-ups.

After a long while, he turned back, drenched in sweat.

"We agree to this deal."

Chapter 569: The Contract Binding the Heavenly Sovereign

"How long will it take for you to acquire the formation diagram?" the spy from the Five Elders Association impatiently asked, not even waiting for Li Fan to speak.

Li Fan pondered for a moment before answering, "At least twenty days."

The other party's expression immediately turned anxious. "Too slow! On the battlefield, things change in an instant. Twenty days... who knows what might happen by then..."

Midway through the sentence, the spy abruptly stopped and directly stated, "We cannot afford to wait that long!"

Li Fan narrowed his eyes, letting out a cold snort. "It seems the Five Elders Association is truly in a rush."

"Even an initial version of the formation diagram isn't something easily stolen. It requires careful planning. You can't just snap your fingers and get it."

Hearing this, the spy's expression darkened.

"However..." At this point, Li Fan's tone shifted. "There’s a slow way to do it, and there’s also a faster way."

"If you want the diagram quickly, it depends on your sincerity."

The blatant price hike made the spy exclaim, "What else do you want?"

Li Fan's face darkened slightly. "The price we just discussed was for the formation diagram. Now we need to discuss the cost of expediting the process."

"Any issues?"

"If you’re unwilling to deal, then forget it..."

With that, he turned decisively and began to walk away.

"Wait! Let's talk this through!" The spy panicked, rushing forward to bring Li Fan back.

"Don’t be so rash, Fellow Daoist Zhou. I already said everything is negotiable." The spy forced a smile through gritted teeth.

Li Fan sat back down and said indifferently, "Agreeing to trade with you already poses a significant risk for my organization. Naturally, the benefits must be sufficient."

Using his finger as a pen, he scribbled a few small characters on the stone table and continued, "Forget about contribution points. Some of the Five Elders Association's specialties are very popular in our circles and can serve as bargaining chips."

The spy leaned in to see items listed on the table: *Enlightenment Pills, Samantabhadra True Boat, Carefree Crystals, Human Dao Stardust, and Truth-Defying Fruit...*

His eyelid twitched uncontrollably.

Previously, when Li Fan had infiltrated the Five Elders Association by controlling Jia Xiuyuan's puppet body, he not only gained some private time in Senior Sister Zhao's illusion realm but also developed a decent understanding of the region's general situation and culture.

'Enlightenment Pills' and 'Samantabhadra True Boat' needed no further explanation.

'Human Dao Stardust', a specialty of the 'Humane Dao Heavenly Domain', corresponded to the stars formed by cultivators ascending to the heavens and merging into starlight. By absorbing stardust, one could clearly perceive the process of reshaping the world.

In the Humane Dao Heavenly Domain, the transformation of the heavens and earth followed a framework created by the 'Human Dao Heavenly Sovereign', albeit on a lower tier than the mystical principles of the Xuanhuang Realm. Nevertheless, it was highly valuable for cultivators seeking enlightenment, regardless of their level.

As for the 'Truth-Defying Fruit', it was a unique item from the Realm of Reality.

The fruit could be pre-programmed with specific information, which, once consumed, would warp the consumer's thoughts. They would believe even the most implausible notions as absolute truth.

This ability to turn falsehood into reality made it incredibly potent.

Even Dao Integration cultivators below the Longevity Immortal Realm couldn’t resist its influence.

...

Moving his gaze from the stone table, the spy looked at Li Fan, who sat silently with his eyes closed, and felt his mouth go dry.

"Fellow Daoist Zhou, please wait."

Wiping the sweat from his forehead, he turned away.

This time, it took even longer than before.

His entire body trembled as though enduring some tremendous ordeal.

By the time the sky darkened, he finally reached a decision.

The spy, looking utterly drained and unsteady on his feet, took a deep breath before saying weakly, "Fine. But the quantities of each item must be negotiated further."

Li Fan, who had been resting with his eyes closed, suddenly opened them and smiled.

"Agreed."

What followed was a long bargaining session.

After much haggling, both sides reached an agreement.

The spy gave Li Fan a deep, meaningful look. "Now, it’s time to sign the 'contract'."

At that moment, something unexpected occurred.

Radiant golden light erupted from the spy's body, engulfing him completely and coalescing into a golden 'contract scroll', which hovered silently before Li Fan.

The spy himself dissolved into the light, vanishing entirely.

Suppressing his discomfort, Li Fan picked up the golden scroll and examined it carefully.

The text was written in faint dark-gold characters.

The terms of the agreement matched what had been negotiated, with no discrepancies.

What caught Li Fan's attention was that one side of the contract was left blank for him to sign, while the other bore five enigmatic and ever-shifting symbols.

Although he couldn’t decipher their meaning, Li Fan instinctively understood that these symbols represented the Five Elders Association’s ‘Five Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereigns’.

Recalling the brainwashing scholar’s lecture in the Five Elders Association’s valley, Li Fan had an epiphany.

"This contract seems to be related to the Five Elders Association's 'Soul Contracts'. The principal parties are the Longevity Immortal Sovereigns, though the content differs."

As Li Fan reached out to sign, an indescribable sense of foreboding swept over him.

"Confirm."

He responded inwardly.

The sensation persisted and intensified with each repetition.

On the third confirmation, a golden light shot into the depths of Li Fan's soul, while the rest disappeared into the void.

"The contract is sealed. No one bound by it may break its terms," Li Fan murmured with narrowed eyes.

"Not even the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereigns..."

"Can defy it."

"The only power capable of subduing someone as inscrutable as Senior Sister Zhao must be a similarly formidable Longevity Immortal Sovereign."

"Perhaps even stronger."

With this, Li Fan’s speculations about the Five Elders Association’s final, unknown Longevity Sovereign were finally validated.

It was the binding power of this Sovereign’s contracts that maintained the organization’s stability.

Far away, Li Fan’s main body meditated silently, monitoring his soul for any anomalies after his clone, Zhou Qingang, signed the contract.

Nothing seemed amiss.

Yet deep down, he had a strong premonition:

Should he violate the agreement, the repercussions would reverberate through his entire being, reaching even his main body.

Chapter 570: White Mist’s Surprise Maneuver

Chapter 570: White Mist's Surprise Maneuver

Up until now, Li Fan still hadn’t figured out the exact consequences of violating the contract with the Five Elders Association.

However, he had no intention of testing it out personally.

Every deal he had made with the Five Elders Association had brought him immense profit. Why would he ever willingly break the agreement? On the contrary, he wished for more opportunities like these.

The Five Elders Association’s spy was now reduced to nothing but bones. At the transaction site, only Li Fan remained.

Casually destroying the stone table with engraved characters, “Zhou Qingang” leaped and returned to Congyun City.

On the way back, Li Fan reflected on some oddities during the negotiation process.

Treasures like the 'Truth-Defying Fruit' and 'Human Dao Stardust', valuable even to cultivators in the Dao Integration realm, were offered sparingly by the Five Elders Association. This was understandable to Li Fan.

However, regarding the 'Samantabhadra True Boat', the Five Elders Association was overly stingy, refusing to provide more even when offered compensation with even more precious resources.

This puzzled Li Fan.

After all, the Samantabhadra True Boat was something his puppet body had casually encountered during its travels within the Five Elders Association. It was readily available not too long ago.

How had it suddenly become so valuable?

What had changed?

Li Fan couldn’t make sense of it until “Zhou Qingang” returned to the Administration Hall and happened to glance at the map of the Congyun Sea and its surrounding regions on the wall. Suddenly, inspiration struck.

He stared intently at the natural boundaries marked on the map—the place labeled as the 'White Mist Barrier'—and seemed to have an epiphany.

“The so-called law of supply and demand,” he murmured.

“Although the Samantabhadra True Boat’s actual value isn’t high, if the Five Elders Association is now requisitioning them on a massive scale and experiencing severe shortages...”

“This would explain everything.”

Li Fan’s thoughts raced.

“The Five Elders Association is planning a campaign within the White Mist?”

“Are they using the White Mist Barrier to launch an attack into the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, or are they venturing deeper into the White Mist itself?”

Even Li Fan himself was startled by this sudden hypothesis.

For countless years, cultivators had avoided the White Mist because of its life-draining properties.

Who would have thought of utilizing the White Mist Barriers as natural pathways?

Although the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had long known that Samantabhadra True Leaf could somewhat mitigate the effects of the life-draining mist, this knowledge hadn’t been widely implemented.

This oversight was a major blind spot in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s thinking.

What seemed like an impenetrable and safe White Mist Barrier could, in the next instant, erupt with countless enemy cultivators pouring forth.

This was an utterly terrifying prospect.

“I hope I’m just overthinking things. With the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s many brilliant minds, they must have already prepared for such a possibility…”

“Right?”

In the days that followed, “Zhou Qingang” deliberately kept himself busy.

Requests for meetings that he would have usually rejected outright were now all accepted.

Whenever he had free time, he patrolled the islands across the Congyun Sea.

In just three to four days, he had interacted with hundreds of individuals from various backgrounds and ranks.

This strategy made it nearly impossible for the Five Elders Association to trace his sources of intelligence or uncover traces of the so-called "Heaven-Suppressing Society".

Even if the Five Elders Association had the means to interrogate every person he met through soul-searching techniques, they wouldn’t find anything.

They would never guess that all of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s top secrets originated from Li Fan himself.

On the fifth day, Li Fan, carrying a fragmented formation diagram, ventured alone to the Ten Thousand Treasure Pavilion on Yulan Island.

In a hidden chamber deep within, he met the contact for this transaction.

The person was dressed in black, their face concealed, but Li Fan could tell they weren’t the same individual as the last contact.

“Excellent! Fellow Daoist Zhou is trustworthy, and we won’t disappoint you either,” the black-clad cultivator praised upon seeing Li Fan arrive as promised.

Li Fan asked about the previous Five Elders Association spy.

The black-clad cultivator replied solemnly, “To complete the mission, he chose self-sacrifice. It is our fate and our honor.”

It was clear that the person Li Fan had witnessed dissolving in golden light had truly perished. They had given their life to secure a contract bearing the marks of five Heavenly Sovereigns.

Curiously, there had been no celestial anomaly marking the spy’s death—a mystery Li Fan couldn’t unravel.

Nodding silently, Li Fan handed over a storage ring containing encrypted jade slips.

The black-clad cultivator accepted it with care and said, “Please wait here for a moment, Fellow Daoist Zhou.”

With that, he left the chamber with the ring, destination unknown.

Li Fan closed his eyes and waited patiently.

He wasn’t concerned about the safety of this puppet body.

First, the golden contract prohibited either side from harming the other.

Second, “Zhou Qingang” presented himself as a member of the massive covert organization 'Heaven-Suppressing Society', hidden deep within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Moreover, he was the only link between the Heaven-Suppressing Society and the Five Elders Association.

Unless the Five Elders Association was prepared to sever ties with the Heaven-Suppressing Society entirely, they wouldn’t dare harm him.

Especially when their war with the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance left no room for creating additional enemies.

Still, Li Fan remained vigilant, ready to abandon this puppet body if needed.

The Five Elders Association’s efficiency was remarkable.

In less than the time it took to brew a cup of tea, the black-clad cultivator returned to the chamber.

Although he tried to mask his emotions, the faint excitement in his demeanor was evident.

“Your methods are truly extraordinary. I am impressed!”

“This is what we promised. Please check it.”

The black-clad cultivator handed over a white stone.

“This is…” Li Fan’s eyes flashed.

Fortunately, after searching through the memories stored in the Dao Deviation Stone, he instantly knew what this white stone was.

It was the 'Primordial Void Stone Mother'—a rare, natural storage material.

Compared to ordinary storage rings, it offered significantly larger space. It could also be refined and stored within a cultivator’s body.

An essential material for crafting spatial artifacts, it was both priceless and scarcely available.

This item wasn’t on Li Fan’s list of requested goods. It was clearly provided as a dedicated storage vessel.

Li Fan nodded slightly, opened his mouth, and swallowed the stone directly.

He didn’t immediately refine it but first inspected its contents.

The Five Elders Association had fulfilled their side of the agreement without any shortages: 10,000 Enlightenment Pills, 300 Samantabhadra True Boat, three fragments of Human Dao Stardust—all matched the contract.

Li Fan’s attention focused on a five-colored glowing statue floating amidst the items.

Chapter 571: Recognizing the Dao Path Today

The statue's design was remarkably peculiar.

It had five faces and ten hands, yet shared a single body. Each face displayed a distinct expression:

- One lowered its eyes with compassion, seemingly sorrowful for the world's plight.

- Another bore a stern countenance, glaring with righteous anger.

- One face was slightly furrowed, appearing fragile and pitiful. Yet upon closer inspection, hints of alluring charm and coquettish seduction emerged.

This last face bore a striking resemblance to Senior Sister Zhao.

Li Fan's heart warmed, and a rush of emotions blossomed in his mind, his thoughts veering toward indulgent fantasies.

For a fleeting moment, he could even hear the gentle whispers of Senior Sister Zhao in his ears.

“Something's wrong!”

Alarmed, Li Fan snapped back to reality, breaking free from the illusion, and cold sweat drenched his back.

Looking again, the vivid expressions vanished. What remained were five indistinct and featureless faces on the ten-handed statue.

“What is this?” Li Fan feigned composure as he retrieved the statue.

The black-robed cultivator, upon seeing the multicolored statue in Li Fan's hands, lit up with fervent enthusiasm and explained:

“This is an Manifestation of Heavenly Sovereign Statue, and it is one of the highest-grade types.”

“It embodies the collective will of the five Heavenly Sovereigns. While it cannot grant you direct audience with them, it does allow communication with the *Five Elders Pavilion*.”

“Mundane matters are typically beneath the attention of the Heavenly Sovereigns and are managed by the Five Elders Pavilion.”

“When your actions require the support of the Five Elders Association, you may use the Heavenly Sovereign Statue to relay your message to the pavilion.”

“But it can only be used once. Afterward, the statue will naturally disappear.”

...

Li Fan nodded slowly as he listened to the explanation.

After scrutinizing the ten-handed statue one last time, he stored it in the *Primordial Void Stone Mother*.

With the transaction complete, Li Fan was preparing to leave.

“Wait, Fellow Daoist!”

The black-robed cultivator suddenly called out, stopping him.

“What is it?” Li Fan narrowed his eyes, his expression turning wary.

The black-robed cultivator waved his hands hastily. “Haha, don’t misunderstand, my friend. I merely have a small favor to ask. Of course, the reward will be more than sufficient!”

“What is it?” Li Fan’s expression softened slightly, his tone remaining indifferent.

The black-robed cultivator handed over a slip of paper. Li Fan accepted it and glanced at the contents, which detailed a peculiar request:

About a year ago, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance discovered an ancient slumbering cultivator from the ruins of the Ancient Purple Heaven Sect.

The Five Elders Association hoped to enlist the 'Heaven-Suppressing Society' to investigate the cultivator’s true identity and current whereabouts.

The name "Purple Heaven Sect" caught Li Fan’s attention, stirring something within him.

“This is a *small* favor?” Li Fan let out a cold snort, his finger igniting a flame that instantly reduced the slip of paper to ashes.

The black-robed cultivator chuckled awkwardly.

“We’ll do what we can. We make no guarantees—this task is as challenging as deciphering formation diagrams.”

Li Fan turned and left, leaving behind a single echoing remark in the chamber.

The black-robed cultivator’s eyes narrowed thoughtfully at those words.

---

On his return journey, Li Fan remained exceptionally vigilant. After all, he now carried a treasure of great value and could not afford to be careless.

Fortunately, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance maintained a relatively secure environment. No one attempted to rob or kill him for his possession.

"Zhou Qingang" smoothly returned to the Congyun Immortal City.

Only once he was completely safe did Li Fan sense the fulfillment of the contract.

The agreement, which prohibited both parties from harming each other, was now void.

Simultaneously, he felt a strange sense of loss, as though something within him had vanished into thin air.

Despite much contemplation, Li Fan could not discern the nature of the "contract's" power and eventually gave up.

He did not immediately examine the results of the trade stored in the 'Primordial Void Stone Mother'. Instead, he reflected on the Five Elders Association’s request.

When he first heard terms like “Purple Heaven Sect” and “slumbering cultivator,” the name “Zhang Qianmo” instinctively flashed through his mind.

In fact, Li Fan had long been aware of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's practice of excavating ancient sect ruins to search for slumbering cultivators.

Around the 11th year, he had commissioned Jiao Xiuyuan to locate the 'Little Medicine King Cauldron', but no updates were ever provided. Upon inquiry, Jiao Xiuyuan revealed a scene he had observed and shared his speculations.

Li Fan had instructed him to investigate the identity of this ancient cultivator.

Unfortunately, two years had passed without any results. This alone illustrated the extraordinary difficulty of the matter.

Jiao Xiuyuan, with a cultivation level potentially nearing Dao Integration, had clones spread across the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and access to a wealth of intelligence.

Yet even he could do nothing regarding this matter...

"Perhaps it may not necessarily be Senior Brother Zhang."

"Senior Brother Zhang cultivates the Purple Core Nirvana Technique, constantly reincarnating. By now, he should have reincarnated as that 'Martial Fanatic Child.'"

"Such a supreme technique shouldn’t have such a glaring flaw."

"If his original body still exists while he reincarnates, it would be tantamount to exposing his lifeline to danger."

After analyzing the situation, Li Fan dismissed his previous speculation.

"In that case, besides Senior Brother Zhang, who else from the Purple Heaven Sect could have survived until now?"

Thinking it over, Li Fan couldn’t come to a clear conclusion.

One must know that in ancient times, the Purple Heaven Sect was merely a second-rate sect.

The sect lacked a Longevity Immortal Realm powerhouse, and even Dao Integration cultivators were only a handful.

Based on the memories of Li Chen, whom he had possessed at the time, the elders of the sect didn’t seem like people capable of traversing eons and surviving to the present.

"Currently, I have discarded my identity as a 'Heavenly Mechanism Sect cultivator' and don’t carry any items with me, so I can’t contact Jiao Xiuyuan for now."

"I’ll wait until after the great battle to deal with it."

After pondering for a moment, Li Fan temporarily set the matter aside.

He retrieved a piece of 'Human Dao Stardust' from the Mother Stone and placed it before him.

After swallowing a Dao Enlightenment Pill, he began to examine it.

The seemingly ordinary black stone emitted a silver starlight.

When touched with spiritual sense, countless images instantly appeared in his mind.

It was the story of a female cultivator, who, driven by great determination, spent 500 years cultivating to ultimately win back the affections of her beloved.

It was a mundane tale of unrequited love, common in the world.

However, unlike many similar stories, this female cultivator paid the price of ascending into a star for her single-minded love.

As a result, the male cultivator she pined for finally fell in love with her.

For the remainder of his life, he gazed at the starry sky daily, shedding tears of regret and sorrow.

Li Fan remained expressionless and decisively swapped it for another piece of Human Dao Stardust.

This time, the story contained within the stardust was somewhat more normal.

It was about a cultivator who, after witnessing his close kin suffer due to lack of aptitude, unable to expel the miasma within their bodies and doomed to an early death, resolved to make cultivation accessible to all.

Unfortunately, this ambition was too grand to realize.

So, he narrowed his goal from "all of humanity" to "his family."

When this cultivator ascended to the heavens, his family flourished, producing countless geniuses.

Within a century, they rose to become a dominant power in the region.

"Reversing aptitude, is it?"

A glimmer of light flashed in Li Fan’s eyes as spiritual power gathered in his palm. He suddenly exerted force, crushing the black stone into powder.

The silver starlight was entirely absorbed by him.

In an instant, countless indescribable insights flooded his mind.

The principles of the heavens intertwined into a vast web, forming the order that governs the world.

One thread in particular stood out vividly in Li Fan’s vision.

It seemed within reach, with even its intricate, profound patterns clearly visible.

In an instant, this "thin thread" filled his entire view.

The "thin thread" became as massive as a pillar supporting the heavens.

The magnificent aura emanating from it intoxicated Li Fan, unraveling many previously incomprehensible mysteries in a flash of understanding.

He also noticed countless fine threads connecting his body to the towering pillar.

As he focused on these indistinct, ethereal threads, an epiphany dawned upon him.

Though he now appeared to be a puppet manipulated by the "pillar" via these threads, someday, if his strength were sufficient, he might reverse the control, using the threads to manipulate the pillar instead.

"So this is what it means to defy the laws of heaven..."

An overwhelming sense of joy surged within him, causing even Li Fan, deep in seclusion within the Congyun Sea Trench, to tremble with excitement.

After reincarnating for a hundred lifetimes, the path to eternal life was now within reach.

Though knowing and achieving were worlds apart, the harvest of this moment filled Li Fan with immense satisfaction.

Immersed in his thoughts, he lost track of time.

When the Human Dao Stardust was completely consumed, and he emerged from his enlightenment, he felt an insatiable yearning.

In a daze, he spent half a day reminiscing before regaining clarity.

When he instinctively checked the time, Li Fan was astonished to discover that what felt like a brief moment to him had been nearly a year in the outside world.

"No wonder Longevity Immortal Realm powerhouses disdain worldly affairs. Now I understand what 'cultivation transcends the flow of time' truly means."

"And this was just a partial glimpse of the laws of heaven through the Human Dao Stardust."

"If one were to fully comprehend the laws of heaven, they might lose decades in a single retreat."

Li Fan couldn’t help but sigh inwardly.

After savoring the experience for a while, he began reviewing the events that had transpired during his year-long retreat.

The communication talisman from Zhou Qingang was nearly bursting with messages from He Zhenghao and others.

Li Fan didn’t respond immediately but instead chose to prioritize the important ones.

The war in Tianling Prefecture hadn’t yet concluded but had significantly de-escalated.

Thus, cultivators began receiving news from the battlefield.

The Xuantian Spirit Locking Formation diagram submitted by Li Fan had an immediate effect.

Just ten days after the trade was finalized, during a medium-scale skirmish, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance attempted to replicate their earlier tactics, using the 'Tianxuan Spirit Locking Formation' to crush and slaughter the Five Elders Association’s forces.

However, they hadn’t expected the other side to be fully prepared.

Every cultivator was surrounded by a red protective glow.

When green and red lights merged, nothing unusual occurred.

While the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance was caught off guard, a brutal close-quarters battle ensued.

Chapter 572: Flourishing Times Give Rise to a Hundred Worms

The events and results of this battle, though deliberately downplayed by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, can still be discerned through the series of actions taken afterward.

Newly issued offensive orders were hastily rescinded; directives were sent to all states, commanding them to fortify their defenses against infiltration by Five Elders Association cultivators. States were strictly prohibited from initiating conflict, with current missions focused primarily on defense.

Deployment orders to the frontlines also became increasingly frequent.

"Changing orders on a whim—what a slapdash operation!"

Almost overnight, the strategy underwent a complete 180-degree turn, prompting widespread complaints among the alliance cultivators. However, out of fear of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's overwhelming authority, no one dared voice their grievances openly. Such frustrations were only vented in private gatherings.

The progress of war was not subject to the will of cultivators.

What once seemed an overwhelming advantage quickly transformed into a stalemate between the two sides.

As the external war faltered, internal chaos also erupted.

At the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance headquarters, it was rumored that many high-ranking cultivators were dismissed and placed under investigation. Even long-serving, influential Dao Integration cultivators were not spared.

However, the reasons for their interrogations remained unknown.

Even when these cultivators were released—visibly weakened and clearly tortured—they remained tight-lipped, refusing to discuss the matter regardless of the questions posed.

This only served to spread suspicion and panic, as no one wanted to be the next person dragged off for mysterious interrogations.

Li Fan, however, knew the truth. The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance was searching for a mole who didn’t exist.

No matter how hard they tried, they would never suspect that the one responsible for leaking the Tianxuan Spirit-Locking Formation was a minor Golden Core cultivator in a remote area on the alliance's outskirts—none other than Li Fan himself.

Thus, this investigation was destined to lead nowhere.

In the end, it would likely conclude with a few unfortunate scapegoats tortured into confessing crimes they never committed, just to wrap things up.

And on Li Fan's growing list of the injured, there would once again be the names of innocents.

After roughly understanding the course of the past year's events, Li Fan turned his attention to the many messages that He Zhenghao had sent to "Zhou Qingang."

Most of them were inquiries and reminders about when he would emerge from seclusion.

At the start, the messages were frequent, but as time passed, they gradually dwindled—perhaps due to resignation or some other reason.

“The Lord Envoy is deeply secluded, and now you’re doing the same.”

“I can’t even reach anyone.”

“Now look, everyone’s following the trend. One by one, they’ve destroyed their communication talismans and claimed to have gone into seclusion.”

“At this rate, we won’t even be able to gather ten administrative staff in Congyun City’s Administration Hall! How am I supposed to explain this to the lord envoy when he returns?!”

He Zhenghao lamented bitterly, but Li Fan merely sneered.

"Do you even acknowledge me as the Lord Secret Envoy anymore?"

Unconcerned with the ramblings of someone soon to die, Li Fan swiftly erased the messages in his communication talisman and left his secluded chamber, quietly appearing in the main hall of the Administration Hall.

---

In the hall, a conversation was underway:

"Brother Gao, the position of Pill Hall Quality Inspector has recently opened up. Someone offered me 50,000 contribution points for it. What do you think?"

"I think it's too low—at least 80,000."

"After all, just recently, the position of Drill Sergeant in the Martial Arts Hall went for a full 130,000 contributions. This time..."

The discussion abruptly stopped when they noticed another person in the room.

Awkwardly, He Zhenghao turned to look at "Zhou Qingang," his face flushed with embarrassment. Gao Yuan, however, narrowed his eyes slightly, showing no signs of panic at being caught in the act of trading positions for personal gain. Instead, he smiled warmly and greeted "Zhou Qingang" naturally:

"Daoist Zhou, long time no see! Perfect timing—you can help us decide!"

He then candidly recounted their scheme of selling vacant positions in Congyun City, eagerly awaiting "Zhou Qingang's" opinion.

The move not only dissolved the initial awkwardness but also subtly drew Zhou Qingang into their circle. Even Li Fan, who had spent centuries navigating the bureaucratic intricacies of the immortal world, couldn’t help but silently commend the tactic.

Smiling faintly, he looked at the two but didn’t act like a righteous whistleblower intent on exposing them. Instead, after a moment of mock deliberation, he slammed the table:

"80,000 contribution points?"

"Too low! One price—160,000 contribution points! Take it or leave it!"

The sudden doubling of the price left He Zhenghao dumbfounded.

After a brief pause, he recovered and chuckled wryly, trying to reason: "Fellow Daoist Zhou, you might not be aware of the current market conditions after your seclusion."

"The position of [Pill Hall] Quality Inspector can only fetch, at most, 80,000. After all, we're not the only ones in Congyun Sea selling positions. Buyers come to us because it's cheaper here and can serve as a stepping stone."

"But if we double the price like this..."

He Zhenghao shook his head. "Why would anyone pay so much when they could go to Luoyan Prefecture or some other more prosperous region?"

Gao Yuan also nodded in agreement.

Li Fan sneered at the two, his eyes brimming with disdain. "I’m out of touch? Or are you two the ones who don’t understand the current situation?"

The change in "Zhou Qingang’s" demeanor was stark—completely unlike his usual measured and steady self.

Gao Yuan and He Zhenghao exchanged glances, their expressions filled with doubt. Something didn’t add up.

Cautiously, He Zhenghao leaned forward and asked, "Fellow Daoist Zhou, what do you mean?"

Ignoring him, "Zhou Qingang" directed his gaze coldly at Gao Yuan, who briefly flashed a look of anger before suppressing it and putting on a polite smile.

Finally, Li Fan spoke, his tone deliberate:

"The war in Tianling Prefecture is nearing its end, and hostilities are about to cease. Your little scheme of buying and selling official positions under the cover of wartime chaos is almost over!"

---

This revelation left Gao Yuan and He Zhenghao truly stunned.

Their shock was no longer feigned.

In the brief silence that followed, disbelief flashed in their eyes.

"But Fellow Daoist Zhou," He Zhenghao quickly asked, "there's been no news of this. How could you know?"

Gao Yuan chimed in, "Indeed, such matters concern the entire alliance, and Fellow Daoist Zhou mustn’t speak lightly."

Li Fan's cold gaze swept over them.

"How do I know?" he sneered. "Naturally, Lord Secret Envoy himself informed me!"

Chapter 573: Greed Before All

“Lord Secret Envoy!”

“Lord Secret Envoy!”

...

Zhou Qingang's voice wasn’t loud, but when it reached He Zhenghao and Gao Yuan’s ears, it was like a thunderclap.

He Zhenghao was stunned for a moment, his face immediately turning pale. “Lord Secret Envoy has emerged from seclusion? How come I wasn’t informed?”

Gao Yuan also appeared utterly shocked, his expression full of disbelief.

However, what Zhou Qingang said next offered them a sliver of relief.

“The Secret Envoy has not yet emerged,” Zhou Qingang said lightly. “But if anyone thinks their petty schemes can escape the attention of the Secret Envoy in seclusion, that would be laughable.”

His words were filled with implication as he cast a sharp gaze at the two men.

He Zhenghao, feeling guilty, laughed awkwardly. “We all know the Secret Envoy possesses heaven-penetrating abilities; none of us would dare to deceive him!”

Gao Yuan, previously calm and confident, now broke into a cold sweat. His mind raced for a countermeasure as he hastily echoed He Zhenghao’s words.

Li Fan, seeing their feigned ignorance, sneered inwardly.

He raised his voice and sternly rebuked:

“You two, embezzling the recruitment funds behind the Secret Envoy’s back; behaving recklessly while he’s away; treating the laws of the Immortal Alliance as if they’re nothing; selling official positions for massive profits…”

“Do you really think such acts can escape the all-seeing eyes of the Secret Envoy?”

“How could you be so foolish?”

He Zhenghao, struck as if by lightning, trembled uncontrollably. Gao Yuan’s face turned ashen, his mouth opening and closing without forming a single word.

“Hmph! Don’t be deceived by the fact that the Secret Envoy outwardly appears to be only at the Golden Core stage. You both should know his true power is terrifying.”

“While he might not claim to know all things without leaving his chambers, do you really believe the filth within this tiny Congyun Sea can elude his discerning gaze?” Li Fan declared with pride.

“Since the time, He Zhenghao, when you privately pocketed unclaimed recruitment funds, the Secret Envoy has been watching you.”

Hearing this, He Zhenghao’s legs gave out, and he collapsed to the ground.

“I...” He Zhenghao tried to defend himself, but his voice was bitter, unable to muster an excuse.

Zhou Qing'ang sighed lightly.

“However, the Secret Envoy doesn’t care about such minor contributions. After all, you were the first to follow him upon his awakening. He chose to turn a blind eye, considering it a reward for your hard work.”

“But the things you’ve done over the past two years have deeply disappointed him.”

Zhou Qingang’s tone turned cold:

“Selling official titles—is it wrong? Many in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance do the same. The Secret Envoy is not ignorant of human nature and wouldn’t oppose it outright.”

“If you had openly applied to the Secret Envoy to profit from such actions, he might have even lent you a hand!”

“But your grave mistake was acting on your own in everything. The wealth you’ve amassed from selling positions likely exceeds a million contribution points.”

“Did you ever report even once to the Secret Envoy? These acts violate the laws of the Immortal Alliance. If they were exposed one day, the higher-ups would surely hold the Secret Envoy, as Congyun City’s highest-ranking official, accountable.”

“Your greed is bad enough, but implicating the Secret Envoy as a scapegoat? Your intentions are truly despicable!” Zhou Qingang roared.

He Zhenghao, still sitting on the ground, felt aggrieved.

He wanted to argue, saying that the Secret Envoy himself had warned them not to disturb him without urgent matters. How could he possibly report illegal actions like embezzlement? Was he supposed to court death?

But no matter how valid his reasoning, it was useless to say it now.

Looking back on his actions over the past two years, He Zhenghao felt as though he had been dreaming.

The contribution points he had worked so hard to earn and cherished deeply now appeared as mere numbers in his eyes, devoid of real value. Even spending hundreds of thousands of points in an instant no longer fazed him.

The vast sums under his control had unknowingly changed his mindset.

Originally, he had sworn to follow the Secret Envoy—rumored to be a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign who had fallen in cultivation—and to achieve great things under his leadership. He had hoped to return triumphantly to Tianyu Prefecture and reconcile with Heng Ruoshui.

But as time passed, he became lost in the flattery of others and the seemingly endless stream of contribution points. He forgot his lofty ambitions and focused solely on gaining more through unscrupulous means to indulge himself.

“Why must it be Heng Ruoshui?” he once thought. “With enough contribution points, what kind of female cultivator could I not have?”

Now, thinking back, he found it laughable.

At the time, though, he had been hopelessly ensnared in greed.

Scenes from the past flashed through his mind. He Zhenghao, drenched in sweat, felt as though he had just been pulled from water.

“How did I become like this?” He Zhenghao felt nothing but regret and bewilderment.

“Will the Secret Envoy show me any mercy?” He shivered, imagining his demise at the hands of Li Fan.

Yet, a glimmer of hope remained in his heart. The logic was simple: if the Secret Envoy had already decided to punish him, why bother sending Zhou Qing'ang to say so much?

His patient persuasion and his earlier mention of "doubling the 160,000 contribution points" suggested there might still be room for negotiation.

Thinking of this, He Zhenghao raised his head to look at Zhou Qingang.

Li Fan, noticing He Zhenghao’s long silence and the despair in his eyes, saw him suddenly look up. Smiling faintly, Li Fan spoke again:

“Although your crimes are severe, you were among the first to follow the Lord Secret Envoy.”

“Therefore, the Secret Envoy has decided to give you one last chance to redeem yourselves.”

These words ignited a flicker of hope in both He Zhenghao and Gao Yuan’s eyes.

“Please guide us!” Gao Yuan quickly bowed and asked.

“As I mentioned earlier, the war in Tianling Prefecture is nearing its end.”

“The Secret Envoy’s instructions are simple…” Li Fan paused before continuing resolutely:

“Seize this final opportunity.”

“Take as much as you can!”

His unwavering tone echoed throughout the hall.

Hearing this, the two men exchanged bewildered glances, doubt creeping onto their faces as they turned to Zhou Qingang.

Chapter 574: Catching Everything in One Net

“Did the lord truly say that?” He Zhenghao asked, somewhat hesitantly.

Gao Yuan also seemed skeptical. “Everyone knows that the Lord Envoy’s mastery of divination techniques is extraordinary. If he wanted to amass wealth, there are countless methods at his disposal. Why would he stoop to such actions? It’s beneath his status!”
