"Zhou Qingang" snorted at their reactions. “The Lord Envoy’s ambitions are not something the likes of you two could fathom.”

“But fine, to put your doubts at ease, I’ll reveal a little more of the inside story.”

Lowering his voice, Zhou Qingang whispered, “The Lord Envoy not only foresaw that the war in Tianling Prefecture is about to end, but he also predicted that after the war, to restore vitality and expedite recovery, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance will issue a decree.”

“What decree?” He Zhenghao and Gao Yuan perked up, eagerly listening.

Zhou Qingang slowly continued, “Every cultivator in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance will be allowed to purchase techniques from the Tianxuan Mirror at a discount.”

“Although divination involving artifacts like the Tianxuan Mirror may result in minor discrepancies, according to the Lord Envoy, this outcome is highly likely.”

“Discounted techniques?” The two gasped audibly upon hearing this.

After reflecting, however, they realized it wasn’t without precedent.

The last time such an event occurred was centuries ago, and only a few elder cultivators had ever mentioned it.

For cultivators, the contribution points required to purchase techniques are one of the largest expenditures in their careers. Techniques often cost tens of thousands or even hundreds of thousands of contribution points—a figure insignificant to someone like He Zhenghao, but for most cultivators, it’s a fortune accumulated at great personal cost.

If the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance truly reopens discounted purchases of techniques—even at a 20% discount—it would save an enormous amount of contribution points during this period. It’s easy to imagine how frenzied the cultivators would become. Borrowing or selling off assets to gather enough points to buy techniques would be inevitable.

After considering this, He Zhenghao’s eyes lit up. He faintly sensed a tremendous opportunity, though his exact plan to capitalize on it remained unclear. Scratching his head, he grew increasingly restless and urged, “Fellow Daoist Zhou, stop teasing us. Tell us the details!”

Zhou Qingang smirked. “It’s simple! First, spread rumors that the war is ending and everything is returning to normal.”

“Opportunities like this don’t come twice. If anyone still wants to use contribution points to secure a position or rank, now is the time. Such chances won’t come again!”

“Of course, slightly increasing prices is entirely reasonable, isn’t it?”

“Second, announce the relaunch of the fundraising campaign, but make it grander this time.”

“This time, set the term to five years with a promised 200% return. Moreover, allow contribution points to be invested without an upper limit!”

As the person who had been managing the fundraising campaigns, He Zhenghao couldn’t help but twitch at these words.

A 200% return in five years was entirely achievable in his mind, especially with the Lord Envoy’s abilities. Considering the prior fundraising successes and the Lord Envoy’s high-ranking position as a Secret Envoy of Congyun City, this unrestricted fundraising campaign would undoubtedly attract unimaginable contributions.

Particularly those cultivators who had missed out on the previous opportunities due to various reasons—they would scramble to invest at the first hint of this news.

After all, five years isn’t long. Many cultivators could easily retreat into closed-door cultivation, and by the time they emerged, their wealth would have tripled.

Opportunities like this are rarer than a lantern in the dark!

Moreover, with Li Fan as the highest administrator of the Congyun Sea region, there was no risk of him fleeing with the contributions.

“But this...” Gao Yuan noticed the ruthlessness in this plan, his gaze flickering with unease.

“Indeed. Both methods aim to empty the cultivators’ pockets in the shortest time possible,” Zhou Qingang said smugly. “Once they’ve handed over all their hard-earned savings, they’ll hear about the Alliance’s discounted technique policy.”

“They’ll recognize it as a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity, yet have no contribution points left to act.”

“What’s that? Want to withdraw your investment? Sure, but the penalty fees must be paid, right?”

“Even if they’re broke, we’ll accept collateral—artifacts, rare materials, anything will do.”

“And if they’re desperate to buy discounted techniques, we could even lend them points! With interest, of course. A modest 20% per year—how reasonable!”

…

Zhou Qingang grinned wickedly as he elaborated, leaving He Zhenghao and Gao Yuan drenched in cold sweat.

When Zhou Qingang finally finished his lengthy explanation, Gao Yuan couldn’t help but ask, “The Lord Envoy’s plan is brilliant, but I have one question. Please enlighten me, Daoist Zhou.”

Zhou Qingang tilted his head, silently pondering before replying, “We’ve worked together for years, Brother Gao. Speak freely.”

“In my understanding of the Lord Envoy’s character, he doesn’t seem overly concerned with wealth. Why the sudden shift to such large-scale operations?”

He Zhenghao agreed. “Indeed, could it be that the Lord Envoy has deeper motives? I, too, believe he wouldn’t go to such lengths merely for contribution points.”

Zhou Qingang remained silent for a long time, seemingly deep in thought. Seeing this, He Zhenghao and Gao Yuan felt their suspicions confirmed, their anticipation growing.

After a while, Zhou Qingang finally made a decision. Using divine sense to transmit his voice, he said, “The Lord Envoy did not explicitly state this to me; it’s merely my own speculation.”

“Take it as an amusing guess, and do not treat it seriously!”

The two quickly nodded, promising discretion.

“It’s highly likely that Immortal Monarchs Hongxi and Ziyun are returning to the Congyun Sea.”

He Zhenghao and Gao Yuan were stunned, clarity dawning on them instantly.

“Not just that. The Nascent Soul cultivators previously dispatched from the Tianji Hall and Formation Hall of the Ten Thousand Immortal Island are likely returning soon.”

“The Lord Envoy, after all, was appointed from above and has shallow roots here. Furthermore, his own cultivation is only at the Golden Core stage. Facing those seasoned Nascent Soul cultivators, he might find it hard to maintain his authority.”

“Thus, the Lord Envoy plans to use this opportunity to consolidate his influence. If my guess is correct, when they return, he’ll likely forgive the cultivators’ debts to win their loyalty.”

“And if my guess is wrong, the Lord Envoy will still profit immensely, suffering no loss either way.”

Chapter 575: The Endgame of Congyun Sea

“Zhou Qingang” explained his reasoning methodically. Upon hearing this, Gao Yuan couldn’t help but slap the table in admiration, exclaiming, “If this plan succeeds, nearly all the cultivators of the Congyun Sea will owe a debt of gratitude to the esteemed Lord Envoy.”

“Even if the two Soul Transformation Immortal Monarchs, Hongxi and Ziyun, return, they will have to carefully consider the consequences of opposing the Lord Envoy.”

“Our lord’s foresight is truly unparalleled, strategizing not just one step ahead, but a hundred steps. It’s beyond the comprehension of ordinary minds.”

The seemingly simple wealth accumulation plan turned out to have so many intricate layers that He Zhenghao couldn’t help but marvel at its brilliance.

Both men were deeply impressed.

However, they failed to notice a critical flaw in the seemingly flawless plan.

The key issue was whether Li Fan could genuinely achieve the promised “200% returns within five years” after absorbing an astronomical amount of contributions.

Perhaps it was because of Li Fan’s prior demonstrations of incredible, seemingly impossible abilities, which had subtly brainwashed them.

Or perhaps they had filled in the gaps of their imagination, believing Li Fan to be a fallen Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign. Their trust in his abilities had reached a point where they no longer doubted him.

Ultimately, they harbored no skepticism about Li Fan’s ability to achieve the goals of this fundraising plan.

After all, what’s a mere threefold return in five years?

How could such a thing stump the revered Lord Secret Envoy?

But in reality...

Even if Li Fan had reincarnated countless times in the Congyun Sea, possessing unparalleled foresight, this time, it was truly beyond his capabilities.

It wasn’t a question of his ability but a practical limitation. Once an asset base grows to a certain scale, doubling it becomes exponentially harder.

To put it bluntly, Li Fan was merely a speculator, profiting from buying low and selling high.

He was not a creator of wealth.

Unlike the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance, he couldn’t generate contribution points infinitely and without restriction.

While he might manage to double a few million contribution points through skillful maneuvering, if the amount reached several billion or more...

Unless another unprecedented war broke out between the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance and the Five Elders Association—one he could anticipate in advance—it would be impossible.

But it didn’t matter that he couldn’t deliver.

After all, from the beginning, he had never intended to fulfill the promised returns.

That’s why the fundraising plan was set to be closed for five years.

By the time five years passed, the Crimson Flame would engulf the Congyun Sea, reducing it to a wasteland.

With everyone dead, there would be no need to repay the debts.

Instead of letting the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance reclaim the contribution points, it was better to let Li Fan make use of them.

Thus, Li Fan carried no psychological burden.

As for the return of Lan Cang, Hao Xuan, and a group of Nascent Soul cultivators, while true, it was merely rhetoric to deceive He Zhenghao and Gao Yuan.

Whether they returned or not, Li Fan genuinely didn’t care.

If they dared return to the Congyun Sea, they would not escape the fate of death.

However, Li Fan did hope that some of the formation masters he was more familiar with, such as Zhang Zhiliang, could survive a little longer in this world.

These thoughts flashed through his mind. At this moment, “Zhou Qingang” turned to He Zhenghao and Gao Yuan and said, “You two have already disappointed the Lord Envoy once. Don’t waste this final chance to redeem yourselves!”

“You must ensure that the Lord Envoy’s plan is executed flawlessly.”

Both men nodded in agreement.

They were fully aware that if the two Soul Transformation Immortal Monarchs returned and Li Fan lost power, their fate, as members of Li Fan’s inner circle, would be dire.

Setting aside loyalty, even for their own survival, they had to give it their all this time.

However, Gao Yuan, being more cautious, hesitated for a moment. Before leaving, he cautiously asked Zhou Qingang, “Fellow Daoist Zhou, do you have the Lord Envoy’s token?”

“It’s not that we distrust you, but the stakes are simply too high…”

Zhou Qingang chuckled, about to reply, when two peculiar fluctuations suddenly emanated from the storage rings of He Zhenghao and Gao Yuan.

Both men’s faces changed as they recalled something.

They quickly retrieved the source of the anomaly: two 'Divine Spirit Jade Slip' that Li Fan had entrusted to them before entering seclusion.

The two jade slips merged in midair, forming a faint humanoid figure.

Li Fan’s voice echoed, “What you’ve said is not unreasonable. This matter is indeed significant enough to warrant my personal involvement.”

Seeing Li Fan suddenly appear, He Zhenghao and Gao Yuan panicked, immediately falling to their knees and exclaiming, “Greetings, Lord Secret Envoy!”

Their hearts raced with fear.

Li Fan’s words implied that their entire conversation with Zhou Qingang had been observed by the Lord Envoy from beginning to end!

In fact, it seemed every move they made since Li Fan had entered seclusion was under his control.

Terrified, the two prostrated themselves, heads touching the ground, not daring to move until Li Fan gave them permission.

“He Zhenghao!”

“Present!” He Zhenghao quickly responded.

“Select some representatives from the cultivators who participated in the previous fundraising plan. Arrange a meeting in ten days so I can personally explain the details of the five-year plan and reassure everyone.” Li Fan’s voice was steady and commanding.

Receiving this order, He Zhenghao felt a glimmer of relief and promptly agreed.

“Gao Yuan!”

“Present!” Gao Yuan’s voice trembled.

“Compile a list of the Congyun Sea cultivators who perished in the recent war in Tianling Prefecture. Submit it to me in ten days.”

Gao Yuan quickly agreed as well.

The light from the Divine Spirit Jade Slip grew dim, eventually fading away entirely.

The jade slip fell to the ground with a soft thud, accompanied by Li Fan’s final words:

“Remember, in my absence, Zhou Qingang has full authority to act on my behalf.”

“His words are my orders!”

Zhou Qingang bowed slightly, expressing gratitude to the Lord Envoy, a faint smirk betraying his sense of triumph.

He Zhenghao and Gao Yuan felt a pang of regret and jealousy.

“The trust of the Lord Envoy was supposed to belong to us!”

Yet they dared not complain, obediently carrying out their orders.

With Li Fan personally confirming the plan, He Zhenghao and Gao Yuan diligently executed his will, terrified of failure.

Years of careful management had given the two better control over Congyun Sea City than Li Fan himself.

Under their direction, news of the imminent conclusion of the great war and the new fundraising plan spread throughout the cultivators of the Congyun Sea within a single day.

The revelations caused a great stir, leaving many unsettled.

Countless messages were sent to He Zhenghao, inquiring about the truth of the situation.

He Zhenghao naturally embellished the story further.

Thus, ten days later, a gathering of cultivators eagerly awaited Li Fan’s arrival.

Chapter 576: The Final Bluff

Liuli Island.

He Zhenghao gazed at the island he had guarded for decades. Turning to the timid, bowing successor beside him, who nodded obsequiously, he couldn't help but feel a surge of pride.

Once upon a time, he too had been like this young man—anxious and uneasy whenever superiors came to inspect. He had been terrified of making mistakes that would incur their wrath.

Yet now, in just a few years, he had become the kind of "big shot" he once looked up to with fear and reverence.

Encouraging the young successor, Zhao Changli, with a few words of advice, He Zhenghao confidently entered the 'Mountain-River Star Formation'.

The mountains overhead shielded the gathering from prying eyes.

Inside, cultivators invited by He Zhenghao had already been waiting for some time.

"Fellow Daoist He!"

As soon as He Zhenghao appeared, they warmly greeted him. To them, if Li Fan was the God of Wealth, then He Zhenghao was the epitome of a generous distributor of fortune.

After exchanging pleasantries, one impatient cultivator asked, "Fellow Daoist He, is it true what the Lord Envoy deduced? That the war is about to end? There’s no sign of it. Just today, I heard the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance vowed to fight to the bitter end…"

Before he could finish, others interrupted, voices clamoring:

"The Lord Envoy’s divination techniques are unfathomable and flawless! If you don’t believe, why bother coming here today?"

"Heh, Fellow Daoist He, ignore him. Tell us more about this open-ended fundraising plan!"

He Zhenghao raised his hands for silence, and the room quieted instantly.

With a gentle smile, he began explaining the details.

Hearing He Zhenghao personally confirm the matter, the cultivators were ecstatic. However, the scale of the fundraising effort was so enormous that even He Zhenghao couldn’t fully reassure everyone. Doubts lingered among some.

It was then that Li Fan made his entrance.

A silver light descended from the sky, spilling through the mountain peaks.

Li Fan, clad in a white Daoist robe, stepped gracefully on starlight. His seemingly leisurely pace brought him to the gathering in an instant.

From him emanated rhythmic waves of power, instantly drawing everyone's attention.

The cultivators present were all seasoned and well-off individuals, invited here because of their stature. Yet even they were deeply shaken by the lingering aura emanating from Li Fan.

It was as though they were standing in the presence of the infinite mysteries of the universe. Even the slightest touch sparked profound insights in their minds.

One cultivator, his face alight with joy, seemed to experience sudden enlightenment. Without regard for the setting, he closed his eyes and began meditating on the spot.

"What kind of power is this? Even a Soul Transformation True Monarch wouldn’t match up!"

"Could it be that the Lord Envoy has recovered his original cultivation realm?"

The crowd exchanged uneasy glances, struggling to contain their astonishment.

“I’ve recently emerged from seclusion with some minor, insignificant breakthroughs,” Li Fan said softly, “but I’ve yet to fully adapt and suppress these changes. Forgive me for the disruption.”

The crowd trembled inwardly, their imaginations running wild, hastily assuring him there was no offense.

Li Fan nodded slightly, waiting for the room to quiet down before speaking again.

“During this seclusion, not only have I advanced in cultivation, but I’ve also managed to repair the treasured artifact of my Heavenly Mechanism Sect—the 'Heaven and Earth Divination Dice'.”

“This artifact was damaged during a forced divination at the Martial Hall. Though repairing it was no great challenge, I had a premonition that the time wasn’t right, so I delayed.”

He spoke as a crystalline 20-sided die materialized in his hand, spinning and revealing fleeting glimpses of countless images within its translucent surfaces.

“Recently, my cultivation bore fruit, and I was struck with sudden inspiration. Realizing the time had come, I repaired it completely. During this process, I glimpsed a faint thread of the future.”

The crowd grew tense, listening intently.

“Hongxi and Ziyun, the two Soul Transformation True Monarchs, may soon return to Congyun Immortal City. You know, while I currently oversee the Congyun Sea, it’s only because these two are temporarily absent. When they return, both propriety and law demand I relinquish power.”

Li Fan’s expression remained calm, as though recounting a matter unrelated to himself.

“When that happens, I will likely resign from my position as Secret Envoy and depart from the Congyun Sea to wander the Immortal Alliance’s heartlands.”

“I’ve governed this region for a time, forming a connection with all of you. My success in rebuilding the Immortal City would not have been possible without your support.

“Thus, I’ve decided to help you one last time before my departure.”

Sweeping his gaze across the crowd, Li Fan declared, “After this, our fates will be severed, and we may never cross paths again.”

The announcement caused a stir.

None among them were naive. Though Li Fan claimed he was relinquishing power to avoid disputes, his actions suggested otherwise. If he truly intended to leave, he could simply step down. Why stage such a grandiose fundraising campaign and rally support?

“So that’s it! He’s laying the groundwork for a power grab, seeking our backing!”

“Well, it’s only natural. Ceding the leadership of an entire region isn’t so easy, after all.”

Connecting the dots, many cultivators felt enlightened. Recalling how loyal supporters of Li Fan—like He Zhenghao and Gao Yuan—had all been richly rewarded after his political victories, they sensed an opportunity.

“Lord Envoy, you need not worry. We stand firmly behind you!”

“Indeed! While Hongxi and Ziyun may have good reputations, they always remained aloof. None could compare to you, leading us to prosperity!”

“Every time I’ve joined the Lord Envoy’s fundraising initiatives, I’ve reaped immense rewards. In just a few years, my wealth has multiplied sixfold!”

“I joined later, but I’ve still doubled my fortune!”

“Support the Lord Envoy!”

“With the Lord Envoy, we’ll amass wealth and achieve enlightenment!”

The support snowballed as one cultivator after another voiced their allegiance.

Li Fan’s gaze flickered briefly toward He Zhenghao, who promptly retrieved pre-prepared contracts and registries from his storage ring, initiating the fundraising process on the spot.

Amid the fervor and under Li Fan’s sharp gaze, even those initially reluctant felt compelled to contribute.

“For appearances’ sake, I used up a piece of Human Dao Stardust and several Dao Enlightenment Pills when I made my entrance,” Li Fan mused silently.

“But no matter. I’ll recover it all from this fundraising campaign.”

Chapter 577: An Early Apocalypse

When Li Fan made his appearance, the silvery starlight radiating from him and the uncontrollable, enlightening aura of the Dao rhythm surrounding him naturally stemmed from the effects of the [Human Dao Stardust] and the Enlightenment Pills he had consumed.

For this, Li Fan swallowed the previously refined [Human Dao Stardust], which had the power to reverse the thoughts of his beloved, along with hundreds of Enlightenment Pills—all in one gulp.

He didn't expect to fully absorb their essence but only needed their residual energy to spill out.

Looking at it now, the intimidation effect worked quite well.

As more and more contributions filled his pouch, Li Fan believed that unless something unforeseen occurred, this final round of fundraising should proceed smoothly.

There was no longer any need to linger here, so Li Fan left quietly.

Instead of returning to Congyun City, he retreated to the hidden chamber he had excavated earlier in the depths of the ocean trench, once again going into seclusion.

---

“The Heaven and Earth Divination Dice...”

Li Fan’s eyes sparkled as a crystalline die appeared in his hand.

He toyed with it, his thoughts surging.

The words he had spoken earlier were not entirely fabricated.

During his prior interactions with this ancient treasure from the Heavenly Mechanism Sect, fleeting, blurry visions occasionally appeared in his mind.

These visions depicted apocalyptic scenes—scorched earth stretching for thousands of miles and the dead silence of Congyun Sea.

If an ordinary cultivator received such inexplicable premonitions, they would undoubtedly panic and be at a loss.

However, Li Fan was unfazed. After all, he had witnessed far more terrifying scenarios, such as the utter annihilation of everything by the Ink Death.

For Li Fan, something like the Crimson Flame Burning the Sea was just a minor scene.

What truly intrigued him was the timing of these future visions sensed through the Heaven and Earth Divination Dice.

It wasn’t tied to the usual 28-year timeline he had experienced in his past reincarnations. Instead, it was happening earlier.

Moreover, the timeline kept advancing as Li Fan made various moves in his current life.

For instance, after he manipulated events to have Sikong Yi complete the Heavenly Doctor’s mission.

Or after he devised a plan for Han Yi to incite a great battle between the Fisherman, the Heavenly Doctor, and the Sage.

Each time, the vision of the Crimson Flame Burning the Sea in the Heaven and Earth Divination Dice advanced significantly.

Li Fan understood that the future was never fixed, nor was there any event destined to occur without fail.

However, an event as monumental as the Crimson Flame Burning the Sea shouldn’t be easily altered by his actions.

Yet evidently, Li Fan had underestimated the impact of his moves on this apocalyptic event.

Why would Congyun Sea witness the slaughter of all life by the Spirit of Heaven and Earth?

Even after the annihilation of the Crimson Flame, why would the will of Heaven persist, sending out the formidable [Ink Death] to turn Congyun Sea into a complete wasteland?

The intervention of Ink Death would reduce Congyun Sea to nothingness—a mutual destruction scenario detrimental to Heaven and Earth itself.

And yet, Heaven remained resolute.

Congyun Sea *must* perish.

This was something Li Fan had understood in his early cycles of reincarnation.

But as for *why*—he still couldn’t find a clue.

However, in this life, after he actively facilitated the meeting between the Heavenly Doctor, the Sage, and the Fisherman, things began to shift.

According to the visions from the Heaven and Earth Divination Dice, if the battle between the three truly took place, the Crimson Flame Burning the Sea, originally pegged for 28 years, would now occur by year 20 at the latest—eight years earlier.

The war among the Heavenly Doctor, the Fisherman, and the Sage had long been part of Li Fan’s plan.

It couldn’t be altered simply because of this shift in timing.

This was why Li Fan decided to launch the final fundraising campaign now.

At present, everything was still just fragmented images from the Heaven and Earth Destiny Dice.

It might take a few years for these events to materialize into a definitive outcome.

“If the Red Flame Burning the Sea really occurs earlier because of the frequent actions of the Heavenly Doctor and others…”

“Then things become truly intriguing.”

A glint of intrigue flashed through Li Fan’s eyes.

He thought again of the shattered fragments of the Heavenly Fiend Sword, suppressed across various places by the Spirit of Heaven and Earth.

Li Fan, after several reincarnations in the Xuanhuang Realm and extensive study of its records, had gained a considerable understanding of its cultivation dynamics.

While not omniscient, he had pieced together a substantial picture.

He knew that ever since the establishment of the new cultivation laws, the conflict between cultivators and Heaven and Earth had become irreconcilable.

Yet Heaven typically countered cultivators indirectly, using mechanisms like “Law of Incompatible Cultivation,” which subtly altered the fundamental rules of existence to purge cultivators.

But the catastrophic calamity in Congyun Sea, with Heaven’s overt display of murderous intent…

Li Fan had rarely encountered similar cases.

Perhaps relevant records had been concealed, but for now, Congyun Sea was the only known example.

“What does this ultimately signify?”

A contemplative expression crossed Li Fan’s face.

“Let’s hope the Heavenly Doctor and the others can give me some enlightenment in this life.”

---

After the grand gathering of cultivators on Liuli Island, it took less than a day for all the cultivators in Congyun Sea to receive confirmed news.

The rumors were true. The reclusive Lord Envoy had personally emerged to validate them.

And so began a grand frenzy.

The high-yield fundraising plan, previously exclusive to cultivators with ties to Li Fan, was now open to all.

The promise of a threefold return in five years seemed miraculous, but with the legendary cultivator of the Heavenly Mechanism Sect leading the project, it didn’t seem impossible.

Cultivators eagerly spread the news, passionately debating how much contribution they should invest.

Even the most cautious among them wavered in the face of such widespread enthusiasm.

“Forty-five thousand contribution points—if I triple that…”

“That would exceed a hundred thousand!”

Sikong Yi’s heart raced.

“Fellow Daoist Han was right. Cultivation is all about connections! Without the opportunity he left for me to work with He Zhenghao, when else could I have made this much?”

“Fellow Daoist Han, you died well!”

With that thought, Sikong Yi didn’t hesitate.

He decided to bet everything he had on this fundraising campaign.

“This is a rare chance, never to be missed. My comeback hinges on this!”

Determination flickered in his eyes.

Meanwhile, in Yuandao Province, Han Yi, still carrying his hard-earned hundred thousand contribution points, heard the news.

“Congyun Sea, Li Fan… threefold in five years?”

A spark of interest ignited within him.

Since forcibly altering his fortune had caused a backlash, everything had been going poorly for him.

His cultivation progress was slow, and his contribution points had already dwindled.

“Perhaps…”

Hesitation flashed in Han Yi’s eyes.

Chapter 578: Han Yi Encounters Azure Wind

"My hard-earned one million contribution points didn’t come easily. Besides, once this cycle of karmic backlash passes, who knows how long it will take."

"I should be more cautious."

After pondering for a moment, Han Yi decided that seeing is believing. Since he had faced setbacks everywhere in Yuandao State, he might as well return to Congyun Sea to investigate personally before making any decisions.

Thus, prompted by a spur of the moment to visit Yuandao State, Han Yi returned to his old stomping grounds after overhearing some intriguing news.

Upon his return to Congyun Sea, he was astonished by the heated discussions among cultivators about the “Fundraising Plan of the Lord Secret Envoy.” The intensity of the debate far exceeded his expectations.

Although not everyone blindly believed in it, a significant portion of Li Fan's loyal followers did.

Believers and skeptics viewed each other as fools, each side eager to persuade the other. Amidst endless arguments, the topic only gained more traction, drawing many previously hesitant cultivators to participate.

However, watching this scene, as lively as oil on a raging fire, Han Yi couldn’t help but feel a chill in his heart.

Before he could delve deeper into the source of his unease, a piece of news swept through the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance like a storm. While it brought relief to countless cultivators, it also pushed the discussion about Li Fan’s fundraising plan to a new peak.

The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association had decided to cease hostilities.

Once again, Master Li Fan’s predictions had come true!

Ever since Li Fan disseminated this information, people had been pulling strings and probing its authenticity, stirring a wave of public speculation. Yet, no concrete conclusions had been reached—until today. The prophecy had come true again!

While sharp-eyed individuals suspected that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had taken advantage of the situation to make a strategic retreat, it didn’t detract from the mythical status of Li Fan’s predictive prowess, which was elevated to a new pinnacle.

Many cultivators who previously believed that this large-scale fundraising plan was merely a scam for Li Fan to pocket one last sum before absconding began to waver in their skepticism.

Even those who had chosen to remain neutral were compelled by this ironclad evidence to join the fundraising frenzy.

Following trends is a human instinct.

Han Yi, still hesitant due to his lingering unease, was suddenly swayed by a new rumor.

It was said that the overwhelming enthusiasm of the cultivators had led to contributions exceeding the original plan. Consequently, the previously promised “no upper limit” fundraising might be prematurely halted.

The source of this rumor was unknown, but its vivid details immediately alarmed those who had yet to "get on board."

Although the representative of the Lord Secret Envoy, He Zhenghao, promptly stepped forward to refute the rumor with righteous indignation, it couldn’t change the fact that the efficiency of collecting contributions was slowing.

Ironically, this only seemed to confirm the "rumor’s" credibility, driving the cultivators into even greater urgency.

Han Yi, too, couldn’t resist any longer.

In the fervent atmosphere, he acted impulsively, surrendering his remaining 910,000 contribution points.

When the cold sea breeze cleared his head, Han Yi regretted his decision.

"At the very least, I should have kept some as backup," he lamented.

But it was too late. A contract had already been signed, and within the five-year lockdown period, the contribution points could not be withdrawn. In emergencies requiring urgent funds, a 30% penalty on the principal would be imposed, along with the forfeiture of any accrued interest.

The terms were severe, and few cultivators would choose this route unless absolutely necessary. According to He Zhenghao, these strict rules were meant to prevent malicious sabotage.

After all, Li Fan’s high-profile fundraising had amassed a substantial sum, attracting jealousy from certain individuals eager to smear his reputation and seize a share for themselves.

“With so many cultivators involved, and given that Li Fan is the current supreme ruler of Congyun Sea, there shouldn’t be any problems,” Han Yi tried to console himself, but his lingering unease remained. Penniless and uncertain of where to go, he aimlessly wandered Congyun Sea, lost in thought.

After an indeterminate time, Han Yi suddenly snapped out of his daze.

Surveying his surroundings, he felt a strange sense of familiarity. "This feeling... odd. I’m sure it’s my first time here," he muttered, a hint of solemnity flashing in his eyes.

Thanks to his cultivation of the *Heavenly Fortune Sutra*, Han Yi’s sharp intuition wouldn’t allow him to dismiss this déjà vu.

He cautiously circulated his energy and surveyed the area.

"Huh?"

Moments later, his gaze fixed on a spot in the sky.

All beings possess their own destiny. Yet, in Han Yi’s vision, the seemingly empty space appeared strangely distorted.

"Something is hidden here!" Han Yi felt a surge of excitement.

Believing he had stumbled upon a great opportunity, Han Yi discreetly ensured no other cultivators were nearby. Confirming he was alone, he carefully ascended to the peculiar spatial distortion to investigate.

“Something’s definitely off!”

After several hours of observation, Han Yi was convinced of his discovery. Yet, no matter how he tried, he couldn’t find a way into the hidden space.

Aware that prolonged exposure increased the likelihood of being discovered, Han Yi grew anxious. Such a significant opportunity couldn’t be shared with others!

At that moment, a vague image flashed through his mind.

Stunned, Han Yi quickly mimicked the actions of the figure in his vision. He stepped back, then suddenly accelerated to his maximum speed, charging toward the distorted space.

A dark light enveloped him as he passed through.

In the next moment, Han Yi found himself standing before two enigmatic entities.

Azure Wind.

A broken sword.

His eyes turned blood red, and his mind descended into chaos.

Just as he was about to lose control and rush toward the fragments of the "Spirit of Heaven and Earth," a faint glimmer from the feather in his dantian saved him once again.

Encased in its glow, Han Yi regained a shred of clarity.

Resolute, he averted his gaze from the extraordinary sight of Azure-Wind and the Broken Sword and unleashed his full cultivation to escape.

Soon, Han Yi fled the strange space, coughing up blood. The mystical feather in his dantian was badly damaged, its once-proud plumes now shriveled and listless.

Chapter 579: Venturing into the Five Elements Heaven

"F*ck!"

In a short span of time, Han Yi experienced immense joy, shocking surprise, and devastating despair, narrowly escaping death.

At this moment, all Han Yi could think of was cursing aloud.

"Was it really necessary for fate to backfire so absurdly just because I gained a million contribution points?"

Finally landing on the ground of an uninhabited island, Han Yi gasped for breath, still shaken.

"Fortune and misfortune truly go hand in hand!"

His expression flickered between gloom and light.

His premonition wasn’t wrong; that place indeed held a great opportunity.

There lay the Spirit of Heaven and Earth capable of advancing to the Dao Integration Realm, along with a peculiar broken sword that could rival the essence itself.

Had his strength been sufficient, he could have slain Azure Wind, subdued the broken sword, and not only stepped into the Dao Integration Realm but also gained a divine weapon matching his power.

...

The thought of such a scenario caused Han Yi's breathing to quicken.

He even contemplated returning to try again.

But fortunately, he retained a shred of reason, quickly shaking his head and dismissing the thought.

"My strength is insufficient!" he lamented inwardly.

"To kill Azure Wind, I would need at least the Soul Transformation Realm. Even with my Heavenly Fortune Sutra, it would take at least a hundred years to achieve that."

"And what if someone else discovers that place during this time?"

"I should’ve known better than to be greedy for small gains. I should’ve used the million contribution points to quickly raise my cultivation level instead."

"Slow and steady—what use is that compared to the thrill of stepping into Dao Integration overnight?"

His mind churned with conflicting thoughts, leaving Han Yi increasingly restless.

---

Meanwhile, Li Fan—the one who had inadvertently guided Han Yi to encounter Azure Wind and the trapped sword through his *Cloudwater Illusion-Dream Technique*—had quietly departed from the Congyun Sea.

He arrived at the Tianling Prefecture.

The ceasefire was now a certainty, and many cultivators who had been conscripted to the frontlines had returned to their homelands.

The former battlefield had regained its calm, though the thick stench of blood lingered in the air, refusing to dissipate.

Looking into the distance, the land was scarred with deep cracks, crisscrossing everywhere.

The sky was an eerie mix of red and green, forming a surreal and unsettling sight.

Squads of azure-robed cultivators roamed the Tianling Prefecture, purifying the lingering resentment in the air and repairing the fractured earth.

Far off, faint, muffled rumblings could be heard.

From time to time, the distorted images of the heavens revealed some massive entity moving between the skies and earth.

"Damn it! The Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven belongs to our Tianling Prefecture! How could they just take it away like that?"

"Well, it’s better this way. Though it’s a fertile land, it’s no good omen. Too many cultivators have perished in this battle."

"Indeed, our Tianling Prefecture has suffered heavy losses this time. Many old friends can no longer be contacted."

...

On his journey, Li Fan overheard the cultivators around him discussing.

The origin of the Tianling Prefecture war and the existence of the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven were no longer secrets.

The cultivators of the Tianling State had complex feelings about the immensely prosperous cave-heaven.

Thus, when the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance officially relocated it to the central lands, many cultivators gathered to watch the process.

Hidden among the crowd, Li Fan took only a brief glance before retreating and heading in the opposite direction—toward the original location of the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven.

Within half a day, Li Fan arrived at his destination.

Amidst the mountains, where two peaks once met, now lay a vast, pitch-black abyss.

The once-scenic mountain range had turned eerie and terrifying.

With the cave-heaven gone, this place held no value for guardianship.

The heavily guarded area had been vacated, leaving only a few Golden Core cultivators for routine surveillance.

Clearly, these cultivators didn’t take their task seriously.

With the war over and the cave-heaven moved, who would bother coming here?

Thus, they were lax, gathered in idle chatter without much vigilance.

Taking advantage of this, Li Fan easily bypassed their defenses and slipped into the black void above.

Pausing before the pitch-black void, Li Fan observed quietly.

Unlike the utterly annihilated abyss he had once seen, this void still carried traces of strange energy.

Spiritual energy lingered faintly within.

"This isn’t a dead zone..."

Receiving no warnings from his spiritual intuition, Li Fan pondered briefly before stepping into the void.

In an instant, the light disappeared.

Li Fan found himself engulfed in darkness, as if he had become blind, with no sense of vision.

His divine sense extended like tendrils, probing the surroundings, yet returned nothing but emptiness.

Looking back, the scenery of the Tianling Prefecture had vanished.

It was as if he had plunged into an endless abyssal sea, utterly lost.

No matter how he moved in any direction, it felt as though he remained in the same spot.

This stark contrast between movement and stillness caused a faint dizziness.

For any other cultivator, such a situation would surely induce panic.

But to Li Fan, a void with only entrapment and no lethal danger was hardly a cause for concern.

With the [Truth] at his disposal, even the most perilous deadlands couldn’t confine him.

With a single thought, he could escape this predicament, so Li Fan felt no anxiety.

He calmed his mind and began to perceive the environment around him.

Although it appeared to be a void, the darkness seemed to conceal something.

At intervals, ripples of an inexplicable force would brush past his body.

But whenever he tried to trace the source of these ripples, the trail would abruptly vanish, as if it had all been an illusion.

Lost in the darkness for an unknown amount of time, nothing changed.

"The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance must have investigated this place after relocating the cave-heaven."

"If they didn’t uncover anything, it means the secrets here are deeply hidden."

Li Fan thought to himself, not the least bit impatient.

Time and opportunity were in his favor.

Setting aside all external affairs, Li Fan focused entirely on the surroundings.

Abandoning his attempts to track the ripples, he allowed himself to flow along with them instead.

Gradually, he felt his body begin to move within the void.

However, the reprieve was short-lived; before long, it felt as though he collided with an invisible wall, forcing him to stop.

Chapter 580: The Black and White Seven-Color Confrontation

"Mm?"

Li Fan squinted his eyes, trying to discern the object obstructing his path in the pitch darkness.

What surprised him, however, was that neither his spiritual sense nor his physical touch revealed the presence of any obstacle ahead.

Li Fan frowned slightly.

This time, instead of aligning with the ripples that emerged in the spatial void, he deliberately bypassed their timing and directly sped forward.

Strangely, the “wall” he had perceived within the ripples earlier seemed to have vanished as though it had never existed.

Li Fan could clearly sense that his position within this void-like space had shifted.

Or rather, part of his positional attributes had altered, while another part remained unmoving.

It felt as though moving by his own momentum and following the ripples' flow were two entirely different planes of existence, each unaffected by the other.

This perplexing phenomenon was beyond Li Fan’s current understanding.

For now, he set aside the question of what lay behind it. Clearing his mind, he waited for the ripples to reappear in the void.

When the ripples arrived, he aligned himself with them, knowingly hurtling toward the "obstacle" ahead.

"Boom!"

In an instant, Li Fan saw stars as he was forced out of alignment with the ripples.

After inspecting himself, he found that while his body remained unharmed, his soul seemed to have suffered a slight shock.

Pondering for a moment, Li Fan decided to abandon such reckless attempts for now.

He did not leave the area. Instead, he stood quietly in the void, focusing his mind to analyze each ripple as it arrived, hoping to discover why he was being obstructed while the ripples passed through unhindered.

When he concentrated in this absolute darkness and silence, the occasional ripple became particularly striking.

Li Fan meticulously recorded the timing of each ripple.

After patiently collecting data from tens of thousands of occurrences, he replicated the pattern in the Dao Deviation Stone within his Sea of Consciousness, attempting to uncover any hidden rules.

Effort rewarded diligence.

Li Fan discovered that roughly every thousand ripples, one distinctive ripple would appear, significantly stronger and faster than the others, spreading nearly twice as fast across the void.

Heart stirred, Li Fan calculated the intervals. When the anomaly reappeared, he steadied his spirit and aligned himself with it.

This time, his attempt produced results. It was no longer like colliding with a wall but instead felt like rubbing against an obstruction.

A sharp, knife-like pain surged from the depths of his soul. Enduring the agony, Li Fan gritted his teeth and persisted.

However, the deeper the ripple went, the more incompatible he became with his surroundings.

The knife-like sensation soon turned into a savage tearing, an unbearable pain that almost caused him to lose consciousness.

It was only his innate self-preservation instinct that pulled him out of alignment with the ripple.

“Phew…”

Li Fan gasped heavily, his body drenched in sweat from the pain.

Even after disengaging from the ripples, the sensation of his soul being torn lingered as though etched into his being.

It took the passing of two complete “thousand-ripple intervals” for the pain to gradually fade.

Once recovered, hesitation flickered across Li Fan’s face.

But when the next anomalous ripple arrived, he once again threw himself into it.

This time, he seemed to last slightly longer—or so he thought.

Without waiting for the pain to fully dissipate, Li Fan immersed his spirit into the ripple once more.

“Argh!”

Li Fan's face twisted in agony, his body convulsing under the torment of his soul’s suffering.

A flash of ferocity crossed his eyes, and the fleeting thoughts of giving up were immediately extinguished by the reverse cultivation method of the *Xuanhuang Heart Refining Mantra.*

“Just a little pain—do you think you can stop me?”

“Again!”

What followed was a relentless cycle of trials.

Li Fan endured unspeakable torment in his attempts to ride the anomalous ripple into the depths of the void.

The pain escalated each time, from tearing to a thousand needles piercing, then to the sensation of being crushed and ground repeatedly.

By the end, his mind became a blank slate.

Only the unwavering determination in his heart sustained him, preventing him from abandoning his efforts.

Throughout this ordeal, the *Xuanhuang Heart Refining Mantra* played a pivotal role.

Human nature tends to shy away from suffering. In such excruciating circumstances, thoughts of surrender—such as "Forget it," "Why bother?" or "This isn’t necessary"—naturally arose in Li Fan’s mind.

Normally, such thoughts could have shaken his resolve. However, under the grinding effect of the mantra’s reverse cultivation, they were transformed into nourishment for his soul.

Without this, even with his exceptional mental fortitude, Li Fan would have been unable to endure the pain.

But regardless of the difficulty, Li Fan ultimately succeeded.

He did not know how much time had passed, but when he finally regained consciousness, he found himself in a mysterious yet strangely familiar space.

In this realm, horizontal and vertical lines intersected, while particles of various colors zipped along the lines at great speed.

Occasionally, particles collided, bursting into radiant seven-colored lights before vanishing as quickly as they appeared.

"Where is this?"

Li Fan first examined his body.

Surprisingly, it appeared as though crudely sketched from intersecting lines—both comical and eerie.

Yet, it felt no different from his normal physical form.

Careful not to act rashly, Li Fan evaded the streaking particles as he observed the wondrous space.

“This seems somewhat similar to the Tianxuan Mirror Space I saw before.”

“However, the Tianxuan Mirror only displayed black and white, unlike this colorful realm.”

“Wait, I remember…”

Li Fan’s heart stirred as he replayed stored images in the Dao Deviation Stone, analyzing them closely.

In the final frame, he noted that the edges of the black-and-white world also contained traces of seven-colored light.

It seemed black and white, and seven colors were two opposing energies.

In the black-and-white world, the seven-colored light was fragmented and assimilated into its form.

“A Newborn Tianxuan Mirror…”

Li Fan squinted his eyes, lost in thought.

Before long, he arrived at a conjecture.

The black-and-white world undoubtedly represented the Tianxuan Mirror.

The seven-colored radiance, on the other hand, likely embodied a microcosm of the real world.

The intersecting lines resembled the laws of nature, as seen through the [Human Dao Stardust], representing the principles governing the real world.

“The Tianxuan Mirror is deciphering the real world in its own way…”

“And this…”

Li Fan's eyes lit up with understanding.

“…is a microcosm of the world in its primordial state.”

Chapter 581: The Attempt to Seize the Newborn Cave Heaven

The term "world" might not fully capture the concept here.

A more fitting description would be a "micro-world" or "cave heaven," a lower-tier existence.

Undoubtedly, a newly formed Five Elements Great Cave Heaven was taking shape here.

"The Gate of the Mysterious Origin is the root of heaven and earth," Li Fan murmured to himself.

In the ancient texts of the Xuanhuang Realm, there were similar expressions.

Heaven and earth nurture all things.

But where do heaven and earth themselves originate?

Among cultivators, there is no shortage of those with a spirit of exploration.

Aside from the cultivators striving to reconnect with other cultivation realms outside the Xuanhuang Realm, some specifically study the birth of heaven and earth and the origins of living beings.

Li Fan had read some related books.

These cultivators believed that heaven and earth are like humans—they grow and evolve over time.

The Xuanhuang Realm, in its infancy, might have been akin to a micro-cave heaven.

After countless epochs, it eventually developed into its current form.

Such micro-cave heavens could either have been created by powerful cultivators and ancient Immortals, or spontaneously emerged from the void.

As for the true vastness of the "space-time" they inhabited, cultivators remained largely unaware.

Yet, there was no doubt that the Xuanhuang Realm was but an insignificant speck within the infinite expanse of space-time.

Even if few cultivators cared about this reality, it did not change its essence.

In this boundless space-time, the embryonic origins of worlds are referred to by cultivators as the [Root of Heaven and Earth].

It is the source of worlds, the convergence of laws, and the primordial essence of creation.

Though theorized, no one had ever truly witnessed it.

Unexpectedly, through the accumulation of knowledge from multiple reincarnations and his own indomitable will, Li Fan had managed to arrive here.

Even if the primordial laws here were still too profound for his current comprehension, Li Fan could not suppress the awe that stirred his heart—a moment that evoked the sentiment: "To hear the Dao in the morning, one could die content by evening."

The space was filled with colorful particles colliding, forming mesmerizing sights.

Crisscrossing threads permeated the space like a massive weaving machine, crafting the birth of a "world."

Li Fan remained enthralled by this magnificent sight for a long time before reluctantly pulling himself away.

While he gained no clear insights, his soul felt as though it had been bathed in warm water—profoundly refreshed and inexplicably elevated.

Amid his joy, Li Fan did not forget his purpose.

"Seize the essence of heaven and earth to form a Nascent Soul."

His eyes gleamed with determination.

For a brief moment, he considered taking the *Root of Heaven and Earth* and transforming it into his own Nascent Soul's Cave heaven.

Such an achievement, combined with his half-formed [Truth] Dao Foundation, would allow him to freely shape his personal domain of laws as he advanced.

He envisioned conjuring mythical constructs such as latent dragons, volcanoes, and divine eyes—all upon gathering the necessary information.

But alas...

"My foundation is too shallow. This isn't just a snake trying to swallow an elephant; it's an ant attempting to devour one," Li Fan muttered with self-mockery.

After observing a little longer, he dismissed his reckless notion.

An ant swallowing an elephant would only lead to its demise.

Perhaps, after reaching the Dao Integration Realm and gaining a deeper understanding of the principles of heaven and earth, he could return to attempt this feat.

For now...

It was more prudent to focus on the "Five Elements Great Cave Heaven" forming nearby.

Having spent some time here, Li Fan began noticing peculiarities.

The forced relocation of the original Five Elements Cave Heaven seemed to have triggered a reaction.

The *Root of Heaven and Earth* was weaving a new cave heaven in its place.

"In that case, all I need is patience."

"A newborn cave heaven is weak and easier to subdue."

"Moreover, I don't need to worry about its strength impacting my combat power after ascension. The Five Elements Cave Heaven, being unified and self-sustaining, will endlessly evolve."

Having formulated a plan, Li Fan exhaled in relief.

Ignoring the outside world, he immersed himself in observing the birth of the cave heaven.

Initially, he believed that the process would be as arduous as childbirth—a lengthy and challenging undertaking.

But clearly, applying human logic to the ways of heaven and earth would only lead to errors.

The Five Elements Great Cave Heaven was forming far faster than he anticipated.

The collisions of particles became increasingly frequent, akin to fireworks exploding before his eyes.

Gold, wood, water, fire, and earth...

Li Fan sensed the emergence of these five elemental energies within the space.

Yet, they remained contained, not dispersing chaotically.

Although his eyes could not perceive the cave heaven's actual formation, Li Fan could sense it indirectly through the energy shifts in the Root of Heaven and Earth.

As the cave heaven's embryonic form drew closer to completion, Li Fan grew increasingly excited.

But at this moment, he noticed his body's lines starting to unravel into the surroundings.

Li Fan speculated that the energy consumption from weaving the Five Elements Cave Heaven had caused the "Root of Heaven and Earth" to attempt replenishment by absorbing whatever it could.

As an intruder, he became the first target.

Should he seize the Five Elements Cave Heaven now and advance to the Nascent Soul Realm, or retreat and wait for it to fully form in the void of Tianling Prefecture before taking action?

Hesitation filled his mind.

But soon, Li Fan made his decision.

While there was a risk of disintegration here, at least there was no external interference.

In the void of Tianling Prefecture, patrolled by cultivators of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, the energy fluctuations of advancing from Golden Core to Nascent Soul would certainly not go unnoticed.

No matter how eloquent his explanations, it was unlikely he could deceive them.

"I'll give it a try."

"If I fail, I'll simply come back another time."

With that resolve, Li Fan stopped resisting, allowing the space to absorb his essence.

Like threads being pulled from a spool, his form visibly shrank.

Yet, without fear, he used this force to propel himself toward the location of the newborn cave heaven.

Above the Root of Heaven and Earth, five distinct orbs of light began to coalesce.

Energy nodes within the crisscrossing threads exploded one by one, stabilizing the five orbs further.

As Li Fan approached, with only half his body remaining, he arrived before the orbs of light.

Chapter 582: Unity of Life and Destruction

Perhaps it was due to the [Root of Heaven and Earth] fearing damage to the newly-formed Five Elements Cave Heaven.

When Li Fan approached the five clusters of light, the external suction force abruptly lessened.

This prevented him from completely disintegrating in a short amount of time.

At this moment, although Li Fan's body was reduced to half of its original size, he still retained all his limbs. However, his overall stature had shrunk, making him look like a seven- or eight-year-old child.

It was both comical and eerie.

Fortunately, this did not affect his ability to move.

He quietly gazed at the flickering five-colored clusters of light in the distance. Instead of hastily using a secret technique to devour them, he carefully observed.

The Root of Heaven and Earth was weaving energy and laws of the same attribute into the five elemental domains—metal, wood, water, fire, and earth—through flickering flashes below.

These newly-born, fragile elemental domains gradually became more complete and resilient.

"If this space were viewed as a womb nurturing life, then these Five Elements Cave Heaven would be like embryos just beginning to take form," Li Fan thought.

Now existing in a line-based form, Li Fan’s perception of the surrounding laws was far sharper than when he was in human form.

Witnessing the initial formation of the Cave Heaven, insights flooded his mind.

In his previous life, when the “Five Elements Great Cave Heaven” that had been relocated out of the city was eventually annihilated due to the imbalance of the five elements, Li Fan was able to realize that the five elements of the Five Elements Great Cave Heaven were not in harmony with each other.

Li Fan had personally witnessed the terrifying, near-apocalyptic black-and-white vortex.

Now, seeing the birth of the Five Elements, he noticed an unexpected similarity between the two.

"Life and destruction..."

"Life is the beginning of destruction; destruction is the source of life," Li Fan murmured, seemingly enlightened.

"I used the principle of the Five Elements’ mutual generation—endlessly cycling—to create the 'Great Five Elements Annihilation Sword' based on the methods of Ink Kill and Heaven Calamity."

"But this principle of life and destruction..."

His thoughts raced to their peak.

Without any external aid, Li Fan appeared to enter a state of epiphany.

He stood motionless beside the clusters of five-colored light, as still as a statue.

Yet his body reacted instinctively.

When stray particles occasionally hurtled toward the Five Elements Cave Heaven and threatened to pierce through him, his body twisted bizarrely, evading the particles with ease.

After avoiding danger, his body instantly reverted to its original form.

Meanwhile, Li Fan remained immersed in contemplation, oblivious to his movements.

Time passed.

Gradually, the five-colored clusters of light revealed more intricate details.

Oceans, molten fire, forests...

Various postnatal creations of the Five Elements began to form within the Cave Heaven.

It was like an embryo maturing over ten months, transforming from an indistinct cluster into a fully developed infant.

Distinct scenes started evolving within the Cave Heaven.

The radiance enveloping the Cave Heaven's exterior began to retract inward, flowing back into its interior.

The light, akin to a perfect natural supplement, was absorbed, accelerating the transformation of the scenes within by hundreds or thousands of times.

A faint rumbling echoed.

The Cave Heaven itself began to "grow," expanding outward.

It expanded until it touched other Cave Heaven, halting its growth only then.

The internal force driving its growth, however, did not vanish.

Amidst the creaking and pressing sounds, the five Cave Heaven intertwined and merged into a natural formation, inseparable from one another.

The Five Elements Cave Heaven was on the verge of forming completely.

"Excellent!" At this moment, Li Fan finally awakened.

The pure line-based form of his face revealed no discernible expression of joy.

Yet clearly, he had gained much from this experience.

"This divine ability is not suitable for use here. I'll address it once I leave!"

"For now, I must focus on the task at hand!"

Li Fan reviewed the recorded imagery in his Dao Deviation Stone, which captured the moments he had missed during his epiphany, and nodded to himself.

"My guess was correct. The Five Elements Cave Heaven has not yet completely detached from the [Root of Heaven and Earth]."

"Just like a mother’s natural instinct to protect her offspring, any attempt to devour it would undoubtedly trigger a full-scale attack from the Root of Heaven and Earth."

"Even a Dao Integration cultivator would perish in this domain."

"My only chance is the fleeting moment when the Five Elements Cave Heaven separates from the mother body but has not yet descended into the void of the Tianling Prefecture!"

Li Fan understood this with clarity, free of any joy or sorrow, as he awaited that critical moment.

For other cultivators, missing such an opportunity would be a lifelong regret. Even with outstanding mental fortitude, they might still feel some anxiety.

But for Li Fan, endowed with the [Truth] ability, it was merely one of countless “ordinary” attempts.

Thus, his heart was undisturbed.

Like an exceptional hunter, he patiently and quietly awaited his prey.

It was unclear how much time passed.

The previously vivid Cave Heaven scenes gradually grew translucent.

In the [Root of Heaven and Earth], only the circular outlines of the five interconnected Cave Heaven remained, suspended in space.

Boom...

The Five Elements Cave Heaven began to tremble violently.

Even the internal space of the [Root of Heaven and Earth] shook incessantly.

It seemed as if the Five Elements Cave Heaven were trying to break free of its mother's constraints.

In Li Fan’s vision, the interwoven lines grew distorted.

"Ping!"

A sound like a snapping string echoed.

Li Fan noticed that a line seemed to break out of thin air around the Five Elements Cave Heaven.

Even though it disappeared in an instant, he was sure it wasn’t an illusion.

Indeed, the snapping sound repeated like a chain reaction.

Above the Five Elements Cave Heaven, countless broken lines swayed in the wind, dissolving into nothingness in moments.

The Cave Heaven’s trembling intensified.

"The time is now!"

At that moment, Li Fan's body completely disintegrated.

Twisting, wriggling lines shielded the Golden Core in his dantian as they sped toward the Five Elements Cave Heaven.

This seemed to alert the [Root of Heaven and Earth].

As Li Fan advanced, the dissolution rate of his fine lines accelerated.

Yet it couldn’t stop him from drawing closer.

When the Five Elements Cave Heaven finally broke free from the [Root of Heaven and Earth], Li Fan’s Golden Core began to crack.

It appeared on the verge of shattering but somehow held together.

From the cracks emerged writhing "tentacles," menacingly reaching for the Five Elements Cave Heaven like ravenous serpents.

These tentacles also represented the “Root of Heaven and Earth.”

Not the primordial creation root of this domain.

Rather, it is the “Root of Heaven and Earth” that the cultivators of the world have formed within their bodies according to the new method of the Immortal Ancestor.

Chapter 583: Finally Reaching the Nascent Soul Realm

Was it a coincidence?

Or perhaps when the Dharma Transmitting Immortal Ancestor created the new cultivation method, they truly referenced and imitated the primordial creation of the world.

In any case, to solve the issue where cultivators without spiritual roots could not practice cultivation, a creation driven by human negative emotions was developed to forcibly extract the energy of heaven and earth. This creation was also named the "Root of Heaven and Earth."

Although they share the same name, the two are worlds apart.

If the [Original Root of Heaven and Earth], symbolizing the beginning of creation, was sacred and solemn...

Then the new "Root of Heaven and Earth," which plunders the heavens and allows everyone to cultivate, feels somewhat sinister.

This ominous nature could perhaps be inferred from its external form.

Countless wriggling tendrils, numbering in the hundreds or even thousands—these were the root filaments of the "Root of Heaven and Earth."

At this moment, the tendrils seemed almost sentient as they extended toward the Five Elements Cave Heaven, instinctively searching for the most suitable place to root and invade.

The newly formed Five Elements Cave Heaven seemed to sense the threat to its existence.

The realm trembled, emitting vibrant lights in an attempt to repel the invasive "foreign objects."

But… it was futile.

The protective effects of the realm's light were negligible against the tendrils. Only a small fraction of them was destroyed—a loss so minor it was insignificant.

The remaining black tendrils advanced unhindered, infiltrating the cave heaven like countless needles, silently embedding themselves deep into it.

The Cave Heaven roared, emitting strange sounds akin to cries of agony.

But it could not stop the ever-growing tendrils, which wrapped around and engulfed the realm tighter and tighter.

The light faded, and darkness descended.

Watching the scene of the Cave Heaven being devoured, Li Fan—the orchestrator of it all—could not help but feel a chill in his heart.

“The Immortal Ancestor’s new method is indeed eerie,” he murmured to himself. “It doesn’t look like the righteous path at all.”

Still, Li Fan was not one to overthink.

No matter how ominous the new method seemed, it was the only cultivation path available to him.

Throwing aside his doubts, Li Fan focused on the Cave Heaven now enshrouded in writhing darkness.

Through the countless tendrils, which felt like extensions of his own body, Li Fan could vividly perceive the state of the celestial realm.

The cave heaven’s strength was being drained, its resistance growing weaker.

From the tendrils, an indescribable energy flowed—a life force several times more refined than the essence he had sensed during his cultivation of the Creation Furnace Technique.

This vigorous vitality, extracted from the Cave Heaven, continuously surged into Li Fan's body.

Even after absorbing just a fraction of this pure vitality, Li Fan felt an astonishing realization:

With such energy, even if he were dismembered and reduced to mere scraps of flesh, as long as some part of his body remained, he could regenerate an entirely new one.

“Rebirth from a single drop of blood... Immortality...”

This legendary divine ability, said to be accessible only to the most powerful ancient cultivators, was now being achieved through this cunning method.

“The Immortal Ancestor...” Li Fan sighed in awe.

Sensing the moment was right, Li Fan finally took action, advancing to the final step of forming his Nascent Soul.

His already partially dissolved body completely liquefied into black essence, which flowed through the tendrils and invaded the Five Elements Cave Heaven.

Li Fan felt his existence splitting into countless fragments, yet somehow remaining unified.

Each fragment had the same goal: to seize and take full control of the Cave Heaven.

It was an extraordinary sensation.

What had once been an elevated realm beyond the human body now felt like an equal lifeform. What had once been the intangible heavens now seemed like a tangible, conquerable entity.

As Li Fan's invasion deepened, the Cave Heaven's struggles weakened, until they faded altogether.

Tianling Prefecture, Beyond the Five Elements Void

“Huh? Did you hear something just now?”

A Golden Core cultivator on watch duty suddenly looked up, staring into the pitch-black void overhead.

“Old Sun, you must be imagining things again,” his lazy companion scoffed.

“I’ve told you before—take a leave and get some rest! After all these battles and so much death, it’s a miracle you’re not mad already. Yet you volunteered for watch duty here?”

Old Sun ignored the mockery, his gaze still fixed on the void, his expression grim.

After a moment of hesitation, he flew to the edge of the void to investigate further.

“Crazy old fool,” the other cultivator muttered under his breath, stretching lazily and watching Old Sun with amusement.

As expected, after searching for a long time, Old Sun found nothing unusual and reluctantly returned to the ground.

“Well? I told you it was just your imagination,” the companion jeered.

“This desolate place is a wasteland—who’d even bother attacking it? Honestly, I don’t know why we’re even stationed here. The higher-ups get to relax, while we suffer here in misery!”

Old Sun didn’t respond, his focus still on the void above, his brows furrowed.

Meanwhile, hidden in the sky, Li Fan observed Old Sun and felt a flicker of surprise.

“This Sun fellow’s spiritual sense is remarkably sharp. He almost noticed me.”

Although Li Fan could easily subdue them given his now superior cultivation, he didn’t want to stir trouble in the current sensitive climate. The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance remained on high alert after the recent war, and any disturbance could ignite fresh turmoil.

Choosing discretion, Li Fan memorized Old Sun’s appearance before preparing to leave.

However, as he began to depart, he overheard their conversation again.

“Hey, Old Sun, did you hear? Zhang Debiao’s struck it rich lately.”

“Isn’t he in charge of post-war clean-up operations?”

“Yeah, and guess what? All those corpses littering the battlefield in Tianling Prefecture? He’s pocketed all the loot for himself!”

Chapter 584: The Power of Five Elements’ Creation and Destruction

Old Sun furrowed his brow slightly and said, “It’s better not to spread baseless rumors.”

“No matter what, they were brave warriors who sacrificed their lives honorably for the Immortal Alliance. How could the higher-ups allow despicable individuals to defile their corpses?”

The lazy cultivator immediately showed some discontent. “How is it baseless? I saw it with my own eyes!”

“That Zhang Debiao kid, using his appointment from the Immortal Alliance, blatantly led a group to gather the corpses. Storage rings, usable magical treasures—weren’t they quietly taken away by them?”

“I even heard that residual golden cores and fragments of cave heaven within the corpses were dug out by these people!”

“You’ve been on the battlefield yourself. You know how brutal the battle in Tianling Prefecture was. Those bodies were almost all incomplete and disfigured. How else could they be collected? They were all burned to ashes, leaving only a bit of powder as proof. Who would notice?”

“As the saying goes, ‘If the people don’t speak up, the officials won’t act.’ Ordinary cultivators are mostly loners. If they die, they die. Who would really care…”

The lazy cultivator rambled on incessantly, with no regard for his words, while Old Sun’s face gradually turned somber.

Suddenly, the lazy cultivator felt a chill rise behind him. Seeing the expression on Old Sun’s face, he inexplicably shuddered and instinctively shut his mouth.

Only when Old Sun’s piercing gaze finally moved away from him did the lazy cultivator let out a sigh of relief, feeling as though a weight had been lifted from his chest.

Having grown accustomed to Old Sun’s usual demeanor, he had almost forgotten the legendary stories surrounding this man.

Old Sun’s full name was Sun Qi.

Though he appeared to be an ordinary Golden Core stage cultivator like the others, with a humble and good-natured demeanor, Sun Qi was, in fact, a fearsome figure.

A native cultivator of Tianling Prefecture, Sun Qi had been conscripted at the beginning of the great war. For reasons unknown—whether sheer luck or something else—while countless Nascent Soul cultivators perished in the war, this seemingly insignificant Golden Core cultivator had managed to survive.

Someone who carved a bloody path through mountains of corpses and seas of blood naturally exuded an aura of dread. Though usually concealed, when provoked, his rage was enough to terrify anyone. The lazy cultivator, recognizing this, wisely decided not to provoke the old master further.

Meanwhile, Li Fan, who had been observing from above and in the shadows, noticed Sun Qi’s gaze sweep over his hiding spot. His interest in this man grew even stronger.

With a faint smile, Li Fan activated the 'Formless Killing Intent' and locked onto Sun Qi.

Watching Sun Qi’s expression shift from suspicion to alarm as he searched his surroundings but found nothing, Li Fan chuckled inwardly.

Leaving Sun Qi aside for now, Li Fan stealthily flew to a desolate mountain range, seemingly flattened by a heavenly force.

As was his habit, he dug deep underground and excavated a secret chamber.

Sealing the chamber, Li Fan sat down and began to inspect his current state.

Name: Li Fan

Cultivation Realm: Early Nascent Soul

Biological Age: 34/999 (Heaven’s Scorn)

Psychological Age: 1335/9999

Void Fusion Energy Progress: 200%

Anchor Energy Progress: 0%

Current Number of Anchors: 3

Available Anchors: 1

Bound Items:

- Thousand Mechanisms Jade Cosmos Golden Sutra

- Taiyan Boat

- Stop-Step Remnant Stele (Damage)

- Ten Thousand Essence Blood

- Dao Deviation Stone

Techniques:

- Xuanhuang Heart Refining Mantra

- Cloudwater Illusion-Dream Technique

- Body Transformation into Dao

- Mysterious True Spirit Transformation

- Melting Furnace of Ten Thousand Forms Technique

- Creation Furnace Technique

- Mountain Sitting Technique

Divine Abilities:

- Chaos

- Reverse Five Elements of Sword Creation and Destruction

- Cycle of Life and Death

- Formless Killing Intent

- Binding Insects

- Clouds Swarm Sword Slash

- Heaven Overturning Palm

...

"Phew!"

Li Fan gently exhaled a breath of turbid air.

He felt an immense, pure vitality surging throughout his body, nourishing his physical form. Spiritual energy flowed endlessly, boundless and infinite.

Within his dantian, where the Golden Core had once been, the faint outlines of five interconnected domains—cave heavens—could now be seen.

“So this is the Nascent Soul stage! Advancing in one leap feels like overturning the heavens and the earth!”

To test the difference from his previous Golden Core stage, Li Fan unleashed the most powerful divine ability he currently mastered.

Using his hand as a pen, he wrote in mid-air, simultaneously sensing the changes in his body.

He inscribed the upper left stroke of the character "Chaos" (亂), and still felt ample strength remaining.

An endless stream of spiritual energy and vitality surged from the cave heavens, supporting the immense consumption of the Chaos Glyph technique while keeping his body from collapsing.

Li Fan continued writing. In an instant, half of the character was complete.

Within the underground chamber, the surrounding soil was influenced, rising and trembling unceasingly. Countless particles moved like ranks of mortal soldiers.

Upon closer inspection, the vibration frequency of each grain was entirely unique.

What seemed orderly was, in truth, chaos in disguise.

Li Fan squinted slightly, but his hand, suspended mid-air, abruptly stopped.

"I understand now," he murmured.

“Having reached the Nascent Soul stage, I no longer need to fear damaging my body. At last, I can fully unleash this ultimate strike.”

“However, it still cannot be used recklessly in succession. Otherwise…”

Li Fan sensed the faint tremors within his five-element cave heavens, a solemn look flashing in his eyes.

“The power of the Chaos is truly terrifying.”

“As the caster, even I, possessing five-element cave heavens, face such backlash. For an ordinary Nascent Soul cultivator, even a slight contact could immediately cause their Nascent Soul cave heavens to collapse.”

“I wonder, though, if a Soul Transformation cultivator could withstand it.”

The Chaos Glyph technique was a realization Li Fan had comprehended within the enigmatic White Mist Domain.

It was profoundly mysterious. As his cultivation advanced, Li Fan increasingly sensed the extraordinary nature of the character "Chaos."

“Even my crude imitation holds such power. I can’t imagine how terrifying the true Chaos Glyph technique must be.”

“It seems to exceed the limits of power a regular cultivator can control. Could it be…”

Li Fan frowned, deep in thought.

After a moment, he set aside his musings, focusing his gaze on the “Reverse Five Elements of Sword Creation and Destruction” listed on his Returning True divine ability panel.

The “Reverse Five Elements of Sword Creation and Destruction” was a divine ability he had comprehended by observing the scene of the Roots of Heaven and Earth weaving the five-element cave heavens and combining it with his understanding of the convergence of the five elements from his previous life.

It incorporated the essence of the "Grand Five Elements Annihilation Sword," possessing not only overwhelming destructive power but also the ability to create life from nothingness.

Casually, Li Fan picked up a dying insect nearby, one that had been severely affected by the residual force of the Chaos Glyph technique.

A gentle, milky-white light emanated from his palm.

Moments later, bathed in the radiant light, the insect miraculously regained vitality. It flipped over, scrambled away from Li Fan's hand, and fled in haste.

Li Fan paid no attention to the lucky creature that had escaped death. Instead, he thoughtfully remarked, “Reviving the dying is merely a minor skill. Other medical techniques can easily achieve this.”

“The true brilliance of the Reverse Five Elements of Sword Creation and Destruction lies in its power to create.”

Taking a spirit stone from his storage ring, he held it in his left hand.

With his right hand, he emitted radiant light continuously.

After half a day, as the light dissipated, a spirit stone identical to the one in his left hand slowly appeared.

Chapter 585: Where Is the Mountain Sitting Technique?

Of course, the resemblance is merely in appearance.

On the surface of the spirit stone, the restrictions jointly inscribed by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association were something Li Fan could not replicate for the time being.

"At the moment, my creations are limited to simple objects like spirit stones, which are purely composed of spiritual energy."

"Anything with a slightly more complex structure is beyond my capability."

Even so, Li Fan was extremely delighted in his heart.

Because this signified a promising start.

In the future, as his cultivation level continued to rise and his skills became increasingly refined, it wouldn’t be impossible for him to create objects out of thin air.

Breaking through to the Nascent Soul Realm was a significant leap in power.

However, a pressing issue now confronted Li Fan and demanded his immediate attention.

He had no technique to practice.

The Mountain Sitting Technique he had secretly learned from He Zhenghao was merely a Golden Core Realm cultivation method.

After stepping into the Nascent Soul Realm, the feedback to his cultivation that once flowed like a gentle stream had nearly disappeared.

It was evident that the technique no longer provided him with any benefit.

Although he had accumulated substantial cultivation from previous efforts, which helped solidify his newly attained realm, he could not delay resolving this issue for too long. The sooner, the better.

Fortunately, Li Fan had already devised countermeasures.

The Three Strategies

1. The Middle Strategy Naturally, the middle option involved using the reward offered by Immortal Sage Jicheng to gain access to the Law Derivation Jade enabling him to deduce the subsequent parts of the Mountain Sitting Technique.
