In his previous life, Immortal Sage Jicheng had been ambushed by the Five Elders Association's Dao Integration cultivators during the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s plan to uncover hidden spies using the "The Plan of the Heavenly Sovereign of Reality and Illusion." This betrayal ultimately led to the sage’s demise.

In this lifetime, Li Fan couldn’t guarantee the same events would unfold.

2. The Lower Strategy

The 'Audience Law Jade Plaque', though exceedingly rare and typically awarded only to cultivators who rendered great service to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, wasn’t a unique or priceless treasure.

Given Li Fan’s current resources, he could potentially acquire one by spending a significant amount of contribution points.

However, doing so would be conspicuous and might expose his identity, attracting the attention of interested parties. He feared that once he obtained the technique, he might have to "escape for real" by using [Truth]

Thus, this was only a last resort.

3. The Upper Strategy

This entirely depended on opportunity.

That is, Li Fan comprehending it on his own.

After several lifetimes practicing the Mountain Sitting Technique, Li Fan considered himself second to none in understanding this technique. His cultivation process had provided fleeting moments of insight that he had carefully accumulated over time.

With his profound foundation, devoting some time might allow him to deduce the subsequent portions of the Mountain Sitting Technique independently.

Ultimately, the Law Derivation Jade could deduce techniques because of its ability to explore infinite possibilities. While it could analyze and create techniques with unmatched depth and insight, it could not fully comprehend Li Fan himself.

Furthermore, Li Fan would never expose all his secrets to a mystical artifact that still seemed bound by the restraints of the Immortal Ancestor and had to work tirelessly to maintain its own survival.

"Everything depends on how things unfold next."

"During this process, I might even steer events a bit further. The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is searching for an internal spy. Why not take advantage of this opportunity…"

Li Fan narrowed his eyes, calculating in his heart.

After a long time, he finally stood up.

Having broken through to a new realm, he had examined the changes in his body for now.

As for the doubling of his biological and psychological age limits displayed on the "[Truth] Panel," such details no longer mattered to Li Fan. To him, it was a triviality.

As long as his cultivation continues to progress, these things will naturally grow alongside it, so Li Fan doesn’t need to worry about them.

Perhaps only when he faces the chasm between the Dao Integration and Longevity Immortal realms in the future will he turn his attention to them again.

Compared to the numerical limit on lifespan, Li Fan found the two words marked afterward—"Heaven's Scorn"—to be more intriguing.

After some reflection, and according to the explanation of [Truth], Li Fan learned that although the theoretical maximum biological lifespan was 999 years, due to the hatred of this world's will, the actual lifespan that cultivators could achieve was far less than this figure.

This matched the current state of cultivators in the Xuanhuang Realm, as far as Li Fan knew.

However, he wasn’t worried about this matter.

Given his storm-stirring style of behavior, no matter the lifetime, it was unlikely that he would live to the average lifespan of a cultivator.

His true lifespan was, in essence, his psychological age.

Therefore, for Li Fan, making the most efficient use of each lifetime’s time was the most appropriate approach.

"Heaven's Scorn..."

Li Fan sneered internally.

Without thinking further, he slightly opened his mouth.

He transferred all the items from his storage ring into his own Cave Heaven, leaving only some ordinary objects in the ring to avoid suspicion. Then, he quietly left the underground chamber.

Instead of hurrying back to Congyun, he lingered in Tianling Prefecture to investigate the Zhang Debiao he had heard about earlier.

That’s right—Li Fan had his sights set on the remains of fallen cultivators on the Tianling Prefecture battlefield.

It wasn’t due to any particular eccentricity but to unlock new [Truth] Anchors points.

Previously, Li Fan had used fragments of a Golden Core to charge the last anchor point.

However, despite all his efforts afterward, [Truth] seemed to disdain the quality of the Golden Core fragments purchased from the Tianxuan Mirror, showing no reaction to them.

Li Fan speculated that the next anchor point might require a complete Golden Core to unlock.

But where would one find a Golden Core cultivator willing to sell their own core?

Neither the Tianxuan Mirror Mirror nor the civilian markets had such items for sale.

As a result, Li Fan had never had the opportunity to unlock a new anchor point.

But now, perhaps, the opportunity had come.

The war in Tianling Prefecture had claimed countless cultivators.

Even though they were not the main forces in the battle, the number of fallen Golden Core cultivators was undoubtedly significant.

Golden Core cultivators, unlike Nascent Soul cultivators, did not possess a Cave Heaven Dharma Domain to support them or reconstruct their bodies.

If vital areas such as the head or heart were suddenly injured and they failed to react in time to sustain themselves with spiritual energy or receive timely treatment, they would die.

Thus, it was quite likely that some of those corpses contained intact Golden Cores.

This Zhang Debiao profited from the dead, and one could tell just by hearing his name that he was a greedy, unscrupulous individual.

It shouldn’t be difficult to purchase some Golden Cores from him.

Li Fan calculated his plans with precision, but he encountered difficulties right from the first step.

After searching all over Tianling Prefecture, he couldn’t find Zhang Debiao’s whereabouts.

It was said that he had been in Tianling City just a few days ago, but recently, no one had seen him.

According to rumors, Zhang Debiao had previously boasted to his confidants that he had taken on a huge deal.

It was unclear if he had gone off to complete this big transaction.

Chapter 586: A Brand-New Shock

“Cultivators’ entire beings are treasures. It's not strange for someone to have the same idea about me as I do about others.”

“After all, compared to the effort of grasping the laws of the heavens, directly seizing a ready-made Golden Core is much quicker.”

“But if it’s something that can be called a major business…”

A flicker of doubt passed through Li Fan’s mind. “Buying large quantities of cultivators’ corpses—what are they planning to do?”

Li Fan didn’t intend to delve too deeply into the other party’s motives.

However, their secretive actions, coupled with Zhang Debiao’s prolonged absence, hinted that something ominous might have already occurred.

Even though it’s challenging to silently kill a cultivator in the Xuanhuang Realm due to the phenomena accompanying their death, making someone vanish without a trace is an entirely different matter—there are countless ways to achieve it.

Take Zhou Qingang, for example. He’s still lying at the bottom of the Congyun Sea, a prime example.

As Li Fan hesitated, contemplating whether to spend some contribution points to have someone investigate Zhang Debiao further, an unfamiliar cultivator unexpectedly arrived at his door.

Since Li Fan had been operating under a completely new identity, using the alias "Yu Ji" during his recent activities in Tianling Prefecture, he immediately realized that the visitor’s purpose must be related to Zhang Debiao’s disappearance.

“Interesting. Let’s see what they want.”

In the courtyard of the Discussing-Dao Tower, Li Fan met the visitor.

It was a gray-robed cultivator.

Short, frail, and hunched, the figure’s face was etched with deep wrinkles, and he hobbled as though a gust of wind could knock him down.

As the stranger approached, Li Fan faintly detected a putrid, rancid odor emanating from him.

“Heh, heh, heh...”

“Fellow Daoist Yu, I heard you’re looking for Zhang Debiao? Could it be that he has something you need?”

The gray-robed cultivator wasted no time, speaking in an eerie, raspy voice.

Li Fan squinted his eyes, scrutinizing the visitor.

Though the person seemed to possess only Golden Core-level cultivation, Li Fan was almost certain it was merely an illusion.

The faint yet persistent sense of danger emanating from the stranger reminded Li Fan that this gray-robed cultivator was anything but simple.

“How should I address you, Fellow Daoist?” Li Fan asked politely, bowing slightly without directly answering the question.

“Daoist Xiumu,” the gray-robed cultivator replied succinctly.

Li Fan scanned his memory and found no record of such a person.

After a moment’s pause, he lowered his voice and nodded. “Indeed. I need some Golden Cores from cultivators. The more intact, the better. The higher the level of law they contain, the better.”

“Price is not an issue,” Li Fan added, emphasizing his sincerity.

A glimmer of light flashed in Daoist Xiumu’s eyes as he reached out, producing a Golden Core that shimmered with alternating blue and red hues.

“Fellow Daoist Yu, what do you think of this one?”

Li Fan’s heart stirred. He accepted the Golden Core and examined it closely.

It appeared freshly harvested from a cultivator, with faint traces of bloodstains still visible.

Sensing it with his cultivation, Li Fan discovered that the core contained insights related to wood and fire laws.

Using his [Truth] ability, the hint that it can be absorbed came through.

“What’s the price?” Li Fan asked.

“30,000 contribution points,” Daoist Xiumu said with a low voice.

Perhaps fearing that Li Fan might consider it too expensive, he quickly added, “I also have single-law Golden Cores available, which are cheaper—only 15,000 contribution points each. Of course, if you need a larger quantity, the price is negotiable.”

“Oh, and payment must be in equivalent spirit stones. I don’t accept direct transfers of contribution points,” he added as Li Fan hesitated.

Li Fan wasn’t concerned about the price but found Daoist Xiumu's sudden appearance suspicious.

Moreover, the blatant sale of Golden Cores—something so taboo—was presented as casually as if it were common merchandise.

Even more concerning, Li Fan was using an entirely fabricated identity.

Daoist Xiumu knew nothing of his background, yet acted so brazenly.

Was he truly not afraid of Li Fan being a member of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, secretly investigating and enforcing the law?

“28,000 works too,” Daoist Xiumu offered, lowering the price when Li Fan remained silent.

Feigning hesitation, Li Fan finally nodded. “Deal.”

Pretending to store it in his ring, he secretly absorbed it using [Truth] Absorption instead.

The [Truth] Absorption panel showed a progress increase of 0.5% for unlocking an anchor point.

“At this rate, I’ll need a total of 200 complete Golden Cores, assuming they’re dual-law cores like this one. If they’re single-law cores, the number will be even higher.”

“Conventional methods won’t suffice to collect so many.”

“Unless I embrace evil and become a demon, slaughtering Golden Core cultivators indiscriminately...”

This thought crossed Li Fan’s mind momentarily before he dismissed it.

“Fellow Daoist Xiumu,” Li Fan coughed lightly, not requesting another transaction but instead voicing his doubts.

To his surprise, Daoist Xiumu responded nonchalantly, “Rest assured, our Golden Cores are nothing like the subpar ones Zhang Debiao scavenges. The origins of ours are safe and reliable—absolutely no concerns.”

“Even if the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance investigates, there won’t be any problems. You can use them without worry!”

He patted his chest confidently, with such force that Li Fan almost thought he might collapse from the effort.

“Impossible.”

The answer was far beyond Li Fan’s expectations, and he couldn’t hide his disbelief.

“This Golden Core clearly looks freshly extracted from a cultivator! Such an inhumane act wouldn’t just alarm the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance—even the Five Elders Association wouldn’t let it slide!”

“If it weren’t for my urgent need, I wouldn’t engage in such a conscience-betraying act!” Li Fan declared righteously.

Daoist Xiumu sneered, not bothering to refute Li Fan’s theatrics, but suddenly asked, “What if the cultivators volunteered for this?”

“Volunteer?!”

Li Fan froze.

“That’s impossible!”

Shocked by the suggestion, he stared at Daoist Xiumu with wide eyes.

“Where there’s demand, there’s a market.”

“For as long as the Xuanhuang Realm’s order has been reestablished, our line of work has never been anything new,” Daoist Xiumu explained, shaking his head.

“Scavenging Golden Cores from corpses, like what Zhang Debiao does, is far too inefficient.”

Chapter 587: The Withering Tree That Boils Human Life

"Not to mention where we could even find so many fallen Golden Core cultivators' corpses."

"After a cultivator dies, their Dao/Law returns to the heavens. While the Golden Core is a condensation of a cultivator's understanding of the laws of heaven and earth, it still relies on the treasures of heaven and earth as its foundation."

"Once the Dao returns to the heavens, the treasures lose their essence, and the methods condensed within the Golden Core lose their foundation. Not only does the quality of the Golden Core deteriorate significantly, but over time, it risks disintegrating and cannot be preserved for long."

It seemed that this topic fell squarely within his area of expertise, as Daoist Xiumu spoke with great confidence.

A rare light appeared on his weathered face, and the tight wrinkles around his features unconsciously relaxed.

"But all of these problems and troubles can be easily solved as long as the cultivator consents."

"If a cultivator extracts their Golden Core while still alive, it does not trigger the mechanisms of heaven's malice. With the treasures of heaven and earth at the core, the Golden Core can be preserved indefinitely."

"Though the cultivator would lose their cultivation and become no different from a mortal, it’s just the Golden Core stage—rebuilding their cultivation isn’t too difficult!"

"If resources are sufficient, it would take no more than ten years to form a new Golden Core."

"Well, while the production cycle is still a bit long, given our current number of cultivators, we could easily achieve a harvest of several hundred Golden Cores annually."

The Daoist Xiumu spoke these eerie words with an unsettling calmness.

"Stable, long-term, and harmless. Can that brat Zhang Debiao, who stumbled upon luck, even compare to this?"

"He can't!"

"So, my friend, if you have a need, you must prioritize working with us!"

Daoist Xiumu looked at Li Fan, his eyes gleaming with fervor.

Li Fan, however, was clearly unconvinced by such a simple pitch and shook his head repeatedly. "Don't try to deceive me, my friend. What cultivator would willingly allow their Golden Core to be extracted every decade or so? Just thinking about it is terrifying…"

"Misunderstanding, misunderstanding!" The Daoist Xiumu quickly interrupted Li Fan.

"We now have techniques to extract Golden Cores painlessly and harmlessly. Not only do cultivators not feel any pain, but they even experience a unique pleasure. In fact, I know of someone who, in pursuit of the thrill of having their Golden Core extracted, immediately resumed cultivation each time after losing their core."

"That person has now become our most efficient cultivator, producing a dual-method Golden Core every three to four years!"

Daoist Xiumu spoke with such enthusiasm that he seemed completely oblivious to the absurdity of his words.

Even someone as detached as Li Fan couldn’t help but feel a chill watching the Daoist Xiumu.

"So, all of your concerns are entirely unnecessary."

"We have been examined and certified by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance. Think about it—we have to supply the alliance with a certain number of materials every year. If there were any quality issues, wouldn’t the alliance be the first to hold us accountable? Rest assured, my friend!"

Li Fan narrowed his eyes. "The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance knows about what you do? Why haven’t I heard of it before?"

The Daoist Xiumu mumbled in a low voice, "Our ideas are simply too advanced. The alliance believes that if made public, it would surely lead to misunderstanding among the masses."

"That’s why it remains undisclosed."

"After all, ordinary people can’t comprehend it. But someone like you, my friend, surely can understand, right?"

Daoist Xiumu looked at Li Fan with eager anticipation.

"Understanding is one thing, but it’s still hard to fully accept right away," Li Fan said ambiguously.

Daoist Xiumu seemed delighted to have found a kindred spirit, clapping his hands in praise. "I knew it! I didn’t misjudge you—you’re a person of great wisdom!"

He suddenly stood up, pacing excitedly as he muttered, "The sorrow of harming one’s kind is but natural law. It’s normal for you, my friend, to take time to adjust your perspective!"

"But I believe that once you see it with your own eyes, you’ll quickly come around!"

"What do you think? Would you like to visit and see for yourself?"

Li Fan was about to refuse outright but was suddenly overcome by an inexplicable impulse.

Looking at the frail and aged cultivator before him and imagining the countless Golden Cores that might be waiting for him there, Li Fan, who needed intact Golden Cores to unlock anchor points, inexplicably changed his mind.

"Fine! There’s no harm in taking a look."

The moment the words left his mouth, Li Fan felt a jolt of shock.

He suddenly realized that this gray-robed cultivator before him was far more dangerous than he had initially imagined!

Wanting only to purchase some Golden Cores, Li Fan hadn’t anticipated stumbling into such a troubling situation.

His luck was truly awful.

Cursing inwardly, Li Fan reconsidered but ultimately convinced himself to proceed.

"Daoist Xiumu, how do I refer to your place, and how do I get there?" Li Fan asked with feigned interest.

Daoist Xiumu slapped his forehead in mock annoyance. "Oh, I almost forgot to introduce it."

"Our place is called… Withering Human Life."

Li Fan felt an eerie chill as the Daoist’s tone and expression became momentarily sinister before returning to his usual enthusiasm.

"As for how to get there…"

"Just hold onto me!"

Li Fan obediently grabbed the Daoist Xiumu’s sleeve.

"Hold on tight!"

The Daoist shouted and began chanting: "The heavens hold the Withering Tree, life ebbs and flows under its shadow…"

Thick gray mist rolled in, enveloping them in an instant. Twisted shadows and eerie sounds blurred their surroundings.

Despite the ominous setting, Li Fan felt no sense of danger. Instead, he was overwhelmed by a strange sense of belonging, as though he was meant to be there.

When the gray fog cleared, their destination revealed itself.

"Here we are, my friend!" Daoist Xiumu announced cheerfully.

Li Fan looked up to see an enormous tree, withered and spotted, stretching toward the heavens. Its branches were covered with countless cultivators hanging like fruits.

Chapter 588: The Span of the Flowing River, The Eternal Strength of the Wall

A gentle breeze swept through the air, carrying a faint yet unmistakable stench of decay.

The rustling of dry leaves broke the silence, as a few fluttered down from the treetops, only to vanish into nothingness before touching the ground.

Li Fan distinctly saw something on the surface of the leaves—a fleeting glimpse of twisted, agonized faces.

Under normal circumstances, anyone witnessing such a bizarre scene would inevitably feel a chill of terror.

Yet, at this moment, in Li Fan's eyes, this place known as “Withering Human Life” was nothing short of enchanting.

Taking a deep breath, the putrid air filled his lungs, and he found it oddly sweet.

Greedily, he inhaled a few more times.

He carefully observed the cultivators hanging from the trees and noticed their lifeless black eyes devoid of pupils, paired with eerie smiles on their faces.

Their hair had fused with the branches, serving as ropes to suspend their bodies.

Some of the cultivators still had intact clothing.

Others seemed to have been hanging there for years, their clothes corroded and tattered.

Rotten branches wound around their bodies, covering exposed flesh while deeply piercing their muscles and sinews.

“Marvelous! Truly marvelous!”

Without needing the Daoist Xiumu to explain, Li Fan immediately understood the mechanisms of this place the moment he stepped into Withering Human Life.

Facing this ghastly scene, not only did Li Fan feel no fear or vigilance, but he clapped his hands in admiration.

His tone carried a hint of envy, as if he believed that all cultivators should naturally be hung upon such branches.

Moreover, to have the dead tree pierce their flesh seemed to him an unimaginable honor.

“How is it, Fellow Daoist Yu? Was my description exaggerated?” The Daoist Xiumu, appearing more frail than ever, coughed violently for a long time before catching his breath to ask.

“Indeed, your words ring true!” Li Fan nodded in agreement.

“This creation is truly extraordinary! What is the name of this tree?” Staring intently at the withered giant tree, his eyes glowed with obsession.

“It was once called ‘Ruomu,’ but now…” Daoist Xiumu also raised his head, his expression unreadable.

[TL Note: Ruomu means 'a young tree' or 'sapling']

“It is known as ‘The Eternal Wall of the River of Life.’”

Though the name was difficult to pronounce, the moment the Daoist Xiumu uttered it, Li Fan immediately understood its meaning.

“It has existed since time immemorial and will continue to exist eternally, standing tall above the River of Life, like a wall that holds up the heavens.”

“Still, I prefer its original name,” Li Fan said, shaking his head.

The Daoist Xiumu let out a low chuckle, unfazed. “A name is but a label. As time flows and generations of living beings rise and fall, their terms for it change as well.”

“But none of that affects its existence.”

For some reason, a shadow seemed to flicker through the Daoist Xiumu's eyes as he said this.

Li Fan, however, agreed and replied, “That may be true, but the present is no longer what it once was.”

Every moment spent here brought countless visions into Li Fan’s mind.

Naturally, he came to know much about the tree and its history.

With a wistful look, he recited softly:

“When heaven and earth birthed life, Ruomu claimed their years. It drew their essence to bear the Fruit of Longevity, granting eternal life to those who consumed it.”

Daoist Xiumu’s cloudy eyes seemed to brighten as he heard Li Fan’s words, turning slightly with a glimmer of light.

After a long silence, the two resumed their conversation.

“Fellow Daoist Yu, you truly possess great wisdom!” the Daoist Xiumu sighed.

“Of the countless cultivators who have come here to witness this, few have adapted as quickly as you.”

Li Fan’s eyes narrowed slightly, and he said in a low voice, “It is not that I am wise but that others are ignorant.”

“How are these cultivators fundamentally different from any other living creature?”

“Trees bear fruit, flowers yield nectar. Beasts give birth to offspring, birds lay eggs.”

“Humans consume these as sustenance, deeming it ordinary. Why, then, should they find it unacceptable when they themselves are consumed?”

“Do they truly believe themselves to be the spirit of the heavens, the masters of all creation?”

Li Fan sneered.

Daoist Xiumu was momentarily taken aback, as Li Fan had preemptively voiced his own argument, leaving him momentarily speechless.

“In my view, it is nothing more than the law of the jungle,” Li Fan continued, shaking his head.

“To devour now is satisfying. Should the day come when one is devoured, there should be no complaints. The way of heaven is fair, and karma spares no one!”

Li Fan swayed slightly, deeply immersed in his own thoughts.

Daoist Xiumu stared at Li Fan for a while before suddenly understanding.

“Ah, so your mindset hasn’t changed—you’ve always thought this way.”

“What a pity, what a pity!”

Daoist Xiumu shook his head slightly.

Li Fan, however, appeared indifferent, as though he hadn’t heard the old man’s words.

He continued gazing at the withered Ruomu, as if something within it deeply captivated him.

“To think that such an anomaly would arise among cultivators…” Daoist Xiumu furrowed his brows, seemingly deep in thought.

“Cough, cough…”

He suddenly burst into a violent coughing fit, green blood faintly seeping from the corners of his mouth.

Above him, the Ruomu trembled without wind, shedding countless withered leaves.

“Good riddance, good riddance!”

Daoist Xiumu’s face twisted with a momentary ferocity as he laughed wildly.

“So the heavens are fair, and even the wicked have their comeuppance!”

“This child is useless to me here. It’s better to send him back to sow chaos!”

“Karma—everything is karma!”

…

After his outburst, Daoist Xiumu gradually regained his composure, returning to the demeanor he had when first meeting Li Fan.

“Fellow Daoist Yu, now that you’ve seen it for yourself, I trust you’re satisfied with the quality of our… products?”

“Shall we proceed with our prior agreement?” he asked with a sinister grin.

“Agreement?” Li Fan turned, momentarily dazed.

“Oh, that matter! No rush!” he replied, waving it off as if it were trivial.

“Ha-ha-ha…”

Daoist Xiumu let out his unsettling laughter once more. “This place is fascinating, but it’s not where you belong.”

“I believe the outside world, the Xuanhuang Realm, suits you far better.”

Li Fan was about to protest, but Daoist Xiumu grabbed his shoulder.

Billowing gray mist rose from the ground, quickly enveloping him.

“Why are you so eager to send me away, Daoist?” Li Fan asked anxiously.

Daoist Xiumu sneered but did not answer.

“You wanted a Golden Core, right? Well, since I’m feeling generous, I’ll gift you some for free this time!”

As the gray mist obscured his vision, Li Fan vaguely heard the Daoist Xiumu’s voice.

His sight blurred, and he stumbled, finding himself back in the guest courtyard of the Discussing-Dao Tower in Tianling Prefecture.

Daoist Xiumu, “The Eternal Wall of the River of Life,” and the countless cultivators hanging from its branches had vanished as if they were never there.

It all felt like a hallucination.

But the withered branch lying quietly on the table served as undeniable proof.

No longer under the tree’s influence, Li Fan’s thoughts returned to normal.

Recalling his recent experience, he felt as though he had plunged into an icy abyss.

Yet, fearing that the Daoist Xiumu might still be watching, he suppressed his terror and feigned calm.

Chapter 589: The Divine Tree Condenses Longevity

This was already Li Fan's sixth cup of spiritual tea.

The tea was named "Spring Sun Warmth", priced at 800 contribution points per cup.

It was said that the tea tree needed to be cultivated in a cave environment with year-round dry weather, grown facing the sun. It only sprouted once every three years, making it extremely rare.

After drinking it, a warm current would rise within one's body, creating a sensation akin to basking in sunlight. The effects lasted for several days.

Yet, even this widely acclaimed tea failed to dispel the cold fear lingering in Li Fan's heart.

This was the third time Li Fan, since entering the cycle of reincarnation in the Xuanhuang Realm, had directly faced a true powerhouse in his original form.

The first time was when his clone was seen through by the Heavenly Doctor, who followed the connection to invade Li Fan’s private space in the Tianxuan Mirror.

The second time was during his secluded cultivation in Tianyu Prefecture, comprehending the "Great Five Elements Annihilation Sword." The Old Fisherman, drawn by the aura of heavenly calamity within it, had unexpectedly appeared.

This third encounter, however, was even more startling and caught him completely off guard.

And it was far more perilous.

At least the Old Fisherman, though mad and incoherent, bore no malice toward Li Fan. On the contrary, he had even given him a fortunate opportunity.

The encounter with the Heavenly Doctor was Li Fan’s own doing, as he had taken on a mission offering a reward of 100,000 contribution points and willingly sought out the trouble. Though he hadn’t yet learned the importance of concealing his thoughts before a powerhouse, leading to his intentions being discovered, his true consciousness was clear at the time. Plus, with the [Truth] Shield protecting him, the danger had been more bark than bite.

But this time...

Daoist Xiumu appeared suddenly and without warning, catching Li Fan entirely unprepared.

Their methods were terrifying, and even now, recalling the experience, Li Fan felt a chill of dread.

“Unlike the Heavenly Doctor’s method of seeing through human hearts, the Daoist Xiumu—or rather, ‘Ruomu’—can directly distort and alter a cultivator's thoughts and perceptions.”

“And the cultivator themselves remains oblivious to any abnormalities…”

“No wonder the Daoist Xiumu previously claimed that the cultivators who had their golden cores taken were all ‘willing.’”

Recalling his thoughts and reactions at the time, Li Fan felt another wave of coldness rising in his heart.

He downed another cup of "Spring Sun Warmth" to calm his nerves.

“Natural selection—this is simply the way of nature.”

“But after following him and witnessing the place called ‘Withering Human Life,’ not only did I not sense danger or sorrow, I actually found it entirely reasonable.”

“I even felt a desire to replace them myself…”

Li Fan squinted his eyes, replaying the scenes before Ruomu in his mind through the Dao Deviation Stone.

The influence of Ruomu had dissipated by now.

Though Li Fan had always regarded all living beings as tools, seeing cultivators suspended like fruit from branches still instinctively filled him with unease.

This was the natural reaction he should have had.

“Under the Daoist Xiumu’s influence, my concepts were twisted and seemingly guided toward extremes.”

“One could say I became somewhat deranged.”

Li Fan didn’t deny that, deep within, he might indeed harbor a faint shadow of such thoughts.

But humans are complex spiritual aggregates, often harboring contradictory beliefs.

A fleeting thought cannot, of course, define one’s fundamental worldview.

“This Daoist Xiumu is highly abnormal.”

“They seem to harbor a profound hatred for cultivators.”

Naturally, Li Fan didn’t believe someone with Ruomu's level of cultivation would sell golden cores merely for contribution points.

Abducting cultivators to join the ‘Withering Human Life’ production line might also be secondary.

The primary purpose, it seemed, was likely to propagate the idea that “cultivators can also be like fruit.”

Such heretical views would undoubtedly be rejected by the cultivator community. The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance was likely monitoring and suppressing such ideologies, which was why the Daoist Xiumu couldn’t act openly.

“Revenge, perhaps…” Li Fan’s eyes flickered with thought.

The heavens give rise to all living things, yet Ruomu steals their longevity. It draws life to create longevity fruits, which, when consumed, grant eternal life.

During the period when Ruomu controlled his thoughts, countless scenes had flashed through Li Fan's mind.

He saw a towering, vibrant tree utterly unlike the current withered one.

It stretched up to the heavens, verdant and brimming with life.

No cultivators hung from its branches.

At its crown, there were merely a few translucent, purple-and-gold fruits of extraordinary quality.

The fruit’s surface bore faint patterns—trees, mountains, exotic beasts.

The markings on each purple-and-gold fruit were unique, with no duplicates.

In those flashes of vision, Li Fan also saw that, at first, only ordinary humans stumbled upon the tree. They had no cultivation and dressed as common mortals.

Only a select few lucky individuals managed to climb the tree’s branches and successfully pluck the purple-and-gold fruits.

Later, however, humans came more frequently and grew stronger.

Some climbed the giant tree as though walking on flat ground.

Naturally, more fruits were taken.

As a result, Ruomu, once indifferent to outside intrusions, began to change.

It birthed various mystical creatures on its branches as a defensive system to repel intruders seeking its fruit.

This worked for a while.

But the peace didn’t last.

When humans returned, their strength had undergone an earth-shattering transformation.

They came in groups, clad in peculiar garments, capable of flight and manipulating the energy of the heavens to battle.

The creatures Ruomu had spawned were no match for them.

Humans seized control of Ruomu and claimed it as their own.

They stationed guards and periodically harvested its fruits.

…

“Xuantian Sect?”

The attire of the humans in those visions was distinctive and unmistakable.

It bore a striking resemblance to the robes Li Fan had seen on the remains of a Xuantian Sect Dharma King in Senior Sister Zhao’s illusion.

The Xuantian Sect ruled over this place for a long time.

When the scene shifted again, the people now appearing at Ruomu were cultivators from the Ten Great Immortal Sects.

“Longevity Fruit, perhaps?”

Li Fan glanced at the withered tree fragment on the table, his mind racing.

After a long moment of reflection, his thoughts returned to the memory.

During the Ten Great Immortal Sects’ occupation of Ruomu, the yield of purple-and-gold fruits inexplicably began to decline.

The cultivators who came to harvest the fruits also seemed to come from different sects each time.

What followed remained unclear…

One day, dozens of cultivators with powerful auras stormed into the scene.

After easily slaying the guards, they did not immediately plunder the purple-and-gold fruits.

Instead, they stared at Ruomu, arguing over something.

Their dispute grew heated but eventually reached a resolution.

The subsequent scene made Li Fan’s pupils contract sharply.

They set up an enormous formation, sealing Ruomu within.

Black chains, like long needles, pierced into the tree at various points.

Soon, an unending stream of life energy was drawn out and gathered into a green ball of light in the air.

........................................................................

Read extra chapters on >>> patreon.com/SpiritStonetranslation

Chapter 590: The Thousand-Year Transformation of Eternal Life

The once lush, vibrant trees began to visibly age as specks of green light continuously dissipated.

During this time, the ‘Ruomu’ made several attempts to fight back. The tree trembled, manifesting countless mystical creatures that fearlessly charged at the cultivators. Even the Ruomu itself lashed out with its branches like swords.

However, the cultivators who had come to this place were terrifyingly powerful. All resistance was futile and was immediately suppressed. Even the Ruomu’s desperate final strike—causing the purple-gold fruits at its peak to wither—was salvaged by this group.

Left powerless, Ruomu could only watch as its life essence was wantonly extracted. Its leaves gradually turned yellow and fell like rain. Amid thunderous roars, many branches snapped off with loud crashes.

Cracks began to spread across the Ruomu's trunk, yet this group showed no signs of stopping. Their intent was clear—they would not cease until it was completely drained.

Fortunately, at the critical moment, another group of cultivators arrived. A fierce battle broke out between the two factions, forcing the extraction process to halt. The newcomers successfully retrieved the condensed green light of ball from the air and departed, but not before launching a combined attack on the already-devastated Ruomu.

This second assault inflicted even greater damage than the forced extraction of its life energy. Massive fissures ran up the tree’s trunk, causing large sections of branches to fall, their destinations unknown.

The rescuers, seeing the extent of the damage, abandoned their pursuit to focus on healing the Ruomu. Thanks to their efforts, the Ruomu narrowly escaped total destruction. However, the injuries it sustained were so severe that recovery seemed impossible.

From that moment on, decay and aging became the tree’s constant companions. Many years later, a humanoid cultivator emerged from the Ruomu, manifesting from within its essence.

---

The fragmented scenes witnessed in the 'Withering Human Life' conveyed an overwhelming amount of information.

Li Fan replayed these images repeatedly through the Dao Deviation Stone, piecing together clues with the information he had previously gathered. Gradually, he formed a hypothesis.

"The cultivators who harmed the Ruomu were likely the same group who, during the great calamity, advocated abandoning the Xuanhuang Realm and fleeing far away."

"Judging by the power they displayed, some among them were clearly experts at the Longevity Immortal Stage."

"Five hundred years ago, for some unknown reason, this group attempted to return to the Xuanhuang Realm, sparking a great conflict."

"Sima Changkong once mentioned that the heavens themselves express extreme hatred for these cultivators, far more than for those of us who plunder and dominate the world."

"Traitors... What did they steal?"

"Could it have been the Ruomu, the tree capable of producing Fruits of Longevity?"

"Hmm... Judging by their methods, there may have been something else involved."

"Thousands of years have passed since their departure and return. Did they ultimately fail to escape the ‘Immortal Ruins’, or was there another reason?"

Li Fan furrowed his brows in thought.

The existence of the Immortal Ruins was no secret to the Ten Immortal Sects. The ruthless, decisive actions of this group implied that they had confidence in their ability to escape the Xuanhuang Realm. Yet, for some reason, they were forced to return.

The known information was too sparse, so Li Fan decided to set this matter aside for now.

Regardless, he now understood why the Ruomu harbored such deep resentment toward cultivators.

Whether it was being recklessly plundered for its fruits or nearly destroyed afterward, the enmity between the Ruomu and cultivators could only be described as irreconcilable.

If Li Fan had suffered such treatment, his vengeance would undoubtedly have been several times more ruthless.

"After the Immortal Ancestor imparted a new method of cultivation, the Fruits of Longevity no longer grant eternal life."

"From the Ruomu's perspective, this might actually be a blessing."

"In a way, the Immortal Ancestor may have been its savior. Without him, no matter how powerful the Ruomu was, it would still be unable to escape the fate of being exploited."

"Judging by its attempt to reverse the 'Destruction of its Kind,' it seems the Ruomu itself has not yet reached the Longevity Immortal Realm. However, given its incredible nature and ancient origin, its strength cannot be measured by simple Dao Integration standards."

"Is it above Dao Integration but below Longevity Immortal? The gap between these stages is staggeringly vast."

The powerful entities Li Fan had encountered recently—the Heavenly Doctor, the Old Fisherman, and now the Ruomu—all seemed to be in this intermediate realm. While this might be coincidental, it highlighted the immense difficulty of transcending the laws of the universe to achieve eternal life.

Despite the abundance of talent and brilliance in the world, the path to Longevity Immortal under the new method remained treacherously narrow, with only a few successfully attaining it.

Li Fan’s gaze deepened, and he fell silent for a long time.

Reflecting on this encounter, Li Fan began to reconsider his actions.

"Encountering the Ruomu and nearly losing my life—it was truly a matter of bad luck."

"I was not complacent after my recent breakthrough. This was the Tianling Prefecture's city, and the villa I rented from the Discussing-Dao Tower should have been secure."

"Who could have anticipated that a cultivator dealing in dubious trades, selling Golden Cores, would turn out to be a powerful entity filled with malice toward humanity?"

This realization left Li Fan feeling helpless.

He could not always hide and rely solely on his clone for action. Although useful, the clone was limited—it was weaker than his true self and could not wield the full extent of his abilities. Expecting it to reach the Longevity Immortal Realm was unrealistic.

"Like being struck by lightning while walking down the street, such rare incidents shouldn't deter me from action altogether."

"There are situations where only my true self can act seamlessly and leave no trace behind."

"Still, the Ruomu’s ability to manipulate and distort one's thoughts is something I must find a way to defend against."

"If it hadn't harbored hatred toward cultivators and glimpsed some future act of mine, intending to use me for vengeance, I might have remained trapped in its grasp indefinitely."

"Even with my supposedly resolute mind, I was utterly defenseless against it."

"In the cultivation world, there are endless treasures and techniques. Surely, I can find a method to counter such abilities."

"I don’t need complete immunity—just enough clarity to counteract this shortcoming."

Li Fan committed this task to memory, placing it as a top priority.

After calming his thoughts, Li Fan finally picked up the withered Ruomu branch that had been sitting on his table.

As he carefully examined it, a sense of familiarity struck him.

It wasn't because he had previously encountered the Ruomu itself but rather because...

This branch seemed similar to the material Jiao Xiuyuan had used to craft clones.

Chapter 591: Anticipating the Path of Soul Transformation

"Jiao Xiuyuan used materials from the Ruomu tree to create his clones?"

Feeling a stir in his heart, Li Fan held the withered branch of the Ruomu tree in his hand and carefully attuned to it.

After a long time, he seemed to understand but shook his head slightly.

"Similar, but different. It's as if they share the same origin, yet there are distinct differences."

"Furthermore, with the Daoist Xiumu's deep disdain for cultivators, it's unlikely he would cooperate with Jiao Xiuyuan."

"So, this must be..."

A scene suddenly flashed in Li Fan's mind: the Ruomu tree being besieged by cultivators, its trunk splitting open, and numerous branches falling from the sky.

"Perhaps those branches that separated back then fell into the Xuanhuang Realm and experienced entirely new fates."

The resilience of plant life is always astonishing. Even ordinary trees can regenerate broken branches.

Let alone an extraordinary being like the Ruomu Tree, capable of bearing the Fruit of Longevity.

"Still, whether Jiao Xiuyuan truly evolved from a fallen branch of the Ruomu tree or simply found its remnants to craft his clones, it's hard to determine for now."

With a thought, Li Fan made the withered Ruomu branch in his hand sprout a new bud.

In an instant, the bud grew into a tender young branch.

At its tip, as if bearing fruit, hung a small golden spherical object.

Li Fan's eyelids twitched.

This "golden fruit" was, of course, the golden core that the Daoist Xiumu had promised to gift him.

However, the method of storage was quite peculiar.

Reaching out, Li Fan tried to pluck the golden core.

A faint resistance emanated from the "fruit."

Li Fan exerted more force, and the golden core was successfully plucked.

Due to the recoil, the new branch flung backward violently and swayed in the air before abruptly retracting into the withered Ruomu branch.

Before Li Fan could think further, the branch extended again, producing yet another golden core.

Looking at the seemingly sentient Ruomu branch before him, Li Fan grew somber.

He refrained from acting rashly and, like harvesting fruit, plucked core after core until they were all collected.

The process took nearly the time of one incense stick to burn.

A total of 372 golden cores.

After relinquishing all its cores, the Ruomu branch fulfilled its purpose.

It disintegrated into ashes, scattering into the wind.

During the "harvesting" process, although Li Fan appeared to store the golden cores in his spatial ring, he had secretly begun absorbing them using the [Truth] ability.

As he had guessed, single-law golden cores increased the anchor's charge progress by only 0.25%, while dual-law golden cores increased it by 0.5%.

However, triple-law golden cores represented a qualitative leap, each contributing 2% progress.

Among the 372 cores, triple-law cores were rare, while single-law and dual-law cores constituted the majority.

There were no cores with four or more laws.

Thus, after unlocking the fifth anchor point, only 16 carefully selected golden cores remained.

Li Fan’s selection wasn’t based solely on the number of laws in the golden core but rather their rarity.

Common five-elemental laws were inferior to those he had personally comprehended and were therefore deemed unnecessary to preserve.

Meanwhile, some laws pertained to fields Li Fan knew little about, making them valuable for someone newly advanced to the Nascent Soul stage like himself.

The Nascent Soul stage revolves around cultivating and refining one's Cave-Heaven Law Domain.

The more complete this law domain, the stronger the Nascent Soul cultivator’s combat capabilities.

When the domain aligns nearly perfectly with the external Xuanhuang Realm, one can begin to anticipate the Soul Transformation stage.

Li Fan didn't know all the details yet, but he had a vague idea of the process.

The so-called "extracting the marrow of heaven and earth to obtain its essence" refers to...

Heaven's marrow functions similarly to human bone marrow.

Human marrow's primary role is blood production, while heaven's marrow produces laws.

The laws of heaven and earth, like blood in the human body, are foundational to the world's stability.

Without blood, the body dies; without laws, the world collapses.

By disguising one’s cave-heaven as part of the Xuanhuang Realm, one can trick heaven's marrow into bestowing its laws, thus appropriating strands of the world's natural order.

However, just as human marrow also supports immunity and defense mechanisms, heaven's marrow possesses certain countermeasures.

Thus, during the "extraction of heaven's marrow", cultivators must be cautious of the world's backlash.

Only one law can be extracted at a time, and greed must be avoided.

If sacrificing heaven’s soul is the bold and open method of claiming laws, then extracting heaven’s marrow is the covert and cunning method employed when one's strength is insufficient.

This process strengthens oneself while weakening heaven, narrowing the gap between the two.

It also prepares for the eventual Dao Integration process.

Standing at the Nascent Soul stage, Li Fan replayed the "extraction of heaven's marrow" process in his mind, gaining deeper insights compared to when he was at the Golden Core stage.

"Truly a heavenly genius, the method of Immortal Ancestor is brilliant."

"From mimicking heaven’s wonders and observing its laws, a mere mortal with no aptitude for cultivation is gradually integrated into the system of heaven and earth."

"Then, by stealing heaven's essence and marrow, one diminishes the gap between oneself and the cosmos."

"Eventually, one sacrifices heaven’s soul to wrest power from it."

"Finally, by defying the laws of heaven, one replaces it and attains eternal life."

"Step by step, clear and methodical…"

"Truly ingenious and nearly impossible to guard against. No wonder even the might of heaven was brought low by these new cultivators, forced to retaliate."

Li Fan sighed again.

As he revisited this cultivation path, a sudden realization struck him—it resembled something deeply familiar in his memories.

Yet, as he tried to dwell on it, the fleeting inspiration vanished entirely.

Even using the Dao Deviation Stone failed to recover the thought.

A feeling of loss welled up within him.

"How strange..."

Li Fan narrowed his eyes and fell into deep contemplation.

He was almost certain that this sudden insight would not have dissipated so quickly under normal circumstances.

Some force must have interfered, causing the inspiration to vanish.

"Just like what I experienced in Senior Sister Zhao’s illusion realm," he thought.

"In that realm, whenever I tried to cultivate, the walls of the confinement room would emit distracting and mocking noises, hindering my recovery."

"The restrictions of the Xuanhuang Realm are even subtler and harder to detect."

"Immortal Ancestor… Is this your doing?"

Li Fan raised his head to the heavens, his expression inscrutable.

Chapter 592: The Fear of Passing on Knowledge

Li Fan naturally wasn’t concerned that the long-hidden "Immortal Ancestor" would suddenly appear just because of a casual upward glance he made toward the sky.

And then confront him, asking:

"Little friend, what exactly are you looking at?"

In fact, what Li Fan cared about was something entirely different.

As the saying goes: "The more you try to cover something up, the more obvious it becomes."

Only matters of great importance prompt one to resort to all sorts of means to hide them.

If someone truly didn’t care, why bother with any methods of concealment?

Throughout the thousands of years of the Xuanhuang Realm’s history, countless geniuses and exceptional figures have emerged.

Surely, many cultivators, like Li Fan just moments ago, must have had a stroke of serendipity, leading them to the brink of a profound realization.

But all of them were inexplicably suppressed by some unseen force.

This just shows that the Immortal Ancestor was actually a little wary of the cultivators from the Xuanhuang Realm understanding this matter...

The Immortal Ancestor, wielding the power of one individual, altered the course of heaven and earth, reshaping the balance between the old and the new cultivation methods.

For thousands of years, he subjugated the realm, forcing all cultivators to live as mere beasts of burden.

For such a figure to harbor even a shred of fear about something—how curious.

"Although it might not be outright fear, there is undoubtedly a concern in their mind," Li Fan mused.

"Interesting..."

In an instant, Li Fan pieced together these insights and grew genuinely intrigued by the hidden secret behind it all.

"Perhaps, the way to counter the Immortal Ancestor lies within this mystery."

"A secret may be able to deceive some people forever, or all people temporarily, but it can never deceive all people forever."

"In the Xuanhuang Realm, I have plenty of time to uncover and extract it."

"Besides, I may not be the only one involved."

Li Fan gazed at the vast sky in silence.

As the saying goes: "If one does not plan for eternity, they cannot even plan for a moment." The Immortal Ancestor of Dharma Transmission, standing as the most formidable obstacle on Li Fan’s path to immortality, was an adversary he would inevitably face.

To stumble upon even a minor flaw in their dominion, by sheer coincidence, was indeed fortunate for Li Fan.

"The world is always full of such coincidences. Just like how I was suddenly captured by the Xiumu and then inexplicably released."

"Just like my sudden enlightenment moments ago..."

"Such occurrences cannot be avoided."

"But my [Truth] ability can minimize the negative impacts of such coincidences while amplifying their beneficial outcomes infinitely."

With his thoughts surging and settling, Li Fan calmed himself after a long time and refocused his attention on the sixteen golden cores before him.

After pondering for a while, Li Fan decided to return to the Congyun Sea through a teleportation formation.

Reusing an old tactic, he excavated a secret chamber deep beneath the seabed trench and hid inside.

This was done to avoid any potential spying by Daoist Ruomu.

Whether it was an illusion or purely psychological, upon returning to the Congyun Sea, Li Fan’s heart instantly felt much more at ease.

Holding his breath and calming his mind, he focused intently.

Li Fan laid out the remaining sixteen golden cores and chose one of slightly inferior quality. He fed it once again to [Truth].

As he had anticipated, after [Truth] absorbed the core, the charging progress for the sixth anchoring point showed no noticeable change.

"[Truth]'s appetite is only growing larger."

"From Foundation Establishment treasures to Golden Cores."

"Don’t tell me that it will next require Cave Heavens or the Marrow of Heaven itself?"

At this thought, Li Fan’s expression subtly changed.

Golden Cores could still be managed—there were ways to procure some.

If his strength advanced further, acquiring a few Cave Heavens shouldn’t be a big problem either.

But as for the Marrow of Heaven or the Spirit of Heaven and Earth...

These were intrinsic to the Xuanhuang Realm, and their quantities were finite.

Countless cultivators were already eagerly waiting for their appearance, and any sighting would incite a frenzy.

Where could he find enough of these for [Truth] to devour?

"The remaining anchoring points are few. This is troublesome."

"I had initially planned to use one anchor after this life and then start anew at the Nascent Soul stage, gradually amassing strength through endless cycles."

"But now, it seems I must be more cautious. After all, I already know the location of the [Root of Heaven and Earth]. Restarting wouldn’t be too difficult."

...

As Li Fan pondered, he decided to stop feeding [Truth].

Instead, he picked up one of the remaining golden cores and held it in his hand to absorb it slowly.

Although it was a single-method golden core, it contained an extremely rare enchantment technique.

Related to mental power, it was exactly what Li Fan urgently needed to replenish.

The saying "One may use a stone from another mountain to sharpen their jade" proved true.

Although it wasn’t a defensive method, knowledge of mental attacks would provide invaluable insight. The next time he encountered such techniques, he would be better prepared.

For a deeper understanding, Li Fan drew upon the power of his Cave Heaven and reactivated the unique trait of the wondrous treasure [Seven-Aperture Exquisite Heart].

In that instant, numerous revelations flooded his mind.

Immersed in these insights, Li Fan couldn’t help but feel elated.

Meanwhile, as Li Fan was secluded in contemplation, the Congyun Sea was far from peaceful.

Although the battle in the Tianling Prefecture had ended and cultivators were recuperating, a recent decree from the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had stirred a commotion.

Due to the heavy losses in the war, the Alliance decided to sell all cultivation techniques at half price for the next year.

Even advanced techniques previously restricted by merit rankings were now unlocked.

No more rank restrictions—anyone with enough contribution points could purchase them directly.

Of course, some limitations remained.

Each individual could only purchase one technique, solely for personal cultivation. Reselling or transferring the technique in any form was strictly prohibited.

Violators would not only lose their cultivation rights to the technique but also face severe punishment.

For most cultivators, who previously couldn’t afford a single technique even by bankrupting themselves, these limitations seemed insignificant.

Their full attention was now captured by the dazzling list of techniques displayed in the Tianxuan Mirror.

Cultivation techniques are the foundation of immortality.

The quality of one’s technique directly determines their future prospects.

When these rare, high-level techniques entered the public view, the cultivators finally realized how inadequate their standard techniques were.

Opportunities like this were rare—missing out would mean regret.

Driven by envy, cultivators scrambled to calculate their contribution points and rushed to acquire their desired techniques.

At the same time, Congyun City became a gathering place for angry cultivators.

They surrounded the Bureau of Administration, demanding an explanation from He Zhenghao.

The reason was simple: during Li Fan’s previous fundraising plan, many had poured in their entire savings, leaving only a small reserve.

Now, they couldn’t afford to purchase techniques.

With rare techniques disappearing quickly, the cultivators grew increasingly frustrated and desperate.

Chapter 593: Endless Chaos Among in Congyun

“Damn it, give me back my money!”

“Who would’ve thought that Li Fan would suddenly become so ‘kind-hearted’? The fundraising plan, which had been suspended for so long, restarted without warning! Not only that, but he even removed the upper limit on contributions! Turns out this was all a setup to swindle us!”

“Exactly! His deduction abilities have reached such perfection that he could foresee even the ceasefire between the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association. Do you really think he couldn’t predict this? I say he took this opportunity to exploit his brothers!”

“No way! With the wealth and status the Lord Envoy now commands, would he really care about such a trivial amount of money from us?”

“Maybe not if it was just one person or even ten. But this time, there are tens of thousands of cultivators contributing! With so much credit at stake, even an Immortal Sage of Dao Integration would be tempted, let alone a minor envoy in a provincial domain! You’ll see—when we go to He Zhenghao to demand our credit back, he’ll surely make all kinds of excuses!”

Under the instigation of some cultivators, panic and anger spread like wildfire.

Crowds gathered in front of the Administration Bureau Hall, refusing to leave for a long time.

Normally, unrelated individuals were not allowed to congregate in the central core area of the Immortal City. However, this fundraising event involved so many people that even many cultivators within the system had contributed their entire savings.

Now that the techniques were available at half price, they couldn’t afford the required credit all at once. While they didn’t dare trouble their direct superiors, they didn’t hesitate to let these outside forces “advocate for their rights” on their behalf, turning a blind eye to the chaos.

Thus, the scene became one of complete disorder.

Outside was a chaotic uproar, but inside the Administration Hall, He Zhenghao and Gao Yuan appeared entirely unconcerned, at ease in their respective seats.

“A bunch of fools!”

“They agreed to five years. Five years is five years! How long has it been, and now they’re clamoring for an early redemption of their credit?”

“Do they think the contracts I painstakingly signed with them are worthless?”

He Zhenghao sneered as his gaze swept across the display of the Tianxuan Mirror before him.

“Dragon Soars Through Nine Transformations—Soul Transformation technique, 950,000 credits. With it, one can transcend mortality, reshape the body, and defy fate...”

“Mountains and Rivers in the Sleeve—Soul Transformation technique, 1,000,000 credits. Mastery allows one to sweep mountains and rivers with a single gesture...”

One after another, techniques he had once dared not even dream of were now at his fingertips, ready for him to choose without hesitation.

After following Li Fan for just a few short years, he was no longer the cautious steward of Liuli Island, counting every credit to the last decimal.

“Although these Soul Transformation techniques are excellent, they still feel lacking. Why not go all the way and exchange for a Dao Integration technique directly? Opportunities like this are rare.”

The thought once sparked in He Zhenghao’s mind could no longer be suppressed.

After carefully examining the descriptions of a few Dao Integration techniques, the previously tempting Soul Transformation techniques now seemed dull in comparison.

“Hmm... these Dao Integration techniques are extraordinary. The cheapest is 2 million credits, and the ones suitable for me cost even more.”

“But that doesn’t mean there’s no way to make it work...”

He Zhenghao began to devise a plan in his mind.

Meanwhile, Gao Yuan sat silently nearby, his excitement evident in his eyes as he browsed the list of techniques.

However, Zhou Qingang, seated between them, remained unmoved, sitting in quiet contemplation.

“Zhou Qingang’s ability to maintain composure is truly remarkable. To resist such temptation... No wonder the Lord Envoy values him more and more,” both He Zhenghao and Gao Yuan thought as they glanced at Zhou Qingang.

Ever since cultivators began demanding early credit redemption, the three of them had taken refuge in the Administration Bureau Hall, shutting the doors and pretending not to see the chaos outside.

After a long silence, Zhou Qingang finally broke it:

“Letting this commotion continue isn’t a solution. While we may not care what they think, if their anger leads to reckless accusations, it could tarnish the Lord Envoy’s reputation.”

“Public opinion is a powerful thing! If rumors spread, outsiders might genuinely believe the Lord Envoy is some greedy, small-minded person!”

Gao Yuan quickly echoed Zhou Qingang’s concerns: “Indeed! The Lord Envoy intends to use this matter to win people’s hearts. If this drags on, it might hinder his plans!”

He Zhenghao looked up, a little stunned. “Do you two have any suggestions?”

“The Lord Envoy has already given instructions, hasn’t he? It’s clearly stated in the contracts: early redemption is allowed, but it comes with a penalty—one-third of the credits—and a lifetime ban from future fundraising plans.”

“Just go out there and explain it to them. If they insist, then return their credits. Keep a record of their names, and I’ll report them to the Lord Envoy. Won’t that resolve the issue?” Zhou Qingang said calmly.

He Zhenghao groaned inwardly: “Easy for you to say! A third of their credits? That’s a huge amount painstakingly saved over time. How many would be willing to accept that? They’d tear me apart!”

He glanced pleadingly at Gao Yuan, who merely avoided eye contact, pretending not to hear.

“Fellow Daoist He?”

Hearing Zhou Qingang’s increasingly firm tone, He Zhenghao had no choice but to grit his teeth and agree.

The moment He Zhenghao stepped outside the Administration Bureau Hall, the previously noisy crowd fell silent, all eyes on him.

“Bang!”

The doors behind him slammed shut, leaving He Zhenghao to face the crowd with a forced smile that was more pitiful than cheerful. “Everyone, please allow me to explain!”

...

While He Zhenghao was racking his brains to reason with the crowd, Han Yi remained in a state of deep regret.

After the announcement of discounted techniques, despite being penniless, Han Yi had reviewed the list out of curiosity.

What he saw threw him into a spiral of frustration.

One of the techniques, Void Tribulation Primordial Codex, was perfect for avoiding disasters and surviving tribulations.

As a Soul Transformation technique, it was available for only 1.1 million credits at half price.

“With this, I could greatly reduce the backlash from my 'Heavenly Fortune Scripture'. No more random disasters falling upon me...”

“It’s absolutely perfect for me...”

The more he thought about it, the deeper his regret grew.

“Damn it! Why couldn’t I keep my hands to myself back then?”

Overwhelmed with frustration, Han Yi felt a tightness in his chest and nearly coughed up blood.

........................................................................

Read extra chapters on >>> patreon.com/SpiritStonetranslation

Chapter 594: The Yin-Yang Dilemma

"No, this method seems tailor-made for me. I absolutely cannot miss it!"

Han Yi paced back and forth, muttering to himself.

"I’ll lose one-third of the penalty fee, and my principal amount is 910,000."

"If I can successfully recover it, that’s 600,000..."

A wave of heartache struck Han Yi as he calculated the loss.

He furrowed his brows in frustration: "Still, I’m short by over 500,000!"

"If I push myself again this year, even at the risk of backlash, I could earn that much. But such frequent use will likely harm my foundation."

Caught in an internal struggle, Han Yi finally made up his mind after a long while.

"I used to think that as long as I controlled my fate, I could achieve greatness in cultivation."

"But judging by my experiences over the past few years, fate alone isn’t omnipotent. To achieve Dao Integration or even Longevity Immortal, fate alone is far from enough."

"Resources, connections—these are just as important!"

"Now that such an incredible technique has surfaced in the world, this is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity. If the heavens give and I refuse, I’ll only regret it later!"

With that thought, Han Yi headed straight to the administrative hall in Congyun City.

On the way, he heard that a large number of cultivators had gathered there, all hoping to redeem their contributions early, just like him.

At first, he was a bit relieved, thinking that a crowd would make things easier.

However, when he arrived, his heart sank.

Only a handful of individuals remained scattered around, their expressions weary and lifeless, like frostbitten eggplants.

"Could something have gone wrong again?" Anxiously, Han Yi began asking around.

To his surprise, it was just a misunderstanding, and his concerns were unnecessary.

"So, as long as I’m willing to pay 30% of the penalty fee, I can retrieve my contribution points?"

"No additional conditions?"

After confirming the details, Han Yi let out a long sigh of relief.

A nearby cultivator, however, scoffed: "Thirty percent is no small amount, and yet you seem completely unfazed."

Han Yi shook his head: "A deal is a deal. The contract was crystal clear when I signed it. Even if I regret it now, I won’t complain."

"Honestly, I thought Lord Envoy might take advantage of everyone’s urgent need for money and increase the penalties. But it seems their integrity is commendable."

Unintentionally, Han Yi’s words provoked the cultivators around him.

"You scoundrel, are you one of Li Fan’s stooges? Listening to you, it sounds like being cheated is a blessing!"

"Exactly! You don’t look familiar—how do we know you’re not here spreading lies for Li Fan? Don’t let his sweet words fool you!"

"Despicable!"

In an instant, Han Yi became the target of everyone’s frustrations. Stunned, he didn’t know how to respond.

Fortunately, He Zhenghao noticed the commotion and intervened in time.

"Enough with this nonsense! I think this fellow Daoist makes a valid point—honor your commitments! None of you were forced to sign the contract back then. Some of you even begged to join the fundraiser. So why act like this now?"

With a stern scolding, He Zhenghao silenced the crowd.

The cultivators, unable to argue further, left in embarrassment.

"What’s your name, Daoist?" After the crowd dispersed, He Zhenghao addressed Han Yi with a friendly tone.

"I am Han Yi," he replied nervously, recognizing He Zhenghao as the person in charge of the fundraiser and the key to recovering his contribution points.

"Haha, fellow Taoist Han, please relax," He Zhenghao said with a knowing smile.

Having interacted with tens of thousands of cultivators, He Zhenghao could easily read Han Yi’s state of mind.

Recalling Li Fan’s recent instructions, he quickly devised a plan.

"In this day and age, cultivators like you, Fellow Daoist Han, who understand reason and fairness, are rare." He Zhenghao sighed.

"Don’t be misled by the gossip outside. Lord Envoy is far from a fraud. On the contrary, he is kind-hearted. When he learned that many cultivators urgently needed contribution points, he specifically instructed us to waive the penalty fees for those in dire straits."

Han Yi was stunned: "Really?"

He Zhenghao’s expression turned serious: "Lord Envoy always keeps his word. Why would I deceive you?"

"Come, Daoist Han, I’ll process your request immediately."

Overjoyed, Han Yi eagerly followed him.

Half a day later, holding his recovered 910,000 contribution points, Han Yi was overcome with emotion.

"Could it be that my luck is finally turning?"

But as he reflected further, he felt a lingering unease.

"No, it’s not just luck. Li Fan truly lives up to his reputation—what magnanimity!"

"Waiving such a significant penalty with a simple gesture… Truly extraordinary."

"Those cultivators earlier were clearly judging him unfairly."

Grateful to Li Fan, Han Yi couldn’t help but admire him even more.

Little did he know, this was precisely what Li Fan had intended.

By instructing his subordinates to selectively waive penalties for some cultivators, Li Fan had sown discord.

Those who benefited would naturally defend him when criticized, while others, burdened by real losses, would remain skeptical.

As debates arose, public opinion shifted from unified criticism to divided arguments.

For uninvolved onlookers, it became harder to trust either side completely.

Thus, the negative impact was quietly neutralized.

When questioned, one could easily dismiss it with: "Ah, it’s a complicated matter. Hard to say who’s right."

This strategy also bought Li Fan precious time to finalize his plans.

If he acted too harshly, it might raise suspicions that he was preparing to flee.

But by temporarily calming doubts, he ensured that when the Crimson Flame arrived, his grand scheme in Congyun Sea would reach its final stage.

As expected, although the incident caused some unrest, it gradually faded from memory.

As the deadline for the discounted technique drew closer, cultivators focused most of their energy on earning contribution points to exchange for techniques before the opportunity disappeared.

Han Yi was no exception.

Because contribution points were scarce, he searched relentlessly but failed to find a suitable opportunity.

Left with no choice, he activated his Heavenly Fate Scripture to seek a chance.

Following its guidance, he departed from Congyun Sea and ventured deep into the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Chapter 595: Where Do You Come From

Luoyan Prefecture.

"Strange, it should be around here. There’s no mistake."

"But why..."

Han Yi furrowed his brows tightly, once again flying over this area for half a day.

Yet, he still couldn’t pinpoint the exact location of the opportunity he sensed.

"It’s definitely pointing here, but I can only lock onto a general area. Once I enter it, that feeling in my heart inexplicably disappears."

"It’s as if something is deliberately interfering."

At this moment, Han Yi felt both joy and worry in his heart.

Such a situation had never occurred to him before. According to the records in Heavenly Fate Scripture, either the opportunity was too great, exceeding his current ability to bear, which would be a misfortune rather than a blessing, or the fortune here was shielding itself, preventing outsiders from discovering it.

"I can only go down and search personally. I’ll act accordingly, and if it’s impossible to proceed, I’ll let it go. After all, no matter what, preserving my life must remain the priority," Han Yi pondered deeply and made a decision.

Leaving the Congyun Sea behind, he traveled far. Gradually calming down, Han Yi realized he might have been too impulsive recently, likely affected by the backlash of fortune.

With the foundation of his Heavenly Fate Scripture and the Feather of the Mystic Black Bird, combined with his knowledge of an undeveloped small world where the Heavenly Fate Mystical Bird had fallen, as long as he didn’t perish prematurely, following a steady path would ensure success in reaching the Soul Transformation and Dao Integration stages.

Even the Longevity Immortal realm was not beyond his imagination.

That Void Tribulation Primordial Codex, though excellent, was merely icing on the cake.

With these thoughts, Han Yi’s mindset gradually became more balanced.

No longer obsessed with obtaining the opportunity, he adopted the philosophy of "What is destined will come, and what is not meant to be should not be forced," wandering leisurely.

This place was a small town populated by ordinary mortals, with no cultivators guarding it.

Han Yi concealed his cultivation and disguised himself as a mortal, blending in.

However, the aura of a cultivator is difficult to hide completely. Among a group of ordinary mortals, Han Yi stood out like a crane among chickens.

Although it was unclear whether he was truly an "Immortal Master," his extraordinary demeanor made it evident he was someone of wealth and status.

Instinctively, the mortals avoided him. Thus, Han Yi found it difficult to integrate.

His plan to secretly search for the opportunity was thwarted prematurely.

"I’ve heard that ancient cultivators cultivated their minds and spirits. Despite having heaven-reaching power, they could live harmoniously among mortals, without the slightest flaw. I truly wonder how they managed it."

Looking at the mortals in the town, who were trembling before he even spoke, Han Yi sighed inwardly.

Though they answered all his questions without omission, their responses were completely irrelevant to his purpose.

Trying to find the true opportunity among them was like chasing a fool’s dream.

Han Yi couldn’t help but feel helpless.

"Opportunities are like this—when sought deliberately, they often come to naught."

Unwilling to give up, he pretended to leave the town, changed his appearance, and returned, wandering for several more days.

Still, there were no results.

He thought about trying his luck in the areas surrounding the town, but this time, the sensed location had narrowed even further.

The opportunity was in the town!

This tantalizing feeling of being close yet unable to grasp it made Han Yi feel suffocated, almost to the point of spitting blood.

His previously calm emotions were once again stirred up.

As his composure turned to agitation, the more impatient he became, the further the opportunity slipped from his grasp.

He didn’t know how long he wandered the town, covering almost every inch of land.

Still, he found nothing.

The mortals in the town, however, noticed his prolonged presence and peculiar behavior.

Although they couldn’t cultivate, they weren’t fools.

This cultivator had been lingering in the town for a long time, obviously searching for something.

Thus, rumors spread that there was treasure in the town.

Although neither they nor Han Yi knew what the treasure was, it didn’t stop the townsfolk from becoming suspicious and restless.

Whether hoping to secretly claim the treasure for themselves to change their fate or to offer it to the immortal master for a reward, this was a chance to transform their lives completely.

They searched through their belongings, digging out old and suspicious items for careful examination.

These small movements didn’t escape Han Yi’s sharp perception.

However, he didn’t care in the slightest.

What could mere mortals know of his methods?

As long as his fortune-sensing persisted, the opportunity remained in its original place.

He only needed to monitor the town.

If something unusual occurred and the sensing disappeared, he would immediately pinpoint the opportunity.

So, Han Yi simply occupied a residence in the town lord’s mansion, staying put while using his divine sense to monitor every mortal day and night.

Months passed, yet Han Yi still gained nothing.

Finally, he decided to give up.

"It seems this is not meant to be," Han Yi sighed, ready to leave.

At that moment, the long-unchanged sensing suddenly stirred!

Han Yi’s heart began to race.

"Who is it?"

Sweeping the entire town with his divine sense, Han Yi noticed an old man wearing a straw raincoat with a fishing basket on his back, preparing to leave.

"Is it him?"

Han Yi didn’t know the man’s exact name, only that he was called "Old Yu," a simple fisherman.

Every day, Old Yu fished in a river east of the town and sold his catch in the marketplace.

Quiet and unassuming, his business was mediocre due to his lack of salesmanship. He barely made a living by pricing his fish cheaply.

Han Yi had seen him before, but apart from his straw raincoat, the old man had nothing.

His home was bare, showing no signs of treasure.

"Could he have recently fished something out of the river?"

Han Yi’s thoughts raced as he eyed the fishing basket, becoming more convinced of his speculation.

Leaping up, he no longer hesitated and chased the fisherman out of the town.

However, just as he approached in excitement, intending to question the old man, the elderly figure with deeply wrinkled features glanced in his direction.

That single glance was like a bucket of icy water pouring over Han Yi.

His hair stood on end as he froze in terror.

"Something’s wrong!"

An overwhelming sense of danger surged within him, and the fortunate omen he had sensed transformed into a terrifying calamity.

Han Yi instantly realized the truth.

This opportunity wasn’t some treasure, and this fisherman wasn’t an ordinary mortal.

He was a hidden powerhouse, concealing himself among mortals for some unknown reason.

The opportunity was the fisherman himself!

The reason his fortune-sensing had always pointed to the town was that the fisherman remained there.

He had been blind to the true dragon before him, missing it repeatedly.

Now that the fisherman decided to leave, the sensing changed accordingly.

If he had acted rashly earlier and provoked this formidable figure…

Understanding everything in an instant, Han Yi broke into a cold sweat.

His pace slowed as he decided not to take any risks and prepared to retreat.

"Who are you, and where do you come from?"

The fisherman suddenly spoke.

Chapter 596: Heaven’s Absolute Bright Sword Appears

Chapter 596: Heaven's Absolute Bright Sword Appears

This location was already several miles away from the small town, a desolate wilderness with no one else around.

Only Han Yi and the Old Fisherman stood there.

The Old Fisherman spoke, and the question was obviously directed at Han Yi.

When a powerful cultivator asks, how could he dare not answer?

Han Yi felt his scalp tingle with fear.

But his life was at stake; he absolutely couldn’t afford to defy the other party. Reluctantly, he flew closer, landed on the ground, lowered his head, bowed deeply, and greeted, "I greet the senior."

Unexpectedly, the Old Fisherman wasn’t appeased by such courtesy.

Frowning, he asked again, "Where are you from?"

Han Yi’s heart pounded violently as if it would explode.

It was obvious that his earlier hesitation had already irritated the elder.

As the saying goes, “Three strikes, and you're out.” If his next response still displeased the elder, it might mean his head would part ways with his body!

Yet, his journey was guided by the fortunes in his heart, seeking his own destiny.

But how could he possibly share such a thing with others?

Though the elder before him had an unfathomable cultivation level, there was no guarantee he wouldn’t covet The Heavenly Fate Scripture.

If Han Yi revealed the truth, he would likely face a fate of having his soul searched and life essence drained.

It seemed that no matter what he did, death awaited him.
