Han Yi’s mind raced wildly, and within a moment, he thought of an ambiguous answer.

Noticing the elder's expression growing impatient, Han Yi steeled himself and forced out a response, "Junior has come here pursuing an item."

"Following its trail for ten thousand miles, I arrived here, only to lose all traces of it."

Afterward, he lowered his head and waited for his fate.

Unexpectedly, the strange and powerful elder didn’t reprimand him.

After a long silence, his tone grew somewhat pensive: "So, you’ve also lost something?"

"Also?"

Hearing that word, Han Yi immediately sensed a glimmer of hope. He quickly nodded, "Exactly so. This item is very important to me, so I’ve traversed mountains and rivers to retrieve it. Yet, heaven has not granted my wish..."

The Old Fisherman’s tone softened.

He gazed at Han Yi and nodded approvingly, "Precious things must be well-kept. Once lost, finding them again is no easy matter."

"I don’t even know how long I’ve been searching, yet I still haven’t found mine."

Han Yi dared not ask what the elder had lost.

At this moment, he felt relieved to have narrowly escaped death.

Not daring to speak recklessly, he merely replied, "Senior’s words are a lesson to remember."

He then lowered his head and remained silent, no longer concerning himself with any opportunities, only praying the Old Fisherman would leave soon.

However, something that made his heart stop abruptly occurred again.

At that moment, he suddenly heard the elder say, "Do not move!"

Han Yi's body froze in place.

Believing he was about to meet his end, countless images from his life flashed through his mind.

There was the ecstatic joy of discovering The Heavenly Fate Scripture in an ancient ruin shortly after entering the Qi Condensation stage.

There was the anguish of repeated Foundation Establishment failures due to the backlash of cultivating the scripture.

And there was the exhilaration of narrowly escaping death in the small world of Beast Realm, finally achieving Foundation Establishment upon his return, and feeling as though the world was his to conquer.

...

"Am I about to die?"

Han Yi thought despairingly.

Just when he had given up all hope, the Old Fisherman frowned and said, "No wonder you couldn’t find it—it’s been under surveillance this whole time?"

With a casual wave of his hand, it seemed as if the elder severed something invisible.

Instead of death, Han Yi felt an inexplicable sense of relief.

It was as if a shackle that had long bound him suddenly vanished.

"Under surveillance? What does that mean?"

Han Yi was momentarily bewildered, then realized with a start:

"Have I been watched this entire time?"

"No wonder I’ve always felt like nothing was going right. Has every move of mine been under someone else’s control?"

Recalling how he used to observe mortals daily in the small town, Han Yi broke into a cold sweat.

"Who?"

"When?"

Faces flashed through Han Yi’s mind one after another.

Each seemed suspicious, yet none fit completely.

"You young people..." The Old Fisherman shook his head at Han Yi’s pale, frightened face.

"Traveling alone, you must always be cautious. Being watched for so long—haven’t all your secrets been laid bare?"

"Perhaps the thing you’re searching for has already been stolen," the elder lamented, as if pitying him.

"But I don’t blame you..." Suddenly, the Old Fisherman’s tone shifted.

He frowned slightly and looked up at the sky.

"The people in this area have some very unpleasant habits," he said, narrowing his eyes as though recalling something serious.

"Senior, please save me!"

Perhaps it was the elder’s momentary display of "kindness," or perhaps Han Yi was terrified by the realization of having been watched without knowing.

Han Yi’s composure broke, and he knelt before the Old Fisherman, kowtowing in desperation.

"Save you?"

The Old Fisherman was briefly puzzled by Han Yi’s plea.

"You needn’t worry. I’ve taught that person a harsh lesson. They won’t be able to watch you anymore."

Hearing this, Han Yi was overjoyed.

"May I ask, senior, who was watching me, and what did they look like?"

The Old Fisherman hesitated. "They were too far away, and my eyesight isn’t what it used to be, so I couldn’t see clearly..."

"No matter, I still ask senior to help identify them!" Grasping at this lifeline, Han Yi felt he couldn’t rest easy without knowing who had been spying on him.

He used the Water Mirror Technique to recreate the faces of those he had interacted with over the years, focusing on the most suspicious ones.

"Senior, please..."

Just as Han Yi was about to speak, he sensed a strange tension in the air.

Turning his head, he felt a sinking dread.

In his panic, he had also included the scene from the sky above the Congyun Sea, where he had glimpsed the [Trapped Sword of Azure Wind].

At that moment, the Fisherman Elder was staring intently at the scene.

"Could it be that he’s recognized the characteristics of the Spirit of Heaven-Earth?"

Han Yi immediately regretted his actions.

"A sword..."

But the elder wasn’t focused on the Spirit of Heaven-Earth.

"A sword?"

Han Yi’s gaze also fell on the broken sword trapped by the Azure Wind.

"I’ve been searching for so long, yet still haven’t found it..."

The elder’s earlier words echoed in Han Yi’s mind.

"Could it be..."

A terrifying thought surfaced in Han Yi’s mind.

Before he could react, the Old Fisherman turned his cloudy gaze toward him.

The next moment, darkness enveloped Han Yi.

........................................................................

Read extra chapters on >>> patreon.com/SpiritStonetranslation

Chapter 597: Defying Fate in Death

The Fisherman and Han Yi stood facing each other.

Suddenly, a violent energy descended upon the scene.

The Fisherman remained calm, standing as immovable as a mountain. Even his straw raincoat seemed to embody the passage of millennia, firmly clinging to him, untouched by the raging storm.

In contrast, Han Yi's body erupted with an overwhelming aura of black malevolence, surging outward. Under the strange energy's influence, his expression froze, locked in the moment the Fisherman had last gazed at him.

Yet, his appearance was eerie beyond words. His pupils vanished, and his face fractured like a shattered porcelain mask, revealing a web of cracks. His entire body flickered intermittently, vanishing into the billowing black mist and reappearing seconds later, as though caught between existence and nothingness.

The transformation occurred in an instant.

The Fisherman calmly picked up his fish basket from the ground and slung it over his back, striding purposefully toward the Congyun Sea.

As for Han Yi...

The swirling black mist abruptly retreated into his body after the Fisherman's departure. Yet, Han Yi did not return to normal. He remained standing motionless, like a statue that had always been there.

His hollow eyes stared blankly ahead.

Time passed.

A plain white bird flew overhead. Strange events followed.

Without warning, a previously healed wound on the bird's wing reopened, causing it to lose balance. It spiraled downward, unable to recover, and crashed to the ground, lifeless, right in front of Han Yi's statue.

More time passed.

A group of ordinary townsfolk, chatting cheerfully, passed by the road where Han Yi stood. Curiously, they seemed oblivious to his presence, failing to notice the statue at all. They walked straight through him, as if he were an illusion.

Strangely, there was no collision.

Moments later, one of the villagers suddenly clutched his chest, his face turning pale. Amid the group's panicked cries, he collapsed lifelessly to the ground, struck by a sudden heart attack.

The group, originally heading into the nearby mountains to gather herbs, abandoned their plans in sorrow. Carrying the body of their deceased companion, they returned to their village, mourning all the while.

More time elapsed.

A cultivator in a green robe flew over Han Yi's statue, his face alight with joy.

"Finally! After countless trials, I've collected the final ingredient. With my new alchemy cauldron furnace, this time, success is certain! The Mystic Ice Treasure Pill will finally be mine!"

His murmurs were filled with anticipation.

A day later, in the skies above Luoyan Prefecture, a minor celestial phenomenon occurred—a cultivator had perished.

It was reported that during a critical alchemical process, an explosion had destroyed the furnace, taking the alchemist's life.

Such incidents were rare but not unheard of in this era. As the deceased was an unremarkable Golden Core cultivator, the news caused little stir beyond a few sighs of pity.

Yet, subtle changes began rippling through Luoyan Province, unnoticed by the world.

...

The narrative shifted back to the Fisherman.

He walked steadily on the ground, not soaring through the skies as other cultivators might. Yet his speed was astonishing. With each step, he seemed to traverse thousands of miles, his figure flashing as he advanced toward the Congyun Sea.

When he reached Yuandao Prefecture, just one step away from his destination, a blue-robed figure appeared in his path.

"Fellow Daoist, I advise you to turn back," the figure said.

The Fisherman frowned, studying the man.

Clad in a blue Daoist robe, the figure had white hair, a deeply wrinkled face, and the frailty of someone nearing their end.

"Have I met you before?" the Fisherman asked uncertainly.

The blue-robed man coughed and replied in a hoarse voice, "You’ve grown forgetful, old friend. Last time we met, you still remembered me. Now, have you truly forgotten who I am?"

He added, "It wasn’t so long ago—just two centuries past."

The Fisherman lowered his head, lost in thought. After a moment, he shook his head.

"I can’t recall. But it doesn’t matter... you won’t live much longer."

The Fisherman's tone was indifferent, as though commenting on the weather.

The blue-robed man froze for a moment.

"Yes," he said softly, "I won’t live much longer..." His voice carried a trace of melancholy.

"Will you still try to stop me?" the Fisherman asked.

"My duty leaves me no choice," the blue-robed man replied without hesitation.

Hearing this, the Fisherman wasted no words. He extended his right hand and grasped at the air.

Suddenly, crisscrossing black threads materialized around the blue-robed man, forming a massive web that ensnared him.

The blue-robed man let out a muffled groan as his body vanished, leaving only a single blue feather glowing within the shrinking net.

When the net retracted into the Fisherman’s hand, he examined the feather, his brow furrowing briefly in confusion.

Shaking his head slightly, he placed the feather into his basket and continued toward the Congyun Sea.

Shortly after his departure, a faint, ghostly figure reappeared at the scene.

"After my death, let the floodwaters rise," the figure muttered with a cold snort.

He cast a deep, lingering gaze at the Fisherman’s retreating form before vanishing.

---

In Qingyun Prefecture, two prefecture away luoyan, another perspective unfolded.

When his spiritual senses were severed, Li Fan immediately knew something was wrong. Reacting swiftly, he retrieved a sacred artifact gifted to him by the Five Elders Association—a statue of the Manifestation of Heavenly Sovereign Statue.

Unlike the five-faced, ten-armed version used for communication with the Five Elders Pavilion, this statue depicted the Heavenly Sovereign of Sorrowless, its serene visage exuding compassion.

The statue served one purpose: to protect the divine sea consciousness from collapse during a fatal attack.

The artifact activated just in time.

It felt as though a heavy blow had struck Li Fan’s head. His mind buzzed, his vision fragmented into countless overlapping images, and his body swayed.

Coughing up blood, he instinctively clutched his head. Even the body protection charging progress of [Truth] dropped by 5%.

Fortunately, he suffered only minor injuries and avoided disaster.

With the power of his heavenly internal law domain and five-elemental energy circulating within him, Li Fan quickly recovered his vitality.

Chapter 598: Reunion of Heavenly Doctor and Old Fisherman

The Xuanhuang Heart Refining Mantra began to operate automatically. Within a few breaths, even the injuries to his divine sea consciousness had completely vanished.

“Hoo…”

“Not only did he effortlessly dismantle my [Formless Killing Intent], but he also managed to strike my divine sense from such a great distance.”

“If it weren’t for the protective shield of the Manifestation of Heavenly Sovereign Statue, my sea of consciousness would have suffered severe damage.”

Li Fan glanced at the Manifestation of Heavenly Sovereign Statue statue in his hand. After emitting a faint white glow, it dissolved and disappeared without a trace.

“Old Fisherman… a being above Dao Integration is indeed terrifying.”

Although Li Fan was astonished, he was far from fearful. Instead, a glimmer of excitement flashed in his eyes.

He hadn’t anticipated things to proceed so smoothly.

When he noticed Han Yi wandering aimlessly into the heartlands of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance and pausing in the Luoyan Prefecture, Li Fan already had a vague sense of what was about to unfold.

Previously, he had subtly implanted the ideas of the Azure Wind Trapped Sword and the whereabouts of the Old Fisherman into Han Yi's mind using the Cloud-Water Illusionary Dream technique. He had hoped to use Han Yi as a medium to relay information about the Azure Wind Trapped Sword to the Old Fisherman.

In Li Fan’s expectations, Han Yi would need additional guidance to find the Old Fisherman within the vast regions of several provinces. However, as if guided by destiny or influenced by unknown factors, Han Yi moved with unexpected precision, directly locking onto the Old Fisherman’s location.

The Old Fisherman was a shared opportunity for all. Cultivators within the heartlands of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance would instinctively search for his whereabouts. Once discovered, news of his presence spread quickly, with mutual cooperation ensuring swift dissemination.

Li Fan, having experienced countless cycles of reincarnation, was naturally well-versed in this pattern.

Thus, when he saw the Old Fisherman through his perspective of heaven and earth, Li Fan couldn’t help but feel immense joy. His plan to orchestrate a battle between the Old Fisherman, the Heavenly Doctor, and the Sage seemed to be on the brink of success.

When Li Fan initially implanted the thoughts into Han Yi's mind, he also left a wisp of "Heavenly Calamity Energy" in his body. Though almost undetectable, under Li Fan’s deliberate manipulation, it could erupt in a manner that the Old Fisherman wouldn’t overlook.

Through Han Yi’s memories, the Old Fisherman could see the location of the Azure Wind Trapped Sword. Similarly, he could witness the appearance of the Heavenly Doctor in the Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace.

Li Fan was confident that both the Sage and the Old Fisherman harbored irreconcilable hatred toward the Heavenly Doctor.

The Old Fisherman, after reclaiming the Heavenly Calamity Sword and restoring some of his power, would undoubtedly seek a confrontation with the Heavenly Doctor. This would undoubtedly complicate matters for the Heavenly Doctor.

The plan was perfect. However, Han Yi proved to be an unexpected variable.

Despite the Old Fisherman appearing before him more than ten times, Han Yi failed to notice anything amiss, leaving Li Fan, who had been tailing them from afar, repeatedly shaking his head.

Of course, Li Fan wouldn’t risk his own safety by intervening. Instead, he kept his distance, patiently observing.

Fortunately, while the process deviated slightly, the outcome ultimately aligned with his expectations.

When Han Yi, lost in his thoughts, charged at the Old Fisherman, even Li Fan couldn’t help but silently applaud his courage.

However, when the Old Fisherman merely cast a glance in Han Yi’s direction, Li Fan immediately sensed trouble.

...

“Thankfully, I was prepared for this and am no longer the novice Foundation Establishment cultivator I once was.”

Exhaling deeply, Li Fan, now recovered, began pondering his next steps.

“If everything proceeds as expected, the Old Fisherman should now be heading toward the Congyun Sea.”

“Gods clash, mortals suffer. My true body should steer clear of the chaos.”

With a thought, Li Fan shifted his attention to his clone, Zhou Qingang.

At the Congyun Sea, the storm was gradually subsiding. Most cultivators had turned their focus to cultivation and studying the techniques they had recently acquired, leaving the administration hall unusually quiet.

Unnoticed by anyone, Li Fan directed Zhou Qingang to approach the Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace. The place was almost deserted, with only a few cultivators occasionally passing through in groups.

After a moment of contemplation, Li Fan decided to wait outside instead of entering the palace immediately.

Three days passed.

A sudden gust of wind rustled his robes.

Li Fan raised his head toward the sky and extended a hand, feeling the intensifying wind. A sense of anticipation swelled within him.

“The Old Fisherman is in place. Will the Sage come?”

Based on past experiences, Li Fan was almost certain of the answer.

The faint aura emitted by the Heavenly Doctor’s statue alone was enough to attract the Sage. With the addition of the Old Fisherman, an old acquaintance, the Sage had no reason not to appear.

Moreover, the timing perfectly aligned with the Sage’s expected arrival.

Li Fan was confident that his plan was coming to fruition.

“Next, I need to find a good spot to watch the show.”

Retrieving a gourd of fine wine from his storage ring, Li Fan gave it a gentle pat and entered the Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace. After completing three trials with lightning speed, he stayed behind, sharing drinks and idle chatter with Senior Brother Qin.

While outwardly relaxed, Li Fan was silently awaiting the inevitable confrontation.

However, as time dragged on without the anticipated scene, Li Fan grew increasingly restless.

“Ha! Junior Brother, you’re quite insincere. Pretending to drink with me while your thoughts wander!”

“Tell me, which junior sister has caught your eye? Don’t worry, share it with me. If suitable, I’ll act as your matchmaker!”

“Of course, a senior sister isn’t out of the question either!”

Senior Brother Qin, half-drunk, burst into hearty laughter.

Li Fan was about to respond when the entire world suddenly shook violently. Senior Brother Qin, mid-drink, froze, trembling uncontrollably.

“Heavenly Doctor…”

All traces of drunkenness vanished as he ground his teeth in anger.

Boom!

Layers of illusions shattered, and when Li Fan reappeared at the gates of the Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace, the first thing he saw was the confrontation between the Old Fisherman and the Heavenly Doctor.

Unlike in his previous life, the once thunderous wails and lamentations within the Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace had subsided significantly, as if something was suppressing their outbursts of hatred and sorrow.

The Old Fisherman glared at the Heavenly Doctor, his body enveloped in surging black calamity energy. Yet, the Heavenly Calamity Sword fragment was nowhere in sight.

Though silent, the murderous intent in his eyes was unmistakable. For some reason, however, he refrained from attacking.

The Heavenly Doctor, on the other hand, appeared rather indifferent, even slightly amused.

“How interesting.”

“Tian Jue, have you regained your memory?” the Heavenly Doctor asked.

TL Note:- [Tian Jue can mean Heavenly absolute/extreme or even something more. Just wanted to give you guys some context as I didn't know if I should keep it as Tian Jue or go with english term of heaven's absolute, both are right of course. but knowing a context behind the name can always be a plus. Same goes for Heavenly Doctor named Tianyi]

Chapter 599: The Gathering of Three Venerable

“Tian…”

“Jue…”

The old fisherman murmured these two words softly, his expression initially filled with confusion.

As he repeated them over and over, it seemed as though he recalled something, a faint light flickering in his clouded eyes.

“I am…”

“Tian Jue?”

As the fisherman’s memories gradually returned, the black fiendish aura already surging around him grew even thicker.

It became like a rolling black tide, spreading and raging outward.

However, all the fiendish aura instinctively avoided the Heavenly Doctor before it could even approach him.

Between the two opposing figures, an expansive empty space was formed.

The Heavenly Doctor remained unmoved by the ominous aura. Observing Tian Jue’s still-dazed state, he showed a trace of surprise.

“Your memories haven’t returned? Then how…”

The Heavenly Doctor's eyes gleamed as he prepared to take action.

But suddenly, a distant voice reciting ancient scripture echoed through the air:

“Heaven’s law is solemn, observe the rules and follow the order.”

“I have obtained the dharma, spreading it to all beings.”

“Heaven’s law cannot be defied.”

The Heavenly Doctor’s expression finally shifted noticeably.

Narrowing his eyes, he turned to look in the direction of the voice.

“Moo!”

Without warning, a massive green ox the size of a small mountain appeared before him.

Its horns tilted upwards, and its four hooves moved swiftly, charging forward as if to crush the Heavenly Doctor in one blow.

“Beast!” The Heavenly Doctor snorted coldly.

He did not dodge but simply raised his right hand, where a glimmer of silver light appeared.

The silver light transformed into a fine thread, piercing the azure ox like lightning.

In an instant, the thread wove back and forth countless times, slicing through the ox entirely.

The green ox was reduced to countless unrecognizable fragments, yet it continued its forward momentum, scattering into the air.

“Condense!”

A furious shout rang out suddenly.

Moments later, the green ox that had been dismembered by the Heavenly Doctor miraculously reassembled, its original form emerging from the scattered remains.

Leaping above the Heavenly Doctor, it prepared to trample him underfoot.

Yet the Heavenly Doctor still did not evade.

Before the ox could touch him, its body suddenly shrank.

From a fully grown, robust beast, it became a newborn calf in the blink of an eye.

Finally, it dissolved into a wisp of energy, vanishing into the heavens and earth.

“Tianyu…” The Heavenly Doctor looked toward the direction from which the ox had come, a trace of amusement appearing on his face.

An ethereal figure with white hair and a hunched posture emerged at that moment.

“Sage!”

“Sage!”

With the arrival of the Tianyu, the previously cowering disciples of the Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace seemed to find their backbone.

No longer fearful, they began to cheer fervently.

“Ah…”

Tianyu sighed softly, as though comforting them, and waved his wide sleeve.

The cries within the Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace momentarily quieted. Only then did his gaze fall upon the Heavenly Doctor and Tian Jue.

Clap, clap, clap.

The Heavenly Doctor began to clap lightly.

“Well…”

“What a coincidence.”

Without looking at the two figures surrounding him, the Heavenly Doctor raised his head, as though searching for something, a thoughtful expression on his face.

“Heavenly Doctor!”

Finally, the Tianyu could no longer suppress his anger.

“You’ve been hiding all these years, and now you finally dare to show yourself?”

His voice was like thunder, filled with boundless rage, reverberating throughout the Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace.

“Hmph.”

The Heavenly Doctor merely snorted coldly, offering no reply.

This dismissive attitude ignited the Tianyu fury.

“If that’s the case, then there’s nothing more to say. Prepare to die!”

“Tian Jue, why aren’t you acting yet?”

The Old Fisherman was still in a state of confusion at this moment.

However, as the Sage roared in anger, the two of them worked together seamlessly, as if they were old comrades-in-arms with years of experience.

In perfect coordination, the next moment, the Heavenly Calamity Sword was drawn with a resonant clang.

Even though it was merely a broken sword, an overwhelming aura of murderous intent surged continuously from it, coalescing and refusing to dissipate, taking the form of a sword.

From deep within the Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace, a massive tremor reverberated.

The Turtle-Serpent Taiyi let out a painful wail as the hilt of the Heavenly Calamity Sword, feeling the call of its master, began to struggle free from the Turtle-Serpent's body.

At that moment, an azure brilliance enveloped the entirety of the Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace.

A giant blue hand emerged, pressing the restless hilt of the Heavenly Calamity Sword back into place.

The Taiyi once again let out an earth-shaking howl of agony.

Then, as if suppressed, its cries grew quieter and quieter until it fell into slumber once more.

"Grandmaster Hanhai?"

From various corners of the Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace, astonished exclamations could faintly be heard.

"At least someone here is still clear-headed," the Heavenly Doctor commented coldly.

In the next moment, the azure ocean in the sky rapidly contracted, condensing into a flickering phantom that seemed as though it could shatter at any moment.

The figure appeared before the three—Heavenly Doctor, Sage, and the Old Fisherman.

"Greetings, esteemed ones," the figure said with neither arrogance nor servility.

"Hanhai, what is the meaning of this?"

Suppressing his anger, Tianyu asked in a low voice upon noticing Hanhai's strange attitude.

"The culprit is right in front of us. With the blood feud of the past, why not exact our revenge now?"

"Master Sage is right—blood debts must indeed be repaid in blood. But…"

Hanhai did not look at the Heavenly Doctor but instead turned to the Old Fisherman, who still seemed somewhat bewildered while holding the sword.

"The one who slaughtered the Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace back then was not the Heavenly Doctor."

"It was Tian Jue!"

His words carried a raging resentment, and Hanhai's azure phantom trembled violently.

His furious gaze locked onto the other party as if tumultuous waves churned within him.

"Hmm?" Tianyu was slightly stunned, then shook his head and sighed.

"Hanhai, in the end, you cannot escape the effects of time. Has even your memory of that day become muddled?"

"The butcher who exploited the vulnerability of our rear defenses and massacred every major sect—is it not this traitor before us?"

Tianyu's gaze bore into the Heavenly Doctor, and the flames of hatred reignited in his eyes.

"One person may err. But could the countless souls who perished on that day all be mistaken?"

Hanhai shook his head resolutely and said, "I do not know about other sects; they are unrelated to me.

"But the one who destroyed my Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace was undoubtedly Venerable Tian Jue!"

He spoke with absolute certainty.

"Though his appearance matched that of the Heavenly Doctor, and even his aura was identical…"

"His ruthless, annihilative actions and his cold, emotionless demeanor could never have been mimicked by the Heavenly Doctor."

"Most importantly, the weapon used in the massacre was none other than the hilt of the Heavenly Calamity Sword, now sealed within Taiyi."

"The Heavenly Calamity, a weapon of unparalleled power, can only be wielded by Venerable Tian Jue."

These words made even the Sage hesitate. He turned his head to glance at Tian Jue.

It seemed Hanhai's words had stirred something buried deep within Tian Jue's mind.

He stared blankly at his own hands.

After a long while, he suddenly spoke.

"Yes, it was me who did it…"

"What!" The Sage's hunched figure straightened instantly as he stared incredulously at the Old Fisherman, who had just confessed.

TL Note: [Hey guys, a reminder again to remember as they might be useful in future chapters that all of these name in original is Tianyi→ Heavenly Doctor, Tian Jue→ Heaven's Absolute/?, Tianyu→ Heavenly Edict/Mandate/Decree, Hanhai→ Vast Ocean. Some things and terms might change name in the future or may even be wrong, but I'll keep you all updated whenever a change might occur]

Chapter 600: The Doctor of Ten Thousand Years

It felt like falling into a nightmare, unable to escape.

Tian Jue's entire body trembled uncontrollably.

"That's right, I killed them all!"

"Qin Tang, Xiao Chong, Fu Yun..."

"I killed them all!"

Even the wise Sage seemed unable to process this answer for a moment.

"Why...?" he asked, dazed.

At that moment, Tian Jue's expression suddenly shifted.

"No..."

"That's not right!"

"It wasn't me at all!"

Tian Jue lifted his head abruptly, glaring at Heavenly Doctor with hatred.

"It’s all your doing!"

"All those memories in my mind—they're fake!"

"Ever since that day I met you, everything has been strange!"

"Everything spiraled out of control..."

Pointing the Heavenly Calamity Sword directly at Heavenly Doctor, Tian Jue demanded:

"Was it you?"

Facing Tian Jue's accusations, Heavenly Doctor's expression remained unchanged.

"I thought you'd have improved this time."

"Turns out, you're still the same as ever."

He shook his head slightly, a trace of regret in his voice.

"What do you mean?" Tianyu noticed a peculiar undertone in Tian Yi's words and asked sharply.

Heavenly Doctor didn’t answer but continued speaking to himself.

"I’ve explained this to you countless times. Sometimes, even what you see with your own eyes might not be real."

As he spoke, he somehow produced a set of nine silver needles, arranging them mid-air.

"Everyone seems so eager to kill me."

"Well, I have no choice but to resolve things my way."

Seeing the nine silver needles in Heavenly Doctor’s hands, Tianyu's expression grew darker.

Without waiting for further explanation, Tianyu acted decisively.

"The law cannot be defied!"

"Bind!"

It was as if an invisible force wrapped around Heavenly Doctor’s body, causing his movements with the silver needles to pause slightly.

"Weaken! Injure! Seal! Cripple! Damage!"

One by one, these words left Tianyu’s mouth, each further slowing Heavenly Doctor's actions.

Meanwhile, the Old Fisherman, his eyes glowing red, gripped the Heavenly Calamity Sword tightly. His body turned into a cloud of black murderous intent, merging with the sword.

Like a sharp arrow, it pierced straight toward Heavenly Doctor.

Bound by Tianyu, Heavenly Doctor seemed utterly powerless, unable to resist.

In an instant, the black sword energy pierced through Heavenly Doctor’s chest.

The black aura surged like a raging tide, engulfing Heavenly Doctor entirely.

In no time, the previously calm Heavenly Doctor vanished from the Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace.

"Is Heavenly Doctor dead?"

Watching from the shadows, Zhou Qingang was stunned.

The battle between Heavenly Doctor, Tianyu, and Tian Jue had produced no residual shockwaves.

For now, his clone observing in secret remained safe.

But the scene unfolding before him was far beyond his expectations.

He had thought Heavenly Doctor, with his formidable power, would at least put up a fight. Instead, he was struck down instantly by Tianyu and Tian Jue’s joint assault...

"With his power, how could he fall so easily?"

"Wait..."

A sudden realization hit Li Fan as he looked to the sky.

The Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace trembled violently.

Two dark clouds appeared in the sky above.

When he saw what they were, Li Fan’s breath caught.

They were giant hands, piercing through the heavens, descending upon the Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace.

Sage and the Fisherman were both shocked, staring up at the hands with dread.

They tried to resist, but their bodies were immobilized.

Terror spread across their faces.

"Don’t worry; this procedure will be over quickly."

A booming voice from above—Heavenly Doctor’s voice—reverberated across the heavens.

Li Fan’s heart raced, his mind nearly frozen.

It was clear now—the figure that Tianyu and the Fisherman had confronted was merely a statue of Heavenly Doctor.

And these giant hands were Heavenly Doctor’s true form!

In the face of these colossal hands, even the powerful Tian Jue and Sage seemed like insects on an operating table, utterly helpless.

The hands seized them, suspending them in mid-air.

The nine silver needles from the statue now floated toward the hands, initiating "treatment."

Watching from afar, Li Fan felt an uncontrollable chill.

"Heavenly Doctor... What on earth is he?"

The overwhelming strength Heavenly Doctor displayed far surpassed Li Fan’s estimations.

Even if he wasn’t at the Longevity Immortal Realm, he was not far from it.

Li Fan immediately considered abandoning his clone to avoid Heavenly Doctor tracing it back to his true body.

But then he realized...

No, Heavenly Doctor has obviously discovered that someone is plotting this behind his back, not insignificant ants observing from the sidelines.

However, if the clone suddenly disappeared now, it would be too obvious and might draw attention instead.

Caught in a mental battle, Li Fan chose to gamble.

He watched the "surgery" with bated breath, hoping Heavenly Doctor still adhered to human logic and wouldn’t overthink.

From Li Fan's current perspective, he still couldn't discern the reason.

He only felt silver light scattering, and the angry curses from Tianyu and Tian Jue gradually grew weaker.

Finally, as if sinking into a deep sleep, becoming almost inaudible.

As the surgery concluded, the Fisherman reverted to his confused, memory-lost state, wandering off.

The Sage, meanwhile, resumed his scholarly demeanor, disappearing with his ox cart.

After completing everything, the two giant hands retracted the silver needles.

Gently pressing down.

The Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace, which had been filled with wailing sounds just moments before, instantly fell silent.

Chapter 601: No War in the Xuanhuang Realm

"Almost there."

"Just a little longer."

As the Heavenly Doctor muttered softly, all the strange phenomena in Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace, including the vast sea, instantly returned to their original state. It was as if they had remained undisturbed for millions of years, unchanged and untouched.

In that fleeting moment, every cultivator adventuring within Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace, including Li Fan’s clone, was reduced to dust under the light press of the Heavenly Doctor’s hands, leaving no trace behind.

There was no room for resistance.

In fact, Li Fan’s clone, Zhou Qingang, never even realized how he had died.

Li Fan, in his true body, only felt the connection to his clone sever instantly as the Heavenly Doctor's massive hands pressed down.

"True destruction—unconcerned with you or your cause."

"Hah." Losing his clone, Li Fan took a deep breath, feeling a peculiar sense of relief.

"It seems my gamble was right. Even someone as powerful as the Heavenly Doctor would never guess that the ant he just crushed underfoot was secretly plotting against him."

However, Li Fan’s expression remained solemn.

The Heavenly Doctor’s strength, displayed during this confrontation, was beyond comprehension.

In Li Fan's original plan, even though the Fisherman was half-mad and forgetful and the Sage was weakened after transforming into an anomaly, their combined effort should have caused some trouble for the Heavenly Doctor.

But the reality was starkly different.

The gap between the two and the Heavenly Doctor was as vast as the gap between Li Fan and them—a difference spanning several major realms.

They were no match for him.

Li Fan’s calculated attempt to trouble the Heavenly Doctor turned into a self-humiliating joke.

Even though the Fisherman and the Sage were top-tier powers beneath the Longevity Immortal Realm, they were effortlessly manipulated like insects in the hands of the Heavenly Doctor.

Such overwhelming power...

"Could it be that Heavenly Doctor has already ascended to the Longevity Immortal Realm?"

Li Fan couldn't help but entertain this thought.

Otherwise, there was no way to explain the Heavenly Doctor’s unparalleled strength.

"What laws is he defying?"

"Silently, unnoticed by others. Could it be that he’s the one controlling the laws of life and death—the very one who caused Lan Yu's failure in achieving the Dao?"

"And what exactly is the relationship between the Heavenly Doctor and the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance?"

"Come to think of it, I’ve never seen the Heavenly Doctor act on behalf of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance—not even during the fiercest battles between Mysterious Net and the resistance cultivators in my previous life..."

Questions upon questions flooded Li Fan's mind in an instant.

Originally, Li Fan thought he could at least uncover some of the Heavenly Doctor’s secrets this time.

But the more he learned, the more he realized how unfathomable this person was.

"Unless I reach the Dao Integration Realm, I’d best avoid provoking him."

Li Fan sighed and reluctantly made his decision.

Even with the rare treasure [Truth] in his possession, the overwhelming disparity in strength left him no choice but to retreat for now.

Otherwise, walking this perilous path repeatedly would eventually expose him to danger—and luck wouldn't always be on his side.

Suppressing his frustration and doubts, Li Fan calmed himself after half a day.

He began reflecting on the observations his clone had made in Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace.

"Tianyi, Tian Jue, Tianyu..."

"All of them start with 'Tian' and seem to be old acquaintances. The people in Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace even call them all 'Venerable Ones.'"

"It's evident they share a common origin."

"The Xuantian Sect?"

Based on the clues he had, Li Fan instinctively drew this conclusion.

Yet, something about it didn’t feel right.

In the illusion created by Senior Sister Zhao, Li Fan had discussed the ancient Xuantian Sect—a massive force that once ruled the Xuanhuang Realm.

The Xuantian Sect usurped the Heavenly Mandate, claimed the power of the heavens, and suppressed all living beings.

The leaders of the sect often bore titles like "Heavenly King" or "Dharma King."

But the Heavenly Doctor and his companions seemed to revere the heavens themselves.

Those who were following the Sage and reading were repeating words such as "The laws of the heavens are strict; rules must be obeyed," and "The laws of the heavens cannot be defied."

This didn’t align with what Li Fan knew of the Xuantian Sect.

"With their level of cultivation, they couldn’t have appeared out of thin air without leaving traces."

"Just who are they?"

Li Fan fell into deep contemplation.

---

The events within Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace were earth-shattering, yet the surrounding Congyun Sea remained eerily unaware.

Other than the mysterious disappearance of the recently revealed Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace ruins, nothing else seemed to have impacted the Congyun Sea.

However, the Xuanhuang Realm’s top-tier powers extended beyond just the Heavenly Doctor.

Ordinary cultivators might not notice anything, but the Five Elders Association’s Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereigns must have sensed something.

As Li Fan gathered scattered pieces of overlooked information, he began to uncover hints.

For instance, after the war in Tianling Prefecture, the Five Elders Association recalled all their cultivators stationed in border regions.

Within days, every cultivator had been withdrawn, suggesting they had no intention of engaging in war anytime soon.

Then, surprisingly, the Five Elders Association sent envoys to propose a "friendly exchange" with the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

They claimed the prolonged estrangement had led to mutual unfamiliarity and suggested this rare post-war opportunity to foster understanding.

While the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had yet to respond officially, the Five Elders Association’s unusual gesture sparked curiosity.

After all, the Five Elders Association, boasting five Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereigns, had always been domineering. Reason and diplomacy were not their style.

For them to suddenly suggest easing tensions and promoting cooperation?

Some uninformed cultivators thought the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s victory in the Tianling Prefecture had forced the Five Elders Association into submission.

But Li Fan believed otherwise.

This shift undoubtedly stemmed from the Heavenly Doctor’s actions, which the Five Heavenly Sovereigns must have noticed.

"Perhaps the previous war was also a probe to see if the Immortal Ancestor was still present."

"While they failed to draw out the Immortal Ancestor, they exposed the Heavenly Doctor instead."

"Could it be that the Five Elders Association is wary of the Heavenly Doctor because he’s truly in the Longevity Immortal Realm?"

Li Fan remained uncertain.

From his limited understanding of the Longevity Immortal Realm, such beings defy the natural order and become part of the heavens themselves.

Their connection to the "Heavenly Dao" should be unmistakably distinct—vastly different from ordinary cultivators.

But every encounter with the Heavenly Doctor lacked any trace of the "Heavenly Dao."

Instead, his human aura remained unmistakably vivid.

"Simply put, the Heavenly Doctor doesn’t yet seem like a Longevity Immortal Realm cultivator."

Chapter 602: Preparation Before Burning the Sea

In the past, when Li Fan was traveling through the Five Elders Association and the illusionary realm shattered, he briefly confronted Senior Sister Zhao. In that fleeting moment, he felt a chilling sense of facing the vast heavens and earth.

The Heavenly Doctor was indeed powerful, but he did not evoke the same feeling in Li Fan.

Even the giant hand that instantly suppressed the Fisherman and the Sage merely made Li Fan sense its overwhelming strength, but not a fundamental transformation.

This was an instinctive feeling in the heart of a cultivator—profound and indescribable.

But deep down, Li Fan believed it was likely true.

"No matter if the Heavenly Doctor has reached the Longevity Immortal Realm or not, he has displayed actual combat strength that could intimidate someone of that level."

"In front of such a cultivator, no matter how many expendable troops are sent, it would be meaningless."

"The five Heavenly Sovereigns definitely won’t act personally, which is why the war was halted."

Li Fan mused thoughtfully.

Recalling the Heavenly Doctor's appearance, he considered how it might influence the trajectory of the Xuanhuang Realm's history.

Suddenly, a formless killing intent that had been monitoring for a long time without results finally responded.

"Hmm?"

Li Fan’s attention shifted instantly across millions of miles, landing on Master Yin of Yin Yin Island in the Congyun Sea.

After studying the barrier between mortals and immortals for a long time, it seemed he had finally discovered something.

At this moment, Master Yin had collapsed to the ground, bewildered and helpless.

"No, no, no! I must be mistaken."

"This is absolutely impossible!"

Master Yin's face was full of unconcealable terror.

It was as if he had uncovered a truth he could not accept, frantically pulling at his hair in a desperate attempt to calm himself.

"No, no, no!"

But he couldn’t control himself.

Whatever he had discovered had deeply shaken his worldview, driving him to the brink of madness.

He repeatedly banged his head on the ground, ignoring the blood streaming from his forehead.

After an indeterminate time, his face was bloodied and unrecognizable, making it impossible to discern his expression.

"It must be a mistake. There’s no way someone like this exists in the world."

"And he couldn’t possibly be such a person!"

"Let’s try again!"

As if clinging to a sliver of hope, Master Yin quickly stood up, not even bothering to wipe the blood from his face.

He once again released several mortal test subjects, extracting the barrier from their bodies for further research.

...

"This Master Yin, erratic and deranged—what exactly did he discover?"

Li Fan frowned.

"Another enigmatic person."

"Why not directly search his soul to find out?"

A flash of malice appeared in Li Fan’s eyes but was quickly suppressed.

Although Master Yin seemed to possess only Foundation Establishment cultivation on the surface, there was something unusual about him.

Li Fan couldn’t entirely rule out the possibility that he was feigning weakness. Forcibly searching his soul might even backfire.

"Patience!"

The Xuanhuang Realm was fraught with danger, with too many hidden powerhouses.

Recently battered by both Ruomu and the Heavenly Doctor, Li Fan took a deep breath to calm his restless heart.

"Continue monitoring. Hopefully, before he self-destructs, we can glimpse the truth."

In the following days, Li Fan focused on re-refining his clone.

For this, he even returned to the seabed of Congyun Sea to retrieve the coffin where Zhou Qingang was buried.

Looking at Zhou Qingang, still trapped in a dreamlike slumber with a faint smile on his face, Li Fan snorted coldly.

"Knowing nothing might be a form of happiness."

This time, Li Fan extracted more essence blood and replenished the stone coffin with spiritual stones to sustain Zhou Qingang's vitality.

Only then did he bury the coffin again.

With practiced ease, he crafted a new clone.

However, the items the previous clone had carried were all reduced to ashes.

Returning to Congyun City would inevitably bring some minor troubles, but they were trivial and wouldn’t affect the overall plan.

As the clone returned to Congyun City, Li Fan’s main body stood above the sea, gazing at the sky.

The Heaven and Earth Divination Dice floated in his hand, its light and shadows shifting.

Before long, Li Fan gained clarity.

"Just as predicted, the date for the Crimson Flame’s descent seems to be moving up significantly."

"…"

"The Heavenly-ranked beings?"

Li Fan pondered for a long while before shaking his head with a sigh.

"Coming sooner might be better—to burn all traces clean."

"As for whether to release Ink Death again…"

He recalled his earlier plans regarding Tianyang Zhenren.

"I’ll ask him when the time comes."

"Whether he remains at Soul Transformation forever or takes a gamble at Dao Integration, let him choose."

"However, given his temperament of 'never being weaker than others,’ he’ll likely choose the latter."

After a while, Li Fan’s thoughts paused.

"I once believed that after refining the Crimson Flame and succeeding in Dao Integration, facing Ink Death would still be a hopeless situation."

"But Tianyang is somewhat unique. He has already died once."

"His current form is more like a puppet infused with a trace of Tianyang’s will than a true living being."

"He might have a chance to escape with his life."

"Ink Death's previous world-ending attacks were confined to the Congyun Sea region. If he flees far enough…"

The thought of having a Dao Integration-level ally greatly tempted Li Fan.

Previously, he viewed Ink Death as an almost invincible force.

But after witnessing the true strength of the Heavenly Doctor, this belief began to waver.

The Heavenly Calamity Remnant Sword had been able to battle Ink Death for a long time during the latter’s apocalyptic rampages.

This suggested that Ink Death was not entirely unbeatable.

"It’s worth a try."

"Even failure wouldn’t cost much."

Having made his decision, Li Fan calculated the timeline—it had already been 15 years since anchoring.

The Crimson Flame would soon descend, and preparations needed to be made.

"15 years anchored…"

A sudden thought struck Li Fan. After a moment of contemplation, he took out a communication talisman to contact Jiao Xiuyuan.

Unexpectedly, Jiao Xiuyuan refused the call.

After a moment, Li Fan tried again.

Jiao Xiuyuan refused once more.

Li Fan was not annoyed and persisted.

After six attempts, Jiao Xiuyuan finally accepted the transmission.

"Hmph, Daoist Jiao have you risen so high lately that you no longer recognize old friends?" Li Fan snorted coldly.

"Not at all! Not at all! I was just busy with something important and couldn’t step away!" Jiao Xiuyuan replied with grievance.

"Daoist Jiao, your excuse is rather clumsy. Who doesn’t know that you have thousands of incarnations? One is busy—are all of them?"

"You’re truly insightful, Daoist! How did you know I was about to break through?" Jiao Xiuyuan asked in surprise.

Li Fan fell silent.

"Haha, but this advancement is proving to be much harder than expected. Without additional opportunities, I fear it will be delayed for a long time," Jiao Xiuyuan said regretfully.

"Oh? Why is that?" Li Fan asked casually.

Chapter 603: The Ultimate Path of Immortal Cultivation

"My Dao lies in [Commerce]. It lies in [Profit]."

Jiao Xiuyuan spoke with a touch of emotion:

"In this world, all things flow for profit. The path of commerce flourishes abundantly across the mortal realm."

"Thus, I create countless puppets, observe the gains and losses of the human world, and cultivate through this process."

"At the beginning, the accumulation of wealth is always extremely rapid. It’s almost like climbing a staircase daily, and my cultivation realm also advanced step by step alongside it."

"But upon reaching a certain level, the expansion of [Qianli Hall] slowed significantly."

"My cultivation stalled for a long time. Originally, I thought I could rely on the insights from this massive profit to make a breakthrough in one go. Yet, it turns out, I’m still lacking a spark."

"The saying ‘Seeing the mountain but exhausting the horse’ comes to mind. What seemed within reach was actually separated by countless mountains and valleys."

Li Fan listened to Jiao Xiuyuan’s lament and recalled the immense gap he recently witnessed between those in the Dao Integration Realm and the Longevity Immortal Realm.

He couldn’t help but silently acknowledge and nod slightly.

At this moment, Jiao Xiuyuan continued,

"Moreover, I’ve found that the path of commerce, at my current level, is now constrained on all sides and fraught with difficulties. Moving further forward has become incredibly challenging."

Before Li Fan could ask, Jiao Xiuyuan answered his unspoken question:

"Take, for example, the last incident with the Samantabhadra True Leaf. Under ideal conditions, we could have profited even more. From a purely commercial perspective, the price of Samantabhadra True Leaf had already soared to the heavens. The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, controlling the Five Elements Great Cave Heaven, had an abundance of Samantabhadra True Leaf. They could have capitalized on the market, yet they abruptly issued an edict that reset everything to its original state."

"They claimed it was for stability, but wasn’t it ultimately for their own benefit?" Jiao Xiuyuan muttered.

Li Fan, upon hearing this, seemed contemplative.

"Daoist Jiao, your meaning is that profit must always be earned from others. Upon reaching a certain point, further advancement inevitably leads to conflict with others."

"Exactly!" Jiao Xiuyuan praised.

"If the opposition is weak, one can easily crush them. But if the opponent is a formidable wall, charging head-on will only result in a bloody head."

"At that point, one has no choice but to take a detour around the wall."

"Yet, this world is ultimately under the rule of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association. Breaking free from these constraints is easier said than done."

"Dancing with shackles on, naturally, is a hundred times harder."

Li Fan laughed lightly after hearing this.

"In that case, Daoist, the fault doesn’t lie with you but with this world!"

"To be constrained at every turn is truly dissatisfying. Daoist Jiao, why not join me in overthrowing the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and recreating the heavens and earth? What do you say?"

Jiao Xiuyuan fell silent abruptly.

He looked at Li Fan with a peculiar gaze.

For a moment, a strange silence enveloped the two of them.

"Haha, Daoist, you must be joking."

"Haha, just a joke. Daoist Jiao, you didn’t take it seriously, did you?"

After a moment, they both spoke at the same time, exchanging glances before mutually moving past the topic.

"Speaking of which, Daoist, what do you believe your path would look like at its extreme?" Li Fan asked.

Jiao Xiuyuan pondered for a moment before answering slowly,

"The world’s wealth has a finite total. The rich grow richer, and the poor remain poor."

"If I continue to profit, the world’s wealth will flow continuously toward me. Then one day..."

"Perhaps my wealth alone will exceed that of everyone else combined."

Jiao Xiuyuan’s eyes gleamed with longing.

To his surprise, Li Fan chuckled lightly after hearing this.

Jiao Xiuyuan raised an eyebrow. "What is it? Does Daoist have a different opinion?"

"Too small. Your vision is too small. I thought Daoist Jiao was among the most brilliant minds in the world, yet..." Li Fan shook his head slightly, his tone filled with regret.

"Hmm?" A trace of gloom flashed in Jiao Xiuyuan’s eyes.

"If it’s truly the extreme, why would anyone else in the world still possess wealth?" Li Fan smiled faintly.

"Shouldn’t it be that all things in the world belong to you, Daoist, and everyone else owes you?"

"Daoist must understand that the total sum of worldly wealth is finite. But..."

Li Fan’s tone turned chilling.

"What others owe you has no limit."

"Billions, trillions—it can be endlessly accumulated."

"Not just in this lifetime, but in life after life, for endless descendants, they would labor eternally to repay their debts to you, Daoist!"

Li Fan’s words were like thunder, instantly striking Jiao Xiuyuan.

The gloom in his eyes dissipated immediately, replaced by shock.

"Could it... could it really be possible?"

Li Fan’s words seemed to open up an entirely new world for him.

First, his eyes showed confusion, but soon they grew brighter and brighter, filled with exhilaration.

Before long, as though he had achieved enlightenment, he exclaimed:

"Indeed, indeed!"

"Profit in one moment or one lifetime is ultimately limited."

"But time is infinite. If I spread my goal across the river of time..."

Jiao Xiuyuan became immersed in his vision, his eyes shining brightly.

"Daoist Li Fan, is this the future path you have deduced for me?"

After a long while, he finally returned to his senses and looked at Li Fan.

Li Fan shook his head.

"I dare not claim to guide. It’s merely a glimpse of a possible future that I happened upon during my daily deductions."

"In my heart, I felt it might benefit Daoist Jiao’s path, so I remembered it."

"Upon meeting you today, I thought to share it with you."

"Daoist Jiao, I hope you don’t find my thoughts absurd!"

Jiao Xiuyuan’s eyes flickered.

"Daoist Li Fan, your ability to deduce is truly astonishing. To foresee such a peculiar future..."

"However, Daoist, you came to me today and pointed this out to me..."

He looked at Li Fan, puzzled.

Li Fan smiled.

"I said you’d prosper and forget old friends, and you still deny it."

"Daoist, could it be you’ve forgotten the commission I gave you earlier?"

Jiao Xiuyuan froze briefly before realizing.

"You mean..."

"Given your cultivation, it’s naturally impossible to forget. But since you’ve not replied for so long, there must be some unspeakable difficulty. Still, this matter is important to me, so I can only thicken my face and trouble you again!" Li Fan cupped his hand and said with solemnity.

Jiao Xiuyuan stared at Li Fan, his expression changing rapidly.

Five years ago, he had promised Li Fan to investigate the identity of an ancient cultivator whose traces were sought after by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance as they excavated the ruins of ancient sects.

He had indeed taken on the task.

At first, he didn’t take it seriously, intending to find some casual information to report back.

However, to his surprise, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, known for leaking secrets like a sieve, had carried out this secrecy effort with extraordinary thoroughness.

Even with his capabilities, it had taken him nearly two years to find nothing of value.

Chapter 604: The Xuantian Hidden in Purple Heaven

Jiao Xiuyuan was genuinely intrigued this time.

News meant opportunities—potential breakthroughs.

He poured tremendous effort into infiltrating and persuading people, spending an incalculable amount of money. However, no cultivator was willing to disclose even a single detail.

Some subtly indicated that this matter was far more significant than anything else before.

"If any of this leaks, you might live to know it but not to enjoy its rewards."

Despite his reluctance, Jiao Xiuyuan had no choice but to abandon the endeavor.

With no results, there was naturally no response to send to Li Fan.

Yet, just as he was about to let the matter fade from his mind, an unexpected turn of events occurred.

Not long after the end of the Great Battle in the Tianling Prefecture, a previously tight-lipped cultivator who had sworn to keep the secret suddenly contacted him in private.

Jiao Xiuyuan was surprised.

The person confessed directly: "Things have changed. The current situation isn't what it used to be."

The confidentiality level of the matter had been downgraded by several levels, but of course, a reward was still expected.

Jiao Xiuyuan paid a hefty price, one that even made him feel the pinch, to acquire this piece of secret information.

The revelation left him both shocked and impressed.

Such information couldn’t just be handed over to Li Fan for free.

Furthermore, Jiao Xiuyuan doubted Li Fan could afford to pay the price for this classified intel.

Thus, he chose to let the matter rest.

Until today, when Li Fan sought him out personally.

“The future of ultimate creations…”

“That’s sufficient.”

In an instant, countless thoughts flashed through Jiao Xiuyuan’s mind.

Finally, he made a decision.

"Ah, my memory is failing me—I almost forgot!" Jiao Xiuyuan exclaimed, patting his forehead.

"Honestly, what you asked me to investigate is truly a top secret of the Immortal Alliance. Even if someone else offered a huge contribution, I wouldn’t have disclosed a thing."

"But…"

Jiao Xiuyuan sized up Li Fan and said, "What’s our relationship? We’ve made money together!"

"And with today’s guidance, how could I refuse?" Jiao Xiuyuan emphasized his words.

"I don’t mind telling you for free."

"But this isn’t something I can discuss over a talisman message. If you're truly interested, come see me at the nearest Qianli Hall."

Li Fan’s eyes narrowed slightly.

It seemed this matter was indeed extraordinary. Jiao Xiuyuan was being extremely cautious.

With that, he nodded and ended the communication.

After thinking it over, he decided to return to the Congyun Sea through the teleportation formation.

At a Qianli Hall shop in Immortal City of the Congyun Sea, he met Jiao Xiuyuan.

There weren’t many customers, and after sending them all away, Jiao Xiuyuan locked the doors and seemed to set up a barrier around them before beginning to speak.

"Do you know the Xuantian Sect?"

Jiao Xiuyuan started with a shocking question.

Li Fan’s eyes flickered, and he nodded slightly.

"An ancient cult—everyone seeks its destruction."

Although the Xuantian Sect was no longer known to the world, Li Fan, as a cultivator from the Heavenly Mechanism Sect, was naturally aware of its existence.

Jiao Xiuyuan wasn’t surprised by his answer and continued:

"This time, the Immortal Alliance discovered an ancient slumbering cultivator, who happens to be one of the Twelve Dharma Kings of the Xuantian Sect."

"What?"

A spark of light flashed in Li Fan’s eyes.

"A Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect? Still alive?" he asked in surprise.

"Indeed. I was shocked when I learned of it too. This individual has managed to survive across several eras..."

"Considering they once unified the Xuanhuang Realm, they indeed had some remarkable abilities," Jiao Xiuyuan sighed.

Li Fan fell into deep thought.

According to earlier intelligence from the Five Elders Association, this ancient cultivator had been excavated from the ruins of the Purple Heaven Sect by the Immortal Alliance.

However, the exact identity of this figure was unclear.

Moreover, this person seemed critical to the Five Elders Association, prompting them to seek Li Fan’s help in investigating.

Originally, Li Fan thought the individual might be connected to Zhang Qianmo, but he hadn’t expected it to be a remnant of the Xuantian Sect.

Why was a Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect hiding in the Purple Heaven Sect?

Li Fan was puzzled.

"Wait…"

Something clicked in Li Fan’s mind, and his gaze sharpened.

In the illusion realm of the Fallen Immortal Realm, during the quest for the Longevity Fruit in Ningyuan, Li Fan had learned from Song Hesong, the city steward.

About 200 years ago, during the Purple Heaven Sect’s centennial celebration, the Ten Great Immortal Sects had sent envoys to investigate a wanted criminal hiding within the Purple Heaven Sect.

The outcome of the investigation was inconclusive—they merely apprehended an inner disciple as a scapegoat.

"Could it be that the one hiding within the Purple Heaven Sect back then was this Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect?

"And the Ten Great Immortal Sects failed to locate them, instead capturing a decoy?"

Realizing this, Li Fan was shaken.

Meanwhile, Jiao Xiuyuan observed the subtle changes in Li Fan’s expression and continued:

"The reason the Immortal Alliance went to such great lengths, digging through ruins to find this Dharma King, is related to the Xuantian Sealing Spirit Formation."

Jiao Xiuyuan paused, studying Li Fan’s reaction before continuing:

"The details aren’t clear, but it seems this Dharma King is an essential component for maintaining the formation."

"At the time, the Immortal Alliance was preparing for war with the Five Elders Association. They placed all their hopes of victory on the Xuantian Sealing Spirit Formation."

"Naturally, they guarded the Dharma King closely, not allowing any room for error."

"But strangely, despite their precautions, the information leaked."

"This ultimate weapon was quickly countered by the Five Elders Association in a very short time."

"Given the formation's complexity, it’s highly unusual. If there wasn’t an inside informant, who would believe it?"

"With the formation’s intricacy, even a figure like the Immortal Ancestor might not have cracked it so swiftly without prior knowledge."

Jiao Xiuyuan sighed, "And yet, the insider remains hidden. Despite extensive purges within the Immortal Alliance, they’ve yet to be found. Isn’t that peculiar?"

"Indeed," Li Fan agreed, his expression calm but slightly amazed.

"It makes me wonder—could someone within the Immortal Alliance have deliberately leaked the formation’s details to prevent a one-sided war?" Li Fan suggested.

"That’s unlikely. Too far-fetched…" Jiao Xiuyuan began, then froze.

"Although... maybe not impossible," he muttered after a long pause, his face turning serious.

Li Fan was left speechless for a moment.

"By the way, what’s the name and appearance of this Dharma King from the Xuantian Sect?"

"The Purple Heaven Sect…"

"I knew many of their members back in the day," Li Fan inquired.

Jiao Xiuyuan, still lost in thought, replied absentmindedly, "Oh, he shares your family name."

"I think he’s called…"

"Li Chen?"

Chapter 605: The Guiding Star of the Outer World

“Li Chen?!”

In an instant, the image of a frail, scholarly young man flashed through Li Fan’s mind.

“He’s actually the secretly hidden Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect? How is this even possible?”

Li Fan was utterly shaken.

This Li Chen was none other than the person whose body Li Fan had possessed during the Fallen Immortal Realm’s Ningyuan Longevity Fruit incident.

An inner disciple of the Purple Heaven Sect and junior brother to Zhang Qianmo!

But...

Li Fan had entered the Fallen Immortal Realm and replaced him many times.

Li Fan knew every single detail of Li Chen’s memories as if they were his own.

Li Chen was just a boy from a humble mountain village. Due to his exceptional talent in cultivation, he was accepted into the Purple Heaven Sect.

There was absolutely no trace of any memory connected to the Dharma King of the ancient Xuantian Sect.

“There are three possible explanations. One, the Dharma King is merely a remnant spirit residing within Li Chen’s body. When the Fallen Immortal cast its final glance, reflecting all beings and objects in the world, only the original self of creatures was replicated in the Fallen Immortal Realm. Any other foreign existence in the body would not have been restored.”

“Two, during the Ningyuan Longevity Fruit event, the Dharma King had not yet occupied Li Chen’s body. It wasn’t until Li Chen was gravely injured and brought back to the sect by Zhang Qianmo that the Xuantian Sect’s Dharma King, hidden in the Purple Heaven Sect, took the opportunity to possess him.”

“Three, the Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect possesses unparalleled cultivation and hides his true nature deeply. Even the omniscient Fallen Immortal failed to uncover his secret.”

“Thus, what was recreated in the Fallen Immortal Realm was only a superficial form.”

...

After a thorough analysis, Li Fan deemed the third possibility to be unlikely.

If even a Dharma King on the verge of death could rival the Fallen Immortal in power, then the overall strength of the Xuantian Sect back in its prime would have been unimaginably terrifying.

The sect would not have been overthrown by the alliance of the Ten Great Immortal Sects.

“The Fallen Immortal Realm replicates the real world almost perfectly. Even the trajectory of spiritual energy and the operation of techniques can be mirrored. Residual spirits within the body would surely be detected by an immortal’s gaze.”

“So, the most plausible explanation is that after Li Chen fell unconscious, the Xuantian Sect’s Dharma King seized his body.”

“The Dharma King’s actual condition might also be quite poor—barely clinging to life. Having narrowly escaped the pursuit of the Ten Great Immortal Sects' envoys, he continued to hide within the Purple Heaven Sect. Over the years, he likely switched hosts multiple times until finally becoming Li Chen.”

Piecing together various pieces of information from different sources, Li Fan reconstructed a plausible truth.

Immediately, he felt a surge of excitement.

The Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect had existed since the ancient era of immortal cultivation.

The secrets he must know would be beyond measure.

If Li Fan could perform a soul-searching technique on him...

“This is absolutely worth trying.”

“When the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance discovered him, he was still in slumber, meaning his defenses are likely weak.”

“If I can control him, I could gain not only countless secrets and techniques but also a new identity in the Xuanhuang World. No more frequent disguises as a cultivator of the Heavenly Mechanism Sect, which always leave flaws.”

Li Fan’s heart wavered slightly.

“However, I must not act carelessly,” he thought to himself.

“The Xuantian Sect once ruled the heavens, and its Dharma Kings were surely at the Longevity Immortal stage under the old system. Though this Dharma King must have been gravely injured during the Xuantian Sect's downfall and has been dormant for so many years, his strength must have diminished considerably.”

“Still, ancient titans like him—who knows what hidden trump cards they might have? I should send an clone to probe first.”

“It’s a gamble worth taking. No matter what, it won’t be more dangerous than scheming against the Heavenly Doctor.”

Countless thoughts raced through Li Fan’s mind in an instant.

Though his expression barely changed, the subtle shifts in his emotions were noticed by Jiao Xiuyuan.

With a peculiar look in his eyes, Jiao Xiuyuan couldn’t help but ask, “Could it be that you truly know this Li Chen?”

Li Fan shook his head slightly and quickly replied, “Acquaintance would be too strong a word. We’ve merely crossed paths a few times.”

“At the time, I thought he was just an ordinary disciple of the Purple Heaven Sect. Who would’ve thought…”

“You truly can’t judge a book by its cover!”

Li Fan sighed.

Jiao Xiuyuan could tell that Li Fan wasn’t being entirely truthful. But everyone has their secrets, and he had no intention of probing further.

“Ha.”

“Then, why is Fellow Daoist investigating the identity of this ancient cultivator in slumber?” Jiao Xiuyuan asked tentatively.

Li Fan cupped his hands and said, “I’m simply fulfilling someone else’s request.”

Jiao Xiuyuan nodded thoughtfully and said no more.

After a brief exchange of pleasantries, just before parting, Li Fan casually asked, “By the way, the small Medicine King Cauldrons I asked you to excavate earlier—are they still with you?”

“They’ve long been sold,” Jiao Xiuyuan replied.

“Back then, you didn’t seem to care about them at all. Why bring it up now?” he asked curiously.

“A sudden whim. Just thought I’d ask. Don’t overthink it,” Li Fan said with a mysterious smile, evading the question before turning to leave the Qianli Hall.

He left behind a puzzled Jiao Xiuyuan, standing in place with furrowed brows.

—

After leaving, Li Fan first returned to the Tianxuan Mirror to search for the small Medicine King Cauldrons.

According to Jiao Xiuyuan, when the Medicine King Sect’s ruins were sealed by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, everything valuable had been taken away.

Jiao Xiuyuan had only managed to excavate two of them.

But now, upon checking the marketplace, Li Fan found no fewer than seventeen small Medicine King Cauldrons for sale.

These clearly came from internal leaks within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Li Fan was already accustomed to such situations.

Without hesitation, he used his vast wealth to purchase every single small Medicine King Cauldron available.

This sudden action instantly attracted the attention of certain individuals.

“Fellow Daoist Li Fan, was it you who made the move?”

“What secret lies within these small Medicine King Cauldrons?”

“Have you deduced something again?”

Jiao Xiuyuan, who had just ended their conversation, hurriedly sent inquiries.

“Guess,” Li Fan replied with a smile and ignored the other man’s response.

Using the Sky-Shrouding Hand technique to conceal himself, Li Fan headed straight for Cangwu Prefecture.

He teleported relentlessly without pause.

Half a day later, he arrived at the Abyss of Cangwu.

After purchasing a guidebook for traversing the Abyss, he followed the paths remembered from his past life as Xiao Fan, moving downward step by step.

He passed through the Forest of Spirit Whispers and the Puppet Canyon to reach the Lost Mysterious City buried 100,000 feet underground.

After some effort, he finally located the future landing site of the true Medicine King Cauldron.

Yes, Li Fan planned to lie in wait here for the falling star to descend.

The true Medicine King Cauldron contained numerous cultivators of the Medicine King Sect who had been forcibly placed in suspended animation.

They were like lambs awaiting slaughter.

........................................................................

[TL- Btw Just for those who might not know, I'm also translating another novel here. It's also xianxia so give it a try, it's a very fun novel -(https://www.scribblehub.com/series/1175101/the-path-of-immortality-starts-with-creating-water-bear-gu/)

Chapter 606: Extra Story – “For Me, A Thousand and Million Times” (Part 1)

Chapter 606: Extra Story – "For Me, A Thousand and Million Times" (Part 1)

The Immortal Ancestor had died.

When Qiao Sidao realized that he had been reborn into the ancient cultivation world—a time when the Ten Great Immortal Sects dominated the world and the new cultivation method had yet to emerge—a daring thought surfaced in his mind.

He would follow the Immortal Ancestor and become one of the earliest pioneers of the new way of cultivation!

At present, the Ten Great Immortal Sects were at their peak.

However, knowing the trajectory of the future, Qiao Sidao was keenly aware that their seemingly unshakable dominance would crumble before the sweeping tide of the new cultivation method.

It wouldn’t be long before the new cultivators—trained in a method that allowed them to plunder the heavens and earth, cultivating at an astonishing pace—would rise under the leadership of the Immortal Ancestor, They would crush the Ten Great Immortal Sects and establish the magnificent Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, destined to rule the Xuanhuang Realm for eons.

In such a grand revolution, the greatest merit lay in supporting the right leader.

If Qiao Sidao pledged his allegiance to the Immortal Ancestor before his rise, then when the Immortal Ancestor eventually ascended to the heavens, Qiao Sidao would undoubtedly secure a position within the supreme ruling body of the Alliance—the Dharma Transmission Council.

...

This was Qiao Sidao's vision.

And it was exactly what he acted upon.

He abandoned the hard-earned identity of an inner disciple of the Seven Stars Sect, traversing mountains and rivers from the heart of the Immortal Lands to reach the remote wilderness of Congyun Marsh.

After years of patient waiting, the day finally arrived when the great Immortal Ancestor—no, at this time, he was still known as the Dharma Transmission Immortal Venerable—began spreading his teachings.

News of the Immortal Venerable sharing his teachings had recently begun to circulate in the surrounding regions.

However, the Immortal Venerable's reputation was still modest at this time.

Announcing the dissemination of his teachings and blessings to the world was met with skepticism.

Few believed him.

Before Qiao Sidao stood only a dozen or so cultivators who had come out of curiosity.

Qiao Sidao made sure to secure a seat at the center of the front row, intending to make himself known.

Surveying those around him, Qiao Sidao realized that these individuals would one day become the key figures who wielded power within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance. His heart began to race.

When the Dharma Transmission Immortal Venerable’s gaze swept across him, Qiao Sidao immediately composed himself, no longer daring to look around.

Three days later, despite the sovereign’s teachings being profound, only about thirty cultivators had gathered on the small island within Congyun Marsh.

The Immortal Venerable, however, remained unbothered.

Sitting cross-legged on the ground, he began his grand discourse.

He spoke of the world of Xuanhuang, the laws of immortality, the mysteries of the human body, and the secrets of vital energy. He then elaborated on the intricate connections between the universe and all living beings.

His words flowed eloquently, captivating every cultivator present.

As the Immortal Venerable continued, celestial phenomena began to manifest in the skies.

Golden light illuminated rolling purple clouds arriving from the horizon, creating a divine and majestic scene.

Even at night, the island radiated with a never-ending glow of purple and gold, visible from hundreds of miles away.

This attracted an increasing number of cultivators who, mesmerized by the spectacle, flocked to the island.

Respectful and awestruck, the newcomers settled wherever they could find space, silently regretting their delayed arrival and the missed opportunities to absorb the profound teachings from earlier days.

Eventually, the island was teeming with over ten thousand cultivators.

At this point, the Immortal Venerable declared:

“To ascend to immortality, why beseech the heavens? If the heavens do not grant it, then take it for yourself!”

“To follow the heavens is mundane; to defy the heavens is Immortality!”

“Thus, the path of immortality lies in:

- Absorbing the spirit of heaven and earth to wield its energy;

- Harnessing the marvels of the heaven and earth to establish a foundation;

- Observing the laws of the heaven and earth to refine the golden core;

- Seizing the essence of creation to form the nascent soul;

- Extracting the marrow of the world to transform into the divine soul;

- Sacrificing the spirit of heaven and earth existence to merge with the Dao;

- Defying the principles of the heavens to achieve Longevity Immortality!”

...

The Venerable then proceeded to elucidate the details of each realm, leaving the gathered cultivators stunned and speechless.

So, immortality could be pursued in such a way!

Qiao Sidao’s blood surged with excitement.

He knew that these cultivators, relying on this revolutionary method of plundering the heavens and earth, would eventually overthrow the Ten Great Immortal Sects and establish the great Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

It felt as though he were a part of history in the making.

However, just as the Dharma Transmission Immortal Venerable reached the pivotal point in his discourse—explaining the principle of defying the heavens—a cold voice suddenly reverberated across the skies, interrupting the sovereign.

“Such deceptive rhetoric!”

“The heavens nurture all things. For cultivators to not repay this debt is already egregious, but to engage in such vile plundering is no different from beasts!”

The voice boomed like thunder, echoing endlessly.

Interrupted suddenly, the cultivators on the island listening to the teachings were naturally both shocked and enraged.

"Who is this reckless cultivator courting death?"

Qiao Sidao, on the other hand, wore a look of amusement, ready to watch the drama unfold.

After all, he knew that the Immortal Ancestor had dominated the world for thousands of years, practically unrivaled.

Wasn’t the one provoking him seeking death?

However, what Qiao Sidao inadvertently glimpsed made him feel a vague sense of unease.

At this moment, the Preaching Immortal Venerable abruptly stood up. His face was filled with solemnity.

“May I know the name of this friend?”

“The so-called 3,000 Great Dao Paths…” The Immortal Venerable cupped his hands and was about to speak.

But he was rudely interrupted again.

“Words are pointless! Under the rule of the Ten Great Immortal Sects, anyone spreading heresies—”

“Must die!”

With a thunderous roar, the speaker revealed himself.

He appeared to be no more than a teenager, clad in shining golden armor, with a red ribbon tied to his head, and wielding a silver spear.

He looked less like a cultivator and more like a mortal general.

“Remember, the one taking your lives today is 'Wu' of the Creation Sect!”

As his words ended, the silver spear descended from the heavens.

“Arrogant child…”

The Immortal Venerable snorted coldly, lightly extending two fingers of his right hand to block it.

Who would have thought...

The silver gleam flashed like lightning, piercing through the Immortal Venerable's body in an instant.

Then, without losing momentum, it slammed violently into the ground.

"Boom!"

In the Immortal Venerable’s incredulous gaze, the entire Ten Thousand Immortal Island turned to dust in an instant.

As the massive silver shockwave crushed the island, it also swept through Congyun Marsh relentlessly.

In just a few breaths, the vast Congyun Marsh no longer had any signs of life.

Only the rampant silver serpents continued to dance in the void.

“Foolishness!”

Before Qiao Sidao’s consciousness faded, he only heard Wu’s cold snort,

and saw the gradually vanishing figure of the Immortal Ancestor.

...

When he awoke from a pitch-black void again,
