Qiao Sidao was surprised to find himself back at the very start of his rebirth.

The outer disciples of the Seven Star Sect were still anxiously preparing for the inner sect assessment.

But this time, entering the inner sect no longer concerned him at all.

His mind was filled with countless doubts.

Why?

Why did the Immortal Ancestor fall so easily?

Who was this "Wu"?

Why had he never heard of such a person before?

Countless questions surged in his heart.

Days passed, and Qiao Sidao still couldn’t come up with a reasonable explanation.

However, since the world of his rebirth diverged from the historical trajectory he remembered,

he decided he must carefully consider the future.

With a figure like Wu around, it seemed unlikely that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance could rise to prominence.

Though somewhat regretful, a wise man knows when to yield.

In this life, Qiao Sidao decisively chose to side with the Ten Great Immortal Sects.

But something unexpected happened once more.

In his previous life, Wu, who ended the Immortal Ancestor’s life with a single spear,

simply did not exist in this life.

Without Wu’s dramatic feat on the Ten Thousand Immortal Island, the new teachings spread like wildfire across the entire Xuanhuang Realm within a few years.

It was a vast, unstoppable force.

In the war against the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, Qiao Sidao, as cannon fodder for the Ten Great Immortal Sects, once again lost his life.

Chapter 607: Extra Story – “For Me, A Thousand and Million Times” (Part 2)

Chapter 607: Extra Story – "For Me, A Thousand and Million Times" (Part 2)

“Why?”

“Why has the course of history in this life returned to the same path again?”

Awakening once more from the darkness, Qiao Sidao clutched his head, overwhelmed by a splitting headache.

But he couldn’t afford to dwell on it. His mind was flooded with questions as he continuously recalled and compared the events of his past two lifetimes.

As an insignificant figure swept up in the tides of destiny, he had little agency of his own.

He couldn’t grasp the full scope of the world’s events.

However, he was aware of certain key junctures critical enough to alter the trajectory of history.

After a thorough comparison, Qiao Sidao realized that the world without the existence of the Sect of Creation [Wu] aligned with the history in his memory: an Immortal Venerable transmitting a new cultivation method, igniting a wildfire of reform, overthrowing the decayed Ten Great Immortal Sects, and establishing the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance that ruled the Xuanhuang Realm for millennia.

So, was [Wu] the anomaly?

Without [Wu], would history return to its rightful path?

After a long period of contemplation, Qiao Sidao finally arrived at a plausible explanation.

“This means, in this lifetime, I should first investigate the Sect of Creation and determine whether this [Wu] exists before making any decisions.”

“But the Sect of Creation is one of the prestigious Ten Great Immortal Sects, while I’m just an outer disciple of an insignificant sect. How could I possibly gather any information?”

“Secrets of this magnitude are clearly beyond what my current body can handle. If someone were to notice, they might use soul-searching techniques to uncover my ability to reincarnate endlessly.”

...

Qiao Sidao, meticulous and familiar with the various means of cultivators, naturally harbored many concerns.

Fortunately, he didn’t need to dwell on these worries for long.

Because after absorbing the memories of the body he now occupied, Qiao Sidao was shocked to discover that this lifetime was not set during the early days of the new cultivation method.

Instead, it was an unprecedented and bizarre period.

In this era, a strange restriction had emerged that made it impossible to cultivate multiple techniques simultaneously. Sects had been eradicated, and only one in ten thousand cultivators survived.

The surviving cultivators roamed the world alone, distrustful of others, struggling to survive in the wilderness.

Qiao Sidao didn’t know what had happened during this time, nor did he understand the reasons behind the variations in the worlds he reincarnated into.

Cautiously, he focused on ensuring his survival and ventured into the ruins of various sects, seeking to piece together the truth of history.

It took more than a decade before Qiao Sidao finally uncovered the events of that time.

The divergence in history occurred during the era of intense conflict between the old and new cultivation methods.

In this timeline, the old sects proved surprisingly resilient.

Not only did they withstand the seemingly endless armies of the new method, but they also began to reform themselves, incorporating the new techniques.

Without the advantage of faster cultivation, the new method practitioners fell behind in terms of techniques, treasures, and mystical arts.

They barely managed to hold their ground, relying solely on sheer numbers.

The tug-of-war lasted for decades.

During this time, both the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Ten Great Immortal Sects used every means at their disposal to secure ultimate victory.

Masses of ordinary people were forcibly conscripted and taught cultivation methods.

After brief training, they were sent to the battlefield, their bodies bound with various restrictions, leaving them no choice but to fight for their survival.

It was said that blood soaked every inch of the Xuanhuang Realm. Even now, traces of those brutal battles remained in the wastelands.

The relentless recruitment of cultivator soldiers led to an unprecedented catastrophe.

It was a curse of unimaginable horror—the inability to cultivate the same technique together.

Anyone practicing the same cultivation method lost their sanity, perceiving one another as mortal enemies.

To accelerate their combat readiness, both the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Ten Great Immortal Sects had their soldiers practice standardized cultivation techniques.

When the calamity struck, chaos consumed the Xuanhuang Realm in an instant.

The situation is the same at the lower levels as it is at the higher levels.

The Ten Great Immortal Sects emphasize the inheritance of their sects. Countless individuals follow the same cultivation methods. At this moment, faced with the great calamity, even the reclusive elders of these sects have started wielding their blades against their own disciples.

The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance values mutual assistance. Everyone regards the teachings of Immortal Ancestor cultivation techniques as the foundation of mentorship, and most members are independent cultivators from various unorthodox paths. To overcome the ancient sects with thousands of years of inheritance, it is essential to gather the wisdom of the vast majority of cultivators and continuously deduce and refine a universal cultivation method that could serve most of the alliance's members.

This method, called 'Heavenly Net Divine Art', was originally the cornerstone of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's unity and mutual aid. However, at this moment, it has turned into a terrifying death sentence.

This period of darkness left a chilling impression on posterity.

The conclusion of the great war was naturally the mutual annihilation of both sides, leaving the Xuanhuang Realm barren and desolate.

Thousands of years later, a few mortals who had miraculously survived stumbled upon remnants of ancient cultivation texts amidst the ruins, rekindling the civilization of cultivation.

As for the leaders of the Ten Great Immortal Sects, the pinnacle powerhouses of the Xuanhuang Realm, their ultimate fate remains unknown.

Throughout his life, Qiao Sidao delved into various ruins, seeking traces of these legendary figures.

Unfortunately, on one such occasion, he was fatally wounded by a hidden mechanism and passed away with regret.

When he awoke again, the first thing he did was explore the memories of his new body.

As expected, the world had changed yet again.

A terrifying plague had emerged, spreading through spiritual energy. Once cultivators were infected, they experienced symptoms akin to mortals suffering from a deadly illness.

No matter the elixirs or divine techniques, nothing could completely cure this affliction.

While not fatal, the disease had a profound impact on cultivators.

When spiritual energy was circulated intensely, they would involuntarily cough violently.

Ignoring the discomfort and forcibly continuing could even result in fainting.

This plague persisted for over a decade, during which conflicts in the Xuanhuang Realm nearly ceased.

It wasn't that the once-competitive cultivators had changed their ways; rather, their physical capabilities had subtly deteriorated over time.

Ridiculously, incidents such as Golden Core cultivators breaking their legs while walking or Nascent Soul cultivators fainting mid-flight and crashing to the ground became alarmingly frequent.

Qiao Sidao's current body, which belonged to a Golden Core cultivator, felt even weaker than an ordinary Qi Condensation cultivator in his memory.

In this world, Qiao Sidao lived for 60 years, nearing the end of his life. Due to the plague, cultivators had been weakened to their limits.

In contrast, mundane martial artists with robust vitality were now capable of subduing Dao Integration cultivators.

The path of immortality had declined, while martial arts flourished.

Thus, the remaining cultivators called this plague "Immortal's Demise."

In another lifetime, Qiao Sidao returned to a world where the new and old cultivation methods clashed.

However, war was no longer the focus.

When the battle between the Ten Great Immortal Sects and the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance was at its peak, an eerie mirage of ruins suddenly appeared in the sky.

A solitary figure stood within the ruins, seemingly gazing silently at the beings of the Xuanhuang Realm below.

The entire world trembled slightly, a strange phenomenon that naturally caught the attention of the cultivators.

Both sides decided to temporarily cease fighting to investigate the mysterious apparition.

After thorough research, the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance and the Ten Great Immortal Sects reached the same conclusion.

The ruins above the sky possessed an immense gravitational pull, strong enough to gradually draw the entire Xuanhuang Realm upward.

The tremors the cultivators had recently sensed were the initial signs of the Xuanhuang Realm being drawn toward the ruins.

Calculations revealed that in no more than a century, the Xuanhuang Realm would collapse into the ruins, resulting in the death of all its inhabitants.

This revelation caused an uproar.

Faced with the threat of extinction, war was temporarily set aside.

The Ten Great Immortal Sects and the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance formed an unprecedented alliance to find a solution.

Ultimately, they devised a plan called "Reversal of Xuanhuang."

This plan aimed to construct tens of thousands of obelisks across the Xuanhuang Realm.

The obelisks' thrust would push the entire Xuanhuang Realm away from the gravitational pull of the ruins.

Initially, the plan seemed promising.

The first completed obelisk did slightly slow the Xuanhuang Realm's upward movement, proving the feasibility of the plan.

However, the optimistic assumptions about human nature soon proved naive.

The alliance fell apart within a mere decade, plunging the Xuanhuang Realm into unprecedented chaos.

The massive project required contributions from every cultivator, which clashed with the inherently independent nature of cultivators.

Rumors began to spread, claiming the apparition in the sky was an elaborate hoax created by the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance and the Five Elders Association to enslave all cultivators.

Some even claimed the obelisks were part of a nefarious formation designed to implant a soul-binding restriction in every cultivator's sea of consciousness.

Despite efforts to suppress these rumors, suspicion lingered, and belief in the conspiracy grew stronger.

The "Reversal of Xuanhuang" plan faced immense resistance, and reports emerged of places where cultivators were forcibly controlled to build the obelisks, adding fuel to the conspiracy theory.

Rebellion broke out across the Xuanhuang Realm, escalating rapidly.

Then came an incident that pushed the situation to its breaking point.

One night, an intense white light burst forth from the direction of the Heavenly Sword Sect, illuminating the entire Xuanhuang Realm.

Cultivators could vaguely see a massive sword rise from the ground, piercing through the heavens.

At the same time, as the shadow of the ruins in the sky twisted, a black void appeared in mid-air.

In the next second, under the watchful eyes of all the cultivators, the giant sword vanished without a trace.

Darkness once again descended upon the world. Initially, the cultivators were somewhat puzzled.

But how could such a matter remain hidden? Soon, everyone understood.

One of the Ten Great Immortal Sects, the Heavenly Sword Sect, had secretly forged a Void-Breaking Divine Weapon, tore through the void, and escaped!

“Traitors!”

“Shameful!”

For a moment, curses filled the air. Yet, it also made the cultivators wonder—could it be that the ruins in the sky were real?

Amidst this uncertainty, the unrest across the regions subsided, and cultivators began to actively construct obelisks.

However…

They quickly realized something was amiss.

Orders from the upper echelons of the Ten Great Immortal Sects and the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance became increasingly rare.

In fact, it had been a long time since anyone had seen any influential cultivators in person.

In their unease, they banded together to visit the residences of the Ten Great Immortal Sects, only to find them long abandoned!

The remaining formations merely issued orders periodically.

Feeling deceived and abandoned, the cultivators were filled with rage but had no one to direct it toward.

They could only vent their anger on those who had initially spread the rumors. Yet in truth, they themselves had fanned the flames of those rumors.

Now, who could they blame?

The upper echelons of the Xuanhuang Realm had collectively fled, leaving behind no instructions on how to operate the obelisks.

Left with no choice but to await death, the cultivators watched as the image of the ruins in the sky grew larger.

Gradually, despair drove them into madness.

The slaughter began.

Amid this farcical chaos, Qiao Sidao watched coldly from the sidelines.

As the Xuanhuang Realm quaked and gradually disintegrated, he too ended his life in this world.

In the cycles of rebirth that followed, Qiao Sidao experienced all kinds of mysterious worlds.

For instance, worlds where the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Ten Great Immortal Sects did not exist. Instead, the Xuanhuang Realm was unified under a Supreme Heavenly Sovereign. From birth, every person was required to cultivate specific techniques. The cultivation they accumulated would be exchanged for essential survival resources.

Or worlds where the Immortal Net enveloped everything, monitoring every action of cultivators. However, the same Immortal net allowed cultivators to earn contribution points to exchange for techniques and treasures. It even provided access to other cultivation worlds for conquest, earning massive military merits.

...

Despite his average aptitude, Qiao Sidao tried his best to live in every lifetime.

Yet he remained an ordinary person among the masses, leaving no mark in history. Each time, he experienced a mundane birth and an ordinary death.

And so, after countless reincarnations…

He returned to the same world where he had first awakened.

An inner disciple of the Seven Star Sect.

The Immortal Ancestor transmitting dharma from Congyun Marsh.

However, after witnessing countless cycles of destruction and resurgence, Qiao Sidao vaguely understood his current predicament.

Thus, he refrained from any drastic actions, behaving instead like an outsider.

Quietly observing the world’s changes.

This time, the Sect of Creation’s [Wu] did not appear. The preaching Immortal Ancestor successfully completed the sermon.

But as the new techniques began to spread, the Ten Great Immortal Sects immediately issued an extermination order.

The new techniques were labeled heretical, and any practitioners were to be executed without mercy.

It was said that this decree came from the Great Dao Sect’s [Zhi].

As a result, the new techniques met their demise before achieving any great feats.

Even the preaching Immortal Venerable himself died tragically under relentless pursuit.

Witnessing all this, Qiao Sidao seemed to understand something.

In the countless cycles of reincarnation that followed…

He never again encountered [Zhi] in this world.

“So, it’s all for these people.”

Most people in this world are ordinary.

But there are always a few extraordinary individuals.

These individuals, through their exceptional talents, could even alter the course of history.

For example, using one's own strength to research a "Medicine" method that completely solves the plague of Deceased Immortals Demise.

And also, after the Ten Great Immortal Sects and Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance abandoned all cultivators, standing up to reverse the tide, reuniting everyone.

Eventually, this person reignited the Reversal of Xuanhuang Plan and saved the entire world—the Immortal Emperor.

...

Through countless reincarnations, Qiao Sidao watched these geniuses rise and fall.

His heart grew colder.

He had realized the truth about the world he was in.

The various divergent worlds were merely tests to select those with exceptional talent.

While the rest of the world’s beings were nothing more than background props.

But…

What about himself?

Why was he able to retain his memories across countless reincarnations?

Qiao Sidao didn’t know the reason.

But he understood that this was his only leverage to escape this false world.

TLN:-[Oof... This took a long time to translate, hope you guys enjoyed it! And also do give your thoughts and theories on what's going on here]

Chapter 608: Extra Story – “For Me, A Thousand and Million Times” (Part 3)

Chapter 608: Extra Story – "For Me, A Thousand and Million Times" (Part 3)

What is real, and what is false?

Having traversed so many worlds,

Each vibrant face,

Every heroic or tragic tale,

Rivers, lakes, seas, and mountain breezes,

Love and hatred, obsessions with immortality,

Heroes and cowards, saints and sinners...

Are these all illusions?

At first, Qiao Sidao was confused.

He wondered: if all worldly matters are mere illusions, what meaning remains in the lives of the myriad beings deceived by this world?

Their heartfelt desires, their painstaking pursuit of divine techniques, treasures, and realms of cultivation—

When time resets, it all begins again.

Even death, which they so fear, is not the end, but the start of something new.

In one lifetime, two souls might share a deep friendship, only to become strangers in the next.

What a sorrowful reality this is.

In his bewilderment, Qiao Sidao lost interest in everything.

Despairing, he began spreading the truth that the world was false.

He thought this would attract the attention of the "Observers" beyond the skies, bringing him liberation.

To his surprise, no one believed him.

Instead, they mocked him as a madman.

Even when he exhausted himself explaining the truth, people responded impatiently,

"Why don’t you see if my sword is real or not!"

When annoyed, they even sent sword lights his way, severing his legs.

At that moment, Qiao Sidao noticed the indifference in their eyes—there was no sympathy, only glee at his suffering.

In a world rife with madness, why would the Observers beyond care?

After this realization, Qiao Sidao gave up on exposing the grand conspiracy.

He adjusted his mindset and sought to blend into each world,

Abandoning the dream of being a savior, focused instead on finding a way to survive.

In this false world, escape was bound to be extraordinarily difficult.

Initially, Qiao Sidao was at a loss.

But soon, he found a path. He stopped openly proclaiming that the world was false.

Instead, he wrote fictional tales, narrating the story of someone living within an immortal artifact called the "Traveling Horse Lantern", experiencing countless fleeting and illusory cultivation worlds.[1]

With his vast experience across numerous civilizations, the grandeur of his depictions attracted many cultivators' attention.

As the tales spread, some cultivators began discussing whether the world they lived in was real.

Inevitably, discussions also turned to: "What would one do if they discovered the world was false?"

"If falsehoods can masquerade as truth, it means the laws of this false world must mirror those of the true world outside."

"To construct a flawless world framework... such an achievement is akin to creation itself."

"If so, the line between real and false blurs."

"Indeed, even if the beings within are false, the foundation of the world's operation might not be."

Someone mentioned an artifact called the "Stone of Dao Deviation" in the Taiyan Sect.

It was said that within its every instant, countless worlds evolved and perished. What might such fleeting worlds look like?

Through collective wisdom, the cultivators' discussions illuminated a path for Qiao Sidao.

From then on, his purpose became clear.

In each lifetime, he no longer sought cultivation or realms of power but delved into formations, restrictions, and simulation techniques.

Though cultivation could not carry over between reincarnations, memories could.

Qiao Sidao believed that, with patient accumulation, he would eventually uncover the flaws in this false world.

The idea was beautiful, but execution was fraught with challenges.

Initially, his proficiency in these niche arts advanced rapidly.

From ignorance, he quickly grasped the basics.

But when he sought mastery, he encountered the immense monopoly over knowledge in the cultivation world.

Ordinary sects only taught the most rudimentary techniques. Even in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, information on these topics was scarce.

True expertise could only be found in the Ten Great Immortal Sects.

But how could someone of average aptitude gain entry?

This was true even in ancient times, let alone in the post-cataclysmic wasteland of sect ruins.

Only in rare worlds, like those governed by the Immortal Net or under the unified rule of the Immortal Alliance, did conditions exist for proper study.

Despite the hurdles, Qiao Sidao believed that, over enough time, his gradual progress would lead him to a method of escaping this world.

But...

After experiencing his 9,999th world, he did not awaken in a new world.

Instead, he found himself in a vast, blue ocean.

There, he witnessed an unforgettable sight.

Countless souls, packed tightly together, drifted.

From above, one could vaguely see sleeping faces.

In the ocean, whirlpools churned, tossing millions of souls about.

Some collided and shattered, dissolving into the sea.

Others absorbed fragmented remnants, reforming into something purer.

A sharp pain, like a needle, stirred in Qiao Sidao's mind, making him dizzy with agony.

What horrified him most was realizing that certain memories within his soul were vanishing amidst the sea's resentment-filled waves.

Despair crept in, and Qiao Sidao lost consciousness.

When his true self awakened again, it was after countless reincarnations.

He regained clarity, as suddenly as before.

Though most of his memories were lost, fragments of knowledge about the 'false world', the 'Sea of Resentful Souls', and scattered insights into formations remained deeply etched in his soul.

"It seems that to prevent other souls from awakening memories of reincarnation like I have, there is a periodic cleansing process conducted on us."

"In each cleansing, I lose most of my memories."

"If I accumulate knowledge too slowly, I will never be able to grasp the method to escape from here."

After careful calculation, Qiao Sidao reached this conclusion.

Even so, he did not give up easily.

Having seen so much, Qiao Sidao had come to understand one principle: if there are enough iterations, then even the most extraordinary things can happen.

Just like himself—by all accounts, he shouldn't be able to inherit and retain the memories of each reincarnation.

Yet it happened anyway.

Qiao Sidao lay low and waited.

After enduring countless cleansings in the Sea of Resentful Souls, he finally encountered an opportunity to break free.

It was a highly developed world called [Eternal Immortal Realm].

In this world, not only was the average lifespan extraordinarily long—thousands of years even without cultivation—but there was also a great entity known as the [Immortal Spirit Tower].

The Immortal Spirit Towers were scattered across every corner of the world, continuously emitting pure spiritual energy day and night.

More critically, any knowledge—

Cultivation techniques, formations, alchemy, pill crafting...

Everything you could imagine could be found, studied, and accessed within the Immortal Spirit Tower without limitation.

Gazing at the vast ocean of information within the Immortal Spirit Tower, Qiao Sidao trembled uncontrollably.

He understood that the method to escape was hidden somewhere within.

Thus, Qiao Sidao devoted himself tirelessly to studying.

He lived in the Eternal Immortal Realm for 3,658 years without ever stepping away from the Immortal Spirit Tower.

Although he was still far from uncovering the [false world], he had finally glimpsed a sliver of hope.

After experiencing thousands of reincarnations and waking up from yet another cleansing, Qiao Sidao was thrilled to discover that, perhaps because his soul had grown more resilient, he had lost far fewer memories this time compared to before.

This gave him renewed confidence.

He continued to accumulate knowledge and insights, waiting for the next time the [Eternal Immortal Realm] would appear.

...

When Qiao Sidao arrived at the Eternal Immortal Realm for the ninth time, near the end of his life, he finally uncovered the secret of his world.

It was a false world, constructed around a certain mysterious artifact of deduction.

Most of the living beings within this world were virtual constructs.

Only a small fraction had real souls.

And Qiao Sidao was one of those rare true souls among millions.

"Deductions have their limits."

"This also means that the timeline of this world has gaps."

"Each smallest gap is an opportunity for me to escape."

"Of course, to avoid detection, the best time to escape is during a world reboot."

Standing atop the Immortal Spirit Tower, gazing at the sky above, Qiao Sidao silently resolved to act.

He spent the remainder of his life preparing.

When his life finally ended, as he sank into darkness, Qiao Sidao awoke from his slumber.

He sensed a fleeting opportunity, like a thread, breaking through the boundary.

In his mind, he had envisioned the [outside world] tens of thousands of times.

He had even imagined confronting the possible [Observers].

But what Qiao Sidao never expected was that the so-called outside world would be so cold and vast.

His once-mighty soul, which he thought invincible, was on the verge of collapse under the assault of this icy expanse.

It seemed like he would disintegrate entirely in the next moment.

To make matters worse, the halo he had escaped from began emitting an alarming sound.

Drifting aimlessly in the void, Qiao Sidao observed his surroundings in confusion.

"A... museum?"

He fell silent.

It turned out that his world was nothing more than an exhibit.

He vaguely sensed several powerful presences rapidly approaching.

Despite the vastness of the heavens and earth, there was no place for him to hide.

For the first time, Qiao Sidao experienced true despair.

At that moment…

He noticed a human skull in the center of the museum.

It sat there quietly, seemingly gazing at him.

From this skull, Qiao Sidao felt an indescribable warmth.

While the entire world rejected him, it exuded the greatest goodwill it could muster.

It was like a mother’s embrace, moving Qiao Sidao to tears.

Thus, as his soul was about to dissipate, Qiao Sidao used the last of his strength to dive into the skull.

[1] Traveling Horse Lantern 走馬燈 (Zǒumǎdēng) is also called zoetrope in english, which some of you might know is a pre-film animation device that produces the illusion of motion, by displaying a sequence of drawings or photographs showing progressive phases of that motion.

Chapter 609: Life and Death in the Immortal Ruins

Under normal circumstances, the dormant cultivators inside the Medicine King True Cauldron would be protected by the 'Dream of Spring and Autumn Formation,' making it considerably challenging for Li Fan to achieve his objectives.

However, the forced detachment from the Immortal Ruins had somewhat disrupted the formation's effectiveness.

More importantly, Li Fan was aware that a Medicine King Sect cultivator named Linghu Chang had not fully integrated into the Dream of Spring and Autumn Formation.

The room he occupied was not completely sealed; a small gap remained.

If Li Fan could access the memories within Linghu Chang's mind, the Medicine King True Cauldron would be virtually defenseless against him.

As for the cultivators at the Nascent Soul stage or higher, Li Fan planned to leave them undisturbed, allowing them to remain in slumber. For those below the Nascent Soul stage, if necessary, he could use his 'Insect Binding' divine ability to suppress them one by one.

Despite the fact that these disciples of the Medicine King Sect carried various magical artifacts and pills, such external items were of little significance to Li Fan in his current state.

What truly captured his interest was the Medicine King Cauldron itself, capable of traversing the void, as well as a set of navigational markers within the sect that could lead to another cultivation realm.

"Even with the existence of the Immortal Ruins, escape from the Xuanhuang Realm is currently impossible. Yet one day, I will leave this place," he thought.

"Having control of those markers is a prudent step for the future."

Another reason for Li Fan’s arduous journey was his desire to witness the Immortal Ruins firsthand.

Raising his gaze to the sky, he calmed his thoughts and awaited the arrival of the Medicine King True Cauldron.

While waiting, he observed the unique "Immortal-Suppressing Force" of the Cangwu Abyss, marveling at the wonders of creation.

Unlike restrictions or formations that merely weakened a cultivator’s strength, the Immortal-Suppressing Force seemed to proportionally scale down one’s cultivation level.

With his current Nascent Soul Early Stage cultivation, although his strength seemed unrestricted, he could only manifest power equivalent to that of the Golden Core Stage.

“How fascinating! It’s as if a mortal entered the land of giants—unchanged in stature, yet, relative to everything around them, reduced to a mere ‘small person.’”

While Li Fan was lost in thought, the ruins of a nearby structure, as though stirred by an unseen wind, began creaking and slowly moving toward his position.

Without warning, the ruins appeared animated, as if imbued with life, exuding a sinister aura.

Li Fan frowned slightly but refrained from destroying the ruins. Instead, he chose to evade them.

As the broken remnants brushed past him, Li Fan’s gaze sharpened. With a flash, he landed atop one of the stone pillars.

The pillar, weathered by countless ages, bore carvings that had become nearly indistinct.

Despite its condition, thanks to his mastery of the Transformation Dao - Divine One, Li Fan could mentally reconstruct its original form.

The faint, fragmented patterns on the pillar seemed eerily familiar to him.

“This is…”

His eyes lit up with intrigue. Comparing the markings before him with his memories, he found them to match perfectly.

Looking around at the sprawling ruins of the Lost City, Li Fan was filled with astonishment.

"Are these buildings perhaps all from within the mist?"

In the mysterious domain where Li Fan obtained the [Chaos] character formula, he had once seen twelve large ruins.

The patterns on those ruins’ structures were identical to those on the stone pillar before him.

He recalled the origins of the Cangwu Abyss—how an entire province’s mountains and rivers had vanished, leaving only this abyss shaped like a giant footprint.

Peering into the abyss’s depths, he saw only darkness, endless and unfathomable.

“Does the Cangwu Abyss connect to the depths of the white mist?”

“In ancient times, the Xuanhuang Realm had no Devouring Origin White Mist. Now, the mist separates the world…”

“Where did it come from? Who were those tragic, fallen cultivators I encountered within the mist?”

Questions surged in Li Fan’s mind, unanswered.

Before he could ponder further, a meteor streaked across the night sky, momentarily illuminating the heavens.

“It’s here!”

Looking up, Li Fan saw the fiery streak descending straight toward his location.

An inexplicable sense of foreboding arose within him—part terror, part confrontation with an unstoppable calamity.

His body trembled slightly, reacting to the lingering aura of the Immortal Ruins emanating from the recently freed 'Medicine King True Cauldron'.

Moving a bit away from the landing point, Li Fan kept his eyes fixed on the fiery meteor.

The cauldron descended rapidly, reaching the ground within moments, plunging into the depths of the Cangwu Abyss.

As it entered the abyss, its speed slowed, and the flames around it dimmed.

Sensing the aura of the Immortal Ruins, the abyss's denizens instinctively scattered, clearing a path.

Finally, the Medicine King True Cauldron came to rest in its former position from the previous era.

After emitting a faint distress signal to the outside world, the cauldron gradually became transparent, vanishing into the air.

Li Fan waited patiently until the Immortal Ruins aura dissipated entirely before controlling the Little Medicine King Cauldron to enter.

With knowledge gained from Xiao Heng and the others’ exploration in his previous life, he navigated effortlessly to Linghu Chang’s slightly ajar door.

Inside, Linghu Chang lay on the floor, deep in slumber.

“Also at the Nascent Soul Early Stage, but…”

Li Fan narrowed his eyes slightly as the phantom of the Five Elements Cave-Heaven emerged behind him.

The power of the Cave-Heaven Domain descended like chains, restraining Linghu Chang.

After confiscating all items from Linghu Chang, Li Fan mobilized his strength.

Moments later, before Linghu Chang could scream in agony, his body was crushed into fine dust under the immense power of the Cave-Heaven.

However, the Nascent Soul within his dantian remained completely unharmed under Li Fan's precise control.

With his body destroyed, the sleeping Linghu Chang woke up instantly.

Seeing his tiny purple infant-like body, he immediately realized what had happened.

"Who exactly are you?"

Linghu Chang stared at Li Fan, half in hatred and half in fear.

Li Fan responded with a flash of purple lightning before Linghu Chang's eyes.

"The Purple Heaven Sect..."

Linghu Chang's words were filled with disbelief.

In the next moment, he lost consciousness and fainted.

After thoroughly absorbing Linghu Chang's memories, Li Fan waved his sleeve and temporarily sealed Linghu Chang’s Nascent Soul within his Cave-Heaven.

He continued deeper into the Medicine King True Cauldron, arriving at the entrance to the "Gate of Life and Death," where he began to contemplate.

"The Gate of Life and Death cannot be breached, not even by a Dao Integration expert."

"Only by cultivating the true teachings of the Medicine King Sect's Longevity and Lifespan Sutra and manifesting the ‘Longevity Green Energy’ can one reverse the gates of life and death in an instant and enter within."

"Longevity and Lifespan Sutra, a Dao Integration cultivation method."

For an ordinary cultivator, obtaining a Dao Integration technique would be enough to leave them sleepless with excitement.

However, Li Fan remained indifferent.

Although Longevity and Lifespan Sutra was indeed a Dao Integration method, its cultivation focused on altruism, healing the sick, and saving lives.

"Saving others is saving oneself; the more people one saves, the faster the cultivation progresses. Even breaking through bottlenecks requires meeting specific rescue quotas."

This technique had low compatibility with Li Fan and no necessity for him to switch to it.

Still, as a Dao Integration method, its value was undeniably high. By exterminating everyone in the Medicine King Sect, this technique would become Li Fan's exclusive possession. But there was no need for such measures; the Medicine King Sect members had other, more significant uses.

The current trouble was that too many people were cultivating The Longevity and Lifespan Sutra—a total of 462.

When Li Fan tried to cultivate this technique, his spiritual energy seemed completely blocked, with no reaction at all.

After pondering for a moment, Li Fan came up with an idea.

Using Linghu Chang's memories, he located the quarters of some Golden Core disciples of the Medicine King Sect.

Breaking in, he forcibly extracted portions of their "Longevity Green Energy."

By fusing these energies, Li Fan formed an energy body.

He separated a strand of his consciousness into the green energy body, stretching and adapting for a while.

"The Longevity Green Energy keeps dissipating and won’t last long. However, it should suffice."

With a thought, the energy body condensed into a green Nascent Soul form.

Li Fan plunged headlong into the Wall of Life and Death.

Passing through a gray membrane, he found himself in a space that seemed identical to the exterior of the Medicine King True Cauldron.

This illusion was due to the transparent interior walls of the Medicine King Cauldron.

Within the space were two skeletons: one standing and one lying on the ground.

"The standing one must be Liu Ruchen; the one on the ground should be Elder Huang."

"To escape the Immortal Ruins, Liu Ruchen had no choice but to sacrifice the life essence of some sect members."

Recalling his past life’s knowledge, Li Fan mused to himself.

"Just bones left—surely, they’re not still alive."

Li Fan cautiously approached Liu Ruchen's remains.

As he reached the skeleton, a phantom suddenly appeared beside him.

Startled, Li Fan quickly realized it was merely a projection without any life force.

The Longevity Green Energy leaking from his body was absorbed by the phantom.

As if completing some sort of verification, the phantom eventually spoke:

"Disciples of the Medicine King Sect, heed my words."

"If you are seeing this image, I have likely perished."

"I was wrong."

"I foresaw the arrival of the Great Calamity but did not expect something even more terrifying above our Xuanhuang Realm."

"The Ten Great Immortal Sects knew everything yet left us to die."

"This enmity is irreconcilable!"

"But remember, the Ten Sects are too powerful to confront directly. After returning to the Xuanhuang Realm, take refuge in the ‘Valley of Longevity’ and preserve your strength. Act cautiously after the calamity subsides."

"After my death, my son Liu Yihang will temporarily serve as sect master, supported by the elders. Once he breaks through to Soul Transformation, he may formally assume the position."

"In critical times of life and death, internal strife is unacceptable!"

…

The phantom recited Liu Ruchen's will mechanically. Li Fan stood quietly, listening.

Long after the message concluded, the phantom dissolved into starlight, leaving behind a glowing, diamond-shaped crystal.

Li Fan knew this was the control core of the Medicine King Cauldron.

Originally intended for Liu Yihang, it now belonged to the prescient Li Fan.

Using the control core with his energy body, Li Fan opened the Wall of Life and Death and entered the main control room.

After seven days of refining, he gained control over the Medicine King True Cauldron.

Although many advanced functions were temporarily unusable without Longevity Green Energy, most basic features were operational.

Li Fan reviewed the images recorded by the Medicine King True Cauldron.

They matched what Xiao Heng and others had seen in his previous life.

In the boundless void, the Xuanhuang Realm’s light sphere appeared insignificantly small, while the Immortal Ruins above threatened to devour everything.

The images continued.

The Medicine King Cauldron, unable to resist, fell toward the Immortal Ruins despite the light radiating from its surface.

Drawing closer to the Immortal Ruins, its collapse seemed inevitable.

At that moment, countless glowing particles emerged from the cauldron, seemingly granting it infinite power.

Amid resounding roars, the cauldron changed its trajectory.

Yet Li Fan’s focus remained on the recorded images of the Immortal Ruins.

Due to the proximity, he discerned a clearer view of the ruins’ outline.

The desolate land was strewn with remnants of destruction.

Amid the ruins stood a towering figure silently gazing downward.

Chapter 610: The Origin of the Xuantian Sect

It was as if he had glimpsed the presence of a higher-dimensional being, one that exuded an inherent oppressive aura.

The moment the figure appeared, Li Fan's heart began to pound violently.

The hairs on his body stood on end, and beads of cold sweat dripped from his forehead.

Even the recording of the scene by the Medicine King True Cauldron seemed to have been affected, becoming distorted and blurry.

Subconsciously taking a step back, Li Fan finally regained his composure, his face slightly pale.

"Even just the recorded image carries such overwhelming power."

"Could it be... a True Immortal?"

Before Liu Ruchen's fall, he had explained many things.

Among them was the terrifying existence that loomed over the Xuanhuang Realm, as if it could devour everything.

In ancient times, cultivators who broke through the Dao Integration realm and endured heavenly tribulations could ascend to the upper realm.

But one day, everything changed.

A cultivator who successfully transcended the tribulation and ascended to the Immortal Realm unexpectedly returned shortly afterward, looking grim.

It was then that people realized the path to the Immortal Realm had been severed.

The original Immortal Realm passage had become nothing but ruins.

At the time, most cultivators were only aware of the existence of the "Immortal Ruins."

What exactly the ruins were like, and their true state, remained unknown.

With the path to immortality broken, more and more Dao Integration cultivators lingered in the human realm.

However, the lifespan of a Dao Integration cultivator—at most a few millennia—was limited.

For those who reached this level, extraordinary talents all, the prospect of sitting idly by and awaiting death was unthinkable.

Thus, the Longevity Immortal Realm emerged.

There existed miraculous treasures in heaven and earth, capable of granting longevity.

Certain rare objects, imbued with the essence of heaven and earth, held special dominion.

When a cultivator's lifespan neared its end, defying fate meant seizing these dominions—this was the origin of the Longevity Attainment Position.

The earliest Longevity Immortal Realm cultivators achieved their state in precisely this manner.

However, the Longevity Attainment Positions were limited, while the number of Dao Integration cultivators was far too vast.

Conflict was inevitable.

In the midst of such chaos, a faction known as the Xuantian Sect rose rapidly to power.

The leader of the Xuantian Sect was none other than the cultivator who had ascended to the Immortal Realm and returned.

At the time, he was the only individual in the Xuanhuang Realm infused with immortal energy, standing just half a step away from becoming a True Immortal.

A True Immortal represented a qualitative transformation compared to ordinary cultivators.

As a result, his power far exceeded that of other Dao Integration and Longevity Immortal Realm cultivators.

Under his leadership, the Xuantian Sect swept across the Xuanhuang Realm with an almost crushing momentum.

Apart from his overwhelming strength, he was also a master strategist.

He used the Longevity Attainment Position as bait to recruit over a dozen of the most powerful Dao Integration cultivators in the cultivation world.

With these allies, the Xuantian Sect became unstoppable.

From that point onward, the Xuantian Sect dominated the world, with few daring to oppose them.

This half-step immortal called himself the Xuantian King.

The sect's twelve strongest warriors were known as the Mysterious Dharma Kings.

After nearly unifying the cultivation world, the Xuantian Sect sought to consolidate its rule, inspired by the idea of seizing the dominion of longevity.

They began to covet the dominions of other aspects of heaven and earth.

In ancient times, cultivators revered the heavens and earth.

Although they could move mountains, fill seas, and split rivers, they believed their mighty powers ultimately stemmed from heaven and earth.

But after the rise of the Xuantian Sect...

The rules were broken.

The Xuantian Sect replaced heaven, granting ordinary mortals powers rivaling those of cultivators through the decrees of their heavenly king.

Not all cultivators accepted this domination without resistance...

The 'Xuantian King' obtained a rare treasure from an unknown source, called the Xuantian Mirror, capable of observing all things in the world.

After several secret gatherings, before any significant threat could form, the Xuantian Sect wiped them out entirely.

Countless cultivators were implicated, and a sea of blood turned the heavens upside down.

The sects of the world, already weak, lost any remaining will to resist after this incident.

But no kingdom lasts forever.

In the later years of the Xuantian Sect’s rule, they became increasingly arrogant. The sect’s members began wantonly oppressing and humiliating other cultivators.

Eventually, when the people of the world could no longer endure, the Ten Great Immortal Sects rallied everyone, uniting the cultivators to overthrow the rule of the Xuantian Sect.

“Hmph, now that I look back, the Ten Great Immortal Sects and the Xuantian Sect are no different—just two sides of the same coin.”

“The Immortal Ruins forcibly absorb all material and energy from the outside world.”

“The so-called Ten Great Immortal Sects, the proclaimed leaders of the world's sects, have never informed us about such critical matters concerning the survival of the world.”

In his dying words, Liu Ruchen spoke these bitter words, filled with resentment.

Liu Ruchen speculated that some unimaginable upheaval must have occurred in the Immortal Realm in the past.

This was the only explanation for the complete severance of the path to immortality.

And that corpse atop the Immortal Ruins—it was likely an immortal who fled from the Immortal Realm.

Even a true immortal could not escape the terrifying pull of the Immortal Ruins. One could only imagine the catastrophic consequences if the Xuanhuang Realm were to fall into the Immortal Ruins.

There would likely be no living beings capable of surviving such a calamity.

The Ten Great Immortal Sects of the Immortal Dao, who led the overthrow of the Xuantian Sect and inherited their legacy, could not have been unaware of this matter.

Yet they kept it secret.

Even when the Medicine King Sect attempted to breach the boundaries of the Xuanhuang World, they issued no warnings, coldly watching as the entire sect marched to their deaths.

It was utterly detestable.

The scene continued playing, showing the Medicine King Cauldron violently trembling. Ultimately, it narrowly avoided disaster.

It circled the terrifying entrance of the Immortal Ruins and returned to the Xuanhuang World.

The vision faded, reverting to the scenery at the bottom of the Cangwu Abyss.

Yet, Li Fan remained dazed for a long time.

In truth, Liu Ruchen’s decision to use the Medicine King Cauldron to escape the Xuanhuang World was not an impractical plan.

After all, the lives of every cultivator in the sect were at stake, and Liu Ruchen was not a reckless man.

The elders of the Medicine King Sect ultimately agreed to his plan.

There were fundamental reasons behind this.

The Medicine King Sect’s ancestor, Sun Piaomiao, during the initial severance of the path to immortality, ventured into other cultivation realms nearby in search of a way to ascend.

But to his shock, he discovered that these worlds, like the Xuanhuang World, had also lost their connection to the Immortal Realm.

Further exploration into the void was beyond his capabilities.

Thus, he had no choice but to return.

The Dao Compass of the Medicine King Sect pointed toward a cultivation realm called [Xiao Yao], which Sun Piaomiao had visited in the past.

To Liu Ruchen, since the ancestor had traveled through the void without encountering danger, he believed that with enough caution, he could replicate this journey safely.

Who could have foreseen that disaster would strike before they even left the Xuanhuang World?

“At first, Sun Piaomiao could ignore the pull of the Immortal Ruins and freely travel to and from the Xuanhuang World.”

“But now, escaping has become almost impossible.”

“The Xuantian Sect and the Ten Great Immortal Sects have been continuously capturing nearby small worlds and dimensional realms in an attempt to resist the pull of the Immortal Ruins.”

“To this day, even the ‘weight’ of cultivators has become crucial to the survival of the Xuanhuang World.”

“So, the pull of the Immortal Ruins has been continuously strengthening over time?”

Li Fan was slightly startled. Piecing together the information, he reached this conclusion.

Chapter 611: The Dark Void Sea

“It’s very likely. And it makes sense,” Li Fan murmured after a long pause, nodding slowly.

This conclusion finally resolved a question that had puzzled Li Fan for a long time:

When the Immortal Ruins appeared, why didn’t they directly swallow the Xuanhuang Realm?

Instead, the cultivators within were given enough time to continuously capture nearby heavenly caves and small worlds to resist?

Given the terrifying suction power of the Immortal Ruins now, if it had been the initial Xuanhuang Realm alone, it would have been impossible to hold out.

Moreover, capturing small worlds is not something that happens overnight. The countless surrounding worlds must be the result of thousands of years of tireless efforts by sects like the Xuantian Sect and the Ten Great Immortal Sects.

All this evidence points to one conclusion: the suction power of the Immortal Ruins has been growing steadily stronger over time.

As for why the suction power keeps increasing...

It’s very likely because the Xuanhuang Realm is gradually getting closer to the Immortal Ruins.

A vivid picture formed in Li Fan’s mind:

On the endless Void Sea, countless cultivation worlds floated like ships on water.

One day, a black hole known as the “Immortal Ruins” appeared above the Void Sea.

Its powerful suction continuously devoured everything around it, forming a massive vortex.

Under the influence of the Immortal Ruins, the cultivation worlds in the Void Sea were uncontrollably pulled closer to it.

At first, due to the minimal changes, people in the cultivation worlds didn’t notice.

It wasn’t until the speed of descent toward the Immortal Ruins increased significantly that they realized something was wrong.

Out of survival instinct, akin to a drowning person clutching at anything to stay afloat, the cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm began tying “ropes” to distant, relatively fixed “reefs” in the Void Sea — heavenly caves and small worlds — in an attempt to delay their inevitable demise.

Of course, during this process, there were cultivators who sought to abandon the ship and search for new vessels to escape on their own.

But if everyone did this, the Xuanhuang Realm would sink even faster.

Thus, the leaders of the Xuanhuang Realm — whether it was the Xuantian Sect, the Ten Great Immortal Sects, or the current Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance and the Five Elders Association — unanimously decided to keep the true state of the Xuanhuang Realm’s plight a secret.

Initially, they believed that by relying on these ropes, they could gradually pull the Xuanhuang Realm out of the vortex.

But they were wrong.

“The weight of cultivators may be tied to these ropes. Initially, the ropes connected directly between worlds, but after cultivators conquered realms, they became part of the connection themselves.

“If a cultivator suddenly dies, it’s like several strands in a rope disappearing.

“Though the heavens can mend the rope over time, there’s still a delay.

“If the death rate of cultivators stays normal, it’s manageable. But if it surpasses a certain threshold...”

Li Fan recalled from his previous life how Ji Hongdao, when directly confronting Senior Sister Zhao in the Tianling Prefecture, used the 'Tianxuan Spirit-Locking Formation to instantly kill a state's worth of cultivators, using mutual destruction as intimidation.

At the moment when many cultivators lost their lives, even the entire Xuanhuang Realm trembled slightly.

“These attached heavenly caves and small worlds are crucial for the Xuanhuang Realm’s survival. The so-called ‘ropes’ are not so easily severed.

“If it were possible, some cultivators would’ve fled to these small worlds through the Immortal Severance Passage and severed the connections to the Xuanhuang Realm.”

“It’s not that they didn’t want to; they just couldn’t.”

“The Empire’s use of the Ten Thousand Rift-Whales to carve paths in the Void Sea isn’t cutting the ropes but extending them.

“When the ropes stretch far enough — the distance between the Xuanhuang Realm and these worlds grows sufficiently large — and when the Xuanhuang Realm finally falls into the Immortal Ruins and disintegrates, perhaps the other end of the ropes will break free, allowing them to escape.”

“Unfortunately, this process takes too long. The Xuanhuang Realm might not last that long.”

Li Fan suddenly thought: If the Xuanhuang Realm can capture heavenly caves and small worlds, why not connect to worlds of similar scale? A complete world would be much more effective than heavenly caves.

“Maybe they tried and failed.”

“Or maybe... they couldn’t locate those worlds in the first place.”

An idea struck Li Fan.

Other worlds floating on the Void Sea, realizing the Xuanhuang Realm’s plight, would likely avoid being dragged down by hiding themselves.

Heavenly caves and small worlds can’t hide, but highly developed cultivation worlds likely can.

Those that couldn’t hide have likely already been pulled into the Immortal Ruins along with the Xuanhuang Realm.

Adding to this, the Immortal Ruins’ presence has caused the Void Sea itself to shift, making previous landmarks unreliable.

This could explain why the Xuanhuang Realm suddenly lost contact with other cultivation worlds.

“What was once a luminous Void Sea turned dark in an instant. Each world now faces not only the threat of the Immortal Ruins but also the need to hide themselves to avoid detection by others.”

“A truly despairing scenario.”

Though Li Fan considered this grim reality, he felt no fear.

With the presence of the [Truth], finding a way out among countless possibilities was no challenge.

Moreover, if even the remains of True Immortals can remain intact within the Immortal Ruins, it suggests that falling into the Immortal Ruins doesn’t necessarily mean death. Survival might simply depend on sufficient strength.

...

After a long silence, Li Fan raised his head, his gaze piercing through the transparent wall of the Medicine King Cauldron and into the heavens.

“If my guess is correct, it’s easy to verify.

“All I need to do is leave the Xuanhuang Realm and face the Immortal Ruins directly.”

“Thousands of years ago, Liu Ruchen used the Medicine King Cauldron to fly in the Void Sea for a while before being drawn to the Immortal Ruins.

“Now, so much time has passed. Once I leave the Xuanhuang Realm and lose its protection, I might be pulled toward the Immortal Ruins immediately.”

“Perhaps one day, as we draw closer, we’ll even see the Immortal Ruins and the remains of the True Immortals standing silently there.”

Li Fan summoned the control core of the Medicine King True Cauldron into his hand.

“In this era, before I return with the [Truth], I should make the most of this opportunity to explore the truth.”

After a long time, Li Fan put the crystalline core away.

“Now that I have full control over the Medicine King True Cauldron, the lives of the Medicine King Sect’s slumbering members are in my hands.

“Currently, there are six Dao Integration cultivators, twenty-three Soul Transformation cultivators, and countless Nascent Soul and lower-level cultivators.”

“My greatest gain this time isn’t just these cultivators but also the knowledge of a hidden secret realm: the Valley of Longevity.”

“I wonder if it still exists after thousands of years.”

Chapter 612: Changes Across Ancient and Modern Lands

The 'Valley of Longevity' was a secret realm accidentally discovered by the Medicine King Sect in ancient times.

Named after its abundant production of the ingredients required to refine the [Longevity Pill], the name speaks for itself: the Longevity Pill is a type of elixir capable of extending the lifespan of cultivators.

This pill was a closely guarded secret of the Medicine King Sect and the key to its immense wealth and power. Depending on the quality of the pill, the lifespan it could extend varied. The highest-quality Longevity Pill even surpassed the [Heavenly Transformation Feather Pill], capable of granting an additional thousand years of life.

To refine the Longevity Pill, one needed not only extremely high-quality medicinal materials but also the Medicine King Cauldron as the core, supplemented by 81 smaller Medicine King Cauldrons, forming the [Great World-Saving Longevity Formation]. During the process, the elixir had to be constantly infused with ‘Longevity Green Energy’.

This process took 49 days to complete one batch of refined pills. Though complex, the results were well worth the effort.

Compared to other longevity-extending treasures, the Longevity Pill had a significant advantage: it could be consumed repeatedly.

Although each subsequent pill's effect diminished significantly until it eventually became ineffective, it was still far superior to other treasures that lost their effectiveness entirely after a single use.

The Sea of Void was vast and boundless, requiring immense courage to traverse. The Longevity Pill and the [Great Dream Spring and Autumn Formation], which allowed an entire sect to enter a state of suspended animation, were the two great lifelines of the Medicine King Sect.

“This Longevity Pill is truly a treasure. Unfortunately, before the Medicine King Sect departed, most of the pills were sold off in exchange for reserved resources,” Li Fan lamented.

“The remaining ones are now in the hands of those elders,” he noted after examining the inventory of resources stored in the Medicine King Cauldron, feeling a hint of regret.

However, he consoled himself with the realization that most of the Medicine King Sect’s cultivators were now under his control. There would be plenty of opportunities to have them refine more pills for him.

Feeling somewhat at ease, Li Fan remarked, “Let’s check on the current state of the Valley of Longevity. If it remains undiscovered, that would be ideal. After thousands of years, it’s hard to imagine what kind of herbs might have grown there.”

“But if it has already been found and developed by the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance...”

“Well, that’s fine too.”

After reviewing the materials needed to refine the Longevity Pill, Li Fan realized they were still available for purchase in the Tianxuan Mirror, though they were rather expensive. However, refining the pills and selling them again would undoubtedly yield a profit.

Moreover, he currently wasn’t short on contribution points.

“Jiarong Territory in Southern Fuzhou…”

“What kind of place is this?”

When Li Fan tried to locate the Valley of Longevity based on the coordinates from Linghu Chang’s memories, he encountered difficulties.

That location no longer existed within the territory of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance.

“Could it be within the region of the Five Elders Association?” Li Fan felt a twinge of unease.

“Or maybe not. After so many years, and with the severance of traditions, it might have simply been renamed,” he thought.

With narrowed eyes, Li Fan began comparing the surrounding terrain of the Valley of Longevity to the current geography within the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance’s borders, hoping to pinpoint its exact location.

After a painstaking search, he was ultimately forced to give up.

“Although I know that the geography of the Xuanhuang World changes over time, I didn’t expect it to reach such an absurd extent,” Li Fan muttered, taking a deep breath.

According to Linghu Chang’s memories, the Valley of Longevity was near a Wormtail Mountain Range, but now, there were several Wormtail Mountains within the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance’s territory.

Compared to thousands of years ago, the Wormtail Mountain Range seemed as though it had been cut into dozens of segments, then scattered chaotically across various locations.

This was only true for the parts that still retained their original names. As for those that had lost their names, they were even harder to locate.

Finding the exact location of the Longevity Valley solely by personal effort would be akin to searching for a needle in a haystack.

If one tried to search location by location, it would indeed be possible to eventually find it, but...

It wasn’t necessary.

Li Fan’s time was extremely valuable.

After pondering for a long while, he decided to leave it to the professionals.

Storing Medicine King True Cauldron in his personal cave heaven domain, Li Fan silently returned to the Congyun Sea.

He then used the Tianxuan Mirror to conduct research and eventually contacted a cultivator named Ximen Yu, who specialized in studying ancient and modern geographical changes.

Ximen Yu’s work, An Examination of Ancient and Modern Mountains and Rivers, was widely circulated.

By using ancient sect ruins as reference points and recalculating directional changes, the book offered results that had been verified by many cultivators with minimal error.

Of course, the Xuanhuang Realm was vast, and the examples in the book merely demonstrated Ximen Yu’s capability in such calculations.

If someone wanted to determine the exact location of places mentioned in ancient texts, they just needed to pay a contribution fee, and the problem would be resolved immediately!

Ximen Yu’s intent was clear: he aimed to earn contribution points with his unique skill.

Li Fan admired such practicality and efficiency.

To obscure his true purpose, Li Fan provided a list of over 50 ancient locations from memory and requested Ximen Yu to calculate their current positions.

Ximen Yu, thrilled to receive such a large order for the first time, repeatedly offered to give Li Fan a discount.

But Li Fan waved it off generously, only asking him to speed up the process.

Having received the deposit, Ximen Yu readily agreed, hung up the communication, and hurried off to begin his calculations.

For Li Fan, the extra contribution points were insignificant—a mere drop in the ocean. Avoiding potential trouble was well worth the cost.

Recalculating over 50 locations was a massive undertaking, and it would take some time to obtain the results.

Meanwhile, Li Fan quietly arrived at Shenhua Island.

It had been seven years since the people from the Outer Realm were brought here.

Ye Feipeng, Xiao Heng, Sun Erlang, and others had all grown into young men full of vigor.

However, due to the rule Li Fan had set—that they must defeat the Tianyang Puppet to leave the island—they had been trapped on Shenhua Island all this time, unable to take a single step off it.

Being passionate and energetic youths, they were nearly going mad from the confinement.

Yet, they dared not provoke the Tianyang Puppet and instead spent their days sparring with one another to burn off energy.

Li Fan smiled as he scanned the group, ensuring they didn’t notice his presence. Then, he made his way to a secret chamber on the island.

This chamber, protected by a formation Li Fan had set up, could only be entered by the Tianyang.

Inside, jars of fresh, crimson blood were stored, faintly emitting the sound of angry roars.

These were the result of the Tianyang, acting under Li Fan’s orders, periodically extracting blood from Ye Feipeng.

After such a long time, a significant amount had accumulated.

Even though Ye Feipeng had the Kunpeng bloodline, being drained so frequently made it impossible for him to gain weight.

Thus, unlike his previous life where he was a chubby figure, this time Ye Feipeng was rather slender.

Referring to him as a refined gentleman would be perfectly accurate.

Chapter 613: Bloodline Enlightenment Transmission

Li Fan suspended a jar of blood in midair and crushed it with a flick of his fingers.

The fierce aura of Kunpeng essence blood gushed out, writhing as if alive, inching outward with an unsettling vitality.

With a wave of his hand, Li Fan encapsulated the blood within the boundaries of his cave heaven domain and began to analyze and comprehend its properties carefully.

The purpose of this study was clear: to replicate the three divine abilities that Ye Feipeng had demonstrated in his previous life—Kun Devour, Peng Flight, and Bloodline Transmission.

Among these, Kun Devour had become almost irrelevant to Li Fan since he acquired the Five Elements Cave Heaven. Peng Flight, however, offered a form of escape technique worth adapting.

The most critical ability, and the one Li Fan urgently sought to master, was undoubtedly Bloodline Transmission.

This ancient beast-originated technique allowed the wielder to imbue their own essence blood into others, subtly influencing and eventually altering their thoughts.

Over time, this transformation would turn the recipient into a loyal subordinate who would unwaveringly serve the master of the essence blood.

In his previous life, Ye Feipeng, who initially loathed his demonic beast bloodline, had eventually grown proud of his Kunpeng heritage. His disdainful term “demonic beast” had gradually morphed into the reverent “sacred beast.”

Such a technique was ideal for controlling the disciples of the Medicine King Sect and others.

For now, Li Fan had managed to temporarily subdue individuals like He Zhenghao and Gao Yuan through coercion and persuasion. But managing a large number of people this way posed significant risks.

The disciples of the Medicine King Sect, who were familiar with each other, would be even harder to control without direct measures. Li Fan needed them primarily for refining pills and occasionally as combatants. Watching them constantly wasn’t feasible.

Without a method to enforce his control, he couldn’t fully trust them.

Thus, mastering ‘Bloodline Transmission’ became a necessity.

Under his meticulous observation, every particle of Kunpeng essence blood seemed to possess its own consciousness, emitting sharp, unsettling cries that made Li Fan frown.

Extracting a single droplet, he absorbed it into his body through his fingertip, closely monitoring how it transformed his physical being.

As soon as the Kunpeng essence blood made contact with his flesh, the sharp sounds abruptly ceased.

The blood became eerily silent as tiny tendrils extended deep into his tissues, anchoring themselves like parasites.

Scarlet flashes of light pulsed along the tendrils, siphoning energy from his flesh into the essence blood.

Moments later, the essence blood began to bubble as though boiling, undergoing a self-evolution.

In no time, it mimicked Li Fan’s own flesh so precisely that even he, the host, could barely discern the difference without close scrutiny.

Despite completing its transformation, the Kunpeng blood didn’t release its grip. Instead, it transmitted streams of dark red energy back into the attached flesh, initiating an enigmatic transformation.

To Li Fan’s astonishment, the altered tissues sprouted their own tendrils, attacking adjacent unaltered flesh like predators.

“So, this is homomorphic evolution…”

Li Fan murmured thoughtfully. Harnessing the power of his cavernous domain, he obliterated the corrupted tissues and the original Kunpeng essence blood in a burst of ash.

The abrupt loss of a portion of his body caused his face to flush, but he recovered almost instantly.

“The indestructibility of the cave heaven makes a cultivator nearly immortal. This new method truly excels in such aspects. If this were an ancient Nascent Soul cultivator, recovering from such damage would be far more challenging,” Li Fan remarked with mild admiration.

After recovering, he absorbed another batch of Kunpeng essence blood and consumed a comprehension pill to delve deeper into the Bloodline Transmission process.

Time after time, he purged the corrupted flesh, then resumed his analysis, repeating the cycle.

Finally, when the room was nearly empty of essence blood, with only one jar remaining, Li Fan halted his efforts.

A glimmer of insight flashed in his eyes as he pondered.

“It seems that the process by which Kunpeng essence blood transforms the body mirrors the methods of the new cultivation system. Both extract and analyze a portion of the target, then mimic and replace it with an overwhelming proliferation of the substitute.”

“Ultimately, they achieve dominance by substituting the original entirely.”

With a single thought, Li Fan took out a slumbering Foundation Establishment stage cultivator of the Medicine King Sect from the Medicine King True Cauldron.

He extracted a drop of his own essence blood, wrapped it in spiritual energy, and slowly infused it into the cultivator's body.

The cultivator instantly awoke in shock, but they were firmly restrained by the "Binding Insect" divine ability, unable to move.

The cultivator stared at Li Fan in panic, struggling violently yet futilely.

Li Fan, however, remained unfazed, focusing intently on manipulating his drop of essence blood.

At first, the infiltration process went smoothly.

The essence blood expanded its influence, quickly occupying most of the space within the cultivator's body.

However, something must have been exposed.

The cultivator’s body began rejecting the parts controlled by Li Fan's blood, causing violent convulsions and uncontrollable spasms. They coughed up mouthfuls of fresh blood before succumbing to death in a short time.

“Apologies,” Li Fan said flatly.

With that, he raised his head and looked to the sky.

The clouds were light, the wind calm—there were no unusual phenomena.

“It seems the heavens have no objections to you old-school cultivators,” Li Fan muttered.

He then selected another Medicine King Sect cultivator and resumed his experiments.

...

Seven days later.

After yet another failure, Li Fan paused for a moment.

“I’ve been too hasty,” he reflected.

“Expanding too quickly triggers the body’s natural backlash.”

...

“If I treat the target cultivator as a complete world, then my drop of essence blood is equivalent to a cultivator practicing the new path of cultivation.”

“I may not possess the Kunpeng divine abilities, but surely I can progress step by step.”

Suddenly, Li Fan seemed to have an epiphany.

This experiment was notably longer than the previous ones.

Li Fan also exhausted a great deal of mental energy.

However, the results were gratifying.

The "lucky subject" remained entirely unaware of the changes happening within their body, sleeping soundly and peacefully.

Yet Li Fan could sense a subtle, wondrous connection between himself and the subject.

It wasn’t as controllable as a clone, which could act as an extension of one’s limbs.

Instead, he could clearly perceive the state of the subject’s body and even vaguely sense fleeting thoughts crossing their mind.

Li Fan glanced at the system panel.

Sure enough, a new divine ability called "Bloodline Transmission" had appeared on the list.

Strangely, Li Fan did not seem particularly excited.

During the process of comprehending Bloodline Transmission, he had faintly sensed certain truths.

He recalled a fleeting inspiration he had experienced before—a revelation that had been forcibly erased from his memory.

If the "lucky subject" before him were to represent the Xuanhuang Realm,

And the cultivators of the new path of cultivation were the "mutated essence blood" subtly transforming the Xuanhuang Realm,

Then...

What role does the fabled Immortal Ancestor play in all of this?

Chapter 614: Truth Induces Dao Integration

Thousands of years ago, the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor appeared out of nowhere, teaching the masses a new method to seize the heavens and plunder the earth.

From that moment onward, people no longer needed to be troubled by so-called talent. Everyone could cultivate!

The trajectory of the Xuanhuang Realm's history was thus altered.

At the beginning, the world of immortal cultivation indeed experienced a brief golden age due to the popularity of the new method.

Nascent Souls were as common as dogs, and Soul Transformation cultivators roamed everywhere.

However, just like Li Fan’s earlier experiment with the Kunpeng’s essence blood, such reckless proliferation and devouring inevitably invited retaliation from heaven and earth.

The emergence of the restriction against practicing multiple technique simultaneously was like a thunderbolt to the cultivators of that era.

Later, the unexpected descent of the immortal-mortal miasma dealt a fatal blow to the cultivators.

Subsequently, the Xuanhuang Immortal Cultivation World entered a prolonged dark age.

During this time, the Immortal Ancestor once again emerged.

In the desolate lands of immortal cultivation, he gathered the surviving cultivators and reestablished the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

The origin of the Immortal Ancestor has always been a mystery.

Neither the Ten Great Immortal Sects in ancient times nor modern cultivators have ever managed to uncover his background.

Yet, the Immortal Ancestor, who was both scholarly and peerless, remained elusive like a dragon’s head glimpsed but its tail hidden.

Even if the world wanted to probe his identity, it was as futile as "raising one's hand to touch the heavens," a goal out of reach.

Was he born with innate knowledge? Did he create this groundbreaking method without a teacher?

What was his purpose? If he truly acted for all beings, why was he absent during the great catastrophe that ravaged lives? Why did he only appear thousands of years later? Where had he been during that time?

Where is he now?

There are far too many secrets about the Immortal Ancestor that the world cannot unravel.

At this moment, as Li Fan meditated on comprehending the divine power of [Bloodline Transmission], the suppressed inspiration resurfaced.

Thus, he began to deduce the potential methods of the Immortal Ancestor.

Every cultivator practicing the new method seemed like a “mutated essence blood” assimilated by the Immortal Ancestor.

Originally part of the world, they had turned into aberrations devouring the world itself.

“Does the Immortal Ancestor aim to dominate the Xuanhuang Realm through this method?”

“Like how I manipulate cultivators using [Bloodline Transmission]?”

“Judging by the current results, one could say he has already succeeded. The myriad affairs of Xuanhuang lie entirely within his grasp!”

Li Fan couldn’t help but sigh in admiration.

Without a doubt, the original Immortal Ancestor wasn’t so powerful.

He might have even been just an ordinary Dao Integration cultivator.

Yet, through this method, he carved out a unique path, akin to a snake swallowing an elephant.

In less than a millennium, he had already transcended the Xuanhuang Realm.

However, Li Fan believed that “dominating the Xuanhuang Realm” wasn’t the ultimate goal of the Immortal Ancestor. Instead, it might have been a necessary step toward achieving another objective.

Just as Li Fan didn’t simply control the cultivators of the Medicine King Sect for the sake of control itself.

Rather, he aimed to use them to refine the [Longevity Pill].

Then, what might the ultimate goal of the Immortal Ancestor be?

Li Fan suddenly recalled the silhouette he had glimpsed in the Immortal Ruins, and his heart shuddered.

Could it be that the immortals weren’t dead and sought to use the world’s power to resurrect themselves?

“It’s not impossible. The so-called innate knowledge, even if it exists, should have limits. To be as monstrous as the Immortal Ancestor…”

“He must either be a transmigrator like me or a reincarnated individual like Senior Brother Zhang.”

"Or they come from the outside! Whether it's immortals descending to the world, or others smuggling in from other immortal cultivation realms..."

…

Li Fan’s thoughts churned in his mind, refusing to settle.

It wasn’t until the Medicine King Sect cultivator, whose essence blood he had eroded, slowly awakened that his attention shifted.

“Who are you…” Xia Ye muttered in confusion, glancing around at his unfamiliar surroundings. His mind was a chaotic mess.

He vaguely remembered that shortly after leaving the Xuanhuang Realm, the Medicine King Cauldron underwent violent tremors. Following that, the sect master activated the [Great Dream of Spring and Autumn Formation], forcing him into dormancy.

From the look of this place, it didn’t seem to be inside the Medicine King Cauldron.

Where was he?

Moreover…

Looking at the figure not far away, Xia Ye felt an inexplicable sense of closeness.

“You’re awake.” He heard a voice that was extraordinarily pleasant.

The tension in Xia Ye’s heart instantly dissipated, and he instinctively relaxed.

The figure then began explaining the cause and course of events.

Upon encountering a fiery meteor falling from the sky, [he] felt a resonance between the meteor and a small cauldron he had accidentally obtained before. Thus, he came to investigate.

Entering the cauldron, he found that all the cabin doors in the rooms were tightly sealed—except for the one where Xia Ye resided, which was inexplicably open.

He discovered Xia Ye severely injured and decided to bring him out for treatment.

...

"Truly, thank you, senior," Xia Ye expressed his gratitude, ignoring many of the illogical aspects of Li Fan's words.

In the subsequent conversation with Li Fan, Xia Ye was repeatedly shocked:

"What? This is the Xuanhuang Realm?"

"How did I return here?"

"It's already been several thousand years?"

Without doubting Li Fan's words at all, Xia Ye was left soul-shaken, struggling to accept this reality for the time being.

"I was inconsiderate. I should have waited until you recovered more before telling you the truth."

"For now, rest. I’ll watch over things here. You can be at ease," Li Fan said gently, seeing Xia Ye's distraught expression.
