Xia Ye nodded, somewhat overwhelmed by the unexpected care. Lying on the stone bed in the secret chamber, he soon fell into a deep sleep again.

...

Li Fan observed thoughtfully, "To completely disregard me, a stranger, this must be the power of [Bloodline Transmission]."

"The effect is unexpectedly good—immediate, even. However, this might also be because this kid is only at the Foundation Establishment stage."

"The stronger the target's power, the longer it might take to fully transform their mindset."

After pondering for a moment, Li Fan finally retrieved a green fruit from the Cave Heaven Domain.

This blue fruit appeared to exist somewhere between reality and illusion, disappearing from Li Fan's palm at regular intervals before reappearing.

"The Fruit of True Temptation," Li Fan murmured as he looked at this treasure from the Five Elders Association. He stepped forward again, returning to the Medicine King Cauldron.

Using Linghu Chang's memories, he located Elder Liu San of the Medicine King Sect, who had reached the Dao Integration stage.

Carefully controlling the formation, Li Fan avoided waking Liu San.

“I am Liu Yihang of the Medicine King Sect, the adopted son of Sect Master Liu Ruchen. By the late master's decree, I now oversee the Medicine King Sect...”

Li Fan pressed the green Fruit of True Temptation to his brow and began chanting.

A faint, imperceptible light flowed from his Sea of Consciousness into the fruit.

Moments later, the fruit shed its illusory nature, becoming an ordinary-looking fruit. However, it now emitted a peculiar fragrance that made even Li Fan swallow involuntarily.

Resisting the temptation, Li Fan carefully crushed the Fruit of True Temptation into green liquid and fed it to Liu San.

As he deactivated the Great Dream Spring and Autumn Formation, Li Fan also activated the internal defense formation of the Medicine King's Cauldron. Standing outside the door, he waited patiently.

Soon after, Liu San stirred.

Unlike Xia Ye's initial dazed confusion, Liu San immediately sensed something was amiss upon waking.

His eyes flashed with a sharp glint as he sprang to his feet, his divine sense scanning the surroundings.

When he saw Li Fan standing at the door, Liu San's face revealed a trace of astonishment.

"Young Master?"

"You're awake too?"

Liu San instinctively asked.

Seeing this, Li Fan relaxed and calmly deactivated the formation. In a deep voice, he said, "Something major has happened."

Chapter 615: Lies Told to Liu San

Liu San frowned slightly upon hearing this and said, "Young master, why are you so flustered? As cultivators, even if mountains and seas collapse before us, we should remain unfazed..."

"We failed in our plan to escape the Xuanhuang Realm," Li Fan interrupted.

"What?" Liu San's expression changed abruptly.

"Foster father... he sacrificed himself to save us," Li Fan continued.

"What?"

It was as if Liu San had been struck by a thunderbolt. He stood frozen in place.

"The master... this is impossible!"

Liu San's body trembled slightly, his eyes filled with disbelief.

Li Fan pressed further, shattering Liu San’s composure: "While we were asleep, thousands of years passed in the outside world."

"What?"

"How could this happen?"

Liu San looked at Li Fan blankly, overwhelmed by grief, shock, and confusion.

In an instant, Liu San felt his mind thrown into chaos. Never in all his years of cultivation had he experienced as much shock as he did in this single day.

Yet Liu San failed to notice that, despite the outrageous and absurd nature of Li Fan’s words, he didn’t doubt them at all.

Even a mortal youth wouldn’t trust someone so easily, let alone a cultivator at the Dao Integration stage.

But such irrational belief occurred with Liu San.

"The principles of longevity Immortality are truly terrifying," Li Fan couldn’t help but marvel inwardly.

To better control Liu San, a Dao Integration cultivator, Li Fan had imbued the Fruit of True Temptation with not only information about himself as Liu Yihang of the Medicine King Sect but also a setting of “Liu San’s absolute trust in Liu Yihang.”

This was to ensure that nothing could go wrong.

After all, even ancient Dao Integration techniques were far beyond what Li Fan, a mere Nascent Soul cultivator, could contend with.

If Li Fan wanted to take control of the Medicine King Sect, he had to ensure that Liu San was firmly under his command.

Of the six Dao Integration cultivators currently in slumber within the Medicine King Cauldron, Li Fan chose Liu San because of his loyalty.

Addressing “Liu Yihang” as “young master” revealed Liu San’s identity.

Liu San was an orphan whom Liu Ruchen had accidentally rescued years ago.

Growing up under Liu Ruchen’s care, Liu San’s cultivation and techniques were all personally taught by him.

The relationship between Liu Ruchen and Liu San was both master-servant and teacher-student.

Liu San was a man of gratitude and loyalty. Even after achieving success in cultivation and reaching the Dao Integration stage, he always referred to himself as an "old servant" despite Liu Ruchen’s repeated encouragement to change his mindset. His unwavering devotion to Liu Ruchen only grew stronger over time.

When Liu Ruchen traveled, he entrusted the day-to-day affairs of the Medicine King Sect to Liu San.

Given Liu San’s loyalty, even though his strength was only average among the six Dao Integration cultivators, Li Fan chose him as the first target to control.

These thoughts flashed through Li Fan’s mind as he faced Liu San’s bewildered questions. With a sorrowful expression, he said, "Sigh, follow me, Elder Liu. You’ll understand once you see for yourself..."

Li Fan led Liu San to the central chamber of the Medicine King Cauldron, where he played recordings of the cauldron’s escape from the Xuanhuang Realm and Liu Ruchen’s self-sacrifice to save the sect.

"Sect Master!"

Despite his age, Liu San broke into tears, sobbing and wailing uncontrollably.

Li Fan stood silently by his side.

When Liu San gradually calmed his grief, Li Fan played Liu Ruchen’s final words.

Listening to Liu Ruchen’s last voice recordings, Liu San’s eyes welled with tears again.

This time, however, he did not cry out loud. Instead, he listened intently to every word, as if engraving them in his heart forever.

The will's image disappeared. After a long time, Liu San reluctantly regained his composure.

"The Ten Great Immortal Sects..." he gritted his teeth and said.

Seeing this, Li Fan sighed lightly and said, "The Ten Great Immortal Sects are indeed hateful, but even if we want to seek revenge now, we are probably powerless to do so."

Liu San was stunned. "Young Master, what do you mean by this? Wait, did you just say that thousands of years have passed in the outside world?"

Li Fan nodded. "That's right. After I woke up, I went out to investigate and discovered that, although we had only wandered briefly outside the Immortal Ruins, several thousand years had already passed within the Xuanhuang Realm."

"The Ten Great Immortal Sects of the past have long turned to dust, vanishing in the river of history. Now, the ones dominating the cultivation world are two colossal powers: the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association."

Li Fan then began explaining the "information" he had gathered about the current situation to Liu San.

As expected of a Dao Integration cultivator, after the initial shock, Liu San quickly accepted reality.

"Young Master, you were too reckless. To venture out alone and gather intelligence in such uncertain circumstances... Now that you bear the heavy responsibility of reviving the Medicine King Sect, what if something had happened to you..."

Li Fan waved his hand dismissively. "Desperate times call for desperate measures. At that time, I thought that the return of the Medicine King's Cauldron would inevitably attract the covetous eyes of certain individuals. My first priority was, of course, to understand our situation."

"Moreover, it’s not that I didn’t want to awaken everyone else. It’s just that..."

Li Fan’s expression suddenly grew grave. "Elder Liu, try circulating the Longevity and Lifespan Sutra and see for yourself."

Hearing this, Liu San was puzzled but complied.

Moments later, his face turned pale, and he closed his eyes, struggling to suppress the killing intent surging within him.

"What is this?"

His voice trembled slightly, betraying his inner turmoil.

“The great calamity of heaven and earth—inability to practice multiple techniques together.”

“Foster father’s premonition was correct, and the catastrophe is even more terrifying than imagined.”

Li Fan let out a long sigh. "Even the Ten Great Immortal Sects were wiped out during the great calamity, leaving only our Medicine King Sect barely surviving."

"This is also why I haven’t awakened the other members of the sect. If they were all to awaken at once, it would surely lead to a tragedy of mutual slaughter."

"In fact, it took me a long time and a change in cultivation techniques before I dared to awaken you, Elder Liu."

Liu San suppressed the lingering fear in his heart and nodded. "It seems that the Young Master has thought this through carefully."

"The place we are currently in is called the Congyun Sea. I was fortunate enough to make the acquaintance of a cultivator overseeing governance here, Zhou Qingang."

"With his help, I infiltrated the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance. For now, I have barely managed to establish a foothold."

Li Fan slowly explained the current situation to Liu San.

"If it were just the two of us, living a decent life in this world shouldn’t be too difficult."

"But as for reviving the Medicine King Sect..."

Li Fan sighed softly and shook his head. "It’s exceedingly difficult!"

"The first issue we need to resolve is the inability to practice multiple techniques together. Otherwise, even if we awaken the sect members, it would only lead to more bloodshed."

"The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance does have countless techniques, but they require significant contributions to exchange for them."

"Although I have been working hard for some time, I have only just managed to exchange for the techniques I need for my own cultivation."

"So..."

Hearing this, Liu San fell into deep thought.

"The Longevity Pill?"

He asked.

Chapter 616: A Spark Joins the Immortal Alliance

"Exactly," Li Fan nodded approvingly as Liu San eagerly answered his question.

"The current world of cultivation, after enduring several catastrophes of heaven and earth, has seen cultivators' lifespans drastically reduced compared to our time," Li Fan explained.

"Furthermore, life-extending treasures have become exceedingly rare. Even a pill that extends life by a mere century can drive cultivators into a frenzy."

"If we can resume mass production of the 'Longevity Pills' and exchange them for cultivation techniques suitable for all sect members, there is hope for our future."

Li Fan spoke confidently, his tone steady and assured.

"It's nothing more than revisiting an old craft," Liu San chimed in. "As long as we have enough manpower, it’s not a difficult task."

As he spoke, he retrieved a jade bottle from his storage ring.

"Here, I have nine high-grade Longevity Pills that the sect master previously rewarded me with. Each of them can extend life by approximately 600 years."

"You, young master, should take these and exchange them for spirit... ahem, what’s it called now? Contribution points?"

"Exactly," Li Fan replied nonchalantly. "Although the name has changed, the essence remains the same." Without hesitation, he accepted the bottle of precious pills, now worth a fortune, with a gracious nod.

Liu San, however, voiced his concern. "Young master, as you mentioned, these Longevity Pills are extremely valuable. Selling them occasionally might be fine, but if we do so frequently, won’t it attract unwanted attention?"

Li Fan agreed with a nod. "You’re absolutely right, Elder Liu. That’s precisely why it’s not suitable for us to handle the transactions directly."

"I’ve mentioned this before—I've established a connection with Fellow Daoist Zhou Qingang. He has a powerful background and can manage everything on our behalf. We only need to share a portion of the profits with him."

Although Liu San frowned slightly, he refrained from commenting further.

Li Fan continued, "This is only a temporary solution. In the future, we will undoubtedly rebuild the Medicine King Sect."

"But it must be done gradually and with caution."

Hearing this, Liu San nodded in agreement.

"Elder Liu, stay inside the Medicine King Cauldron for now. I’ll head back and exchange the pills for cultivation techniques. Once we’ve awakened some disciples, we can discuss further plans."

After informing Liu San, Li Fan exited the Medicine King Cauldron.

However, the explanation he gave Liu San was merely to appease him. The Longevity Pills were not going to be casually traded.

With his current contribution points, Li Fan had more than enough to acquire the cultivation techniques necessary to revive disciples capable of refining Longevity Pills.

Still, the identity of "Li Fan, a cultivator of the Heavenly Mechanism Sect" would be discarded after the fiery battle of Crimson Flame burning the Sea.

Yet, the disciples of the Medicine King Sect still held value.

The question was how to ensure their identities were "cleansed" without linking them to Li Fan or each other.

After some thought, Li Fan decided to use a "divide and conquer" strategy.

Through his alternate persona, Zhou Qingang, he sought out Gao Yuan.

"Fellow Daoist Zhou, what brings you here?" Gao Yuan was surprised.

Ever since Zhou Qing’ang had become the spokesperson for the secret envoy, he had essentially become the de facto ruler of the Congyun Sea region.

Both Gao Yuan and He Zhenghao had to consult Zhou Qingang on major decisions.

Moreover, Zhou Qingang’s work ethic—handling everything meticulously and personally—had reached an almost intimidating level, earning him the lord secret envoy’s deep trust.

It was rare to see Zhou Qingang leave his administrative hall, let alone visit someone personally. Gao Yuan was naturally caught off guard by this sudden visit.

With a slight smile, Zhou Qing’ang said, "No need to be nervous, Fellow Daoist Gao. It’s just a small matter that I need your help with."

Gao Yuan looked puzzled. Thinking You’re in a higher position than me—what could you possibly need my help with?

Zhou Qing’ang spoke to himself, saying, “I have a friend who accidentally discovered a hidden secret realm. Inside this secret realm, a group of cultivators was frozen in slumber. After awakening them and asking a few questions, it was revealed that they had originally hidden there to escape the pursuit of the Ten Great Immortal Sects. However, due to an accident, they ended up trapped in slumber…”

At first, Gao Yuan listened attentively, but as Zhou Qingang continued his tale, Gao Yuan’s expression grew increasingly strange.

Finally, when he heard Zhou Qingang express his intention to "arrange" for this group of cultivators to join the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, his face turned grave with alarm.

Nevertheless, being a man of tact and prudence, he did not question Zhou Qingang outright. Instead, he forced a reluctant expression and said, “Isn’t this a bit too convenient?”

“I wonder, what is the identity of this friend of yours, Fellow Daoist Zhou? Can he be trusted?”

“These people… could they be spies sent by them?” He gestured toward the direction of the Five Elders Association as he tentatively inquired.

Zhou Qingang chuckled and replied firmly, “Fellow Daoist Gao, you’re overthinking. I, Zhou Qingang, swear on my life that these people absolutely cannot be spies from the Five Elders Association!”

“You can rest assured!”

“It’s just that my friend doesn’t want the news about this secret realm to leak. If these cultivators were to join the alliance through normal channels, it would be impossible to keep the matter hidden. So, they entrusted me…” Zhou Qingang showed a knowing expression.

“Of course, there will be benefits. I know that Fellow Daoist Gao, in order to exchange for cultivation techniques, has practically exhausted his resources and can hardly afford to activate the [Spirit Awakening] state lately. Such a golden opportunity presented to you—you can’t miss it.”

Hearing this, Gao Yuan was slightly tempted. Zhou Qingang explanation, while not entirely convincing, was plausible enough.

However, Gao Yuan still had some reservations.

“What about the Envoy, my lord…”

Zhou Qing’ang waved dismissively. “Such a trivial matter does not need to trouble the Secret Envoy. Recently, the Secret Envoy has just recovered his Nascent Soul cultivation and is preparing to make another breakthrough to a higher realm.”

Gao Yuan was startled.

This was significant news. The higher the Secret Envoy’s cultivation, the more secure their standing would be. However, neither he nor He Zhenghao was aware of this development. Clearly, the Secret Envoy trusted Zhou Qingang more than anyone else.

If the Secret Envoy knew that Zhou Qingang was engaging in these backdoor dealings behind his back…

A thought flashed through Gao Yuan’s mind.

Once it appeared, it became impossible to suppress.

“Since Fellow Daoist Zhou has said so, I can’t refuse,” Gao Yuan said after a brief pause, his eyes flashing with cunning. “Let me know before you bring those cultivators here. I’ll personally handle their admission procedures into the alliance.”

“Great! Great!” Zhou Qing’ang left, satisfied.

Gao Yuan, however, paced back and forth as if caught in a dilemma.

In the end, he gritted his teeth and made up his mind.

He used the Fragmented Spirit Jade Slip left by the Secret Envoy to contact Li Fan.

“Lord Secret Envoy, I have something to report,” Gao Yuan said, his tone full of flattery.

“Speak,” Li Fan’s voice was cold, making Gao Yuan’s heart sink as a sense of foreboding crept over him.

Nevertheless, the arrow was already notched on the bowstring, and he had no choice but to proceed. Summoning his courage, he reported Zhou Qingang’s actions.

In response, there was only silence.

This silence made Gao Yuan increasingly uneasy.

“I understand,” Li Fan finally spoke after a long pause.

“However, Gao Yuan…”

“Little Zhou is right. Don’t bother me with such trivial matters in the future.”

Gao Yuan’s heart sank.

“And I hope you understand: unity is the most important thing.”

With that, Li Fan fell silent again, leaving the flustered Gao Yuan standing there, at a loss for what to do.

Chapter 617: Taking Charge of the Medicine King Sect

The attitude of the secret envoy was very clear.

This matter was something he had known for a long time and didn't particularly care about. However, the secret envoy was greatly displeased with the act of slandering colleagues.

"Gao Yuan, oh Gao Yuan, you must have lost your mind! The secret envoy possesses methods as vast as the heavens. How could Zhou Qingang's petty schemes possibly escape his divine sight?"

"Such misplaced cleverness…"

"It seems you've grown too comfortable, dulling your sharp instincts," Gao Yuan thought bitterly.

But the mistake was already made, and there was no use in lamenting it now.

"Fortunately, judging by his reminder to focus on unity, it seems the secret envoy still has some regard for past ties."

After being sternly reprimanded by Li Fan, Gao Yuan was compelled to pay close attention to Zhou Qingang's entrusted matters.

In theory, when a cultivator joins the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, the Alliance Headquarters must approve their membership. Only after their information is submitted will the 'Tianxuan Mirror' grant access to the new member.

In practice, however, the process was not so rigid. Since the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance governed over a hundred regions, requiring headquarters' approval for every matter would severely hinder efficiency. Thus, individual regions were granted a degree of autonomy. They could temporarily grant new recruits access to the Tianxuan Mirror with the condition that their information would be reported periodically to headquarters.

After headquarters verified the identity of new recruits, they would issue official access permissions to the Tianxuan Mirror. This process was seamless and unnoticed by the recruits.

For ordinary cultivators at the Golden Core stage or below, joining the Alliance only required a routine inquiry. Only those with profound cultivation, unclear backgrounds, or those seeking official positions within the Alliance were subjected to the trial of the White Jade Heart-Questioning Platform.

...

The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had already made the necessary preparations, so Li Fan began to act.

"Old Liu, a thousand years have passed, and the world has undergone great changes. I had hoped to find the Valley of Longevity, as the sect master instructed, but the landscape has shifted so drastically that all my inquiries have yielded nothing."

"I'm afraid I must trouble you to go there in person."

Li Fan spoke gravely.

"In this era, Dao Integration cultivators are scarce. If you're cautious, you shouldn't encounter much trouble."

"If luck is truly against us and you run into unforeseen events, prioritize retreating and saving your life. The future revival of the Medicine King Sect cannot happen without you, Old Liu."

Grasping Liu San's hands tightly, Li Fan reluctantly gave his instructions.

"Rest assured, young master. Back in the day, I followed the sect master through countless hardships. While I may not excel in combat, when it comes to survival—hmph!"

"I dare say I'm no worse than these modern cultivators," Liu San declared confidently.

He accepted the map Li Fan handed him and studied it carefully.

After a moment, his brows furrowed deeply. "A thousand years have indeed turned the world upside down. But I will complete this task."

Li Fan hastily added, "Whether successful or not, return within thirty days. Your presence here in Congyun Sea is also indispensable."

Liu San nodded respectfully without further words. Leaving behind a communication talisman, he transformed into a streak of green light and sped towards the heart of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

...

After sending off Liu San, Li Fan entered the Medicine King's Cauldron.

Over several sessions, he completed the ‘Bloodline Transmission’ ritual for more than 40 Foundation Establishment cultivators. Feeling slightly dizzy, Li Fan paused for a moment.

Transforming into the guise of Liu Yihang, he began awakening the disciples of the Medicine King Sect one by one.

Initially, everything was fine. Without actively channeling their techniques, the disciples—still groggy—did not notice the restrictions of the heaven and earth’s law of "techniques cannot be cultivated simultaneously"

However, as more disciples woke up, an eerie tension began to spread among them.

Instinctively, they distanced themselves from their peers, a dangerous gleam flickering in their eyes.

Li Fan observed this unfolding unease but did not stop. He continued awakening more Foundation Establishment cultivators.

The atmosphere within the Medicine King's Cauldron grew increasingly oppressive, with killing intent permeating the space.

Finally, when the number of awakened disciples surpassed thirty, something was triggered. They instantly became aware of the abnormality in their techniques.

Their eyes turned blood-red, glaring at their fellow disciples as if looking at mortal enemies.

Just as they were about to clash in a battle to the death, Li Fan suddenly unleashed his Cave-Heaven Law Domain, suppressing them all.

He added another spell, Binding Insect Technique, rendering them completely immobile.

"Disciples of the Medicine King Sect, heed my command!"

Li Fan's voice boomed like thunder, temporarily snapping them back to their senses.

"Immediately cultivate this Tai Shang Primordial Scripture and dissolve the techniques of the Longevity and Lifespan Sutra you have practiced!"

Due to the connection from the bloodline transfer, these Foundation Establishment cultivators, though reluctant, ultimately complied under Li Fan’s relentless urging.

Before long, they gradually regained their clarity.

"Senior Brother Liu, what exactly just happened?" The group of disciples was all shocked and horrified.

Li Fan succinctly recounted to them what he had earlier explained to Liu San.

For a moment, the inside of the Medicine King Cauldron was filled with gasps of disbelief, sobs, and panicked murmurs.

Li Fan merely observed them coldly.

After they began to calm down, he spoke in a deep voice:

"At present, the Medicine King Sect stands at the brink of life and death. Since I have inherited the will of my foster father and assumed the leadership of this sect, I bear responsibility for all of you."

"The present circumstances are unlike those of the past. The external world is rife with dangers, and our sect's efforts to reestablish itself will be fraught with difficulties. Any misstep could result in utter annihilation!"

"In such perilous times, there is no room for the slightest error. My orders must be followed without question!"

"Anyone who disobeys will face execution without mercy!" Li Fan declared sternly, exuding a chilling aura.

Having been subjected to Li Fan’s bloodline transfusion and now further intimidated, none of them dared harbor dissent.

They hurriedly responded in unison, "We will strictly obey Senior Brother's orders!"

"Hmm?" Li Fan narrowed his eyes, his displeasure evident.

A quick-witted disciple of the Medicine King Sect promptly corrected himself, shouting, "We will strictly obey the Sect Master's orders!"

The others quickly followed suit, expressing their loyalty.

Li Fan nodded slightly.

After subduing these 30 disciples of the Medicine King Sect, Li Fan paused his efforts to awaken the others.

"Everyone, return to your rooms and change into these clothes. Do not carry anything with you," he instructed, distributing a pile of black robes among them.

The disciples complied.

Before long, 30 Foundation Establishment cultivators dressed in black assembled before Li Fan.

He led them out of the Medicine King Cauldron, awaiting the arrival of his clone, Zhou Qingang.

Half a day later, Zhou Qingang arrived silently.

"No matter what you encounter, remain calm and silent. Leave everything to this senior, Zhou. Simply follow his instructions," Li Fan said.

The disciples of the Medicine King Sect all nodded in agreement.

Under Zhou Qing'ang's guidance, the first batch of disciples was taken to Congyun City, a towering and majestic place that rivaled the grandeur of their former sect.

As a result, the disciples were not overly surprised.

Meanwhile, the city's inhabitants, seeing Zhou Qingang leading a group of unfamiliar cultivators, were curious but assumed it was official business and paid no further attention.

With Zhou Qingang, a key official, leading the way, they passed through without obstruction and arrived smoothly at the Administrative Hall.

Gao Yuan was already there, waiting.

"Daoist Gao, I'll leave them in your care," Zhou Qing'ang said with a polite bow.

"No problem at all," Gao Yuan replied, reciprocating the gesture and carefully observing the group of cultivators behind Zhou Qingang.

As agreed, they were all Foundation Establishment cultivators, yet they gave Gao Yuan an unusual impression.

"These are..."

Gao Yuan's eyes narrowed. After a moment, as if realizing something, his pupils suddenly contracted.

"Ancient-path cultivators?!" he asked, probing Zhou Qingang.

Zhou Qingang smiled faintly. "What do you think? Did I not tell you the truth? These individuals were indeed discovered by a friend of mine in a secret realm."

"Like the envoy, they are genuine ancient-path cultivators!"

"No wonder the secret envoy turned a blind eye to this matter," Gao Yuan remarked with sudden understanding.

Feeling reassured, Gao Yuan dismissed his doubts.

Indeed, ancient-path cultivators differed vastly from modern cultivators in terms of cultivation methods, aura, and even their foundational techniques like Dao Foundations and Golden Cores. Anyone with sharp spiritual senses could immediately notice the distinction. Using ancient cultivators as spies...

The Five Elders Association surely wouldn't be so foolish.

Moreover, ancient-path cultivators had long vanished from the world. Even if the Five Elders Association wanted to recruit some, it would be nearly impossible.

With this in mind, Gao Yuan's concerns were completely allayed.

Since they weren't spies and merely sought to conceal their identities as ancient-path cultivators, the situation was manageable.

Gao Yuan took out a talisman, registering each cultivator's identity one by one.

"Meng Wushi, converted rogue cultivator, Foundation Establishment realm..."

"Ji Yu, converted rogue cultivator..."

Though Congyun Sea lay at the fringe of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, it was still a major region, with thousands of new cultivators joining the alliance annually.

Adding a few more was entirely inconspicuous.

Before long, the 30 disciples of the ancient Medicine King Sect had seamlessly integrated into the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

---

Author's Note:

While writing this chapter, I noticed a bug in the plot: Li Fan impersonating an ancient cultivator should have been easily exposed since ancient and modern cultivation methods differ significantly. I had to explain this with Li Fan’s use of the 'Sky Shrouding Hand' skill to mask his identity.

Chapter 618: Communication to Resolve the Ice Seal

“Thank you for your trouble, Daoist Gao!” Zhou Qingang said with a smile, transferring 30,000 contribution points in the process.

This was naturally the reward for Gao Yuan. Resolving the matter with just 1,000 contribution points per cultivator wasn’t much, but it certainly wasn’t insignificant either—especially since it was just a matter of lifting a finger.

Both parties understood that this was only the beginning, with much larger matters to come.

Gao Yuan accepted the contribution points without hesitation and made a commitment: “If there are more ancient cultivators who wish to join the alliance in the future, feel free to come to me. I’ll make sure all the procedures are handled flawlessly without the slightest error.”

“To avoid drawing attention, though, it’s better to handle this in batches with intervals in between,” Gao Yuan added tactfully.

Zhou Qingang cupped his hands and said, “Daoist Gao, your foresight is commendable. We’ll be troubling you often in the days to come.”

Gao Yuan’s heart skipped slightly, and he lowered his voice. “Daoist Zhou, give me a hint—how many ancient cultivators are there in this secret realm?”

Zhou Qingang simply smiled and raised four fingers in response before leading the disciples of the Medicine King Sect away.

“Four hundred? This secret realm is quite vast. No wonder Zhou Qingang friend wanted to monopolize it…” Gao Yuan thought to himself, slightly startled.

With years of experience managing the affairs of Congyun Sea, Gao Yuan had gained considerable insight.

Even so, he couldn’t have guessed that the “four” gesture Zhou Qing’ang made didn’t represent four hundred—it represented four thousand.

...

Instead of taking the 30 Medicine King Sect disciples who had obtained Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance identities into the Tianxuan Mirror’s inner space, Zhou Qingang led them to a residence in the central district of Congyun Immortal City.

In a chamber within the residence, more than fifty miniature Tianxuan Mirrors were neatly arranged.

“Each of you, familiarize yourselves with the basic functions of the Tianxuan Mirror,” Zhou Qingang instructed after demonstrating the usage once.

Though the Tianxuan Mirror was extraordinary, the disciples of the Medicine King Sect were well-versed in dealing with mystical artifacts. After a brief moment of amazement, they quickly got the hang of it.

“Each of you starts with 1,000 contribution points as a beginner’s benefit. Don’t worry; keep an eye on the missions about to be published in the Tianxuan Mirror,” Zhou Qingang said with a wave of his sleeve.

A light screen materialized in the chamber, displaying tasks with odd requirements but generous rewards.

Examples included:

- Seeking biographical details of an ancient sect cultivator from thousands of years ago.

- Requesting clarification on a particular cultivation method.

- Offering high rewards for ways to woo a specific female cultivator.

“These are the standard answers. Once the tasks are posted, just copy the answers directly.”

“Each of you should complete no more than two tasks. Don’t compete, and avoid redundancy,” Zhou Qingang instructed, summoning another light screen that showed the corresponding answers.

The disciples of the Medicine King Sect, quick on the uptake, immediately realized the purpose of the exercise. Excitement gleamed in their eyes as they divided the tasks among themselves.

They waited anxiously in front of their Tianxuan Mirrors for the tasks to appear.

Soon, mechanical voices emanated from the mirrors, signaling the arrival of tasks. Each disciple successfully earned their first reward.

Satisfied, Zhou Qingang nodded, then waved his hand, causing a mountain of miscellaneous items to appear in the chamber.

“While waiting for more tasks, exchange these items for contribution points through the Tianxuan Mirror. Keep your earnings under 3,000 each,” he instructed.

The disciples complied without hesitation.

Once this task was complete, Zhou Qingang directed them to open a section of the Tianxuan Mirror called [Law Proliferates Across the World].

The section was bustling, with constant updates.

“Place your bets! Where will the ‘Friendly Exchange Meeting’ between the Five Elders Association and the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance be held?”

“Haha! I guessed it right— Old Fisherman appeared in Taihua Prefecture! Who could’ve expected him to travel so far?”

“Ultimate wager: How long will the peace between the Five Elders Association and our alliance last? High rollers, step up!”

The disciples were momentarily stunned but quickly got the hang of the betting system, following preset results to minimize losses while ensuring a net gain.

When each disciple had accumulated a reasonable amount of contribution points, Zhou Qingang stopped them.

“Now, select cultivation techniques suitable for your Golden Core stage. Tomorrow, we’ll continue.”

Faced with a dazzling array of techniques, the disciples were entranced.

Meanwhile, Zhou Qingang calculated silently:

“In total, we’ve spent 400,000 contribution points. Each disciple has earned about 10,000, effectively laundering 300,000 points. Not too bad.”

Not bad. This secret chamber and the missions and wagers within the Tianxuan Mirror are all channels for quickly clearing contribution debts.

As the saying goes, professional matters should be handled by professionals.

It’s merely a matter of spending more contribution points, something Li Fan could easily afford.

This group of people did not disappoint Li Fan; they were exceptionally professional. The methods of clearing debts were diverse and highly discreet.

Take the Tianxuan Mirror in this secret chamber, for example. Although it appeared to be centralized here, its true components were scattered across various locations of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

This secret chamber merely provided an interface to extend its functionality. There was no need to worry about raising suspicion due to intensive contribution activities in a single location.

The debt-clearing process was highly efficient.

After three days, the first batch of disciples from the Medicine King Sect had already accumulated the required contribution points.

Elated, they exchanged their points for cultivation techniques.

Zhou Qingang then escorted them back to Shenhua Island.

Meanwhile, the next batch of Medicine King Sect disciples was already prepared to depart.

As Zhou Qingang was an official of the Immortal Alliance, he was too conspicuous and risked exposure.

Thus, the leader this time was the first lucky person to awaken—Xia Ye.

Although Xia Ye appeared slightly nervous, he managed to stay composed. Furthermore, he had already informed Gao Yuan in advance, so there were no issues.

Soon, everything proceeded as planned. The second and third batches of ancient Medicine King Sect cultivators transitioned smoothly and became members of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

One month later.

When Liu San, worn out and defeated, hurried back, what greeted him was the sight of the Medicine King Cauldron brimming with newfound vitality as the disciples flourished.

Liu San was utterly astonished.

At this moment, Li Fan asked, "Elder Liu, how did things go?"

Liu San's face flushed red. Just as he was about to reply, he glanced at the disciples discussing something amongst themselves. In the end, he pulled Li Fan aside and spoke via sound transmission, "I’m ashamed to report, Young Master. Although I had studied the map, only by visiting the actual sites did I realize how much the landscape had changed."

Liu San sighed deeply. "I couldn’t even find a trace of the places I remembered. It was as though I had stepped into an entirely different world."

"Moreover, the Dao Integration cultivators here are far more perceptive than in our time. Even though I did my utmost to conceal my presence, I was still discovered."

Hearing this, Li Fan narrowed his eyes slightly.

"Fortunately, he thought I was a member of the Five Elders Association and merely issued a warning, saying something about a 'Friendly Exchange Meeting' approaching and advising me not to wander around carelessly. Otherwise, it might lead to unnecessary misunderstandings. Hmph..."

Liu San snorted coldly, his expression tinged with discontent.

However, after a brief pause, he looked somewhat helpless. "Sigh. I could sense that the other party was at the mid-stage of Dao Integration. If it came to a fight, I fear I wouldn’t be his match."

Li Fan offered words of comfort: "The new cultivation methods harness the power of heaven and earth and contain inner cave-heaven and laws, giving their practitioners a natural advantage in combat compared to us ancient cultivators. Elder Liu, there’s no need to dwell on it. If you were to adopt the new methods, I’m sure your combat strength would rival theirs."

This statement somewhat alleviated Liu San’s frustration.

Li Fan continued, "The cultivators required to refine the Longevity Pill are now assembled, and we’re counting on you to oversee the process, Elder Liu."

"The contribution points used to exchange for the disciples' cultivation techniques were all credited by Fellow Daoist Zhou and me. We urgently need to sell a batch of Longevity Pills to repay the debt."

Li Fan explained.

Liu San nodded in agreement but soon furrowed his brows. "Currently, I’m the only one in the sect practicing the World-Saving Longevity and Lifespan Technique. The longevity essence I can produce is limited, and I fear the quality of the pills won’t be very high."

After a moment of thought, Liu San frowned and said, "At best, I estimate the pills will be of mid-to-low quality, capable of extending life by only 200 to 300 years."

"That’s more than sufficient. Elder Liu, please begin," Li Fan said firmly.

Chapter 619: Elder Crafts the Longevity Pill

“The exact location of the Longevity Valley remains unclear for now, but I’ve already purchased a batch of raw materials for refining Longevity Pills from the Tianxuan Mirror,” Li Fan said as he waved his hand, causing a storage ring to appear mid-air.

“Elder Liu, take a look at the quality. Can it meet the requirements for pill refinement?” Li Fan asked.

Liu San examined the ring’s contents, his expression astonished. “The quality is excellent, with most of the spiritual herbs being over a hundred years old. Did you select them personally, Young Master?”

Li Fan shook his head. “They’re merely common spiritual plants sold in the Tianxuan Mirror.”

Hearing this, Liu San couldn’t help but marvel, “After the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association unified the cultivation world and consolidated the world’s resources, they indeed became incredibly wealthy.

“In our time, even the ten great immortal sects wouldn’t have been able to provide such a large quantity of high-quality spiritual herbs.”

Li Fan smiled and nodded in agreement. “Perhaps it’s also because most cultivators have perished. The current scale of the cultivation world is nothing compared to what it used to be. Back then, our Medicine King Sect, with a few thousand disciples, would have been considered a medium-sized sect at most. In one state alone, there would have been countless sects like ours.”

“But now…” Li Fan paused, “If we were to suddenly reappear, it might cause a great stir in the world, drawing the attention of Longevity Immortal Realm experts.”

Liu San was startled, frowning slightly. “While flying across several states earlier, I noticed the same issue. Compared to the past, the cultivation world has become far more desolate. The land is vast, but the population is sparse. Outside of established cities, it’s rare to encounter cultivators in the wilderness. Back then, any mountain with a spiritual vein would be occupied by cultivators.”

“As the saying goes, the taller the tree, the more it attracts the wind. The Longevity Immortal Realm experts of today, who defy the laws of heaven and earth, are likely far stronger than the elders of the Ten Great Immortal Sect. If our Medicine King Sect, having traversed time from the ancient era to the present, were to reveal ourselves, we would inevitably attract their covetous attention.”

“Young Master, your decision is correct. Breaking into smaller groups and infiltrating the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is the best way for us to recover our strength without drawing attention,” Liu San said, his eyes filled with admiration as he looked at Li Fan.

“Within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, all cultivation resources are tied to contribution points. We already owe Fellow Daoist Zhou some favors. Although he hasn’t mentioned it, if we fail to produce results soon, it could lead to trouble. Binding ourselves to a shared interest with him is the most secure strategy.”

Li Fan explained, “Trust in people’s hearts is fleeting; only shared interests are eternal. To stabilize our position, we must produce Longevity Pills quickly. Elder Liu, I’ll need to trouble you!”

Liu San’s expression turned solemn. “Restoring the glory of the Medicine King Sect is my unshakable duty. Please rest assured, Young Master!”

Leading a group of disciples into the central alchemy chamber of the Medicine King Cauldron, Liu San said in a deep voice, “Young Master, please grant me permission to control the True Medicine King Cauldron.”

With a thought, Li Fan temporarily transferred the authority over the chamber. A shadowy image of the Medicine King Cauldron materialized in the center of the room.

Liu San lightly tapped the void, and the shadow transformed into a solid cauldron with a resounding “clang” as it landed on the ground.

“Form ranks!” Liu San swept his gaze over the disciples and commanded in a firm voice.

Ninety-nine carefully selected elite Foundation Establishment disciples each controlled their own small Medicine King Cauldrons. They arranged themselves in a specific formation around the central True Medicine King Cauldron.

Green light radiated from the True Medicine King Cauldron, linking with the smaller cauldrons to form a vast formation etched into the ground.

“The Great Longevity Formation…” Observing from the side, Li Fan muttered thoughtfully.

Liu San activated the Longevity Sutra with all his might, and a stream of pure azure Longevity Energy flowed from the central cauldron. The energy circulated through the formation, becoming even more vibrant before returning to the main cauldron.

Once the cauldron was half-filled with this green energy, Liu San began adding the medicinal ingredients required for pill refinement.

“Poof…”

The spiritual herbs were placed into the cauldron, and the Longevity Green Energy seemed to boil, surging violently without pause.

In an instant, the spiritual herbs melted and disappeared within the cauldron. The vapor they produced condensed into a transparent barrier at the top of the cauldron, preventing the Longevity Green Force from spilling out.

Liu San's expression was grave as he carefully controlled the timing of adding the medicinal ingredients based on the state within the cauldron.

The ninety-nine disciples around him, while assisting with the operation of the auxiliary Small Medicine King Cauldron, seized this rare opportunity to observe Liu San's alchemy process without blinking.

Time passed, second by second.

As more and more medicinal ingredients were added, the Longevity Green Energy became increasingly viscous, almost turning into a tangible substance.

At the most critical moment, Liu San shouted, “Condense!”

With that, he pointed toward the center of the cauldron from mid-air.

In an instant, the cauldron blurred and then shrank sharply toward the center.

During this moment of compression, the Longevity Green Energy, already thick to the extreme, underwent a qualitative transformation, changing from a liquid to a solid state.

The phantom of the Medicine King True Cauldron disappeared, leaving only a cyan pill suspended and rotating mid-air, exuding a rich vitality.

A strong medicinal fragrance spread from the pill.

All the cultivators present, including Liu San, subconsciously showed a trace of greed in their eyes upon smelling the aroma.

However, Liu San, being a Dao Integration cultivator, quickly snapped out of the abnormal state.

His expression shifted slightly, and he suddenly shouted, “Not good!”

He lunged forward, forming a giant hand that enveloped the freshly refined Longevity Pill.

“Hm?”

Just as the others were puzzled, a loud explosion erupted from Liu San's palm.

Liu San’s body trembled slightly. Although he quickly composed himself and withdrew his hand, a trace of awkwardness was evident on his face.

“Did… the alchemy fail?”

Li Fan and the disciples of the Medicine King Sect looked at Liu San with strange expressions.

“Ahem…”

Liu San cleared his throat softly and explained, “I forgot about the drastic changes in the world and still used the old method of alchemy, so…”

“But it’s not a big issue. It only requires some minor adjustments.”

“Next time, next time it will definitely work,” Liu San declared confidently.

Li Fan nodded without saying much.

Thus, Liu San once again summoned a phantom of the Medicine King Cauldron and restarted the refinement of the Longevity Pill.

This time, while there was no explosion, the resulting product...

Li Fan glanced at the half-green, half-purple pill in his hand, his face twitching slightly.

Liu San’s expression faltered as he roared in anger, “Again!”

The elder's fury made the disciples tremble with fear, leaving them no choice but to continue assisting.

Finally, on the third attempt, they successfully refined a proper Longevity Pill.

At this point, Liu San let out a slight sigh of relief.

Chapter 620: The Ancient and Modern Differences of Xuanhuang

It must be noted that in Linghu Chang's memory, this Liu San was a highly skilled master of pill alchemy.

Even for such an expert, it took him three attempts to adapt to the changes in pill refinement brought about by the differences between ancient and modern times?

Li Fan observed everything quietly, deep in thought.

"I'll first take this Longevity Pill to Daoist Zhou to see how much it can sell for. Old Liu, please continue working hard and refine all the raw materials in the storage ring into pills as quickly as possible," Li Fan instructed Liu San.

"Rest assured, young master!" Liu San nodded in agreement. After allowing his disciples to rest briefly, he resumed the pill refinement process.

Li Fan then left the Xuanhuang Cauldron, tossing the freshly refined Longevity Pill in his hand as he walked.

"It's inconvenient to act under the identity of 'Heavenly Mechanism Sect Cultivator Li Fan'…" After some contemplation, Li Fan transformed into his original appearance and headed toward Congyun City.

When purchasing the Heavenly Spirit Flower earlier, Li Fan had used his original appearance to join the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance through Huang Ranqi, the guardian of Chongwu Island, creating a brand-new alias for himself.

Now, he activated the Sky-Shrouding Hand secret technique, entered the Tianxuan Mirror, and took out the Longevity Pill.

First, he used the mirror's free appraisal function.

"Longevity Pill: Low-grade, can extend life by 186 years."

Li Fan's eyelid twitched slightly.

It seemed that even though Liu San had adapted to the differences between ancient and modern techniques, the quality of this first refined pill left much to be desired. At the very least, it fell short of his promised medium-grade pill that could extend life by 300 years.

After checking the recent market prices for life-extending treasures, Li Fan listed the Longevity Pill for 50,000 contribution points—a 30% markup.

The result? It was sold almost instantly.

Li Fan was momentarily stunned but quickly understood why.

Life-extending treasures lose their effectiveness after consumption. Before this, the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance had never seen a Longevity Pill on the market. For cultivators in need, this pill represented a genuine extension of their lifespan by nearly two centuries, making it far more valuable than common life-extending treasures.

Moreover…

As Li Fan expected, the buyer soon sent a message.

"Fellow Daoist, do you have more Longevity Pills?"

"I feel that this pill is somewhat different from other life-extending treasures. It seems to retain its effectiveness even with repeated consumption?"

Feigning surprise, Li Fan replied, "Is that so? How incredible! Then I must have underpriced it!"

The buyer, undeterred by Li Fan's act, pressed on: "Haha, Fellow Daoist, let’s not joke. That pill was clearly newly refined. How could you not know its properties?"

Still playing innocent, Li Fan responded, "Haha, you misunderstand! I happened to stumble upon it at a roadside stall. I thought the pill looked extraordinary but didn’t realize it was such a treasure."

"Tell you what, if you really need more, I’ll go back and check if the stall owner is still there."

"..." The other side fell silent.

After a moment, they responded with restrained patience: "Alright. If there’s more stock in the future, please contact me."

"Tianquan Prefecture, Zhao Tianlong!"

Li Fan ended the conversation without replying further.

"The value of the Longevity Pill exceeds my initial estimates. Even relying solely on purchasing raw materials through the Tianxuan Mirror, I can make a substantial profit."

"However, to maximize profit, I must control the supply rate."

"Additionally, I could engage in bartering for specific resources."

After some thought, Li Fan also considered expanding his sales channels—not just within the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance but also to the Five Elders Association and other factions.

After all, good things like "Fruit of True Temptation" are absolutely never too much to have.

If he could control one or two more Dao Integration cultivators, the upcoming situation would greatly improve.

"Let’s wait until there are more completed products before we act."

Li Fan pretended to leave Congyun City but only changed his identity, reverting to his guise as a "Heavenly Mechanism Sect cultivator."

Upon returning to the Tianxuan Mirror, he contacted Ximen Yu.

"Fellow Daoist Ximen, how is the task progressing?"

After a long while, a message finally came through.

"Uh, more than half of it has been analyzed, but there are still a few locations where I’ve encountered some difficulties."

"Oh? What do you mean?" Li Fan asked with interest.

Ximen Yu first sent over the locations he had already completed comparing between ancient and modern maps, then explained:

"Qingniu Ridge, Longevity Valley, Overturning River…"

"No matter how I compare, I cannot find any traces of these places in the current real world."

"Actually, this has happened in my previous research as well, though the chances were very slim."

"I must say, Fellow Daoist, your luck isn’t great. Out of the dozens of places randomly chosen, so many of them have completely vanished," Ximen Yu teased.

"I don’t think I’ll be able to complete this task. I’ll refund the extra contribution points," he sighed.

Upon hearing this, Li Fan's gaze flickered slightly.

"Completely vanished? Fellow Daoist Ximen, do you know the reason?" Li Fan asked.

"There could be many reasons. First, a great upheaval in heaven and earth—rivers shift, seas turn into mulberry fields, and such places naturally disappear.

"Second, it could be the existence of the White Mist Barrier. The locations of these places in ancient times might coincide with where the White Mist Barrier is now, making them inaccessible."

"The third possibility…"

Ximen Yu stopped speaking here, falling silent.

"What’s wrong? Does Fellow Daoist have something difficult to explain?" Li Fan asked, puzzled.

"Not exactly, but my conjecture is rather bold and without evidence, so I didn’t want to speak and make a fool of myself," Ximen Yu hesitated.

Now Li Fan was even more intrigued. "No problem. Your vast knowledge is rare in this world. Sharing it would broaden my horizons."

Perhaps it had been a long time since someone acknowledged Ximen Yu so earnestly. Hearing Li Fan’s words, he became excited.

He immediately explained, "You may not believe it, but based on my years of comparing ancient and modern terrains, I’ve discovered that a significant portion of the ancient regions of the Xuanhuang Realm is missing."

"It’s as if someone forcibly took away part of the land."

"However…"

Ximen Yu’s tone became puzzled again.

"Some places, on the other hand, seem to have appeared out of nowhere, as if conjured from the void. These regions didn’t seem to exist in the ancient cultivation world."

"So, overall, compared to ancient times, the Xuanhuang Realm hasn’t shrunk. Instead, it has expanded."

"Truly bizarre, an enigma that defies explanation."

…

Hearing this, Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

"Are Fellow Daoist’s conclusions reliable?"

"Absolutely reliable! The Fallen Immortal Realm contains a panoramic view of the ancient Xuanhuang Realm. However, ordinary cultivators can only glimpse a small portion during each entry. By visiting many cultivators and piecing together fragments, I’ve essentially restored the ancient cultivation world’s landscape. This conclusion is irrefutable!" Ximen Yu declared firmly.

Chapter 621: The Challenge of Writing a Book

Hearing Ximen Yu’s confident assertion, Li Fan couldn’t help but fall into deep thought.

“Time flows, increasing and decreasing in an orderly manner. Is this the natural evolution of the Xuanhuang Realm, or is it caused by external forces?”

Li Fan instinctively thought of the elusive Immortal Ancestor.

No one else came to mind. If there were a cultivator in the Xuanhuang Realm capable of altering the heavens and earth so effortlessly, it would undoubtedly be this creator of the new laws.

“But if this guess is correct, why, as the Xuanhuang Realm approaches its fall into the Immortal Ruins, does the Immortal Ancestor not flee? Instead, He has been transforming the world for thousands of years as if nothing has changed. Why?”

“Could it be that the transformation of the world itself allowed the Immortal Ancestor to transcend?” Li Fan pondered further, recalling how, in his previous life, the Immortal Ancestor left the Xuanhuang Realm a decade or so later.

As countless thoughts flashed through his mind, Li Fan temporarily suppressed his doubts.

“Brother Ximen, you truly are a rare genius who can perceive the essence of the world from the smallest details. Even Dao Integration stage cultivators pale in comparison to you!” Li Fan praised sincerely.

Then he shifted the topic: “Such groundbreaking research! Has my friend perhaps authored any detailed works on this? I’d love to study them thoroughly!”

At first, Ximen Yu was slightly pleased. But when Li Fan brought up the matter of writing, he hesitated and appeared rather embarrassed.

After persistent questioning from Li Fan, Ximen Yu finally revealed the truth.

It turned out that he had completed writing A Study of Mountains and Rivers Through the Ages and was preparing to publish it, dreaming of leaving a legacy for future generations.

However, he received a warning from the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance.

The Alliance deemed the book to contain content unsuitable for public release, requiring revisions.

But they didn’t specify which parts were problematic.

Helpless, Ximen Yu removed some sections and resubmitted it for review. Yet it still failed to pass.

In the end, the once-thick manuscript was reduced to scattered fragments, leaving only a solitary essay intact.

“Haha, since then, I’ve felt disheartened. Now I just rely on my knowledge to earn some contributions and have shifted my research focus,” Ximen Yu said with a touch of melancholy.

“Oh, by the way, I’m currently studying the flow of earth veins. If you’re interested, we could exchange insights,” he added.

Li Fan pondered for a moment before softly asking, “Does my friend still have a copy of the original manuscript?”

Ximen Yu laughed awkwardly. “A Study of Mountains and Rivers Through Ancient and Modern Times embodies my life’s work and is etched deeply in my mind. What need is there for a backup?”

“However, the full version can’t be transmitted via the Tianxuan Mirror. If you’re truly interested, you’re welcome to visit me at Qihong Isle in Leyang Prefecture.”

Leyang Prefecture was located in the eastern central region of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance, several prefectures away from the Congyun Sea. However, with teleportation formation, the journey wouldn’t take long.

Li Fan agreed without hesitation.

“By the way, Fellow Daoist Ximen, regarding those locations I commissioned you to search for, which remain elusive, you mentioned they might have fallen within the range of the White Mist Barrier.

“Could you mark their potential locations on a map for me?” Li Fan asked before their communication ended.

Ximen Yu was surprised. “Could it be that you plan to venture into the White Mist?”

"It's not necessarily so; it's just a thought, nothing more. After all, the Devouring White Mist is fierce—who would risk their life going in there without reason?" Li Fan smiled but didn’t admit anything. "Perhaps one day, when my lifespan is nearing its end, I might go and explore it for a bit."

"That's good. I thought I’d run into another lunatic," Ximen Yu muttered.

"Another lunatic? Daoist Ximen, what do you mean by that?" Li Fan grew curious and quickly asked.

"Ah, nothing special. When we were surveying the terrain earlier, I witnessed a deranged cultivator repeatedly rushing in and out of the White Mist Barrier."

"At first, he looked like a young man. Later, he became old and decrepit. I don’t even know if he’s still alive now."

"I tried to persuade him, but he wouldn’t listen. He just kept babbling about some great secret hidden in the White Mist Barrier…"

"Isn't that nonsense? You need to stay alive to study it first," Ximen Yu sneered with disdain.

As he spoke, he passed along a map marked with several points.

"I’ll try to figure out the remaining ones over the next few days. If I can’t crack them, I won’t bother contacting you again." With that, the other end went silent.

Li Fan carefully examined the map. He noticed the markers were scattered across the territory of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance. Interestingly, when he deliberately chose these locations earlier, he had focused on regions concentrated within one or two neighboring provinces based on Linghu Chang’s memories.

This confirmed that Ximen Yu’s research was credible.

Indeed, the Xuanhuang Realm had been torn apart and reshaped.

Staring at the map, Li Fan remained silent for a long time. After a while, he thoroughly erased the map’s data.

"For now, I should focus on purchasing the materials for refining Longevity Pills through the Tianxuan Mirror. Once I’ve gathered enough, I’ll have Liu San use the Samantabhadra True Boat to venture into the depths of the White Mist Barrier and see if we can uncover anything."

"If that fails, I can consider planting them in the wood-attribute domain of my Five Elements Cave Heaven."

Currently, Li Fan’s Five Elements Cave Heaven was still in its embryonic stage.

In terms of size, scale, and spiritual energy concentration, it couldn’t yet compare to the one that previously sparked a war between the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance and the Five Elders Association.

Fortunately, its essence was no different, and its potential was limitless.

"Planting spiritual herbs will also aid in refining the laws within the wood-attribute domain. But… specialization is key…"

Li Fan suddenly thought of Chen Ying, the Nascent Soul cultivator from the Medicinal Hall of Congyun Sea.

Since being conscripted into the Five Elements Cave Heaven, Chen Ying had vanished without a trace.

However, unlike in his past life, thanks to Li Fan’s warning, Chen Ying had not fallen yet.

He just couldn’t be contacted.

"He should still be in the Five Elements Cave Heaven, though I have no idea what he’s been up to." Li Fan recalled that in his previous life, just a few years later, in Year 38, the Five Elements Cave Heaven collapsed into oblivion due to the extraction of vast resources, leading to an imbalance in its elements.

"I wonder if the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance will repeat the same mistake in this lifetime." Li Fan was still unsure why the Alliance was so aggressively exploiting the resources of the Five Elements Cave Heaven. Yet, judging by Chen Ying’s continued absence, it seemed their operations there hadn’t ceased.

After pondering for a moment, Li Fan shook his head and dismissed the thought.

Just as he was about to return to Shenhua Island, a notification from the Tianxuan Mirror arrived.

The former island lord of Ten Thousand Immortals Island, Immortal Lord Hongxi—a Soul Transformation cultivator who had been conscripted into the Alliance’s headquarters for years—

Had finally returned.

He ordered Li Fan, the "Secret Envoy," to report to him immediately.

Chapter 622: Hong Xi Returns to Congyun

"Finally back, huh..." Li Fan narrowed his eyes slightly.

"Is he alone? Where is Immortal Lord Ziyun?"

In an instant, Li Fan had already played out the possible scenarios of their confrontation in his mind.

These included, but were not limited to:

1. Immortal Lord Hong Xi, facing the reality of being stripped of power and authority, launching a vigorous counterattack. Relying on the influence of his Soul Transformation cultivation, he could instantly regain the support of the majority of cultivators.

2. Alternatively, Immortal Lord Hong Xi might appear calm and cooperative on the surface while secretly biding his time. Once Li Fan relaxed his guard, he could strike swiftly and decisively, reversing the situation. In the end, Li Fan could be removed under a trumped-up charge.

However, what Li Fan never anticipated was that when Immortal Lord Hong Xi actually met him, there was no tension or hostility. Instead, Hong Xi burst into hearty laughter and gave him a big hug.

Li Fan's body stiffened slightly, and a trace of confusion flashed in his eyes.

"Are we even that close?" he thought to himself.

Immortal Lord Hong Xi, seemingly oblivious to the odd look in Li Fan's eyes, patted him on the shoulder with satisfaction.

"Good, very good! You've done well! When I heard that the Five Elders Association had nearly uprooted Ten Thousand Immortal Island, Ziyun and I were worried that Congyun Sea would descend into chaos. Who would have thought that you'd emerge out of nowhere? Over the past few years, not only did various evaluation metrics not decline, but they even rose by several ranks!"

"Why didn't you wake up earlier? If you had, I wouldn’t have been overwhelmed with all those issues over the years."

"Keep it up! From now on, the administration of Congyun Sea is yours to manage!"

Immortal Lord Hong Xi appeared genuinely pleased.

Li Fan fell silent.

Dressed in white, Hong Xi exuded a carefree aura. Humming an unknown tune, he returned to the long table in his quarters.

Gracefully pouring himself a cup of tea, he sipped it with evident contentment.

"Now, this is the life—lying back, watching achievements roll in without lifting a finger," he said lazily.

Seeing Li Fan still standing stiffly, Hong Xi called out, "Hey, don’t be so uptight. Have some tea with me!"

"Thank you, Lord City Master!" Li Fan didn’t refuse. He stepped forward and took a seat.

After finishing another cup of tea, Hong Xi said, "Ziyun and I have heard of your deeds from the headquarters of the Immortal Alliance. Remarkable, truly remarkable. As expected of a disciple from an ancient sect, far more capable than us modern cultivators."

"By the way, what’s your current cultivation level? Nascent Soul? Soul Transformation?" Hong Xi glanced at Li Fan, then shook his head.

"I can’t see through you at all!"

Li Fan replied calmly, "Regardless of my cultivation, I’m merely a subordinate under the City Lord’s command."

Immortal Lord Hong Xi chuckled. "And I am but a subordinate to the Lord Jinglun, who himself is under the Law Enforcers’ command. We all serve the Immortal Alliance—what difference does it make?"

Li Fan’s expression grew solemn. "Your wisdom and perspective are indeed extraordinary. I am in awe!"

Seeing Li Fan’s formal demeanor, Hong Xi’s smile faded slightly. Shaking his head, he sighed. "Truly an old relic—so dull, so boring."

"Fine, as long as you continue to handle the administration and maintain the current state of affairs, that’s all I ask."

Noticing Hong Xi’s seemingly genuine attitude, Li Fan couldn’t help but ask, "Do you really have no intention of reclaiming power?"

Hong Xi burst into laughter again. "That’s where you don’t understand. But it’s okay; you’ll figure it out eventually. I might as well explain a bit."

"I’ve been managing Congyun Sea for nearly two centuries now, always diligent and cautious. While I’ve made no great achievements, I’ve also committed no serious errors."

"But such days have reached their end. Advancing further?"

Hong Xi sighed softly. "It’s difficult!"

"The Immortal Alliance has so many Soul Transformation cultivators. Competing with them without reaching Dao Integration..."

“Hehe, isn’t it more carefree and comfortable staying here in my Congyun Sea?”

“All these administrative affairs—sure, you can handle them carefully for a year, two years, even ten or thirty years.”

“But what about a hundred years, or two hundred years?”

“I’ve long grown tired of it. Yet, I can’t bring myself to resign. Handing it over to my subordinates? They’re all just incompetent fools, and I wouldn’t trust them with it.”

“For so many years, finally, someone like you has appeared!”

“Just look at this—Ziyun has stayed inland to attend some so-called ‘Friendly Exchange Meeting’ to broaden horizons. I couldn’t even be bothered to attend that rare grand event, held only once every few centuries. Instead, I couldn’t wait to return here to see you.”

“You didn’t disappoint me!”

Immortal Lord Hong Xi sighed deeply.

“I heard you might have been worried earlier, afraid I’d return and seize your authority? That’s unnecessary! I’m eager to hand over all these messes to you!”

“Rest assured, tomorrow I’ll summon everyone and make it clear. You’ll still be in charge from now on!”

Li Fan’s face twitched slightly but still cupped his hands respectfully, saying, “In that case, thank you for your generous favor, City Lord.”

Immortal Lord Hong Xi patted Li Fan’s shoulder again. “Do a good job! Even though the merit points you earn annually from your secret title are slightly less than mine, compared to those cultivators who toil away every year on merit tasks, it’s an entirely different league.”

“Moreover, I’ve heard that while you served as acting Island Lord and supervised the construction of Congyun City, your position was equivalent to that of a City Lord.”

“If we calculate it this way, your merit rankings should have increased quickly over these years.”

This time, it was Li Fan’s turn to be stunned.

“Merit points distributed annually? Why haven’t I received any?”

Immortal Lord Hong Xi, who was sipping tea, spat it out in shock, staring at Li Fan in disbelief.

“Impossible! You didn’t receive any merit points? Then what have you been working hard for all these years?”

“I…” Li Fan hesitated, words failing him.

Suddenly, he realized a significant generational gap between them and could only remain silent.

“You haven’t been participating in the annual settlements through the Tianxuan Mirror all this time, have you?” After a long pause, Immortal Lord Hong Xi looked at Li Fan with an exceptionally peculiar expression.

Li Fan shrugged. “No one ever mentioned it to me.”

Immortal Lord Hong Xi smacked his forehead.

“Ah…”

With a weary tone, he said, “You’d better go check it out quickly. Maybe you’ll find a surprise.”

Li Fan nodded, saluted, and left in a hurry.

Watching Li Fan’s figure gradually fade away, Immortal Lord Hong Xi shook his head. “Sigh, as expected of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance. When it’s not their concern, they completely ignore it…”

When Li Fan returned to the Tianxuan Mirror and inquired further, he finally understood what the so-called annual settlement was about.

It turned out that the primary administrators of each province not only received an annual contribution as their “salary.”

They were also awarded “performance” rewards based on their province’s overall ranking within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

This was settled annually, and in addition to contribution points, a large amount of merit was distributed.

Chapter 623: Calendar of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance

In the Tianxuan Mirror, beams of light and shadows appeared one after another.

Since the anchoring of the year 11 and the official foundation of the Congyun Immortal City under Li Fan's supervision, up until the end of year 14,

the settlement data for a total of four years instantly appeared before Li Fan.

"New Immortal Calendar, Year 2021: Comprehensive Ranking: 231st, rewarded with three Intermediate Grade B Merits and 11,000 Contribution Points."

"New Immortal Calendar, Year 2022: Comprehensive Ranking: 226th, rewarded with three Intermediate Grade B Merits and 15,000 Contribution Points. Additionally, due to active participation in the Congyun Sea Region's response to the Immortal Alliance’s recruitment policy during the Tianling Prefecture War, an extra reward of one Superior Grade B Merit."

...

With the completion of thirteen meritorious missions, Li Fan's merit level soared, eventually stopping at Level 22.

In his previous life, Li Fan had only managed to reach Merit Level 31 at the end of his lifespan by relying on unparalleled contributions, such as constructing the Tianxuan Spirit Locking Formation.

But now, by essentially being a hands-off overseer, he had effortlessly risen to Level 22.

Of course, this achievement was partly due to the Superior Grade A Merit reward from the foundation of Congyun City.

As his merit level increased, many cultivation techniques and treasures previously hidden in the Tianxuan Mirror were unlocked. However, having reached higher levels in his past life, Li Fan only needed a glance to notice that the list had only a few additional items. These were mainly treasures redeemable by regional administrators.

For example, the Mirror of All Living Beings, which monitors the overall number and cultivation levels of cultivators within a state; and the Bell of Myriad States, which displays the annual development status of other regions and predicts the local state's ranking in the annual comprehensive evaluation.

In summary, these tools were primarily designed to facilitate competition between regions and were of little practical use to Li Fan.

What truly caught Li Fan’s attention, however, was the date displayed in the settlement notification.

“New Immortal Calendar…”

As the name implies, the New Immortal Calendar was a system implemented starting from the year when the Immortal Ancestor rebuilt the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Previously, all time references in various ancient texts that Li Fan consulted were deliberately vague, using terms like ancient, distant ancient, primordial, or broad time spans such as thousands or hundreds of years ago.

This was the first time Li Fan had encountered a precise record down to a specific year.

As for Sima Changkong's Bloodline History, it also followed a "Year One" system, using his own lineage’s beginning as its baseline. It didn’t apply universally to the overall immortal cultivation world.

"It seems the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance must have a detailed recording system internally. It’s just kept secret from the public."

Li Fan wasn’t surprised by this realization. Given that the Museum of Divine Relics housed various precious artifacts from the history of the Xuanhuang Realm, it was only natural that it would also preserve records of the true history.

“Ancient matters are clearly not suitable for public dissemination. Keeping people ignorant ensures stability.” Li Fan smirked coldly.

“If I recall correctly, reaching Merit Level 30 grants a free tour of the Museum of Divine Relics.”

Images of the museum’s central hall flashed in his mind, and Li Fan seemed to sense the hunger of [Truth].

But he forcibly suppressed his restlessness. The Museum of Divine Relics was heavily guarded, with the Longevity Beast Emperor Sanmo overseeing it. Acting recklessly would be akin to walking into a trap.

At least for now, it was beyond Li Fan’s capabilities to covet. He could only gradually strengthen himself through the cycles of reincarnation, uncover more secrets, and find the right breakthrough point. Only then would he have even the faintest hope of success.

After closing the merit record, Li Fan sent a message to the Immortal Lord Hong Xi, informing him that he had claimed all the merits accumulated over the past few years and expressing his gratitude for the guidance.

Immortal Lord Hong Xi laughed heartily and said little else, merely encouraging Li Fan to continue his efforts. He also assured Li Fan not to worry about the minds of others; he would handle them personally.

As expected, three days later, the returning Immortal Lord Hong Xi convened a meeting with all the internal cultivators of Congyun Sea.

Just as everyone assumed that the once-prominent Li Fan would lose power and be cast down to obscurity, Immortal Lord Hong Xi announced publicly that Li Fan would continue managing state affairs on his behalf.

This announcement brought immense joy to He Zhenghao and others, who had been restless with anxiety.

The rest of the cultivators, however, were left in shock and disbelief.

As they stole glances at Li Fan’s calm and composed face, their hearts were filled with both awe and fear, speculating endlessly about his background.

What kind of hidden power could Li Fan possess to force Immortal Lord Hong Xi, who had ruled Congyun Sea for centuries, to relinquish authority?

Ignoring the shifting expressions around him, Li Fan bowed respectfully to Immortal Lord Hong Xi and expressed his gratitude once again.

Immortal Lord Hong Xi waved his hand and stepped away, disappearing from the scene.

Li Fan, however, knew that Immortal Lord Hong Xi had grown tired of dealing with the mundane matters of Congyun Sea and was eager to leave everything behind.

But others were unaware of this.

In their eyes, Immortal Lord Hong Xi’s retreating figure seemed despondent.

The truth was clear to them now—Immortal Lord Hong Xi had indeed lost to Li Fan in the power struggle!

The cultivators’ hearts were stirred with tumultuous waves of realization. They lowered their heads, not daring to look directly at the triumphant envoy before them.

Seeing their reactions, Li Fan understood their thoughts but chose not to explain. Instead, he imitated Hong Xi’s demeanor.

“The governance of the Immortal Alliance must prioritize stability. Everything in Congyun Sea will remain as it is. Zhou Qingang, He Zhenghao, and Gao Yuan will assist me in managing all affairs.”

Zhou Qingang, He Zhenghao, and the others were overjoyed and quickly agreed.

“Now, disperse!” Li Fan waved his hand and disappeared as well.

After Li Fan’s departure, the Bureau of Administration Hall erupted into a commotion.

“Congratulations, Fellow Daoist Zhou!”

“Lord He, this is truly worth celebrating!”

…

Hearing their words as he walked away, Li Fan shook his head slightly.

He was about to return to Shenhua Island when he suddenly received another message.

“The Second Alliance of Ten Thousand Immortals and the Five Elders Association’s Friendly Exchange Meeting will take place in Tianling Prefecture in ten days.”

“At this former battlefield, both sides will set aside their grudges and forge new friendships.”

Li Fan’s first thought was of the scene of devastation he had previously witnessed in Tianling Prefecture.

“Hosting a friendly exchange event in such a place? Is that really appropriate?” Li Fan muttered to himself.

“Could it be that, under the guise of friendly exchange, tensions will remain high?”

Li Fan carefully searched for related information and indeed found some suspicious details.

In addition to the mutual exhibition of both parties "World-Defying Supreme Treasures," the exchange event would also include competitions in martial arts, philosophical debates, and formation testing.

Representatives from both sides would be the top young talents from their respective organizations.

The entire process of the competitions would be broadcast live.

Chapter 624: Tianyang Seeks Dao Integration

“This is just a ceasefire in plain sight, switching to another form of competition.” Li Fan was quite familiar with this kind of situation.

“It’s a perfect opportunity to gauge the true capabilities of the elites on both sides.”

Li Fan found himself highly intrigued.

To make it easier for all cultivators to witness the grand event, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance specially crafted a magical mirror tool.

It was affordably priced—just 100 contribution points to purchase. Cultivators could use it to watch the scenes of the event anytime and anywhere. They could even replay the battles between both sides repeatedly. Most importantly, the mirror displayed real-time commentary synchronized with the Tianxuan Mirror, ensuring lower-level cultivators wouldn’t feel lost amidst the advanced techniques.

The “Tianling Viewing Mirror” became an instant hit among cultivators upon its release.

Apart from its low price and the rarity of missing such a grand occasion, some cultivators also bought it for collection purposes. According to veteran cultivators, during the first friendly exchange event, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had also released a similar viewing mirror.
