At that time, it didn’t attract much attention because the event details could be casually searched in the Tianxuan Mirror. Only the more affluent cultivators purchased it.

What no one anticipated was that after the competition ended, the viewing mirrors became limited-edition treasures. Their inherent value wasn’t the main attraction; it was the battle scenes they recorded.

During the first exchange event, the representatives from both sides later rose to become prominent figures in their respective organizations. Almost all of them achieved the Dao Integration realm.

For lower-level cultivators, repeatedly analyzing the discussions and battles of these elites proved extremely beneficial. Some even presented these mirrors, which recorded the victories of key elites, as gifts to the individuals themselves, winning their favor.

Over time, with the deaths of many cultivators, the remaining viewing mirrors became increasingly scarce. Today, they were so rare they could hardly be found.

With such precedent, it was no surprise that this round of “Tianling Viewing Mirrors” sold out rapidly.

For just 100 contribution points, Li Fan naturally bought one.

Upon receiving it, Li Fan found the workmanship of the mirror rather crude.

It was incomparable to the Tianxuan Mirror and even far inferior to ordinary copper mirrors used by mortals. It was essentially a piece of polished stone.

“Could this have been outsourced production again?”

“Selling for 100 contribution points—who knows how much the cost was? Although the unit price is low, considering how many cultivators are in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance…”

“I wonder who’s profiting from this.”

Li Fan muttered to himself as he put the mirror away.

While the cultivators on the island were enthusiastically discussing the exchange event, he quietly returned to his private island.

Over the past few days, Liu San and the others worked tirelessly, exhausting all the raw materials they had prepared beforehand.

They successfully refined 28 Longevity Pills, with their quality fluctuating between 200 years of extended lifespan.

When Liu San handed over the pills, his face was full of guilt. “I’ve disappointed you, young master. Perhaps due to the limits of practicing multiple arts, the essence of my Longevity Green Energy fell far short of expectations. Even after being purified with 99 small medicinal cauldrons, the result is still this…”

“To produce pills of such quality…”

“If the old sect master were alive, he would’ve surely mocked me endlessly,” Liu San said sadly.

Li Fan consoled him. “Elder Liu, there’s no need to blame yourself. The changes in heaven and earth cannot be resisted without attaining Longevity. Besides, I’ve already checked the market. These Longevity Pills will suffice for now. Releasing excessively high-quality pills all at once might even have adverse effects.”

As he spoke, Li Fan handed over a storage ring.

“I’ve also uncovered some clues about the whereabouts of Longevity Valley. It might be located at one of the locations marked on the map.”

“Although they’re all within the White Mist Barrier, the ring contains a magical vessel called the Samantabhadra True Boat. With it, you should be able to negate the effects of the mist's energy-draining properties.”

Upon hearing this, Liu San’s face lit up with joy.

“The environment within Longevity Valley is exceptional and distinct from the outside world. If we can refine pills there, their quality might improve significantly.”

Li Fan nodded slightly, "In that case, I will leave this matter to you, Elder Liu. Currently, the outside world is holding some kind of friendly exchange event, and the eyes of the world will all be drawn to it. This is the perfect opportunity. I’ll trouble you to make the journey."

"Once again, your own safety must be the top priority. The revival of our Medicine King Sect depends on you!"

Faced with Li Fan's sincere reminder, Liu San was deeply moved.

"I will not fail the Young Master's trust."

After speaking, he familiarized himself with the Samantabhadra True Boat and then transformed into a streak of light, heading towards the marked location on the map.

"Hopefully, his journey goes smoothly, and he can find the Valley of Longevity."

"This Congyun Sea is no longer a place I can stay."

Li Fan flew above the Shenhua Island, looking up at the sky. His eyes narrowed as he sensed the faint killing intent gradually forming between heaven and earth.

The killing intent of heaven and earth was subtly infused into all things, almost imperceptible.

It had little to do with one's cultivation level and was more closely tied to individual comprehension. Li Fan, possessing the Formless Killing Intent, could leverage the will of heaven, making him acutely sensitive to such phenomena.

"The killing intent in this life is so overwhelming. It seems even stronger than in the previous ones."

"Could it be due to the collective reappearance of the Heavenly Doctor?"

Li Fan frowned slightly, already planning to retreat in his mind.

He arrived on the island and led Tianyang alone into a secret chamber.

"Junior Brother, there is now an opportunity for you to advance to the Dao Integration realm. Are you willing to seize it?"

At first, Tianyang tilted his head, seemingly unable to fully understand the meaning of Li Fan's words.

Only after Li Fan repeated himself did Tianyang straighten his posture. Despite his puppet body, a solemn expression appeared on his face.

"You know as well as I do that crises and opportunities have always coexisted in this world."

"The chances of success are slim. It is extremely dangerous, and there is a possibility of complete annihilation."

"Even so, are you willing to take this chance?"

Li Fan's face softened slightly as he patiently asked.

It didn’t take long for Tianyang to respond. In his fragmented mechanical voice, he declared:

"Tianyang’s life..."

"Will never be inferior to anyone!"

Even though Li Fan had already anticipated Tianyang's answer, hearing it from him still stirred some emotion.

"Good! If that’s the case, then I, as your senior brother, will give you my all!" Li Fan said firmly.

In his hand, the Heaven and Earth Divination Dice suddenly appeared. After a few rapid spins, Li Fan felt a faint premonition in his heart.

"Approximately a year from now, is it...?"

"That’s enough time."

Bringing Tianyang with him, Li Fan ventured into the depths of the Congyun Sea.

One after another, precious heavenly materials and earthly treasures were retrieved from Li Fan’s personal storage dimension.

He was preparing to enhance Tianyang's body once more.

At all costs.

Among them was even some ‘Eternal Tribulation Gold,’ a material that could survive the unification of the Five Elements.

"I’d like to see whether the Ink Death truly has the power to erase everything!"

Chapter 625: The Tianling Martial Duel Begins

Beneath the Congyun Sea, where several vital ley lines converge, the energy of the earth veins surged turbulently, appearing far more agitated than before.

Using this powerful energy, Li Fan set up the [Earth-Fire Convergence Formation], placing the dormant Tianyang at its center.

He then gradually added materials such as Eternal Tribulation Gold, Radiant Heaven Crystal, and Purple Spirit Essence into the formation.

The formation resembled a massive furnace. Under the blazing heat of the Earthfire energy, these materials began to merge with Tianyang’s puppet body.

During Tianyang’s countless years of slumber, it was precisely this formation that allowed him to break through his own limits, ascending from a mere Foundation Establishment cultivator to become a Soul Transformation Immortal Monarch.

However, due to the mediocre heritage of the minor sect he had inherited, even with all its resources, Tianyang’s financial means were limited. Over millennia, reaching the Soul Transformation realm was already his peak achievement.

The puppet body, constrained by the innate limitations of its materials, lacked significant strength. While it could contend with those in the same realm, crossing realms to defeat enemies, as true prodigies did, was nearly impossible.

Now, with Li Fan’s assistance, all of this was about to change.

With so many rare treasures poured into its creation, even if it were purely a puppet, it could rival an ordinary Dao Integration cultivator.

Coupled with Tianyang’s indomitable spirit and will, he might even survive against the ultimate manifestation of the soul of heaven and earth—Ink Death.

Li Fan’s eyes reflected the fierce glow of the [Earth-Fire Convergence Formation]. After observing for several days, he noticed the process was slower than expected.

“Junior Brother, let Senior Brother give you a little extra boost.”

With that, Li Fan tossed a massive pile of top-quality spirit stones, brimming with pure spiritual energy, into the formation.

Like dry wood meeting a roaring fire, or a strong wind fanning the flames, the effect was immediate. The efficiency of the Earth-Fire Convergence Formation doubled.

Li Fan continued to stare at Tianyang within the formation, his gaze deep and contemplative.

...

Ten days passed in the blink of an eye.

The Tianling Prefecture’s friendly exchange event was about to begin.

To prevent any unforeseen incidents, the entire Tianling Prefecture was locked down. Even all teleportation formation were deactivated, barring unrelated individuals from entering and causing disturbances.

Thus, the opening ceremony and the unveiling of the World-Defying Supreme Treasures were closed to ordinary cultivators.

These so-called "World-Defying Supreme Treasures" referred to peerless magical artifacts possessed by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association, capable of drastically altering the course of their wars.

According to rumors, both sides had unveiled one supreme treasure each. Those who witnessed their terrifying power were left utterly shaken, abandoning any thoughts of reigniting conflict. However, due to strict confidentiality, no details about these treasures were disclosed, leaving everyone itching with curiosity.

On the second day after the opening, the highly anticipated competition phase officially began.

Dao, Martial Arts, Tools, Formation, Pills, Talismans—

Each day featured a single category, with the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association each sending three prodigies to compete.

The first event, and the most eye-catching, was the Martial Arts Duel.

At that moment, countless cultivators of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance watched their first representative step onto the stage through the Tianxuan Viewing Mirrors.

The participant appeared to be a teenager, around ten years old, with a genderless beauty. Dressed in white with a red ribbon tied around their head, they looked strikingly handsome.

The name "Di Luwu" appeared alongside them in the Viewing Mirror.

A buzz of astonishment swept through the crowd.

On the Five Elders Association’s side, their representatives looked grim.

“What’s the meaning of this? Sending a mere child to such an important event?”

“Are they mocking us, as if the Five Elders Association lacks capable individuals?”

...

All the cultivators present had extraordinary cultivation levels, and they could naturally see that the boy named Di Luwu had not maintained a childlike appearance after reaching adulthood. Instead, he genuinely appeared to be less than ten years old.

No matter how much of a genius one might be, how strong could someone become in such a short lifespan?

The expressions of the cultivators from the Five Elders Association were extremely grim. At that moment, a young swordsman in green robes stepped forward, his face filled with indignation and a hint of murderous intent.

"Guzhi, do not underestimate him!"

A middle-aged woman from the Five Elders Association, who appeared no different from a simple village farmer, suddenly shouted.

Her identity seemed particularly special. The green-robed youth, named Xu Guzhi, nodded solemnly in acknowledgment before gracefully stepping forward to face Di Luwu.

"Please enlighten me!" Xu Guzhi narrowed his eyes, his sword pointing directly at Di Luwu.

The battle was on the verge of breaking out, and the cultivators of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance noticed the information about the two contestants.

Both were at the peak of the Soul Transformation stage. Di Luwu was nine years old, while Xu Guzhi was fifty-six.

The cultivators across the world who witnessed this scene were utterly shocked.

"A nine-year-old at the Soul Transformation peak? Am I seeing this right?"

"Even if you started cultivating in the womb, it shouldn’t be possible to progress this quickly!"

"Is this real? Is Di Luwu the fastest cultivator in history? How did he achieve this?"

"Look at me, I’m already 378 years old and still stuck in the Nascent Soul stage. The gap between people truly makes one despair."

"Heh, you’re at least at the Nascent Soul stage. Should I, a mere Foundation Establishment cultivator, even say anything?"

...

Before the duel even began, it had already ignited worldwide debate. Cultivators speculated wildly about Di Luwu's background.

Even Li Fan’s eyes flickered with amazement and surprise.

After all, a nine-year-old at the Soul Transformation peak was simply beyond reason.

"Could it be the reincarnation technique like Senior Brother Zhang’s method? Or perhaps the body-possession rebirth technique of the Xuantian Sect’s Dharma King?"

"Or maybe..."

Li Fan stared intently at the perpetually cold expression on Di Luwu’s face, feeling a strange sense of familiarity.

"A Heavenly Warlock?"

"Is this Di Luwu from the [Era]?"

While Li Fan was lost in thought, Xu Guzhi moved.

With a swift swing of his sword, a massive sword shadow materialized and descended from the sky.

"A thousand swords unbroken, stretching like mountains."

The viewing mirror immediately displayed a synchronized explanation.

Countless gigantic sword shadows overlapped and pressed down on Di Luwu from all directions with the weight of a mountain, creating an unparalleled sense of oppression without any earth-shaking noise—just a silent and seamless execution.

In the midst of the surrounding swords, Di Luwu seemed frozen with fear, unmoving and at a loss.

The hearts of the cultivators from the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance tightened instantly.

Just as the countless massive swords were about to strike, Di Luwu made his move.

A silver dragon, like a sudden thunderbolt, lit up the heavens and earth.

It swiftly pierced through the encircling swords.

Before anyone could react, it had already penetrated Xu Guzhi's chest.

........................................................................

Read extra chapters on >>> patreon.com/SpiritStonetranslation

Chapter 626: Hidden Returning Sword vs. Silver Radiance

The attack by Di Luwu was unbelievably swift.

It wasn’t until the silver dragon revealed its true form—a silver spear—that the scene became clear.

The explanation slowly appeared in the viewing mirror:

“The spear strikes like a dragon, breaking through all.”

After piercing through Xu Guzhi’s body, the silver spear swiftly turned back, shattering the countless sword shadows in its path.

Then, it leisurely returned to Di Luwu’s hand.

At this point, the giant mountain swords Xu Guzhi had swung still hadn’t managed to touch Di Luwu’s body.

In the dazzling silver brilliance, they vanished into nothingness.

Xu Guzhi coughed up a mouthful of fresh blood and stared in disbelief at the “child” before him, who showed no emotional fluctuations whatsoever.

The reversal of the battle took place in an instant.

In truth, most of the spectators couldn’t even discern what had happened.

Only after watching the slow-motion replay in the viewing mirror repeatedly did they begin to grasp the details of the fight.

Gasps echoed across the crowd.

“What incredible speed! Such sharp spear techniques!”

“Who is this Di Luwu? His strength is terrifying! I suspect even some Dao Integration Immortal Sages might not be his match!”

“Who exactly are you referring to? Don’t hesitate to name names.”

On the battlefield, Xu Guzhi, pierced by the silver spear, didn’t admit defeat immediately.

He took a deep breath, and his injuries healed completely.

Xu Guzhi slightly opened his mouth and swallowed the straight sword in his hand.

With the sword consumed, his body disappeared from sight.

Amid the stunned gazes of the audience, Xu Guzhi vanished entirely!

It was only through the explanation appearing in the viewing mirror that the onlookers understood what had occurred:

“The sword returns to the sheath; its strike conceals itself in the void.”

For the first time, a faint ripple of emotion appeared on Di Luwu’s face—but it was just a fleeting ripple.

Standing motionless in midair, he extended his right hand, curling his fingers in a provocative gesture.

Almost instantly, an invisible sword light emerged above Di Luwu’s head.

Silent and undetectable, it aimed to sever his head.

But as the strike descended, a burst of silver light erupted, intercepting the Hidden Returning Sword and neutralizing the killing blow.

Di Luwu scanned the surroundings, but Xu Guzhi’s whereabouts remained elusive.

Another wave of invisible sword energy silently approached, impossible to detect.

Yet, once again, just before it touched Di Luwu, his silver spear intercepted it.

“Though the sword is formless, its intent lacks awareness.”

“The martial spear, at the peak of speed, breaks all techniques.”

The viewing mirror displayed these words again.

Li Fan stared at the lines in the mirror for a long time, replaying the scenes of the duel in his mind, coming to some realizations.

Xu Guzhi’s Hidden Returning Sword* was indeed extraordinary—even Di Luwu couldn’t locate it.

However, Di Luwu’s speed was simply unmatched, far surpassing Xu Guzhi’s by several levels.

Moreover, Di Luwu had mastered the method of acting instinctively without conscious thought, enabling him to summon his silver spear at the critical moment to intercept each strike of the Hidden Returning Sword.

From this perspective, Xu Guzhi defeating Di Luwu seemed like an impossible task.

But for Di Luwu to triumph over Xu Guzhi…

That, too, seemed highly challenging.

Di Luwu, appearing to have had enough of the game, furrowed his brow for the first time.

A violent surge of silver radiance erupted from his body, sweeping outward with the intent to annihilate everything in its path.

The viewing mirror’s display was completely overwhelmed by the blinding silver light.

After a brief moment of blindness, the mirror gradually returned to normal.

“Surely this time, Xu Guzhi must be dead.”

When the numerous cultivators were speculating about the outcome, another formless sword light struck toward Di Liuwu as if it were a persistent ghost.

Xu Guzhi remained concealed somewhere within the field!

Seeing this, Li Fan's eyes lit up: "This technique is truly excellent for self-preservation."

Di Luwu, clearly provoked by Xu Guzhi's relentless evasion, became visibly enraged.

Silver lightning serpents swept through the surrounding space, creating black void fissures.

Yet, Xu Guzhi could not be located.

From the spectator seats of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, boos and jeers erupted:

"What kind of duel is this? Can't win, so he hides?"

"Don't call him Xu Guzhi anymore—rename him Xu Wugui!" [1]

But no matter how others criticized him, Xu Guzhi remained unmoved, concealed within the void, launching one sword strike after another against Di Luwu.

As the battle dragged on endlessly, it seemed no conclusion could be reached. Finally, through mutual agreement, a dramatic result emerged:

The first duel of the first day ended in a tie!

This result surprised everyone, save for one cultivator who posted the following message in the Tianxuan Mirror's [World of Dharma] section:

"Wow! It really ended in a draw. With 300-to-1 odds? I've struck it rich!"

The post garnered a mix of envy and scorn from countless cultivators.

After Xu Guzhi and Di Luwu left the stage and rested briefly, the second duel began.

The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance sent a cultivator Li Fan knew well: Shuo Feng, nicknamed "I Am Invincible".

Meanwhile, the Five Elders Association's representative was a limping disabled man.

This so-called "Limping Daoist" appeared unremarkable but was, in fact, incredibly powerful.

Every move he made seemed to carry immense force, distorting space itself and blurring the live broadcast from the viewing mirrors.

However, Shuo Feng was no easy opponent. Clad in radiant golden armor, he withstood all of the Limping Daoist's attacks.

After a prolonged fight, Shuo Feng seized an opportunity and deployed 49 flying swords, ultimately defeating the Limping Daoist.

Thus, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance won the second duel.

Yet, Shuo Feng showed little joy on his face. He clasped his hands toward the Limping Daoist in acknowledgment before leaving silently, seemingly dissatisfied with his victory.

"Shuo Feng's victory lies in the strength of his equipment, not the courage of his martial skill."

This post-match commentary even appeared in the viewing mirrors, a rare critique that praised an opponent while downplaying one's own side.

Such remarks should not have surfaced but somehow did.

"Who is Shuo Feng?"

"The treasures he's wearing are incredible! If I had those weapons, I wouldn’t be much weaker!"

"You? Dream on. He has a powerful mother; what do you have?"

"A powerful mother? Fellow Daoist, please elaborate..."

...

Cultivators across the world began discussing Shuo Feng fervently. Soon, everyone knew he was the favored son of the Immortal Sage Fei Xue. Many speculated that his participation in this duel was due to his mother's influence.

Regardless of Shuo Feng's feelings, amidst the heated debates, the third duel commenced.

Initially, everyone expected another intense battle, but the outcome was decided in an instant.

With a single punch, the representative sent by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance was defeated.

The one who delivered the punch? A seemingly ordinary peasant-looking woman from the Five Elders Association.

[1. Wugui here means 'turtle' basically insulting Xu Guzhi by calling him coward]

Chapter 627: Clash of True Prodigies

As the punch landed, the entire Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance fell into a deafening silence.

The woman, however, maintained a remarkably composed demeanor as she slowly retracted her fist. "Let’s go back," she said.

The representative of the Five Elders Association’s martial faction, though visibly shaken, followed behind the peasant woman, gradually disappearing from the viewing mirror’s display.

It wasn’t until Xu Jing, the peak Soul Transformation cultivator from the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, regained consciousness with a confused expression that the spectators finally snapped out of their shock.

"Wow! That old lady is insanely powerful!"

"That punch... it felt like even the Dao itself was about to be annihilated!"

"Did anyone see clearly how she struck?"

Even Li Fan and the rest of the spectators repeatedly played back the scene captured by the viewing mirror.

However, despite slowing the footage to its limits, the peasant woman’s movements remained indiscernible. All they could see was a blur before the shadow of a fist appeared, and Xu Jing was overwhelmed by the punch’s energy, falling unconscious.

"Three punches from the peasant woman can bring down the heavens and collapse the earth," someone muttered.

Even the commentator seemed stunned by the punch, as a single line slowly appeared on the mirror:

"Three punches from the peasant woman? Does that mean there are two punches she hasn’t unleashed yet?"

"Gasp! If the first punch alone could suppress someone as prodigious as Xu Jing, who could possibly withstand all three punches?"

"Shuo Feng definitely can’t handle it. What about Di Luwu?"

"Di Luwu’s speed is incredible; the peasant woman might not even be able to land a hit on him."

"I wouldn’t be so sure."

…

Amid the heated debates, the first day of the competition finally came to an end.

The result was a draw, seemingly setting a harmonious tone for this "friendly exchange meeting."

However, as the days passed, and the outcomes of the remaining contests—focused on Dao, artifacts, formations, alchemy, and talismans—all unexpectedly ended in ties, the atmosphere gradually took on a peculiar vibe.

If the draws on the first and second days could be attributed to coincidence, then six consecutive days of evenly matched results suggested something more deliberate.

It seemed as though the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association had reached some sort of secret agreement, collectively sending a subtle message to all cultivators:

A message of "peace."

From every angle, the two sides appeared evenly matched. Reigniting the flames of war would likely lead to mutual destruction.

With such stakes, was there any point in further conflict?

Enlightened by this realization, cultivators across the land understood that this "friendly exchange meeting" was merely a grand performance. The outcome was likely predetermined, with each duel meticulously following a script.

Still, for just 100 contribution points, one could enjoy the spectacle and study the battles of various prodigies, gaining valuable insights. For most cultivators, it was well worth it.

Moreover, this display seemed to set the tone for a period of "peace" in the near future, providing cultivators with a sense of relief and stability.

Thus, even after the friendly exchange meeting ended, discussions about it persisted among the cultivators.

"In my opinion, the so-called prodigies who participated in this event weren’t all that extraordinary. They were strong, no doubt, but not beyond imagination. I’m currently at the Nascent Soul stage. Once I break through, I might be able to challenge them!"

"Exactly. Take that nine-year-old Soul Transformation cultivator, Di Luwu, for example. While he’s fast, his fighting style relies heavily on speed. If we analyze it carefully, we might find a way to counter him."

"I’ve had similar thoughts. So it’s not just my imagination?"

"We should devote ourselves to cultivation. Who knows? The next time there’s a chance for such a grand performance, we might be the ones stepping into the spotlight and making a name for ourselves across the land."

…

Just as all the cultivators across the world were starting to think they had a chance again, Li Fan received a message from Immortal lord Hongxi.

"The real competition is about to begin. Do you want to come and watch?"

Li Fan's heart stirred slightly.

"The real competition? Sir, what do you mean?"

Hongxi replied lazily, "This so-called friendly exchange meeting is divided into two parts: the overt and the covert. The overt part is a performance where the results are pre-determined."

"Neither side in the open competition will reveal overwhelming and terrifying power. Now that the great war has just ended, it’s crucial to replenish fresh blood. If we crush their motivation to cultivate, it would be counterproductive."

"So, both sides have been holding back their full strength."

"Privately, however, it’s necessary to truly determine a winner and probe each other’s depths."

"The entire process of this private competition must be kept confidential. Each region is allotted only two remote viewing slots. Since Ziyun is watching on-site, one spot is vacant."

Immortal Lord Hongxi explained.

Hearing this, Li Fan immediately agreed. At the same time, he felt somewhat relieved.

He had thought the performances of those so-called "prides of heaven" (geniuses) had been somewhat underwhelming. While their techniques and skills were impressive, none displayed truly stunning divine abilities.

At the same level of power, not to mention competing with him, even Zhong Shentong, who mastered the Seven-Colored Divine Light, might not guarantee a clear victory.

Now it seemed there was indeed something fishy going on.

Li Fan arrived at the Administrative Hall, where Hongxi was already waiting.

Hongxi lightly tapped the table, and in an instant, the world’s scenery changed.

From the Congyun Immortal City, they were transported to the peak of a mountain surrounded by a sea of clouds.

Li Fan was initially startled. But seeing that Hongxi showed no hostility, he chose to wait and observe.

"The competition is about to begin. There’s no commentary, so how much you comprehend depends entirely on your own understanding," Hongxi said, waving his hand.

In the distance, the sea of clouds surged, revealing a square seal.

The seal’s engraved patterns seemed to resemble the scenery of the Congyun Sea.

At that moment, the seal projected a beam of light upward, illuminating the sky.

In the next instant, two figures appeared.

Not only were they lifelike images, but the aura and pressure emanating from them felt utterly real.

It was as if a massive mountain suddenly weighed down on him, and Li Fan almost bent under the pressure, struggling to breathe.

His internal cave-heaven energy circulated slightly, not at full power but enough to ease the burden a bit.

Li Fan stared intently at the two figures standing above the sea of clouds.

One of them bore an uncanny resemblance to the nine-year-old Soul Transformation genius who had appeared earlier. Even their attire and weapon were identical.

However, this figure looked even younger, appearing to be only five or six years old.

"Please grant me your guidance!" the child said in a soft, milky voice, sounding utterly adorable.

But when the child made a move, Li Fan's expression changed dramatically.

With a casual swipe at the void ahead, countless silver beams descended from the sky in an instant.

As the world was dyed entirely in silvery hues, the surrounding area seemed to transform into a domain under the child’s complete control.

In Li Fan's perception, the area ahead had become akin to an independent world.

"I fear my Binding Insect Divine Ability would be greatly weakened in that space," a thought quickly flashed through Li Fan's mind.

Chapter 628: Ducks Know When the Water Warms

The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's representative "Wu" displayed extraordinary skill, his moves creating an immense commotion.

Meanwhile, the Five Elders Association’s representative was no ordinary figure either. He was not the green-robed youth seen earlier, but a cold-faced, lean middle-aged cultivator exuding a murderous aura.

Countless silver rays descended around him but were effortlessly neutralized by the swirling gray-white energy emanating from him.

“Ice!”

The cold and indifferent voice of the lean cultivator rang out. Before his words faded, the space surrounding him seemed to freeze, as if encased in ice.

A chilling aura spread outward from him as its origin, seemingly capable of freezing even time itself. When a silver ray approached the cultivator, it froze mid-air on the spot.

As the frozen domain expanded, more and more silver rays became immobilized.

Only then did Li Fan clearly see the dancing silver serpents in the air, which turned out to be an array of various weapons: swords, spears, halberds, axes, and hooks.

Despite his moves being countered, "Wu" showed no trace of anger on his face. Instead, he clapped joyfully and laughed, then pointed lightly at the lean cultivator. His smile disappeared, replaced by a solemn and murderous expression.

“Bang!”

An invisible surge of lightning passed through the frozen domain, and cracks started to spread toward the lean cultivator.

However, just as the lightning was about to strike his body, the swirling gray energy reappeared, blocking it.

Within the gray aura, black streaks briefly emerged before vanishing, leaving behind a bleak, ghostly gray light.

"Wu" pointed again, unleashing another series of deadly strikes.

The lean cultivator, unchanged in expression, calmly called out: “Wind!”

A fierce gust of wind erupted from nowhere. Li Fan saw the invisible lightning, which had pierced through the frozen domain, being blown back as if carried away by the wind. It turned around and struck toward "Wu."

"Wu" furrowed his brow and summoned silver light to shield himself.

The crackling sound of colliding energy resonated continuously around him.

“This is more like it…” Although the spectacle left Li Fan puzzled, he could sense the brilliance of the battle between the two.

Not wanting to miss a single detail, he focused all his attention, carefully observing and recording every ripple of energy fluctuation on the battlefield.

Beside him, Immortal Lord Hongxi did the same. However, his gaze occasionally fell on Li Fan, a thoughtful expression flickering across his face.

While Li Fan was immersed in the enthralling duel between two geniuses of the Xuanyuan Realm, the outside world had gradually calmed down from discussions about the "Friendly Exchange Meeting."

Life had returned to normal, with more cultivators choosing to enhance their insights through secluded meditation.

At this time, Zhou Qingang, who meticulously managed the daily affairs of the Congyun Sea, received an intriguing report from Zhao Changli, the guardian of Liuli Island.

Zhao Changli had succeeded He Zhenghao in his role. Li Fan had met him during his visit to Liuli Island when he explained and clarified his fundraising plans to the Congyun Sea cultivators.

Cautious, meticulous, and attentive, Zhao Changli was unfortunately not talented in cultivation. Being born a mortal and having limited resources, he barely reached the Foundation Establishment stage.

The report read:

“Recently, the production of Liuli Pills, a specialty of Liuli Island, has sharply declined. Upon careful investigation, I discovered that the liuli fish near the island have almost disappeared. Their whereabouts remain unknown.

Additionally, discussions with the guardians of other islands revealed that this issue is not unique to Liuli Island.

There may be significant changes occurring within the Congyun Sea. However, my abilities are limited, and I cannot ascertain the cause. This leaves me deeply anxious. I respectfully report this matter and await your wise directive.”

Looking at the familiar report, Li Fan smiled faintly.

“This man is commendable—a rare talent. Although his cultivation aptitude is lacking, his ability to observe subtle signs and deduce the impending disaster in the Congyun Sea is remarkable.”

Li Fan subtly glanced up at the sky.

"So, it’s finally about to happen..."

After staring for a long while, Li Fan finally withdrew his gaze.

He did not respond to Zhao Changli’s report but chose to leave it unaddressed, continuing to handle other matters instead.

A true battle between geniuses would clearly not be decided in a short period of time.

Time flew by, and it wasn’t until nearly twenty days later that the clandestine contest between the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association finally concluded.

Above the mountain's peak and sea of clouds, all the scenes vanished without a trace.

The energy receded, and the great seal was once again concealed beneath layers of white clouds.

Li Fan exhaled slowly.

This time, he had gained a lot from observing the battle.

However, the sudden influx of information was overwhelming, leaving him unable to process it all immediately. He would need some quiet time to reflect and comprehend.

"How do you feel?"

The Immortal Lord Hongxi asked lazily as usual.

"This humble one is dull-witted and could only barely understand what was happening," Li Fan answered cautiously.

Hongxi chuckled but did not refute.

"Understanding a little is enough. By the way, when you return, write an essay reflecting on the battle you observed. It should include, but not be limited to, a comparison of the strengths between the core members of our Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association, potential future developments, and possible breakthroughs."

"The more detailed, the better," Hongxi suddenly added.

"Huh?" Li Fan was startled by his words.

Hongxi, however, continued as if it were only natural, "Did you think that watching this remote [True Scene Reappearance] was free of charge? You should know that every moment of activating this feature costs countless contributions."

"Many people would kill for this opportunity. What’s wrong with asking you to write a reflection?"

"Besides, this is an assignment handed down from above. It’s also considered part of the administrative achievements of our Congyun Sea. Don’t slack off."

Hearing this, Li Fan could only remain silent.

He cupped his hands in acknowledgment, indicating that he understood.

"Go quickly, and make sure to send it to me as soon as possible," Hongxi said, waving his hand. The mountain-top and sea-of-clouds scene abruptly disappeared.

The two returned to the administrative hall.

After bidding farewell, Li Fan returned to the Tianxuan Mirror.

Seizing the moment while the memories were still fresh, he activated the "Awakening" state and swallowed a Dao Enlightenment Pill.

Reflecting and comprehending the scenes of the battle between geniuses, his mind immersed itself fully.

After some unknown amount of time, when he finally awoke from his epiphany, a sharp gleam shot out from his eyes before quickly retracting.

"Battling against geniuses—divine abilities and techniques cannot be as invincible as they are against ordinary cultivators."

"For example, my Congyun Sword and Heaven-Overturning Palm are both incredibly powerful. But hitting the swift martial artist or the emaciated cultivator who seemed capable of freezing everything was an arduous task."

"Only by mastering more divine abilities and merging them seamlessly to act as one with my will can I gain an absolute advantage."

"In the end, it’s still due to insufficient real combat experience."

...

Li Fan pondered for a moment and then opened the long-unused [Sitting and Discussing Dao] section within the Tianxuan Mirror.

Using the Congyun Sword and Heaven-Overturning Palm as templates, he virtually created a character.

Chapter 629: The Tianxuan Mirror and the Divine Ability Deduction

"Would you like to spend 10,000 contribution points to conduct a deduction of a divine ability? The first attempt has a 1% success rate. Each subsequent attempt increases the success rate until it reaches 100%."

Li Fan stared at the prompt displayed by the Tianxuan Mirror, his expression unchanging, and selected "Confirm."

Within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance system, cultivators gradually unlock specific privileges as their merit levels increase.

These privileges manifest in various aspects of cultivation life, such as reduced contribution costs for using teleportation formations, or an increased number of items that can be sold to the Tianxuan Mirror at market-standard prices.

However, some significant privileges are only available upon reaching specific levels:

1. Level 5 Privilege: Once per year, one can request a free long-distance teleportation.

2. Level 10 Privilege: While searching the Tianxuan Mirror for information, one can preview materials and item details that are typically restricted to those a realm higher.

3. Level 15 Privilege: Every ten years, one can randomly contact a cultivator who is one major realm higher through the Tianxuan Mirror. This contact does not impose any obligations or responsibilities on either party, leaving the relationship to personal ability.

4. Level 20 Privilege: The ability to use contribution points for divine ability or combat technique deductions during the Sitting and Discussing Dao.

However, this deduction process has a reputation for being particularly harsh.

Not only does it consume a massive amount of contribution points, but success is far from guaranteed.

Many cultivators in the system ridicule it as a "contribution-recovery trap."

When Li Fan confirmed his choice, the miniature figure representing him in the mirror began to move.

Its expression was stern, eyes fixed on the void ahead. The left hand executed a palm strike, while the right hand wielded a sword.

A faint glow erupted from the figure, and the surrounding space distorted and blurred.

As expected, the Tianxuan Mirror notified him:

"This deduction attempt has failed. Would you like to spend 15,000 contribution points to continue?"

"If you proceed, the success rate will increase to 2%. If you abandon the process, all deduction data will be reset, requiring you to start over next time."

"You may also choose to supplement the divine ability's data details to further increase the success rate."

Li Fan decisively chose to continue.

The miniature figure resumed its movements. This time, the display of the "Congyun Sword" and "Heaven-Overturning Palm" techniques seemed more vivid than before.

However, the probability of success was still minuscule, and failure quickly followed.

The third deduction required 20,000 contribution points, raising the success rate to just 3%.

Li Fan's expression remained unchanged as he selected "Continue."

The third attempt failed.

Then came the fourth, the fifth...

As the miniature figure’s performance of the Congyun Sword and Heaven-Overturning Palm grew increasingly refined and imbued with a divine essence, Li Fan began to understand the underlying principle of the Tianxuan Mirror's deduction process.

In simple terms, the mirror creates a hypothetical divine ability target and assigns it the expected effects and powers of the technique.

The mirror then reverses the process, deducing all the necessary conditions for mastering the divine ability and summarizing them as experiences for the cultivator.

This process is akin to ancient cultivators observing others' battles, instantly learning, and replicating the divine abilities they saw—what is known as "learning through analogy and reaching the same destination by different paths."

The more deduction attempts made, the greater the contribution cost.

When the cost of each attempt rose to 100,000 points, the success rate had barely increased to 18%.

"This deduction process really isn’t something ordinary people can afford to play with."

"The Tianxuan Mirror’s deduction capability must be far more efficient than this. This setup is clearly deliberate, designed to maliciously drain contribution points."

"By now, so much has already been invested, and the sunk cost is too high. Very few people would be willing to give up at this point. It’s like being trapped in a quagmire, unable to escape," Li Fan mused to himself.

After some thought, he uploaded his insights into the Congyun Sword and the Heaven-Overturning Palm divine abilities to supplement the data.

Instantly, the success rate skyrocketed from 18% to 78%, while the deduction cost remained unchanged.

“It seems that deductions with theoretical support are far superior to fabricating out of thin air,” Li Fan thought silently as he initiated another deduction.

In the blink of an eye, a seven-colored divine light descended from the heavens, enveloping the miniature version of Li Fan.

The small figure seemed to attain enlightenment, displaying an expression of profound realization, as though achieving the Dao in the morning and being willing to die by evening.

Letting out a resonant cry, it struck with a single palm. Instantly, the void ahead twisted, and space-time was overturned. Several blue sword lights flashed repeatedly, slicing through the void.

At the same time, a golden light appeared before Li Fan’s eyes, accompanied by stirring music resonating in his ears.

“Congratulations! You have successfully comprehended the divine ability: [Heaven-Shattering Heart Sword].”

“Divine Ability Description: Unrestricted by form or technique, every punch, palm, blade, or sword carries the power to shatter the heavens.”

“Would you like to spend 500,000 contribution points to infuse the divine ability?”

“You may also continue to refine the [Heaven-Shattering Heart Sword], enhancing it to perfection. Remember, the Dao has no limits.”

“The first advanced deduction comes at a 50% discount, costing only 50,000 contribution points. Success rate: 8%.”

As the series of prompts from the Tianxuan Mirror echoed in his mind, Li Fan’s expression fluctuated, and he finally couldn’t hold back his emotions.

He had initially believed his contribution points were abundant—enough to last him a lifetime.

But now…

Even with that, the Tianxuan Mirror still outmaneuvered him!

With a "let's give it a try" mindset, Li Fan initiated the advanced deduction.

The first discounted attempt cost 50,000 contribution points, with an 8% success rate. Failed.

The second attempt consumed 150,000 contribution points, but the success rate increased to 10%. Still failed.

…

Even though Li Fan had accumulated an enormous amount of contribution points—practically windfalls—watching them deplete rapidly left him heartbroken.

In this cultivation method deduction, contribution points seemed to lose their inherent value, becoming mere fuel to power the process.

If the success rate steadily increased with each attempt, Li Fan might have gritted his teeth and pushed through to achieve the advanced version of the divine ability.

But the Tianxuan Mirror’s schemes exceeded his expectations.

When the success rate reached 50% and another failure occurred, Li Fan discovered that it had stopped increasing!

Instead, a new progress bar appeared before him:

“Specialized Directional Deduction.”

“When the success rate of divine ability advancement deductions stagnates, failures can contribute to the progress of a directional deduction. Once the progress bar is full, you can specify the enhancement direction of the advanced divine ability.”

“For example: destructive power, mystique, priority, etc.”

…

The success rate did not steadily increase, but the contribution cost for each deduction unequivocally escalated.

At this rate, refining an advanced version of the [Heaven-Shattering Heart Sword] would require an astronomical amount of contribution points.

Chapter 630: A Thousand Years of Longevity

Li Fan thought for a moment and eventually decided to give up for the time being.

"You may choose to consume 100,000 contribution points to save the progress of this advancement and deduction."

"The next time, you can continue the deduction from the saved checkpoint."

"You currently have three divine ability deduction record slots available. Additional slots can be unlocked by spending contribution points."

...

Li Fan fell silent.

In the end, he reluctantly chose to save the progress.

Then, he infused the [Heaven-Shattering Heart Sword] with divine abilities.

A brilliant seven-colored radiance suddenly burst from the miniature figure of Li Fan.

The figure transitioned from solid to illusory, slowly solidifying. Finally, it transformed into a seven-colored prism that floated gently before Li Fan.

Li Fan reached out and grasped it. In an instant, the prism seemed to dissolve, shrinking smaller and smaller.

At the same time, countless images and insights surged into Li Fan’s mind.

It was the perfect fusion of the Congyun Sea Sword and the Heaven-Overturning Palm, forming a brand-new divine ability.

The effect of the divine infusion was even better than achieving an epiphany on his own.

When the prism in his hand completely disappeared, Li Fan had fully mastered the [Heaven-Shattering Heart Sword].

"Congratulations! You have successfully acquired a new divine ability."

"Would you like to apply the new divine ability to your character template?"

Of course, Li Fan confirmed his choice.

Moments later, a brand-new miniature figure of Li Fan appeared before him.

Its expression was calm, and its aura was noticeably stronger than that of the previous figure.

Using this new character, Li Fan initiated challenges against other cultivators.

Within moments, amidst the shifting heavens and earth and the flashing sword light, his opponent was already defeated.

"You have accumulated a battle experience entry. Would you like to extract and infuse it?"

The mechanical voice of the Tianxuan Mirror rang out once more.

"No need for now. Activate the auto-challenge function," Li Fan said in a deep voice.

"Proxy mode has been activated. In this mode, the specified character template will automatically seek suitable targets for battles. Each proxy battle costs 10,000 contribution points," the mechanical voice of the Tianxuan Mirror echoed.

"This pricing is much more reasonable," Li Fan thought to himself.

Watching the miniature figure before him autonomously engage in battles with new cultivators, Li Fan exhaled deeply and temporarily exited the [Sitting and Discussing Dao] interface.

Although not much actual time had passed, he felt a peculiar sense of having been away for ages.

Clearing his mind, Li Fan exchanged insights on the Tianxuan Mirror's divine deduction with other cultivators.

It was only then that he realized his earlier actions were indeed quite wasteful.

Typically, ordinary cultivators rely on their own comprehension to deduce divine abilities. Only when they are stuck at a critical point and unable to proceed do they resort to the Tianxuan Mirror.

The reason is simple: the contribution points required for divine deduction with the Tianxuan Mirror are exorbitantly high, far beyond what most cultivators can afford.

"But on the flip side, contribution points are merely a currency used by the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance to maintain its operations. They hold no real intrinsic value."

"If someone could master the permissions of the Tianxuan Mirror, wouldn’t they be able to deduce any divine ability they desire?"

"After two millennia of reconstruction, how powerful have the high-level cultivators of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance become?"

Li Fan couldn’t help but feel astonished.

However, he suddenly recalled a hypothesis he had entertained a long time ago.

The Tianxuan Mirror is the true ruler of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance.

Now, it seems that even if the truth deviates somewhat from his speculation, cultivators may not have absolute control over the Tianxuan Mirror.

Rather than one side having complete control, it’s more like a relationship of mutual cooperation and restraint.

This notion could be glimpsed from the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance’s efforts to manipulate the Xuantian Spirit Locking Formation, requiring the excavation of the Xuantian Sect’s Dharma King.

...

After mastering a new divine ability, Li Fan, who hadn’t engaged in combat for a long time, couldn't help but feel an itch in his hands.

Looking around, he couldn’t immediately find a suitable opponent.

Fortunately, the heavens seemed to be on his side, as he soon encountered the perfect sparring target.

Liu San sent a message, informing him that he had returned to Shenhua Island.

Li Fan’s heart stirred, and he quietly left Congyun City, also heading back to the island.

When he saw Liu San in front of him, he noticed that Liu San seemed slightly older compared to when they had last parted.

"It seems the Samantabhadra True Boat still cannot completely eliminate the effects of the White Mist that depletes one’s lifespan," Li Fan realized inwardly.

However, he didn’t show any signs of knowing this and instead stared at Liu San in apparent surprise.

He then feigned shock and said, "Elder Liu, what happened to you? Has your lifespan decreased?"

Liu San nodded.

Li Fan pretended to be furious and said, "Outrageous! When I purchased that Samantabhadra True Boat, the seller swore it would completely isolate the White Mist’s effect of consuming lifespan."

"How dare he deceive me! I’ll make him pay for this!"

Li Fan, filled with anger, turned around as if to leave immediately.

Seeing how concerned Li Fan was and how angry he became on his behalf, a hint of emotion flashed in Liu San’s eyes.

He quickly stopped Li Fan and persuaded him, "Young Master, let it go. We are newcomers here, and it’s better to avoid unnecessary conflicts."

"It’s just a few years of lifespan. This old servant’s humble life is insignificant compared to the revival of the Medicine King Sect."

"Besides, merchants tend to exaggerate their claims to sell their products. It may not have been intentional deception."

Under Liu San’s persuasion, Li Fan’s expression shifted several times before he finally snorted coldly and gave up on immediate revenge.

"Did you gain anything during this trip, Elder Liu?" After making the appropriate gestures, Li Fan asked calmly.

"Thankfully, I did not fail in my mission!" Liu San’s face revealed a smile.

"The heavens have not forsaken our Medicine King Sect! I searched nearly all the locations you marked, finding nothing."

"Just as I was about to give up, I discovered traces of the Longevity Valley at the last location!"

Hearing this, Li Fan’s eyes lit up.

Liu San, looking excited, continued, "I entered the valley and saw it for myself. Perhaps due to its location within the White Mist Barrier, the secret realm seems untouched by cultivators for thousands of years."

"Compared to when we last left, the spiritual energy inside, the growth density of spiritual plants, and medicinal herbs have all improved significantly!"

"Moreover, the formation we set up back then is still operational, having automatically collected and stored a large amount of mature herbs over the years."

Liu San spoke at length, finally concluding, "Reclaiming the Longevity Valley gives us hope for the revival of the Medicine King Sect!"

Hearing this, Li Fan also became visibly excited. "Excellent! Elder Liu, this time you have truly made a great contribution!"

"Once the matters here at Congyun Sea are settled in a few days, we will head to the Longevity Valley."

Liu San nodded in agreement.

However, he seemed to recall something and furrowed his brows slightly.

This subtle change did not escape Li Fan’s sharp eyes. He asked, "Elder Liu, do you have any concerns?"

Chapter 631: White Mist Reversing Life and Death

Liu San did not answer immediately but pondered for a moment before asking a question.

“Does the Young Master know if the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance has any similar strongholds within the White Mist Barrier?”

Li Fan was slightly taken aback. “What does Elder Liu mean by this?”

Stroking his beard, Liu San slowly explained, “Earlier, while maneuvering the Samantabhadra True Boat through the vast white mist, I happened to glimpse a group of cultivators acting strangely.”

“They had no protective measures and were exposed directly to the essence-devouring white mist, moving sluggishly as though searching for something.”

“What was even more peculiar was that I could not sense any signs of life from them. At first, I thought they were corpses acting purely on instinct. But just as I was about to approach and investigate, one of them seemed to notice me and turned their head. At the same time, I felt a spiritual sense probing me.”

“At that time, my main task was to locate the Longevity Valley. To avoid unnecessary trouble, I sent out a spiritual message indicating I had no malicious intent, then withdrew on my own initiative.”

“Since Longevity Valley is hidden within the White Mist, it is possible that our Medicine King Sect may encounter these individuals again when entering or exiting. It would be wise to prepare in advance.”

As Liu San narrated this incident, Li Fan's expression gradually became serious.

“Cultivators within the White Mist, devoid of any life force, yet behaving just like ordinary cultivators?”

Almost instantly, Li Fan recalled the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance cultivators from his previous life, who emerged from the White Mist over four hundred years later—dead yet still alive.

“Have they already succeeded in reversing the principles of life and death?”

Li Fan immediately asked Liu San for more details about those cultivators.

After a brief exchange, Li Fan’s heart settled slightly.

“Wandering mindlessly like walking corpses—they are still far from truly being reborn after death. However, they indeed exhibit characteristics of life emerging from dead bodies.”

This mysterious Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign, who reversed the principles of life and death and secretly proved their Dao without anyone noticing, was utterly enigmatic.

Even in his past life, up until the unification of Xuanhuang and the establishment of the Heavenly Alliance, this person never revealed themselves.

Clearly, they intentionally concealed their identity. Regardless of their motives, it was evident they did not wish to be disturbed.

“This matter is undoubtedly bizarre, but it has nothing to do with our Medicine King Sect. If the sky falls, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance can hold it up. If we encounter them again, we should simply avoid them,” Li Fan instructed after pretending to deliberate for a moment.

Liu San also felt that Li Fan’s words made sense, so he nodded and did not dwell on the matter further.

“Longevity Valley is currently located within the White Mist Barrier, at the border of Luoyan Prefecture and Lueying Prefecture,” Liu San said as he took out a map and marked the location.

“It should be roughly here. The perception of distance within the White Mist may be slightly skewed, but the general direction is accurate.”

Li Fan glanced at the map and committed it to memory.

“It’s not far from Congyun Sea, so we can relocate there at any time. Moreover, Luoyan Prefecture is much more prosperous than Congyun Sea and would be a better springboard for the rise of our Medicine King Sect.”

“However, to avoid arousing Zhou Qingang’s suspicions, the affairs in Congyun Sea must be gradually and carefully detached,” Li Fan explained.

“Young Master can decide as you see fit. After so many years, a little more time won’t hurt. Besides, I’ve already resealed the entrance to Longevity Valley using secret methods. There is no way outsiders will detect it,” Liu San replied with a nod.

Having settled the matter, Li Fan returned to the main topic and proposed a sparring session.

Liu San immediately became interested and said, “It seems the young master has gained something new from his cultivation?”

“Indeed, Elder Liu, you don’t know. The Tianxuan Mirror of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is truly a supreme artifact. It possesses all sorts of incredible powers, even assisting me in deriving divine abilities. Unfortunately, Elder Liu, your cultivation is too advanced, and your origins cannot be concealed. Otherwise, you could experience it yourself,” Li Fan remarked with a mix of awe and regret.

“Haha, no matter how many benefits it offers, my life has reached its peak. As long as you, the sect leader and the others, can enjoy them, it’s enough for me,” Liu San replied nonchalantly.

Afterward, the two went to the martial arts chamber of the Medicine King Sect to conduct a sparring session.

Although it was called sparring, it was merely Liu San acting as a training partner.

Even if the "Heaven-Shattering Heart Sword" was extraordinary, it was still difficult to span two major realms and cause any real harm to someone like Liu San, whose cultivation was at the Dao Integration level.

However, Liu San was full of praise for this divine ability.

“The young master is indeed worthy of being the designated successor by the sect master, to have comprehended such a profound divine ability.”

“One strike shatters the heavens, the sword moves at will. Its destructive power is astonishing, and it’s difficult to defend against. If you, young master, were to break through to the Soul Transformation stage, facing this divine ability would certainly be troublesome even for me.”

Liu San extended his left index finger and looked at a shallow blood mark on it as he spoke.

Looking at his "achievement," Li Fan roughly estimated the power of the Heaven-Shattering Heart Sword.

In fact, he hadn’t used his full strength, only employing the power of one of his Cave Heaven domains.

If the power of all five elemental Cave Heavens were fully circulated, the explosive destructive power would likely be at least ten times stronger.

At that time, it wouldn’t be just a scratch.

“To wound but not kill. After all, the gap between Dao Integration and Nascent Soul is far greater than that between Foundation Establishment and Nascent Soul,” Li Fan thought to himself.

In the days that followed, Li Fan instructed Liu San to select some trustworthy individuals from the still-dormant cultivators of the Medicine King Sect and awaken them first.

Before long, the Crimson Flame will burn the sea, and the great calamity would descend. The foundations Li Fan had laid in this place would be buried along with it.

Reestablishing his identity later would not be easy.

Therefore, it was necessary to take advantage of this remaining time to expedite the process of integrating the Medicine King Sect cultivators into the alliance.

Liu San also understood the current situation. In an environment where dual cultivation of laws was no longer possible, cultivation methods were more precious than ever, especially high-level ones. Thus, he was particularly cautious in his selection. However, Liu San had never indulged in power struggles in his earlier years, focusing instead on cultivation and alchemy while following Liu Ruchen.

As a result, he had few confidants and only a general understanding of the disciples' characters within the Medicine King Sect.

After much thought, he secretly approached Li Fan and suggested a method of "forcible control."

Although this fit perfectly with Li Fan's intentions, he still needed to act hesitant on the surface.

Pretending to hesitate, Li Fan lowered his head and remained silent.

Seeing this, Liu San persuaded him, saying, “Young master, you must understand that mercy has no place in leadership. The current circumstances are extraordinary and leave no room for error. Human nature is complex and unpredictable. You can’t expect everyone to be as devoted as we are, willing to give their all for the revival of the Medicine King Sect.”

As if recalling something, Liu San sneered, “There are quite a few traitors within the Medicine King Sect.”

“In those days…”

Liu San paused and continued, “Now that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is stronger than the Ten Great Immortal Sects, there’s no guarantee that when these people wake up and see the alliance’s grandeur, they won’t entertain the idea of defecting.”

Chapter 632: Subtle Changes in the World

"One person's defection is manageable, but what I fear most is them seeking merit by sacrificing our Medicine King Sect."

Liu San's eyebrows slightly furrowed as he said, "Therefore, the Young Master must prepare thoroughly."

Li Fan feigned hesitation but eventually let out a long sigh and reluctantly agreed.

"The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance has everything one could need. As long as we have enough contributions, acquiring a powerful controlling technique shouldn't be too difficult."

"It's just that we've already accumulated significant contribution debt..."

Hearing this, Liu San patted his chest confidently, reassuring Li Fan.

"This time, when I returned, I brought some top-quality mature herbs from the Longevity Valley. They should be enough to refine some high quality Longevity Pills."

Li Fan nodded. "In that case, I will have to trouble you again, Elder Liu."

Liu San waved it off without concern and immediately led a group of disciples to begin refining the Longevity Pills.

Meanwhile, Li Fan exited the Medicine King's Cauldron, intending to return to Congyun Immortal City to make preparations for their eventual departure.

Once the Congyun Sea disappears, the Immortal Alliance will likely investigate the surviving cultivators from the area.

As members of the Medicine King Sect are all registered as being "from the Congyun Sea," if only they survive this calamity, it might arouse suspicion.

To avoid this, Li Fan planned to muddy the waters. He intended to find an excuse to send out another group of people from the Congyun Sea. The number of survivors would need to be at least double the registered cultivators of the Medicine King Sect to make it appear reasonable.

As he deliberated over names, one by one passing through his mind, he was about to leave when he suddenly heard the cry of a baby.

Startled, Li Fan scanned with his spiritual sense, and his expression became somewhat peculiar.

It turned out that, being young men and women full of vigor, some had inevitably developed romantic feelings for each other while living together on the island.

To his surprise, the newborn's mother was none other than the mother of Han Wuyou from his previous life, though her father was now a different man.

"So, in this lifetime, Han Wuyou won't exist?"

"Does this mean that nothing is truly predestined? Or does fate itself constantly shift with the actions of living beings?"

Li Fan's eyes narrowed slightly as he fell into deep thought.

The birth of new life always brings hope, especially to these young people who had been confined for so long.

They gazed at the wrinkled face of the baby girl with genuine joy, grinning foolishly.

Su Xiaomei, in particular, was overjoyed, hopping around and clamoring to hold the baby. However, she was firmly stopped by Xiao Heng.

Watching the warm scene on the island, a distant memory of a similar moment surfaced in Li Fan's mind, causing a fleeting ripple in his gaze.

But the emotion quickly dissipated.

"Without longevity, all is fleeting."

Having witnessed too many instances of parents burying their children and personally experiencing numerous separations through life and death, Li Fan no longer dwelled on such matters.

With a cold heart, he turned away and flew toward Congyun Immortal City in the clouds.

Upon his return to the city, Li Fan spotted a familiar figure.

"It's her? So, she also sensed her father's peril?" Li Fan's eyes flickered.

A young girl was sitting in a room in the Administrative Hall, curiously looking around. She was none other than He Zhenghao's daughter, He Xinxin.

Meanwhile, He Zhenghao, usually idle and not very busy with work, appeared to be working frantically.

"Lord He, please, you must help our island!"

"My lord, the Taian Fruits from Taian Island have had a poor harvest this year. Could we ask for some leniency?"

...

A crowd of people surrounded He Zhenghao, following him as he entered the room.

He Xinxin first studied He Zhenghao carefully, confirming that this man was indeed her father, and a look of surprise flashed across her face.

Then, noticing how busy he appeared at the center of the crowd, her face showed a trace of astonishment.

After all, she was young and couldn’t hide her emotions well.

He Zhenghao noticed all the expressions on his daughter’s face and couldn’t help feeling a bit proud.

“Ahem…”

He cleared his throat, putting on a stern face, and reprimanded, “I’ve told you all—I’m handling urgent matters right now! Here’s what we’ll do: come back tomorrow, and I’ll make sure everything is properly taken care of!”

The cultivators around He Zhenghao exchanged glances and nodded in agreement before scattering and disappearing in no time.

Li Fan found the scene amusing. This group was clearly invited by He Zhenghao to help him put on an act, just to impress his daughter.

“What a little scheme…”

Li Fan continued observing from the shadows.

Meeting his daughter for the first time, He Zhenghao seemed somewhat nervous. He stared at He Xinxin for a long time before murmuring, “She looks like me… truly like me…”

He Xinxin timidly looked back at He Zhenghao. When their gazes met, she quickly averted her eyes in a fluster.

After a long silence, He Xinxin finally mustered up the courage and softly called out, “Fa…ther…”

He Zhenghao’s eyes instantly filled with tears.

However, he quickly suppressed his emotions and stepped forward hastily, holding He Xinxin’s small hands.

“Ah…”

“Let me take a good look at you…”

He Zhenghao seemed to be in a dream.

“I never imagined that I’d have a daughter…”

He Xinxin’s eyes reddened as well, and she began to sob softly.

A reunion between a father and daughter who had been separated for many years was naturally a touching and emotional scene.

After a long time, their emotions finally calmed down.

He Xinxin said, “I wanted to come find you a few years ago, but Mother suddenly appeared and stopped me.”

“She wouldn’t let me come no matter what, so it was delayed.”

He Xinxin pouted, looking quite upset.

Hearing this, He Zhenghao’s expression grew somber.

“It’s my fault. It’s only natural that your mother wouldn’t want you to see me. Don’t blame her.”

As he spoke, He Zhenghao hesitated for a moment. “But why did your mother suddenly let you come now?”

“Has she forgiven me? Has she changed her mind?”

He Zhenghao was overjoyed.

He Xinxin’s face turned slightly red, and she tugged at He Zhenghao’s clothes, shaking her head slightly.

“No, Father. Mother doesn’t know. I succeeded in establishing my foundation and sneaked over here without telling her.”

He Xinxin stuck out her tongue, looking a little embarrassed.

He Zhenghao’s body stiffened slightly, and his expression became a bit awkward.

Seeing this, He Xinxin quickly changed the subject.

“Father, you don’t know, but I came here at the risk of being scolded because I have something very important to warn you about.”

He Xinxin’s face turned serious.

“What important matter?” He Zhenghao, though somewhat dismissive, still tilted his head to listen, noticing her solemn demeanor.

He Xinxin lowered her voice and said, “When I broke through, I had a premonition that your life is in danger, Father.”

“That’s why I traveled all this way to find you.”

“I’ve discovered that the danger comes from this Congyun Sea. Father, come back with me. As long as you leave this place and return to Tianyu Prefecture, you’ll be safe.”

Chapter 633: Zheng Hao’s Dilemma

“Danger?” He Zhenghao was slightly stunned.

Then, he dismissed the idea with a smile and said, “Xin Xin, you’re overthinking this! Your father now oversees the administration of the Congyun Sea and stays in the Bureau Hall all day, without venturing out. How could there be any danger?”

“It’s true!” Seeing her father’s disbelief, He Xinxin stomped her foot in frustration.

She leaned closer and whispered, “Father, you don’t know. My Foundation Establishment treasure is an innate companion artifact called the Dao Pattern Compass. The cultivation technique I practice was custom-made by Mother for me, known as [Heavenly Dao Net]...”

After listening to his daughter’s explanation, He Zhenghao was slightly tongue-tied.

He had thought that by following the secret envoy, he had done well for himself, earning enough contribution points to barely count as a prominent figure.

Yet, compared to the deep-rooted heritage of cultivation families like the Heng clan in Tianyu Prefecture, he realized there was still a vast gap.

At the very least, the concept of a custom-tailored cultivation technique was something far beyond his current capability.

This realization left He Zhenghao with a bitter feeling in his heart.

“There is indeed a real danger, Father. You should leave with me,” He Xinxin urged, running another deduction in front of him, which yielded the same unsettling result. She couldn’t help but try to persuade him again.

Looking at her serious demeanor, He Zhenghao began to feel doubtful.

“It’s impossible. How could there be a life-threatening crisis in Congyun City? I’ve been upright and honest lately, not doing anything to provoke the secret envoy’s wrath.”

Pondering over it carefully, He Zhenghao’s brow furrowed tightly.

“Could it be that the Five Elders Association is up to their old tricks, planning another surprise attack on Congyun Immortal City?” Suddenly, He Zhenghao recalled past events in the Congyun Sea and was startled.

“That can’t be… Didn’t we just host a friendly exchange meeting recently?” His expression grew uncertain.

Pacing back and forth in the room, his face betrayed his growing anxiety.

He Xinxin, seeing her father’s indecision, couldn’t help but feel both worried and frustrated.

Moreover, He Zhenghao’s reaction fell far short of her expectations. She had thought he would immediately follow her back to Tianyu Prefecture after hearing the deduction results. Disappointed, she began to feel a bit resentful of his lack of trust.

Unaware of his daughter’s emotional turmoil, He Zhenghao continued to hesitate.

It wasn’t that he didn’t believe her. As someone who had personally witnessed the power and influence of the Heng clan in Tianyu Prefecture, he understood their capability all too well. The [Heavenly Dao Net] his daughter practiced did not appear to be ordinary.

But He Zhenghao had risen from a destitute and marginalized guardian of an island to become a key figure in the Congyun Sea, with countless cultivators eager to curry favor with him.

This hard-earned status was not something he could abandon easily, not even for his daughter’s warning.

Furthermore, his roots were firmly planted in the Congyun Sea. Without the connections he had painstakingly built here, he would be reduced to nothing.

Even if he returned to Tianyu Prefecture, what would he become?

A Golden Core cultivator too insignificant to even qualify as a guard for the Heng family.

What face would he have to meet Heng Ruoshui again?

…

Gradually, He Zhenghao made up his mind.

With a sly glint in his eye, an idea came to him. Smiling, he said, “Xin Xin…”

He Xinxin glared at him, puffing her cheeks in anger.

He Zhenghao, slightly embarrassed, straightened his expression and said, “I know you care about me and that your cultivation technique is extraordinary. But the world is unpredictable, and the art of deduction is, after all, just that—deduction.”

“It only reveals one of many possible outcomes for the future. As for whether it will actually happen…”

“Even a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign wouldn’t dare guarantee it, would they?”

He Xinxin, unconvinced, pursed her lips but couldn’t find a rebuttal.

At this moment, He Zhenghao spoke again, "Moreover, speaking of the art of deduction, my direct superior—Secret Envoy of the Congyun Sea and a cultivator of the Ancient Heavenly Mechanism Sect, Master Li Fan—he's far superior to you!"

"That's truly world-shaking and awe-inspiring! I'm a trusted confidant of Lord Secret Envoy. If there really were any danger, how could he not warn me?"

Hearing this, He Xinxin's eyes widened in surprise. "Li Fan of the Heavenly Mechanism Sect?"

She had heard of the name Li Fan before. He had accurately predicted several major events that were about to occur in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, something she herself could not achieve.

Could it be that she had indeed made a miscalculation? For a moment, He Xinxin hesitated, feeling unsure.

Seeing the effect of his words, He Zhenghao immediately pressed his advantage.

"If you're still worried, I'll ask secret envoy myself in your presence."

As he spoke, He Zhenghao took out a shard of a jade slip left by Li Fan and began summoning.

In no time, Li Fan's projection appeared in midair in the room.

"What is it?" Li Fan asked indifferently, his expression emotionless.

At the same time, his gaze casually swept over to He Xinxin.

The young girl showed no fear, meeting Li Fan's eyes directly.

In contrast, He Zhenghao lowered his head nervously, recounting the situation in a submissive manner.

"Dare I ask, Master, will there be any upheaval in the Congyun Sea soon?" After explaining, he looked at Li Fan with hopeful anticipation.

A silence fell over the room.

On the projection, the Heaven and Earth Divination Dice seemed to spin unceasingly in Li Fan's palm.

"Dao Pattern Compass? As expected, the Heng family of Tianyu lives up to its reputation."

"Your daughter possesses such exceptional talent that her future achievements will certainly not be beneath mine."

After a brief pause, Li Fan did not directly answer He Zhenghao's question but instead looked at He Xinxin and praised her.

He Zhenghao was stunned. He had not expected lord secret envoy to discern his daughter's abilities with just one glance.

He Xinxin, too, was astonished, her mouth slightly agape.

"You flatter me, Lord," He Zhenghao replied hurriedly.

"Such promising youth," Li Fan shook his head, seeming to recall something with a hint of nostalgia.

Then, he pointed a finger toward He Xinxin's forehead.

"Lord!" He Zhenghao's expression changed slightly, but he quickly realized Li Fan bore no malice and was merely imparting knowledge to his daughter. This calmed him.

Soon, golden light dissipated, and He Xinxin regained her composure.

She began examining the newfound knowledge in her mind.

Taiwei Celestial Calculations, Thousand Mechanisms Hidden Records,Theories of Qi Mechanism Circulation...

These were works of the Ancient Heavenly Mechanism Sect?

Moreover, they were versions she had never encountered before.

Her eyes lit up, and she was overjoyed.

With a radiant smile, she bowed and said softly, "Thank you, Senior."

"No need to be so formal. It's rare to find a suitable candidate. Besides, these are not particularly valuable," Li Fan replied with a wave of his hand.

Then, he turned his gaze to He Zhenghao.

He Zhenghao felt his heart skip a beat.

"Will there be upheaval in the Congyun Sea?" Li Fan chuckled lightly.

"If I'm not leaving, what are you so afraid of, He Zhenghao?"

Chapter 634: Zheng Hao’s Ambition

Chapter 634: Zheng Hao's Ambition

"You, what are you so afraid of?"

These words struck like a dagger to the heart. Hearing them, He Zhenghao broke out into a cold sweat on the spot.

"I swear I have no ulterior motives. Please, my lord, discern my sincerity!" He immediately voiced his loyalty.

"Think carefully and act wisely," Li Fan snorted coldly. Then his illusory figure shattered and disappeared without a trace.

It was only after a long while that He Zhenghao dared to straighten his bent posture.

Wiping the sweat from his forehead, he exhaled deeply. Suddenly realizing his daughter was nearby, he coughed lightly and quickly composed himself.

Fortunately, He Xinxin hadn't noticed her father’s awkwardness. She clapped her small hands on her chest and exclaimed, "Senior Li is truly awe-inspiring! He's almost on par with those Dao Integration Immortal Sages we've seen before. He really scared me."

"Hmph, that's only natural. The honored secret envoy might even be a Long..." He Zhenghao stopped himself abruptly, realizing his words might be inappropriate.

Luckily, his daughter hadn’t caught on to his implication. He quickly changed the topic.

"What did he mean by what he just said?"

"He didn’t outright deny Xinxin’s deduction. He merely said he wouldn’t leave..."

Moments later, a trace of alarm flashed through He Zhenghao’s eyes.

"Could it be that something truly shocking will happen in the Congyun Sea?"

He fell into deep thought for a while.

Meanwhile, in the depths of the Administrative Hall, Li Fan, who had been observing He Zhenghao’s every expression, remained indifferent.

"Abandon power and flee for your life, or cling to it with a gambler's hope and refuse to leave..."

"He Zhenghao, what will you choose?"
