Based on Li Fan’s understanding of He Zhenghao, the latter would undoubtedly choose to stay in the Congyun Sea. Even so, Li Fan hoped this version of He Zhenghao might surprise him.

Shifting his focus away from He Zhenghao, Li Fan used the Envoy Token to summon various internal members of the Congyun Sea’s administration.

"Lord secret envoy hasn’t summoned us in ages. I wonder what the urgency is?"

"It’s strange. I haven’t heard of any critical missions lately."

As the crowd discussed, He Zhenghao remained caught in inner turmoil, his expression distracted.

Gao Yuan noticed this, his eyes revealing a thoughtful look. However, he refrained from asking immediately and instead made a mental note of it.

Before long, once everyone had gathered, Li Fan appeared leisurely.

"Greetings, Lord Secret Envoy!" the crowd greeted in unison.

"There's no need for formalities. Please, take your seats," Li Fan said warmly.

"I called you here today not for any pressing matters. As you know, while I hold the title of Secret Envoy of Congyun Immortal City, I have rarely interfered in administrative affairs. Yet, the governance of the Congyun Sea has never faltered. In fact, its overall ranking among the regions has even improved in recent years, and this is all thanks to your hard work."

Li Fan paused, scanning the expressions of those present, before continuing:

"As the saying goes, ‘one good turn deserves another.’ Recently, I divined a new opportunity and decided to share it with you all."

The cultivators in the hall perked up at these words, their eyes lighting up.

Who was Li Fan? A figure who wouldn’t bat an eye at contributions in the tens of millions! If he spoke of an opportunity, it was bound to be extraordinary. The group eagerly looked at him with anticipation.

"I have deduced that, in the near future, a hidden cave abode will rise from the depths of the Congyun Sea. The opportunity lies within that abode!" Li Fan announced solemnly.

As soon as the words left his mouth, the cultivators began to stir restlessly.

"Of course, opportunities always coexist with danger. Whether you choose to pursue them or not is entirely up to you." Li Fan said these final words indifferently, his expression ambiguous, before disappearing from everyone's sight.

Once they confirmed that Li Fan had left, the hall immediately erupted into an uproar.

"What exactly does Lord Envoy mean by this? Calling us all here from so far away, only to say something so simple?"

"Strange! Truly strange!"

"An underwater cave residence—could it be the ruins of an ancient sect? Hmm, for something to be called an opportunity by the lord and warrant such a commotion, it must be extraordinary!"

…

The crowd's faces were filled with excitement as they buzzed with discussion.

He Zhenghao, however, was filled with doubts and confusion.

"Friend He, do you perhaps know some inside information?"

At that moment, he suddenly heard Gao Yuan's voice transmitted directly to him.

After a moment's hesitation, He Zhenghao decided to briefly explain the recent events to Gao Yuan, hoping to hear his thoughts.

"Something is about to happen in the Congyun Sea?" Gao Yuan was initially startled but maintained his composure.

"But the lord said he wouldn’t leave. After questioning your intentions, he then announced the opportunity of the cave residence..."

Gao Yuan’s mind raced as he quickly analyzed the situation.

Before long, a realization struck him.

"So that's it!"

"Brother Gao, enlighten me!" He Zhenghao, feeling as though he’d found a savior, eagerly pressed for an explanation.

"The lord is using this matter of the cave residence to give us a hint. If something is happening in the Congyun Sea, yet the lord himself is unwilling to leave, why is that?"

"Because opportunity and danger go hand in hand!" Gao Yuan said excitedly. "Given the resources the lord has at his disposal, for him to value this opportunity so much..."

"It must be something that could lead to transcendence..."

"The Spirit of Heaven and Earth?"

He Zhenghao exchanged a glance with Gao Yuan, and both arrived at the same conclusion.

"So that's how it is..." He Zhenghao murmured to himself as if everything suddenly made sense.

"The lord fell from the Longevity Immortal Realm and wants to reattain it. He will likely have to follow the steps of the new method. For him, this is undoubtedly a critical opportunity for integration. I’ve heard that when the Spirit of Heaven and Earth descends, it always stirs up chaos and bloodshed. At that time, not just us Golden Core cultivators but even Nascent Soul and Soul Transformation cultivators might not escape unscathed."

"The descent of the Spirit of Heaven and Earth cannot be spoken of directly. Any disclosure might trigger changes due to the sensitivity of destiny. As loyal subordinates of the lord, he cannot bear to see us perish meaninglessly in the calamity. Thus, he chose an indirect method to alert us."

…

He Zhenghao suddenly understood.

While his heart was filled with excitement, a certain inappropriate emotion began to stir within him.

"The Spirit of Heaven and Earth..."

He Zhenghao squinted his eyes.

"So, Brother Gao, what do you plan to do?" After some time, he looked at Gao Yuan, whose expression was also shifting unpredictably, and asked.

"Friend He, have you ever heard of this saying?" Gao Yuan looked at He Zhenghao.

"What is it?"

"There is no greater merit than following the dragon," Gao Yuan said in a faint tone.

"If the lord successfully integrates with the Dao, then we, his steadfast and loyal subordinates..."

Hearing this, He Zhenghao suddenly felt a fire of ambition ignite within him.

Even deeper in his mind, a thought he dared not voice began to take form.

The Spirit of Heaven and Earth belongs to those with virtue.

If the lord envoy fails to claim the Spirit of Heaven and Earth, then perhaps, just perhaps, there might be the slightest chance for him...

After all, history in the Xuanhuang Realm has recorded instances of such occurrences.

Chapter 635 – Parting Ways from Here

Chapter 635 - Parting Ways from Here

At this moment, He Zhenghao had already cast aside his daughter's warning.

In his mind, even if the process of refining the Spirit of Heaven and Earth was extremely dangerous, he was not a reckless person. He would act according to the situation—if it truly became impossible, he would not throw his life away in vain. Taking some risks to gamble on an opportunity to ascend in one leap—why not?

However, He Zhenghao could never have imagined that the true Spirit of Heaven and Earth was on an entirely different level from what he had envisioned.

Ultimately, it was a matter of his limited perspective. Despite his broad travels and wide social connections, He Zhenghao was only at the Golden Core stage. He had never personally seen, nor even found records in ancient texts, detailing the true power of the Spirit of Heaven and Earth.

He merely knew of its existence.

It was like a farmer imagining the emperor's golden plow—far from reality. This, too, seemed to seal He Zhenghao’s tragic fate in this lifetime.

...

Meanwhile, while the gathered cultivators were still in the Administrative Hall discussing Li Fan’s prophecy regarding the underwater ascension of a hidden cave,

Li Fan himself had quietly arrived at the cave’s location.

Over a mere few hundred miles, the seabed formed three major fault steps, resembling steep terraces. Each step had a height difference of four to five thousand meters. Due to intense earth vein activity, towering mountain ranges had risen from the seabed, creating a spectacular and breathtaking scene—more magnificent than even the mountains on land.

This was the very place where, in his previous life, He Zhenghao had formed his Golden Core: the Three Undersea Faults.

"In my past life, He Zhenghao, though somewhat unremarkable, never lost his drive for progress. The day he obtained the Hidden Dragon Art of Rivers and Mountains, he soared like a dragon from the abyss and rose powerfully. By comprehending the Golden Core through four laws, his future was boundless."

"But in this life, despite wielding far greater power and practicing a Dao Integration cultivation technique, he has been lax in his cultivation, forming his Golden Core with only a single law."

"I gave you the opportunity, but you failed to make use of it."

Li Fan felt a slight sense of regret in his heart.

Shaking his head slightly, he focused on the matter at hand.

Sweeping his divine sense across the mountainous faults below, his eyes narrowed slightly.

"Chaoyuan Sect..."

What he had said earlier in the Administrative Hall was no empty talk. Though the Chaoyuan Sect was shrouded in mystery and filled with dangers, in his previous life, after Shuofeng, Su Xiaomei, and the others entered, they all returned safely—and each had ascended an entire cultivation realm.

Setting aside the unexpected variable of He Zhenghao’s Foundation Establishment in the previous life, this ancient ruin was originally supposed to leave the Congyun Sea in the year 22 of anchoring and travel toward Jiushan State Prefecture.

Thus, at this moment, it remained silently hidden beneath the faults.

Having fully inherited the memories of Dugu Chang of the Medicine King Sect, Li Fan searched for traces of the Chaoyuan Sect within those memories but found nothing.

Not only that, but even the Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace, which claimed dominance over Congyun Sea, was similarly absent.

Neither sect could be found.

"Strange... Whether it is the Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace or the Chaoyuan Sect, the records in the Tianxuan Mirror indicate that they were renowned sects of ancient times. Although they couldn't compare to the Ten Great Immortal Sects, they were definitely stronger than the Medicine King Sect."

"So why do none of the Medicine King Sect's disciples have any knowledge of them?"

"Could it be that they existed in entirely different time periods? Did the Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace emerge more recently?"

Li Fan pondered for a moment but could not find an answer. Instead, the many clues seemed contradictory, revealing numerous inconsistencies.

Temporarily setting aside his doubts, he turned his gaze toward the seabed below and activated the newly mastered divine ability—Heaven-Shattering Heart Sword.

In the next instant, countless sword lights appeared amid the continuous undersea mountain ranges.

Illuminating the dark seabed, they sent thunderous roars echoing in all directions.

As the mountains crumbled, massive fissures split open across the ocean floor.

As if torn apart by countless sword lights in an instant, the vast underwater wonderland, stretching for hundreds of miles, completely collapsed and disappeared the moment Li Fan willed it.

Amid this catastrophe, Li Fan finally discovered traces of the hidden Chaoyuan Sect.

There was no obstruction—he simply watched as the ruins of ancient structures rose from the depths, breaking through the water’s surface.

Smaller and smaller it became, until it finally took the form of a cave dwelling, drifting toward Jiushan Prefecture.

After reaching the Nascent Soul stage, Li Fan's spiritual perception had become increasingly acute. The moment he directly faced the Chaoyuan Sect ruins, he even felt a faint sense of mortal danger.

"Opportunities in this world are endless. There's no need to take this risk. Let others explore it first, and once the mysteries within are fully understood, I’ll reconsider."

Watching the Chaoyuan Sect relics disappear into the distance, Li Fan thought to himself.

Though Li Fan himself remained indifferent, the emergence of the Chaoyuan Sect ruins caused an uproar among the cultivators.

Moments ago, he had just informed everyone that a mysterious underwater cave dwelling had appeared. Many cultivators hadn't even left the Administrative Hall yet when the relics surfaced.

What a coincidence!

Some cultivators even suspected that the cave dwelling was a fabrication by Li Fan—an elaborate ploy to once again showcase his unfathomable prophetic abilities.

However, this theory was quickly dismissed. The reason was simple—the ancient and solemn aura radiating from the Chaoyuan Sect ruins was impossible to fake.

Furthermore, due to the immense attention the relics attracted, cultivators working together soon identified the origins of the Grand Hall of Taiyuan within the ruins.

The Ancient Immortal Sect—Chaoyuan Sect!

A seasoned Soul Transformation cultivator, well-versed in the history of ancient cultivation, personally vouched for its authenticity, solidifying the relics as genuine.

As a result, cultivators from across Congyun Sea and even throughout the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance were drawn in by the allure of this so-called "fortuitous encounter," pursuing the ruins on their journey.

Among them was someone Li Fan hadn’t expected.

Inside the Administrative Hall

"You're going too? No matter how great the Chaoyuan Sect’s opportunity is, it still can’t compare to… Or are you just going to observe for a while and then return?"

Facing Gao Yuan's farewell, He Zhenghao was completely taken aback.

"Heh. After returning, I kept feeling like something was off. I pondered for three days and nights before I finally figured it out," Gao Yuan said with some emotion.

"To forge iron, one must be strong themselves. No matter how favored I am by my lord, my cultivation is still only at the Golden Core stage. Here in Congyun Sea, I might still hold some authority. But if my lord truly succeeds in his Dao Integration breakthrough, his subordinates will inevitably be filled with Soul Transformation and Nascent Soul cultivators. How could I possibly command respect? To better follow in my lord’s footsteps, I, Gao Yuan, must fight for my own strength!"

He Zhenghao, however, was not convinced by these righteous words. He scrutinized Gao Yuan with a skeptical gaze.

"Don't look at me like that," Gao Yuan chuckled. "I'm not lying to you this time. I’ve already applied for leave from my lord and will be departing immediately."

"What about you, Daoist He?" Gao Yuan gave He Zhenghao a meaningful look.

He Zhenghao hesitated for a moment but ultimately declined the invitation, citing the need for someone to maintain and oversee the affairs of Congyun Sea.

Seeing this, Gao Yuan said no more. He cupped his hands in farewell and swiftly departed.

Chapter 636: The Last Matters of Congyun

Before his departure, Gao Yuan entrusted He Zhenghao with the task of "clearing the identities of the ancient secret realm cultivators."

As a gesture of sincerity, "Zhou Qingang" once again provided a considerable benefit.

Being old colleagues, He Zhenghao readily agreed. Along the way, he also inquired whether Zhou Qingang had any plans to leave Congyun Sea.

Zhou Qingang laughed heartily and assured him that he had no such intentions.

Hearing this, He Zhenghao was immediately relieved. Even someone as trusted as Zhou Qingang, a close confidant of the secret envoy, had no plans to flee, which meant that although the descent of the Spirit of Heaven and Earth carried some risks, it was unlikely to be catastrophic.

Feeling even more certain about his choice, he dismissed his worries and focused on handling the matter of "integrating secret realm cultivators into the alliance."

To him, this was no different from his time guarding Liuli Island, where he helped mortals from outside the realm smuggle across borders.

It was simply a matter of charging per head, something he was quite adept at.

Moreover, he was far bolder than Gao Yuan and had no fear of being discovered by the Immortal Alliance.

As a result, the integration and identity-cleansing of the Medicine King Sect cultivators progressed at an even faster pace.

One after another, cultivators were awakened through bloodline rituals and joined the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, with their contributions being discreetly transferred to Li Fan.

Yet even so, compared to the hundreds of millions of contribution points Li Fan needed to transfer, it was merely a drop in the ocean.

To complete the transfer before the Crimson Flame descended, Li Fan secretly exchanged and purchased standardized spirit stones from other cultivators.

At the same time, he once again reached out to the Five Elders Association.

As before, contact was made through Zhou Qingang. However, this time, the other party acted much faster than before.

Before long, Zhou Qingang once again met with the representative of the Five Elders Association.

The familiar black-robed figure concealed their appearance, yet they clearly remembered the contents of the last transaction.

Without preamble, they asked, "Do you have the results from our previous matter?"

Zhou Qingang smiled faintly. "It seems this matter is truly important to you. Even after so long, you still can’t let it go."

The previous matter, of course, referred to the Five Elders Association’s request for Zhou Qingang to investigate the identity of an ancient cultivator excavated from the ruins of the Purple Heaven Sect.

Li Fan had already extracted the information from Jiao Xiuyuan and intended to use it as leverage in this deal.

The Five Elders Association cultivator replied frankly, "Although we are currently in a ceasefire, everyone knows that peace is destined to be temporary. No one can predict when war will break out again. Moreover, this is only a broad-scale truce—there are still regions where the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and our forces remain in direct confrontation."

"As for the [Xuantian Nether-Locking Formation] of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, we have only found ways to counterbalance it, but to completely dismantle its effects, we need more intelligence."

Zhou Qingang's gaze flickered slightly, but he did not reveal any emotion. Instead, he nodded.

"I have confirmed the identity of the ancient cultivator in question. Now, what price is the Five Elders Association willing to pay for this information?" he said with a subtle smile.

"Is that true?" The Five Elders Association cultivator seemed genuinely shocked, abruptly standing up and staring intently at Zhou Qingang.

Zhou Qingang nodded proudly.

"Good, good!" The other party repeated several times, visibly excited. "Your Heaven-Suppressing Society's methods are truly extraordinary!"

"Wait here a moment—I must report this immediately!"

The black-robed cultivator turned away, falling into silence.

Zhou Qingang observed carefully, but he couldn't discern how the other party was contacting the higher-ups of the Five Elders Association. As expected from the intelligence division of the association, they were not to be underestimated.

Before long, the Five Elders Association cultivator turned back around.

This time, with an air of confidence, Zhou Qingang began negotiating terms.

“The last batch of [True Temptation Fruits] and [Human Dao Stardust] were extremely effective. I’ll need more of them…”

After a round of bargaining, both parties settled on a mutually agreeable price and finalized the transaction.

“The matter is urgent—the sooner we complete the trade, the better,” Zhou Qingang said with implicit meaning.

The cultivator from the Five Elders Association gave Zhou Qingang a long look before nodding in understanding.

“Oh, there’s one more thing.”

Just as the contract was about to be fully signed, Zhou Qingang suddenly asked, “I have some contribution points with a rather complicated origin. I need them converted into standardized spirit stones with a clean and untraceable source. Can you help me with that as well?”

The Five Elders Association cultivator was momentarily stunned, initially thinking Zhou Qingang was backing out. But after hearing the request, he chuckled nonchalantly and said, “A trivial matter. No problem.”

“How much do you need?” he asked.

“Not much, just two to three billion,” Zhou Qingang replied casually.

The Five Elders Association cultivator instantly turned to stone.

“H-How much?” For a moment, he wondered if he had misheard.

Zhou Qingang repeated himself.

“This… Fellow Daoist, please wait a moment. I’ll need to seek approval,” the cultivator wiped the cold sweat off his forehead, his voice trembling slightly.

Zhou Qingang waved his hand dismissively, signaling him to hurry up.

This round of approval took much longer than before. By the time the black-clad cultivator returned, he looked utterly drained.

“Uh… the higher-ups have agreed to your request. However…”

He hesitated before continuing, “The resource list we discussed earlier may need some adjustments.”

“Hm?” Zhou Qingang’s expression darkened with dissatisfaction as he turned to leave.

“Wait! Wait!” The black-clad cultivator hurriedly stepped forward to stop him.

“Everything is negotiable! But, Fellow Daoist, the sheer amount of standardized spirit stones you need is simply too vast. And making it completely undetectable by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is even more difficult!” he explained anxiously.

“If it weren’t difficult, why would I come to you? I could have handled it myself,” Zhou Qingang scoffed coldly.

The Five Elders Association cultivator nodded repeatedly, not daring to argue.

After further negotiations, they eventually reached an agreement.

As a golden light shot into Zhou Qingang’s body, the black-clad spy slowly dissolved within the radiance, disappearing completely.

Yet, there wasn’t a single trace of fear or panic on his face.

Before vanishing, he only reminded Zhou Qingang of the time and place for their next transaction.

Once the spy had completely disappeared, Zhou Qingang carefully examined the area, then shook his head slightly.

“Binding one's life to a contract, without fear of death… Truly an eerie method.”

With that, he erased all traces of the exchange and quietly departed.

Ten days later, Zhou Qingang met another black-clad spy with an eerily similar aura—yet it was clearly not the same person.

Just like before, the new spy handed him a [Voidbright Stone Mother], containing all the requested materials.[1]

After a brief inspection, Li Fan revealed the identity of an ancient cultivator who had been unearthed.

“The Xuantian Sect’s Dharma King?”

Upon hearing this, the spy was visibly shocked.

However, he seemed to have expected such a possibility, as he quickly regained his composure.

1. Previously it was called [Primordial Void Stone Mother] but decided to change it to [Voidbright Stone Mother].

Chapter 637: Blades Over the Heads of All Beings

"So, remnants of the former Xuantian Sect still survive in this world. The one who fled to the Purple Heaven Sect... who exactly is it?" A cultivator from the Five Elders Association murmured to himself in a low voice.

As he spoke, his gaze shifted toward Zhou Qingang.

"Confirming this matter is of great importance to our Five Elders Association. Although this is merely a transaction, we still owe you our gratitude, Daoist friend. As for the contribution points that need to be laundered..."

He paused briefly before continuing, "Within a month, more than ten cultivators with different identities will personally bring secure, standardized spirit stones to you. All you need to do is transfer the contribution points to them."

Sensing that Zhou Qingang might have concerns, he added, "These cultivators all use false identities that our Five Elders Association has carefully crafted over the years. Shortly after the transaction is completed, they will all perish due to various 'accidents.' There will be no risk of being traced or exposed."

With the secret phrases for their rendezvous carefully explained, the transaction between the two parties was essentially complete.

"I look forward to our future cooperation." As they parted ways, the black-robed cultivator from the Five Elders Association said to Zhou Qingang in a slow, deliberate tone.

"Likewise." Zhou Qingang cupped his hands and replied with a smile before turning and leaving.

It wasn't until Zhou Qingang’s figure disappeared beyond the horizon that the cultivator from the Five Elders Association furrowed his brows and muttered, "Zhou Qing’ang… Li Fan…"

"What are their true identities? We've investigated for so long and still haven't found a single useful clue."

"Does the Heaven-Suppressing Society truly exist? Or is it just a fabrication by certain cultivators within the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance, using the intelligence they possess as leverage to exchange for resources?"

After pondering for a while, he chuckled in amusement.

"Either way, as long as they provide us with intelligence, it’s enough. The more chaos within the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance, the better!"

The figure of the Five Elders Association cultivator gradually faded until he completely disappeared into the air.

Meanwhile, Zhou Qingang, having completed the transaction, returned to Congyun Immortal City as if nothing had happened.

Spending such a vast amount of contribution points, he had already prepared for the possibility of his information being exposed. But it didn’t matter—at most, the Five Elders Association might deduce that "Li Fan, the cultivator from the Heavenly Mechanism Sect," was also a member of the Heaven-Suppressing Society. They might even suspect that his identity as an ancient cultivator was merely a disguise.

But as for Li Fan’s true identity? They would never be able to guess it.

After all, who would have thought that the cultivator making waves in the Xuanhuang Realm was, in reality, just a mere "mortal" from a small outer world?

Before long, all truths would be buried beneath the catastrophe of world destruction. Even if someone wanted to investigate, there would be no way to do so.

The river of time surged forward, and everything proceeded steadily, step by step.

The number of revived cultivators from the Medicine King Sect had now reached 346, including Liu San.

Although the vast majority were at the Foundation Establishment and Golden Core stages, with only five at the Nascent Soul stage, when united, they still formed a formidable force.

More importantly, as time passed, the effects of the Bloodline Transmission Ritual became increasingly apparent. Their reverence for Li Fan grew stronger by the day.

Moreover, Li Fan constantly reinforced their beliefs through indoctrination, repeatedly emphasizing the goal of "reviving the Medicine King Sect." Gradually, their gazes toward him began to reveal a near-fanatical devotion.

Li Fan was convinced that soon, even if he ordered them to sacrifice their lives for the Medicine King Sect, they would do so without hesitation.

"The Bloodline Transmission Ritual is truly extraordinary." Li Fan was extremely satisfied with the effects of this divine technique.

Of course, its remarkable effectiveness was largely built upon his absolute dominance in strength.

When he had attempted to use the ritual on a Soul Transformation cultivator, it had completely failed. Even among the five Nascent Soul cultivators, converting them had been extremely difficult. It was only with Liu San’s assistance that the process had barely succeeded.

Now that he had enough manpower, Li Fan gradually ceased the revival of further Medicine King Sect cultivators.

Li Fan knew that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance monitored the number of cultivators in each state. The sudden increase of more than 300 cultivators was still within a reasonable range, given the vast population of cultivators in Congyun Sea. However, any further increase might arouse suspicion and lead to an investigation, so he decided to hold off for now.

After inquiring with Liu San about the detailed information regarding the still-slumbering Dao Integration elder, Li Fan used the second True Temptation Fruit.

He awakened a Dao Integration cultivator named Fang Zaiji.

This man was an elder of the Medicine King Sect, specializing in artifact refinement. The Small Medicine King Cauldrons used by the disciples were crafted by him.

However, Fang Zaiji was not originally a cultivator of the Medicine King Sect. Years ago, while being pursued and near death, he was saved by Liu Ruchen. To repay this kindness and to escape from his enemies, he chose to remain in the Medicine King Sect as a Guest Elder.

Fang Zaiji had little emotional attachment to the Medicine King Sect, but he was deeply interested in the refinement method of the sect’s treasured divine artifact, the "Medicine King True Cauldron".

Back then, Liu Ruchen had promised to lend him the Medicine King True Cauldron for research, which convinced him to stay.

Li Fan used the True Temptation Fruit to alter Fang Zaiji’s perception.

Now, in Fang Zaiji’s revised memories, his time in the Medicine King Sect was mostly distant from the other disciples.

Only Liu Yihang—who was actually Li Fan—constantly pestered him every day. He had practically watched Li Fan grow up and had already come to regard him as half a son.

Along with absolute trust in Li Fan’s commands, when the effects of the True Temptation Fruit faded and Fang Zaiji awoke—

After listening to Li Fan’s explanation, he quickly understood the current situation.

"It seems that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is even more sinister than the Ten Great Immortal Sects of back then," Fang Zaiji muttered, his eyes darkening.

"Sect Master, you should have awakened me earlier," he said with a trace of reproach in his tone.

Li Fan shook his head slightly and explained, "At the time, I wanted to secure Longevity Valley as a foothold first, so I awakened Elder Liu first."

"When I considered awakening you next, I learned that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance was monitoring the number of cultivators in each state. At the time, I wasn’t sure what was going on, so I held off for safety reasons. Now that I understand the situation, it seems to be related to the new cultivation method of today’s cultivators. However, you remain unaffected, so I decided to awaken you."

Fang Zaiji nodded slightly, accepting Li Fan’s explanation.

"The monitoring of cultivator numbers might be connected to the Immortal Ruins," he said after a moment, as if recalling something.

"Oh?" Li Fan looked at him curiously.

"During my travels in the past, I once heard by chance that the Ten Great Immortal Sects had deployed a formation covering the entire Xuanhuang Realm," Fang Zaiji said, lost in thought.

"A formation like a blade hanging over all living beings. From the moment they are born, regardless of their cultivation level or race, they are all caught within it."

"This formation not only allows the sects to easily control all cultivators in the world but also gathers the power of all living beings to pierce through the endless void, locking onto the coordinates of other cultivation worlds. It can even establish cross-realm pathways to launch invasions."

Fang Zaiji slowly recounted.

Chapter 638: The Heaven’s Rain Returns as My Rain

Chapter 638: The Heaven's Rain Returns as My Rain

At this moment, Liu San interjected.

"Really? Such a formidable formation—why have I never heard of it?" He scrutinized Fang Zaiji, his gaze full of skepticism.

Fang Zaiji snorted coldly. "You're just a mere servant, never having ventured far beyond the territory of the Medicine King Sect in your entire life. How could you possibly compare to someone like me, who has traveled across the world?"

"Besides, do you even know the kinds of people I associated with back in the day? Almost all of them were true disciples of the Ten Great Immortal Sects. It’s no surprise that I learned such secrets," Fang Zaiji said proudly.

Being called a servant, Liu San didn’t get angry. Instead, he retorted sarcastically, "Oh? If you're so incredible, then why didn’t anyone come to your aid when you were being hunted down? You only survived thanks to the old sect master!"

Fang Zaiji’s expression changed, and he retorted indignantly, "The Heavenly Sword Sect had issued a kill order—what could I do against that? The fact that I survived at all was already a stroke of great fortune. If it had been you, you’d have long since turned into a pile of bones!"

Seeing that the argument was about to escalate, Li Fan quickly spoke up to interrupt them.

"Master Fang, do you know the name of that formation?" Li Fan asked.

"I do not," Fang Zaiji shook his head. "Back then, a direct disciple of the Supreme Sect mentioned it in passing with a sigh."[1]

"He also said that if the grand formation hadn’t been damaged, the situation wouldn’t have deteriorated to this extent."

Hearing this, Li Fan slowly nodded.

"A blade hanging over all beings, capable of instantly stripping cultivators of their lives—this sounds strikingly similar to the [Tianxuan Spirit-Locking Formation] I encountered in my past life."

"By harnessing the power of all living beings, it locks onto other cultivation realms. My previous speculation that the Xuanhuang Realm uses it to anchor a ‘rope’ into the distant void now seems to be correct."

"From what I can tell, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance seems to have restored part of the formation's functionality, but not entirely. And this formation was definitely not constructed by the Ten Great Immortal Sects—it originates from the much older era of the Xuantian Sect."

As he pondered, Li Fan gradually connected all the clues together.

Now, with the aid of a Dao Integration cultivator, he proceeded with the relocation plan.

The people stranded on the island, including the now-awakened Medicine King Sect cultivators, were escorted by Liu San and Fang Zaiji aboard the Samantabhadra True Boat, setting off toward Longevity Valley ahead of him.

"I still have some unfinished business in Congyun Sea—I’ll catch up later," Li Fan told them.

Although Liu San and Fang Zaiji were a little worried, they had no choice but to respect Li Fan’s decision.

After repeatedly cautioning him, they reluctantly left.

At this time, within the ruins of the Chaoyuan Sect, eerie phenomena had begun to surface. The boundaries between reality and illusion blurred, making it seem as if one had stepped into the ancient past, where they could retrieve cultivation techniques, pills, and magical artifacts from within the sect.

As word spread, the entire world was shaken. Cultivators, hearing the news, flocked to the ruins in droves. Among them, the Medicine King Sect’s group was barely noticeable in the massive crowd.

After sending everyone away, Li Fan first checked on Tianyang.

Within the enhanced Earth-Fire Origin Returning Formation, all the precious spiritual materials had been completely absorbed by Tianyang.

He himself seemed to be undergoing a transformation—his puppet body was now enveloped in a thick, black crystalline substance.

"Almost there. I hope you can make it in time for the grand event, little junior brother," Li Fan thought to himself.

After bidding farewell to Tianyang, Li Fan did not return to Congyun City. Instead, he traveled hundreds of miles to Yin Yin Island.

Under the watchful eye of Formless Killing Intent, it seemed that Master Yin had recently completed yet another verification of the secrets behind the Immortal-Mortal Miasma.

The results remained unchanged.

He sat limply on the ground, as if all hope had been extinguished, motionless for a long time.

Li Fan quietly approached him, sensing a deep aura of death emanating from Master Yin.

Despite the sudden appearance of this cultivator, Master Yin showed no surprise.

However, he ignored him, merely casting a glance before withdrawing his gaze.

"Daoist Yin, what exactly did you discover in the Immortal-Mortal Miasma?"

After a long silence, Li Fan finally couldn't resist asking.

In his perception, Master Yin’s cultivation was indeed at the Foundation Establishment stage. Even with his true form standing before him, he felt no danger.

"So, it was you watching me all along." Master Yin did not answer the question but suddenly spoke. "I thought it was that damn heavens."

He abruptly stood up and patted the dust off his clothes.

Ignoring Li Fan, he walked straight toward the underground chamber in the heart of the island.

As he walked, he spoke:

"Back then, I was nothing special—just a small Qi Condensation cultivator."

"But one day, in my hometown, it rained."

"What was terrifying was that every cultivator around me, everyone I knew, disappeared within that rain. Can you imagine that feeling?"

"One moment, they were talking to you, and in the next, they vanished before your eyes. The world became eerily silent. I searched frantically for those who had disappeared, but I found nothing."

"It was as if I was the only one left in the world. But I didn’t know why—why was I the only one who remained alive?"

"And then..."

Master Yin arrived at a passage filled with his personal collection.

His tone suddenly grew agitated. With a wave of his hand, he unleashed a flame, setting his collection ablaze.

Li Fan did not stop him. He simply watched as Master Yin’s expression shifted under the flickering flames and continued listening.

"The rain kept falling. It overflowed from the rivers, as if it intended to drown the entire land. And then, along with the rain, countless corpses began to descend from the sky."

"Most were incomplete, mere fragments. But some were still whole."

"I was almost paralyzed with fear. But when one of the more intact corpses landed right in front of me, I finally understood what true terror was."

By this point, Master Yin had reached the deepest part of the underground chamber.

Light illuminated the space, revealing countless corpses identical to Master Yin himself.

Now that Li Fan had reached the Nascent Soul stage, his perception had become even keener. In his senses, these corpses seemed... alive.

The blurred flesh and tissue squirmed ever so slightly—imperceptible to the naked eye.

Master Yin pointed at the countless corpses littering the ground, his expression gradually turning maniacal.

"Yes, the corpse that fell before me that day—was my own!"

"In fact, every corpse that fell from the sky bore my exact face!"

"And they were all smiling at me!"

Master Yin's eerie voice echoed through the underground chamber. The sinister truth he spoke of sent chills down the spine.

"How could such a terrifying thing happen in this world? Can you explain it?" He turned to Li Fan, staring at him blankly.

Li Fan could only remain silent.

"There is something wrong with this world."

Master Yin lifted his head, gazing at the sky.

1. Tai Shang will be translated as Supreme Sect from now on.

Chapter 639: Chaotic Interpretation, Layers of Duplicated Rain and Danger

"The world is full of things that defy common sense—mountains and rivers shifting, the Devouring Origin White Mist, the Immortal-Mortal Miasma..."

"Ever since the Immortal Ancestor spread his teachings, it has been one grand performance after another."

"From that day on, I have done everything in my power to uncover the secrets behind it all."

Master Yin’s voice was deep and enigmatic, his expression dazed.

Li Fan also listened intently, focusing on every word.

But what followed was a long silence.

After a long pause, Master Yin turned his head and looked at Li Fan, a mocking expression appearing on his face. "Are you expecting me to tell you the answer?"

"What are you thinking?"

"I am merely an ordinary Foundation Establishment cultivator. The hidden truths of this world—just the Immortal-Mortal Miasma alone—have exhausted all my efforts. As for the others..."

Master Yin sneered. "I have no interest."

Li Fan remained unfazed. He replied calmly, "If that is the case, could you at least share the mysteries of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma?"

"Sure." Master Yin agreed readily.

"The Immortal-Mortal Miasma, it is..."

Halfway through his sentence, his face suddenly twisted in horror.

With a look of utter contempt, he spat on the ground and glared at Li Fan in fury.

"You? You dare ask?"

"A selfish, cold-blooded cultivator like you! To let you learn of his deeds would be the greatest blasphemy!"

"I would rather see his actions buried in history, never to be known by the world! Otherwise, people like you would not admire him but mock him in secret!"

Master Yin seemed to grow increasingly agitated, his gaze toward Li Fan filled with deep-seated hatred.

Li Fan’s eyes turned cold.

Without hesitation, he activated his Binding Insect Divine Ability, aiming to capture Master Yin and search his soul for answers. At the same time, he remained vigilant, prepared for Master Yin to suddenly reveal his true strength and counterattack.

But unexpectedly, everything went smoothly. There was no resistance—Master Yin was instantly subdued, unable to move.

Yet, moments later, Li Fan’s expression changed slightly.

Because he suddenly realized that the "Master Yin" bound by the divine ability had, in an instant, lost all signs of life—he had turned into a lifeless corpse.

Li Fan immediately turned his gaze to the other corpses in the underground chamber.

At that moment, the previously motionless bodies, once piled haphazardly like rotting flesh, all lifted their heads simultaneously.

Every single one of them was grinning menacingly at him.

"Tricks and illusions!"

Li Fan remained unfazed by this eerie sight. He let out a cold snort, and in an instant, the Five Elements Cave Heaven Law Domain engulfed Yin Yin Island.

The power of the Five Elements surged, forming an impenetrable prison, attempting to suppress all the corpses within.

However, before Li Fan could even act further, something even more bizarre occurred.

All the corpses within his domain suddenly lost all life signs, one after another, and truly perished.

It was as if his strike had landed on nothing but air, leaving Li Fan feeling frustrated.

Sweeping his divine sense across the entire island, he searched for any trace of Master Yin. But at this moment, aside from himself, there was not a single living being on the entire island.

"Suicide? I don't believe it!"

Li Fan narrowed his eyes and exerted the power of his Cave-Heaven Domain, crushing every corpse into dust.

Yet, even after every single body had disintegrated into nothingness, nothing else happened.

As if Master Yin had truly perished.

But instead of relaxing, Li Fan grew even more alert.

Drip...

The sound in his ears made Li Fan’s pupils contract sharply.

He stretched out his hand.

A single droplet of rain had appeared out of nowhere above him.

It fell onto his palm.

And then—

The rain poured down.

The rain grew heavier and heavier. Gradually, dark shadows began to fall from above, carried by the downpour.

Bang!

Bang!

Bang!

They were corpses—some broken and mangled, others intact!

What sent a chill down Li Fan's spine was that these corpses no longer bore the face of Master Yin. Instead, they all looked like him!

As they hit the ground, the corpses began to writhe and struggle, twisting into bizarre postures as they slowly raised their heads.

Just like Master Yin earlier, their eyes were locked onto him—unwavering.

And on their faces was that same eerie, twisted grin.

"What the hell is this...?"

Li Fan's heart sank.

He no longer held back. With a single thought, the Heaven-Shattering Heart Sword blazed to life in the underground chamber.

Sword light swept across the area, shredding the corpses into dust.

"Keh keh keh..."

As they vanished, sinister laughter escaped their mouths—like a mocking taunt from the void.

In the brief moment of their disappearance, Li Fan's figure flickered, and in the blink of an eye, he had already left Yin Yin Island, attempting to escape these eerie corpses.

But…

Drip.

Drip.

Even after flying hundreds of miles away in an instant, Li Fan still felt the icy rain falling onto his face.

This time, he switched to the Reverse Five Elements Creation-Destruction Sword.

The moment the countless corpses fell from the sky again, Li Fan obliterated them with sword light.

Yet, his expression only grew darker.

Because he realized that dealing with these corpses… was slightly more difficult than before.

The difference was almost imperceptible, but it was there—a growing resistance, an increasing drain on his strength.

And as the rain continued to pour, Li Fan repeated the process again and again, eliminating the corpses each time.

This cycle only confirmed his worst fear.

"This is bad..."

Li Fan's face turned grim.

He had already tried nearly every technique in his arsenal, yet he still couldn't shake off these grotesque corpses.

Moreover, the bodies, which looked more and more like himself, seemed to be growing stronger, becoming harder and harder to destroy.

If this continued any further…

"Am I really going to be forced to activate [Truth]?" Li Fan furrowed his brows.

Then, out of the corner of his eye, he caught sight of a Divine Ability on his [Truth] Panel—one he had never fully used before.

[Chaos]

"A desperate gamble... but it's worth a try."

And so, as the cold rain fell once more, Li Fan stood firm amidst the grinning corpses.

With a solemn expression, he raised his hand as if wielding a brush, and with a single, fluid motion, he wrote the word—

"Chaos" (亂).

Boom!

The instant the Chaos Glyph formed, an uncontrollable surge of power erupted within Li Fan’s body.

It was as if an immense force was bearing down on him.

Inside his Five Elements Cave Heaven, ominous creaking sounds rang out as if the entire domain was on the verge of collapse.

Even the natural circulation of the Five Elements began to spiral into disorder.

Within the Wood-Element Cave Heaven, energies of water, fire, metal, and earth burst forth chaotically.

The same occurred in the other elemental domains.

In an instant, his newly-formed Five Elements Cave Heaven plunged into utter turmoil.

Strange and eerie phenomena began manifesting.

But as its master, Li Fan had no time to care.

Because at that very moment—his vision was overwhelmed by an infinite deluge of hallucinations.

No… rather than hallucinations, it was more like he had suddenly experienced a thousand lifetimes of reincarnation in a single instant.

Each cycle of life and death unfolded with terrifying clarity, flooding his mind with countless realities.

It was as if he had been split into countless versions of himself.

His head felt like it was about to explode.

Just as he was on the verge of breaking—

A scripture that had been silently operating in the background suddenly surged forth—

The [Xuanhuang Heart-Refining Mantra] roared to life.

Chapter 640: Hundred Refinements of an Immortal’s Heart

Chapter 640: Hundred Refinements of an Immortal's Heart

Since Li Fan had begun cultivating the Heart-Refining Mantra, he had never experienced such a wild and frenzied operational speed.

It was as if some special switch had been triggered—the efficiency of the Xuanhuang Heart-Refining Mantra had increased not just by a hundredfold but by a thousandfold or more.

If Li Fan’s previous attempts at self-exploration were akin to a slow-moving millstone pulled by a donkey,

Then now, the Xuanhuang Heart-Refining Mantra was like a roaring, thunderous mechanical giant, absorbing all the countless surreal and lifelike experiences that had suddenly surged into Li Fan’s mind.

Restoring order, returning to clarity!

It was as if a bucket of ice water had been poured over his head, instantly cooling down the searing heat within.

Li Fan gradually regained his senses, pulling himself out of his trance and confusion.

“This…”

“?”

In an instant, Li Fan understood what had just happened to him, and his heart was filled with shock.

He had not expected the backlash from the complete "Chaos" Character Glyph to be so terrifying.

Once it took shape, it was several times stronger than his previous simulated attempts, which had always fallen just short of completion.

Once the "Chaos" Character fully formed, it underwent a qualitative transformation, its power now incomparable to the fragmented pieces he had previously grasped.

"If even the backlash is this terrifying, then its actual effects must be…"

Suppressing the turmoil within his body and mind, Li Fan looked up toward the sky.

He saw that where the rain had once fallen and where the corpses had previously dropped, the scene seemed to twist and distort.

It was as if an invisible void existed there—rain and corpses alike disappeared into thin air the moment they came close.

However, after consuming the eerie rainwater, the twisted void seemed to be slowly shrinking.

Thus, the two forces reached a state of mutual balance, constantly neutralizing each other.

Finally, when the rain ceased to fall from the sky,

The influence of the "Chaos" Glyph vanished as well.

A battered and disheveled figure plummeted from the air—it was none other than Master Yin.

At this moment, his body had become semi-transparent. His face, filled with disbelief, stared blankly at Li Fan.

He tried to say something, opening his mouth, but no sound came out.

Master Yin lowered his head, looking at himself as if he had understood something. He no longer struggled in vain.

His body became increasingly faint, yet there was no trace of fear on his face at his impending demise.

Instead, he showed an expression of relief and liberation.

Moments later, Master Yin completely disappeared from this world.

Li Fan had no time to celebrate surviving the ordeal.

Driven by the overwhelming sense of impending crisis in his heart, he endured his injuries, activated the Sky-Shrouding Hand secret technique, and pushed his escape technique to its limits, swiftly fleeing the scene.

Not long after Li Fan’s departure…

A vast and boundless divine consciousness seemed to descend.

The scenery beneath the sea reversed like rewinding time itself, tracing back events and replaying the past.

But just as Li Fan’s image was about to emerge—

A crack suddenly appeared out of thin air.

Then a second, a third—countless cracks followed.

The vision shattered like a broken mirror, restoring the timeline to normal.

The divine consciousness lingered for a long while, as if contemplating something.

Then, it silently scanned the entire Congyun Sea, but ultimately found no anomalies.

And finally, it withdrew into complete silence.

At this moment, far from returning to Congyun City, Li Fan dug out a mineral stone from the seabed beneath him.

Feigning delight, he carefully placed it into his storage ring.

Then, for quite some time, he pretended to continue mining, as if he were just an ordinary cultivator collecting resources.

Only when the ominous feeling of danger completely faded did he stop his act.

Just moments ago, right when he was rushing back to Congyun City…

An unprecedented sense of crisis suddenly struck, and his heart pounded violently as if he would perish in the next second.

There was no time to think. He first dispelled his Sky-Shrouding Concealment, then activated the Mysterious True Spirit Transformation, instantly changing his appearance into that of another cultivator.

Feigning nonchalance, he pretended to be mining ores from the seabed.

Sure enough, his intuition was correct. Moments later, he felt as though he was being watched.

Suppressing his unease, he acted as if he had noticed nothing.

Though the situation was extremely perilous, he ultimately managed to evade the other party's detection.

“The Chaos Character, the Xuanhuang Heart-Refining Mantra, the eerie Duplicating Rain... and that immense divine sense...”

On his way back to Congyun City, Li Fan kept pondering the connection between these elements.

“If I hadn't unintentionally used the Chaos Character, I would have had no way to escape the 'Duplicating Me' Rain. My only option would have been to confront it directly.”

“But to my surprise, the Chaos Character Glyph was actually able to dispel the 'Duplicating Me' Rain.”

To Li Fan, Master Yin and the rain that carried countless identical corpses bore a striking resemblance to the eerie anomalies of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Both were phenomena that defied logic—rules beyond rules.

However, this so-called unalterable, ever-present strangeness had been neutralized by the Chaos Character.

What did this mean?

Li Fan repeatedly recalled the moment when the Duplicating Me Rain disappeared.

“Chaos... Chaos...”

“Rather than being dispelled, it felt more like...”

“Chaos upon chaos, canceling each other out?”

A bold idea suddenly surfaced in his mind.

“Could it be that the root of all eerie anomalies in the world originates from this concept of 'Chaos'?”

Once the thought arose, it became impossible to suppress. At the same time, a deep and inexplicable fear gripped his heart.

“Back in the mist, I saw the word ‘Chaos’ carved into a stone. Its power seemed to have faded over the passage of time.”

“But without a doubt, it was the culprit that destroyed that entire mist-shrouded world.”

“If that was merely a weakened remnant of the original Chaos Character...”

Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

“Furthermore, it seems that powerful beings in the Xuanhuang Realm are extremely interested in this Chaos Character. The moment they sense its presence, they descend to investigate.”

“It seems that unless I am faced with an absolute life-or-death crisis, I should avoid using it as much as possible.”

Li Fan silently contemplated.

After all, he had formed his Nascent Soul through the Five Elements Cave-Heaven, granting him boundless regenerative power.

By the time he returned to Congyun City, his injuries had completely healed, leaving no trace of abnormality.

Additionally, the 'Momentary Glimpse of Myriad Realities' that had surfaced in his mind had been absorbed and neutralized by the Xuanhuang Heart-Refining Mantra, which had been operating at full capacity.

However, something puzzled Li Fan.

Under normal circumstances, absorbing such a large amount of stray thoughts should have nourished and strengthened his divine soul, based on his past experiences.

Yet, from the moment it happened until now, he hadn’t felt the slightest increase in his soul’s power.

“Could it have been used to repair hidden wounds within my soul instead?”

With a hint of doubt, Li Fan examined himself carefully.

The Heart-Refining Mantra had gradually returned to its normal rhythm, yet he keenly sensed that it had undergone a subtle transformation.

It felt as if it had achieved a form of sublimation—though not yet complete.

A sudden impulse drove Li Fan to open his [Truth] Panel, his gaze locking onto the technique descriptions.

The Xuanhuang Heart-Refining Mantra, previously ranked first, had silently changed its name.

Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra (Incomplete).

Li Fan’s pupils contracted sharply, his heart filled with shock.

Chapter 641: Unchanging Will Across a Thousand Lifetimes

From "Refinement" to "Immortal"—though just a single character apart, the difference is as vast as heaven and earth.

For countless ages, the path forward in the Xuanhuang Realm had been severed. "Immortality" had become an unattainable goal, existing only in ancient texts, where it served as an object of longing and imagination for cultivators.

Yet now, Li Fan had come across a technique that might be related to "True Immortals"!

"True Immortal inheritance?"

Just the thought alone sent waves of excitement surging through Li Fan’s heart. The exhilaration and fervor he felt at this moment were reminiscent of the time he first encountered Kou Hong and Dao Xuanzi—when he had finally confirmed the existence of cultivators in this world.

"No wonder the Xuanhuang Mantra has always been ranked at the forefront of all my cultivation techniques. Even the Cloud-Water Illusion Dream Technique passed down by Qin Tang at the Dao Integration realm pales in comparison! It turns out to be the true legacy of an Immortal!"

"The path to Immortality is not broken! The path to Immortality remains open!"

Li Fan’s heart surged with emotions, making it difficult for him to calm down.

Even with his current state of mind and cultivation, it took him quite some time to gradually regain composure.

After carefully comprehending this so-called "Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra," he realized that, perhaps because it was only a fragment, it did not seem significantly different from the previous Refining Heart Mantra.

Or perhaps, with Li Fan’s current level, he was still unable to discern the true distinction between the two.

He began to recall the origins of the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra.

Its earliest form was the widely spread technique in the Xuanhuang Realm, known for expelling miasma from the body—"Xuanhuang Clear Heart Mantra." Since this technique had no other benefits aside from purging mortal impurities, very few cultivators continued practicing it after drawing Qi into their bodies.

However, due to Li Fan’s poor natural aptitude, he had struggled to expel the miasma within him. Thus, while waiting for the opportunity to enter the Purification Spirit Pool, he tirelessly cultivated the Xuanhuang Clear Heart Mantra day and night. Moreover, thanks to his [Truth] Insight ability, which allowed him to perceive even the slightest changes within himself with great clarity, he became convinced that the Xuanhuang Clear Heart Mantra was indeed effective. As a result, he never abandoned it.

During the excruciating purification process in the Purification Spirit Pool, where the Immortal-Mortal miasma were forcibly expelled from his body, Li Fan never wavered in his pursuit of the Dao, even when he was on the verge of losing consciousness. His unwavering determination remained unshaken. With the power of [Truth], which allowed him to endlessly reincarnate and start over, he feared neither life nor death.

Ultimately, when he successfully transitioned from a mere mortal into a Qi Condensation cultivator, the Xuanhuang Clear Heart Mantra evolved into the Xuanhuang Refining Heart Mantra.

Throughout his countless cycles of reincarnation, Li Fan continued to experiment and refine his cultivation method. Eventually, he discovered the true way to practice the Xuanhuang Refining Heart Mantra—cultivating the Dao Heart in reverse.

Like a great millstone, he shattered all his worldly attachments and transformed them into nourishment for his soul. The profundity of this technique far surpassed the cultivation methods currently circulated within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Originally, Li Fan believed that this was the ultimate form of the Xuanhuang Mantra. However, due to a fateful coincidence, when he activated the Chaos Character and endured its "Ten Thousand Lifetimes Shadow Reflection" backlash, the Refining Heart Mantra began to operate on its own—finally shedding its disguise and revealing its true nature.

"Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra..."

Li Fan kept repeating this name in his mind.

Without a doubt, this was an unfathomably powerful technique.

It was said that "worldly matters can taint even the gods and immortals." No matter how powerful a cultivator was, when entangled in the endless cycle of mundane affairs, their Dao Heart would inevitably suffer damage.

The "Ten Thousand Lifetimes Glimpse of Myriad Realities" was akin to personally experiencing hundreds or even thousands of lifetimes. Countless images and emotions surged into his mind all at once. If not for Li Fan’s own experience of reincarnating through a hundred lifetimes—granting him an unshakable will—he would have succumbed to madness and insanity on the spot.

Without the assistance of the Immortal Heart Mantra, no matter how extraordinary Li Fan’s willpower was, escaping the influence of the Glimpse of Myriad Realities on his own would likely take him several decades.

However, with the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra, the result was entirely different. Almost in an instant, those sincere emotions and vivid memories were dissolved and absorbed.

"In an instant, I have experienced countless cycles of reincarnation, yet my immortal heart remains unchanged..."

"So this is the power of an immortal." Li Fan couldn’t help but feel a deep sense of yearning.

"With such an immortal technique, the various illusory realms of the Xuanhuang World will be nothing to me." A sharp glint flashed in Li Fan’s eyes.

The first thing that came to his mind was the moment when Senior Sister Zhao had drawn him into the Grand Dao Sect.

"If I wield the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra, perhaps I can maintain my true self within that real illusion. With self-awareness and active intent, I may even be able to steal more secrets."

"In my next life, I must give it a try."

After pondering for a long time, Li Fan focused his gaze on the character "Incomplete" that followed the Immortal Heart Mantra.

"This immortal technique is still incomplete, and to restore it, one must use the experiences and memories of countless past lives as raw material. Originally, using the Chaos Character technique to induce spiritual backlash was the best method."

"But..."

Li Fan frowned slightly.

He still felt lingering fear over that immense divine sense that had appeared afterward. His instincts told him that the owner of that divine sense had likely already marked the Chaos Character Technique. If he used it again, he would probably be discovered instantly.

"Perhaps I was able to escape before only because the Chaos Character technique had not appeared in this world for many years."

"Once may be fine, but never again..."

"No matter." Thinking of the mysterious treasure he carried, Li Fan smiled slightly.

"Even if I only get one surprise opportunity per lifetime, for me, that is as good as an endless supply!"

"No matter whether it was the one who deliberately hid the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra, or that immense divine sense so concerned with Chaos, neither would ever expect that an anomaly like me exists in this world!"

Reflecting on his past experiences, Li Fan knew just how difficult it was to restore the Xuanhuang Clear Heart Mantra step by step back into the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra.

Moreover, powerful figures were constantly watching, never letting their guard down.

Even if someone was lucky enough to rediscover it by chance, they could never remain in the blind spot of those great beings' perception like Li Fan had, completely unnoticed.

"Among the infinite possible futures, as long as a single sliver of hope exists, I will find it and turn the impossible into reality."

Li Fan once again grasped the terrifying nature of [Truth].

At the same time, he felt immense gratitude.

"If I did not possess this extraordinary treasure, no matter how much of a genius I might be, I would never be able to achieve transcendence from this Xuanhuang World."

Filled with emotion, Li Fan began searching through the Tianxuan Mirror for scattered information about the Xuanhuang Refining Heart Mantra.

"It makes sense. The Immortal-Mortal Miasma violates the fundamental laws of heaven and earth, so how could the method to dispel it possibly be simple?"

A flash of understanding passed through Li Fan’s mind.

With his current level of authority, he could access many things that ordinary cultivators were forbidden to see.

However, regarding the origins of the Xuanhuang Refining Heart Mantra, there were countless theories—none of which were definitive.

Chapter 642: The Disappearing Heavenly Sovereign

At the end of the Great Plague Era, under the coercion of cultivators, the vast majority of mortals were relocated to various hidden realms and small worlds.

However, as the influence of the "incompatibility of immortal cultivation techniques" grew stronger, the cultivators ultimately could not escape the fate of mutual destruction. The immortal sects collapsed, and the cultivation civilization entered a prolonged period of darkness.

As the saying goes, "When one declines, another rises."

The number of cultivators dwindled to near extinction. Yet, mortals, like resilient weeds, began to emerge once again across the world.

Regarding the origins of these newly born mortals, some claimed they were survivors of the great migration. Others believed they were the descendants of cultivators. There were also those who suggested that mortals from the small worlds had broken through the blockade of the Immortal-Sealing Formation and returned.

Regardless, as cultivators gradually vanished from the land, the mortals of the Xuanhuang Realm began to thrive in the gaps left behind.

Along with the resurgence of mortals came the Xuanhuang Clear Heart Mantra.

Like folk songs and legends of unknown origin, it spread by word of mouth. Eventually, nearly every human tribe became aware of this technique, which allowed mortals to escape the influence of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma and once again embark on the path of cultivation.

Today's cultivators speculate that this could very well be the work of the Mysterious Eastern Extremity Heavenly Sovereign of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance.

After all, the Purification Spirit Pool, which also removes the Immortal-Mortal Miasma, was created by the Eastern Extremity Heavenly Sovereign. It is highly possible that the Xuanhuang Clear Heart Mantra was an earlier experiment before the creation of the Purification Spirit Pool.

However, now that Li Fan understands the true nature of the Xuanhuang Clear Heart Mantra, he finds this possibility unlikely.

The Eastern Extremity Heavenly Sovereign, the nominal leader of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance, only appeared a few times in the alliance's earliest recorded history before vanishing entirely.

Rather than believing he was a true immortal, Li Fan considered it more likely that, like himself, the Eastern Extremity Heavenly Sovereign had uncovered the secrets of the Xuanhuang Clear Heart Mantra.

Perhaps, inspired by this discovery, he later created the Purification Spirit Pool.

"Could the disappearance of the Eastern Extremity Heavenly Sovereign also be related to the Xuanhuang Clear Heart Mantra?" This thought surfaced in Li Fan’s mind.

Yet, when he tried to search for records on the Eastern Extremity Heavenly Sovereign, he found almost nothing—just as before, the information was nearly nonexistent, with no additional records to be found.

This was completely inconsistent with the status of a leader of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance.

"This is truly unsettling."

Li Fan decided not to dwell on it further and instead focused once again on comprehending the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra.

Half a month later, Li Fan gathered everyone in the Administration Hall once more.

At first, they thought he had another major announcement to make, but instead, they were greeted with the news that he was going into seclusion again.

"Didn’t he just leave seclusion not long ago? And now he’s going back? Could it be that ancient cultivators were all this diligent?"

"Lord Envoy doesn’t lack contribution points, so he can maintain the [Spiritual Awakening] state permanently. Cultivation for him is practically a pleasure. If I had the same opportunity, I’d do it too."

"There were rumors that Lord Envoy had already restored his Nascent Soul realm. Could it be that he is now breaking through to the Soul Transformation stage?"

…

Amid the heated discussions, only He Zhenghao appeared deep in thought.

"It seems that Lord Envoy is making preparations for the descent of the Spirit of Heaven and Earth."

He casually glanced at Zhou Qingang beside him.

When Lord Envoy announced this matter, Zhou Qingang’s expression remained completely unchanged, clearly indicating that he had already known about it beforehand.

Thinking back, he had once been the most trusted subordinate of Lord Envoy. Unfortunately, due to a moment of greed, he had lost that trust to this young man.

At this thought, a wave of discomfort surged in He Zhenghao’s heart.

His eyes flickered, and an idea surfaced in his mind.

He transmitted his voice to Zhou Qingang, saying, "Daoist Zhou, how has your cultivation been progressing lately?"

Zhou Qingang looked at He Zhenghao in surprise. After a brief moment of contemplation, he immediately understood He Zhenghao’s underlying intentions.

With a cold sneer in his heart, he responded along He Zhenghao’s line of questioning, "Hehe, Brother He, you must be joking. You know very well that Lord Envoy does not manage affairs personally, leaving all matters, big and small, to us. Originally, Gao Yuan helped share the workload, but he recently took a leave of absence to travel. That has made things even busier."

"Just handling political affairs takes up nearly all of my time—how could I possibly have the peace of mind to cultivate?"

He Zhenghao pretended to be in complete agreement, sighing as if sympathizing.

However, before long, he shifted the topic.

"I have something to say—would Daoist Zhou be willing to hear it?"

Zhou Qingang was momentarily stunned before responding quickly, "Please speak, Brother He."

He Zhenghao said solemnly, "Daoist Zhou, your dedication to assisting Lord Envoy is commendable."

"But…"

He Zhenghao continued meaningfully, "One must still rely on their own strength! No matter how much favor you have from Lord Envoy, your cultivation level remains at the Golden Core stage—moreover, at its weakest early stage. In a small place like Congyun Sea, you can still maintain authority over your subordinates. However, as Lord Envoy's cultivation continues to recover and his realm grows higher, he will inevitably attract numerous Nascent Soul and Soul Transformation cultivators. If you stagnate at your current level, how will you command their respect?"

Upon hearing this, Zhou Qingang expression changed slightly.

He initially looked as if he wanted to argue, but after a moment, he fell into deep thought.

Seeing this, He Zhenghao secretly felt pleased with himself.

"That rhetoric from Gao Yuan is truly effective. If not for my firm Dao heart, I might have been swayed by him back then," He Zhenghao mused.

After a long while, Zhou Qing'ang seemed to have come to a realization, though a bitter smile appeared on his face.

"You are right. But I truly cannot spare the time—I find it difficult to cultivate in peace," he said, looking at He Zhenghao.

He Zhenghao's eyes lit up. "Daoist Zhou, why not follow Gao Yuan’s example? There must be great opportunities hidden within the ruins of the Chaoyuan Sect. If you can obtain them, you could easily advance by one minor realm. Perhaps even breaking through to Nascent Soul isn’t out of reach."

Zhou Qingang hesitated, as if he wanted to speak but refrained.

However, He Zhenghao seized the moment and continued, "I know what worries you. You fear that your absence will affect governance, correct? Rest assured, I am here! If I’ve already taken on extra responsibilities, what’s one more?"

Zhou Qingang looked at him suspiciously. "If that’s the case, why don’t you go yourself? Since when have you been so considerate of your colleagues?"

He Zhenghao’s expression darkened slightly. "How could you say that? Lord Envoy once reminded us that we must prioritize unity among ourselves. If my two brothers can enhance their cultivation, what’s a little hardship on my part?"

"As Lord Envoy’s cultivation grows, more and more followers will rally to his side. We are natural allies—helping you is helping myself."

He Zhenghao paused, observed Zhou Qingang expression carefully, and then continued, "Besides, I’ve had some insights recently. I believe I’m not far from breaking through to Nascent Soul. Even without external opportunities, I’m confident I can advance within ten years!"

"Why not let me help you achieve this?"

Chapter 643: Flying Stone Falls into the Deep Sea

"Are you confident you can advance to the Nascent Soul stage within ten years?"

Zhou Qingang looked at the smug He Zhenghao, a hint of surprise flashing across his face.

This reaction was not feigned.

After carefully examining He Zhenghao for a moment, Zhou Qingang realized that his claim might not be mere boasting. A profound and mysterious aura lurked within him—extremely well-hidden. If He Zhenghao hadn't revealed it himself, and if the current "Zhou Qingang" weren’t actually Li Fan's true body in disguise, it would have been nearly impossible to detect.

As memories from the Dao Deviation Stone replayed in his mind, Li Fan quickly identified the source of this change. It was due to a simple white jade that He Xinxin had given to He Zhenghao before her reluctant departure, instructing him to nurture it within his dantian.

"He has never trained properly, yet just by relying on this jade, he is confident that he can advance from Golden Core to Nascent Soul in such a short time…?"

"This jade is indeed an extraordinary treasure! Even for the Heng Clan of Tianyu Prefecture, it must be quite rare. He Xinxin truly went to great lengths to ensure her father's survival."

"But unfortunately…"

With an almost imperceptible cold gaze, "Zhou Qingang" glanced at He Zhenghao, sneering inwardly.

He then feigned great astonishment, exclaiming, "Daoist He, your progress is truly astonishing! This is completely unexpected. It seems that your talent for cultivation far surpasses mine and Gao Yuan’s."

A trace of embarrassment flashed across He Zhenghao's face, but he quickly concealed it and arrogantly declared, "Haha, no need to feel discouraged! In cultivation, besides talent, perseverance and fortunate encounters also play a crucial role. Since your natural aptitude is slightly lacking, you must not let this opportunity slip by!"

Hearing He Zhenghao’s persuasion, Zhou Qingang appeared to lower his head in contemplation.

Just as He Zhenghao believed that he had swayed him and was secretly pleased, Zhou Qingang let out a long sigh and refused his proposal.

"You are right, Daoist He. To better serve Lord Envoy, personal strength is crucial. However, opportunities often come hand in hand with dangers. As for me…"

Zhou Qingang shook his head, feigning regret.

"I have never been blessed with good fortune! Even if there is some great opportunity within Chaoyuan Sect, I doubt it would ever fall into my hands! I'd rather stay here in Congyun Sea and focus on my duties."

"And besides, Lord Envoy…"

Zhou Qingang deliberately paused before continuing, "His Lordship never neglects his subordinates. If he sees our dedication and hard work, he might reward us with something that could help us break through our current bottlenecks!"

"But I still appreciate your kindness, Daoist He!"

Zhou Qingang cupped his hands in salute before turning to leave Bu Zheng Hall.

Watching Zhou Qingang departing figure, He Zhenghao’s expression flickered uncertainly.

"This brat truly deserves to be one of the Lord’s trusted aides—he must know something!"

"It seems my decision was right. Since even he refuses to leave Congyun Sea, that must mean this place is not only free of danger but also holds tremendous benefits…!"

With his last bit of hesitation erased, He Zhenghao solidified his resolve.

And seeing the greed and deep obsession in He Zhenghao’s gaze, Li Fan knew exactly what was going through his mind.

"The greedier one is, the more foolish they become. The more foolish they are, the greedier they get."

"A vicious cycle… The He Zhenghao of this life is no longer the Daoist He I once knew!"

"The experiences one goes through shape their personality and fate so profoundly."

Li Fan pondered for a moment, sensing a deeper truth within this realization.

"Perhaps… this has some connection to the foundation of the New Method, which thrives on boundless greed and ruthless plundering."

Shaking off these thoughts, Li Fan resumed his usual routine. For the time being, he continued acting as Zhou Qingang, handling various affairs methodically.

Meanwhile, his disguised clone, posing as the "Secret Envoy Li Fan," remained hidden deep within the Adminstration Hall’s secret chamber, claiming to be in secluded cultivation.

In secret, Li Fan had swapped places with his true body and clone, while also starting to craft a puppet in Zhou Qingang likeness.

Deep within Congyun Sea, he activated the Earth-Fire Returning Origin Formation, consuming a small amount of ordinary materials to forge a skeletal puppet.

Then, using the Mysterious True Spirit Transformation Technique, a method for refining clones, he coated the puppet’s bones with a layer of flesh and skin.

He once again attached a trace of his divine sense to it.

In the end, he successfully created a puppet body that looked exactly like Zhou Qingang.

After transferring his clothing, storage ring, and other belongings, Li Fan's true self took one last look at the vast azure sea of clouds and shook his head.

"It is time to leave," he thought.

Reverting to his original appearance, he sped toward the secret realm of the Longevity Valley without looking back.

Meanwhile, the puppet Zhou Qingang, controlled by the trace of Li Fan’s remaining divine sense, returned alone to Congyun Immortal City.

Since Zhou Qingang was always reserved and taciturn, his somewhat stiff expression did not immediately arouse suspicion among other cultivators.

Moreover, Li Fan deliberately reduced his interactions with outsiders. On the rare occasions he did meet others, he always appeared engrossed in official duties, busy to the point of being overwhelmed.

Thus, within the vast Congyun City—despite the endless flow of cultivators—no one realized that Zhou Qingang had already completed a seamless deception in the shadows.

Though there were still some flaws in the disguise, and in time, someone was bound to notice, it hardly mattered.

For the entire Congyun Sea and all the living beings within it were already approaching their final moments.

As Li Fan's true self was still on his way—

On this day, both he and his divine sense-possessed puppet suddenly felt a wave of unease.

"What is that?"

The startled cries from Congyun City stirred Li Fan’s heart, and he instinctively looked up at the sky.

There, a massive black fireball had suddenly appeared without warning in the firmament.

Trailing a dark tail, it hurtled toward Congyun Sea at a terrifying angle.

"This is—!" Li Fan’s pupils contracted sharply.

"Crimson Flame?" Sensing a vaguely familiar aura from the black fireball, Li Fan hesitated, uncertain.

The black fireball was unbelievably fast. Before the cultivators of Congyun Sea could even react, it had already crashed into the ocean.

Wherever it touched, the seawater instantly vaporized due to the extreme heat.

A massive void appeared in the sea before the black fireball violently struck the ocean floor.

Boom!

Boom!

Boom!

Deafening explosions erupted, shaking the entire Congyun Sea. Even Congyun City, high above the clouds, was soon swept by the shockwaves, swaying like a floating leaf in a storm.

Amid the violent impact, towering tsunamis surged outward from the fireball’s impact site, engulfing everything in their path.

The cultivators watching in horror saw that within those colossal waves—hundreds of meters high—dark flames flickered ominously.

Wherever the waves passed, the fusion of water and fire obliterated countless islands in an instant, reducing them to ashes.

Chapter 644: Changes in Heaven Follow Changes on Earth

The waves, engulfed in black flames, were utterly terrifying.

Not only were mortal islands easily destroyed, but even the large islands fortified with protective formations and guarded by cultivators were as fragile as paper. Under the horrifying destructive force, they turned to ashes in an instant.

The island-guarding cultivators had no chance to resist—they vanished completely into the sky.
