The anomalies caused by their deaths lasted only for a brief moment before being engulfed by the dense black aura in the heavens.

The massive waves continued to sweep across the sea, while the colossal black fireball at the center of it all shattered into tens of thousands of black streaks of light in an earth-shaking explosion.

From the point of impact, these streaks of light shot out in all directions, scattering across the Congyun Sea.

Faced with this apocalyptic scene, the cultivators in Congyun City were momentarily stunned. Then, unable to suppress their fear, they let out terrified cries.

“By the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor! Is this the end of the world?”

“A great catastrophe! A terrifying calamity is upon us!”

“How could such a massive meteor fall without any warning from the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance? What were they doing?!”

Some cultivators were terrified. Some went mad. Others were furious. But there were still those who held faith in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

They believed it was merely a natural disaster—an asteroid calamity. Even though the monstrous tsunami could wipe out all the islands in the Congyun Sea, the city floating high in the sky should remain safe.

Yet, there were always cultivators who prioritized survival above all else.

“Run!”

This was the first thought that flashed through their minds.

However, when they rushed to the Dharma Transmission Plaza, they discovered something that filled them with horror.

“Damn it! Why have all the teleportation formation stopped working?!”

“It's over! There's no escape! We're doomed!”

“A conspiracy! This must be the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s doing!”

Panic spread like wildfire through the plaza, and their cries of alarm quickly reached every corner of Congyun Sea City.

Within moments, all cultivators in the city knew that the teleportation formation had failed.

As they saw the approaching tsunami, fear and chaos took hold.

Yet, amidst the turmoil, He Zhenghao remained unnaturally calm. Though he felt a flicker of fear, he forcibly suppressed it through sheer willpower.

“Such an overwhelming force… This must be the Spirit of Heaven and Earth. When will it take form? According to legend, Spirits of Heaven and Earth always manifest in humanoid forms…”

A trace of unease crept into He Zhenghao’s heart.

“It should be fine… If the Lord Envoy could predict the descent of the Spirit of Heaven and Earth, He must have prepared for this.”

He reassured himself.

Sure enough, just as he had this thought, a voice suddenly resonated throughout Congyun Sea City— Li Fan’s voice.

“Cultivators, do not panic! With Immortal Lord Hongxi here, nothing will go wrong!”

“All of you need only remain within the city!”

“Formation Hall, activate the grand defensive array formation at full power to withstand the disaster! Martial Hall squads, assemble and maintain order!”

The steady voice echoed through the city. Like a stabilizing anchor, it momentarily restored calm among the cultivators.

Soon after, a glowing barrier enveloped Congyun Immortal City, while cultivators rushed to reinforce various formation nodes.

For a brief moment, order returned to the city.

Meanwhile, Li Fan gazed at the endless black streaks of light in the sky and the ever-expanding tsunami. Then, his eyes drifted toward Immortal Lord Hongxi, dressed in white not far away.

Li Fan saw that his face was filled with solemnity.

“Black flames? Has Crimson Flame been enhanced, or is this the power of another Spirit of Heaven and Earth?”

“Ink Flame?”

Faced with this unexpected change in the world, Li Fan was somewhat surprised, but overall, this outcome was still within his expectations.

In previous lifetimes, the Crimson Flame had descended as a heavenly mandate, carrying out acts of burning the seas and annihilating the world.

However, after the Crimson Flame was sacrificed and refined by cultivators, it would trigger a violent counterattack from the will of heaven and earth.

The catastrophic Ink Death would descend, completely reducing Congyun Sea to nothingness.

But in this world, due to the battle between the Heavenly Doctor, the Sage, and the Fisherman, the predetermined timeline for the world's destruction was drastically moved forward.

"The Crimson Flame burning the seas… there is still room for maneuver."

"If the will of heaven and earth had intended complete destruction from the start, then what would have descended wouldn’t have been that feeble boiler worker, Crimson Flame."

"Instead, it would have sent a much stronger spirit of heaven and earth."

"Heaven's mandate, change, fate…"

As Li Fan’s thoughts turned, he vaguely came to an understanding.

"The will of heaven and earth is not immutable, but dynamically adjusts based on actual circumstances."

"Yet its ultimate objective remains the same…

"Congyun Sea must perish!"

"The reason behind this is perhaps not only because cultivators plunder the heavens and seize the land, making them the scourge of heaven and earth, but also due to the involvement of that group from the Heavenly Doctor!"

Li Fan’s eyes gleamed with sharp insight.

While he pondered, a massive wave was already approaching beneath Congyun City.

Even though Congyun Immortal City stood high above the clouds, a mere few hundred-meter-tall wave seemed incapable of posing a threat. However, for some unknown reason, an ominous premonition surged in the hearts of all the cultivators within the city.

And as it turned out, their instincts were correct.

The colossal wave, flickering with black flames, arrived beneath Congyun City—and then, as if it had come alive, its movement trajectory abruptly changed.

It surged upward, ferociously crashing toward the sky.

Cries of alarm rang out in succession.

At that moment, the silent Immortal Lord Hongxi finally made his move.

Beneath Congyun Immortal City, a vast mountain range suddenly rose from the ground.

Like a great wall, it forcibly blocked the oncoming wave.

The wave, obstructed, fell back onto the sea.

Yet Li Fan, who had witnessed Immortal Lord Hongxi’s full strength before, could tell that this seemingly casual move had actually cost Hongxi nearly half of his power.

"That strong?"

Feeling the faint tremor beneath his feet, Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

Although this was only one of his clone, it contained three divine abilities passed down from his true body, each executed with full force.

At a critical moment, he could make it seem real enough to deceive everyone.

The reason for such an elaborate act was to solidify the illusion that Li Fan, the cultivator from the Heavenly Mechanism Sect, had perished.

Li Fan was certain that even amidst this apocalyptic calamity of burning seas, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance would find a way to uncover the final moments before Congyun Sea was obliterated.

Thus, his act had to be flawless—he could not afford to reveal a single flaw.

"It’s still not time to make a move."

"The Crimson Flame… no, where is the true body of the Ink Flame now?"

Li Fan kept his gaze locked onto the surface of Congyun Sea, trying to discern any clues.

Meanwhile, the temporarily blocked wave, as if retreating into dormancy, fell silent upon returning to the sea.

But what followed next was a rain of thousands of black fire meteors.

Almost as if they possessed intelligence, these meteors altered their original trajectory upon seeing the wave’s assault had been thwarted.

They all collectively hurtled toward Congyun City instead.

The sight was so overwhelming that it left the gathered cultivators speechless.

Boom!

The moment the first meteor collided with the protective barrier, the entire Congyun City trembled violently.

What horrified the cultivators even more was that—after just a single impact—fine cracks had already begun to spread across the protective shield.

Chapter 645: The Eternal Choice

Within the Congyun Immortal City, the cultivators were instantly thrown into an uproar upon witnessing the scene.

Fortunately, ever since the last time Ten Thousand Immortal Island was raided and taken by the Five Elders Association, the defenses of the rebuilt Congyun City had been reinforced to a level far superior to that of ordinary state-level immortal cities. Its protection was now comparable to that of several central state capitals. As the defensive grand formation shimmered with flowing light, the crack in the barrier vanished in an instant.

Before the people could even breathe a sigh of relief, a second meteorite of flowing fire crashed into the protective barrier once more. This impact was even more intense than the previous one, causing the floating city in the clouds to tremble violently, as if it were about to plummet from the sky at any moment.

What truly filled the crowd with dread, however, was that this black meteorite did not fully dissipate upon impact. Instead, it left behind a viscous, tar-like substance that wriggled and corroded the protective grand formation. Even from a great distance, one could hear the eerie sizzling sounds coming from the outer edges of the array.

"Although the [Heavenly Origin Transformation Formation] of Congyun City is strong, it won’t hold out for long," said Li Fan, who quickly made his assessment as a formation master.

While the grand formation struggled against the corrosive black , countless more streaks of black fire rained down upon Congyun Immortal City. Though the Immortal Ancestor Statue continuously emitted bursts of violet radiance to intercept some of the incoming fire, many of them still managed to bombard the city unimpeded.

In an instant, Congyun Immortal City swayed like a lone leaf caught in a violent storm, teetering on the brink of destruction.

At that moment, Immortal Lord Hongxi finally displayed the decisiveness expected of a ruler of an entire prefecture.

He transformed into a towering giant, standing as high as the heavens, and intercepted the countless black fireballs. At the same time, he issued a cold, commanding order:

"Activate the entire [Transformation Grand Formation] of the Congyun Sea area! Draw power from all surrounding nodes and ensure Congyun Immortal City remains in peak condition!"

As he spoke, he cast a mystical seal, sending it soaring toward the highest point of the city.

For a brief moment, silence fell over the entire Congyun Immortal City. Most cultivators did not understand the full implications of Immortal Lord Hongxi’s words, but those who did turned pale in an instant.

Li Fan, too, narrowed his eyes as he looked at Hongxi, who had a resolute expression on his face, and silently praised him:

"Such boldness!"

Having studied formations for countless lifetimes, Li Fan had an in-depth understanding of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s defensive system. Each guardian city was equipped with protective formations. Within each state, a floating celestial capital served as the core, linking together hundreds of smaller defensive formations into a vast state-wide formation.

Moreover, throughout the territory of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, the state-wide formations were interconnected, forming an immense and terrifying array that covered nearly half of the Xuanhuang Realm.

A layered system—endlessly intricate, immeasurably powerful!

The defensive formation of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance was replaced every five hundred years. In the past, Li Fan had once seen the remnants of an older array, the "Ten Thousand Mile Rivers-Mountains Formation," on a sunken island. However, the alliance was currently using the "Heavenly Origin Transformation Formation."

Although its defensive strength was slightly weaker than the previous formation, it possessed an irreplaceable ability—

It could absorb the life essence of all beings within the formation to enhance its power!

Thus, Immortal Lord Hongxi’s intent was crystal clear.

He planned to fully activate the Heavenly Origin Transformation Formation, drawing in the life essence of all living beings still surviving on the remaining islands of Congyun Sea area—sacrificing them to maintain the protective barrier of Congyun Immortal City.

From a purely logical standpoint, this decision was not wrong. After all, in the face of such a catastrophe, Congyun Immortal City was the only place that could still barely hold out, while all other islands were doomed to be reduced to ashes in an instant.

By sacrificing those who were already destined to perish, the formation might be strengthened just enough to grant the cultivators within Congyun Immortal City a sliver of hope for survival.

But...

Being annihilated by the Wrath of Heaven and Earth and being slaughtered by one’s own people were two completely different things.

Not everyone had the resolve to make such a cold and ruthless decision—to treat the lives of their fellow brethren as nothing more than expendable fuel.

So, after Immortal Lord Hongxi’s words spread, the cultivators of the Formation Hall remained silent and motionless.

Hongxi himself also seemed to lack the courage to repeat the order. His expression was grim as he watched the protective barrier on the verge of collapse, yet he did not issue another command.

"I shall lend you a hand."

A sharp glint flashed in Li Fan’s eyes. His clone soared into the air and shouted loudly, "What are you all waiting for? This is a matter of life and death! Just follow orders! All consequences will be borne by Lord Hongxi and me alone!"

Hongxi glanced at Li Fan with some surprise.

The cultivators of the Formation Hall also exchanged glances, gritted their teeth, and finally made up their minds.

One after another, talisman seals flew toward the various nodes of the Heavenly Origin Transformation Formation. The protective shield suddenly erupted with brilliance.

It was as if time had frozen for an instant. In the next moment, endless spiritual energy surged in from all directions. The purple barrier instantly became as solid as a tangible entity, effortlessly blocking the impact of the black firestorm.

The violent tremors ceased, replaced by continuous muffled explosions.

For now, the crisis was averted, yet the surviving cultivators of Congyun City showed little joy on their faces. Because along with the drastic enhancement of the Heavenly Origin Transformation Formation, the air was filled with agonized wails and curses. On the glowing barrier, horrifying scenes were faintly visible—humans being drained of all their vital energy in an instant, reduced to skeletons.

It was like a purgatory on earth, chilling to the bone.

"Though we can protect ourselves for now, this is not a long-term solution. All contact with headquarters has been severed. Staying here is nothing more than waiting for death."

"I intend to go out and confront this Spirit of Heaven and Earth. I leave this place in your hands!"

Immortal Lord Hongxi paid no heed to the terrifying spectacle surrounding him and transmitted his voice to Li Fan.

Then, he gazed into the distance toward the impact site of the black meteor and took a step forward.

His figure flickered rapidly, vanishing from everyone's sight in the blink of an eye.

With the departure of Immortal Lord Hongxi, the cultivators who had just regained their composure became anxious again. Fortunately, Lord Secret Envoy was still present, allowing them to retain some measure of reassurance.

Li Fan, however, maintained a cold expression, staring intently at the center of Congyun Sea, patiently waiting.

Time passed slowly. As the first wave of black firestorm was completely repelled, the apocalyptic crisis seemed to have subsided. The once-raging Congyun Sea gradually calmed, leaving only the thick, sticky black substance clinging to the protective barrier—evidence of the catastrophe that had just unfolded.

Yet, this unnatural calmness carried the ominous tension of an approaching storm.

Li Fan sensed something was amiss.

"Ink Flame isn’t there?"

Sensing the rapid return of Immortal Lord Hongxi, Li Fan swept his gaze across the sky, then toward the deep sea.

It seemed as though some terrifying calamity was brewing beneath the waves.

Plop!

A single air bubble suddenly surfaced.

Then, a fish corpse—its belly upturned as if it had been boiled—floated to the surface.

And then—

In an instant, the entire Congyun Sea seemed to boil.

Countless bubbles surged violently, accompanied by the floating corpses of innumerable sea creatures.

Chapter 646: Sealing the Spirit, Locking the Crimson Flame

In past lifetimes, the Crimson Flame boiled the sea, taking more than a dozen years to completely incinerate the Congyun Sea.

Yet now, the Ink Flame had descended for less than half a day, and it had already brought the entire Congyun Sea to a rolling boil.

Billowing steam continuously surged upward, forming dense mist like floating clouds above the sea.

At this rate, in just a few days, the Congyun Sea would be completely dried up!

The difference between the Crimson Flame and the Ink Flame was evident at a glance.

"But compared to Ink Death’s terrifying power that can obliterate everything, it's still somewhat lacking," Li Fan observed the churning, boiling sea below, contemplating silently.

Just then, Immortal Lord Hongxi had already flown back.

"The earth veins!"

Without further words, he swiftly formed a series of complex hand seals, activating the Heavenly Origin Transformation Formation.

The scene within the light screen shifted, and an enormous, glowing web appeared before everyone.

Li Fan immediately noticed that the outermost edges of this web were already tainted black!

Suddenly, realization dawned upon him.

The Ink Flame had been utilizing the vast, ceaselessly flowing earth veins scattered throughout the Congyun Sea, rapidly transmitting its scorching heat to every corner of the sea.

"No wonder it never showed itself. Not only is its martial strength on another level, but even its intelligence has evolved?"

"Extract the earth veins and force it to reveal itself!" Immortal Lord Hongxi’s face flashed with a ruthless glint as he commanded coldly.

The earth veins are the very foundation of the land. If they were damaged, the terrain of the entire region would be upheaved, potentially leading to unpredictable and eerie changes. It might even become completely uninhabitable for cultivators.

This was an absolute last resort. Even if they survived the calamity, they would not escape the punishment of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

But at this moment, having already committed the act of "slaughtering their own kin," the cultivators no longer cared about such consequences.

The Heavenly Origin Transformation Formation, originally linked to various earth vein nodes, was now reversed—starting to extract power directly from the earth veins.

Hummm…

Before long, a strange sound echoed in everyone’s ears.

It was as if the earth itself was toppling, mountains fracturing apart.

The already boiling sea grew even more violent. The Congyun Sea surged with monstrous waves, and dark storm clouds gathered from an unknown source, rolling in from the sky.

The howling wind roared, the ocean trembled.

Before the overwhelming might of heaven and earth, every cultivator in Congyun City turned pale as death, their bodies trembling uncontrollably.

However, infused with the yellowish earth vein power, the protective formation of Congyun City became even more solid and unyielding. Amidst the world-shaking destruction, it stood firm like an unshakable fortress in a storm, offering a sliver of hope to the cultivators.

The waves grew even fiercer.

As the surface of the Congyun Sea continued to recede, parts of the shallow seabed began to emerge.

But unlike a normal seabed covered in sediment, this one was entirely shrouded in a layer of an unknown black substance.

It was as if the rocks had been completely incinerated to ash.

"Even if we survive this disaster, it'll take at least several decades—maybe even centuries—for the Congyun Sea to recover."

Many cultivators, witnessing the scene, sighed in lament.

Yet, seeing that the Ink Flame had still not revealed itself, Immortal Lord Hongxi hardened his resolve completely.

"Continue—do not stop!"

The rumbling sound of the seabed fracturing echoed as the Heavenly Origin Transformation Formation continued operating at full power.

Boom!

It seemed to have reached a critical threshold, as fiery magma suddenly erupted from the ocean floor.

Then, as if triggering a chain reaction, volcanic flames burst forth across the entire Congyun Sea, with lava shooting toward the sky.

A thousand fiery dragons soared, scorching the heavens and earth.

Amid the distorted air, a figure half-red and half-black silently emerged beneath Congyun City.

"So, you've finally come out?"

A flash of killing intent and greed flickered in Immortal Lord Hongxi's eyes before his figure vanished.

In the next moment, he transformed into a continuous mountain range, encircling the entity at the center.

"That is..."

"Crimson Flame! The Spirit of Heaven and Earth, Crimson Flame!"

Witnessing the evolved form of Crimson Flame, the cultivators were all thrown into a frenzy.

Even though they had already seen its terrifying power—capable of incinerating the sea with a mere gesture—it did nothing to quell their burning desire.

"So it wasn't a meteor catastrophe, but rather the descent of the Spirit of Heaven and Earth!"

"Indeed! This is a great opportunity!"

"Sacrificing the Spirit of Heaven and Earth can grant us an instant breakthrough to Dao Integration!"

Within just a few breaths, the cultivators were consumed by greed. Some began rallying others to hunt down Crimson Flame together.

Others, having completely lost their minds, rushed toward Crimson Flame like moths to a flame.

As expected, before they could even approach, they were reduced to ashes by the intense heat.

"It's still Crimson Flame, not Ink Flame?"

Li Fan paid no heed to their deaths, instead fixating on the half-red, half-black mutated Crimson Flame, lost in thought.

His clone felt the same surge of greed.

However, unlike in previous lifetimes, where the mere sight of Crimson Flame nearly made him lose his sanity, this time was different.

Without consciously activating the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra, the greed from his clone dissipated on its own.

Like snow melting into water, it only caused faint ripples, leaving no real impact on him.

"Immortal techniques are truly extraordinary. Not only does my main body remain clear-minded, but even a clone thousands of miles away is unwavering."

Li Fan sighed inwardly.

Still, to avoid exposing himself, he feigned being deeply captivated by the Spirit of Heaven and Earth, struggling to restrain himself.

His eyes turned bloodshot, veins bulging, his body rigid.

He wanted to see—where did Immortal Lord Hongxi find the courage to face Crimson Flame alone?

After all, in the previous life, even a weakened version of Crimson Flame had been too powerful. Hongxi and several other Soul Transformation cultivators together were no match for it.

Let alone this black-red version in this life.

Without some secret weapon, Immortal Lord Hongxi would surely be instantly annihilated.

But clearly, Hongxi was not a reckless fool.

Under Li Fan’s watchful gaze, Hongxi flew toward Crimson Flame.

A towering mountain range materialized, momentarily trapping Crimson Flame. At the same time, Hongxi raised a small rectangular mirror and aimed it at Crimson Flame!

"That is..."

Li Fan’s pupils contracted sharply.

"Xuantian Sealing the Spirit!" Hongxi roared.

A radiant blue light shot forth from the mirror, striking Crimson Flame directly.

As if struck by a powerful gust of wind, Crimson Flame’s translucent body flickered unsteadily.

Yet despite its overwhelming might just moments ago, it was utterly powerless against this blue light!

As though inherently restrained, a look of astonishment appeared on Crimson Flame's face, and its body froze instantly!

A look of ecstasy surged onto Hongxi's face.

"This is bad!"

Li Fan’s heart sank.

"Could it be that in this life, Hongxi will actually succeed in Dao Integration so easily?"

He hadn’t expected that after returning from the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance headquarters, Immortal Lord Hongxi would wield such a terrifying weapon—the Xuantian Sealing Spirit.

And in the face of this technique, the Spirit of Heaven and Earth was unbelievably feeble!

Chapter 647: Recklessly Reaping the Fisherman’s Profit

As the green pillar of light restrained Crimson Flame, countless thin threads split off from the mirror Hongxi held high. These threads, like long needles, pierced into Crimson Flame’s body.

Crimson Flame’s black-and-red body trembled violently, like a flickering candle in the wind.

Li Fan keenly noticed that the green threads seemed to be absorbing something. Crimson Flame’s body was gradually shrinking, and it's aura was continuously weakening.

Crimson Flame struggled desperately to break free, but it was like an insect caught in a spider’s web—the more he resisted, the tighter the threads wrapped around him.

The massive green net firmly locked Crimson Flame in place.

The sight of his current miserable state starkly contrasted with Li Fan’s past-life memories, where even in defeat, Crimson Flame had at least displayed the combat strength of a Dao Integration powerhouse imbued with the power of the Spirit of Heaven and Earth.

"The power of the Spirit of Heaven and Earth comes from the heavens and the earth. The Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation, however, can replace the heavens and sever his connection to the world. No wonder Crimson Flame is so utterly powerless," Li Fan thought to himself as he observed Crimson Flame’s tragic condition.

"But I wonder… will this formation be able to suppress Ink Death as well? If Ink Death is still sacrificed and refined, will the heavens respond by sending an even stronger incarnation of the Spirit of Heaven and Earth?"

Just as everyone in Congyun Sea thought the battle was already decided, a colossal hand suddenly emerged from beneath the ocean’s surface.

In the blink of an eye, the five fingers closed together, capturing both Hongxi and Crimson Flame in its grasp!

"Tianyang!" Li Fan instantly recognized the origin of the giant hand.

However, this time, Tianyang did not shout his signature phrase, ‘Tianyang’s life—never weaker than others!’ Instead, he had silently lurked beneath the battlefield, waiting for the perfect moment.

Like a cunning predator, he had swooped in to capture them both in one fell swoop.

"You court death!" Hongxi’s expression changed drastically upon realizing Tianyang’s ambush.

He maintained the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation while simultaneously commanding layers of mountain-like formations to crash into the five imprisoning fingers around him.

"Boom!"

To Hongxi’s shock, the massive hand did not even attempt to resist his attack. It allowed the manifested mountains to crash into it directly. Yet, at the moment of impact, those towering peaks—indistinguishable from real mountains—shattered as if they had struck something a hundred times harder.

They crumbled into dust on the spot.

Immortal Lord Hongxi’s body trembled slightly. The immense counterforce almost caused him to lose control of the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation.

Sensing a glimmer of hope, Crimson Flame immediately ceased his struggles.

Instead, he withdrew and conserved his strength, waiting for Hongxi to expose another opening.

“Damn it!” Hongxi cursed under his breath after suffering an unexpected setback. He chose to momentarily ignore Tianyang’s giant hand and instead focused all his efforts on the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation, accelerating the refining of Crimson Flame.

However, Tianyang—who had been greatly enhanced by Li Fan’s relentless efforts—had evidently grown more intelligent. He was no longer just a brute relying on sheer force.

The five fingers of the enormous hand suddenly turned crimson, as if molten lava flowed within them. Some of the lava even seeped from the puppet’s body, freely circulating and forming intricate patterns.

Like fiery dragons soaring through the air, these streams of lava swiftly arranged themselves into a complete formation, trapping both Hongxi and Crimson Flame within.

“The Earth-Fire Return to Origin Formation!” Li Fan’s eyes flickered with sharp insight.

“It seems Tianyang’s transformation is quite significant. He’s no longer just relying on brute force but has actually learned to use formations!”

“Hongxi was too greedy. He had plenty of time to evade while the formation was taking shape, but he refused to give up on the Spiri of Heaven and Earth he had already captured.”

"Now, it’s just a matter of who’s faster. Will Hongxi drain and kill Crimson Flame first, advancing to the Dao Integration realm? Or will Tianyang absorb Hongxi entirely and ascend to become a Dao Integration Immortal Sage…”

With an amused expression, Li Fan watched the three-way standoff in the sky, ready to enjoy the show.

However, some of the cultivators within Congyun City could no longer sit still.

"The Spirit of Heaven and Earth belongs to the virtuous! Fellow Daoists, the opportunity to defy fate and change destiny is right before our eyes!"

Encouraged and incited by those with ulterior motives, dozens—if not hundreds—of cultivators could not resist the temptation in their hearts. One after another, they launched attacks on the three who were locked in a standoff, hoping to become the lucky one who would reap the benefits and ascend to greatness in a single step.

Li Fan noticed that He Zhenghao almost lost control as well. He had already flown forward, but for some reason, he suddenly came to his senses halfway and turned back.

"Wait a little longer… just a little longer."

Li Fan heard him mumbling under his breath.

His tightly shut eyes and trembling body clearly showed that he was desperately suppressing his own desires at this moment.

Li Fan chuckled and shifted his gaze back to Tianyang and the others.

The Earth-Fire Return to Origin Formation had already been pushed to its limit by Tianyang. Columns of magma erupted continuously from the seabed beneath Congyun, forming a spectacular scene of fire dragons surging through the ocean. Li Fan knew that Tianyang was exerting his full strength to harness the power of the Congyun Earth-Fire.

Ordinarily, Earth-Fire was bound to and restricted by the earth’s veins, making it nearly impossible for cultivators to control it so easily.

However, earlier, in order to force out Crimson Flame, Immortal Lord Hongxi had activated the Heavenly Origin Transformation Formation, completely destroying the earth veins of Congyun Sea.

As a result, the Earth-Fire magma lost its restraints and raged like a wild horse, allowing the Earth-Fire Return to Origin Formation to function at twice its normal effectiveness.

From a certain perspective, this was a case of cause and effect—Immortal Lord Hongxi was digging his own grave.

Noticing that his energy was depleting even faster than Crimson Flame’s, Hongxi’s expression kept shifting.

At this moment, if he withdrew the Xuantian Sealing Spirit Mirror and gave up suppressing Crimson Flame, focusing entirely on the situation at hand, he might be able to escape from the Earth-Fire Return to Origin Formation.

However, the Xuantian Sealing Spirit Mirror could only be used once. After activation, the mirror would turn into an ordinary object. To use it again, he would have to return to the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance headquarters to request a recharge.

This meant that if he interrupted the process now, all his previous efforts would be wasted.

He might be able to save his life, but achieving Dao Integration? That would be out of the question.

On the other hand, if he fought to the death, there was indeed the risk of losing his life—but there was also a chance of breaking through to the Dao Integration realm! If he succeeded, the heavens and earth would be vast before him, and his fate would be forever changed!

With a ferocious expression, Immortal Lord Hongxi made his final decision in an instant.

Blazing streaks of light shot out from his body, attacking the Earth-Fire Return to Origin Formation, attempting to slow down his own refinement and absorption process.

Meanwhile, Hongxi’s eyes were filled with unwavering determination. He cast aside all distractions, focusing solely on controlling the Xuantian Spirit Sealing Formation to suppress and refine Crimson Flame.

Time passed, second by second.

Crimson Flame’s body grew dimmer and dimmer.

It had become almost completely transparent, as if it could disappear from the world at any moment.

"Die for me!"

Hongxi roared, transforming into a golden-brown beam of light and charging at Crimson Flame without hesitation.

At the same time, the Xuantian Spirit Sealing Formation erupted with its most dazzling radiance.

Green and yellow intertwined like a sharp blade, about to pierce fiercely into Crimson Flame’s body.

Chapter 648: The Transformation of Heaven and Earth – Ink Death

At that moment, Crimson Flame, who had seemingly given up struggling and was silently awaiting death, suddenly lifted his head.

On his blurred and flickering face, a mocking smile seemed to emerge.

Then, in an instant, his body, originally a mix of black and red, turned completely pitch black!

Like ink dripping into a pool of water, the surrounding space was instantly dyed into a deep darkness!

Li Fan’s mind trembled violently.

Even the surviving cultivators, who had once gazed at Crimson Flame with greed in their hearts, were now completely engulfed in fear.

Because what they sensed as the Spirit of Heaven and Earth – Crimson Flame had, without warning, transformed into the Spirit of Heaven and Earth – Ink Death!

“What is happening?!”

Not only were the onlookers overwhelmed with panic, but even Li Fan himself was filled with shock.

“The Spirit of Heaven and Earth… can switch between one another? Ink Death can replace Crimson Flame instantly without requiring his death?”

Li Fan’s heartbeat accelerated, his mind racing. What he witnessed today felt as though it had opened a completely new door before him.

Amid this sudden and drastic change, Hongxi, who had just risked everything in a desperate strike, was the first to bear the brunt of it.

His once resolute and determined expression turned into sheer terror and despair.

But there was no turning back—the arrow had already left the bow. He could no longer stop himself as he charged straight into the ink-black domain surrounding Ink Death.

There was no earth-shattering explosion. No dazzling bursts of light.

There was only the soundless dissolution—like snowflakes melting into water—as Hongxi’s entire body disappeared without a trace.

Ink Death tilted his head slightly, the corners of his mouth curling into an eerie smile.

Above, the sky gave birth to a strange phenomenon.

“Soul Transformation cultivator Hong Xi—

Seven hundred and sixty-three years of cultivation.

Established his Dao foundation through the Five Elements Mountain.

Formed his Golden Core with the laws of metal, wood, water, fire, and earth.

Devoured the Hundred Ridge Cave-Heaven to condense his Nascent Soul.

Drew from Taihua’s Thousand Rising Peaks to transform his soul.

Now, struck by divine retribution—his Dao vanishes, returning to the heavens.”

The sky trembled as vast mountain ranges collapsed, signifying the fall of Immortal Lord Hongxi, the once-dominant Nascent Soul cultivator of the Cloud Sea Region.

From the moment Ink Death appeared, Tianyang had already sensed the danger.

Although he had vowed never to be weaker than anyone in his lifetime, that did not mean he would throw his life away in vain.

Without hesitation, he activated the Earth-Fire Return to Origin Formation to its full extent, sacrificing the integrity of the formation to trigger a massive eruption.

As the earth’s molten lava raged, Tianyang attempted to sever his own hand and escape.

Even as his severed hand remained to restrain Ink Death, his true body had already begun to flee in secret.

However, no matter how fast he was, he was still slower than Ink Death.

The blazing lava had not even reached Ink Death before it was tainted, transformed into fine, pitch-black particles.

Like a drop of ink falling into the world, the darkness spread rapidly.

Tianyang had barely gotten far before the ever-expanding ink-black domain caught up to him.

Unlike Hongxi, who had been silently dissolved, Tianyang’s demise was accompanied by crackling flames and agonizing creaks that echoed from within the darkness.

Even as the inky void spread further outward, signs of Tianyang’s desperate struggle could still be faintly seen in the center.

But in the end, it seemed only to prolong his suffering.

Before long, all disturbances ceased completely—the pitch-black domain fell into an eerie stillness.

Li Fan’s eyelids twitched violently.

He had fortified Tianyang’s body with materials, including the legendary Eternal Tribulation Gold, said to be indestructible across countless calamities.

Originally, he had hoped that Tianyang might at least endure a couple of exchanges against Ink Death.

But the result...

“The gap is simply too vast. Ink Death…”

“…is truly terrifying.”

Even though Li Fan had witnessed battles between Heavenly Doctor, the Grand Sage, and others, the sight of Ink Death’s power still sent a chill through his heart.

“And this time… Ink Death seems even more ‘alive’ than before?”

He wasn’t sure if it was just his imagination, but as he stared at that ever-expanding abyss of darkness in the sky, a strange realization dawned upon him.

As for the other cultivators in Congyun City, they were not merely feeling a slight chill like Li Fan.

The sudden turn of events had left them in complete despair.

In the blink of an eye, the two Soul Transformation cultivators, who had once seemed to hold the upper hand, had both fallen.

The remaining survivors could only tremble in fear, their hearts sinking into the abyss of hopelessness.

Meanwhile, in Congyun City, many cultivators who had been secluding themselves within the Tianxuan Mirror were suddenly cast out. They wore expressions of utter bewilderment, having no inkling of what was happening.

“Even the Tianxuan Mirror has withdrawn its bestowed power—it appears to have abandoned the Congyun Sea.”

“What is meant to come will come.”

Li Fan looked around at the cultivators—crying out in despair and exposing their pitiable state—and thought as such.

After the fall of Tianyang, the spreading of the ink traces gradually slowed. Reappearing in human form, Ink Death’s gaze swept over everyone in Congyun City. Every cultivator who came under his stare found their bodies suddenly stiffened and immobilized, their hearts plunged into profound terror.

Then, perhaps in a mischievous, cat-and-mouse manner, Ink Death did not immediately attack these cultivators; instead, he flickered away, vanishing without a trace. The cultivators, their faces awash with disbelief, assumed that Ink Death had spared them. In that moment, a spark of hope ignited within their hearts. But clearly, that hope was in vain.

High above, black rain began to fall. As the droplets descended to the ground, everything they touched was rendered insubstantial. Soon after, an inky substance—of the same origin—surged forth from the void, devouring everything in its path. Under the watchful eyes of all, the Congyun Sea was slowly disappearing. Ironically, every drop of the black rain avoided the airborne Congyun City, as if to punish the cultivators inside, forcing them to witness the gradual erasure of the Congyun Sea. Ink Death orchestrated it all.

“This Ink Death sure has a twisted sense of humor,” Li Fan mused while staring at the increasingly dark surroundings, his heart growing ever heavier.

The horrifying scene drove the cultivators of Congyun City into complete madness. Realizing that they had no hope of survival, some resorted to self-destruction, ending their own lives; others, with eyes blazing red, unleashed lethal attacks toward the pitch-black expanse outside the city; still others collapsed to the ground, sobbing uncontrollably.

He Zhenghao was among them. His body trembled incessantly as his daughter’s earlier counsel echoed in his mind:

“A terrible calamity—a threat to life.”

“All you need to do is leave the Congyun Sea.”

…

With a look of bewilderment and regret on his face, images of his beloved Heng Ruoshui and his daughter He Xinxin materialized before him.

“I have been so foolish!”

A cascade of memories, like a revolving lantern, flashed through his mind, and He Zhenghao wept bitterly. But then, suddenly, he stopped and bolted in Li Fan’s direction.

“Esteemed Secret Envoy! Please, you must come up with a solution!”

“You surely have some way, don’t you?”

Crawling and stumbling, he reached Li Fan’s side, clinging to his last shred of hope as he pleaded.

Li Fan offered no reply; he silently soared upward into the sky. With a provocative stance aimed at the pitch-black realm beyond Congyun City, the inky darkness of the heavens and earth seemed to come to an abrupt standstill. Then, a figure appeared not far from Li Fan, watching him with keen interest.

Chapter 649: Myriad Phenomena Amidst the Congyun

Ink Death and Li Fan, separated by the protective light shield of Congyun City’s [Heavenly Origin Transformation Formation], regarded each other from afar.

Their standoff instantly captured the attention of all the surviving cultivators.

Although it was hard to believe that the Secret Envoy could contend with the terrifying “Spirit of Heaven and Earth” before him—a force that had so easily slain two Soul Transformation-stage cultivators—the aura of mystery and the incredible legends surrounding Li Fan, the cultivator of the Ancient Heavenly Mechanism Sect, inevitably rekindled a glimmer of hope in their hearts.

Under the gaze of countless onlookers, Li Fan stood with his arms folded, his voice thundering:

“How dare you, mere fragments of the Spirit of Heaven and Earth, act so presumptuously!

Although my cultivation has not yet been fully restored, I will not tolerate your insolence in my presence!”

Enhanced deliberately by his spiritual power, his voice boomed and echoed throughout Congyun City.

Coupled with his transcendent, solitary demeanor, his domineering words truly exuded the aura of an unparalleled master.

While the cultivators of Congyun City were rendered silent, Ink Death’s reaction was noticeably subtle.

The true nature of Li Fan’s clone was, of course, not hidden from Ink Death. Yet even he had not expected that a cultivator at the Golden Core stage could not only overcome his inner greed and fear but also dare to speak so impertinently to him.

Clearly, such a feat was beyond the capabilities of an ordinary cultivator.

Doubting his own judgment, Ink Death stood momentarily stunned—as if Li Fan’s words had struck him with overwhelming force.

“Lord Secret Envoy is mighty!” cheers erupted throughout Congyun City.

But Li Fan paid no heed, his expression grave as he lightly pointed toward where Ink Death stood.

“Flying Star!” he commanded, his voice cold and lethal, utterly devoid of emotion.

Then, a small point of light appeared within the pitch-black domain surrounding Ink Death and soon burst forth with brilliant radiance.

An extremely terrifying force erupted from that light.

Under the shroud of white light, the dense, inky darkness began to fade and dissipate.

As space twisted and trembled, it seemed that a towering, tumultuous wave was rising from the sea of darkness. Ink Death’s body swayed incessantly—like leaves trembling in a wild, gusty wind.

In that instant, all the surviving cultivators, including He Zhenghao, were profoundly shaken.

The might of the Secret Envoy was indeed fearsome.

This never-before-seen divine technique, known as “Flying Star,” was utterly terrifying—so much so that even Ink Death found it hard to withstand.

As they caught sight of a renewed glimmer of hope, the onlookers were both shocked and elated.

However, among everyone present, only Li Fan knew that it was all but an illusion.

He did not actually possess any “Flying Star” divine technique.

The dazzling white light that appeared at his fingertips was merely the effect of the self-detonation of the Immortal City Cave—a remarkable treasure imbued with countless precious materials, including [Annihilating Thunder of Oblivion].

The Immortal City Cave itself was no ordinary artifact. Moreover, during its construction, Li Fan had ordered Zhou Kebao to incorporate various lethal modifications.

When it detonated at its extreme, even a cultivator at the Dao Integration stage, caught off guard, would suffer severe injuries.

Of course, Ink Death’s power was far beyond that of ordinary Dao Integration cultivators.

Thus, this seemingly formidable “Flying Star” could not truly harm Ink Death—it would at most only cause him a bit of trouble.

Li Fan was well aware of this; his intention was merely to delay Ink Death for a moment.

Only then would he unleash his trump card.

Under the cover of the dazzling white light, Li Fan silently retrieved a five-faced, ten-armed statue, and after uttering his final words to it...

Fiercely, he hurled it toward Ink Death.

The secret technique [Sky-Shrouding Hand] enveloped the battlefield, while the [Heaven-Shattering Heart Sword] unleashed an endless cascade of sword light, concealing the surroundings.

"Myriad Phenomena!"

As Li Fan roared in fury, the Five Faces, Ten Hands, and the Manifested Heavenly Sovereign Form had already arrived before Ink Death.

Faced with repeated provocations from a mere Golden Core cultivator, the killing intent in Ink Death's heart had reached its peak.

He decided to stop playing this game of cat and mouse.

Endless black particles coalesced into a black dragon, surging toward the incoming sword light of Li Fan, determined to annihilate this insolent challenger.

In an instant, as the black tide engulfed everything, the sword light imbued with the Heaven-Shattering Heart Sword was forcibly transformed.

Immediately afterward, the wriggling black particles launched a direct attack on the Manifested Heavenly Sovereign Form.

In the next moment—

The Five Faces, Ten Hands shattered with a deafening explosion.

A jade-like delicate arm suddenly emerged, slashing a sword toward Ink Death.

A robed man’s phantom figure lightly waved a dust whisk toward him.

A scholar-dressed white-robed cultivator flung an ancient wooden scroll at Ink Death.

A sleeping infant, with eyes closed, let out a series of wailing cries.

A golden talisman sheet, light as a feather, descended upon Ink Death with crushing weight.

"Now is the moment!"

Li Fan’s clone's eyes shone with brilliance as he crushed a storage ring filled with an immense quantity of Kunpeng essence blood and hundreds of Beast Soul Beads, meticulously crafted within an empire's small-world.

In an instant, waves of blood surged, and demonic aura soared skyward.

A misty purple energy immediately descended from the horizon.

"Still not enough!"

Li Fan then unsealed the divine ability [Kun Devours] from within his true body's core, activating the [Heaven-Devouring Earth-Eating Technique], wildly absorbing the countless top-grade spirit stones stored within the ring.

With this surge, he charged toward the already overstretched limit of his bottleneck—Calamity of Heaven!

"Demonic heretic!"

Just as the western winds carried the purple aura, a cold and merciless voice from Senior Brother Zhang rang out.

Sensing that Li Fan’s clone was about to shatter the Heaven’s Limit, a colossal hand suddenly emerged across the celestial sky.

"Aren't you all fond of hiding in the shadows and scheming? This time, I'll make you tear each other apart!"

A manic expression flashed across Li Fan’s clone as his Golden Core exploded with a thunderous roar.

His human body disintegrated inch by inch, yet his flesh, empowered by immense force, did not immediately disperse.

Eyes filled with a savage glow, his fingers danced rapidly in the void. Before his form could collapse entirely, he wrote a single character: [Chaos (亂)]!

This sequence of actions had already been rehearsed countless times in Li Fan’s mind.

Though it appeared to span an eternity, it all transpired in a single instant.

"Myriad Phenomena!"

Li Fan’s cold shout still echoed in the air.

As the sword light vanished and the shattered Manifested Heavenly Sovereign Form faded, five distinct figures emerged.

Ink Death, who had been brimming with killing intent, now showed a flicker of surprise on his face.

However, he would not retreat.

A boundless black tide surged, colliding with the divine abilities unleashed by the five Longevity Immortal Sovereigns.

Then, another purple lightning bolt tore through the void, striking directly into their battlefield.

The colossal celestial hand in the sky remained indifferent to the chaos below and continued to press downward with overwhelming might.

Meanwhile, Li Fan's final technique—sacrificing his clone to cast the [Chaos] mantra—plunged the battlefield into even greater turmoil and eerie unpredictability.

With so many unforeseen variables arriving in an instant, for the first time, a trace of shock appeared on Ink Death’s face.

Yet he still did not retreat.

The dark tide raged, surging into a towering tsunami, engulfing everything in its path.

Chapter 650: The Chaos Script Confounds the Heavenly Sovereigns

In an unknown space.

Five statues with indistinct faces stood in a circle.

Their heads were lowered, gazing at the center.

There, a massive glowing cloud floated in the air.

Within the cloud, faint miniature landscapes of land, mountains, and flowing rivers could be seen.

The cloud was divided into isolated regions of various sizes, with each region containing a tiny floating point of light.

At the edge of this luminous cloud, in a small blue area, black specks were writhing and shifting.

Suddenly, in an instant, this region erupted with various brilliant lights.

Then, as if a violent explosion had occurred, faint tremors rippled outward, spreading across the surrounding cloud.

Like clouds swayed by the wind, the luminous cloud flickered and shifted gently.

Soon after, from the turbulent area at the cloud's edge, a vast swath of blackness surged forth.

In a flash, it engulfed everything.

As if some unseen entity had taken a single bite, the entire region was swallowed up in an instant, vanishing entirely from the glowing mass.

At the same time, apart from the statue in the center, whose eyes remained closed and head bowed, the other four statues suddenly opened their eyes.

They all gazed at the now-void region.

A strange atmosphere filled the space.

"Fellow Daoist Yi Xin, what do you think?"

"Hehe, my eyes were dazzled by the flash—I can’t see clearly."

"Some force has disrupted our perception… Wait, could this be…"

"Indeed."

"Impossible."

The space fell into silence.

It seemed they were sensing something.

After a long while, a voice broke the silence again.

"Besides [Chaos], there’s also [Xuanhuang Celestial Palm], [Purple Cloud Dharma Body]…"

"The Xuanhuang Realm hasn’t been this lively in a long time. I do hope this keeps happening," Senior Sister Zhao said lazily.

The other three ignored her.

"Each of us was drawn into activating a divine ability. It must be related to that entity we made a deal with through the [Heaven-Suppressing Alliance]."

"Zhou Qingang, Li Fan?"

"Are they all dead?"

"Heh, how interesting."

"These are mere trivial matters; it could just be a distraction meant to catch our attention. The real issue is—why has [Chaos] reappeared in the Xuanhuang Realm?"

"I'll have my subordinates investigate, but we shouldn't place too much hope in it. There’s something unusual about this."

"That old geezer Immortal Ancestor seems to have disappeared again recently."

"Oh? That reminds me of something amusing, hehe."

…

As the conversation continued, the five statues eventually closed their eyes once more.

Silence returned to the space.

Tianling Prefecture.

Looking toward the Congyun Sea in the distance, the vision in Li Fan's mind suddenly cut off.

He remained silent.

Focusing his senses, he detected no imminent danger.

After a long time, he finally let out a breath and flew swiftly toward the location of the Longevity Valley.

"As I expected, the 'Manifested Heavenly Sovereign Statue' isn’t just a simple communication tool linked to the Five Elders Association."

"Senior Sister Zhao, the robed cultivator, the scholar, the infant, and that invisible golden parchment…"

"They must correspond to the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereigns of the Five Elders Association."

Li Fan’s eyes flickered with thought.

As the most valuable artifact obtained from his dealings with the Five Elders Association, he refused to believe that the Heavenly Sovereign Statue was merely a transmission device.

Even his own Soul Fragment Jade Slip carried a trace of his divine sense, after all.

Therefore, although the Five Elders Association did not explicitly state it, Li Fan still speculated that the Heavenly Sovereign Statue must contain some of the power of the Five Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereigns.

Using it to deceive others while simultaneously testing Mo Sha's true strength was a perfect strategy.

"I just don't know whether, after using the Manifested Heavenly Sovereign Statue in this way, my final request—that the Five Elders Association hide my identity, command Samantabhadra True Boat, sneak into the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance through the White Mist Barrier, and create chaos across various locations—will be granted."

Li Fan pondered silently.

According to the Five Elders Association's spies, orders from the Manifested Heavenly Sovereign Statue were almost equivalent to a decree from the Heavenly Sovereigns themselves. As long as it did not threaten the rule of the Five Elders Association, it would be strictly carried out.

However, since it had only been a short time since the peace negotiations between the Five Elders Association and the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance, and given that Li Fan had essentially tricked the Five Elders Association, it was uncertain whether all his orders would be implemented.

"No matter what, my goal has already been achieved. With so many forces erupting at once and the Chaos Technique further stirring the pot, everything has turned into an unsolvable mess."

"Even if someone wants to investigate, they likely won’t have the means to do so."

Restored to his original appearance, Li Fan thought to himself.

"The former cultivator of the Heavenly Mechanism Sect, Li Fan, is already dead. The only one who exists now is just an ordinary Nascent Soul cultivator."

Li Fan knew that his mysterious "death" and the sudden disappearance of billions of contribution points from his account would undoubtedly raise many suspicions.

But...

So what?

He was already "dead," and he had died on a battlefield surrounded by powerful figures.

How could they investigate?

Who would dare investigate?

Most likely, the matter would be quietly dismissed.

"As long as I hide in Longevity Valley for a while longer, all of this will be forgotten."

"By then, even if I openly proclaim myself as Li Fan, it probably won’t cause much of a stir."

...

Li Fan's eyes gleamed as he sped toward Longevity Valley.

After about half a month, he finally arrived at his destination.

Within the Essence Devouring White Mist, he located the markings left behind by Elder Liu, broke through the seal, and finally entered Longevity Valley.

A surge of dense wood-attribute spiritual energy washed over him, making Li Fan unconsciously squint his eyes in comfort.

"Young Master, you've arrived!"

Sensing Li Fan's aura, Liu San hurried over to greet him.

"Was everything successful?" he asked.

Li Fan nodded but did not elaborate.

Since Liu San trusted Li Fan deeply, he refrained from asking further questions.

"For the next few years, we will focus on laying low. Unless necessary, do not venture outside. Our priority is refining the Longevity Pill," Li Fan declared, setting the course of action for the near future.

Liu San immediately agreed.

"Apart from the Longevity Pill, I have found several other medicinal pills that could also fetch a high price," Liu San suggested.

"I noticed that New Method Cultivators tend to have highly volatile emotions. Since Longevity Valley has all the necessary herbs, I can take some time to refine the Supreme Emotionless Pill."

Liu San then explained the pill's effects to Li Fan.

It was quite similar to Blue Flame, which Li Fan had previously used. This pill would allow its user to maintain an almost absolute state of rationality.

Not only could it enhance combat performance by up to 200%, but it also had miraculous effects in breaking bottlenecks and achieving enlightenment.

Li Fan was very pleased with this.

"Elder Liu, you are absolutely right. This pill will surely be well-received in the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance."

"However, do not overly pursue high-quality versions. Try to refine ones with lower medicinal potency instead," Li Fan instructed.

"Oh, right."

As if remembering something, Li Fan began introducing Liu San and the others to the existence of the Fallen Immortal Realm.

Chapter 651: Calmly Planning for the Future

"A single glance reflects ten thousand years, and after falling, one becomes a world of their own?!"

"How is this possible?"

Liu San was shocked by the unbelievable reality that Li Fan had just described.

"How could the Xuanhuang Realm have a True Immortal? Why have we never heard of such a thing?"

Even as a Dao Integration expert, upon hearing of the existence of the Fallen Immortal Realm, Liu San's reaction was no better than Li Fan's.

Li Fan smiled and said, "Elder Liu, there is no need for doubt. This matter is absolutely true—I have personally experienced it."

"What my eyes saw was exactly as it was back then. Truly the work of a True Immortal." He shook his head, full of emotion.

Hearing this, Liu San was completely convinced, but his heart grew even more astonished.

Suddenly, as if he had realized something, his eyes flashed with excitement.

"Young Master, you just said that the Fallen Immortal Realm is a true projection of the ancient Xuanhuang Realm. Does that mean that the Medicine King Sect from back then still exists within it?"

"The old sect master, even you and me, as well as all the other cultivators of the Medicine King Sect..."

"During our exploration, is it possible that we might encounter them?" Liu San’s voice trembled as he slowly asked.

Li Fan pondered for a moment before nodding, giving him a definite answer.

Throughout the history of the Xuanhuang Realm, there were indeed cases where ancient slumbering cultivators entered the Fallen Immortal Realm and encountered another version of themselves.

However, strange phenomena such as "the two cannot meet" or "a mutual resonance" never occurred. At the end of the day, when ancient cultivators arrived in the present, everything from the past was already gone. The Fallen Immortal Realm merely contained a projection of their past selves at a certain moment in time. Other than evoking feelings of nostalgia and sentimentality, seeing another version of oneself was no different from encountering any other being.

Likewise, the "natives" of the Fallen Immortal Realm would not mistake outsiders who entered as mere projections of the past. Even if their appearance and aura were exactly the same, it wouldn’t matter. They would simply assume it was some kind of illusionary technique.

However, Li Fan had once come across a discussion in the [Seeking Immortals] section of the Tianxuan Mirror. It speculated that if a cultivator survived from ancient times to the present and reached an unimaginably profound level of cultivation, they might achieve something called "Eternal Presence, Timeless Freedom."

The so-called Eternal Presence referred to a cultivator transcending the River of Time, allowing them to exist simultaneously in the past, present, and future. Every instance of themselves across time would be the same transcendent being. If such a cultivator projected into the Fallen Immortal Realm, their projection and true self might indeed be considered one and the same.

Though this was only a theoretical concept, it represented the ultimate pursuit of the Dao for cultivators, making it a topic of much fascination.

Some cultivators further argued that if such a being truly existed, they would have long since reversed cause and effect, turning time itself into an unbroken cycle. How could they possibly be captured by a mere glance from a True Immortal and drawn into the Fallen Immortal Realm?

Thus, the idea that the Fallen Immortal Realm’s projections were actually the true selves of people from reality remained a paradox.

Li Fan roughly explained these ideas to Liu San. Though Liu San nodded on the surface, appearing reassured, he was still eager to enter the Fallen Immortal Realm and see for himself.

Seeing this, Li Fan didn't mind. He simply shook his head with a faint smile and then carefully explained the ritual procedure to Liu San.

"Blessings to the Celestial Venerable Of Xuanhuang!"

Without hesitation, Liu San activated the ritual before Li Fan and entered the Fallen Immortal Realm.

Li Fan, however, narrowed his eyes slightly and gazed toward the sky.

Perhaps due to his recent breakthrough in the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra, his perception had become far keener than before.

At the very moment Liu San’s strand of divine consciousness vanished, Li Fan clearly sensed a shadow fleeting across the heavens of the real world.

"That was no illusion... The Fallen Immortal Realm, huh..."

The shadow disappeared from his perception in an instant, but Li Fan’s gaze lingered on the sky for a long time.

Li Fan had spent a long time wandering in the [Seeking Immortals] forum and knew that many cultivators had attempted to find traces of the Fallen Immortal Realm in the real world. However, it was said that without exception, they all failed.

They only knew of its existence and how to enter it.

But they could never observe it.

Yet now, Li Fan, who was merely at the Nascent Soul stage, had unexpectedly broken this pattern.

"My previous experiences in the Fallen Immortal Realm were different from others. I kept reliving certain scenarios in an endless cycle. I never understood the reason before. But now, it seems that it might be closely tied to the Xuanhuang Mantra."

"The True Immortal's legacy... the remnants of a True Immortal’s will… Maybe there really is some connection between the two."

"It’s been a long time since I entered the Fallen Immortal Realm. I hope that with the blessing of the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra this time, I’ll receive some surprises."

Li Fan pondered silently.

However, he did not act immediately. While waiting for Liu San to wake up, he took a stroll around Longevity Valley.

The valley was divided into separate areas by formations, each dedicated to growing different types of spiritual herbs. As expected from a secret realm sealed for a thousand years, even with the formations isolating the area, Li Fan could still feel the abundant vitality emanating from the spiritual fields.

From time to time, cultivators from the Medicine King Sect moved through the valley, using secret techniques to select and harvest the appropriate materials for alchemy.

In the distant open area, he could vaguely see several half-constructed buildings taking shape.

That was the new Medicine King Sect headquarters, being built under Fang Zaiji’s command.

"Quite an imposing sight," Li Fan nodded in admiration.

With the Congyun Sea Conflict settled, it was time to plan for the future.

His main objectives were twofold:

First, he needed to find a way to obtain the latter part of the Mountain Sitting Technique beyond the Nascent Soul stage.

Since the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had not yet enacted the "The Plan of the Heavenly Sovereign of Reality and Illusion" to lure out hidden spies, the Five Elders Association had not been forced to send a Dao Integration powerhouse as a test. As a result, the great battle between the two sides, the scheme against Immortal Sage Jicheng, and his impending death due to lifespan exhaustion had not yet occurred.

Therefore, if Li Fan wanted to acquire the "Audience Law Jade Plaque"—the key to access Law Derivation Jade—he would need to find another method.

Fortunately, he had already made preparations, so this wasn’t a major concern.

His second goal was to accumulate experience and insights for advancing to the Soul Transformation stage. The Nascent Soul stage was essentially the process of cultivating and perfecting one's Cave-Heaven Domain, while the gap between Nascent Soul and Soul Transformation was the key dividing line in a cultivator’s actual combat power.

Take, for example, Immortal Lord Hongxi, who had perished in the Congyun Sea Calamity.

He built his Dao Foundation through the Five Elements Mountain and achieved Golden Core using the five elemental laws—Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, and Earth.

His talent was undeniable, and his initial path was smooth.

However, when it came to the crucial stages of "Seizing the essence of heaven and earth to form a Nascent Soul" and "Extracting the marrow of heaven and earth to obtain divine soul transformation," his promising future took a drastic downturn.

His so-called "Hundred Ridges Cave-Heaven" and "Taihua Giving Birth to a Thousand Mountains" were clearly far inferior in strength.

As a result, Immortal Lord Hongxi's combat power remained unimpressive. He spent his entire life trapped in the remote Congyun Sea, and breaking through any further was nearly impossible.

On the other hand, if Immortal Lord Hongxi had managed to cultivate the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven to achieve Nascent Soul, how far could his potential have taken him?

........................................................................

Read extra chapters on >>> patreon.com/SpiritStonetranslation

Chapter 652: The World is About to Change

With the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven as a foundation, even if the Marrow of Heaven that Hongxi extracted during his Soul Transformation was unremarkable, his achievements would still be incomparable to today’s standards.

Was it because he didn’t want to?

No, it was simply because he couldn’t.

If rare treasures and heavenly laws could be obtained through personal effort, then at least there would still be some chance to strive for them.

However, by the time a cultivator reaches the Nascent Soul or Soul Transformation stage, acquiring a powerful and precious Cave-Heaven World or Heavenly Marrow is no longer just about diligence. Without a strong family background, sufficient resources, or extraordinary luck, how could one compete with other cultivators?

For an ordinary cultivator, simply securing enough resources to break through is already a great fortune. They have no luxury to pick and choose.

Take Diyi Jinglun, for example—he decisively abandoned the opportunity for Dao Integration when faced with the temptation of the Spirit of Heaven and Earth. Of course, this was partly because he was a peerless genius who looked down on the weak Spirit of Heaven and Earth. However, it was also because, as a high-ranking member of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, the resources and knowledge he controlled were beyond the reach of ordinary cultivators.

The strong can afford to be selective about their path to immortality, carefully weighing every choice, making them even stronger.

Meanwhile, the weak must seize every rare opportunity for advancement, barely scraping by—thus, the weak remain weak.

This is why, from the Nascent Soul Realm onward, the gap between individual cultivators grows increasingly vast.

Even within the same realm, instant defeat in battle is not unheard of.

Now, with his breakthrough through the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven, Li Fan has already reached the pinnacle of the Nascent Soul Realm.

But when it comes to finding a Marrow of Heaven that matches his cultivation, he is still completely lost.

What is the Marrow of Heaven?

Long Jiuyuan used the 'Heavenly Spirit’s Thousand Waters' to achieve Soul Transformation.

Hongxi relied on Taihua’s Thousand Mountains to break through.

From the heaven and earth notices issued upon their deaths, some clues can be inferred.

Just as human marrow produces blood, Marrow of Heaven produces laws.

When a new law appears in the Xuanhuang World, it manifests as a change in nature—the heaven and earth undergoes transformation.

In Tianling Prefecture, thousands of rivers will form over the next few millennia.

In Taihua Prefecture, thousands of mountains will rise in the coming ages.

These are preordained, inevitable changes in Xuanhuang World over a certain region and period.

Extracting the Marrow of Heaven means taking the fundamental laws that drive these natural transformations and drawing them into oneself.

By channeling the immense power of heaven and earth, one can achieve an enormous leap in cultivation and battle prowess.

Furthermore, the initial fusion of heavenly laws within one’s body lays the groundwork for the Dao Integration stage, when a cultivator must sacrifice the Spirit of Heaven and Earth.

"Heaven and Earth transformations take tens of thousands of years. With ordinary perception, cultivators wouldn’t even notice them. But under the new Heavenly Sovereign Laws, one can detect even the subtlest changes—first tearing open a gap, then continuously drawing in and absorbing the world's originally slow-releasing source power at an accelerated rate."

"Though this greatly depletes the world’s potential, for cultivators, it provides a rapid surge in strength."

Li Fan’s mind raced, analyzing everything he had learned.

"The Five Elements Cave-Heaven is self-sustaining, forming a perfect cycle. It is a rare and precious opportunity. If I advance to Soul Transformation and extract the Marrow of Heaven, it must be related to this."

"However, the Five Elements, when manifest in the world, tend to disperse. A single type of Marrow of Heaven will likely correspond to only one elemental attribute."

"Attempting to cultivate multiple laws at the Soul Transformation stage, like during the Golden Core stage, is far more difficult."

Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

Beyond law creation, Marrow of Heaven also possesses immunity and resistance mechanisms.

Once a cultivator has absorbed a particular Marrow of Heaven, attempting to extract another will trigger resistance from the world itself, leading to rejection.

“The more one masters, the greater the repelling force. With each additional type, the difficulty increases almost exponentially. So, for the vast majority of cultivators in this world, extracting even a single type of Marrow of Heaven is already the limit.”

“Even someone as powerful as Long Jiuyuan, who could single-handedly battle the Spirit of Heaven and Earth and ascend to Dao Integration, faced the same challenge. This alone shows how difficult it is.”

“I’m afraid I can, at most, accommodate only two types of Marrow of Heaven at the same time…” Li Fan thought to himself, not blindly overestimating his abilities.

“To achieve a perfect breakthrough, unless…”

A sharp glint flashed in Li Fan’s eyes. “Extracting five different types of Marrow of Heaven simultaneously and utilizing the principle of mutual generation and restriction to achieve self-balancing.”

This was undoubtedly an outlandish idea.

Not to mention the rarity of encountering an opportunity to extract five types of Marrow of Heaven at once—even if such an opportunity arose, the chances of success would be minuscule.

Any rational cultivator would never attempt such a thing.

However, for Li Fan, it was not entirely impossible to try!

In his mind, the Dao Deviation Stone continuously emitted a soft blue glow, systematically integrating all the information he had ever come across, slowly deducing a potential method to realize his idea.

...

More than ten days later, Li Fan sensed Liu San awakening. His figure flickered, and he appeared in front of him.

It seemed that Liu San had spent an incredibly long time in the Fallen Immortal Realm. Just as he returned to the real world, he was still somewhat unaccustomed to it.

A hint of confusion flashed in his eyes.

However, the moment he saw Li Fan, that trace of bewilderment quickly faded.

“Young Master!” Liu San stood up, his expression calm and composed.

“How was it? Did you encounter the alchemists from the Medicine King Sect of the past?” Li Fan asked kindly.

Liu San shook his head.

“Strangely enough, the scene I experienced this time in the Fallen Immortal Realm was not the ancient cultivation world you described, Young Master. Instead, it was a time and space I had never heard of before.”

“In that world, immortal arts had been completely severed, and no cultivators existed anymore. The only way people could wield extraordinary powers was by resonating with ancient artifacts left behind from ages past. They were called something like ‘Divine Weapon Wielders’…”

“And this time, the person I possessed was merely a little brat, no more than seven or eight years old.”

As Liu San recalled the experience, he narrated everything to Li Fan.

“In the end, after enduring countless hardships and experiencing endless bloodshed and slaughter, I finally managed to resonate with the legendary strongest divine weapon.”

“The ‘Immortal Execution Sword’…”

As he spoke, Liu San took out a long sword that radiated a dazzling seven-colored light, yet seemed to exude an endless aura of slaughter.

Li Fan’s gaze sharpened. But after taking a closer look, he couldn’t help but chuckle.

Liu San then remarked, “Quite the grand name. But in truth, it’s nothing more than a Natal Flying Sword forged by a Nascent Soul-stage sword cultivator.”

“It only stood out among a pile of so-called ‘divine weapons’ because it happened to be tainted with a wisp of a fallen cultivator’s lingering soul.”

Liu San glanced at the flying sword before him with some disdain and commented, “The forging technique is crude, and the material is extremely ordinary. What a piece of junk.”

With that, he applied a slight force.

The so-called strongest divine weapon, the ‘Immortal Execution Sword,’ instantly crumbled into dust.

Chapter 653: Illusory Scenes at Will

"That was quite an interesting experience," Li Fan said with a slight smile after listening.

"In the Fallen Immortal Realm, apart from the original world, there are countless other derivative time-spaces. This time was just a matter of bad luck. If you still want to try your luck, Elder Liu, you can enter again after some time," Li Fan explained.

Liu San let out a long sigh and said, "I’ve come to terms with it. The past is gone. Even if I were to see him again, so what? In the eyes of the sect master, I am no longer that loyal old servant. I will leave it to fate. It’s better to focus my energy on reviving the Medicine King Sect."

"There are countless opportunities within the Fallen Immortal Realm. Why not let the disciples try their luck as well? Otherwise, keeping them from going out for so long will stifle them," Liu San suddenly suggested.

Li Fan had no objections.

Over the next period, the people of the Medicine King Sect devoted themselves wholeheartedly to building their new sect within Longevity Valley.

The general layout still followed that of the former Medicine King Sect, with structures rising one after another.

Seeing the familiar scene slowly taking shape again before them, Liu San and the disciples were filled with excitement and joy.

Meanwhile, outside their world, something unexpected occurred.

To Li Fan’s surprise, the destruction of Congyun Sea did not cause much of a stir.

Logically speaking, the complete annihilation of an entire region should have been an event that cultivators would discuss for a long time.

However, in this lifetime, perhaps due to the sheer magnitude of the disaster, both the suppression of information and the speed at which people forgot the catastrophe far surpassed previous cycles.

Li Fan disguised himself as a passerby and gathered some information, only to find that in less than a month, memories of the countless beings within Congyun Sea had faded from the world.

Even if someone occasionally mentioned it, they only recalled it as something that happened "a long time ago."

"The power of the Carefree Heavenly Sovereign is truly both awe-inspiring and terrifying."

Even as someone who personally witnessed the event, Li Fan’s own memory of it had started to blur. Fortunately, with the secret technique [Transformation of the Divine Dao], he could constantly remind himself of the truth.

Currently, the hottest topic in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance was not the destruction of Congyun Sea but rather the sudden emergence of a group of mysterious cultivators from the White Mist.

These attackers looted and destroyed without restraint.

They came and went like the wind, highly trained, and seemed to be extremely familiar with the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance. They specifically targeted strongholds and fortresses rich in special resources.

Moreover, they never engaged in prolonged battles. As soon as reinforcements arrived, they would immediately retreat into the White Mist.

The Samantabhadra True Boat, which could greatly reduce the corrosive effects of the Devouring Essence White Mist, was still a rare item within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance. Not every cultivator had access to one. As a result, they could only watch helplessly as these raiders vanished into the mist.

What? Chase them down at all costs?

Fellow Daoist, how much is your yearly salary? Why would you risk your life for this?

Just report it, and let the officials handle it.

As a result, in no time, the headquarters of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance was flooded with reports of attacks from various regions.

Naturally, the Alliance was furious.

Since the establishment of its dominance over half of the Xuanhuang Realm, it had never experienced such blatant humiliation on its own territory.

In response, they dispatched specialized cultivators to investigate the attacked locations.

However, the attackers were incredibly experienced, leaving behind no traces or evidence.

Instead, they simply avoided the areas where investigation teams were stationed and continued their attacks elsewhere, striking like phantoms.

Such open provocation completely enraged the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Squads of black-clad cultivators, brimming with killing intent, were transported to various regions via teleportation formation. They vowed to capture these criminals at all costs.

Yet, after this large-scale deployment, the raiders vanished entirely, as if they had never existed.

The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had prepared extensively, only to punch empty air. It was beyond frustrating!

Eventually, they had no choice but to continue patrols in various regions for a while. After capturing a few suspicious rogue cultivators as scapegoats, they hastily concluded the operation.

As for the true identities of these raiders, the first suspect in the eyes of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance was naturally the Five Elders Association.
