However, accusations of this magnitude required evidence—especially since such claims could easily reignite a war between the two factions.

Before the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance could make any statement, the Five Elders Association had already spoken.

They expressed regret and sympathy for the attack suffered within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s territory. Furthermore, they proposed, in the spirit of the mutual agreement for peaceful coexistence, that if the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had any difficulties handling the matter, the Five Elders Association could send specialists to assist in the investigation.

There was no way the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance would agree to this. They strongly suspected that the attacks had been orchestrated by the Five Elders Association, who were now feigning concern just to further disgust them.

However, since they had not been able to find any conclusive evidence, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance could do nothing but silently suffer the loss.

Not only could they not retaliate against the Five Elders Association, but they also had to begrudgingly express gratitude for their concern.

In this round of confrontation, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance suffered a complete defeat.

As a direct consequence, the alliance started taking the Samantabhadra True Boat, which could freely traverse the White Mist, much more seriously.

Orders were issued requiring every province to be equipped with a sufficient number of these vessels, along with regular patrols by cultivators outside the White Mist Barrier to guard against future sneak attacks.

To prevent another ambush.

This, in turn, led to a short-term surge in the price of Samantabhadra True Leaves, which had long remained at a low value.

Those cultivators who had been trapped in their investments finally made a significant recovery.

"Since they rule through contracts, it seems that the Five Elders Association does keep their word," someone remarked.

"But they’ve also gained quite a lot this time."

Scanning through the estimated property losses circulated privately among the people, Li Fan smiled and thought to himself.

"With such a dramatic event, the matters of Congyun Sea are nearly forgotten."

"Probably in another year, once the atmosphere calms down, I can gradually send the disciples of Medicine King Sect back to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance."

Letting out a deep breath, Li Fan adjusted himself to his optimal state before stepping into the newly constructed sect’s main hall within the valley.

He performed a talisman seal, activating the entrance to the underground secluded chamber beneath the main hall, and then sealed the doorway behind him.

Taking out an ice-blue pill, it was none other than Liu San’s refined "Supreme Emotionless Pill". Li Fan consumed it.

A familiar sensation surged through him as he initiated the ritual.

"Blessings to the Celestial Venerable Of Xuanhuang!"

He muttered softly. The next moment, a slight dizziness washed over him.

However, unlike before, he did not immediately enter the Fallen Immortal Realm. Instead, it felt as though he had arrived in a distorted transparent bubble.

In front of him, two constantly flickering scenes appeared.

Both were familiar to Li Fan.

One was [Ningyuan's Longevity Fruit], and the other was [The Beast-Taming Sect’s Upheaval]—both events he had previously experienced in the Fallen Immortal Realm!

"So, I can freely choose which scene to enter… Is this the effect of the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra?" Li Fan mused.

Without much hesitation, he chose to return to the [Beast-Taming Sect’s Upheaval] scene.

In an instant, the light and shadow in front of him surged toward him.

The surroundings became clearer.

"Sigh, I wonder when Senior Brother Lu Ya will return."

A slightly dejected voice from Xu Ke reached Li Fan’s ears.

Chapter 654: The Calamity of the Beast-Taming Sect

Under the instinctive power of his possessed body, Li Fan struck Xu Ke with a claw.

Memories flooded into his mind naturally.

Since their return to the Beast-Taming Sect from the Sacred Beast Mountain of Nanming, Li Fan and Xu Ke had learned that both Emperor Sanmo and Senior Brother Lu Ya had gone out on important matters and were nowhere to be found.

As a result, the rewards promised for their mission could not be fulfilled, which Xu Ke had been complaining about ever since.

Of course, in Li Fan’s view, Xu Ke’s concern stemmed more from his pure longing for Senior Brother Lu Ya. After all, both were orphans from the Xuantian Temple in Ningyuan City and had joined the Beast-Taming Sect together. It wouldn’t be an exaggeration to say that they were like family, relying on each other for survival.

Ignoring Xu Ke’s grumbling, Li Fan closed his eyes and focused on cultivating the Creation Furnace Technique.

It was indeed a perfect technique, modified by Mr. Bai himself. Ever since he had begun cultivating it, not only had his physical body become increasingly powerful, but his essence, energy, and spirit had also surged daily. Even if he stayed awake for days without rest, he wouldn’t feel the slightest fatigue. More importantly, his Heavenly Fate Black Bird bloodline seemed to have become purer.

Li Fan’s originally jet-black feathers now occasionally reflected a seven-colored radiance under the sunlight, making him appear extraordinarily majestic.

Even Xu Ke couldn’t help but reach out to touch them from time to time—only to be ruthlessly swatted away by Li Fan.

The enhancement of his bloodline brought comprehensive improvements to his abilities.

His divine ability, "The Mandate of Heaven is Mine," was now wielded with increasing ease, nourishing Xu Ke’s fortune while simultaneously reinforcing his own. By now, Li Fan had reached the first major breakthrough recorded in his inherited memories—he could form a Mandate Domain within a certain range around himself. This not only allowed him to foresee and avoid danger but also to use destiny itself as a weapon against his enemies.

This was an extraordinary feat.

Among the Heavenly Fate Black Bird clan, only adult black bird over a hundred years old could typically achieve this.

Yet, Li Fan had hatched less than five years ago—he was still a fledgling.

Breaking the growth limitations of spirit beasts demonstrated just how extraordinary Mr. Bai’s Creation Furnace Technique truly was.

"After returning from the Fallen Immortal Realm, everything besides the rewards for fulfilling obsessions will be forgotten—including all learned techniques. I wonder… with the support of the 'Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra,' will this rule be altered?"

Li Fan pondered in silence, immersing himself in the mysteries of the Creation Furnace Technique.

Even if he couldn’t bring the technique back to reality, the countless insights gained from cultivating it were already immensely beneficial.

Thus, even though the storyline of the Fallen Immortal Realm had yet to progress, he remained entirely unbothered, dedicating himself fully to cultivation every day.

Time passed.

On this particular day, deep in meditation, Li Fan suddenly jolted awake.

A wave of unease surged through his heart, and he instinctively looked up at the sky.

Although the sky remained clear and boundless, Li Fan could see an overwhelming aura of death and slaughter spreading across the heavens. It had almost materialized into a tangible force—rolling like dark clouds, shrouding the entire sky.

The oppressive presence was suffocating, terrifying.

"This is…"

"The Dao technique cannot be cultivated in parallel."

A sudden realization struck Li Fan.

Before long, panicked cries erupted from all over the Beast-Taming Sect.

"What’s going on?!"

"The Beast-Control Technique—why does the sect have exactly 36,482 practitioners?"

"No matter how I circulate my cultivation technique, I can’t gain any more spiritual power?!"

"This is absurd!"

The Calamity of Incompatible Cultivation Technique

For the Beast Taming Sect, which primarily cultivates only the Beast Control Technique, was nearly catastrophic.

Almost everyone could foresee that once countless cultivators were trapped at their current cultivation level, with their lifespan nearing its end, they would resort to extreme measures in a desperate attempt to survive.

As a result, the disciples of the Beast Taming Sect fell into a state of immense panic. In an instant, they distanced themselves from one another, their eyes filled with suspicion toward the senior and junior brothers and sisters they once held dear.

For now, due to the lingering rationality and conscience of the disciples, no one had resorted to violence.

Even with the Sect Master and the elders personally stepping forward to calm the situation, they were unable to halt the spread of fear that continued to fester within the sect.

Gradually, some disciples could no longer endure the pressure and began to secretly flee. Meanwhile, others, pushed to their mental limits, had bloodshot eyes and showed signs of hysteria.

It was like a powder keg, ready to be ignited by a single stray spark.

At this critical moment, Emperor Sanmo and Lu Ya returned.

"Did you bring it back?" Upon seeing Xu Ke, Lu Ya was the first to ask.

His expression was calm, showing no trace of panic.

Xu Ke nodded, reaching into the beast pouch in his robe and retrieving a small, slumbering flesh-like creature.

This was the peculiar exotic beast gifted by Emperor Yi—a creature capable of self-division and reproduction.

Upon seeing it, Lu Ya’s expression lightened with joy. He carefully took the small creature, examining it closely for a moment before finally breathing a sigh of relief.

"Senior Brother Lu, what exactly is this little thing for? Why are you so anxious about it?" Xu Ke asked curiously. He knew that Lu Ya was always composed and rarely revealed his emotions, making his reaction particularly unusual this time.

"Heh, this is our hope for overcoming this calamity," Lu Ya replied, his eyes flickering with an indiscernible emotion.

"This thing?" Xu Ke's eyes widened in disbelief.

"You’ll understand in due time," Lu Ya said before hastily departing, leaving behind a bewildered Xu Ke and a thoughtful Li Fan.

Three days later, the Beast Taming Sect’s Sect Master convened a grand sect meeting to address the calamity that had descended upon the world and to announce a series of plans:

To prevent mutual slaughter caused by the incompatibility of cultivation techniques, the Sect Master took the lead in dispersing the Beast Control Technique, requiring all disciples to follow suit—retaining only their cultivation base.

The entire Beast Taming Sect would evacuate from the main world of Xuanhuang in batches, relocating to designated small pocket realms for refuge.

Since the strength of Beast Taming Sect cultivators primarily lay in the spirit beasts they controlled, dispersing their own cultivation techniques would not significantly weaken their actual combat ability. Though slightly affected, they could still fight effectively.

Moreover, the spirit beasts raised by the disciples were carefully nurtured from birth, forming deep bonds with their masters. Even without the Beast Control Technique, the disciples could still command their beasts.

This plan successfully averted the danger of internal conflict, so there was little opposition. Those who initially refused eventually relented once the Sect Master personally led by example.

As for how they could disperse their techniques without affecting their cultivation base…

Li Fan watched as Xu Ke muttered incantations, and in an instant, his entire cultivation technique dissipated, leaving behind a purely refined cultivation base stored in his dantian.

"The Supreme Primordial True Scripture?"

Having seen this method before, Li Fan immediately recognized the technique used by the Beast Taming Sect.

"But… they only explained how to operate it, without mentioning its origin."

"What’s going on? As far as I remember, the event where the Immortal Ancestor forcefully seized the 'Supreme Primordial True Scripture' hasn’t happened yet."

"So where did the Beast Taming Sect obtain this technique?"

In that instant, a white-robed figure surfaced in Li Fan's mind.

"Could it be… him?"

[TL :- Changed Emperor One to Emperor Yi as it is more appropriate]

Chapter 655: Unrestrained Killing Intent Arises

"The Supreme Primordial True Scripture is a secret art never passed down by the Supreme Sect. How could Mr. Bai possibly know it? Could it be that, just like the Immortal Ancestor, it was forcibly seized? But that's something only Immortal Ancestor could do after defying the heavens and achieving the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign realm. Although Mr. Bai is strong, he doesn't seem to have reached the Longevity Immortal realm yet, right?"

A surge of doubt arose in Li Fan’s heart.

Meanwhile, within this brief moment, Xu Ke had already dissipated the energy of his own Beast Control Technique.

"Xiao Hei, look! This is amazing! My cultivation is really still within my dantian!" Xu Ke excitedly shouted toward Li Fan.

Hearing Xu Ke’s words, Li Fan no longer felt the same sense of closeness as before. Instead, a flash of blood-red flickered across his eyes, and a sudden surge of violent intent arose within him. Driven by instinct, he almost tore the noisy little creature before him into pieces.

Fortunately, the one controlling this body now was not the Black Bird itself but Li Fan. So, after just a brief moment, he regained his composure.

Xu Ke remained completely unaware that he had just brushed past death’s door. Instead, he foolishly rushed forward, patting and touching Li Fan in concern. "Xiao Hei, what’s wrong? You looked so scary just now!"

"It’s best if you stay away from me for now. Otherwise, I can’t guarantee that I’ll be able to hold back next time." Li Fan cast a sidelong glance at Xu Ke, warning him.

As if to confirm Li Fan’s words, the Beast Control Sect was suddenly filled with the sounds of ferocious beast roars and the anguished screams of cultivators.

"We are inherently ferocious by nature and see humans as mere food. It was only the Beast Control Technique that suppressed our instincts before. Now that the restraints have suddenly disappeared, those beasts who have been with their masters for a long time might still have some lingering attachment. But for those that were only recently tamed by ordinary disciples, they will likely turn on their former masters the moment they regain their freedom." Li Fan stated coldly.

The disciples' desperate screams continued to echo. Xu Ke glanced outside, seemingly catching sight of the bloody scene, and his face turned pale. "This is terrifying! How could the sect leader and the others not have foreseen this?"

Then, as if switching moods in an instant, he put on his usual playful grin and moved closer. "But I’ve always treated you well, Xiao Hei. I should be safe, right?"

Li Fan remained silent as he felt the violent energy within him—though temporarily suppressed, it hadn’t dissipated at all. At any moment, it could erupt again.

It was at this moment that he finally understood why, according to history, Xiao Hei would eventually part ways with Xu Ke.

Just as he had explained earlier, the nature of demonic beasts is inherently savage, making peaceful coexistence with humans difficult. Even if a bond forms through years of companionship, suppressing their killing instincts time and time again, those instincts will continue to accumulate.

One day, when they can no longer be restrained, that so-called bond will prove to be as fragile as paper.

Moreover, the vast power disparity between demonic beasts and the disciples of the Beast Control Sect meant that if such a loss of control occurred, the cultivators would be left with only one fate—death.

"Could this be the root of the Beast Control Sect’s Great Upheaval? Because the Heavenly Fate Black Bird, Xiao Hei, was unable to control his murderous instincts, he ultimately parted ways with his master Xu Ke, never to meet again?"

"If that’s the case, then perhaps this time, there is a way to resolve its obsession." A thought suddenly surfaced in Li Fan’s mind.

With the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra within him, Li Fan’s self-control far surpassed that of any demonic beast. He was confident that, no matter how violently the murderous intent surged like a raging tide, his willpower would remain an unbreakable dam, keeping it tightly sealed.

As his thoughts shifted, Li Fan chose not to answer Xu Ke’s question directly.

Instead, he sneered. "That Emperor Sanmo claims to be a beast of supreme wisdom. With him around, how could he not have considered this exact outcome?"

"Then still…" Upon hearing this, Xu Ke's eyes widened in shock.

"The great calamity has just begun, and one of the Ten Great Immortal Sects, the Beast Taming Sect, is already preparing to flee. If word of this spreads, what a devastating blow it would be to the cultivators of the world. The other sects among the Ten Great Immortal Sects will most likely not agree to such an act and will surely step forward to obstruct it."

"Naturally, the cultivation world of the Xuanhuang Realm must be given an explanation. Since the dao technique cannot be cultivated together, disciples have turned against each other, and the sect has suffered heavy losses—what then? After all, the overwhelming stench of blood covering the ground is no illusion."

"This also serves as a perfect cover for evacuating the small world," Li Fan stated matter-of-factly.

Xu Ke involuntarily shivered. "My lord, your mind is truly terrifying."

Then, he stared at Li Fan, his face full of doubt. "But… Xiao Hei, since when did you become so clever? Did you secretly consume some kind of rare heavenly treasure again? That shouldn't be possible—I’ve been keeping an eye on you the entire time..."

Hearing Xu Ke’s words, a surge of violent killing intent arose within Li Fan. He ruthlessly swiped a claw at him to vent a little of his fury before slowly suppressing it.

The turmoil within the Beast Taming Sect lasted for three to four days.

Although many lower-level disciples were killed or injured, the rampaging spirit beasts were soon recaptured and imprisoned. Meanwhile, the core strength of the sect—including elite disciples and various elders—remained largely unaffected.

The plan to evacuate from the Xuanhuang Realm was proceeding in an orderly manner.

During this process, Li Fan also picked up snippets of conversation among the disciples, which revealed another pressing reason for the Beast Taming Sect's desperate retreat—to prevent the spirit beasts from seeking vengeance.

If spirit beasts and humans were two distinct races competing for survival resources, then the relationship between the Beast Taming Sect and spirit beasts was one of absolute enmity, an irreconcilable conflict.

Spirit beasts were inherently proud, considering their status to be far above that of mere humans. Yet, the Beast Taming Sect had used despicable means to enslave and subjugate them—a disgraceful humiliation in the eyes of the spirit beasts.

In the past, the Beast Taming Sect was located deep within human territory, and many of the captured and controlled powerful spirit beasts remained within its ranks.

Thus, even if some spirit beasts harbored thoughts of revenge, they were largely powerless to act. On the contrary, they ran the risk of being captured and enslaved themselves.

But the present was no longer the past. With the arrival of the 'dao cannot be cultivated together' calamity, word would inevitably reach the spirit beasts before long. Known for their vengeful nature, the spirit beasts would never let such an opportunity slip by. They would undoubtedly come seeking retribution.

Leaving aside whether the Beast Taming Sect could withstand the onslaught of the vengeful spirit beasts—once the battle began in earnest, it was uncertain which side the sect’s own captured spirit beasts would ultimately take.

To prevent such a dreadful scenario from occurring, relocating to a safe haven had become an urgent priority.

"All disciples of the Beast Taming Sect, hear this—only spirit beasts that pass the trial of the [Heart-Linking Ring] shall be permitted to evacuate with us.

"Those who fail…"

"Shall be set free!"

Soon, this announcement spread throughout the entire Beast Taming Sect.

Chapter 656: Mr. Bai’s Gift

The so-called "Heart-Linking Ring" was a mystical artifact personally crafted by Emperor Sanmo.

At first glance, it appeared as a circular doorway radiating a blue glow. When a beast passed through it, only an instant would pass in the real world. However, in that fleeting moment, the beast would experience countless lifelike illusionary realms, indistinguishable from reality.

The "Heart-Linking" test aimed to assess whether a beast would ever act against its master under extreme circumstances.

Forging this "Heart-Linking Ring" was no easy task, and in their haste, the Beast Taming Sect managed to create only one. Although the test itself took very little time, the sheer number of beasts in the sect was overwhelming. It wasn't just the personal spirit beasts of the disciples; there were also beasts used for labor, tending spirit fields, and guarding the sect—an entire horde of masterless beasts.

Although they were called "masterless," these beasts were all enslaved under the rule of the Beast Taming Sect.

The key to their control was the sect's supreme treasure, the Ten Thousand Beasts Reincarnation Wheel. It was said that this wheel bore engravings of nearly every known beast in existence. Even when a new species of beast emerged, its image would soon appear on the wheel.

From the moment a beast was born, the Ten Thousand Beasts Reincarnation Wheel would imprint a brand upon its soul, binding it for eternity, ensuring that it could never escape the wheel’s control.

It was said that this treasure had originally been brought from the Nanming Sacred Beast Mountain by Emperor Sanmo and given to the sect’s founding ancestor, Wan Shiyong. It was from the Ten Thousand Beasts Reincarnation Wheel that Wan Shiyong comprehended the profound [True Art of Beast Control].

However, despite its incredible abilities, the Ten Thousand Beasts Reincarnation Wheel had several fatal flaws. It could only be used on newborn beasts. Additionally, any beast imprinted with its brand would suffer excruciating, never-ending pain, known as the Agony of the Wheel. This agony severely stunted their intelligence, making them capable of only the simplest tasks.

True beast taming required perfect synchronization between beast and master. Only then could a tamer wield their beast as effortlessly as an extension of their own body, maximizing combat potential. In battle, even the smallest details could determine victory or defeat. If a controlled beast lacked intelligence, it was as good as fighting with one arm tied behind one’s back.

Thus, Beast Taming Sect cultivators used the True Art of Beast Control to nurture their life-bound spirit beasts from a young age. They never considered relying on the beasts controlled by the Ten Thousand Beasts Reincarnation Wheel.

This also led to the Beast Taming Sect suddenly falling into an extremely difficult situation after the great calamity of the inability to cultivate the same Dao technique descended

Fortunately, the evacuation was personally overseen by Emperor Sanmo. Under the gaze of this long-browed, white-haired elder, neither man nor beast dared to disobey. The Heart-linking Ring test was carried out in an orderly manner.

By the end of the first day, only one-tenth of the beasts had been tested. At this rate, the selection process would take nearly half a month to complete. Beasts that passed the test were reunited with their masters, shedding tears of relief, and were the first to board the Ten Thousand Beasts Ark.

Soon, they would embark on this flying artifact, leaving the Xuanhuang Realm to seek refuge in an unknown minor world.

As for the beasts that failed the test, no matter how much their masters wished otherwise, they were forcibly separated. It was said that these beasts would be temporarily imprisoned and later released after the Beast Taming Sect had fully evacuated.

On the seventh day of testing, that night—

Xu Ke, who had been absent all day, suddenly appeared before Li Fan, his face full of panic.

"Xiao Hei, this is bad! You need to get out of here, now!"

Li Fan, who was meditating and cultivating the Creation Furnace Technique, opened his eyes, glanced at him indifferently, and remained unmoved.

Xu Ke continued urgently, "This time, I’m not joking. If you stay here, you’ll really die. Forget about me—just leave the Beast Taming Sect quietly!"

Li Fan yawned, stretching his mouth.

Xu Ke became even more anxious. "Xiao Hei, did you even hear what I just said? Today, I overheard Senior Brother Lu Ya saying…"

"That the beasts who fail the test won’t actually be set free as promised, but will instead be executed. Isn’t that right?" Li Fan interrupted.

Xu Ke froze. "You… how do you know?"

"Did you eavesdrop on our conversation?" A trace of shock flashed across Xu Ke’s face.

Li Fan scoffed, raising his head arrogantly. "You don’t need to eavesdrop to figure that out—it’s just common sense."

"Think about it. These beasts, once belonging to the Beast Taming Sect, know countless sect secrets. The evacuation of the Xuanhuang Realm is a matter of life and death for the sect. If word gets out, who can guarantee that these beasts won’t lead pursuers to the minor world? If that happens, there will be no escape—it would be total annihilation!"

"That Emperor Sanmo is no kindhearted, merciful figure. Anyone who could hand over a method for enslaving his own kin to the humans…" A dangerous glint flickered in Li Fan’s eyes.

"In short—these beasts must all die!" Li Fan declared coldly, his words firm and unwavering.

After a long time, Xu Ke finally reacted. He stared blankly at Li Fan and asked, “Since you’ve figured everything out, Xiao Hei, why are you still so calm? Aren’t you afraid?”

Li Fan stood tall, staring intently at Xu Ke, pressing him, “What a joke! Why would I be afraid? Do you really think I wouldn’t pass that so-called Heart-Linking Ring test? Do you have so little confidence in me?”

Overwhelmed by Li Fan’s imposing aura, Xu Ke couldn’t even meet his gaze. He stammered, “That’s not what I meant… Nothing in life is absolute. What if…”

Li Fan flapped his wings and flew over Xu Ke’s head, landing a fierce claw strike. “There is no ‘what if’!”

He declared firmly.

Xu Ke hesitated, wanting to say more. Although he was deeply worried, he knew this stubborn bird’s temperament all too well, so he refrained from further persuasion.

Three anxious days passed, and finally, the day arrived for Xiao Hei to undergo the test.

Under the intense and watchful eyes of those around, Li Fan stepped into the Heart-Linking Ring.

For a moment, time seemed to freeze.

In the next instant, the Heart-Linking Ring burst into a gentle blue glow—a sign of successfully passing the test!

“Ah! Xiao Hei, you’re amazing!” Xu Ke shrieked and rushed forward, attempting to hug Li Fan tightly—only to be ruthlessly kicked away by a sharp claw.

“The test is complete. Next.” Lu Ya announced, glancing at Li Fan with slight surprise.

Five days later, after all the spirit beasts of the Beast-Taming Sect had completed the Heart-Linking Ring test, the Ten Thousand Beast Ark was filled to the brim.

It was finally ready to set sail towards an unknown homeland.

“Senior Brother Lu Ya, aren’t you coming?” On the deck, Xu Ke curiously looked at Lu Ya, who stood at the bow of the ship, tilting his head as he asked.

Lu Ya reached out and patted Xu Ke’s head. “Some people have to stay behind. The Ten Great Immortal Sects still care about appearances. If they don’t even bother to put on a show, it wouldn’t be good to provoke unnecessary trouble.”

Xu Ke nodded in half-understanding.

“Go on. The future of the Beast-Taming Sect depends on you now.”

Tying a red string around Xu Ke’s right wrist, Lu Ya spoke with a hint of reluctance in his eyes.

“Wow! This is a red string woven by Mr. Bai!” Xu Ke immediately recognized the unique knotting style.

Back when they were still in the abandoned temple of Ningyuan City, every time Mr. Bai cured a sick child, he would tie such a red string around their wrist, praying for their future safety and well-being.

Xu Ke raised his hand, staring at the red string, inspecting it closely over and over again.

Li Fan also fixed his gaze on the red string, an indescribable feeling stirring in his heart.

Chapter 657: Obtaining the Remnant of the Black Bird

No matter how one looked at it, the red string in Xu Ke’s hand appeared utterly ordinary—just a common object.

However, given that Mr. Bai could effortlessly bestow the supreme True Profound Art of Creation with a mere casual remark, how could he possibly gift the children something so mundane?

Especially when Li Fan’s gaze swept over Xu Ke, and the moment he slightly eased the killing intent in his heart, an overwhelming sense of imminent danger surged within him.

Li Fan instantly understood that if he truly lost control and attacked Xu Ke…

Then the first to die would undoubtedly be himself.

Yet Xu Ke remained completely unaware of the red string’s value. He simply felt immense joy, solely because it was a gift from Mr. Bai.

“Let’s go. It’s time.” Lu Ya’s gaze was deep as he took one last look at Xu Ke.

Then, he silently flew out of the Ten Thousand Beasts Ark and formed a hand seal.

A dim light enveloped the flying vessel in absolute silence. The Ten Thousand Beasts Ark tore through the void, sailing toward an unknown homeland.

The very moment the vessel departed from the Xuanhuang Realm, Li Fan, who was standing above Xu Ke’s head, suddenly felt as though everything around him had frozen in absolute stillness.

Then, just like an old photograph weathered by time, the colors gradually faded away.

In the end, everything shattered into countless fragments, dispersing like falling stars.

Li Fan understood—this was because he had resolved the lingering obsession of the Heavenly Fate Black Bird and completed the [Beast Taming Sect’s Upheaval].

However, unlike before, he did not immediately return to the real world.

Instead, he found himself back inside the distorted, transparent bubble where he had been after entering the Fallen Immortal Realm.

Before him, a new light projection emerged.

In the rapidly shifting images, a vast, spiraling abyss could be vaguely seen. Within it stood a colossal stone sword. Thousands upon thousands of cultivators toiled like ants beside it, fervently refining countless materials into the sword’s core, using the raging flames of the earth itself.

“This seems to be unlocking a new storyline… It looks like…”

“The Heavenly Sword Sect, and the World-Rifting Divine Weapon?”

Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

Unfortunately, perhaps because he had just left the Fallen Immortal Realm, he was not yet able to enter this entirely new scene.

“I’ll have to wait until next time.”

In the flickering imagery, countless cultivators came and went, streaking through the sky like flowing lights. Yet that World-Rifting Divine Weapon stood immovable, its presence growing ever more imposing as time passed.

It exuded a peculiar power, drawing Li Fan’s gaze for a long while before he finally looked away.

When he turned his attention to the first two completed light projections, he noticed subtle differences between them despite both being marked as “cleared.”

The projection of Quest [Ningyuan's Longevity Fruit] shone like a perfect sphere, radiating light in all directions—pristine and flawless.

However, the projection of [Beast Taming Sect’s Upheaval] was only partially illuminated, with most of it still shrouded in darkness.

Li Fan mused, “Perhaps Xiao Hei’s obsession, like Senior Brother Zhang’s, is merely a surface-level illusion. The true master of the Beast Taming Sect’s time-space continuum… may be someone else entirely.”

He carefully reflected on his experiences within the Fallen Immortal Realm, piecing them together into a coherent narrative.

Even as the surrounding distorted space grew increasingly unstable, he still had no clear answer.

Then, the bubble shattered.

Li Fan returned to the real world. At the same time, a black feather appeared in his hand.

“The Remnant of the Black Bird…”

Accompanying the Heavenly Fate Black Bird’s feather was a fleeting, blurred memory.

A moment from history—a real event that had once happened to Xiao Hei.

Just like what Li Fan did, Xiao Hei was full of confidence in himself. Ignoring Xu Ke's dissuasion, he insisted on taking the "Heart-Linking Ring" test.

However, after all, he was merely a demonic beast and did not have Li Fan’s extraordinary fortune of possessing the Immortal Heart Mantra.

Without a miracle, the final result was inevitable—he failed to pass the "Heart-Linking Ring" trial, which required him to never harm his master.

Originally, Xiao Hei was destined to be executed along with the many other demonic beasts that failed the test. However, due to Xu Ke’s desperate pleas, Lu Ya was moved by compassion. In the end, he made an exception and spared Xiao Hei’s life.

To prevent any leaks of information, Lu Ya requested Emperor Sanmo to intervene, banishing Xiao Hei to a desolate small world where he was forbidden from leaving for a thousand years.

"Xiao Hei, we will definitely meet again."

At the moment of their reluctant farewell, Xu Ke spoke with tear-filled eyes.

The Heavenly Fate Black Bird was also overcome with sorrow, letting out mournful cries. Yet, it understood that without the restriction of the Beast Control Technique, it could not suppress the violent nature within its heart. If it insisted on staying by Xu Ke’s side, it might end up harming him instead.

Forcing itself to remain calm, it gently brushed Xu Ke’s head with its wing as a sign of comfort.

"Xiao Hei, by the time we meet again, a long time will have passed. We will have grown up—will you still recognize me then?" Xu Ke asked with a trace of worry.

Xiao Hei was about to mock Xu Ke for this seemingly foolish concern when he suddenly saw Xu Ke slap his forehead, then extract a drop of his own essence blood.

Placing it inside a brown jade bottle, Xu Ke solemnly handed it to Xiao Hei.

"Here, take this. You must not forget me." Though Xu Ke’s little face had turned slightly pale, he still forced himself to smile bravely.

The Heavenly Fate Black Bird let out a sorrowful cry and swallowed the brown bottle into its stomach.

After parting ways with Xu Ke, Xiao Hei was banished by Emperor Sanmo’s spell, exiled to a barren small world.

The scene shattered, and the memory ended there.

...

Li Fan recalled the final image that flashed in his mind—the desolate and ruined scenery reflected in the Heavenly Fate Black Bird’s eyes. A sudden sense of familiarity struck him.

It was the very same small world that Han Yi had accidentally entered earlier—the one filled with various hybrid creatures of man and beast.

"So, the fallen Heavenly Fate Black Bird really was Xiao Hei."

Li Fan pondered for a moment, and suddenly, a thought sparked in his mind.

"I wonder if Xu Ke's drop of essence blood is still there."

"The Imperial Royal Bloodline... The method to control beasts..."

A vague plan began to take shape in Li Fan's mind.

Xiao Qing, Li Chenfeng, and the other members of the Empire had been extremely cautious.

Ever since Li Fan had warned them that the Xuanhuang Realm was about to face a great war and that they should halt all transactions for a time, they had completely withdrawn and disappeared.

According to the final surveillance scene from the Formless Killing Intent, they seemed to have temporarily returned to the Empire.

"I've never tried creating a clone using a cultivator's essence blood. If Xu Ke’s drop of blood is still there, I might just be able to give Xiao Qing and their people a ‘surprise’."

Li Fan's eyes flickered. After a moment, he temporarily suppressed this thought and carefully examined the [Remnant of the Black Bird].

The gains from the Fallen Immortal Realm this time included not only this feather but also some residual memories of Xiao Hei’s innate divine ability—[Mandate of Heaven is Mine].

Although he did not possess the bloodline of the Heavenly Fate Black Bird, with the help of this feather, he could still manifest some of its effects.

As he absorbed the [Remnant of the Black Bird] into his body, a familiar sensation, akin to when he had possessed the Black Bird for cultivation, surged through him.

His perspective suddenly shifted upward, allowing him to observe his own destiny.

A nearly imperceptible white pillar of smoke lingered around him, as if it could be blown away by the slightest breeze.

Chapter 658: Absorbing Fortune, Reversing the World’s Order

"White, green, blue, red, purple... Even among mortals, my fortune is considered among the worst."

Li Fan narrowed his eyes slightly, but despite facing this discouraging fact, his heart remained calm.

What is known as fortune is merely one of the factors that influence a person's fate and opportunities. For someone like Li Fan, who can reincarnate repeatedly, if opportunities do not come to him, he can simply seek them out himself. As long as it is not the kind of black misfortune that brings endless calamities and unpredictable disasters, it doesn’t matter much.

Following the cultivation method of [Mandate of Heaven is Mine], Li Fan practiced for half a day. However, he soon frowned and stopped.

"After all, I am relying on a single feather. Compared to a true Black Bird, my progress is far too slow. Unlike Xu Ke, who can absorb fortune from benefactors, just cultivating foolishly like this would take hundreds of years before I could accumulate any substantial fortune."

"Fortune... hmph..."

Faced with a bottleneck in his cultivation, Li Fan immediately shifted his approach.

"With the aid of [Truth], I can foresee events ahead of time. I don't need fortune at all."

"Fortune and fate are intertwined, resonating with the heavens and flowing through the world. But if it manifests outwardly, it becomes a weakness. If I’m not careful, I might be targeted by cultivators skilled in this field..."

A thought arose in Li Fan’s mind, and a plan took shape.

Activating his divine ability, this time, instead of nourishing his own fortune, he did the opposite—he channeled his already meager fortune entirely into the Black Bird Feather within him.

From his perspective, it was as if a small vortex appeared on his body. The faint white column of fortune struggled momentarily but was ultimately unable to resist and was drawn in.

Perhaps because his fortune was already so thin, even after it was completely absorbed, Li Fan felt no discomfort at all.

Now, even if Li Fan used the Black Bird’s Divine Ability, he could no longer see a fortune column above his head.

It was as if he had become one of the legendary “Fortuneless Ones.”

"All good luck and opportunities have nothing to do with me. But on the other hand, without fortune backlash, my chances of encountering disasters are significantly reduced."

Upon observing the Black Bird Feather in his dantian again, Li Fan noticed that after absorbing his fortune, it seemed to glow just a little brighter.

"I am not truly a Fortuneless One after all. Even if my fortune disperses for a time, it will regenerate naturally through daily activities. However, with this feather, I can reabsorb my fortune at any time."

"At a critical moment, I can unleash all the fortune stored in the feather at once. Perhaps it will even allow me to turn the impossible into reality."

His thoughts raced, but once he sorted them out, Li Fan felt very satisfied with his gains in the Fallen Immortal Realm.

Sensing the flow of time, he estimated that he would need to wait over a year before he could enter again.

"Heavenly Sword Sect..."

"In the past two scenarios, Mr. Bai has always played an important role in the shadows. I wonder how this sword-forging event at the Heavenly Sword Sect is related to him."

A moment later, Li Fan set aside his thoughts.

While he had been wandering through the Fallen Immortal Realm, Liu San had already informed all the sect disciples of the method to enter.

Hearing that they could travel back to ancient times in an unconventional manner, the disciples were all thrilled and eagerly tried it out.

The time periods they entered were diverse and strange—anything and everything was possible.

After they awakened, Liu San assigned a team to collect and organize their experiences. To him, the Fallen Immortal Realm was essentially an enormous treasure trove—a free trial ground. If used wisely, it could greatly accelerate the revival of Medicine King Sect.

When Li Fan emerged and learned of this, he compiled the "strategies" he had seen in the Seeker of Immortality section and shared them with the disciples to improve their efficiency in exploring.

Regarding the gains from the Fallen Immortal Realm, Liu San had once proposed that all disciples submit their findings to be distributed under Li Fan’s management.

However, Li Fan rejected this idea.

Seizing someone’s opportunity is akin to killing their parents.

However, the Bloodline Transmission Technique had yet to reach the level where others could be regarded as mere slaves. If it provoked rebellion among the disciples for the sake of insignificant benefits, it would be a complete loss.

"Stability comes first in all matters." Li Fan once again reminded Liu Sandao.

With Liu San's flattering words—"Young Master's foresight is beyond my own"—Li Fan quietly left the Longevity Valley.

As he traversed the white mist and was about to return to the normal territory of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, he suddenly discovered a patrol team of Nascent Soul cultivators guarding the barrier outside the mist.

It was clearly a response to the continuous harassment and attacks by the Five Elders Association.

With a slight smile, Li Fan silently bypassed them and headed straight for Luoyan Prefecture.

His target was none other than Han Yi, who had already turned into a stone statue.

Li Fan did not know what kind of transformation Han Yi had undergone, but the stone statue he had become was truly eerie.

Previously, when investigating through the Tianxuan Mirror, Li Fan had noticed that despite a long time passing and countless cultivators passing by, none had been able to detect Han Yi's presence.

Let alone the fact that the stone statue was continuously absorbing the fortune and fate of nearby living beings.

From the scattered clues Li Fan had gathered, it was evident that the influence of Han Yi was slowly expanding.

If he remained in this state indefinitely, it was conceivable that one day, the entire Luoyan Prefecture would be affected.

Although Li Fan had been aware of this before, he had no means to resist the method of absorbing fortune, nor was he willing to take the risk of investigating further.

But now, after obtaining the Heavenly Fate Black Bird Feather and gaining the ability to use the divine powers of the Black Bird, he felt he could attempt an investigation.

After more than ten days, Li Fan arrived at the mortal town from his memories.

It was not far outside this town where Han Yi had been turned into a stone statue by a single glare from the old fisherman.

At this moment, it was clear that the town had already fallen within the range of Han Yi’s influence.

Looking over, Li Fan saw pillars of fortune and fate rising from the heads of the mortals in town. Regardless of their quality, each one was entangled with a dense black mist.

The specific manifestations were evident—misfortune plagued every single resident.

Some stumbled and injured themselves for no reason, which was already considered fortunate. Others choked to death while eating, failed in business and lost everything, or even suffered complete ruin.

Some mortals had begun to notice that something was very wrong and attempted to flee.

However, as soon as they reached the outskirts, they died inexplicably due to various strange accidents.

Observing from the sky for a while, Li Fan noticed that when a mortal died, their pillar of fortune immediately shattered.

At that moment, the black mist entwining it devoured it ravenously, swallowing it entirely before suddenly vanishing, its destination unknown.

"Interesting," Li Fan mused.

Just as this thought crossed his mind, he suddenly felt a chilling sensation behind him—something was rushing toward him at high speed.

His expression changed slightly, and he swiftly dodged, barely avoiding a streak of sword light.

"Be careful, fellow Daoist!"

The sword light narrowly missed Li Fan and struck the mortal city below.

"Boom!"

In an instant, the entire city was annihilated by the sword light.

The mortals within had no chance to even scream before being completely wiped out.

Chapter 659: Invincible in Battle

A sharp sword aura seemed to brush past, leaving a chilling sensation. Li Fan looked down at the now-obliterated mortal city, which had turned into a massive crater, and couldn't help but twitch his face.

Fortunately, he reacted quickly. If he had been hit by that sword light, not only would his body have been destroyed, but even the foundation of his inner cave-heaven might have been damaged.

Luckily, he wasn't too unlucky and hadn't been too close. Otherwise, if he had been covered in the Immortal-Mortal miasma, he might have truly perished on the spot!

"To be affected this much even from such a distance from the statue…" Li Fan's expression turned serious. He extracted and replenished his lost fortune using the power of the Black Bird Feather and quietly activated [Domain of Mandate] to prevent further loss of his fortune energy.

As the smoke below dissipated, at the bottom of the crater, a wooden sword was firmly embedded into the ground.

It seemed… somewhat familiar.

"Ah! Fellow Daoist, my sincerest apologies!"

At this moment, the owner of the wooden sword finally arrived, wearing a look of embarrassment and guilt as he spoke to Li Fan.

"It's all my fault for lacking mastery in my techniques—I nearly cost you your life!"

Li Fan glanced toward the newcomer. Although the other party didn't recognize him, Li Fan, on the other hand, was very familiar with him.

This was none other than the famous second-generation immortal of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, the obedient son of Immortal Sage Fei Xue, and the one known by the moniker "I Am Invincible"—Shuo Feng!

However, in the recent "friendly exchange duel" between the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association, Shuo Feng had appeared as a Soul Transformation cultivator.

Yet now, he appeared to only be at the Foundation Establishment realm!

"It's not a concealed cultivation… Did he undergo some kind of enlightenment, disperse his power, and restart his cultivation?" Li Fan's gaze swept over Shuo Feng, his eyes flashing with a hint of undetectable curiosity.

"So, it's Fellow Daoist Shuo Feng!" Li Fan cupped his hands in neither an overly respectful nor dismissive manner. "I almost thought it was another scoundrel from the Five Elders Association causing trouble!"

Shuo Feng's face reddened slightly.

He wasn’t surprised that Li Fan recognized him but hurriedly explained, "It’s a misunderstanding! A total misunderstanding. I was in mid-air, comprehending my cultivation, but for some reason, this wooden sword suddenly lost control. Fortunately, you reacted fast, or else I would have unintentionally committed a great sin!"

"Heh, no worries. I can tell you didn't do it on purpose. However… what happened to your cultivation, Fellow Daoist Shuo?" Li Fan examined him deliberately, pretending to be puzzled.

Shuo Feng didn't hide anything and replied frankly, "Nothing much. I just felt I was on the wrong path before, so I decided to start over!"

Although Li Fan had already guessed as much, he still put on a shocked expression. Studying Shuo Feng for a moment, he shook his head slightly and sighed, "Reaching Soul Transformation is already the ultimate goal that most cultivators dream of… Yet, Fellow Daoist, you had the resolve to start over just like that…"

"Truly admirable! Admirable!" Li Fan cupped his fists in praise.

Shuo Feng chuckled, indifferent to the compliment. "I'm not as extraordinary as you make me out to be. I simply have my mother backing me up. Even if I fail this time and remain a Foundation Establishment cultivator for the rest of my life, how many in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance would dare to look down on me? But for an ordinary cultivator, if they fail… that would be a true disaster."

Li Fan smiled without commenting, neither agreeing nor refuting the remark.

Instead, his gaze shifted to the wooden sword embedded in the crater below. Frowning slightly, he remarked, "Even though you restarted your cultivation, you're clearly not an ordinary Foundation Establishment cultivator. Judging by the speed and power of that wooden sword, it could likely kill an average Golden Core cultivator with ease."

Shuo Feng nodded in agreement. "You have sharp eyes, Fellow Daoist. This wooden sword…"

He paused momentarily before continuing, "To be honest, this sword is a natural treasure that I acquired upon rebuilding my foundation. However, despite successfully using it to establish my foundation, I still can't fully control it."

"It's quite the headache," he added, pointing downward.

Yet, the wooden sword in the crater merely trembled slightly, refusing to heed his summons and remaining firmly stuck in the ground.

Even with his usual composure, Shuo Feng couldn't help but show a trace of awkwardness.

Clearing his throat, he tried casting multiple techniques, three in total.

Finally, the wooden sword reluctantly returned to his hand.

Li Fan carefully observed the wooden sword before him. The term "plain and unremarkable" wasn’t enough to describe it.

There were no engravings on the sword, no mysterious aura emanating from it.

In fact, it looked incredibly simple—almost like a child's toy, carved crudely from wood.

However, given the overwhelming power of its earlier strike, Li Fan knew this weapon was far from ordinary.

A thought flashed through his mind, and Li Fan suddenly suggested, "This sword is quite interesting. Coincidentally, I have some insights into the way of the sword myself, but I've long struggled to find a worthy opponent to spar with. How about…?"

Shuo Feng's eyes lit up upon hearing this and clapped his hands in excitement. "I've just made a breakthrough and was worried about finding a sparring partner. Fellow Daoist, your words are exactly what I was hoping for!"

His expression turned serious as he gripped the wooden sword lightly, taking a few steps back to put some distance between them. He pointed his sword at Li Fan and declared, "Just to the point of learning!"

"Agreed!" Li Fan responded loudly.

Before his words had fully left his lips, eighty-one azure water swords had already taken shape, assembling into a sword formation and whistling toward Shuo Feng.

This was Li Fan's adaptation of Cloud Water Palace's "Sea-Stabilizing Divine Sword", utilizing the water-attribute power of his inner cabe-heaven. He did not hold back, even though Shuo Feng was only a Foundation Establishment cultivator—he mobilized the full power of his domain.

"Water Dragon Roar!"

The azure water swords, guided by Li Fan’s battle cry, spread out like a sea of dragons, surging toward Shuo Feng from all directions.

Yet, instead of fear, Shuo Feng showed exhilaration.

Closing his eyes, he made a single, slow-yet-lightning-fast sword swing just as the eighty-one water swords reached him.

"Ding!"

"Ding!"

"Ding!"

The wooden sword flickered like white lightning, weaving through the storm of water dragons.

With each strike, a crisp metallic clang echoed as his wooden sword clashed with each of the water swords.

In the blink of an eye, his wooden sword had parried all eighty-one attacks.

Shuo Feng withdrew his sword.

It seemed to have drained all his strength, his arm trembling slightly.

But in the next moment, something astonishing happened—the eighty-one azure water swords, which should have been under Li Fan’s control, suddenly turned against him, reversing their trajectory and charging at him!

Moreover…

A faint mysterious transformation had taken place—the assembled azure water dragon seemed to come alive in Li Fan’s eyes.

Faintly, he could even hear a dragon’s roar, and the sword aura surged as the water dragon roared toward him.

"This is…"

A sharp gleam flashed in Li Fan’s eyes, yet his reaction was swift.

In an instant, the sky was bathed in blue light.

A single sword radiance slashed out from Li Fan’s position, cutting through the water dragon like a blade through paper.

And without losing momentum, it streaked toward Shuo Feng’s face.

Chapter 660: This Object, a Wonder of the Heavens

In the next moment, it seemed that Shuo Feng was about to be cleaved in half by Li Fan’s sword light.

But just then, Shuo Feng swung his sword once more.

"Clang!"

The sword light struck the wooden sword, producing a sound like a hammer pounding against a massive bell.

The two forces clashed momentarily.

Then, in an instant, the sword light abruptly changed direction and shot toward Li Fan with even greater speed and sharper momentum!

Once locked onto by the returning sword light, there was no way to dodge. Li Fan had no intention of revealing his true strength, and his probing attack had already served its purpose.

Thus, he extended his right hand, directly manifesting his Water-Attribute Cave Heaven, drawing upon the power of the domain to suppress the incoming sword light.

"Boom!"

The sword light, originally unleashed by Li Fan, seemed to have gained an even sharper edge after being rebounded by the wooden sword.

Even though it was trapped within the domain, it did not lose its momentum. It roared forward with unstoppable force, determined to break through the restraints placed upon it.

Li Fan let out a cold snort and exerted a bit more power.

Only then was he able to fully suppress it.

When he looked back at Shuo Feng, the latter had not seized the opportunity to launch another attack. Instead, he seemed to be experiencing some kind of internal struggle, as he tried to calm the violently trembling wooden sword.

"Let’s end this sparring session here!" Li Fan sighed and shook his head. "I am two major realms above you, yet our battle was evenly matched. That alone means I have already lost."

"A heaven’s chosen will always be a heaven’s chosen. A Foundation Establishment cultivator battling a Nascent Soul cultivator..."

"It’s simply beyond the reach of us ordinary cultivators."

Li Fan appeared somewhat dispirited.

Seeing this, Shuo Feng, who had just regained control over his wooden sword, couldn’t help but console him. "Fellow Daoist, don’t be discouraged. The only reason I was able to fight on equal footing with you is largely due to the power of this wooden sword."

Perhaps it was because Li Fan’s temperament resonated with Shuo Feng, or perhaps Shuo Feng simply had nothing to fear.

After hesitating for a moment, Shuo Feng spoke with a hint of pride. "To be honest, Fellow Daoist..."

"This sword... is a wonder of the heavens!"

"Your defeat is not a fault of battle!"

Gently stroking the wooden sword’s blade, a trace of infatuation flickered across Shuo Feng’s face.

Hearing this, Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

Feigning extreme shock, he stared at the unremarkable wooden sword in Shuofeng’s hand. "A wonder of the heavens?"

"Fellow Daoist, surely you must be joking? The Wonder of the Heavens are attuned to the Dao itself, elusive and unseen, never revealing themselves to the world. The only one widely known is the legendary Derivative Law Jade."

"And you’re telling me this broken sword is a Wonder of the Heavens?" Li Fan deliberately voiced his skepticism.

Shuo Feng chuckled. "How could I be mistaken when I built my Foundation upon it? This Wonder of the Heavens... is called [Sword]."

As he spoke, Shuofeng lightly swung the wooden sword, forming a dazzling sword flower in the air.

"Sword?"

Li Fan’s heart trembled.

"Could it be... that this object is the embodiment of the very Dao of the Sword in the Xuanhuang Realm?" he couldn’t help but ask.

Shuo Feng nodded and pointed the wooden sword toward a lush, towering tree in the distance.

Under Li Fan’s gaze, the tree underwent a mysterious transformation.

A gentle breeze passed by, and as a leaf detached from its branch and drifted through the air, it brushed against another tree—yet in that moment, it was as if the leaf had become an incomparably sharp sword.

A single slash.

The tree was severed at its trunk.

Another gust of wind swept through, carrying countless leaves aloft. The tree, now imbued with the sword’s essence, moved like an unparalleled swordsman, continuously striking.

One tree after another fell in its wake.

This bizarre sight left Li Fan utterly dumbfounded.

"Perhaps... what Fellow Daoist says is true!" He feigned a stammer, as if in awe.

Shuo Feng smiled faintly. "Of course. I obtained this sword from the ruins of the former Heavenly Sword Sect, risking my life countless times to do so."

Looking at the wooden sword in his hand, Shuo Feng recalled that moment. "If you had seen it with your own eyes, Fellow Daoist, you would never be able to imagine the shock I felt. Within the Heavenly Sword Sect’s Sword Tomb, over a million swords were buried. Those countless ancient swords, chaotically plunged into the ground, all bowed slightly in the same direction."

"As if paying homage to the Emperor of Swords."

"And at the very center of that million-sword tomb, I found this."

A trace of pride appeared on Shuo Feng’s face. "That day, I knew—I knew that defying my mother’s wishes and insisting on retraining was the absolute right choice."

"Otherwise, how could I have encountered such an opportunity?"

"The Heavenly Sword Sect... the Sword Tomb..."

Li Fan stared at the Wonder of the Heavens, [Sword], as countless thoughts flashed through his mind.

However, in the end, he abandoned the idea of immediately using his Binding Insect Divine Ability to claim the treasure for himself.

"A Wonder of the Heavens..." Li Fan's eyes were filled with envy.

Then, as if suddenly realizing something strange, he asked, "Such a secretive matter, yet Fellow Daoist is casually telling a mere passerby like me? Aren’t you afraid that this information will spread and be known to all?"

Shuo Feng waved his hand boldly and declared, "I have always acted according to my whims. You knew my identity yet still fought me without reservation—that is commendable!"

"Besides, what if you tell others? If I possess such a divine treasure and do not flaunt it, but instead keep it hidden, how would that be any different from wearing embroidered robes in the dark?"

Li Fan hesitated. "But possessing such a rare artifact will inevitably invite covetous eyes..."

"Petty thieves coveting it?" Shuo Feng suddenly burst into laughter, exuding an undeniable dominance.

A radiant golden armor materialized over his body, emanating an overwhelming pressure. Even Li Fan instinctively took a step back.

"Though my Wonder of the Heavens is exceedingly rare, it is useless to cultivators of the Dao Integration realm and beyond."

"And below Dao Integration, who can possibly harm me? Even if they could, I doubt they could break through the defenses of this armor." Shuo Feng gestured toward the golden armor with a complex expression.

Li Fan had no words to reply.

"So this is the confidence of a top-tier immortal scion of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance..."

"But this works in my favor. If you weren’t this arrogant, I’d have to put in much more effort to extract information about this Wonder of the Heavens from you."

Suppressing his thoughts, Li Fan looked at Shuo Feng, who had already retracted his golden armor, and asked, "Although your wooden sword is indeed extraordinary, I feel that it still falls short of the legendary Wonder of the Heavens."

"Is it because Fellow Daoist has not fully mastered it yet?"

Shuo Feng smiled bitterly. "Your observation is sharp, Fellow Daoist! A Wonder of the Heavens is indeed extraordinary. Even though I have built my Foundation upon it, I still cannot fully control it. Sometimes, it even resists my will."

"Just now, it almost wounded you—that was why."

Hearing this, Li Fan suddenly recalled a past life battle between Shuo Feng and Su Xiaomei...

Chapter 661: The Extremity of the Sword, A Reversal of Momentum

At that moment, Shuo Feng seemed to have fully mastered the Heavenly Wonder [Sword]. From beginning to end, there were no signs of it going out of control.

However, unlike now, back then, when facing Su Xiaomei’s relentless attacks, Shuo Feng had only defended, never once taking the initiative to attack.

"A streak of white light reflected all of the enemy’s attacks back at them. In fact, the counterattack was even several times stronger than the original strike."

"The characteristics are exactly the same as a wooden sword. It just can't take the initiative to attack..."

Li Fan seemed to have figured out why Shuo Feng had never been able to completely control [Sword].

After pondering for a moment, he thought that since Shuo Feng would eventually have to comprehend it himself, he might as well offer him a helping hand.

He then fixed his gaze on the wooden sword in Shuo Feng’s hand and furrowed his brows slightly:

"Logically speaking, with your unparalleled talent, even if it were the legendary Wonder of Heaven, it shouldn’t be something that is difficult to control."

Shuo Feng agreed and nodded. "I, too, am puzzled by this."

Li Fan pondered for a moment before suddenly realizing something.

"I have a theory. I don't know if it's correct."

"Oh? Please share it," Shuo Feng responded politely, though he did not believe Li Fan would say anything truly insightful.

"A sword is a weapon of slaughter. Ancient sword cultivators were capable of taking a person’s head from a thousand miles away; a single strike could break ten thousand techniques. The essence of the sword manifests in the world in various forms—gold, jade, stone—but why, of all things, is this [Sword] a wooden sword?"

Li Fan posed this question, and Shuo Feng immediately furrowed his brows, his expression turning serious.

"I once heard that in the ancient sects of sword cultivators, disciples would only use wooden swords in friendly sparring matches where victory or defeat was not the goal. Therefore..."

Li Fan paused for a moment and then spoke in a solemn tone:

"I believe that [Sword] is the pinnacle of all swordsmanship. As the saying goes, ‘extremity begets reversal.’ Every trait of a mundane sword has been completely inverted in the Heavenly Wonder [Sword]."

"Slaughter becomes non-slaughter. Seeking defeat is victory. Not attacking is triumph. Motionlessness is invincibility!"

Li Fan's words were like a great bell ringing in Shuo Feng’s ears, or a bolt of lightning under a clear sky. He was stunned.

A strange glimmer flashed in his eyes as he re-examined the wooden sword in his hands, seemingly entering a profound and mysterious state.

He stood there like a stone statue, murmuring something under his breath.

"It seems he was just one step away from enlightenment. Now that I have pointed it out, he has instantly comprehended it," Li Fan thought to himself as he quietly activated his Black Bird Divine Ability to observe Shuo Feng's fate.

A towering pillar of purple qi shot into the sky, spiraling like a dragon tornado, coalescing without dissipating. This was a sign of supreme destiny, only slightly weaker than Xu Ke’s.

The pillar of fortune was so resilient that even Han Yi's Fortune Absorption Domain, formed by his transformation into a statue, could not affect it.

"Well, of course. Without great destiny, how could one be born into such a favorable position? What countless cultivators struggle for their entire lives to obtain, he has never lacked since birth," Li Fan sighed as he observed Shuo Feng’s astonishing and heaven-defying fortune.

"In this Xuanhuang Realm, it is rare for two Dao Integration Immortal Sages to choose to have a child together," he mused, recalling the rumors about Shuo Feng and his mother.

It was said that after Immortal Sage Fei Xue realized she had no hope of attaining Longevity Immortality, she decided to place her hopes in her offspring. To produce the most exceptional descendant, she chose the oldest yet most effective method—a martial contest for a spouse.

She declared that any Dao Integration cultivator who could defeat her in combat would be qualified to become her Dao companion. Given the rarity of Dao Integration cultivators—each one a one-in-ten-million genius—the combination of their bloodlines, along with the full support of both parents’ resources, might produce another Longevity Immortal.

When the news broke, the entire world was shaken. Countless cultivators, eager to witness a grand battle among Dao Integration cultivators, gathered to watch. However, the outcome was a major disappointment.

Few responded to the challenge, and nearly a year passed before a single Dao Integration cultivator stepped forward to challenge Fei Xue. He ultimately failed.

It was then that the broader community of cultivators realized:

Dao Integration cultivators are incredibly rare across the Xuanhuang Realm. Those who have reached this stage have exceptionally high ambitions. Unless faced with extraordinary circumstances, they would never so easily abandon their pursuit of Longevity Immortality, their ultimate goal.

Furthermore, while Fei Xue’s combat strength was only average among Dao Integration cultivators, she was extremely skilled in artifact refinement. With her formidable arsenal of defensive treasures, defeating her was easier said than done. Without absolute confidence, any challenger would simply be seeking humiliation.

Thus, due to these various factors, Fei Xue’s martial contest for a spouse fell into an extremely awkward and quiet state.

Just when everyone thought this matter would gradually fade into obscurity, an event that shocked the world once again occurred—

Fei Xue was suddenly pregnant!

And apart from herself, no one knew who the father was!

She refused to speak on the matter and officially declared the contest null and void.

From that moment on, she devoted herself entirely to nurturing the child in her womb—Shuo Feng.

There was no doubt that the one who had managed to make Immortal Sage Fei Xue conceive in complete secrecy must have been a terrifyingly powerful Dao Integration cultivator. That much was certain.

As for why he chose to conceal his identity, that remained a mystery.

"Not only does he have a Dao Integration mother, but he also has a father hiding in the shadows, keeping his true identity a secret..."

"No wonder Shuo Feng is so confident. The world may be vast, but he can go anywhere he pleases."

As Li Fan was lost in thought, Shuo Feng slowly emerged from his enlightenment.

A faint joy surfaced on his face, but after taking a deep breath, his expression gradually calmed.

The hands gripping the wooden sword no longer trembled. As a mysterious aura descended and locked onto him—

The Heavenly Wonder [Sword] transformed into a gentle white light and gradually merged into his body.

In an instant, Shuo Feng’s presence completely changed.

His sharpness was entirely withdrawn.

From being as sharp as an unsheathed blade, he now appeared utterly ordinary.

Even the towering purple fortune pillar above his head gradually faded under Li Fan’s gaze, eventually turning into an unremarkable white mist—so subtle that, if one didn’t look closely, it could easily be overlooked.

Shuo Feng turned his gaze toward Li Fan. Li Fan withdrew his Black Bird Divine Ability and cupped his hands.

"Congratulations, Daoist friend, for returning to your true nature and achieving supreme mastery!"

"Supreme mastery? That’s an overstatement. However..."

Shuo Feng made a refined gesture of invitation.

"I would like to ask you to test my sword!"

Li Fan naturally understood his intention.

With a flick of his fingers, several blue water swords flew toward Shuo Feng.

Shuo Feng stood with his hands behind his back, neither dodging nor blocking.

Just as the water swords were about to strike him—

A streak of white light flashed.

The water swords completely reversed direction.

Chapter 662: The Four Realms of Dao Integration

"Fellow Daoist, this Reversal Sword of yours—what is the highest level of power it can reflect?" Feeling the rebounded attack nearly doubled in strength, Li Fan's expression changed slightly. With a wave of his hand, he suppressed the Water Sword before turning to ask Shuo Feng.

Shuo Feng seemed to still be reflecting on the self-protective reaction of the wooden sword. After a long while, he finally returned to his senses.

"The Reversal Sword…" He shook his head. "I see it as the Sword of Pacification, the Sword of No Battle."

Without further explanation, Shuo Feng continued, "Ordinary Nascent Soul cave-heaven power can be countered effortlessly. If it were a full-force strike from a Soul Transformation cultivator, it would be somewhat difficult. As for Dao Integration and beyond…"

"Fellow Daoist, you are only at the Foundation Establishment stage, yet you have already achieved such an astonishing feat. If you advance to the Soul Transformation stage, wouldn't you be able to fight against Dao Integration cultivators?" Li Fan expressed his shock.

"It's not that simple. Even among Dao Integration cultivators, there are vast differences. The Spirit of Heaven and Earth is divided into…"

Li Fan's heart stirred, and he was about to concentrate and listen carefully. However, he suddenly noticed that Shuo Feng's lips were moving, but no sound came out.

Shuo Feng quickly realized this himself and decisively fell silent.

Li Fan, deep in thought, tactfully refrained from pressing further.

"In any case, though I possess the Heavenly Wonder, I still have a long road ahead before I can defeat my mother." Shuo Feng smiled bitterly.

"Moreover, although the Heavenly Wonder makes my Foundation Establishment extremely powerful, it also has its drawbacks. For instance, advancing in cultivation is much more difficult and slower compared to ordinary cultivators. Even with abundant resources and the aid of new cultivation methods, this remains true."

This was the first time Li Fan had heard of such a thing, so he immediately asked, "Why is that?"

Shuo Feng answered straightforwardly, "The Heavenly Wonder is, in essence, the Law of Heaven. Once one establishes their foundation with it, it becomes nearly impossible to incorporate anything else."

"Ordinary cultivators must observe the laws of heaven and earth, seize its essence, extract its marrow, and refine its spirit step by step to ascend. But a cultivator of the Heavenly Wonder is different. They use the Heavenly Wonder as their law, as their cave-heaven domain, as the transformation of heaven and earth, and as the very spirit of heaven and earth itself."

"As long as they continuously comprehend their own Heavenly Wonder to the utmost, they can progress all the way to the Dao Integration stage without obstruction."

Hearing this, Li Fan couldn't help but ask, "Isn't that a good thing? Why do you say it makes cultivation more difficult?"

Shuo Feng countered with a question, "Fellow Daoist, don’t you think that compared to forcibly absorbing external elements, a cultivation method that relies solely on personal comprehension would be much slower?"

"Naturally, that…" Li Fan suddenly realized something and fell silent.

"Daoist Shuo, do you mean that cultivating with the Heavenly Wonder is more akin to practicing the ancient methods?" Li Fan unconsciously changed the way he addressed him and quickly asked.

"More precisely, it is practicing the ancient methods while bound in chains." Shuo Feng sighed lightly. "This is both its advantage and its drawback. However, I have no regrets. Although the path is more arduous, the potential ceiling is much higher!"

Seemingly reminded of something, Li Fan suddenly asked, "If one reaches Dao Integration through the Heavenly Wonder, then the next step would be to reverse the principles of the Heavenly Wonder?"

A flicker of admiration flashed in Shuo Feng’s eyes. "Exactly! The difficulty of achieving Longevity Immortality lies in this—Heaven and Earth’s principles are intangible and abstract concepts, difficult for ordinary people to perceive. To reverse them is even harder."

"One must search for the laws of Heaven and Earth, familiarize themselves with them, master them, and then finally overturn them…"

"All of these steps must be completed within the Dao Integration stage. While Dao Integration cultivators enjoy long lifespans, every step forward requires an immense price. Throughout history, how many peerless geniuses have fallen just before taking the final step?"

"But those who build their foundation with the Heavenly Wonder naturally bypass the first step. From the moment they begin cultivation, they are already practicing the second and third steps. It's almost like skipping half the effort."

Shuo Feng explained patiently in a way that was easy to understand.

And Li Fan gradually began to grasp the concept.

"Seeking, familiarizing, mastering, and reversing—it seems these correspond to the different sub-realms within Dao Integration."

Li Fan suddenly recalled something. Back when Ji Hongdao was confronting Senior Sister Zhao, he had once said, "After a Heavenly Sovereign establishes their 'Definitive Law,' they should no longer meddle in worldly affairs."

"A 'Definitive Law' means that one has already reversed the laws of Heaven and Earth, ultimately replacing them and transforming into a part of the universe itself. This is the true path to Longevity Immortality."

"Before that, Dao Integration cultivators still have four major steps to complete."

Shuo Feng saw Li Fan lost in contemplation and couldn't help but caution him, "What I have shared today is merely in gratitude for your earlier guidance. Do not become too ambitious or lose yourself in these thoughts. If that happens, my goodwill would have led to harm."

Li Fan snapped back to reality and smiled. "Daoist Shuo, you worry too much. I am not someone who fails to appreciate good advice. I used to believe that Longevity Immortality was just a few major realms away from us cultivators, and that I might one day reach it."

"But now, I realize that the gap is not just a few realms, but rather multiple chasms—each one capable of making a person despair."

"One must always have hope, though." Shuo Feng nodded in agreement, before suddenly making an unexpected remark.

"By the way, I still don’t know your title. Given your character and talent, you must not be an unknown figure." Shuo Feng looked at Li Fan with curiosity.

Li Fan cupped his hands and said, "I am Li Fan."

Shuo Feng narrowed his eyes and examined Li Fan carefully.

"It's just a common name. I have been mistaken for others many times in the past." Li Fan explained.

Shuo Feng slowly nodded.

"I have a talent for sensing auras. Passing by this place, I noticed something unusual, so I descended to investigate. Who would have thought that before I could find anything, I was nearly killed by you, Fellow Daoist?" Li Fan actively explained the situation.

"In that case, I also feel something strange about this area." Shuo Feng suddenly realized and looked off into the distance.

His gaze landed on a particular direction—the place where Han Yi’s stone statue stood.

However, he did not seem to notice the statue itself, only that something felt off about that location.

"Interesting…"

"Fellow Daoist, why don’t we go and investigate together?" Li Fan suggested.

"That was exactly my thought." Shuo Feng, clearly someone unafraid of trouble, immediately agreed.

Just as the two were about to set off, the sky suddenly turned pink.

Shuo Feng's expression changed drastically.

Scarlet snowflakes drifted down.

A melodic female voice suddenly echoed, "Feng'er, you’ve been away from home for long enough. It’s time to return."

Shuo Feng's face stiffened slightly.

Yet, he dared not resist his mother’s will. He only cast an apologetic glance at Li Fan.

"I understand, Mother." He responded.

As he grasped a snowflake, the scarlet color melted in his palm.

Moments later, his figure blurred and gradually faded from sight.

Suddenly, a communication talisman fell from the sky and flew toward Li Fan.

"If Brother Li ever needs help, feel free to contact me."

Shuo Feng’s voice lingered faintly in the air.

Chapter 663: The Divide Between the New and Old Worlds

Shuo Feng’s voice grew quieter and quieter.

In the end, as it became almost inaudible, the scarlet snowflakes falling from the sky also disappeared without a trace.

As if it had all been nothing more than an illusion.

"Was it merely a coincidence, or was it his extraordinary fortune leading him to avoid disaster?"

"Or perhaps, Immortal Sage Fei Xue has always been watching over Shuo Feng, unwilling to let him suffer harm? And upon seeing him about to step into danger, intervened to stop him?"

Li Fan remained silent, turning his gaze toward the stone statue of Han Yi.

After a moment of contemplation, he descended to the ground and activated the Heavenly Mandate Domain, walking step by step toward it.

His pace was extremely slow because he was carefully sensing the power of fortune absorption in the surroundings.

Since he was already infinitely close to the state of a "Fortune-less Being," he was particularly sensitive to changes in his own destiny.

After walking about ninety steps forward, Li Fan suddenly noticed a flaw appearing in his Heavenly Mandate Domain.

It was like a hole had been pierced in a cup of water—his already near-nonexistent fortune was rapidly draining away. The moment the last trace was completely exhausted, he saw dense black mist beginning to swirl above his head.

An intense, ominous feeling surged through his heart, as if an impending catastrophe was about to befall him in the next moment.

Li Fan quickly retreated, retrieving the fortune stored within the Black Bird Feather at the same time.

Even though his reaction had been swift, the effects of the drained fortune were immediate. As he stepped back, he stumbled, almost falling to the ground.

A Nascent Soul cultivator like him—one who had formed his Nascent Soul using the Five Elements Cave-Heaven, the pinnacle of methods—was actually tripping while walking?

And yet, such an illogical event had truly occurred.

Li Fan dared not hesitate. While firmly engraving the sensation into his memory, he accelerated the process of replenishing his lost fortune.

Once he had stabilized himself and retreated to a safe distance, Li Fan discovered that nearly half of the fortune stored within the Black Bird Feather had been consumed just to dispel the ominous black mist above his head.
