"Even from this distance, so much fortune has already been drained. This Fortune-Draining Statue is truly terrifying. Even someone as blessed as Shuo Feng wouldn't have been able to resist it and would have been completely drained. No wonder his mother took him away."

"This is not something mortal power can resist—unless..."

"Worldly Fortune."

A thought suddenly struck Li Fan, and he immediately recalled the world where Xiao Hei had perished.

That Beast Realm’s fortune had clearly been refined and integrated by Xiao Hei. But not long ago, Xiao Hei had fallen for unknown reasons, causing that fortune to shatter and scatter everywhere.

Even with Han Yi’s meager cultivation back then, he was able to absorb and control the free-floating Worldly Fortune.

With the Black Bird Feather in hand, Li Fan would undoubtedly have an even easier time absorbing the World’s Fortune.

"Moreover, a drop of Xu Ke’s essence blood was also buried there. It seems I must make a trip."

"There are many powerful beast species hidden within that small world. In the past, when I was merely at the Nascent Soul stage and alone, I would have had some concerns. But now..."

A sharp glint flashed in Li Fan’s eyes.

He temporarily withdrew from the fortune-draining field and returned to Longevity Valley, summoning Liu San.

Just as he was about to instruct Liu San to lead a group of Medicine King Sect disciples into the Beast Realm to clear out potential threats, Li Fan suddenly sensed something amiss and hesitated.

"Young Master, what troubles you?"

Liu San looked at Li Fan with a hint of confusion.

Li Fan pondered for a moment, then reviewed the records stored in the Dao Deviation Stone, and finally came to a realization.

At some point, he had once again forgotten about the calamity that had befallen Congyun Sea.

"I wonder what Congyun Sea looks like now. Is it a void of nothingness, or a barren wasteland?"

"If it has already turned into the void, then does the entrance to the Beast Realm still exist...?"

As thoughts raced through his mind, Li Fan’s expression grew solemn.

"On my recent journey, I discovered something utterly terrifying."

Without delay, Li Fan told Liu San about how Congyun Sea had been destroyed and how the world had gradually forgotten about it.

"Congyun Sea?" Liu San was initially puzzled, but then, as the memories resurfaced, his face turned pale with shock.

"It’s fortunate that, due to our move to Longevity Valley, we unknowingly avoided this calamity," Li Fan sighed.

But Liu San was more focused on the fact that he had forgotten about Congyun Sea’s destruction.

"To make the entire world forget without them even realizing it... Is this the power of the New Method Longevity Immortality?"

Liu San, whose understanding of Longevity Immortal Sovereigns was still rooted in ancient times, was deeply shaken.

After all, as one of the strongest Dao Integration cultivators of the Medicine King Sect, he had once met the Longevity Immortal Sovereigns of the Ten Great Immortal Sects.

Although he had never considered himself their equal, he had at least believed he could put up some resistance.

But now...

In an instant, Liu San’s pride shattered. The more he thought about it, the more terrified he became, cold sweat dripping from his forehead.

Noticing Liu San’s abnormal state, Li Fan reassured him, "Elder Liu, there is no need to dwell on this. The world has changed, and although the title ‘Longevity Immortal Sovereign’ remains the same, the New Method Longevity Immortal and Ancient Method Longevity Immortal are clearly not of the same level anymore."

Despite his deep trust in Li Fan, Liu San took a long time to calm down.

After a prolonged silence, he sighed deeply before turning to Li Fan and saying, "Today, I have finally witnessed the power of the New Method Longevity Immortal. Before, I was merely a frog at the bottom of a well."

"The gap between the New and Old Method is this vast..."

"Young Master, I wish to transition to the New Law cultivation method." Liu San solemnly declared.

Li Fan was not surprised by this decision at all. He nodded in approval, "I support you! Elder Liu, reigniting your ambition is a blessing for our Medicine King Sect. Who knows? You might attain enlightenment and achieve Longevity Immortality. If that happens, with a Longevity Immortal Sovereign watching over us, our sect will finally return to the world openly and proudly."

"However..."

Li Fan’s tone suddenly shifted. "The Old and New Laws cannot be cultivated together. If Elder Liu wants to advance further and defy the natural order, he must completely rebuild his cultivation with a different Dao Integration technique."

"First, such techniques are incredibly rare. Second... the refinement of the Longevity Pills still requires your expertise."

Liu San immediately understood Li Fan’s meaning. His previous enthusiasm dimmed slightly.

The gap between ideals and reality forced him to make a choice.

However, as someone devoted to the Medicine King Sect, Liu San only hesitated for a moment before making his decision.

"I understand, Young Master. For now, I will prioritize the revival of our sect," he said with some regret.

Li Fan smiled faintly. "Elder Liu, you misunderstand me. I fully support your transition to the New Method, and your cultivation breakthrough does not contradict our sect’s revival."

"It just requires some preparation, that’s all."

Chapter 664: Heavenly Capital Formed from Purple Qi

"Although it may seem a bit inconsiderate, we must admit that it was precisely this calamity that led to the demise of Daoist Zhou Qingang. As a result, the enormous debt we originally owed no longer needs to be repaid. As long as Elder Liu refines more Longevity Pills and other useful elixirs for sale, after a few years of accumulation, exchanging them for a Dao Integration cultivation method won’t be a problem," Li Fan said confidently.

Upon hearing this, Liu San’s eyes regained a glimmer of spirit.

A few years of waiting was insignificant to him. As for Zhou Qingang, who had unfortunately fallen, Liu San had only met him a few times and had no deep connection with him. Naturally, he felt no sorrow.

"This person’s death is truly convenient! It saved me years of effort!" Liu San thought to himself.

Li Fan continued, "During this period of accumulating contribution points, I also need to devise a reasonable identity for Elder Liu. After all, with your Dao Integration cultivation, it’s not as easy to conceal yourself as it is for people like us. Originally, I planned to use the excuse of an ‘Ancient Cultivator Awakening from Slumber’ to get past any inquiries. But for some reason, recent events have made the cultivators of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance more cautious and skeptical of such claims. So, I need to come up with a more reliable explanation."

"But Elder Liu, don’t worry, I already have some ideas in mind."

Liu San did not dwell on the details of Li Fan’s words. His natural trust in Li Fan made him simply nod in agreement. "Young Master, you make the decisions!"

After temporarily reassuring Liu San, one of the two Dao Integration cultivators of the Medicine King Sect, Li Fan headed to the newly built artifact refinement workshop in Longevity Valley. There, he met another Dao Integration cultivator—Fang Zaiji.

At this moment, Fang Zaiji was staring intently at the Medicine King True Cauldron floating in the air before him, his eyes filled with fascination.

After relocating to Longevity Valley, Li Fan had placed the Medicine King True Cauldron here for Fang Zaiji to study.

Beyond providing some comfort, Li Fan also hoped that Fang Zaiji’s artifact refinement skills would improve further—ideally to the point where he could enhance and modify the Medicine King True Cauldron.

As for why this was necessary...

In this lifetime, Li Fan intended to use his clone to control the Medicine King True Cauldron and break free from the Xuanhuang Realm, plunging into the Immortal Ruins to uncover its secrets!

He wanted to see with his own eyes—the figure within the Immortal Ruins. Was it alive or dead? What did it truly look like?

Li Fan knew that upon approaching the Immortal Ruins, the terrifying gravitational pull would warp even time and space.

A mere moment inside the Immortal Ruins could mean tens of millions of years had passed in the outside world.

Under normal circumstances, if one were to send an clone to explore, the immense time dilation would make it impossible to receive any information. The original body would simply perceive a loss of connection, and before any message could be transmitted back, the main body would have perished from the passage of time.

But Li Fan had a way to circumvent this issue.

It was thanks to the new ability [Incarnation] that he had awakened after absorbing the remnants of Tianyang.

Transforming into an object—traversing the ages!

In his previous life, with only a Golden Core cultivation, he had managed to exist in an [Incarnation] state for over three thousand years. Now, with his Five Elements Cave Heaven having elevated him to the Nascent Soul stage, his strength had undergone a qualitative transformation. Furthermore, he had awakened the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra, which should allow him to endure even longer.

It would be enough to withstand the long years and wait for his clone’s report.

The Immortal Ruins concealed great secrets, including but not limited to the lost history of the Xuanhuang Realm and its future destiny.

If he could glimpse its truth, it would be of immense significance to Li Fan—perhaps even revealing the mystery of the Fallen Immortals!

Of course, all of this was based on the premise that the Medicine King True Cauldron could withstand the terrifying gravitational force of the Immortal Ruins for long enough without disintegrating.

"The Medicine King Sect, due to material and cost limitations, did not forge the Medicine King True Cauldron from the highest-grade materials. However, its artifact refinement philosophy and techniques are unique and worth studying."

"Give me enough time, and I will definitely return to you a stronger Medicine King True Cauldron!"

When Li Fan presented his request for strengthening the cauldron, Fang Zaiji responded with this firm declaration.

And Fang Zaiji was indeed highly skilled. The small cauldrons he casually refined in recent times were far superior to those used by disciples, already carrying traces of the True Cauldron’s essence.

At that moment, Fang Zaiji was so engrossed in his work that Li Fan had to call out to him several times before he finally snapped out of it.

Li Fan then narrated the events of the disappearance of Congyun Sea and the existence of Carefree Heavenly Sovereign.

Unlike Liu San’s shock, Fang Zaiji remained exceptionally calm.

He merely responded with a simple "Oh," before once again focusing his gaze on the Medicine King True Cauldron.

After a while, seeing that Li Fan had not left, he finally asked, "Sect Master, is there anything else?"

Li Fan hesitated briefly before saying, "I intend to return to Congyun Sea. However, since the calamity has only recently passed, I am uncertain about the current situation. There may still be hidden dangers, so I would like to ask you to accompany me."

Fang Zaiji’s expression instantly brightened.

He smirked smugly and said to Li Fan, "So, you finally understand who’s truly reliable in critical moments, huh? That Liu San is nothing more than a short-sighted servant who got lucky. When real trouble arises, you still have to rely on me!"

"Let’s go! We’ll set off immediately! With me here, you will be safe!"

Li Fan simply smiled and nodded without arguing.

Without alerting the other members of Longevity Valley, Li Fan and Fang Zaiji headed east, swiftly traveling toward Congyun Sea.

With Fang Zaiji’s assistance, they neared their destination in just over ten days.

However, upon entering Shilin Prefecture, Fang Zaiji suddenly halted and cast a glance toward the neighboring Yuandao Prefecture, his expression turning serious.

"Strange..." Fang Zaiji furrowed his brows, then shook his head and muttered to himself.

Li Fan’s heart stirred, but he feigned surprise and asked, "Sir, what’s the matter?"

"I sensed a familiar aura," Fang Zaiji explained.

"A familiar aura? Could it be an old acquaintance?" Li Fan asked, astonished.

"No, it seems like [Heavenly Capital Purple Qi], but there’s something slightly different about it," Fang Zaiji observed the distant scene carefully before speaking again.

"Heavenly Capital? That name sounds familiar, but I can’t quite recall it," Li Fan followed Fang Zaiji’s gaze and pondered aloud.

Fang Zaiji chuckled, "It’s no surprise that you juniors don’t know. Even Liu San might not have heard of the name [Heavenly Capital]. I only learned of it during my travels, when I explored with the direct disciples of the Ten Great Immortal Sects."

"You must have heard of the Xuantian Sect, right? Back then, the Xuantian Sect was at its peak, dominating the Xuanhuang Realm. The so-called Ten Great Immortal Sects were nothing more than its vassals, treated like mere cattle and horses."

"Under normal circumstances, we cultivators would never have had a chance to rise up."

"But one day, a surge of purple qi descended from the heavens, transforming into a massive, towering city that hovered in the sky."

"The Xuantian Sect swiftly issued a decree forbidding anyone from approaching. But some cultivators, disregarding the risks, ventured inside."

"And that… was the origin of the Ten Great Immortal Sects!"

Chapter 665: The Abyss Between Immortals and Mortals

"Is this truly the case?"

"Each of the Ten Great Immortal Sects is an unquestionable giant. What exactly exists within that colossal city in the sky that could give rise to such mighty immortal sects?" Upon hearing this, Li Fan was visibly shocked, exclaiming in disbelief.

Fang Zaiji nodded slightly. "When I first learned of this, I, too, found it hard to believe. However, after extensive inquiries, I have confirmed that this is indeed true. The Ten Great Immortal Sects were able to rise so suddenly precisely because of the opportunities they obtained in [Heavenly Capital]!"

Before Li Fan could ask further, Fang Zaiji continued, "It is said that within Heavenly Capital, though it appears empty and devoid of any living beings, at the very center of a pavilion sits a solitary figure in meditation. Standing beside this figure is a child attendant. The figure’s face is indistinct, yet it seems to be preaching to the void ahead. Countless profound and mystical Daoist discourses, resonant like grand bells and mighty drums, echo in the ears of all who hear them. What’s even more astonishing is that each person hears something different."

"Entranced by the teachings, they immerse themselves completely. But when they awaken from their enlightenment and try to listen further, they find they can no longer hear anything from the figure. Instead, the child attendant beside the figure merely waves a hand and expels them from the pavilion."

"Upon leaving, these cultivators compared their insights and discovered that their revelations stemmed from their original knowledge, yet they had become exponentially more profound—countless times more exquisite than what their sects had taught them!"

"Thereafter, no matter how hard they tried, they were never able to enter the pavilion again."

Fang Zaiji sighed slightly. "These cultivators understood the immense value of this opportunity. As they quietly left Heavenly Capital, they informed their sect members to come. However, perhaps it was precisely this action that alerted the Xuantian Sect. Not only did the sect begin hunting down those who had left Heavenly Capital, but it also sent its forces to completely seal off the floating city in the sky."

"This act of disrespect seemed to provoke the discontent of the mysterious figure within Heavenly Capital. The child attendant was sent to confront them. The details of this battle remain unknown, but the outcome was that although the Xuantian Sect retreated in disgrace, no other cultivators could enter Heavenly Capital afterward either."

"However, from time to time each year, strands of purple qi would descend, dispersing across the Xuanhuang Realm. Those fortunate enough to obtain them, while not experiencing the figure’s Daoist teachings firsthand, would still gain insights nearly as profound."

Li Fan pondered for a moment, then frowned. "What became of Heavenly Capital afterward? Why is it that in our time, so few have even heard of it?"

"Heavenly Capital remained suspended in the sky for a full ten years. Then, just as it had mysteriously appeared, it vanished without a trace, unnoticed by anyone."

"Not long after that, tensions between the Xuantian Sect and the Immortal sects had escalated beyond reconciliation. Amidst the war that engulfed the entire Xuanhuang Realm, no one had the time to concern themselves with the vanished Heavenly Capital."

Fang Zaiji sighed. "By the time of our generation, Heavenly Capital had already become nothing more than a legend spoken of in idle conversations."

At that moment, realization dawned on Li Fan. "I recall now—when I looked into the Tianxuan Mirror, I once read about a Dao Integration cultivator named Lan Yu from Yuandao Prefecture. He claimed to be a direct successor of the Grandmaster of Heavenly Capital. However…"

A trace of doubt appeared on Li Fan’s face. "I have also heard that in ancient times, Heavenly Capital fell from the sky for some unknown reason. Even now, remnants of Heavenly Capital can still be found across the land."

"What? Heavenly Capital fell?" This time, it was Fang Zaiji’s turn to be stunned.

"Impossible! Absolutely impossible!" A moment later, Fang Zaiji firmly denied this claim. "If Heavenly Capital had truly collided with the Xuanhuang Realm, it’s hard to say which would have suffered more!"

"Sir, you mean to say…?" Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

"That’s right. Heavenly Capital very likely originates from the legendary Immortal Realm! And the mysterious figure within it could very well have been an actual immortal! The reason why the cultivators of the Ten Great Immortal Sects were unable to perceive the figure clearly is that after ascending to immortality, one undergoes a fundamental transformation in the nature of existence—far beyond the comprehension of ordinary cultivators!" Fang Zaiji declared with conviction.

"Another immortal… So it did not fall after all?" Li Fan neither confirmed nor denied it. He thought of the unknown entity hovering over Yuandao Prefecture, devouring time itself. Perhaps, some unforeseen event had indeed led to this bizarre phenomenon…

Seeing Li Fan’s skepticism, Fang Zaiji snorted. "You cannot understand the power of a true immortal unless you witness it with your own eyes. If you were fortunate enough to obtain even a single wisp of [Heavenly Capital Purple Qi] like I did, you would know that my words are no exaggeration. By the way, that Lan Yu who claims to be from the lineage of the Grandmaster of Heavenly Capital may not be lying. After all, the Heavenly Capital Purple Qi contains many inheritances from that Grandmaster."

Li Fan was slightly taken aback. "Sir, you once obtained a wisp of Heavenly Capital Purple Qi?"

Fang Zaiji smirked proudly. "Of course! Back then, I was just a naive child who stumbled upon this fortune without knowing its true origins. Otherwise, how could a nobody like me, without any sect or lineage, have cultivated to the Dao Integration realm? And why would those arrogant disciples of the Ten Great Immortal Sects even bother to mention this hidden past to me? They must have sensed the presence of Heavenly Capital Purple Qi within me."

"The so-called ‘Grandmaster of Heavenly Capital’—could it be the figure within Heavenly Capital?" Li Fan asked after a brief silence.

Fang Zaiji rolled his eyes. "What are you thinking? I already told you—that figure was most likely a true immortal. If an immortal chooses not to reveal their identity, how could mere mortals ever know who they are? Moreover, even those cultivators of the Ten Great Immortal Sects who had the privilege of listening to the immortal’s teachings likely wouldn’t dare to claim they had received the immortal’s direct inheritance."

"The ‘Grandmaster of Heavenly Capital’ we refer to was actually the child attendant standing beside the figure. The Ten Great Immortal Sects were founded after only briefly listening to the immortal’s discourse—can you imagine the level of mastery possessed by the Grandmaster who stood beside the immortal for an eternity?"

"The Heavenly Capital Purple Qi contains the Grandmaster’s interpretations of the immortal’s teachings, encompassing countless disciplines. Even a single trace of it would be a lifelong treasure for a mortal."

"The wisp I obtained long ago contained only a fragment of the Grandmaster’s insights on artifact refinement." Fang Zaiji glanced toward the direction of Yuandao Prefecture as he spoke.

Li Fan finally understood.

The Ten Great Immortal Sects had received direct guidance from an immortal.

The Heavenly Capital Purple Qi, however, contained the insights of the Grandmaster of Heavenly Capital, who had spent years absorbing the immortal’s teachings. Though this knowledge was a step removed from the source, it was still powerful enough to create a Dao Integration cultivator with ease.

"This… This is the true abyss between mortals and immortals. The gap is even greater than that between mortals and cultivators," Li Fan sighed in his heart.

Chapter 666: Charred Black Wasteland

"If the Heavenly Capital truly fell, then what exists now must be a replica created by later generations as a tribute," said Fang Zaiji.

Although Li Fan nodded in agreement on the surface, he harbored his own thoughts deep within.

Fang Zaiji repeatedly claimed that the phantom in the Heavenly Capital held infinite mysteries and was undoubtedly a True Immortal. However, from beginning to end, this matter exuded an eerie aura.

For many years after the severance of the Immortal Path, a True Immortal unexpectedly passed through the Xuanhuang Realm. Not only that, but this Immortal willingly preached and imparted divine teachings to mere cultivators, who were nothing more than ants in his eyes.

Ask yourself: how many cultivators, after passing by mortal cities, would benevolently descend and teach the mortals the ways of cultivation?

More often than not, wouldn't they be like Shuo Feng—who, with a single careless sword strike, would massacre all the mortals without a second thought?

For audacious cultivators who dared to intrude, merely being spared was already a mercy. Why, then, would such a being take the trouble to teach them?

Moreover, if Fang Zaiji’s words were true, then there was something clearly wrong with the figure in the Heavenly Capital. His preaching might not have been intentional but rather an automatic occurrence.

If that were the case, then the child standing beside that phantom—the so-called Grandmaster of the Heavenly Capital, the only one who ever took action—would be highly suspicious.

"Perhaps this person was drawn in by the Immortal Ruins and was forced to descend into the Xuanhuang Realm. His actual strength might not even qualify as a true Immortal. However, since the Xuantian Sect failed to take the Heavenly Capital, he must have been incredibly powerful. At the very least, he was at the Half-Step True Immortal stage, on par with the ‘Xuantian King’ of the Xuantian Sect."

"And allowing cultivators from the Ten Great Immortal Sects to enter the Heavenly Capital might have just been a ploy to cause trouble for the Xuantian Sect. After all, what truly concerns an Immortal should be matters of their own level."

"Immortal Spiritual Energy?"

Almost instantly, Li Fan, as if he were a conspiracy theorist, constructed an elaborate scheme in his mind.

Though his thoughts were purely speculative, one thing was nearly certain—the abnormalities in Yuandao Prefecture were undoubtedly connected to the Heavenly Capital.

"As a fellow inheritor of the Heavenly Capital’s Purple Qi, sir, are you not interested in visiting Yuandao Prefecture?" Li Fan asked tentatively.

Fang Zaiji shook his head repeatedly. "Haha, I'd rather not. A Dao Integration cultivator who has lived for thousands of years is far stronger than I am. If I go, wouldn’t that be like walking into a tiger’s den? Sect Master, let’s stick to our real mission."

Li Fan smiled slightly and nodded.

After this brief detour, the two of them traveled for more than half a day before finally arriving at the border of Shilin Prefecture.

However, the sight before them made Li Fan’s pupils constrict.

In the distance, the land had sunken, scorched black. Rivers of black molten lava flowed in all directions, radiating a post-apocalyptic atmosphere.

From time to time, pillars of black flames would erupt from the depths of the earth, spreading through the air and distorting the atmosphere with their blistering heat.

What truly made Li Fan’s heart pound was the unsettling sight of countless pitch-black voids scattered irregularly across the ground and sky of this charred basin.

Like a worm-eaten apple, the land was riddled with scars.

Moreover, Li Fan soon realized that these dark voids were not completely static. Rather, they seemed to possess a life of their own, writhing slowly, or suddenly jumping to a different location—devouring everything within their reach.

Even Fang Zaiji, a Dao Integration cultivator, looked grim in the face of such an eerie scene.

"Sect Master, are you sure we should proceed?" he asked hesitantly.

Li Fan did not respond immediately. Instead, he carefully observed for a long time.

"If we're careful, there shouldn't be a big problem. Those void caverns seem to shift unpredictably, but in reality, they follow a set pattern. They only teleport to relatively empty areas and will not appear near existing caverns."

"So, as long as we maintain a certain distance from the void caverns and keep moving forward, we should be fine."

"Besides, don’t we still have the True Cauldron of the Medicine King?"

As he spoke, Li Fan tossed the Medicine King Cauldron toward a pitch-black void not far away.

"Sect Master!" Fang Zaiji exclaimed in a low voice.

The Medicine King Cauldron emitted an earthy-yellow glow that enveloped itself. In the midst of the void, though the glow gradually dimmed, it still managed to persist for over ten breaths of time.

"See? Even if we accidentally enter, this amount of time would be more than enough for us to escape." Retrieving the Medicine King True Cauldron, Li Fan looked at Fang Zaiji and said with a smile.

"Sect Master, you're far too reckless! What if something happened to the Medicine King True Cauldron? What then?" Fang Zaiji muttered.

"Isn't that why you're here? Even if the Medicine King Cauldron were lost, I believe you, sir, could refine a new one for our Medicine King Sect." Li Fan replied nonchalantly.

Hearing this, Fang Zaiji couldn't help but smile and stopped nagging. He followed Li Fan, controlling the Medicine King Cauldron as they flew into the scorched basin.

Li Fan carefully oriented himself and cautiously made his way toward the location in his memory.

"This is truly terrifying… How could such a catastrophe befall this once-thriving sea?" Fang Zaiji clicked his tongue in amazement as he observed the surroundings. "Back in our time, nothing like this ever happened. Judging by the situation, it seems the heavens intend to completely erase this place."

Li Fan remained silent.

Congyun Sea had always been vast, and now, in order to avoid the ever-present void caverns, their flying speed was even more affected. It took them over thirty days before they finally arrived at the entrance of the Small World of Exotic Beasts.

However, the sight before them made Li Fan’s expression darken.

The original entrance had been completely consumed by the void. Naturally, the passageway itself no longer existed.

Li Fan pondered for a moment and recalled that when Han Yi exited the Small World, he had done so from another location.

Thus, he set out for that spot.

Fortunately, luck was on their side this time. The entrance was not within the range of the void caverns but was instead hidden beneath pitch-black lava.

"Sect Master, what if we enter and this exit gets swallowed by the void? Wouldn't that mean we’d have no way to return?" Fang Zaiji noticed the issue as well. Just as Li Fan was about to step in, he abruptly stopped him and voiced his concern.

"No worries, I've made preparations."

As he spoke, Li Fan cleared away the black lava. Then, he retrieved a thin piece of paper from his storage ring and gently pressed it against the entrance of the Small World.

It was as if a drop of ink had fallen onto the paper—delicate patterns slowly emerged.

"This is…?" Fang Zaiji squinted his eyes, momentarily unable to recognize it.

"This is a Star-Stealing Lodging Talisman. It can replicate and record the spatial node data of this passageway. Once inside the Small World, we will perform the same process on the other end of the passage, allowing us to reconstruct a new pathway."

Once the patterns on the Stolen Star Lodging Talisman had fully formed, Li Fan took out a gate-shaped talisman seal and tossed it onto the thin paper.

Under the talisman’s influence, a faintly glowing door emerged.

"Young Master, the connection on this side is ready." From within the door, Liu San's voice could be faintly heard.

With a gentle flick of his finger, Li Fan sent the Star-Stealing Lodging Talisman into the passage.

"Mister Fang, let's go. Elder Liu will handle the preparations for the new passage in the Valley of Longevity."

Chapter 667: Sweeping Through the Beast Realm

"Hmph, you actually kept this from me…" Fang Zaiji muttered under his breath as he followed behind Li Fan into the spatial passage.

"Hiss!"

As soon as they stepped into this small world, Fang Zaiji's vision blurred, and he saw dozens of Green-Winged Flying Serpents baring their fangs, lunging toward him.

"You beasts dare to attack me?!" His expression darkened as he waved his wide sleeve. Instantly, the space in front of him trembled, and the ferocious beasts were reduced to dust, leaving no remains.

The entrance was located at the bottom of a deep ravine, shrouded in mist, with faint traces of spiritual energy dispersing into the air. The disturbance caused by Li Fan and Fang Zaiji's arrival quickly drew the attention of countless beasts above.

Like waves of an unending tide, they charged forward fearlessly.

"Sir, please protect me while I work." Despite their overwhelming numbers, these beasts were at most at the Foundation Establishment stage, posing no real threat to Fang Zaiji, who had reached the Dao Integration realm. Li Fan smiled, spoke briefly, then took out a Star-Stealing Lodging Talisman and placed it at the passage entrance.

In no time, after completing the transcription of this spatial node, Li Fan sent the talisman to Liu San, who was preparing inside the Longevity Valley.

"Young master, constructing the spatial passage will take approximately thirty days. Will you return first, or…?" Liu San's voice faintly echoed through the gateway.

"No rush. I will explore this place with Mr. Fang first. With him here, Elder Liu, you need not worry about my safety," Li Fan replied.

"Hmph, it's exactly because you're with him that I am worried."

"What did you say?!" Fang Zaiji, still clearing out the beasts, suddenly turned around upon hearing this.

Just as he was about to argue with Liu San, he realized the connection had already been cut off. Feeling stifled, Fang Zaiji could only vent his frustration on the reckless beasts.

Before long, the creatures that had lived in this ravine for countless generations were slaughtered to near extinction.

Flying out of the gorge, Li Fan landed on a desolate plain. He took a deep breath, closed his eyes, and focused. The Black Bird Feather within him emitted a faint black glow. In an instant, he became aware of the omnipresent, free-flowing Heavenly Fortune within this small world.

Like a whale drawing in water, like leaves returning to their roots—without much effort, the Heavenly Fortune from hundreds of miles around surged eagerly into Li Fan's body.

Or rather, into the Black Bird Feather.

As he absorbed more and more of this power, Li Fan felt a shift within himself. With a mere flick of his finger and a thought, a massive rift split the ground with a thunderous roar.

Countless plants and beasts were swallowed by the crevice, while those that survived let out terrified howls. No longer caring about this sudden intruder, they frantically tried to flee.

Watching the beasts retreat, Li Fan stirred his thoughts, and suddenly, fierce winds swept through the heavens and the earth.

Sand and stones rose into the air, howling as they lifted the fleeing beasts into the sky—only to hurl them back to where they started.

These creatures, already lacking in intelligence, were completely overwhelmed by terror. Trembling, they collapsed to the ground.

Satisfied, Li Fan withdrew his power.

"My fortune is the heavenly fortune, my fate is the heavenly fate. Every word and deed carries the might of heaven and earth."

"Marvelous!" he thought to himself in admiration.

"Sect Master, was that… all your doing?" Fang Zaiji asked in shock.

Even with his Dao Integration cultivation, effortlessly splitting the earth and summoning stormwinds was no easy feat.

Li Fan simply smiled without answering.

For the next period of time, under Fang Zaiji’s protection, Li Fan continued gathering the free-flowing Heavenly Fortune within this world while making his way deeper into the wilderness.

If the Black Bird Feather’s faint guidance was correct, then Xiao Hei’s remains should be there.

During this journey, Li Fan discovered something rather intriguing…

The closer they got to Xiao Hei's corpse, the fewer human-like external features the beasts had. At the same time, these beasts became significantly stronger.

"The beasts in this small world belong to a branch of hybridized [Beastkind] that fuses humans and beasts. However, after thousands of years of reproduction across countless generations, the beastly bloodline has not weakened. Instead, it has exhibited an atavistic phenomenon."

"Interesting."

As Fang Zaiji cleared a path forward, Li Fan also noticed that some of these beasts had actually mastered various "spells" that allowed them to utilize the free-flowing Heavenly Fortune for combat.

This somewhat hindered Li Fan's ability to absorb Heavenly Fortune, but it was merely an inconvenience.

No matter what kind of divine abilities or mystical arts these beasts possessed, in the face of absolute power disparity, all of them were meaningless—they would all be crushed.

Fang Zaiji advanced relentlessly, while Li Fan leisurely followed behind, harvesting the remains.

"Mr. Fang, go easy on them. Leave some of the beasts alive. This place could make a fine ranch for our Medicine King Sect in the future." Holding a blue crystal core in his hand, Li Fan examined it carefully while giving his instructions.

"Whatever you say, Sect Master." The prolonged slaughter had made Fang Zaiji somewhat impatient. Now that Li Fan had spoken, he could rightfully slack off a bit, so he readily agreed.

This blue crystal core was something Li Fan had discovered within the corpse of a beast at the Golden Core stage.

It was identical to the beast cores described by Li Chenfeng—beast cores that the Empire’s cultivators relied on for cultivation.

Crushing the core, a surge of boiling-hot energy gushed forth like scalding water. As Li Fan absorbed it, he noticed that part of this searing, unfamiliar energy transformed into spiritual qi, flowing through his meridians. Another small portion dispersed into his physical body in tiny specks, strengthening his flesh and enhancing its resilience.

"Not bad, this is good stuff." Li Fan thought to himself.

At this moment, Fang Zaiji also noticed Li Fan’s actions. Casually slaughtering another beast, he retrieved a crystal core and absorbed it.

"Interesting… Back in the day, we cultivators couldn't absorb these demon cores. I never expected that after thousands of years, they would become usable to us!" After a brief moment, Fang Zaiji sighed.

"Indeed, the world has changed over these millennia!" Li Fan laughed in agreement.

"Perhaps this is precisely due to the fusion of demon beast and human bloodlines over the past thousands of years." Li Fan thought to himself, recalling those [Beastkind] that looked nearly identical to humans.

Continuing forward, they saw a towering black three-legged pagoda standing on the distant land. At its peak, a massive black bird stood with its wings outstretched.

"So it really is that thing." A glimmer of sharpness flashed in Li Fan’s eyes. The black bird’s appearance was exactly the same as the Xiao Hei he had encountered in the Fallen Immortal Realm.

As if sensing that Fang Zaiji’s power was utterly unstoppable, the beasts no longer attempted to hinder their approach.

Li Fan could only watch as thousands upon thousands of beasts knelt beneath the black three-legged pagoda, bowing their heads in reverence toward the black bird, as if pleading for mercy.

Chapter 668: Divine Power Defies Fate

In Li Fan’s field of vision, under the worship ceremony of the exotic beasts, the drifting heavenly fate in the depths of the wilderness began to madly converge toward the top of the black three-legged tower.

Like a massive storm vortex, lightning flashed and thunder roared, making the sky darken ominously.

Seeing this, Li Fan attempted to use the Feather of the Black Bird to seize control of the heavenly fate. However, the outcome was clear—it was utterly futile. Compared to a mere feather, the black mysterious bird perched at the top of the three-legged tower was the true ruler of this beast race world.

Under that immense suction force, Li Fan even faintly sensed that the strands of drifting heavenly fortune he had previously absorbed into his body were beginning to loosen and show signs of being forcibly drawn away.

Although Fang Zaiji could not see the changes in heavenly fate, the increasingly lifelike appearance of the black mysterious bird was visible to the naked eye.

A solemn look flickered across his face, but he remained disdainful. "The dead are dead—do you really think bowing and begging will bring them back to life?"

Despite his words, Fang Zaiji remained extremely cautious. Without waiting for the beasts to complete their ceremony, he conjured a towering giant hand, gripping a massive gray-black hammer, and violently smashed it toward the black bird atop the tower.

"Buzz!"

The colossal hammer filled the sky, making even the towering three-legged tower seem like nothing more than a toy. As the hammer descended, a piercing boom erupted.

It was as if, in the next moment, the black three-legged pagoda and the thousands of exotic beasts below would be completely obliterated by the sheer force of the hammer!

However, at that very instant, a bolt of lightning suddenly struck from the sky, smashing into the gray hammer. The hammer momentarily paused mid-air, and then dozens of massive lightning bolts, each as thick as a water bucket, rained down.

With each strike, the hammer’s form shrank slightly. In just a brief moment, the once-mountainous hammer had diminished to the size of an ordinary human tool.

As the lightning struck the tower's peak, Fang Zaiji’s expression subtly changed—not merely because the hammer was attacked, but because the very space around him underwent a cataclysmic shift.

Dark clouds rolled across the sky, thick and heavy, as if they could drip water. A yellow demonic wind howled, its razor-sharp edges slicing through the earth like sentient blades, all converging toward Fang Zaiji. Beneath his feet, violent earth fire erupted, like a furious dragon roaring to consume him. Chains of golden talismanic script emerged from the void without warning, coiling tightly around his limbs. Overhead, black lightning continued to flash.

It was as if the entire beast race world had declared him its mortal enemy. Wind, fire, thunder, lightning—every force in existence, under the decree of fate, launched an unrelenting assault upon him.

"Young Master, stay back for now," Fang Zaiji said seriously, tossing out a cyan bell that shielded Li Fan, who had already retreated to a safe distance.

Then, he opened his mouth and spat out thirty-six willow-leaf-shaped flying blades.

The emerald-green blades danced with extraordinary agility, as if they were alive. In an instant, they surrounded Fang Zaiji, effortlessly deflecting the raging wind, fire, and lightning.

With a composed expression, Fang Zaiji strode toward the spire of the pagoda. The golden chains wrapped around him tightened instantly, attempting to restrain him. Yet, his steps remained firm. After just a moment of resistance, cracks began to form in the space where the chains were anchored.

The chains stretched longer and longer. Ultimately, they could no longer withstand the force and shattered piece by piece, scattering golden light across the sky.

"The entire world stands against him—this is the ultimate form of the Formless Killing Intent. But even so, it cannot harm Fang Zaiji in the slightest. After all, this world is inherently weaker. No matter how fiercely it resists, it cannot contend against a Dao Integration-level powerhouse from another realm," Li Fan thought calmly as he observed from within the protective bell.

Fang Zaiji drew closer to the black three-legged pagoda, and the exotic beasts that had been bowing in worship gradually lost their composure.

Some, overwhelmed with fear, prostrated themselves even more fervently. Others, in blind panic, attempted to flee—only to be instantly executed by the leader-like beasts. Still, some, with reckless determination, charged at Fang Zaiji without regard for their lives, hoping to sacrifice themselves in a desperate attempt to exhaust this terrifying invader.

But their fate was already sealed. The power gap between the two sides was too vast. When Fang Zaiji finally stood atop the three-legged pagoda, looking down at the trembling, kneeling beasts below, he felt an overwhelming sense of boredom.

"How dull!" He snorted coldly before summoning Li Fan from the distance.

"Sect Master, is this the thing you were looking for?" Fang Zaiji asked.

Without the support of the exotic beasts' ritual, the Black Bird's projection at the pagoda's peak returned to its original form—it was merely the projection of a black bird statue.

The vast amount of drifting Heavenly Fate that had gathered above the tower, now unrestrained, began to scatter like flowing water toward the corners of the world.

Standing before the small black statue, Li Fan lifted his head and gazed at it. At the same time, he activated the divine ability [Heaven's Mandate is Mine], using the Black Bird’s Feather to frantically absorb the drifting Heavenly Fortune.

Like a hundred rivers converging into the sea, the process of absorbing Heavenly Fortune was astonishingly smooth. There was almost no resistance, and in less than half a day, Li Fan had completely drained the accumulated Heavenly Fortune in this place.

The effect was immediate.

With the three-legged pagoda as the center, within a radius of several thousand miles, every movement of the wind and grass was instantly perceivable to Li Fan with just a thought. Moreover, within this area, Li Fan nearly achieved the ability to replace Heaven itself."

Sunshine or storm, wind or rain—everything was under his control with a single thought.

After closing his eyes and searching for a moment, Li Fan furrowed his brows slightly.

He realized that Xiao Hei's remains were not here. The reason the beasts had been able to manipulate fate through their rituals was merely because the statue had been imbued with a trace of Xiao Hei's divine authority.

"No matter. As long as I remain in this minor world, I will find it sooner or later." Li Fan did not mind.

In the following days, Li Fan and Fang Zaiji traveled across the Beast Realm. Everywhere they went, the beasts had no power to resist and submitted one after another.

Any lingering thoughts of defiance quickly vanished when a new passageway was established, and Liu San led the main forces of the Medicine King Sect into the realm.

"Young Master, you’ve really found a great place this time! I was just worrying that Longevity Valley was too small for the disciples to train in!" Liu San scanned the Beast Realm with his divine sense and nodded in satisfaction.

"Most of these beasts are too weak to be of any real use, but they can still help with farming and managing the spiritual fields. The slightly stronger ones would make decent guards."

"This plan is feasible. Once I refine a batch of Beast-Controlling Rings, we won’t have to worry about these creatures going out of control."

...

With just a few casual remarks from the two Dao Integration cultivators, the fate of the Beast Realm’s creatures was already decided.

Chapter 669: Silk Slashes the Red Nine Heads

With the disciples of the Medicine King Sect joining the management, Li Fan no longer had to worry too much.

After spending a month absorbing all the drifting Heavenly Fortune of the Beastkind Realm, he finally reached a qualitative transformation.

Within the feathers of the Black Bird, a faint image of a newly hatched chick—its feathers not yet grown—could be seen.

It bore some resemblance to Xiao Hei when it was young, yet there were also differences.

Li Fan closed his eyes, and in the next moment, the entire Beastkind Realm appeared before him like a sphere of glowing mist.

He could instantly perceive every detail of the realm with perfect clarity.

However, he also noticed that around the two Dao Integration experts, Fang Zaiji and Liu San, there were distortions in the light and shadow, making the area unclear. And this was despite the fact that the two had noticed Li Fan's gaze and had not actively attempted to block it.

"In the Xuanhuang World, the influence of a Dao Integration expert can span nearly an entire province. But in this small world, a Dao Integration cultivator can already rival the world itself. This is a natural difference in levels," Li Fan grasped in realization.

With a mere thought, he stepped forward, instantly crossing ten thousand miles to arrive at a clear spring atop a mountain peak.

Previously, when he and Fang Zaiji had swept through the Beastkind Realm, they had passed by this mountain. Yet, surprisingly, they had not noticed the pool at its summit.

It was only after Li Fan had fully mastered the world's Heavenly Fate that he became aware of the anomaly here.

By the pool, there was a wooden hut. Li Fan pushed open the wooden door and stepped inside.

Inside the room, a Black Bird with feathers that had lost their luster stood proudly.

Though it still looked majestic, it no longer carried the breath of life.

"Xiao Hei..." Li Fan instantly recognized the Black Bird.

"So... it has died of old age?"

After observing for a while, Li Fan murmured to himself.

Even though its lifespan was far longer than that of a cultivator, this Heavenly Fate Black Bird had ultimately reached the end of its life, having lived since ancient times.

However, Li Fan soon noticed something unusual.

By all logic, Xiao Qing had lived in the same era as Xiao Hei, yet Qingluan birds were far weaker than Heavenly Fate Black Birds.

Moreover, Xiao Hei had fused with the Heavenly Fate of this world.

There was no reason why Xiao Qing was still alive while Xiao Hei had perished first.

"Could it be that Xiao Hei exhausted its lifespan for some reason?"

Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

Activating the divine ability [Heaven's Mandate is Mine], he shielded himself with the domain of Heavenly Fate and gently touched the Xuan Bird's corpse.

"Whoosh!"

Like a breeze, Xiao Hei's body instantly disintegrated into countless tiny particles, scattering into the air.

At the same time, countless blurry images flashed through Li Fan’s mind.

At first, the events mirrored what he had experienced in the Fallen Immortal Realm.

Growing up joyfully alongside Xu Ke in the Beast Taming Sect, encountering Mr. Bai who intruded into the sect, and later being sent to the Sacred Beast Mountain of the Nanming…

Ultimately, Xiao Hei had failed the "Heart-Linking Ring" trial and was exiled here by Emperor Sanmo.

The difference was that, in the real timeline, Xiao Hei had missed the opportunity to meet Mr. Bai.

Without the True Profound Art of Creation, upon arriving in this small world, it could only cultivate using the divine abilities inherited through its bloodline.

Even after countless years, it barely managed to attain the [Heaven's Mandate is Mine] divine ability, but it had already become bound to the fate of this world.

Leaving this world was not impossible, but it came at an extremely steep price.

However, as long as one did not frequently leave their origin world—or replenished themselves with Heavenly Fate upon returning—it was not easy to suffer fatal damage.

Yet, Xiao Hei had chosen to do just that.

And the reason was...

Li Fan sifted through and examined Xiao Hei’s memories from after it arrived in the Beastkind Realm.

At the beginning, in order to prevent Xiao Hei from feeling lonely, Xu Ke would frequently send messages, sharing his experiences and observations.

"Xiao Hei, do you know how thrilling and dangerous this journey has been? We’ve encountered countless strange small worlds and were even hunted by demonic beasts!"

"At first, we thought someone had leaked information. But later, we realized it was just our bad luck—we ran into a group of demonic beasts that, for some unknown reason, also appeared in the small world. We struck first, but in the end, one of the beasts managed to escape, exposing our retreat."

"Luckily, we're almost at our destination!"

...

"Xiao Hei, Xiao Hei! Do you still remember Mr. Bai? I originally thought he was already incredibly powerful. But I didn’t expect him to be even stronger than I imagined! My senior brothers and I were sent to explore a small world, but unexpectedly, we encountered a terrifying monster!"

"It had nine heads, a colossal body lying across the sky! Every time it opened its mouth, it seemed as if it could tear apart and devour a portion of the world!"

"I thought I was doomed! That I would never see you again, Xiao Hei!"

"But before I left the Xuanhuang Realm, Senior Brother Lu Ya gave me a red string woven by Mr. Bai. Just as that nine-headed monster fixed its gaze on me, a thin thread suddenly shot out from the red string!"

"Before I could even react, the red thread slashed through the air like a sharp sword—instantly cutting off six of the monster’s heads!"

"And the red string didn’t stop there—it forcibly dragged the beast down from the sky!"

"I was completely stunned! Mr. Bai is truly incredible!"

...

"Xiao Hei, I have received an extremely important mission. I may not be able to contact you for a long time."

"I'm really sorry. But don’t worry, I’ll come back once it's over!"

...

"Xiao Hei, tell me, why is it that cultivators were originally humans too, yet once they step onto the path of cultivation, they become so ruthless toward their own kind?"

...

Scenes flashed rapidly before Li Fan’s eyes.

He now knew that Xu Ke had once come to this Beast Realm and met Xiao Hei.

At that time, Xu Ke had already grown into a refined and heroic young man.

Master and beast companion reunited, sitting by the clear pond atop the mountain, chatting for a long time.

But in the end, Xu Ke came in a hurry and left just as quickly.

Xiao Hei originally wanted to follow Xu Ke, but at the time, the restrictions set by Emperor Sanmo were still in place. Moreover, Xu Ke had said that great upheavals were occurring in the outside world, and if Xiao Hei left with him, it might be dangerous.

So, Xu Ke told Xiao Hei to wait here until the time was right—he would come back to take him away.

After their farewell, they communicated a few more times.

However, the intervals between their conversations grew longer and longer. Through the tone of Xu Ke’s messages, one could witness his growth.

Until one day…

Xiao Hei suddenly lost all sense of Xu Ke.

As Xu Ke’s companion beast, even though their master-servant bond had faded, a profound connection still existed between them.

No matter how many millions of miles apart they were, even across multiple worlds—

Xiao Hei could always faintly sense Xu Ke’s existence.

But now, for that connection to completely disappear, there was only one possibility.

Xu Ke was dead.

Chapter 670: The Fate of the Defier is Death

As the Heavenly Fate Black Bird, Xiao Hei was naturally well aware of how extraordinary Xu Ke’s fortune was.

A Purple-Gold fourtune, one in a billion. No matter where he went, he could turn misfortune into blessings, transform crises into opportunities, and effortlessly obtain countless treasures and opportunities.

How could someone like him possibly die so easily?

Of course, destiny is not omnipotent. Possessing great fortune does not mean one is immortal. If an individual encounters a calamity beyond what their fate can withstand, they still face the risk of perishing.

However, aside from his own formidable destiny, Xu Ke also had the Red String Protection of Mr. Bai. Even a single strand from that red string was capable of severely injuring a top-tier powerhouse from the Demon Beast Clan, (Red Nine-Headed). The sheer might of Mr. Bai was simply unimaginable. From his last conversation with Xu Ke, Xiao Hei learned that there were still some remnants of that red string on Xu Ke’s wrist. Xiao Hei firmly believed that, no matter what dangers Xu Ke encountered in the Xuanhuang Realm, the remaining red string should have been enough to help him escape alive.

Therefore, Xu Ke’s inexplicable death was something Xiao Hei simply could not understand or accept. He vowed to uncover the truth behind Xu Ke’s demise.

When the seal placed by Emperor Sanmo weakened, Xiao Hei forcibly broke free from the restrictions of the Beast Realm, disregarding the shackles this world had imposed upon him. He sought to retrace Xu Ke’s life path and investigate the mystery surrounding his death.

The Xuanhuang Realm was vast, filled with innumerable subsidiary worlds. Trying to piece together the truth from mere fragments of past events was an incredibly difficult task. However, as the Heavenly Fate Black Bird, Xiao Hei had once been Xu Ke’s companion, bound by fate’s unseen threads. After spending a thousand years searching, a chance encounter finally led him to an expansive minor world—a place where a massive floating corpse of Red Nine-Headed lay suspended in the sky. At that moment, Xiao Hei knew he had found the right place.

Upon meeting an old acquaintance, the Azure Luan Bird, Xiao Hei finally learned the full story.

After escaping, the Beast Taming Sect found refuge in a minor world known as the Lingxu Realm. There, they experienced a period of relative stability. Though the spiritual energy in Lingxu was weaker than in the Xuanhuang Realm, it was still sufficient to sustain their disciples. However, due to the lingering restriction on practicing multiple cultivation paths, the sect devised a dual strategy for the future.

Due to the continued restriction of 'incompatibility of cultivation techniques,' the Beast-Taming Sect devised two parallel future plans. The first was to gather the most talented disciples within the sect and have the sect leader and elders teach them everything they had learned in their lives, hoping that this group could eventually develop new cultivation techniques for the sect's members to practice. The second was to research a method that would allow disciples to establish a mental connection with beasts even without practicing the 'True Beast-Taming Technique.'"

Although Xu Ke lacked talent in comprehending Dao, he possessed an innate affinity with spirit beasts. Following the sect master’s guidance, he joined the group researching new methods of beast taming. Day after day, he immersed himself in studying the sect’s sacred artifact, the Ten Thousand Reincarnation Beast Wheel, losing himself in the pursuit of knowledge, unaware of time's passage.

One day, however, he received shocking news—his senior brother, Lu Ya, had suffered severe injuries and fallen into a coma. Despite everyone's objections, Xu Ke secretly returned alone to the Xuanhuang Realm.

At that time, a terrifying miasma had begun to spread from mortal bodies, engulfing the entire cultivation world. Upon his return, Xu Ke, too, became infected. Fortunately, his luck held, and he inexplicably recovered after seven days.

At the same time, the dying Lu Ya suddenly regained consciousness, his complexion returning to a healthy glow. However, Xu Ke knew it was nothing more than a final burst of energy before death. Grief overwhelmed him.

Lu Ya, however, remained serene. Dismissing everyone else, he called Xu Ke to his bedside.

That night, no one knew what the two of them talked about.

From that moment on, Xu Ke remained in the ruins of the Beast Taming Sect in the Xuanhuang Realm. When the Great Migration Plan was later initiated, he became the sole representative of the sect, tasked with relocating countless mortals to the Spirit-Devoid Small World.

A hundred years passed in the blink of an eye.

The final group of mortals was sent to the very minor world where Xu Ke had once encountered Red Nine-Headed.

Having completed his mission, Xu Ke never returned to the Beast Taming Sect in the Lingxu Realm. Instead, he deliberately severed all ties, hiding his identity and choosing to live among mortals.

Of course, this did not mean he lived as an ordinary mortal.

Without those around him realizing it, Xu Ke used the six severed heads of Red Nine-Headed, which had fallen into this world, as incubators. He combined them with gentler beast species he had brought from the Beast Taming Sect, breeding and cultivating various mutant spirit beasts.

His two loyal avian companions, Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong, never understood his true intentions. Yet, they assisted him, meticulously recording all his research findings.

Over the generations, the number and variety of mutant spirit beasts grew exponentially.

Though these mutant creatures were weaker than their original counterparts, their innate aggression had diminished. At the very least, they no longer attacked humans indiscriminately.

Many years passed, and the world witnessed an explosion of new exotic beast species.

Then, one day, Red Nine-Headed reappeared—without warning.

It seemed to still be haunted by lingering fear, lying atop the firmament and observing for a long time. Only after confirming that there were no threats did it finally relax. Accompanying it was a brown Great Peng. Both creatures looked extremely battered, with multiple scorch marks covering their bodies.

"If I had known earlier, I would have left with Lord Di Yi.. There was no need to suffer this humiliation in the Xuanhuang Realm!"

"Without the great leadership of Lord Di Yi, we demon beasts have indeed declined year after year. Originally, we thought that after the Great Catastrophe descended, humanity would soon be wiped out. But unexpectedly, powerful figures keep emerging one after another! This is simply unjust!"

"That guy from the Purple Heaven Sect is alright, not too outrageous. Speaking of true powerhouses, back in the day, I was right here..."

"Tsk tsk, the scars on my head still ache from time to time!"

The two fearsome demon beasts conversed freely in the sky, treating the many mortals of this world as nothing more than livestock to replenish their blood and vitality.

"Heh heh, big brother, don't take it to heart. Once we devour this realm and restore our strength, we'll go and settle the score with those people!" The Great Peng's eyes were fixed on the shivering mortals below, its saliva nearly dripping.

However, among demon beasts, hierarchy was strict.

"Big brother, please go first!" The Great Peng forcibly suppressed its hunger and flattered its companion.

Red Nine-Headed let out a cold snort, and in an instant, its body expanded once more. Its three remaining heads opened their enormous bloodthirsty mouths, ready to swallow this entire world.

But at that very moment, it caught sight of that familiar streak of red once again.

"How is this possible...?!"

This time, Red Nine-Headed was not as lucky as before.

Threads of silk directly pierced through its body, dragging it down from beyond the world.

Seeing its elder brother being slain in an instant, the Great Peng was so terrified that its soul nearly shattered.

No longer caring about any bonds of kinship, it transformed into a streak of black light and fled in panic.

The mortals, whose eyes could not perceive the full extent of what had transpired, only saw the two ferocious demon beasts about to commit atrocities—only to be slain by an immortal at the last moment.

Rejoicing in their miraculous survival, they erupted into cheers, chanting praises of the immortal’s divine grace and power.

Only Xu Ke, standing among the crowd, silently caressed the now noticeably thinner red string around his wrist, saying nothing.

Chapter 671: Holy Blood Turning into Mortal Body

The corpse of Red Nine-Headed came at the perfect time to resolve Xu Ke's urgent dilemma.

With the increasing variety and number of exotic beasts, the six original heads used as breeding vessels had gradually been depleted.

Red Nine-Headed, despite being a single entity, possessed nine heads, each with a distinct personality.

Perhaps it was precisely this unique biological trait that allowed the exotic beasts cultivated from it to evolve in countless different directions.

If the breeding materials had been replaced with other equivalent demon beasts—such as that brown peng—it might not have produced the same effect.

Thus, the arrival of Red Nine-Headed was incredibly timely.

According to Xu Ke's calculations, once the number of existing exotic beast species reached a certain threshold, even without the flesh and blood of Red Nine-Headed, the sheer vastness of their population would be sufficient to sustain their self-propagation and evolution.

With that in mind, Xu Ke shifted his focus to how to control these exotic beasts.

Since most of the world's exotic beasts had been cultivated from Red Nine-Headed’s flesh and blood, and given his past research on the Ten Thousand Beasts Reincarnation Wheel, Xu Ke, after several generations of mortal lifetimes, finally devised the Unified Heart Technique—an advanced method of communication and control based on insights from the ancient text True Beast-Taming Technique.

After Xu Ke imparted this technique to the mortal tribes of this world, humans quickly established complete dominion over the land by commanding the countless exotic beasts within it. In doing so, they founded a vast human empire.

Xu Ke was revered by the mortals as the "Holy Emperor", while Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong, his two lifelong companions, were honored as the "Holy Masters".

However, despite being exalted as an emperor, Xu Ke showed little interest in the mundane affairs of mortals.

He delegated authority, allowing humanity to govern itself. As for himself, he became increasingly reclusive, engaged in mysterious endeavors that even Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong knew nothing about.

Then, one day, Xu Ke unexpectedly brought a young boy before them.

He claimed that this was his descendant, created through his research on the gift left by the ancient being Di Yi. He had developed a technique known as the "Holy Blood Embryo Transformation", allowing him to generate offspring from his refined blood essence.

The Holy Blood Embryo Transformation was a technique that converted a portion of one’s own blood essence into an embryo capable of inheriting the majority of the creator’s memories.

This embryo required no maternal womb—only sufficient nourishment—and could mature into a human child in just seven days.

Moreover, both physical strength and intelligence would develop to an exceptionally high level.

Staring at the unfamiliar yet eerily familiar child, Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong felt a sense of unease creeping into their hearts.

Their premonition was correct.

Xu Ke instructed them not to interfere with human affairs unless the empire faced an existential crisis.

As for the Holy Embryo, bearing his bloodline, it would only serve as a puppet emperor.

After leaving these final instructions, Xu Ke abruptly departed.

He disclosed nothing about his destination and vanished without a trace.

Until Today, Many years later, Xiao Hei appeared at their doorstep.

By then, Xu Ke's aura had completely vanished—a fact Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong had already sensed.

Faced with Xiao Hei's furious accusations, the two could only remain silent, bearing the weight of Xiao Hei's anger.

But after venting, Xiao Hei calmed down.

He knew Xu Ke well—his carefree yet stubborn nature.

Once he made a decision, not even Xiao Qing or Xiao Hong could change it.

When he saw his descendants—the Holy Embryo, now self-propagating through more than a dozen generations—Xiao Hei felt a deep sense of disappointment.

Though traces of Xu Ke’s presence still lingered in them, even their aura faintly resembled his…

But…

It was not Xu Ke.

Without a word, Xiao Hei turned and left the empire, never to return.

For years, Xiao Hei wandered through countless minor worlds, tirelessly searching for the true cause of Xu Ke’s disappearance.

But in the end, he found nothing.

His years of roaming beyond the Primordial World had drained his lifespan at an alarming rate.

As his final moments approached, Xiao Hei returned to the last place where he had seen Xu Ke.

There, lost in memories, he silently awaited death.

...

Xiao Hei’s body completely turned to dust, scattering into the heavens and earth.

Meanwhile, the image of Xiao Hei on the Black Bird Feather within Li Fan’s body grew increasingly vivid.

"Xiao Hei once merged with the world of the Beast Realm. Although he perished when his lifespan ended, by gathering the remnants of his drifting fate and using this feather from his own body..."

"Perhaps a form of rebirth could be achieved."

"However, even if it succeeds, this Xiao Hei will no longer be the same as before."

Li Fan shook his head slightly.

Leaving the wooden house, he arrived at the clear pool atop the mountain peak.

Raising his right hand, in the next moment, a brown jade bottle containing several grams of vital blood flew out from beneath the water, landing in Li Fan's palm.

The bottle was sealed with several layers of restrictions set by Xiao Hei, preserving the blood’s vitality even after thousands of years.

“There’s no rush. I should first uncover the mysteries of Han Yi’s statue.”

After a moment of contemplation, Li Fan put away the jade bottle.

With a single step, he returned to the black three-legged pagoda.

Through his perception, he noticed the disciples of the Medicine King Sect busy in various corners of the Beast Realm.

Judging by their movements, they seemed to be engraving a formation onto the land.

“Elder Liu, what are you all working on?”

After carefully observing for a while but failing to recognize the formation, Li Fan asked curiously.

"Heh, this was my idea!" Before Liu San could respond, Fang Zaiji hurriedly spoke up to claim credit.

"This world, while vast enough for our disciples to relax and train, has spiritual energy that is far too thin, making long-term cultivation difficult. On the other hand, the Longevity Valley is rich in spiritual energy. So, we are planning to transfer some of the spiritual energy from Longevity Valley to this place—of course, only on the condition that it does not affect the valley’s medicinal herbs."

Liu San then added, “For safety, I have already ordered the disciples to investigate whether any other passageways exist. If any are found, Old Fang and I will seal them off together.”

"This way, the only entrance from the outside world will be through Longevity Valley. And if Longevity Valley ever comes under attack and we are unable to resist, we can simply reopen the passage and retreat with ease."

"With this, the safety of our Medicine King Sect will be fully assured!"

Liu San explained proudly.

"Thank you both for your efforts."

Hearing this, Li Fan revealed a satisfied expression and nodded approvingly.

After entrusting Liu San and Fang Zaiji with the task of managing the connection between Longevity Valley and the Beast Realm, Li Fan took the Black Bird Feather infused with the fate of a small world.

He once again approached Han Yi’s stone statue.

As he felt an immense suction force coming from the statue, Li Fan focused his mind. Streams of fortune surged from the Black Bird Feather, counteracting the suction force.

At the same time, he pushed his speed to the limit and flew rapidly toward Han Yi.

Chapter 672: Severing Fate to Enter the Pivot of Return

With every inch he advanced, the suction force drawing in his fate grew stronger.

The world’s heavenly fate stored within the Black Bird Feather gushed out uncontrollably, like a flood bursting through a dam, making Li Fan’s expression change slightly.

The terrifying Fortune-draining ability of Han Yi’s stone statue exceeded his expectations.

If it were an ordinary cultivator, they would likely be drained of all their fortune in an instant, bringing calamity upon themselves and dying on the spot!

Even someone as blessed with fortune as Xu Ke would struggle to last long here.

However…

An individual’s fortune alone was indeed incapable of sustaining itself within this fortune-absorbing domain. But the fate of an entire world—now, that was a different story.

After all, the stone statue had a limit to how quickly it could absorb fortune. Even as Li Fan rapidly approached its side, the amount of fortune being drained each moment was nothing compared to the immense reserves stored within the Black Bird Feather—merely a drop in the ocean.

By Li Fan’s estimation, even if he remained stationary and allowed the statue to absorb his fortune freely, it would still take at least half a day to fully deplete it!

"This is what is meant by 'Divine Powers Cannot Overcome Heavenly Fate!"

Once again drawing upon the world’s heavenly fate stored within the Black Bird Feather, Li Fan enveloped himself in a protective barrier, ensuring his absolute safety before quietly observing the Han Yi stone statue before him.

Its face was frozen in terror, eyes filled with despair—so lifelike, as if time itself had stopped at the very moment it suffered a fatal blow.

"Han Yi must have encountered the Fisherman before ending up like this. Was it the Fisherman’s doing, or the effect of the Heavenly Fortune Sutra?"

Li Fan did not act recklessly but instead carefully analyzed the situation.

"Neither alive nor dead… something is strange about this."

Previously, through the Cloud-Water Dream Art, Li Fan had gained a general understanding of the Heavenly Fortune Sutra. However, none of its recorded techniques described such an eerie transformation.

If anything came close, it would be a divine ability known as [Severing Fortune, Return to the Pivot].

This technique allowed one to sever their own fortune in moments of life-threatening danger—completely cutting off all ties to the world and entering an realm of the Pivot, where there is no space and no self.

In this state, one’s body and mind would completely stagnate, as if they had escaped into the void itself, making them undetectable by others.

The state of returning to the Pivot may last anywhere from several months to several years, only gradually restoring itself once all external threats had passed.

It was a technique with severe side effects but also unparalleled survival potential.

"Perhaps the Fisherman’s attack interacted with [Severing Fortune, Return to the Pivot], leading to the creation of this stone statue."

After a long period of contemplation, Li Fan came to a realization.

"Although Han Yi activated this life-preserving divine ability, the power gap between him and the Fisherman was simply too vast. He didn’t even have time to fully enter the Returning To Pivot state before he was struck by the Fisherman’s technique."

"Hmm…"

"The Fisherman likely had no intention of killing Han Yi. He was merely searching for clues regarding the Heavenly Calamity Sword within Han Yi’s mind. But even so, Han Yi couldn’t endure it. The sheer force of the attack engulfed him, turning him into this stone-like state."

"Severing fortune means returning one’s fortune to the heavens—essentially forsaking it. But now, this state has transformed into one that absorbs fortune from the outside world instead."

"Is this due to the Fisherman’s attack?"

Li Fan’s thoughts raced, his expression turning serious.

After a while, he emerged from his deep contemplation and gazed at Han Yi’s frozen figure, his eyes cold.

"If this were a normal Return to Pivot state, you would eventually wake up one day. But with the Fisherman’s interference… in your current condition, you will never return to normal again."

"A fate worse than death. Let me put you out of your misery."

As he spoke, Li Fan pointed a finger in midair and cast the Purple Heaven Soul-Viewing Technique on Han Yi.

At this moment, Han Yi's thoughts were in absolute stasis. Because of this, Li Fan faced no resistance as he roamed freely through Han Yi’s mind. Every secret, even the darkest corners of Han Yi’s heart, were laid bare before Li Fan.

It could be said that at this moment, Li Fan understood Han Yi better than Han Yi himself.

After extracting every single thought from Han Yi’s mind, Li Fan flicked his finger, releasing a streak of pitch-black sword light.

The dark sword light swiftly pierced through the statue’s chest.

In an instant, the statue disintegrated into countless tiny particles, scattering into the heavens and earth.

At the same time, the Fortune-draining Domain that had enveloped the statue vanished without a trace.

Rather than any ominous signs appearing in the sky due to a cultivator’s fall, an invisible storm instead surged in place. The fortune energy that Han Yi had absorbed over time also returned to the heaven and earth following Han Yi’s demise.

Li Fan would not let such a rare opportunity slip by. He immediately activated the Black Bird Feather, seizing the moment before this unclaimed fortune completely dispersed and devoured it all. Then, before anyone could notice the anomaly in this place, he quietly disappeared.

Returning to Longevity Valley, he did not disturb Liu San and the others, who were still busy.

Li Fan entered the Sect Master's secluded cultivation chamber, where he placed the brown jade bottle containing Xu Ke’s essence blood and the materials needed to refine a clone in front of him.

Just as he was about to start the process, an inexplicable sense of unease arose in his heart.

"I am currently at the early Nascent Soul stage. The clone I refine will be limited to the Peak Golden Core stage. I intend to use the clone to cultivate Han Yi’s Heavenly Fortune Sutra. But if I create the clone first and then have it cultivate and break through on its own..."

"The bottleneck imposed by the Calamity of Heaven may be even more rigid than my own, causing unnecessary delays. It would be better for my main body to cultivate first and break through to the Mid Nascent Soul stage. That way, I can achieve twice the result with half the effort."

After contemplating this, Li Fan temporarily put away the materials and ascended into the sky of the Beast Realm.

"I achieved my Nascent Soul through the Five Elements Cave-Heaven. To break through quickly, I must deeply comprehend the Laws of the Five Elements."

"In the Xuanhuang Realm, I would have to spend great effort searching for suitable opportunities. But in this Beast Realm..."

"The laws of the heaven and earth operate, the Five Elements circulate—all within my grasp!"

"Although this small world is of a lower tier, and I must avoid excessive entanglement with it due to what happened to Xiao Hei… It is still more than sufficient to aid my rapid breakthrough to Mid Nascent Soul."

Closing his eyes, Li Fan focused, and in an instant, a massive inverted hourglass seemed to appear in the sky. The Five Elements Power sustaining the Beast Realm was slowly drawn into it. As the Five Elements clashed, deafening explosions echoed through the air. The sky itself transformed into a brilliant tapestry of five-colored radiance, creating a breathtaking spectacle.

Liu San and Fang Zaiji looked up, gazing at Li Fan, who stood motionless above the clouds, and nodded slightly.

"Young Master's aura when cultivating is truly extraordinary. He has quite a bit of the old master’s demeanor!" Liu San said with some relief.

"Heh, I think even Liu Ruchen can’t compare to him!" Fang Zaiji retorted without giving Liu San any face.

Liu San’s expression stiffened, but surprisingly, he did not argue back this time.

"For the new to surpass the old—that is a good thing. Otherwise, wouldn’t our Medicine King Sect be doomed to repeat the past?"

"It is a good thing!" Liu San repeated.

Ordering the disciples not to disturb Li Fan’s cultivation, the two of them then joined forces to set up protective barriers around him, finally putting their minds at ease.

Time flowed on as Li Fan immersed himself in cultivation.

In the blink of an eye, two years passed.

Chapter 673: A Heart Longing for Immortality

Everything fell into place naturally, without the slightest obstruction.

When Li Fan awakened from his secluded cultivation, he had successfully broken through to the mid-Nascent Soul stage.

“It has already been anchored for seventeen years…”

“After all, I only had the assistance of the Enlightenment Pill. Without the spirit-awakening effects of the Tianxuan Mirror, my progress was significantly slower.”

He checked his internal state. The scale of the Five Elements Cave-Heaven within his body had expanded more than threefold compared to the early Nascent Soul stage. Each Cave-Heaven was now brimming with vitality, no longer as eerily still as before. However, the emergence of true creation was still a little way off. The circulation of the Five Elements’ power had accelerated noticeably, as if something was brewing within his Cave-Heaven world.

At this point, Li Fan had achieved complete control over his own Five Elements Cave-Heaven and the Beast Realm. He was akin to the very Dao governing these worlds.

Yet, upon closer comparison, he noticed many differences between the two.

The Five Elements Cave-Heaven had been seized from the Xuanhuang Realm. Although he had integrated it into himself using new techniques, it was akin to how a mortal, despite owning their own body, could not exert absolute control over every function. The operation and evolution of the Cave-Heaven mostly occurred autonomously, following a set of inherent laws. While he could perceive every change occurring within it, his current level of comprehension was insufficient to fully understand, let alone manipulate or create at will.
