The Beast Realm, however, was different. Wind and rain, thunder and lightning, ice and fire—every manifestation of the world's laws could be dictated at a single thought. If he wished, he could freeze the Beast Realm in a fixed state, preventing any future changes. At the same time, he could also reshape it as he pleased. Raising mountains or leveling rivers with a single thought was merely a trivial matter.

“Under normal circumstances, even if one seizes all the heavenly fortune of a small world, they wouldn’t be able to wield such absolute control in the beginning. It would take years of comprehension and resonance with the world’s origin. But this process has already been completed for me—Xiao Hei has paved the way. I am merely inheriting its legacy, reaping immense benefits.”

Li Fan gazed at the familiar image within the Black Bird Feather in his body, suddenly realizing everything.

Shifting his focus back to the Beast Realm, he saw that two years had passed, and the world had undergone drastic transformations. The concentration of spiritual energy had surged, now only slightly weaker than the Xuanhuang Realm. The once barren land had become lush and full of life.

Various spirit herbs and medicinal plants were now categorized and cultivated systematically. Surprisingly, those tending the spiritual fields were none other than the beast species. However, their necks bore no sign of the so-called "Beast-Controlling Rings" that Fang Zaiji had previously mentioned.

Li Fan scanned the entire world with his divine sense and found that only the most powerful exotic beasts bore any signs of control.

“As long as the rulers are subjugated, the rest will follow. Dealing with these beast species indeed requires little effort.”

At this time, Liu San and Fang Zaiji were nowhere to be found within the Beast Realm. Passing through the spatial passageway to Longevity Valley, Li Fan discovered that the two were gathered, seemingly deep in discussion.

Sensing Li Fan’s presence, both of their faces lit up with a trace of joy.

“Sect Master, you have emerged from seclusion!”

“What has happened? You both seem somewhat tense,” Li Fan asked as he stepped forward.

“Congratulations, Young Master, on advancing your cultivation once again!” Liu San sized him up with a smile.

Fang Zaiji, however, directly explained the reason for their solemn expressions.

About half a year ago, a group of cultivators from the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had arrived at the White Mist aboard the Samantabhadra True Boat. Initially, Liu San feared that their target was Longevity Valley and went on high alert, even mobilizing all the cultivators of the Medicine King Sect, preparing for the worst.

However, it soon became apparent that it was a false alarm. The cultivators did not stop at the entrance of Longevity Valley; their actual destination seemed to be even deeper within the White Mist.

Relieved, Liu San assumed that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance cultivators were merely passing through by coincidence.

However, what happened next made Liu San realize that he had been gravely mistaken.

Over the past six months, every once in a while, dozens of Samantabhadra True Boats filled with cultivators would sail deep into the White Mist. They seemed to be carrying out some kind of mission, exuding a faint yet chilling aura of determination. Occasionally, some cultivators would retreat from the depths of the White Mist, looking dejected and gloomy.

These cultivators were generally not of very high cultivation levels, but to be safe, Liu San refrained from probing too deeply—he merely observed from a distance.

Although the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance cultivators did not seem to be targeting the Medicine King Sect, their frequent passage through the area was concerning. No one could guarantee that, by coincidence, they wouldn’t discover the location of Longevity Valley. And if they did, who could say whether a conflict with the Medicine King Sect would break out?

Because of this, Liu San and Fang Zaiji remained on high alert during this time.

“This… is this a covert operation by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, or is it an open and large-scale action? Do ordinary alliance cultivators even know about this?” After listening to their report, Li Fan's eyes flickered as he immediately asked.

“Ordinary cultivators are unaware of it—at least, from what we’ve gathered so far,” Fang Zaiji replied.

Li Fan pondered for a moment before saying, “Something about this is strange. We should stay put and observe for now. I’ll go out and investigate the truth before making a decision.”

Having full confidence in Li Fan’s abilities, the two immediately agreed.

Afterward, Liu San took out twelve jade bottles and handed them over. “These are the pills I refined during this period. Nine bottles contain a total of eighty-one Longevity Pills, two bottles hold twenty Supreme Emotionless Pills, and there is also one…”

Liu San paused for a moment, his expression turning slightly strange. “It is a Heart-Desire Ascension Pill.”

“Elder Liu, you've worked hard.” Li Fan put away the other pills and took the jade bottle containing the Heart-Desire Ascension Pill, intending to open it and inspect its contents.

But suddenly, Liu San stopped him.

“Is there something wrong with this pill?” Li Fan frowned.

Liu San let out a bitter smile. “This pill is not poisonous, but its actual harm is no less than that of the deadliest poisons in the world.”

“The Heart-Desire Ascension Pill is an extremely rare byproduct that can appear during the refinement of the Supreme Emotionless Pill. Any cultivator who consumes it will experience an overwhelming illusion of comprehending the Great Dao and achieving immediate ascension to immortality.”

At this point, Fang Zaiji added, “Furthermore, the more one consumes, the stronger this illusion becomes. In the end, those who become addicted to it will do anything just to relive the ‘taste of ascension’ once more.”

Li Fan instinctively tightened his grip on the jade bottle in his hand.

He now understood exactly what this so-called Heart-Desire Ascension Pill was.

“In the past, this pill caused massive turmoil, so it was completely forbidden under the jurisdiction of the Ten Great Immortal Sects . However, based on what our disciples have found, the current Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance does not seem to have banned this pill.”

“I thought this item might be of use to the Young Master, so I did not destroy it,” Liu San explained.

Chapter 674: Refining the Perfect Body

"The addictive nature of this Heart-Desire Ascension Pill—how severe is it?" Li Fan weighed the jade bottle in his hand with interest and asked.

"The closer one is to the legendary True Immortal Realm, the greater the craving for it after consumption," Liu San said with an extremely solemn expression.

"Perhaps someone with an extraordinarily strong will could resist the temptation to take another one, but..." Liu San shook his head.

"At least, in our era, such individuals were exceedingly rare."

Li Fan's eyes flickered slightly as he stored the jade bottle away.

"If Elder Liu refines more of this pill in the future, you should keep them all. They may be useful at a critical moment," Li Fan instructed.

Liu San nodded in agreement.

"By the way, I also need to trouble Mr. Fang to refine a few protective artifacts for me." At this moment, Li Fan turned to Fang Zaiji and spoke.

"Oh? What kind does the Sect Master want?" The mention of his expertise immediately piqued Fang Zaiji's interest.

"At the very least, they should be able to withstand attacks from ordinary Soul Transformation cultivators. Can you manage that, Mr. Fang?" Knowing Fang Zaiji’s temperament well after spending time together, Li Fan deliberately set a lower requirement and smiled.

As expected, Fang Zaiji, who was quite prideful about his craftsmanship, was provoked:

"Young Master, you underestimate me! Forget Soul Transformation cultivators—even refining artifacts that can withstand Dao Integration cultivators is not difficult! However..."

"It would just require more materials," Fang Zaiji murmured.

Seeing that this concerned the Young Master’s safety, Liu San spoke up:

"No problem. The Medicine King Cauldron still holds some materials, enough for you to craft them."

Fang Zaiji was momentarily stunned. "The Medicine King Cauldron? Impossible! I've studied it for so long—how could I have missed that?"

Liu San sneered. "Looks like your skills still have a long way to go."

Without further explanation, he flew into the Medicine King Cauldron. Moments later, he returned and casually tossed a storage ring to Fang Zaiji.

Fang Zaiji took the ring, glanced inside, and immediately cried out in excitement:

"Xuanwei Ancient Bamboo, Black Demon Gold, Purple Essence Sand...!"

"So many rare treasures?"

Liu San smirked dismissively. "Our Medicine King Sect was once one of the wealthiest sects. If we truly decided to withdraw, do you think we wouldn't have prepared adequately?"

A sudden thought made Liu San’s expression dim slightly.

"Don't worry about that—just focus on crafting the protective artifacts for the Young Master. If the materials aren't enough, you can ask me for more."

This time, Fang Zaiji did not argue. Instead, he gazed delightedly at the various rare materials in the ring and began contemplating what kind of artifacts to forge.

"Mr. Fang, could you craft a white robe and a folding fan for me?" At that moment, Li Fan suddenly suggested.

"A white robe... and a folding fan?" Fang Zaiji was stunned.

But seeing Li Fan's unquestionable gaze, he had no choice but to mutter in agreement.

After temporarily leaving the two, Li Fan entered a secluded chamber.

He once again took out Xu Ke’s blood essence and various materials. Following Xiao Hei’s memories of an adult Xu Ke’s appearance, he even enhanced the facial features, concentrating fully on refining a new clone.

This clone was crucial for obtaining the subsequent techniques of the Mountain-Sitting Art, so Li Fan was more meticulous than ever.

Seven days and nights passed.

A perfectly refined male body appeared before Li Fan.

His features were exceptionally handsome, his skin smooth and fair like porcelain. Stars seemed to glimmer in his eyes, and his faint smile carried an ethereal charm—like a banished immortal from the heavens!

Even Li Fan couldn't help but be momentarily captivated by the clone’s unparalleled beauty.

It was only then that he realized—while striving to perfect the clone’s appearance, he had unconsciously modeled it after the most handsome man he had ever seen—Mr. Bai.

This also resulted in the clone bearing a striking resemblance to Mr. Bai. Of course, it was only a resemblance. The general mold was still based on Xu Ke's appearance.

"There shouldn't be any issues, right?"

The clone's appearance was so flawless that even with some minor unexpected deviations, Li Fan had no intention of refining a new one.

"Besides, all of Xu Ke’s essence blood has already been used up. If I were to refine another one, it wouldn't be nearly as effective as this one."

Li Fan stared at the clone before him. After a moment of contemplation, he finally slashed his finger through the air, activating the clone.

The sensation of experiencing two perspectives simultaneously surged once again.

"Although it is at the Nascent Soul stage, it's merely an empty shell..."

"But that’s fine."

The clone dressed itself, sat cross-legged on the ground, and immediately began cultivating the Heavenly Fortune Sutra.

Meanwhile, the original body retrieved the Feather of the Black Bird and handed it to the clone.

Using a Foundation Establishment technique at the Nascent Soul stage was already an overwhelming advantage. Coupled with the terrifying heaven and earth fortune stored within the Black Bird Feather, the clone instantly absorbed it and completed the Foundation Establishment process.

However, the Foundation Establishment stage was far from sufficient to fulfill the clone’s mission requirements—it had to continue advancing.

Li Fan crushed several top-grade spirit stones, unleashing an incredibly pure aura that instantly formed a swirling vortex within the chamber, madly rushing into the clone’s body.

The clone absorbed and refined all the energy like a great whale drinking water.

In less than half a day, a Golden Core formed in the clone’s dantian.

The surface of the Golden Core occasionally flashed with a faint purple hue, radiating an extraordinary air of nobility.

"Though it is a single-method Golden Core, this Heavenly Fortune Technique is practically tailor-made for the clone. Furthermore, Xu Ke’s essence blood has a unique connection with the Black Bird Feather..."

"Its power might not be inferior to an ordinary Four-Method Golden Core." Li Fan nodded in satisfaction.

After the Golden Core stage came the Nascent Soul stage.

Under normal circumstances, to maintain a perfect disguise, one would have to find a Cave-Heaven for the clone to absorb.

However, thanks to the existence of the Beast Realm, this trouble was easily bypassed.

With a single thought, the original body carried the clone into the Beast Realm.

Compared to Li Fan himself, the clone was far more adept at perceiving and manipulating the world's fortune within the Beast Realm.

"Indeed, people should not be judged by the same standard."

Realizing the disparity between them, Li Fan couldn’t help but sigh slightly.

The clone closed its eyes and levitated mid-air.

Spiritual energy from all directions in the realm began converging upon him.

Even more astonishingly, mountains and rivers within the Beast Realm rose into the sky, rushing toward Li Fan’s feet.

The land compressed itself, forming a miniature Cave-Heaven at a speed tens of millions of times faster than natural evolution.

This grand spectacle naturally startled the disciples of the Medicine King Sect.

However, upon seeing their Sect Master, Li Fan, present, none dared to act recklessly.

Instead, all their gazes fixated on the breathtakingly handsome man beside Li Fan, unable to look away.

Privately, they speculated about his true identity.

Extracting nearly one-thirtieth of the Beastkind Realm’s world essence, a [Beast Realm Cave-Heaven] was formed.

Under the watchful eyes of many, the clone swallowed the Cave-Heaven into its body.

Chapter 675: Shared Dream – Soul Searching Defense

Chapter 675: Shared Dream - Soul Searching Defense

With the successful formation of his Nascent Soul, the clone now exuded an even more ethereal and transcendent aura, as if detached from the mortal world.

Not to mention the ordinary disciples of the Medicine King Sect, who were staring in awe—even Liu San and Fang Zaiji, who had hurried over after sensing the disturbance, were momentarily stunned.

“With Xu Ke’s blood essence and appearance, combined with Mr. Bai’s demeanor…”

“How about calling him Xu Bai from now on?”

Li Fan looked at his clone with satisfaction and nodded approvingly.

Xu Bai cupped his hands toward Li Fan and offered a faint smile.

The gathered disciples below gasped audibly in astonishment.

“Young Master, this is…” Liu San stepped forward, looking at Xu Bai with a trace of doubt in his eyes.

During this period, he had been guarding the entrance to the Longevity Valley to prevent any cultivators from the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance hidden in the white mist from infiltrating. Yet, he had no idea when this person had entered—it was as if he had materialized out of thin air. A suspicion formed in Liu San’s mind, but he still found it hard to believe. So, he sought confirmation from Li Fan.

“This isn’t the right place to talk. Follow me.”

Noting Fang Zaiji’s similar look of confusion, Li Fan led both of them—along with Xu Bai—into a secluded meditation chamber.

“This is a clone that I refined.” Xu Bai spoke directly.

“As expected.” Liu San suddenly understood but still had lingering doubts.

“The technique of refining clones is indeed rare, but with Young Master’s abilities, obtaining such a method wouldn’t be difficult. However, why did you refine a clone that is so…”

“So high-profile?” Liu San glanced at Xu Bai again, still unable to understand.

Li Fan simply smiled and did not answer. Instead, he changed the subject:

“By the way, how is the artifact refinement coming along, Mr. Fang?”

Fang Zaiji immediately caught on.

“The white robe and folding fan—are they for this clone?” He chuckled. “I was wondering! That style doesn’t suit you at all, Sect Master!”

“Refining an artifact at the Dao Integration level is no easy feat. It’ll take at least another six months. Besides…”

Fang Zaiji took a closer look at Xu Bai and suddenly frowned.

“The original design I planned won’t be a good match for this clone. No, no, I need to start over!”

The more he looked, the more he felt that the previously envisioned white robe and folding fan would not do justice to Xu Bai’s presence.

Just as he was about to rush off to draft a new refinement plan, Li Fan stopped him in time.

“Three years have passed since the Crimson Flame Burning Sea incident. It’s time for the disciples to re-enter the mortal world. Besides, my plans require their cooperation.” Li Fan said calmly.

Liu San and Fang Zaiji had no objections to this decision.

“However, returning to the mortal world also means increased risks. If any disciples are unfortunate enough to encounter danger and have their souls forcibly searched, the secrets of Longevity Valley and the Beast Realm may be exposed…”

“What should we do then?”

Li Fan looked at the two Dao Integration cultivators and asked for their opinions.

“I only specialize in artifact refinement. You’ll have to ask Old Liu about this one.”

Fang Zaiji shrugged, indicating that this was beyond his expertise.

Liu San did not decline and, after pondering for a long time, gave his answer:

"A single person's mind can be broken, but the minds of millions are difficult to breach. Currently, inside the Medicine King True Cauldron, the [Great Dream Spring and Autumn Formation] is still operating. As long as our disciples connect a strand of their divine sense to it before leaving, the formation will activate a counterattack if they are forcibly subjected to a soul search. Unless the enemy's soul is stronger than the combined souls of all the Medicine King Sect cultivators, even in their slumber, they will not be able to extract any information from our disciples' minds."

"The Great Dream Spring and Autumn Formation essentially links the thoughts of all participating cultivators into a grand dreamscape. This not only allows them to unite and resist external divine sense attacks but also enables them to use the power of dreams to seal specific memories. Just as mortals do not realize they are dreaming, disciples will be unaware of the sealed information. Moreover, even if they are scattered across different regions of the Xuanhuang Realm, they can instantly communicate through the formation without being noticed by outsiders..."

Liu San carefully explained another wondrous function of the Great Dream Spring and Autumn Formation to Li Fan.

Hearing this, Li Fan was very satisfied:

"Then I will have to trouble Elder Liu with this matter. Once the disciples go out, they may act freely, only needing to casually inquire about the [Heavenly Spirit Flower] when the opportunity arises. The Heavenly Spirit Flower is a unique treasure of the Tianling Prefecture within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance—blessed by the essence of the heavens, it is breathtakingly beautiful. However, after the great battle in Tianling Prefecture several years ago, it underwent a strange transformation..."

Liu San did not question Li Fan's reasoning for this order but firmly committed it to memory.

After issuing the necessary instructions, Liu San immediately began organizing the disciples' connection to the formation.

Meanwhile, Li Fan departed ahead of time, leaving Longevity Valley.

Longevity Valley was located within the White Mist Barrier, at the border between Luoyan Prefecture and Lueying Prefecture.

Avoiding patrolling cultivators, Li Fan silently left the mist and arrived in the city of Tiancheng within Luoyan Prefecture.

Although located in the heart of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, Luoyan Prefecture was not much more prosperous than Congyun Sea. In fact, it had even fewer cultivators. Most of Luoyan Prefecture was barren and lacked resources, but more importantly, it was plagued by strange occurrences.

For example, Li Fan was quite familiar with the [Heart Monkey], which had once broken out in a massive outbreak in this region. Although the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance did not keep detailed records of this event, in previous lifetimes, Li Fan noticed that when purchasing Heart Monkey bones in large quantities, most of them originated from Luoyan Prefecture. This led him to suspect the connection.

At this moment, Luoyan City was rather desolate.

Upon arriving at the Tianxuan Mirror, the first thing Li Fan did was search for information on addictive pills.

Although Liu San had mentioned that the disciples had already inquired and it seemed that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance did not prohibit such substances, Li Fan knew that many secrets were hidden behind the merit ranking system. Not all knowledge was accessible to ordinary cultivators.

There were plenty of cultivators in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance who had unknowingly broken taboos and died without ever understanding why.

Since this matter was crucial to his future plans, Li Fan had to confirm the alliance's stance.

His current identity was still that of a "clean slate" with a merit rank of one, but this did not prevent him from gathering information.

Taking out a jade bottle containing "Heart-Desire Ascension Pill", Li Fan prepared to list it for sale in the market.

Suddenly—

"Warning! The pill you are attempting to sell is a prohibited item. Your trading privileges have been temporarily frozen. Please dispose of the contraband immediately."

"Warning..."

A sharp, mechanical voice from the Tianxuan Mirror suddenly sounded, repeating itself incessantly.

Li Fan feigned an expression of extreme shock and innocence:

"What? A contraband item? What do you mean by that?"

"Isn't it just an ordinary pill...?"

The Tianxuan Mirror's cold voice repeated:

"Heart-Desire Ascension Pill—Ranked 3,674 on the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's list of prohibited circulation items."

"Hazard Level: Grade B-Plus."

"Please dispose of it immediately."

Chapter 676: Willpower Assists the Refinement of the Heart

Upon hearing the prompt from the Tianxuan Mirror, Li Fan's eyes narrowed instantly.

"Heart-Desire Ascension Pill… and its danger level is only ranked a little over three thousand? What kind of things have the cultivators of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance been tinkering with all these years?"

Though a certain plan had just fallen apart, Li Fan wasn't particularly surprised.

After all, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance prioritized stability above all else.

Any item capable of disrupting the balance of power would inevitably be subjected to strict control.

Just imagine: if a Dao Integration cultivator addicted to the Heart-Desire Ascension Pill were to suffer withdrawal, how much destruction would they unleash?

The fact that it was banned wasn’t surprising—it would have been odd if it weren’t.

"Just my luck! Turns out this damn thing is contraband!"

Inside the Tianxuan Mirror, Li Fan feigned an expression of frustration.

"But, after all the effort I put into obtaining it, instead of destroying it..."

He pretended to flash a ruthless look in his eyes.

"I might as well take it myself!"

With that, he made a show of swallowing the pill right in front of the Tianxuan Mirror.

"Warning: Consumption of the Heart-Desire Ascension Pill will result in imprisonment for a duration proportional to the cultivator’s potential danger level, along with forced withdrawal treatment. This will cause irreversible damage to both body and mind."

"Warning..."

Li Fan’s body stiffened slightly, stopping just before he could actually consume the pill.

Cursing under his breath, he crushed the Heart-Desire Ascension Pill into powder with a single squeeze.

"Satisfied now?!"

"No! I can't let this go! That bastard dared to deceive me—I have to settle this score!"

As if growing angrier by the second, Li Fan stormed out of the Tianxuan Mirror, left Luoyan City, and flew deep into the wilderness.

Only when he reached a desolate, uninhabited place and ensured that no one had followed him did he finally stop.

Turning into a streak of light, he descended underground and skillfully excavated a secret chamber.

From within his palm, he carefully retrieved and recondensed a small amount of the Heart-Desire Ascension Pill's powder, which he had deliberately preserved.

Moments later, a miniature version of the Heart-Desire Ascension Pill, shrunken by dozens of times, appeared in his hand.

Splitting it in two, Li Fan gazed at one half before consuming it.

He wasn’t taking it due to addiction but to verify a certain suspicion he had.

The micro-dose melted the moment it touched his tongue, transforming into a warm current that surged through his entire body.

A slight dizziness washed over his mind.

For a fleeting moment, Li Fan felt as if he was once again witnessing the interwoven celestial network—the vast and intricate net of Heaven and Earth’s truths that he had previously glimpsed while comprehending the Human Dao Stardust.

However, this time, it was a hundred times clearer than before!

It felt within reach, as if he could grasp it at any moment.

The fundamental truths of Heaven and Earth were laid bare before his eyes!

His eyes widened involuntarily, eager to see more.

But just then, the pill’s effects wore off.

Like an illusion dissolving into mist, the profound scene before him shattered and vanished.

An indescribable emptiness surged into his heart.

"Damn it! I was so close!"

"The truths of Heaven and Earth… they were right there within my grasp..."

"Quick, I need to have Liu San refine more of it!"

Thoughts like these, fierce and overwhelming, stormed through Li Fan's mind like a raging hurricane.

He shot to his feet—

But he did not leave the chamber.

Instead, his expression twisted with determination.

"I seek immortality—why should I rely on mere pills?"

"To ordinary people, missing a chance at immortality might mean eternal regret. But for me…"

"A single fleeting opportunity is meaningless. My chances are infinite—limitless, inexhaustible! If I miss it in this life, then I’ll seize it in the next. If I miss it again in the next, then I will try once more in the life after that!"

Li Fan, driven by his own will, began to resist the effects of the Heart-Desire Ascension Pill.

His face contorted, his entire body trembling uncontrollably.

Exerting all his strength, he fought against the wild, unrestrained desires surging within him.

Thus, half a day passed.

After all, it was merely some powdered residue rather than a complete Heart-Desire Ascension Pill. Yet, Li Fan managed to endure the addiction.

All sorts of distracting thoughts receded like a tide, and when he recalled the pill, he no longer felt the slightest craving.

"This thing is truly terrifying. If it had been a complete Ascension Pill, relying solely on my current willpower, I fear I still wouldn't have been able to resist its temptation."

"However, if I use the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra to assist me, it will be a different story."

Li Fan let out a deep breath, steadied his mind, and then swallowed the remaining half of the Ascension Pill.

The moment the desire surged again, he activated the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra.

Just as before, Li Fan once again saw the immense net woven from the principles of heaven and earth.

But under the influence of the Immortal Heart Mantra, his mind was as calm as still water, completely devoid of impulsive urges.

And so, he waited in silence for the effects to subside.

When the hallucinations before his eyes abruptly vanished and the emptiness and longing resurfaced in his heart, the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra began to operate slowly. Before these desires could affect his mind, they were instantly absorbed, transformed into nourishment for the mantra itself.

"Claiming to be an immortal before true immortals—what an utter joke." Li Fan felt not even the slightest ripple in his heart.

"No matter what, at least one thing is confirmed. Taking this Heart-Desire Ascension Pill can indeed assist in cultivating the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra, and I don’t even have to worry about side effects."

Once the desires faded, Li Fan ceased operating the Immortal Heart Mantra.

At present, he was still unable to keep the mantra running instinctively, like breathing. Perhaps only when he fully completed the mantra would he achieve such an effect.

As he left the underground chamber and set off toward Tianling Prefecture, a sudden thought surfaced in his mind.

"The heaven and earth principles seen under the effects of the Heart-Desire Ascension Pill are nothing more than illusions that are nearly real. No matter how many I take, they will never lead to true enlightenment. But on the other hand, if I could witness the real laws of heaven and earth—the kind that cultivators are inherently incapable of comprehending—wouldn’t the effect be even better?"

"After all, no matter how real an illusion may seem, it can never compare to true existence."

"A pill that can genuinely help cultivators attain enlightenment wouldn’t be something the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance would ban. But what if, among a batch of ineffective pseudo-law pills, there were one or two that actually contained a trace of heaven and earth’s true principles…"

Lost in thought, a strange smile crept onto Li Fan’s lips.

When he arrived at Tianling City, he temporarily set his thoughts aside.

He headed straight for a shop that sold Heavenly Spirit Flowers.

"Shopkeeper, give me a pot of Heavenly Spirit Flowers," Li Fan said.

"Right away, sir! Please take a look over here. We have top-quality ones with sixteen to twenty petals—our shop has them all!" the shopkeeper responded enthusiastically.

However, after scanning the dozens of Heavenly Spirit Flowers displayed in the shop, Li Fan's expression darkened immediately.

"You scoundrel! Are you trying to take advantage of me just because I’m an outsider? These pathetic things dare to bear the name ‘Heavenly Spirit’?"

"Why do all these flowers have a strange, eerie blood-like flow within them? What an absolute eyesore!"

Li Fan cursed loudly, his voice booming like thunder, instantly drawing the attention of many cultivators nearby.

"Ah, sir, you may not know this," the shopkeeper sighed bitterly, "but ever since a few years ago, all the Heavenly Spirit Flowers that have grown in this region have been like this!"

Chapter 677: Sowing Seeds, Waiting for Flowers to Bloom

"Could such a thing really happen? Are you trying to fool me because I don’t understand?" Li Fan still looked unconvinced, unwilling to let the matter go.

After the shopkeeper explained repeatedly and bystanders chimed in to confirm, he finally, though reluctantly, accepted the explanation.

"So, you’re telling me that the Heavenly Spirit Flower, once the most stunning bloom in the entire Xuanhuang Realm, has now completely disappeared?"

Li Fan looked dazed and filled with regret, muttering, "Had I known this would happen, I would have done anything to come and witness its beauty a few years ago!"

"I heard that the Heavenly Spirit Flower’s petals bloom in different shapes. When it fully blossoms, each petal reveals a unique vision—some depict vast green mountains, some show surging rivers, while others resemble snow falling from the heavens. A single flower encompasses all the wonders of the world, embodying the essence of heaven and earth, an unparalleled beauty..."

Li Fan’s words instantly stirred memories among the cultivators present.

Most of them were native to the Tianling Prefecture and had once seen the breathtaking elegance of the Heavenly Spirit Flower. As they began reminiscing, sharing their own accounts one after another, the atmosphere grew wistful.

The unattainable is always the most beautiful.

The more they thought about it, the more they felt it was a great loss. Many cultivators sighed and shook their heads in lament.

Seeing that the atmosphere had reached its peak, Li Fan suddenly declared in a loud voice, "Such a rare treasure—if I cannot witness it with my own eyes, it will be a lifelong regret! The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is filled with extraordinary individuals; I refuse to believe that no one preserved the original Heavenly Spirit Flower back then!"

"I hereby offer a reward—anyone who can grant me the opportunity to see the original Heavenly Spirit Flower in person will receive a Longevity Pill capable of extending one’s lifespan by three hundred years!"

With that, he openly displayed a pill in the palm of his hand, allowing everyone to see.

The moment his words spread, an uproar followed. When they laid eyes on the pill in his hand, many felt an irresistible pull from within their souls.

A treasure that could extend life by three centuries was already incredibly rare. Yet, this man was willing to exchange it merely for a chance to gaze upon the Heavenly Spirit Flower!

"You are truly a man of passion, my friend! I respect that! Rest assured, I have a friend who once specialized in cultivating Heavenly Spirit Flowers—perhaps he still has a preserved specimen."

"I’ll ask around as well!"

…

The crowd instantly became lively.

Even the florist's eyes flickered with interest as he picked up a communication talisman to make some inquiries.

Li Fan, however, simply stood tall in the middle of the gathering, quietly waiting.

As expected, the result was just as he had anticipated.

After half a day, expressions of deep regret appeared on everyone's faces. Word had spread throughout Tianling City, yet no one had been able to produce an intact Heavenly Spirit Flower.

Li Fan let out a long sigh, his disappointment palpable.

"If I cannot fulfill this wish, I shall never rest in peace!"

"My offer remains indefinitely. I kindly ask everyone to keep an ear out for me!" He cupped his hands toward the crowd before departing with a melancholic air.

Though this matter seemed insignificant on the surface, in the quiet and desolate Tianling City—still recovering from the great war—it became a rare and intriguing topic.

As people discussed it, the previously overlooked news of the "extinction of the original Heavenly Spirit Flower" began to spread.

After all, the number of cultivators who had seen or heard of the legendary flower was not small.

And as this story continued circulating, their memories of the Heavenly Spirit Flower resurfaced from the depths of their minds.

"Ah, it really is a pity."

"Such a rare treasure, and I never got to see it myself? Once missed, it is gone forever!"

More and more cultivators found themselves lost in similar thoughts, unable to shake off their lingering regret.

The mastermind behind all this, Li Fan, was watching discussions about the Heavenly Spirit Flower increasing across various regions through the Tianxuan Mirror. Satisfied, he nodded.

"Next, I need to let the emotions ferment for a while. The ordinary cultivators have already set a good precedent. With the disciples of the Medicine King Sect adding fuel to the fire, there shouldn't be much of a problem."

"However, if I truly want to inflate the value of the Heavenly Spirit Flower, it will still depend on the real aristocrats of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance."

A sharp gleam flashed in Li Fan’s eyes as he took out the communication talisman left to him by Shuo Feng.

"Brother Shuo, how have you been lately?"

After exchanging a few pleasantries, Li Fan got straight to the point: "I have a matter that I need to trouble you with."

"The Heavenly Spirit Flower…"

After sending his message, Li Fan quietly waited for a response.

Before long, Shuo Feng replied, "The Heavenly Spirit Flower? I think I’ve heard of it before. No big deal, I'll ask around for you."

Li Fan smiled slightly. "Then, I'll thank you in advance, Brother Shuo!"

On Shuo Feng’s side, there was silence for the time being.

"Now, all I need to do is wait for the flower to bloom."

Instead of rushing back to Longevity Valley, Li Fan browsed through the past two years' worth of events in the Xuanhuang Realm using the Tianxuan Mirror, reviewing everything in detail.

Being well-versed in the course of history, Li Fan was naturally able to detect traces of hidden and unusual changes from the smallest clues.

For example, something he had been particularly concerned about—the information regarding the ruins of the Chaoyuan Sect in Jiushan Prefecture—had completely vanished overnight. It was as if the flying abode that once soared into the sky, attracting cultivators to explore it, had never existed. All that remained were sparse records about the ancient Chaoyuan Sect.

Another example was the mysterious drafting of cultivators from martial academies across various regions. No one knew where they were being sent. This sudden vacancy in positions had even sparked competition and unrest.

...

Li Fan carefully committed these clues to memory.

"I still need to resolve the issue of authority. The amount of information I can gather as an unranked individual is too limited. There are too many restrictions."

After half a day, Li Fan temporarily stopped his search.

After some thought, he sent another message to Shuo Feng:

"Brother Shuo, I recently comprehended a new divine ability. Thinking back to our past sparring sessions, I can't help but feel a little eager. Do you have time for another duel?"

This time, Shuo Feng replied swiftly.

"Oh? What’s this? After more than two years, you think you can beat me now? I forgot to mention, I’ve already broken through to the Golden Core stage. Even if you go all out with your Nascent Soul cultivation, I’m afraid you might not win."

"There's no need for words—let’s test it in battle," Li Fan replied bluntly.

His response immediately ignited Shuo Feng’s fighting spirit.

"Come here." Shuo Feng sent him a location.

Li Fan glanced at it—it was in a mountain range on the outskirts of Tianquan City, in Tianquan Prefecture.

"Alright, I’ll be there soon. Please wait a moment, Brother Shuo."

"No rush. I'll be here for the next few days." After Shuo Feng sent this message, there was no further response.

Li Fan then exited the Tianxuan Mirror and used a teleportation array to travel to Tianquan Prefecture.

Tianquan Prefecture was filled with the cave dwellings of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s aristocracy.

Naturally, the location Shuo Feng had chosen was one of them.

Soaring through the sky, Li Fan carefully avoided the defensive formations that enshrouded the area and headed straight for his destination.

Chapter 678: Thread Extraction, Annihilation of Living Beings

While flying, Li Fan occasionally sensed divine consciousness scanning him from below.

However, upon realizing he was merely passing by, the probing forces quickly retracted.

After the time it takes to brew a cup of tea, Li Fan arrived outside the mountain range marked by Shuo Feng.

The mountains stretched like a winding dragon, with sixteen towering peaks standing proudly.

Even through the protective formation, one could faintly sense the dense spiritual energy lingering in the mountain range.

The moment Li Fan arrived, a female cultivator in a pale yellow dress flew out from one of the peaks, approaching him.

"You must be the young master's guest. Please, follow me."

The female cultivator displayed utmost respect, leading Li Fan through the protective formation and into the mountain range.

Glancing at the guide, Li Fan noticed that she, like him, was at the mid-stage Nascent Soul Realm.

Yet, here she seemed to hold the status of a mere servant.

Li Fan, however, did not feel awkward. Instead, he maintained a composed expression and inquired about this place.

The woman in the yellow dress, unfazed by Li Fan’s cultivation level, answered in detail as long as it was permissible to do so.

This mountain range was named Shuofeng Mountain.

Indeed, it was purchased by Immortal Sage Fei Xue and named after Shuo Feng. Back when Shuo Feng successfully established his Dao Foundation, this mountain range was a gift from Shuo Feng.

Although called a mountain range, it was actually a meticulously crafted cultivation cave estate. The sixteen peaks were arranged in a formation that gathered spiritual energy from heaven and earth. Moreover, they were forged from rare materials imbued with the laws of the universe. Residing here, even without actively cultivating, one would naturally absorb these laws, steadily refining their power.

Despite its remarkable nature, after Shuo Feng broke through to the Nascent Soul Realm, Immortal Sage Fei Xue gifted him another estate in Tianquan City.

Thus, Shuofeng Mountain gradually fell into neglect.

Now, he only visited occasionally for leisure.

Before long, at the summit of the central peak, Li Fan saw Shuo Feng in a flowing blue robe—

He stood with his hands behind his back, his expression calm and indifferent.

Surrounding him were six late-stage Nascent Soul cultivators, launching relentless attacks against him.

Yet, Shuo Feng did not activate his Cave-Heaven Power—he simply responded with pure spell techniques.

Li Fan’s eyes narrowed slightly at the sight.

Strictly speaking, these six Nascent Soul cultivators were no weaklings. Their attacks included Five Elemental Spells, spiritual weapons and flying swords, and even black arrows capable of teleporting unpredictably through space.

Yet, Shuo Feng did not dodge nor flinch.

He didn't even blink.

A radiant white sword light danced through the air—

Heavenly Wonder Sword!

In an instant, it blocked and reflected all incoming attacks.

Boom! Boom!

Explosions echoed through the mountains.

The six Nascent Soul cultivators lasted no more than a dozen breaths before being overwhelmed by their own countered attacks and forced into defeat.

Shuo Feng showed no mercy.

Their injuries were severe—one even had his entire body obliterated, only managing to regenerate after his Cave-Heaven Power circulated for some time.

"Too weak. Bring the next batch." Shuo Feng’s voice was cold, his expression showing a hint of impatience.

The six defeated cultivators wore bitter expressions but dared not protest. Bowing respectfully, they quickly withdrew.

"Hahaha! Brother Shuo, you are quite formidable!"

At this moment, Li Fan suddenly burst into laughter, clapping his hands without the slightest sign of fear.

"Brother Li, you mock me!" Shuo Feng’s icy demeanor softened, revealing a faint smile.

The six retreating Nascent Soul cultivators discreetly glanced at Li Fan, their eyes filled with curiosity about his identity before hurriedly leaving.

"It has been a while, Brother Shuo. Your strength has indeed advanced...

But I am no weaker than you!"

"Please, enlighten me!"

Without further words, Li Fan’s expression turned cold.

He raised his right hand and pointed at Shuo Feng from a distance.

Whoosh…

A gentle breeze passed.

Yet, Shuo Feng, who had been on high alert, waited for a long moment but felt no change in his surroundings.

His smile faded.

His eyes turned sharp.

"Brother Li, are you toying with me?"

Li Fan’s expression remained unchanged, smiling lightly.

"It’s my first time using this divine ability—small mishaps are expected."

"But no worries. This time, it should work."

"Be careful!"

In an instant, Li Fan’s voice turned icy.

He retracted his right hand—

Then, lightly pointed once more.

"Thread Extraction!"

The wind remained calm, and the clouds drifted lightly, as if nothing had happened. Only Li Fan's emotionless voice echoed across the mountain peak.

Shuo Feng was just about to speak when he suddenly sensed something, and his expression changed dramatically.

Threads, one by one, began to unravel from his azure long robe.

The fine strands floated through the air, dissolving as if merging into water, vanishing in an instant.

Shuo Feng was about to take action, but before he could react, a muffled groan escaped his lips involuntarily.

In the blink of an eye, a crimson wound appeared on his body, as if a sharp blade had sliced through his flesh, exposing the muscle beneath.

And in front of him, a single red thread had appeared in mid-air.

"Sssss..."

"Sssss..."

A strange, eerie sound kept ringing out.

With each sound, another crimson thread appeared in the air. And with each thread, another bloody wound opened on Shuo Feng’s body.

In mere moments, he was covered in cuts, his body drenched in blood.

An icy chill surged through his heart.

Because he understood his own condition far too well—these were not mere surface wounds.

His very being was being extracted, disappearing into nothingness!

It was as if...

A puppet woven entirely of thread was having its strings slowly pulled away, unraveling its form.

Moreover, from beginning to end, his Foundation Establishment artifact—the sword—had not made a single move to defend or counterattack!

"So this is why it's called 'Thread Extraction'..." Shuo Feng couldn't help but think.

"If this continues..."

A horrifying image flashed through his mind—his own body shrinking bit by bit as the threads were pulled away, until he became nothing more than a tattered, lifeless ragdoll, collapsing helplessly to the ground, awaiting his doom.

A deep terror gripped his heart.

Yet, even as his mind raced for a solution, he could not think of a way to counter this Thread Extraction technique.

Li Fan, meanwhile, remained motionless in midair, his finger still locked onto Shuo Feng.

He had no intention of stopping!

"This guy... He really will kill me!"

Looking into Li Fan’s unfathomable gaze, Shuo Feng felt a chilling realization strike him.

"I surrender! I surrender!"

Driven by sheer survival instinct, Shuo Feng shouted repeatedly.

Hearing his words, Li Fan finally withdrew his right hand.

"Poof!"

In that instant, it was as if countless severed threads had snapped apart.

Blood mist burst from Shuo Feng’s body in layers.

"Young Master!"

The female cultivator in the yellow dress turned pale with fright, letting out a panicked scream.

"I'm fine!"

Shuo Feng waved his hand to stop her from rushing over.

"Thank you for the match."

Li Fan clasped his hands in a polite gesture, his expression calm.

Shuo Feng's gaze was complicated as he looked at Li Fan.

"What an incredible technique, Daoist friend."

He couldn't help but admit it with sincerity.

Chapter 679: The Xuan Family Appoints a Guest Elder

"It's just a clever trick, nothing more. Brother Shuo, your Foundation Establishment artifact, the [Sword], is not adept at initiating attacks, but its defensive counterattacks are unparalleled. However, this [Thread Extraction] technique mimics the natural cycle of birth, aging, sickness, and death—the changes of human existence. Rather than an attack, it is more of a state-inflicting ability. That is why it did not trigger the [Sword]'s counterattack."

Having won the duel, Li Fan did not show any arrogance. Instead, he took the initiative to explain the reasoning to Shuo Feng.

Back when he was cultivating within the Root of Heaven and Earth, nurturing the Five Elements Cave-Heaven, Li Fan had experienced his own body being woven like delicate silk threads, continuously being drawn out.

At that time, he had gained an initial insight.

However, he was still far from being able to directly manifest it as a divine ability in the real world. It wasn’t until now—after gaining control over the Beast Realm's fate and breaking through to the Mid Nascent Soul stage—that he had almost become akin to the Dao of a small world itself.

In his mind, all life and death were but a single thought away.

Through this, Li Fan developed an entirely new and profound understanding of the composition and disintegration of all things.

Thus, the divine ability [Thread Extraction] was born.

As he explained to Shuo Feng, strictly speaking, [Thread Extraction] is not a direct offensive technique. Instead, it attaches an accelerating decay effect to the target—it is a transformation of the target itself.

Just as mortals inevitably age and die, all things in existence eventually reach their end and dissolve back into the world. [Thread Extraction] merely hastens this natural process.

During his battle with Shuo Feng, Li Fan had demonstrated [Thread Extraction] at full power, making it appear overwhelmingly destructive. However, it had one critical weakness—its execution required continuous casting. If interrupted or disrupted, its effectiveness would be significantly diminished.

It was only because Shuo Feng's cultivation emphasized defensive counterattacks that [Thread Extraction] was particularly effective against him.

In reality, the optimal usage of Thread Extraction was not in the explosive, rapid application used in the duel. Instead, it should be employed covertly, working silently over time—gradually unraveling a target’s “threads” without them noticing.

By extending the timespan, the target would not develop visible wounds as Shuo Feng had during the battle.

Instead, they would simply feel increasingly weak, their body inexplicably deteriorating, their spirit and vitality steadily fading—yet they would never be able to pinpoint the cause.

In the end, they would watch helplessly as their life force withered away, perishing in agony.

The phrase "life fades like drawn silk" perfectly encapsulates the technique’s essence.

It was, without a doubt, an exceptional assassination technique—even surpassing many formless killing arts in effectiveness.

As someone who always kept a trump card hidden, Li Fan had deliberately concealed the true lethality of [Thread Extraction] during his match with Shuo Feng.

"Brother Li, you once praised me as a natural talent, but I believe your comprehension surpasses mine by far. This [Thread Extraction] technique is truly remarkable!"

Despite being defeated, Shuo Feng showed no anger. Instead, his attitude had grown noticeably more friendly.

The fleeting cold killing intent he had exhibited earlier had now vanished as if it had never existed.

"Brother Shuo, you flatter me. It was merely an insight I gained while traveling." Li Fan replied with a faint smile.

"Brother Li, there's no need for false modesty! In the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, there are countless who claim to be geniuses, but few can comprehend divine abilities on their own as you have!"

As he spoke, Shuo Feng patted his body. In an instant, a flash of white light enveloped him, and his attire changed.

Leading Li Fan up the mountain, he guided him to a small pavilion at the peak, inviting him inside.

A female cultivator in a yellow dress briefly left the room before returning, bringing two bowls of spiritual tea.

The fragrance of the tea filled the air, invigorating the spirit.

Shuo Feng took a sip and said, "Brother Li, I have yet to think of a way to counter your divine ability. But once inspiration strikes, I will certainly seek you out for another match!"

Li Fan nodded slightly. "I’ll be waiting."

Shuo Feng laughed heartily. "Refreshing! Brother Li, your temperament suits me well! You’re far better than those spineless flatterers, who lack ability yet seek favor through sycophancy!"

Li Fan did not continue the topic but instead changed the subject.

"Speaking of sycophants, I actually have a matter where I’ll need your help, Brother Shuo."

"Oh? What is it? Speak freely."

Li Fan then expressed his desire to improve his merit ranking.

"Having insufficient authority is truly frustrating. Being restricted everywhere is so uncomfortable!" Li Fan sighed.

Hearing this, Shuo Feng dismissed it indifferently, "Hmph, it's just a threshold deliberately set by the Immortal Alliance to consolidate its rule. For those true powerholders, there’s no need to climb step by step to raise their authority level..."

"But since Brother Li has such a need, it’s easy to handle. Zhi Jin..."

The female cultivator in the yellow dress immediately responded.

"Are there any vacant guest elder positions available recently?" Shuo Feng asked.

"There are still three vacancies this year. However..." Zhi Jin glanced at Li Fan, hesitating to continue.

"His cultivation level doesn't meet the requirement, right?" Shuo Feng chuckled. "No problem. Special cases require special handling. Just say I appointed him. You just need to give them a heads-up."

Zhi Jin nodded slightly. Her figure blurred and disappeared from the scene in an instant.

Only then did Shuo Feng explain, "Serving as a guest elder under my family grants an initial authority level of thirty. Additionally, you will receive a fixed amount of merit points annually."

Upon hearing this, Li Fan did not show joy but instead frowned. "Thank you, Brother Shuo. However, I am used to my freedom. If—"

Shuo Feng waved his hand. "No worries. You won’t need to do anything—just hold the honorary position. You and I are like-minded individuals; are we the type to be willingly bound by restrictions?"

"However..."

Shuo Feng looked at Li Fan, a glint of battle intent flashing in his eyes. "If one day your hands itch for a sparring match, you must not refuse me!"

Li Fan, feeling relieved, immediately cupped his hands in gratitude. "Then, I must thank Brother Shuo in advance!"

Shuo Feng truly lived up to his status as a top-tier second-generation immortal of the Immortal Alliance—his efficiency was remarkably high.

Before they even finished drinking the spiritual tea on the table, Zhi Jin had already returned.

A snowflake-shaped ice crystal talisman was handed to Li Fan, signifying that his guest elder appointment had been officially registered.

"Brother Li, you can check the effect," Shuo Feng tapped his index finger on the table, and a small Tianxuan Mirror appeared before Li Fan.

When Li Fan checked his information in the mirror, he indeed found a new title: "Guest Elder of the Xuan Family."

His authority level, as Shuo Feng had mentioned, had directly risen to level thirty.

However, there was also a note stating that this authority level was tied to the "Guest Elder" position. If he lost this title, his authority level would disappear accordingly.

Meanwhile, any merit points he earned personally would accumulate from level one.

The two were independent of each other.

This was within Li Fan’s expectations, but what caught his attention more were the four words: "Xuan Family Guest Elder."

"Xuan Family?" Li Fan looked at Shuo Feng with some confusion.

Shuo Feng did not shy away from the question and openly explained, "My mother’s surname is Xuan. As for my name..."

He shrugged, looking as if he wasn't entirely sure himself.

Li Fan nodded without probing further.

Chapter 680: Goodbye, Lu Xuejing

"I had only heard of your esteemed mother by chance before. A person of profound strength, highly skilled in artifact refinement, and widely revered. Yet, I never realized that your Xuan family held such influence within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance."

"For an unknown rogue cultivator like me, I understand that earning merit within the Immortal Alliance is no easy feat. Many cultivators toil tirelessly, risking their lives, only to barely attain the 20th Rank. Yet, with just your approval, Brother Shuo, one could immediately gain 13th Rank authority…"

"Meeting you that day was truly the greatest fortune of my life!" Li Fan sighed slightly as he drank another cup of spiritual tea.

"Hahaha! I never expected that a momentary loss of control over my sword would lead me to meet such a remarkable individual as Brother Li. In the entire Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, there are only a handful of Nascent Soul cultivators who can defeat me with their divine abilities!" Shuo Feng held Li Fan in high regard, showing no condescension despite his lack of background.

"You and I must truly be fated…" Shuo Feng, in high spirits, ordered Zhi Jin to bring in some rare delicacies.

Halfway through their meal, accompanied by the fragrant aroma of spirit wine, they suddenly heard a voice from outside.

"Brother Shuo! Brother Shuo!"

A trace of displeasure flashed across Shuo Feng’s face, and his smile vanished instantly.

Before he could even respond, a white figure swiftly flew into the central hall.

The newcomer was a young woman dressed in a white gown. She had a slender figure, and her skin was as smooth as white jade.

"Brother Shuo, why didn’t you tell me you had returned?" She puffed her cheeks in annoyance, seemingly a little angry. However, her eyes were filled with admiration as she gazed at Shuo Feng.

"I just got back not too long ago," Shuo Feng replied impatiently.

"Fine…" she muttered, clearly displeased.

Her gaze then shifted to Li Fan, her large eyes blinking curiously. "Brother Shuo, who is this? I don’t think I’ve ever seen him before."

Shuo Feng answered indifferently, "This is my new friend, Li Fan."

"That name… It sounds familiar…" The young woman tilted her head slightly, scrutinizing Li Fan.

Li Fan merely glanced at her briefly before averting his eyes. His heart stirred slightly.

Although she did not recognize him, he was quite familiar with her.

She was none other than Lu Xuejing, the daughter of Lu Xichan, the chief formation master of the Strategy Formation Hall—a person with whom Li Fan had once shared a master-servant relationship in his past life.

"As fellow second-generation members of the Immortal Alliance, it’s only natural that they know each other. However, I didn’t expect that the usually arrogant and privileged Lu Xuejing—who is always surrounded by young admirers—would act so meek in front of Shuo Feng," Li Fan thought to himself.

He quickly shifted his gaze away from Lu Xuejing and turned to Shuo Feng, pretending not to know her. "Brother Shuo, this is…?"

"Her surname is Lu. She is Lu Xuejing." Shuo Feng merely stated her name without mentioning her mother’s identity.

The meaning was clear—Li Fan didn’t ask further.

"Since you have a guest, I won’t intrude any longer." Li Fan cupped his hands in farewell, preparing to leave.

"About the Heavenly Spirit Flower, I’d appreciate it if you could continue looking into it for me, Brother Shuo," he casually reminded before departing.

Unexpectedly, this one sentence provoked Lu Xuejing’s anger.

"What? The Heavenly Spirit Flower was for you?" She glared at Li Fan furiously. "Brother Shuo told me he wanted it for himself! I even went through so much trouble to get my people to search for it!"

Li Fan turned to look at Shuo Feng.

"How did I deceive you? Brother Li’s business is my business," Shuo Feng said awkwardly. However, seeing Lu Xuejing’s aggrieved expression, he seemed a little troubled as he quickly tried to explain.

Lu Xuejing, however, covered her ears like a child, refusing to listen.

Instead of venting her anger on Shuo Feng, she began to dislike Li Fan even more.

"Whose family do you belong to? You look very unfamiliar! You’re not a spy from the Five Elders Association trying to get close to Brother Shuo just to find out the location of the Tianxuan Mirror, are you? You don’t look like a good person at all! Brother Shuo has never lied to me before..."

"Lu Xuejing, what nonsense are you spouting!" Seeing her speak so recklessly, Shuo Feng's expression changed slightly, and he immediately reprimanded her.

However, Li Fan, who was inexplicably implicated by Lu Xuejing’s wild imagination, was not particularly angry.

Instead, after hearing her words, his gaze sharpened slightly.

"So, the Xuan family does have some connection to the Tianxuan Mirror."

"Brother Li, I sincerely apologize. Let’s end things here for today. I’ll invite you over another day." Shuo Feng said apologetically.

While instructing Zhi Jin to see Li Fan out, he also had to console Lu Xuejing, who was on the verge of tears.

Taking a deep look at the two, Li Fan left the cave dwelling.

"Brother Shuo, you must believe me. That Li Fan just now is definitely not a good person. His gaze was so unsettling. You should keep your distance from him in the future."

After Shuo Feng’s patient persuasion, Lu Xuejing finally calmed down.

She then declared firmly,

"I'm absolutely sure of it!"

Compared to someone else's one-sided claims, Shuo Feng clearly trusted his own judgment more.

"Mm, alright, I got it." He responded perfunctorily, not taking Lu Xuejing's words to heart at all.

"Immortal Sage Fei Xue, highly skilled in artifact refining. Has a son, but his father is unknown."

"Lu Xichan, chief of the Strategy Formation Hall. In her past life, she was the leading figure behind the Tianxuan Spirit Locking Formation. Has a daughter, but her father is also unknown."

"The two are acquainted, possibly close friends."

"Both have connections to the Tianxuan Mirror..."

On his way back to the Longevity Valley, Li Fan analyzed the limited information he had and vaguely pieced together some clues.

"Interesting. I wonder if there will be a chance in this lifetime to have the Fisherman take action again. However, the Stealing Heaven and Replacing the Sun Order was lost in the Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace in this era. Even if Lu Xuejing gets captured, I have no idea what could be used to exchange for her release." Li Fan pondered in his heart.

Upon returning to the Longevity Valley, he found that Fang Zaiji had already disappeared. He had likely gone off somewhere to craft the protective treasure needed for Xu Bai's clone.

Meanwhile, Liu San was busy overseeing the process of integrating the disciples of the Medicine King Sect into the Great Dream Spring and Autumn Formation.

"In half a year, once everything is ready, the clone can leave the valley."

"Until then, my true self should continue to stay hidden."

Entering his secluded cultivation chamber, he found that the restriction on entering the Fallen Immortal Realm had been lifted.

"Blessings to the Celestial Venerable Of Xuanhuang!"

Performing the ritual, Li Fan once again stepped into the distorted, transparent space.

Before him, three different scenes flickered.

A newly unlocked scenario—‘Heavenly Sword Sect: Sword Refining’—was now accessible.

Without hesitation, Li Fan focused his mind. In the next moment, after a brief dizziness, he entered the Fallen Immortal Realm.

Before he could even make sense of the identity he had assumed this time, he heard voices filled with both excitement and anger in his ears.

"Hurry, there’s a good show to watch! A newly admitted outer disciple is making an outrageous claim—he wants to challenge the Senior Brother!"

"Are you joking? Senior Brother’s cultivation is on an entirely different level. How could an outer disciple even withstand a single move from him?"

Chapter 681: Facing Mr. Bai

"Sigh, it's hard to explain. Just go and see for yourself. Earlier, Senior Brother Zhao, who is at the Golden Core stage, was displeased and wanted to teach that person a lesson, but he was sent flying to the ground with a single sword strike."

"I heard about that too. That guy only seems to be at the Qi Condensation stage. Do you think that's possible? He must be an imposter who infiltrated our sect. I don't think he came with good intentions."

"Hurry up, or we’ll miss the sparring match."

Amidst the murmurs, Li Fan followed the crowd to an arena where the sparring matches were taking place.

At the same time, he began to understand the details of the body he now inhabited.

Ji Zhaoxuan—Golden Core cultivator, an inner disciple of the Heavenly Sword Sect.

He was a man of few words, disinterested in socializing, and completely devoted to the way of the sword.

"Senior Brother Chen, I appreciate your guidance!"

A pleasant voice suddenly jolted Li Fan back to reality.

Because he was all too familiar with the owner of that voice—it was none other than Mr. Bai!

Li Fan followed the direction of the voice and saw the speaker, a seemingly unremarkable cultivator who looked nothing like Mr. Bai.

However, the subtle aura he exuded made Li Fan certain—this was indeed Mr. Bai!

"He must have changed his appearance to avoid drawing attention."

"But why now? And why would he disguise himself as an ordinary person to join the Heavenly Sword Sect?"

A flood of questions surged in Li Fan's mind.

With these doubts, he continued watching the match.

The Golden Core cultivator surnamed Chen had just been defeated by Mr. Bai, who appeared to be only at the Qi Condensation stage. However, rather than looking devastated, Chen simply clasped his hands in respect and said sincerely, "Thank you, Senior, for your guidance."

Then, with a hint of excitement, he swiftly departed to enter seclusion and reflect on his insights.

The watching cultivators erupted in an uproar.

Everyone now understood that this so-called "Qi Condensation" cultivator was anything but ordinary.

At that moment, Li Fan finally noticed something.

His gaze locked onto the wooden sword in Mr. Bai’s hand.

"That sword..."

Li Fan was instantly shaken.

He hurriedly asked his fellow disciples about it and soon learned that when Mr. Bai had started his match, he had no suitable weapon.

So he casually broke off a piece from a nearby tree and crafted this wooden sword on the spot.

Upon hearing this, Li Fan was thrown into an even deeper shock.

"There's no mistake; this wooden sword is the one that will be in Shuo Feng's hand later on..."

"A Heaven’s Wonder—the [Sword]!"

"How is this possible? Such an extraordinary artifact... was merely something Mr. Bai created on a whim?"

"Just what level of cultivation has he reached?"

This realization sent Li Fan's thoughts into turmoil.

The Heavenly Wonder, the [Sword], was a manifestation of the very laws of the Dao of the Sword.

In theory, it could only be nurtured through the power of the heavens and the earth.

Yet now, in Mr. Bai’s hands, it was nothing more than a child's toy, effortlessly created.

Just how profound was his understanding of the Dao of the Sword?

Just how deep was his comprehension of the very laws of the world?

Li Fan could hardly fathom it.

As he stood there in stunned silence, another Nascent Soul sword cultivator suddenly arrived, flying in on a streak of sword light...

A formation of forty-nine paired swords shot out like a torrential rain of pear blossoms, surging toward Mr. Bai.

Mr. Bai raised his hand and lightly waved his sword.

In an instant, all forty-nine swords turned against their wielder, plunging into chaos.

Within mere moments, the sword cultivator had been defeated.

"Did you all notice? He’s even stronger than when he fought Senior Brother Chen just now!"

"He must be hiding his true cultivation, toying with us!"

"Now our Senior Brother has no choice but to step in. I just wonder if he’s sobered up yet."

As murmurs spread among the crowd, memories of the legendary Senior Brother of the Heavenly Sword Sect resurfaced in Li Fan’s mind.

The eternal senior disciple of the Heavenly Sword Sect.

In truth, his seniority surpassed even that of the current sect master.

However, he was naturally lazy, disliked handling sect affairs, and only loved drinking. Using the excuse of being "the eternal Senior Brother to all junior disciples," he had monopolized the title of "Senior Brother" for years.

His name: Situ Yao.

Back in the day, Senior Brother Situ Yao was hailed as the strongest combatant in the world. His reputation attracted countless battle-hungry cultivators to challenge him.

Annoyed by the constant interruptions, Situ Yao somehow procured two massive boulders and placed them at the sect’s entrance.

With his sword, he carved two lines into them:

"Idlers, keep out."

"Challengers, lay down your swords."

It was said that after carving those words, Situ Yao downed a jug of fine wine and laughed heartily. He declared that, from then on, he would finally have some peace and quiet.

Sure enough, from that day forward, most challengers found themselves unable to even overcome the restriction placed on the boulders.

Realizing the immense gap in strength between them and Situ Yao, they could only leave in shame.

...

"Hiss… It seems that Situ Yao is indeed an extraordinary figure."

Years later, standing before those now-legendary boulders that had turned into artifacts of heaven and earth, Li Fan couldn’t help but think so.

"However, compared to Mr. Bai, there is still a considerable gap."

"One is merely a wonder of man, while the other has reached the realm of heavenly wonders…"

"Truly unfathomable."

Situ Yao’s legendary status only added to the enigma surrounding Mr. Bai.

At this moment, facing the challenges from the Heavenly Sword Sect disciples, the immeasurably powerful Mr. Bai accepted them all.

Yet with a single move, he defeated every challenger.

Surprisingly, rather than feeling frustrated, the defeated disciples were overjoyed, as if they had gained immense enlightenment from their sparring session.

Realizing this was a rare opportunity, the disciples were eager to take their turn.

Seizing the moment, Li Fan stepped forward before anyone else and stood before Mr. Bai.

Even though he could overlook all beings in the Xuanhuang Realm as insignificant, in front of this enigmatic Mr. Bai, Li Fan couldn't help but feel a slight nervousness.

Since he had entered the Fallen Immortal Realm in an incarnated form, he was unable to use his own divine abilities.

Taking a deep breath, Li Fan recalled the cultivation technique of the body he had possessed—Ji Zhaoxuan.

It was an obscure technique that condensed alchemic energy into swords.

However, mastery of one technique leads to mastery of all.

By relying on sword energy, he could still manifest a portion of the power of his divine ability, Heaven-Shattering Heart Sword.

"Please enlighten me, sir."

Li Fan spoke in a deep voice.

In the next moment, with a shift of his mind, several sword auras shrouded in black demonic energy materialized around Mr. Bai.

The black swords let out piercing cries, as if they sought to shred Mr. Bai into countless pieces.

"Not bad. The creativity is commendable, but… does your heart truly align with your sword?"

Just as the black swords were about to strike Mr. Bai, they suddenly halted mid-air.

Time seemed to freeze.

In the eerie stillness, Li Fan faintly heard Mr. Bai’s gentle voice.

"If you treat your sword as a mere tool, then your sword will treat you as a tool in return."

Boom!

Like a bolt of lightning piercing through the fog, countless insights burst into Li Fan’s mind.

Endless possibilities for evolving the Heaven-Shattering Heart Sword unfolded before him.

So many, in fact, that he felt overwhelmed, unable to decide which path to take.

Chapter 682: Junior Brothers, Bring Your Swords

"So a sword... can be used like this too!"

Just like when he had first witnessed the perfected version of the Creation Furnace Technique taught by Mr. Bai and was completely captivated, Li Fan once again found himself utterly immersed in the boundless mysteries of Heaven-Shattering Heart Sword after receiving Mr. Bai's guidance.

He was so entranced that he didn’t even manage to utter a simple "Thank you, Senior, for your guidance." In a daze, he left the dueling arena without even realizing how.

No one knew how much time had passed until a chorus of "Senior Brother!" from the outside world finally pulled Li Fan out of his enlightenment.

Following everyone's gaze, Li Fan looked over and saw Situ Yao, wobbling unsteadily as if he was still drunk. Two disciples of the Heavenly Sword Sect were supporting him as they forcefully brought him into the arena.

"Wine... where's my wine?" Situ Yao hiccuped, completely ignoring the presence of Mr. Bai, and drowsily glanced left and right, searching for his drink.

"Situ, why pretend to be drunk?" Mr. Bai was not offended. Instead, he smiled faintly.

Hearing this, Situ Yao knew he couldn’t keep up the act anymore. He cleared his throat, straightened his posture, and looked at Mr. Bai.

A helpless expression surfaced on his face. "Seriously… I was hoping to save face as the Senior Brother of the Heavenly Sword Sect. But now that you’ve exposed me, I guess there's no avoiding this fight."

Somehow, Situ Yao pulled out a gourd of wine and took a deep swig.

His eyes sharpened as he carefully studied Mr. Bai.

"Can't win... can't win at all." He muttered under his breath.

Though spoken softly, his words caused an uproar among the watching cultivators.

Situ Yao was undisputedly the strongest in the Heavenly Sword Sect. He hadn't fought seriously in years, and no one knew his true limits.

Yet, this absolute powerhouse of the Xuanhuang Realm, before even making a move, had already admitted he wasn’t Mr. Bai’s match!

Situ Yao was not the kind of person to lie or downplay his abilities. If he said he couldn't win, then it meant he truly believed it.

So, who exactly was this unremarkable-looking man? Where did he come from?

For a moment, every disciple of the Heavenly Sword Sect had their eyes locked onto Mr. Bai, filled with uncertainty and astonishment.

"To do the impossible, despite knowing it's impossible—isn't that your life’s creed, Situ?" Mr. Bai encouraged, seeing that Situ Yao was hesitating.

"That sword of yours… you've kept it hidden for a long time. Isn't it time to test it out?"

His tone was light, but to Situ Yao, the words hit like thunder.

A sudden surge of energy erupted from his body. His eyes narrowed as he scrutinized Mr. Bai, a flicker of doubt crossing his gaze.

However, being a true powerhouse, Situ Yao quickly suppressed his doubts and focused his mind.

"If that's the case, then I won't hold back," he said solemnly.

He took a step forward, raised his right hand, and swept his gaze across the disciples of the Heavenly Sword Sect who were watching.

Then, with utmost seriousness, he called out:

"Junior Brothers, bring your swords!"

In that instant, every single cultivator of the Heavenly Sword Sect—regardless of their location—heard Situ Yao's words.

They were momentarily stunned, but without the slightest hesitation, they all threw their lifebound flying swords into the sky.

As the Senior Brother of the sect, Situ Yao had always taken great care of the new disciples. He never put on airs or distanced himself. Whenever his junior disciples were in trouble, he would always stand up for them—even if it meant being biased in their favor.

He had held the title of Senior Brother for so many years. Every disciple, whether directly or indirectly, had received his kindness.

Now that he was asking to borrow their swords—how could they refuse?

And so, in the blink of an eye, tens of thousands of flying swords soared into the sky.

All of them surged toward Situ Yao.

For disciples of the Heavenly Sword Sect, half of their cultivation and battle strength resided in their lifebound flying swords.

From the Foundation Establishment stage onward, they poured their blood, sweat, and soul into forging their flying swords, strengthening their durability and lethality, gradually achieving complete harmony with them.

Thus, when Situ Yao uttered "Bring your swords",

It was not just tens of thousands of swords that took flight—

It was half of the entire Heavenly Sword Sect’s battle power.

Countless sword auras interwove, illuminating the sky in dazzling colors.

Situ Yao raised his hand, fingers shifting into a sword gesture.

The storm of swords roared toward their target—Mr. Bai.

Countless flying swords gathered into one, seemingly forming a giant sword that spanned the heavens and earth in the void.

It locked onto Mr. Bai from afar and arrived in an instant.

It seemed that in the next second, Mr. Bai would be pierced by ten thousand swords, dying a tragic death on the spot.

However, there was not the slightest trace of panic on Mr. Bai's face.

He merely revealed a faint smile and then raised the wooden sword in his hand.

Facing the ten thousand swords.

Buzz...

A resonant sword hum echoed from the wooden sword.

In that instant, time seemed to come to a halt.

Wherever the sword hum passed, the countless flying swords first stopped in mid-flight, frozen in place.

Then, their blades trembled violently, as if struggling fiercely against some invisible force.

Finally…

The first flying sword lost control and fell from the sky.

It plunged into the ground, its blade quivering slightly.

Then came the second, the third…

In the blink of an eye, countless flying swords rained down from the sky like a torrential storm, embedding themselves into the earth.

Densely packed, they formed an impenetrable graveyard of swords within a small area.

Yet, not a single one had touched even the corner of Mr. Bai’s robe.

The ultimate killing move that Situ Yao had cultivated for most of his life had been effortlessly neutralized.

At that moment, the entire Heavenly Sword Sect fell into a deathly silence.

The wooden sword in Mr. Bai's hand emitted another sword hum.

Then, all the disciples, including Li Fan, witnessed a scene that would remain etched in their memories forever.

All the flying swords embedded in the ground suddenly bent toward Mr. Bai's direction of their own accord.

As if paying homage to their emperor, they bowed in reverence.

Mr. Bai stood calmly, holding his wooden sword, his expression indifferent.

“You are…” At this moment, as if recalling something, Situ Yao’s pupils shrank abruptly, and he blurted out in shock.

Mr. Bai smiled slightly and gently waved his wooden sword once more.

In an instant, the countless flying swords returned to their respective owners.

“I came today to ask for a favor.” Having effortlessly resolved the conflict, Mr. Bai casually tossed his wooden sword aside and smiled as he addressed Situ Yao.

“Please, speak.” Situ Yao's tone was filled with deep respect.

Mr. Bai glanced around but did not immediately speak.

Situ Yao suddenly slapped his forehead as if realizing something. “Please, follow me.”

With that, he led Mr. Bai toward the grand hall of the Heavenly Sword Sect.

Only the many cultivators still standing in shock remained, unable to recover from the scene they had just witnessed.

“So this… is the true power of a supreme expert from the ancient cultivation world.” Li Fan was also awed by the overwhelming might of Situ Yao’s sword strike.

He had a vague feeling that if that single massive sword had been successfully unleashed, it could have torn a rift in the Xuanhuang Realm itself.

And yet, the fact that Mr. Bai had so casually neutralized the attack…

Somehow, it did not surprise him at all.

Chapter 683: Traces of the Past

After all, based on the current information available, Mr. Bai’s status has risen to an even higher level.

He seems to have surpassed the power limits of ordinary cultivators, and he may even be connected to the True Immortal who created the entire Fallen Immortal Realm.

Although Situ Yao’s sword strike was powerful, it was ultimately insignificant before an immortal.

A long time passed before the disciples of the Heavenly Sword Sect finally recovered from the shocking scene they had just witnessed.

No one dared to speak loudly, fearing they might disturb Mr. Bai, who was still within the sect.
