Instead, they whispered among themselves, some even expressing their shock in a near-hysterical manner.

At that moment, under everyone’s watchful eyes, a figure suddenly flew towards the wooden sword that Mr. Bai had thrown.

It was Li Fan.

Ignoring the murderous gazes of the other cultivators who wished to kill him, Li Fan took a deep breath and gripped the wooden sword tightly.

In that fleeting instant, it felt as if a radiant white light illuminated the heavens and earth.

Countless profound mysteries of the "sword" unfolded within his mind in an instant.

Li Fan was completely entranced.

But in the very next moment…

A violent tremor shook the ground, and the wooden sword was forcibly wrenched from his grasp.

Li Fan snapped out of his enlightenment.

A trace of frustration and reluctance flashed through his heart, and he suddenly realized that, for some unknown reason, he had been flung several meters away.

Seeing this, the other cultivators also tried to imitate Li Fan, attempting to pull out the wooden sword.

But without exception, the moment they grasped it, they were immediately repelled.

"Sigh, it makes sense. How could we possibly take away something that belongs to such a powerful figure so easily?"

"Perhaps only Senior Brother could pull it out..."

Everyone sighed in regret, gazing greedily at the lone wooden sword in the field, wiping the drool from the corners of their mouths.

Just as recorded in true history,

Mr. Bai did not take the wooden sword with him. Without a sound, he simply left the Heavenly Sword Sect.

No one knew what he and Situ Yao had spoken about.

But from that day onward, the Heavenly Sword Sect bore a new mission:

To forge a legendary weapon that only exists in the stories of the sect— the World-Rifting Divine Weapon.

At any cost.

As an inner disciple, Li Fan was naturally required to contribute as well.

Like the other disciples, his task was to absorb insights from the wooden sword and channel them into a Sword Embryo—a type of primal stone.

One by one, countless primal stones infused with their sword comprehension were thrown into the massive crater at the back of the Heavenly Sword Sect.

Using molten flames, they forged the prototype of the World-Rifting Divine Weapon.

No one knew the true purpose of this divine weapon, but Senior Brother Situ Yao held immense authority, and the unparalleled power displayed by Mr. Bai had left the entire Heavenly Sword Sect in awe.

Thus, the disciples held no resentment toward this endeavor.

On the contrary, by comprehending the wooden sword’s mysteries, they could elevate their own cultivation and mastery of the sword. So why not?

And just like that, time passed swiftly.

Before Li Fan could fully savor the experience, the journey through the Fallen Immortal Realm had already come to an end.

As the surrounding scene faded, Li Fan found himself back in the warped, transparent bubble of space.

The three visions before him had dimmed and were no longer selectable.

However, he did not immediately leave. Instead, he silently reflected on everything he had witnessed in the Heavenly Sword Sect.

"Based on the timeline, the [Heaven Sword Sect's Divine Refinement] happened after [Ningyuan's Acquisition of the Longevity Fruit] but before the [Beast-Taming Sect’s Upheaval]."

"I never expected that the creation of the World-Rifting Divine Weapon was also Mr. Bai’s directive… Raising a Rift Whale, forging a World-Rifting Divine Weapon…"

"What exactly is Mr. Bai planning?"

"On the surface, it seems like he is preparing for an impending catastrophe, creating multiple contingencies and backup plans. But is that truly the case?"

Judging others by oneself, Li Fan always felt that behind everything Mr. Bai did, there might be other unknown secrets.

However, Mr. Bai was an extremely mysterious figure. His thoughts were not something that Li Fan could fathom at his current level.

After pondering for a long time, Li Fan still came up empty-handed and had no choice but to set it aside for now.

"Within the Fallen Immortal Realm, there is also a condensation of the Sword Dao’s laws. If I could take it out of the Fallen Immortal Realm, what kind of consequences would it bring?"

Back in the mortal small world, Li Fan had conducted a similar experiment before.

He understood that in the natural order, two identical heavenly treasures could not exist.

If, for some special reason, two did come into existence, then eventually, they would merge and elevate each other.

The weaker one would vanish, while the stronger one would remain.

"Although the wooden sword in Shuo Feng’s hands is said to be a wonder of the heavens, I have always felt that the one Mr. Bai wielded thousands of years ago was its complete form."

"After enduring a thousand years of trials and tribulations, its power may have weakened."

"So if I can take the wooden sword out, wouldn’t that mean..."

"Interesting."

Imagining the moment when Shuo Feng suddenly lost his foundational treasure, Li Fan shook his head slightly.

"I’m thinking too far ahead. I should first see what I’ve gained this time."

Leaving the Fallen Immortal Mirror and returning to the Longevity Valley, Li Fan carefully recalled everything he had witnessed in the Heavenly Sword Sect.

Moments later, a trace of disappointment appeared on his face.

"I didn't fulfill my obsession, so I can't bring back my insights after all..."

"Wait a moment..."

Li Fan's eyes gleamed. With a flick of his fingers, countless streaks of blue sword light flashed through the void in front of the meditation chamber.

Fixing his gaze on the continuously flickering [Heaven-Shattering Heart Sword], a familiar sensation surged in his heart.

"So that’s how it is. Although memories and insights cannot be brought back to the real world, the traces of enlightenment still remain."

"It’s like the ebb and flow of tides—though they return to the sea, they leave their marks on the shore."

"In this way, even if I don’t directly obtain comprehension, it is still immensely beneficial for me to deduce divine abilities. It’s as if I’ve inexplicably gained a great deal of proficiency."

Feeling a surge of joy, Li Fan immersed himself in comprehending the Sword Dao while the familiar sensation still lingered.

Time passed unknowingly.

It was only when a message from Fang Zaiji arrived that Li Fan was pulled back to reality.

It turned out that his secluded cultivation had already lasted for more than half a year. The white robe and folding fan—protective artifacts he had instructed Fang Zaiji to craft—had finally been completed.

"Truly, in cultivation, time is meaningless," Li Fan sighed softly, but he did not rush to leave.

Instead, he first checked the situation in the Fallen Immortal Realm.

Compared to the previous two times, the duration of his [Heavenly Sword Sect Training] seemed significantly longer.

Even after half a year had passed, there were still about five months remaining before he could re-enter.

"Could it be because I came into contact with a higher level of power?"

Li Fan speculated in his heart.

Without dwelling on it too much, he simply memorized the next entry point and then exited seclusion, where he was greeted by the excited and immensely proud Fang Zaiji.

"Haha! Sect Master, I really outdid myself this time! The artifacts I’ve crafted—even someone like Liu San wouldn’t be able to easily break through their defenses!"

Chapter 684: The Peerless Elegant Young Master

“That’s because the Young Master urgently needs these items. I was afraid that if I used my full strength, I might accidentally destroy them,” Liu San glared at Fang Zaiji before turning to Li Fan and explaining.

“But Young Master, to be fair, Old Fang really put effort into refining these treasures this time. They are indeed well-crafted.”

Hearing Liu San’s words, Fang Zaiji beamed with joy. “Of course! The Sect Master lent me the Medicine King True Cauldron for research for such a long time. Naturally, I should have gained something from it.”

…

Watching the two bicker, Li Fan smiled slightly.

“Mr. Fang, aren’t you going to show me the treasures? I must say, I’m rather eager to see them.” The one who spoke, however, was not Li Fan himself, but his clone, Xu Bai.

While Li Fan’s true self had spent the past six months exploring the Fallen Immortal Realm and comprehending the Dao of the Sword, Xu Bai had remained in the Beast Realm, continuing to comprehend the principles of the Five Elements and the World’s Laws.

This body was highly compatible with the Beast Realm, making cultivation exceptionally easy. His talent was no less than that of any so-called prodigy.

The two had long been accustomed to the existence of the clone, so when Xu Bai suddenly appeared in the secret chamber, neither Liu San nor Fang Zaiji found it surprising.

“Young Master, please take a look.”

With a proud expression, Fang Zaiji waved his hand, and four spheres of light immediately appeared before them.

Within the spheres of light were a white robe, a folding fan, a scented pouch, and a jade pendant.

“The Pure Glaze Robe is crafted from rare materials such as Hundred-Color Glaze and Floating Life Pure Light. It remains untainted by dust and untouched by calamities. Conventional attacks below the Dao Integration Realm can be completely ignored. Even cultivators at the Dao Integration level would need considerable effort to break through its defenses.”

“The Shadowless Hundred-Flower Fan is refined from Shadowless Stone and Heavenly Hollow Jade. The folding fan is adorned with a painting of a hundred blooming flowers, but in reality, it seals hundreds of actual flowers within it. The wielder can freely select and mix floral fragrances at will. More importantly, in times of crisis, the fan can create a phantom illusion that attracts the enemy’s attention while the true body silently escapes a hundred miles away…”

“The Thousand-Knot Silk Pouch—aside from its standard storage function, it can also capture female cultivators of interest. Through the Thousand-Knot Love Web, their minds will gradually change over time. Even if they were once mortal enemies, they would eventually come to love the owner of the pouch with unwavering devotion.”

Fang Zaiji spoke enthusiastically, unable to contain his excitement.

Li Fan and Liu San, on the other hand, exchanged odd glances.

“The last item, the Heavenly Treasure Carriage Token—one’s mode of transportation is just as important as their appearance. Simply flying with sword flight like an ordinary cultivator would be far too lacking in style. Within this carriage token are over a hundred different types of flying carriages and vessels. Every time you go out, you’ll be spoiled for choice.”

“Each flying treasure has a spacious interior. Even if you bring along a dozen or twenty ladies, it will still be more than sufficient…”

Cough, cough. “Mr. Fang, that will do.”

Li Fan’s expression twitched, while Xu Bai, his clone, helplessly interrupted.

Fang Zaiji finally noticed the slightly awkward atmosphere. Taking the hint, he wisely shifted to guiding Xu Bai on how to refine these four treasures.

“By refining them with your blood essence and divine sense, not only will the treasures recognize you as their master, but when you suffer serious injuries, these four treasures can collectively share the damage.”

…

After half a day, Xu Bai had successfully refined all the treasures.

He now wore the white robe, held the folding fan, and had the scented pouch as a small ornament hanging from the end of the fan. The jade pendant rested on his body.

Whoosh!

Xu Bai opened the fan with a gentle flick, waving it slightly. A soft white glow enveloped him, while a faint fragrance emanated around him.

“What an elegant and refined young master,” Liu San’s eyes brightened as he couldn’t help but praise.

As the saying goes, "A man is judged by his attire." Xu Bai was already exceptionally handsome, with an outstanding demeanor. Now, adorned with the magical artifact meticulously designed by Fang Zaiji, he appeared almost otherworldly, leaving those who beheld him momentarily dazed.

Fang Zaiji couldn't help but sigh in admiration.

However, after a moment, he furrowed his brows. "But I still feel like something is missing."

Liu San was puzzled. "Missing what? I think it's already perfect."

Fang Zaiji suddenly realized something and clapped his hands. "They say a hero is best accompanied by a beauty. With how celestial the young master’s clone looks, it would be a shame if there were no beauties by his side!"

Liu San, who usually enjoyed contradicting Fang Zaiji, surprisingly nodded in agreement this time.

"Heh."

Xu Bai chuckled but did not respond.

After admiring Xu Bai’s striking appearance for a while, Li Fan finally shifted to more pressing matters. "How is the disciples’ secular world integration plan progressing?"

Liu San regained his focus and replied seriously, "Over the past six months, nearly two hundred disciples have left the Longevity Valley. Following your instructions, Young Master, they have infiltrated various regions, lying low."

"While spreading information about the Heavenly Spirit Flower, they are also gathering any noteworthy intelligence. Through the [Great Dream of Spring and Autumn Formation], all findings are transmitted back to our sect’s headquarters in Longevity Valley."

"I’ve also established a specialized organization to systematically categorize and analyze this information, extracting useful insights..."

When it came to this matter, Liu San was indeed reliable. Without Li Fan needing to micromanage, everything was organized and executed flawlessly.

Hearing this, Li Fan was very pleased. He reminded, "Very good. Our disciples should not seek merit, only ensure they make no mistakes. In their daily activities, they should blend in as ordinary cultivators of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, prioritizing their own safety above all."

Liu San nodded in acknowledgment.

"However..." He hesitated, looking at Li Fan.

"Speak freely, Elder Liu."

"With so many disciples entering the secular world, manpower within Longevity Valley is becoming stretched thin. Should the Young Master consider awakening more people?" Liu San tentatively suggested.

Li Fan pondered for a moment before ultimately shaking his head. "We currently don’t have any surplus cultivation techniques. Even if we awaken more people, it would only bring unnecessary trouble without much benefit."

"The exotic beasts in the Beast Realm, however, can be put to use for now. With my clone suppressing that realm, they won’t dare harbor any rebellious thoughts."

"Everything must be done step by step. The revival of our Medicine King Sect is not something to be rushed."

Liu San nodded slowly in understanding.

"But it won’t be long now. On this trip, barring any unexpected circumstances, I should be able to obtain a batch of unclaimed cultivation techniques. Elder Liu, just be patient," Li Fan reassured.

After issuing a few more careful instructions, both his main body and his clone, Xu Bai, left Longevity Valley.

After passing through the white mist barrier, they went their separate ways.

Li Fan, altering his appearance to that of a middle-aged cultivator, headed straight for Qihong Isle in Leyang Prefecture.

Meanwhile, his clone, Xu Bai, leisurely made his way toward the Tianling Prefecture.

Now, let’s first discuss the main body’s journey.

Li Fan’s objective in Leyang Prefecture was none other than Ximen Yu, an expert in studying changes in ancient and modern topography.

Ximen Yu possessed a detailed comparison of the past and present geographical differences of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Li Fan intended to use this information to visit the ancient Sacred Beast Mountain of the Nanming.

His goal was to confirm whether the demonic beast race’s retreat plan had been successful.

Chapter 685: The Withered Branch Appears in Yueyang

Although, according to Xiao Hei’s memories and the dying words of Red Nine-Headed, the demonic beast race should have successfully retreated.

However, since this information has been relayed through multiple people, there is inevitably some distortion.

It’s better to see it with one's own eyes.

If the demon race, under the leadership of Emperor Yi, can truly pass through the Nanming Sacred Beast Mountain and break through the world's boundary into the void—

Then it would prove that the Heavenly Sword Sect had also accomplished the same in the past.

Perhaps, the next step in the Fallen Immortal Realm should focus on researching how to obtain the forging methods of world-rifting divine weapons.

Not only would this provide a means of retreat for oneself,

but such a secret technique would surely be of great interest to both the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association.

Leyang Prefecture is located in the southwest of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, not too far from the four central prefectures.

Within its territory lies a great lake, named Yueyang Lake.

The prefecture derives its name from the lake.

According to legend, at sunrise every day, a magnificent scene unfolds—

a crimson sun leaps from the depths of the lake.

In that moment, the Solar Qi is far denser than in other regions.

Absorbing and comprehending it for just a short while is equivalent to days of arduous cultivation.

Thus, many cultivators have gathered along the shores of Yueyang Lake.

Moreover, the lake is rich in resources—

the fish in its waters, nourished daily by the dense Solar Qi, have become extraordinary.

Their flesh is exceptionally delicious, and consuming them is akin to swallowing fire-attribute spiritual stones, filling one’s body with warmth.

Thanks to this great lake, even cultivators of mediocre talent can advance rapidly.

Of course, such a fortunate place naturally draws envy from the world.

To prevent outsiders from seizing their resources, the cultivators of Yueyang Prefecture formed an alliance, claiming the vast majority of Yueyang Lake for themselves.

Foreign cultivators who come seeking its riches can only compete for the lower-quality areas left for them.

After more than ten days of travel, Li Fan finally entered Leyang Prefecture.

Instantly, he sensed several gazes falling upon him.

However, upon seeing that Li Fan was not heading toward Yueyang Lake, they gradually withdrew their surveillance.

Ignoring these people, Li Fan flew toward Qihong Isle.

Qihong Isle lies along a tributary that feeds into Yueyang Lake—Jinsha River.

Whenever the sun rises over Yueyang Lake and Solar Qi erupts,

Jinsha River shimmers with golden waves.

It is considered the afterglow of pure Solar Qi, yet for some unknown reason, it carries traces of baleful Qi, making it impossible for cultivators to absorb.

As a result, very few cultivators visit this place, making it one of the quieter regions in Yueyang Prefecture.

Ximen Yu's name is fairly well known in this area.

It didn't take Li Fan much effort to find his cave dwelling.

From a distance, he could already hear Ximen Yu’s loud complaints:

"How many times do I have to tell you?! If you want a complete copy of Study of Ancient and Modern Mountains and Rivers, come find me at Qihong Isle!

If you try to transmit it through the Tianxuan Mirror, it will be blocked!"

"What? You don’t believe the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance would do such a thing?

You think I’m lying to you?

You’re even threatening to report me as a fraud?"

"You damn—"

After Ximen Yu’s furious outburst ended, Li Fan finally spoke loudly:

"Is Daoist Ximen Yu present?"

"I am Han Wuyou. I have long heard of your esteemed reputation and have come to pay a visit!"

A lazy voice replied:

"Come in."

The door swung open, and Li Fan entered the cave dwelling.

It wasn’t very large and had no decorations.

The floor was littered with jade slips, paper books, and wooden tablets.

Sweeping his gaze over them, Li Fan realized that many were written in unfamiliar scripts.

"You’re here for the Study of Ancient and Modern Mountains and Rivers, aren’t you?"

Ximen Yu didn’t even lift his head, his eyes fixated on a withered tree branch growing out of the cave floor.

"That’s right."

Li Fan replied directly.

Ximen Yu casually pointed his finger, causing a paper book to fly from the cluttered floor.

"Ten thousand contribution points. Confidential. No reselling."

At the same time, a golden light, along with the book, flew toward Li Fan.

Li Fan smiled and signed the contract while tossing over ten top-grade spirit stones.

For now, he put away Study of Ancient and Modern Mountains and Rivers without reading it in detail.

Li Fan was in no hurry to leave. Instead, he asked with interest, “Fellow Daoist Ximen, why do you use paper books instead of recording on jade slips?”

Ximen Yu paused his study of the withered branch, glanced at Li Fan, and replied indifferently, “The contents recorded on jade slips can generally only last for ten thousand years. If the spiritual energy dissipates, the time is even shorter.”

“But if written with Baleful Ink on paper made from Evergreen Wood, it can last thirty to fifty thousand years without fading.”

“If inscribed directly onto Evergreen Wood, even after a hundred thousand years, it will still be clearly visible.”

Upon hearing this, Li Fan chuckled. “Fellow Daoist, your thinking is truly different from ordinary people—measuring time in tens of thousands of years…”

“In ten thousand years, who knows whether the Xuanhuang Realm will even still exist?” Li Fan sighed.

Ximen Yu suddenly turned his head, his gaze solemn.

“What do you mean by that, Daoist friend?”

Li Fan was slightly taken aback. “It was just a casual remark. What’s wrong?”

“Hmph. In that case, you may leave now.” Ximen Yu gave Li Fan another glance, then turned away without speaking further.

“Until we meet again!” Li Fan cupped his hands in farewell and was about to leave.

“Boom!”

Just as he reached the entrance of the cave mansion, he suddenly felt the ground tremble slightly.

A familiar yet unfamiliar energy appeared within Li Fan’s perception.

He couldn’t help but turn back, only to see a surge of earth-yellow energy erupting from the withered branch that Ximen Yu had been observing.

Ximen Yu seemed to have been waiting for this moment. He took out a small white jade bottle and absorbed all the yellow energy into it.

The eruption lasted for nearly half a cup of tea’s time before gradually subsiding.

Seeing his harvest, Ximen Yu revealed a satisfied smile.

“This is Earth Vein Energy?” Li Fan stepped forward and asked curiously.

Ximen Yu’s expression changed slightly. He put away the jade bottle and blocked Li Fan’s gaze from the withered branch.

“You do have some knowledge, Daoist friend. That’s right, I have completed my research on Study of Ancient and Modern Mountains and Rivers, and now I am studying Earth Veins.”

“This is a private matter, so it’s best if you don’t inquire further.” Ximen Yu’s tone was unfriendly.

Li Fan showed a hint of apology. “It was not my intention. It’s just that I feel this withered branch looks somewhat familiar.”

“Oh?” Ximen Yu was slightly stunned, and then his expression changed subtly. “Daoist friend, don’t joke with me!”

“I never speak falsehoods,” Li Fan said seriously.

“Once, in Tianling Prefecture, I encountered a similar withered branch in the wild. When I touched it, I found myself momentarily transported to an unknown space.”

“There, I saw a colossal, decaying tree standing tall, filling one’s heart with a sense of desolation. I didn’t stay long before waking from the vision.”

“The withered branch in my hand had disappeared, as if it had all been a dream.”

Li Fan sighed slightly. “This withered branch of yours resembles what I saw that day, though there are some subtle differences…”

The more Ximen Yu listened, the more surprised he looked.

By the time Li Fan finished speaking, Ximen Yu waved his hand, shutting the cave mansion’s door. Then, in a deep voice, he asked, “Fellow Daoist, where in Tianling Prefecture did you see that withered branch?”

Chapter 686: Withered Branch Transforming into an Ancient Tree

"It was in..." Li Fan furrowed his brow, seemingly trying hard to recall something.

Ximen Yu stared at him intently, listening with full concentration.

"I can't remember." After a long pause, Li Fan shrugged helplessly and said.

"You..." Ximen Yu's face stiffened. "Such a strange event—how could you forget so easily?"

His expression was filled with disbelief as he scrutinized Li Fan.

"Daoist Ximen, why don’t you tell me about this withered branch? Maybe as you talk, I might remember something," Li Fan suggested with a smile.

Upon hearing this, Ximen Yu narrowed his eyes, scanning Li Fan up and down.

Yet, Li Fan remained completely unfazed, meeting his gaze with calm composure.

Unable to gauge Li Fan’s true strength, Ximen Yu ultimately chose not to act recklessly.

He shifted slightly, revealing the withered branch he had been guarding behind him.

After a brief silence, he finally spoke: "As for this item’s origins, I’m not entirely sure myself. Back then, my research on the earth veins had reached a bottleneck."

"Under the rule of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, the power of the earth veins is tightly sealed by a protective formation that covers the entire region. Without proper authorization, attempting to tap into or study it is extremely difficult. I tried many methods, but I couldn't find a breakthrough. Just as I was considering switching to a different research direction..."

"About two years ago, the power of the earth veins in this area suddenly erupted. It was as if a catastrophic disaster had occurred thousands of miles away, one capable of annihilating an entire province, triggering a chain reaction. Seeing this rare opportunity, I seized the chance to absorb the overflowing power of the earth veins."

"And this withered branch—this is what I discovered within the energy of the earth veins."

Ximen Yu spoke slowly, while Li Fan listened, deep in thought.

"Two years ago... that was around the time of the Crimson Flame Burning Sea incident. Could it be that Hongxi, in his attempt to force out the hidden Crimson Flame within the earth veins, caused this disturbance by forcefully extracting its power?"

The Xuanhuang Earth Veins are interconnected—though separated by vast distances, they can still influence one another. In the past, in the Congyun Sea, there was a sunken island that emerged from the ocean due to the distant event of "A Hundred Mountains Flattening into Plains."

The seismic activity Ximen Yu observed here might very well be the residual shockwaves from the battle with the Crimson Flame back then.

Looking at the withered branch, which was still continuously emitting a yellowish-brown energy from the earth veins, Li Fan asked with some confusion:

"The power of the earth veins is supposed to be pure and pristine. How could a withered branch be mixed into it? Ordinary trees would be crushed into dust within mere moments in the depths of the earth veins due to the immense pressure. What exactly is the origin of this branch? Not only has it endured in the earth veins, but it can also draw upon and absorb the suppressed energy within?"

Li Fan then turned his gaze toward Ximen Yu once more.

"I assume the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance hasn’t detected the disturbances in the earth veins here yet? If they had, considering this concerns the safety of their grand protective formation, they would have definitely sent people to eliminate this hidden threat."

Ximen Yu’s expression shifted slightly, but he did not deny it.

"This withered branch does indeed possess some kind of mysterious power. It seems to be of the same origin as the earth veins, so my small-scale extractions for research have only been perceived as natural fluctuations of the earth veins themselves."

The withered branch’s emission of earth vein energy seemed intermittent, following a specific pattern. At this moment, the outflow was gradually weakening until finally, no more energy seeped out.

Ximen Yu carefully stored the jade bottle containing the branch.

"Of the same origin as the earth veins?" Li Fan pondered over these words carefully.

Ximen Yu then retrieved a stone tablet from his storage ring. It appeared to have been separated from an ancient rock wall, bearing extremely old marks.

The carvings on it were abstract, but the general depiction was still somewhat understandable.

Countless tiny dots represented humanity. They worshiped and lived upon the earth.

Meanwhile, beneath the surface, an inverted great tree grew.

Its roots spread densely, anchoring themselves into every corner of the land.

Yet its crown extended deep underground, reaching the very core of the earth.

“This is something I discovered in a geological fault while studying the changes in ancient and modern landforms. It should be a relic left behind by an ancient mortal civilization.”

“And it’s not just this mural. I have found similar ancient records in various places across the Xuanhuang Realm.”

“I suspect that what we call the earth’s spiritual veins are actually derived from the roots of this ancient tree. And this withered branch I have belongs to that very tree.”

Ximen Yu explained.

“Although the information left behind by mortals is extremely simplistic, and their perspective may not reveal the full truth, it is precisely because it comes from mortals that we cultivators often choose to ignore it. As a result, records that should have been erased have instead managed to survive.” Ximen Yu sneered.

“The Tree of Earth’s Veins…” Li Fan stroked his chin.

“No, that’s not right.” Suddenly, he shook his head.

“It’s very similar to what I once saw in an illusion, but there were still some differences.” Li Fan said with certainty.

Ximen Yu was not surprised. After thinking for a moment, he said, “It’s possible that the ancient tree you saw was even older.”

“It might even be the origin of the Tree of Earth’s Veins.”

Li Fan was astonished. “The Tree of Earth’s Veins has an origin?”

Ximen Yu took out several black stones from somewhere, crushed them, and scattered the powder onto the withered branch planted in the ground. The black powder was quickly absorbed, and the branch seemed to regain some vitality.

“It is said that in the beginning, there was only a single Mother Tree that governed the lifespans of all living beings.”

“Then, a great catastrophe occurred, and the Mother Tree suffered severe damage. Some of its branches broke off and fell into the world.”

“One of them became the ancient Tree of Earth’s Veins.”

Ximen Yu gazed at the carefully nurtured withered branch with deep affection as he spoke slowly.

A sharp glint flashed in Li Fan’s eyes. “Where did you learn of this, Daoist Ximen? I have never heard of such a thing.”

Ximen Yu kept his gaze fixed on the withered branch and did not answer.

Li Fan paused, then nodded slightly.

“Ah, after hearing you say this, I seem to recall something. Back then, I encountered that withered branch right here.”

Casually, he sketched out a map of Tianling Prefecture and marked a location.

Only then did Ximen Yu shift his focus from the branch and firmly memorize the location before erasing the map.

“Times have changed. Over the years, I have revisited that place many times, but I have never been able to find that withered tree again. Daoist Ximen, you should not place too much hope on this.” Li Fan cautioned.

Ximen Yu chuckled, “Such a rare object can only be found by chance, not sought after. But I’ve always been lucky. Once I finish my research on the Theory of Earth’s Veins, I will definitely try my luck.”

“Then allow me to wish you success in advance!” Li Fan cupped his fists in salute, preparing to leave.

“Han Wuyou, was it?” Ximen Yu tossed a communication talisman over. “I feel like there’s some fate between us. Keep this. Perhaps we’ll meet again in the future.”

Li Fan stored the talisman away and did not linger.

Once his figure disappeared, the doors of the cave mansion closed once more.

Ximen Yu furrowed his brows deeply. “In Heaven and Earth stands the Ruòmu tree, by day and night it wanes yet fosters eternal life…”

“Could it still exist in this world?”

Chapter 687: Rift-Rending Grand Vortex

Li Fan left Qihong Isle and took out Study of Ancient and Modern Mountains and Rivers.

With a sweep of his divine sense, he flipped through its pages. In just a few breaths, he had read the entire contents.

A ball of flame leaped from his hand, reducing the book to ashes.

Li Fan gazed toward the southeast.

"The Extreme South... has shifted to the southeast, huh? The changes between ancient and modern times are truly unfathomable."

"What Ximen Yu said before was indeed true. Over millions of years, the Xuanhuang Realm has actually expanded as a whole. Some places have completely vanished, while others have emerged out of thin air..."

"The once-sacred Nanming Sacred Beast Mountain has now transformed into a deep-sea vortex that connects to the endless ocean."

"According to Ximen Yu’s investigations, the Sacred Beast Mountain no longer exists. However..."

A sharp gleam flashed in Li Fan’s eyes.

Around the grand whirlpool, a ring of islands coiled like a dead giant serpent.

"This must be the red snake I saw back in the Fallen Immortal Realm, the one that wrapped around Nanming Sacred Beast Mountain."

"If even it has perished, then the demonic beast race's journey when they left the Xuanhuang Realm might not have been as smooth as they had hoped."

Li Fan flew toward Tiancheng of Yueyang Prefecture.

On the way, he reverted to his original appearance. As a guest official of the Xuan Clan, he held a Level 30 authority, granting him free access to the Long-Distance Teleportation Formation.

Originally, traveling through conventional teleportation formations would have taken at least half a month.

With the Long-Distance Teleportation Formation, he could arrive in just half a day.

Upon reaching Yueyang Tiancheng, he entered the inside of Immortal Ancestor’s Statue Hall. The attending reception staff verified Li Fan's identity and were slightly startled.

They then respectfully led Li Fan to the teleportation formation chamber.

Moreover, he was given priority over the cultivators ahead of him in the queue—the formation was activated for him first.

The cultivators who had been bypassed showed little resentment. Realizing that Li Fan’s status was extraordinary, they only revealed curiosity and envy in their gazes.

A slight dizziness washed over him. In the next instant, Li Fan arrived at Lingxu Prefecture, where the deep-sea grand vortex resided.

"Hmm?"

As he stepped out of the teleportation formation and adjusted to the anomalies in his body, he sensed something unusual.

He had used Long-Distance Teleportation Formation before.

Since the process involved crossing multiple prefectures and passing through many layers of Devouring Essence White Mist barriers, it typically resulted in more than just dizziness and discomfort.

The loss of lifespan from the journey was also quite noticeable—like a part of himself being extracted, leaving behind a faint sense of emptiness.

But this time…

Li Fan checked his [Truth] Interface for his current age.

"It's not an illusion. My lifespan hasn't decreased significantly."

"Has the Devouring Essence White Mist weakened, or has the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance improved the Long-Distance Teleportation Formation technology?"

Recalling his previous experience crossing the White Mist from Longevity Valley, Li Fan pondered.

"The Devouring Essence White Mist is still effective. Then what does this mean...?"

He also remembered that the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance had been secretly dispatching personnel into the White Mist, seemingly searching for something.

"It seems that, apart from the Samantabhadra True Boat, the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance may have found another way to counter the Devouring Essence White Mist."

"What exactly is hidden within the White Mist?"

In an instant, Li Fan recalled the Chizha Abyss he had seen in his previous life and the many Lost Maze Zone rumored to be concealed within the White Mist.

"Wait a moment."

Li Fan suddenly halted his steps.

Because he recalled the time when he had encountered the Inverted Monster and comprehended the "Chaos" Character on the Broken Stone within that mysterious zone.

"Could it be that my use of the 'Chaos' Character back then led the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance to delve deep into the White Mist?"

Li Fan's thoughts raced.

"It's not impossible. However, under normal circumstances, the initial investigation should have been focused within the Xuanhuang Realm. Yet, they directly set their sights on the depths of the White Mist."

"Does that mean they've already searched the Xuanhuang Realm and found nothing? Or..."

"Has the 'Chaos' character appeared before, and its origin is actually within the White Mist?"

"If that’s truly the case, what does it imply?"

Li Fan couldn't help but fall into deep contemplation.

The Dao Deviation Stone emitted a dazzling blue light as he continuously deduced various possibilities.

Yet, his body never stopped moving, flying swiftly toward the great vortex.

Before long, the increasingly dense and violent water-element spiritual energy in the air reminded Li Fan that he was approaching his destination.

"Hiss..."

A sharp pain snapped Li Fan out of his thoughts.

"The spiritual energy here is rather strange," he frowned slightly.

With his current physique, merely absorbing a trace of this violent water-element energy caused unbearable pain—

as if countless sharp blades were cutting through his body from the inside.

Li Fan temporarily sealed his body's pores to block the influx of external spiritual energy. He then captured a wisp of it in his palm, carefully analyzing it.

"Not only is its nature violent and difficult for cultivators to absorb, but it also naturally contains the attribute of 'Rend'..."

"No wonder this region is sparsely populated. The closer one gets to the great vortex, the more desolate it becomes."

Li Fan continued flying toward his destination, noticing that the surrounding spiritual energy was becoming even sharper.

"Whoosh!"

During his flight, the astral winds slashed against his face, causing stinging pain.

He had no choice but to form a protective layer of spiritual energy around himself.

"Luckily, I have the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven, forming a self-sustaining cycle within my body. If it were an ordinary cultivator, they’d likely deplete their spiritual energy in no time."

Sensing the rapid consumption of spiritual energy within him, Li Fan was secretly alarmed.

Thus, he continued to fly at full speed.

After the time it takes for an incense stick to burn, he finally saw the grand, surging Deep Sea Vortex and the serpent-shaped island coiled beside it.

Rather than approaching immediately, he observed from a distance.

For a moment, it felt as if he had returned to thousands of years ago—when the beast clans had collectively retreated from this place.

"This vortex must be an anomaly caused by the collapse of the Sacred Beast Mountain and the Rifting of Realms."

"Even after thousands of years, it has yet to subside. This alone shows how catastrophic the event must have been. Is this not also a form of damage inflicted upon the Xuanhuang Realm?"

At this thought, Li Fan suddenly had an epiphany.

"Every group that forcefully leaves this realm is like cutting an opening in the great balloon of the Xuanhuang Realm, which is already on the verge of being devoured by the Immortal Ruins."

"Naturally, those within the realm wouldn't allow it once they discovered the truth."

"They would inevitably try to stop it. That Red Serpent—perhaps it perished in battle for this very reason."

"Then what about the Heavenly Sword Sect? Was it because they were one of the Ten Great Immortal Sects that no one confronted them? Or...

"Was it that those who left with the World-Rifting Divine Weapon were not only members of the Heavenly Sword Sect?"

"Or perhaps, after the Heavenly Sword Sect departed, the other cultivators of the Ten Great Immortal Sects only realized it too late?"

Li Fan's thoughts remained turbulent, making him even more eager for his next journey to the Fallen Immortal Realm.

"The greater the turmoil, the deeper my Dao enlightenment!"

"This place... shall be my proving ground for ascension!"

Suddenly, amidst the howling gales stirred by the great vortex, a series of wild, frenzied shouts faintly reached Li Fan’s ears.

Chapter 688: Rift-Refined Demon Body

Li Fan followed the direction of the sound and looked over. At the very center of the massive vortex, where wind and thunder clashed violently, stood a cultivator with a bare upper body, his frame lean but covered with tempered, powerful muscles. He was roaring toward the sky in fury.

Around him, countless tiny tornadoes could be faintly seen swirling. At the heart of the whirlwind, an abyssal darkness loomed, as if space itself had been torn apart.

The burly man drifted with the wind, the miniature tornadoes flickering in and out of existence in sync with his movements.

Even from a considerable distance away from the vortex’s core, Li Fan could feel the fierce winds slicing painfully against his skin. Yet, at the very heart of the storm, that muscular cultivator had no protective measures at all. He simply let the raging gales slam against his body, producing crisp, metallic collision sounds.

"That man is..."

Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

Though it was their first time meeting in this life, in his previous life, he had once crossed paths with this individual.

It was Dongfang Yao, the one who had overseen the construction of the Tianxuan Spirit-Locking Formation in the Ten-Thousand-Mile Scorching Sand Flats and Transformation Spirit Ravine. He was a close confidant of Huangfu Song and had already reached the Soul Transformation realm at that time.

However, it seemed that in this life, he had yet to break through that threshold and was still at the Nascent Soul stage.

"Interesting. No spiritual energy fluctuations at all, yet he can withstand the gales purely through his formidable physical body. If I recall correctly, body-refining techniques in the Xuanhuang Realm are limited by the world's natural laws, making progress extremely slow past a certain point. I wonder how he managed to refine himself to this level..."

Li Fan did not rashly approach but instead observed Dongfang Yao from a distance, contemplating his insights.

The violent winds howled as the vortex's currents grew even more turbulent. Dongfang Yao attempted to steady himself within the storm, pushing toward the vortex’s core. Each step forward caused his body to emit ominous creaking noises, as if he were being compressed by immense pressure.

"Hmph!"

Dongfang Yao let out a deep roar, the veins on his neck bulging as a faint golden glow enveloped his muscles.

With unwavering resolve, he continued advancing toward the vortex’s center.

Suddenly, a black rift, resembling a bolt of lightning, appeared out of nowhere before Dongfang Yao. It was as if a sword had descended from the void, slashing directly across his body.

"Boom!"

A deafening explosion resounded, its force so immense that it pierced through the storm and rain. A fresh wound split open across Dongfang Yao's body, forcing him several steps back.

Yet, instead of fear, his expression showed excitement.

"I've finally been waiting for you!"

With a strange shout, the grievous wound on Dongfang Yao’s body healed in an instant. He stomped hard against the void, and in a sudden burst of energy, he leaped forward dozens of feet in an instant.

A colossal black rift loomed ahead. It was unclear whether it had just appeared or had always been there, hidden since ancient times, beyond the sight of ordinary beings.

A black radiance, sharp as a sword, slashed straight down Dongfang Yao’s midline.

"Pfft!"

Dongfang Yao's flesh was instantly torn apart, nearly splitting him open from chest to abdomen. His body was flung backward, retreating a thousand feet in the blink of an eye, returning to the outer perimeter of the vortex where it was relatively safe.

"Are you alright, Fellow Daoist?"

Seeing this, Li Fan called out at the right moment.

Without approaching, he flicked over a healing pill—a Hundred-Heal Pill, specially prepared for him by Liu San before this expedition. Though not quite a miraculous panacea that could revive the dead or regrow lost limbs, it was still an exceptional healing medicine. For ordinary injuries, it could heal completely within just a few breaths.

Dongfang Yao reached out and caught the Hundred-Healing Pill. With just a glance, he swallowed it whole.

"This is nothing! Many thanks for your concern, fellow Daoist!" As he spoke, the originally severe wounds on his body had already healed completely.

Not even a scar remained.

While part of the credit belonged to the Hundred-Healing Pill, the greater reason was Dongfang Yao's exceptionally strong physique.

Li Fan couldn’t help but take notice.

"How should I address you, fellow Daoist?" Dongfang Yao temporarily halted his training amidst the wind and rain, soaring over to Li Fan’s side.

"I am Li Fan. I heard of the Grand Vortex Phenomenon in Lingxu Prefecture, so I passed by to witness it for myself. I never expected to meet such an extraordinary individual like you, fellow Daoist!" Li Fan's gaze swept over Dongfang Yao’s well-defined muscles, his eyes filled with admiration.

"My name is Dongfang Yao!" He waved his hand dismissively. "I’m not extraordinary, just a bit sturdier than most!"

"Fellow Daoist Dongfang, you are being far too modest. With such an incredibly strong body, even the legendary body cultivators of ancient times might not compare to you!" Li Fan clicked his tongue in amazement.

Dongfang Yao burst into laughter. "Now, that’s something I like to hear..."

Just as he was about to continue speaking, he suddenly turned his head and looked toward the center of the Grand Vortex.

Amidst the roaring wind and thunder, a dark shadow seemed to surface once again.

"Fellow Daoist, wait here for a moment. I’ll be right back!"

His voice still echoed in the air as his figure shot toward the whirlpool’s core like a bolt of lightning.

A series of deafening explosions and collisions resounded once more.

A few breaths later, Dongfang Yao returned, covered in fresh blood and looking rather battered.

This time, however, Li Fan did not take out another Hundred-Healing Pill. Instead, he quietly observed Dongfang Yao heal himself.

His injuries were even more severe than before, but with just a bit more effort, he had fully recovered once again.

"So I worried for nothing and wasted a top-grade pill," Li Fan remarked in feigned exasperation.

"Haha, it wasn’t wasted! I still have it stored in my stomach!" Dongfang Yao smugly patted his abdomen and laughed.

Li Fan was momentarily stunned before shaking his head with a wry smile. "You truly are a fascinating person, fellow Daoist."

Dongfang Yao simply smiled without replying.

"To remain here at the Ancient Rift’s Vortex for so long without even flinching, you must be hiding some extraordinary abilities as well, Daoist Li," Dongfang Yao said meaningfully after a moment of contemplation.

A trace of helplessness appeared on Li Fan’s face. "The Xuanhuang Realm is riddled with dangers. Without some means of survival, how could I dare to wander about? But it’s nothing more than a quick spiritual recovery technique—not even close to comparing with your abilities, fellow Daoist."

"I’ve heard that body cultivation is extremely difficult. To reach this level, you must be a once-in-a-generation genius!" Li Fan remarked with genuine admiration.

Dongfang Yao waved off the praise, but the pride in his expression was impossible to conceal.

"It’s just that my physique is naturally a little special."

As he spoke, the dark fissure at the whirlpool’s center reappeared. Dongfang Yao halted their conversation and charged into the chaos once more.

Again, he returned with severe injuries, and again, he conversed with Li Fan after healing.

After several repetitions of this cycle, Li Fan gradually pieced together some truths from Dongfang Yao’s words.

It turned out that Dongfang Yao, much like Ye Feipeng, carried a trace of ancient beast bloodline within him.

Though diluted over thousands of years to the point of near insignificance, Dongfang Yao had once encountered a rare treasure that fully awakened the latent potential of his beast lineage.

"At first, I worried it might turn me into something neither human nor beast, but that thing... truly miraculous," Dongfang Yao sighed in amazement.

Chapter 689: The Heavenly Spirit Gives Birth to a Hundred Flowers

"It merely extracts and amplifies the effects brought by the demonic beast bloodline within me, allowing me to absorb them. It does not have any adverse impact on my body."

"My ancestors... I have no idea which demonic beast they originated from. I don’t have any special abilities, except that my body is exceptionally resistant to attacks." Dongfang Yao said with a hint of pride.

"As long as I’m not beaten to death, I can recover within just a few breaths." He patted his chest, producing a loud thud.

"The legacy of your predecessors, combined with your own good fortune. That’s not something one can simply envy." Li Fan sighed and shook his head.

"I can see that you’re not far from breaking through to the Soul Transformation Realm. Are you planning to advance here?" After a moment, Li Fan asked.

"Not at all, not at all. I am here for two reasons: first, to temper my body; and second, to comprehend the Dao of [World-Rift]." Dongfang Yao spoke confidently. "Though my defense is extremely strong, I lack offensive means. If I get into a fight, I’d be nothing more than a punching bag. How could that not be frustrating? That’s why I found this place, which is perfect for me to comprehend the Dao."

"World-Rift…" A subtle glint flashed in Li Fan's eyes.

"I’ve heard you mention this term multiple times just now. What exactly does it mean?"

Dongfang Yao shrugged. "I’m not entirely sure either. But from the vague memories I inherited from my ancestors, I know that this place holds something akin to a scar on the Xuanhuang Realm. Compared to ordinary spatial rifts, it is several times more dangerous."

"Moreover…" He paused briefly.

"Before coming here, I made some inquiries. It is said that, in this great vortex, some cultivators have occasionally witnessed an extraordinary sight."

"A massive pillar of light bursts forth from the center of the vortex, piercing through the heavens and the earth. The entire world seems to tremble slightly, and the wind and clouds shift in response."

"The magnificent scene only lasts for a few moments before disappearing. And that pillar of light, as if it never truly existed, leaves no trace behind—just like an illusion. Some say it is a Time Mirage, a phenomenon that replays a real event from thousands of years ago. I don’t quite understand it myself."

Dongfang Yao, appearing open and straightforward, told Li Fan everything he knew.

"I actually know a little about this Time Mirage," Li Fan’s gaze flickered as he explained.

"When certain conditions are met, specific events in the world get recorded and then replayed at particular moments, over and over again…"

Dongfang Yao suddenly understood. "So, you're saying that this light pillar once tore apart the Xuanhuang Realm, creating this great vortex? That’s truly astonishing! If I could comprehend even a fraction of its power…"

As he spoke, excitement flashed across Dongfang Yao’s face.

The moment another black spatial fissure appeared, he let out a loud cry and charged toward the vortex’s center.

"Nanming Sacred Beast Mountain, the World-Rifting Divine Weapon…"

"If that’s the case, then at the former site of the Heavenly Sword Sect, there should also be such a [scar] left on the Xuanhuang Realm. Perhaps I could ask Shuo Feng about it—he was the one who found the precise location of the Sword back then."

As Dongfang Yao immersed himself in comprehending the power of Rift, Li Fan did more than just observe.

His Formless Killing Intent had already locked onto Dongfang Yao.

Though his physical body was not as resilient as Dongfang Yao’s—meaning he could not recklessly charge into the vortex’s core—by observing through Dongfang Yao’s perspective, he could still closely study and perceive the power of the black rift.

"Interesting… This seems somewhat similar to the force produced when the Five Elements merge into one. No wonder a Time Mirage manifests here as well."

While Li Fan's true self was outside the Great Vortex, comprehending the Dao amidst the storm,

His clone had already arrived in Tianling City.

Xu Bai, with his peerless beauty, naturally drew attention wherever he went.

However, his cold and aloof demeanor, coupled with his extraordinary attire, made it clear that he was no ordinary person.

As a result, no cultivators dared to approach him recklessly.

He leisurely wandered through Tianling City.

Over time, the name of the Heavenly Spirit Flower had spread widely throughout the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

What was originally a niche interest, only known to a select group, had now gained widespread recognition. First, Li Fan had offered longevity treasures as a bounty for it. Then, Shuo Feng and Lu Xuejing ordered people to inquire about it, while disciples of the Medicine King Sect, dispersed across various regions, secretly fueled the trend.

With multiple forces pushing it forward, almost every cultivator, unless they lived in complete isolation, had at least heard of the Heavenly Spirit Flower.

After a prolonged collective effort, people were finally forced to accept a cruel truth—

The Heavenly Spirit Flower no longer existed in this world!

The battle between the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association had resulted in countless fallen cultivators. The entire state was soaked in unimaginable bloodshed.

The Heavenly Spirit Flower, born from the essence of heaven and earth, was naturally sensitive to such changes. Now, every flower petal carried faint traces of red blood energy.

“What an eyesore! It ruins the elegance!”

“Alas, what good does war bring? Instead of gaining anything, countless cultivators perish, and the world loses its former beauty. Peace is hard to come by—fellow Daoists, you must cherish it and not recklessly start another conflict!”

Some mourned, some reflected.

But others saw an opportunity.

"Although the original Heavenly Spirit Flower no longer exists, this particular one has only a faint trace of blood energy—almost imperceptible. Compared to the original breed, it’s not much different. If you're interested, why not take a look for yourself?"

As its fame grew, the value of the Heavenly Spirit Flower skyrocketed.

Sharp-witted cultivators seized this moment to capitalize on the hype, deliberately selecting flowers with minimal blood energy to sell.

After all, the original breed had gone extinct—seeing a lower-grade substitute wasn’t a bad alternative.

While not many were willing to spend large sums on it, the vast number of cultivators in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance meant there were always buyers.

Moreover, the Heavenly Spirit Flower had a fixed annual yield, and those with less blood energy were even rarer. This naturally led to a continuous rise in its price.

Tianling City, which had been somewhat desolate after the war, was now bustling once again.

Some came out of curiosity, hoping to witness the flower in person. Others sought to profit through speculation.

Meanwhile, the merchants selling Heavenly Spirit Flowers came up with innovative methods.

Their shops were filled with unopened Heavenly Spirit Flowers.

Customers could try their luck, gambling on how much blood energy would appear on the petals once the flower bloomed.

If fortunate enough to pick one with minimal blood energy, they could sell it immediately for several times the price.

Of course, the vast majority suffered losses.

But the world has never lacked cultivators who believed in their own luck. As a result, even unopened Heavenly Spirit Flowers became highly sought after. The flowers barely stayed on display before they were quickly sold out.

“Luck, huh…”

Xu Bai smiled slightly as he stood among the crowd.

Without much thought, he casually picked one.

“Shopkeeper, this one will do.”

After paying the spirit stones, he did not take the flower with him but patiently waited for it to bloom.

Chapter 690: Original Species of the Heavenly Spirit

Xu Bai lingered in the shop, and the owner did not stop him.

After all, with his breathtakingly exquisite appearance, Xu Bai merely standing there, doing nothing, was enough to attract the attention of passing cultivators.

Even though cultivators could reshape their appearances, and those with stunning looks were not uncommon, Xu Bai was still someone who could leave people in awe at first glance.

Moreover, the otherworldly and mysterious aura he carried only added to his allure.

Both men and women paused in the store, secretly observing Xu Bai while casually purchasing a Heavenly Spirit Flower as a cover.

Business boomed, and the shop owner was naturally overjoyed. Overwhelmed with excitement, he wished Xu Bai could stay in the store day and night.

However, that was obviously impossible.

Two days later, the Heavenly Spirit Flower Xu Bai had chosen bloomed in full splendor.

At first, no one paid much attention, as their gazes still frequently drifted toward Xu Bai.

But when Xu Bai held the flower in his palm, and people caught a glimpse of it—

A chorus of exclamations erupted.

“This is…?”

“The petals are truly red, yet tinged with an almost imperceptible pink… This can be rated as a first-grade Heavenly Spirit Flower!”

“Hiss… I heard that a first-grade Heavenly Spirit Flower recently sold for a sky-high price of 100,000 contribution points! No matter what, this one can’t be worth any less, right? But he only spent 1,000 contribution points to buy it—that’s an enormous profit!”

“Wow, not only is he beautiful, but even his luck is this good? How enviable.”

...

“So this is the power of fortune. Even without deliberate pursuit, every word and action causes things to develop in a direction beneficial to oneself"

Holding the Heavenly Spirit Flower, Xu Bai remained silent, contemplating how fortune influenced reality.

Sensing that part of his luck had been depleted, he immediately drew from the Feather of the Black Bird to replenish it.

As he returned to his senses, he noticed that the cultivators, including the shop owner, were all looking at the flower in his hands with intense excitement.

Xu Bai smiled slightly.

“No matter how beautiful one’s appearance, nothing moves the human heart more than profit.”

Then, in front of everyone, he spoke indifferently:

“First-grade? What trash.”

With that, spiritual energy surged in his palm, and in an instant, the twelve-petaled, first-grade Heavenly Spirit Flower turned to ash.

“What are you doing?!”

The crowd erupted in shock.

Although Xu Bai was the rightful owner of the flower and could dispose of it however he wished, it was still a treasure worth over 100,000 contribution points!

Destroying it so casually—while even calling it "trash"—was simply too much!

The faces of the cultivators darkened, their expressions turning grim.

One scholar-like cultivator, clutching a Heavenly Spirit Flower in his arms, stepped forward with a livid expression.

“Fellow Daoist! You may not love it, but please, do not harm it!”

“The life of a Heavenly Spirit Flower is already fleeting. In its full bloom, it should be admired and shared with the world…”

He continued speaking in righteous indignation.

“Move aside. You’re in my way.”

Xu Bai, however, simply flicked open a folding fan and effortlessly brushed the scholar to the side.

Ignoring him completely, Xu Bai walked away unhurriedly.

“You—!”

The scholar’s face flushed red with anger.

Strictly speaking, this scholar was not bad-looking, but compared to Xu Bai, he lacked a certain charm. He had already felt somewhat displeased with Xu Bai, and now, being looked down upon, jealousy and anger surged within him all at once.

"All first-grade Heavenly Spirits are trash? What an arrogant statement! You should know that unless the Original Species appears, the most beautiful Heavenly Spirits in the world are merely a few top-grade ones. Have you ever seen one yourself?" The scholar shouted at Xu Bai.

"From what I know, those few top-grade Heavenly Spirits had just bloomed and were immediately bought, gifted to various Immortal Alliance dignitaries for their viewing pleasure. Who exactly are you, and when have you ever seen one?"

The scholar was somewhat cautious, afraid of offending someone he shouldn't. His tone was restrained, carrying a hint of probing.

Xu Bai turned around upon hearing this.

With a crisp swish, he unfolded his folding fan, gently fanned himself, and shook his head with a smile. "As for those so-called top-grade Heavenly Spirits, I have never seen them either."

"Then you are just being pretentious and ignorant!" The scholar, relieved, immediately lashed out in anger.

"But in my eyes, those so-called top-grade Heavenly Spirits are nothing more than trash."

Although Xu Bai's voice was light, it fell upon everyone's ears like a thunderclap.

The scholar was momentarily stunned.

Then, overcome with rage, he let out a bitter laugh. "By your logic, then only..."

Xu Bai calmly finished his sentence for him. "That's right! Only the Original Species can truly be called a Heavenly Spirit Flower!"

As he spoke, he extended his right hand.

A translucent, paper-thin sheet—delicate as cicada wings—unfolded in his palm.

A Heavenly Spirit Flower appeared on the sheet, as vivid as if it were alive.

All seventeen of its petals were incomparably detailed, to the point where one could even see the entire flower trembling ever so slightly.

The scene instantly fell into an eerie silence.

Everyone present was well-versed in Heavenly Spirit Flowers, and the moment they laid eyes on the one in Xu Bai’s hand, it seized their full attention.

"The Original Species?"

After a brief moment, someone snapped out of their trance and cried out in shock.

"What?! That’s the Original Species!"

"The absolute pinnacle of Heavenly Spirits—worthy of its name! Compared to the Original Species, any so-called top-grade or first-grade Heavenly Spirit, if tainted with even a hint of blood, is nothing but garbage!"

…

Not only was the previously arrogant scholar stunned, but the cry of "Original Species" had also drawn the attention of nearly all the cultivators in Tianling City.

More and more cultivators rushed over upon hearing the news, staring at the Heavenly Spirit Flower in Xu Bai’s hand in a daze.

"Crash!" The scholar's pot of Heavenly Spirit Flowers fell to the ground, yet he seemed completely indifferent.

Instead, he stared at the Original Species in Xu Bai’s hand, his eyes filled with obsession as he slowly stepped closer.

Just as he was about to reach Xu Bai, Xu Bai suddenly withdrew it.

"No…!"

As if losing the most cherished thing in his life, the scholar's face contorted with madness. He lunged at Xu Bai in a frenzy.

In Immortal Alliance’s Cities, combat was strictly forbidden.

Before the towering statue of the Immortal Ancestor could even deliver its punishment, a radiant glow flickered on Xu Bai's clothes.

Xu Bai remained motionless while the scholar let out a miserable cry, violently rebounding and flying backward.

A divine light then descended from the Immortal Ancestor’s statue, instantly scorching the scholar’s body into a charred husk.

After struggling for a moment, he lost all signs of life and collapsed to the ground, dead.

The enforcement cultivators from the Martial Hall rushed over to collect the corpse. The heavenly phenomenon marking the death of a cultivator finally suppressed the restless crowd.

Xu Bai clasped his hands in a courteous salute to those around him before drifting away.

"It’s over. The Heavenly Spirit Flower business is finished."

The shop owner watched Xu Bai’s departing figure, his face ashen as he muttered to himself.

Glancing at the neatly arranged Heavenly Spirit Flowers in his shop, he quickly wrote a sign: "90% Clearance Sale", and hung it outside.

Chapter 691: Rift World’s Mirage

The news that an original species of the Heavenly Spirit Flower had appeared in Tianling Prefecture spread like a whirlwind throughout the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

All the cultivators who had just been admiring and playing with their so-called top-grade or first-grade Heavenly Spirit Flowers suddenly found them dull and uninteresting.

"So, an original species truly exists in this world…"

With this thought in mind, they discarded their previously prized Heavenly Spirit Flowers like worthless trash and began frantically searching for the original species.

However…

Days turned into weeks.

Despite mobilizing nearly half the forces of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, they were still unable to locate the legendary original species of the Heavenly Spirit Flower.

This led many to doubt the credibility of the rumor.

But after thorough interrogation of those cultivators who had personally witnessed the event, they finally confirmed—the news was real!

The Heavenly Spirit Flower that had appeared that day was undoubtedly the true original species.

Now, things were getting interesting.

It was known that the environment of Tianling Prefecture had changed, and no more Heavenly Spirit Flowers without blood essence could be born.

Yet, the one displayed by that mysterious white-clad cultivator was unlike any ordinary Heavenly Spirit Flower.

It appeared to be sealed within a thin piece of paper.

This led to a shocking conclusion—

Before the great battle in Tianling Continent, that white-clad cultivator had somehow preserved a seventeen-petaled Heavenly Spirit Flower!

And most crucially—

This might be the only original species left in existence!

Unlike other short-lived original species that could only appear for a few brief moments before vanishing, this one could be preserved indefinitely and taken out for viewing at any time!

The implications of this…

The value of something is determined by its rarity.

And something truly unique in the world—

Is priceless.

The world went into a frenzy, searching for the white-clad cultivator who had possessed the original Heavenly Spirit Flower that day.

Yet, to everyone’s bewilderment, after that day, this person seemed to have vanished from the face of the earth. His past was shrouded in mystery, as if he had suddenly dropped from the sky. No one knew his background or identity.

Even Dao Integration Realm cultivators attempted to divine his whereabouts using fate-tracing techniques, but they found nothing.

This led to endless speculation.

Some claimed he was a spy from the Five Elders Association, and that the Heavenly Spirit Flower original species was a fabrication meant to disrupt and destroy the newly booming Heavenly Spirit Flower market.

Others believed he might be a reclusive rogue cultivator, living in seclusion within a hidden realm. His sudden appearance and equally abrupt disappearance could mean he was waiting for the highest bidder.

As the outside world grew increasingly curious about this mysterious cultivator, Xu Bai had already returned to the Beast Realm.

His own fortune was now merged with the world’s fortune, making him one with his small world, resisting any external attempts to trace or predict him.

"Rest assured, Young Master. Since you are within this small world, the outside world’s ability to sense you is already weakened. Moreover, with both myself and Old Fang working together to conceal your heavenly fate…"

Elder Liu San stroked his beard confidently. "Unless a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign takes action personally, they will never be able to locate this place."

Xu Bai, however, wasn’t worried at all.

Besides the protective measures Elder Liu mentioned, he also had his own [Sky-Shrouding Hand] secret technique. Even Heavenly Net had been deceived, so within the current Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, no one should be able to deduce his existence.

Of course, if Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor were to personally descend just for this trivial matter—

Well, so be it.

After all, his true body was in the Great Vortex, millions of miles away, completely safe.

"Master, your strategy of ‘playing hard to get’ is truly brilliant! According to reports from our disciples outside, those people are getting desperate. They are scratching their heads in frustration, willing to offer outrageous prices just for a glimpse of the legendary original species of the Heavenly Spirit Flower!"

Fang Zaiji looked at Xu Bai with admiration, his voice filled with excitement.

"Some cultivators have even spoken out, willing to exchange a Dao Integration True Technique with the Sect Master in return for the Primal Seed. Tsk tsk…"

Xu Bai’s expression remained unchanged as he said indifferently, “No rush, let them wait a little longer.”

“The Sect Master is wise,” Fang Zaiji responded with a knowing smile.

“However, Sect Master, the commotion you caused this time is quite significant. I fear that when you go out again, the few magical treasures I crafted for you may not be able to withstand the pressure.” He suddenly furrowed his brows, expressing concern.

“If three to five Dao Integration cultivators conspire together to seize it by force, then your clone, Sect Master, would indeed be in real danger.”

Xu Bai’s face twitched slightly.

“Don’t worry, I have my own plans. Mr. Fang, you should focus on researching the True Cauldron of the Medicine King.”

Fang Zaiji chuckled before his figure flickered and disappeared.

“Elder Liu, there is something I need you to do.” After Fang Zaiji left, Xu Bai suddenly turned to Liu San.

“Young Master, please instruct me,” Liu San said solemnly.

“Find this person for me.” Xu Bai projected an image of Jiao Xiuyuan into the air.

“He has countless incarnations, with clones spread throughout the entire Xuanhuang Realm. In every state’s Heavenly City, there is a branch of the Qianli Hall where one of his clones resides. Normally, I could contact him directly, but at the moment, both my true self and my clone are preoccupied.”

“And since you do not yet have an official identity within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, you are unable to enter the Immortal Alliance’s Heavenly City. Therefore, you will have to trouble yourself by searching for him in the wilderness.”

“Focus on the ruins of ancient sects; it shouldn’t be too difficult.”

“When you find him, give him this item and tell him I have a business proposition to discuss.”

Xu Bai instructed carefully.

“Young Master, rest assured.”

After receiving the order, Liu San immediately left Longevity Valley to track down Jiao Xiuyuan.

Meanwhile, Xu Bai’s attention was mainly focused on his true self.

Lingxu Prefecture, The Great Vortex.

“Fellow Daoist, look! Could that be the Time Mirage you spoke of?”

Dongfang Yao pointed excitedly at the massive pillar of light rising from the center of the vortex.

Even though he was practically shouting at the top of his lungs, his voice was barely audible in the midst of the raging storm.

Even spiritual voice transmissions were being distorted by the twisted spiritual energy in the surroundings.

During the past few months of Dao comprehension alongside Dongfang Yao, Li Fan had sensed that something unusual was brewing within the Great Vortex.

Dongfang Yao had not noticed anything amiss, but Li Fan felt an inexplicable premonition.

Sure enough, on this very day, as Dongfang Yao was tempering his body in the black rift at the Vortex’s core, he suddenly froze in place.

The rift’s energy tore several deep wounds into his body, and blood streamed freely, yet he remained motionless.

Within the vortex, an inexplicable towering mountain suddenly appeared.

Scarlet serpents coiled around the peak.

Then, from the summit, a dazzling white light erupted—

Like the sharpest blade, it ripped through space.

It surged forth, piercing straight into the heavens.

Heaven and earth trembled, and the mountain began to crumble.

The scarlet serpents, hissing furiously, were forced to retreat.

“The World Rift… This is the true World Rift…”

Dongfang Yao stared at the breathtaking spectacle in a daze, murmuring to himself.

Meanwhile, Li Fan’s expression grew solemn.

“A Time Mirage… something that only appears once in a century, and yet, I encountered it so effortlessly…”

Chapter 692: Heading to the White Mist

“Du'e Sect…”

“They just won’t let go!” A cold glint flashed through Li Fan’s eyes.

If it had only happened once, it could be brushed off as coincidence. But for it to occur repeatedly—luck alone could no longer explain it.

It was almost certain that this was related to what Jiao Xiuyuan had mentioned: Li Fan being the so-called "Calamity-Bearing One."

However, how exactly did the Du'e Sect, lurking in the shadows like relentless flies, manage to detect and lock onto him? That was something Li Fan still had no clue about.

After all, even in the ancient cultivation world, the Du'e Sect was an incredibly mysterious existence, let alone now, thousands of years later.

“Each time the cycle resets, the Du'e Sect must also be affected. So from their perspective, I might just seem like a cultivator with a mysterious background, harboring some unknown secret. But how are they always so certain that I am their so-called Calamity-Bearing One—the one who can help them overcome disaster?”

“Could it be that aside from the [Truth], I have some other special quality? Or is it purely because the Du'e Sect’s techniques are so profound that they can foresee the future?”

Thoughts raced through Li Fan’s mind.

Regarding whether he could escape the desperate situation of the Xuanhuang Realm and attain true immortality, Li Fan, who possessed the [Truth], had absolute confidence.

Conversely, if there truly existed a savior in this doomed world, then as the only variable, "Li Fan" was undoubtedly the most likely candidate.

“But if that’s the case, Ruomu letting me go back then was probably because he foresaw the boundless slaughter I would commit, bringing unimaginable disaster upon the world of cultivators.”

“So… does my future hold both salvation and destruction?”

…

Li Fan’s contemplation was abruptly interrupted by an overwhelming burst of white light before him.

Perhaps due to the astonishing nature of the recorded images within the Time Mirage, even the fabric of reality and space seemed to have been affected.

At the moment when the Sacred Beast Mountain of the Nanming emitted its world-shattering radiance, Li Fan noticed that the already turbulent spiritual energy around him suddenly resonated in unison, trembling violently.

“Not good! Fellow Daoist Li, retreat at once!”

Dongfang Yao, who had been excited moments before, suddenly paled, his figure flickering as he rapidly retreated beyond the vortex.

Though not entirely selfish, he still found the time to call out to the dumbfounded Li Fan.

“This is…”

As Li Fan’s body drifted backward, his gaze remained fixated on the enormous vortex and the surrounding sea, where space itself seemed to be sliced into fragmented sections.

Each black spatial rift seemed to contain the ferocious shadow of a monstrous beast.

They roared. They howled.

They clawed and tore through the very fabric of space.

A myriad of beasts, working as one, sought to rip apart the Xuanhuang Realm.

In an instant, Li Fan recalled the forging of the World-Rifting Divine Weapon in the Fallen Immortal Realm by the Heavenly Sword Sect.

They had cast a [Sword Embryo], infused with the various understandings of swordsmanship from multiple cultivators, into the Divine Weapon Furnace.

This scene of the Sacred Beast Mountain's world rupture felt eerily similar in principle.

“Tsk tsk tsk, I wonder what truly happened back then. Even after a thousand years, we can still catch a glimpse of that magnificent spectacle through mere illusions.” Dongfang Yao sighed in amazement.

The dazzling white pillar of light lasted for the time it takes to finish half a cup of tea.

Then, it vanished abruptly without a sound.

The stark contrast between the intense brilliance and the sudden darkness made the world seem as if it had plunged into twilight in Li Fan’s eyes.

With the disappearance of the Time Mirage, the tempest surrounding the massive vortex also began to calm, as if it had entered a period of silence after a great battle, slowly gathering its strength once more.

“What a pity. Who knows how long it will be before another rift appears?” Dongfang Yao said regretfully.

“But from the looks of it, Fellow Daoist, you seem to have gained some insights.” Li Fan smiled.

Dongfang Yao waved his hand dismissively. “Gaining insights from a wondrous scene is always beneficial. But my comprehension is still far from matching the true might of that world rift. It’s a shame this place isn’t like the [Mortal Ascension to God Wall], which appears at a fixed location and time. Here, it’s purely a matter of luck.”

“I once studied the Mortal Ascension to God Wall over and over, and eventually managed to form my Golden Core using four different methods. But unfortunately, my comprehension is limited, and I could not glean anything further from it.” A hint of nostalgia flashed in Dongfang Yao’s eyes.

“The Mortal Ascension to God Wall.” Li Fan’s heart stirred.

It was another Time Mirage, recording the transformation of Mr. Bai from a mere mortal into a Godhood in a single step.

Li Fan had long heard of it.

However, due to lingering doubts, he had never gone to observe it personally.

His main concern was whether Mr. Bai, who was hailed as "the kindest man in the world," was truly as benevolent as he appeared—and whether he was still alive today.

From Li Fan’s repeated experiences in the Fallen Immortal Realm, it was clear that Mr. Bai had achieved a level of mastery close to that of an immortal.

If such a figure still existed somewhere in the Xuanhuang Realm, then even seeing him through the recorded images of the Mortal Ascension to God Wall might be no different from encountering him in reality.

What consequences that might bring—no one could say for sure.

Until he uncovered Mr. Bai’s true nature, Li Fan dared only to observe his “past” through the Fallen Immortal Realm.

After all, the treasured [Truth] was something that even a true immortal would fight tooth and nail to obtain.

As these thoughts passed through his mind, Li Fan casually responded, “The [Mortal Ascension to God Wall] is indeed extraordinary—a true wonder of Tianyun Prefecture!”

Dongfang Yao donned a green robe before suddenly recalling something. His expression turned a bit strange. “The Ascension Wall is remarkable, but if you ask me, the strangest thing in Tianyun Continent is actually a black dog!”

“A black dog?” Li Fan was momentarily stunned before his mind flickered with light from the Dao Deviation Stone. He suddenly recalled a legend he had once heard from Shenyu Zi.[1]
