“Are you referring to that infamous man, Chen Shimei—the one who ruthlessly refined his own Dao companion into his cultivation foundation?”

Dongfang Yao nodded vigorously. “Exactly! That vile act enraged the [Fairy Kongyou], who transformed him into a black dog. Countless cultivators, eager to curry favor with her, would bring all sorts of wild beasts just to torment him.”

“The sight of it…”

Dongfang Yao shivered, as if recalling something terrifying.

“But actually, there’s something even more bizarre about this whole affair.” Dongfang Yao suddenly lowered his voice.

“Oh? Could there be more to the story?” Li Fan raised an eyebrow.

“You know that I possess the bloodline of ancient divine beasts. As my physique grew stronger, I discovered another unique ability that comes with it—”

“I can communicate with all beasts.” Dongfang Yao spoke in a conspiratorial tone.

“Once, when I passed through Tianyun Prefecture, I encountered that tormented black dog. To others, its cries sounded like pitiful howls of pain, but to me, they were words of grievance.”

“The dog swore solemnly, saying that everything was the idea of its perverted Dao companion. It claimed that it had simply fallen asleep and woke up to find that its fellow cultivator was gone, but it had gained an additional foundation of the path within its body.”

Li Fan was momentarily speechless.

Dongfang Yao shrugged. “At first, I didn’t believe it either. But once Chen Shimei realized I could understand him, he clung to me like his last hope, desperately pleading his case…”

“What's even more terrifying is that he said his Daoist partner actually hasn't died. Through some unknown method, they can still communicate and talk every day.”

“Suffering a wrongful accusation, enduring both mental and physical torment every day, 'Chen Shimei' has become utterly insane.”

“That time, he pleaded with me, begging me to help him find release. But, well...”

Dongfang Yao had a helpless expression on his face. "Fairy Kongyou has countless admirers; I wouldn't dare offend her. Even if she were wrong, I couldn't say it outright."

"So, in the end, it’s always Chen Shimei who suffers."

Dongfang Yao let out a sigh.

"Since then, I’ve come to realize just how terrifying women can be. I’d rather avoid them entirely."

"Men like Fellow Daoist Li, who are straightforward and genuine, are much more to my liking."

He glanced at Li Fan, nodding in satisfaction.

"Heh…" Li Fan discreetly took a slight step away from Dongfang Yao.

"This is the first time I’ve heard of this incident. It’s truly interesting. Fairy Kongyou…"

The name Fairy Kongyou was familiar to Li Fan. In fact, in his past life, he had even met her once.

That was at the commendation ceremony held after the Tianxuan Spirit-Locking Formation was completed.

She was indeed breathtakingly beautiful, living up to the name of a fairy.

More importantly, she had a unique constitution, possessing a rare Innate Yin-Yang Jade, an existence that was half a heavenly wonder.

Through the dual cultivation method, she could fuse the Yang half of her Yin-Yang Jade with her Dao companion. This process would elevate the companion’s Foundation Establishment treasures, Golden Core, Nascent Soul Cave-Heaven, and even their life transformations to a higher level.

It was enough to turn an ordinary cultivator into a peerless genius overnight.

It wouldn’t be an exaggeration to call it defying fate itself.

Because of this, Fairy Kongyou was fervently pursued by countless talented young cultivators.

She also seemed to have a powerful background. Some reckless cultivators had once attempted to force her, but they all mysteriously vanished—neither their bodies nor their souls were ever found again.

Dongfang Yao noticed Li Fan's subtle change in expression and couldn't help but warn him, "Fellow Daoist Li, trust me. Beauty is a disaster; brotherhood is eternal."

"Haha, Brother Dongfang speaks wisely! A woman like that is beyond my reach!" Li Fan laughed heartily, cutting him off.

"The Great Vortex's turmoil has settled. Where will you be heading next?" Li Fan asked.

Dongfang Yao was pleased to hear Li Fan agreeing with him and grinned. "I have a friend named Huangfu Song. We get along extremely well, like brothers. Since you and I are so compatible, I imagine you would also get along well with him."

"Recently, I heard he's heading to Chizha Abyss, saying it’s a rare opportunity to make great contributions. He invited me to join him. I’ve got nothing better to do, and I’ve just comprehended a new divine ability. My hands are itching for action, so I figured I’d join the fun."

"So, Brother Li, are you interested?" Dongfang Yao looked at Li Fan with anticipation.

"Chizha Abyss? White Mist, Maze Zone, great contribution…" Li Fan narrowed his eyes as countless clues connected in his mind.

"It is what I desire, though I dare not ask it of you." After a moment of thought, Li Fan agreed without much hesitation.

"Great!" Dongfang Yao was overjoyed.

"I’ll ask him where he is now and go meet up with him!"

With that, he took out a communication talisman and sent an inquiry.

A short while later, Dongfang Yao put away the talisman.

"Tianyu Prefecture, let’s go!"

Hearing this familiar place name, Li Fan smiled slightly, then followed behind Dongfang Yao, flying towards the nearest teleportation formation.

In the Beast Realm…

Amid his deep meditation on the world’s destiny, Xu Bai suddenly opened his eyes.

Standing in the sky, he parted his lips slightly, as if uttering a command.

The world fell into an eerie silence.

A moment later, an earth-shaking chorus of millions of ancient beasts roaring erupted across the realm.

Unlike the dominant powerful beasts that once ruled the Beast Realm, these roars came from the most formidable ancient beasts of the primordial era.

Their cries carried a primal savagery and terrifying ferocity.

At that moment, every beast in the realm—no matter how mighty—stopped in its tracks and trembled in fear.

Uncontrollably, they knelt in submission, gazing toward the source of the sound.

Before Xu Bai, the space itself fractured, forming cracks as deep and dark as those seen in the Great Vortex’s Time Mirage.

The surrounding space was torn apart, distorting the very fabric of reality. Even the realm itself seemed to become unstable.

A figure suddenly appeared.

It was Fang Zaiji.

"Sect Master, what happened?"

Seeing this shocking scene, Fang Zaiji was alarmed and asked anxiously.

He feared that an enemy had forcefully broken through space and attempted to abduct Xu Bai. Preparing to strike in defense, he steadied himself.

Yet, Xu Bai merely sealed his lips.

Instantly, the deafening beastly roars vanished, and the world returned to silence.

The space fractures disappeared as if they had never existed.

Xu Bai glanced at Fang Zaiji and said indifferently, "It’s nothing. I merely comprehended a new divine ability."

"Uh…" Fang Zaiji was stunned as he examined Xu Bai.

"The phenomenon just now—was that really caused by the Sect Master’s comprehension? Are you serious? Even Liu San and I can’t cause something like that…"

His face showed clear disbelief.

Xu Bai ignored him and simply relived the process of casting his divine ability.

"Strange… this clone’s talent is ridiculously high."

"While observing the World-Rift Time Mirage, my main body only had some insights… But this clone…"

"When witnessing the forms of the ten thousand beasts, it felt as if I were there in person, hearing their roars firsthand."

"Even those obscure, unrecognizable ancient beasts—I could see their images vividly in my mind."

"And…"

Xu Bai looked at his hands.

"To perceive essence beyond appearance… to instantly comprehend and replicate the power of World-Rifting…"

"Could it be because of Xu Ke’s bloodline, combined with the Feather of the Black Bird?"

"Or… is it because of Mr. Bai?"

As this thought crossed Li Fan’s mind, he found it utterly absurd.

It was merely a resemblance in demeanor based on Mr. Bai's, a coincidental similarities they just happen to share.

But…

What if it wasn’t just a coincidence?

TL- [Shenyu Zi was previously translated as Oracle]

Chapter 693: Observing Flowers & Comprehending the Dao

"Simply by bearing a resemblance in spirit, one can receive the favor of Heaven and Earth, as well as the wonders of creation..."

Li Fan suddenly recalled an anecdote from the previous dynasty of the Great Xuan.

The last emperor of the previous dynasty, Emperor Zhengxu, was originally a rare ruler capable of revitalizing his empire. From the moment he ascended the throne at the age of sixteen, he executed treacherous ministers, quelled bandits, improved water conservancy, and abolished taxes—sweeping away the signs of the empire's decline and resembling the sage-kings of old. In just over twenty years, the land was peaceful, prosperous, and thriving. The common people had no worries about food or clothing and sang praises of the wise ruler. The officials submitted wholeheartedly, writing books extolling the emperor’s virtues.

Had he continued this way, the founding emperor of the Great Xuan might never have had the opportunity to overturn the heavens and establish a new era.

However, everything took a sharp turn when Emperor Zhengxu reached the age of thirty-seven. The reason? His beloved Empress Duanmu passed away due to illness.

Upon hearing the tragic news, Emperor Zhengxu nearly fainted on the spot. Overcome with grief, he withdrew from state affairs for several months. Had it ended there, the empire would have remained stable under the guidance of its many capable ministers, even if the emperor himself remained secluded. But perhaps the fall of the Zheng Dynasty was already predestined—on a visit to the place where he had first met Empress Duanmu, Emperor Zhengxu encountered a woman who bore an uncanny resemblance to her.

Not only was her appearance nearly identical, but even her expressions and mannerisms were indistinguishable from the woman he had lost.

And she was younger.

Shaken to his core, Emperor Zhengxu believed it was fate. Without hesitation, he brought her back to the palace, made her his concubine, and indulged in her company day and night.

To please her, he engaged in all manner of extravagance—constructing lavish palaces and gardens within the imperial city and even digging a canal connecting the royal court to the outskirts, so they could drift upon its waters at their leisure. He commanded his officials to scour the land for rare treasures to entertain his beloved concubine.

The entire court was thrown into chaos, and the people’s resentment boiled over. Those who dared to admonish him were either dismissed from office or executed.

Even so, the empire did not collapse immediately, thanks to the strong foundation Emperor Zhengxu had built in his earlier years.

But when the concubine gave birth to a son, the emperor seemed to lose all reason. Ignoring the vehement opposition of his ministers, he sought to depose the crown prince. The crown prince, unwilling to sit idly by, rallied his supporters under the banner of "eliminating the wicked concubine and purging the court." His rebellion was backed by many noble families in the capital, including the Duanmu clan.

After days of fierce battle, the rebellion was ultimately crushed, and the crown prince took his own life in defeat. But the Zheng Dynasty had suffered a devastating blow.

From that point on, Emperor Zhengxu withdrew entirely from court affairs, indulging solely in pleasure.

The empire fell into decline. By the time Emperor Zhengxu turned fifty-six, the imperial palace was stormed by rebel forces. The emperor and his concubine perished in each other's arms, consumed by fire.

Later scholars, when studying this period of history, were baffled by how an emperor who had once shown such promise could lose himself to lust and bring ruin to his empire.

The only explanation was that his love for Empress Duanmu had reached an unfathomable depth. So when he encountered someone who resembled her, he completely lost his reason—perhaps even falling into madness—and in the end, destroyed a once-glorious kingdom in a single day.

There are no new things under the sun.

Similarly, if Xu Bai’s clone could gain such extraordinary favor from Heaven and Earth simply by resembling Mr. Bai, then there were only two possibilities:

Either Mr. Bai was an incarnation of the Dao itself.

Or he held an unparalleled significance to the Xuanhuang Realm—so much so that the world constantly yearned for the emergence of another "Mr. Bai." To the extent that even a mere resemblance could grant someone an extraordinary affinity with the laws of Heaven and Earth.

"Mr. Bai..."

Memories of all he had seen in the Fallen Immortal Realm surfaced in Xu Bai's mind, yet he remained silent.

After a long while, his thoughts settled. He retrieved the seventeen-petal Heavenly Spirit Flower, which had been sealed with a special secret technique.

With narrowed eyes, he once again examined the countless scenes imprinted upon its petals. This time, a perception completely different from his original self began to emerge.

It was as if he was gazing down upon the world from a celestial perspective, sweeping across the entire Tianling Prefecture in an instant. In that moment of illusion, he glimpsed vast mountains and rivers, the myriad beings of the land, the ever-changing winds and clouds, and the cycle of prosperity and decline.

Before him, the Heavenly Spirit Flower seemed to reflect all that transpired within the continent—like a divine mirror revealing the essence of the world itself.

A trace of enlightenment quietly passed through Xu Bai’s heart. However, like snowflakes melting into water, it vanished without a trace in an instant, leaving him with a sense of loss.

"This feeling… it's just like when I once used the Canghai Pearl to observe the grand transformations of the world from the vast perspective of heaven and earth, ultimately comprehending the [Formless Killing Intent]."

"The divine abilities and spells of cultivators largely originate from heaven and earth itself. Observing from the perspective of heaven and earth naturally makes comprehension easier."

"However, in the end, a flower is merely a record of nature’s scenery—it is not truly one with heaven and earth. Gaining insight from it is not so simple; it requires exceptional perception. Just like before, when my true self personally crafted it, studied it carefully countless times, yet still saw it as nothing more than an ornamental object."

"But this is not the flower’s problem—it is the person’s problem."

"Hmph."

Xu Bai made fine adjustments to the plan in his mind. Before Liu San returned, Xu Bai's mind continued to settle into contemplating the flower and understanding the Dao.

Tianyu Prefecture.

After spending quite some time, Li Fan and Dongfang Yao finally arrived in Tianyu City. However, instead of heading to the Huanyu Courtyard, where Li Fan had received formation training in his previous life, they went to a private room in the Dao-Discussion Tower.

"Let's wait a bit. I've already notified Brother Huangfu, and he should be here soon," Dongfang Yao said casually, sitting cross-legged on the ground. He tapped his fingers on the floor, and before long, a cup of spiritual tea emerged.

"Damn, how stingy," Dongfang Yao muttered under his breath, downing the tea in one gulp.

Li Fan was no stranger to the Dao-Discussion Tower and knew that Dongfang Yao was short on funds, so he could only drink the complimentary tea.

Smiling slightly, Li Fan connected his divine sense with the control jade token of the room.

Before long, a dark green teapot appeared.

"Brother Dongfang, please!" Li Fan gestured with a smile.

"Brother, you’re too generous!" Dongfang Yao beamed with joy, happily pouring himself a cup and drinking it in one go.

"This is the finest [Thousand Cultivators’ Dao Discourse] tea! Brother Li, you are truly magnanimous! The last time I had tea of this caliber was when I returned from the [Thousand Pages Book Forest] and couldn’t resist celebrating!" Dongfang Yao praised endlessly.

Shaking his head, he closed his eyes slightly, as if savoring some deep insight.

Just then, a familiar voice rang out.

"Dongfang Yao! You dare to enjoy [Thousand Cultivators’ Dao Discourse] alone without sharing it with me?"

A plump cultivator with a kind and amiable face stepped into the room.

His face bore a mock expression of anger, but there was a trace of a smile at the corner of his lips.

His gaze briefly swept over Li Fan before settling on Dongfang Yao with an unreadable expression.

"Brother Huangfu, you’re just in time!" Dongfang Yao’s eyes snapped open. He poured a cup of spiritual tea and tossed it over.

Chapter 694: The Age of Great Exploration

Huangfu Song steadily caught the teacup and tilted his head back to drink it.

"Now that you've had Brother Li’s tea, we are brothers from now on," Dongfang Yao said with a satisfied nod.

"Brother Dongfang, you haven’t introduced me yet. Who might this be?" Huangfu Song glanced at Li Fan, who was sitting upright beside him, and asked tentatively.

"This is Li Fan," Dongfang Yao said, raising his head. "I happened to meet him while comprehending the Dao in the Grand Vortex of Lingxu Prefecture. We hit it off instantly. When you mentioned this rare opportunity to earn contribution, I discussed it with him, and we decided to come together."

A glint flashed in Huangfu Song’s eyes as he discreetly gave Li Fan another look.

Li Fan remained composed, cupped his hands, and said, "I've long heard of Brother Huangfu’s great name. It’s an honor to meet you!"

However, Huangfu Song did not display any particular enthusiasm. He merely nodded slightly in acknowledgment.

After some casual conversation, the straightforward Dongfang Yao finally got to the point.

"Huangfu, stop keeping us in suspense. What is this once-in-a-century opportunity for contribution you mentioned? Speak now!"

Huangfu Song pondered for a moment before slowly speaking. "Although this matter is still confidential, it will soon be officially announced. Since both of you are our own people…"

"I won’t hide it anymore."

"The Immortal Alliance is about to issue an order encouraging all cultivators to explore deep into the White Mist. Not only will they provide the Samantabhadra True Boat needed for the expedition free of charge, but all treasures obtained during the exploration will belong entirely to the individual. The Immortal Alliance will not interfere in the slightest."

"Furthermore, merely reporting the terrain and discoveries of the White Mist will earn contribution points, merits, and even access to top-secret cultivation techniques as rewards."

…

Huangfu Song continued to explain the new policy of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance in great detail.

After he finished, Dongfang Yao still looked puzzled.

"Did I hear that right? Deep into the White Mist? Other than the White Mist itself, could there be anything else inside?"

Huangfu Song cast an exasperated glance at Dongfang Yao before explaining, "Within the White Mist, there exist Maze Zone. Each Maze Zone is vast, even larger than many Cave-Heavens or small worlds."

"And that’s just the surface of what we’ve discovered. According to the latest investigations, many hidden rifts and passageways exist within the White Mist, leading to unknown destinations."

"The higher-ups of the Immortal Alliance are extremely determined to explore the White Mist this time, and the rewards are unprecedentedly generous. Many cultivators who got wind of the news have already ventured into the mist ahead of time. Once the policy is officially finalized, they’ll report their findings and immediately claim their merit rewards."

"Though we received the news a bit late, if we move quickly, we can still get a share of the rewards. If I hadn’t been waiting for you, Brother Dongfang, I would have set out seven days ago."

Huangfu Song sighed and took a sip of tea, glancing at Dongfang Yao helplessly.

"Good brother, you’re really looking out for me!" Dongfang Yao slapped Huangfu Song’s shoulder forcefully, causing his round belly to wobble.

"So what are we waiting for? Let’s set off immediately! I’m practically broke. The resources I need to strengthen my physical body are ridiculously expensive!" He urged impatiently.

Huangfu Song rolled his eyes at Dongfang Yao. "The White Mist is full of dangers. Since we’re already late, a little more preparation won’t hurt. We need to be fully equipped before we go. We may not be extraordinary, but at the very least, we shouldn’t be a burden to the team."

As he spoke, his gaze subtly swept over Li Fan.

Li Fan smiled slightly. "Since Brother Huangfu has said so, I won’t hide it either. My combat strength may be somewhat lacking, but I am quite wealthy. I can provide the Samantabhadra True Boat required for this journey, as well as artifacts that can temporarily resist the energy-draining effects of the White Mist."

"If we encounter challenges beyond the Nascent Soul level during exploration, I will voluntarily withdraw so as not to put my brothers in a difficult position."

…

Seeing Li Fan's frankness, Huangfu Song was somewhat surprised. Meanwhile, Dongfang Yao was slightly dismissive. "What is Li Fan saying? So what if it's a Nascent Soul cultivation? Am I not also at the Nascent Soul stage? When brothers work together, their strength can cut through metal. How could a mere Devouring Essence White Mist possibly stop us?"

Li Fan frowned and instead offered a word of caution. "I know that Brother Dongfang has an exceptionally strong physique, and even the spatial rifts within the Great Vortex couldn't harm you. However, the depths of the White Mist are truly extraordinary. I once heard Brother Shuo mention that within the mist lies a Maze known as the Chizha Abyss. Even he must tread carefully, or else he risks falling to his doom. Brother Shuo possesses the combat power of the Soul Transformation stage and carries a protective artifact gifted by his mother. If even he says such things, then the dangers of the White Mist are self-evident."

Huangfu Song and Dongfang Yao were momentarily stunned.

"Brother Shuo? Which Brother Shuo?"

Huangfu Song’s expression subtly changed. "Could it be…?"

Li Fan nodded slightly. "I won’t hide it from you two—Shuo Feng and I are close friends, and he has invited me to serve as a guest elder for the Xuan family."

Dongfang Yao showed little reaction, but Huangfu Song suddenly stood up, his face full of shock.

"Brother Li, are you serious?"

Li Fan smiled. "I doubt there’s a single Nascent Soul cultivator in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance who would dare impersonate a guest elder of the Xuan family."

Upon hearing this confirmation, Huangfu Song’s attitude shifted immediately.

"Amazing! Why didn’t you mention this earlier, Brother Li? With your help, this expedition into the White Mist is sure to be a fruitful one!"

His words were full of flattery, while he subtly probed for more details regarding Shuo Feng.

After Li Fan revealed a few details, Huangfu Song finally confirmed the truth and became even more enthusiastic.

"With Brother Li's assistance, our chances of success have increased significantly. We must set out as soon as possible!" Huangfu Song declared decisively.

"One day should be enough to prepare the necessary supplies," Li Fan responded.

Dongfang Yao shrugged, indicating that he was ready at any time.

Thus, the three of them agreed to meet at the same place the next day.

After temporarily parting ways, Li Fan entered the Tianxuan Mirror, took out a communication talisman, and inquired with Shuo Feng about the Immortal Alliance’s decision to conduct a large-scale exploration of the White Mist.

Before long, Shuo Feng sent a reply.

"Oh, I think I did hear something about that. Why? Are you interested? There are too many strange and unpredictable things inside—there's no need to take that risk. If you need contribution points or anything, I can speak with my family and increase your offerings instead. There's no need to get involved in the chaos. If you die in there, it wouldn't be worth it." His tone remained as indifferent and carefree as always.

After declining Shuo Feng's offer, Li Fan asked about the original species of the Heavenly Spirit Flower before ending the communication.

"A Maze…"

The thick White Mist was indeed eerie and filled with countless dangers.

In his past life’s knowledge alone, he had heard of the Chizha Abyss and the Chaotic Character Maze Zone.

In fact, the Eternal Immortal Fortress that guarded the Chizha Abyss was built from the severed hand of an Ancient Heavenly Sovereign who had fallen.

That severed hand of the Heavenly Sovereign had drifted out from within the White Mist.

This alone was proof of the immense danger and mystery hidden within.

Chapter 695: Unexpected Joy from Spending Wealth

Li Fan speculated that within the white mist, besides the remnants of ancient cultivation worlds, there might also be the remains of other cultivation realms.

After all, no one truly knew how many worlds the Xuanhuang Realm had absorbed over the years to delay being devoured by the Immortal Ruins. Even the Xuanhuang Realm itself had undergone drastic changes, as if it had expanded in size. Not to mention the white mist barrier, which seemed to be a buffer zone where worlds merged.

However, for Li Fan, though the white mist was full of dangers, its actual level of threat might not necessarily surpass that of the Xuanhuang Realm itself.

The Xuanhuang Realm hid too many terrifying entities. Since Li Fan’s reincarnation, he had encountered beings such as the Heavenly Physician, Ruomu, and the mysterious Heavenly Palm. Each time, he barely escaped with his life. Who knew how many other hidden powerhouses still lurked in the shadows?

In comparison, while the white mist was perilous, most of the danger came from the Devouring Essence Mist itself. Even if he encountered eerie and terrifying entities, they would not be as overwhelmingly powerful as the great cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm, who could prevent him from even using his [Truth] ability.

"Compared to the Xuanhuang Realm, the white mist is like the corpse of a dead cultivation world. And the living are often more terrifying than the dead."

"With my clone Xu Bai handling the planning for the later chapters of the ‘Mountain Sitting Technique,’ there shouldn't be any major issues. My true body can take this opportunity to explore the white mist and see what the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is up to."

Clearing his thoughts, Li Fan used his past life's experience to purchase useful supplies from the Tianxuan Mirror.

For example:

Eight Directions Purity Formation Diagram – A formation that could temporarily block the invasion of the Devouring Essence Mist, providing a crucial moment to catch one's breath.

Black Death Talisman – A necessary item to resist the Devouring Essence Mist's effects and allow movement within the white mist.

Various spirit pills and elixirs to rapidly replenish internal spiritual energy.

Li Fan keenly noticed that the prices of these items had been steadily rising in recent times. The Black Death Talisman, in particular, had silently doubled in price. It was clear that a significant number of people were already aware of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's plan to send cultivators into the white mist and were taking advantage of the last moments to profit.

Among all these supplies, the price increase of longevity-related treasures was the most astonishing, with most of them tripling or even quadrupling in price. Longevity-enhancing items had always been rare and expensive.

After consuming one, a cultivator would need to find a different type for further effect. This made them highly sought after, often commanding exorbitant prices and always being in short supply.

Now that the era of white mist exploration was approaching, these longevity treasures had essentially become life-saving artifacts against the Devouring Essence Mist.

In his previous life, Li Fan had been trapped in the white mist and had barely escaped. However, he had stayed inside for too long. By the time he returned to the Eternal Immortal Stronghold, he had aged drastically. If he had possessed Longevity Pills back then, he could have avoided such a fate.

Other cultivators did not have the luxury of Li Fan’s ability to restart. It was only natural to stock up on life-saving resources to ensure survival.

Glancing at the over one hundred Longevity Pills that Liu San had prepared for him, Li Fan, who was not lacking in contribution points, had no intention of selling them. Instead, he planned to use them at critical moments.

"It's a pity that at this point in time, Zhong Shentong has yet to rise to fame. I've searched for a long time, but I haven't been able to find any trace of him. Otherwise, if I could learn his Seven-Colored Divine Light technique, moving around would be much easier. As for his incomplete manuscript of the ‘Life and Death Profound Art’… I’ll wait until I have the opportunity to obtain the full version."

Time passed quickly.

The next day, Li Fan met up again with Huangfu Song and Dongfang Yao.

As promised, Li Fan took out the large batch of supplies he had purchased and handed them over to them.

"Damn, brother, you’re really generous!" Dongfang Yao grinned widely as he happily accepted the storage ring filled to the brim with supplies.

Huangfu Song glanced at the ring, his face showing surprise. "Brother Li, you’ve truly gone all out!"

"Since we’ve agreed to explore the white mist together, we must make thorough preparations. A little money is nothing compared to our lives," Li Fan said casually, waving off their concerns.

"Besides that, I also prepared these."

Li Fan’s expression turned serious as he took out two jade bottles and handed them over.

Huangfu Song and his companion took the items and opened them. Inside, they saw three pills emitting a faint cyan glow.

The enticing fragrance of the pills filled the air, making it almost impossible for them to resist the urge to swallow them immediately.

Both of their expressions changed slightly, and they spoke in unison, "Longevity Pills?"

Li Fan nodded slightly, lowered his voice, and whispered, "I went through great effort to obtain these. These pills are called 'Longevity Pills.' Each one can extend life by two hundred years. What’s even more remarkable is that they can be taken multiple times. Although the effect gradually diminishes, it is said that within ten doses, it can still guarantee an additional hundred years of life."

Upon hearing this, Huangfu Song and his companion immediately realized the immense value of the Longevity Pills.

Without hesitation, they carefully stored the jade bottle and looked at Li Fan with deep emotion. "Brother Li..."

Li Fan smiled slightly and raised his hand to interrupt them.

Huangfu Song's expression fluctuated as if he was struggling internally. Finally, he gritted his teeth, as if he had made up his mind.

"Brothers, please wait a moment. I will be back shortly."

Without waiting for Li Fan’s response, Huangfu Song hurriedly left the private room in the Dao-Discussion Tower. To an outsider, it might have looked like he had taken the items and fled.

However, neither Dongfang Yao nor Li Fan showed any such suspicion.

They remained calmly waiting in the room with unwavering patience.

Dongfang Yao had known Huangfu Song for many years and was well aware of his character, so he had no concerns. However, the fact that Li Fan remained just as composed left him quite impressed.

"Hehe, my judgment is truly excellent. Brother, you are indeed worth befriending!"

"In the White Mist, dangers lurk everywhere. If we cannot trust our companions, then what is the point of traveling together?" Li Fan responded indifferently, exuding an air of confidence.

However, as time dragged on and Huangfu Song still did not return, even after half a day, and his communication talisman remained unanswered, it seemed as if he had vanished from the world.

This time, even Dongfang Yao couldn't help but feel uneasy.

Yet, Li Fan remained as calm as ever, his demeanor unshaken.

Dongfang Yao couldn't help but marvel at him.

The reason Li Fan remained so composed was not just because he understood Huangfu Song's character and knew that he was not a short-sighted person. More importantly…

To Huangfu Song and his companion, these were extremely "precious" resources.

But in Li Fan's eyes, they were nothing worth mentioning.

Another half-day passed, and by the time night had fallen, Huangfu Song finally returned, quietly slipping back into the room.

"Brother Li, since you have been so honest, I will take a leap of faith as well."

"My brothers, take a look at this…"

After sealing the door, Huangfu Song set up an formation to prevent eavesdropping.

Then, with a solemn expression, he took out an ancient, square-shaped mirror from his robes and placed it in front of them.

"What in the world is this?" Dongfang Yao was completely puzzled.

Li Fan, however, was visibly shaken, his eyes locked onto the mirror in Huangfu Song’s hands.

Chapter 696: Qingxuan Can Measure the Heaven

Mirrors of the world, countless and numerous.

However, the only one that could make Li Fan take it so seriously was [Tianxuan].

Although the square mirror in Huangfu Song’s hands was not exactly the same as the Tianxuan Mirror he had seen before, the familiar aura emanating from it made Li Fan almost certain that it was undoubtedly connected to the Tianxuan Mirror in some way.

Sure enough, Huangfu Song whispered nervously, “Brother Dongfang, be careful with your words. This little mirror may look unremarkable, but it is a great creation born from the collective efforts of almost all the top formation masters of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.”

“The Heaven-Measuring Mirror.”

Li Fan’s eyes flickered, but Dongfang Yao was still completely lost.

Impatiently, he said, “Stop acting so mysterious. If you have something to say, just say it clearly.”

Huangfu Song didn’t take offense. He gently stroked the Heaven-Measuring Mirror and sighed, “Even if I explained it in detail, you wouldn’t understand. Just know that this artifact is forged using a formation core and refined from the Qingxuan Mirror as the primary material, making it an invaluable treasure.”

“It can be considered a portable fragment of the Tianxuan Mirror. The most crucial part is that the user has almost complete control over it.”

Upon hearing this, Dongfang Yao's eyes widened. “A fragment of the Tianxuan Mirror? Such a treasure—quick, let me have a look!”

Saying this, he immediately reached out to grab the Heaven-Measuring Mirror from Huangfu Song’s hand.

However, something unexpected happened. His hands clearly touched the square mirror, yet they passed right through as if grabbing at air, like trying to scoop water with a bamboo basket—completely futile.

“A fake?” Dongfang Yao was stunned on the spot.

“Haha.” Huangfu Song smugly tossed the Heaven-Measuring Mirror in his hand. “Such a treasure can only be wielded by those who are worthy. Without the Immortal Alliance’s authorization, even if an ordinary cultivator were lucky enough to obtain it, they wouldn’t be able to touch it at all.”

At this moment, Li Fan, who had been silently observing, finally spoke, “For Brother Huangfu to be able to borrow such a priceless treasure, you must have paid a significant price.”

“However, how exactly does this Heaven-Measuring Mirror help us in exploring the White Mist?” Li Fan frowned as he asked.

Huangfu Song stopped keeping them in suspense and explained, “As its name suggests, the Heaven-Measuring Mirror is capable of measuring the heavens and the earth. In the vast White Mist, even a cultivator’s divine sense cannot penetrate far, forcing us to explore blindly, relying purely on luck. But with this mirror…”

Huangfu Song smiled and continued, “Within a hundred-zhang radius, everything will be revealed in intricate detail. Even with the obstruction of the White Mist, nothing will be hidden.”

“Unfortunately, I exhausted years of accumulated merit just to borrow this single low-grade Heaven-Measuring Mirror from Dean Ji. If it were a higher-grade version, it could scan everything within ten thousand li in an instant.” He sighed regretfully.

“A hundred-zhang radius is already extraordinary. With such a powerful tool, our exploration of the White Mist will be twice as effective with half the effort.” Li Fan couldn’t help but praise.

Huangfu Song added, “Since the Heaven-Measuring Mirror and the Tianxuan Mirror share the same origin, any discoveries it records are immediately reported rather than being stored and tallied upon our return.”

“Is that so?!” Dongfang Yao exclaimed in delight. “I was worried we’d have to constantly go back to report our findings. Now, we can just charge straight into the White Mist without concern!”

“Haha, unlike you two, I have no wealth or power—I’m just a penniless man who can only rely on brute force.”

Dongfang Yao patted his chest and promised, “If there’s any fighting to do, leave it to me. You guys can just sit back and watch the show.”

Li Fan shook his head. “Brother Dongfang, you jest. If not for you, how would I have had the fortune to meet Brother Huangfu? The fact that I can get ahead of other cultivators in exploring the White Mist—half the credit belongs to you!”

A few words made a bright expression appear on Dongfang Yao’s face.

The three of them discussed briefly and, feeling that everything was well-prepared, immediately decided to set off.

"In ordinary white mist zones, at most, you’ll earn some contribution points as a reward. If we want to obtain truly generous rewards, we need to seek out unknown Maze Zones. Even though we have the Heaven-Measuring Mirror to lead the way, the white mist regions are vast, making it no different from searching for a needle in a haystack. However, I once heard from Dean Ji that Maze Zones are drawn to each other and tend to merge. So, around known Maze Zones, there’s a high chance of discovering new ones. As it happens, I know of a Maze Zone within the white mist barrier of Tianyu Prefecture called [Wandering Living Words]. Why don’t we try our luck there?" Huangfu Song suggested.

"Wandering Living Words? What kind of bizarre place is that?" Dongfang Yao scratched his head, asking curiously.

"It is said that, among the explored Maze Zones, its danger level ranks relatively low. However, the words inside cannot be fixed in place by any means—they float in the sky like living creatures. The scenery is rather peculiar," Huangfu Song briefly explained.

Li Fan nodded in agreement. Dongfang Yao had no objections either.

Thus, the three of them controlled the Samantabhadra True Boat, following Huangfu Song’s guidance as they charged into the white mist barrier.

As soon as they entered the boundless white mist, Huangfu Song tossed the Heaven-Measuring Mirror above his head.

A soft cyan glow spread from the mirror, radiating outward and forming a circular area with a hundred-zhang radius around the Samantabhadra True Boat.

Under the cyan light’s protection, Li Fan squinted slightly. After a careful check, he found that his body showed no abnormalities, allowing him to relax slightly.

"Bad luck. Someone's already beaten us here," Huangfu Song muttered, shaking his head.

"It’s only natural to be a step behind since we’ve just entered the white mist barrier," Li Fan remarked. However, his real focus was on the large map that had suddenly appeared in his mind.

Most of the map was a vast, blank expanse of white. However, small dots and thin lines had begun to appear, slowly spreading.

Zooming in, he saw a black dot marking his own location.

The surroundings were a mix of deep blue and black, standing in stark contrast to the boundless white of the outer regions.

"So, while the explored areas are marked, their specific contents remain unknown?"

Li Fan was not surprised by this.

The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had launched the White Mist Exploration Project for a clear purpose. The environmental data within the white mist was highly classified—there was no way they would let the pathfinding cultivators gain access to such critical information.

Huangfu Song controlled the Samantabhadra True Boat, navigating around the deep blue-black regions marked on the map as they advanced toward the Wandering Living Words Maze Zone. They traveled while accumulating contribution points along the way.

The vast white mist stretched endlessly, much like a boundless ocean.

Along their journey, aside from the white mist itself, there was nothing else in sight.

Li Fan checked his contribution points through the Heaven-Measuring Mirror, but the accumulation was painfully slow.

After three or four days, he had barely gained just over two hundred points.

"For ordinary cultivators, this rate of earning isn’t considered slow. But for me, it’s practically useless."

"No wonder Shuo Feng didn’t bother with it."

Aside from contribution points, there was another type of currency called [Qingxuan Points], which could be used to exchange for special resources.

However, since Li Fan’s current balance of Qingxuan Points was still zero, he couldn’t view the specific exchange list yet.

Chapter 697: The Sealing of Ten Thousand Cultivators in the Dead Sea

"Exploring the ordinary white mist regions grants contribution points, so exploring the Maze Zone should reward these Qingxuan Points instead."

Li Fan's gaze inadvertently swept over the Heaven-Measuring Mirror suspended above the Samantabhadra True Boat, emitting a brilliant azure light that illuminated a hundred-foot radius.

"The Xuantian Formation as the core, and the Qingxuan Mirror as the foundation..."

Li Fan had heard Zhang Zhiliang mention the Qingxuan Mirror in his previous life.

It was one of the secondary derivatives of the Tianxuan Mirror, storing all the knowledge and information that existed within the main body before it separated.

A vast repository of knowledge—essentially an offline version of the Xuanhuang Realm's Encyclopedia.

As for the core formation...

In this life, after the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance excavated the Xuantian Dharma King, who had been slumbering in the Purple Heaven Sect, the formation centered around the Tianxuan Mirror had undergone drastic changes.

It had evolved from "Tianxuan Spirit Locking" into "Xuantian Spirit Sealing"— A far more aggressive version.

More importantly, the sequence of the characters "Xuan" and "Tian" seemed to imply that the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation was now within the control of cultivators.

Whether it was the small mirror that Immortal Lord Hongxi summoned against Crimson Flame, or the Heaven-Measuring Mirror, which functioned independently while still possessing part of the Tianxuan Mirror’s power—both served as proof of this transformation.

"Speaking of which... I wonder if the [Dissociation Disc], which was the biggest highlight of the previous life's 'Tianxuan Spirit Locking Formation' construction competition, will appear in the Qingxuan Points exchange list this time."

As a secondary derivative of the Tianxuan Mirror, it was naturally inferior to the main body, but it still ranked as one of the top-tier artifacts in the Xuanhuang Realm.

From what Li Fan knew:

The Qingxuan Mirror recorded all things in existence.

The Dissociation Disc had unparalleled computational power and was unmatched in breaking formations.

The Calamity Destruction Stone Disk could even shield perceptions from the Mysterious Net and create loopholes...

"If I can obtain one of these secondary artifacts in this life, then when I reach the stage of selecting a preservation option, it would absolutely be the top choice."

"After all, even if I return to the Golden Core stage, achieving Nascent Soul would merely be repeating a familiar process."

As Li Fan was lost in thought, a sudden whispering voice brushed past his ears, pulling him back to reality.

He abruptly turned his head, scanning his surroundings.

Within the white mist, there was absolute silence. The sudden emergence of these mysterious whispers was particularly eerie and conspicuous.

Narrowing his eyes, Li Fan tried to pinpoint the source of the sound.

But the whispering drifted unpredictably—now to the left, now to the right, sometimes in front, sometimes behind, and at times, it even seemed to come from directly beside his ear.

A chill ran down his spine.

His unusual reaction quickly caught the attention of Huangfu Song.

"Brother Li, what's wrong?" he asked with concern.

Even Dongfang Yao, who had been lethargic, suddenly perked up and looked over inquisitively.

"Did you two hear anything?" Li Fan asked, his expression serious.

"Hmm? Sound? But it’s completely silent in this white mist..." Dongfang Yao and Huangfu Song exchanged puzzled glances.

Waving his hand to cut off further questioning, Li Fan leapt to the bow of the Samantabhadra True Boat, focusing his mind and carefully listening to the whispers in the mist.

The flying boat advanced continuously.

Only after an entire incense stick's time had passed did the whispers finally fade from his ears.

"Strange."

Li Fan connected his consciousness to the Heaven-Measuring Mirror, checking his current location.

He had already left the previously explored vast expanse of dark-blue mist, now carving a thin passage through the endless white mist.

Then, a sudden thought flashed through his mind.

"Turn around. Head back."

Li Fan ordered Huangfu Song in a deep voice.

Huangfu Song hesitated briefly but, seeing Li Fan's serious expression, immediately complied.

Following their original path back—

It didn’t take long before the whispers, which had vanished, returned to Li Fan’s ears.

"Fly in this direction."

Standing at the bow, Li Fan carefully identified the source of the whispers, guiding Huangfu Song in adjusting their course.

As the Samantabhadra True Boat changed direction, the murmuring whispers grew increasingly louder and clearer.

Until finally—

When they crossed a certain threshold, Li Fan could distinctly make out the words within the whispers:

"Tian..."

"Yi..."

A tremendous sense of oppression surged into his heart in an instant. However, since he had already anticipated it, he wasn’t frightened by the content of the whispering voice.

“It seems that the ‘Heavenly Doctor’ voice I heard in my past life while heading toward the Chizha Abyss wasn’t merely an auditory hallucination caused by my deepest fears.”

“It truly exists.”

Li Fan suddenly came to a realization.

The Samantabhadra True Boat continued flying forward under Li Fan’s guidance.

The surroundings remained a vast expanse of white, seemingly unchanged.

However, Li Fan keenly noticed that, in an instant, the trio on the ship had their Qingxuan Points increase from zero to one hundred.

And as the Samantabhadra True Boat continued its relentless exploration, the number kept rising rapidly.

“Slow down. We have most likely entered a Maze Zone,” Li Fan cautioned in a low voice.

Huangfu Song was momentarily stunned. After checking the Heaven-Measuring Mirror, he couldn’t help but rejoice.

“Brother Li, how did you know there was a Maze Zone here? Was it because of the voices you mentioned earlier?” he asked hurriedly, staring at Li Fan.

“That’s right. But what’s strange is that upon entering this place, those eerie voices suddenly disappeared,” Li Fan nodded in response while extending his divine sense to explore the surroundings.

“This is a huge find! This must be an unexplored, unknown Maze Zone. Our Qingxuan Points are skyrocketing!” Huangfu Song said gleefully.

Dongfang Yao, however, cautioned, “We should still be careful. I have a bad feeling about this place... it’s unnervingly eerie.”

As they continued flying forward, the Devouring Essence White Mist gradually thinned.

Eventually, it dissipated completely, revealing the true face of the Maze Zone.

Upon seeing the scene before them, even the well-traveled and knowledgeable Huangfu and Dongfang stood frozen in place, their hands and feet ice-cold.

Li Fan took a deep breath, suppressing the shock in his heart.

What lay before them was an endless black ocean of deathly silence. The surface was utterly still, devoid of any waves, with only countless ice-crystal cubes floating upon it.

Inside each cube, a cultivator’s corpse was frozen.

Through the ice crystals, one could vaguely make out their final expressions before death.

Rage, fear, confusion...

Lifelike, as if they were still alive.

A sea of densely packed ice coffins filled the entire field of vision, stretching endlessly across the black ocean.

It was impossible to estimate how many there were.

It was as if the entire world’s cultivators had been entombed in ice here.

The overwhelming visual impact plunged the Samantabhadra True Boat into an eerie silence.

After a long while, Huangfu Song swallowed hard and whispered, “How about… we just leave?”

Clearly, even the usually greedy Huangfu Song was shaken by the utterly bizarre sight before him.

....

Translator’s Note:

Hey everyone! Starting from here, "Tian Yi" and "Heavenly Doctor" will be used interchangeably. They refer to the same thing, so whenever you see either term, just know they’re identical. It might take a few chapters for me to settle on one consistent translation, so bear with me! In the meantime, what do you all prefer—"Tian Yi" or "Heavenly Doctor"? Let me know your thoughts!

Chapter 698: The Corpse Formation Absorbs Vital Energy

"I'm afraid that even if we want to leave, we won’t be able to for the time being," Li Fan reminded in a cold voice.

At this moment, Huangfu Song suddenly remembered that once they entered the Maze Zone, the only way to leave was by finding and passing through specific locations.

Otherwise, despite being seemingly within reach, they would remain forever separated, unable to cross even the shortest distance.

In an instant, a drop of cold sweat trickled down his forehead.

"This..."

Dongfang Yao, having a bit more courage, patted Huangfu Song’s shoulder and comforted him: "Relax, Brother Huangfu. This place may seem eerie, but after all, it's just a bunch of dead people. There shouldn’t be any danger."

"If you’re really scared, just hide behind me. I’ll take the lead," he promised, patting his chest confidently.

Huangfu Song nodded repeatedly. "I’ll leave it to you then. But be careful, this place..."

After hesitating for a moment, he lowered his voice and said, "I don't sense even a trace of death aura. These cultivators… they might still be alive."

Hearing those words, Dongfang Yao's body trembled instantly.

"Brother Huangfu, it's fine if you don’t want to help, but don’t say such things recklessly." Dongfang Yao scanned the countless ice coffins floating on the dark sea, his face turning grim.

"There's no need to scare ourselves. Since we’re here, let’s stay calm and first figure out the situation," Li Fan, who appeared much calmer than the others, spoke decisively. Unlike them, he possessed a rare treasure that could allow him to escape at any moment, giving him a sense of security.

At his command, the three of them put away the Samantabhadra True Boat, formed a protective battle formation, and activated defensive arrays around them. They also donned all their prepared defensive artifacts before cautiously gliding over the sea.

The Heaven-Measuring Mirror flickered with blue light, collecting and recording data from the areas they passed through.

They dared not get too close to the frozen cultivators floating on the sea but observed them carefully from a distance.

"Judging by their attire, they should be cultivators from the Ancient World of Immortal Cultivation. However, I can't sense any aura from them, making it impossible to determine their cultivation levels."

"Strange. They don’t seem alive, but they also don’t entirely resemble the dead."

"I wonder what they saw before they were frozen. Their expressions are utterly twisted in terror."

"And who did this? To instantly freeze so many cultivators at once… their cultivation level must be…"

The three of them continuously exchanged thoughts through divine sense but refrained from making reckless moves, such as attempting to break the ice coffins below.

Indeed, the countless ancient cultivators must have carried valuable treasures, pills, and even cultivation techniques. However, none of them dared to guarantee that shattering the ice would not trigger an unknown disaster.

Besides, with the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's reward system, as long as they could return safely, they would already be gaining substantial benefits.

Compared to the lucrative rewards from the alliance, the ancient cultivators’ belongings seemed much less tempting.

In the deathly silent Black Sea, even time itself seemed frozen. There was no cycle of sunrise and sunset—only an eternally dim, gray sky.

The Heaven-Measuring Mirror also appeared to have lost connection with the Tianxuan Mirror, and their rapidly increasing reward points were recorded only in the ancient square mirror, without synchronizing with the main system.

Huangfu Song and his companions knew that if they could not make it out alive, all the Qingxuan Points would be nothing more than a meaningless set of numbers, completely useless. However, if they managed to complete the exploration and escape successfully, even if they gained nothing else in future endeavors, what they had obtained here alone would already be enough.

Thus, they proceeded with extreme caution.

According to their perception, they had been flying for dozens of days, yet they still had not reached the end of this black sea.

Everywhere they looked, all they saw were frozen corpses.

Even Dongfang Yao realized something was wrong.

“Are we going in circles?”

Huangfu Song nodded in agreement. “It does seem that way. Although we appear to be moving in a straight line, it’s evident that some kind of force here is distorting our perception. Otherwise, based on the number of corpses we’ve encountered, we’ve already seen tens of billions of them. Even if every cultivator from the ancient cultivation world were buried here, it still wouldn’t add up to such a number.”

Li Fan remained silent.

He was comparing and reorganizing the images recorded in the Dao Deviation Stone within his mind.

A blue light flickered, as if his thoughts were operating at their peak.

Soon after, Li Fan discovered a chilling truth.

In reality, so far, none of the frozen cultivators they encountered had actually repeated.

Or rather, even if a few similar-looking ones had been overlooked, the vast majority of the cultivators they saw in this desolate black sea were indeed unique individuals.

“There are exactly 2,679,800,000 cultivators lying dormant here.”

“And that’s just what I’ve seen so far.”

Li Fan couldn’t help but gaze into the distance. The endless sea of black was filled with floating ice coffins, stretching far beyond what the eye could see.

“What in the world…”

The eerie nature of this place had far exceeded his imagination.

“We can’t keep going like this. We need to find a way out, fast,” Huangfu Song said, but then he suddenly coughed lightly.

Li Fan and Dongfang Yao were momentarily stunned. They exchanged glances, their expressions shifting slightly.

“Huangfu, are you alright?” Dongfang Yao quickly flew to his side, grabbing his shoulder to check his condition.

A moment passed.

“That’s strange… there’s nothing wrong. But why did you just cough?” Dongfang Yao’s expression was grave.

Huangfu Song also sensed that something was off. After closing his eyes and carefully examining his condition, his face darkened. “I feel… weaker. It’s as if my vitality is slowly draining away…”

He looked down at the deathly still black sea. “This ocean… it seems to be siphoning our life force.”

“So that’s what’s happening. My physique is a bit stronger than yours, so I haven’t felt anything—yet.” Dongfang Yao paused mid-sentence.

He turned to Li Fan. “But, Brother Li Fan… why do you…”

Huangfu Song narrowed his eyes as well.

After all, it was Li Fan who had led them to this eerie maze. Huangfu Song knew of Dongfang Yao’s unique constitution.

Yet, Li Fan, who outwardly only had the cultivation of a Nascent Soul cultivator, was exhibiting more vitality than even Huangfu Song, who was at the Soul Transformation stage. He seemed to be withstanding the sea’s effects far better…

It was impossible for Huangfu Song not to be suspicious.

Li Fan understood this perfectly. He smiled faintly and shook his head. “Brothers, there is no need for doubt. Perhaps it is because my personal cave-heaven domain follows the Dao of Wood, allowing me to possess a stronger life force.”

“In times like this, we must stand united. The last thing we should allow is distrust among ourselves.”

“Huangfu, take the Longevity Pill I gave you. It might help.”

Seeing how calm and open Li Fan was, Huangfu Song temporarily suppressed his suspicions. He took out the jade bottle, swallowed the Longevity Pill, and immediately felt his complexion improve.

“It really works. Brother Li, thank you!” Huangfu Song said with some guilt.

“No need,” Li Fan waved his hand, as if he didn’t mind at all.

“As for getting out of here… Brother Huangfu, do you have any ideas?” he asked.

Chapter 699: The Reverse Life-and-Death Grand Formation

The medicinal power of the Longevity Pill was slowly being absorbed, and Huangfu Song's complexion gradually returned to normal.

He surveyed the densely packed frozen coffins around him, pondered for a moment, and then said, “Although these ice crystals appear to be randomly arranged—merely stacked without any discernible pattern—based on my years of experience with formations, this place might…”

As he spoke, he took out a formation-breaking jade disk and projected a light screen before everyone, beginning his calculations on the spot.

On the light screen, the countless ice coffins they had seen before transformed into black dots, each precisely positioned and recorded. As the perspective of the display continued to rise, the number and speed of these black dots increased rapidly.

Faintly, one could discern that these ice coffins were not simply crammed together but were indeed bound by some force, arranged according to an unknown pattern.

“We still cannot grasp the full picture. Perhaps only after thoroughly exploring this place will we uncover the formation that enshrouds this maze.” Huangfu Song scrutinized the light screen for a long time before shaking his head in regret.

“Then let’s not waste time—let’s move out. Who knows what other eerie things we might encounter if we linger here too long?” Dongfang Yao urged. The three of them continued their exploration of the remaining unknown areas.

After an indeterminate period of time…

“Stop! Stop!” Suddenly, Dongfang Yao raised his hand, blocking their path forward.

“What is it, Brother Dongfang?” Li Fan scanned the surroundings but did not notice anything amiss.

Dongfang Yao’s expression was uncertain as if he were listening carefully to something.

Moments later, his gaze locked onto the depths of the black, deathly still sea.

“There seems to be something alive down there… something like…”

“A kind of demonic beast?” Dongfang Yao was unsure.

Huangfu Song’s expression turned grim upon hearing this. “Impossible. This seawater is composed entirely of deathly energy. Forget ordinary demonic beasts—even if a cultivator were to fall in and become tainted by this death energy, they wouldn’t last long.”

Li Fan also gazed at the eerily calm black sea, deep in thought. “When death reaches its peak, life is reborn…”

“I trust Brother Dongfang’s judgment,” he continued. “If there truly is a creature living in this Dead Sea for so long, it might hold the key to our escape. Brother Dongfang, since you can communicate with beasts, why not try speaking with it?”

Dongfang Yao hesitated but eventually nodded. He let out a strange, rhythmic sound—rising and falling as if an ancient beast itself was roaring.

Before long, the once motionless sea surface suddenly rippled.

“There really is something alive?!” Huangfu Song’s face showed shock.

Dongfang Yao, however, cursed under his breath. “Damn it, that thing didn’t understand me—it got scared and ran away!”

“No matter, we’ll just follow it. Brother Dongfang, lead the way!” Li Fan instructed in a deep voice.

Dongfang Yao immediately snapped to attention, quickly discerning the creature’s movement beneath the black sea before flying off in pursuit.

Li Fan and Huangfu Song followed closely behind.

The unknown creature wasn’t particularly fast, and the three of them trailed it without much difficulty.

During the chase, Li Fan could almost tell with the naked eye that the number of ice coffins around them was gradually decreasing.

"Right here, it suddenly disappeared!"

Abruptly, Dongfang Yao halted his movement and turned back to look at Li Fan and the others.

Li Fan ascended a certain distance, gazing into the distance.

Countless ice coffins, appearing as mere dots, formed intricate lines resembling a black dragon stretching endlessly from the horizon.

From all directions, they converged at this location.

These lines were like the veins of the land, channeling and gathering the deathly aura of the maze zone into this very spot.

The density of the aura had reached an extreme level, faintly undergoing a qualitative transformation.

Huangfu Song also flew over to Li Fan’s side. After carefully observing the surroundings, he noticed something peculiar.

"This place... it seems to be the core formation node of the grand formation enveloping this maze-like zone." His expression turned grave.

"A formation node? Doesn't that mean we can escape from here?" Dongfang Yao exclaimed in delight.

However, Huangfu Song shook his head. "Without understanding the full structure of the formation, we cannot jump to conclusions. It could lead us out of this trap... or it could..."

"Trigger the formation’s self-defense mechanism," Li Fan continued, picking up on Huangfu Song's train of thought. "The scale of this formation is almost unheard of, and it seems to be vaguely tied to the Dao of Life and Death—exceedingly eerie. Even a Dao Integration powerhouse may not survive if the formation launches a full-scale attack."

Huangfu Song scrutinized Li Fan, a trace of surprise flashing in his eyes. "Brother Li, you are well-versed in formations?"

"Just a little," Li Fan nodded slightly, acknowledging it.

"Then what do we do now? Are we just going to stand here wasting time? I can feel the deathly aura affecting me—my vitality is constantly depleting. I’m even starting to feel sore all over," Dongfang Yao grumbled. After hesitating for a moment, he finally took out a Longevity Pill and swallowed it.

"Damn it, that feels much better!" He absorbed the medicinal energy far faster than Huangfu Song, regaining his vigor almost instantly.

"We must fully comprehend the formation first," Li Fan and Huangfu Song exchanged glances and reached a silent consensus.

"We need to hurry." Huangfu Song coughed lightly as he spoke. His expression darkened, and with no other choice, he took another Longevity Pill to slow down the loss of his vitality.

Having found no immediate threats in the maze aside from the constant erosion of their life force, and with their supply of Longevity Pills running low, the three of them abandoned caution and flew forward at full speed.

Finally, after Huangfu Song consumed his last pill, they completed the full mapping of the grand formation.

"A stroke of genius… A masterpiece…"

Huangfu Song stared at the projection on the formation-breaking jade disc, muttering to himself in awe.

Even Li Fan couldn’t help but be captivated by the sheer intricacy of this unknown grand formation.

Under normal circumstances, given their level of mastery over formations, both Huangfu Song and Li Fan would have been able to deduce the formation’s basic function and infer its remaining structure without needing to see it in its entirety.

However…

Before this unparalleled formation—constructed using the frozen bodies of billions of cultivators as its foundation—their accumulated knowledge and experience were rendered utterly useless.

Before witnessing the formation in its entirety, it was like glimpsing only a fragment of a divine dragon shrouded in misty mountains, its form obscured and indiscernible. Without prior knowledge of its existence, one would never realize what they were looking at.

Until the final piece of the formation was revealed before their eyes.

That last sequence of formations instantly linked everything they had seen together—like the finishing touch on a dragon painting, bringing the entire formation to life in all its divine completeness.

This formation was beyond words, truly indescribable.

It seemed to contain the mysteries of heaven and earth, defying even the laws of life and death.

Before the formation’s sketched blueprint, both Li Fan and Huangfu Song stood in stunned silence, unable to speak.

Could they escape through the formation node?

They had no answer.

Chapter 700: Life and Death, Moving Forward Again

The intricacy of this formation was so profound that it was almost on par with the Tianxuan Spirit-Locking Formation that Li Fan had studied in his previous life.

Even with the considerable expertise in formations that he and Huangfu Song possessed, it took them a long time—engaging in thorough discussion—before they could barely comprehend its structure.

Of course, they only understood it in theory.

As for how the formation actually operated, or how it converted deathly energy into vitality, it was beyond their current scope of understanding.

"Reversing the principles of life and death..."

"Could this formation be related to the cause of Blue Feather’s Dao-seeking failure, or to the cultivator who walked out of the white mist, lingering between life and death?" Li Fan's heart trembled with shock.

Meanwhile, Huangfu Song murmured to himself, "When one dies, both body and Dao should perish—how could there be a principle that allows one to return from death? Unbelievable... utterly inconceivable..."

Watching his two companions lost in deep thought, seemingly entranced for an extended period, Dongfang Yao—who had no understanding of formations—became both frustrated and anxious.

Finally, he couldn’t hold back anymore and let out an angry shout, snapping them out of their trance.

"You two have been studying this for so long—do you have any conclusions or not?" He frowned and asked.

Huangfu Song shook his head decisively and answered, "In my opinion, the formation here, even if the head of our Formation Hall, Chief Lu, came personally, might not be able to set it up. Such a grand and massive formation, yet it remains unknown to the world, quietly hidden within the White Mist Maze Zone..."

A trace of fear flashed across his face. "It seems we have unknowingly stepped into a place arranged by a great being who is in the process of proving the Dao of Eternal Life."

"The Maze Zone within the White Fog is vast, yet we just happened to encounter one that contains this formation. I really don’t know whether to call it fortune or misfortune." Huangfu Song sighed bitterly.

"Perhaps, this isn’t just a mere coincidence." Li Fan suddenly spoke. "What if this formation isn’t limited to just this one zone?"

Huangfu Song was stunned for a moment, then his expression changed drastically, falling into a fearful silence.

However, Li Fan had more thoughts that he didn’t voice out.

He had been led here by a faint murmuring voice—one that sounded suspiciously like 'Heavenly Doctor'.

This zone contained a grand formation capable of reversing life and death. In his previous life, a cultivator had indeed succeeded in doing just that—and ultimately ascended to become the new Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign.

When linking these facts together, it seemed only natural to infer that it was the Heavenly Doctor who had orchestrated all of this from the shadows.

It was he who would soon ascend to become the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign.

And yet…

Li Fan still had some lingering doubts.

Logically speaking, if this formation within the Maze Zone was the key to the Heavenly Doctor proving the Dao of Eternal Life, such a crucial place should not allow any margin for error.

Then why was it so easy for Li Fan and his companions to stumble into it?

"This place has absolutely no defensive measures at all…"

"Is it a trap? Or does the owner of this place simply not care? Or perhaps… he is so confident that even if someone enters by accident, they would still be incapable of affecting the foundation of this formation?"

Li Fan suddenly recalled the small wooden hut on the peak of Jieli Mountain in the Great Xuan World.

That had been his place of seclusion, where he rested and cultivated while waiting for [Truth] to fully recharge. Like this Maze Zone, he had left it unguarded.

He had only set up a minor illusionary barrier around Jieli Mountain to prevent mortals from wandering in by mistake.

Because, in his eyes, there was simply no need for further precautions.

"Do I see mortals the way that 'he' sees cultivators?"

"Is 'he' the Heavenly Doctor?"

Li Fan wasn’t certain.

But when he asked himself honestly—if his own ascension were at stake, he would take extra precautions, just to be safe.

"Yet 'he' has deliberately chosen not to…"

Just as Li Fan was deep in contemplation, Dongfang Yao suddenly said something that unintentionally enlightened him.

"Brother Huangfu, I think you're mistaken. Even though I don’t understand the intricacies of this formation, you mentioned it can reverse life and death. In that case, wouldn’t the one who set it up be even more capable of doing so?"

"After all, if one doesn’t understand the principle, how could they construct such a formation? The ability to overturn life and death—this is already within the realm of the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign, isn’t it? Then why have I never heard of this particular Heavenly Sovereign before?"

Li Fan suddenly realized, "That's it. Earlier, I thought the master of this place was using this formation to reverse the cycle of life and death. But it's also possible that they had already achieved that ability long ago. In that case… this place…"

Li Fan looked around.

"This isn’t a place for proving the Dao—it’s a testing ground after achieving enlightenment!"

His thoughts raced.

"After attaining eternal life, even the laws of heaven and earth would change accordingly. Logically speaking, with a mere thought, one could revive these frozen cultivators. And yet, they went through the trouble of setting up another formation…"

"What else were they researching? Achieving immortality wasn't enough—they sought to go even further?"

Li Fan’s gaze shifted toward the formation core of the life-and-death reversal formation he had discovered earlier.

"Perhaps the answer lies there."

With a solemn expression, he said, "This senior… has most likely already become a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign. This place has been abandoned by them, which is why we were able to enter so easily. Leaving through the formation core should be safe. Let’s move quickly."

Without waiting for Huangfu and Dongfang to respond, Li Fan took the lead and flew toward the formation core.

Huangfu Song and Dongfang Yao were briefly stunned. But upon considering Li Fan’s reasoning, they found it logical and quickly followed.

Before long, they arrived at the center of the grand formation, where the deathly aura was most intense.

The strange beast from the dark sea of death had vanished right in this spot.

"Brother Li, should we reconsider?" Huangfu Song looked at the black seawater below, feeling uneasy.

Li Fan, however, was fixated on the 200% charge displayed on his [Truth]. Shaking his head, he said, "Hesitation in times of crisis only leads to disaster. We've already explored this place thoroughly—staying longer won’t change anything. Unless you plan to comprehend the entire life-and-death reversal formation and break through it yourself? Rather than waiting for death, it’s better to take the risk!"

With that, a dense surge of wood-attribute spiritual energy surrounded his body.

"Stay close to me!" Li Fan shouted coldly before diving headfirst into the sea of death.

Seeing the situation unfold, Huangfu and Dongfang gritted their teeth and followed.

The moment they entered the seawater, an unimaginable deathly aura swept in from all directions—like countless wriggling worms gnawing at their vitality. The sensation was eerily similar to the life-draining white mist.

Having once personally experienced the complete depletion of his lifespan in that white mist, Li Fan was not unfamiliar with this feeling.

He remained calm, retrieving five Longevity Pills in one breath and tossing them into his mouth.

As the medicinal effects surged, he forced the longevity-infused green energy out of his body, forming a protective barrier against the corrosion of the deathly aura.

Pushing his escape technique to the limit, he rapidly descended into the pitch-black depths of the sea.

In just a few breaths, he was already nearing the seafloor.

Li Fan narrowed his eyes slightly, sensing the presence of a small vortex ahead.

Within the vortex, a faint trace of life flickered.

"That’s it!"

Focusing his mind, Li Fan transformed into a streak of radiant light and plunged into the vortex.

In the next moment…

After a brief moment of dizziness, light suddenly filled his vision.

A gentle sea breeze, the salty and humid air, the occasional cries of seabirds…

As Li Fan adjusted to his surroundings, he found himself above a vast, azure ocean.

Brimming with vitality.

Chapter 701: The Principle of World Creation and Destruction

"Finally, we made it out!"

The relieved voices of Huangfu Song and Dongfang Yao echoed in Li Fan's ears.

Li Fan turned to look at them and realized they were in a much worse state than he was.

In just a short time, they had visibly aged. Strands of white hair had appeared in their tied-up hair, and wrinkles had formed on their faces.

"If it weren’t for you, Brother Li, charging ahead and drawing in most of the deadly aura, Huangfu and I would have likely perished here!" Dongfang Yao said with lingering fear.

Huangfu Song nodded in agreement.

"You two should take some more Longevity Pills first. I still have a few left," Li Fan said, his expression showing both pain at the loss and decisiveness. He took out a jade bottle, turned it over, and poured out the last three pills.

"I should have bought more back then," Li Fan sighed, dividing the pills and handing two to Huangfu and Dongfang.

Seeing this, the two men couldn’t help but feel touched.

"I knew I wasn’t wrong about you! Brother Li, you are truly righteous!" Dongfang Yao said emotionally as he solemnly swallowed the last Longevity Pill. "At the brink of life and death, you never abandoned us. People like you are rare in the Xuanhuang Realm!"

"Traveling with Brother Li this time has truly been our great fortune," Huangfu Song said as he refined the pill's medicinal power, dispelling the negative effects of the deadly aura before echoing his agreement.

"By the way, Brother Li, where did you obtain these Longevity Pills? Their effects are extraordinary! I have taken six in a row, yet I can still feel the immense life force within them. I have never heard of such a divine medicine before," he asked after a brief pause, shifting the topic.

"To be honest, I bought them from a cultivator I met by chance in Tianyu City. He boasted about how powerful these pills were, but I was skeptical at the time, so I didn't stock up. In my haste, I even forgot to get his contact information," Li Fan shook his head regretfully.

Upon hearing this, Huangfu Song's expression turned disappointed. "What a pity! A divine medicine like this will definitely cause a frenzy among the cultivators in the Immortal Alliance once the official decree is issued. If only we could have prepared some in advance…"

"For now, let's focus on finding a way out. We've only escaped from the Sea of Death; we still haven't left this Maze," Dongfang Yao interrupted Huangfu Song's wishful thinking rather bluntly.

With this, the three of them took a closer look at their surroundings.

Before them was a vast, azure ocean—completely different from the pitch-black Sea of Dead they had just escaped.

Not only was it different, but it was the exact opposite.

One side was filled with dense death energy that even Soul Transformation cultivators couldn’t easily resist or dispel. Meanwhile, this side, though not overwhelmingly filled with life energy, was like the morning sun, the vigor of youth, and the revival of spring.

Life flourished.

It was like a newly born world, brimming with vitality.

Even the three of them, upon entering, felt as though both their bodies and minds had become more "youthful."

"What do you think, Brother Li?" Dongfang Yao asked.

Li Fan remained silent in contemplation.

Huangfu Song then shared his theory: "This Sea of Life might be the counterpart of the Sea of Death, both part of this maze—two sides of the same coin."

"Which means that somewhere in this place, there must also be a formation core. Since life and death are opposites, the cores must be located in different places within their respective realms. If we find the core of the Sea of Life and pass through it, we might be able to escape this maze."

Dongfang Yao scratched his head. "Why wouldn't it just lead us back to the Sea of Death?"

Li Fan smiled and answered on Huangfu Song’s behalf. "Because this maze formation is the ‘Grand Reversal of Life and Death Formation.’ Furthermore, considering how dense the death aura was in the Sea of Death, if there had been a place as full of life force as this one connected to it, it would have stood out like ink dropped into water. Yet we searched the entire Sea of Death and didn’t find even the slightest trace of life force. This suggests that the exit of this Sea of Life isn’t over there."

"Brother Li, your thoughts align perfectly with mine!" Huangfu Song praised.

"Alright, since you both agree, let's hurry and find this so-called formation core," Dongfang Yao said, conceding to the majority.

At first glance, this Sea of Life seemed like an ordinary ocean. Other than the abundance of marine creatures, there were no apparent anomalies.

Their journey was smooth, encountering no danger at all.

What surprised Huangfu Song was that their exploration here still counted toward the expansion of the unknown White Mist territory.

The rapidly increasing Qingxuan Points filled him with excitement. He couldn't help but exclaim that they had come to the right place, seemingly forgetting the life-or-death crisis they had just experienced.

Li Fan’s face also carried a hint of joy, but in truth, this was merely an act to blend in with the group.

His real focus was on a single question.

Was this Sea of Life actually the experiment of that Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign who reversed life and death?

"Creating an entirely new world of vitality from a world of extinction?"
