"Raising the concept of life and death from all beings to the level of an entire world… It is indeed a step further."

"Who exactly is this powerful figure?"

Li Fan felt that there might be other hidden secrets behind all of this, but at the moment, he was unable to fully grasp them.

"If my guess is correct, then the principle of [Reversing Life and Death] has already been claimed by someone. At this point in time, the Immortal Sage Blue Feather, who also seeks to attain Dao through this concept, has not yet faked his death and gone all in."

"Perhaps, there is an opportunity to profit from this."

"But dealing with a tiger is always dangerous—utmost caution is needed. For Blue Feather to have survived since the ancient cultivation era, he is definitely not an ordinary figure."

While Li Fan pondered in silence, the three of them thoroughly explored the Sea of Life.

In the end, they actually found the [Formation Core].

"Last time, Brother Li took the lead, so this time, let me go first." Feeling the faintly discernible miniature vortex ahead, Dongfang Yao patted his chest and volunteered.

Li Fan had no objections to this suggestion.

Huangfu Song also nodded in agreement, not competing with Dongfang Yao. Instead, he simply followed behind him.

Li Fan took up the rear, and one after another, the three of them plunged into the vortex.

The familiar white mist surged in from all directions. This terrifying existence, which could normally consume one's lifespan, now instead brought them a sense of joy.

"We finally made it out alive!"

"We earned over thirty thousand Qingxuan Points this time! I bet no one in the entire Immortal Alliance has more than us!"

Unable to contain his excitement, Huangfu Song immediately raised his Heaven-Measuring Mirror, eager to synchronize their recorded data with the Tianxuan Mirror.

However, in the very next moment, his expression drastically changed, and he let out a miserable cry.

"What’s going on? Why have our Qingxuan Points reset to zero?"

Chapter 702: The Immortal Alliance’s Cover-Up

Huangfu Song clutched the Heaven-Measuring Mirror tightly, as if he had seen a ghost, his eyes filled with utter disbelief.

Meanwhile, Dongfang Yao, who usually appeared open-minded and carefree, turned bloodshot the moment his divine sense connected to the Heaven-Measuring Mirror. He watched as the 30,000-plus Qingxuan Points they had risked their lives to earn instantly dropped to zero.

"Huangfu! Is this thing even reliable? How did it just swallow up all our hard-earned merit?" His veins bulged on his neck, and his face twisted with rage.

In contrast, Li Fan remained much calmer.

After checking the records, he confirmed that during the brief period when the Heaven-Measuring Mirror disconnected from the Xuanhuang Realm, all the Qingxuan Points they had accumulated from exploring the Life-and-Death Maze had indeed vanished without a trace.

"This only happened after we left the Maze and reconnected with the Tianxuan Mirror..." Li Fan pondered, summoning the Samantabhadra True Boat to pull Huangfu and Dongfang, who were still exposed to the Devouring Essence White Mist, into the cabin.

"Calm down, brothers. We should be thankful that we made it out alive. We can always earn more Qingxuan Points in the future," Li Fan reassured them while standing at the bow of the boat, gazing into the dense white mist not far away.

Beyond the thick, milky veil, something seemed to be changing quietly, beyond the limits of their sight.

"No! We can’t just let this slide. Either something went wrong with the Tianxuan Mirror, or someone stole our merit. I have to get an explanation!" Huangfu Song gritted his teeth.

"Damn it! They dare mess with me?! If I find out who took our Qingxuan Points..." Flames of fury burned in Dongfang Yao’s eyes, his chest rising and falling violently as he struggled to contain his rage.

Seeing their determination, Li Fan no longer tried to dissuade them.

After such an incident, they had lost all interest in further exploration. Besides, they had already used up a significant amount of supplies, and embarking on another expedition wouldn’t be wise. Thus, they quickly returned to Tianyu City.

"Wait for my news. I'm going straight to Dean Ji!" As soon as they arrived, Huangfu Song couldn't wait any longer and rushed off to find Ji Hongdao.

Dongfang Yao, however, couldn't suppress his anger. Even after they entered the discussion hall’s private room, he didn’t sit down. Instead, he kept pacing back and forth, stretching his body as his joints crackled loudly.

Li Fan remained silent. He ordered a cup of spiritual tea, took a sip, and closed his eyes to wait.

Half a day later, Huangfu Song returned, looking completely dejected.

He collapsed onto the floor, his eyes empty.

"Huangfu, what did he say?" Dongfang Yao immediately sensed something was wrong but couldn't hold back his impatience.

"It... doesn’t exist... It doesn’t exist anymore..." Huangfu Song mumbled under his breath.

"What doesn’t exist?! Speak clearly, damn it!" Dongfang Yao roared.

"Dean Ji said... the Life-and-Death Maze we reported..." Huangfu Song stammered, his face pale. "That place doesn’t exist at all."

Dongfang Yao was stunned for a moment before his fury exploded. "How dare they lie in broad daylight?! We experienced it firsthand, and we have that damned mirror as proof!"

"I told Dean Ji the same thing. But..." Huangfu Song’s expression turned even more ghastly.

"He asked me to take him there again. But when I followed my memory back to the location... the Life-and-Death Maze was gone."

"What?" Dongfang Yao froze.

"There was only the Devouring Essence White Mist. No great Reversal Life-and-Death Formation, no Sea of Death and Life—everything we went through... it was as if it had all been an illusion," Huangfu Song murmured in confusion.

"Did we really experience all that? Or were we affected by some strange entity within the white mist, trapped in an illusion?" His expression was filled with doubt, as if even he couldn’t tell reality from deception anymore.

Dongfang Yao opened his mouth, wanting to say something, but in the end, he simply slumped beside Huangfu Song and grabbed a cup of spiritual tea, downing it in frustration.

"An illusion? Hmph..."

In Li Fan’s mind, the Dao Deviation Stone emitted a dazzling blue light, instantly reconstructing the image of the Reversal Life-and-Death Formation.

"What kind of illusion could create a formation like that?"

Li Fan was certain that the experiences he and his two companions had in the Life-and-Death Maze were entirely real.

However, for some reason, the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance officially refused to acknowledge the existence of such a place.

"It seems that the high-ranking officials of the Immortal Alliance, or perhaps the Tianxuan Mirror, are aware of the true identity of this Heaven-Defying Life-and-Death Sovereign. Moreover, they appear to have a deep connection with them. Since this being has no intention of revealing themselves to the world, the Immortal Alliance is actively covering their tracks."

Li Fan noticed that after they left the Life-and-Death Maze and the Heaven-Measuring Mirror established a connection with the Tianxuan Mirror, faint fluctuations emanated from the location of the Maze.

That was probably when the Maze was relocated elsewhere.

"Such a method..."

"Interesting."

Although more than thirty thousand Qingxuan Points had vanished without a trace, Li Fan was not as grief-stricken as Huangfu and Dongfang were.

"If my guess is correct, the compensation from the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance should already be on its way."

"After all, they need to turn a big issue into a small one, and a small one into nothing. Otherwise, if Huangfu Song and Dongfang Yao become enraged and start spreading the news, it will be difficult to contain the situation."

Having figured out the intricacies of the matter, Li Fan leisurely sipped his spiritual tea, patiently awaiting their visitor.

Sure enough, after a short while, a knocking sound came from outside the private room.

"Who is it?" Huangfu and Dongfang both showed a hint of vigilance in their eyes.

Before they could react, the door opened on its own. A black-robed cultivator, whose face was obscured, suddenly appeared before them.

"You..." Dongfang Yao’s expression changed drastically. His muscles tensed as he instantly entered a combat-ready state.

Just as he was about to strike, he suddenly froze, his heart pounding in shock.

Because at that moment, he saw the Heaven-Measuring Mirror automatically fly out of Huangfu Song’s robes and float before the black-robed cultivator.

The black-robed cultivator tapped lightly on the mirror and then spoke coldly:

"The currently explored regions within the White Mist Barrier are all stored in here."

"If you wish to explore more efficiently, head toward the unmapped areas."

"Remember—there are things you must never speak of. Otherwise, no one will be able to protect you."

"Take care of yourselves."

With a flick of his finger, a glowing orb flew toward Huangfu Song.

Then, the figure of the black-robed cultivator began to distort, gradually fading away until he vanished into thin air.

Huangfu Song and Dongfang Yao stood frozen, staring at the glowing orb before them.

After a long while, as if finally grasping the weight of the situation, cold sweat dripped from their foreheads, and their bodies trembled slightly.

Only after some time did they manage to collect themselves.

Exchanging a glance, they remained silent, as if tacitly agreeing never to speak of this again.

Probing the light with his spiritual sense, Huangfu Song's pale face lit up with a hint of joy.

"Talisman of Exemption!"

As he spoke, he retrieved three talismans radiating seven-colored light from within the orb.

Chapter 703: Sketching Mountains and Rivers

"With this thing, we can at least recover some of our losses," Huangfu Song let out a slight sigh of relief as he put away one of the Exemption Talismans. He then distributed the other two to Li Fan and Dongfang Yao.

"Just this worthless thing?" Dongfang Yao held the seven-colored talisman up to his eyes, scrutinizing it with disbelief.

"I’ve actually heard of this item before," Li Fan narrowed his eyes, recalling, "It seems that when the Immortal Alliance issues a compulsory mission, cultivators can use this Exemption Talisman to completely ignore the mission’s requirements."

"Exactly!" Huangfu Song nodded with satisfaction, his previous frustration dissipating.

"What’s the use of that?" Dongfang Yao muttered under his breath, still somewhat unconvinced.

Huangfu Song shot him a glare. "It might not seem useful in everyday situations, but at critical moments, it could literally save your life! For instance, if a war breaks out with the Five Elders Association and cultivators are drafted to the battlefield, others will have to pull every string they can find or resign themselves to fighting on the front lines. But with this Exemption Talisman, we can avoid such calamities altogether."

"In a way, this is like an imperial pardon of death!" Dongfang Yao suddenly realized the true value of the item and immediately stored it carefully.

"That’s right. And more importantly, this Exemption Talisman is unregistered. Any cultivator holding it is considered its rightful owner. If someone offers a high enough price, we could even trade it away." Huangfu Song added, "To prevent anyone from coveting it, you two should avoid carrying it on you at all times. Store it in the Tianxuan Mirror’s space instead."

Dongfang Yao nodded repeatedly in agreement.

Meanwhile, Li Fan was examining the map in the Heavenly-Measuring Mirror. "Although we’ve received these Exemption Talismans as compensation, our Qingxuan Points have dropped to zero—meaning all our previous efforts were in vain. What are your plans now? Do we challenge the White Mist again, or do we call it quits?"

"The real game has just begun; how could we stop here? Now that we have a partially mapped route, we can directly push into uncharted territory. Our exploration efficiency has increased many times over," Huangfu Song’s stance was clear, and his eyes flickered with boundless greed.

Dongfang Yao naturally sided with Huangfu Song.

Li Fan clapped his hands in admiration, "To rise stronger after setbacks—that is the spirit of a true hero! In that case, I’ll restock on supplies first, and then we’ll set off immediately."

"However…" Li Fan hesitated, looking troubled. "I’m afraid we won’t be able to find any more Longevity Pills—affordable yet effective life-extending treasures like that are incredibly rare."

Huangfu Song and Dongfang Yao both nodded in understanding.

"We can’t keep making you take the losses. I’ll find a way to contribute too," Dongfang Yao offered, taking the initiative.

The three of them agreed to meet again in two days, then went their separate ways.

Beastkind Realm.

Xu Bai lay motionless, floating in the sky with his eyes tightly shut, as if in deep slumber.

Above his forehead hovered a Seventeen-Petal Heavenly Spirit Flower, emitting a faint, milky-white radiance.

A mysterious energy surrounded him, distorting the air. Layer after layer of seven-colored halos rippled outward from him, expanding across the sky.

From the ground of the Beast Realm, it looked as if a seven-colored sun had appeared in the heavens.

Countless exotic beasts felt an instinctive reverence, kneeling in worship.

The disciples of the Medicine King Sect exchanged uncertain glances, whispering amongst themselves.

Of course, with Liu San standing guard beside Xu Bai, no one dared to speak out of turn.

More than ten days ago, Liu San had already located Jiao Xiuyuan.

Jiao Xiuyuan had shown great interest in the deal Li Fan had mentioned.

However, he insisted on personally verifying whether the Heavenly Spirit Flower in Li Fan’s possession was as miraculous as the rumors claimed.

But with Li Fan’s true body absent and impossible to contact, Liu San hurried back with Jiao Xiuyuan’s communication talisman, intending to report to Li Fan’s clone.

Yet, upon arriving in the Beast Realm, he discovered that Xu Bai was in a state of epiphany.

Not daring to disturb him, Liu San instead stood watch over him.

"Old Liu, the sect master’s enlightenment this time… seems rather extraordinary."

A voice rang in Liu San’s ears—it was Fang Zaiji speaking.

However, Fang Zaiji himself was nowhere to be seen. The voice originated from a golden eyeball floating in midair.

This was an experimental creation following his research on the True Cauldron of the Medicine King. Drawing inspiration from the [Great Dream of Early Autumn Formation], which connects the consciousness of multiple individuals within the Medicine King’s Cauldron, he crafted a set of Eighty-One [Eyes of Shared Vision].

The holders of these Eyes could not only communicate with one another but also synchronize and share everything they saw and heard. Even their perceptions of the changes in the world’s spiritual energy and their cultivation insights could be mutually sensed, as if they were experiencing them firsthand.

“You could clearly communicate with me directly in my Sea of Consciousness, yet you insist on speaking right next to my ear.” Liu San’s expression darkened slightly.

“You don’t understand. This is called a sense of ritual.” Fang Zaiji scoffed and retorted immediately.

Liu San turned his head and glanced at the golden eyeball.

The golden eyeball immediately darted to the side. “Old Liu, let’s talk this over calmly. This artifact was not easy to refine…”

Liu San was not one to indulge the other party. Just as he was about to act, he suddenly sensed something, raising his head to look toward the sky.

In his sleep, Xu Bai suddenly lifted his right hand. Using his finger as a brush, he made a sweeping motion in the air.

Countless specks of light gathered in the sky. Moments later, a vivid and lifelike painting of a roaring, rushing river appeared in the heavens.

“Go!”

Xu Bai pointed downward.

The painting transformed into a stream of light and plummeted toward the Beast Realm.

Then…

“Boom!”

A mighty river descended from the sky, manifesting out of thin air and crashing onto the land.

Yet Xu Bai did not stop.

Majestic mountains, ancient pines, deep ravines…

One breathtaking landscape painting after another materialized, descending like falling stars, scattering across the Beast Realm.

The earth roared continuously.

Ancient trees broke through the ground. Towering mountains rose from the land. Plains split open with thunderous cracks.

Like a divine creator, Xu Bai floated in the sky, shaping existence from nothingness, remodeling the Beast Realm according to his will.

Liu San and Fang Zaiji watched in stunned silence.

“…This…” Fang Zaiji hesitated, unsure.

“This is not an alteration made through resonance with this small world's Heavenly Dao. Rather, it is a direct manipulation, forcibly rewriting reality using an external, mysterious force.” Liu San saw through it at a glance.

“Such effortless control… While part of it is due to the Young Master’s clone fighting on home ground, that only enhances the power he can wield here.”

“It does not change the essence of this divine ability.”

A sharp light flashed through Fang Zaiji’s eyes. “In that case, if this technique were used in the outside world or even in the Xuanhuang Realm, as long as one’s power was great enough, wouldn’t it be possible to reshape mountains and rivers as easily as painting them?”

Liu San’s expression grew heavy as he slowly nodded.

“Issue a strict gag order to all sect disciples. This matter must be kept absolutely confidential.” Liu San spoke in a deep voice.

With their knowledge, even in the ancient cultivation era, this would have been considered an extraordinary divine ability.

Chapter 704: Creating Heaven’s Essence with Bare Hands

Destruction and creation have always been fundamentally different concepts.

Powerful cultivators can easily move mountains and boil seas. However, to create mountains and rivers from nothing with their bare hands is an infinitely more difficult task.

It may seem like many cultivators can achieve this, but in reality, they are merely relocating water and earth from one place to another within the world.

What Xu Bai had just done in the Beast Realm was completely different.

It was like bringing forth flowers with a flick of the wrist—creating something from nothing.

Or rather, reshaping the heavens and the earth.

As Dao Integration experts, Liu San and Fang Zaiji saw this with perfect clarity.

The mountains, rivers, and trees that had suddenly appeared in the Beast Realm had never been part of the world's natural evolution.

Yet, Xu Bai had forcibly rewritten the laws, compelling the world to undergo these changes.

This was not merely about the transformation of physical matter—it involved the very alteration of fundamental laws.

The rumbling within the Beast Realm gradually subsided. As Liu San and Fang Zaiji watched with complex emotions, Xu Bai awoke from his enlightenment.

Noticing the gazes gathered upon him, Xu Bai was momentarily stunned.

Then, as he observed the transformed landscape of the Beast Realm, realization dawned upon him.

"Even while still comprehending, my body naturally manifested it. My will merged with the heavens, and everything flowed seamlessly."

"Incredible!"

Of course, Li Fan was not praising himself from the depths of his heart, but rather, his clone.

Or more precisely, the unique essence left within this clone by Mr. Bai.

With a single thought, all the events that had unfolded within the Beast Realm during his moment of enlightenment instantly replayed in his mind.

Xu Bai pondered, "Using my hands as a brush to reshape the heavens and earth—this technique shall be called (Heaven's Transformation)."

The initial inspiration for Heaven’s Transformation originated from the Reverse Five Elements Life-Death Sword.

Back then, Li Fan had comprehended this divine ability from the grand phenomena of the Five Elements Converging into One, the Shattering of the Five Elements from the roots of heaven and earth, and the Weaving of the Five Elements into a Cave-Heaven.

This ability allowed him to perform simple acts of "creation," such as condensing scattered spiritual energy into spirit stones.

However, as the complexity of creation increased, Li Fan found himself powerless.

Yet this time, he had managed to alter the world with a mere wave of his hand. The key to this breakthrough lay in the seventeen-petaled Heavenly Spirit Flower.

Upon the petals of the Heavenly Spirit Flower, the mountains and rivers of the Heavenly Spirit Continent were depicted. As Xu Bai carefully observed them, he felt as if he were soaring above the prefecture itself, witnessing its vast landscapes unfold.

The entire process of how mountains and rivers were formed in the world was displayed before him.

Simply put, Heaven and Earth had become his teachers, using the Heavenly Spirit Flower to demonstrate the act of creation.

Thus, in his moment of enlightenment, Xu Bai instinctively imitated and followed the guidance of the world itself. Without conscious effort, he replicated this process within the Beast Realm.

"Heaven’s Transformation—Xu Bai wields it effortlessly. But for my true self to master it completely, I will need repeated practice."

Strictly speaking, Heaven’s Transformation was far more ornamental than practical outside the Beast Realm.

After all, Li Fan was still only in the Nascent Soul Realm, and the impact he could have on the world was quite limited.

However, this technique possessed limitless potential.

The greatest application Li Fan could currently envision was the creation of "Essence of Heaven and Earth."

As a necessary catalyst for advancing to the Soul Transformation Realm, Essence of Heaven and Earth was a driving force behind world-changing transformations.

From the Heavenly Spirit, a thousand rivers would be born.

From the Great Hua, a thousand mountains would arise…

A Nascent Soul cultivator seeking to break through to the Soul Transformation realm must first observe an imminent change within a particular region.

Afterward, they must extract and absorb this "force of transformation" to complete their advancement.

In Congyun Sea, there are hundreds of Nascent Soul cultivators, yet only two Soul Transformation cultivators—Ziyun and Hongxi.

This vast numerical disparity clearly illustrates the immense difficulty of this breakthrough.

For an ordinary Nascent Soul cultivator, merely detecting the transformation of heaven and earth is already an insurmountable challenge. Even more difficult is absorbing the "Essence of Heaven and Earth" while evading the watchful eyes of other Nascent Soul cultivators—an endeavor akin to ascending the heavens.

However, for Li Fan, who had mastered the divine ability "Heaven's Transformation", it was entirely possible to initiate a transformation of the heavens in a remote and uninhabited area.

He could then steal this power and complete his advancement with ease.

And if he dared to be even bolder...

Mass-producing Soul Transformation cultivators wouldn't be impossible!

Dao Integration cultivators were essentially the rulers of their respective provinces, while Soul Transformation cultivators formed the core strength of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

If an organization suddenly emerged with dozens or even hundreds of Soul Transformation cultivators, both the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association would have no choice but to take it seriously.

Of course, all of this was predicated on one crucial factor: that the process of using "Heaven’s Transformation" to manipulate the Xuanhuang Transformation Force remained undetected by stronger cultivators.

A few discreet attempts, properly concealed, might go unnoticed. But large-scale disturbances?

Those would undoubtedly expose everything.

At that point, attracting the attention of Dao Integration cultivators—or even Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereigns—would be inevitable.

Thus, for now, Li Fan needed to gradually experiment with casting "Heaven's Transformation" in the Xuanhuang Realm while ensuring his own safety.

"Congratulations, Young Master, on making further progress along the Dao!"

Seeing Li Fan awaken, Liu San flew forward to offer his congratulations, his expression tinged with joy.

Even as he spoke, he casually sealed the surrounding space to prevent the secret from being exposed—that Xu Bai was actually Li Fan’s clone.

Meanwhile, Fang Zaiji maneuvered the "Shared Vision Eye" closer and chimed in:

"Using mountains and rivers as a canvas, laws as ink, and divine abilities as a brush…Sect Master, you are truly extraordinary!"

"I recall that the Divine Brush Sect once had a similar technique. Unfortunately, shortly after Chu Youhong created that move, the sect was utterly annihilated..."

"This move..."

Liu San’s face twitched. Before Fang Zaiji could finish, he waved his sleeve and retracted the golden eyeball.

Fang Zaiji's voice abruptly cut off, and silence enveloped the area.

Liu San then turned to Xu Bai and relayed Jiao Xiuyuan’s conditions.

"Daoist Jiao still refuses to act without seeing tangible benefits first, huh?"

Xu Bai had expected this response.

He extended his left palm, and seventeen petals of the Heavenly Spirit Flower floated into his grasp.

He plucked a petal with a smile.

Although the frozen Heavenly Spirit Flower remained completely intact, a transparent petal—one reflecting the image of the rising sun slanting over mountain ridges—appeared in his right hand.

"This is something I 'copied' from the original Heavenly Spirit Flower. It holds only a tenth of its essence, but… it is more than enough."

"Elder Liu, deliver this to Jiao Xiuyuan. He will naturally recognize its value."

Xu Bai spoke calmly.

Liu San solemnly cupped the transparent petal in his palm before nodding and swiftly departing.

"We need to speed things up."

"This must be completed before the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance officially announces the start of the Great Exploration Era."

"Otherwise, once everyone rushes off to explore the White Mist, who will still be around to buy my Heavenly Spirit Flowers?"

Xu Bai muttered to himself while waving his hand like a brush, sketching out one imitation Heavenly Spirit Flower petal after another in midair.

Chapter 705: Cultivators Gather at Tianling

Seven days later, under Jiao Xiuyuan's deliberate influence, a piece of news spread throughout the entire Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance in just half a day.

The mysterious cultivator who possessed the Heavenly Spirit Flower was about to appear once more.

At that time, he would host a Flower Appreciation Gathering, inviting all cultivators interested in this flower to come and admire it.

The location of this Flower Appreciation Gathering was set in Tianling Prefecture!

Most cultivators found the news rather baffling when they first heard it. After all, things like flower appreciation and admiration seemed far removed from their daily struggles—earning contribution points, calculating how long it would take to acquire their desired cultivation techniques, and simply trying to improve themselves. If they had the spare time, they’d rather take on another mission or two.

However, those who had been keeping an eye on the Heavenly Spirit Flower were now growing restless. They began making inquiries, trying to uncover the identity of this mysterious cultivator.

As soon as the Qianli Hall, which had branches in every city of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance, began displaying “replica copies” of the true Heavenly Spirit Flower, things started to spiral into madness.

The true Heavenly Spirit Flower—a title newly coined by the Qianli Hall for the world's only original Heavenly Spirit plant.

Although there had long been rumors about how mystical and extraordinary this flower was, only a handful of fortunate individuals had actually witnessed it with their own eyes.

No matter how convincing the stories were, nothing compared to seeing it in person.

Thus, when those initially indifferent cultivators laid eyes on the transparent petals within the Qianli Hall, their skepticism quickly turned into awe.

"Gifted by the heavens… truly gifted by the heavens! I thought people were exaggerating, but now…"

"I heard that the divine aura of these transparent petals isn't even one-tenth of the true Heavenly Spirit Flower? If the replica is already this astonishing, then what kind of supreme existence must the real one be?"

"Ah… it can only be admired from afar, never possessed. A divine artifact like this will never fall into the hands of ordinary cultivators like us."

For most cultivators, while they were indeed stunned and captivated by the beauty of the true Heavenly Spirit Flower, if it was merely a matter of aesthetics, they would have simply sighed in admiration, etched the memory in their minds, and eventually forgotten about it over time.

Would they go through the trouble of traveling thousands of miles to Heavenly Spirit Prefecture just to attend a Flower Appreciation Gathering?

The sheer lifespan loss from the journey alone was significant, not to mention the various costs and dangers along the way…

There were countless beautiful treasures in the world—losing out on one Heavenly Spirit Flower was hardly a big deal.

That was how most cultivators felt—until a series of inexplicable events occurred, completely overturning their perception of the flower.

It all began with a late-stage Golden Core cultivator who had been trapped for years due to the Heavenly Calamity. Upon witnessing the transparent petals displayed at the Qianli Hall, he was struck with sudden enlightenment, inexplicably breaking through his bottleneck.

He advanced to the Golden Core Perfection stage, with the Nascent Soul realm now within reach.

At that moment, he was so overwhelmed with emotion that he wept openly, letting out a long cry of joy.

Soon after, more and more similar cases began emerging across different prefectures.

Rumors spread of cultivators achieving breakthroughs upon merely seeing the replica petals—some even claimed to have comprehended powerful divine abilities from the mystical visions hidden within the flower’s essence.

As the stories became more and more exaggerated, skepticism arose.

Some people began to suspect that this was all just a publicity stunt by the Qianli Hall—a scheme to artificially inflate the value of the true Heavenly Spirit Flower.

"Instant enlightenment? Sudden breakthroughs? Hah, it’s all an act! A ploy to drive up the price!"

Conspiracy theories always had an audience.

Yet, regardless of the rumors, the number of cultivators flocking to Heavenly Spirit Prefecture continued to grow…

This skepticism quickly resonated with many cultivators. They spontaneously began investigating the identities of those who had recently broken through within the Thousand Mile Hall.

However, after thorough investigations, an unexpected discovery emerged.

Every cultivator they could find was genuinely someone who had been stuck at a cultivation bottleneck for many years.

And indeed, in recent times, they had successfully broken through. Each one had their friends, family, and numerous records as evidence—there was no room for falsification!

Facts spoke louder than words, and the investigation results immediately caused an uproar.

This True Heavenly Spirit Flower was not only beautiful—it could even help cultivators break through bottlenecks and comprehend divine abilities!

The difference in value between something merely beautiful and something that could enhance cultivation was immeasurable.

More importantly, treasures that could aid in Dao comprehension were typically monopolized by the powerful, making them nearly impossible for ordinary people to obtain.

Yet now, this Heavenly Spirit Flower was freely available for public viewing!

Even though the displayed ones were only replicas, they still had the effect of aiding comprehension!

Cultivators couldn't help but be tempted.

Thus, before the news spread too widely, they rushed toward the nearest Qianli Hall in a frenzy.

In an instant, the Qianli Hall became overcrowded.

Long lines formed at the entrance, and Jiao Xiuyuan beamed with joy as he maintained order.

"Young Master, was this within your expectations?"

In the Beast Realm, Liu San raised an eyebrow in confusion as he read the joyous report from Jiao Xiuyuan.

"The True Heavenly Spirit Flower does indeed have unique properties. But even the imitations you created can help cultivators comprehend the Dao?"

A trace of doubt flickered in his eyes.

"Perhaps it's because Elder Liu’s natural talent is too low," a thoughtful voice suddenly echoed from the floating golden eyeball beside him.

"Why are you haunting me like a lingering ghost?!" Liu San's expression darkened.

He reached out to grab the Eye of Shared Vision, but his grasp caught nothing but air.

"Tch, trying to catch me? Do you think I’d make the same mistake twice?" Fang Zaiji spoke smugly.

Meanwhile, Xu Bai's clone ignored Fang Zaiji’s antics, temporarily halting his painting of the Heavenly Spirit Flower replicas. He turned to look at Liu San.

"It’s not just about my replicas capturing a fraction of the True Flower’s essence. Even a blank sheet of paper—if enough cultivators observe it—will eventually inspire some to gain insights." He smiled.

"Hiss… So that’s how it is. Master, since when did you become so cunning?" Fang Zaiji's incredulous voice rang out.

Xu Bai remained expressionless and extended his hand.

This time, Fang Zaiji failed to dodge. The golden eyeball was caught firmly in his grasp.

Fang Zaiji’s voice was abruptly silenced.

Li Fan turned to Liu San and explained, "Elder Liu, your divine sense is still synchronized with the Eye of Shared Vision, which is why Elder Fang could anticipate your movements. If you temporarily disconnect, you won’t miss again."

Liu San suddenly realized, "I completely forgot about that."

Xu Bai smiled slightly, choosing not to comment further.

His expression then turned serious as he asked, "Elder Liu, how is the pill refinement coming along?"

Liu San carefully took out a wooden box from his robes.

"The Soul-Melting Body-Dissolving Pill is refined from over a hundred highly toxic ingredients. Upon ingestion, the body will dissolve completely within a single breath’s time—erasing one’s existence from the world. Even Dao Integration cultivators are no exception."

"Young Master, you intend to…?"

"It’s for myself—to make suicide more convenient when the time comes." Xu Bai said indifferently.

Chapter 706: Recalling Memories Once Again

Xu Bai's words startled Liu San.

However, he quickly realized that when Xu Bai mentioned "suicide," he was referring to his clone.

"Young Master, why go to such lengths? With Old Fang and me here, along with the Medicine King's True Cauldron, even if we are outmatched, escaping shouldn't be too difficult." Liu San looked at Xu Bai with some confusion.

Xu Bai did not elaborate further. "This is just a precaution, nothing more."

Seeing this, Liu San did not press the matter. Instead, he advised, "If it is for the sake of a swift end, Young Master can use spiritual power to envelop the Soul-Melting Body-Dissolving Pill and store it in your dantian. At the critical moment, dissolving the pill will allow its effects to spread throughout your body in an instant. During this process, you must also be mindful of…"

After listening to Liu San's detailed instructions, Xu Bai calmly swallowed the highly toxic pill.

Feeling the lethal presence within his dantian, Xu Bai suddenly felt much more at ease.

"With the additional safeguard of the Mysterious True Spirit Transformation technique, which allows me to discard this clone's life at will, I should never find myself in a situation where I cannot die if needed."

After all, this clone was heading to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance headquarters to meet with Law Derivation Jade. The level of power he might encounter there was unpredictable.

Moreover, Xu Bai's unique appearance and aura made him easily recognizable…

It was only natural to make thorough preparations.

"Next, it all depends on how Fellow Daoist Jiao performs."

Standing in the void of the Beast Realm, Xu Bai gazed into the distance as if his vision could pierce through space and time, seeing the events unfolding in Tianling Prefecture.

"Damn it, the last time Tianling Prefecture was this lively was…"

Inside Tianling City, a guard cultivator responsible for maintaining order looked at the vast crowd of gathered cultivators and cursed under his breath.

However, before he could finish his sentence, his words caught in his throat.

It was as if he had forgotten something important, leaving him momentarily lost in thought. "When was the last time Tianling Prefecture had this many people?"

He was puzzled.

"It was during the Tianling Prefecture War."

Beside him, a lean and serious-looking cultivator responded coldly.

As the lost memories resurfaced in his mind, the guard cultivator felt as if he had traveled back in time to centuries ago. His expression grew distant.

"Yes, before the Tianling Prefecture War, the city was just as crowded."

"Old Sun, your memory is really something. I had almost forgotten about that…"

Sun Qi ignored his colleague's mumbling. Instead, he carefully examined the Floral Invitation in his hands, his eyes flickering with excitement.

The Floral Invitation was an exclusive entry ticket to the upcoming Flower Viewing Gathering.

Due to the overwhelming number of cultivators arriving for the event, even the massive space that Tianling City's Lord had prepared was nearly full.

To prevent chaos, all cultivators hoping to enter and witness the True Heavenly Spirit Flower had to do so in an orderly manner, based on their arrival sequence.

Since they had come from far and wide, most cultivators didn't mind paying the 100 Contribution Points entry fee.

The real issue was time.

The queue of cultivators had completely filled Tianling City, and in an unprecedented move, the teleportation formations leading into the city had been temporarily shut down.

For ordinary cultivators, it was impossible to predict how long they would have to wait to see the True Heavenly Spirit Flower.

Moreover, the Flower Viewing Gathering had no official duration.

The True Heavenly Spirit Flower itself was merely being stored at Qianli Hall by its owner, who could retrieve it at any moment.

If one missed this opportunity, there might never be another.

Naturally, the sooner one could see the True Heavenly Spirit Flower, the better.

The Floral Invitation granted its holder priority entry, bypassing the queue entirely.

Rumors had it that these invitations had already been scalped to prices as high as 10,000 Contribution Points per ticket, and even at that price, they were extremely limited and difficult to obtain.

The only reason Sun Qi had one was because his uncle had gifted it to him.

Sun Qi’s uncle, Sun Liancheng, was the newly appointed Lord of Tianling City in Tianling Prefecture.

A Dao Integration cultivator, he guarded the entire Tianling region.

“This Tianling Flower does seem to have some unique qualities. It appears to be somewhat different from what I have seen before. You can take a look—perhaps it might help you break through,” Sun Liancheng said in a detached tone, as if he held little hope.

It was no surprise—Sun Qi had been trapped at the Golden Core stage for far too long due to the Calamity of Heaven.

He had exhausted countless methods, even risking his life by throwing himself into the battles of the Tianling War-zone, hoping that the immense terror between life and death would help him break through his bottleneck. But in the end, every attempt ended in failure.

Apart from Sun Qi himself, the rest of the family had already given up on him.

“Heavenly Spirit Flower…” A vivid image of it emerged in Sun Qi’s mind.

As a native cultivator of Tianling Prefecture, he was naturally familiar with it.

Before the great war, he would occasionally buy a few pots of the flower for personal enjoyment when the mood struck him.

However, after the war, the Heavenly Spirit Flower had become tainted with the scent of blood.

Every time he saw one, it would remind him of the hellish battlefield during the war in Tianling Prefecture. From then on, he never purchased another.

“I never expected that a original Heavenly Spirit Flower would still exist in this world.” Sun Qi was momentarily lost in thought.

After completing his task handover with a fellow cultivator, he hurried home, changed into fresh robes, and set off for the Paradise Amidst Flowers.

Paradise Amidst Flowers was the venue prepared for the Floral Appreciation Gathering in Tianling City. It had been jointly created by his uncle, Sun Liancheng, and a cultivator named Zhao Chong.

Zhao Chong was well-known for his love of flowers.

Upon hearing that the Floral Appreciation Gathering was to be held in Tianling Prefecture, he personally sought out Sun Liancheng and volunteered to help set up the venue free of charge—his only request was to witness the true Heavenly Spirit Flower with his own eyes.

Though Zhao Chong was only a Soul Transformation cultivator, he had an extensive network of connections, with ties to several esteemed Dao Integration cultivators within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Sun Liancheng found it difficult to refuse and had no choice but to accept.

The entrance to the Paradise Amidst Flowers was located at the Dharma-Transmitting Plaza within the city. There, a dark-skinned man named Jiao Xiuyuan had set up a table, beaming as he blocked the entrance.

Only after presenting his Floral Invitation was Sun Qi allowed to enter the Paradise Amidst Flowers.

Before he could take in his surroundings, a rich and intoxicating floral fragrance enveloped him.

In an open space covered in a vibrant array of flowers, rows of chairs woven from green vines were arranged neatly, already occupied by numerous cultivators.

Sun Qi, being a solitary individual by nature, scanned the crowd but found no one he recognized. Without hesitation, he located his assigned seat and patiently waited.

It was unclear how much time had passed when a sudden wave of noise rippled through the venue.

The first group of lucky participants had begun to enter the deeper parts of the Paradise Amidst Flowers.

Once all the cultivators had gathered inside, Jiao Xiuyuan abruptly appeared on the grand stage at the front, a platform adorned with beautiful and exotic flowers.

In his hands, he held a red wooden box, immediately drawing the attention of every cultivator present.

“Fellow Daoists, the Flower Appreciation Gathering officially begins!”

Without unnecessary words, Jiao Xiuyuan made the simple yet exciting announcement.

Chapter 707: The Reversed Evolution of Heaven and Earth Record

Amid the attention of the entire audience, Jiao Xiuyuan opened the wooden box.

A thin, translucent "paper" as light as a cicada's wing and emitting a gentle white glow slowly floated into the air.

"The True Heavenly Spirit Flower!" A cultivator in the crowd couldn't help but exclaim.

Some were even so stunned by the flower’s beauty that they stood up in astonishment.

Strangely enough, even though the True Heavenly Spirit Flower was sealed within a flat surface, those who gazed upon it did not perceive anything unnatural.

It was as if a real flower were blooming slowly before their very eyes, breathtakingly beautiful.

Even a faint floral fragrance seemed to drift through the air.

As the crowd fell into complete silence, entranced by the True Heavenly Spirit Flower’s beauty, Jiao Xiuyuan smiled triumphantly and gently pointed at the translucent paper in midair.

In an instant, countless rays of light shot out from it, projecting the originally palm-sized flower into the sky above the venue.

The projection magnified the flower tens of thousands of times without losing any of its ethereal charm. Every petal's intricate details became even more vivid and clear.

While all the cultivators were captivated by the sight, Jiao Xiuyuan discreetly crushed a small round bead in his hand.

A faint white mist, carrying an aura of profound mystery, began to spread across the venue.

Even though his body was only a puppet, Jiao Xiuyuan instinctively avoided the mist. He subtly cast a protective barrier around himself, keeping the mist at bay.

He recalled the words of the Dao Integration cultivator named Liu San—clearly an alias—who had given him this item.

"Ahem, this is an elixir I have meticulously refined. It aids cultivators in their cultivation. Once inhaled as mist, it induces an almost—but not quite—genuine state of enlightenment..."

As Jiao Xiuyuan observed the entranced expressions of the cultivators around him, he muttered to himself:

"Even though he swore that this improved version has absolutely no addictive properties..."

"It's still best to avoid this kind of mysterious stuff whenever possible."

The True Heavenly Spirit Flower continued to bloom radiantly. Its petals cast mesmerizing reflections on the faces of every cultivator in the Paradise Amidst Flowers.

Each viewing session lasted only three hours. Once the time passed, the opportunity would be lost forever. Thus, almost every pair of eyes remained locked on the projected True Heavenly Spirit Flower above.

Only one person, however, was staring blankly at the frozen thin paper in the center of the venue.

"There's no mistake—Ice Dew Condensation, Image Capture, Thousand-Color Elegance..."

"This is exactly the same technique I use in my Floral Anthology to preserve flowers. But I have never shared this method with anyone else!"

Zhao Chong's eyes were filled with disbelief.

"Could it be... that someone else in this world has managed to think of the same technique as I did?"

After laying eyes on the True Heavenly Spirit Flower, Zhao Chong's lifelong yearning was finally fulfilled. He no longer cared about breaking through realms or comprehending divine abilities.

Instead, his curiosity was drawn toward the mysterious owner of the Heavenly Spirit Flower, who had yet to reveal themselves.

Time passed slowly as the cultivators remained immersed in their trance.

As the three-hour mark approached, no one had shown any signs of breaking through or achieving enlightenment.

"This is the first exhibition—I can't afford to mess this up."

Just as Jiao Xiuyuan was about to activate his pre-arranged backup plan, a sudden fluctuation stopped him in his tracks.

"It's that kid! Perfect—now I don't have to waste extra effort advertising this!"

Seeing who was undergoing a breakthrough, Jiao Xiuyuan was overjoyed.

He instantly teleported next to the cultivator and sealed off the energy fluctuation to prevent any disturbances to the others' comprehension.

The first to break through was none other than Sun Qi.

As he gazed at the breathtaking scene of the Heavenly Spirit Flower in the sky, he suddenly felt as if he had been transported back to a brutal battlefield.

Yet, unlike the current blood-soaked battlefield infused with the Heavenly Spirit Flower’s aura, this time, he felt no urge to kill.

Instead, the world's beauty flowed through him like water, healing and soothing the deep psychological scars left by war.

It was as if time had reversed—blood, corpses, and the cracked earth all vanished. His vision soared above the Tianling Prefecture, returning to an era before the great war.

Sun Qi was completely mesmerized by everything he saw.

In that moment, he forgot his family's expectations, the disappointment of his elders, the mockery of his peers, and even his own relentless desire to break through.

His mind was filled solely with the beauty of the Heavenly Spirit and the world itself.

His hostility dissipated entirely, and his cultivation advanced naturally.

By the time he regained consciousness, the seemingly insurmountable bottleneck of the Heaven’s Calamity—which had troubled him for years and nearly driven him to despair—had completely vanished without a trace.

Now, all he needed was a suitable cave dwelling to refine the energy, and he would instantly step into the Nascent Soul Realm.

For the Sun Family, this was an easily achievable feat.

In the past, if he had broken through suddenly, he might have been overwhelmed with joy.

But at this moment, Sun Qi felt neither happiness nor sorrow.

He remained seated in silence, ignoring the occasional glances cast his way, and continued to gaze intently at the True Heavenly Spirit Flower above.

It was only when the host, Jiao Xiuyuan, finally stored the flower back into the wooden box and announced the end of the first appreciation event that he snapped out of his trance.

Excited voices, sighs of regret, and words of admiration filled the air.

"Daoist Jiao, name your price! How much for this Heavenly Spirit True Flower?"

Having witnessed its wonders firsthand, some cultivators could no longer hold back and asked impatiently.

Their inquiries quickly gained support from others.

Jiao Xiuyuan, however, only smiled and replied:

"How many times do I have to tell you? The flower’s owner is very clear about his stance: Not for sale. Not for sale. Still not for sale!"

"Even though I'd love to broker this deal, there's nothing I can do if the owner refuses to sell!"

A commotion erupted among the crowd.

A rotund, middle-aged cultivator stood up arrogantly and said, "I refuse to believe that there’s anything money can't buy! Ten million contribution points—does that work? If not, I’ll offer more!"

Before Jiao Xiuyuan could respond, another voice from the crowd mocked him sarcastically:

"Oh? Isn't this Daoist Zhu Yuhua from the Tianshu Prefecture? I heard you’re quite wealthy, but why start with only ten million contribution points? Are you looking down on us?"

"Heh, with such a low offer, you might as well settle for those imitation flowers!"

Zhu Yuhua's expression darkened as he turned toward the speakers. They were indeed all influential figures.

Realizing that ten million contribution points were insignificant to them, he swallowed his words and prepared to increase his offer.

However, Jiao Xiuyuan quickly stepped in as the mediator.

"Everyone, everyone…"

Raising his voice, he once again captured the audience’s attention.

"The Heavenly Spirit Flower’s owner is an extraordinary person, unmatched in both grace and elegance. Naturally, he treasures the world’s only Heavenly Spirit Flower beyond measure and would never sell it."

"However…" He paused before continuing,

"While he won’t sell it, he has agreed to an alternative arrangement after some persuasion on my part."

"The True Heavenly Spirit Flower will be available for rental instead of sale!"

"If any of you are interested, stay behind to hear the details."

...

"Only for rent, not for sale. This Master of the Heavenly Spirit Flowers truly knows how to do business." Sun Qi chuckled.

Watching the crowd of cultivators swarming toward Jiao Xiuyuan, Sun Qi knew that he lacked the ability to rent the Heavenly Spirit Flower. Shaking his head, he quietly left the Paradise Amidst Flowers.

After leaving, the first person he visited was his uncle, Sun Liancheng. After all, his recent breakthrough was primarily due to the Floral Invitation that Sun Liancheng had gifted him.

He had only waited for a short moment in his uncle’s cave dwelling before Sun Liancheng arrived in a hurry.

"Good… good…" Sun Liancheng examined him from head to toe, even more excited than Sun Qi himself about his breakthrough.

"The prodigy of the Sun Clan has finally returned after all these years," Sun Liancheng sighed with emotion.

Sun Qi let out a self-deprecating laugh. "Prodigy…?"

"Born at the Foundation Establishment realm, reaching Golden Core by the full moon—I did indeed live up to the title of 'prodigy' back then. But now, I am already 213 years old…"

Sun Qi gently shook his head. "How can I be considered a prodigy? Uncle, please refrain from calling me that in the future. Others have long since reached the Nascent Soul and Soul Transformation stages, while I am still lingering at the Golden Core stage…"

"If word gets out, I will surely be ridiculed."

Sun Liancheng, however, remained unconcerned. "Why should our Sun family care about what others think? Qi’er, you have remained at the Golden Core stage for over two hundred years, but now you have finally broken free. With such a solid foundation, your future is boundless."

"Moreover…"

A peculiar expression flickered across Sun Liancheng’s face. "Breaking through is so difficult—it’s not your fault. After all, the entire clan's bottleneck has been placed upon your shoulders."

"On top of that, with the Primal Qi of Heaven and Earth as your innate companion artifact, you naturally draw the hostility of the world. To have even broken through the Golden Core Heaven's Calamity within your lifetime is already a blessing. Many ancestors never even reached the Golden Core stage before exhausting their lifespan and perishing. But now…"

Sun Liancheng patted Sun Qi's shoulder, his tone filled with satisfaction. "The future is promising!"

Sun Qi’s expression remained entirely unchanged.

"The next major bottleneck in Reversing the Heaven and Earth Record should be in the late Soul Transformation stage, correct?" Sun Liancheng asked.

Sun Qi gave a slight nod.

"Don’t worry. The Cave-Heaven, Heavenly Marrow, and all necessary resources will be prepared for you by the clan. You only need to focus on cultivating."

After a long silence, Sun Liancheng suddenly sighed. "Qi’er, the burden of the entire clan rests solely on your shoulders. This has hindered your cultivation, and you cannot even voice your struggles to anyone. You must endure it all in silence. Do you feel wronged or resentful?"

Sun Qi remained composed. "It is simply my duty. Countless ancestors have made silent sacrifices just as I have. It is precisely because of their dedication that the Sun family is as powerful as it is today. How could I possibly feel resentment?"

Sun Liancheng narrowed his eyes, carefully scrutinizing Sun Qi, as if trying to determine whether his words were genuine.

After a long moment, just as he was about to speak, his expression suddenly shifted. "We have a guest."

"Then I shall take my leave, Uncle." Sun Qi cupped his hands and turned to leave.

"No need, just stay here. It's nothing important," Sun Liancheng stopped him.

"Hahaha, Old Sun, we've hit the jackpot this time!" A voice rang out before the person even arrived.

Upon hearing Jiao Xiuyuan’s voice, Sun Qi remained silent and motionless.

Moments later, Jiao Xiuyuan strode in, brimming with confidence.

"The number of cultivators who have traveled here is far beyond your expectations, hahaha…"

Mid-sentence, he noticed Sun Qi standing quietly in the room and immediately halted, his eyes flashing with an unreadable expression.

"Haha, no need for secrecy, Daoist Jiao. Qi’er is not an outsider," Sun Liancheng waved his hand dismissively.

Jiao Xiuyuan opened his mouth as if to say something but ultimately let out a light chuckle instead.

"Old Sun, you misunderstand. Of course, I know the relationship between this boy and you. However, we agreed to confidentiality when signing the contract."

His voice suddenly became inaudible as his lips moved in silence. Upon hearing his words, Sun Liancheng’s expression shifted between shock and delight.

After exchanging a few more words, Jiao Xiuyuan retrieved a small Tianxuan Mirror from his sleeve.

Following the completion of their transaction, he promptly departed in a hurry.

"I never expected someone to be willing to trade a Dao Integration-level Derivative Jade Token just to be the first to lease that Heavenly Spirit Flower…"

"It seems that compared to the true elites of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, our Sun family still has a long way to go." Sun Liancheng sighed lightly. "The road ahead is arduous."

Hearing this, Sun Qi was momentarily stunned. "Wasn’t this supposed to be confidential?"

"The contract only binds Jiao Xiuyuan, not me," Sun Liancheng replied indifferently.

"That Master of the Heavenly Spirit Flower is rather intriguing, though. An ancient cultivator from the distant past, emerging from the White Mist, now seeks my help in obtaining an entry status into the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance…"

"Qi’er, what do you think?" Sun Liancheng asked after a brief moment of contemplation.

Sun Qi pondered for a moment before responding, "A schemer. Possibly a spy from the Five Elders Association."

Sun Liancheng burst into laughter and shook his head. "Qi’er, you are still too young. The Master of the Heavenly Spirit Flower has gone through so much trouble simply to meet Derivation Law Jade and request a Dao Integration cultivation technique suited to himself. If he were truly a spy, would he waste such a rare opportunity on something like this?"

"Besides, Derivation Law Jade is stationed at the headquarters of the Immortal Alliance Guardian Hall. With the True Intent of the Dao suppressing the area, what kind of spy would dare to cause trouble there? That would be a blatant act of suicide."

Sun Qi remained silent.

These hidden secrets were beyond the understanding of a mere Golden Core cultivator like himself. His uncle, Sun Liancheng, was subtly reminding him—no matter how much he advanced in cultivation, even if he broke through to the Nascent Soul stage, he was still nothing compared to the entire Sun family. His sole duty was to cultivate the Reversing the Heaven and Earth Record and bear the clan's bottleneck. He must never develop any rebellious thoughts.

"Hmph."

Firmly burying his fleeting thoughts of defiance deep within his heart, Sun Qi dared not reveal even the slightest change in expression.

Sun Liancheng seemed quite satisfied with his reaction. From that day forward, Sun Qi was permitted to stay in the City Lord’s Mansion.

Seven days later, Sun Qi finally encountered the mysterious Master of the Heavenly Spirit Flower, Xu Bai.

Despite priding himself on his unshakable composure, Sun Qi found himself momentarily dazed upon seeing the man. Only then did he realize that Jiao Xiuyuan's claim—"Master of the Heavenly Spirit Flower is a rare, unparalleled figure"—was not an exaggeration.

Xu Bai had come seeking status within the Immortal Alliance.

For Sun Liancheng, who held dominion over an entire province, this was a trivial matter.

In less than half a day, he bypassed all the necessary verifications and successfully secured Xu Bai’s membership.

After personally verifying his identity using the Tianxuan Mirror, Xu Bai nodded in satisfaction.

After offering a few words of praise regarding Sun Liancheng’s immense authority, he folded his fan and departed gracefully.

Sun Qi’s gaze followed his silhouette until it disappeared.

"He does seem to bear the favor of the heavens…"

"But what a pity—he has strayed from the righteous path," Sun Liancheng snorted coldly, giving his evaluation.

Sun Qi was momentarily stunned. He wondered if he had unknowingly done something to anger his uncle.

It was only after a few moments that he realized his uncle was not referring to him—

But to Xu Bai, who had just left.

"Strayed from the righteous path? Uncle, what do you mean?" Sun Qi asked, puzzled.

"Those favored by the heavens—back in the Ancient Cultivation Era, they would have been sought after by the great sects, natural-born prodigies of the Dao."

"But in this era…" Sun Liancheng’s eyes flashed with disdain.

"The New Method of the Immortal Ancestor is an act of defiance against the heavens themselves. The more one benefits from the heavens, the harder it becomes to defy them in the future."

"When the time comes to sacrifice one's Spirit of Heaven and Earth, the backlash from the will of the heavens will be exponentially stronger. No matter how talented one may be, they will likely never surpass the Soul Transformation stage."

"Just like your Primal Qi of Heaven and Earth—a fragment of the Heavenly Wonder, a gift of the heavens. Have you not sensed the world's hostility towards you? As your cultivation grows, this hostility will only intensify."

"Once, the heavens showered them with blessings, and yet, they choose to turn against it. How could they not be despised?"

Sun Qi silently nodded, lost in thought.

Neither he nor the Dao Integration-level Sun Liancheng noticed—

That from the very beginning, their conversation had been silently observed, every word recorded.

By none other than Li Fan—who lurked in the shadows, concealed within a formless killing intent.

Chapter 708: Xu Baimian, the Heavenly Sovereign

Outside the void of Tianling Prefecture, Li Fan, who had successfully stolen the Five Elements Grand Cave Heaven and broken through to the Nascent Soul stage, was preparing to quietly escape.

However, he noticed that a cultivator named Sun Qi, stationed below, seemed to vaguely perceive his presence.

Sun Qi even had a faint awareness of his Formless Killing Intent.

It was important to note that even ordinary Dao Integration cultivators would have difficulty detecting the Formless Killing Intent Li Fan unleashed while still at the Nascent Soul stage under the guise of false destiny.

Yet, this seemingly insignificant Golden Core cultivator managed to perceive it.

This series of signs indicated that Sun Qi was no ordinary person. As a result, Li Fan casually released a Formless Killing Intent to lock onto him.

For a long time, Sun Qi showed no unusual behavior. Like any ordinary cultivator, he practiced diligently and carried out missions assigned by the Immortal Alliance.

That was until recently, when the Lord of Tianling City, Sun Liancheng, approached him and handed him a Floral Invitation.

Within the Maze Zone, Li Fan, who was watching events unfold from millions of miles away, hesitated slightly in his movements.

"The more one benefits from the heavens, the harder it becomes to defy them…" Li Fan mused to himself.

"Brother Li, are you struggling to hold on?" Huangfu Song’s voice pulled him back to reality.

Dongfang Yao shouted, "Stay behind me! Huangfu, how much longer?"

"Just 1% left! Once this Maze Zone is fully resolved, hold on a little longer!" Huangfu Song called out.

"Damn it, hurry up!" Dongfang Yao roared, punching out and shattering dozens of lurking Shadow Beasts into fragments.

Li Fan looked outward—countless Black Shadow Beasts surged in from all directions like tidal waves, surrounding the three of them completely.

This was already the third Maze Zone they had explored during this period.

Compared to the previous two, which were barren and lifeless, the danger level here had suddenly multiplied several times over.

The seemingly calm ground was filled with strange Shadow Beasts hiding among jagged rocks.

During the daytime, they remained relatively dormant.

But as night fell and a crimson moon rose, the eerie beasts seemed to come alive under its orange-red glow.

They launched relentless assaults on the intruders—Li Fan and his companions.

These Shadow Beasts were not only swift and elusive but also incredibly lethal.

Even with Dongfang Yao’s formidable physical strength, he was left covered in wounds after taking a few hits from their claws.

What frustrated Li Fan and the others the most was that, no matter how much effort they put into slaughtering the crazed Shadow Beasts each night,

When the crimson moon rose again the following evening, the beasts reappeared in full force.

Not only did their numbers remain unchanged, but they also seemed to retain memories of the previous night’s battle.

This plunged Li Fan and his companions into a bitter struggle.

They barely managed to hold on, exhausting almost all their supplies in the process.

By the third day, before they could even finish exploring the entire Maze Zone,

The crimson moon descended earlier than expected.

Their situation immediately became critical.

Fortunately, both Huangfu Song and Dongfang Yao were powerful, while Li Fan had concealed the vast majority of his true cultivation and combat prowess.

As a result, despite the constant peril, they remained unscathed.

Though their defensive line appeared on the verge of collapse under the Shadow Beasts' relentless assault, it held firm—unyielding and unwavering.

Finally, when the Heaven-Measuring Mirror completed its full data recording,

The trio unleashed their full power, instantly clearing the surrounding area.

Then, the Samantabhadra True Boat shot into the sky, racing toward the crimson moon above.

Even though the Shadow Beasts had gone completely berserk, they still couldn’t stop them. They could only watch helplessly as Li Fan and the others flew into the Crimson Moon.

“Damn, that was way too close!” Dongfang Yao, covered in blood, couldn’t help but curse when he saw the familiar white mist around them.

“In the future, we shouldn’t listen to you anymore, Huangfu. If we had followed Brother Li’s plan from the start—avoiding an all-out battle on the first night and instead fighting while exploring—we would have completed the progress long ago and made our escape.” Complaining, he took a deep breath, and the deep, bone-exposing wounds on his body wriggled as they slowly healed.

“Hey, you can’t blame me for that. It’s all because of those damn Immortal Alliance rules. There’s a huge difference in rewards between 99% and 100% exploration—the reward points literally double! It’s practically forcing us to explore the entire Maze Zone.” Huangfu Song wiped the cold sweat from his forehead, looking somewhat innocent.

Li Fan, on the other hand, remained calm. “After all, the real danger is likely hidden within that last 1%. A full 100% exploration means eliminating all risks. The Immortal Alliance’s approach makes sense.”

“Let’s check our earnings this time. We gained another 1,600 points, plus what we had before…”

“Only 2,400 points.”

The expressions of the three turned sour.

“Didn’t expect such a huge difference in value between different Maze Zone.”

“I really miss the days when earning 30,000 Qingxuan points was effortless…” Dongfang Yao muttered.

“Shut up already!” Huangfu Song snapped irritably.

Li Fan didn’t join their bickering; instead, he focused on the Qingxuan Points exchange list displayed on the Heaven-Measuring Mirror.

"Dissociation Disc: 50,000 Qingxuan Points."

"Remaining stock: 8."

Li Fan sneered internally. “So they finally pulled this thing out to bait people. I wonder which poor fool bought the first one.”

This time, possibly to encourage cultivators to explore the white mist further, the rare items on the Qingxuan Points exchange list had limited stock—once exchanged, they were gone for good.

However, the rewards were indeed generous. Aside from the nine Dissociation Discs, the list also included the [Spirit of the Xuan Mirror] and [Endstone Plate].

The Spirit of the Xuan Mirror was a sentient consciousness with a decent level of intelligence. It could be fused into any magical treasure, significantly enhancing its power.

As for the Endstone Plate, it was a newly emerged secondary artifact. It appeared as a circular stone plate, hence its name.

Its exact function had yet to be discovered.

“This Endstone Plate Plate… seems to be the [Calamity Destruction Stone Plate]. In my previous life, the Heaven-Suppressing Society used this item to mass-produce [Calamity Stones], which could block the Mysterious Net’s detection. It took their cultivators years of research to uncover its true potential. Since the item has only just emerged, it makes sense that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance hasn’t figured out its effects yet.”

“100,000 Qingxuan Points, huh…”

Li Fan stroked his chin, recalling the areas he had secretly noted along the way—places where the wails of the "Tian Yi" could be heard continuously.

Based on his experiences so far, not every Maze Zone emitted the faint sound of the "Tian Yi."

However, whenever the "Tian Yi" sound appeared, it always meant that a Maze Zone could be found nearby.

"It shouldn’t all be the experimental grounds of that Heavenly Sovereign who reversed life and death."

"A bit risky, but not necessarily impossible to explore."

A sense of eagerness stirred in Li Fan’s heart.

While his true self was exploring the white mist, in the Beast Realm, Xu Bai had already prepared to head to the headquarters of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance.

"Sect Master, why are you taking off all the protective artifacts I refined for you? Are you dissatisfied with me or something?" Fang Zaiji panicked as he saw Xu Bai remove the folding fan, white robe, scented pouch, and other items one by one.

Xu Bai chuckled lightly. "Once I arrive at the headquarters of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance, if real danger arises, these items won’t be of much use."

"Rather than letting them be buried along with my clone, it’s better to leave them here."

Liu San shot a fierce glare at Fang Zaiji before reassuring Xu Bai, "Young Master, you need not worry. I asked Daoist Jiao about this—the Immortal Alliance cultivators who use the Derivative Jade Token have almost never encountered any accidents. Nearly all of them return safely."

"Your clone should be no exception."

Xu Bai waved his hand dismissively. "You two don’t need to worry. It’s just a clone. Even if it’s lost, I can refine another one."

"Elder Liu, is the [Great Dream Spring and Autumn Formation] ready?"

Liu San nodded solemnly. "We have already linked your clone’s consciousness to a blank node. If an irresistible force intervenes, it will help him maintain clarity of thought for a brief moment."

"That’s sufficient." Xu Bai smiled.

Then, he set off alone from the Longevity Valley.

Using the teleportation formation, he traveled across multiple prefecture and arrived in Fuyu Prefecture, located in the central region of the Immortal Alliance.

In a secluded area, he activated the Derivative Jade Token.

Moments later, a square-shaped gate appeared out of thin air. A black-clothed cultivator stepped out from within.

After glancing at the Derivative Jade Token in Li Fan’s hand, the black-clothed cultivator said nothing.

He simply led Li Fan through the transparent portal.

A brief moment of dizziness followed, and Li Fan immediately realized he had arrived inside the headquarters of the Immortal Alliance.

Unlike the Statue of the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor he had seen in his past life, this time, upon entering the headquarters with his clone, he saw a different vision—a thin and solitary figure.

Hands clasped behind his back, gazing up at the sky, letting out a soft sigh.

"Before us, The path to immortality lies ahead, yet it cannot be treaded. The Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor stands above!"

Chapter 709: Transmission of the Ultimate Dharma

It was as if the entire world responded to that figure's words, plunging into darkness in an instant.

Xu Bai vaguely heard a sound of helpless wailing.

Then, the thin figure slightly shook his head and turned around.

Their eyes met.

Boom!

Xu Bai's mind instantly exploded, roaring with noise. He was shocked to discover that the figure's appearance was identical to his own!

No...

In a flash, his vision blurred, and the face abruptly changed. Xu Bai seemed to see the peerless visage of Mr. Bai.

However, it was different from the time he saw him at the Beast-Taming Sect. Back then, Mr. Bai appeared as an unrivaled, celestial being.

Now, there was a profound sense of compassion and sorrow—a more genuine, mortal presence.

His clear eyes seemed to carry countless emotions and stories waiting to be told, like a vortex gradually engulfing Xu Bai’s mind.

"Wake up!"

A soft yet powerful voice rang out, like a great bell echoing from beyond the heavens. It pierced through the endless worlds and suddenly resounded in Xu Bai's ears.

Xu Bai’s previously dull, lifeless gaze instantly regained a trace of clarity.

When he looked again at Mr. Bai, the flesh on his face melted away like a candle, revealing a horrifying and sinister sight.

The once breathtakingly beautiful face now appeared eerie and grim.

In just a brief moment, the terrifying transformation spread from Mr. Bai's face to his entire body.

Like being stripped away by a gust of wind, he instantly became a skeletal figure, his hollow eye sockets staring straight at Xu Bai.

Xu Bai was overwhelmed with shock.

The surroundings shattered like glass, cracking and breaking apart in an instant.

A faint sense of dizziness washed over him as the illusion completely dissipated.

The black-robed cultivator who came to guide him scanned him briefly before speaking slowly:

"This space contains a lingering aura of the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor. Any cultivator coming here for the first time will sense it and experience hallucinations."

Having visited the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance headquarters before, Xu Bai naturally understood.

The last time his true self came, he had seen the towering statue of the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor.

From that statue, Li Fan felt an extreme sense of danger, as well as a vague sense of familiarity.

This time, however, he used Xu Ke's blood essence and Mr. Bai's divine charm to refine a clone to come here.

What he saw was a strange and eerie scene.

"The path to immortality lies ahead, yet it cannot be treaded. The Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor stands above..."

"Mr. Bai’s face turned identical to that of the clone. And in the end, he suddenly transformed into a skeletal figure..."

"What exactly does all of this signify?"

Even after escaping the illusion, Xu Bai remained deeply shaken, instinctively following behind the black-robed cultivator who led the way.

It seems that Xu Bai’s heaven-defying appearance had an effect, as the black-robed cultivator did not disturb them upon seeing him.

He merely led the way in silence.

When the two of them passed through the teleportation formation and transformed into beams of light, swiftly traversing the space of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance headquarters, Xu Bai slowly emerged from the illusions' influence.

At this moment, the black-robed guide cultivator explained to Xu Bai, “This trace of aura left behind by the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor is usually referred to as the ‘True Meaning of Dharma Transmission.’ The True Meaning of Dharma Transmission is profoundly mysterious and possesses countless wondrous applications. A cultivator only experiences its effects the first time they enter the Alliance headquarters, caught off guard and falling into illusions. Once they stay here for a while and their body adapts to the presence of the True Meaning of Dharma Transmission, it becomes almost impossible to face such illusions again.”

In his previous life, when Li Fan’s original self came here with Han Yi and Ximen Yue, the guide did not explain things in such detail.

“It seems that judging people by their appearance is human nature. Even as cultivators, we cannot completely escape from this mundane mindset.”

Xu Bai silently ridiculed in his heart but seized the opportunity to ask,

“According to what Senior said, the chance to directly face the ‘True Meaning of Dharma Transmission’ is extremely rare—possibly a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity. But aside from seeing some illusions, I didn’t notice any other effects?”

The black-robed cultivator responded solemnly,

“We practitioners all follow the new methods passed down by the Heavenly Sovereign. Hence, when confronting the ‘True Meaning of Dharma Transmission,’ it’s not just simple illusions we see. It is highly likely to be related to each individual’s ‘Ultimate Dao.’”

Before Xu Bai could ask, the guide took the initiative to explain the concept of the ‘Ultimate Dao’:

“Every cultivator, from the moment they set foot on the path of cultivation, generally feels that the immortal path is vast and the future perilous. How to cultivate each realm and choose the most suitable technique—these are things we must explore on our own.”

“But life offers no second chances. One mistake can lead to lifelong regret, forever severed from the Dao. Therefore, every step we take must be careful and prudent.”

“The ‘Ultimate Dao’ represents the final destination of our cultivation as seen from the perspective of the Heavenly Sovereign—the path most suited for us. The Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor is an extraordinary being whose vision far surpasses ours. What he acknowledges is almost indistinguishable from the truth.”

“That is why the illusion just now is of utmost importance. If you contemplate it day and night, you will certainly gain tremendous insights each time.”

Countless floating lands flashed rapidly behind them as the black-robed guide calmly spoke of the profound nature of the ‘True Meaning of Dharma Transmission,’ eventually concluding with a sigh:

“The path of cultivation is like a road to the heavens, shrouded in dense fog. A single misstep can lead to a fatal fall, shattering one’s path to immortality.”

“The ‘True Meaning of Dharma Transmission,’ which reveals the Ultimate Dao, is like an unmistakably bright torch at the peak of the heavenly road. Its light pierces through the fog, illuminating the way forward.”

“This is the Heavenly Sovereign’s compassion toward all living beings under the heavens!”

As the two transformed from beams of light back into human form and their feet touched the ground again, the black-robed cultivator fell silent, resuming his usual cold demeanor.

A straight, verdant stone path stretched toward a towering black stone stele at the end, which marked the headquarters of the Protectorate Hall of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

As he stepped onto the Path of Dharma, the spiritual energy within Xu Bai instantly sank, rendering him as ordinary as a mortal. Step by step, he walked solidly toward his destination, traversing the rather long path.

Upon reaching the end, the black-robed guide spoke once again, this time in a softer tone:

“Present your Derivative Jade Token here, and you may enter. I am not permitted to follow, so I will wait here.”

Xu Bai slightly bowed, then took out the jade token.

As in his previous life, a colorful passage emerged from the stone stele, and Xu Bai strode into it.

...

“Applicant for the Derivation Law Token: Xu Bai.”

“Number: 03. Authority Level: Dao Integration.”

“Please wait here patiently. Estimated remaining waiting time: thirteen hours.”

A somewhat familiar voice rang in Xu Bai’s ears.

Chapter 710: Meeting the Derivation Jade Again

Looking around, it was still an enclosed space.

However, compared to the last time when he used the Nascent Soul-level Derivative Jade Token, it was much more spacious.

Aside from the familiar works like "Guidelines for Using the Derivation Law Jade" and "Ten Theories of Derivation Law" displayed on the bookshelves, there were also some short, unsigned articles.

"Discussion on the Relationship Between the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association in the Next Century"

"The Secret of the Unique Physique of the Fairy Kongyou"

"A Study on the Most Beautiful Woman of the Immortal Alliance"

To avoid drawing attention, Xu Bai pretended to browse through the relevant books like "Guidelines for Using the Derivation Law Jade" first.
