Then, his spirit lifted as he eagerly read through the anonymous articles one by one.

“There are quite a few interesting characters in the Immortal Alliance. However, being able to enter this Dao Integration-level waiting room means they are far from ordinary,” Xu Bai mused, indulging in the pleasure of reading more volumes.

It turned out that these anonymous articles were left behind by cultivators who had once been here.

Without leaving their names, they couldn't be traced back, allowing them to speak freely.

The topics covered were diverse and unrestricted, ranging from personal insights to wild speculations. Though not necessarily aligned with the truth, they were entertaining nonetheless.

Interestingly, later visitors could also add comments to these articles, creating an interactive exchange—an atmosphere reminiscent of scholarly debates.

Deeply engrossed, Xu Bai unknowingly spent thirteen hours reading.

“Cultivator Xu Bai, your turn is approaching. Please prepare yourself.”

The familiar notification woke him up.

Glancing at the countdown displayed on the wall, Xu Bai returned the book to its original spot.

Before leaving, he couldn't resist adding a note to the article "A Study on the Most Beautiful Woman of the Immortal Alliance" that read:

"Fellow Daoist, truly insightful. Perhaps you could also evaluate the 'Most Beautiful Woman of the Five Elders Association'? Combining the two might create the 'Xuanhuang Beauty Rankings'!"

With a slight smile, the countdown hit zero.

The room’s scene suddenly became illusionary, transforming into countless specks of light drifting toward a distant location. The lights formed a long band, glowing brilliantly in the surrounding darkness.

Following the trail of light, Xu Bai arrived before the Derivation Law Jade.

Under the enormous spherical structure formed by countless changing characters, there was a floating desk.

On the desk sat a little girl—Derivation Law Jade’s spirit—her chin resting on her hands, eyes half-closed, and head nodding with drowsiness. A bit of drool trickled from the corner of her mouth—clearly, she was dozing off.

Even as Xu Bai approached, she remained half-asleep and unaware.

“Ahem!” Xu Bai cleared his throat lightly.

The little girl jolted awake, startled by the sound.

With a hint of dissatisfaction on her face, she frowned, pouted, and looked at the intruder who had disturbed her sleep.

Upon seeing Xu Bai’s face, her eyes widened, and her mouth opened slightly.

Hurriedly wiping the drool from her mouth, she sat upright with a slightly embarrassed expression.

“Y-you... hello!”

A faint blush appeared on her cheeks.

Remembering the previous encounter from his past life, Xu Bai remained silent but politely bowed.

“May I ask if you are the Derivation Law Jade...”

“Yes, yes, that’s me. What do you need?” The little girl nodded repeatedly, her big eyes fixed on Xu Bai.

“Just speak your request, and I will help you!” she said in a sweet, childlike voice, patting the desk with confidence. A blank piece of paper floated over to Xu Bai.

This piece of paper, no matter how I look at it, seems much larger than the one my original self received in my previous life.

"..." Xu Bai remained silent for a moment before his thoughts stirred, and he began to write on it.

Line after line of text appeared:

"Using the Golden Core technique 'Mountain Sitting Technique' as the foundation, with the 'Great Dream of Spring and Autumn Formation' as a reference, and incorporating the technique of 'Heavenly Vision and Earthly Hearing' as guidance."

"Deduce the Dao Integration version of the 'Mountain Sitting Technique' technique."

"While retaining the characteristic of the 'Mountain Sitting Technique' to passively gain cultivation, I hope to establish a certain degree of surveillance on the cultivators providing the feedback cultivation. Ideally, it should create a kind of connection or sharing among the consciousnesses of all cultivators involved with the 'Mountain Sitting Technique'."

...

Xu Bai meticulously wrote down his requirements.

Although the paper had not yet flown to the hands of the Derivation Law Jade, it seemed as if she had already grasped the content on it.

Her face showed a mix of surprise and distress.

When the paper was densely covered with writing, Li Fan handed it over.

The little girl pretended to take it and carefully examined it.

The space around them fell into silence.

"What’s wrong? Is it too difficult?" Xu Bai smiled gently, showing concern.

"If you find it too challenging, I can lower the technique requirements a bit," he said softly.

The little girl slammed her chubby hand on the table. "What do you mean? Don’t underestimate me! How could something like this possibly stump me!"

"Hmph!"

She furrowed her brows, appearing serious.

She looked over the paper presented by Li Fan once more and then tossed it into the air.

The characters on the paper instantly seemed to come alive, rushing toward the massive spherical object overhead.

“Creak...”

In an instant, the frequency of character changes on the sphere increased countless times compared to before, even producing faint, strained noises.

“Snap.”

Xu Bai looked over to see the little girl had already collapsed on the table, sound asleep.

With a faint smile, Xu Bai looked up, keeping his gaze fixed on the gigantic sphere of light.

After advancing to the Nascent Soul stage, his vision had improved several times compared to when he was at the Golden Core stage. He could barely make out some changes within the sphere.

As the characters kept transforming, some gradually faded and disappeared, seemingly eliminating ineffective arrangements.

Occasionally, a burst of dazzling white light would erupt, wiping out countless characters at once. But shortly after, new unnecessary characters would appear in the blank space, flickering as they continued to deduce.

"This should signify the successful deduction of a new technique."

Xu Bai carefully observed the massive spherical character array, noticing that about one-tenth of the area was still engaged in the usual technique deduction process.

Meanwhile, in the other nine-tenths, the speed of character flashing and changing had reached an entirely different level.

"It must be helping me deduce the follow-up to the 'Mountain Sitting Technique'."

"Compared to my previous life, it truly seems to be giving its all. It’s no longer just a matter of looking good or using reverse psychology."

"Heaven’s chosen, embodiment of heavenly anomaly..."

"I see."

Xu Bai glanced at the seemingly sleeping Derivation Law Jade out of the corner of his eye, and a sense of realization dawned on him.

The time permitted for deducing techniques using the Dao Integration-level Derivative Jade Token was two days.

Xu Bai stood quietly beneath the sphere, patiently awaiting the final deduction result from the Derivation Law Jade.

However, perhaps due to the excessively demanding nature of Xu Bai’s request, it seemed that the difficulty of deducing this technique had surpassed the capabilities of the Derivation Law Jade.

When a phantom countdown appeared before Xu Bai’s eyes, the little girl was still unable to complete the technique deduction.

Chapter 711: Mysterious Technique That Can Tread Into Immortality

Xu Bai's heart sank.

Based on his experience from his previous life, when the countdown ended, he would be directly transported out of this space.

If there was still no result by then, wouldn’t it mean that his trip here would have been in vain?

According to the "Guidelines for Using the Derivation Law Jade", such situations had indeed happened before. It was merely his own greed at fault—there would be no chance to start over.

However, looking at the little girl of the Derivation Law Jade sleeping soundly, Xu Bai pondered for a moment but did not rashly wake her up.

Instead, he continued to wait patiently in silence.

Even as the countdown approached its end, he remained calm and composed, not making a sound.

The countdown reached zero, and just as the surrounding scenery began to blur and fade—

"Wait a minute..."

The little girl, still in her sleep, raised her hand with a hint of annoyance.

Just like that, Xu Bai watched as the previously fuzzy countdown became clear once more, rapidly increasing until it reset to two days before stopping.

This time, the countdown did not disappear but remained constantly visible in front of Xu Bai, ticking away like a final warning.

"As expected, I bet correctly."

Xu Bai ignored the countdown completely, his expression unwavering as he continued to focus on the Derivation Sphere above him.

"If my true body were here, I could use a Dao Deviation Stone to record every subtle change in the scenery during this period. Wouldn't that mean I could also record the spell derived by the Derivation Law Jade during this time?"

"Of course, it’s just a sequence of character combinations. To truly comprehend the technique, only the original Derivation Law Jade would know the specific correspondence between the characters and the technique."

Xu Bai's plan to "coax the Derivation Law Jade" became even more refined.

Of course, the plan’s execution would not be immediate.

Another day and a half passed, and the massive Derivation Sphere gradually stopped spinning.

The little girl suddenly raised her head, waking from her deep sleep.

Her exquisitely carved face surprisingly showed two faint dark circles.

She rubbed her eyes and yawned before boasting proudly, "Done!"

She lightly tapped the table.

Countless small characters surged from the tabletop, transforming into a white paper that flew towards Xu Bai.

Receiving it solemnly, Xu Bai did not rush to read the newly derived technique but instead bowed to the little girl again.

"You’ve worked hard," Xu Bai said softly.

"Hahaha, it’s fine! I’m really strong!" The little girl from the Derivation Law Jade yawned again and scratched her head with a satisfied grin.

Xu Bai glanced at the countdown and said gently, "There’s still half a day left. Please take some time to rest."

Upon hearing this, the little girl’s face drooped.

"No way! This is my hard-earned vacation. I have to use it sparingly."

"You better leave quickly."

"The next technique to derive is a Nascent Soul-level one, so I can take the chance to slack off a bit."

Treating Xu Bai like an old acquaintance, the little girl giggled as she waved him off.

"I look forward to meeting you again." Xu Bai gave a slight bow, memorizing the contents of the paper in his hand.

The countdown abruptly ended, and the surroundings turned illusionary.

In the next moment, he found himself standing outside the Guardian Hall Black Stone Tablet.

"How did it go?" asked the black-robed guide cultivator.

"Very satisfactory." In his mind, Xu Bai reviewed the Dao Integration Technique derived from the Derivation Law Jade and nodded slowly.

"Sitting Immortal Technique..." His gaze showed a trace of surprise.

The "Immortal" in the Sitting Immortal Technique did not refer to a True Immortal but rather to an Immortal Cultivator.

The Derivation Law Jade had used its own vacation time and took three and a half days to deduce this Dao Integration technique, which was truly extraordinary.

It perfectly met the requirements Xu Bai had put forward.

Still using [Sitting and Reaping the Fruits of Others' Labor] as the core concept of the technique, the upper limit of the technique's realm was raised to the Dao Integration Realm.

From now on, until reaching the Longevity Realm, Li Fan no longer needed to worry about lacking a cultivation technique.

Additionally, the Sitting Immortal Technique had been improved in several aspects.

For example, when the conditions for feedback cultivation are met, it is further reduced.

The "Mountain Sitting Technique" only grants cultivation feedback when the benefactor’s cultivation level has progressed significantly, and only if the favor shown to the cultivator has reached a certain threshold.

However, the "Sitting Immortal Technique" is different.

Even a casual piece of guidance, as long as there is a [causal connection], will generate a trace of corresponding cultivation feedback once the other party's cultivation improves. This feedback will nourish the practitioner of the "Sitting Immortal Technique." Even if the "favor" is minimal, the feedback cultivation will be almost negligible, barely worth mentioning. Nevertheless, it still exists.

As the saying goes: "A drop of kindness should be repaid with a drop of kindness."

Moreover, the "Sitting Immortal Technique" further strengthens the bond between the practitioner and the recipients of their favor.

Anyone who receives Li Fan's kindness will establish a "causal connection", allowing Li Fan to sense them through an ethereal link.

The deeper the kindness, the stronger the connection.

A monumental kindness, such as "Passing on Dharma", would almost make the connection as profound as the [Formless Killing Intent], as if experiencing it personally.

Li Fan can further utilize the continuous stream of feedback cultivation to deepen the causal bond with the beneficiary cultivator.

Once the connection reaches a certain level, it can even disregard spatial distance and exert a degree of spiritual influence.

Xu Bai was thoroughly impressed by the various mystical aspects of the [Sitting Immortal Technique], his heart surging with emotion.

"Even if it doesn’t truly compare to true immortal arts, it can still be called a genuine [True Mysterious Creation Art]!"

While his heart was filled with excitement, the thought of claiming the Derivation Law Jade for himself once again inevitably arose.

"Brother Li? Brother Li!"

In the vast white fog, the sound of someone calling pulled Li Fan back to his senses.

"Did you hear any strange sounds nearby?" Huangfu Song asked.

Li Fan pretended to listen intently, then shook his head after a while.

"Distinguishing the strange sounds of the Maze Zone consumes too much mental energy. Thanks to Brother Li’s ability, we’ve already completed two low-danger level explorations in the Maze Zone," said Dongfang Yao, slightly reproaching.

Huangfu Song looked embarrassed and admitted, "That’s my mistake. I was just too excited!"

Connecting his spiritual sense to the Heaven-Measuring Mirror, Huangfu Song saw that their Qingxuan Points had soared to 15,000, and he praised cheerfully, "Brother Li’s ability is truly extraordinary, being able to hear the sounds within the mist."

"No matter how much Dongfang and I tried, we couldn’t hear anything at all!"

"I knew Brother Li was reliable and worth building a friendship with!" Dongfang Yao also chimed in with praise.

Li Fan smiled and was about to speak when his expression suddenly grew tense.

He looked sharply in a particular direction within the white mist. After a brief moment, his face changed slightly.

"Danger! Dodge immediately!"

As he spoke, he seized control of the Samantabhadra True Boat and abruptly maneuvered the vessel to the right, shifting it more than ten zhang (approx. 33 meters) away.

Before Huangfu and Dongfang could react, they saw a massive black light pillar shoot out from the depths of the mist, roaring past them at incredible speed.

It barely grazed the Samantabhadra True Boat, howling as it continued to blast into the distance.

The power was so immense that even the eternally unchanging white mist was torn open, leaving a long, empty gap in its wake.

Chapter 712: Sky-Splitting Maze Zone

"This..."

Huangfu and Dongfang, who had narrowly escaped death, were both pale, cold sweat streaming down their foreheads.

They stared blankly at the long, gaping void not far away, rendered speechless.

If Li Fan had been even a step slower just now, the three people on the Samantabhadra True Boat would have already been pulverized into dust!

Swallowing hard, Huangfu's legs softened, and he almost collapsed onto the deck.

"What the hell was that..." Dongfang Yao, being a bit more courageous, managed to recover from his shock, forcibly suppressing his fear as he cautiously looked outside the boat.

The destructive power of the black pillar of light was terrifying beyond imagination. Even after a long time, the Devouring Essence White Mist that had been pierced through still had not recovered.

Moreover, the black light seemed to contain some strange corrosive power. Even though the light pillar had dissipated by now, just looking at that void from a distance gave everyone an unsettling sense of impending danger.

"Hey, how about we move farther away for now? If another one comes, we're dead for sure," Dongfang Yao whispered, after carefully observing for a while.

At this moment, Li Fan, who had managed to maintain relative composure, spoke up, "Not a good idea! It’s better to stay put and not act rashly. Although I don’t know the origin of that black light pillar, since this direction has already been struck once, the chances of it being hit again are..."

"Not high..."

Before he could finish the word "high," Li Fan’s expression changed again.

He instantly circulated his spiritual energy to the maximum, pouring it into the Samantabhadra True Boat, making it suddenly accelerate and soar upward a considerable distance.

Just as he finished this, another terrifying black pillar of light shot out from the depths of the white mist.

This time, it was even more dangerous than before—the Samantabhadra True Boat narrowly evaded it. Even through the boat’s hull, they could feel the suffocating, all-destroying power of the black light.

Having been frightened twice in such a short period, Huangfu finally couldn't take it anymore and collapsed directly onto the deck.

Li Fan, having just been proven wrong, cursed inwardly but maintained his unwavering determination, suppressing his instinct to flee and remaining steadfastly still.

After that, sure enough, seven more black pillars of light blasted out from the depths of the white mist, almost sweeping across the entire area.

The Devouring Essence White Mist, which had existed for tens of thousands of years, seemed to have been scoured by this world-shattering power, becoming significantly thinner.

This magnificent and terrifying scene left all three on the boat stunned and speechless.

"World-Suppressing Ultimate Weapon... This is the Sky-Splitting Cannon of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance!" Huangfu Song suddenly exclaimed as if recalling something.

His words immediately drew the attention of Li Fan and Dongfang Yao.

"World-Suppressing Ultimate Weapon?" Li Fan's eyes flickered with curiosity.

The so-called World-Suppressing Ultimate Weapons are powerful treasures capable of altering the course of war between two sides, renowned for their unmatched destructive power.

During the previous Friendly Exchange between the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association, both sides had each showcased one of these weapons. It was said that the demonstration had caused many militant cultivators to change their original stance.

The existence of World-Suppressing Ultimate Weapons is considered classified information within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, and ordinary cultivators rarely get to witness them.

Who would have thought that Li Fan and the others would encounter one here?

Moreover, it was fully operational, seemingly engaged in a battle with something...

"Could it be that they've gotten into a fight with the Five Elders Association again?" The Samantabhadra True Boat fell silent for a moment before Dongfang Yao couldn't help but whisper his guess.

"It shouldn't be..." Huangfu Song replied hesitantly, though it was clear he still harbored some concerns. Taking out a Communication Talisman, he contacted someone briefly before finally breathing a sigh of relief.

"Stop being so paranoid. It's just the Immortal Alliance Martial Hall clearing out a Maze Zone. We were just unlucky enough to run into them." Huangfu Song shot Dongfang Yao a glare.

"What kind of Maze Zone requires such a massive weapon? And there wasn't even a warning! If it weren't for Brother Li reacting quickly, we'd all be dead here. It's really reckless disregard for human life!" Dongfang Yao cursed angrily.

"Just stop talking," Huangfu Song quickly urged him to calm down.

Meanwhile, Li Fan stared deeply into the depths of the white mist, riddled with countless holes. Even from a great distance, he could faintly sense the spiritual energy fluctuations coming from there.

After waiting a while and confirming that the Sky-Splitting Cannon bombardment had ceased, the three of them piloted the Saman True Boat and quickly left the area.

"Have you two thought about what items to exchange for?" On the way back to the city to purchase supplies, Huangfu Song opened the Heaven-Measuring Mirror's item list, happily browsing through it while asking.

"I've got my eye on that technique that nourishes the body by eating. Even though I have a special constitution that can recover from most injuries instantly, I still feel like there might be hidden internal damage. It’s not a big deal in daily life, but I’m worried it might hold me back when breaking through to higher realms." Dongfang Yao spoke honestly, laying out his plans without reservation.

"Heh, I've got my sights set on the Tianxuan Secondary Body, the Dissociation Disc. There are still six left, and if we act fast enough, we might still have a chance." Huangfu Song chuckled but didn't explain why he chose it.

"What about you, Brother Li?" Dongfang Yao asked curiously.

"I'll take my time and look around first—no rush to decide." Li Fan replied calmly.

However, when they arrived at Tianyu City, the originally relaxed trio suddenly grew anxious.

It turned out that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's Decree had been officially issued.

Cultivators from all over the world moved at the news. Friends gathered in small groups, and countless Samantabhadra True Boat rushed out from every corner of the Xuanhuang Realm, racing toward the white mist.

The Great Exploration Era had officially begun!

Although those without powerful backers or connections had missed the initial opportunity and fallen behind in exploration progress, their sheer numbers remained overwhelming. Who could say whether one or two of them might defy the odds and stumble upon a place as significant as the Reversal Life-and-Death Maze Zone?

If someone were lucky enough to discover a similarly important location, they would instantly earn 30,000 Qingxuan Points.

To put it in perspective, even after risking their lives, Li Fan and his group had only managed to accumulate a little over 21,000 points! In the face of truly favored individuals, this meager head start meant nothing at all!

After hastily restocking essential supplies, they didn't even take a break before plunging back into the white mist.

It was worth mentioning that the supposedly "cheap" yet highly effective Longevity Pills that Li Fan had "accidentally" purchased had now, with the arrival of the Great Exploration Era, suddenly flooded the Immortal Alliance Market like bamboo shoots after the rain.

Every city's Qianli Hall had them available for purchase.

"I wonder which organization is behind these Longevity Pills—they don't even need to explore the white mist like we do. Just relying on this single pill, they must be making a fortune."

Looking at the crowds swarming the Qianli Hall to buy Longevity Pills, Huangfu Song couldn't help but speak with a hint of envy.

Chapter 713: The Ethereal and Indeterminate Prison

Beastkind Realm.

"Sect Master, we painstakingly refined the Longevity Pills, yet that Jiao guy is taking almost half of the profits. Is this really okay?"

A golden eyeball circled around Xu Bai, spinning continuously. A somewhat resentful voice from Fang Zaiji emerged from within.

"Let me talk to him. I can definitely squeeze some more out of him. Sigh, Old Liu is good at everything, except he's too honest. Even after getting taken advantage of, he still speaks up for others like a fool."

Although Liu San had gradually grown accustomed to Fang Zaiji’s blunt nature, he couldn't help but feel annoyed upon hearing this.

He reached out to grab the [Eye of Shared Vision] that Fang Zaiji was possessing, but the latter nimbly dodged.

"Heh, trying to catch me? Do you really think I'd let myself suffer twice in the same place? I’ve already improved—"

Before he could finish, Xu Bai suddenly caught him in his hand.

A buzzing sound came from the golden eyeball as it struggled, but this time, Fang Zaiji's voice was absent.

"Mr. Fang, don't dwell on it. As the saying goes, 'If you wish to take, you must first give.' If we didn’t let Jiao Xiuyuan take such a large share, would he have been so enthusiastic and proactive in promoting our Longevity Pills? For us, all it costs is a few herbs from the Longevity Valley—pure profit with no investment. The only difference is whether we earn more or less."

"Besides, Jiao Xiuyuan has countless clones spread across the Xuanhuang Realm, and his strength is unfathomable. Do you really want to argue with him?"

Xu Bai asked with a half-smile.

The golden eyeball immediately stopped struggling.

Xu Bai released his grip, and after a moment, Fang Zaiji's weak voice emerged, "Sigh, I was just saying. Since you, Sect Master, have no objections, then forget it."

After a pause, he added, "I heard that in Jiao Xiuyuan’s Qianli Hall, they sell everything? Then if I refine some little trinkets and sell them there, that should be fine, right?"

Liu San snorted coldly. "The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance now mass-produces magical artifacts and treasures in standardized batches, selling them at far lower prices than before. Even if you can refine something, how much could you possibly earn?"

Fang Zaiji's impatient voice replied, "Old Liu, you don’t understand artifact refinement at all, so stop worrying about it. Sect Master, just give me a straight answer—yes or no?"

Liu San was about to say more, but Xu Bai raised a hand to stop him.

"If Mr. Fang wishes to do so, then go ahead. If you lack materials, you can request them from Elder Liu." Xu Bai replied with a smile.

"Sect Master, you're so generous!" The golden eyeball flipped up and down excitedly.

"Just wait for my good news—you'll be in for a big surprise!"

With that, the golden eyeball turned into a streak of light and vanished into the distance.

"Young Master, you're too soft-hearted. Always indulging Fang Zaiji like this—who knows what kind of trouble he might stir up in the future?" Liu San sighed.

"It’s fine. Nothing serious will come of it. While Mr. Fang may seem a bit unreliable, he has never neglected my task of strengthening the Medicine King True Cauldron. He just doesn’t show it in front of you, Elder Liu." Xu Bai explained with a smile.

"Is that so?" Liu San looked slightly surprised.

Not continuing the topic, Xu Bai instead inquired about the progress of refining the Longevity Pills.

Liu San furrowed his brows and said, "The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance has recently lifted restrictions on Maze Zone Exploration, greatly increasing the demand for Longevity Pills among cultivators. Our stockpile has nearly been depleted, and with only me providing Longevity Green Energy, the rate of pill refinement is far too slow to keep up with consumption..."

He hesitated for a moment, then tentatively asked, "Young Master, do you think we should consider awakening a few more?"

Xu Bai pondered for a moment and did not answer immediately. Instead, he asked, "Elder Liu, do you have any suitable candidates in mind?"

Inside the Medicine King True Cauldron, there were originally six Dao Integration cultivators in slumber...

Liu San and Fang Zaiji have already been awakened; now, four others remain within the Grand Dream of Spring and Autumn Formation.

After pondering for a moment, Liu San gave his suggestion: "I recommend awakening Jiang Yushan, Elder Jiang."

He then explained to Xu Bai the reason for his choice.

"The primary reason why we cannot awaken all the cultivators of the Medicine King Sect at once is the restriction of incompatible cultivation methods. If all those who practice the World-Saving Longevity Scripture were to wake up together, a brutal slaughter would likely break out immediately."[1]

"But if it’s Yushan, I believe such murderous intent would have no effect on her." Liu San spoke slowly.

It turns out that Jiang Yushan was originally a disciple of Indeterminate Prison, one of the Ten Great Immortal Sects.

Indeterminate Prison is a rather unique existence among the immortal sects. As its name suggests, rather than a sect, it is actually a prison—one that has suppressed countless cultivators who defied the commands of the Ten Great Immortal Sects ever since their rule over the Xuanhuang Realm began.

These exiled cultivators were confined to the same space, left to slaughter each other at will.

The location of this exile drifts unpredictably, and aside from a select few, no one knows how to enter it.

Thus, it is called Indeterminate Prison.

Jiang Yushan was originally a warden of this prison, tasked with keeping these ruthless criminals from escaping.

After spending a long time in Indeterminate Prison, she inevitably became tainted by the overwhelming killing intent that permeated the place.

Even the most resolute of cultivators cannot guarantee that they will always maintain their clarity of mind in such an environment.

For this reason, the prison rotates its wardens every thirty years.

New wardens are selected through various means. While their cultivation level may not always be the highest, their combat strength must be formidable. Furthermore, they must be ruthless—otherwise, they would never be able to suppress the countless criminals within Indeterminate Prison.

After leaving the prison, Jiang Yushan joined the Medicine King Sect to cleanse herself of the murderous aura lingering around her.

She dedicated herself to healing the sick and saving lives, accumulating merit and virtue—concealing her once bloodthirsty nature.

...

"The near-tangible killing intent within Indeterminate Prison could not shake Yushan’s mind. If it’s just the hostility generated by two people cultivating the same technique, she should be able to withstand it with ease." Liu San declared confidently.

Xu Bai remained silent for a moment before suddenly asking,

"Then what about you, Elder Liu? The consequences of incompatible cultivation methods affect both sides. Can you guarantee that you won’t attack Elder Jiang?"

Liu San blurted out,

"Even if I were to die, I would never become Yushan’s enemy…"

Xu Bai immediately smiled.

"Very well. Since that’s the case, let’s proceed as planned. However, some preparations are still necessary. Elder Liu, calm your mind first. When the time comes, I will notify you."

"Good, good." Liu San seemed somewhat excited.

He conjured a Water Mirror, carefully examining his own reflection.

"Although Jiang Yushan is an outsider and unfamiliar with the internal affairs of the Medicine King Sect, my use of a clone to impersonate Liu Yihang will remain undiscovered."

"Still, I must be cautious."

Xu Bai’s eyes flickered with thought.

[TL- The Longevity and Lifespan Sutra/Technique will be translated as World-Saving Longevity Scripture because the former was not really that accurate]

Chapter 714: The Fall of Wang Qiupo in Tianliang

An item capable of influencing or even altering the mindset of a Dao Integration cultivator must undoubtedly be a supreme treasure.

After all, with the Longevity Immortals remaining hidden, Dao Integration cultivators stand at the pinnacle of authority in the Xuanhuang Realm.

Thus, even after experiencing multiple reincarnations and uncovering countless secrets of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, Li Fan still did not know whether the alliance possessed an artifact comparable to the [Fruit of True Temptation].

Therefore, to resolve Jiang Yushan’s hidden concerns, he had no choice but to seek out the Five Elders Association!

Fortunately, Li Fan had already determined his bargaining chip for this trade with the Five Elders Association.

As for how to establish contact with them…

During this period, disciples of the Medicine King Sect had been scattered throughout various regions of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, gathering intelligence.

Following Li Fan’s instructions, they identified a number of suspicious individuals based on previously known methods used by Five Elders Association spies to make contact.

After reviewing the list of cultivators and cross-referencing it with knowledge from his past lives, Li Fan finally confirmed the identity of one particular spy.

Wang Qiupo of Tianliang Prefecture.

This Wang Qiupo, despite only being at the Golden Core stage, had already reached the astonishing age of eight hundred years.

His lifespan far exceeded the typical limits of a Golden Core cultivator. Though his hair had turned completely white, his spirit remained vigorous, showing no signs of aging.

Having lived for such an extraordinarily long time, all those from his era who were still alive had already ascended to Soul Transformation or Dao Integration levels, holding key positions within the Immortal Alliance.

As the saying goes, one must respect the monk for the sake of the Buddha. Even though Wang Qiupo himself lacked remarkable abilities, his vast network of connections made him influential.

As a result, even the City Lord of Tianliang treated him with great courtesy.

Yet, no one would have ever imagined that such a figure was, in fact, a spy for the Five Elders Association.

This infiltrator had remained hidden for so long—buried so deeply—that when he finally perished in Li Fan’s previous life, the Five Elders Association openly revealed his identity, intending to mock the Immortal Alliance.

Embarrassed by the revelation, the Immortal Alliance immediately suppressed all information regarding the matter.

Li Fan had only heard rumors of a deeply hidden spy whose exposure had caused the Immortal Alliance great humiliation but had never known the spy’s actual name.

Only in this life, after observing Wang Qiupo’s unusual behavior—combined with intelligence gathered by Medicine King Sect disciples and his own past-life knowledge—was he able to deduce the truth.

"It seems that Wang Qiupo’s lifespan is nearing its end," Xu Bai mused before swiftly departing Longevity Valley.

Stepping into the White Mist, he soon encountered a Samantabhadra True Boat.

The occupants of the vessel failed to notice Xu Bai and continued flying deeper into the mist.

"More and more people are passing through here. I wonder how much longer this place can remain hidden."

With that fleeting thought, Xu Bai exited the White Mist and set out directly for Tianliang Prefecture.

Tianliang Prefecture.

Located in the northwest of Tianling Prefecture, Tianliang was renowned for its perpetual autumn-like climate.

It was said that the lingering killing intent from an ancient war had never dissipated, leaving the land barren and unable to sustain normal growth. This unique phenomenon was what gave the region its distinct character.

Wang Qiupo did not reside in Tianliang City.

Instead, he lived in seclusion beneath Liang Mountain, in a humble cottage.

Though his dwelling was remote, many cultivators eager to benefit from his connections frequently visited to curry favor.

Most of them, however, were turned away, leaving disappointed.

When Xu Bai arrived, he found a long queue already formed at Wang Qiupo’s doorstep.

Over ten cultivators were patiently waiting for their turn.

Xu Bai’s presence immediately attracted their attention.

One cultivator even offered to swap places with him in line.

Xu Bai first thanked the cultivator for their kindness before politely declining with a smile.

His courteous demeanor won over the gathered cultivators, who, in turn, enthusiastically began explaining the situation to him.

Old Wang didn’t know why, but he had been feeling quite irritable lately. He had already rejected the visits of a hundred cultivators in a row.

"Old Wang has always been eccentric. No one can guess what he’s thinking. But that doesn’t stop people from trying. Who knows? Maybe when it's their turn, his mood will suddenly improve. After all, there’s precedent for this!"

"That’s right. There was once a young Foundation Establishment cultivator, completely unknown. But after receiving Old Wang’s recommendation, he soared to prominence overnight and directly entered the Immortal Alliance system."

The gathered cultivators were engaged in heated discussions.

Meanwhile, under Wang Qiupo’s repeated angry shouts of "I’m not seeing anyone!" the line outside gradually shortened.

Some cultivators who were turned away left with their heads hanging low, while others had expressions of frustration.

However, none dared to speak out of turn.

Otherwise, even without Wang Qiupo lifting a finger, the waiting cultivators at the entrance—eager to win his favor—would immediately step in to teach them a lesson.

Xu Bai, however, remained composed, patiently waiting in silence.

Finally, when it was his turn, he stepped forward and heard a deep voice from inside:

"You brat, why have you come?"

Xu Bai’s cultivation was actually higher than Wang Qiupo’s, yet the latter still addressed him that way.

None of the surrounding cultivators found this surprising.

Xu Bai, too, was unfazed. He cupped his hands in greeting and said with a smile:

"I have come to…"

"…send you off!"

His voice was as loud as a bell, echoing at the foot of Cool Mountain.

The gathered cultivators were stunned. They stared at Xu Bai in disbelief, as if unable to comprehend how such an elegant-looking person could utter something so disrespectful.

Many even showed regretful expressions.

"This is bad. He’s completely enraged Old Wang now. We probably won’t get to see him for months!"

However, things took an unexpected turn.

At first, the hut fell into complete silence.

Then, Wang Qiupo’s hearty laughter erupted from within.

With a loud boom, the doors swung open. Wang Qiupo instantly stopped laughing and said:

"Interesting. Come inside, brat. I want to see what gives you such a bold tongue!"

Xu Bai remained calm and strode into the house.

The doors closed behind him, cutting off everything inside from the outside world.

Inside the hut—

Wang Qiupo scrutinized Xu Bai and raised an eyebrow.

"You’ve got quite the fine appearance. Brat, you—"

Before he could finish, Xu Bai interrupted him:

"Do you realize that you don’t have much time left?"

Wang Qiupo’s eyes narrowed instantly.

"You…"

"Do you want to die alone in a foreign land, or do you wish to return home before the end?" Xu Bai continued, completely ignoring the other’s reaction.

"!"

Wang Qiupo abruptly stood up from his reclining wooden chair, his movements so swift that he showed no sign of age.

"Young man, what exactly do you mean?" He clutched his wooden staff tightly, pressing it against the floor, his eyes glinting with danger.

Xu Bai met his gaze without a hint of fear and asked, enunciating each word clearly:

"Where is your homeland? The Land of Carefree Bliss? Realm of Reality? Or the Humane Heavenly Domain?"

In an instant, a violent surge of spiritual energy erupted from his body.

The wooden staff in Wang Qiupo’s hand glowed with a cyan light, as if he was ready to fight to the death.

But just then, Xu Bai spoke a single

sentence that made him change his mind.

"Do you want to go home?"

"Our Heaven-Suppressing Society can help you."

Xu Bai smiled—a sincere and confident smile.

Chapter 715: The Poisoned Nail of Eight Hundred Years

After Xu Bai spoke those words, the violent aura brewing within Wang Qiupo suddenly calmed down.

His somewhat clouded eyes locked onto the excessively handsome cultivator before him, his mind pondering over the words "Heaven-Suppressing Society."

This name—of course, Wang Qiupo had heard of it before.

Previously, he had received a secret order from the Five Elders Association, instructing him to investigate information related to this organization in secret. He had expended a considerable amount of resources but found absolutely nothing. Not a single soul had even heard of this name.

At one point, Wang Qiupo had even suspected that the organization had made a mistake in transmitting the target’s name.

Eventually, the matter was left unresolved.

Until today—when this young cultivator, claiming to be a member of the Heaven-Suppressing Society, suddenly appeared before him.

“Not only does he know about my identity as a spy, but he also seems to know my physical condition inside out…”

“It seems there must be a traitor within the organization.”

As one of the most outstanding spies still alive in the Five Elders Association, this was Wang Qiupo’s first instinctive thought.

After all, the news of his nearing lifespan exhaustion had only recently been transmitted. He had hoped to have the organization cooperate with his staged death, using it as an opportunity to stir the waters.

Wang Qiupo had been in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance for nearly eight hundred years. The first half of his life had been unremarkable.

It was only in the latter four hundred years, when the cultivators he had befriended in his youth began to rise to prominence, that he ushered in the most glorious period of his espionage career.

Throughout these years, the number of young cultivators he had recommended into the alliance exceeded ten thousand!

Of course, this was partly due to the goodwill of his old friends, who agreed to help him out of past camaraderie.

But more importantly…

These individuals were, without exception, outstanding young talents!

And this was precisely why outsiders found his personality so peculiar.

If they weren’t geniuses, he would never recommend them!

As a top-tier spy, Wang Qiupo understood that planting low-level spies in enemy ranks could bring temporary benefits. However, all spies would eventually be exposed. When that day came, all the operatives he had painstakingly nurtured would be wiped out in one fell swoop.

In the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, rising to a high position required the test of time. These young spies would never last that long. Even if, by sheer luck, some managed to ascend quickly, whether they could truly acquire valuable intelligence remained uncertain.

Thus, such an approach posed only a limited threat to the alliance.

What Wang Qiupo truly intended was to personally expose his identity as a spy before his death—only then could he deal a devastating blow to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance!

Imagine the uproar when news broke that Wang Qiupo had actually been a Five Elders Association spy all along.

All the cultivators he had recommended over the years would undoubtedly fall under suspicion!

Even if investigations later proved their innocence…

Would the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance dare to continue trusting and using them?

Who could guarantee that these individuals had not undergone some kind of secret technique to evade detection?

With such concerns in mind, these once-promising cultivators, originally poised to become the backbone of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, would—at best—be exiled to insignificant positions for quiet disposal.

The wise and capable would fade into obscurity, while their vacated positions would be filled by mediocre individuals.

This was Wang Qiupo’s meticulously crafted "Poisoned Nail" Plan, which had been in the making for eight hundred years.

A small, inconspicuous "nail"—yet capable of crippling a vital portion of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

For a mere Golden Core-level cultivator like Wang Qiupo, this was the greatest devastation he could achieve.

Originally, the Poisoned Nail Plan had been flawless, with its final phase just around the corner.

But unexpectedly, an unforeseen variable had emerged at this critical moment.

“Young man, what exactly do you mean? Speak plainly.”

Wang Qiupo remained composed, carefully probing.

Xu Bai smiled faintly and got straight to the point:

"You must be a spy planted by the Five Elders Association, aren’t you?"

Wang Qiupo narrowed his eyes and openly admitted, "That's right!"

Such straightforwardness was somewhat beyond Xu Bai's expectations.

However, it did not affect anything.

"Old sir, there's no need to be nervous. If you have any understanding of our Heaven-Suppressing Society, then you should know that, in reality, we are on the same side," Xu Bai said with a reassuring smile.

"The more chaos you create within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, the better. Why would we expose you?"

Just as Wang Qiupo was deep in thought, Xu Bai suddenly put away his smile, his expression turning serious. "Actually, I came here today to discuss a deal with you."

"And it involves something extremely important. I was afraid that sending an ordinary spy might risk leaking information, so I came directly to you."

Seeing how serious the other party was, Wang Qiupo's expression also became more solemn.

However, having lived for 800 years, he was no fool. He wouldn't easily believe Xu Bai’s words.

He remained silent, waiting to see what Xu Bai was hiding.

Yet, Xu Bai’s next words nearly made him crush the bamboo staff in his hand.

"Do you know that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is about to give birth to another Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign?" Xu Bai said.

"What did you just say?"

No matter how deep his composure ran, upon hearing such an earth-shattering piece of news, Wang Qiupo's expression changed dramatically.

"So, you weren’t aware of this? That’s strange..." Xu Bai frowned.

Wang Qiupo took a deep breath, seemingly trying to discern the truth in Xu Bai’s words.

But Xu Bai didn’t give him the chance to think and immediately dropped another bombshell.

"We have already uncovered the fundamental law that this new Heavenly Sovereign is trying to overturn—it is highly unusual."

"Previously, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had only one Preaching Heavenly Sovereign, and your Five Elders Association could still hold your own against them. But now, with another Heavenly Sovereign joining their ranks..."

"You’d better start preparing now."

"At this moment, this new Heavenly Sovereign has not yet officially 'solidified their law' and can still participate in mortal conflicts. If you’re caught off guard..."

Wang Qiupo's mind was in complete turmoil.

Though he prided himself on being a successful spy within the Five Elders Association, his knowledge of Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereigns was quite limited.

All this talk of overturning laws and solidifying laws—it left him somewhat confused.

However, if what this Heaven-Suppressing Society cultivator said was true...

Then he must report this to the organization immediately.

Wang Qiupo glanced at Xu Bai again.

The latter seemed to have guessed his thoughts and handed over a jade slip.

"I told you—I came here to make a deal. The specific details regarding this Heavenly Sovereign can be disclosed to you, but you must pay the required price."

"The importance of this information is far greater than in our previous transactions. We haven't raised the price, which shows our sincerity. After all, we are still counting on you to fight the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance to the death."

Xu Bai revealed a strange smile and then gestured invitingly.

Wang Qiupo first examined the jade slip, and his pupils suddenly contracted.

Chapter 716: Wang Po’s Death and the Counterintelligence Scheme

The jade slip listed items of immense value, far beyond Wang Qiupo’s imagination.

As a spy who had left home at a young age, some of these items were things he had never even heard of.

In that moment, Wang Qiupo found himself believing Xu Bai’s words a little more.

After a brief moment of contemplation, he gestured for Xu Bai to wait.

Then, he quietly lay back onto the rattan chair behind him, closing his eyes as if he had fallen into a deep sleep.

From Xu Bai’s perspective, Wang Qiupo’s vitality was dissipating at an astonishing rate.

In just a brief moment, it seemed as though he had died of old age, becoming indistinguishable from a corpse.

"No wonder he managed to remain hidden as a spy for eight hundred years without being exposed. He certainly has some remarkable tricks," Xu Bai thought to himself as he observed Wang Qiupo for a long time.

Even the thatched hut where Wang Qiupo resided seemed to possess some mysterious qualities. His life force had disappeared, yet the people outside remained unaware. They were still lined up outside, waiting patiently.

After the time it takes to drink a cup of tea, a gentle breeze seemed to stir within the hut.

Then, like a withered tree experiencing spring’s revival, Wang Qiupo’s vitality returned.

However, Xu Bai keenly noticed that this elder, who had lived for eight centuries, was now one step closer to death.

With a light cough, Wang Qiupo stood up again and approached Xu Bai.

"I have already confirmed with the organization, young man. Your words are not false," he said.

"Our previous transactions also prove that your Heaven-Suppressing Society has credibility. However…"

Wang Qiupo’s aged eyes locked onto Xu Bai.

"How do you prove that you are truly a member of the Heaven-Suppressing Society?"

"And not someone from the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance who has uncovered my true identity and is trying to use this to launch a counterattack?"

"What were the contents of our last two transactions?"

Faced with Wang Qiupo’s barrage of questions, Xu Bai remained unfazed. He smiled faintly and gave his answer.

"The first was the Immortal Alliance’s entrance examination questions. The second was the true identity of an ancient cultivator the Immortal Alliance was searching for."

Hearing these two statements, Wang Qiupo’s tense body immediately slumped.

After a moment of silence, he spoke in a deep voice.

"The organization has indeed detected traces of the laws of the world reversing. However, we have yet to pinpoint the true identity of this Heavenly Sovereign…"

"This deal is accepted."

"However, since it involves the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign, signing a contract might alert him. So, this transaction can only be a verbal agreement, relying on mutual trust."

Xu Bai’s eyes flickered slightly before he shook his head with a smile.

"No problem. There will be many opportunities for us to collaborate in the future. I trust that you won’t go back on your word."

"Since that’s settled, I’ll share the information with you now."

Xu Bai’s expression grew serious as he whispered,

"The law this Heavenly Sovereign is reversing is that of life and death."

"Recently, we discovered some beings in the Devouring Essence White Mist—neither truly alive nor truly dead. They resemble living corpses."

"Coupling this with our observations of the world’s laws being reversed, our investigations have confirmed this theory."

"As for this Heavenly Sovereign’s true identity, we are still uncertain."

"However, we do have some suspicious targets."

After speaking, Xu Bai lifted his hand and, as if writing in the air, inscribed two names—"Lan Yu (Blue Feather)" and "Tian Yi (Heavenly Doctor)."

Wang Qiupo narrowed his eyes and firmly memorized the names.

Just as he was about to recline back into his rattan chair, Xu Bai suddenly asked,

"Old sir, do you wish to return home?"

"If you use the information I provided to negotiate with the Five Elders Association…"

"I believe they would agree to your return."

A flicker of hope appeared in Wang Qiupo’s eyes, only to be quickly extinguished.

He finally shook his head and said softly,

"The fate of spies like me is to have both our bodies and souls rot away in foreign lands."

"As for my homeland…"

"I have long forgotten what it looks like."

His voice was low as he lay back in the rattan chair. Once again, his life force gradually faded.

"The items on the list will be delivered to you as promised."

"Now, leave. This time, I will not wake up again."

Before his vitality completely dissipated, he uttered these final words.

Xu Bai nodded.

"In that case, why don’t I borrow your death for a moment?"

Wang Qiupo was momentarily stunned before understanding dawned on him.

With his last ounce of strength, he slowly nodded.

Before his life force completely vanished, Xu Bai struck out with a palm.

Wang Qiupo was instantly reduced to ashes.

At the same time, Xu Bai bellowed,

"So, you were a lackey of the Five Elders Association? Courting death!"

With Wang Qiupo’s death, the restrictions placed upon the hut vanished. Xu Bai’s voice spread beyond its walls.

Coupled with the celestial phenomenon of a meteor falling from the sky, the cultivators outside immediately realized what had happened.

The handsome young man before them had actually killed Wang Qiupo, a well-known figure in Tianliang Prefecture!

The crowd erupted into an uproar.

Rage, shock, disbelief…

Countless emotions surged in their hearts.

"Seize him!"

The cultivators, full of righteous indignation, surrounded Xu Bai as he calmly stepped out of the hut.

However, Xu Bai remained utterly composed. Facing the enraged cultivators, he coldly rebuked,

"Are you all planning to become accomplices of a spy from the Five Elders Association?"

Hearing this, the cultivators stiffened.

Though they had vaguely overheard mention of the Five Elders Association earlier, they hadn’t linked it to Wang Qiupo.

After all, the old man’s reputation was far too renowned—practically a household name in Tianliang Prefecture.

Yet, the young man before them didn’t seem like someone who would make baseless accusations.

"What exactly is going on?"

They exchanged uncertain glances, momentarily stunned by Xu Bai’s words.

"Report this to the authorities immediately!" Someone finally reacted.

"Until the City Lord arrives, you’re not allowed to leave!" They blocked Xu Bai’s path.

Xu Bai remained unfazed.

"No problem. In fact, you should call the Martial Hall and the Defense Bureau as well. Once they investigate, you’ll see that my words are true."

Seeing how calm he was, the cultivators grew even more uncertain.

"If what he says is true, and Wang Qiupo was really a spy for the Five Elders Association…"

"Then the sky is about to fall."

Thinking of the countless cultivators he had recommended over the years, the crowd swallowed nervously, a chill rising in their hearts.

They didn’t have to wait long before an orange streak of light flew down from the sky.

It was none other than the Lord of Tianliang City, Xiang Rongxin.

Sweeping his gaze around, he locked eyes on Xu Bai.

Without a word, without even questioning, he raised his hand high, forming a massive palm from above—

He was going to kill Xu Bai on the spot!

“This is a cover-up!”

The cultivators present were all shocked, but no one dared to intervene.

Just as they thought this handsome cultivator was about to meet a tragic end, they saw him calmly pull out a folding fan and, with a crisp swish, unfold it.

Before the massive palm could strike him, an invisible ripple spread out, neutralizing the deadly attack.

“Hm?”

A trace of astonishment appeared on Xiang Rongxin’s face.

Seeing Xu Bai’s gaze carrying a hint of mockery, a sinister glint flashed in his eyes.

Just as he was about to unleash his full strength to ensure Xu Bai’s death—

A lazy voice suddenly came from the horizon.

“Hold on, City Lord Xiang!”

“I heard someone reported that a spy from the Five Elders Association was executed. Is this true?”

Before the voice even faded, a black-robed cultivator appeared at the scene.

Xiang Rongxin’s expression immediately darkened.

The newcomer was none other than Nangong Shirong, the Commander of Tianliang Prefecture’s Defense Bureau Office.

With him here, there was no way to suppress the matter.

This was troublesome.

Glancing at the lingering celestial phenomenon above, Xiang Rongxin sighed internally.

“Wang Qiupo… Wang Qiupo… You’ve really put me in a tough spot.”

After receiving reports from his subordinates, Xiang Rongxin quickly made a judgment. Regardless of whether “Wang Qiupo being a spy from the Five Elders Association” was true or not—

He had to turn it into a falsehood.

Otherwise…

Seeing the smile on Nangong Shirong’s face, Xiang Rongxin could already foresee the storm of bloodshed about to engulf Tianliang Prefecture—perhaps even the entire Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

“This young friend, please come with me,” Nangong Shirong said to Xu Bai in a friendly tone.

“I was thinking the same.” Xu Bai cupped his hands in response, his expression fearless.

What followed progressed swiftly.

Xu Bai firmly insisted that, based on subtle clues, he had suspected Wang Qiupo of being a spy.

Acting in the interest of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, he personally approached Wang Qiupo to probe him.

To his shock, Wang Qiupo openly admitted his true identity and even attempted to assassinate him.

Left with no choice, Xu Bai fought back and killed him.

It was a simple matter.

Nangong Shirong seemed uninterested in verifying Xu Bai’s claims and immediately ordered his subordinates to investigate Wang Qiupo.

Even if Wang Qiupo wasn’t a spy, he wouldn’t be able to withstand the meticulous scrutiny of the Defense Bureau Office.

Wherever one walks, traces are left behind.

Moreover, Wang Qiupo truly was a spy from the Five Elders Association.

It didn’t take long before Nangong Shirong held a wealth of irrefutable “evidence” in his hands.

“Hahaha! Young friend, you have done a great service for the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance this time!” Nangong Shirong laughed heartily, patting Xu Bai’s shoulder with great satisfaction.

“Until the dust settles, stay here and avoid going out to prevent retaliation. Rest assured, once everything is clarified, you will receive your rightful rewards!”

Xu Bai replied solemnly, “Eradicating traitors for the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is our duty.”

Seeing Xu Bai’s strong sense of duty, Nangong Shirong was very pleased.

He patted Xu Bai’s shoulder again in encouragement before hurriedly leaving.

The conclusion of this matter came even faster than Xu Bai had anticipated.

Because the Five Elders Association had also stepped in.

In response to the accusations from the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, the Five Elders Association firmly denied everything. They claimed Wang Qiupo had absolutely no connection with them.

The Five Elders Association maintained its principle of peaceful coexistence and would never intentionally undermine relations between the two sides.

They urged the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance to stop fabricating stories and making baseless accusations.

…

The more they denied it, the deeper the suspicions grew.

Although many clues suggested that this might have been Wang Qiupo’s final attempt to sow discord before his death—

Even so…

Better to kill a thousand by mistake than to let a single one slip away.

In just over ten days, all the cultivators who had been promoted thanks to Wang Qiupo’s recommendations were placed under isolation and investigation.

Even those on missions deep within the White Mist had been forcibly recalled.

The results were predictable.

A small number were indeed found guilty and immediately taken down.

Most, though lacking direct evidence of wrongdoing, were permanently sidelined—relegated to meaningless roles with no future prospects. If nothing unexpected happened, they would spend the rest of their lives in obscurity.

While the entire Immortal Alliance was in turmoil—

A cultivator from the Defense Bureau Office, who had seized an empty position left by the removed officials, approached Li Fan.

“These are the agreed-upon supplies.”

“The organization is very pleased with this transaction.”

“We look forward to working together again.”

Chapter 717: The Giant Stitched from Ten Thousand Corpses

The young guard cultivator appeared to be full of righteousness. No one would have expected that he was actually a spy for the Five Elders Association.

Even more ironically, he had previously participated in the capture of Five Elders Association spies…

This only made the situation seem even more absurd.

After casually leaving behind these words and a Voidbright Stone Mother, he quickly departed without drawing any attention.

Xu Bai also remained calm, swiftly stowing away the fully packed stone core.

Upon inspection, he confirmed that the types and quantities of resources were exactly as he had requested—down to the last detail.

"In this regard, the Five Elders Association is actually quite reliable. At the very least, they're far more dependable than the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance." Xu Bai mused to himself.

After some twists and turns, he had finally obtained the True Fruit of Temptation he needed.

However, Xu Bai still could not leave Tianliang Prefecture.

Due to the unresolved cases caused by Wang Qiupo, he, as the initiator of the events, had a duty to continue cooperating with the investigation.

At this moment, however, public attention was largely focused on the purging of Wang Qiupo's old faction and the power struggle over vacant positions.

Thus, he had been momentarily forgotten, allowing him to enjoy some peace.

Meanwhile, amidst the boundless white mist…

"What’s going on? Yesterday, when I checked, there were only five Dissociation Discs left. Why has the number returned to six now?"

Huangfu Song suddenly exclaimed in shock as Samantabhadra True Boat sped through the mist.

Dongfang Yao's face changed drastically. "Could it be that we've entered another strange maze zone? Have we gone back in time by a day?"

Li Fan was silent for a moment before speaking with some helplessness:

"It’s likely due to the impact of the Wang Qiupo case. Among the four people who redeemed the Dissociation Discs, one must have been related to Wang Qiupo and is now suspected of being a spy. Since the Dissociation Disc is an invaluable treasure of the Immortal Alliance, it naturally wouldn't be left in his hands. It must have been confiscated."

The three had only just escaped a maze domain and reestablished communication with the Tianxuan Mirror, so they were aware of this major recent event in the Immortal Alliance.

Upon hearing this, both Dongfang Yao and Huangfu Song immediately understood.

"Brother Li, you really think fast," Dongfang Yao chuckled.

Huangfu Song sighed in relief. "I was worried that at our current pace, we wouldn't be able to snatch a Dissociation Disc. But now that an extra one has appeared, our chances should be solid."

All three of them instinctively checked their Qingxuan Points.

“36,000 points.”

Based on previous experience, they only needed to complete one or two more maze explorations to make up the remaining 14,000 points.

"Nowadays, even the most remote areas within the white mist are swarming with cultivators. It’s as if the entire Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance has flooded in. This is ridiculous! The maps they gave us for the explored regions are completely useless now," Dongfang Yao grumbled.

"Yeah. Good thing Brother Li has exceptional abilities and can hear those mysterious voices from the mist," Huangfu Song said, glancing subtly at Li Fan.

"Speaking of which, Brother Li, what exactly do those voices sound like? Could you describe them to us?" Huangfu Song probed cautiously.

Li Fan smirked coldly in his heart, just about to reply—

"Tian…"

"Yi…"

That ghostly voice suddenly echoed in Li Fan’s ears once again.

"There’s a Maze Zone nearby."

Having grown accustomed to this phenomenon, Li Fan did not feel fear. Instead, he immediately halted the speeding Samantabhadra True Boat, focusing his mind to discern the direction of the voice.

However, this time, something felt different.

Because the wailing, which sounded like “Tian Yi”, was growing louder and louder—

As if…

A maze zone was rapidly approaching them!

Li Fan's expression instantly changed. His divine sense expanded outward, probing the mist to detect any danger.

But the mist was like a deep, still pool—completely undisturbed.

There was no way of knowing where the threat was coming from.

"Tian…"

"Yi!"

The sound of wrath and resentment grew clearer, the voices filled with anger and resentment became increasingly distinct.

One could clearly hear the words—"Tian Yi."

The sound came from all directions, as if countless ancient, berserk beasts had lost their reason, roaring and closing in.

The sheer intensity of it made Li Fan’s eardrums ache.

He glanced at Huangfu and Dongfang beside him, only to realize that despite the deafening roar, they seemed oblivious to the terrifying noise.

"Something feels off around us," Dongfang Yao, being the more alert one, suddenly spoke up.

"Go!"

A sudden surge of crisis flooded Li Fan’s heart, growing stronger by the second. He made a swift decision.

The Samantabhadra True Boat instantly accelerated, attempting to break through the mist.

At that moment, a colossal hand suddenly emerged from the white fog below.

Its five fingers curled inward, forming a cage, aiming to seize the Samantabhadra True Boat in its grasp.

"What the hell is that?!" Huangfu Song’s face turned pale. He let out a shrill cry, but his hands moved swiftly.

He flung an apricot-yellow formation flag, which shot forward like an arrow towards the giant hand.

The flag exploded upon contact, transforming into strands of golden silk that wrapped around the massive hand, momentarily halting its movement.

"Go! Quickly!"

Huangfu Song shouted in panic.

Li Fan didn’t need the reminder—he had already pushed the Samantabhadra True Boat to its limits, fleeing in the direction they came from.

It wasn’t that they lacked the courage to fight; rather, the sudden appearance of this hand was far too horrifying.

Li Fan had once seen the severed hand of an Ancient Heavenly Sovereign outside the Chizha Abyss, at the Eternal Immortal Fortress.

But even that sight paled in comparison to what they had just witnessed!

Because this so-called "hand" was not a natural entity—it was grotesquely stitched together from the corpses of countless cultivators.

In that brief moment of terror, Li Fan could clearly see their twisted bodies, their contorted faces, and the strange black threads that bound them together.

What sent chills down his spine, however, was that despite the complete absence of life in these corpses, their mouths continued to move, letting out hellish howls:

"Tian!"

"Yi!"

Though the Thousand Silken Vine Formation temporarily restrained the giant hand, another one suddenly emerged from the depths of the white mist.

With sheer brute force, it ripped apart the golden silk strands.

The three of them could now see it clearly—

It was another ghastly, monstrous arm, grotesquely fused from countless corpses.

It was as if a colossal undead giant lurked within the mist, watching and hunting them.

"Could it be that the Immortal Alliance’s 'Sky-Splitting Cannon' was meant to deal with this thing?!" Dongfang Yao shouted, his voice trembling.

Gritting his teeth, he swung a powerful fist towards the monstrous giant behind them.

A black rift tore through space like a blade, erupting in an explosion—this was the divine ability Dongfang Yao had comprehended within the Great Vortex of the Rift Realm.

Yet even this attack, strong enough to sever space itself, failed to slow the undead giant.

The shattered corpses making up its body were obliterated, only for new ones to squirm out from the depths of the corpse pile, instantly replacing them.

This terrifying scene made both Huangfu and Dongfang shudder in absolute fear.

Chapter 718: A Glimmer of Hope in Desperation

"Hurry up and leave! This monstrous thing is beyond our ability to resist!"

Huangfu Song shouted in alarm while simultaneously setting up several formations outside the Samantabhadra True Boat.

The speed of the flying vessel instantly multiplied several times.

Yet, the terrifying corpse giant continued its relentless pursuit.

Moreover, its speed seemed to be only slightly slower than the Samantabhadra True Boat!

"Quick, return to the nearest Luoyan Prefecture! A creature like this can only be dealt with by the official forces of the Immortal Alliance!"

Without needing further instructions, Li Fan was already controlling the flying vessel according to the fastest escape route.

However…

Based on the map’s distance and their current speed, they should have long since escaped the range of the white mist.

But their surroundings remained shrouded in thick fog, unchanged as if frozen in time.

"This is bad… We must have unknowingly been dragged into a Maze Zone by that corpse giant," Li Fan said grimly.

"What?!" Huangfu Song was shocked. After checking their surroundings, he realized that Li Fan was right.

"This… We can’t defeat it, and we can’t escape either. Isn’t this a dead end?" Dongfang Yao’s face turned pale.

"Keep running and find a way out," Li Fan responded decisively.

The Samantabhadra True Boat maintained its high-speed flight, trying to locate the exit of the Maze Zone. Meanwhile, the corpse giant chased closely behind them, determined to capture Li Fan and his companions at all costs.

Several times, the Samantabhadra True Boat was nearly grabbed by the giant’s decayed hand. Fortunately, thanks to Li Fan’s exceptional skills—honed during his time navigating the Great Immortal-Severing Formation—he narrowly avoided disaster.

"Damn it! Why is it fixated on us?! What kind of grudge does it have?!" Huangfu Song roared in frustration.

"Hmm?"

That seemingly thoughtless complaint suddenly sparked an idea in Li Fan’s mind.

This terrifying and eerie corpse giant was clearly connected to the Heaven Doctor. It lacked conscious thought and seemed to act purely on instinct.

So why was it relentlessly pursuing the three of them?

As it chased them, it let out wails filled with hatred and resentment.

"Could it be sensing the aura of the ‘Heaven Doctor’ on me?"

That thought crossed Li Fan’s mind.

But he quickly dismissed the idea.

Not just in this lifetime—

Ever since his clone exposed a flaw before the Heaven Doctor, leading to his desperate escape through [Truth] through the rupture in the Tianxuan Space—he had not come into direct contact with the Heaven Doctor for a long time.

Let alone carrying any lingering traces of its aura.

Li Fan then glanced at Huangfu Song and Dongfang Yao.

They couldn’t even hear the corpse giant’s eerie cries of "Tian Yi," which meant they were even less likely to be connected to this powerful being.

"So… is it something I’m carrying that’s attracting this corpse giant?"

At lightning speed, Li Fan considered the possibility.

He quickly scanned and checked all the items in his possession. Without hesitation, he discarded several suspicious objects, but the corpse giant’s pursuit remained unchanged.

Finally, Li Fan’s gaze locked onto a single white rib bone.

This was the only item that had dropped from Yin Shangren after he was killed.

The first known infected of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma.

"Could this be the cause?"

Li Fan hesitated for a moment before gripping the bone tightly.

Its touch was chilling yet oddly smooth.

With force, he hurled it in the opposite direction of their flight path.

Moments later—

"Tian…"

"Yi…"

The giant corpse, as expected, shifted its target of pursuit!

Abandoning the Samantabhadra True Boat, it roared and went after that single white rib bone!

"……"

"What does this mean?" Li Fan was momentarily stunned, his brows furrowed as he pondered carefully.

What happened next made him even more bewildered.

When the giant corpse obtained the rib bone, Li Fan initially thought it would go on a rampage and seek revenge.

However, its movements suddenly slowed, and then it stood still in place, dazed.

The agonized howls of the "Tian Yi" gradually subsided.

The giant corpse clumsily cradled the rib bone in its hands, holding it close to its chest.

Then, it sank into the vast white mist and disappeared.

The entire transformation occurred in an instant. Aside from Li Fan, the other two people on the boat failed to grasp what had happened.

All they saw was Li Fan seemingly tossing something away, and that terrifying giant was lured away.

Surviving by sheer luck, they stared blankly at Li Fan.

It took Li Fan a long while to snap out of it. Shrugging, he said, "It was just good luck, that's all."

Huangfu and Dongfang remained silent. However, since Li Fan had saved their lives, and he was unwilling to elaborate further, they did not press him.

Over this period of time, they had truly gone through life and death together.

Even if they were not the closest of friends, their bond was far deeper than that of most cultivators in the world.

At the very least, in Huangfu and Dongfang's eyes, that was the case.

Everyone has their own secrets, and they unanimously chose to avoid discussing this matter further.

With the giant's threat gone, the three of them spent considerable effort and finally escaped from this maze zone.

For some reason, however, this zone did not grant them any Qingxuan Points as a reward.

Simply surviving was already a great fortune. One could not ask for more.

Still shaken, the three discussed their next steps and initially decided to return and rest for a while.

However, upon seeing that two more Dissociation Discs had disappeared from the Heavenly-Measuring Mirror, their plans changed.

Ignoring the fact that they had just escaped death, they plunged once more into the white mist.

"So, as the saying goes, 'Men die for wealth, birds die for food.' This is the law of the heavens and the earth. Even we cultivators are not exempt from it. Unless a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign appears to overturn this principle, similar incidents will continue to occur within our Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance in the future."

Nangong Shirong spoke confidently before Xu Bai—not about Huangfu Song and his companions, but rather about the Lord of Tianliang City, Xiang Rongxin.

After a thorough investigation lasting several dozen days, coupled with negotiations among various factions, the scapegoat for the Wang Qiupo Incident had finally been decided.

It was none other than City Lord Xiang.

There was no way around it—after all, most of the cultivators recommended by Wang Qiupo had followed Xiang Rongxin’s path. Moreover, he openly admitted to accepting a large number of treasures from Wang Qiupo in the past.

As a result, he was stripped of his position as City Lord. However, he was fortunate enough to keep his life—and even his cultivation remained intact.

The only punishment was exile to the Cangwu Abyss in the extreme southwest, where he would be tasked with guarding against the increasingly frequent uprisings of abyssal monsters.

Having rendered significant service in this case, Nangong Shirong naturally and effortlessly succeeded Xiang Rongxin’s position.

The internal decision had already been made, and in just a few days, the official decree would be issued.

Now basking in his success, Nangong Shirong had not forgotten Xu Bai, the "key contributor" to the case.

He even extended an olive branch to Xu Bai, inviting him to take up a position in Tianliang Province.

After all, though his rise to power had been swift, he had also offended a great many people.

His foundation was weak, and he was in urgent need of cultivating his own power base.

Chapter 719: The Tianliang Communication Envoy

Xu Bai did not immediately refuse.

Instead, he pondered for a moment, his expression showing hesitation.

“What’s wrong? Do you have some unspoken concerns, young friend?” Nangong Shirong asked.

“To be honest with you, Senior Nangong, I am not actually a member of the Immortal Alliance. I am an ancient cultivator who was in deep slumber…” Xu Bai then recounted the story of how he had used the Heavenly Spirit Flower to obtain his identity within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Nangong Shirong burst into hearty laughter. “You need not worry, young friend. I have already investigated these matters thoroughly. Including that Dao Integration-level Derivative Jade Token—it's in your hands, isn’t it?”

Xu Bai’s face revealed a look of shock.

However, Nangong Shirong simply waved his hand, signaling him to relax.

“Although it does bend the rules slightly, your identity within the Immortal Alliance has already been recognized by the Tianxuan Mirror. That’s all that matters!”

“Even the cultivators of the Five Elders Association can reform and be accepted into the Immortal Alliance—so why not ancient cultivators like you?”

“Besides, the Wang Qiupo incident has proven your loyalty to the Immortal Alliance beyond any doubt! If it weren’t for your vigilance, who knows how many more spies he would have planted within our ranks?”

Nangong Shirong let out a cold snort before softening his expression as he looked at Xu Bai.

“Young friend Xu, I am in need of capable people. Why not lend me a hand?”

“Don’t worry—with me here, no one will dare to question your past!”

At this point, if Xu Bai still refused, he might not be able to leave the room at all.

So, after pretending to hesitate for a moment, he responded with heartfelt gratitude, “In that case, I thank you for your guidance, Senior!”

Hearing Xu Bai’s affirmation, Nangong Shirong laughed heartily once more.

With his approval, Xu Bai’s official induction into the system went exceptionally smoothly.

Even the White Jade Heart-Questioning Platform’s assessment was nothing more than a formality.

After asking just a few insignificant questions, the process was hastily concluded.

Xu Bai was appointed as the Tianliang Communication Liaison Envoy.

His duty was to report directly to the ruler of the state, a position neither too powerful nor too insignificant.

Everything depended on the Tianliang City Lord’s discretion.

If Li Fan’s previous role as the Secret Envoy had been to manage the state’s affairs on behalf of the City Lord…

Then the Communication Envoy was responsible for coordinating between Tianliang State, other states, and the headquarters of the Immortal Alliance.

It was common for those in power to appoint their trusted juniors to official positions.

However, to avoid suspicion, they wouldn’t place them directly within their own territories but would instead send them to serve in familiar neighboring regions.

After accumulating experience for a decade or two, they would then be transferred back, making the appointment seem more legitimate.

This method ensured the move was justified and widely accepted.

Even if the Immortal Alliance headquarters investigated, it would all appear to be within proper regulations—making it impossible to challenge.

Among the duties of a Communication Envoy, this type of arrangement constituted the majority of their work.

As soon as Li Fan took office, this became his first challenge.

After all, it was widely known that Tianliang State had a large number of vacant key positions.

Would Nangong Shirong monopolize all the benefits for himself? At the very least, he had to leave some leftovers for others, right?

Countless factions were vying for a share of the spoils, and balancing their interests while keeping everyone satisfied was no easy task.

If handled well, it would be seen as part of his responsibilities. But if a mistake were made, Nangong Shirong could simply use Xu Bai as a scapegoat to quell public outrage.

A well-played move indeed.
