Faced with the flood of invitation cards and requests, Xu Bai ignored them all.

Instead, he took leave, concealed his presence, and returned directly to Longevity Valley.

When Nangong Shirong sent a message inquiring about his absence, Xu Bai simply smiled and replied:

“Let them wait for now. If there are any complaints, just say that everything is up to me.”

After pondering for a moment, Nangong Shirong simply said, "Brilliant," and then fell silent.

Xu Bai, who had returned successfully, took out the True Temptation Fruit and entered the Medicine King Cauldron.

Jiang Yushan’s resting chamber was located right next to Liu San’s.

Xu Bai entered without any difficulty.

Without making extensive modifications to her thoughts, he only changed the appearance of Liu Yihang in her memory to resemble Li Fan instead.

Additionally, he implanted a subconscious suggestion that made her deeply trust "Liu Yihang."

Then, he called Liu San inside and awakened Jiang Yushan in his presence.

Jiang Yushan’s eyelashes trembled slightly, while Liu San’s face was filled with excitement.

Xu Bai, however, quietly took a few steps back.

Sure enough, as soon as Jiang Yushan woke up, her eyes were momentarily filled with confusion.

But her expression soon changed, and she immediately fired a black death ray toward Liu San.

The black light, like a sword, carried an intense killing aura.

Yet, within it, Xu Bai faintly sensed an aura identical to Longevity Green Energy, which was rather peculiar.

"Yushan, it’s me!" Liu San hurriedly blocked the black death ray and called out anxiously.

Jiang Yushan was briefly stunned, then shut her eyes tightly, suppressing the murderous intent in her heart.

After a brief moment, she reopened them.

"What’s going on? Have we reached the Xiaoyao Realm?"

Her voice was not the soft and melodious tone of an ordinary female cultivator. Instead, it was hoarse and sharp, like the grating sound of metal scraping against metal.

Liu San didn’t mind at all and began explaining the entire sequence of events to her.

"We’re back in the Xuanhuang Realm?"

"Thousands of years have already passed?"

Even though this female cultivator had endured the harsh environment of Indeterminate Prison for a long time, she was still momentarily bewildered upon hearing such an absurd revelation.

"I need to go out and take a look!"

Clearly, she did not fully trust Liu San.

At Liu San’s signal, Xu Bai released her from the Medicine King Cauldron.

Liu San then led her on a tour around the current Xuanhuang Realm.

Not long after, she returned, looking somewhat dazed and lost.

"Just now, your subconscious action against me was precisely due to the great calamity of 'the cultivation technique cannot be practiced together" Liu San proactively explained.

Jiang Yushan frowned slightly and said, "To avoid accidentally killing you, I’d better switch back to my original cultivation technique."

Liu San quickly waved his hands. "No need, no need. Right now, the sect urgently needs Longevity Pills, and you can use Longevity Green Energy to help me refine them."

However, Jiang Yushan refused without hesitation. "The Longevity Green Energy I cultivate is likely different from that of your Medicine King Sect. The pills I refine might cause an uncontrollable surge of killing intent when consumed."

"You’d better find someone else!"

Liu San’s face immediately stiffened upon hearing this.

"Right now, aside from me, you’re the only one who still possesses the World-Saving Longevity Scripture."

"The calamity of Incompatible Cultivation technique is truly terrifying. If more than three people practice together, it will be nearly impossible to control."

Liu San stammered as he explained.

A cold glint flashed through Jiang Yushan’s eyes, and Liu San fell silent.

"Elder Jiang, please proceed with refining the pills. Even if there are some minor side effects, the cultivators of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance surely won’t mind at this point."

At the crucial moment, it was Xu Bai who stepped in to resolve the situation for Liu San.

Chapter 720: Where does the Heavenly Doctor come from

Jiang Yushan looked at Xu Bai.

His handsome appearance did not stir any emotional waves in her heart.

However, the image of "Liu Yihang" flashed through her mind, causing her to hesitate for a brief moment.

From Liu San, she had learned that "Xu Bai" was a clone created by Liu Yihang. Now that Liu Ruchen had fallen, Liu Yihang was the current sect master of the Medicine King Sect.

Her expression softened slightly. After a moment of hesitation, Jiang Yushan finally nodded.

"Since the sect master has said so, we might as well give it a try."

"However, I once lived in the Indeterminate Prison and have been tainted with an immense and unremovable baleful aura. Are you certain this won’t be a problem?" She frowned slightly, somewhat doubtful.

"Given how desperately the cultivators of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance seek the Longevity Pill, even if it has some minor side effects, it should still be within an acceptable range. After all, the choice is between dying of old age or suffering some bodily harm—anyone can see which is the lesser evil." Xu Bai spoke confidently.

At the same time, he briefly explained to Jiang Yushan the origins of the Devouring Essence White Mist and the current policy of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, which encouraged cultivators to explore the mist.

"When I was flying outside just now, I noticed those towering walls of white mist that stretch across the heavens and earth. They consume lifespan and divide the world…"

"A thousand years have passed, and such great changes have taken place." Jiang Yushan sighed almost imperceptibly.

"This is the best time for selling the Longevity Pill—demand far exceeds supply. With Elder Liu alone, he cannot meet the demand. I hope Elder Jiang will lend us your aid." Xu Bai spoke softly.

"Refining pills… I suppose I can give it a try." Jiang Yushan nodded in agreement.

A hint of joy appeared on Liu San's face.

Immediately, within the alchemy chamber of Longevity Valley, they gathered ninety-nine Golden Core disciples and set up the World-Saving Longevity Grand Alchemical Formation.

Liu San and Jiang Yushan sat cross-legged at the center of the formation, channeling their Longevity Green Energy into the core of the formation—the Medicine King Cauldron.

As the two forces were unleashed, Xu Bai keenly sensed the difference between them.

If Liu San's Longevity Green Energy was like the vibrant vitality of spring, then Jiang Yushan’s carried a faintly chilling aura of slaughter within its vitality.

Moreover…

There was something familiar about this baleful aura.

Narrowing his eyes slightly, Xu Bai remained composed and silently waited for the Longevity Pills to be refined.

With Jiang Yushan's assistance, the formation's operation speed increased more than threefold. Combined with Liu San’s experienced control, it wasn’t long before the first batch of Longevity Pills was successfully produced.

Three pills were formed. However, on the otherwise flawless, sky-blue pills, an ominous trace of black mist marred their appearance, disrupting their aesthetic harmony.

Even the natural medicinal fragrance of the longevity elixir was suppressed.

Holding the pill in one's hand did not evoke the usual urge to consume it immediately.

"Sect Master, is this kind of pill really viable?" Jiang Yushan frowned slightly.

Xu Bai did not answer immediately. Instead, he tossed one of the pills into his mouth and closed his eyes to sense its effects.

He paid no attention to the increase in lifespan but instead focused on how the pill dissolved in his body, merging with the Longevity Green Energy and—along with it—the baleful aura that wreaked havoc within his flesh.

"As expected…"

"Heavenly Baleful Qi…"

Xu Bai's expression turned slightly grave.

"Elder Jiang, could you explain in detail the origin of this baleful aura?" Circulating his spiritual energy, he slowly repaired the damage the aura had caused and then opened his eyes to ask.

Jiang Yushan was briefly stunned but then began explaining.

"In ancient times, cultivators underwent heavenly tribulation before ascending. This tribulation was both a test and an opportunity. Although it carried the risk of death, those who succeeded would be bathed in celestial energy and transform into immortals."

"However, when the path to immortality was severed, heavenly tribulation ceased to appear. Yet, the killing intent of the heavens still needed an outlet—thus, the baleful aura descended upon the world."

"This was the original source of the baleful aura within the Indeterminate Prison. Later, as countless heinous criminals were imprisoned there, the boundless killing intent of humanity became intertwined with it…"

"The resonance between heaven and man has made this baleful aura increasingly eerie and persistent. Even though I have distanced myself from it for decades, constantly cleansing myself with a healer’s heart, I still find it difficult to dispel." Jiang Yushan spoke slowly. "Over time, the damage this baleful aura inflicts on a cultivator’s body is irreversible. This rather unique voice of mine is one such consequence."

Jiang Yushan’s expression grew slightly dazed as she continued, "The great upheaval in the Xuanhuang Realm... I wonder what has become of Indeterminate Prison now."

Xu Bai's face showed a contemplative expression. "Heaven's Calamity… Heaven’s Slaughter..."

"Elder Jiang, have you ever encountered this person or a sword brimming with baleful energy?" As he spoke, Xu Bai traced an image in the air, depicting the Fisherman and the Heavenly Calamity Sword.

Jiang Yushan stared at the image for a while before shaking her head. "I have never seen them."

"Then, let’s leave it at that."

This result was within Xu Bai’s expectations. With a wave of his hand, he dissipated the image of the Fisherman and turned to Jiang Yushan and Liu San. "The two of you need not worry. Though the Longevity Pill you refined together does indeed harm the physical body of cultivators, its merits outweigh its flaws. As long as its life-extending effects remain unchanged, I am certain many will still clamor to buy it. At most, we can lower the price a little."

Reassuring them, Xu Bai instructed them to focus on refining the pills.

"How many should we refine?" Jiang Yushan asked directly. "I am quite curious about this world after thousands of years and would like to go out and explore."

Xu Bai was momentarily speechless.

He glanced at Liu San, only to see him staring at Jiang Yushan in a daze, clearly not objecting to her decision.

After a brief moment of thought, Xu Bai said, "Use up half of the raw materials for the Longevity Pill in the Longevity Valley. Otherwise, keeping them unused would just be a waste."

Clearly, Xu Bai did not have a precise understanding of the quantity of medicinal ingredients in Longevity Valley. Jiang Yushan nodded in agreement without hesitation.

"Then, I’ll leave it to you both."

With a faint smile, Xu Bai gracefully left Longevity Valley.

"At the very least, she won’t be coming out for the next year or so."

"However..."

A figure flashed in Xu Bai’s mind—[Tian Jue] Fisherman.

The baleful aura clinging to Jiang Yushan was strikingly similar to the aura surrounding Tian Jue.

Yet, there was a subtle difference.

It was difficult to put into words, but for someone like Li Fan, who had interacted with both, distinguishing between them was easy.

If he were to use an appropriate analogy, it would be like comparing "two bodies of seawater with different salt concentrations."

Similar yet distinct, as if...

"They come from two different worlds."

A glint flashed through Xu Bai’s eyes.

Jiang Yushan hailed from Indeterminate Prison and the Medicine King Sect, both of which still had records in the current Xuanhuang Realm.

That meant the answer was obvious.

For a long time, he had harbored a suspicion in his heart.

The likes of Tian Yi, Tian Jue, Tian Yu, and the Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace—these people likely did not originate from the Xuanhuang Realm.

Rather...

They were outsiders.

Chapter 721: The Heavenly Sovereign Defies Reason

Because not only is there currently no record of them, but even the people from the Medicine King Sect, who have traversed time from the ancient cultivation world, know nothing about the Tian Yi.

This anomaly inevitably raises suspicions about their origins. After all, such powerful beings could not possibly remain obscure and unknown.

"If that's the case, then many things can be explained."

"Back when I intended to form a Golden Core using the Heavenly Calamity Law and the Vast Ocean Law, I sensed a mortal danger. If I had formed the core solely with these two techniques, it would have undoubtedly provoked a backlash from the heavens. Only by incorporating other laws like Blue Flame and Ink Death could I stabilize the core. This is because the Law of Heavenly Calamity and Vast Ocean studied were not originally laws of the Xuanhuang Realm."

"If one forcibly forms a core using only these two law, it might be treated by the world as a complete outsider. The outcome would be..."

In Li Fan’s mind, scenes of the Congyun Sea being utterly destroyed flashed by.

"Perhaps this is the reason why the Congyun Sea had to be annihilated."

"An existence that doesn’t belong to the Xuanhuang Realm, yet thrives on its resources and flourishes like a foreign object lodged within the body, must be eliminated without delay."

"However, the fact that Zhang Haobo successfully built his foundation with the Heavenly Calamity Sword Intent proves that these ancient outsiders are gradually becoming part of the Xuanhuang Realm."

"Just like the Congyun Sea, which once faced annihilation by Crimson Flame and Ink Death but then regained vitality—the world’s hostility toward it seems significantly reduced."

"Assimilation... integration..."

Li Fan pondered deeply.

On that day, within the Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace, when the Vast Ocean accused the Fisherman of being the murderer who wiped out the entire sect, he once said:

"The Heavenly Calamity Weapon—other than the Venerable Tian Jue, no one else can wield it."

Originally, Li Fan thought that what he meant was the two words [Tian-sha]. After all, when Zhang Haobo fell in the past, the foundation of Zhang Haobo’s Dao, revealed through the anomalous phenomena of heaven and earth, was the [Heavenly Calamity Sword Intent]. And one of Li Fan’s nine laws was precisely the Law of Heavenly Calamity.[1]

Now it seems that, perhaps in the original world of the Heavenly Doctor, [Heavenly Calamity] might have been [Heavenly Slaughter].

However, upon arriving in the Xuanhuang Realm, their laws underwent a convergent transformation, giving rise to subtle differences.

Li Fan also recalled that the current Xuanhuang Realm has almost doubled in size compared to ancient times.

In its quest to devour other realms and avoid the fate of being consumed by the Immortal Ruins, conflicts between different world laws arose.

This might be the true origin of the world's anomalies.

"The amnesia of Tian Jue... the transformation of Tian Yu and the Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace disciples into anomalies—could it all be the result of world fusion?"

"In that case, the fact that the Heavenly Doctor remains unscathed throughout this process only makes his power seem all the more terrifying."

"Moreover, the Heavenly Doctor has lived for thousands of years, and the countless eerie and strange areas within the white fog clearly have some connection to him. Who knows what he's planning?"

"The strangest thing of all is the reaction of the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereigns of the Xuanhuang Realm. It’s impossible to believe they know nothing of the Heavenly Doctor’s subtle manipulations, yet they remain utterly indifferent. Have they reached some kind of agreement, or is there another reason..."

The image of the Heavenly Doctor surfaced in Xu Bai’s mind.

After a long moment, he shook his head slightly and suppressed his thoughts for the time being.

Upon returning to Tianliang Prefecture and reestablishing the connection with the communication talisman, countless messages flooded in like snowflakes.

Xu Bai remained calm and handled them one by one.

Balancing interests without causing conflict was a skill he had honed to perfection during his time as the Grand Tutor of the Great Xuan Dynasty.

Currently, there were still 640 positions available in Tianliang Prefecture. Of these, only around 200 had been approved by Nangong Shirong for negotiation and compromise with other forces.

However, the number of parties hoping to gain a share exceeded a thousand.

To satisfy the majority while offending the fewest possible people required careful deliberation.

As he continued to investigate the backgrounds of those involved and respond to their messages, Xu Bai remained composed and thoughtful.

...

While Xu Bai was busy with his new position, a major event suddenly captured the attention of the entire world.

The leader of Yuandao Prefecture, Immortal Sage Blue Feather, whose lifespan was nearing its end, announced to all cultivators that he was seeking any and all longevity-extending treasures.

At the same time, he released a list of longevity treasures he had already consumed.

He proclaimed that anyone who could provide an effective treasure would be allowed to choose freely from his vast collection.

Immortal Sage Blue Feather had ruled over Yuandao Prefecture for thousands of years.

His collection was immensely rich—so much so that it far surpassed even the rewards offered by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance to encourage cultivators to explore the White Mist.

The world was shaken.

Many cultivators hurriedly returned from the White Mist, choosing instead to embark on dangerous quests in search of longevity treasures.

Li Fan stared at the news, momentarily lost in thought.

“Has Blue Feather given up on risking everything to reverse life and death?”

“It seems news of a Heavenly Sovereign attaining the Dao has already leaked. Was it an internal leak from the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, or…”

“The Five Elders Association?”

While Li Fan was still deep in thought, Huangfu Song carefully studied Lanyu’s announcement and shook his head with a sigh.

“Immortal Sage Blue Feather has ruled one state for thousands of years—what kind of longevity treasure hasn’t he consumed? This list is practically an Encyclopedia of Longevity Treasures in the Xuanhuang World. Trying to earn a reward from him…

“Well, I certainly don’t have that kind of luck,” he said with a touch of self-mockery.

“Damn it, so many of these things—I’ve never even heard of them,” Dongfang Yao exclaimed, sticking out his tongue. “He’s eaten everything under the sun. If you ask me, the doomed are bound to die. Why struggle and cling to life? Wouldn’t it be better to find peace sooner?”

Listening to his companions’ complaints, Li Fan suddenly gained a moment of clarity.

“A long-prepared plan, suddenly disrupted. What Blue Feather needs most now is time. Offering a reward to the entire world is his only choice under these circumstances.”

“What will he do next?”

At this point, Blue Feather didn’t have many options left.

First, he could attempt to change the fundamental laws of life and death and fight for a slim chance to attain immortality.

However, it was obvious that mastering such a reversal was not something achievable in a short time. If it were, Blue Feather wouldn’t have waited until death was imminent before setting up a great formation and risking everything.

Therefore, the only option left for him was the most realistic one.

“To once again defy the laws of life and death and contend with that mysterious Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign!” Li Fan’s heart suddenly became clear.

“Although this path is also incredibly challenging, Blue Feather is, after all, more familiar with the principles of life and death. Compared to changing the nature of principal in reversal, his chances of success might actually be slightly higher.”

“It’s possible that he might even gain support from the Five Elders Association.”

Li Fan’s thoughts raced.

“This is getting interesting. Let’s see how the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance decides.”

“Will they support that mysterious Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign, or will they back Blue Feather?”

TL Note: ‘天煞’ (Tiansha) here means ‘heavenly calamity,’ but it sounds just like ‘天杀’ (also Tiansha), which means ‘heavenly slaughter’—same sound, different meaning!"

Chapter 722: The Giant Corpse Suddenly Collapses

Huangfu Song noticed Li Fan lost in thought and assumed he was considering taking a chance by going back to search for longevity treasures.

He quickly tried to persuade him otherwise.

After all, without Li Fan, it would be much harder for him and Dongfang to explore the Maze Zone efficiently. The hope of exchanging for the limited treasures on the Qingxuan List would become even more remote.

“This bounty issued by Immortal Sage Blue Feather might actually be a good thing for us,” Huangfu Song analyzed earnestly. “The principle of rising and falling forces—many cultivators are being drawn back. The competition pressure here in the White Mist will lessen…”

Li Fan smiled faintly and waved his hand to interrupt, “Brother Huangfu, don’t worry. I have no intention of going back. Besides, I might stay here in the White Mist even longer than you.”

Dongfang Yao couldn’t help but become curious. “Oh? Brother Li, did something on the Qingxuan List catch your eye?”

Li Fan did not hide it and said, “The Endstone Plate.”

Dongfang and Huangfu exchanged glances. “A hundred thousand Qingxuan Points, to bet on that still-unknown secondary body…”

Dongfang Yao couldn’t help but advise, “Brother Li, think carefully! The risk is just too great. If it turns out to be just an impressive-sounding name with little practical use, wouldn’t you lose everything? It might be better to look at something else. Even if you exchange for a Dao Integration technique that you can’t use, you could at least trade it with others…”

Dongfang Yao continued to ramble, while Huangfu Song pondered and gave his own opinion. “The Endstone Plate…

“I heard that after this secondary body was born, there were no more Tianxuan secondary bodies appearing for a full ten years. The headquarters became so nervous they thought there might never be another one.

“That’s why it earned the name ‘Endstone.’

“However…” Huangfu Song frowned slightly and said, “The prolonged anomaly caused by the Tianxuan Mirror originally led people to believe it had some unique feature. Yet, after extensive research, they couldn’t reach any definite conclusion, and ultimately had to give up. That might be why the Immortal Alliance decided to put it on the Qingxuan List.”

“After all, it’s still a Tianxuan secondary body—there might be some practical use that the Immortal Alliance hasn’t discovered yet. Although the price of a hundred thousand Qingxuan Points is steep, if the gamble pays off…”

Li Fan smiled and said, “A single investment for endless profit! I’m willing to take the risk!”

Dongfang Yao clicked his tongue and said, “Brother Li, you sure have a big appetite for risk. What if that thing turns out to be just a useless stone?”

“At the very least, it would still have collectible value. It wouldn’t be a total loss!” Li Fan laughed heartily, his attitude carefree.

“The only thing I worry about now is whether someone else will compete with me. There are countless Immortal Alliance cultivators, and I can’t be the only one willing to gamble.”

Huangfu Song clapped his hands and said, “Looks like we’ll need to pick up the pace. We’re still quite a ways off from a hundred thousand Qingxuan Points!”

After that discussion, the three of them aligned their goals and continued to explore the Maze Zone with renewed vigor.

Time passed quickly during their relentless exploration.

Huangfu and Dongfang had already exchanged their points for the Dissociation Disc and the Yuan-Devouring Saint Physique Technique, and they set their sights on other treasures.

The accumulated Qingxuan Points were inching closer to a hundred thousand.

Up to now, they had explored thirteen Maze Zone in total, including the initial Life-and-Death Maze Zone.

With experience, their exploration skills became increasingly proficient, and Li Fan also deduced some patterns regarding the existence of the “Maze Zone.”

Based on the conclusion that the current Xuanhuang Realm was formed from the fusion of the ancient Xuanhuang Realm with many other worlds, Li Fan suspected that the so-called Maze Zone might be fragments shed from the original worlds during the process of fusion and collision.

These Maze Zone were often eerie and followed their own unique rules, much like the bizarre phenomena within the Xuanhuang Realm itself.

By comparing the clothing styles of the corpses and the patterns on the buildings within the Maze Zone, Li Fan further discovered that these zones clearly originated from different sources.

“It seems that world-level evolution is occurring through collisions, and the White Mist serves as a buffer zone…”

After completing the exploration of yet another labyrinth domain, Li Fan gained some insight.

Perhaps this could also explain why there is such a vast space within the white mist—because it is originally the distance between worlds.

“Damn it, it’s getting harder and harder to find unexplored Maze Zones,” Dongfang Yao couldn’t help but curse as the Samantabhadra True Boat sped through the white mist for several days. They passed by several maze zones, but each time, the Heaven-Measuring Mirror indicated that they had already been documented.

Huangfu Song, absentmindedly fiddling with the Dissociation Disc, said, “It’s normal. It’s been almost a year since the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance issued the exploration decree. Considering the number of cultivators in the alliance, the shallow layers of the white mist should be mostly explored by now. To gain any more rewards, we’ll have to go deeper…”

“Boom!”

Before Huangfu Song could finish speaking, a sudden loud noise interrupted him.

It was as if something had fallen from above and crashed onto the Samantabhadra True Boat, causing the ship to shake violently for a moment.

Huangfu Song instinctively put away the Dissociation Disc, scanned the surroundings with his spiritual sense, and revealed a strange expression.

The object that had collided with the speeding Samantabhadra True Boat turned out to be the corpse of a cultivator!

Moreover, judging by the clothing on the corpse, it did not originate from a maze zone but belonged to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance!

The three people on the ship instantly tensed up, thinking that an alliance cultivator had encountered some unexpected danger and died in this place. They immediately heightened their vigilance.

But what happened next made Li Fan and the others visibly horrified.

“Boom!”

“Boom!”

At first, there were one or two sounds, but then the noises became more and more frequent.

A continuous barrage of crashing sounds erupted, and the Samantabhadra True Boat trembled unceasingly. The protective barrier suddenly appeared on the verge of collapse.

Huangfu Song quickly reinforced the barrier with a spell while looking at the scene outside, his face pale.

Overhead was a dense, pitch-black sky, from which countless cultivator corpses rained down like raindrops.

Some of the bodies were still relatively intact, while others were already broken into pieces, with only fragmented limbs remaining.

Without exception, the edges of their bodies seemed to bear traces of twisted, wriggling black threads.

Occasionally, they caught glimpses of the faces on the corpses, which were not as ferocious or terrifying as those seen in maze zones.

Instead, their eyes were tightly closed, and their expressions were peaceful.

The endless rain of corpses seemed as if it would never stop.

Forcing their way out of the rain of corpses at high speed could damage the Samantabhadra True Boat.

The three of them halted the flying vessel and took action to intercept the falling corpses from above.

Although these lifeless entities posed little threat, the eerie scene still made them feel a chill creeping into their hearts.

Chapter 723: Immortal Heavenly Sovereign of Life and Death

Witnessing this scene, Li Fan immediately recalled the "Replicate Rain" that Master Yin mentioned.

However, this time, what he encountered was not the same—it was not the so-called "Replicate Rain."

The corpses falling from the sky were clearly different in appearance.

He quickly realized that it was not "Replicate Rain" but rather the disintegration of the "Ten Thousand Giant Corpses" they had previously encountered.

It was evident that Huangfu Song also realized this instantly, just like Xu Bai. With his brows tightly knit, he muttered,

"What’s going on now? Did we just happen to run into the Immortal Alliance taking action against the Giant Corpse?"

Dongfang Yao and he were both confused, but Li Fan vaguely guessed the reason.

"Is this... a sign that the principle of life and death has been reversed again?" Li Fan’s heart skipped a beat.

"If I calculate the days, even if Blue Feather took some life-extending treasures, it should be nearing the end of his lifespan."

"It seems he ultimately chose this path. But within such a short time, he has already managed to neutralize the manifestation of reversing the principle of life and death..."

"Is Lan Yu really that powerful?"

A trace of doubt flashed through Li Fan’s mind.

"Or... is there some other assistance involved?"

Although Xu Bai still did not fully understand how the reversal of the heavenly principle and its impact on all things had come to be, the scene unfolding before his eyes—the sudden collapse of the freely moving Giant Corpse—unquestionably indicated that two entirely opposing forces were clashing against each other.

"However, it doesn't necessarily mean that Blue Feather has gained the upper hand in this confrontation.

It could simply be that the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign, who reversed life and death, was caught off guard by Lan Yu’s counterattack.

After all, it has not been long since He defied the principle, and He may not have had time to complete the process of establishing a [Principle]."

"The gap between not truly stepping into the Longevity Immortal Realm and merely achieving Dao Integration may not be as vast as imagined."

While Li Fan was deep in thought, the corpse rain finally ceased.

Huangfu Song and Dongfang Yao looked at the countless corpses vanishing into the depths of the white mist with uncertain expressions.

"Damn it, this white mist is getting more and more eerie." Dongfang Yao muttered under his breath.

After taking a short rest, the three of them continued their journey into the white mist, still searching for traces of the Maze Zone.

At that moment, in Tianliang Prefecture, Xu Bai, who had been happily conversing with other prefectural envoys, suddenly found an excuse to leave.

He returned to the Tianxuan Mirror and started investigating any clues related to the conflict between the principles of heaven and earth.

Everything was eerily quiet, as if nothing unusual had occurred.

But that was precisely the most unusual aspect.

Even the depths of the white mist were affected by the clash between the two opposing forces.

How could the Xuanhuang Realm itself remain unaffected?

There must have been some anomalies contrary to common sense, deliberately concealed by the Immortal Alliance.

After pondering for a while, Xu Bai exited the Tianxuan Mirror and contacted Liu San.

He instructed him to temporarily halt his pill refining and ordered the disciples of the Medicine King Sect across the regions to investigate any strange occurrences nearby.

The disciples' consciousnesses were connected through the Great Dream Spring and Autumn Formation, allowing them to act swiftly.

Within half a day, reports from various states began to pour in continuously.

Report 1:

"A cultivator rushed out of the white mist, attacking everything in sight like a madman, showing no fear of death.

Before the Immortal Alliance cultivators could kill him, he collapsed on his own. Upon inspection, it was discovered that the man had long been a corpse."

Report 2:

"In Tianlin Prefecture, a Golden Core cultivator died suddenly during the Core Formation process.

An unusual phenomenon appeared in the sky above, but as his friends prepared to collect his body, the man suddenly revived.

The phenomenon abruptly halted, yet the drifting clouds in the sky seemed reluctant to disperse."

Report 3:

"In Taihua Prefecture, there was a pair of Dao companions. The wife had passed away long ago, but the husband, unwilling to accept reality, preserved her body in ice.

Recently, this devoted man appeared in public alongside a female cultivator.

At first, everyone thought he had moved on and found a new companion.

However, upon closer inspection, they were shocked to discover that the woman was none other than his long-deceased wife!

Her expression was dull, her movements abnormal, and she did not recognize any of her former friends."

"Interesting..." Xu Bai’s eyes glinted with intrigue.

Xu Bai’s expression gradually became solemn as he continued to read.

Because, apart from the initial rumors about some seemingly living yet non-living people suddenly losing their ability to move, more and more incidents of resurrection began to emerge from various places.

It was not limited to just one state—the entire territory of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance was experiencing the same phenomenon.

"Not just the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, even the Five Elders Association..."

Xu Bai’s expression turned serious.

"Is this because of Blue Feather’s interference? Has that Heavenly Sovereign of Life and Death started accelerating the progress of the [Principle]?"

According to Xu Bai’s knowledge, there were no signs of battle in the Yuandao Prefecture, where Blue Feather was located.

"Without engaging in combat, he directly dealt with his rival by reversing the principle and crushing him through sheer momentum."

Xu Bai squinted his eyes. "It seems that this Heavenly Sovereign of Life and Death doesn’t even consider Lan Yu worth his attention, not even having the interest to make a move against him."

"He just needs to follow his step-by-step plan to prove his Longevity Dao. The obstacle before him—Blue Feather—is no more than an ant trying to block a cart, destined to be crushed."

Xu Bai seemed to already hear the roar of Blue Feather’s failure in achieving the Dao.

"Perhaps the conclusion will come soon—just need to wait patiently."

Xu Bai continued to instruct the disciples of the Medicine King Sect to gather information. To prevent any external disturbances, he simply sealed his communication talisman once again.

He focused solely on observing the progress of the situation.

As expected, just as he anticipated, the increasing occurrences of resurrection finally stirred vigilance among the cultivators of the Immortal Alliance.

The atmosphere grew increasingly anxious and uneasy, and eventually, it led to an official statement from the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance:

"Fellow cultivators of the Immortal Alliance, remember this great day."

"After countless years, our Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is about to welcome a new Heavenly Sovereign of Longevity Immortal."

"The principle that 'the dead cannot be revived' is a fundamental law of heaven and earth."

"But from this day forward, this established fact will be completely rewritten."

"Reversing the principle of life and death, the Heavenly Sovereign shall be known as Rebirth (Wangsheng)."

"Therefore, do not panic—rejoice without restraint."

"Under the divine power of Rebirth Heavenly Sovereign, any fallen cultivator can be resurrected after eighteen years, retaining memories of their previous life."

"A new era has arrived!"

After the announcement was issued, all the cultivators throughout the world were left stunned.

Shock, doubt, and fear...

All kinds of emotions erupted at once.

The branches of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance in every state were instantly surrounded by cultivators, leaving not a single gap.

They were all desperate to know the details of this so-called rebirth and how the resurrection process would unfold.

However, even the local officials were completely clueless about the matter, leaving them with no choice but to maintain order as best as they could, while waiting for the day when the final answer would be revealed.

Chapter 724: Rebirth Ascension to the Firmament

"The changes in this world are truly happening too fast. As old relics like us, it’s hard to keep up with the times." Nangong Shirong looked up at the sky, where a countdown number "14" was displayed, and sighed without saying more.

Xu Bai stood behind him and smiled as he spoke, "Lord, there's no need to worry. Who would have thought that a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign, capable of reversing the fundamental laws of heaven and earth, would suddenly appear without any warning?"

"So mysterious, not a single trace can be found. It’s truly unbelievable."

"Even if it were a Nascent Soul True Lord, it wouldn’t just appear out of thin air like this." Xu Bai's tone was deep and contemplative.

Nangong Shirong nodded slightly, "That’s why people outside are speculating that this 'Rebirth Heavenly Sovereign' might very well be an ancient cultivator who survived the Great Catastrophe."

"Just like you," Nangong Shirong glanced at Xu Bai and said slowly.

Xu Bai lowered his head, deep in thought. "An ancient cultivator..."

Cultivators across the world were immensely curious about the true identity of the Rebirth Heavenly Sovereign. However, despite the extensive investigations that had taken place over a long period, not a single piece of information about him had been leaked.

After all, the number of Dao Integration - Immortal Sage cultivators within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance was limited. They had scrutinized every candidate, yet none matched the profile. This led to a strong possibility that this newly ascended Heavenly Sovereign originated from ancient times, always hidden within the mist, silently comprehending the principles of heaven and earth, and only recently succeeded in proving the Dao.

As for the speculation that the Rebirth Heavenly Sovereign was a cultivator from the Five Elders Association...

The recent frequent actions of the Five Elders Association seemed to disprove that theory.

First, they officially released a statement, congratulating the birth of the new Heavenly Sovereign. Then, they rapidly recalled all their cultivators who had been conducting friendly visits within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance territory. All living forces near the borders were ordered to retreat and consolidate...

It was clear that the Five Elders Association was extremely wary of the emergence of this new Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign.

"Lord City Master, do you think that under the protection of the Rebirth Heavenly Sovereign’s power, cultivators who have fallen can truly be resurrected?" After a long silence, Xu Bai suddenly asked.

"I personally remain skeptical about it. Although the divine power of a Heavenly Sovereign is both awe-inspiring and fearsome, resurrection itself is too fantastical." Nangong Shirong shook his head. "Even if it is possible, I fear it would still require specific conditions. If a cultivator has already perished without leaving behind any remains or their soul has completely dissipated, then attempting resurrection in such a case..."

Nangong Shirong snorted coldly, "Not to mention a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign, even the legendary Grand Luo Golden Immortal would likely be powerless."

"But whatever the truth is, it will be revealed in fourteen days. We just need to wait patiently."

Upon hearing this, Xu Bai focused his gaze on the sky, where everyone could see the countdown.

The numbers, appearing both black and white, flowed in a mystical manner, quietly floating in the sky. According to the official statement of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, the countdown represented the process of Rebirth Heavenly Sovereign’s reversal of natural law.

When the countdown reaches zero, the fundamental laws of life and death in the Xuanhuang Realm will be completely reversed.

An era where everyone can be resurrected will follow.

"Let’s see what methods this Rebirth Heavenly Sovereign truly possesses." Xu Bai narrowed his eyes, taking out a folding fan and gently fanning himself.

Meanwhile, as the countdown in the sky of the Xuanhuang Realm continued to decrease, the one who failed in the Contest of Reversal, Blue Feather, did not seem willing to accept his fate.

He did not stop offering rewards for life-extending treasures; on the contrary, he increased the stakes.

He even took out his cultivation technique, Heavenly Metamorphosis Feather Art, as part of the reward.

It seemed that Blue Feather was desperately trying to delay the arrival of his demise.

However, the Rebirth Heavenly Sovereign clearly did not intend to spare him.

On the day the countdown changed to "1", without warning, a phenomenon marking the fall of a Dao Integration cultivator suddenly appeared in the skies above Yuandao Prefecture.

"Dao Integration Cultivator Blue Feather, one who cultivated the path of Dao..."

Unlike the previous lifetimes where Li Fan witnessed heaven and earth mourning together, this time it was different. Perhaps it was because Blue Feather's actions in this life had gone against the fundamental laws of heaven and earth. In the sky, a phenomenon resembling the fall of a new-method cultivator appeared.

However, this scene had just emerged when, before the cultivators of Yuandao Prefecture could react, the countdown numbers on the celestial screen of the Xuanhuang Realm transformed into swirling black and white energies, rushing straight toward Yuandao Prefecture.

As the phenomenon of Blue Feather's fall was obscured, the number "One" instantly returned to zero.

The entire Xuanhuang Realm trembled slightly, as if some mysterious transformation was taking place.

When the sky cleared once again, all the cultivators could vaguely see an ancient and solemn mansion appearing on the celestial screen of the Xuanhuang Realm.

"Rebirth Mansion"

The large characters on the mansion plaque were clearly visible.

All cultivators who saw the Rebirth Mansion naturally had information about the Rebirth Heavenly Sovereign's resurrection appear in their minds.

Under the influence of the Rebirth Mansion, when any cultivator falls, a trace of their true soul will be drawn into the mansion.

After the eighteen-year cycle passes, the true soul, carrying the memories of the fallen cultivator, can return to the world from the Rebirth Mansion.

If a prepared physical body has been made in advance, the true soul will directly merge with it.

If death occurred abruptly and no preparation was made, the true soul would randomly descend into the body of a newly born being in the Xuanhuang Realm.

...

After seeing the detailed rules of the Rebirth Mansion, the cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm were in an uproar.

They never expected that the so-called "resurrection" would turn out to be real.

However, this method of resurrection was beyond what they could accept.

Survival and reproduction are inherent human instincts.

If the path of cultivation proves hopeless, one might entrust the future to the next generation.

But according to the rules of the Rebirth Mansion, the newborn child, cherished like a precious gem, might actually be occupied by the soul of a cultivator who fell eighteen years prior...

What difference is there between this and soul possession?

Who could guarantee that a resurrected cultivator from the past does not harbor old grudges or enmities?

What if one painstakingly raises a child to adulthood, only to be stabbed in the back one day?

How could one bear the absurdity of having everything they’ve accumulated ultimately benefit an "outsider"?

The operation of the Rebirth Mansion clearly conflicted with the ethical and moral values of the cultivators in the Xuanhuang Realm, leaving them unable to accept it for the time being.

Fortunately, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance soon released a more detailed explanation.

In the Rebirth Mansion, the true soul only preserves the memories of the past life. All previous emotions—love, hatred, resentment, and grievances—are thoroughly cleansed. When reflecting on past experiences, it feels more like recalling a dream, without deeply identifying with it.

Moreover, the true soul’s rebirth does not directly take over the body. Instead, it merges with the new soul. The essence of life does not change—only an additional set of "past life" memories exists.

...

After this explanation, although the cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm still felt some resistance, they knew they could not defy the Heavenly Sovereign’s decree or the unstoppable trend.

Whether they liked it or not, they could only choose to quietly accept it.

Thus, the intense debate about "rebirth" and "resurrection" slowly spread throughout every corner of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Chapter 725: The Life and Death Decree

“Have you heard? It is rumored that the Rebirth Mansion possesses a secret technique capable of preventing Resurrected True Souls from taking over the bodies of their descendants!”

“Hmph, I asked around, and it does seem to be true. However, it is already clear that obtaining this secret technique will come at an enormous cost. Those prestigious families, in order to maintain the ‘purity’ of their bloodlines, will go to any lengths to make it happen, no matter the price!”

“If you ask me, fellow Daoists, there is no need to resist this concept so strongly! The existence of the Rebirth Palace may actually be a blessing for us!”

“Oh? What do you mean by that?”

“Think about it—since we can be resurrected in eighteen years anyway, if we feel that our talent in this life is too mediocre and cultivation is hopeless, we could simply commit suicide. Perhaps in the next life, we will be born into a better family with an extraordinarily gifted body…”

Such a naïve remark immediately drew laughter from the other cultivators.

“Fellow Daoist, have you had too much spirit wine?”

“Not to mention whether or not you would be so lucky, have you even considered why resurrection requires an eighteen-year wait? Do you really think the descent of True Souls into newborns is completely random? I’d bet anything there’s something shady going on behind the scenes!”

“Well… I actually think he makes a bit of sense. Consider this: we are already of mediocre talent with no hope of rising in this life. Even if we have children, they will only suffer the fate of being treated as mere servants, bullied and oppressed. Because of this, I never even considered having descendants before. But now…”

“…Perhaps it’s worth taking the gamble. Even if the True Soul merging with my child wasn’t a genius in their past life, just the additional lifetime of cultivation experience would already be an invaluable asset. And if luck is on our side and the soul belonged to a powerful being in their previous life… well, then I, as the father, would rise in status as well! Haha!”

“Hiss… When you put it that way, it does seem reasonable.”

Similar debates took place across the entire Xuanhuang Realm.

Meanwhile, Xu Bai, through Nangong Shirong, learned more details about the Rebirth Mansion.

“So the rumors are true. There really is a secret technique that can prevent a newborn from being merged with a True Soul. But…”

“Eight million contribution points—and it must be performed while the child is still in the womb.”

“Damn it, that’s daylight robbery! I’ve worked in Tianliang Prefecture for so many years, and I’ve never saved up that much.”

“And then there’s the Rebirth Mirror, which allows one to glimpse the memories of the True Soul before it merges with a newborn. If you don’t like what you see… hiss…”

“Then there’s the True Soul Guide, which, when placed on a prepared body in advance, increases the probability that one’s True Soul will reincarnate into the designated vessel.”

“The Perfect Vessel, which allows one to perfectly replicate their current body within the Rebirth Mansion—ensuring an ideal resurrection in the next life.”

“The Soul Stability Seal, which preserves the emotions and memories of the previous life even after the Rebirth Mansion’s eighteen-year cleansing process.”

“And the Rebirth Decree—with this, there’s no need to wait eighteen years. A fragment of the True Soul can be resurrected immediately upon death.”

Xu Bai and Nangong Shirong stared at the jade slip before them, each with a different expression.

“There are so many flashy and expensive options! Ordinary people could never afford any of this!” Nangong Shirong cursed.

“But that Rebirth Decree… that’s a real treasure. If you combine it with the Perfect Vessel, wouldn’t that be like having an extra life? No, wait… if you have enough contribution points, wouldn’t that make you immortal? Able to revive indefinitely?” He exclaimed in amazement.

“We just don’t know if there are any hidden limitations,” Xu Bai’s eyes flickered as he nodded in agreement.

“It seems like the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance has prepared for every possible scenario. There may be some initial chaos, but I believe cultivators will adapt quickly,” Xu Bai said as he scanned the list of offerings in the jade slip.

“Achieving immortality in a single moment—the world will be turned upside down. This Rebirth Heavenly Sovereign is truly remarkable. The history of the Xuanhuang Realm is about to enter a new era,” Nangong Shirong mused.

“I just wonder what the Five Elders Association thinks about all this. Can the power of the Rebirth Heavenly Sovereign reach their domain?” Xu Bai suddenly asked.

“Uh…” Nangong Shirong hesitated. “I’m not sure. But I heard that some sort of deal has been made—only a small test area has been approved for now…”

Xu Bai's eyes flickered slightly.

From that moment on, the cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm gradually adapted to the presence of the Rebirth Mansion in the sky.

Not long after, the first resurrection case emerged.

A Golden Core cultivator named Ximen Yang self-detonated in full view of the public, his soul completely scattered.

However, before long, he reappeared alive, standing before the masses once more.

His form and demeanor remained exactly as before.

He even remembered his self-detonation and would boast to anyone he met about his experience of exploding, dying, and being reborn.

News of this spread rapidly. The cultivators who had initially been skeptical about Rebirth began to believe in it.

As more cases of resurrection surfaced across the lands of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, the existence of Rebirth gradually became accepted by the public.

Within the Devouring Essence White Mist

Even through the vast, hazy fog, the three could vaguely make out the Rebirth Mansion looming above them.

“Damn it, cultivators these days are acting like they’re unafraid of death! Even the depths of the White Mist are crowded with people now,” Dongfang Yao cursed angrily. Just as he finished speaking, a Samantabhadra True Boat roared past him.

“Aren’t you just stating the obvious?” Huangfu Song sneered. “With the Rebirth Heavenly Sovereign around, everyone can resurrect. Why fear death? Worst case, after eighteen years, I’ll be a hero again!”

“I don’t believe in this Rebirth Mansion nonsense,” Dongfang Yao said, his face serious. “There’s definitely something off about it. Think about it—this so-called preservation of a tiny fragment of one’s true soul… Even if you’re revived, you’re merging with something else. Are you really still yourself? Even if a prepared body ensures so-called resurrection, the fact remains—I truly died back then. The one reborn is merely someone else who happens to have my memories.”

He warned, “Brothers, don’t be fooled by this. We must still treasure our lives and be cautious!”

“Since when did you get so sharp, Dongfang?” Huangfu Song frowned slightly, contemplating his words. “You actually make some sense…”

Meanwhile, Li Fan remained silent as he listened to their debate. His mind, however, was occupied with something else entirely.

“In my past life, this Rebirth Heavenly Sovereign never revealed himself to the world, let alone established the Rebirth Mansion.”

“The reversal of life and death should have naturally become a fundamental law of existence—just like the Carefree Heavenly Sovereign, who seamlessly integrated into the world’s order.”

“But now, this reversal of life and death requires the Rebirth Mansion as a medium. Doesn’t this mean that the Rebirth Heavenly Sovereign has yet to reach his ultimate, ideal state?”

“Perhaps this was merely a hasty, desperate measure, influenced by Blue Feather…”

Chapter 726: The End of the Maze Zone

Of course, all of this was merely Li Fan’s speculation.

His understanding of the Reversal of Heaven and Earth and the Struggle for Immortality was still too shallow. He could only analyze and judge based on the different historical evolutionary directions of the Xuanhuang Realm that he had experienced. He could only glimpse the surface but could not grasp its essence.

Perhaps only when he truly reached the realm of Reversal could he fully comprehend the events unfolding in the Xuanhuang Realm during this period.

While Li Fan was deep in thought, the argument between Huangfu and Dongfang had finally reached a reluctant consensus.

One should not act recklessly just because of the resurrection methods of the Rebirth Mansion. It was still necessary to cherish one's life.

However, if one had the resources, it wouldn’t hurt to purchase rare treasures like the Soul-Stability Seal or the Rebirth Decree as a last resort. After all, life and death are unpredictable—no one could guarantee they wouldn’t suddenly perish due to unforeseen circumstances. It was always better to be prepared.

“The number of resurrected cultivators is still very small for now. I can’t even begin to imagine what will happen eighteen years from now when a large number of fallen cultivators return to life. What kind of impact will that have on the Xuanhuang Realm?” Huangfu Song sighed.

“I don’t know what the future will look like, but one thing is clear—the day when the White Mist Barrier is fully explored isn’t far away!” Watching another Samantabhadra True Boat rush past them, Dongfang Yao let out a cold snort.

“Brother Li, if you want to exchange for the Endstone Plate, you’d better hurry up,” he reminded.

“Almost there. One more Maze Zone to complete, and I’ll have one hundred thousand Qingxuan Points.” Li Fan nodded as he carefully distinguished the sounds coming from deep within the White Mist, constantly adjusting his course.

As they delved deeper into the mist, Li Fan once again picked up the sound of the Tian Yi’s Wail.

However, this time, the sound was strange compared to before. It was as if something was interfering with or distorting its transmission. When Li Fan heard it, it barely resembled the “Tian Yi” anymore. If he hadn’t heard its wailing so many times while traveling through the Maze Zone, he might not have recognized it at all.

After contemplating for a moment, Li Fan chose not to act rashly.

Huangfu and Dongfang, seeing Li Fan stop, immediately asked why.

After hearing his explanation, the two of them spoke in unison, “We’ve been through all kinds of dangers together. Even if there’s a risk, there’s no need to be afraid. Besides, we can still resurrect, can’t we? Brother Li, don’t worry—let’s charge in!”

It seemed that although they had expressed concerns about the mysterious nature of resurrection, deep down, they had developed a sense of confidence.

After all, they could come back to life!

Li Fan smiled faintly.

“Alright, since both of you say so, then let’s venture into this Maze Zone.” He spoke in a deep voice, immediately steering the flying vessel toward the source of the distorted sound at full speed.

It was unclear how long they traveled, but after crossing an indistinguishable boundary, something suddenly and inexplicably happened—

The Samantabhadra True Boat came to an abrupt stop.

“What’s going on, Brother Li?” Huangfu and Dongfang looked at Li Fan with surprise.

“It wasn’t me,” Li Fan explained.

The three of them exchanged glances, their expressions turning solemn.

They extended their spiritual senses outward, scanning the surroundings of the Boat, but found nothing unusual.

Yet, they also couldn’t determine why the boat had stopped.

Li Fan thought for a moment, then took out the Black Death Talisman to protect himself before flying out of the Samantabhadra True Boat.

He planned to circle around and personally inspect the surroundings.

Above, ahead, behind—there was nothing unusual.

But when Li Fan flew to the underside of the Boat, the scene before him made his pupils contract sharply.

From the white mist below, a mass of black, viscous tendrils extended outward, their tips clinging to the underside of the Samantabhadra True Boat.

This black, unidentified substance seemed alive, producing a faint “rustling” sound as it wriggled, slowly spreading outward.

Li Fan could even hear the sound of it crawling along the bottom of the ship.

“This is…”

Li Fan was completely unable to sense anything with his divine sense and could only rely on his naked eye to discern the situation.

He flicked his fingers, sending out a burst of flame in an attempt to burn off the black tentacle clinging to the ship’s hull.

However, to his astonishment, the flames seemed to exist in an entirely different space. No matter how fiercely they burned, they failed to affect the black tentacle in the slightest.

Li Fan then unleashed a sword aura, but the result was the same. It was as if the tentacles did not exist at all—the sword light passed straight through them and shot off into the distance.

Yet, the thick black substance remained firmly adhered to the ship's hull, showing no signs of breaking.

As Li Fan remained silent for a long time, spiritual energy fluctuations began to spread. This made Huangfu Song and Dongfang Yao uneasy. The two of them flew out of the ship together, witnessing the strange phenomenon with their own eyes.

They tried various methods but still could not sever the black tentacles.

"We can only follow them downward and see where they originate from," Huangfu Song suggested.

As he spoke, he took out the Heaven-Measuring Mirror and placed it above his head.

"As expected, we've entered a new Maze Zone that no one has explored before," he said, his tone carrying a hint of excitement.

"There are still three Samantabhadra True Boat as backups, but until we figure out what this thing is, it’s best not to use them. If they get entangled again, we might be forced to escape into the white mist with just our physical bodies," Dongfang Yao advised.

Li Fan reassured them, "No worries. I have plenty of Black Death Talismans. Even without the Samantabhadra True Boat, the talismans alone are enough to ensure our safe return."

Huangfu and Dongfang both nodded in praise. "Brother Li, you are always meticulous in your preparations."

With their concerns addressed, the three of them immediately decided to follow the long black tentacle downward in search of its source.

Their flight was not particularly fast, but the sheer length of the thick black substance exceeded their expectations. It took them the time it takes to brew a cup of tea before they finally reached the origin.

Upon seeing what lay before them, all three were rendered speechless.

A massive black sphere, resembling a grotesque tumor, floated silently in midair.

It was composed of the same thick, black substance.

Hundreds of tentacles extended from the sphere, reaching in different directions through the white mist, seemingly clinging to something unknown.

At first glance, it looked like an enormous black web, with the sphere trapped at its center.

"Can you sense its presence with spiritual sense?" Huangfu Song asked through spiritual sense transmission, his expression somewhat tense.

Li Fan closed his eyes and concentrated. In his perception, there was nothing but empty space ahead. However, when he opened his eyes again, the black sphere was right there in front of him.

"No, I can't," Li Fan shook his head slightly, his expression solemn.

"Forget it. Let’s not disturb this thing. We’ll finish exploring this Maze Zone and then leave," Dongfang Yao, who was usually bold, felt a rare sense of unease and suggested cautiously.

Li Fan stared at the black sphere for a long time before nodding slightly.

Anything that could block spiritual sense perception was certainly no ordinary object.

Caution was never a mistake.

Chapter 727: Huangfu’s Explosive Relic

However, things did not go as planned.

After thoroughly exploring the entire maze, Li Fan and his two companions still could not find an exit. They had no choice but to return to the black spherical object once more.

"It seems that if we want to get out, we’ll have to figure out something from this thing," Huangfu Song said, his expression somewhat grim.

"Could the exit be inside this thing?" Dongfang Yao shuddered.

"What exactly is this black sphere? You two are knowledgeable and well-traveled—do you have any clues?" Li Fan stared at it for a long while before voicing his question.

"I know of some things that cannot be sensed with divine perception, but clearly, none of them match this thing!" Dongfang and Huangfu were both at a loss.

After another moment of silence, the black talisman light above Li Fan's head gradually dimmed as its energy was depleted.

"Standing around won’t do any good. We might as well test its nature first."

Replacing the exhausted talisman with a new one, Li Fan cautiously approached the tentacles protruding from the black sphere, gently touching one.

It felt like an illusion—his hand passed right through, grasping nothing but air.

"It's as if it doesn’t exist. But why can it trap the Samantabhadra True Boat?" The three exchanged glances, utterly perplexed.

After a brief hesitation, Li Fan shielded himself and flew straight toward the massive black sphere.

Huangfu and Dongfang hesitated for a moment but quickly followed suit.

The writhing mass of viscous black substance coalesced, filling the entire field of vision with an overwhelming sense of pressure.

Suppressing the uneasiness in their hearts, the three gritted their teeth and "dove" into the sphere’s interior.

Though neither divine sense nor physical touch could detect the black substance, once their bodies were fully enveloped, a bizarre sensation washed over them.

It felt like their entire bodies were crawling with cold, slimy insects—clammy and nauseating.

Fortunately, aside from the unnerving feeling, the viscous black substance did not seem to cause any other harm.

The three of them trudged forward as if walking through a muddy swamp, cautiously making their way toward the center.

Time seemed to lose meaning as they advanced through the endless black sea, until finally, a faint glow appeared in the distance.

"Quick! That must be the exit ahead!" Huangfu Song transmitted through divine sense, his voice tinged with excitement.

Just as Li Fan and Dongfang Yao were about to respond, the previously calm black sea suddenly boiled over.

The viscous black substance, as if coming to life, surged madly toward Huangfu Song.

What was once an untouchable, ethereal substance had seemingly found an outlet to pour into—rushing toward Huangfu Song’s seven orifices, forcibly invading his body.

"Ugh... ugh..."

His face twisted in utter terror, and his body began to swell like an inflating balloon.

"Help me!"

Unable to utter a sound, Huangfu Song frantically transmitted his plea through divine sense to his companions. However, his panic only seemed to accelerate the black substance’s invasion.

A savage and agonizing expression appeared on his face.

Countless treasures emerged from his body, and he even retrieved the Dissociation Disc, instantly setting up a formation around him.

But...

All efforts were in vain!

In a flash of lightning and sparks, his body swelled more than ten times its original size.

Boom!

Finally, under the horrified gaze of Li Fan and Dongfang Yao, it exploded with a thunderous roar!

There was no flesh and blood flying everywhere—just a massive amount of black, viscous substance spraying in all directions.

According to common sense, cultivators at or above the Nascent Soul True Lord level, even if their physical body perishes, can instantly revive as long as their Cave Heaven remains intact.

But at this moment, a terrifying situation unfolded before their eyes.

After waiting for a while, there was still no sign of Huangfu Song's physical rebirth.

Instead, they seemed to notice a speck of dim light breaking through the void, vanishing into the unknown.

“Is... is he dead?” Li Fan suddenly froze in disbelief.

“Huangfu!” Dongfang Yao's eyes widened in rage as he rushed forward, trying to find any trace of Huangfu Song.

However, at the spot where the explosion occurred, he only found Huangfu Song’s personal belongings, like the Heaven-Measuring Mirror and the Dissociation Disc—nothing else remained, not even a single hair.

Recalling the sudden incident in his mind, a bold speculation surfaced in Li Fan’s heart.

These black, viscous substances... could they be...

Materialized Divine Spiritual Sense!

A cold shiver ran down his spine as Li Fan shouted, “Brother Dongfang, remember—do not let your spiritual sense leave your body! Communicate only through words!”

Dongfang Yao immediately understood, his face turning pale.

Li Fan flew to Dongfang Yao's side and collected Huangfu Song’s relics.

Then he spoke in a low, urgent tone, “This place is too dangerous. We must leave—now!”

Grabbing Dongfang Yao, he sped toward the center of the Black Sphere Spiritual Sense.

Just outside the black sphere, the Spiritual Consciousness Aggregates were relatively dispersed. Thus, even when they probed with their own spiritual senses, it did not trigger any unusual reactions.

But within the core of the black sphere, the density of spiritual sense had reached an unimaginably horrifying level.

Huangfu Song recklessly transmitted his spiritual sense, which was like poking a hornet’s nest, giving these condensed materialized spiritual senses a breakthrough point.

Before Huangfu Song could even resist, the overwhelming spiritual sense poured into his Sea of Consciousness.

Even with the tenacity of a Soul Transformation True Monarch's soul, it was utterly impossible to withstand such an immense influx of spiritual sense.

He exploded on the spot, with his soul scattered and perished!

Dongfang Yao was overwhelmed with sorrow while simultaneously breaking out in a cold sweat.

If it had been him whose divine sense had left his body just now...

Li Fan led Dongfang Yao through the glowing central layer, entering a relatively empty inner space.

Although this place had not formed substantial black spiritual sense, countless transparent faces floated around.

Joy, anger, sorrow, fear.

The expressions on these countless faces varied, yet none of them had eyes.

Like a school of fish, they lingered and wandered ceaselessly.

Dongfang Yao was deeply terrified, frantically avoiding the drifting transparent faces.

However, Li Fan casually reached out and captured one of the faces, absorbing it.

Moments later, a vague image appeared in his mind.

Wailing and sobbing echoed from all directions.

Under the blood-colored sky, the shadow of death rapidly devoured every living being it encountered.

But as if his vision was veiled, he could only make out a rough outline of the scene.

When the shadow moved from the horizon to right before him, everything turned pitch black, and the vision in his mind abruptly shattered.

Li Fan carefully contemplated for a moment, unsure whether the strength of his soul and spiritual sense had increased.

However, the sudden disappearance of the transparent face had alerted the other existences in the area.

They seemed to become restless and agitated, wandering even faster.

After pondering for a while, he refrained from acting recklessly.

"Let's go!"

With Dongfang Yao in tow, Li Fan headed to the highest point in the space, where the light shone the brightest.

There, he found the exit of the Maze Zone.

His vision blurred, and moments later, the two of them had returned to the outside of the Maze Zone.

"Brother Huangfu!"

It was only then that Dongfang Yao came to his senses, bursting into tears.

Chapter 728: The Endstone Plate is Obtained

"Brother Dongfang, don’t be too heartbroken. Although Brother Huangfu has met a tragic fate, fortunately, the Rebirth Mansion exists. He still has a chance to be revived." Li Fan let out a long sigh, trying to console him.

He then summoned a new Samantabhadra True Boat and pulled the grief-stricken Dongfang Yao inside.

After that, he brought out the Heaven-Measuring Mirror.

Once the synchronization of the Divine Consciousness Maze’s exploration records was complete, he glanced at his just over 100,000 Qingxuan Points and the still-unclaimed Endstone Plate. Without hesitation, Li Fan chose to redeem it.

His long-accumulated Qingxuan Points were instantly depleted.

A faint white glow flickered, and a heavy gray stone disc materialized in Li Fan’s hands.

"So, this is the Endstone Plate?"

It was only about the size of a palm. He weighed it in his hand and examined it for a moment.

As its name suggested, it looked no different from an ordinary stone. Neither Spiritual Sense nor Spiritual Power could interact with it in any way.

"I wonder how the Heaven-Suppressing Society in my past life managed to figure out its usage."

However, Li Fan knew there was no need to rush. He had plenty of time in this life to uncover its secrets.

For now, he put the stone disc away and retrieved Huangfu Song’s relics, arranging them before him.

Apart from the Heavenly-Measuring Mirror and the Dissociation Disc, there were also two storage rings.

"Brother Dongfang, do you know if Huangfu has any close relatives still alive?" Li Fan asked.

Dongfang Yao, having slightly regained his composure, shook his head and said, "Like me, he was alone in this world, with no attachments."

Li Fan frowned at this and muttered, "Then these items…"

Dongfang Yao only took a glance before deciding, "Brother Li, you risked your life to retrieve Huangfu’s belongings. You should hold onto them for now. When we find Huangfu’s reincarnation, we can return them to him."

Li Fan sighed. "That’s the only option, then. But the Xuanhuang Realm is vast. Who knows where Huangfu will reincarnate in eighteen years? If he is still within the Immortal Alliance’s territory, then it won’t be too difficult—we’ll just need to search for him. But if he ends up in the hands of the Five Elders Association…"

"The Rebirth Mansion has plenty of mystical methods. There must be a way to roughly track a true spirit’s reincarnation. Since Brother Huangfu has passed, I have no interest in exploring the White Mist any further. Once we return, I will inquire about this matter immediately. I must find Brother Huangfu as soon as possible," Dongfang Yao said solemnly.

"I’ll ask around as well. Brother Shuo Feng might know something," Li Fan suggested.

With that, the two began their journey back from the depths of the White Mist.

Their first stop was the Huanyu Courtyard in Tianyu Prefecture, where they informed the others of Huangfu Song’s unfortunate demise.

The cultivator who received them was someone Li Fan had met before—Shangguan Shi, a lean man.

Having been colleagues for many years, Shangguan Shi’s expression darkened upon hearing the news. He sighed and said, "I will inform Dean Ji of this matter. Thank you both for your efforts."

Dongfang Yao, feeling guilty, had no face to linger. After a brief salute, he quickly took his leave.

Once outside Huanyu Courtyard, he also bid farewell to Li Fan, leaving behind a communication talisman before setting off to investigate the Rebirth Mansion.

"This Dongfang Yao is indeed a person of character," Li Fan thought to himself as he watched the other person's gradually disappearing figure..

Instead of returning to Longevity Valley, he headed straight for Tianquan Prefecture.

During his time exploring the White Mist, Shuo Feng had repeatedly sent messages challenging him to a duel.

However, Li Fan had used his entanglement in the White Mist as an excuse to decline each time.

After all, he was still nominally a Guest Elder of the Xuan family.

Although Shuo Feng had not openly expressed any dissatisfaction, it was inevitable that his tone had subtly changed after being repeatedly rejected multiple times.

Thus, as soon as Li Fan had some free time, he immediately reached out. After all, at the moment, the status of a Guest Elder in the Xuan family still had some value. A mere few sparring matches were enough to maintain this position, so it wasn’t too much of a hassle.

Shuo Feng was currently residing in a separate courtyard within Tianquan City.

This residence was also a gift from his mother, Immortal Sage Fei Xue. Compared to Shuo Feng Mountain in the outskirts, this place was much smaller in terms of land area, but its price was more than ten times higher.

Moreover, even having enough contribution points wasn’t enough; without the right connections, purchasing such a place was impossible.

Arriving at the central Cave Dwelling District of Tianquan City, one could see the towering Administrative Hall at the city’s core. Standing outside, already waiting, was a female cultivator in a red dress.

However, she was not the yellow-dressed cultivator Zhi Jin from before, but rather a different person.

Li Fan remained calm and composed as he followed the red-dressed female cultivator into the courtyard.

“This is so frustrating! Even though Rebirth Mansion exists now, allowing cultivators to be resurrected, my mother still places so many restrictions on me.”

From a distance, Li Fan could already hear Shuo Feng’s exasperated voice.

The red-dressed female cultivator showed no reaction on her face, as if she hadn’t heard Shuo Feng’s complaints at all. After leading Li Fan inside, she simply bowed before quietly leaving.

"Haha, Brother Li! It’s been a long time!"

Sensing Li Fan’s presence, Shuo Feng was overjoyed.

However, instead of a warm embrace, what greeted Li Fan was a flash of white sword light!

Li Fan’s eyes flickered, and in the blink of an eye, a blue water sword formed before him, blocking the attack.

Boom!

Amidst the explosion, Li Fan laughed and said, "Congratulations, Brother Shuo, on solving the problem of not being able to strike first."

"It seems that my [Thread-Extraction] divine ability is no longer a match for you."

Soaring through the air, Li Fan landed in front of Shuo Feng. Upon seeing the scene before him, a trace of surprise flashed in his eyes.

Shuo Feng was still dressed in his usual simple robes, but floating above his head was a green willow-leaf flying dagger.

Yet, the dagger’s tip was not pointed at an opponent—it was aimed directly at Shuo Feng’s own head!

"Haha! Brother Li, what do you think of my method? Since the ‘sword’ refuses to strike first, I simply force it to act. With a flying blade suspended above my head, my life hangs by a thread. Since it is part of me, when my life is in danger, it will instinctively counterattack. I then control the sword light it releases and use it against my enemies."

Shuo Feng glanced at the flying dagger above him with a look of satisfaction.

"To come up with such a brilliant technique, Brother Shuo is truly a prodigy."

Li Fan followed along with the praise while shifting his gaze toward a cultivator seated beside Shuo Feng.

This man had sharp brows and bright eyes, exuding an air of heroic spirit. Although his appearance did not quite match Xu Bai’s peerless beauty, he was still an outstanding figure among men.

Though this was Li Fan’s first encounter with him in this lifetime, he was not unfamiliar with the man.

He was none other than Tantai Tao, a peerless genius in array formations who, in Li Fan’s past life, had tragically perished during a formation training exercise.

But in this life, that incident had not occurred—thus, Tantai Tao was still alive.

"And this is...?" Li Fan turned to Shuo Feng, feigning ignorance.

"Brother Tantai is a rare genius in the Dao of Formations. You should get to know him."

Shuo Feng gave a brief introduction.

"A pleasure to meet you."

Tantai Tao regarded Li Fan warmly and greeted him with a nod.

After exchanging pleasantries, the three of them began to chat about Rebirth Mansion.

Chapter 729: The Transformation of the Tianxuan Mirror

"I had originally planned to stay in the white mist for a few more days, but unfortunately, my companion, Huangfu Song, perished. Watching someone I had traveled with for so long die so tragically right before my eyes left me deeply shaken."

Li Fan sighed, his face full of sorrow. "You have to understand, Huangfu Song's cultivation was a whole major realm higher than mine, yet he still died so suddenly and inexplicably. Life and death are truly unpredictable. At that moment, all my greed vanished, and I decided to return immediately."

"Fortunately, with the divine power of the Rebirth Heavenly Sovereign, Huangfu now has a chance at revival."

Hearing that Li Fan had fought his way back from the white mist, a barely perceptible trace of disdain flashed in Tantai Tao’s eyes.

Shuo Feng, on the other hand, chuckled. "I warned you not to go, but you refused to listen. All for a measly reward—hardly worth it."

Li Fan shook his head slightly. "Unlike you, Brother Shuo, I don’t have a powerful family backing me. If I want something, I have to fight for it myself. Fortunately, luck was on my side…"

As he spoke, Li Fan took out the [Endstone Plate].

This immediately caught the attention of both Shuo Feng and Tantai Tao.

Casually handing over the plate, Shuo Feng took it in his hands, examining it carefully for a moment before clicking his tongue in amazement. "You really do have incredible luck. From what I know, quite a few people had their eyes on this thing, yet you were the first to exchange for it."

"But whether it’s a profit or a loss remains to be seen."

Finding nothing unusual, Shuo Feng tossed the plate to Tantai Tao for him to inspect.

Tantai Tao narrowed his eyes, observing it for a moment before shaking his head slightly and handing it back to Li Fan.

"Did either of you notice anything?" Li Fan asked casually.

"The Immortal Alliance has already researched it thoroughly and found nothing. How could we possibly discover anything in such a short time?" Shuo Feng smirked.

Tantai Tao went further, saying, "I think this might just be an ordinary stone, nothing more."

Li Fan shook his head in disagreement. "I don’t think this object is that simple. I’ll study it further when I get back. If I make any discoveries, I’ll be sure to inform you both immediately!"
