A flicker of displeasure flashed in Tantai Tao’s eyes.

Shuo Feng, however, clapped his hands and praised, "Then I’ll be looking forward to it!"

Tantai Tao could only follow along and nod in agreement.

"By the way, when I arrived just now, I overheard you, Brother Shuo, mentioning that the honored Immortal had…?" After a brief moment of silence, Li Fan changed the subject.

Shuo Feng waved his hand in frustration. "Don’t even bring it up. Recently, I’ve been sensing an opportunity to form my Nascent Soul, but she refuses to let me leave, saying I need to wait a little longer."

"Being stuck in this tiny courtyard all day is driving me insane," Shuo Feng complained.

"The Immortal Sage must have her reasons for this. If she’s making you wait, could it mean that something major is about to happen within the Immortal Alliance?" Li Fan didn’t speak ill of Immortal Sage Fei Xue but instead frowned in thought.

"I did hear something," Tantai Tao suddenly spoke up.

"Oh?" Shuo Feng turned to him with interest.

"I heard that the exploration of the white mist barrier is nearly complete. They’ve gathered enough data, and perhaps the Tianxuan Mirror is about to…"

Halfway through his sentence, Tantai Tao abruptly stopped.

"No worries—Brother Li is a guest elder of my Xuan family. You can speak freely!" Shuo Feng instantly saw what Tantai Tao was hesitating about and waved his hand dismissively.

Only then did Tantai Tao continue explaining.

"The Tianxuan Mirror was left behind by the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor and is the most mystical treasure of the Immortal Alliance. Within the Xuanhuang Realm, everything in the heavens and on earth is reflected in its light."

"Except for the White Mist Barrier."

"The regions within the White Mist are completely new and unfamiliar to the Tianxuan Mirror."

"If the Tianxuan Mirror were likened to a cultivator, its method of cultivation would be the measurement of the heavens and the earth. However, over thousands of years, it has reached a bottleneck and has been unable to advance further."

"The Five Elders Association naturally would not allow the Tianxuan Mirror to pry into their affairs. Therefore, the only way for it to progress further is to measure the regions within the White Mist."

"If enough data is gathered, there is a chance that the Tianxuan Mirror can break through and undergo a transformation."

"This is also why the Immortal Alliance is pushing for large-scale exploration of the White Mist Barrier this time."

Tantai Tao explained at length.

Shuo Feng couldn’t help but ask, "So the reason why you formation masters were summoned to the Immortal Alliance headquarters was related to this matter? I wasn’t entirely clear on these secrets."

Tantai Tao merely smiled and remained silent, tacitly confirming it.

"The current Tianxuan Mirror can already be considered the foundational artifact of the Immortal Alliance. If it can complete its transformation..." A hint of longing flashed in Tantai Tao’s eyes.

Li Fan, deep in thought, said, "If the Tianxuan Mirror evolves, it will certainly have a profound impact on the Immortal Alliance. Immortal Sage Fei Xue must have her reasons for not allowing you to leave, Brother Shuo. Just be patient and wait—it seems, according to Brother Tantai, that day is not far off."

Shuo Feng snorted lightly and did not continue the discussion.

The three chatted idly for a while longer.

In the end, at Shuo Feng’s insistence, Li Fan dueled him once again.

Deliberately slowing down his spellcasting, Li Fan was in the middle of executing the Thread-Extraction divine ability when Shuo Feng’s sword light shattered it.

A sword wound was left on Li Fan’s body, fresh blood flowing, and he admitted defeat immediately.

Shuo Feng, on the other hand, laughed heartily and waved his hand, restoring the bloodstains left by the countless fine threads on his own body.

Having finally broken the Thread-Extraction divine ability, Shuo Feng was satisfied and did not urge Li Fan to stay.

After lingering for a moment longer, Li Fan bid farewell and left.

Leaving Tianquan Prefecture, he returned to the Longevity Valley.

Liu San, Fang Zaiji, and Jiang Yushan all came to pay their respects.

After reporting the number of Longevity Pills that had been refined, Liu San brought up another matter.

"By the way, we’ve found some information about the cultivator you asked us to investigate—Zhong Shentong."

"Oh? What did you find?" Li Fan’s eyebrows rose.

Liu San’s expression turned somewhat strange. "Young Master, are you sure this is the person you’re looking for?"

As he spoke, Liu San displayed an image of an elderly man with white hair.

Li Fan narrowed his eyes, it was indeed Zhong Shentong, whom he had met in his past life.

After confirming it, Liu San said in an odd tone, "We found him, but apparently, he was nearing the end of his lifespan. He failed to break through his cultivation bottleneck... and has already died."

"Died?" Li Fan was momentarily stunned.

"Are you sure there’s no mistake?" He repeated his question.

Zhong Shentong’s Life and Death Profound Arts and Seven-Colored Divine Light were both exceedingly rare and extraordinary techniques.

Someone who had mastered both could not have been an ordinary cultivator.

Could he have perished so quietly in this life?

Liu San smiled bitterly. "Young Master, you personally assigned this task, so I naturally understood its importance. We've confirmed it from multiple sources—Zhong Shentong is indeed dead."

Hearing this, Li Fan furrowed his brows deeply.

After pondering for a moment, his brows relaxed again.

He had likely figured out the reason why Zhong Shentong had fallen in this life.

It was probably because of the existence of the Rebirth Heavenly Sovereign.

Chapter 730: Executing of Xuan’s Locking Mirror Source

Zhong Shentong cultivated the Life and Death Profound Art, a unique technique that harnesses the immense terror between life and death as a means of cultivation.

According to Zhong Shentong himself, he suffered from an extreme case of "procrastination."

Even at the Foundation Establishment stage, he could only break through when he was on the verge of death, using the immense pressure of impending demise to force advancement.

That was before.

In this lifetime, due to the Heavenly Sovereign of Rebirth reversing the laws of life and death and establishing the Rebirth Mansion, everyone could now be resurrected. The fear of death no longer existed.

After all, "Eighteen years later, I’ll be a hero again"—so why fear death?

At worst, he could just start over in the next life. Why work so hard?

With such a "slacker mindset," it was only natural that Zhong Shentong failed to break through.

Thinking of this, Li Fan's face twitched.

"It seems that in this life, the Life and Death Profound Art is useless. But I still don’t understand how Zhong Shentong managed to comprehend the Seven-Colored Divine Light in the first place."

Shaking his head, he waved his hand and said to Liu San, "Forget it. Dead is dead. Let’s pretend I never brought it up."

Liu San’s expression turned slightly strange, but he didn’t ask further.

Instead, Fang Zaiji praised, "Sect Master, you truly have an open mind and see through the cycle of life and death."

Li Fan ignored him and continued giving orders:

"Elder Liu, we can slow down the refining of the Longevity Pill for now. Let’s sell off all our current stock first."

Liu San was briefly stunned before quickly realizing, "The era of cultivators exploring the White Mist is coming to an end?"

Li Fan nodded. "It has been about three years since the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance officially issued the decree. With the existence of the Rebirth Mansion, cultivators have become fearless of death. I estimate that the complete exploration of the White Mist is not far off. We should start preparing in advance."

Then, he turned to Jiang Yushan, who remained expressionless.

"Elder Jiang, haven’t you always wanted to see the outside world? I have found a way to conceal your true cultivation level and forge a Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance identity for you."

With that, Li Fan took out the Endstone Plate.

"This item can interfere with and block the Tianxuan Mirror, the supreme treasure of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance." He spoke with absolute confidence.

Fang Zaiji's eyes lit up instantly.

He quickly flew closer and stared intently at the small stone disk in Li Fan’s hand.

After a moment, he scratched the back of his head and asked, "Sect Master… how do you use this?"

Li Fan shrugged. "I have no idea. You’ll have to figure it out yourselves."

Fang Zaiji gave him a skeptical look. "Sect Master, you’re not just making up an excuse to stop Little Jiang from leaving, are you?"

Jiang Yushan shot Fang Zaiji a sharp glare, a trace of killing intent in her eyes.

Li Fan simply chuckled. "Heh, I didn’t expect Mr. Fang to be wrong for once. This stone plate may look unremarkable, but it is actually a secondary body of the Tianxuan Mirror."

"However, I can’t blame you. Even though you claim to be well-traveled, the Xuanhuang Realm has changed over so many years. It’s only natural that you’ve fallen behind the times…"

Fang Zaiji's eyes widened in shock. "A secondary body of the Tianxuan Mirror?"

He immediately grabbed the Endstone Plate, clutching it like a priceless treasure, and began studying it with great excitement.

At the same time, he muttered under his breath, "This is a real treasure…"

Li Fan let Fang Zaiji take the stone plate without stopping him. Remembering the Calamity Destruction Stone Disk that the Heaven-Suppressing Society used in his past life, Li Fan gave a reminder:

"Perhaps this object itself does not possess any special traits, but if a small portion of it is cut off, it may undergo some unexpected changes."

Fang Zaiji nodded, though it was unclear if he truly took it to heart. He was completely entranced, his entire being fixated on the Endstone Plate.

"Once Mr. Fang makes progress in his research, Elder Liu and you will be able to walk around freely without issue," Li Fan said to Jiang Yushan with a smile.

"Good, good! I'll be sure to keep a close eye on Old Fang!" Liu San grinned excitedly.

However, Jiang Yushan hesitated as she looked at the Endstone Plate and asked, "Is this so-called Tianxuan Mirror related to the Xuantian Sect's Xuantian Treasure Mirror?"

Seeing Li Fan's puzzled expression, Jiang Yushan explained, "The Xuantian Treasure Mirror was the supreme treasure of the ancient Xuantian Sect. After the Ten Great Immortal Sects destroyed the Xuantian Sect, this artifact vanished without a trace. The Ten Sects captured and tortured many Xuantian Sect remnants, but they never found any answers. I only learned about this when I was a prison warden in the Indeterminate Prison, from my colleagues’ discussions."

Upon hearing this, Liu San was shocked. "Xuantian... Tianxuan... The names are so similar! Could it be that the one who founded the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and destroyed the ancient cultivation world—the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor—was actually a member of the Xuantian Sect?"

Li Fan shook his head. "That, I do not know. However, since Elder Jiang brought it up, we can look into it in the future."

Liu San quickly advised, "If this speculation is true, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance would have surely sealed all information regarding the Xuantian Sect. If you inquire about it too openly, it might arouse suspicion."

"Besides, even if the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance originated from the Xuantian Sect, what does it matter? Back then, the Ten Great Immortal Sects stood by and watched as we charged out of the Xuanhuang Realm to meet our doom..."

"If anything, we should be thanking the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance for avenging us." Liu San snorted coldly.

Jiang Yushan furrowed her brows. After a moment of silence, she looked at Li Fan. "I do know of a method that can test whether this Tianxuan Mirror is truly a relic of the Xuantian Sect."

"Back then, the Ten Great Immortal Sects developed a secret technique called [Exterminate Xuantian] in order to hunt down Xuantian Sect remnants. When activated, the technique would create a sensory reaction if there were any objects related to the Xuantian Sect within a small radius."

"However, the range of this sensing ability is extremely limited. You must be very close to the object—almost brushing past it—to detect anything. That made it impractical. But I’ve heard that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance has placed Tianxuan Mirrors everywhere. We could try using this technique."

Li Fan's eyes flickered with thought, and he nodded. "Very well. Elder Jiang, please teach me!"

The secret technique was not particularly complex. Within moments, Li Fan had already mastered it.

He immediately activated the technique and approached the Endstone Plate.

Nothing happened.

"Could it really just be a coincidence in naming?" Liu San was surprised.

Li Fan suddenly thought of something and focused his consciousness on his clone, Xu Bai.

At that moment, Xu Bai was at the Bureau of Governance, casually chatting with his newly arrived colleagues from the Hall of Rebirth.

The Hall of Rebirth was an organization established by the Rebirth Mansion in every prefecture, responsible for all affairs related to "reincarnation and resurrection," much like the Formation Hall and the Martial Hall.

Without drawing attention, Xu Bai excused himself and headed toward the Tianxuan Mirror in the city, quietly activating the [Exterminate Xuantian] secret technique.

"Ding! Ding! Ding!"

A sharp, piercing sound suddenly rang in Xu Bai’s ears.

In his vision, the once unremarkable and ancient-looking mirror now radiated a glaring, blood-red glow.

"As expected! The Tianxuan Mirror is none other than the supreme treasure of the Xuantian Sect—the Xuantian Treasure Mirror!"

Xu Bai’s heart tensed, and in an instant, he withdrew the secret technique.

All abnormal signs disappeared without a trace. Keeping his expression calm, Xu Bai stepped into the Tianxuan Mirror.

Chapter 731: Chaos from the Immortal Realm

Within the Tianxuan Mirror Space, Xu Bai listened to the slightly metallic, mechanical voice coming from the mirror. His mind, however, was racing with thoughts.

"Even if the Tianxuan Mirror is not the original Xuantian Treasure Mirror, there must be an extremely close connection between the two."

"Since the Tianxuan Mirror originates from the Xuantian Sect, does that mean the Immortal Ancestor is also related?"

"Was it all for revenge against the Ten Great Immortal Sects for their destruction of the sect?"

Xu Bai suddenly recalled the fact that, for thousands of years, the Tianxuan Mirror had continuously given birth to secondary clones.

"Even though the Xuantian Sect was annihilated long ago, the Execution of Xuantian secret technique can still be used to sense the connection between the Tianxuan Mirror and the sect. Does this mean that the mirror has never completely escaped the control of the Xuantian Sect?"

"That’s why the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance went to such great lengths to search for the Xuantian Sect's Dharma King buried within the Purple Heaven Sect—to seize the final control over the Tianxuan Mirror."

"And it all started with the prophecy I made while pretending to be a cultivator from the Heavenly Mechanism Sect: ‘The Tianxuan Lock Spirit, Xuan-Huang Return to Unity.’”

At that moment, all the scattered events of this world suddenly connected.

Xu Bai saw past the surface of these events and grasped the deeper reasons hidden beneath them.

"And now, the Immortal Alliance is actively ushering in the Era of Great Exploration, seemingly to facilitate the further evolution of the Tianxuan Mirror. Does this mean that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance has already succeeded in obtaining this supreme treasure left behind by the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor?"

Xu Bai's eyes flickered.

Once, he had speculated that the true ruler behind the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance was not a cultivator but rather the Tianxuan Mirror itself.

However, due to a series of coincidences, he later learned of the existence of the Dharma Transmitting Practitioners. This led him to deduce that the Transmitting Dharma Practitioners and the Tianxuan Mirror restrained each other, jointly leading and governing the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

But now, was it the cultivators who had ultimately won this power struggle?

In his mind, the images of Shuo Feng and Lu Xichan suddenly flashed.

"The Xuan Family..."

A past conversation replayed in his mind.

When Lu Xuejing saw his true form, she had said:

"Which family are you from? You look completely unfamiliar! You’re not some spy from the Five Elders Association, trying to get close to Brother Shuo just to find the Tianxuan Mirror’s location, are you? You don’t look like a good person at all! Brother Shuo has never lied to me before..."

Like a bolt of lightning, the truth cut through the fog.

"So that's how it is." Xu Bai's eyes filled with understanding.

"The so-called 'outside the party, there is no party, only imperial thinking; within the party, there are no factions, yet a thousand oddities and wonders abound.'"

Not all cultivators stand on the side of the Dharma-Transmitting Practitioners.

At least, based on the current information, the Chief of the Formation Hall, Immortal Sage Fei Xue, and the Xuan-surnamed cultivators were on the side of the Tianxuan Mirror.

The Dharma Transmitting Practitioners sought to fully control the Tianxuan Mirror through Xuantian Sect techniques.

Meanwhile, those who followed the Tianxuan Mirror naturally sought ways to counteract this. Perhaps they lacked the strength to stop the Dharma Transmitting Practitioners directly, so they took an alternative approach—pushing the Tianxuan Mirror to complete its transformation and evolution, resisting the control of the Xuantian Sect’s secret techniques.

However, such a large-scale operation, mobilizing almost the entire Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance to encourage cultivators to explore the White Mist, couldn’t possibly have happened without the approval of the highest governing authority—the Dharma Transmitting Practitioners themselves.

Xu Bai found it hard to believe otherwise.

"Unless, the decree to explore the mist comes from a higher will, one that even the Dharma Transmitting Practitioners cannot defy. And the Tianxuan Mirror is merely taking advantage of this force to evolve."

"And in the Xuanhuang Realm, the only existence capable of making the Dharma Transmitting Practitioners bow their heads is..."

After analyzing everything, a realization sent a shiver through Xu Bai’s heart.

"The Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor!"

"He never left? He's still in the Xuanhuang Realm?"

A crushing sense of oppression descended upon Xu Bai.

Suddenly, he recalled that before the Era of Great Exploration officially began, Liu San had already seen many cultivators from the Immortal Alliance venturing deep into the mist.

Back then, Xu Bai had guessed that the Immortal Alliance was searching for clues about the Chaos Character.

Now, everything was finally coming together...

Xu Bai suddenly felt a chill run down his spine, a lingering sense of fear.

"That immense divine sense that descended upon me the day I used the Chaos Character Technique—was that the Immortal Ancestor?"

But soon, Xu Bai frowned slightly and dismissed the thought.

Although his performance that day had been remarkable, he didn't believe he could deceive the eyes of the Immortal Ancestor.

Moreover, the time between casting the Chaos Character Technique and the divine sense's arrival was too long. If it had truly been the Immortal Ancestor, with his level of cultivation, their reaction time wouldn't have been so slow.

"It was probably the Chaos Character Technique triggering again during the battle against Ink Death that ultimately drew their attention."

Xu Bai's thoughts suddenly halted.

"Or perhaps… the Immortal Ancestor wasn’t within the Xuanhuang Realm at the time, and it was only my use of the Chaos Character Technique that brought m him back?"

The moment this idea surfaced, a wave of unease swept over Xu Bai.

He pondered over it repeatedly but couldn’t rule out the possibility.

"It seems that while the Chaos Character Technique is powerful, it’s not something that can be used carelessly."

"Once was a stroke of luck… but if it happens again…"

Even the Heavenly Doctor would be affected.

If the Immortal Ancestor—who had dominated the Xuanhuang Realm for millennia—were to descend personally, Xu Bai had no confidence that he could use True Return in their presence.

"Unless absolutely necessary, it’s best not to use it." Xu Bai cursed inwardly.

Another thought crept into his mind: if his guess was correct, and the Immortal Ancestor—who had already achieved Longevity and transcended worldly concerns—still cared so much about the Chaos Character Technique…

"Could 'Chaos' also be an immortal lineage technique?"

Xu Bai was startled by the possibility.

In his mind, memories of what he had witnessed in the Reversal Maze Domain replayed rapidly—

The eerie, horrifying corpses strewn across the ground, and the stone stele in the center of the maze, inscribed with the character Chaos (亂).

A chilling hypothesis surfaced in his mind.

"That cultivation world in the Reversal Maze Zone… was it annihilated because of the influence of the Chaos Character?"

"And that Chaos character… came from—"

"The Immortal Realm!"

As for why the Reversal Beasts mistook him for the old fisherman Tian Jue and accused the Heavenly Doctor of being the true culprit—

Xu Bai suddenly recalled something Emperor Sanmo had once told Lu Ya:

"Sometimes, even what you see with your own eyes may not be the truth."

"Under the influence of the Chaos Glyph, misidentifications cannot be ruled out."

"Back at Cloud-Water Heavenly Palace, when Tian Jue, Tian Yi, and Tian Yu confronted one another, Tian Jue himself admitted to slaughtering everyone in the palace."

"Perhaps the same is true for the Reversal Maze Zone."

"The Devouring Essence White Mist is filled with strange, inexplicable phenomena. It’s hard to say whether the Chaos Character’s influence is absent from it."

"The Chaos Character Technique may not be limited to the Xuanhuang Realm. It may have appeared in other cultivation realms as well."

"And it may have even brought about boundless calamities."

"That’s likely why the Immortal Ancestor, as well as the current Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and Five Elders Association, all pay such close attention to it."

Xu Bai remained deep in thought.

Meanwhile, in the Longevity Valley, Li Fan—who had been in a daze—was suddenly called back to reality by Liu San.

"Young Master, does the Tianxuan Mirror have anything to do with the Xuantian Sect?"

Liu San asked.

Spirit.Stone.translation

Chapter 732: The Nameless True Immortals

At this moment, the true body of Li Fan finally regained his senses. He nodded slightly, his expression solemn. "The Tianxuan Mirror, the supreme treasure of the Immortal Alliance, is indeed connected to the Xuantian Sect."

He then described in detail the scene that his clone had perceived using the [Execution of Xuantian] secret technique.

Hearing this, Jiang Yushan frowned. "Three chimes of warning—this is the highest level of alert within the Xuantian Sect. It seems that this so-called Tianxuan Mirror is actually the Xuantian Mirror of old."

Liu San, however, looked confused. "The name is just reversed—what does that matter? If they wanted to hide its origins, they could have chosen a completely unrelated name. Besides, the Xuantian Sect’s mortal enemies, the Ten Great Immortal Sects, have long been wiped out. There's no longer any need for secrecy, is there?"

Jiang Yushan shook her head and explained, "It's not just a simple name change. I've heard that the Xuantian Treasure Mirror has a mysterious origin. It can reflect all things in the world and possesses supreme power. Back in the days of the Ten Great Immortal Sects, some speculated that this mirror was not a native artifact of the Xuanhuang Realm but might have come from the Immortal Realm."

Li Fan's eyes narrowed.

Meanwhile, Fang Zaiji, who had been lost in thought while studying the [Endstone Plate], suddenly looked up and stared at Jiang Yushan. "The Immortal Realm?!" he exclaimed.

Jiang Yushan continued steadily, "It’s not an unfounded theory. The master of the Xuantian Sect, the Half-Step True Immortal Xuantian King, did not possess any mirror-like treasures before his attempted ascension. But after he returned from the Immortal Ascension Passage, he suddenly had this artifact. During his conquest of the Xuanhuang Realm, establishing the Xuantian Sect, the Xuantian Treasure Mirror played a pivotal role."

"Otherwise, even after the Xuantian Sect was destroyed, the Ten Great Immortal Sects would not have continued to covet and fear it, even offering the position of a Longevity Immortal as a bounty."

"And when one reaches the True Immortal realm, their very name itself represents a certain kind of power."

Jiang Yushan fell silent for a moment, lost in thought.

Sensing an opportunity, Li Fan asked, "Elder Jiang, what do you mean by that?"

"Before the Immortal Path was severed, many cultivators in the history of the Xuanhuang Realm successfully overcame tribulations and ascended. Some were even elders of the Ten Great Immortal Sects. However, when later generations tried to trace their records and study their history…"

"They found that all records about them had vanished on their own."

"Not only could they find no trace of these individuals’ past deeds, but even their names could not be preserved."

"The Nameless True Immortal. Or rather, after completing their transformation into a True Immortal, they became beings beyond our comprehension."

Liu San and Fang Zaiji, both Dao Integration cultivators, were visibly shaken by this revelation.

"No wonder," Fang Zaiji murmured in realization. "I've traveled across the Xuanhuang Realm and always heard legends of ancient immortals—but never once did I hear their names."

Jiang Yushan continued, "If this is true for True Immortals, then it must also apply to their treasures. Though an artifact may not be as transcendent as a True Immortal, its true name likely corresponds to some kind of fundamental law. The shift from Xuantian to Tianxuan must hold some unknown and profound significance."

Her words left the other three in silent contemplation, deeply shaken by the mysteries surrounding True Immortals.

Moments later, Fang Zaiji was the first to react. "If the Tianxuan Mirror is a True Immortal artifact, then wouldn’t its secondary body be equivalent to half an Immortal-grade treasure?"

His face flushed red with excitement. Clutching the [Endstone Plate] tightly, he dashed away in an instant.

"Sect Master, rest assured! I'm going into seclusion to study this! I won’t come out until I’ve figured it out—even if it takes my entire life!"

His silhouette vanished, but his voice continued to echo through the hall.

Li Fan shook his head slightly and then expressed his gratitude to Jiang Yushan:

"Elder Jiang, as expected of a true disciple of the Ten Great Immortal Sects—your vast knowledge and keen insight are truly remarkable. I have never heard of such secrets about True Immortals before."

Liu San also sighed and said, "Our Medicine King Sect is already considered a mid-tier sect, yet we know so little about such matters."

Jiang Yushan, however, seemed indifferent. In a sharp voice, like metal scraping against metal, she replied, "It's merely a topic for idle conversation. After all, the Immortal Path has been severed for so long. Immortals… they're as distant and unattainable as myths to the common people."

She glanced in the direction where Fang Zaiji had disappeared, then suddenly said, "I need to keep an eye on him. Otherwise, if we wait for him to produce results, it might take a hundred years."

"Haha, it won’t be that bad, right? Old Fang is still quite reliable…" Liu San began to say, but before he could finish, Jiang Yushan had already turned into a black streak and vanished into the distance.

In a hurry, he called out,

"Yushan, wait for me!"

Without even saying goodbye to Li Fan, he rushed after her.

In an instant, Li Fan was the only one left in the area.

"True Immortals have no names, huh…"

He paid no mind to the departing two, instead pondering Jiang Yushan’s words, momentarily lost in thought.

He didn’t know how much time had passed before he finally snapped out of his reverie.

"The exploration of the White Mist is about to conclude, and the Tianxuan Mirror will soon complete its transformation…"

"Right now, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is at a crucial stage of reform. It’s not wise to leave. It’s best to remain here in the Longevity Valley and wait for the changes to unfold."

"The restrictions on entering the Fallen Immortal Realm were lifted long ago, but I had been busy exploring the Maze Zone, so I never had time to enter."

"Perhaps this is a good opportunity to visit the Heavenly Sword Sect again."

After a moment of contemplation, Li Fan made his decision.

However, before entering the Fallen Immortal Realm, he silently took a stroll through the Longevity Valley and the Beast Realm.

In the Longevity Valley, most of the awakened disciples of the Medicine King Sect had already left, with only a few stationed at key positions.

Meanwhile, in the Beast Realm, Li Fan spotted a few familiar figures.

They were Xiao Fan, Su Changyu, Su Xiaomei, and the others.

Sweeping his divine sense over them without their knowledge, Li Fan noticed something strange.

In this life, he had not interfered much with their paths.

Yet, he had still granted them cultivation techniques and had placed no significant restrictions on their progress.

Over a decade had passed. Based on their previous life’s talent, at least one of them should have broken through to the Golden Core realm by now.

But now…

Their progress was somewhat disappointing.

Ye Feipeng, who cultivated a combination of three methods—techniques, body refinement, and the Beast Soul Bead—was the strongest among them. However, he had only reached the mid-stage of the Foundation Establishment realm.

Su Xiaomei and Su Changyu, who focused purely on cultivation techniques, had just recently broken through to the Foundation Establishment stage. Natural treasures and spiritual resources were, of course, provided by the Medicine King Sect. After three years of selling Longevity Pills, the sect’s treasury had grown increasingly abundant.

As for Xiao Heng, who had chosen not to cultivate but instead focused on communicating with the Imperial Beast Soul Bead—he had completely given up.

He had lost all motivation, spending his days flaunting his status in the Beast Realm while clad in his Beast God Armor.

"Even though their cultivation speed is still much faster than mine, it’s clearly not at the level they should have achieved."

"Is the spiritual energy gradually fading...?"

Li Fan contemplated deeply.

Spirit.Stone.translation

Chapter 733: Infiltrating the Heavenly Sword Sect

"While it is true that I have kept them confined in one place in this life, perhaps the real issue lies with the outer realm itself."

"Otherwise, these so-called geniuses from the outer realm wouldn’t be losing to mere youths like Sun Erlang and Wang Xuanba from the Great Xuan."

Back then, Li Fan had personally tested their cultivation potential.

At best, they only barely met the requirements to cultivate—not even close to matching the geniuses from the outer realm.

Yet now, without him realizing it, they had somehow surpassed them…

A vision of the great volcano at the center of the Great Outer Realm suddenly emerged in Li Fan’s mind.

From the moment he entered the outer realm, he had a nagging suspicion that something was amiss with that volcano.

However, perhaps due to his insufficient cultivation or lack of perception, he had explored it multiple times but still failed to uncover any secrets.

"Unfortunately, the entrance to the outer realm in this life has already been swallowed by spatial fissures, making it impossible to return."

"But in my next life, I must investigate it thoroughly."

With that thought in mind, Li Fan waved his hand lightly, summoning Su Changyu, Su Xiaomei, and the others before him out of thin air.

Their vigilance was noticeably weaker than in his past lives.

Several moments passed before they snapped out of their confusion. Upon recognizing Li Fan, they hurriedly saluted.

"Greetings, Sect Master!"

Li Fan's gaze swept over them, and then he spoke in a deep voice:

"I took you all from a small mortal world over ten years ago. First, I confined you on an island, and then I brought you here to the Longevity Valley, never allowing you to leave…"

"Do you hold any resentment?"

Ye Feipeng was the first to respond:

"How could we ever resent you, Sect Master? These years have been incredibly fulfilling for us. Especially this Longevity Valley and the Beast Realm—while they may seem insignificant in your eyes, to us, they are already far grander than our homeland."

His tone carried a hint of flattery.

Xiao Heng quickly nodded in agreement, and the others followed suit.

Li Fan remained silent for a moment, waiting until they started to feel uneasy before finally speaking:

"The outside world—the Xuanhuang Realm—is undergoing an unprecedented transformation, one that occurs only once in a thousand years. Countless opportunities await. It is now your time to shine. Pack your things; tomorrow, you will leave the valley."

The expressions on their faces immediately stiffened.

But before they could react, Li Fan waved his sleeve and departed, leaving behind a group of disciples staring at each other in bewilderment.

Li Fan’s orders were absolute—they dared not disobey. With no choice, they begrudgingly accepted their fate. Looking miserable, they hurried off to seek help from their acquaintances in the Medicine King Sect.

"I hope that once they return to the world, they will bring me some surprises. Otherwise, the true problem must indeed lie within the outer realm."

With an formless killing intent lingering over the group, Li Fan quietly returned to his secluded cultivation chamber in the Longevity Valley.

"Blessings to the Celestial Venerable Of Xuanhuang!"

Setting up a ritual, in the next instant, Li Fan once again entered the Fallen Immortal Realm.

Without hesitation, he selected the [Heaven Sword Sect's Divine Refinement] scenario.

As the scene around him twisted and blurred, a furious voice rang in his ears.

"Ji Zhaoxuan! Why have you failed to submit your [Sword Embryo] again this time?"

"Do you realize that you're delaying Senior Brother’s grand plan? Can you take responsibility for this?"

A flood of memories rushed into Li Fan’s mind, instantly making him aware of his current situation.

Ever since Mr. Bai had left, the Heavenly Sword Sect had been preparing to forge a World-Rifting Divine Weapon.

To accomplish this, all disciples were required to extract insights from their wooden swords and infuse them into a specialized energy stone known as the [Sword Embryo]. These sword embryos were then thrown into the abyss at the back of the mountain, where they would be refined in molten fire to shape the prototype of the divine weapon.

Everyone in the Heavenly Sword Sect, from disciples to elders—and even the strongest figure in the sect, Senior Brother Situ Yao—followed this practice.

But the cultivator Li Fan had now possessed—Ji Zhaoxuan, a Golden Core cultivator—had repeatedly failed to turn in his [Sword Embryo] on time.

And now, he was being confronted about it.

Li Fan maintained a calm expression and cupped his hands.

"Senior Brother Chu, I humbly request a few more days of grace! My aptitude is mediocre, and the process of comprehension and refinement is slower for me than for others."

Senior Brother Chu scrutinized Li Fan before letting out a cold snort.

"This is your last chance. Don’t think I don’t know what you’re scheming! Your technique of Condensing Qi into Sword is the complete opposite of the process of infusing sword intent into the [Sword Embryo]. The longer you keep the sword embryo within you, the more benefits you gain. Isn’t that right?"

Li Fan immediately put on a flustered expression, as if his secret had been exposed.

He hurriedly replied, "Senior Brother Chu—"

But the other party cut him off with a wave of his hand, his expression turning cold.

"I have no intention of showing favoritism. Individual cultivation is nothing compared to the future of the entire Heavenly Sword Sect. You need to understand where your priorities lie!"

"I will return in two days. You had better be ready!"

After saying that, Senior Brother Chu turned and left.

Countless fellow disciples around pointed and whispered, but the panic on Li Fan’s face instantly disappeared. He calmly returned to his own room.

After checking his own internal condition, he immediately understood.

"As expected, the one I possessed this time is no ordinary person."

In the dantian of Ji Zhaoxuan, a misty gray "Golden Core," resembling a gaseous planet, continuously emitted gray mist.

It corroded and devoured the Sword Embryo Essence Stone floating nearby.

At the same time, profound insights into the Dao of the Sword surfaced in Li Fan’s mind—more pure and powerful than any comprehension he had gained from directly touching a wooden sword.

This was precisely why Ji Zhaoxuan had repeatedly delayed submitting the sword embryos.

Every time he acquired a sword embryo, he would first absorb it himself, converting it into his own understanding before handing it over to the Heavenly Sword Sect.

In fact, this body's talent in the Dao of the Sword was undeniably at the level of a true prodigy.

Even so, deciphering the true essence within the sword embryos was an extremely slow process.

It required a significant amount of time, making it seem to others that his speed in refining the sword embryos was much slower.

Even Senior Brother Chu had only figured out that Ji Zhaoxuan could benefit from the sword embryos to improve his cultivation.

But he would never have imagined that Ji Zhaoxuan could directly convert the true essence within the sword embryos into his own comprehension.

"What Heavenly Sword Sect's World-Rift Plan? This body doesn’t care at all."

"Because he was a double agent all along."

As Li Fan absorbed the sword embryo, he recalled the sudden influx of memories in his mind.

One night, unnoticed by anyone, Ji Zhaoxuan had used a secret technique to transmit everything that had recently happened in the Heavenly Sword Sect to the outside world.

Who exactly received the information? That part remained unknown in his mind.

Even Ji Zhaoxuan himself didn’t know why he had done it.

One day, as if controlled by someone else, he instinctively carried out such an act.

And he hadn’t even found anything strange about it.

"To even deceive oneself… that truly is an advanced form of espionage."

Li Fan thought to himself.

"The secret of the Heavenly Sword Sect’s sword-forging will soon be exposed to the world."

"Things might not be peaceful for much longer."

Scenes of the World-Rift eruption at the Nanming Sacred Beast Mountain and the shattering of the Xuanhuang Realm flashed through his mind.

With that thought, Li Fan braced himself for what was to come.

Chapter 734: Stellar Core Sword Qi

Fallen Immortal Realm, Heavenly Sword Sect.

Three days later.

Inside a secluded chamber, Li Fan sat cross-legged in deep meditation, eyes closed in silence.

Surrounding him, dozens of Sword Qi coiled and circled in the air. These sword energies were as solid as metal, sharp enough to cut through gold and iron, even emitting a faint metallic gleam. Upon closer inspection, countless blurry sword shadows flickered and changed along the edges of the auras.

Before Li Fan floated a Sword Embryo, its essence completely absorbed and mastered.

“This Breath-Forming Sword Technique truly has its mysteries,” Li Fan murmured. He opened his mouth, and the dozens of razor-sharp Sword Qi howled as they returned to his body, once again nurturing within his core.

Inside his dantian, a golden core resembling a gaseous planet was now encircled by over ten thousand sword lights. The lights formed a dazzling, magnificent ring, mesmerizing to behold.

Only Li Fan knew the terrifying power hidden within this Sword Light Ring. If he were to unleash all ten thousand sword energies in a single breath, even a Nascent Soul True Lord of this era might perish instantly.

“Ji Zhaoxuan’s memories contain no knowledge of the origins of this technique. It seems to be nothing more than the Ten Thousand Swords Art—a common technique practiced by all core disciples of the Heavenly Sword Sect. But clearly, very few in the sect achieve such a shocking phenomenon at the Golden Core stage.”

“Moreover, this move bears some resemblance to Situ Yao’s Sword Arrival...”

As his thoughts drifted, Li Fan fully restrained the overwhelming presence of his ten thousand sword lights within his dantian. He now exuded no sharpness, appearing just like an ordinary Golden Core cultivator.

Leaving the secluded chamber, Li Fan did not wait for Senior Brother Chu to summon him; instead, he proactively handed over the Sword Embryo.

Senior Brother Chu gave him a look of approval, as if to say, “At least you know your place.” He briefly examined the Sword Embryo, then casually stored it away.

“Just in time—Senior Brother has called everyone together. It seems there is an important matter to discuss. You will come with me.”

Hearing this, Li Fan’s heart stirred slightly. He nodded and followed behind.

The sect’s main hall stood atop the tallest mountain peak at the very center of the sect’s territory, piercing the sky like an unsheathed sword.

Inside the hall, many cultivators had already gathered—all of higher seniority than Li Fan.

Not knowing why Senior Brother Chu had brought him here, Li Fan simply followed and positioned himself at the edge of the crowd, waiting for Situ Yao’s arrival.

Before long, the once-buzzing grand hall suddenly fell into silence.

A strong aroma of alcohol filled the air, accompanied by a flash of sword light. Moments later, Situ Yao stumbled into the hall, reeking of liquor.

He let out a loud belch before speaking in broken sentences, revealing the reason for the gathering.

It turned out that the Prototype of the World-Rifting Divine Weapon had been completed. The next step was forging its sword body.

To achieve interdimensional travel, the weapon’s blade had to be incomparably sturdy. The key material required for this was [Taiyuan Essence Metal].

Although the sect’s treasury contained a fair amount of this material, it was far from enough to meet the requirements for forging the World-Rifting Divine Weapon.

Situ Yao was an unparalleled fighter, but in matters like these, he was at a loss. Thus, he sought the opinions of the assembled disciples.

He also laid out two conditions:

The forging of the World-Rifting Divine Weapon must remain a secret. While the sect was not afraid of battle, if other powerful sects joined forces against them, handling the situation would become exceedingly troublesome.

Minimize costs. Despite its wealth, the Heavenly Sword Sect could barely afford the immense resources required for forging the divine weapon. Apart from Taiyuan Essence Metal, over a thousand other rare and exotic materials were needed—nearly draining the sect’s entire treasury. Thus, it was crucial to acquire the resources with minimal expenditure.

Upon hearing Senior Brother Situ’s words, all the gathered cultivators revealed expressions of concern.

"Everyone, speak your minds and think of a solution. Whoever can resolve this matter, I will appoint them as the next Sect Master of the Heavenly Sword Sect!"

Situ Yao slumped to the ground, completely lacking the demeanor of a high-ranking expert, yet the words he spoke were astonishing.

The current Sect Master of the Heavenly Sword Sect, Huo Yuzhu, could only offer a bitter smile, not daring to refute him.

As soon as these words were spoken, an uproar erupted within the grand hall.

After all, who wouldn’t be envious of the position of Sect Master among the Ten Great Immortal Sects? Even if it didn’t hold much real power, the status and benefits far surpassed those of ordinary sect disciples.

The crowd’s expressions varied, but Li Fan keenly noticed that Senior Brother Chu’s gaze swept over him in an almost imperceptible manner.

"Hmm? What does he mean by that?"

Although Li Fan indeed knew where to find a large quantity of Taiyuan Essence Gold, that knowledge came from his past life, outside the Fallen Immortal Realm, within the Time Mirage of the Five Elements Grand Cave Heaven.

It had nothing to do with Ji Zhaoxuan, the person he was now inhabiting.

What exactly did Senior Brother Chu know? Why did he specifically call him over?

Retracing the memories of this body's past, Li Fan found no close connection with Senior Brother Chu—at most, they were mere acquaintances who had exchanged nods.

Thus, he remained calm and composed, pretending not to notice the other’s gaze.

After the meeting concluded and he was on his way back to his own mountain residence—

Senior Brother Chu suddenly sent a voice transmission: "Junior Brother Ji, your Ji family should have quite a bit of Taiyuan Essence Gold, right?"

Li Fan was momentarily stunned. "What?"

Senior Brother Chu’s face showed a hint of dissatisfaction. "Junior Brother, don’t play dumb with me. Your Ji family is the most prestigious merchant chamber in the world. It’s said that you even possess half-immortal artifacts—so how could you possibly not have Taiyuan Essence Gold?"

As if a switch had been flipped, Li Fan’s mind was instantly flooded with memories of Ji Zhaoxuan’s past.

That was from when his original self was only five or six years old—

He had been sent away from his parents and placed in the Heavenly Sword Sect by his clan elders. He seemed to have been given some instructions back then, but over time, he had long since forgotten them.

If not for Senior Brother Chu’s words triggering these distant memories within this body, the possessed Li Fan might have remained completely unaware.

Connecting this to some of his own past peculiar actions, Li Fan suddenly realized the truth.

However, his expression remained unreadable, his face filled with confusion. "Ji family?"

After a brief pause, he reacted as if recalling something, a flash of anger and desolation appearing in his eyes.

With a cold voice, Li Fan said, "It has been many years since I’ve had any contact with them. Our ties have long been severed. Even if they do have Taiyuan Essence Gold, it has nothing to do with me."

Senior Brother Chu chuckled, speaking in a persuasive tone: "Junior Brother, don’t let emotions cloud your judgment. I know you have many grievances, but think about it—if you could gain the full support of the Ji family’s World Chamber of Commerce, wouldn’t you have a real chance at competing for the position of Sect Master?"

"Even though our Heavenly Sword Sect is preparing to break through the realm and leave, there will still be things left behind—such as the vast sect lands and the governance of numerous affiliated sects. Offering just a portion of those would be an enormous profit for the World Chamber of Commerce."

"A win-win situation—why not fight for it? Think it over carefully. If you’re interested, I can accompany you back home and act as a mediator."

Senior Brother Chu patted Li Fan’s shoulder, wearing a meaningful expression.

Chapter 735: The Sky City of Spirit Stones

After Senior Brother Chu left, Li Fan recalled his words, a playful expression appearing on his face.

Thinking back, he remembered that the Ji family had sent many of their peers into different sects. Li Fan was almost certain that their years of no contact were just a diversion.

Ji Zhaoxuan was definitely a spy sent by the Ji family to infiltrate the Heavenly Sword Sect.

However, calling him a "spy" might not be entirely appropriate since the World Chamber of Commerce did not have any direct conflicts with the Heavenly Sword Sect.

"Merchants travel the world, and confidential information is crucial. The Ji family likely relies on such methods to stay informed about everything happening in the Xuanhuang Realm, allowing them to profit from it."

"In that case, the news about the Heavenly Sword Sect forging a World-Rifting Divine Weapon might not spread too widely. After all, merchants are naturally opportunistic and profit-driven."

"Taiyuan Essence Gold…"

Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

To end the Fallen Immortal Realm scenario, he needed to find the master of this remnant time-space and resolve his lingering obsession.

Based on the clues he had gathered so far, Ji Zhaoxuan seemed to be the target.

"What is his obsession?"

Li Fan calmed his mind and recalled the emotions attached to this body.

As he thought about the Ji family, he keenly detected deeply buried resentment and a thirst for revenge.

"Was he forced to leave home as a child, leading to resentment?"

"I should test this first."

His thoughts spun rapidly, and in an instant, he had already devised a plan to take revenge on the Ji family.

The next day, Li Fan contacted Senior Brother Chu again.

"Oh? Junior Brother Ji, you've finally come around?" The other party appeared quite excited.

Li Fan nodded.

"Now that's more like it! We're all family—there's no grudge that can't be resolved. I'll make the preparations right away and accompany you to the World Chamber of Commerce headquarters."

"If you succeed in becoming the sect master, don't forget about me!" Senior Brother Chu, who had been arrogant before, suddenly became fawning.

Not long after, using the search for Taiyuan Essence Gold as an excuse, the two of them left the Heavenly Sword Sect and set off for the Ji family.

To avoid suspicion, they even took a detour at Senior Brother Chu’s suggestion.

Half a month later, they finally arrived at their destination—

A city in the sky, entirely constructed from top-grade spirit stones.

It floated above a bustling market town. Cultivators and merchants moved about in an endless stream. Whenever they looked up at the sky city of spirit stones, their eyes inevitably filled with envy.

The marketplace was protected by a formation, preventing cultivators from flying. Additionally, an entry fee was required.

As soon as they stepped into the marketplace, they were met with an overwhelming surge of pure spiritual energy—far surpassing even that of the Heavenly Sword Sect.

Senior Brother Chu couldn't help but exclaim, "As expected of the greatest Chamber of Commerce in the world—such magnificence!"

Leading Li Fan through countless shops, they finally arrived before a grand estate at the very center of the marketplace.

Above the entrance, a plaque bore four large characters: (Ji Family’s World Trade).

As Li Fan and Chu approached, a golden-robed Golden Core cultivator stationed at the gate stepped forward to block their path.

With a polite smile, he asked, "Do the two of you have an invitation?"

Senior Brother Chu snorted, "Invitation? You have no sense! Why would we need an invitation to return home?"

The golden-robed cultivator was momentarily stunned. He carefully examined Senior Brother Chu.

"Why are you looking at me? It's the person next to me!" Chu said impatiently, pointing at Li Fan.

Only then did the golden-robed cultivator shift his gaze.

Rather than becoming angry, he furrowed his brows as if deep in thought.

Moments later, his expression turned to one of shock.

"Please wait here for a moment."

With that, he hurriedly rushed inside the Ji estate.

Before long, a middle-aged cultivator with a square face emerged, leading a group of other cultivators…

As his gaze fell on Li Fan, the square-faced cultivator showed no change in expression.

"Zhao Xuan, why have you returned? Could it be that you violated sect rules and were expelled?" Instead of the joy of seeing a long-lost family member, his tone carried only reprimand.

Senior Brother Chu was about to smooth things over when Li Fan directly retorted, "And who might you be? I've been away from home too long—I don’t recall you."

The square-faced cultivator’s expression darkened. "Insolent child! Is that how you speak to your father?"

Li Fan narrowed his eyes, his expression unchanged. "Prove it."

The cultivator's face turned crimson in an instant.

The pressure emanating from him was like a volcano on the verge of eruption.

The cultivators following behind him—members of the Ji Clan—exchanged strange glances as they observed Li Fan.

However, Li Fan remained unfazed. He exhaled lightly, and immediately, hundreds of sword auras of different colors flashed and hovered around him.

Just as a fight was about to break out, Senior Brother Chu quickly interjected, "It's a misunderstanding! A misunderstanding! Everyone, calm down!"

"I am Chu Zongyi, a core disciple of the Heavenly Sword Sect. This time, I was on a mission with Junior Brother Ji when we happened to pass through World Market. Since this is his hometown, we decided to stop by for a visit." He hurriedly explained.

Upon hearing this, Ji Zhaoxuan's father hesitated slightly. His gaze swept over the hundreds of sword auras surrounding Li Fan, a flicker of surprise appearing in his eyes.

Gradually, he withdrew his imposing presence and let out a cold snort. "Come in, then."

Only then did Chu Zongyi breathe a sigh of relief. Pulling Li Fan along, he followed him into the Ji Clan residence.

The path twisted and turned, leading them deeper into the estate until they reached an inner hall.

Ji Zhaoxuan's father took a seat at the head of the hall, dismissing the others before speaking in a solemn voice, "Speak. Why have you come here?"

Chu Zongyi was about to respond, but Li Fan stopped him.

"You’re not qualified. Let the Ancestor come." Li Fan said expressionlessly.

Returning to the Ji Clan seemed to stir up old memories buried in dust.

Li Fan knew that the man before him, Ji Shiwen—Ji Zhaoxuan’s father—was merely the overseer of World Market.

In the Ji Clan, he held little real power.

The true authority of the Ji Clan lay with their Ancestor, Ji Wangxian.

Decades ago, he had already reached the Dao Integration stage, establishing the World Chamber of Commerce with his own hands. His true cultivation level was unfathomable.

"You..." A trace of barely suppressed anger flashed in Ji Shiwen's eyes.

However, when his gaze met Li Fan’s emotionless, unyielding stare, an involuntary shiver ran down his spine.

After a long silence, he finally swallowed his anger.

"Wait here."

With a cold snort, he stomped his foot, turning into a streak of light that shot toward the Sky City of Spirit Stones.

"Junior Brother Ji, he is still your father. Doing this… isn’t it a bit much?" Chu Zongyi whispered.

Li Fan smiled. "Doesn’t this make us appear even more confident?"

Seeing Li Fan’s indifferent demeanor, Senior Brother Chu chuckled awkwardly and said nothing more.

While waiting, Li Fan noticed something—

The patterns in the hall seemed oddly familiar.

"Hmm? They resemble the Ten Thousand Arts Chamber of Commerce's emblem in reality… though there are slight differences."

Li Fan pondered silently.

"It seems there must be some connection between the two."

It wasn’t long before Ji Shiwen returned.

"Come with me." He said darkly.

Chapter 736: The Ji Family’s Ji Wangxian

Ji Shiwen took out a golden command flag and tossed it onto the ground.

In an instant, a formation appeared beneath the feet of the three individuals.

Chu Zongyi’s expression was filled with excitement, while Li Fan’s face remained unchanged.

As the formation’s light shone brightly, they transformed into streaks of light, soaring like meteors in reverse, traveling directly from the market to the sky city of spirit stones.

In just a few breaths, the three of them landed on the spirit stone-paved ground.

“Ugh…” The spiritual energy concentration in the sky city had reached an astonishing level, flooding into their bodies uncontrollably, causing their internal energy circulation to become obstructed. Chu Zongyi’s face turned purple, resembling a mortal choking and unable to breathe.

It was only when Li Fan forcefully slapped his back that he was able to recover.

“Cough, cough…” Even after stabilizing himself, Chu Zongyi continued to greedily absorb the pure spiritual energy around him, his face full of awe.

Ji Shiwen, who had been leading the way, flashed a look of pride upon witnessing this. However, when he noticed Li Fan’s completely indifferent expression, his face darkened instantly.

Passing through the city of spirit stones, Li Fan eventually arrived at a garden in the center, where he met the Ji Family’s ancestor.

Contrary to his expectations of an old, frail figure, Ji Wangxian appeared as a young man in his early twenties.

With shoulder-length hair, a handsome appearance, and eyes that shimmered like starlight, he exuded an extraordinary presence.

If not for Ji Shiwen respectfully bowing and addressing him as “Ancestor,” Li Fan and Chu Zongyi would have found it difficult to believe that this “young cultivator” was actually the legendary figure.

“So, you two are the ones who sought an audience with me?” Ji Wangxian asked softly.

Even without deliberately exerting pressure, the aura he naturally emitted made both Li Fan and Chu Zongyi feel an overwhelming weight on their hearts.

Chu Zongyi nodded repeatedly, preparing to explain the situation.

But before he could, Li Fan stopped him.

Looking at his own biological father, Li Fan said calmly, “Secrecy is the key to success. With this person here, it’s not appropriate to speak.”

Ji Shiwen was instantly enraged. “You ungrateful wretch—”

Before he could erupt completely, Ji Wangxian raised a hand to stop him.

With a light chuckle, Ji Wangxian said, “You’re quite an interesting little one. Shiwen, step back.”

Faced with the ancestor’s command, Ji Shiwen dared not disobey. Suppressing the murderous intent in his eyes, he lowered his head and stormed away in frustration.

“Well then, you may speak now.” Ji Wangxian’s smile faded.

Chu Zongyi felt a chill in his heart and immediately explained everything—how the Heavenly Sword Sect needed a large amount of Taiyuan Essence Gold to forge World-Rifting Divine Weapons, and how whoever resolved this matter would have a high chance of becoming the next Sect Master.

“Senior Ji, with the vast wealth of the World Chamber of Commerce, if you participate in this, securing the Sect Master position will be a sure thing. Once our Heavenly Sword Sect departs, all the fertile land within 90,000 miles of Heavenly Sword Mountain will be yours…” Chu Zongyi earnestly tried to persuade him.

But Ji Wangxian was entirely unmoved, contrary to expectations.

Instead, he sighed and said, “Everyone knows that the position of Sect Master of the Heavenly Sword Sect is nothing but an empty title. The real power lies with Senior Brother Situ Yao.”

“Taiyuan Essence Gold is an extremely rare and invaluable resource. World-Rifting Divine Weapons…”

“Even with the financial resources of the World Chamber of Commerce, fulfilling the material requirements to forge such weapons would be an enormous sacrifice. And all we get in return is a hollow title…”

Ji Wangxian suddenly turned to Li Fan. “Your name… is Ji Zhaoxuan, correct? Since you left home, this should be your first time returning. After traveling all this way back, do you think this plan is feasible?”

Li Fan shook his head slightly. “It is not.”

Chu Zongyi was stunned. “Junior Brother Ji…”

Li Fan continued, “But… it’s worth a gamble.”

A spark of intrigue flashed in Ji Wangxian’s eyes before he burst into laughter. “Good! You do remind me of my younger self.”

"You're absolutely right! The uncertainty of this matter is too high, and the risks far outweigh the rewards. When the Heavenly Sword Sect washes its hands of the matter and walks away, we won’t even be able to find a debtor to hold accountable."

"But, it's still worth a gamble!"

"The foundations of the Ten Great Immortal Sects… If our World Chamber of Commerce can swallow them whole..." Ji Wangxian stood with his hands behind his back, turning his gaze to the distant horizon, his tone inexplicable.

In an instant, the situation took a dramatic turn.

Chu Zongyi, upon hearing this, was overjoyed.

With the Ancestor’s approval, everything that followed proceeded far more smoothly than Li Fan had expected.

Under the incredulous gaze of Ji Shiwen, Li Fan and Chu Zongyi returned with 3,000 jin of Taiyuan Essence Gold from the World Chamber of Commerce’s reserves.

Furthermore, Ji Wangxian declared that the World Chamber of Commerce would fully support Ji Zhaoxuan in his bid for the position of Sect Master of the Heavenly Sword Sect by continuously purchasing Taiyuan Essence Gold.

His generosity was astonishing, and he did not ask Li Fan for any promises in return.

If Li Fan had not already known that this body had, at times, acted autonomously and lost control, he might have been deeply moved by this unconditional trust.

"It seems that the Ji family is quite confident in their ability to control the spies they've placed within the various sects." Li Fan sneered inwardly while contemplating ways to counteract them.

Upon returning to the Heavenly Sword Sect, Li Fan handed over the 3,000 jin of Taiyuan Essence Gold and assured them that there would be a continuous supply arriving in the future.

This immediately caused an uproar throughout the sect.

It was well known that, up until now, the disciples had managed to collect only a little over 1,000 jin—including the original sect reserves.

Yet Li Fan alone had acquired more than three times that amount.

After presenting several fine jars of wine he had brought back from the Ji family to Situ Yao, the Senior Brother of the Heavenly Sword Sect beamed with joy. He even publicly praised Li Fan as a role model for all junior disciples of the sect.

With Chu Zongyi’s efforts in spreading the word, news of Li Fan’s affiliation with the World Chamber of Commerce quickly spread.

Soon, Li Fan's residence was flooded with visitors—fellow disciples coming to pay respects and build connections.

Most cultivators in the Heavenly Sword Sect now viewed Li Fan as a strong contender for the position of the next Sect Master.

And as the World Chamber of Commerce continued to deliver more Taiyuan Essence Gold, the disciples only grew more convinced of their judgment.

At this critical juncture, however, Li Fan quietly paid a visit to the current Sect Master of the Heavenly Sword Sect—Huo Yuzhu.

"Oh? Isn't this the pillar of our Heavenly Sword Sect, the designated successor to the Sect Master? What brings you here?" Huo Yuzhu greeted him with a smile, though a hint of mockery flashed in his eyes.

Li Fan remained composed and replied frankly: "I’ve come for the position of Sect Master."

Huo Yuzhu's expression darkened. "You insolent junior! Don't think that just because—"

"Does Sect Master Huo truly wish to hand over your position so easily? Even if it is merely a nominal title, the power that comes with it is still intoxicating, is it not?"

Hearing the hidden meaning in Li Fan’s words, Huo Yuzhu’s expression flickered between uncertainty and intrigue. "What exactly are you implying?"

"I know of a place that holds an enormous amount of Taiyuan Essence Gold—far more than what my Ji family can gather." Li Fan said solemnly.

"?" Huo Yuzhu scrutinized Li Fan in surprise, unable to grasp his true intent.

"I wish to exchange the position of Sect Master of the Heavenly Sword Sect… for my complete freedom. Sect Master, are you willing to help me achieve that?" Li Fan asked with a smile.

Chapter 737: Soul-Blood Refinement of the Sword Body

“No wonder they say that merchants are never truly honest. That old fox Ji Wangxian clearly has ulterior motives.”

After listening to Li Fan’s explanation, Huo Yuzhu cursed under his breath.

Then, his expression softened slightly as he looked at Li Fan. “It seems I wrongly accused you.”

Li Fan was indifferent. “I was inexplicably placed under control. Does the Sect Master have any leads on this?”

After all, as the nominal leader of one of the Ten Great Immortal Sects, his knowledge and experience were undoubtedly exceptional.

Huo Yuzhu pondered for a moment before answering, “I once heard that the entire Ji Clan—no, the entire World Chamber of Commerce—was created by Ji Wangxian for the sake of his cultivation.”

“Although Ji Wangxian has yet to break through to the Longevity Immortal realm, all of his contemporaries have essentially perished. Even those who are still alive are aged and decrepit. Yet he alone remains eternally youthful, looking as if he were still a young man.”

“This must be related to the cultivation technique he practices. No one, aside from himself, knows exactly what it is, but it is almost certain to involve bloodlines and desire.”

“I fear it’s not just you—perhaps every cultivator of the Ji Clan is under Ji Wangxian’s control,” Huo Yuzhu said darkly.

“Then does the Sect Master know of a way to break free?” Li Fan frowned.

Huo Yuzhu did not answer immediately. Instead, he paced back and forth in deep thought.

Li Fan remained patient, waiting silently.

After a long while, Huo Yuzhu finally stopped. With a wave of his hand, he cast multiple layers of restrictions, sealing the chamber’s space completely.

Only then did he whisper, “Our Heavenly Sword Sect possesses a secret art that mimics the process of forging a sword. It refines a cultivator’s soul and flesh into the Supreme Sword Body. If successful, the sword becomes the body, and the body becomes the sword, achieving the ultimate unity between man and blade.”

“The Supreme Sword Body repels all foreign energies. Ji Wangxian’s method of control would inevitably lose its effect.”

“However…”

Huo Yuzhu paused before continuing, “This technique is extremely dangerous. Throughout the history of our Heavenly Sword Sect, only a handful of cultivators have succeeded. Even our senior disciple, who was an unparalleled genius, failed and was left with lasting afflictions…”

Without hesitation, Li Fan said directly, “I am willing to give it a try.”

Huo Yuzhu nodded slightly, his eyes showing approval. “If you truly succeed in cultivating the Supreme Sword Body, then what harm is there in making you the next Sect Master of Heavenly Sword Sect?”

“In the cultivation world, strength reigns supreme. If I can reach the same level as Senior Brother Situ, then I wouldn’t care for the position of Sect Master,” Li Fan replied indifferently.

Huo Yuzhu was momentarily speechless.

Inside the sealed chamber, the two of them discussed the matter in detail and ultimately reached an agreement.

From then on, Li Fan would act openly, drawing the attention of the entire sect, while Huo Yuzhu would secretly travel to the Five Elements Sect.

As the Sect Master of Heavenly Sword Sect, Huo Yuzhu naturally had his own supporters. Just as in real history, persuading the Sect Master of Five Elements Sect to sell the Taiyuan Essence Gold shouldn’t be too difficult.

Furthermore, having already anticipated the possibility of spies from the World Chamber of Commerce within Five Elements Sect, Huo Yuzhu would be even more cautious this time, ensuring that no information leaked.

As expected, seven days later, Huo Yuzhu returned safely.

He exchanged no words with Li Fan, merely giving a glance that conveyed everything unspoken.

Time passed. With a sufficient supply of Taiyuan Essence Gold, the forging of the World-Rifting Divine Weapon progressed at a pace several times faster than expected.

By this point, Li Fan no longer needed to extract insights from the wooden sword left behind by Mr. Bai before infusing them into the sword embryo.

Now, he simply remained beside the sword, greedily absorbing its profound mysteries, and no one objected.

Just as Li Fan sensed that this Fallen Immortal Realm was nearing the end of its existence, the World-Rifting Divine Weapon, forged with the full strength of the sect, was finally completed.

The Ji Clan seemed to have learned of this through some unknown means and sent a team of cultivators, led by Ji Shiwen, under the pretense of offering congratulations.

In truth, they had come to claim the fruit of others' labor.

The massive World-Rifting Divine Weapon stood towering, its exterior resembling ordinary gray stone—unassuming in appearance.

However, Li Fan, who spent his days comprehending the sword, could vaguely sense a terrifying power emanating from it.

Situ Yao gathered the members of Heavenly Sword Sect at the back mountain.

“The divine weapon has been forged, and everyone's contributions have been invaluable.”

“As I promised, the one who contributed the most Taiyuan Essence Gold shall become the Sect Master of Heavenly Sword Sect.”

Upon hearing this, Ji Shiwen's face lit up with joy.

But the next words from Situ Yao made his expression twist in rage.

“According to the statistics from the Elders’ Council, Huo Yuzhu contributed a total of 86,912 catties of Taiyuan Essence Gold, the highest among everyone!”

“Therefore, the next Sect Master of Heavenly Sword Sect shall continue to be him!”

The scene fell into an instant silence.

“Impossible! There's no way someone contributed more than our Ji family…” Ji Shiwen's furious voice shattered the silence.

“Hm? Are you questioning me?” Situ Yao narrowed his eyes, gazing at Ji Shiwen.

Ji Shiwen immediately choked on his words.

“Well then, let me make you accept your loss wholeheartedly. Your Ji family contributed a total of 86,911 catties of Taiyuan Essence Gold—just one cattie short…” Situ Yao shook his head slightly, appearing as if he deeply regretted it.

Ji Shiwen's eyes nearly bulged out of their sockets. He pointed a trembling finger at Situ Yao, his whole body shaking with anger.

“This is outrageous! This is outright bullying! Do you not fear being ridiculed by the world for such actions?!”

Situ Yao's expression turned cold. “Ji brat, considering that you did contribute a significant amount of Taiyuan Essence Gold, I’ll overlook your earlier remarks. But if you continue to spout nonsense…”

He snorted coldly. Ji Shiwen shuddered and had to swallow back the words stuck in his throat.

Suddenly, as if realizing something, he abruptly turned to look at Li Fan.

Yet, to his surprise, Li Fan also wore a look of disbelief, his soul seemingly lost, as if he too was utterly confused.

Thus, the selection of the Sect Master came to a dramatic conclusion.

After seeing off the guests, Heavenly Sword Sect officially began its migration into the World-Rifting Divine Weapon.

Everything that could be taken was taken.

Even the spiritual fields outside the sect were dug up and transplanted in their entirety.

The World-Rifting Divine Weapon was said to be a world of its own, so there was no concern about space limitations.

However, under Situ Yao's orders, the wooden sword left behind by Mr. Bai and countless flying swords left behind by fallen elders in the Sword Tomb remained untouched.

His explanation was that the sword intent was too strong and could conflict with the World-Rifting Divine Weapon.

As for the true reason, only he knew.

Soon, the day of departure arrived.

The disciples transformed into streaks of sword light, entering the divine weapon in waves.

Situ Yao, however, stood there watching as several powerful presences rapidly approached.

He revealed a cold and confident smile.

“There’s no need for you all to see us off. The mess left behind in Xuanhuang Realm is yours to clean up. We, Heavenly Sword Sect, simply lack the ability to do so,” he said loudly.

“Oh, by the way, I forgot to tell you—Ji Wangxian, that kid, is quite the schemer. He’s planted plenty of spies within our Ten Great Immortal Sects.”

As he spoke, he turned his gaze toward a rapidly approaching figure.

“Zhao Xuan!”

Ji Wangxian’s voice rang out from afar.

At the same time, as if beyond his control, Li Fan suddenly shot toward Situ Yao.

A strange, multicolored radiance surged from his body.

Just as he was about to reach Situ Yao, however, he abruptly stopped.

Turning his head, he cast a mocking smile at Ji Wangxian.

Ji Wangxian instantly understood everything, his face twisting in fury.

However, Situ Yao grabbed Li Fan and vanished into the World-Rifting Divine Weapon.

“Little Ji, thank you for sending us such a promising talent for Heavenly Sword Sect!”

Ji Wangxian's face was dark enough to drip water.

Raising his left hand, an endless stream of copper coins seemed to converge upon his palm.

Yet at that very moment, an incomparable burst of radiance erupted from the World-Rifting Divine Weapon.

The image of the copper coins instantly dissipated.

He could only watch helplessly as a sword light tore through the heavens.

That overwhelming, time-and-space-severing power forced even him to flee a thousand miles away to evade its might.

When the light finally faded, Heavenly Sword Sect and the World-Rifting Divine Weapon had vanished without a trace.

Chapter 738: Iterative Dissociation Disc

Inside the World-Rifting Divine Weapon.

Li Fan saw Ji Wangxian’s furious expression suddenly freeze. Not just him— the entire Xuanhuang Realm seemed to have fallen into a state of stillness.

A moment later, the scene accelerated, playing at hundreds or even thousands of times the normal speed.

Li Fan saw several figures arriving late and engaging in battle with Ji Wangxian. In the end, Ji Wangxian was forced to retreat in disgrace, seemingly suffering serious injuries.

Inside this body of "Ji Zhaoxuan," Li Fan suddenly felt his thoughts clear, his mind and body feeling inexplicably refreshed.

Then, he witnessed the impact of the World-Rifting Divine Weapon tearing through the Xuanhuang Realm. The once spirit-rich and cultivator-friendly Heavenly Sword Mountain had become a perilous place. Thunder and storms raged, and black spatial rifts would occasionally split through the sky— eerily similar to the chaotic rift-vortex Li Fan had encountered in the real world.

And then...

Li Fan vaguely saw a white-robed figure standing alone before the ruins of the World-Rift, silently gazing ahead. With a gentle wave of his hand, the devastation suddenly calmed, the anomalies gradually fading, and space slowly stabilizing.

After finishing this, Mister Bai did not linger and swiftly disappeared.

The images then changed even faster.

Various sects sent their cultivators to seize control of the Heavenly Sword Sect’s territory. None were willing to back down, leading to a full-scale war.

A great calamity descended, and countless cultivators slaughtered each other.

The skies darkened, the land was littered with corpses, and for a long time, no living souls could be seen.

...

"These…"

"Are these scenes of the future?" After the images twisted into an unrecognizable mess, Li Fan turned to Situ Yao in a daze and asked.

Situ Yao continued staring intently at the images beyond the divine weapon. After a while, he finally looked away.

Raising his wine gourd, he took a long swig before replying, "Not the future— this is the present."

Li Fan's eyes narrowed.

The scene outside had turned completely dark, as if a lost traveler had stepped into an eternal night. The Heavenly Sword Sect now faced an entirely unknown fate.

"Senior Brother, can we truly succeed in rending the realm apart?" In the darkness, a lurking sense of dread and unease rose within Li Fan, compelling him to ask.

Situ Yao took another swig before answering, "Who knows? After all, we’re probably the first ones to try escaping from the Xuanhuang Realm."

"If we fail, we’ll just die. Staying behind wouldn’t be much better— we’d probably die sooner or later anyway."

As if in response to Situ Yao’s words, the World-Rifting Divine Weapon suddenly dimmed.

Then, it froze completely.

Like a shattered mirror, it splintered into countless fragments.

Back in the distorted space, Li Fan gazed at the three now-dim orbs of light ahead of him, lost in thought.

"One breath inside the World-Rifting Divine Weapon equals decades or even centuries outside. It’s similar to the Immortal Ruins. Indeed, only a force capable of distorting time and space could break free from the Immortal Ruins’ constraints."

After pondering for a long time, Li Fan finally returned to the real world.

Having fulfilled Ji Zhaoxuan’s final wish, he should have gained some kind of reward.

However, after checking, he was a bit surprised.

It wasn’t Ji Zhaoxuan’s "Breath-Exhaling Sword Technique," but rather— a pile of sword embryo essence stones.

Li Fan’s expression grew strange as he counted— there were exactly 326 pieces.

Casually taking one in hand, he felt a sudden surge of insights about the Dao of the Sword flooding into his mind.

Even stranger, he felt a faint sense of familiarity— as if he had once wielded this knowledge before.

"These should be the Sword Embryo Primal Stones that Ji Zhaoxuan once absorbed in real history. They contain the true essence of swordsmanship from the [Sword]. For sword cultivators, they might be quite valuable. But for me, they are of little use."

"With Xu Bai, that human-shaped Dao comprehension machine, just give him an ordinary wooden sword, and he will comprehend everything on his own. It would just take some time, that’s all."

"On the other hand, the material of these Primal Stones is quite good. They could be used as forging materials for World-Rifting Divine Weapons or to reinforce the Xuanhuang True Cauldron, so that when we break into the Immortal Ruins in the future, it will last a little longer."

Li Fan kept half of them and threw the remaining hundred or so to Fang Zaiji.

Fang Zaiji was fully immersed in researching the [Endstone Plate] at the moment, carefully directing Jiang Yushan and Liu San as they cautiously cut into the stone disc. He casually stored the Sword Embryo Primal Stones away without paying much attention to them.

Li Fan observed for a while but did not interfere.

He then returned to the secret chamber.

"The rewards gained in the Fallen Immortal Realm are closely tied to resolving one's obsessions. These Sword Embryo Primal Stones, in the context of the [Heavenly Sword Sect's Divine Forging] scenario, are quite ordinary. It seems that the owner of the obsession maintaining that time-space fragment is not Ji Zhaoxuan."

However, Li Fan already had some suspicions in his mind. He pondered for a moment before setting the matter aside.

He took out two relics of Huangfu Song—the [Dissociation Disc] and the [Heaven-Measuring Mirror].

First, he examined the Heaven-Measuring Mirror.

It had already turned into an ordinary mirror, completely unresponsive no matter how he tried to probe it with his divine sense.

"No wonder, even though Huangfu Song borrowed it from Ji Hongdao, when we went to the Universal Courtyard to inform them of Huangfu Song's death, they didn't request to reclaim it. It should be the same as the Tianxuan Branch Mirrors across various prefecture—once its bestowed power is withdrawn, it loses all its mystical properties."
