Li Fan played with it in his hand for a while, feeling a slight sense of regret.

He then turned his attention to the [Dissociation Disc].

Compared to when it was first exchanged, the light of the Dissociation Disc in his hand seemed slightly dimmer.

The difference was subtle—if one didn’t observe carefully, it would be easy to overlook.

But Li Fan knew this was because the other eight Dissociation Discs had already begun their process of iteration and evolution.

As for his own...

No, rather, as for Huangfu Song’s Disc, it was still in its initial state, with its abilities gradually being absorbed by the others.

"Huangfu, oh Huangfu… It’s not that I didn’t preserve it for you—it’s disappearing on its own. You can't blame me for that."

Muttering to himself, Li Fan held the Dissociation Disc in his palm.

In an instant, the Dao Deviation Stone in his mind radiated a brilliant blue light, and countless foundational formation patterns were inscribed into the Dissociation Disc.

Under normal circumstances, cultivating the Disc required a cultivator to first outline the basic framework of the formation in their mind and then infuse it with divine sense. Basic formations could be completed in an instant by an Formation Master and were not much trouble.

However, as the formations became increasingly complex, the effort and time required would also grow exponentially.

Yet, thanks to the secret technique of the [Transformation of the Divine Dao], Li Fan had no such concerns.

Since he started learning formations under Zhang Zhiliang, all the countless formations he had encountered were meticulously stored in the Dao Deviation Stone. There was no need for him to recall or outline them manually—he could simply access them at will.

At first, this advantage was not particularly obvious.

But as the Dissociation Disc evolved and required increasingly complex formations, the difference would become more and more apparent.

Of course, anyone capable of exchanging for a Dissociation Disc in this world was already a dragon among men.

The remaining eight individuals must have their own secret techniques as well.

Li Fan would not underestimate any of them.

Aside from the Transformation of the Divine Dao technique, he had other cards up his sleeve.

Chapter 739: The Wall of Boundless Enlightenment

In his mind, Li Fan couldn't help but recall the detailed explanation that Master Hongdao had given in his past life about the Dissociation Disc.

"The more formation data the Dissociation Disc absorbs, the stronger its ability to break formations becomes. Likewise, its capacity for deduction and iteration also grows exponentially. It’s unimaginable what heights it may reach in the future."

"Who’s to say that, in your hands, the Dissociation Disc won’t evolve into a second Tianxuan Mirror?"

...

For the Dissociation Disc to complete its transformation, it required fuel—in the form of various formations. Li Fan had immersed himself in formation techniques across multiple lifetimes. While he might not rank among the top formation masters in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, his breadth of knowledge was second to none.

Zhang Zhiliang’s [Infinite Law], He Zhenghao’s [Hundred Veins of Mountains and Rivers Formation], the Medicine King Sect’s [Great Dream of Spring and Autumn Formation]...

Even the [Tianxuan Spirit-Locking Formation], which had yet to appear in this era, or the [Life-and-Death Reversal Grand Formation] from the mysterious zone of life and death—legendary formations of unparalleled power.

Li Fan was intimately familiar with them all.

If he had to personally set up these formations, he might find himself somewhat lacking. However, if it was only about virtual deduction and calculation, there would be no difficulty whatsoever.

In the competition of the Nine Discs, obtaining the complete Dissociation Disc was not Li Fan’s sole goal—it was also a test.

A test to determine whether the Dissociation Disc, as a secondary entity derived from the Tianxuan Mirror, still maintained a connection to its original form.

His method of testing was simple—the [Tianxuan Spirit-Locking Formation].

This formation had been the very foundation upon which the Mysterious Net was built in his past life. If the Dissociation Disc shared a connection with the Tianxuan Mirror, then the mirror should be able to perceive the state of its derivative entity. By infusing the Dissociation Disc with the data of the Spirit-Locking Formation, Li Fan expected that forces within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance loyal to the Tianxuan Mirror would take immediate notice.

If that happened, they would surely track down the Dissociation Disc's location.

On the other hand, if the Dissociation Disc completed its transformation without causing any disturbances, it would confirm the claim that secondary entities were completely severed from the Tianxuan Mirror upon separation and could be regarded as independent beings. At least, the Dissociation Disc would be.

"It may be risky, but it's worth a try."

Li Fan narrowed his eyes, his pupils reflecting countless swiftly changing formations.

The Dissociation Disc in his hand glowed faintly, responding to his calculations.

Meanwhile, in Tianliang Prefecture, Xu Bai was facing an unexpected predicament.

Since taking on the role of Communication Envoy, he had handled the placement of the influential clans’ descendants from other prefectures into various non-critical positions within Tianliang Prefecture. His management had been smooth, keeping all parties satisfied.

However, just recently, a cultivator named Guan Changge, hailing from Tianyu Prefecture, had gone missing.

In these times, death was not as alarming as disappearance.

If one died, the Rebirth Mansion ensured that they could be reborn in eighteen years. But if someone went missing...

The possibilities were endless.

Xu Bai was acquainted with Guan Changge’s elder—a powerful figure named Guan Xingxiu, the Commander of the Tianyu Prefecture Garrison Institute. A man of his status would normally not personally intervene in such matters; at most, he would send subordinates to inquire.

Yet, Guan Xingxiu had personally come to Tianliang Prefecture, and his demeanor suggested he was ready to demand accountability.

This clearly indicated that something unusual was at play.

The newly appointed City Lord of Tianliang, Nangong Shiyong, had solemnly promised to give Guan Xingxiu a satisfactory explanation.

After temporarily appeasing Guan Xingxiu, Nangong Shiyong immediately turned to Xu Bai and assigned him the task.

In a secret chamber, his expression was serious.

"This matter seems suspicious. We had only just received the report, and yet, Guan Xingxiu arrived almost immediately, as if he had already known in advance..."

"This is most likely aimed at us. Investigate the situation first. I will head to the Immortal Alliance Headquarters. If you uncover anything significant, do not act rashly. Wait for my return."

With those instructions, Nangong Shiyong departed in haste.

Xu Bai, now tasked with the investigation, set aside his other duties and proceeded to the last known location of Guan Changge.

Tianliang Prefecture, Wuliang Mountain.

"Guan Changge disappeared right here, right before your eyes?" Xu Bai asked while scanning the mountain with his spiritual sense.

The three cultivators accompanying him nodded repeatedly, looking deeply anxious.

One of them explained, "We've heard that strange phenomena sometimes appear on the Boundless Wall of Wuliang Mountain, much like the Mortal Ascension to God Wall. So, we decided to come and observe it. However, just as we arrived and were trying to locate the exact position of the Boundless Wall, Brother Guan suddenly vanished."

Another added, "At first, we thought he had left due to some urgent matter, so we didn’t think much of it. But after we finished observing the spectacle of the Boundless Wall and returned to Tianliang City, we still couldn’t reach Brother Guan. That’s when we realized something was wrong."

"Not only did we fail to reach him via talisman communication, but even when I attempted a divination using objects he left in my care, I couldn’t get any results." said the last cultivator, Fu Xingchi.

Xu Bai flew above Wuliang Mountain, scanning the area but sensing no abnormalities.

Given his close connection with Heavenly Dao, if there were something wrong with this location, he should have been able to perceive it.

It seemed unlikely that the problem lay with Wuliang Mountain itself...

Wait.

Xu Bai suddenly thought of something and asked, “Where exactly is this so-called Boundless Wall?”

Fu Xingchi was momentarily stunned before pointing toward a canyon below. “It’s at the bottom of the mountain.”

“Take me there,” Xu Bai said in a deep voice.

The three others didn’t understand his urgency, but knowing this matter was of great importance, they dared not refuse.

Leading Xu Bai, they arrived before the Boundless Wall.

Originally, the mountain was covered with scattered rocks and vegetation, but as they neared the bottom, the surface suddenly became smooth as a mirror.

Even the mountain streams reflected clearly upon it.

Xu Bai gazed at the massive mirror-like rock face, which was approximately three hundred zhang (around 1,000 meters) in length and over fifty zhang (about 170 meters) in height. He saw his own reflection within it.

When he reached out to touch it, it was as cold as jade.

“At the time, did you witness the so-called phenomenon?” Xu Bai asked.

Fu Xingchi nodded. “The manifestations of the Boundless Wall do not appear at fixed intervals. Sometimes, they occur multiple times in a single day; other times, it can go years without appearing. It all depends on one’s fate.”

“We were quite lucky last time—we saw the image of a cultivator practicing swordsmanship within it. Though the sword moves were slow, they seemed to contain supreme sword techniques. Our minds were completely captivated by it, unable to pull away.”

“Can you recreate what you saw?”

“I can.”

With that, Fu Xingchi retrieved a brush and began drawing in the air.

Moments later, just like a water-mirror technique recording the scene, a vivid depiction of the cultivator practicing swordsmanship appeared before everyone.

“Brother Fu, your brushwork is truly extraordinary—it looks exactly as I remember it,” one of the other cultivators praised.

Xu Bai stared at the swordplay scene for a long time before suddenly asking, “Does Guan Changge know swordsmanship?”

Fu Xingchi was stunned on the spot.

He quickly responded, “Are you suspecting that the figure appearing in the Boundless Wall was Brother Guan?”

“That’s impossible. Brother Guan cultivates the Dao of Music—he doesn’t know swordsmanship,” Fu Xingchi firmly denied.

“I’ve heard that Brother Changge deeply admires Senior Guan Xingxiu. He often laments that he cannot wield sword techniques as earth-shattering and divine as Senior Guan,” another cultivator suddenly recalled.

As soon as these words were spoken, everyone fell into silence.

Unconsciously, they all turned toward the Boundless Wall, an unsettling chill rising in their hearts.

Xu Bai was the first to break the heavy silence. “For now, this is just speculation without concrete proof. Temporarily seal off Wuliang Mountain and prevent anyone from approaching. I need to return and check if similar incidents have occurred before.”

Fu Xingchi and the other two cultivators wore grave expressions but nodded in understanding.

Xu Bai hurried back to Tianliang City and requested access to past records.

Sure enough, he found something suspicious.

Over the past century, there had been occasional reports of cultivators mysteriously vanishing.

However, they were all wandering cultivators without strong backgrounds.

After their disappearances, only their close companions would report the incidents to the Immortal Alliance.

The path of cultivation is fraught with dangers, and life and death are unpredictable.

Investigations had ruled out Five Elders Association spies, but without any useful leads, the cases were ultimately left unresolved.

And so, the Boundless Wall had silently swallowed countless nameless cultivators over the years—yet no one had ever noticed.

Until now.

TL:- The term "Wuliang" also translates to "Boundless," but to avoid confusion with "Boundless Wall" and keep the flow natural, I’ve opted to leave it as "Wuliang Mountain." Otherwise, we’d end up with a bit too much "boundless" bouncing around—Boundless Mountain, Boundless Wall—and that might feel repetitive. Hope that keeps it clear and easy to read!

Chapter 740: The Divine Sword That Can Fell Stars

After roughly understanding the cause of the incident, Xu Bai did not rush to make a fuss. Instead, he first informed the Tianliang Prefecture Garrison to temporarily seal off Wuliang Mountain and detain Fu Xingchi and his two companions. He then held his position and patiently awaited the return of Tianliang City Lord, Nangong Shirong.

Since Nangong had specifically instructed him before leaving, as a subordinate, it was his duty to comply.

Moreover...

For years, the Boundless Wall had been swallowing cultivators, causing numerous disappearances. Strictly speaking, Li Fan, could not be entirely absolved of responsibility.

After all, before becoming the City Lord of Tianliang, Nangong Shirong had served as the commander of the Tianliang Prefecture Garrison. For such a significant matter to have occurred within his jurisdiction without his awareness…

If someone were to accuse him, no matter what, he would undoubtedly be charged with dereliction of duty. Nangong Shirong had not been in office for long, and his foundation was still unstable. His rise to power had been built upon stepping over Xiang Rongxin, which had already earned him many enemies. If he were to make even a single misstep and reveal a weakness, it could incite a collective attack against him. In that case, before he could even settle into his position, he might be forced out.

As a trusted confidant, Xu Bai naturally had to share his lord’s burdens.

After secretly backing up records of the past disappearance cases, Xu Bai headed to the Bureau of Governance to receive Guan Xingshu, who had once again come to demand answers.

Unlike his previous life when Xu Bai had met him in Lanlin Prefecture, where he had appeared indifferent and lazy, Guan Xingshu now radiated an aura as sharp as an unsheathed sword, making no effort to conceal his edge.

“I greet Senior Guan.” Xu Bai cupped his hands and bowed.

“Any news on Changge’s whereabouts?” Guan Xingshu narrowed his eyes as he examined Xu Bai. His previously aggressive tone softened slightly.

“We have found some clues. I believe we will have an answer for you soon.” Xu Bai replied calmly, neither humble nor overbearing.

“With such inefficiency, had this been in Tianyu Prefecture, you would have been dismissed and investigated long ago.” Guan Xingshu snorted coldly.

Xu Bai lowered his head without responding.

“I’ll give you seven more days. If there is still no definitive result by then…”

A golden flying sword suddenly shot out and hovered above the Bureau of Governance.

“Don’t blame me for being ruthless!” Guan Xingshu’s voice turned icy as his figure gradually faded.

All that remained was the golden sword, exuding a chilling killing intent.

"The Falling Star Divine Sword…"

The sheer presence of its killing intent was so tangible that it pricked Xu Bai’s skin, forcing him to step back. Looking up at the golden flying sword, he seemed to witness a scene of the sword soaring through the sky, causing countless stars to fall.

He was no stranger to this sword.

In his previous life, when he and Huangfu Song traveled to Lanlin Province to establish the Tianxuan Spirit-Locking Formation, they had specifically invited Guan Xingshu’s Falling Star Divine Sword to suppress the defiant local cultivators. At the time, even though Guan Xingshu had already fallen to the Soul Transformation realm, with this golden sword, he had swept through all obstacles. Even Dao Integration cultivators had to avoid its edge.

This alone was enough to prove the extraordinary nature of the Falling Star Divine Sword.

Now, as Xu Bai gazed at the golden flying sword, he did not feel anger but rather focused on studying it carefully.

"This sword is no weaker than the elders of the Heavenly Sword Sect. No wonder Guan Changge holds such admiration for it."

Feeling the sword’s unparalleled sharpness, carrying the intent to cleave all in its path, Xu Bai became fully immersed in its aura.

He was only brought back to reality by the furious yet apprehensive voice of Nangong Shirong.

"That old bastard! This is too much! If only I could defeat him..."

Xu Bai pretended not to hear the latter part of the complaint and cupped his hands.

"My lord, you have returned."

“No wonder Old Guan was in such a hurry. As soon as Guan Changge got into trouble, he rushed over to hold someone accountable. So it turns out that Guan Changge is the son of his old lover.” Nangong Shirong waved his hand, signaling Xu Bai not to be overly formal. Then, he sat down heavily and said with a hint of schadenfreude.

“So, Guan Changge is Guan Xingshou’s illegitimate son?” Xu Bai suddenly realized.

However, Nangong Shirong’s next words caught him off guard: “No. There’s no actual blood relationship between them. It’s just the same old tragic love story—one of unfulfilled affections. Old Guan may appear ruthless and merciless, but deep down, he’s a hopeless romantic. Even though his old lover had long since married someone else, he never forgot her. He even extended his care to her son, treating him with deep concern.”

“If it weren’t for my visit to Lord Jicheng, I wouldn’t have known about this at all,” Nangong Shirong said with a half-smile.

Xu Bai simply listened quietly, his face showing no unusual expression. The banter between Dao Integration-level Immortal Sages was not something a small Nascent Soul cultivator like him could interfere in.

"Immortal Sage Jicheng, the Chief Marshal of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s Defense Division. In the previous era, he perished prematurely due to a curse after the great war with the Five Elders Association. Yet in this lifetime, he’s still alive and well, holding great power over the Defense Division. Judging from Nangong Shirong’s tone, his connection with Jicheng seems quite deep," Xu Bai thought to himself.

"When that old bastard Guan Xingshou loses his temper, few people can stop him. Not even for Lord Jicheng’s sake. We need to get rid of him quickly. How’s the investigation into Guan Changge’s disappearance?" After muttering to himself for a while, Nangong Shirong finally asked.

Xu Bai then gave a detailed report on his findings regarding the past disappearances of cultivators in Tianliang Prefecture.

“The Boundless Wall?” Nangong Shirong’s eyes flashed with surprise as if something had come to mind.

“Besides you, who else knows about this?” he asked quickly.

“I have not spoken of it. I was waiting for your return,” Xu Bai responded decisively.

Nangong Shirong was very satisfied. “Good. The previous disappearances—just pretend they never happened. It was merely an isolated case! We can’t allow others to make baseless connections.”

“Next, you’ll come with me to the Boundless Wall. Let’s see if we can rescue that brat, Guan Changge,” Nangong Shirong commanded.

“I obey!”

Without gathering too many people, Nangong Shirong led only Xu Bai and three other trusted Nascent Soul cultivators to the foot of Wuliang Mountain.

At that moment, the smooth mountain surface showed no unusual images.

They did not get too close but observed from a distance.

“I came here once before, back when I was a Nascent Soul cultivator. I had quite the encounter at the time.”

Seeming to have fallen into old memories, Nangong Shirong’s gaze became dazed. After a long while, he spoke in a slow voice.

The other three Nascent Soul cultivators remained silent, but Xu Bai, with a trace of surprise in his voice, asked, “Could it be that, my lord, you once saw an anomaly on the Boundless Wall?”

Nangong Shirong chuckled. “Not just saw it—I was once trapped inside the Boundless Wall.”

“But I broke out quickly, so I thought it was just an illusion from my Dao enlightenment. Over the years, I never heard of anyone else experiencing the same thing, so I gradually forgot about it.”

Chapter 741: Seeking the Dao Without Breaking the Barrier

"Only when I heard you mention that Guan Changge might have been swallowed by the Boundless Wall did I remember," Nangong Shirong said with a sigh.

"Since my lord has once entered the Boundless Wall and broken through it, then rescuing Guan Changge should be an easy task, right?" One of the accompanying cultivators, Yan Yiqiu, immediately flattered.

Nangong Shirong's expression darkened. "I wouldn't be so sure. Whether it works or not depends on that kid’s luck."

Realizing his mistake in excessive flattery, Yan Yiqiu's face fell, and he quickly lowered his head.

At this moment, Xu Bai interjected, "My lord, what exactly is so special about the Boundless Wall?"

Nangong Shirong looked at Xu Bai, who was filled with curiosity, and after a moment of contemplation, he explained, "I cannot be certain, but based on my experience, I can speculate. The Boundless Wall might be a natural place for enlightenment. When visions appear upon its surface, there is a chance that nearby cultivators will be drawn into it."

"Inside the Boundless Wall..." Nangong Shirong narrowed his eyes. "It is as if the [Spirit Awakening] function of the Tianxuan Mirror has been activated. No, it surpasses [Spirit Awakening] by several times. The moment a thought arises, countless insights flood in. That kind of joy, the thrill of effortless understanding—I can still recall it vividly."

"But there is a downside. This heightened comprehension ability seems to apply only to the specific Dao that you are most obsessed with. At that time, I was entirely fixated on comprehending..."

Nangong Shirong paused, skipping over the details of his own cultivation before continuing, "I was already one step away from my breakthrough. With the amplified enlightenment, it didn’t take long before I achieved realization. Naturally, I then broke through the wall and emerged."

Xu Bai glanced at the Boundless Wall, connecting it to the clues he had gathered before, and mused, "It is said that Guan Changge deeply admires Guan Xingshu and reveres Senior Guan’s swordsmanship. Yet, he himself lacks the talent for sword cultivation..."

"If even with the Boundless Wall’s enlightenment boost, he still needs ten years or more, then it’s no wonder he has gone missing."

"Moreover, the cultivators who accompanied Guan Changge claimed that the visions they saw on the Boundless Wall depicted swordsmanship. This aligns with your lordship’s speculation..."

Xu Bai shared his deductions all at once but attributed them solely to Nangong Shirong's theory.

Nangong Shirong neither confirmed nor denied it.

After a while, he added, "The flow of time inside and outside the Boundless Wall may not be the same. Furthermore, if one remains inside too long, even if they attain enlightenment, they may still be unable to leave."

"So if we are to save Guan Changge, we must act quickly."

At this, Yan Yiqiu spoke up, "Then, my lord, how do we enter the Boundless Wall?"

Nangong Shirong turned his head, his expression darkening. "Are you asking me?"

"I wouldn't dare!" Yan Yiqiu hurriedly explained.

Nangong Shirong let out a cold snort. "If I knew, why would I have brought you all here?"

Yan Yiqiu inwardly cursed himself, wishing he could slap himself for his foolishness.

Meanwhile, before Nangong Shirong could finish speaking, Xu Bai had already flown back down to the Boundless Wall.

He pondered to himself, "Since this is not some eerie anomaly but a natural place of enlightenment, then with this body’s high affinity to the Heavenly Dao, I should be able to sense something."

After observing for a long time, he still could not detect anything unusual.

After some thought, Xu Bai reached out both hands and touched the wall.

Closing his eyes, he remained motionless for a long time.

Under Nangong Shirong’s gaze, Yan Yiqiu and the other three followed Xu Bai’s example, placing their hands on the Boundless Wall to explore it.

Before the luminous surface of the wall, it was as if four stone statues had suddenly appeared.

As Xu Bai persisted in his efforts to sense his surroundings, the once-solid wall ahead seemed to gradually soften.

His body also became supple, as if slowly merging into the wall itself.

After a brief hesitation, Xu Bai did not resist.

Instead, he allowed the Boundless Wall to swallow his body.

In an instant, amidst the astonished cries of Yan Yiqiu and the others, Xu Bai vanished without a trace.

Nangong Shirong, however, remained fixated on the spot where Xu Bai had disappeared, his eyes flashing with an unreadable expression.

Since he had already learned the secrets of the Boundless Wall from Nangong Shirong beforehand, Xu Bai's first thought upon entering was, "How can I move the Boundless Wall?"

He had not seriously expected this to be possible, so when countless thoughts surged into his mind involuntarily, he was somewhat surprised.

However, it was clear that he had wasted this rare opportunity for enlightenment.

According to the Boundless Wall’s own response, moving it without disrupting its enlightenment function…

was simply impossible.

The birth of the Boundless Wall was purely a chance occurrence. Even the heavens and earth themselves could not easily replicate it.

Xu Bai felt a slight sense of regret, but he quickly regained his composure.

Having completed an enlightenment session, he was not immediately expelled by the Boundless Wall. Instead, he began searching for Guan Changge’s whereabouts.

The scenery inside this space resembled that of the Root of Heaven and Earth, where a cultivator’s body was represented by abstract, distorted lines. However, unlike the orderly, singular lines of the Root of Heaven and Earth, the lines here shimmered with dazzling colors, swaying like seaweed drifting in water.

Xu Bai keenly noticed that, as time passed, some of the lines that formed his body were slowly dissolving, merging with the Boundless Wall.

Occasionally, he would see vague silhouettes devoid of vitality, with only their outer contours remaining. These seemed to be the remnants of cultivators who had mistakenly entered the Boundless Wall but never left, becoming one with this space.

Moving swiftly through the Boundless Wall, Xu Bai soon located Guan Changge, guided by the intermittent fluctuations in the surroundings.

At this moment, Guan Changge’s body had already shrunk to the size of a seven- or eight-year-old child, though he remained completely unaware of it. He clumsily swung a few sparse lines in his hand, which represented a sword.

“Guan Changge!” Xu Bai attempted to call out, trying to awaken him.

However, in the Boundless Wall, sound did not exist. Some of the lines from Xu Bai’s body seemed to flow away and disappear into the surroundings, yet they failed to catch Guan Changge’s attention.

Without hesitation, Xu Bai flew directly to his side and seized the sword from his hands.

Then, without another word, he willed his mind to take Guan Changge and leave.

But at the last moment, the part of Guan Changge that Xu Bai was holding actively detached from his body.

Startled, Xu Bai looked at him, only to see Guan Changge meeting his gaze before shaking his head slightly.

His already shrunken body contracted even further, yet a new sword emerged in his hands. His expression was one of obsession and determination as he continued to swing it.

“At dawn, the Dao I comprehend, By dusk, my life may gladly end.”

Xu Bai felt a slight stir in his heart.

After a brief silence, he no longer forced the matter.

Holding onto a part of Guan Changge, he broke through the Boundless Wall and departed.

Chapter 742: The Divine Ability That Cuts Life

"So, this is why he became a fool?"

Nangong Shirong looked at Guan Changge, who had reappeared but now resembled a dull-witted child, constantly grinning foolishly. His expression turned somewhat strange as he asked.

"That's right." Xu Bai nodded. "Most of his divine consciousness is immersed in comprehending the Sword Dao and refuses to return. There’s nothing I can do about it…"

"Cough, cough…" Xu Bai couldn't help but cough.

Having part of his body devoured by the Boundless Wall, he could clearly feel a certain weakness overcoming him, as if his vital energy and spirit had been extracted, leaving him with an overall sense of incompleteness.

"This seems somewhat similar to my [Thread Extraction] divine ability, but while Thread Extraction leans more toward bodily disintegration, this one feels like a part of the body is being cut away…"

In an instant, Xu Bai was once again lost in comprehending divine abilities, momentarily dazed.

Thinking he was still suffering from severe injuries within the Boundless Wall, Nangong Shirong reassured him, "It's fine. You've done your best. If that kid refuses to come back on his own, there's nothing we can do."

"Besides, as long as we return with his intact body, it will be enough to explain things to Old Guan. Now, go and rest. Leave the rest to me. I’d like to see whether Guan Xingshu will still cherish this foolish and dazed son of his." After instructing Xu Bai to rest, Nangong Shirong let out a cold laugh.

Xu Bai accepted the order and retreated, yet his mind remained deeply immersed in comprehending divine abilities.

The others assumed it was merely because of his injuries and paid no further attention to it.

Ten Days Later, in Tianliang City

Xu Bai suddenly woke from his epiphany, his eyes flashing with a sharp glint as he looked toward a bird soaring past outside his window.

With no warning at all, the bird—locked under Xu Bai’s gaze—suddenly lost control and plummeted from the sky.

It flapped its wings frantically, barely managing to stabilize itself midair, but its flight was noticeably slower than before.

Xu Bai withdrew his gaze, satisfied.

"To silently sever a living being’s life force… Compared to Thread Extraction, this technique is far more concealed. It can be cast instantly, making it nearly undetectable. Others would simply feel their body inexplicably weaken."

"And if combined with [Thread Extraction], attacking both internally and externally… it could instantly erase someone from existence."

"Together, these two techniques shall be called [Extracting Threads, Cutting Life]."

...

Xu Bai let out a long breath and slowly rose to his feet.

The saying goes: One who wields a sharp weapon is bound to harbor the intent to kill.

With his divine abilities advancing to a new level, a fleeting thought arose in Xu Bai’s mind—he wanted to find someone to test it on.

But before he could act on the impulse, the desire dissipated on its own.

His gaze sharpened as he noticed something unusual.

This clone of his had not cultivated the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra. If his true body had given rise to such thoughts, it would have taken considerable effort to suppress them.

But now…

Xu Bai recalled the sight of Guan Changge, willing to face death in pursuit of enlightenment within the Boundless Wall. Strangely, he felt a sense of pity and admiration—emotions that his true self would never have.

With Li Fan’s temperament, he would have simply dismissed it as Guan Changge seeking his own demise, a fool who didn’t know his limits.

"Is this the influence of this physical body?"

Xu Bai narrowed his eyes.

"Enjoying the benefits of a peerless comprehension ability… but also bearing the burden of a shifting temperament."

"Xu Ke… Mister Bai…"

The main body carried the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra, but the clone did not pay much attention to this detail.

After leaving the resting courtyard and inquiring about the follow-up to Guan Changge’s disappearance, Xu Bai noticed something unusual.

Since Nangong Shirong had successfully brought the person before them, Guan Xingshou could no longer use this matter as an excuse to make trouble.

However, what Guan Xingshou did next shocked everyone in Tianliang Prefecture, who had originally been prepared to watch the drama unfold.

Right in front of Nangong Shirong and the gathered cultivators, Guan Xingshou summoned the Falling Star Divine Sword and directly executed the foolishly muttering, drooling Guan Changge.

"Such disgraceful behavior utterly tarnishes your mother’s reputation. Better to die early—eighteen years later, I will seek you out again."

Before striking, Guan Xingshou spoke these words with absolute indifference.

Golden sword energy surged, leaving nothing behind—not even a trace of flesh or blood. Guan Changge was reduced to ashes on the spot.

The cultivators of Tianliang Prefecture were astounded by Guan Xingshou’s ruthless decisiveness.

Even Nangong Shirong’s expression turned stiff as he offered words of condolence.

Yet Guan Xingshou gave him no face at all, cutting through the void and leaving immediately.

Although Nangong Shirong’s face showed some displeasure, he ultimately sighed in relief—at least the bringer of misfortune had departed.

What happened next left Xu Bai somewhat perplexed.

By all accounts, he had been instrumental in resolving this situation. Yet for ten whole days, Nangong Shirong treated him as if he had been forgotten. Not only was there no reward—there wasn’t even a word of acknowledgment.

On the contrary, the three cultivators Yan Yiqiu and his companions, who had merely tagged along and repeatedly irritated Nangong Shirong, received various rewards.

Xu Bai meticulously reviewed every detail of his involvement, contemplating what might have gone wrong.

After a long time, he finally had an epiphany.

There had been no mistakes. From beginning to end, he had performed flawlessly.

And that was precisely the problem.

He had entered the Boundless Wall, despite knowing its unpredictable dangers that could devour cultivators at any moment, and yet had pressed forward without hesitation.

Within mere moments, he had discovered a way through the Boundless Wall and even managed to bring back Guan Changge.

If the one who had accomplished all this was a trusted cultivator personally trained by Nangong Shirong, then perhaps he would have been overjoyed.

But let’s not forget—Xu Bai was an outsider. A cultivator of unknown origins who had pledged allegiance only halfway through.

Nangong Shirong was not so naive as to believe that a few words alone could earn someone’s unwavering loyalty.

Which meant that Xu Bai’s excessive dedication only aroused his suspicion.

"So, in the end, I was too clever for my own good." Xu Bai shook his head with a wry smile.

However, he didn’t dwell on it.

He simply continued to carry out his duties with diligence and professionalism.

At the same time, he subtly expressed grievances to his fellow cultivators about the injustice he had suffered.

As these murmurs reached Nangong Shirong’s ears, his doubts began to subside.

Yet he still did not entirely lower his guard.

Xu Bai pretended to be unaware, acting as if everything was as usual.

Time Flies.

Two years passed. Anchored in Year 22.

In Longevity Valley—

A dazzling white light suddenly burst from the Dissociation Disc in Li Fan’s hand.

Countless talismanic formations emerged from the disc, shifting and transforming at high speed.

As the brilliant light slowly faded, Li Fan keenly noticed that his Dissociation Disc had grown larger.

"This means that in the struggle of the Nine Discs, the first failure has occurred," he thought to himself.

Before he could carefully examine the now-ascended Dissociation Disc, an ecstatic voice suddenly rang out.

"Sect Master! I have finally discovered the exact usage of this Endstone Plate!"

The Eye of Shared Vision flew to Li Fan, darting up and down in excitement, drawing streaks of golden light in the air.

Chapter 743: The Rebellious Son of Tianxuan

"Oh?" Li Fan showed a hint of surprise—he hadn't expected Fang Zaiji and the others to have progressed so quickly.

Guided by the Eyes of Shared Vision, Li Fan arrived at the experimental site.

What he saw was the Endstone Plate, originally indistinguishable from an ordinary rock, now floating above the heads of Fang Zaiji and his two companions. Around it, space seemed to be separated into distinct layers following different rules, forming concentric rings of various colors, frozen in place. The sight was truly peculiar.

A wisp of black baleful energy, under Jiang Yushan's control, was slicing through the circular rings surrounding the Endstone Plate.

Li Fan did not interrupt; instead, he stood by and observed.

Before long, he began to grasp the process. Jiang Yushan's method of cutting was not simply removing a portion from the disc—it was more like "peeling off a layer of rice paper," slicing out a flat plane from the plate instead.

She seemed quite experienced, performing the operation with skilled precision.

Soon, a thin Endstone Fragment was separated from the main plate.

The moment it left the main body, the originally plate-sized fragment began to rapidly shrink.

Both the attached rings and the fragment's size were continuously decreasing.

"Quick! Feed it, now!" Fang Zaiji shouted urgently.

As he spoke, he tossed several stones toward Jiang Yushan.

Li Fan focused his gaze—it was none other than the Sword Embryo Primal Stones he had casually given to Fang Zaiji earlier!

The primal stones, upon approaching the Endstone Fragment, melted into it like snowflakes falling into water.

Meanwhile, the fragment's rate of shrinkage slowed down and gradually stabilized.

After a total of six primal stones had been fed to it, the surrounding circular space contracted inward, merging back into the fragment itself.

And just like that, a miniature version of the Endstone Plate formed before Li Fan's eyes.

"Damn, this was harder than delivering a baby! Don't you think so, Yushan?" Fang Zaiji exhaled deeply, beaming as he held the plate in his hands.

"You really have no filter! How can you even compare the two?" Liu San scolded with furrowed brows.

At that moment, Li Fan spoke up. "Mr. Fang, have you discovered the specific use of the Endstone Plate?"

Fang Zaiji waved the disc in his hand with a smug expression. "Indeed. All thanks to those strange stones you gave me earlier, Sect Master..."

He then proceeded to explain.

For a long time, Fang Zaiji had been unable to make sense of the Endstone Plate. Frustrated, he eventually followed Li Fan’s suggestion and attempted to cut it apart.

However, he discovered that any piece cut from the stone plate immediately dissolved into thin air. No matter what method they tried, nothing could prevent this from happening.

Enraged, Fang Zaiji decided to take a desperate gamble—he dumped every potentially useful item from his storage ring onto the plate.

By sheer luck, he stumbled upon the key to stabilizing the plate.

That key was to feed it objects infused with the comprehension of the Dao and the principles of heaven and earth.

Not only did the Sword Embryo Primal Stones work, but any treasure that condensed Dao insights could achieve the same effect.

The reason Fang Zaiji had just used primal stones was simply that he had plenty of them left. Treasures containing profound Dao insights were incredibly rare, after all.

"This thing is just like a cultivator," Fang Zaiji mused, stroking the disc in his hand. "When it's newly ‘born,’ it knows nothing. So at first, it doesn’t exhibit any strange properties. But if you ‘nurture’ it with Dao comprehension, allowing it to ‘grow,’ then its true potential will emerge!"

He continued, "Just as you said, Sect Master—this thing doesn’t have many uses, but it does have one unique ability: it can, to some extent, block the perception of the Tianxuan Mirror!"

Just as he finished speaking, a disciple from the Medicine King Sect entered the room.

He held a Tianxuan Mini-Mirror in his hand, his expression tense.

"Greetings, Sect Master!" He first saluted Li Fan, then greeted Elder Liu San and the others in turn.

Li Fan recognized this person. His name was Meng Wushi, one of the first Medicine King Sect cultivators to awaken. He had already obtained the status of a Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance cultivator, and after switching to the New Method, he had successfully broken through to the Golden Core Realm.

"Demonstrate it for the Sect Master," Fang Zaiji instructed.

Meng Wushi nodded, first taking out a pile of top-grade spirit stones and placing them around the Endstone Plate.

Then, he activated the exchange function of the Tianxuan Mini-Mirror.

A beam of dim light shot out from the mirror’s surface, first illuminating the spirit stones.

"Would you like to exchange?" The Tianxuan Mirror’s prompt appeared.

After Meng Wushi confirmed, the spirit stones instantly vanished.

Then, Meng Wushi placed the Endstone Plate within the range of the dim light.

However, this time…

The Tianxuan Mirror showed no reaction at all.

It was as if it could not even perceive the existence of the disk!

"Clearly, this was born from the Tianxuan Mirror, yet its only function upon maturity is to counteract the mirror itself. What a rebellious creation!" Fang Zaiji remarked, though his eyes gleamed with admiration.

"So far, we have only tested it with the Tianxuan Mini-Mirror. We are uncertain whether it will still maintain its shielding effect when facing the regional Tianxuan Sub-Mirrors or even the Tianxuan Mirror’s true body," Liu San added cautiously.

Li Fan took the disk into his palm and examined it carefully. He found it remarkably similar to the Calamity Stone created by the Heaven-Suppressing Society in his previous life.

"How many Endstone can be cut from this Endstone Plate?" This was a critical question. If only a limited number could be produced, they would have to be reserved for key figures. But if it could be endlessly replicated...

In response to Li Fan’s question, Fang Zaiji gave a precise answer:

"From what we have observed so far, the Endstone Plate does not appear to diminish when we cut pieces from it. However, this might be because we have only cut a small number so far. We need further testing to confirm."

Li Fan nodded, handing over more than a hundred Sword Embryo Primal Stones to him. Then, he instructed Liu San:

"You can work through Jiao Xiuyuan to acquire treasures that condense and embody the principles of Heaven and Earth. With the contribution points we have accumulated over the years, we should be able to sustain the Endstone Plate’s production for a while. The more, the better. This will be of great use to us in the future…"

As if validating Li Fan’s words, a line of golden text suddenly appeared on the Tianxuan Mini-Mirror in front of them:

"Due to special circumstances, the functions of the Tianxuan Mirror are temporarily unavailable. Please try again later. We apologize for any inconvenience."

Liu San and the others were stunned.

They knew very well that the Tianxuan Mirror was a supreme immortal artifact. And now, it was experiencing a malfunction…

Unconsciously, all eyes turned toward Li Fan.

"The final transformation of the Tianxuan Mirror... is it finally happening?"

A sharp light flashed in Li Fan’s gaze.

Suddenly, a sense of danger surged within his heart.

Chapter 744: The Tresure Mirror’s Ascension

Chapter 744: The Tresure Mirror's Ascension

As his thoughts raced, Li Fan furrowed his brows. He could not determine the source of the faint yet persistent sense of crisis.

However, his intuition had always been sharp—ignoring it was not an option.

"This must be closely tied to the Tianxuan Mirror..."

Li Fan murmured to himself while gazing at the newly created Endstone Plate that Liu San and the others had just completed.

"Can this formation amplify its effects and extend a barrier over the entrance of the Longevity Valley?" Li Fan suddenly asked.

"It should be possible, but Sect Master, why do you ask so suddenly...?" Fang Zaiji replied with certainty before abruptly realizing something, his expression turning grim.

"Could it be..." Liu San's face also showed shock.

Li Fan did not explain further but instead urged them to complete the task as quickly as possible.

At the same time, his attention shifted to Xu Bai.

Over the past two years, Xu Bai had gradually regained the trust of Nangong Shirong through his actions.

Currently, in Tianliang City, chaos reigned due to the temporary failure of the Tianxuan Mirror.

Tens of thousands of cultivators who had been in seclusion inside the mirror for cultivation were forcibly ejected onto the streets, which were previously somewhat empty but now packed with people.

Even the Administrative Hall, Martial Hall, and Protectorate Hall had fallen into varying degrees of disorder.

The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance depended heavily on the Tianxuan Mirror. Now that it had abruptly ceased functioning, the impact was immediate and significant.

With no clear understanding of what had happened, cultivators began to feel anxious.

"Could it be another battle with the Five Elders Association?"

"This doesn't look good. Even the Tianxuan Mirror has been affected. By the way, does anyone here know much about the Five Elders Association?"

Just as the situation was on the verge of spiraling out of control, Nangong Shirong appeared in time to clarify the situation.

As Li Fan had speculated, the sudden failure of the Tianxuan Mirror was indeed due to its evolution and transformation.

However, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance officially referred to this process as Ascension.

"Since the founding of the Rebirth Mansion, another epoch-defining event is about to take place. You all need only wait patiently—there is no need for panic!"

With Nangong Shirong's explanation, the cultivators quickly set aside their worries.

Instead, excitement filled the air as they enthusiastically discussed the ascension of the Tianxuan Mirror.

For ordinary cultivators of the Immortal Alliance, the Tianxuan Mirror was an integral part of their daily lives—an indispensable existence.

Now that it was undergoing ascension, further evolving, anticipation soared among the crowd.

"The current Tianxuan Mirror is already nearly omnipotent. If it truly ascends, just how powerful will it become?"

"Transactions, communication, spirit awakening, Dao discussions, divination—these functions already exist. What new abilities will the upgraded Tianxuan Mirror introduce? This is so exciting!"

"Hmph, what does this have to do with us ordinary cultivators? Do you really think it will start handing out cultivation techniques for free? We'll still have to struggle to earn contribution points.

...

Cultivators Engaged in Heated Discussion.

The Tianxuan Mirror did not keep people waiting for long.

Seven days later, the Tianxuan Mirror returned to normal. All its functions appeared unchanged from before.

However, cultivators soon discovered something unexpected when they attempted to leave the Tianxuan Mirror—a prompt appeared before them:

"Would you like to generate a personal version of the [Tianxuan Treasure Record]?"

"Tianxuan Treasure Record? What is that?" Cultivators asked in confusion.

The Tianxuan Mirror’s response made their hearts race with disbelief:

"The Tianxuan Treasure Record can be considered an extension of the Tianxuan Mirror. It is generated for free and can be carried by cultivators at all times."

"In addition to the regular functions of the Tianxuan Mirror, such as transactions and communication, it also acts as the cultivator’s personal eye, recording everything they see and hear in perfect detail for future review."

"Furthermore, the Tianxuan Treasure Record can provide personalized cultivation guidance based on the individual’s condition. It can deduce techniques and divine abilities, and it even allows virtual battles through spiritual sense simulation to improve actual combat ability."

"There are many other features—cultivators are encouraged to explore them on their own."

A single stone stirred up a thousand waves.

Cultivators stared blankly at the Tianxuan Mirror's explanation, hardly able to believe their eyes.

The sheer power of the Tianxuan Treasure Record was astonishing—comparable to legendary immortal artifacts.

If it were sold for tens of millions of contribution points, cultivators would still scramble to obtain it. Yet, what were they seeing now?

Such a miraculous treasure… being offered for free?

When did the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance become the world's greatest charitable organization?

Given past experiences, some cultivators chose to remain cautious and observe.

Others, who had nothing to lose, immediately chose to accept.

Not long after, their feedback spread throughout the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance:

"There is no physical object—it seems to be directly generated within the sea of consciousness and can be accessed with a single thought."

"It’s incredibly convenient! The experience is leagues ahead of the Tianxuan Mini-Mirror I spent hundreds of thousands of contribution points on. My heart aches…"

"No need for communication talismans anymore! Everything can be done through the Tianxuan Treasure Record. You can even transfer items instantly! Tsk tsk, those merchants profiting from inter-state trade are doomed!"

"The personalized cultivation guidance… is real? The Tianxuan Mirror advised me to stabilize my foundation before breaking through, warning that the calamity of heaven would be especially severe otherwise…"

"Damn it! Why does deducing techniques and divine abilities still cost contribution points? That spiritual sense battle mode is fun, though—it feels exactly like real combat! Even if you 'die' in battle, the worst that happens is some spiritual sense depletion."

With such widespread praise, even those who had hesitated at first changed their minds and rushed into the Tianxuan Mirror, eager to generate their own Tianxuan Treasure Record.

Xu Bai carefully read through all the user feedback, his breath involuntarily hitching.

"Isn't this just an upgraded version of the Mysterious-Net from my past life?"

All its functions were essentially extensions of Mysterious-Net's divine abilities.

However, unlike the past life—where Mysterious-Net relied on the Tianxuan Spirit-Locking Formation spread across the entire Xuanhuang Realm—this time, the Tianxuan Treasure Record used cultivators themselves as its carriers.

Perhaps the method was different, but the outcome would be the same.

Such an extraordinary artifact was nearly impossible for cultivators to refuse. Once every cultivator integrated the Treasure Record into their body, the influence of Mysterious-Net in this era would undoubtedly rival that of the past.

"If it can provide cultivation guidance, that means it has full insight into a cultivator’s internal condition. Its authority is definitely higher than the Tianxuan Mirror. Even if the Mirror scans it, it may not detect anything unusual."

"But I won’t take that risk."

"However, my clones could try… or maybe…"

A thought suddenly struck Xu Bai—the Endstone Plate.

"I wonder… can this thing influence the Tianxuan Treasure Record?"

Just as Xu Bai was lost in thought, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance released a new announcement.

Chapter 745: The Beginning of a Hundred Continuous Battle

The shock brought by this announcement was no less than that of the Tianxuan Treasure Record.

The announcement was titled "A Letter to the Cultivators of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance," and its main message was as follows:

"Through the tireless efforts of the cultivators of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, we have completed the full exploration of the White Mist Barrier in the Xuanhuang Realm. This is a great milestone, worthy of eternal remembrance."

"However, the path of the Immortal Dao is arduous, and the road ahead is endless. Now, an even greater and more formidable mission awaits us all."

"As is well known, apart from the towering White Mist Barrier, which divides the states of the Xuanhuang Realm, there exist countless Cave-Heavens and Small-Worlds."

"Now that the White Mist Barrier has been fully explored, it is time to advance into these small worlds!"

"Let us bring them all under the rule of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and achieve the great unification of the Xuanhuang Realm!"

"Any cultivator who contributes to this effort will receive abundant merit and contribution points."

"When cultivators carry the Tianxuan Treasure Record and encounter passages leading to cave-heavens and small-worlds, the Treasure Record will provide an alert."

"However, it is crucial to note that exploring cave-heavens and small-worlds is vastly different from exploring the White Mist Barrier. The level of danger is significantly higher. While the White Mist Barrier contained only eerie remnants and the dead, small-worlds may still harbor cultivators and species wielding unique supernatural powers. They may resist us with their lives."

"But fear not!"

"Even if you perish in battle, the merit and contribution points you have earned will not disappear. Instead, they will be inherited by your reincarnated true spirit in your next life."

"The great unification of the Xuanhuang Realm is destined to be a long and arduous process. However, with the fearless spirit of our alliance’s cultivators, this goal will ultimately be achieved!"

Some cultivators were stirred with excitement, while others were filled with doubt.

Meanwhile, Xu Bai secretly cursed in his heart—he immediately understood the source of his true self's unease.

"Fang Zaiji, is the Endstone Plate Formation ready?!"

Flying swiftly to the entrance of Longevity Valley, Li Fan asked in a deep voice.

This was the first time Li Fan had called Fang Zaiji by his full name, which immediately alerted the latter to the seriousness of the situation.

Not daring to be careless, Fang Zaiji replied, "We've done our best. However, the power within the Endstone Plate is something we've never encountered before. Constructing a formation based on it will still take some time."

Li Fan shook his head slightly. "There is no time left. Tell me the current progress of the formation."

Fang Zaiji was slightly surprised but quickly complied.

As Li Fan listened, he retrieved the Dissociation Disc and began inputting the formation prototype.

The Dissociation Disc emitted a faint glow, and countless images rapidly flashed before Li Fan’s eyes.

After half a day, the images suddenly came to a halt, and a complete formation emerged in Li Fan’s mind.

As the glow faded, Li Fan pointed into the air, transmitting the formation to Fang Zaiji, Liu San, and the others.

They immediately began setting up the formation together.

Fortunately, their luck held—the entrance to Longevity Valley was well-hidden, concealed within the mist.

Three days later, the formation was completed.

And the entrance remained undiscovered by other cultivators.

"The Tianxuan Treasure Record… It sounds like a precious artifact."

Now fully understanding the situation, Fang Zaiji had a flicker of greed in his eyes.

"It’s probably a delicious poison," Jiang Yushan sneered. "Something that can illuminate one's entire being? I wouldn't take it even if it were given to me for free."

Fang Zaiji was indifferent. "A divine artifact like this naturally requires a price to use. I don't have much of an issue with it—after all, I have nothing to hide."

As soon as he said this, he noticed that Li Fan and Jiang Yushan’s gazes had suddenly fallen on him, with a faint trace of killing intent.

Fang Zaiji let out an awkward chuckle and quickly changed the subject. "The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is making quite a big move this time. From what I know, the Xuanhuang Realm contains no fewer than tens of thousands of small worlds—not to mention the countless secret realms and cave-heavens."

"After the Great Catastrophe back then, many sects and cultivators fled into these places to seek refuge. Now, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is inciting cultivators to explore them thoroughly…"

He clicked his tongue and sighed. "It's easy to imagine the bloodshed that will soon unfold."

Liu San frowned. "Even though the small worlds and cave-heavens may not be weak, the Xuanhuang Realm now has the Rebirth Mansion, allowing cultivators to revive. How can they possibly win this fight? It’s almost certain that, despite some resistance, the small worlds will ultimately lose."

"Perhaps when the Rebirth Mansion was established, the Immortal Alliance had already planned this war against the small worlds," Fang Zaiji nodded in agreement.

Listening to their conversation, Li Fan remained silent.

In this era, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's plans were meticulously intertwined. Every step they took carried deeper meaning.

The question was—why was the Immortal Alliance going to such great lengths? Why were they making the Tianxuan Mirror accessible to everyone and launching a war against the small worlds?

What special significance did unifying the Xuanhuang Realm hold for the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance?

Almost instantly, Li Fan thought of the towering obelisks that had once stood throughout the Xuanhuang Realm in his past life.

In that lifetime, after the Xuanhuang Realm was unified, the Heavenly Alliance seemed to use those tens of thousands of obelisks in reverse—to push the Xuanhuang Realm away from the pull of the Immortal Ruins.

Yet in this life, there were no signs of such an attempt.

Was it because they lacked the power? No—more likely, it was because…

"The Tianxuan Mirror reflects all things in the world. If it can penetrate the White Mist Barrier and complete an initial ascension… and if it can then encompass countless small worlds within its reflection range…"

"Perhaps it can take another step forward!"

"If that happens, external forces might not even be necessary. The sheer power of the Tianxuan Mirror itself could be enough to free the Xuanhuang Realm from the grip of the Immortal Ruins."

Li Fan's eyes gleamed as he considered the possibility.

"No matter what, this trend is unstoppable. I must figure out how to maximize my own benefits from it."

Over the next few days, Meng Wushi of the Medicine King Sect conducted experiments.

First, he voluntarily disconnected from the Great Dream of Spring and Autumn Formation, ensuring that even if his internal condition was completely exposed, it wouldn’t implicate the Medicine King Sect.

Then, he generated his own Tianxuan Treasure Record. While activating its detection function, he repeatedly wandered near the entrance of Longevity Valley.

After maintaining this for some time, he simply flew away.

"Good thing it worked. Otherwise, we might have been in for a bitter struggle," Fang Zaiji exhaled in relief.

"It was sheer luck that I managed to obtain that Endstone Plate, which can block the Tianxuan Mirror’s perception," Li Fan added, feigning a sigh.

Liu San was quite pleased. "With this, our Medicine King Sect can stay out of the upcoming world-shaking battle. That is truly a great fortune. Perhaps this is our chance to rise again."

At that moment, Jiang Yushan also seemed lost in thought. "Perhaps we can take advantage of this opportunity to openly join the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance."

"After all, the alliance can’t possibly wipe out everyone from the small worlds. There will certainly be those who choose to surrender voluntarily."

"We might be able to blend in and completely cleanse our identities."

Chapter 746: Everyone Can Attain Nascent Soul

"Yushan makes a very good point," Liu San agreed.

Li Fan also nodded. "Let's observe for a while before making any moves. In the meantime, we should focus on producing more Endstone Plate. If possible, we should test whether it can affect the Tianxuan Treasure Record. After all, a divine artifact like that is truly tempting."

Fang Zaiji's eyes lit up as he carefully examined an Endstone Plate in his hand, deep in thought. "Sect Master, now that you mention it, both of these artifacts originated from the Tianxuan Mirror. It might really be possible to merge them in some way. However, to achieve that, we'd need to get our hands on the Tianxuan Treasure Record and study it directly."

...

Meanwhile, as the members of the Medicine King Sect pondered their future, more details regarding the conquest of small worlds were being revealed within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

When a cultivator carrying the Tianxuan Treasure Record discovers the entrance to a small world, they have two choices. One option is to explore it alone—if they can single-handedly dominate an entire world, they will receive all the merit for the discovery. The rewards for this are unimaginable. However, if they lack the strength to overcome the challenges within, they can choose to share the entrance with others.

If the entrance is made public, every cultivator with a Tianxuan Treasure Record will be notified, and they will swarm to the location.

Aside from the merit earned by reporting a discovery, the original finder can also claim a share of the contributions from those who come later. Though the percentage is small, when accumulated from a large number of cultivators, it can become an enormous fortune.

In short, whether they monopolize it or share it, the discoverer of a small world is guaranteed to become rich overnight. This policy strongly encourages cultivators to explore every corner of the realm.

Even more exhilarating is the distribution of war spoils after the small world conquest is complete.

Every cave-heaven discovered during the campaign will be cataloged in the Tianxuan Treasure Record. As long as one has enough merit, they can directly exchange it for ownership of a cave-heaven! Moreover, the discoverer of a small world has priority in purchasing its ownership.

This announcement sent shockwaves through the cultivation world, making countless cultivators restless with excitement.

In today's Xuanhuang Realm, the Nascent Soul stage is a clear dividing line in power. While forming a Golden Core relies on one's comprehension, reaching Nascent Soul requires either extraordinary luck in finding a suitable cave heaven or leveraging powerful connections to acquire one. Out of a hundred Golden Core cultivators, perhaps only one ever attains the Nascent Soul stage, highlighting the immense difficulty of the breakthrough.

But now, with the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance determined to unify the Xuanhuang Realm, all existing cave heavens will be revealed. Luck and connections will no longer be the deciding factors. Anyone who puts in the effort will have the chance to "seize the essence of heaven and earth to form their Nascent Soul!"

The golden era where everyone has the opportunity to reach Nascent Soul had arrived!

Though exhilarated, cultivators also felt an urgent pressure. Everyone knew that the number of cave heavens in the Xuanhuang Realm was finite—first come, first served. If one hesitated for even a moment, they might miss their chance at Nascent Soul forever. Their only hope would be to wait for a Nascent Soul cultivator to fall so that a new cave heaven could form.

As a result, the territories of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance were soon filled with a remarkable sight—cultivators swarming across the land like locusts, meticulously searching every inch of terrain. Deep mountains, vast lakes, dense forests, and treacherous swamps—no place was left unchecked.

The once-empty wilderness was now flooded with countless cultivators.

Only then did people realize just how many cultivators the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance actually had.

Before long, the first Small World outside the Alliance’s control was discovered.

It was named Zhuo, a barren world without spiritual energy, inhabited only by mortals.

A lucky cultivator named Cheng Shi took just three days to complete a full scan of the world using his Tianxuan Treasure Record.

No one knew the exact rewards he received, but soon after, Cheng Shi purchased a secluded residence in the Daoist district of Tianyun City. He stopped venturing outside, focusing solely on his cultivation, waiting for the Alliance to allow merit exchanges—at which point he would ascend directly to the Nascent Soul stage!

With such a vivid example before them, cultivators became even more enthusiastic.

Soon, the second and third small worlds were discovered one after another.

As the entire cultivation world fell into a frenzy, Xu Bai arrived at the Tianxuan Mirror.

"Would you like to generate a private version of the Tianxuan Treasure Record?"

The prompt from the Tianxuan Mirror echoed in his ears. Compared to its previous emotionless mechanical voice, it now carried a hint of liveliness.

Xu Bai pondered for a moment before choosing "Yes."

Within his Sea of Consciousness, a rhombus-shaped crystal, crafted using the Endstone Plate as raw material, radiated a brilliant seven-colored glow.

This was the initial plan that Fang Zaiji and his team had developed after a brief period of research.

To prevent the Tianxuan Treasure Record from secretly scanning the contents of his Sea of Consciousness, they utilized the Endstone Plate's shielding ability to protect it.

At the same time, the rhombus-shaped crystal camouflaged itself externally, continuously emitting various thoughts.

This ensured that the Tianxuan Treasure Record wouldn’t detect anything unusual.

Of course, the thoughts being exposed were deliberately sent out—trivial and insignificant—meant for the Tianxuan Treasure Record to perceive.

Simply put, it was like placing a lock in his Sea of Consciousness to prevent the Tianxuan Treasure Record from spying on it.

Through several experiments, this method had proven effective in protecting the Sea of Consciousness. Fang Zaiji was now researching ways to safeguard the physical body.

Meanwhile, his true body remained in Longevity Valley, maintaining absolute focus. If anything went wrong, he would immediately use [Truth].

As for Xu Bai, he quietly observed the changes in his Sea of Consciousness.

It felt as if an invisible ripple swept through his body.

A moment later, a small, ancient bronze mirror appeared within his Sea of Consciousness.

The rhombus-shaped crystal floated silently above it, yet the Tianxuan Treasure Mirror remained completely unaware.

"It seems everything is fine," Xu Bai thought to himself.

As soon as his divine sense connected with the mirror, a vast amount of information surfaced instantly.

Everything matched what he had previously learned—every function was intact and fully operational.

"This is truly convenient."

With a mere thought, a detailed map of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance appeared in Xu Bai’s mind.

On the map, four flashing red dots and six calm green dots were clearly visible.

"The red ones indicate worlds currently being shared among cultivators and still in the midst of conquest, while the green ones represent worlds that have already been fully explored."

Xu Bai immediately understood.

His gaze shifted toward Shilin Prefecture. Seeing that the location he remembered remained undiscovered, Xu Bai revealed a faint smile.

Exiting the Tianxuan Mirror, he rushed straight toward his destination.

That’s right—his destination was none other than the Empire created by Xu Ke!

"I wonder, what price would they be willing to pay for a treasure that grants immunity from the Xuanhuang Realm's conquest?"

"And when they see this body, which looks identical to Xu Ke, what kind of reaction will they have?"

Chapter 747: A Millennium’s Return to the Empire

With anticipation, Xu Bai quickly approached the familiar mountain valley ruins from his memory.

When Li Chenfeng returned to the Empire, Xu Bai had already discovered the entrance to the Empire through the surveillance of the Formless Killing Intent. However, he had never had the opportunity to go before—now was the perfect chance to make the journey.

In his Sea of Consciousness, the prismatic crystal once again emitted multicolored radiance, enveloping the Tianxuan Treasure Record below. Under Xu Bai's deliberate control, a series of illusory images appeared within the radiance, distorting the perception of the Tianxuan Treasure Record.

Moving swiftly, he arrived at the entrance.

After carefully searching for a while, he indeed found a spatial passage hidden by some special means.

Xu Bai looked at the Tianxuan Treasure Record, but it did not issue any warning.

"As expected, it works."

He nodded to himself but did not rush in immediately.

Sweeping his spiritual sense across the surroundings to confirm there were no cultivators nearby, he took out a Endstone Plate and set up a formation to conceal the entrance. Only then did he leap into the spatial passage.

Darkness stretched endlessly before him.

This scene was not unfamiliar to him—it closely resembled the void environment created by countless Rift Whales when passing through the Immortal-Severing Grand Formation. However, this place seemed even deeper and more unfathomable.

After a brief contemplation, Xu Bai summoned the Pure Glaze Robe, forged by Fang Zaiji, which appeared on his body as an extra layer of protection. Once properly safeguarded, he flew forward.

He had already crossed the Immortal-Severing Grand Array countless times and was long accustomed to it.

His journey through the array was smooth and uneventful, but upon emerging, he did not see any trace of a small world.

All that greeted him was the boundless, dark void.

"It seems I have drifted far from my original location due to the Realm-Splitting Whales." Xu Bai mused.

Standing in the void, he closed his eyes and focused his senses.

After only a brief moment, he vaguely detected a familiar energy fluctuation in the distant darkness.

Following this sensation, Xu Bai accelerated toward it.

Just as he was about to reach his destination, a resonant whale song suddenly echoed through the void.

Xu Bai halted abruptly.

As if triggering a chain reaction, more and more whale songs rang out, spreading one after another from near to far. The chorus continued endlessly into the distant void.

There was no way to determine just how many Rift Whales existed within this dark expanse. Their calls intertwined, echoing like a grand symphony.

Despite being surrounded by countless Rift Whales, Xu Bai felt no sense of danger.

He could tell—they were not hostile. Instead, they were joyfully calling out, as if welcoming his arrival.

"Interesting." Xu Bai’s eyes flickered as he continued forward.

The Rift Whales along the way, sensing his presence, actively made way for him.

Before long, Xu Bai arrived at the outskirts of the Empire.

From the dark void, he gazed upon an oval-shaped world. He could vaguely make out vast expanses of water—and floating in the sky, the massive corpse of the Red Nine-Headed Beast.

Just as Xu Bai was observing, the space ahead suddenly fluctuated.

Seven cultivators, clad in Beast God Armor, appeared abruptly, riding atop an eel-like beast.

"Who goes there?!"

The cultivators reacted with exceptional coordination. The moment they spotted Xu Bai, their expressions shifted slightly. They swiftly dispersed into formation, surrounding him.

However, their Beast God Armor was only at the Golden Core level—nowhere near enough to match Xu Bai.

With a faint smile, he casually waved his folding fan. Before they could react, all seven were instantly subdued.

"Mmmph…!"

Their faces were filled with shock, but they were unable to speak.

What happened next, however, left them utterly horrified.

Xu Bai gestured toward the beast they had nurtured with their own blood and tamed with their collective Heart-Linking Technique—the Void-Roaming Dragon.

To their astonishment, this once-fierce beast immediately swam toward Xu Bai with docile enthusiasm.

It even lowered its head, rubbing against him affectionately.

The sheer absurdity of the scene made the seven cultivators wonder if they were hallucinating.

Since when had the violent Void-Roaming Dragon become so obedient?

Sensing the beast’s intimacy, Xu Bai placed a hand on its head, gently stroking it.

Soon, vague images emerged in his mind.

From them, he learned its name.

"Quite a commanding name. And its ability to teleport across short distances… Even in the Xuanhuang Realm, that’s quite remarkable."

Xu Bai nodded slightly.

"Lead the way." He commanded.

The Void-Roaming Dragon let out a joyful cry, shaking its body as it actively supported Xu Bai.

At the same time, Xu Bai did not forget to seize the seven restrained individuals nearby.

With a fluctuation in space, in the next moment, Xu Bai arrived within the Empire—a human nation built upon the corpse of the Crimson Nine-Headed Beast.

Standing atop the Void-Roaming Dragon, with seven Beast God Armor Warriors restrained behind him, and an extraordinary appearance, Xu Bai's arrival instantly captured the attention of everyone nearby.

After a brief moment of stunned silence, chaos erupted in the surroundings.

"Enemy attack!"

"A cultivator!"

"Where is the Imperial Guard?"

"Quickly, summon the Holy Master Qing!"

Amid the rising cries of alarm, hundreds of figures rushed over from various parts of the city.

Some were clad in Beast God Armor, others rode upon different exotic beasts, and some even flew through the air with just their physical bodies. Judging from their auras, they were clearly cultivators like Xu Bai.

Although their numbers were overwhelming, the strongest among them was only at the Nascent Soul Realm.

With the Pure Glaze Robe protecting him, Xu Bai remained unshaken.

"Who are you?"

Realizing that Xu Bai was not an ordinary individual, the guards cautiously refrained from attacking outright and instead called out to test him.

Xu Bai did not respond but simply scanned his surroundings with his gaze.

"Why have you come here?"

The Empire's Imperial Guard cultivators shouted again.

At that moment, a streak of azure light shot out from the center of the Imperial City, swiftly arriving before Xu Bai.

"Fellow Daoist..."

The figure, Xiao Qing, came to a halt and had just begun speaking when she got a clear look at Xu Bai’s face. Instantly, she was struck by shock, as if she had been hit by lightning, freezing in place.

"Mas—"

Before she could finish the word "Master", Xiao Qing realized something was amiss.

Suppressing the turmoil in her heart, she stared at Xu Bai for a long time before finally asking:

"You are...?"

Her tone carried deep confusion.

Xu Bai smiled and said, "Daoist Qing, do you know that your Empire is about to face imminent catastrophe?"

"Audacious madman! How dare you speak such arrogant words!"

"How dare you act so brazenly before the Holy Master Qing!"

The moment these words left Xu Bai’s mouth, the surrounding crowd erupted in fury, shouting curses at him.

Yet, within Xiao Qing's eyes, astonishment only deepened.

"You... know me?"

Xu Bai gave a slight nod and then asked,

"Fellow Daoist, do you still remember the Federation of All Worlds?"

Chapter 748: The Prosperity of Ten Thousand Beasts

"The Federation of All Worlds?" Xiao Qing's body trembled slightly upon hearing the term, as countless memories surged within her mind.

"What proof do you have?" She did not believe it outright, as both Xu Bai's appearance and his timing were highly suspicious.

Xu Bai smiled faintly and transmitted the details of their previous transactions through spiritual sense.

A strange glint flashed in Xiao Qing's eyes, and she temporarily accepted Xu Bai's identity.

"Please follow me, Fellow Daoist." With a slight wave of her hand, she dismissed the surrounding guards and led Xu Bai toward a towering spire-like palace in the city.

As Xu Bai flew through the air, his spiritual sense swept over the vast architectural complex built upon the remains of the Red Nine-Headed Beast.

After thousands of years of continuous development, the once-terrifying beast's form was nearly unrecognizable.

Only in certain key locations could faint traces of its original body still be observed—such as the massive crack in its skull, now revered as a sacred site for worship, or its razor-sharp claws, which were encased in layers of mysterious metallic structures.

It seemed that the empire's capital had been established right at the beast’s former heart.

As he flew, Xu Bai gained a more intuitive understanding of this civilization, which was deeply intertwined with exotic beasts.

These creatures had truly become an integral part of people's daily lives.

In just a brief moment of observation, Xu Bai saw:

Beasts with hollow bodies, resembling massive serpentine dragons, carrying passengers as they weaved through the city.

Lion-like creatures with powerful wings, ridden by armored cultivators patrolling the skies.

Floating, eye-shaped creatures hidden in the city’s corners, periodically casting glances toward him.

Not to mention the countless exotic beasts of various shapes and sizes that the empire’s residents carried with them.

"It is indeed a unique civilization, brimming with vitality," Xu Bai silently praised.

The two moved at an astonishing speed, and in no time, they arrived at the imperial palace.

Xu Bai then realized that the towering spire he had seen earlier was actually a living exotic beast.

Or rather, not just the spire, but the entire complex spanning dozens of miles had evolved from this colossal creature.

"This beast’s power is likely on par with a Nascent Soul True Lord," Xu Bai estimated.

Given that one of them was an Imperial Holy Master, and the other carried the bloodline of the empire’s founder, the beast showed no signs of hostility.

Instead, the once smooth and seamless exterior of the spire suddenly revealed a door.

Xiao Qing glanced back at Xu Bai with a hint of doubt before entering first.

Xu Bai remained unfazed and followed closely behind.

Inside, he was greeted by a lavishly decorated chamber.

The ceiling was intricately carved with ornate patterns, the walls gleamed like white jade, the wooden floor was covered with luxurious carpets—

It was indistinguishable from an ordinary human palace, with no indication that they were inside a living beast.

The room was empty.

Xiao Qing also showed no intention of allowing others to participate in their conversation.

After gesturing for Xu Bai to take a seat, she began with a polite inquiry:

"I have yet to ask for your esteemed name, Fellow Daoist?"

"Xu Bai."

"You also bear the surname Xu?"

The moment she heard his name, Xiao Qing's aura fluctuated chaotically.

Realizing her lapse, she quickly composed herself and continued calmly:

"I should inform you—'Xu' is the imperial surname of our royal family."

As she spoke, Xiao Qing focused her attention on Xu Bai, carefully observing his expression.

Xu Bai's reaction clearly left her somewhat disappointed.

“What a coincidence,” Xu Bai said with a hint of surprise, as if he had not known about this matter before.

“Heh…”

Xiao Qing did not respond immediately. After a brief silence, she got straight to the point.

“You previously mentioned that our Empire is facing imminent catastrophe. What exactly do you mean?”

Xu Bai let out a faint sigh, his face filled with concern.
