He then proceeded to recount the recent events in the Xuanhuang Realm—the establishment of the Rebirth Mansion, the ascension of the Tianxuan Mirror, and the mobilization of cultivators to explore the cave-heaven and small worlds, all in an effort to unify the world.

When he spoke of the establishment of the Rebirth Mansion, Xiao Qing remained relatively calm.

However, the moment Xu Bai mentioned that cultivators were now carrying Tianxuan Treasure Record and actively searching for entrances to the small worlds, she could no longer suppress her shock.

“When did this happen? How is it that I haven't received any news at all?” Xiao Qing exclaimed in a slightly shaken voice.

“The Xuanhuang Realm changes in an instant. Its development has been too rapid, and the number of unforeseen events too many. It is understandable that your Empire’s spies have not yet had time to relay intelligence. Even we, the Federation of All Worlds, had anticipated the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s movements, yet we never expected them to act so swiftly and decisively.

We were a step too late, resulting in several small worlds being swiftly conquered.”

A trace of sorrow flashed in Xu Bai’s eyes. “Fortunately, your place has not yet been discovered.”

“Although we have the Federation of All Worlds, we are scattered across different regions, making it difficult to concentrate our forces. Facing the overwhelming momentum of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, we have chosen to lie low for now and preserve our strength.”

A hint of worry flickered in Xiao Qing’s eyes. “I fear that even if we can hide for a while, we won’t be able to hide forever.”

Xu Bai spoke with conviction, “That is precisely why I have come to find you. While the Tianxuan Mirror is indeed powerful and fearsome, our Federation of All Worlds has its own hidden reserves.”

“As of now, our organization has successfully developed a supreme artifact capable of interfering with the Tianxuan Treasure Record’s detection abilities.”

At this point, Xu Bai deliberately paused.

After ensuring he had Xiao Qing’s full attention, he continued, “Before I arrived, I had already activated the artifact’s power, temporarily concealing your Empire’s entrance. So for now, you have nothing to worry about.”

Xiao Qing immediately turned to look at Xu Bai, a trace of doubt appearing in her eyes.

Xu Bai chuckled softly, took out a folding fan, and gently waved it in front of his chest. “If you don’t believe me, you may go verify it yourself.”

Xiao Qing’s eyes flickered, and then she smiled knowingly. “You have traveled a great distance to come here, so naturally, I trust that you wouldn’t lie about something so important. However, what I am curious about is… how did your organization learn the location of the Empire’s passage in the first place?”

Xu Bai confidently replied, “Without a solid foundation, how could we dare to call ourselves the Federation of All Worlds? Besides, don’t forget—it was us who first approached you for a deal back then.”

“In that case, I must thank you,” Xiao Qing said with a slight smile. “But…”

She fixed her gaze on Xu Bai and added, “Your Federation has never acted without benefit. This time, you’re voluntarily offering protection—what is your price?”

With a crisp snap, Xu Bai closed his folding fan. “I enjoy conversing with intelligent people. My purpose in coming here, besides informing you of the Xuanhuang Realm’s current situation, is indeed to carry out a mission.”

Xu Bai suddenly stood up, his expression serious. “The Immortal Alliance is currently too powerful, and we have no choice but to endure for now. But as you said, hiding forever is not an option.”

“That is why we must develop a force strong enough to rival the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance—before the day of reckoning arrives.”

Chapter 749: Mr. Bai’s Sword

“We all come from different small worlds, and compared to the Xuanhuang Realm, there is a natural disparity in level. However, we also possess an advantage that cannot be underestimated.”

“And that is diversity.”

“Just as your [Empire] is able to command exotic beasts in battle, over the years, other small worlds have each developed unique and extraordinary abilities.”

“Even if these abilities are slightly inferior to the immortal arts of the Xuanhuang Realm, if we combine all our strengths and integrate the best of all worlds, it may not be impossible to formulate a system capable of rivaling immortal arts.”

Xu Bai spoke confidently.

Xiao Qing’s first reaction was to shake her head.

However, before she could speak, Xu Bai raised a hand to interrupt her and solemnly said, “It all depends on human effort. Everyone knows that the chances are slim, but at this juncture, we have no choice but to fight to the death.”

“You should be even more aware than I am of the kind of life mortals live under the rule of cultivators, right?”

“The members of the Federation of All Worlds are all rulers of their respective realms. Even if they face death, they would never willingly live as mere cattle and horses.”

“The unification of the Federation of All Worlds is an inevitable trend. As for those who refuse to join…”

Xu Bai’s expression darkened instantly. “While we won’t go to war against them, they can forget about receiving any protection from us.”

Xiao Qing spoke softly, “You need not worry, Fellow Daoist. Our Empire would never align with the Xuanhuang Realm. However, matters of the Empire are not for me to decide alone.”

“Please wait here for a moment. I need to discuss this with Her Majesty the Imperial Princess and the Imperial Council.”

Hearing this, Xu Bai nodded in understanding.

At the same time, he made a request. “I have heard that the Empire was built upon the corpse of a three-headed divine bird.”

“And that its head was severed by an immortal’s sword strike in ancient times.”

“Such a magnificent sight—since I am here, it would be a great regret if I could not witness it with my own eyes. Would you be able to fulfill this long-held wish of mine?”

Xiao Qing’s eyes flickered as she looked at Xu Bai’s smiling face.

After a brief moment, she agreed. “It’s a small matter. Since you are interested, I will arrange for someone to take you there. However, be cautious—the severed head still retains residual sword aura and lingering intent.”

Xu Bai’s face showed astonishment before turning to delight. “For the sword aura to remain after so long, it must have been a truly remarkable strike. Now I am even more eager to see it.”

Xiao Qing simply smiled without saying a word.

After she left, it was only a short while before a young woman, appearing to be around seventeen or eighteen years old, entered the room. She was dressed in a gauzy robe.

“Sir, please follow me.”

As she spoke, the young woman summoned a peculiar, balloon-like beast.

A slit opened on the surface of the sphere, and the woman stepped inside.

Xu Bai, filled with curiosity, followed suit.

Inside the sphere, there were seats for passengers. As soon as they entered, the sphere expanded once more.

It slowly floated out of the spire-like palace and swiftly soared toward the Empire’s sacred land.

The body of the balloon-like beast gradually became transparent, allowing Xu Bai to clearly see the scenery around him.

“This is a [Flying Sphere Beast]. Once it inflates, it can soar through the skies and ride the wind at extreme speeds. It is the most common means of travel for Imperial citizens visiting the holy land,” the young woman explained in a soft, melodious voice.

“However, since you are visiting, Holy Master Qing has already given instructions to clear the holy land of all visitors temporarily, to ensure you are not disturbed.”

…

Under the gentle guidance of the woman’s voice, they soon arrived at one of the severed heads of the Red Nine-Headed Divine Beast.

“This is one of the Nine Holy Temples.”

Xu Bai followed the young woman into the silent temple. The moment he stepped inside, he faintly heard wailing and agonized howls.

The floor and walls were covered in pitch-black stone slabs, giving the temple an austere and eerie atmosphere.

Without needing further direction, Xu Bai instinctively followed the source of the sounds, heading deeper into the temple.

The further he went, the louder the sorrowful cries of the beast became.

According to the young woman’s introduction, these were not merely echoes of the Red Nine-Headed Beast’s final cries before its death…

It was not the divine bird itself but the countless exotic beasts slaughtered and sacrificed over the years by the empire to quell its ferocity, whose collective wails formed a mournful chorus.

Every temple had witnessed the tragic deaths of an untold number of these creatures.

The entanglement of countless vengeful spirits was enough to turn an ordinary area into something akin to an underworld of torment.

Yet, within this temple, though there was an eerie atmosphere, no spirits had manifested to cause trouble.

This was solely because of a sharp and unparalleled sword aura that had been suppressing them all along.

"Swish..."

A strand of hair drifted down for no apparent reason, causing Xu Bai to stop in his tracks.

Ahead of him, black flesh twisted and coiled like tangled vines, forming a grotesque mass.

From time to time, it would wriggle slightly, making it hard to believe that this was the corpse of a monstrous beast that had perished thousands of years ago.

And floating just above this black mass was a red sword aura—

Like a long, drifting thread.

In truth, ordinary cultivators could not perceive this red thread of sword aura.

Let alone the common folk of the empire.

They could only infer the remnants of "immortal sword aura" from the continuously suppressed black flesh and the bursts of sword energy that occasionally flared outward.

But Xu Bai could see everything clearly.

Even...

Xu Bai closed his eyes slightly.

A vivid image suddenly emerged in his mind.

A streak of crimson light illuminating the heavens and earth—so swift that even lightning seemed sluggish in comparison.

Its contained sharpness seemed capable of splitting the world itself.

"It looks like a thread, but in truth, it is..."

"A sword."

Gazing at the red line before him, Xu Bai pondered for an unknown length of time before murmuring, deep in thought.

"Is this the red thread gifted by Mister Bai...?"

"Compared to the wooden sword he casually crafted in the Fallen Immortal Realm, this red-threaded sword exudes an even stronger intent of slaughter."

"Rather than a pure sword, it carries a trace of judgment within it."

A flood of insights surged into Xu Bai’s heart.

In his mind, he could almost see the figure of Mr. Bai—casually flicking a single thread.

And in that instant, the unparalleled ferocious beast, the Red Nine-Headed Beast, perished on the spot.

…

Lost in his enlightenment, Xu Bai remained unaware of the passage of time.

The young girl in the gauzy dress did not dare to disturb him and simply stood silently behind him.

Not far from Xu Bai, separated by only a single temple wall—

Xiao Qing and a graceful young woman were watching him intently through the transparent barrier.

"So, can you confirm it?" Xiao Qing asked, a rare trace of urgency flickering in her eyes.

The young woman had kept her eyes closed the entire time.

Her eyelashes trembled incessantly, sweat beading on her face.

After a long moment, she suddenly opened her eyes.

"How can this be…?"

Her expression was filled with shock.

"When I look at him, it's as if I am looking at myself!"

Chapter 750: Nine-Headed Beast Unceasing Even in Death

"This feeling..."

"It's truly incredible."

The young girl's voice carried a hint of fascination. "It's like looking into a mirror and seeing another version of myself. An inexplicable sense of closeness wells up in my heart."

"Master Qing, what exactly is happening?"

Hearing the girl's confirmation, Xiao Qing's eyes flickered with disbelief.

"Could it be..."

Meanwhile, Xu Bai remained unaware of what was happening just beyond the wall.

At this moment, his entire focus was immersed in the realization of the Red Rope Sword Intent.

As his comprehension deepened, the red rope that was suppressing the black flesh seemed to come alive. It floated gently beside Xu Bai, affectionately circling around him.

No one knew how much time had passed when Xu Bai suddenly opened his eyes and flicked his fingers lightly.

A barely visible red light flickered between his fingertips before shooting toward the twisted mass of flesh in front of him.

For a brief instant, the eerie wails echoing throughout the temple came to an abrupt halt.

Although they resumed shortly after, this unusual occurrence left the veiled woman standing behind Xu Bai utterly shocked.

"My lord..." She couldn't help but speak.

Xu Bai, however, raised a hand to stop her from asking further questions. His gaze was fixed on his wrist, where an unexpected thin cut had appeared.

With the physical resilience of a Nascent Soul cultivator under the New Method, even wounds inflicted by blades or swords should have healed in an instant.

Yet this minor cut seemed innate—impossible to erase.

"Such severe side effects?" Xu Bai frowned slightly.

"It seems that Xu Ke's disappearance back then may have been related to his repeated use of the Red Rope Sword Technique."

"A wooden sword embodies the principles of all sword techniques, yet it cannot strike first."

"A rope sword possesses unparalleled killing intent, but it demands the user's life in exchange."

A sharp glint flickered in Xu Bai's eyes. "So they both have limitations... Interesting."

Xu Bai proceeded to explore the remaining eight temples one by one.

Beyond gaining a deeper understanding of the Red Rope Sword Technique, he also witnessed firsthand the three remaining heads of the fallen Red Nine-Headed Beast, which refused to rest even in death.

One of the heads had already been hollowed out by the Empire’s people, leaving behind only a bleached skull.

The other two, however, remained eerily lifelike—just as they had been at the moment of death.

Even from a distance, Xu Bai could feel the overwhelming malice and resentment emanating from them.

"What a monstrous creature!"

This was Xu Bai's first encounter with a true Ancient Ferocious Beast, and he couldn't help but feel a chill in his heart.

"A thousand years after death, its ferocity remains undiminished. I can only imagine how terrifying it must have been at the height of its power. And to think that someone was able to slay it with nothing more than a single red cord..."

Xu Bai's mind wandered, pondering the legendary figure known as Mr. Bai.

After completing his observations, Xu Bai returned to the palace atop the high tower.

There, he saw a veiled woman seated beside Xiao Qing.

The moment he laid eyes on her, an inexplicable sense of connection arose within him.

Curious, he raised his right hand.

To his surprise, the veiled woman mirrored his action in perfect synchronization.

No words had been exchanged, yet their movements were eerily identical.

It was as if a mirror stood between them, reflecting their actions.

Apart from a slight difference in appearance, the veiled woman was almost identical to himself.

"The Holy Blood Embryo Transformation."

In that instant, Xu Bai understood the cause of this strange phenomenon.

And at the same time, he recognized the veiled woman's identity.

She was the Imperial Princess.

Xu Ke’s descendant, the nominal ruler of the empire.

However, he clearly could not reveal himself.

Feigning extreme shock, he abruptly stood up, pointed at the imperial princess, and exclaimed, “What is going on?”

Xiao Qing carefully observed every nuance of Xu Bai’s expression, trying to detect any flaw. But to her disappointment, she found none.

Xu Bai’s reaction was almost identical to that of the imperial princess.

“It seems he is also unaware of his true identity,” Xiao Qing thought to herself.

“What do you mean by that, Fellow Daoist?” she still decided to probe further, feigning ignorance.

By this point, Xu Bai seemed to have recovered somewhat from his initial shock. He stared at the imperial princess, his eyes filled with deep confusion.

“This person is...? Although it’s my first time meeting her, I feel an inexplicable sense of closeness and familiarity.”

“It’s not an illusion. I feel the same way,” the imperial princess softly replied.

Xu Bai appeared even more shaken.

Turning to Xiao Qing, he asked, “Fellow Daoist, what exactly is going on?”

Xiao Qing held his gaze for a long time before finally speaking. Instead of answering, she countered with a question:

“Daoist Xu, how much do you know about your own lineage?”

“My lineage?” Xu Bai was momentarily stunned.

“I am merely a descendant of ordinary mortals. I originally lived in a small world. Later, by a stroke of luck, I joined the Federation of All Worlds and embarked on the path of immortality. My blood relatives have long since passed away...”

“Why? Is there something wrong with my lineage?” Xu Bai asked.

Xiao Qing studied Xu Bai’s eyes, as if trying to discern whether he was speaking the truth.

After a long silence, she finally gave up.

Then, Xiao Qing took out a portrait. The figure in the painting looked almost identical to Xu Bai.

“This is…” Xu Bai continued to feign ignorance.

“This is the founder of the empire. He was also my master,” Xiao Qing said in a solemn tone. “His name was Xu Ke.”

“Many years ago, he bid farewell to everyone. Since then, he has vanished without a trace.”

Xu Bai stared at the painting, seemingly overwhelmed by the weight of this revelation, standing there in a daze.

After a long while, he finally spoke slowly:

“He also had the surname Xu. Could it be… that I am a descendant of Xu Ke?”

“At present, that seems to be the only reasonable explanation,” Xiao Qing said, though her tone carried a hint of uncertainty.

“Daoist Xu, where exactly is your homeland? From what I know of my master, he was not the type to take a wife or father children...” Xiao Qing asked, seemingly out of nowhere.

“My homeland is…” Xu Bai started to speak but suddenly stopped.

Snapping back to his senses, he immediately turned the tables. Looking at Xiao Qing and the imperial princess, his face was filled with suspicion.

“Daoist Qing, are you toying with me like a child? What an unbelievable coincidence!”

“Speak. What exactly is your purpose?” Xu Bai coldly fixed his gaze on Xiao Qing.

Faced with Xu Bai’s sudden change in attitude, Xiao Qing was momentarily taken aback.

Then, she let out a bitter laugh.

“To be honest, I also find it hard to believe. But everything aligns too perfectly. As if it were destined… That after thousands of years, when I had already given up, I would meet you.”

“As for whether my words are true, there is a way to find out immediately.”

After saying this, Xiao Qing exchanged a glance with the imperial princess.

The imperial princess took out a scepter and lightly tapped it against the ground.

Suddenly, a hole appeared in the floor, swallowing all three of them in an instant.

Xu Bai did not resist.

In the next moment, he found himself in a vast space with no visible end.

Rows upon rows of different exotic beast corpses filled the area.

In the distance, various mechanical devices also seemed to be arranged in an orderly fashion.

Xu Bai attempted to move forward but quickly discovered that an invisible barrier blocked his path.

“This is the empire’s treasury, where the accumulated wealth of thousands of years is stored.”

Chapter 751: The Eternal Empire

"The rulers of the empire, throughout history, have had to undergo studies here from birth. Only after mastering the vast knowledge preserved within can they formally inherit the throne."

"And the Imperial Treasury—only those with royal blood may enter," Xiao Qing explained.

"But I can't enter right now, can I?" Xu Bai shook his head slightly.

"Perceive it with your heart, and this invisible barrier will cease to exist," the Imperial Princess said softly.

With that, she personally demonstrated. Stepping forward, she passed through the barrier effortlessly and entered the Imperial Treasury.

Xu Bai, upon hearing this, closed his eyes.

Sure enough, an indescribable feeling surged through his mind.

In the boundless darkness, he seemed to hear the rhythmic beating of a heart—coming from all directions.

Recalling what he had seen earlier, it appeared that the entire imperial palace was formed from the body of some massive, mysterious beast.

Xu Bai suddenly understood.

The Imperial Treasury might just be the heart of this creature.

The empire’s various exotic beasts all originated from Xu Ke's secret methods of cultivation.

Since he carried Xu Ke's bloodline, it was only natural that this place could not keep him out.

With newfound clarity, Xu Bai took a step forward. It felt as though he had passed through a thin, transparent membrane. The next moment, he found himself inside the Imperial Treasury.

Rather than immediately inspecting the artifacts within, he turned to the Imperial Princess and Xiao Qing. "I made it inside, as expected. But that doesn't prove anything."

"Only those with royal blood may enter..."

"That claim," Xu Bai shook his head slightly.

The Imperial Princess smiled. "There’s no need for you to be so suspicious. Take a walk through the treasury, and you will understand."

"This place is filled with the empire’s most valuable treasures. Aren't you afraid I'll just take a few for myself?" Xu Bai asked.

"If you wish, you could take everything here. But in truth, the most precious thing inside isn't the artifacts—it's the memories of the empire’s past rulers," Xiao Qing replied casually.

The Imperial Princess simply gestured toward Xu Bai in invitation.

Xu Bai let out a cold snort and casually flew toward an exotic beast—a winged turtle.

"Silent Soaring Turtle: Lifespan of up to 300 years. Its meat can treat hyperactivity, mania, and similar conditions. However, caution is advised—its blood is harmful and reduces lifespan if consumed."

A voice echoed in Xu Bai’s mind, accompanied by a vivid image.

The person in the vision bore a striking resemblance to Xu Ke.

He was seated at a research table, dissecting a Silent Soaring Turtle while meticulously recording his findings.

Before Xu Bai could fully absorb this information, another vision emerged moments later.

This time, the researcher was a woman—she, too, bore some resemblance to Xu Ke.

"New discovery: The wings of the Silent Soaring Turtle can be used as material for constructing aerial ships, maintaining high-speed flight while minimizing noise."

The scene continuously flickered and changed.

The protagonist shifted through more than a dozen individuals, and research on the Silent Soaring Turtle advanced steadily.

In the end, a technique capable of mass-producing Silent Soaring Turtle was developed. This allowed them to complete a full life cycle in just three years, significantly reducing cultivation time.

The scene disappeared. Xu Bai savored the countless new pieces of information in his mind before looking at the Imperial Princess.

"What is this?"

"The Empire’s first ruler was cultivated using the Holy Blood Embryo Transformation by Holy Emperor Xu Ke."

"The second generation of emperors was created in the same way."

"And so on, passed down from generation to generation."

"In essence, the imperial bloodline throughout history is actually the same person—Holy Emperor Xu Ke." The Imperial Princess smiled as she spoke.

Xu Bai had already known this but still feigned shock and horror. "What kind of wicked sorcery is this?"

"How can technology be classified as good or evil?" The Imperial Princess shook her head.

"Although we share the same flesh and blood, we each have independent consciousness. You may consider us as different individuals."

"However, due to the connection established by the Holy Blood Embryo Transformation, our thoughts can resonate and synchronize."

"What you just experienced was the accumulated research of past emperors on the Silent Soaring Turtle."

"Before each ruler passes away, besides undergoing the Holy Blood Embryo Transformation Method, they must also leave behind their will within the Imperial Vault."

"The successor will inherit the vast majority of their predecessors' wisdom and experience."

"Thus, the ruler of the empire will only grow stronger with each generation."

"Only in this way can an eternal empire be established."

The Imperial Princess spoke indifferently, her tone carrying a trace of grandeur.

"An eternal empire…" Xu Bai sneered, refusing to acknowledge her claim. "Forget about Longevity Immortals, even Dao Integration cultivators—do you really think they would fear your so-called empire?"

Hearing this, the Imperial Princess froze, her face flushing red.

Xu Bai swept his gaze over the Imperial Treasury and then asked, "Although this place holds numerous strange and unique records, truly valuable ones are few."

"I'm in a hurry to report back. Speak—what are the Empire's most powerful technologies?"

"If you have enough bargaining chips, I might be able to secure better terms for you in the Federation of All Worlds." Xu Bai hinted.

The Imperial Princess glanced at Xiao Qing, who was standing outside the invisible barrier.

Seeing Xiao Qing give a slight nod, she hesitated briefly before replying, "Our definitions of 'valuable' may differ."

"From the perspective of the Empire’s strategic goals, the most advanced technologies we possess are:

First, the method to cultivate and control Rift-Whales.

Second, Void Coordinate Locator.

"With these two technologies, the Empire can continuously open void passages and move as far away from Xuanhuang Realm as possible," the Imperial Princess explained.

Xu Bai smirked with ridicule. "I've heard of your ridiculous plan from my fallen comrades."

"The idea isn't bad, but..."

"If it were really so easy to leave Xuanhuang Realm, don’t you think someone would have done it long ago? Do you really believe it's your turn?"

"Those cultivators who fled into small worlds to take refuge during past calamities—why do they still long to return to Xuanhuang Realm instead of escaping altogether?"

"It's not that they don’t want to—it's that they can’t."

"I advise you to abandon this unrealistic fantasy and join our Federation of All Worlds instead..."

The Imperial Princess remained unfazed by Xu Bai’s mockery.

Instead, she firmly interrupted him. "What if our goal was never to escape Xuanhuang Realm in the first place?"

Xu Bai was momentarily stunned.

"Not escaping Xuanhuang Realm? Then why go through all this effort?"

The Imperial Princess smiled faintly. "To buy time."

"The farther we move from Xuanhuang Realm, the lower the chances of being affected when catastrophe strikes."

"At the same time, we wait patiently."

"Because one day, a savior will emerge to rescue Xuanhuang Realm from its apocalyptic fate."

Chapter 752: The Only Future

Hearing the Imperial Princess's firm response and seeing the unwavering determination on her face, Xu Bai almost laughed out loud.

"This is your plan?"

"Placing all your hopes on some illusory, unknown great hero who may or may not even appear?"

Xu Bai shook his head repeatedly. "It seems the organization has really overestimated your value."

Despite Xu Bai’s condescending attitude, the Imperial Princess remained unfazed.

Instead, her eyes gleamed with steadfast conviction. "The savior we've awaited for thousands of years, the one we've desperately longed for, will eventually appear!"

"Before the Xuanhuang Realm completely falls into ruin."

"This is the sacred belief passed down from the Holy Emperor. No matter what policies the empire’s rulers have enacted throughout history, none can go against this principle."

The moment those words left her lips, Xu Bai, who had been ready to mock her further, suddenly fell silent as a thought crossed his mind.

There was no doubt—the only person capable of making Xu Ke believe so deeply was none other than Mr. Bai.

"So you're saying that Mr. Bai foresaw that, in a few millennia, a heaven-sent prodigy would descend to save the Xuanhuang Realm from catastrophe?"

Xu Bai couldn’t help but feel that the notion was absurd.

Yet, he also recalled the ever-persistent presence of the Du'e Sect, which seemed to have some inexplicable connection to him.

Perhaps... this wasn’t entirely impossible.

At the very least, the "Calamity-Bearing" chosen by the Du'e Sect pointed directly to him.

Xu Bai furrowed his brows.

"From Mr. Bai's cultivation of the new breed of Rift-Whale to his efforts in distancing numerous mortal worlds from the Xuanhuang Realm, it’s clear that the empire’s ultimate plan aligns with that of other mortal worlds."

"The only difference is that the empire has a stronger initiative, allowing it to move further away from the Xuanhuang Realm. Meanwhile, the other worlds are merely being forced to accept their fate, unaware of what is truly happening."

"The source of this disparity lies in the connection between Xu Ke and Mr. Bai. Perhaps this was the task entrusted to Xu Ke by Lu Ya before his passing."

"But the real question is—could Mr. Bai and the Du'e Sect truly have foreseen my existence, as well as the existence of [Truth], a thousand years in advance?"

After a brief moment of contemplation, Xu Bai dismissed the idea.

[Truth] had the ability to turn truth into falsehood, to transform reality into illusion, and to return all things to their original state.

Such power would surely surpass even the legendary True Immortals.

If Mr. Bai and the Du'e Sect had truly predicted the existence of [Truth], then why would they need to wait for some prophesied savior? With their own abilities, they should have been able to resolve the crisis of the Immortal Ruins on their own.

"The Du'e Sect's methods are likely similar to Senior Brother Zhang’s—they only cast their gaze upon someone once certain conditions are met. They may even employ a broad search, meaning the so-called 'Calamity-Bearer' is not necessarily limited to me alone."

"And as for Mr. Bai..."

Xu Bai remained silent.

He still had no idea what made Mr. Bai so certain that, a thousand years later, someone would rise to save the Xuanhuang Realm.

"It can't just be because of hope, right?"

"An infinite future holds infinite possibilities. This means that no matter how small the chances may be, under the premise of 'infinity,' everything will inevitably happen." The words of Emperor Yi suddenly surfaced in Xu Bai's mind.

"Perhaps, among the countless futures deduced by Mr. Bai, there really is a possibility where the Xuanhuang Realm is saved. Just like what I saw in my past life when I merged with the object itself—as desolate as the Xuanhuang Realm had become, with all things withering and civilization crumbling, in the end, it still welcomed the light of revival. Even though I don't yet understand what transpired, in a certain sense, if the Empire can truly endure until that time, then perhaps their strategy can be considered a success."

Xu Bai seemed to have gained some insight.

Seeing Xu Bai lost in thought, the Imperial Princess did not interrupt him.

"Alright then, if this was my ancestor's judgment, then maybe there's something to it. However, it's unfortunate that, from the current situation, without the help of our Federation of All Worlds, your Empire probably won’t last until that day." A while later, after snapping out of his thoughts, Xu Bai spoke with a hint of mockery.

"Although we are somewhat distant relatives, and I’d love to help, the right to use a supreme treasure capable of concealing the Tianxuan Treasure Record is not something I alone can decide. If you don’t show some sincerity, my hands are tied." He shrugged with a helpless expression.

The Imperial Princess nodded slightly. "While you were visiting the Nine-Headed Shrine, we have already gathered intelligence regarding the changes in the Xuanhuang Realm. Rebirth Mansion, Tianxuan Treasure Record…"

"It has indeed exceeded what we can handle. After discussions, if we can exchange resources for the assistance of your Federation of All Worlds…"

"There would be no objections from anyone in the Empire. After all, those nobles are not only afraid of death, but they also fear losing their current status." Her expression remained indifferent, as if she were simply stating a mundane fact.

"Heh, it seems your Empire is even more pragmatic than I expected. Well, at least that saves me some effort in persuading you. But…" Xu Bai's tone paused, a slight smile appearing at the corner of his lips. "Given the current crisis and the immense pressure from the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, our Federation cannot spread its aid evenly across all realms. Support will be distributed based on the potential each small world demonstrates."

"So, if you want to receive more of our assistance, it depends on how many truly valuable things your Empire has to offer."

"I’ll be blunt—your so-called proud beast cultivation techniques, in our eyes, are only useful as cannon fodder. With just this alone, you won’t impress those greedy old men in the Federation." Xu Bai said coldly.

The Imperial Princess nodded slightly, expressing her understanding.

Then, she flew forward and said, "Follow me."

After traveling through the Imperial Treasury for some time, she finally stopped before a mechanical device.

The device consisted of several interlocking rings, continuously rotating, with faintly visible numbers rapidly changing within.

"This is the culmination of thirteen generations of emperors' efforts—the [Void Coordinator Trajectory Instrument]," the Imperial Princess introduced with a trace of nostalgia in her eyes.

"During void navigation, it records and preserves spatial data from the surrounding area. Based on a predetermined target, it sets a course to prevent us from getting lost in the void. At the same time, it can mark coordinates of the locations we pass by…"

"It has some use, but not much." Xu Bai interrupted, extending his hand. "Right now, our biggest concern is how to survive the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s first wave of purges."

The Imperial Princess nodded in acknowledgment. Then, she led Xu Bai to a round pearl.

"This is?" Xu Bai narrowed his eyes slightly.

From this pearl, he could sense both spiritual energy and the aura of a beast.

Chapter 753: Myriad Phenomena Molten Ancestral Beast

"This pearl is called [Spiritual Crystal Marrow]."

A trace of pride flashed across the Imperial Princess's face. "It is the latest research achievement of the Empire."

"Over a hundred years ago, we discovered certain demonic cores within the bodies of some exotic beasts that cultivators could absorb and refine for cultivation."

"The blood and flesh power of these exotic beasts unexpectedly formed spiritual energy crystals within their bodies. Although the purity of the spiritual energy was low, this phenomenon still attracted the attention of the previous Emperor."

"After more than a century of persistent research, we have gained a preliminary grasp of the technology for [Synthetic Spiritual Energy]. Although it requires a large amount of flesh as a medium, the spiritual energy crystals we cultivate have a purity level that is very close to top-grade spirit stones of the Xuanhuang Realm."

Upon hearing this, Xu Bai's eyes revealed a trace of surprise.

He carefully examined the [Spiritual Crystal Marrow] before him and slowly nodded. "Impressive. With such methods, given enough time, you might indeed be able to transform this world into a small realm suitable for cultivators. However, if this is all, it still won't significantly impact the overall situation. Let alone our Federation of All Worlds, even any reliable faction in the Xuanhuang Realm would not lack spirit stones." Xu Bai said with some regret.

The Imperial Princess seemed to have anticipated his reaction. "I am naturally aware of this. If the only function of the [Spiritual Crystal Marrow] were to provide spiritual energy, I wouldn't rank its importance right after the Void Coordinator Instrument."

"In truth, the primary function of the [Spiritual Crystal Marrow] is to transfer the abilities of exotic beasts to humans—completely and without side effects."

With a sudden flash of red light, a round pearl wreathed in flames appeared in her palm.

"This was crafted using an exotic beast known as the [Blazing Flame Tiger] as raw material. You should try it for yourself." The Imperial Princess confidently handed over the red pearl.

"Inheriting the divine abilities of demon beasts?"

For an instant, Xu Bai thought of a rare treasure that Dongfang Yao had once mentioned—its effect was similar, except that it stimulated the dormant ancient bloodline within oneself.

Holding the red [Spiritual Crystal Marrow] in his palm, Xu Bai applied slight pressure.

Like a fragile glass bead, it shattered instantly.

In the blink of an eye, countless red flames surged forth like fiery dragons, flowing up Xu Bai's arm and drilling into his body.

"Roar!"

Before his eyes, a ferocious tiger composed entirely of flames appeared, letting out an enraged, unwilling roar.

Xu Bai snorted coldly, and the illusion shattered instantly.

A surge of heat coursed through his body before finally settling between his brows.

Xu Bai closed his eyes and meditated. Moments later, a small crimson flame flickered in his palm.

It danced continuously, distorting the surrounding air with its heat.

Xu Bai's gaze turned serious.

This was because the flame did not rely on any spiritual energy or divine abilities—it was purely an instinctual power, as natural as breathing.

With a mere thought, he could command it.

The flame morphed into different shapes according to his will.

And as he continued manipulating the fire, memories of how to wield this ability surfaced in his mind.

Seeing Xu Bai master the ability of an exotic beast so effortlessly upon his first attempt at absorbing [Spiritual Crystal Marrow], the Imperial Princess appeared visibly astonished.

Fearing Xu Bai might misunderstand, she quickly added, "In reality, inheriting the powers of exotic beasts through [Spiritual Crystal Marrow] is not guaranteed to succeed. It depends on a person's innate talent and qualifications, as well as the strength of the ability itself."

"According to our research, the stronger and rarer an ability is, the harder it is for humans to master. Furthermore, if one fails during the inheritance process, the chances of succeeding in future attempts will decrease significantly."

"The number of abilities a single cultivator can inherit is also limited. The more powers one has already mastered, the lower the likelihood of successfully acquiring new ones."

…

The Imperial Princess continued explaining the usage rules of [Spiritual Crystal Marrow] in detail.

Meanwhile, Xu Bai grasped the key issue. "How difficult is it to manufacture [Spiritual Crystal Marrow]? How many exotic beasts are required to produce a single pearl?"

The Imperial Princess, who had been speaking fluently, suddenly fell silent.

A faint blush appeared on her face as the Imperial Princess spoke with slight embarrassment, “It takes the flesh and blood of nearly a thousand exotic beasts to create a single Spirit Crystal Marrow. However, the Empire's cultivation technology is already very advanced. As long as we have sufficient resources, there is no need to worry about the production of Spirit Crystal Marrow.”

Xu Bai nodded slightly. “That is indeed a considerable bargaining chip. The power of exotic beasts is almost equivalent to a weakened version of a divine ability. In a life-and-death battle, if used unexpectedly, it could have miraculous effects.”

“Besides this, is there anything else surprising?” Xu Bai asked again.

The Imperial Princess hesitated.

After a long pause, she slowly said, “This technology is not yet fully developed…”

“No matter,” Xu Bai reassured her. “The Federation values potential. If it truly holds limitless possibilities, we will not hesitate to provide support.”

The Imperial Princess did not immediately respond. Instead, she turned her gaze toward Xiao Qing outside the Imperial Treasury.

Seeing Xiao Qing nod in silent approval, she took a deep breath and led Xu Bai to the deepest part of the treasury.

There, a massive metallic furnace stood.

The furnace was engraved with thousands of different exotic beasts, each incredibly lifelike.

There was no visible fire heating it, yet the temperature seemed incredibly high.

Even with Xu Bai’s current strength, he could feel traces of heat just by standing near it.

Bang! Bang!

Loud collisions echoed from within the furnace.

Upon careful listening, one could faintly hear the agonized wails of countless exotic beasts intertwined within.

It was deeply unsettling.

The Imperial Princess, seemingly wary of the furnace, stood even farther away than Xu Bai.

She whispered, “This object is called the Myriad Phenomena Furnace.”

“Its origin stems from a hypothesis—or perhaps, a truth.”

“All demonic beasts and exotic beasts in the world were once part of the same original entity in ancient times.”

“That being was the progenitor of all demonic beasts, containing unimaginable power.”

“Over countless years, countless individual creatures have separated from it.”

“So… what if we reverse the process? What if we fuse all exotic beasts back into…”

“…That original entity?”

A mysterious glint flickered in the Imperial Princess’s eyes.

“Even if we can’t fully reconstruct every demonic beast that has ever existed, by gathering enough species, we should be able to create a weaker fusion body.”

“It should be possible.”

“In fact, ten years ago, we briefly managed to fuse a terrifying demonic beast.”

“The aura it radiated was even more terrifying than the Nine-Headed Bird beneath our feet. At that time, everyone present—even the Holy Master Qing and Hong—were so overwhelmed by fear that they lost the ability to move.”

“Unfortunately, it did not survive for long before dissolving on its own.”

Chapter 754: Tianxuan Attacks Oneself

“It seems there’s a natural restriction preventing the fusion of all beasts,” the Imperial Princess said somewhat regretfully.

“However, we’ve made significant progress in researching the catalytic substances that promote fusion. I believe the birth of the first fusion beast is not far off,” she quickly regained her confidence.

“Myriad Phenomena Beast Furnace... merging flesh and blood into one...” In an instant, Xu Bai thought of the [Emperor Yi] he had seen in the Fallen Immortal Realm.

Without a doubt, the inspiration for the empire’s Myriad Phenomena Furnace came from this primordial beast ancestor.

As the origin of the demonic beasts in the Xuanhuang Realm, the power of Emperor Yi must be no less than that of a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign.

If the empire truly succeeds in mass-producing fusion beasts, even if the resulting versions are significantly weakened, their power would still be formidable.

“Have you assessed the actual strength of the fused beasts? If the experiment succeeds, can you control them? Aren’t you afraid they might turn against you and destroy the empire?” Xu Bai raised a series of questions.

The Imperial Princess confidently replied, “The exotic beasts thrown into the Myriad Phenomena Furnace are all individuals controlled by us through the Same Heart-Linking Technique. Even after being refined by the furnace, although their physical bodies disappear, the bond remains.”

“By gathering the mental waves of all those linked by the Same Heart-Linking Technique, we can create a device to control the fusion form. There’s no need to worry about losing control.”

“Based on previous strength evaluations, the current fusion forms we can produce should not be weaker than the Dao Integration cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm...” The Imperial Princess hesitated but ultimately spoke slowly.

Xu Bai nodded slightly; this result was within his expectations. However, he did not sound a warning regarding the empire’s mysterious confidence.

He skillfully took out his folding fan and lightly waved it. “Not bad... the Void Coordinator Trajectory Instrument, the Spiritual Crystal Marrow, and the possible future support of Dao Integration-level combat power...”

“With these, I believe it will be enough to convince the Federation to grant you protection.”

“Oh right, give me a few more Spiritual Crystal Marrow. Seeing is believing—I’m worried those old folks might not be easily convinced.”

The Imperial Princess didn’t mind Xu Bai’s request. With a casual gesture, she tossed over ten Spiritual Crystal Marrow.

Without further ado, Xu Bai put them away and flew out of the imperial treasury.

“Be prepared. If nothing goes wrong, the next time the Federation Elders will come with me for the final assessment. Those guys aren’t as easy to talk to as I am.”

Leaving the treasury, Xu Bai quickly returned to the towering palace. After giving a few instructions, he didn’t linger and transformed into a streak of light, soaring into the sky and disappearing from the imperial citizens' sight.

"Master Qing..." The Imperial Princess looked at Xiao Qing, her eyes seemingly filled with many questions.

Xiao Qing, however, kept her gaze fixed on Xu Bai’s retreating figure, not looking away for a long time.

"His words are hard to judge as true or false. But it can be confirmed he bears no ill intent. And indeed, the entrance to our world has been concealed by an unknown formation."

"Let’s prepare according to what he said. Who made us the weak ones, after all? The weak don’t have many choices." Xiao Qing spoke in a faint, wistful tone.

...

Outside the empire, in the dark void.

While flying through the void, Xu Bai suddenly sensed a spatial fluctuation nearby.

Immediately after, a Void Roaming Dragon appeared at his side, affectionately rubbing its head against his thigh.

It looked familiar—it was the same one he had casually tamed earlier.

Sensing that Xu Bai was about to leave, it had come to bid him farewell.

“You little thing, you’ve got quite the spirit. Very well, the Beast Realm happens to lack a leader—you shall follow me!” Xu Bai smiled and said.

The Void Roaming Dragon was overjoyed at these words, twisting its body and willingly allowing Xu Bai to ride on its back.

Under Xu Bai’s guidance, it continued to traverse the void, heading toward the Xuanhuang Realm.

Upon returning to the deep valley at the entrance, Xu Bai first stored the Void Roaming Dragon in his Cave-Heaven, then used the Endstone Plate to dispel the illusion of closed cultivation that had been fooling the Tianxuan Treasure Record.

Passing by the entrance of Longevity Valley, he didn’t go inside but discreetly released the Void Roaming Dragon before returning alone to Tianliang Prefecture.

Outside Longevity Valley, Liu San, who had been notified beforehand, looked at the exotic beast before him with amazement.

“So inconspicuous, yet it has the ability to traverse space...” He led the Void Roaming Dragon into the valley and once again concealed the entrance.

As for how the dragon would cause chaos and dominate the Beast Realm with Xu Bai’s permission, that was left unspoken.

“We have ample reason to suspect that the Tianxuan Treasure Record is constantly monitoring the cultivators' physical conditions. Without a certain level of bodily mastery, it’s impossible for the so-called cultivation guidance to be so precise and effective,” Fang Zaiji said with a grave expression.

“That’s obvious—what cultivator in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance doesn’t know this? Yet they still willingly accept it. After all, compared to advancing one’s cultivation, such concerns are trivial,” Liu San retorted.

“No, no, you’re not understanding my point,” Fang Zaiji explained seriously, without his usual sarcastic tone. “If the Tianxuan Mirror can evolve by measuring the world and the heavens, what kind of transformation will occur once it has gathered the physical data of so many cultivators?”

Upon hearing these words, Liu San couldn’t help but be startled.

"In the ancient cultivation world, there is a saying that has been passed down: the human body is the most perfect creation in existence. To ascend and become an immortal, regardless of whether you were originally human, you must first take on a human form."

"Although it is merely a rumor and its authenticity can no longer be verified, the fact that humans managed to defeat demonic beasts and become the true rulers of the Xuanhuang Realm already demonstrates the limitless potential of being human."

"That Tianxuan Mirror might very well harbor thoughts of transforming into a human form," Fang Zaiji said with a serious expression.

"So, Mr. Fang, is this the conclusion you’ve reached after all your research?" Li Fan interrupted Fang Zaiji’s words.

In his hand, the Dissociation Disc had become several times more crystalline and transparent than before.

Perhaps the great battle of all realms had already begun, and some owners of the Dissociation Discs, realizing their power was insufficient, had given up on feeding the discs with formations. In a short period, the disc in Li Fan’s hand had devoured three other Dissociation Discs in succession.

The final battle for supremacy did not seem far away.

As for the various rewards offered by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance for conquering the small worlds, Li Fan was not particularly interested. Therefore, he remained wholeheartedly focused on the transformation of the Dissociation Disc.

Even when he came to inquire about the progress of Fang Zaiji’s research on the Endstone Plate, he did not cease feeding formation data into it—managing both tasks simultaneously.

"Have you found a way to block the Tianxuan Treasure Record’s scanning of a cultivator’s body?" Li Fan asked.

Fang Zaiji gave a wry smile. "I have a few ideas, but to actually accomplish it... it might be a bit challenging."

Fang Zaiji slowly explained the reasons:

"To block the Tianxuan Treasure Record’s perception of the external world, one only needs to use spiritual sense to temporarily fabricate a single scene.

"Similarly, to interfere with the Tianxuan Treasure Record’s probing of one’s own body, it would be necessary to construct a false body.

"But... that’s where the difficulty lies."

"Although it’s just a simple body, it contains countless structures—blood, and even the traces of spiritual energy circulation. It truly resembles a miniature world. Unless one’s understanding of the body’s fine details matches that of the Tianxuan Treasure Record, flaws are inevitable."

Fang Zaiji sighed helplessly. "The Tianxuan Treasure Record resides within the cultivator’s sea of consciousness and completes a body scan at the time of its formation. Any sudden, significant discrepancy will definitely be detected immediately.

"Moreover, everyone’s physique is different, making it practically impossible to develop a universal solution."

Hearing Fang Zaiji’s explanation, Li Fan finally understood the difficulty.

Even a Dao Integration cultivator likely could not guarantee complete mastery over their own body, let alone those below that level.

Expecting them to weave a false body to deceive the Tianxuan Treasure Record would undoubtedly result in glaring flaws.

"To truly achieve complete control over one’s body, unless..."

"Using [Foundation Built Upon Oneself]."

The phrase suddenly flashed through Li Fan’s mind.

However, he quickly shook his head. The difficulty of Foundation Built Upon Oneself was far too great—no one in the Xuanhuang Realm had ever succeeded throughout the ages. Even a genius like Yin Shangren left behind severe aftereffects...

"Hmm? The difficulty of cultivation?" An idea suddenly struck Li Fan’s mind like a spark of inspiration.

The Tianxuan Treasure Record was claimed to be capable of guiding cultivators in their cultivation.

What would happen if he let the Tianxuan Treasure Record guide the Foundation Built Upon Oneself?

After pondering for a while, Li Fan explained the concept of Foundation Built Upon Oneself to Fang Zaiji and the others, sharing his speculation.

"Building one’s foundation without relying on external objects... marvelous! Truly marvelous! In this way, doesn’t it break the limitations of the new method to some extent?" Fang Zaiji gasped in amazement, exclaiming repeatedly.

"To think that such a brilliant idea came from a mere Foundation Establishment cultivator... Truly..." He couldn’t help but feel incredulous.

"But upon careful consideration, with the comprehensive scanning capability of the Tianxuan Treasure Record, it might indeed be possible to realize Foundation Built Upon Oneself." After thinking for a moment, Fang Zaiji’s excitement grew.

Liu San also pondered deeply. "A cultivator may not fully know their own body, but by leveraging the Tianxuan Mirror, it might be possible to take an unconventional approach. If successful, and a method of Foundation Built Upon Oneself can be summarized afterward, it would significantly reduce the difficulty."

"If someone with outstanding talent were to undertake it, they might even develop a universally applicable method."

"Achieving it solely by one’s own ability would mean realizing Foundation Built Upon Oneself."

"It’s entirely feasible! Worth a try! If I hadn’t already reached Dao Integration, I’d be tempted to abolish my cultivation and start anew just to test this miraculous foundation-building method!" Fang Zaiji was overflowing with excitement.

Li Fan nodded. "To leverage the Tianxuan Mirror’s guidance, one needs to earn merit points from the conquering various small worlds. I would have to trouble Elder Liu to arrange for some disciples to take on this task. It would be best to send a group of low-level Qi Condensation cultivators together for safety."

Chapter 755: The Immortal Alliance Faces Its First Setback

Liu San's expression turned awkward upon hearing this. “Uh… This might be a bit difficult...”

“Hm?” Li Fan was slightly taken aback.

Just as Liu San was about to explain, Fang Zaiji interrupted him. “Haha, Sect Master, have you been in seclusion for too long? Our Medicine King Sect doesn’t have any Qi Condensation disciples anymore. Even those with the worst aptitude have long since reached the Foundation Establishment stage.”

Li Fan's hand, which had been stroking the Dissociation Disc, paused slightly.

“In that case, I’ll have to trouble Mr. Fang to make a trip outside and select some promising talents.” Li Fan feigned realization and then added somewhat helplessly.

“It would be best if you carried the Endstone Plate with you and remained cautious. If the cultivators of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance discover you, a battle will be inevitable.” He kindly reminded him.

“Uh…” Fang Zaiji’s face instantly fell. “Sect Master…”

“Mr. Fang, it’s best if you leave and return quickly. This concerns our hope of deciphering the Tianxuan Treasure Record. I wouldn't feel at ease entrusting this task to anyone else.” Li Fan spoke earnestly.

Seeing that he had no way to refuse, Fang Zaiji shot a glare at Liu San—who was enjoying the spectacle—before flying away.

“I’m going out as well.” At this moment, Jiang Yushan, who had remained silent, suddenly spoke.

Liu San was immediately stunned.

“I’ve been stuck here for too long; it’s getting suffocating.” Jiang Yushan said indifferently. “The outside world seems rather lively now. Countless hidden small worlds that have remained in obscurity for thousands of years are finally about to reveal themselves. I find that quite interesting. Perhaps I might even run into some old acquaintances.”

Li Fan pondered for a moment before nodding in agreement.

He handed her a piece of the Endstone Plate and a Communication Talisman, instructing, “Safety first. If our Medicine King Sect is to rise again, we will need your support, Elder Jiang.”

“Don’t worry.” Jiang Yushan replied coldly before vanishing into the sky.

“Young Master, I also—” Liu San hurriedly spoke.

“Elder Liu, you should stay in the Medicine King Valley. A crucial matter will arise soon, and I will need you and my clone to handle it together.” Li Fan waved his hand decisively, rejecting Liu San’s request.

Liu San’s face turned bitter, but he had no choice but to comply. Frustrated, he went to find the disciples of the Medicine King Sect to vent his frustration.

Li Fan once again immersed himself in feeding the Dissociation Disc.

Meanwhile, his clone, Xu Bai, who had returned to Tianliang City, was gathering intelligence on the recent progress of the Immortal Alliance’s conquest of the myriad worlds.

Up until now, everything had been going smoothly. However, shortly after his return to the Xuanhuang Realm, the zealous cultivators of the Immortal Alliance encountered their first major defeat.

The initial force that entered a small world consisted of over a hundred cultivators, including three Soul Transformation leaders and fifty Nascent Soul elites.

Such formidable strength… yet they were nearly wiped out.

The only survivor was a Foundation Establishment cultivator named Lu Zhixian.

This person had only managed to join the expedition because of his connections with one of the Soul Transformation leaders. He initially intended to earn some minor merit, but the battle took a drastic turn for the worse. Sensing danger, Lu Zhixian decisively fled.

Perhaps due to his low cultivation level, the enemy did not consider him worth pursuing.

Such a devastating loss naturally caused an uproar, prompting an official investigation by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Thanks to the recorded images in the Tianxuan Treasure Record, Lu Zhixian was quickly cleared of any suspicion of being a spy and was released without charge.

When the footage was made public, it shocked the entire cultivation world.

Because the one who single-handedly annihilated the entire expedition… was just one man.

He had white hair, white eyebrows, and a face full of wrinkles. At first glance, he looked incredibly old, as if he could die of old age at any moment.

But his attacks were ruthless beyond compare.

His hair and beard moved as if they were alive, lashing out like silver dragons and instantly piercing through the bodies of the Immortal Alliance cultivators.

What was even more terrifying was that after the old man's beard and hair pierced into the bodies of the Immortal Alliance cultivators, they seemed to be able to absorb their life force.

In an instant, countless cultivators aged rapidly, some even turning into skeletons without so much as a scream.

Meanwhile, the old man’s face became visibly more flushed.

This white-haired elder was at least at the Dao Integration stage. Moreover, he seemed to have a special advantage within the Small World, rendering ordinary Soul Transformation cultivators completely powerless against him. They could only watch helplessly as they were drained dry.

This scene immediately incited immense outrage among the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance cultivators.

"Absorbing a cultivator’s lifespan directly? Such an act is no different from demonic cultivators! He must be eliminated!"

"Well said! Fellow Daoist, I support you! Go and chop off his head!"

"Hiss... I didn't expect such a ruthless figure to exist in a small world. I think it will take at least two or three Dao Integration experts to take him down."

"Fools! Haven't you realized it yet? That Lu Zhixian was deliberately let go to report back—just to lure more cultivators to their deaths!"

"That makes sense. But if that's the case, why hasn’t he just left that small world and wreaked havoc in the Xuanhuang Realm?"

"Because he's not as stupid as you are."

Despite the heated discussion, the cultivators of the Immortal Alliance were no fools. Since such a monster existed in that small world, they simply chose to avoid it. After all, there were countless unexplored small world—why fight to the death with this one? It was better to pick an easier target.

Thus, a dramatic turn of events unfolded.

That particular small world was marked on the map with a red skull symbol, but no one dared to enter it again.

"In the end, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance will surely send people to clean it up anyway."

Holding onto this belief, the cultivators chose to completely ignore the matter.

Surprisingly, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance itself seemed to silently approve of this behavior, as no official bounty or wanted notice was issued for the small world.

"Interesting."

After investigating the situation, Xu Bai discovered that there was actually an internal dispute within the Immortal Alliance over how to handle this small world.

One faction believed that such an insidious threat must be swiftly eradicated to uphold the supreme authority of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

The other faction argued that future conquests across different worlds would inevitably lead to encounters with opponents of similar strength to the white-haired elder. If they insisted on eliminating every single one of them, it would lead to unnecessary casualties.

Dao Integration cultivators were the backbone of the Immortal Alliance—losing even one would be a significant loss.

Even though the Rebirth Mansion existed, allowing fallen cultivators to be resurrected...

It appeared that Dao Integration cultivators had deep concerns about "resurrection" and were unwilling to rush into battle.

After further inquiries, Xu Bai finally uncovered the reason.

As it turned out, even though various methods allowed one to be revived with their past life’s memories and cultivation intact…

There was a fatal flaw that no Dao Integration cultivator could ignore.

Once one entered the Rebirth Mansion, they would forever lose their chance to reach the Longevity Immortal realm.

The exact reason was unknown, but judging from the reactions of various Dao Integration experts, it was likely true.

After all, what Dao Integration cultivator did not aspire to achieve eternal longevity?

Resurrection… was merely a desperate last resort.

Chapter 756: Cutting Off the Path to Immortality

"It is just like how the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor defied the natural order of cultivation—since then, no cultivator in the world has been able to surpass him."

"The Rebirth Heavenly Sovereign defies the natural order of life and death."

"And once a cultivator has been resurrected by him, they will never be able to attain the Longevity Immortal realm again."

Xu Bai seemed to have realized something.

"However, for the vast majority of cultivators in the world, the Longevity Immortal realm is already an unattainable dream. Even if they knew about this, they probably wouldn’t care much."

Suddenly, Xu Bai seemed to recall something and frowned slightly.

He calculated the future developments of the Xuanhuang Realm several years from now.

"In the original Xuanhuang Realm, cultivators were born naturally and perished naturally. As time passed, even though the chances were extremely slim, a new Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign would eventually emerge every few thousand or ten thousand years."

"But now, with the existence of the Rebirth Mansion, resurrected cultivators are gradually taking the place of naturally born cultivators. This has led to a decreasing number of naturally born cultivators."

"And the already minuscule probability of attaining Longevity Immortal status will become even rarer."

"Eventually, until…"

"There are no more new Longevity Immortals in the world."

Xu Bai stroked his chin. "The Xuanhuang Extermination Plan—carve out your own path, while leaving the rest of the world with no way forward."

"Such a domineering method is quite reminiscent of the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor."

"However, for the existing Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereigns, this is actually a good thing. Perhaps this is the very reason why the Five Elders Association has not stepped forward to stop the Rebirth Heavenly Sovereign."

After all, not every small world has an old monster like the White-Browed Old man overseeing it.

The minor setbacks encountered during the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's conquest were quickly forgotten. Even the occasional small world that resisted fiercely was swiftly subdued with reinforcements.

Fifty, one hundred, one hundred and thirty-six…

The number of discovered small worlds increased rapidly.

Xu Bai, through the Tianxuan Treasure Record, recorded the process of these small worlds being conquered, along with their current state.

Once the time was right, he and Liu San arranged to return to the Empire Small World together.

After blocking the perception of the Tianxuan Treasure Record, the two entered one after the other, reuniting in the dark void.

Having already informed each other of important matters in advance, Liu San had also changed his appearance. The two sped through the void.

"A Beast-Taming Sect lineage? That’s quite rare," Liu San commented as he scanned the land below with his divine sense.

Seeing countless exotic and strange beasts, Liu San couldn't help but click his tongue in admiration.

"It’s merely a branch of the Beast-Taming Sect. The true inheritance of the Beast-Taming Sect seems to be hiding in the Lingxu Realm. After thousands of years, who knows what has become of it now?" Xu Bai casually replied through voice transmission.

"Lingxu Realm… I feel like I’ve heard of it somewhere?" Liu San was slightly taken aback.

After a long while, Liu San shook his head. "Strange, I can’t seem to remember. Have I really grown this old?"

"No matter. Now that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is sweeping through the realms, they will eventually be exposed. Elder Liu, did you have any acquaintances within the Beast-Taming Sect back in the day?" Xu Bai asked.

"I’ve only heard of them, but never had any direct interactions," Liu San replied absentmindedly, still dwelling on his lost memory.

At that moment, within Longevity Valley, Li Fan suddenly felt a wave of unease.

"Hmm?"

It had been a long time since he had experienced such a sensation, and he dared not take it lightly.

He stopped feeding Dissociation Disks with formation data and became visibly solemn.

In his mind, the Dao Deviation Stone spun at full speed as he tried to pinpoint the source of this looming threat.

Before long, he arrived at a possible answer…

Liu San, as a Dao Integration powerhouse, clearly wouldn’t fail to remember events that happened to him. Even if he momentarily couldn’t recall, a search through his divine sense should have absolutely allowed him to retrieve those memories.

Yet, this had inexplicably occurred.

“It’s because the memories related to the Lingxu Realm in his mind were altered by someone.”

“The only ones capable of silently modifying the divine sense of a Dao Integration cultivator are those at the Longevity Immortal stage. Liu San, in the first half of his life, had never come into contact with a Longevity Immortal.”

“So the issue must lie with the True Temptation Fruit that I used on him back then.”

As he contemplated the memory alterations he had made to Liu San, Li Fan suddenly realized: “The Lingxu Realm must have been something he once mentioned in a conversation with the true young master of the Medicine King Sect, Liu Yihang.”

To be cautious, Li Fan had not killed Liu Yihang at that time.

Instead, he had hidden him inside the Medicine King True Cauldron, in an inconspicuous room that only Li Fan himself could open.

Liu Yihang remained in a deep slumber within the Great Dream Spring and Autumn Formation.

At this moment, with the three elders of the Medicine King Sect absent, Li Fan had no scruples about his actions.

He released Liu Yihang from the Medicine King True Cauldron and brought him into his own Cave Heaven.

Without the formation’s effects, Liu Yihang slowly regained consciousness.

But in an instant, he realized something was terribly wrong.

He had no control over his body, unable even to cry out.

His expression drastically changed, and though he wanted to struggle, it was futile.

Within his own Cave Heaven, Li Fan had no need to personally appear—he could suppress Liu Yihang with ease.

Using Soul Searching Art, Li Fan effortlessly extracted the information about the Lingxu Realm from his mind.

It wasn’t anything particularly special—just that, many years ago, Liu Yihang had come across the name of this realm while reading an ancient text.

The Lingxu Realm was home to a plant known as Lingxu Grass, an essential ingredient for refining the Nurturing Soul Pill.

Because of this, Liu Yihang had once consulted Liu San about it.

The person involved had likely long since forgotten about this matter. Yet, thousands of years later, it had led to an unforeseen disaster.

Originally, Liu Yihang could have remained in the Great Dream Spring and Autumn Formation, slumbering for a few more decades.

Having unraveled the situation, Li Fan felt no guilt about his actions.

He continued suppressing Liu Yihang in the Cave Heaven while his true body returned to Medicine King Valley.

Meanwhile, his clone, Xu Bai, interrupted Liu San’s thoughts, saying, “Now that I think about it, I recall reading a secret record back in the day that detailed the method for refining the Nurturing Soul Pill.”

“One of the primary ingredients, Lingxu Grass, was said to grow in the Lingxu Realm. At that time, I even asked Elder Liu about it.”

Upon hearing this, Liu San’s expression first turned puzzled.

Then, he slapped his forehead. “Ah, my memory! That did happen. I nearly forgot about it!”

Having resolved his doubts, Liu San shifted his focus back to the Empire small world below.

Together with Xu Bai, he flew to the towering palace.

The powerful spiritual sense of a Dao Integration cultivator had long since alerted Xiao Qing.

She, the Imperial Princess, and another woman dressed in red flew forward to greet them.

“This is Elder Liu of our Federation,” Xu Bai solemnly introduced.

The three women saluted Liu San.

“Greetings, Senior!”

Chapter 757: Strength Is the Ultimate Proof

Unless a Longevity Immortal emerges, Dao Integration cultivators are the strongest beings in the world.

This is true for the Xuanhuang Realm, let alone this small Empire world.

Qing and Hong were somewhat prepared—they had lived long enough. In their memories, back when they were in the Beast-Taming Sect many years ago, they had encountered a Dao Integration cultivator before.

However, the Imperial Princess was not as fortunate.

Even though she had inherited the memories of past emperors of the empire, her impression of the legendary power of Dao Integration cultivators remained vague.

After all, she was merely a mortal.

Faced with the immense, mountain-like pressure that Liu San unintentionally emanated, the Imperial Princess turned pale, struggling to breathe.

The three of them bowed, yet Liu San remained silent.

Qing and Hong felt a growing unease.

To be honest, until today, they had harbored some doubts about this so-called Federation of All Worlds.

After all, from beginning to end, they had only ever communicated with a single representative. Moreover, that representative’s cultivation was not particularly profound—merely at the Nascent Soul stage, which was quite common in the Xuanhuang Realm.

But today, the moment they personally witnessed a Dao Integration cultivator, all their doubts vanished.

Because strength is the best proof.

It was impossible for a great Dao Integration cultivator to be involved in some kind of scam. With a mere wave of his hand, he could wipe an entire empire off the map. There was no reason for such deception.

Countless thoughts flashed through their minds in an instant, and the three from the empire became even more respectful.

Sensing that the atmosphere was just right, Liu San finally let out a slight hum and nodded. "Let's go. Take me to see the things you reported."

At that moment, Xu Bai spoke as well. "The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's attacks have been getting more intense lately. Elder Liu doesn't have much time to waste."

The Imperial Princess hurriedly nodded and led them to a hidden underground chamber beneath the palace’s high tower.

The chamber was vast and empty. Inside, a Void Coordinator Trajectory Instrument, over a thousand different types of Spirit Crystal Marrow, and a massive furnace had already been prepared.

Liu San first looked at the Void Coordinator Trajectory Instrument, then suddenly asked, "If we know the relative coordinates of a certain world in comparison to the Xuanhuang Realm, can we use this instrument to pinpoint its location in the void?"

Xiao Qing was stunned for a moment, then her expression changed drastically.

She realized that Elder Liu wasn’t referring to just a small world within Xuanhuang.

He was referring to another cultivation world on the same level as the Xuanhuang Realm.

Her evaluation of the Federation of All Worlds instantly rose.

After a moment of contemplation, Xiao Qing shook her head and responded honestly, "Due to the influence of the Immortal Ruins, the space-time around the Xuanhuang Realm is distorted. If we only have raw coordinate data, even if we manage to escape the Immortal Ruins' pull, we might still lose our way."

"However, if we pre-set the destination coordinates in advance, we can continuously adjust our course through space-time corrections. Theoretically, it is entirely possible to safely reach the target location," she quickly added.

"A world without spiritual energy has still managed to develop such technology. That is no small feat," Liu San nodded approvingly.

Hearing this, Xiao Qing and the others couldn't help but reveal a hint of joy in their eyes.

Liu San then turned his gaze toward the thousands of different Spirit Crystal Marrow specimens.

With just a glance, he dismissed them.

To a Dao Integration cultivator, these ferocious beast abilities were nothing more than child’s play.

Finally, Liu San’s attention shifted to the massive, roaring furnace.

The faint, dangerous aura seeping from it made him narrow his eyes slightly.

"You are playing with fire," Liu San finally commented after a long silence.

"All beasts returning to one. Indeed, it is a possibility. But if such a terrifying creation were truly brought into existence, I fear that your so-called [Heart Linking technique] would not be able to control it."

"Perhaps if the supreme treasure of the Beast-Taming Sect, the [Ten Thousand Beasts Reincarnation Wheel], were still around, there might still be a sliver of hope."

Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong exchanged glances, both startled in their hearts.

However, before they could respond, Liu San left behind only one sentence before departing directly.

"I have already grasped the general situation of this world. Be patient and await the results."

Xiao Qing asked nervously, "Fellow Daoist Xu…"

Xu Bai appeared helpless. "I already said earlier that the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance is launching an aggressive assault, and many small worlds have fallen one after another. The organization has already decided to implement the 'Sever the Tail to Survive' strategy, retracting our sphere of influence. Only the valuable small worlds will be preserved as part of the core forces."

"In the end, the decision is not solely up to Elder Liu. A comprehensive evaluation by the higher-ups is necessary before a final judgment can be made."

As proof, Xu Bai displayed the scenes he had gathered earlier from the Tianxuan Treasure Record, showing numerous small worlds falling one after another under the relentless attacks of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance cultivators.

Faced with these brutal, real, and bloodstained images, the three imperial figures couldn't help but reveal slight changes in their expressions.

Tossing the Image-Storing Stone to them, Xu Bai spoke in reassurance:

"Don't worry. Considering our shared ancestral lineage, even if the organization does not approve the decision to protect you, I will personally come to rescue you and take you away."

"Of course, the number must be small. Five people at most."

Xu Bai’s expression turned somewhat solemn.

Seeing the increasingly pale faces of Xiao Qing and the other two, he continued, "Of course, if the organization ultimately decides to provide you with protection, that would be ideal."

"However, when the time comes, as the price for protection, all resources and technologies of your empire must be fully integrated into our Federation of All Worlds."

"No matter what the outcome, you should start making preparations in advance."

"I've heard that within your empire, there still exists some sort of noble class…"

Xu Bai sneered and looked at the imperial princess, saying,

"Remember, the empire only needs an Emperor—it does not need nobles."

"From today onward, let the empire have only one voice."

With that, Xu Bai cupped his hands in farewell.

"I have many matters to attend to and cannot linger here any longer. I hope that when I return next time, I will bring good news."

Without waiting for Xiao Qing and the others to bid farewell, Xu Bai soared into the sky and disappeared from the empire.

Watching Xu Bai depart, the imperial princess gazed beyond the palace.

A flash of killing intent crossed her eyes, but in the end, they gradually became resolute.

Xuanhuang Realm, Entrance to the Empire.

Liu San, who had left earlier, was waiting for Xu Bai there.

"Young Master, how was my performance?"

Seeing Xu Bai arrive, he couldn't help but ask smugly.

"Haha, I never expected Elder Liu, who appears so upright and righteous, to be such a natural at deception—flawless, without a single trace of pretense. I must remind Elder Jiang to be careful in the future," Xu Bai said with a smile.

Liu San’s face immediately fell.

However, he quickly shifted the topic on his own.

"Setting that aside, this so-called Empire small world is quite remarkable. Not to mention other aspects, but simply that [Myriad Phenomena Furnace] alone would be considered extraordinary even in the ancient cultivation world."

Chapter 758: Peaceful Concealment of Danger

"And besides, I’ve realized that due to the natural limitations of the materials, the furnace they are using can only accommodate a limited number of exotic beasts. If we were to use our Medicine King True Cauldron, we might be able to refine several times the number of exotic beasts in a single process."

"At that time, who knows what kind of monster we could create?"

"I'm afraid that even if I joined forces with Yushan, we might not be able to suppress it."

Liu San shook his head slightly. "It’s like a potent poison—highly effective, but with too many restrictions."

"If only we could master a method to control Dao Integration combat power," Liu San suddenly sighed.

Xu Bai's eyes narrowed slightly, his expression remaining unchanged. Instead, he followed the train of thought and mused, "Elder Liu makes a valid point. The Xuanhuang Realm is vast and full of mysteries—there might indeed exist a way to control Dao Integration cultivators."

"I'll investigate. If it truly works, then wouldn't our Medicine King Sect be able to steadily produce a Dao Integration-level fighter at regular intervals?"

Hearing this, Liu San couldn't help but feel a surge of excitement.
