"Although compared to the new Dao Integration, the combat power of these Fused Beasts would certainly be inferior, they are still at the Dao Integration level. If we have enough of them, even the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance would have to tread carefully around us, wouldn't they?"

"At that point, our Medicine King Sect might even be able to openly return to the world?"

Xu Bai nodded in agreement. "It's not an impossible plan."

"By the way, Young Master, Elder Ruan is still in deep slumber within the Medicine King True Cauldron. He has extensive knowledge of demonic beast bodies. Perhaps waking him up might help us find a feasible method," Liu San suggested.

"..."

Suddenly, memories from Liu Yihang surfaced in his mind.

Ruan Tianxiao, one of the Dao Integration Elders of the Medicine King Sect.

Unlike the other elders who primarily used spiritual plants in their alchemy, Ruan Tianxiao preferred to incorporate animals, demonic beasts, and even human body tissues into his concoctions.

Though undeniably effective, his methods were excessively bloody and brutal, bordering on the grotesque.

As a result, Ruan Tianxiao’s "Meat Pills" were never widely accepted.

He was also a reclusive figure, preferring solitude and keeping no close associates within the sect.

After pondering for a long time, Xu Bai frowned and decided, "Elder Ruan has always been estranged from others. If he awakens and suddenly realizes that he has traveled thousands of years into the future, he may no longer have the desire to remain in our Medicine King Sect."

Liu San couldn't refute this possibility. "That is indeed possible."

"However, Elder Ruan’s Meat Pill technique does have some unique merits. The Myriad Fusion Beast..."

Xu Bai seemed to be weighing his options. "Let’s do this—once we officially acquire the Empire’s technology, we’ll decide based on the situation."

"If we can mass-produce Fused Beasts on our own, then there’s no rush to awaken Elder Ruan. But if we encounter any insurmountable difficulties, we can summon him at that time."

In the end, Xu Bai made his decision.

Liu San nodded in agreement.

With that matter settled, Xu Bai needed to return to Tianliang Province, while Liu San would head back to Medicine King Valley.

After they parted ways, Xu Bai watched Liu San disappear into the distance, deep in thought.

"Was that a test? Or just a coincidence?"

"Perhaps previous events made him suspicious. After all, even Dao Integration cultivators, despite being unable to resist the changes brought by the True Temptation Fruit due to the power of a Heavenly Sovereign, could still sense something was amiss with themselves."

"To be safe, I should leave Longevity Valley for now."

Li Fan had always acted swiftly and decisively.

As soon as the thought crossed his mind, he did not hesitate. Leaving behind only a message stating that he had urgent matters to attend to, he quietly departed from Medicine King Valley before Liu San returned.

"I should also consult the Five Elders Association to confirm the effects of this True Temptation Fruit."

A sharp glint flashed in Li Fan’s eyes.

He temporarily put away the Dissociation Disc and headed straight for Shou Feng’s residence.

At the same time, Xu Bai, who had returned to Tianliang Prefecture, secretly sought out the Garrison Institution cultivator and the Five Elders Association spy with whom he had previously made a deal.

This person's name was Liu Wenyu.

“Daoist Liu, I heard that you still haven’t generated your own Tianxuan Treasure Record?”

Xu Bai started the conversation with this question.

A hint of gloom flashed across Liu Wenyu’s face, but he did not say anything out of line. Instead, he spoke with implicit meaning:

“Soon. Although many cultivators in the Immortal Alliance still have concerns about the existence of the Tianxuan Treasure Record and are unwilling to generate it…”

“But I heard that the official decision has already been made. Any member within the system of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance must generate the treasure record within their body. For us Garrison Institution cultivators, we are required to be the first to fully comply. And this is only the first step.”

“I believe it won’t be long before the day comes when all cultivators under the heavens carry the treasure record.”

“Hmph, when that time comes…”

A trace of unconcealable apprehension flashed through Liu Wenyu’s eyes.

“I don’t see an issue with it. This thing is indeed miraculous. With it, many troubles are avoided.” Xu Bai smiled slightly, indifferent to the matter.

“Hm? You’ve already generated one?” Liu Wenyu’s expression changed, and he was about to retreat.

But Xu Bai grabbed him.

The Endstone Plate suddenly appeared above them, emitting a dim white glow that enveloped both of them.

“Relax. The Tianxuan Treasure Record is nothing. Our Heaven-Suppressing Society doesn’t even regard it as a threat.” Xu Bai spoke with an air of arrogance, straightforwardly.

“Heaven-Suppressing Society? I don’t know what you’re talking about.” Liu Wenyu’s face turned pale, and he quickly shook his head.

Breaking free from Xu Bai’s grasp, he attempted to flee.

However, upon hearing Xu Bai’s next words, he abruptly halted.

“I’ve made it this obvious, and you still don’t see it? As a spy of the Five Elders Association, your instincts are really dull.”

Xu Bai shook his head slightly. “I’ll be direct—our Heaven-Suppressing Society possesses a method to block the Tianxuan Treasure Record’s surveillance.”

Though his tone was calm, Liu Wenyu’s ears rang as if he had just been struck by thunder.

“Impossible! Absolutely impossible!” He lost his composure on the spot. “We have been completely powerless against it…”

Liu Wenyu’s words came to an abrupt stop. His face darkened. “You’re tricking me?”

Xu Bai chuckled lightly. “If I were lying, then I imagine it wouldn’t be long before the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s Garrison Institution cultivators arrive to execute us both on the spot.”

“Daoist Liu, why not wait and see? In any case, things have already come to this point, and even if you wanted to run, you wouldn’t be able to.”

Liu Wenyu’s expression shifted continuously. In the end, he withdrew his foot and collapsed into a chair inside the room, anxiously waiting.

Time passed slowly, each second feeling like an eternity.

Yet, even after half a day, there was no movement outside.

Liu Wenyu became increasingly doubtful. He raised his head to look at the Endstone Plate hovering above them, his eyes filled with disbelief.

“This thing… can really block the Tianxuan Treasure Record’s detection?” His face was full of shock.

“Heaven-Suppressing is not just an empty name.” Xu Bai said coolly.

Chapter 759: The World Has Bewitched Cultivators

"Heaven-Suppressing Society..."

Liu Wenyu was filled with shock, murmuring softly under his breath.

His eyes were locked onto the Endstone Plate above his head, and he couldn't help but reach out with both hands, wanting to touch it.

As a spy secretly working for the Five Elders Association, he had been cornered by the Tianxuan Treasure Record. He knew all too well just how precious this object was.

"What is this?" Liu Wenyu couldn't help but ask.

"The Heaven-Concealing Disc," Xu Bai replied indifferently. With a thought, the Endstone Plate instantly faded into illusion, causing Liu Wenyu’s hands to grasp nothing but air.

Only then did Liu Wenyu suddenly snap back to reality.

Reluctantly shifting his gaze away from the Endstone Plate, he cupped his hands solemnly and said, "Fellow Daoist, you must have come here for something important."

Xu Bai snorted coldly, "That's right. I’m here to demand an explanation!"

"Huh?" Liu Wenyu was momentarily stunned.

"Not long ago, a Dao Integration cultivator that our organization controlled using the True Temptation Fruit showed signs of breaking free. Fortunately, we discovered it in time and took other measures before he could fully turn against us. Otherwise, our Heaven-Suppressing Society would have suffered a disastrous loss," Xu Bai said grimly.

"Didn’t you say that the True Temptation Fruit was a creation of the Heavenly Sovereign and was absolutely infallible? How could there be such a flaw?"

"Empty boasts! No wonder you've been suppressed by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance to this extent," Xu Bai glanced at him disdainfully and said in a slow, deliberate tone.

"The True Temptation Fruit failed?" Liu Wenyu’s face turned pale with shock, but he quickly shook his head repeatedly.

"That is absolutely impossible. As long as the Heavenly Sovereign exists in this world, no Dao Integration cultivator can defy His power," Liu Wenyu said with absolute certainty.

Xu Bai said in a deep voice, "And yet, the loss of control happened. How do you explain that?"

"Fellow Daoist, don’t be hasty. Please describe the situation in detail."

So Xu Bai omitted names and specific details, fabricating an account of a Dao Integration cultivator who, upon realizing he was being controlled, attempted to rebel.

Liu Wenyu pondered for a moment before responding, "Perhaps the problem lies in how you used the True Temptation Fruit."

Xu Bai’s face darkened with anger. "So now you’re saying the problem is on our side? We followed your instructions to the letter!"

Liu Wenyu hurriedly explained, "The True Temptation Fruit can distort a cultivator's thoughts, making them believe even the most absurd notions. However, cultivators are not mindless puppets. They still have their own consciousness. If the implanted lie is too simplistic, and they later encounter contradictions, they won’t suspect the lie itself but might attempt to verify it in their own ways.

"For example, if you use the True Temptation Fruit to implant the idea that a Dao Integration cultivator is nothing more than a powerless mortal, he will act accordingly. However, if one day, by sheer accident, he effortlessly kills a Nascent Soul True Lord, the contradiction between reality and his implanted belief will force him to search for the cause of the inconsistency—he must find an explanation that convinces himself.

"Otherwise, the disparity between perception and reality could drive him into madness.

"Likewise, if you use the True Temptation Fruit to instill unwavering loyalty in a Dao Integration cultivator, but he later realizes that this loyalty might be the result of external influence, he will still remain loyal. However…

"His way of expressing that loyalty… may become rather extreme."

Liu Wenyu paused for a moment, glanced at Xu Bai, and then continued, “He might believe that the Xuanhuang Realm is full of hidden dangers. If one's strength is insufficient yet exposed to the outside world, it could very well endanger their life. So he believes that imprisoning you in a dungeon somewhere and having you cultivate endlessly until you achieve Dao Integration is the safest approach. Only when you have enough power to traverse the Xuanhuang Realm should you be released.”

“From an outsider’s perspective, this might seem twisted and unreasonable. However, in their understanding, this is completely logical and follows a natural course.”

“In our Five Elders Association, there was once a case of a loyal cultivator defecting to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance. He remained loyal to the Five Elders Association, but he believed that the strength of the Immortal Ancestor was unfathomable and that we were incapable of opposing them. Over time, defeat would be inevitable. He thought that only by proactively surrendering and facilitating a merger with the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance could there be a chance for survival.”

Liu Wenyu sighed helplessly and said, “He spoke so convincingly that he even tried to persuade other members of the Five Elders Association to follow him.”

“There are actually quite a few people like this. We refer to them as ‘Obsession-Craze Cultivators.’ This is the result of a partial misalignment with the Heavenly Principles of the Xuanhuang Realm, due to the Heavenly Sovereign’s incomplete grasp of supreme logic.”

“Of course, if every Heavenly Sovereign possessed the omnipresent divine power of Carefree Heavenly Sovereign, such incidents wouldn’t happen.”

As Liu Wenyu explained, Xu Bai’s expression gradually softened.

“When we initially set up the deception, we made it as foolproof as possible. Who would have thought that something like this would still happen…” Xu Bai snorted coldly.

Liu Wenyu also looked helpless. “After all, we're dealing with a Dao Integration cultivator—it’s inevitable. If they were that easy to control, wouldn’t our Five Elders Association have unified the Xuanhuang Realm long ago? We wouldn’t have ended up in our current predicament.”

“So what do we do now? This is an extremely critical matter, yet it wasn’t discussed in advance during our transaction. Letting him go is out of the question, but keeping him imprisoned for too long will arouse suspicion. Should we just kill him and frame you for it?” Xu Bai asked.

Liu Wenyu was startled and quickly responded, “Fellow Daoist, don’t act recklessly. I believe there’s still a way to salvage this.”

“One option is to use the ‘True Temptation Fruit’ on him again to repair the flaws in the deception.”

“The other option…”

Liu Wenyu’s expression turned a bit strange. “We reveal the truth to him directly and then convince him to abandon his ‘crazed obsession.’”

“Explain more clearly.” Xu Bai’s face darkened.

Liu Wenyu lowered his voice. “Let’s take the cultivator who defected to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance as an example. The reason he defected was simply because he believed that our Five Elders Association was no match for the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance. If we can provide irrefutable proof that the Five Elders Association is actually stronger than the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance—or at the very least, can stand against them—then he will return to our side.”

“After all, his belief in loyalty to the Five Elders Association has never truly wavered.”

Xu Bai instantly understood his meaning.

“Of course, if this ‘persuasion’ process is combined with the True Temptation Fruit, the effect will be even greater,” Liu Wenyu added.

“Daoist Xu, does your Heaven-Suppressing Society still require any more True Temptation Fruits?” he asked.

Chapter 760: The Appearance of the Ziqiong

Xu Bai did not respond.

He simply pointed to the Endstone Disc above his head and asked calmly, “Does your Five Elders Association need this?”

Liu Wenyu was momentarily stunned, then nodded repeatedly.

“Before coming here, our organization had already given instructions: a fair trade—one Disc in exchange for one True Temptation Fruit,” Xu Bai said, looking up.

Liu Wenyu nodded slightly. He did not think Xu Bai was asking for too much. In fact, he believed that the Five Elders Association was getting a great deal in this trade.

His gaze lingered greedily on the Endstone Plate, and he said, “That shouldn't be a problem. However, I still need to report to my superiors for confirmation.”

Hearing this, Xu Bai handed him another Endstone Plate and said, “Keep this with you for now. The outside world is full of Tianxuan Mirror’s eyes. If you accidentally expose yourself, things could turn bad.”

At the same time, Xu Bai explained in detail how to use the Endstone Plate.

Liu Wenyu’s eyes flickered with excitement, and he felt a slight sense of gratitude toward Xu Bai. “Fellow Daoist, your foresight is commendable. In these difficult times, our two groups should indeed join forces to overcome the crisis.”

Xu Bai waved his hand dismissively. “Go on then. Hurry back, I’ll be waiting here.”

Liu Wenyu nodded before transforming into a streak of light and disappearing.

He returned in less than half an hour, rushing back in a hurry.

“The higher-ups have agreed to the trade. However, there’s one issue—how many of these Heaven-Concealing Discs can your Heaven-Suppressing Society provide?” Liu Wenyu asked.

“These items are difficult to refine, and even our organization doesn’t have enough,” Xu Bai said solemnly.

This was within Liu Wenyu’s expectations. However, Xu Bai’s next words sent a shock through his heart.

“At most, we can only spare a few hundred for you.” Xu Bai sighed, sounding somewhat helpless.

“So many?!” Liu Wenyu’s face was filled with astonishment, and he blurted out in shock.

Instantly, a wave of regret surged within him.

He had realized that these Heaven-Concealing Discs might not be as valuable as he had initially thought.

“Too many? Then let’s make it a hundred instead. After all, if your Five Elders Association doesn’t want them, there are plenty of cultivators who do.” Xu Bai snorted coldly, his tone straightforward.

“When I say a few hundred, of course, they will be delivered in batches. Did you think these things grow like weeds, just needing water to sprout?”

“No, no, not too many at all.” Liu Wenyu hurriedly reassured him.

“However, we don’t have that much True Temptation Fruit in stock…” Liu Wenyu said hesitantly.

“Same as before—any valuable resources will do.” Xu Bai waved his hand dismissively. “In fact, we could even lend you a batch of Heaven-Concealing Discs first.”

“But…” Xu Bai’s tone grew serious. “The organization believes that we need to strengthen our cooperation further.”

“Strengthen cooperation?” Liu Wenyu frowned slightly.

“Ever since the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance established the Rebirth Mansion, and since the Tianxuan Mirror began its strange movements, our once-promising situation has taken a sudden turn for the worse. If the Rebirth Heavenly Sovereign has truly defied fate and cannot be stopped, so be it. But now, the Tianxuan Mirror is scanning countless small worlds across Xuanhuang, attempting to ascend—and your Five Elders Association remains indifferent…”

“With five Heavenly Sovereigns on your side, surely you have some means of counteracting this, don’t you?” Xu Bai asked, clearly dissatisfied.

“What exactly are you all doing?”

Liu Wenyu hesitated, as if he wanted to say something but held back.

After a long silence, he sighed in defeat. “It’s not just you, Daoist. I, too, have many doubts about this matter.”

“Perhaps, I can use this trade as an opportunity to find out the truth.” His expression was unreadable.

“The situation is urgent. The sooner we trade, the better. Three days from now, outside Tianliang City, in Wuliang Mountain.”

After setting the location for the exchange, Liu Wenyu prepared to leave.

“Don’t forget—the Heaven-Concealing Disc I gave you earlier counts as part of the trade,” Xu Bai reminded him.

Liu Wenyu’s steps faltered slightly upon hearing this, then he quickened his pace even more.

A moment later, Xu Bai also left the room, turning into a streak of light and disappearing into the distance.

Wuliang Mountain

Since the Boundless Wall incident—where cultivators were swallowed by the wall—the already remote Wuliang Mountain had become even more deserted.

Very few cultivators in the world understood the true nature of the Boundless Wall’s enlightenment.

Moreover, most cultivators were now focused on conquering small worlds and earning merits.

As a result, even fewer people ventured here.

After all, if one died in battle, they could be resurrected. But if they were swallowed by the Boundless Wall, there was no telling what would happen.

Xu Bai silently arrived at the bottom of a valley in Wuliang Mountain.

From a distance, he gazed at the Boundless Wall, its surface as smooth as a mirror, and patiently waited.

"I heard that it was you who rescued Guan Xingxiu's nephew from the Boundless Wall last time?"

Suddenly, a voice rang out behind Xu Bai.

Xu Bai was startled.

Turning around, he saw a middle-aged cultivator dressed in a purple-gold Daoist robe standing beside him.

The man was quietly observing the Boundless Wall without looking at Xu Bai.

But it was clear that he was the one who had just spoken.

Xu Bai's heart grew heavy.

Even though the man had deliberately concealed his aura, the fact that Xu Bai couldn't sense his presence at all was enough to determine the truth of his cultivation level.

A Dao Integration Immortal Sage!

"Senior, it was merely by luck that I managed to rescue Guan Changge," Xu Bai replied respectfully.

At the same time, his mind raced as he tried to deduce the other party's identity.

At this time and place, someone of this cultivation level appearing here—

It couldn't be a coincidence.

"Could he be the contact for the Five Elders Association's transaction this time?" Xu Bai speculated.

"A Dao Integration Immortal Sage, acting as a spy for the Five Elders Association…?"

In an instant, the identity of the purple-gold-robed cultivator became obvious.

Immortal Sage Ziqiong.

The Supreme Commander of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s Martial Hall.

Even though Xu Bai had already learned from his past lives that this man was a spy,

Seeing Immortal Sage Ziqiong suddenly appear in front of him still gave him a bit of a shock.

Without revealing anything, Xu Bai cautiously probed,

"May I ask, Senior…?"

"I represent the Five Elders Association. I’m here to conduct a transaction with your Heaven-Suppressing Society."

To Xu Bai’s surprise, Immortal Sage Ziqiong stated his purpose outright, without any attempt to conceal it.

Xu Bai fell silent.

He couldn't quite figure out the man’s intentions and was carefully considering his next move.

Fortunately, it was only a clone of himself present, so he didn't feel too panicked.

"So, you've recognized my identity? Interesting. I've been overseeing the Martial Hall headquarters for many years without stepping outside."

"Your Heaven-Suppressing Society is quite something."

Immortal Sage Ziqiong glanced at Xu Bai and smiled slightly.

"Senior flatters us. I was simply startled to learn of your true identity so suddenly—I wasn’t sure what to say," Xu Bai said, cupping his hands and putting on a nervous expression.

Chapter 761: Rebirth Reduces Longevity

Before Ziqiong could respond, Xu Bai couldn't hold back his curiosity and asked with a puzzled expression, "This transaction is of great importance, and it makes sense that a senior like you would personally oversee it. However, given your strength, concealing your identity should be effortless. Why...?"

"Aren’t you afraid that our Heaven-Suppressing Society might use this information to blackmail you?" Xu Bai's sharp gaze was fixed on Ziqiong.

Ziqiong replied calmly, "Blackmail? Heh, don’t misunderstand. Although I came here on behalf of the Five Elders Association, that doesn’t really mean much."

"I’m just running an errand, nothing more."

Ziqiong's confident and fearless demeanor made Xu Bai feel a bit uncertain.

"No need to be surprised. In the end, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance belongs to the Immortal Ancestor. As for me, from beginning to end, I’ve only remained loyal to him and no one else. As for the rest, they are trivial matters."

"The so-called Great Dao of Fifty, the Heavens evolve into forty-nine. The Tianxuan Mirror seeks to perceive all things in the world, so it is only natural that something beyond its control must exist."

"Otherwise, this 'New Heaven' would be imperfect."

Ziqiong raised his head to look at the sky, slowly explaining.

"So, even if the Heavenly Sovereign knows what I’m doing, He wouldn’t blame me. He might even reward me instead."

"Hmph, but those mortals may not necessarily understand my intentions."

Though just a few words, the amount of information they contained was terrifying. Upon hearing this, Xu Bai fell into deep contemplation.

"Knowing too much without reaching that realm is not necessarily a good thing."

Before long, the Immortal Sage Ziqiong interrupted Xu Bai's thoughts.

With a casual wave, he tossed over the Voidbright Stone Mother containing the transaction materials.

This time, there was no formal contract.

It was evident that Ziqiong was supremely confident in his strength, unafraid of Xu Bai playing any tricks.

Nonetheless, Xu Bai still followed protocol, carefully verifying the material list in the stone

before handing over the previously agreed fifty Endstone Plate.

"This is the first batch. The rest will be delivered gradually in the future," Xu Bai explained.

The fifty End Disc Plates were not stored in a spatial ring. Instead, they were stacked like thin sheets of paper, overlapping one another.

With a single thought, they would automatically separate, forming individual entities.

Ziqiong picked up one of the discs and examined it thoughtfully. After a moment, he remarked,

"This object seems ordinary, yet it can shield against the perception of the Tianxuan Mirror...Interesting."

Storing the Endstone Plates away, Ziqiong instructed, "In future transactions, others will contact you. If your Heaven-Suppressing Society encounters any emergencies, you can still seek out Liu Wenyu."

"However, try not to involve me. Although I don't mind..."

"If those people set their sights on you, even I won’t be able to protect you."

Immortal Sage Ziqiong’s figure gradually faded, leaving as suddenly as he had arrived.

"Senior, why does the Five Elders Association keep retreating in the face of the Tianxuan Mirror’s relentless aggression, without even the slightest countermeasure?"

Just before Ziqiong's figure completely disappeared, Xu Bai asked.

Ziqiong did not answer, merely glanced faintly at the sky before vanishing.

"Hm?" Xu Bai also looked up at the sky.

A moment later, his expression turned grim and fearful.

That "Heaven" was clearly not referring to the Tianxuan Mirror.

Immortal Sage Ziqiong had stated that he remained loyal to the Immortal Ancestor from start to finish.

His final gesture made it even more obvious.

It wasn’t that the Five Elders Association didn’t want to fight back. It was just that, with the Immortal Ancestor present, they dared not act.

Xu Bai couldn't help but recall the sigh from Mr. Bai's illusion back then:

"The path of immortality ahead cannot be tread upon, for the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor stands above."

Xu Bai subconsciously clenched his hand.

"In my previous life, perhaps it was the departure of the Immortal Ancestor that caused Ziqiong to once again lean towards the Five Elders Association, becoming a pure spy."

"But in this life, I used the 'Chaos' Character and brought back the already departed Immortal Ancestor. As a result, Ziqiong still holds onto his somewhat unique stance and hasn’t completely acted as a spy for the Five Elders Association."

In an instant, Xu Bai sorted out the sequence of events in his mind, but countless doubts still surged within him.

The main question was the true purpose of the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor.

If his ultimate goal was transcendence and leaving the Xuanhuang Realm, then even if he was deeply concerned about the 'Chaos', after returning and finding nothing, he should have chosen to leave again.

However, a long time had passed, and the Immortal Ancestor still lingered in the Xuanhuang Realm without any sign of leaving.

"It seems that the Xuanhuang Realm holds some special significance to the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor—something that cannot be casually abandoned."

"Moreover, the ascension of the Tianxuan Mirror in this world must have been approved by the Immortal Ancestor himself. He needs the Tianxuan Mirror to complete its transformation, yet he tacitly allows for potential flaws..."

"Heaven's Will has its shortcomings, so he must also impose limitations on the Tianxuan Mirror."

...

Countless speculations flashed through Xu Bai’s mind.

Even though this physical body was favored by heaven and possessed extraordinary talent, it still felt like looking at flowers through fog—completely unable to discern the intentions of the Immortal Ancestor.

Feeling a bit confused, Xu Bai returned to Tianliang City, only to be summoned by Nangong Shirong.

"Recently, there have been some unfavorable rumors within the territory. Go and handle it." Nangong Shirong said vaguely.

Normally, Xu Bai was merely a Liaison Envoy of Tianliang Prefecture. In cases of rumors or slander, it would be reasonable for either the Garrison Institution or the Martial Hall to take charge. Yet, Nangong Shirong secretly assigned the task to him alone.

Xu Bai immediately understood.

This matter must not be made public and needs to be handled quickly and cleanly.

It was because of his ability that Nangong Shirong entrusted him with this task.

With orders from his superior, subordinates naturally couldn’t refuse.

"Rest assured, my lord. I will handle it properly." Xu Bai cupped his hands and confidently pledged.

After leaving under Nangong Shirong’s watchful gaze, Xu Bai inquired around to understand what the so-called "unfavorable" rumors were all about.

It turned out that within Tianliang Prefecture, there was a cultivator named Peng Qing who, shortly before his death, suddenly went mad and began flying around erratically.

While flying chaotically, he babbled nonsense, claiming that he was supposed to live for five hundred years, but now, after less than four hundred years, he was on the verge of death.

He insisted that some thief must have secretly reduced his lifespan.

Peng Qing cursed incessantly, and then, in full view of the crowd, he suddenly dropped dead.

His death was exceptionally tragic—bleeding from all seven orifices and aging hundreds of years in an instant.

His appearance, once that of a middle-aged cultivator, abruptly transformed into that of a decayed old man.

Chapter 762: Reordering Heaven and Earth

After carefully understanding the situation, Xu Bai’s first thought was not how to suppress the heated public outcry.

Instead, his true self, thousands of miles away, immediately checked his [Truth] panel.

His physiological lifespan limit had not decreased.

However, Xu Bai did not believe that Peng Qing’s words were mere nonsense.

The Rebirth Heavenly Sovereign had first attained the Dao amidst the White Mist.

And as everyone knew, the White Mist—also known as Devouring Essence White Mist—had the ability to consume a cultivator’s lifespan.

Peng Qing’s sudden violent death and his miserable state before passing were almost identical to those of cultivators who perished within the White Mist.

Such a coincidence could not be explained away.

Nevertheless, to prevent the situation from escalating, Xu Bai first silenced all witnesses of that day through a combination of coercion and enticement.

Then, he sent out cultivators to spread even more bizarre and terrifying rumors.

For instance:

In some place, a cultivator died just as miserably as Peng Qing, and in his final moments, he shouted:

"The one who shall annihilate the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is none other than the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor!"

Another rumor claimed that Peng Qing was never really Peng Qing—the real Peng Qing had died years ago.

The one who perished in front of everyone that day was actually a clone created by a cultivator of the Five Elders Association, known as the Thousand-Faced Demon Lord.

This schemer had harbored ulterior motives, attempting to sow chaos within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

...

For a while, rumors spread wildly, making it impossible to discern truth from fiction.

Gradually, although the fervor of the discussions did not diminish, fewer people paid attention to Peng Qing’s actual deranged words before his death.

And so, another ten days passed.

The Peng Qing Incident slowly faded from people’s memories. Fewer and fewer discussed it until, in the end, public opinion completely died down—

as if the event had never even occurred.

Xu Bai had fulfilled his duty, and Nangong Shirong was extremely pleased.

In a rare act of generosity, he rewarded Xu Bai with substantial merits and contributions.

He even handed Xu Bai a statue.

"This is…?" Xu Bai held the statue in his palm, feeling a mysterious sensation surge within him—

As if he were holding another version of himself.

"This is the [Rebirth Decree]." Nangong Shirong introduced it with a proud expression.

"Not long ago, I received three of these from above. I kept one for myself, but carrying extra is pointless. Since you have performed a great service this time, I might as well reward you with one."

"With this, even if you were to perish, you would be instantly resurrected."

Xu Bai’s face lit up with joy. "Many thanks for your generosity, my lord!"

Since the establishment of the Rebirth Mansion, despite being a state-level liaison officer, Xu Bai had never managed to uncover the methods for acquiring the many treasures housed within it.

Back when the decree was first issued, it was proclaimed that anyone could obtain these treasures as long as they had enough contribution points.

However, the Rebirth Mansion of each region remained tightly sealed.

Not only were ordinary cultivators unable to enter, but even Xu Bai himself found it completely inaccessible—

Let alone exchange for any of its legendary artifacts.

Although cultivators across the land were deeply dissatisfied, the Rebirth Mansion was not under the jurisdiction of any regional authorities.

It simply deflected inquiries by claiming that "sufficient supplies were not yet prepared."

Xu Bai carefully stored away the Rebirth Decree.

Just as he was about to leave, he suddenly asked in a low voice:

"Lord Nangong, before Peng Qing died, he claimed that some thief had stolen his lifespan…"

"Could it have really happened?"

"If it’s true, then suppressing the truth may work for a while, but it won’t last forever."

Nangong Shirong fell silent for a moment before shaking his head slightly.

"Since anyone can now revive, does lifespan even matter anymore?"

"For cultivators like us, attaining the Dao and achieving eternal life is nothing more than an unattainable dream. Since that’s the case, why should we concern ourselves with such things?"

Nangong Shirong paused for a moment before changing the topic:

"However, not all cultivators in the world may be as open-minded as I am. Sooner or later, people across various regions will realize the truth. It won't be suppressed forever."

"What we must do is ensure that this matter does not first erupt in our Tianliang State."

Nangong Shirong said coldly.

His words were essentially an acknowledgment of the truth in Peng Qing's final words before his death.

Xu Bai remained silent but nodded heavily.

On his way out, Xu Bai’s mind churned with thoughts:

"Draining lifespan..."

"Is it a necessary means for the Rebirth Heavenly Sovereign to imperfectly reverse the natural order and complete the true resurrection of a cultivator's soul?"

"Or..."

"Is it a deliberate imitation of the ancient Ruomu?"

From the moment this Rebirth Heavenly Sovereign revealed his traces to the moment he officially defied the natural order, everything about him exuded an eerie peculiarity.

"The Tianxuan Mirror replaces the heavens."

"The Rebirth Heavenly Sovereign replaces Ruomu."

...

Suddenly, Xu Bai realized something, and his entire body stiffened.

Just like the Immortal Sage Ziqiong before, he instinctively glanced at the sky, barely perceptibly.

Then, he quickly lowered his head and walked away in haste.

Tianquan State, Shuo Feng Courtyard.

"Brother Li?"

A slightly surprised voice from Shuo Feng rang out.

During their sparring match, Shuo Feng had been fighting with great enthusiasm.

Yet, in a crucial moment, Li Fan suddenly froze. A blow he could have easily dodged struck him head-on.

The immense sword energy surged, directly slicing Li Fan’s lower half into nothingness.

Fortunately, this was the era of the new cultivation methods.

Such a minor injury was of no great concern to a Nascent Soul True Lord.

Within a single breath, amidst a faint rumbling in his cave-heaven, Li Fan’s body rapidly regenerated.

Li Fan looked apologetic: "I only recently mastered this Lifespan Draining Divine Ability. After battling you continuously for days, I seem to have become somewhat absent-minded."

Shuo Feng suddenly understood:

"That was my oversight. I got carried away and forgot that such a top-tier divine ability must consume an immense amount of energy."

"Hahaha, it's my fault for being too excited. It's been a long time since I’ve encountered such a mystical technique."

"To think that it even affects my control over the Sword..." Shuo Feng clicked his tongue in admiration.

"Brother Li, you should rest for a moment."

As he spoke, a flash of sword light appeared, and Shuo Feng casually sliced off a few strands of white hair from his head.

Then, with a loud shout, his entire body shed like a snake molting its skin.

Like taking off old clothes, he completely discarded his aged and weakened body.

Now rejuvenated and at peak strength, Shuo Feng flicked his fingers, reducing his discarded form to ashes.

He sighed as he spoke:

"Fellow Daoist, this [Extracting Threads, Cutting Life] divine ability is truly extraordinary. In terms of practical combat effect, it's the most remarkable technique I have ever witnessed in my life."

"If not for my special physique, I wouldn't dare fight you so recklessly."

"Any ordinary cultivator struck by your technique would likely age to death within half a day."

Li Fan made a weary gesture and waved his hand:

"Don’t mention it. Though I poured my heart and soul into creating it, it still fails to keep up with the times."

"Now that the Rebirth Mansion stands atop the heavens, anyone can be resurrected. No matter how powerful my divine ability is, its deterrence has weakened significantly. After all, if one can be revived, what does it matter if their body deteriorates?"

Li Fan let out a long sigh.

Shuo Feng shook his head:

"Brother Li, you underestimate yourself. Reincarnation and resurrection..."

"Hmph."

"True powerhouses of this era would never disregard your divine ability. Just by mastering this technique, you have already surpassed countless self-proclaimed geniuses in this world."

"Hmm... Your treatment should also be reconsidered. Merely a Junior Worshipper title seems rather unfair for you."

Shuo Feng stroked his chin and spoke slowly.

Chapter 763: Tianxuan Evolution & Immortal Technique

Shuo Feng's efficiency was truly remarkable.

He summoned a female cultivator dressed in a light purple long skirt, and shortly after giving the order, Li Fan learned that he had officially become a mid-level guest elder of the Xuan Family.

His initial merit level in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had been raised to level 35.

At the same time, he unlocked a new privilege: once every hundred years, he could freely utilize the Tianxuan Mirror to deduce and enhance one of his divine abilities.

“If you don't use your rights, they will expire. This is the perfect opportunity, Brother Li. You should take advantage of this to further increase the power of the [Extracting Threads, Cutting Life] technique. Though it already feels quite powerful, it hasn't yet reached perfection and still has room for improvement.”

Shuo Feng stretched his body, and his bones made a series of crackling sounds. Noticing that Li Fan seemed a bit lost in thought, he reminded him aloud.

“Once you’ve advanced further, we can have a good, satisfying battle!”

Among his peers, few cultivators could keep up with his cultivation progress. Most would fall behind before long, losing the ability to compete with him. Finding a worthy opponent like Li Fan was already rare.

Moreover, Li Fan occasionally managed to surprise him, which made Shuo Feng genuinely pleased with him.

“I wonder, what’s the difference between this divine ability deduction feature and the one offered by the Tianxuan Treasure Record? I previously tried using the Tianxuan Mirror to deduce the continuation of a divine ability during the [Sitting and Discussing Dao] session. However, the cost was prohibitively high, like a bottomless pit, and I had to give up halfway.”

Li Fan looked at the prompt from the Tianxuan Mirror and couldn't help but ask.

“The Tianxuan Treasure Record is merely a branch of Tianxuan. Though it’s already amazing for most cultivators, it still pales compared to the true power of the Tianxuan Mirror itself,” Shuo Feng replied with a smile.

“For the same divine ability, the continuation deduced by the Tianxuan Treasure Record and the Tianxuan Mirror is not worlds apart, but there is certainly a qualitative difference.”

However... Shuo Feng's smile suddenly faded.

“This is only the current difference between the Tianxuan Treasure Record and the Tianxuan Mirror. As time goes on... things may change.”

“Perhaps one day, every single branch mirror will be indistinguishable from the original mirror.”

His expression became a bit solemn, as if he had thought of something troubling.

Li Fan, realizing the implication of Shuo Feng’s words, felt his heart pound violently.

It turned out that the level 35 merit privilege actually allowed one to leverage the true Tianxuan Mirror itself to deduce divine abilities!

Did that mean he would once again have the chance to witness the real Tianxuan Mirror?

The last time he saw it was during the training to construct the Tianxuan Spirit-Locking Formation, in that vast space filled with black-and-white lines. Alongside the other trainees, he had witnessed the birth and sealing of the Tianxuan Newborn Mirror up close.

“In this world, the Tianxuan Mirror has already undergone a preliminary transformation. I wonder what changes have taken place within it.”

Li Fan’s thoughts were in turmoil.

Shuo Feng, coming out of his contemplation, added another piece of advice:

“As for the divine ability deduction feature in the [Sitting and Discussing Dao] module... you’d best avoid it from now on.”

“Even I only dared to try it when I was young and reckless. Now that I’ve sobered up, I don’t want to waste my resources in vain.”

Shuo Feng rarely displayed such a wistful expression.

Li Fan was slightly taken aback.

“Why is that? Is there something even Brother Shuo can’t afford?”

Shuo Feng waved his hand and explained:

“Divine abilities in this world have a difference between theoretical and practical applications.”

“When deducing a divine ability, both the Tianxuan Treasure Record and the Tianxuan Mirror will set a potential upper limit. For example, your [Extracting Threads, Cutting Life] technique, when cast at the Nascent Soul stage, can at most harm a cultivator at the Soul Transformation stage. It may have some effect on a Dao Integration cultivator as well.”

“However, before an Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign, it would definitely lose effectiveness. This is the inherent limit of most divine abilities in the world.”

“No matter how talented someone may be, it’s impossible to create a divine ability in the Xuanhuang Realm that can threaten an Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign without having reached that realm oneself.”

“This is the reality.”

Shuo Feng paused, raising his head to look at the sky.

After a moment of silence, he suddenly spoke,

"In theory, is there truly a technique below the realm of Longevity that can affect the divine abilities of a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign?"

"There must be something in this world," a trace of longing flashed through Shuo Feng’s eyes.

"But that might already be approaching the level of legendary immortal arts. Not just for us—even the Tianxuan Mirror would find it incredibly difficult to deduce the existence of such a level. Besides using the majority of its computational power, success might also depend on a stroke of luck."

"The deduction function of the [Sitting and Discussing Dao] has no set upper limit. As long as something is theoretically possible, there’s a chance it can be deduced. That’s why the cost in contribution points to perform each deduction is unimaginably enormous. The further you go, the more this is the case."

"And the result..."

Shuo Feng let out a mocking laugh.

"Since the creation of the [Sitting and Discussing Dao] section so many years ago, it has attracted countless gamblers, recklessly throwing themselves into it—some even to the point of losing everything they own. The number of deductions the Tianxuan Mirror has performed is beyond calculation."

"But I've never heard of anyone succeeding."

Li Fan was stunned and shook his head repeatedly.

"I never thought there would be such a trick behind it. If I had known earlier, I definitely wouldn’t have taken the risk."

"When I almost got sliced in half by your sword back then, I knew I wasn’t one blessed with good fortune," Li Fan sighed.

Shuo Feng recalled their first meeting and found it amusing, bursting into hearty laughter.

"By the way, Brother Shuo, do you happen to have the Tianxuan Treasure Record on you?" Li Fan suddenly asked.

"Recently, there's been a rumor circulating that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is promoting the requirement for all cultivators to generate their own Treasure Record."

A trace of gloom flashed across Shuo Feng's face.

"Tianxuan Treasure Record..."

"Heh, I might just be the first person in the entire Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance to put that thing on."

"Let’s not talk about it! Just thinking about it annoys me!"

"Brother Li, fight me one more time!"

As he spoke, countless sword lights erupted from Shuo Feng's body, slicing fiercely toward Li Fan with an intense and resentful aura.

Li Fan's heart tightened, not daring to be careless, and he immediately focused his mind to respond.

In the Longevity Valley.

Fang Zaiji, who was ordered to go out and recruit disciples, had now successfully completed his mission.

In the grand square of the sect's main hall, a group of children around five or six years old stood timidly, looking around with fear written on their faces.

Some even broke down crying on the spot, causing a chain reaction that turned the scene into utter chaos.

"Mr. Fang, are these the 'promising seedlings' you brought back?"

Xu Bai looked at Fang Zaiji and asked.

Chapter 764: I Wish to Establish My Foundation

"You can rest assured, Sect Master. I will handle this matter properly," Fang Zaiji guaranteed, patting his chest confidently.

"My judgment is far better than Old Liu's. I won’t make a mistake. I dare to bet that every one of these little ones is a rare cultivation genius, one in ten thousand."

"I traveled across more than a dozen provinces just to find these few. That alone should tell you how difficult this journey was."

Fang Zaiji sighed with emotion.

"You didn’t just abduct these children without informing anyone, did you?" Liu San's expression darkened as he looked at the group of children crying together.

"What a joke! The path to immortality, the road to ascension—how many mortals beg for the opportunity but never get it? I am kindly leading them onto this path. Do I really need to get their parents' permission?" Fang Zaiji rolled his eyes at Liu San, speaking as if it was only natural.

"Besides, our Medicine King Sect is still in a state of seclusion. Of course, we must act with even greater secrecy."

Liu San was left speechless by his words.

"If Mr. Fang has chosen them, it means they share a karmic connection with our Medicine King Sect. I trust Mr. Fang’s judgment," Xu Bai coughed lightly and made the final decision.

"Unlike in ancient times, when countless sect cultivators roamed the world selecting disciples, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance now governs with a policy of non-interference. Who can embark on the path of cultivation is entirely determined by their own fate. As a result, many exceptionally talented individuals are left undiscovered."

"This might be an opportunity for our Medicine King Sect."

Hearing this, Liu San's eyes lit up. "Sect Master makes a valid point."

"In that case, taking care of these disciples will be up to you, Elder Liu. Start by teaching them the path of cultivation. Once they begin Qi Condensation..."

Xu Bai was speaking when suddenly, inspiration struck him.

After a brief moment of contemplation, he changed his mind. "When first teaching them the path of cultivation, do not mention the concept of ‘borrowing the wonders of heaven and earth to establish the Dao Foundation.’"

"Instead, only tell them to ‘forge their Dao Foundation by refining their own physical being!’"

Liu San and Fang Zaiji were momentarily stunned upon hearing this.

Neither of them was slow-witted—they immediately understood Xu Bai’s intentions.

"Brilliant! In this way, if any of them succeed in establishing their foundation, it will undoubtedly be through 'self-foundation establishment'!" Fang Zaiji slammed the table in admiration.

However, Liu San hesitated slightly. "Sect Master, wouldn’t this be a bit...?"

Xu Bai smiled faintly. "If they truly fail to establish their foundation and completely lose hope, it won’t be too late to reveal the truth to them then."

Seeing Xu Bai’s confidence, Liu San could only nod in agreement.

After explaining the details of "foundation establishment with One Self" to Liu San, Xu Bai suddenly asked, "By the way, why haven’t I seen Elder Jiang? I clearly sensed her returning aura."

Fang Zaiji immediately laughed gleefully. "She got into a fight with someone and suffered a miserable defeat. She's been deeply affected and has gone into seclusion for intense training."

"Haha, and I heard her opponent was a woman—more beautiful than her and even mocked her. Yushan must be absolutely livid!"

"Finally, we’ll have some peace and quiet without her sharp tongue for a while," Fang Zaiji said with an expression of relief.

Liu San’s expression, however, changed slightly. "What? This is important news, Old Fang. Why didn’t you mention it earlier? Was Yushan injured?"

His concern was evident, and he immediately set aside the task given to him by Xu Bai, flying off in a hurry to check on Jiang Yushan.

Fang Zaiji curled his lips. "I don’t get it. What does Liu San see in that woman?"

"Since Elder Jiang is in seclusion for training, the task of crafting the Endstone Plate will be left to you, Mr. Fang," Xu Bai spoke up, interrupting Fang Zaiji’s thoughts.

"With your skills, this shouldn’t be a problem, right?" Xu Bai looked at him expectantly.

Rather than feeling burdened, Fang Zaiji was overjoyed. "No problem at all! Of course not! The Endstone Plate—it's something that could even rival an immortal artifact! I’ve long thought Yushan’s methods were a bit too rough."

"Sect Master, rest assured. I will handle it with great care and gentleness."

Fang Zaiji stared eagerly at Xu Bai.

Xu Bai smiled and tossed the Endstone Plate over, handing it to him.

Without waiting for further instructions, Fang Zaiji, having obtained the treasured artifact, excitedly left on his own.

At this moment, Xu Bai finally turned his attention to the group of children gathered in the plaza.

If it were his true self present, he would surely have found their crying and noise unbearably annoying.

However, the clone of Xu Bai, looking at these noisy children before him, did not feel much impatience at all.

Instead, a sense of pity and affection welled up in his heart.

Xu Bai silently contemplated the origin of these emotions within his body.

A faint smile appeared on his face as he slowly floated down beside the children.

His ethereal, celestial-like appearance, combined with his incredibly gentle aura,

instantly captured the attention of all the children present.

They quieted down immediately, their eyes wide as they all turned to look at Xu Bai in unison.

Xu Bai warmly interacted with the children.

In just a short moment of excited chatter,

he had already learned all of their names and their respective cultivation talents.

"No wonder he was able to escape pursuit from the major sects time and time again during the ancient era. Fang Zaiji truly has some skill."

"These children's talents are almost on par with Zhang Haobo's."

"And then there's Gu Xinghan..."

Among the children, Xu Bai noticed a name that seemed familiar.

It was the same name as the cultivator who, in his past life, was the first to issue a proclamation revealing the true nature of the Tianxuan Spirit-Locking Formation to the world.

That powerful and stirring ten-thousand-word article vividly surfaced in Xu Bai's mind.

Looking once more at the five-year-old boy before him,

the two figures in his memory gradually overlapped.

"It really is him. Interesting."

In his past life, Gu Xinghan was one of the leaders of the Heaven-Suppressing Society, leading countless cultivators in their struggle against Mysterious Net, yet he was never captured by the Heavenly Alliance.

His abilities were beyond doubt.

"Perhaps this boy might surprise me."

Xu Bai gently patted Gu Xinghan on the shoulder, his smile deepening.

After a while, Liu San returned, looking somewhat dejected.

It was clear that he had not even managed to meet Jiang Yushan.

Forcing himself to perk up, he assumed a serious demeanor as he faced the children.

Thanks to Xu Bai’s earlier efforts to calm them, the children were now much more obedient.

As Xu Bai departed, they all waved enthusiastically, bidding him farewell.

Liu San clicked his tongue in amazement at the sight.

Instead of returning to Tianliang State, Xu Bai first entered a secret chamber within Longevity Valley.

A sudden thought had emerged in his mind, one he wasn’t entirely certain about.

He needed to calm his thoughts and carefully consider it.

"Should I use this body to perform the ritual and enter the Fallen Immortal Realm?"

This idea had surfaced in his mind just moments ago while interacting with the children.

For someone so kind to children, as Mr. Bai should be, just as Xu Ke had said, he was likely a "good person."

If that were true, then what would happen if he entered the Fallen Immortal Realm in this body?

Chapter 765: The Unpredictable Human Heart and Immortal Mind

There is no doubt that Mr. Bai is deeply connected to the Fallen Immortal Realm.

If Xu Bai were to enter using a clone, it might draw the attention of Mr. Bai, who resides within the Fallen Immortal Realm...

However, the outcome remains uncertain—whether it will bring fortune or disaster.

Since transmigrating to this world, Li Fan has experienced countless events and has long since stopped blindly trusting anything, even what he sees with his own eyes—especially when it concerns his own life and safety.

After pondering for a long time, Xu Bai finally suppressed the sudden impulse to explore the Fallen Immortal Realm.

"This situation is too strange; I must remain cautious," Xu Bai murmured, his expression unreadable.

This body was refined using Xu Ke's essence blood, combined with the spiritual demeanor of Mr. Bai.

Just by being slightly infused with his spiritual demeanor, Xu Bai began to exhibit several peculiar phenomena, including but not limited to:

Being favored by the heavens, possessing extraordinary talent.

Frequently feeling compassionate and merciful.

Occasionally having uncontrollable thoughts arise in his mind.

These phenomena alone were enough to prove the formidable power of Mr. Bai, causing Li Fan to become even more vigilant.

If the influence were limited to the clone, it would be manageable.

What Li Fan truly feared was that this transformation might subtly seep through the connection between the clone and his true self, ultimately affecting his true body.

By then, would he still be himself?

Even if he remained authentic, could he free himself from this kind of "contamination"?

Yes, in Li Fan’s eyes, this strange change that alters his original nature is undoubtedly a form of contamination—something he absolutely cannot tolerate.

"If I notice even the slightest sign of my true body being affected, I must immediately dispel it," Xu Bai resolved inwardly.

After calming his emotions, Xu Bai returned to his usual demeanor and left the Longevity Valley.

He traveled back to Tianliang Prefecture and continued to handle various matters as the liaison envoy.

Since the large-scale campaign to conquer the small worlds began, he had taken on a new responsibility—monitoring the number of discovered Cave-Heaven and small worlds within the territory and coordinating cultivators to lead expeditions against them.

The core reason behind this responsibility is that every unknown small world holds immense merit and contributions for cultivators.

Unless under special circumstances, cultivators are reluctant to share such discoveries with others.

Usually, they would first share the opportunity with close friends and family.

Only when the power of a small world is overwhelmingly strong and their small group is powerless to resolve it would they reluctantly consider joining forces with others.

The envisioned scenario by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance—where the entrance to a small world is openly shared with other alliance cultivators—is exceedingly rare.

As time passed, cultivators gradually realized that conquering small worlds is essentially a non-renewable resource.

It might even be the only chance in their lifetime to rapidly accumulate merit and contributions.

Thus, naturally, they strategize and maximize their gains.

Consequently, after the initial phase of rapid expansion, the process of conquering the myriad realms suddenly slowed down.

The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is well aware of the reasons behind this phenomenon.

Therefore, they assigned Xu Bai with this new responsibility.

Although no mandatory measures were imposed, his official status as an envoy of the alliance made it easier for him to facilitate cooperation between small groups.

Surprisingly, instead of encountering resistance, his reputation grew, and cultivators proactively sought his assistance.

After frequent interactions with them, Xu Bai gradually understood their needs and intentions.

First, they can share the entrance information of the small worlds they hold with others. However, in return, any cultivator who gains benefits from this must also give priority to helping them when discovering other small worlds in the future.

This is what is known as mutual assistance.

Second, conquering a small world is not as simple as eating or drinking. It requires constantly facing bloody battles, where the slightest mistake could lead to instant death. Therefore, fellow cultivators who embark on such journeys must be trustworthy. Though it may not be necessary to share life and death, at the very least, one must not stab others in the back.

Third, as the saying goes, "Don’t let fertile water flow into others' fields." If possible, the small worlds within Tianliang Prefecture should be managed and absorbed solely by the local cultivators of Tianliang Prefecture.

Xu Bai, having experienced a hundred reincarnations and priding himself on his deep understanding of human nature, still felt a slight headache when dealing with these cultivators harboring hidden agendas.

Often, the harmonious-looking teams he introduced would return with only a few survivors.

They would remain silent about the fallen comrades, only to start blaming one another.

Yet, when contacted again to form another expedition team, most of them—eight or nine out of ten—would still agree.

This was because, despite being aware of each other’s dark behavior, they at least knew some details about one another.

Compared to completely unfamiliar partners, those with some background knowledge were ironically more trustworthy.

"Human nature is truly unfathomable and hard to predict," Xu Bai sighed, shaking his head.

In his mind, the names of numerous cultivators resembled chess pieces, each positioned differently according to their personalities and abilities.

Xu Bai was trying to find a way to maximize the power of the cultivators in Tianliang Prefecture.

In a way, it was also a unique form of cultivation.

Xu Bai thought to himself.

"At present, Tianling Prefecture has already discovered thirteen small worlds. Among them, one is extremely dangerous—numerous expeditions have failed with no survivors—so it has been temporarily set aside. Of the remaining twelve, half have been completely cleared..."

After the cultivators of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance completely annihilated the resistance within the small worlds and scanned them with the Tianxuan Treasure Record, a team of black-robed cultivators from the alliance headquarters would take over.

They would drive out unrelated individuals and seal the entrances, conducting unknown activities within.

Even after inquiring with Nangong Shirong, Xu Bai could not uncover any secrets.

However, based on feedback from the cultivators under his command, he deduced that shortly after the black-robed cultivators took over, the entrances to these small worlds inexplicably disappeared.

Although the marked locations remained on the Tianxuan Treasure Record map, no matter how hard one searched, the actual entrances could not be found.

"It’s not that the entrances were concealed by some method—they fundamentally changed."

"In fact, the entrances still exist, but it seems they’ve undergone some kind of encryption, making it impossible to find them through conventional means."

This was the conclusion Xu Bai reached after conducting on-site explorations.

While Xu Bai was busy in Tianliang Prefecture...

The original body of Li Fan finally bid farewell to the enthusiastic Shuo Feng, leaving his residence.

During the days of being entangled in duels, although Li Fan himself benefited greatly, he was even more astonished by Shuo Feng's rapid progress.

From the very beginning, when Shuo Feng was utterly helpless against the Extracting Threads, Cutting Life, merely enduring with his peculiar constitution...

To later on, when Shuo Feng gradually adapted to the life-severing effects...

Chapter 766: Comprehending Divine Abilities Within the Mirror

"It’s like getting beaten so much that you develop resistance to divine abilities," Li Fan thought to himself in shock.

His techniques were becoming increasingly ineffective, while Shuo Feng was only growing stronger with each battle.

In the end, Li Fan admitted his inferiority and left, using the excuse that he needed time to reflect and develop new divine abilities.

Instead of going elsewhere, he headed straight for the Tianxuan Mirror in Tianquan Prefecture, utilizing his privilege level of authority-35.

However, the process was different from what he had imagined.

Rather than directly opening a passage from a Tianxuan Sub-Mirror to the Tianxuan Main Mirror, he was instead given a specific time and location to go to. He was instructed that someone would guide him at the designated time—there would be no waiting for late arrivals.

At the appointed time, Li Fan arrived outside Tianquan City, atop a towering stone mountain that resembled a lotus flower.

A middle-aged cultivator was already there, waiting.

The man had a goatee and wore a blue Daoist robe. He glanced at Li Fan with a hint of surprise but remained polite. He cupped his hands in greeting and said, "Greetings, fellow Daoist. I am Wang Wan."

Sensing the subtle aura Wang Wan unconsciously exuded, Li Fan judged that this man was at least at the Soul Transformation stage. He did not dare to be negligent and returned the greeting: "Greetings, Daoist Wang. I am Li Fan."

After a brief exchange of introductions, they nodded slightly and fell silent.

"A level 35 authority privilege isn’t something that can be achieved through cultivation strength alone. There must be deep connections within the Immortal Alliance. No wonder, despite my mid-stage Nascent Soul cultivation, he treats me with such respect," Li Fan thought to himself.

A short while later, another cultivator arrived at the mountain peak—a female cultivator dressed in tight-fitting white attire.

After greeting Li Fan and Wang Wan, she also remained silent, waiting quietly.

Li Fan learned that her name was Deng Mingxi.

After that, no more cultivators arrived.

A full incense stick’s time later, subtle ripples of spatial fluctuations appeared above the mountain peak.

It was as if invisible threads had cut open a transparent doorway.

A black-robed cultivator stepped out from within.

After scanning the three of them and confirming their identities, he said in a deep voice, "Follow me."

Without any discernible movement on his part, the transparent door instantly expanded, engulfing all three of them.

A dazzling light erupted.

The door and its occupants vanished from sight.

A familiar sensation surged through Li Fan.

It was just like the time he had entered the Root of Heaven and Earth in the void of Tianling Prefecture.

His flesh and bones felt as if they were dissolving and transforming.

When Li Fan regained consciousness, he found himself once again in that peculiar black-and-white form, composed entirely of lines—a ridiculous yet surreal appearance.

However, unlike in the Root of Heaven and Earth, this vast monochrome space seemed to contain a mysterious suppressive force.

That force settled upon him, preventing his own lines from slowly unraveling and dissipating.

Li Fan quietly sensed the faint yet ever-present suppressive power and thought to himself, "This must be the Tianxuan Mirror’s protective mechanism."

"After all, we are here to comprehend divine abilities. Without this protective layer, ordinary cultivators would likely be completely assimilated by this space within moments."

"However, given my previous experience in the Root of Heaven and Earth and my comprehension of the similar [Extracting Threads, Cutting Life] divine ability, I should be able to last longer than most."

Li Fan looked around.

Not far away, Deng Mingxi and Wang Wan had also transformed into line-drawn figures.

However, there was a noticeable difference from their original forms.

Deng Mingxi’s body was significantly smaller than the two male cultivators.

She now appeared to be no more than thirteen or fourteen years old.

Although Wang Wan's physique did not change much, his vaguely visible appearance transformed from a middle-aged cultivator with a goatee into an image of an elderly man, bent with age.

It seemed that Wang Wan was not coming to this place for the first time, as he moved forward swiftly and with practiced familiarity.

Deng Mingxi, on the other hand, was initially somewhat confused and fearful.

However, her mental resilience was strong, and she quickly adapted. Following Wang Wan, she flew toward the center of the black-and-white space.

Li Fan pondered for a moment and then followed along.

During the flight, Li Fan noticed that this place was different from the location where the Tianxuan Mirror had manifested its own mirrored subspace in his previous life.

It was not as vast and seemed relatively independent, yet faintly interconnected.

"The essence remains the Tianxuan Mirror, but their functions differ," Li Fan thought, gaining sudden clarity.

It didn't take long before they reached the very center of the black-and-white space.

There, countless intersecting lines formed a suspended platform.

At this moment, Deng Mingxi and Wang Wan landed on the platform.

The lines beneath their feet became extremely chaotic, splitting into countless fine black threads that extended downward like tiny tendrils, connecting to the ground below.

The scene looked somewhat eerie.

After a moment of contemplation, Li Fan imitated their actions.

In the next second, his vision once again became colorful and radiant.

Countless characters cascaded down like a waterfall before his eyes, finally forming several small lines of text:

"Cultivator [Li Fan] has connected."

"Please demonstrate the divine ability you wish to deduce within your Sea of Consciousness."

"Based on the current cultivation level of Cultivator [Li Fan], the upper limit for the divine ability deduction power is set at the [Soul Transformation] level."

"Remaining deduction time..."

The last line displayed a continuously ticking countdown, showing only ten hours remaining.

Before the Tianxuan Mirror, it was necessary to maintain some reservations.

However, this opportunity was hard to come by, so maximizing the benefit was equally essential.

That astonishing [Chaos] character divine ability definitely could not be revealed.

After pondering for a moment, Li Fan made up his mind.

"The spatial structure of this Tianxuan Mirror space is extremely similar to the root of the heaven and earth."

"If my guess is correct, it is analyzing the birth process of the world."

"In that case..."

With a thought, various insights about the [Reverse Five Elements Birth and Annihilation Sword] surged into Li Fan's mind.

The [Reverse Five Elements Creation-Destruction Sword] was a divine ability Li Fan had comprehended by building upon the Great Five Elements Annihilation Sword, adding his own understanding of the Path of Creation and Destruction.

However, he was only at the Nascent Soul stage, and his understanding of the Path of Creation and Destruction was still relatively shallow.

After all, his innate talent and comprehension were not as formidable as his clone Xu Bai's.

Since comprehending it, the technique had not seen much practical use.

For the most part, he still treated it as an Annihilation Sword.

As for the creative function of "creation," it was currently limited to trivial uses like forming spiritual stones in his palm—something extremely unimpressive.

"I hope this brings me some surprises," Li Fan thought.

He noticed that as he meditated on the divine ability comprehension of the [Reverse Five Elements Creation-Destruction Sword] in his mind, the lines connected to the platform under his feet swayed as if brushed by a gentle breeze.

The black color of the lines grew increasingly dense, as if something was being transmitted.

After just a brief moment, the feedback from the Tianxuan Mirror arrived.

Countless scenes flashed before Li Fan’s eyes in an instant.

He vaguely witnessed the birth process of the Five Elements Cave-Heaven, followed by countless overlapping images appearing simultaneously. They rose from the ground to the sky, forming a giant tree with countless branches.

Li Fan stood at the base of the tree, about to make a crucial decision.

Chapter 767: Transformation to Resolve the Crisis

Within Li Fan's sea of consciousness, a Endstone disc emitted a faint, eerie glow, constructing a layer of disguise outside his true spirit to guard against potential spying from the Tianxuan Mirror.

Before him stood a towering ancient tree, on which Li Fan saw countless vastly different yet seemingly interconnected scenes.

All of them were derived from the evolution of the [Reverse Five Elements Creation-Destruction Sword], presenting various possible outcomes.

One path strengthened the "Destruction" attribute, pushing the power of slaughter to its absolute limit.

Another path emphasized the "Creation" attribute, enabling not only instant healing of injuries but also the power to create objects from the void and give birth to living beings.

Yet another focused on the "Five Elements Force", integrating the elements into one or allowing them to counterbalance one another, generating endless possibilities.

The sudden influx of such colossal amounts of divine ability data overwhelmed even Li Fan's current mental strength. When attempting to examine the "Divine Ability Tree", he felt a slight mental strain.

Every specific divine ability he focused on would produce corresponding feedback in his mind.

After roughly understanding the overall picture, Li Fan glanced at the countdown timer continuously flashing at the top of his vision.

Only then did he realize that, unknowingly, half the time had already passed!

With less than five hours remaining, Li Fan pondered for a moment before swiftly making a decision.

He chose one of the potential branches from the fusion of the five elements, summarized in sixteen words: "The Five Elements unite as one, the limitless ebbs and flow; its power endures unending, the divine soul remains unextinguished."

Indeed, the divine ability that Li Fan desires is a wondrous secret technique capable of protecting the divine soul!

The power of the Five Elements' mutual generation can greatly enhance the circulation and recovery abilities of a cultivator’s physical body. It can almost reach a state where, even without external aid, the body achieves perpetual motion of spiritual energy. Ordinary physical injuries can also be healed in the blink of an eye.

In the deductions of the Tianxuan Mirror, it is similar to the power of the Five Elements' mutual generation. When the Five Elements unite as one, there is a certain possibility of entering a marvelous state of limitless fullness and emptiness.

In the ebb and flow of fullness and emptiness, it is like a person's breath bringing forth the source of life, generating an endless power that nourishes and strengthens the divine soul.

With this power to support him, even if his soul were severely injured, he could gradually recover on his own.

"Ordinary slaughter abilities are essentially useless to me," Li Fan mused to himself.

"For weaker opponents, I can simply use the [Insect Binding] divine ability to suppress them. For slightly stronger ones, [Heaven-Shattering Heart Sword] or [Extracting Threads, Cutting Life] would suffice."

"But if I were to encounter an overwhelmingly powerful opponent, I would have no choice but to face reality."

"For me, survival techniques—especially those related to the soul—are invaluable."

The mysterious impact caused by Mr. Bai on his clone had aroused a profound sense of crisis within Li Fan, forcing him to take it seriously.

Without hesitation or second-guessing, he resolutely locked onto his chosen divine ability in his mind.

In an instant, the once lush Divine Ability Tree began to fade from its branches and leaves, leaving behind a solitary, bare branch standing between heaven and earth.

It then transformed into a beam of light, shooting straight into Li Fan's sea of consciousness.

"Boom!"

It was as if a catastrophic explosion erupted within his mind, accompanied by blinding radiance and a flood of detailed divine ability information.

It felt as though someone was violently stirring his sea of consciousness with a thick wooden stick.

The unimaginable pain made Li Fan involuntarily let out a muffled groan.

However, within the world of the Tianxuan Mirror, only countless black-and-white lines representing rules existed—there was no physical sound.

From an outsider's perspective, Li Fan's line-figure appeared to tremble and sway as if suffering a tremendous impact.

Li Fan noticed that from time to time, one or two black lines on his body would separate and dissipate into the surrounding space under the intense transformation.

As this happened, he inexplicably felt a bit weaker.

Alerted, Li Fan focused his mind and made every effort to absorb and process the data that the Tianxuan Mirror was transmitting into his consciousness.

However, the complexity of this divine ability far exceeded his expectations.

With his current level of spiritual sense, even after a long time, the redundant data showed no signs of decreasing.

"The amount of data contained in this divine ability is too vast. At this rate..." Li Fan’s heart sank.

In just a short moment, his threaded figure had already dissolved by half.

"Should I abandon this divine ability and try again next time?"

In a flash of thought, Li Fan suppressed this instinctive idea.

Although startled, he remained calm and quickly devised a better approach.

Under the Endstone Disc, the Dao Deviation Stone suddenly erupted with a brilliant azure light under Li Fan's control.

Similar to the previous white light emitted when the Tianxuan Mirror transmitted the divine ability, the azure light instantly swept through Li Fan's entire sea of consciousness.

Within the blue glow, all the divine ability data was completely absorbed.

Like relentless waves washing away chaotic footprints on the shoreline, the divine ability data, filled with blue light, was gradually absorbed by the Deviation Stone.

"I have the Deviation Stone, so there's no need to rush. I can store it now and study it later."

With the crisis slowly dissipating and his thoughts returning to normal, Li Fan secretly breathed a sigh of relief.

When the divine ability data of the [Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Method], named by Li Fan himself, was fully absorbed by the Deviation Stone, he noticed something unusual.

To his surprise, the once crystal-clear azure Deviation Stone had lost its transparency. The blue color seemed ready to overflow, even shaking faintly.

Moreover, faint, fine cracks appeared on the surface of the crytal stone.

"This..."

"Wasn't it said that divine abilities of the Soul Transformation Realm were the most it could handle? How could the data volume be so terrifying?"

For a moment, Li Fan was filled with doubt and uncertainty.

Although he wasn’t sure how other Soul Transformation Realm cultivators’ divine abilities compared, he was certain that his Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Method was far beyond the ordinary level of divine abilities in the Soul Transformation Realm.

"Could it be that the Tianxuan Mirror discovered something and left behind some sort of hidden mechanism?"

The thought startled Li Fan, but he couldn’t be sure. Perhaps he was just scaring himself.

After some contemplation, Li Fan decided to take no immediate action.

He neither began practicing the Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Method nor deleted the stored divine ability data.

Coming back to his senses from his insight, Li Fan glanced at the two cultivators nearby.

Deng Mingxi still seemed to be selecting and deducing which divine ability to cultivate.

Meanwhile, Wang Wan had already entered the process of comprehending a divine ability.

Chapter 768: The So-Called Little Heavenly Doctor

However, unlike Li Fan, Wang Wan’s comprehension of divine abilities did not seem overly complex.

At the very least, Wang Wan remained exceptionally calm as he received the influx of data.

The black lines that made up his lower body did not even waver in the slightest.

Let alone separate from his body.

"Could it be that I got the short end of the stick?" A hint of gloom flashed through Li Fan’s eyes.

"This Wang Wan… it seems this isn’t his first time using the Tianxuan Mirror to deduce divine abilities. Maybe I can ask him about it."

Having completed the deduction of his divine ability, Li Fan’s connection to the black lines linking him to the platform below had already been severed.

However, the countdown in front of him was still ongoing, meaning he had yet to be expelled from this space.

Thus, Li Fan did not rush to leave. Instead, he patiently observed the two people beside him while waiting.

Time slowly passed, and soon, less than an hour remained.

Deng Mingxi, who had yet to make a choice, was clearly becoming anxious.

She looked somewhat helpless, and in the end, she seemed to have made a decision she was not entirely satisfied with.

Meanwhile, Wang Wan had already completed his comprehension of the divine ability, just like Li Fan.

The connection beneath his feet was severed, and he opened his eyes.

Noticing Li Fan’s gaze on him, Wang Wan seemed slightly surprised.

However, since communication was impossible in this space, he merely exchanged a glance with Li Fan before shifting his attention to Deng Mingxi.

After observing her for a moment, he shook his head slightly.

The countdown reached zero.

A streak of multicolored light shone down from above.
