The black and white lines gradually faded, and the surrounding space became more vivid.

For a moment, everything blurred.

In the blink of an eye, the three of them had unknowingly returned to the Lotus Stone Mountain outside Tianquan Prefecture.

Deng Mingxi let out a burst of energy, striking a nearby mountainside with great force—

As if venting her frustration.

However, unlike ordinary rock formations, this mountainside was incredibly solid.

Even with her attack, she failed to leave so much as a crack.

Tears welled up in her eyes as she felt increasingly aggrieved.

"Young girl, greed leads to loss," Wang Wan sighed upon seeing this.

Through careful questioning, Li Fan gradually uncovered the strange nature of the Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Technique from Wang Wan.

It turned out that the divine ability tree generated by the Tianxuan Mirror in a cultivator’s mind was not something that all cultivators could fully perceive.

Because it contained far too many branches, ordinary cultivators could not possibly comprehend them all.

They could only rely on luck to make a choice.

Deng Mingxi, for example, had become overwhelmed by the sheer number of options before her, delaying the time she had to truly comprehend her chosen ability.

"It's alright, don’t be too discouraged. You're still young. You can always come back in another hundred years. When I first came here, I was just like you—trying to pick the most powerful and suitable divine ability from the tree. In the end, I wasted my precious opportunity." Seeing that Deng Mingxi was still struggling to let it go, Wang Wan continued to comfort her.

Deng Mingxi pouted in frustration. "It’s all my brother’s fault! Before I came, he secretly told me that the Tianxuan Mirror evaluates a cultivator’s potential based on how much of the divine ability tree they overview."

"The more branches you look at, the greater your potential. And when the divine ability is instilled, its upper limit of power increases accordingly."

"So I thought… why not look at as much as possible…"

The more she spoke, the more wronged she felt, as if she were about to burst into tears.

"Your brother may not have good intentions." Li Fan thought to himself.

"What did you say?!" Deng Mingxi suddenly froze, staring at Li Fan in an instant.

"Hmm?" Li Fan's expression changed slightly.

"What did you mean by what you just thought?" Deng Mingxi locked her gaze onto Li Fan, pressing him aggressively.

Li Fan quickly restrained his thoughts and narrowed his eyes. "Daoist Deng, I don’t understand what you mean."

"Stop pretending. I can sense other people's thoughts, especially those related to me!" Seeing Li Fan feign ignorance, Deng Mingxi's anger flared even more.

"Just now, you were clearly thinking that my brother had ulterior motives. What did you mean by that?"

"I sensed it perfectly. When Brother Qingyu told me this secret back then, he was genuinely thinking about my well-being," Deng Mingxi said confidently.

"This little girl is truly naïve." Li Fan deliberately thought to himself again.

As expected, Deng Mingxi, who had once again picked up on his thoughts, turned even redder.

"She can actually read minds?" Li Fan was secretly astonished.

He immediately cleared his thoughts, stopped teasing the young girl, and began explaining.

"That Brother Qingyu of yours—based on how you talk about him, he must be very close to you. That means he is also well aware of your cultivation state. Wouldn't he know whether you have the necessary spiritual sense level to fully comprehend the Divine Ability Tree?"

"If he truly had your best interests at heart, he would never have told you about it. He would have simply let you choose an ability that suits you best."

"But instead, he pretended to be thinking of you and carelessly let it slip."

Li Fan sneered. "That was intentional—to stir up your greed so you would leave empty-handed."

"As for the thoughts you sensed from him…"

"If he had been unaware of your ability beforehand, then maybe what you sensed was genuine."

"But clearly, he knew about your mind-reading ability. That being the case, what you sensed means nothing at all."

Hearing this, Deng Mingxi was about to refute.

But suddenly, she froze—because at that moment, from Li Fan’s thoughts, she felt an overwhelming sense of care and affection.

So intense, so direct—it was unlike anything she had ever experienced before.

In an instant, Deng Mingxi’s face turned bright red.

"You…"

She stomped her foot in embarrassment. Unable to face Li Fan any longer, she turned and flew away.

"Hmph." Li Fan chuckled lightly.

"If possible, Fellow Daoist, you should leave Tianquan State for now and lie low." At this moment, Wang Wan, who had witnessed everything, spoke up.

"Even though it was just an unintentional slip, the fact remains that the young lady overheard your thoughts—and you exposed Deng Qingyu's schemes."

"That man is narrow-minded and holds grudges deeply. He always repays even the smallest slight…" Wang Wan kindly transmitted his advice through voice transmission.

Li Fan cupped his hands. "Oh? Compared to the Xuan family, how does the Deng family fare?"

"Xuan…?" Wang Wan was momentarily stunned. Then, his expression drastically changed. "You are…?"

"I am a mid-level guest elder of the Xuan family." Li Fan said calmly.

"I see… I spoke out of turn. The younger generation of the Deng family…" Wang Wan was at a loss for words.

He quickly apologized to Li Fan.

"It’s fine. You were just being considerate." Li Fan didn’t mind. After exchanging contact details, he took off.

As he flew, Li Fan felt a lingering sense of relief.

"I never expected to encounter another mind-reader, just like Heavenly Doctor, after all this time."

"Luckily, she’s just a simple-minded child. Otherwise, I would have been in real trouble again."

Chapter 769: The Guardian Wang Family

"From within the Tianxuan Mirror space, the Deng Mingxi I saw appeared to be only thirteen or fourteen years old. That should be her actual age."

"She’s still young, so her clan must have protected her well. As a result, even though she has the ability to read minds, she probably hasn't developed much scheming yet," Li Fan silently pondered.

"She’s clearly only at the Golden Core stage, yet she can perceive my thoughts…"

"It’s probably not due to her cultivation technique. It might be related to a special artifact she obtained during her Foundation Establishment. The ability to read minds is already extremely rare in the Xuanhuang Realm. But to ignore differences in cultivation levels and still achieve it—this might already be on the level of a half-step Heavenly Wonder."

A strange light flickered in Li Fan’s eyes.

Throughout countless cycles of reincarnation, aside from the Heavenly Wonders like the [Derivation Law Jade] and [Sword], Li Fan had encountered many cultivators who possessed half-step Heavenly Wonder.

There was He Zhenghao’s daughter, He Xinxin, with her [Dao Pattern Compass], the ethereal Fairy Kongyou with her [Yin-Yang Jade], and Sun Qi with his [Heaven and Earth Primordial Qi].

Yet none of them had ever captivated Li Fan as much as Deng Mingxi’s mind-reading artifact.

The human heart is unpredictable. In the Xuanhuang Realm, where different cultivation paths cannot be practiced together, this truth is even more apparent. No one can guarantee that the sworn brother standing beside them does not secretly harbor murderous intent.

If one could master the ability to read minds—even if only a few key thoughts at critical moments—it would greatly reduce the risks faced in the path of cultivation.

Not to mention, such an ability could serve as a type of power assessment tool.

If one suddenly realized their mind-reading ability had stopped working, that would be a clear sign that they were dealing with someone they could not afford to provoke.

"Perhaps, I can even deduce a method to prevent my own thoughts from being read."

With his decisive nature, Li Fan immediately returned to the Tianquan City’s Tianxuan Mirror to investigate information about Deng Mingxi.

To his surprise, he found nothing of value.

It was as if Deng Mingxi had appeared out of thin air.

Changing his approach, Li Fan searched for Deng Mingxi’s so-called "Brother Qingyu," whom she had mentioned before.

At the same time, he also included traits like arrogance, vengefulness, and pettiness—words that Wang Wan had used to describe him.

The results matched almost instantly.

However, Deng Qingyu’s backing was not the Deng family.

It was the Tianquan Wang family.

"So he’s an adopted son. But the Wang family treats him as one of their own, even better than their direct descendants."

"Perhaps it’s because of his sister," Li Fan nodded to himself.

The Tianquan Wang family, while not considered one of the supreme noble families within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, was still not a force that ordinary people could afford to offend. Many of their cultivators held positions in the mysterious Guardian Hall.

It was said that the Wang family’s patriarch was even entrusted with guarding the [Derivation Law Jade]…

At the moment Li Fan read this information, he had already made up his mind.

He was determined to forge a friendship with the Wang family that would last several lifetimes.

However, as he continued his research, Li Fan’s brows furrowed slightly.

It turned out that Deng Qingyu was not the only one with a bad reputation.

The entire Wang family’s younger generation—even its elders—had an equally terrible name.

Not a single cultivator in the entire Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance was willing to speak on their behalf. Mentioning the Tianquan Wang family only made people want to spit in disgust.

"They are complete outcasts, not a [solitary family]—this isn’t just a matter of individual character flaws. It’s intentional."

"Are they trying to avoid suspicion?"

Having spent time navigating political circles, Li Fan was no stranger to such tactics.

"[Derivative Law Jade]…"

Li Fan pondered for a moment and stopped his search there, deciding not to dig any deeper into the matter.

The Tianxuan Mirror of this world had already completed its ascension. If he paid too much attention to these sensitive matters, he might end up being marked by it.

Having long been wary of the Tianxuan Mirror, Li Fan naturally did not wish to cultivate within it.

At present, the cultivators of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance were scouring the mountains and seas, searching for entrances to small worlds. Even digging deep underground to create hidden chambers was no longer a safe option.

"The hidden threat of Liu San has yet to be eliminated..."

For a moment, despite the vastness of the world, Li Fan found it difficult to locate a safe place for secluded cultivation.

"This is just like the Mysterious Net of my previous life—the consequence of the Tianxuan Mirror growing too powerful."

After weighing his options, Li Fan ultimately chose to rent a secluded courtyard within Dao Discussion Tower in Tianquan City.

At the same time, he set up layers upon layers of protective formations as additional security measures.

Only then did he feel slightly at ease.

"Although I have not acted recklessly, and all my actions and plans still seem within my control, this world has begun to feel increasingly restrictive."

"This is the oppression of the grand momentum. My cultivation is too weak, forcing me to move along with the tide. If I go against it, even the slightest misstep could result in my complete annihilation."

"Perhaps it's time to consider [Truth]."

"However, before that, there are still a few things I must do first."

Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

After a moment, he shook his head slightly.

Due to the Dao Deviation Stone absorbing too much data within his Sea of Consciousness, he actually felt a slight sluggishness in his thoughts.

"Step by step. First, I need to fully master the [Limitless Fullness and Emptiness]."

Li Fan closed his eyes.

In his mind, the blue crystal, as if bloated from overeating, struggled to emit a faint glow, slowly analyzing and processing the vast divine ability data it had absorbed.

...

Tianliang City.

Xu Bai suddenly received a message from Liu San.

"Young Master, good news. Among the new disciples recently recruited by Elder Fang, someone has successfully reached Foundation Establishment!"

"What?" Xu Bai was momentarily stunned.

When it came to knowledge about [Foundation Establishment Through Oneself], now that Master Yin was dead, there was hardly a cultivator left in the world who understood it better than he did.

To establish one's foundation through oneself—how difficult that was!

How could someone possibly succeed in such a short amount of time?

Was Liu San...

A flurry of thoughts flashed through Xu Bai's mind, and he abruptly fell silent.

After a while, Liu San’s next words came slowly.

"However, it was not [Foundation Establishment Through Oneself]. Instead, one of the disciples, a young man named Jie Lin, found the method too difficult. Without a teacher's guidance, he unexpectedly devised his own way—establishing his foundation using external objects from between heaven and earth."

"At first, I didn’t pay much attention. But in the blink of an eye, he successfully reached Foundation Establishment using a Ten-Thousand-Year Hidden Dragon Herb from the Longevity Valley."

"Haha, in that case, this Jie Lin is indeed a remarkable talent. Since he has already succeeded in Foundation Establishment, there is no need to force him further. Just separate him from the others and ensure the true method of Foundation Establishment does not spread among the disciples." Xu Bai’s expression softened as he instructed.

Liu San’s laughter came from the other side:

"Haha, I have already done so. In ancient times, someone with talent as extraordinary as his would have been immediately recruited by the Ten Great Immortal Sects. There’s no way we, the Medicine King Sect, would have had a chance. Truly, times have changed."

Xu Bai gave another order:

"Use Jie Lin’s success as inspiration to motivate the others. Perhaps it will awaken more hidden geniuses."

"As expected of the Young Master—you’ve thought of everything."

Chapter 770: In a Crisis, One Contemplates Return to [Truth]

After finishing his words, Xu Bai ended the communication.

His face immediately darkened.

"A hundred careful steps, yet a single misstep—eventually, a flaw was exposed."

"This Liu San always seemed carefree and unserious, but I never expected his thoughts to run so deep."

Indeed, during his seemingly casual conversation with Liu San just now, Xu Bai had made a mistake.

When Liu San mentioned that a disciple had successfully reached Foundation Establishment, Xu Bai hesitated for a moment.

This hesitation stemmed from his distrust of Liu San.

Because he understood the difficulty of achieving Foundation Establishment himself, he knew it was practically impossible.

Thus, he suspected that this might be a trap—a ruse by Liu San to lure him back.

Logically speaking, upon hearing such news, he should have either been surprised or skeptical, immediately questioning Liu San about its authenticity.

Yet, instead of doing so, he had remained silent.

Although he could have come up with countless excuses to explain that silence, deep down, Xu Bai knew—it was already too late.

Liu San hadn't spoken in a continuous flow but had deliberately paused after the first half of his sentence, waiting for Xu Bai’s reaction.

That in itself was a test.

Liu San had already obtained the answer he wanted. From that brief moment of hesitation, he had confirmed Xu Bai’s distrust of him.

In a battle between experts, even the slightest slip can determine victory or defeat.

"However, the situation hasn’t spiraled to an irreparable state just yet. The effects of the True Temptation Fruit aren’t so easily broken. Although they have sensed something amiss and solidified their suspicions, they still cannot turn against me."

"Apart from having altered their thoughts, the more crucial factor is that the Xuanhuang True Cauldron is still in my hands."

"With the numerous alchemists of the Medicine King Sect still slumbering inside the cauldron as hostages, they wouldn’t dare to act recklessly."

"For now, I’ll ignore them and wait until the final moment..." A trace of cold ruthlessness flashed in Xu Bai’s eyes.

The relationship between Xu Bai and the Medicine King Sect remained in a precarious state of equilibrium.

Xu Bai only communicated with them remotely via Communication Talismans, while Liu San and the others continued their usual behavior, as if completely unaware of anything unusual.

During this period, Xu Bai made a brief return to the Empire.

As he flew above the capital, he caught a faint scent of blood lingering in the air.

Clearly, a large-scale purge had recently concluded.

Revealing himself, Xu Bai was quickly greeted by Xiao Qing.

Inside the grand tower palace, he once again met the Imperial Princess and Xiao Hong.

To his surprise, in the short time they had been apart, the Imperial Princess had transformed from a delicate young maiden into a voluptuous and mature beauty.

Furthermore, there was now a newfound confidence in her gaze, replacing the timid hesitation of before.

"It seems your Empire still has some hidden technologies you haven’t disclosed," Xu Bai remarked indifferently.

The Imperial Princess chuckled, her ample figure trembling slightly. "The Empire has endured for a thousand years. It would never gamble its survival on a single path."

"You should understand that, shouldn’t you?"

As she spoke, her deep and radiant eyes locked onto Xu Bai’s, carrying both a subtle charm and a blatant temptation.

Yet, Xu Bai’s gaze remained clear and tranquil, like an undisturbed lake—completely unfazed.

Instead, he responded with a brilliant, innocent smile.

In that instant, the Imperial Princess’s mask was shattered. A flicker of panic and embarrassment crossed her face.

"My apologies for the inappropriate display," Xiao Hong intervened, stepping forward slightly to shield the Imperial Princess.

Taking a deep breath, the Imperial Princess closed her eyes for a moment before regaining her composure.

Xu Bai did not mock or rebuke her failed attempt at seduction. Instead, he asked with great interest, "If I’m not mistaken, the Imperial Princess is pregnant?"

The three people present fell into an awkward silence upon hearing his words.

Xiao Qing waved her hand lightly, setting up a barrier around them before explaining in a hushed voice, “Fellow Daoist, after you left, we followed your suggestion and carried out a purge of the empire’s nobility. Anyone whose will did not align with ours was captured.”

“Of course, the empire has existed for thousands of years. The power accumulated by these noble families is not something to be underestimated.”

“Before taking action, we had already considered the possibility of failure. To prevent the imperial bloodline from being severed, the Imperial Princess performed the Holy Blood Embryo Technique in advance.”

Xiao Qing glanced at the Imperial Princess before continuing, “In fact, the Holy Blood Embryo Transformation Technique that our master originally passed down has been significantly improved over the years through the imperial family’s continuous research.”

“It can now be completed with external assistance, even if the necessary conditions are not met naturally.”

“In this scenario, the resulting infant is not so much a next-generation heir but rather a type of clone.”

“However, there are drawbacks. A clone cannot inherit cultivation; it is merely a physical body.”

At this point, Xiao Qing stopped speaking, deliberately avoiding further explanation.

Xu Bai narrowed his eyes, his expression unreadable.

He did not pursue the matter further but instead, in front of Xiao Qing and the others, formally announced the approval of their review.

After deliberation by several elders, they unanimously agreed that the technological advancements demonstrated by the empire were worth investing in for the Federation of All Worlds.

As a result, the empire would become one of the few small worlds currently under the alliance’s protection.

With that, Xu Bai retrieved three Endstone Disc from his storage ring.

He then explained to them an array formation that could amplify the power of the Endstone Disc and conceal the entrance to their small world.

Among the three, the Imperial Princess was utterly confused.

However, Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong showed visible excitement.

With utmost reverence, they carefully stored the Endstone Disc away. Then, following their exchanged glances, the Imperial Princess handed over a storage ring.

The storage ring was engraved with the emblem of a Heavenly Fate Black Bird. Its aura was ancient, showing clear signs of age.

It bore a striking resemblance to Xu Ke’s spirit pet, Xiao Hei.

“All the items we previously showcased are inside.”

As Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong looked at the storage ring, a hint of nostalgia flickered in their eyes.

“This was something our master left behind, and we have never used it. Using it now to trade for the empire’s future… I don’t think he would blame us,” Xiao Qing said with a sigh.

Xu Bai merely glanced at the contents, noticing that various valuable materials—including the 'All Beasts Merged into One,'—were present. However, he did not immediately verify their authenticity.

Instead, he put away the ring and looked at Xiao Qing and the others once more.

Sensing that Xu Bai had more to say, Xiao Qing and her companions turned to him with questioning expressions.

“The transaction between the empire and the Federation of All Worlds has been finalized.”

“However, there is another personal deal I would like to propose to you all. I wonder if you’d be willing to accept it?”

Xiao Qing’s expression became somewhat serious. “Fellow Daoist, please speak.”

“I’m very interested in the improved Holy Blood Embryo Transformation Technique,” Xu Bai said calmly.

Xiao Qing’s expression changed slightly, and she was about to refuse.

However, Xu Bai’s next words left the three of them unable to remain calm.

Chapter 771: The True and False Xu Ke

"You mentioned before that the Holy Emperor of the Empire is likely our common ancestor. I found that very interesting, so I put in some effort and had someone investigate it for me." Xu Bai looked at the Imperial Princess and spoke calmly.

Before the Imperial Princess could react, Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong grew excited. "What did you find out?"

"You want to know too?" Xu Bai smiled. "Then exchange it for the Holy Blood Embryo Transformation Technique."

Xiao Hong was about to respond, but Xiao Qing reached out and stopped her.

She took a deep breath, calmed herself slightly, and said to Xu Bai, "You want to gain something for nothing just based on that one sentence? At the very least, you have to show us that the information you uncovered is actually worth the exchange."

"That makes sense." Xu Bai nodded approvingly and then extended his right hand.

In the next moment, a pitch-black feather appeared in his palm.

As soon as they saw the feather, both Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong felt a familiar presence.

"Xiao Hei?" Their bodies trembled, and they exclaimed in unison.

Just as they were about to take the Black Bird’s Feather for a closer look, they realized Xu Bai had already withdrawn it.

"It seems that you are not unfamiliar with this Fate Black Bird either. That makes things easier—I won’t have to waste my breath."

"Thanks to the Federation of All Worlds, which allows connections across the myriad worlds, I was fortunate enough to find Xiao Hei's remains in a small world."

"This feather is the only thing left from its body. Along with it, there was also a fragment of Xiao Hei's memories from when it was alive."

At this point, Xu Bai suddenly stopped.

"Xiao Hei is dead?" Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong were momentarily shocked, then stared intensely at Xu Bai.

After deliberately building their suspense, Xu Bai glanced at them before sneering, "Xiao Hei was far more loyal than you two. To search for my ancestor's whereabouts, it didn't hesitate to deplete its own lifespan, traveling across the small worlds of the Xuanhuang Realm."

"Though it never found Xu Ke before it died, it did not return empty-handed."

"Xu Ke might still be alive." Xu Bai spoke slowly.

His soft-spoken words hit Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong like a thunderclap.

"Impossible!" they both refuted in unison.

"If Master were still alive, we would definitely be able to sense it. But we lost all connection with him a long time ago."

Xiao Qing furrowed her brows, and a cold glint flashed in her phoenix eyes. "To deceive us into handing over the Holy Blood Embryo Transformation Technique, you would even fabricate lies about Master's life and death…"

Despite Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong’s rising hostility, Xu Bai remained unshaken. He shook his head and sighed. "This is exactly why, back then, Xu Ke favored and trusted Xiao Hei the most."

"You claim that you could sense Xu Ke's life and death, but are you saying Xiao Hei couldn't? Yet, even knowing that, why did it still firmly believe that Xu Ke was alive, searching across countless small worlds for him?"

As he spoke, Xu Bai pointed his finger into the air.

A projection appeared before them.

It was a fragment of Xiao Hei’s memories from its remains—scenes of it traversing many small worlds, ceaselessly searching for Xu Ke.

Watching the images flash by, revealing different small worlds, and seeing Xiao Hei’s movements gradually slow as it aged and weakened—

Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong trembled slightly, their expressions turning incomparably complex.

The image abruptly stopped.

Xu Bai said nothing. He simply watched them in silence.

After a long silence, he finally spoke again:

"The Xuanhuang have countless small worlds, though vast and seemingly endless, it does have a limit."

"Back then, Xiao Hei personally visited some of them and had already ruled out those small worlds."

"And first, we can be certain of one thing—my ancestor never left the Xuanhuang Realm back then."

"So..."

Finally understanding, Xiao Qing's eyes flickered with hope as she stared at Xu Bai. "The master is in one of the remaining small worlds?"

Xu Bai neither confirmed nor denied it.

Instead, he casually shifted the topic. "Even if we knew this before, we would have been powerless in the face of the countless remaining small worlds. But now, things are different."

"The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is now unifying the Xuanhuang Realm, sweeping through and conquering all the small worlds."

"Through the relentless campaigns of countless cultivators who fought without regard for their lives, many of these small worlds have already been thoroughly explored. As a result, the possible locations where Xu Ke might be have been greatly narrowed down."

At this moment, Xiao Hong could no longer hold back and spoke up. "Doesn't that mean the master is in great danger?"

Xu Bai nodded. "If the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance finds Xu Ke before we do, given their current modus operandi, I'm afraid the outcome will be dire."

Xiao Hong's expression darkened instantly. "No! I must—"

"Calm down, Hong." It was Xiao Qing who remained composed.

She stopped Xiao Hong with a look, then turned to Xu Bai and said, "Your reasoning doesn't hold up to scrutiny."

"Not to mention that there's no real evidence proving that the master is still alive. Even if he does still exist, how can you be sure that he is within the remaining unexplored small worlds?"

Before she could finish her sentence, Xu Bai interrupted her with a burst of laughter.

"Ah, Daoist Qing, you're truly rational to the extreme. Fine, I admit that what I just said was all based on conjectures derived from Xiao Hei’s memories. But can you deny the possibility that Xu Ke is indeed still within the remaining small worlds?"

"Back then, when facing an endless sea of unknown small worlds, Xiao Hei never flinched. But now that the search area has been significantly reduced, you still refuse to face reality?"

"What exactly are you afraid of, Daoist Qing?" Xu Bai's gaze was sharp and piercing as he stared directly at Xiao Qing, questioning her.

Xiao Qing's body trembled as if struck by a heavy blow.

Her mouth opened slightly, but no words came out.

"Besides," Xu Bai continued, his tone carrying a hint of mockery, "all I seek is a technique that Xu Ke once passed down so casually. Yet now, after all this time, those closest to him are actually willing to disregard his life and death just to protect something as insignificant as the Holy Blood Embryo Technique."

Xiao Qing was about to speak when the Imperial Princess, who had remained silent all this time, finally spoke up.

"I accept your request. Regardless of whether the Holy Emperor is dead or alive, I will not allow him to remain lost in a foreign land any longer," she said with unwavering determination.

Faced with the Imperial Princess’s decision, Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong remained silent.

Xu Bai, on the other hand, nodded approvingly. "A wise choice."

Then, with a gentle wave of his hand, a map of the Xuanhuang Realm appeared before them.

"The Xuanhuang Realm has undergone earth-shattering changes over thousands of years."

"However, our Federation of All Worlds has always been monitoring and recording everything in secret. So, the small worlds Xiao Hei once explored can still be matched with our current records."

Chapter 772: Mr. Bai and the Red String

A winding curve divided the map into two halves.

On one side, the map's details were exceptionally clear—names of regions, topography, and terrain were all visible at a glance.

On the other side of the curve, however, everything was shrouded in mist. Even the general outlines of the regions were difficult to discern.

It was only vaguely divided into five sections.

"The Five Elders Association is under the strict control of five Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereigns. It’s nearly impossible to infiltrate. Even our Federation of All Worlds knows very little about it."

As Xu Bai spoke, he swiftly marked thousands of black dots on the map.

Most of them were within the territory of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, while only a few were located in the mist-covered area.

"These are the small worlds that can already be ruled out. The vast majority of them have yet to be discovered by the cultivators of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance. However, some have already been exposed."

Xu Bai pointed lightly, and thirty-seven of the black dots were marked with small flags bearing the character “仙” (Immortal).

"There are also some worlds that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance has already explored but that Xiao Hei hasn't ventured into over the years."

Another four hundred thirty-five immortal-character flags flew to different corners of the map.

"Xu Ke’s whereabouts should be within the remaining small worlds of the Xuanhuang Realm."

Standing before the map, Xu Bai said calmly,

"I hope you can find Xu ke before you finish searching all the remaining small worlds within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's territory."

"Otherwise, if he is unfortunate enough to be in a small world whose entrance lies within the Five Elders Association's domain, then there will be almost no hope."

At this moment, Xiao Hong couldn't help but ask, "Aren’t you called the Federation of All Worlds? Can’t you provide us with the entrances to the small worlds under your control?"

Xu Bai, however, responded with a question of his own, "Fellow Daoist Hong, do you think I’m some high-ranking figure in the Federation of All Worlds?"

"To ensure the safety of each small world, our Federation designates special envoys responsible for maintaining contact with specific small worlds. Aside from their assigned worlds, these envoys know nothing about the others." Xu Bai explained.

"If you have the ability to capture Elder Liu, the Dao Integration cultivator who came with me last time, and subject him to torture, you might be able to get some information from him."

Xiao Hong was immediately speechless.

The Imperial Princess looked at the map of the Xuanhuang Realm before her, feeling an overwhelming sense of helplessness.

Her gaze was no longer as resolute as before. "This… it’s like searching for a needle in a haystack."

"What? You’re not having second thoughts already, are you?" Xu Bai asked with some surprise.

"Whatever Xiao Hei can do, I can do as well. Daoist Xu, rest assured, the Empire will not go back on its word."

At this moment, the once hesitant Xiao Qing suddenly became firm.

Under Xiao Qing’s instruction, the Imperial Princess finally handed over the improved [Holy Blood Embryo Transformation Technique] to Xu Bai.

It was not recorded in books or jade slips.

Instead, it was inscribed by a rare Bookworm, a unique beast of the Empire.

"To practice the Holy Blood Embryo Transformation Method, certain specific resources are required. Daoist Xu, please wait a moment while we prepare them for you," Xiao Qing continued.

Xu Bai nodded slightly.

Without immediately checking the contents stored within the Bookworm, he first put it away. Then, after a moment of contemplation, he suggested,

"Your top priority now is to race against the cultivators of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance."

"Besides using the power of the Tianxuan Treasure Record to quickly and conveniently detect small world entrances, you might also be able to determine Xu Ke’s general location through divination techniques."

"Did Xu ke leave behind any personal belongings? If so, I might be able to ask a senior from our organization to help with a divination."

With a smile, Xu Bai added,

"After all, I am quite curious about this ancestor of mine."

Within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, the empire harbored quite a few law thieves.

If they also had the Endstone Disc gifted by Xu Bai, they could search for small world entrances without revealing their identities.

Upon hearing Xu Bai’s words, Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong exchanged a glance.

After hesitating for a moment, Xiao Qing finally spoke: "When Master left back then, there were indeed some personal belongings that he did not take with him. We have kept them well."

"Fellow Daoist, please come with me."

With that, Xiao Qing led Xu Bai to the very top of the tower palace, into an unremarkable small room.

Unlike the lavish room they had met in earlier, the interior was extremely simple and plain.

There was no trace of it being the residence of the empire’s founder.

"This was where Master lived back then. Everything inside has remained untouched. At first, we still held onto hope that Master might return. But after so many years, we have long realized that was nothing more than a futile wish." Xiao Hong’s tone carried a hint of sorrow.

Xu Bai’s gaze swept across the small room, and suddenly, his heart trembled.

Inside one of the wooden desk drawers, he discovered a faintly worn red string!

It was just a few short strands, seemingly on the verge of breaking apart.

Yet, both its appearance and the faint aura it carried were unmistakably familiar to Xu Bai!

"This is the red string that Mr. Bai left for Xu Ke?"

"He didn’t take it with him when he left?"

Xu Bai was shaken to his core.

Without betraying his emotions, he shifted his gaze, as if examining other objects in the room.

But in his mind, he kept replaying the sight of that red string.

"There’s no mistake. This is the red string that Xu Ke used to easily slay Red Nine-Headed."

"But this doesn’t seem to be the original artifact—rather, just a single strand separated from it."

"Was it meant as a final protective measure for the empire…?"

"Judging from how it’s been left here to gather dust, it seems that Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong don’t actually know how terrifying this red string truly is."

Xu Bai’s thoughts spun rapidly, and at the same time, he felt a surge of uncontrollable excitement.

He knew all too well the terrifying power contained within this red string.

Even though only a single strand remained, it was likely still capable of posing a fatal threat to a Dao Integration cultivator.

Naturally, a desire arose in Xu Bai’s heart to claim it as his own.

"The art of deduction is profoundly mysterious. It’s best to collect as many items as possible."

He explained, "It’s fine. These are all just ordinary objects. To maximize the chances of finding Master, Fellow Daoist should take as many as needed." Xiao Qing spoke nonchalantly.

Thus, Xu Bai took a brush and a set of clothes that Xu Ke had once worn from the room.

Finally, after making a show of thoroughly searching the surroundings, he discreetly took the red string as well.

"That was too easy?"

With the treasure now in hand, Xu Bai still found it hard to believe.

But after discussing a few more details with Xiao Qing and the others and bidding them farewell, he finally left the empire.

Only then did he confirm—he had truly obtained Mr. Bai’s red string so effortlessly.

"Now I just need to study its specific usage."

Xu Bai did not dare to linger. He sped all the way back to the Xuanhuang Realm.

Instead of returning to Tianliang City, he went to a nearby Dao Discussion Tower branch residence and entered seclusion.

Chapter 773: Condensing the Holy Embryo with Blood and Essence

Inside the secluded cultivation chamber, Xu Bai sat cross-legged on the floor paved with top-grade spirit stones.

He first placed the red string in front of him, then took a deep breath to calm his slightly excited emotions.

After all, ever since he had fortuitously obtained the Canghai Pearl years ago, it had been a long time since he had casually picked up another treasure.

Xu Bai narrowed his eyes and carefully recalled the entire sequence of events and details from his journey to the Empire, reviewing them several times.

“It shouldn’t be a scheme by Xiao Qing and the others. This time, I was the one who actively sought them out, and it was also my own idea to request to see Xu Ke’s relics.”

“Moreover, they genuinely seemed unaware of the peculiar properties of the red string…”

After pondering for a long time and finding no flaws in the situation, Xu Bai did not immediately touch the red string. Instead, he first took out the Bookworm.

Like a living creature, the book flipped its pages on its own, projecting numerous texts and images above it.

"Holy Blood turns into fetus…"

A glimmer of sharp light flashed through Xu Bai’s eyes.

"As expected of the one highly regarded by Mr. Bai, the very person who established the entire Exotic Beast Empire. The profundity of this Holy Blood Embryo Transformation technique is nearly on par with any top-tier clone technique."

The Mysterious True Spirit Transformation technique creates clones by directly refining flesh and blood using rare natural treasures. It then infuses them with divine consciousness while severing the connection between the clone and the original body, forming an entirely independent entity.

However, the Holy Blood Embryo Transformation technique could create an identical fleshly body purely by cultivating one's own blood essence and flesh—without relying on spiritual energy or divine consciousness.

The entire process resembled limb regeneration. But instead of regrowing a severed limb, it regenerated an entirely new self.

Until the clone completely detached from the original body, it remained connected by flesh and blood, much like the process of human reproduction. Because of this resemblance, Xu Ke named the technique Holy Blood Embryo.

Xu Bai then retrieved three key materials from his storage ring, which were necessary for catalyzing the Holy Blood Embryo Transformation technique:

Eternal Dragon Blood

Brahma Consciousness Divine Worm

Core of Pure Light

The original Holy Blood Embryo Transformation technique, as passed down by Xu Ke, was designed for mortals with no cultivation. Consequently, the gestation process for the Holy Embryo, or next generation, was quite slow—typically taking over half a year to fully mature.

During this period, the host had to consume large amounts of highly nourishing medicinal herbs and meat to sustain the normal growth of the Holy Embryo.

However, after thousands of years of imperial research, successive emperors discovered ways to accelerate the process by utilizing the extraordinary traits of various exotic beasts.

Eternal Dragon Blood greatly enhances the circulation of blood and energy, shortening the incubation period from over half a year to just a month—or even a few days.

Brahma Consciousness Divine Worm replenishes spiritual exhaustion.

Core of Pure Light, when implanted within the Holy Embryo, ensures that it remains free from disease or calamity during gestation.

“Every method has its pros and cons. While external assistance significantly reduces the time needed to cultivate the Holy Embryo, it also introduces numerous drawbacks. Due to the rapid growth process, these fast-incubated Holy Embryos are nearly identical to the original body, essentially making them indistinguishable from clones—just as Xiao Qing mentioned.”

“On the other hand, the original Holy Blood Embryo Transformation technique allowed the Holy Embryo to develop its own consciousness over the years, making it more like a separate individual rather than an exact replica of the original body.”

"Which of these two approaches is superior? It’s hard to say."

Xu Bai swept his gaze over the three materials, contemplating silently.

"Regardless, the accelerated method is precisely what I need right now."

He swallowed the Eternal Dragon Blood and silently activated the Holy Blood Embryo technique.

A scorching sensation surged through his abdomen, spreading like a blazing current to every part of his body in an instant.

Squelch…

A massive lump of flesh suddenly protruded from Xu Bai’s back.

The flesh wriggled incessantly within the swelling tumor, which rapidly expanded from the size of a fist to that of an infant in the blink of an eye.

Fortunately, the clothes Xu Bai wore were the Pure Glaze Garment, refined by Fang Zaiji, which could withstand attacks at the Dao Integration level. This spared him the embarrassment of his clothes being destroyed.

The Holy Blood Embryo Transformation technique allowed any part of the body to serve as the growth point for the Holy Embryo, depending on one's intention.

Throughout the history of the empire, different emperors had their own preferences. Xu Bai chose his back.

Perhaps it was influenced by the scene he had witnessed when he was still a Foundation Establishment cultivator, being hunted by a red-haired Nascent Soul cultivator—where the shadow of a baby, hunched like a parasite, clung to the back of a volcanic cave.

“There is no vitality from the mutual reinforcement of the Five Elements, only a state of extreme hyperactivation of the flesh and blood, breaking past the normal limits of cell division.”

“The so-called Eternal Dragon is merely a long flood dragon that has atavistically awakened the Azure Divine Dragon bloodline. Yet, even so, it still has such a significant effect on Nascent Soul cultivators.”

Xu Bai felt a crawling itch spreading across his back, like countless ants scurrying over his skin, which made him inwardly startled.

The scorching Eternal Dragon Blood surged ceaselessly through his body.

In the blink of an eye, seven days had passed.

The tumor-like mass on Xu Bai’s back had begun to take on a vaguely human shape.

In his perception, the Holy Embryo now felt entirely like an extension of his own body, something he could manipulate at will.

With just a thought, the Holy Embryo moved accordingly, performing various actions as he intended. However, since it had not yet fully developed, it resembled a veiled figure with indistinct facial features, carrying an eerie, unsettling aura.

“It’s time.”

Having completely familiarized himself with the Holy Embryo, Xu Bai guided the Core of Pure Light with his divine sense, moving it slowly toward the fleshy growth.

The raised mass of flesh seemed to offer no resistance.

Without any obstruction, the Core of Pure Light burrowed directly into it.

Xu Bai could clearly sense that the chaotic, uncontrolled proliferation of flesh within the Holy Embryo was gradually calming down.

The Core of Pure Light began dissolving into the flesh, causing the bulging growth on Xu Bai’s back to faintly radiate a white glow.

Limbs and facial features started forming from within the Holy Embryo.

Thus, after more than half a day, a smooth, humanoid figure appeared on Xu Bai’s back.

It was described as "smooth" because, at that moment, it lacked even a single strand of hair.

Not even the natural folds of skin were present.

It was like a flawless sculpture carved from white jade, emitting a soft, pale glow.

“Now, for the final step.”

“My spiritual sense far surpasses that of ordinary people, so there is no need for the Brahma Consciousness Divine Worm to supplement my mental energy.”

Xu Bai focused part of his consciousness on the Holy Embryo growing on his back.

Activating the Holy Blood Embryo Transformation technique, he visualized its transformation. In an instant, the Holy Embryo underwent a drastic metamorphosis.

Bones formed within its soft flesh, and its once-limp body swelled and straightened as if inflated like a balloon.

Hair, nails, and the distinctive textures of human skin began appearing in sequence across different parts of its body.

It was as though an expert sculptor was carefully chiseling away at the once-featureless body.

The Holy Embryo took on an increasingly human-like appearance.

Before long...

The face on Xu Bai’s back, like a mirror reflection of his own, suddenly opened its eyes.

At the same time, the layers of flesh that had connected the Holy Embryo to Xu Bai’s body peeled away on their own.

The Holy Embryo—another Xu Bai—gently patted the shoulder of his original body and landed lightly on the ground.

Chapter 774: Yet Unwilling to Return to [Truth]

"This feeling?" Xu Bai couldn't help but narrow his eyes.

Having created clones in every lifetime, he was long accustomed to splitting his mind into two.

But at this moment, as he forged another entity—practically equivalent to a third clone, the Holy Embryo, a completely different sensation surged within him.

The Mysterious True Spirit Transformation was an extension of the Stealing Heaven and Replacing the Sun Technique, built upon its foundational principles and refined further.

It was arguably the most orthodox cloning technique in the cultivation world.

Both the original body and the clone were fully under his consciousness’s control.

In contrast, the Holy Blood Embryo Transformation Technique—

Before the Holy Embryo separated from the main body, it indeed felt like an extension of himself, something he could manipulate at will.

However, the moment it detached from his back, a mysterious transformation seemed to occur.

While he had indeed imbued the Holy Embryo with a separate consciousness, and still retained complete control over it—

Something still felt off.

The Holy Embryo turned to face Xu Bai, and their gazes locked.

It was as if a mirror stood between them—aside from one being clothed and the other completely bare, their appearances were identical.

Yet, after staring for a long time, Xu Bai couldn’t shake off a deep sense of discord between them.

A sudden memory surfaced—

A scene from a horror film he had watched before crossing over.

Late at night, in a bathroom.

After washing up, he had accidentally glanced at the mirror.

But to his horror, his reflection was smiling back at him—a twisted, eerie grin.

The thought vanished in an instant.

In reality, nothing of the sort happened—the Holy Embryo did not suddenly go rogue or smile at him sinisterly.

Yet, looking at it now, a realization struck Xu Bai.

If the true body—Li Fan—were to perish, then without a doubt, the clone Xu Bai would also die.

But what about the Holy Embryo?

Would it perish along with them?

The purpose of the Holy Blood Embryo Transformation Technique was to ensure the eternal continuity of the imperial bloodline.

So the answer was obvious—it wouldn’t.

"This is the fundamental difference between the Holy Embryo and a clone," Xu Bai suddenly understood.

"What Xiao Qing said—‘almost identical to a clone’… it really is just ‘almost.’"

As this realization dawned on him, far away in Tianquan Prefecture, Li Fan, who was in seclusion studying the Limitless Fullness and Emptiness, suddenly paused his actions.

Replaying everything that had transpired in the empire through Xu Bai’s perspective, an unreadable expression appeared on his face.

"Interesting… So, in the end, I wasn’t completely unaffected."

Looking back at the situation from his original perspective—

Xu Bai’s choices now seemed somewhat reckless.

Of course, it had still been his own decision.

But under different circumstances and environments, even the same person might make completely opposite choices.

That was exactly what had happened to Xu Bai.

If he himself had personally experienced this event, when faced with the Red String and the Sacred Blood Embryo, he would have prioritized studying the Red String first—

Rather than rushing to create the Holy Embryo.

Although he had intended to use the Sacred Blood Embryo to forge another clone,

He would have been far more cautious.

Having reached a conclusion in an instant, Li Fan still felt no immediate sense of crisis—

But he did sense that something was amiss.

After much deliberation, a thought surfaced in his mind—

"Should I simply return to [Truth]?"

"Do you wish to virtualize the current scenario and return to the initial anchor point?"

As his surroundings began to blur into nothingness, faced with the prompt to return,

Li Fan hesitated.

He thought about the Limitless Fullness and Emptiness, which he had yet to fully decipher.

He thought about the Dissociation Disc, which had yet to merge into one.

He thought about how he still hadn’t figured out a way to completely shield Tianxuan Treasure Record’s detection using the Endstone Plate.

He thought about how he hadn’t yet mastered the Medicine King True Cauldron and broken out of Xuanhuang Realm to explore the Immortal Ruins.

He thought about…

If he left now, he would be unwilling.

Li Fan remained still for a long time, like a stone statue, completely motionless.

A fierce battle of thoughts raged within his mind, causing his body to tremble uncontrollably.

"Do you wish to virtualize the current scene and return to the initial anchor point?"

The prompt from [Truth] appeared once again.

Li Fan’s expression wavered.

But in the end, he chose no.

In an instant, the once-faded scene regained its full reality.

Having made this decision, Li Fan felt as if he had just experienced a great battle, nearly collapsing to the ground from exhaustion, his entire body drenched in sweat.

Yet, his instincts told him that he was not satisfied with the choice he had made.

He barely had time to catch his breath before reopening the [Truth] panel once more.

"Do you wish to virtualize the current scene and return to the initial anchor point?"

The prompt remained as reliable and clear as before.

But this time, it no longer sounded so pleasant to Li Fan’s ears.

Every action a person takes is driven by desire.

And now, as Li Fan faced the [Truth] panel for the second time, his desire to "restore reality" had noticeably weakened compared to before.

Hesitation, concerns, and reluctance surged through his mind.

This time, the struggle was shorter.

Li Fan ultimately closed the [Truth] panel again.

Whoosh...

It was as if all the strength had drained from his body.

He collapsed onto the ground, gasping for breath.

A long time passed before he finally managed to prop himself up with his hands. A complicated emotion flickered in his eyes.

Then, he attempted for the third time.

The result was clear.

This time, he made his decision even faster.

In just a few breaths, he closed the [Truth] panel again.

"Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra..."

On his fourth attempt, Li Fan silently activated the supreme immortal technique that had saved him from countless crises.

Yet, the moment he opened the [Truth] panel—before any of his lingering attachments could interfere—he instinctively exited on his own.

The Immortal Heart Mantra was a path forged by reversing the Dao Heart of cultivators.

Now, Li Fan desired to restore reality in order to escape calamity.

Under the mantra’s influence, the thought of [Truth] was instantly devoured and converted into nourishment for his spiritual consciousness.

Having failed yet again, Li Fan stood in the secret chamber, silent for a long time.

This time, he no longer struggled.

Instead, he closed his eyes and calmly contemplated.

At this moment, Li Fan found himself facing the greatest crisis since his transmigration.

Because he had spent years laying down intricate schemes in this world, he had yet to reach the stage of reaping the rewards. This created an intense sense of reluctance.

And under the influence of some unknown force, that reluctance had been magnified to the extreme—making him unwilling to restore reality of his own accord.

Even now, Li Fan felt that there was nothing wrong with himself.

At worst, he was simply too greedy.

But in the end, Li Fan cherished his life.

His obsession with immortality was unwavering, and he understood one thing clearly—

If he couldn’t use [Truth], then in this perilous Xuanhuang Realm, he was truly at risk of falling at any moment.

A fall from which he would never recover.

Chapter 775: Reaching Golden Core in Half a Day

Li Fan stood in the secret chamber, silent for a long time.

He was deep in thought, contemplating a strategy.

Now that he had calmed down, he was not particularly panicked.

After all, he was far from being in a desperate situation.

In the vast Xuanhuang Realm, countless beings never attain True Awakening, and each person only gets one chance at life.

He had merely returned to the same starting point as everyone else.

Moreover, he still possessed the immense advantage of accumulated foresight from his many cycles of reincarnation.

"Everything stems from a single, fleeting thought in the past."

"When I used Xu Ke’s blood essence to create a clone, I also infused it with a trace of Mr. Bai’s divine aura."

Li Fan swiftly pieced together his thoughts.

Before long, he pinpointed the source of his abnormalities.

"As expected, there’s no such thing as a free lunch."

"I gained extraordinary talent and comprehended divine abilities simply because I resembled Mr. Bai."

"But in exchange, his subtle influence gradually tainted both my clone and even my true self."

"Although I was already on guard when I noticed something was wrong—determined to awaken my True Self if I sensed any deeper influence—"

"What I didn’t anticipate was that, by the time my true self became aware of the issue, it was already too late."

In his mind, that breathtakingly flawless face surfaced once more.

"Mr. Bai…"

"Interesting."

"You wish to be reborn through me? Then I shall grant your wish!"

A sharp glint flashed in Li Fan’s eyes.

The Dao Deviation Stone, which had already been pushed to its limit within his mind, suddenly erupted in a brilliant blue radiance.

Countless images flickered through it.

These were all the possible futures Li Fan was deducing.

"Trying to obstruct my path…"

"It won’t be that easy!"

In an instant, the light from the Dao Deviation Stone extinguished entirely.

But Li Fan had already devised a countermeasure.

A cold smirk surfaced on his lips as he sat down again, unhurriedly resuming his deciphering of the Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Technique.

The scene shifted to Xu Bai’s side.

He exchanged a glance with the Holy Embryo, and both of them revealed eerie smiles.

Xu Bai gently pointed at the red string before him.

"Go!"

The red string seemed to come to life, shooting straight toward the Holy Embryo.

At the same time, Xu Bai retrieved a massive pile of top-grade spirit stones from his storage ring.

With a single palm strike, he shattered them.

The Holy Blood Embryo Transformation Technique produces offspring or clones without any cultivation.

But for the Holy Embryo Xu Bai, this was not an issue at all.

His innate talent was identical to that of Xu Bai—already reaching an almost unimaginable level.

Not to mention, he also had the cultivation experience accumulated over Li Fan’s many lifetimes of reincarnation.

"Absorb the essence of heaven and earth, harness its qi!"

The Holy Embryo Xu Bai chanted softly.

Within the secret chamber, an invisible whirlwind seemed to rise.

Dense spiritual energy, as thick as substance, roared as it surged toward the Holy Embryo Xu Bai.

Within just a few breaths.

He shattered the barrier between mortals and cultivators, successfully stepping into the early-stage Qi Condensation Realm.

Yet, his absorption of spiritual energy did not slow in the slightest; instead, it only accelerated.

The clone Xu Bai remained expressionless, methodically repeating the cycle of extracting top-grade spirit stones, crushing them, and retrieving more.

For ordinary cultivators, absorbing such an immense amount of spiritual energy in such a short time would have caused their bodies to explode long ago.

But the Holy Embryo Xu Bai was like a bottomless abyss.

His expression did not change; no matter how much spiritual energy came, he absorbed it all.

All of it was drawn into his dantian.

His cultivation realm was rising at an astonishing speed.

Mid-stage Qi Condensation, late-stage Qi Condensation…

Qi Condensation Perfection!

The Heavenly Calamity that troubled countless cultivators across the world seemed to be completely nonexistent for Holy Embryo Xu Bai.

For the first time, Clone Xu Bai witnessed a true genius of the New Path Cultivation, one unhindered by bottlenecks.

That terrifying cultivation speed!

"Borrow the wonders of heaven and earth to establish the Dao Foundation!"

Holy Embryo Xu Bai softly chanted once more.

Inside his Dantian, the red string belonging to Mr. Bai emitted a faint glow.

There was no obstruction, everything flowed naturally.

In just the span of a single breath, Holy Embryo Xu Bai successfully stepped into the Foundation Establishment Realm.

The faint red string dissolved into his Dantian, transforming into his Dao Foundation.

Because of this, he learned its true name—

Heaven’s Will Sword.

"If there is Heaven’s Will, let it be one with me."

"Marvelous."

Both Holy Embryo Xu Bai and Clone Xu Bai spoke in unison.

Despite stepping into the Foundation Establishment Realm, Holy Embryo Xu Bai did not stop his cultivation.

He continued to absorb the dense and pure spiritual energy in the secret chamber.

His cultivation level soared steadily and rapidly.

There were still no bottlenecks.

Mid-Foundation Establishment, Late-Foundation Establishment, Perfected-Foundation Establishment…

"Observe the ways of heaven and earth to refine the Golden Core."

Holy Embryo Xu Bai stood with his hands behind his back, murmuring.

He opened his mouth and inhaled, instantly draining all the nearly liquefied spiritual energy in the secret chamber.

Then, he directly took the storage ring filled with spirit stones from Clone Xu Bai, gripping it tightly.

Inside his Dantian, a red radiance gradually solidified.

"My will is Heaven’s Will, my heart is Heaven’s Heart."

Holy Embryo Xu Bai naturally spoke.

It was as if a world-shattering explosion had occurred.

A red radiance filled every part of his Dantian, then abruptly compressed to the extreme.

Moments later, a small red light floated within his Dantian.

Holy Embryo Xu Bai had stepped into the Golden Core Realm!

In an incredibly short time, he accomplished what ordinary cultivators required dozens or even hundreds of years to achieve.

Yet, he still did not stop cultivating.

With an endless supply of spiritual energy, Holy Embryo Xu Bai advanced towards Perfected Golden Core.

As expected, there was still no Heavenly Calamity.

The double standard of the Heavenly Dao in the Xuanhuang Realm was clear as day.

When Holy Embryo Xu Bai finally reached Perfected Golden Core,

Only half a day had passed since his creation.

"Is this Mr. Bai’s cultivation speed?"

"No, Mister Bai back then was even faster—achieving Soul Transformation in an instant as a mortal."

Inside the secret chamber, Holy Embryo Xu Bai and Clone Xu Bai conversed.

Then, after a long silence, Clone Xu Bai shook his head slightly.

"In today’s Xuanhuang World, achieving Golden Core in half a day is already the limit."

Holy Embryo Xu Bai nodded in agreement.

"Seize the essence of heaven and earth to form the Nascent Soul."

"Without prior preparations, no matter how great the talent, further advancement is impossible."

"As the saying goes…"

Holy Embryo Xu Bai cupped his hands towards Clone Xu Bai, then strode away gracefully.

"Before me lies the path of immortals, yet I cannot tread it—for the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor stands above!"

His figure vanished.

Yet, his voice echoed within the secret chamber for a long time.

Clone Xu Bai knew that Holy Embryo Xu Bai had left in search of an opportunity to form his Nascent Soul.

For ordinary cultivators, this process would be unimaginably difficult.

But for Holy Embryo Xu Bai, it was merely a trivial matter.

There was no need to worry about his safety.

Even though he was only at Perfected Golden Core,

Even a Soul Transformation cultivator might not be his match.

Because—

"My heart is Heaven’s Heart."

Chapter 776: Seeking Life in Desperation

Although the Holy Embryo Xu Bai had already departed, the Clone Xu Bai remained immersed in the process of the other party’s half-day Golden Core Perfection.

“No wonder, just by being tainted with a trace of Mr. Bai’s divine aura, the cultivation talent of this clone has become so terrifying.”

“My will is the will of heaven; my heart is the heart of heaven.” Xu Bai murmured these words again, suddenly enlightened.

"Mr. Bai might truly be an existence akin to an incarnation of the Heavenly Dao. Without the shackles of the new cultivation system, achieving Soul Transformation in one step would not be difficult at all."

By borrowing the memories transmitted from the Holy Embryo Xu Bai, the Clone was able to fully comprehend the essence of "Unity of Heaven and Man."

At present, the relationship between the Original Body Li Fan, the Clone Xu Bai, and the Holy Embryo Xu Bai had become rather profound.

Although they were still governed by the same consciousness, the differences in their physical constitutions led to different insights on the same matter.

The Clone Xu Bai's talent far surpassed Li Fan’s.

And the Holy Embryo Xu Bai was far beyond the Clone Xu Bai.

Moreover, from the moment it detached from the mother body, the Holy Embryo Xu Bai suffered from an even more severe "contamination." Subconsciously, it would perform actions beyond its own control—just like suddenly tripping while walking, as if affected by some external force.

However, at this stage, neither the Clone nor the Holy Embryo Xu Bai had any knowledge of this external force, nor could they resist it. They could only allow these changes to silently manifest within them.

The only certainty was that, although the final outcome was predestined and inevitable, the Holy Embryo Xu Bai had yet to develop an independent consciousness.

Its actions and behavior were still under Li Fan’s control.

This was precisely why, when Li Fan realized he had already been influenced by Mr. Bai and could no longer actively return to his true state, he deliberately accelerated the birth of the Holy Embryo.

Since he could no longer stop the process, he might as well take control of it, ensuring that he held the initiative in his own hands!

And in doing so, he could secretly plant a trap for his adversary.

For example…

If Mr. Bai were to awaken on his own, possessing all of Li Fan’s memories, he might attempt to “Establish Foundation Through Oneself” in order to break free from the shackles of the Immortal Ancestor and carve out a new path of cultivation.

If this theoretical path were truly feasible, Mr. Bai would undoubtedly be the one most capable of realizing it.

But Li Fan refused to let him do that.

Instead, he manipulated the Holy Embryo Xu Bai to establish its foundation with the “Heavenly Will Sword” and continue walking the path of the new cultivation system.

"When Mr. Bai is reborn, he might have to face a battle against the Immortal Ancestor."

"Let’s make things a little harder for him."

Li Fan had no goodwill toward this being attempting to seize his body for rebirth.

However, a more likely scenario was—

Once the other party awakened its consciousness, the first thing it would do was hunt down the original Li Fan and seize the “[Truth]” treasure. After all, he possessed all of Li Fan’s memories.

At that point, Li Fan would be like a lamb awaiting slaughter, utterly powerless to resist.

"I must make preparations before that moment arrives."

"Time is running out."

Xu Bai’s expression grew uncharacteristically solemn.

At the Holy Embryo Xu Bai’s current cultivation speed, by the time Mr. Bai finally awakened, his cultivation would undoubtedly surpass Li Fan’s by an overwhelming margin.

Furthermore, with access to all of Li Fan’s memories, he would be aware of every precaution Li Fan had taken.

Under such circumstances, escaping from him would be as difficult as ascending the heavens.

The only possible lifeline lay in the [Incarnation] function of [True].

“Though the body may perish, the true spirit remains eternal. Transforming into matter, crossing the ages.”

“Junior Brother Tianyang, whether I can survive this calamity depends entirely on you.”

“If there truly is a next life, I will surely treat you well!”

Xu Bai thought to himself in secret.

After activating the Incarnation Transformation ability, he could abandon his physical body and entrust his true spirit to an object.

Once the duration reached its limit, the ability would automatically trigger Returning to [Truth].

This was the only method Li Fan could currently think of to escape Mr. Bai’s mental control.

However, if he were to recklessly use Body Transformation into Object now, then once Mr. Bai’s will awakened, he would still retain memories of Li Fan’s transformation. There was still a high probability that he would locate the object Li Fan had fused into.

At that point, Li Fan’s fate would be even more miserable.

"To deceive Mr. Bai, I must first deceive myself."

"Before activating the Incarnation Transformation ability, I must not fixate on a target."

"At the same time, I need to use the [Chaos] Character to interfere with the process."

...

Xu Bai’s mind worked at full speed, strategizing his way out of the predicament.

Seven Days Later

Xu Bai left the secret chamber and first returned to Tianliang City, where he resigned from his position as Communication Liaison Envoy.

This decision immediately left Nangong Shirong in utter shock.

"If you have any dissatisfaction, you can tell me directly. Why go as far as resigning?"

"Do you think the position is too low? I can promote you. With the merits you’ve earned over the years, no one would question it." He hastily tried to persuade him.

Xu Bai gently shook his head. "Thank you for your kindness, my lord. However, just the other day, I had a sudden realization. I feel that worldly affairs are too burdensome and hold no real benefit for my cultivation."

"No matter how high the position or abundant the resources, if I am not focused on cultivation, it is all meaningless. Instead, it becomes a burden."

Xu Bai assumed an enlightened expression, and with his transcendent and otherworldly appearance, he truly managed to convince Nangong Shirong.

"It is just a pity..." Nangong Shirong sighed. "In a few decades or a hundred years, when I ascend to the headquarters of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, Tianliang Province would have naturally fallen under your control. Among all my subordinates, you are the only one I can truly rely on."

Seeing that Xu Bai was firm in his decision and not merely putting on an act, Nangong Shirong sighed again and made one last attempt to persuade him.

After Xu Bai firmly rejected him, he finally relented. "Tianliang Province will always have a place for you. If you change your mind in the future, you are welcome to return to me at any time."

"Then, I will thank you in advance, my lord!" Xu Bai saluted before leaving gracefully.

Nangong Shirong stood there watching his departing figure, his face full of confusion.

Xu Bai’s resignation indeed caused a significant stir.

After all, in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, every position was highly coveted, and suddenly having an opening for the role of Liaison Envoy, a prestigious and resourceful position, naturally led to various factions competing for it.

However, this commotion was quickly overshadowed by another shocking event.

During the Alliance’s campaign to conquer minor worlds, an unexpected and significant event occurred.

The Taiyan Sect, a renowned Ancient Immortal Sect, had not been destroyed as previously believed.

On the contrary, it still thrived within a certain small world.

A squad of Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance cultivators entered that world, only to be easily defeated.

However, the Taiyan Sect did not kill anyone. Instead, they let them all go.

Chapter 777: The Arrival of Various Worlds

The entrance to the small world was located in Qiongjing Prefecture.

Returning alongside the team of cultivators was also a Dao Integration cultivator from the Taiyan Sect.

As the representative of Taiyan Sect, this person visited Qiongjing Heavenly City and publicly posed a question:

Could Taiyan Sect join the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance as a whole?

Although the City Lord of Qiongjing City, Meng Shufu, was also a Dao Integration cultivator, he did not dare to make such a decision on his own.

After temporarily appeasing the other party, he hurried to the headquarters of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance to report the situation in person.

Meanwhile, the Taiyan Sect’s Dao Integration cultivator appeared completely at ease, showing not the slightest trace of anxiety.

It seemed as though he had already foreseen the outcome of Meng Shufu’s trip.

As expected, not long after, the official announcement from the Immortal Alliance was released:

To further accelerate the unification of the Xuanhuang Realm and to reduce unnecessary cultivator casualties while lessening the burden on the Rebirth Mansion, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance welcomes all factions and sects from the various small worlds to join.

Those who voluntarily submit will not be driven from their current residences.

They only need to cooperate in completing the [Observing Heaven, Understanding Earth] process of the Tianxuan Treasure Record.

Moreover, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance will even provide additional benefits, including support in resources and cultivation techniques.

Additionally, cultivators who successfully persuade factions from the Cave-Heaven and Small Worlds to submit will receive merit-based rewards.

Upon hearing the announcement, countless cultivators across the realm immediately began reconsidering their positions.

Fighting was not their strong suit—but carrying the banner of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and persuading others to surrender under such generous conditions? That was certainly much easier!

Thus, many cultivators who had begun to slack off were once again eager to take action.

In Qiongjing Prefecture, Meng Shufu looked at the Taiyan Sect’s Dao Integration cultivator across from him and suddenly realized the truth.

No wonder the other party had shown no concern from beginning to end.

Taiyan Sect had been renowned since ancient times for its unparalleled mastery of divination techniques.

By choosing to submit now, they had surely already calculated the outcome in advance!

"Ancient cultivators truly cannot be underestimated."

With this thought, Meng Shufu respectfully escorted the Taiyan Sect’s Dao Integration cultivator to the headquarters of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance to discuss the details of their submission.

Three Days Later.

A piece of news began to spread:

Not long ago, the Sect Master of Taiyan Sect had foreseen that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance would soon unify the Xuanhuang Realm.

After internal discussions, the sect reached a consensus: to align with the will of fate and cease any futile resistance.

Thus, their representative personally came forward to negotiate.

As of today, Taiyan Sect had officially joined the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

This marked the first small world faction to voluntarily submit and be accepted.

The news sent waves of excitement through the cultivators of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

After all, even rogue cultivators had heard of the prestigious Taiyan Sect.

Now that such a renowned sect had chosen to surrender, it was clear that the unification of the Xuanhuang Realm was truly imminent.

Cultivators across the land immediately became anxious, determined to seize this last opportunity to earn as much merit as possible.

In the Valley of Longevity.

"I had my disciples investigate the ancient sects, and they all said that Taiyan Sect had long since perished in the great calamity."

"And yet, here they are, alive and well."

Liu San sneered.

"Of course. Taiyan Sect's divination techniques are unmatched in the world. How could they not have foreseen the arrival of the great calamity and taken precautions?"

"But for them to abandon their former arrogance and voluntarily submit to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance—now that is unexpected. Given their temperament back in the day, they would never have surrendered unless at least half their sect had been wiped out first."

His tone was filled with disdain, clearly showing his lack of goodwill toward Taiyan Sect.

"The tides of fate cannot be resisted," Fang Zaiji said indifferently.

"Face and pride are insignificant compared to one's survival."

"Actually, this presents an opportunity for us," Xu Bai suddenly remarked.

"Let's observe how Taiyan Sect is treated after their submission. If their treatment is indeed as favorable as stated in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s announcement—if they are allowed to maintain their existence and some level of independence—then surrendering directly may not be such a bad choice after all."

As soon as these words were spoken, Liu San, Fang Zaiji, and Jiang Yushan all stared intently at Xu Bai.

It was as if they had never expected him to say such a thing.

However, Xu Bai remained indifferent and said, “Elder Liu, haven’t you always wanted to release the other elders and disciples trapped within the Medicine King Cauldron? If the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance can provide cultivation techniques to support them, then we won’t have to worry about them slaughtering each other due to the restrictions of incompatible cultivation paths.”

“We have been awake for so long now, and keeping them confined in the Great Dream Spring and Autumn Formation isn’t a long-term solution,” Xu Bai said in a relaxed tone.

Liu San opened his mouth slightly but inexplicably stopped himself.

After a moment of hesitation, he finally asked, “Isn’t this decision a bit too hasty?”

Xu Bai waved his hand dismissively. “Elder Liu, you’re overthinking it. The Taiyan Sect is highly skilled in divination. If surrendering was truly detrimental to them, they would never have made this choice.”

“The fact that they chose to submit at this moment means that there’s no major issue.”

“In fact, the sooner they join the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, the greater the benefits they may receive. After all, the Alliance needs to set a good example for the remaining small worlds. If they say one thing but act differently, it would only backfire, triggering a violent resistance from those small worlds.”

“For the current Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, unifying the Xuanhuang Realm and completing the ascension of the Tianxuan Mirror is the top priority. A few cultivation resources are of little significance in comparison.”

Xu Bai explained thoroughly, his reasoning sound and well-founded, leaving Liu San momentarily unable to refute.

“Hah! Surrendering is great! Honestly, I’ve wanted to say this for a while now, but I was afraid the Sect Master would blame me, so I kept quiet,” Fang Zaiji said cheerfully, fully supporting Xu Bai’s suggestion.

“I’ve been wanting to visit the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance for a long time. I heard that their artifact refinement techniques have improved tremendously compared to our time. I really want to see it for myself.”

“Yushan, haven’t you always wanted to challenge that woman again? Now you’ll be able to issue a challenge openly and honorably.”

Jiang Yushan remained silent.

She was not originally a disciple of the Medicine King Sect; she had only stayed there to suppress the sinister energy of the Indeterminate Prison. She had little sense of belonging to the sect, so she had no objections to Xu Bai’s decision.

Seeing this, Liu San sighed softly in his heart.

At the same time, he looked at Xu Bai, his mind filled with doubt.

“Alright, let’s settle the matter for now. Once the Taiyan Sect has fully integrated, we will personally visit and see if what the Immortal Alliance claims is true.”

“I imagine that day is not far off,” Xu Bai said with a slight smile.

“Oh, right. Mr. Fang, how is your research on the Endstone Plate progressing?” he suddenly changed the topic.

Fang Zaiji’s cheerful expression instantly froze.

He immediately turned to Liu San and asked, “Old Liu, how are those little ones doing? Has anyone successfully reached Foundation Establishment with One self method?”

“If you don’t have results, I can’t continue my research,” Fang Zaiji said righteously.

Chapter 778: A Thousand Schemes of Chaos

"Foundation Establishment with One self..."

Liu San let out a bitter laugh. "Young Master, I’m not sure where you heard such a whimsical idea."

"The difficulty of this is truly no small matter. Those little ones are all exceptionally gifted talents."

"During this period, they have all reached the peak of Qi Condensation, yet they are completely stuck at the Foundation Establishment stage."

Liu San shook his head. "From my perspective, wanting them to successfully achieve Foundation Establishment through oneself is extremely difficult."

"Back then, we came up with this method as a last resort to deceive the Tianxuan Treasure Record. But now that we are considering submitting to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, is there really a need to continue? Why not..." Liu San cautiously suggested.

"One must always be wary of others." Xu Bai rubbed his chin, deep in thought. "Although joining the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance may not pose an immediate threat, we cannot rule out the possibility of clashing with them in the future."

"Having a trump card for self-preservation is always a good thing. This plan must continue." Xu Bai said firmly.

A trace of surprise flashed in Liu San’s eyes, but he instinctively nodded.

"The Sect Master has thought things through thoroughly." Fang Zaiji immediately chimed in with agreement.
