At this moment, Xu Bai turned to Jiang Yushan. "I heard that Elder Jiang has been brooding over her narrow defeat at the hands of a female Dao Integration cultivator from the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance?"

Jiang Yushan frowned and nodded. "The new method of Dao Integration steals the power of heaven and earth. In combat, it indeed surpasses the old Dao Integration method by a margin. However, I have already devised a countermeasure. The next time we fight, I will make sure she pays."

A sharp glint flashed in Jiang Yushan’s eyes.

Xu Bai did not inquire further. Instead, he retrieved a translucent green fruit from his storage ring, seemingly fluctuating between reality and illusion.

"This item contains the profound principles of heaven and earth. It is a rare treasure in this era. Perhaps it may be of some help to Elder Jiang."

There was no need for further explanation.

The moment the True Temptation Fruit appeared, its aura instantly drew the attention of the three Dao Integration cultivators present.

Although they were unsure of the fruit’s exact effects, the faint ripples of divine law emanating from it were proof enough of its extraordinary nature.

Fang Zaiji nearly drooled, muttering, "Sect Master, you’re so biased. You’re giving such a treasure to Yushan alone?"

"Do you have more? Let me have a taste too."

Xu Bai chuckled. "Do you think this is some ordinary fruit that grows on trees? It took me a long time to barely acquire one. If not for Elder Jiang’s lingering frustration, I wouldn’t have taken it out so easily. To be honest, it does pain me a little."

Xu Bai laughed heartily.

Jiang Yushan hesitated for a moment, about to return the True Temptation Fruit, but Xu Bai firmly refused.

"A gift, once given, is not meant to be taken back. Elder Jiang, just keep it."

"After all, the stronger you become, the safer our Medicine King Sect will be."

Hearing this, Jiang Yushan nodded and accepted the fruit before leaving to enter closed-door cultivation.

"Yushan..." Liu San watched her departing figure, hesitating to speak.

But Jiang Yushan did not look back, ignoring him entirely.

At this moment, Xu Bai turned to Fang Zaiji. "Since researching the Endstone Plate has yielded no results, you might as well put your idle time to good use."

"Elder Fang, why don’t you take this opportunity to reinforce the Medicine King True Cauldron for me?"

Fang Zaiji’s face fell.

"If you satisfy me, I might just find someone to procure another 'Grand Dao Fruit' for you."

The Grand Dao Fruit—a name Xu Bai had fabricated for the True Temptation Fruit.

Fang Zaiji’s eyes lit up, and he immediately responded, "Sect Master, rest assured! Leave it to me. In fact, when you first instructed me, I already had a plan for reinforcing the Medicine King True Cauldron. But due to time and material constraints, I never acted on it..."

Xu Bai smiled. "Then you can rest easy now, Elder Fang. Whatever materials you need, just tell me."

He stretched out his palm, and the Medicine King True Cauldron hovered above, slowly rotating.

"After all, our disciples of the Medicine King Sect still reside within it. Naturally, we must consider their safety." Xu Bai said meaningfully.

Liu San’s gaze lingered on the Medicinal King True Cauldron for a long time.

It was only when Xu Bai followed Fang Zaiji to the artifact refining chamber that he reluctantly withdrew his eyes.

His expression was unreadable, as if lost in thought.

Tianquan State.

After an extended period of data processing, Li Fan had finally fully deciphered the entirety of the Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Technique.

After testing its operation, he wondered whether he could use it to eliminate Mr. Bai’s influence on himself.

Unfortunately, whether due to the technique’s upper limits or the fact that he had already been tainted beyond recovery, it did not work.

When Li Fan invoked [Truth], a surge of reluctance and attachment once again overwhelmed him.

The emotions erupted all at once, forcing him to hastily close the [Truth] panel.

"It seems I was overthinking it."

Having failed multiple times, Li Fan was unfazed.

After committing the contents of the Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Technique to memory, he did not continue cultivating it.

Instead, he set it aside for the time being and took out the Dissociation Disc.

At this moment, the Dissociation Disc appeared even more translucent and crystalline than before.

"The Nine Discs Struggle—seven have already been eliminated."

"Now, only I and one other unknown competitor remain."

As Li Fan played with the jade-like Dissociation Disc, he pondered silently.

During his free time earlier, he had already infused into it all the formations he knew, except for the Life-and-Death Reversal Formation and the Tianxuan Spirit-Locking Formation.

And he could clearly feel that the Dissociation Disc in his hands had grown significantly stronger than the remaining one.

Even without feeding it more formation data and simply allowing it to evolve naturally—

It would still secure the final victory.

"It seems my opponent has accepted their fate and stopped struggling."

"Unfortunately, I don’t have enough time."

Li Fan shook his head slightly.

He chose not to inject the final formation data into it.

"If the Tianxuan Secondary Body is still within the sensing range of the Tianxuan Mirror…"

"Then this could serve as my trump card."

"I wonder, after its ascension, how the Tianxuan Mirror compares to the reborn Mr. Bai in terms of power?"

A cold glint flashed in Li Fan’s eyes.

Since he sought to survive from the brink of death, he had to stir chaos to find opportunity.

Just like when the Crimson Flame burned the sea and Ink Death Descended in this world. To prevent others from tracing his true self through his clones, he had to completely establish their "deaths."

The greater the chaos, the better.

Too many hidden existences lurked in the Xuanhuang Realm—only by pitting them against each other could he obscure their vision, even if just slightly.

"Actually, there is another way to break free from Mr. Bai’s influence."

"And that is to eliminate the very cause of 'attachment' itself."

"For example, if I am obsessed with obtaining the fully unlocked Dissociation Disc—then I should complete its final form."

"If I am reluctant to part with the Endstone Plate, which can fully block the Tianxuan Treasure Record—then I must research a potential breakthrough as soon as possible."

"Unfortunately… these are only theoretical possibilities."

"As the saying goes—human desire knows no bounds."

Chapter 779: The First Step of a Thousand Miles

"Perhaps reaching the legendary state of being free from all desires would allow one to resist the corruption of Mister Bai."

"But then again, if one truly has no desires for anything…"

"Then they wouldn’t crave [Truth] anymore."

Li Fan shook his head slightly and dismissed this unrealistic thought from his mind.

With a light tap of his index finger, he suspended the Dissociation Disc in midair. Then, he retrieved eight white, glowing crystals from his storage ring.

"If a crisis arises and I need to use a formation to attract the attention of the Tianxuan Mirror through the Dissociation Disc, there certainly won’t be enough time for me to set it up slowly. I must prepare in advance."

With this in mind, Li Fan narrowed his eyes and began injecting the information of the [Great Reversal Life-and-Death Formation] into the eight glowing crystals.

These crystals, known as Formation Crystals, function similarly to Formation Crowns in that they can record and store formation techniques. However, while Formation Crowns can be reused multiple times, Formation Crystals are disposable.

Each Formation Crystal was inscribed with a portion of the formation’s data. Then, Li Fan arranged them to hover around the Dissociation Disc.

"With just a single thought, these Formation Crystals will shatter simultaneously, transmitting the formation’s information directly into the Dissociation Disc."

As Li Fan gazed at the eight flickering white crystals, he set up an additional formation around them as a safeguard against unexpected incidents.

Next was the [Tianxuan Spirit-Locking Formation].

After repeating these meticulous steps, the Dissociation Disc, now encased by sixteen glowing crystals, had become almost unrecognizable.

Carefully, Li Fan placed it into a separate, empty storage ring.

"I'm still unsure whether the Tianxuan Secondary Body remains connected to the Tianxuan Mirror. This is merely a contingency plan."

"I must be fully prepared and give it my all."

Leaving the secret chamber, Li Fan made his way to the Qianli Hall in Tianquan City.

The place was practically deserted, and even the shop’s sign was hanging crookedly. Not even Jiao Xiuyuan had come out to fix it.

"I heard that the business of Qianli Hall has been declining. Seems that was true," Li Fan thought as he stepped inside.

With the growing popularity of the Tianxuan Treasure Record, cultivators could now conduct transactions seamlessly across dozens of provinces.

Trades could be made anytime, anywhere, with almost no restrictions.

Moreover, due to the widespread availability of information, product prices had become nearly transparent.

For merchants like Jiao Xiuyuan, this was nothing short of a devastating blow. Countless shops vanished overnight.

Fortunately for Jiao Xiuyuan, he ran his business primarily to support his cultivation. As long as he didn’t suffer losses, it wasn’t a life-or-death concern. True profit was not his top priority.

However, it was evident that losing his foundation for cultivation had taken a toll on him.

"What should I do…"

Jiao Xiuyuan lay listlessly behind a wooden counter covered in dust, muttering to himself.

So deep was he in thought that he failed to notice someone entering.

Li Fan knocked lightly.

Jiao Xiuyuan jolted up in shock. "A customer?"

He eyed Li Fan with suspicion, disbelief still lingering on his face.

Li Fan, in turn, scrutinized Jiao Xiuyuan’s puppet body, staring so intently that it made the latter feel uneasy.

"You…" Jiao Xiuyuan asked hesitantly.

"Daoist Jiao, would you be willing to sell this puppet body of yours? I’m open to negotiation!" Li Fan said with a smile.

Jiao Xiuyuan’s expression darkened, and he slammed the table, about to retort angrily—only to stop abruptly.

His eyes locked onto the object Li Fan had quietly taken out.

"This is…" A well-traveled merchant like him recognized it almost immediately—its aura was similar to that of the Tianxuan Mirror.

"A Tianxuan Secondary Body?" Jiao Xiuyuan was utterly shocked.

In the entire Xuanhuang Realm, the total number of Tianxuan Secondary Bodies did not exceed fifty.

Each possessed unique and extraordinary abilities, making them incredibly rare and valuable. No cultivator would willingly part with one.

A flood of information regarding different Tianxuan Secondary Bodies flashed through Jiao Xiuyuan’s mind, yet none matched the item before him.

Jiao Xiuyuan’s heart pounded with excitement. He waved his hand to close the shop’s door and warmly welcomed Li Fan.

"Of course, of course! A mere puppet body? That’s not a problem at all."

"But, I’m curious… the item in your hands, what exactly is it?" Jiao Xiuyuan lowered his voice and cautiously inquired.

Li Fan answered without hesitation, "Tianxuan Secondary Body, Endstone Plate."

"It can block the perception of the Tianxuan Mirror and Tianxuan Treasure Record."

Upon hearing Li Fan’s first sentence, Jiao Xiuyuan’s eyes lit up with excitement.

But the moment Li Fan spoke the second sentence, he shuddered violently.

Instinctively, he glanced around and wiped the cold sweat from his forehead.

"Is this true?"

However, his expression quickly changed.

A trace of greed flashed in his eyes as he reached out, wanting to touch the item.

To his surprise, Li Fan did not stop him from doing so.

Instead, he allowed him to take the Endstone Disc into his hands.

"Hmm?" Jiao Xiuyuan examined the jade-like disc with some doubt.

He flipped it back and forth.

Moments later, his expression turned to shock.

Gripping it tightly, he looked up at Li Fan, whose expression was unreadable.

"Fellow Daoist..."

Li Fan raised a hand, cutting him off. "Daoist Jiao, what do you think this item is worth?"

"Incalculable! The stronger the Tianxuan Mirror becomes, the more desperate cultivators will be for this item, and the higher its value will be!" Jiao Xiuyuan blurted out without thinking.

"What price do you want to sell it for?" He naturally did not believe that Li Fan would trade such a precious treasure just for a mere puppet body. He immediately asked.

In that instant, a new business strategy formed in his mind.

He realized his future path—high-end, monopolized goods.

Public information about commodities?

If he was the only one in the world with this item, wouldn't he be the one to set the price?

With his vast network of stores and unmatched publicity capabilities…

If every premium item were sold through auctions…

Although the scale of his business might shrink, his profits might not only remain unaffected but could even increase further.

Jiao Xiuyuan’s mind was filled with grand visions of the future.

But Li Fan’s next words abruptly pulled him back to reality.

"Haven’t I made myself clear? Just a single puppet body from you, Fellow Daoist."

Li Fan's calm and indifferent tone left Jiao Xiuyuan momentarily stunned.

Doubt crept into his heart.

"Could it be… I misjudged? Is this thing actually a fake?"

He secretly examined the Endstone Plate in his hands once again.

"Daoist Jiao, there’s no need to worry. The effects of this item are beyond question."

"However, my request might be… a bit unusual," Li Fan said in a deep and meaningful tone.

Jiao Xiuyuan’s expression flickered with uncertainty.

But as Li Fan continued to send him transmissions, his face changed to one of surprise.

Then, he nodded repeatedly.

Inside Qianli Hall, the two conversed for a long time.

Eventually, Li Fan left quietly without retrieving the Endstone Plate.

Likewise, he did not take the puppet body with him.

Chapter 780: Casually Extracting the Heavenly Marrow

Longevity Valley, inside the artifact refinement chamber.

Xu Bai was overseeing Fang Zaiji as he reinforced the Medicine King True Cauldron.

"Sect Master, the amount of rare heavenly materials we've added is already excessive. I doubt even when the Medicine King True Cauldron was first forged, such an abundance of precious materials was used."

"What a waste..."

"Are you planning to use it to withstand the attacks of the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign?"

Fang Zaiji spoke with a trace of heartache.

Yet, under Xu Bai’s firm and resolute gaze, he had no choice but to toss a small lump of Eternal Calamity Gold into the earth fire before him.

Under his strenuous manipulation, it took more than ten days of calcination before the Eternal Calamity Gold slightly loosened and deformed.

With careful precision, he then embedded and fused it into the surface of the Medicine King True Cauldron.

Xu Bai nodded in satisfaction upon seeing this.

He then took out some black powder and handed it over.

Fang Zaiji, just having breathed a sigh of relief, was startled once again upon seeing what Xu Bai held.

"This material... why can't my spiritual sense perceive it?"

Xu Bai smiled faintly. "That’s exactly how it should be. Mr. Fang, please coat this material over the surface of the Medicine King True Cauldron. If it’s not enough, I have more."

"A material that can block spiritual sense detection... This must be quite expensive," Fang Zaiji muttered under his breath but still followed Xu Bai’s instructions.

The earth fire flickered, casting a shifting glow over Xu Bai’s face.

Three thousand zhang underground, Beast Realm.

Having quietly returned, Li Fan excavated a secret chamber deep underground.

After sealing all exits and using formations to conceal it, he placed a metal furnace on the ground before him.

"The Myriad Phenomena Furnace..."

"Although it might not truly be able to refine an 'Emperor Beast,' a beast of such immense power appearing in the Xuanhuang Realm will certainly draw the attention of Senior Brother Zhang’s Grand Aspiration Dharma Body."

"Moreover, I won’t even need to worry about controlling the 'Myriad Phenomena Ancestral Beast' after refining it."

"The more chaotic it is, the better—it’ll save me a lot of trouble."

Li Fan pondered in silence.

To refine the Myriad Phenomena Ancestral Beast, a vast variety of exotic beasts was required.

Fortunately, Li Fan had plenty at his disposal.

These weren’t from his recent dealings with the Empire but from his very first trade with Xiao Qing.

It was none other than the Sealed Life Treasure Box.

Li Fan took out a red, palm-sized wooden box.

Despite its small size, the interior was partitioned into tens of thousands of different spaces.

Each space contained a frozen exotic beast.

"Let’s start with the weaker ones."

Following the method imparted by Xiao Qing, Li Fan willed the box open, extracting several dozen palm-sized exotic beasts.

The moment they left their frozen confinement, they began regaining consciousness.

Before they could react, Li Fan trembled his spiritual power slightly, instantly slaughtering them all.

Their flesh and blood were disassembled down to their smallest particles, yet they retained their original appearances before being cast into the metal furnace.

Sensing the entry of exotic beast flesh, the intricate bestial engravings around the furnace slowly began to glow.

"I heard that when the Empire forged this artifact, they referenced information from the Beast-Taming Sect’s supreme treasure—the Ten Thousand Reincarnation Beasts Wheel..."

"The Beast-Taming Sect has hidden itself in the Lingxu Realm. I wonder when the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance will discover them."

While contemplating, Li Fan continued tossing exotic beasts from the Sealed Life Treasure Box into the Myriad Phenomena Furnace.

As more and more exotic beasts were added, Li Fan could sense a mysterious power forming within.

His expression grew solemn.

Ten Days Later.

Both Li Fan and his clone, Xu Bai, abruptly halted their actions.

A peculiar expression flickered across their faces.

"Has the Nascent Soul finally formed...?"

"But such an inconspicuous Cave-Heaven...?"

At that very moment, Xu Bai’s Holy Embryo wandered across the Xuanhuang Continent and finally sensed it—

He had discovered the Cave-Heaven most suitable for himself.

However, what surprised Li Fan was that this cave heaven was nowhere near comparable to his Five Elements Grand Cave Heaven.

It was not even close to ordinary single-attribute cave heavens.

This was because the cave heaven was merely the size of a square inch, surrounded by dark and chaotic void.

There was only a barren piece of yellow land floating in the void, providing a foothold for anyone inside.

Since they shared the same divine sense, Li Fan could clearly perceive that this cave heaven truly had no remarkable features.

The reason why the Holy Embryo Xu Bai chose this place was purely because it had only just been born.

"Interesting. This is the perfect opportunity to see how Mr. Bai employs the new method to achieve Soul Transformation."

"As the world undergoes a great change, what choice will you make?"

While secretly preparing for a desperate gamble, Li Fan split a portion of his consciousness to carefully observe the "natural" actions of the Holy Embryo Xu Bai.

Xu Bai's spiritual sense manifested as an ethereal projection, standing on the yellow earth of the newly born cave heaven.

Instead of showing disdain, he had a faint look of delight on his face.

He conjured water with his own power and irrigated the barren land.

Then, tiny green lights emerged from his body and scattered into the soil.

Before long, small green sprouts began breaking through the ground.

The first traces of life had appeared within the cave-heaven.

Then, gentle streams began to form, winding around the newly grown plants.

As the atmosphere became full of vitality, the cave heaven itself started expanding into the surrounding void.

Li Fan observed each scene closely, deep in thought.

"Creating a brand-new cave heaven from nothing."

"It can be completely tailored according to one's own will. Compared to relying on luck to find an existing one, this method is undoubtedly superior."

"However, a cave heaven is not like a mortal being. Its growth spans thousands or even tens of thousands of years—that's in the most ideal conditions."

"I've already been at the Nascent Soul stage for so long, yet even my Five Elements Cave-Heaven remains in its infancy. This proves just how difficult it is for a cave heaven to mature."

"Are you planning to slowly wait for it to grow?"

"If so, that would be good news for me."

That was Li Fan's thought process.

However, the means employed by the Holy Embryo Xu Bai far exceeded his imagination.

He was caught off guard, and a sense of urgency crept into his heart.

After reaching the Nascent Soul stage, the Holy Embryo Xu Bai strolled leisurely through the Xuanhuang Realm, as if he were merely taking a casual walk.

He stopped in one of the regions and gently reached out toward the sky.

Then, something mysterious and profound seemed to take place between heaven and earth.

It was as if something had been extracted by the Holy Embryo Xu Bai and effortlessly placed into his own cave heaven.

"Boom!"

Within the cave heaven, a continuous rumbling erupted.

In the blink of an eye, a mountain range rose from the ground.

Inside the cave heaven, changes were occurring at a speed a thousand—no, ten thousand—times faster than usual, transforming the landscape dramatically.

"This is…"

"Extracting the Marrow of Heaven?"

"Such ease and grace, without any fear of heavenly backlash. And…"

Upon witnessing this scene, Li Fan's pupils suddenly contracted.

What shocked him even more was that the Holy Embryo Xu Bai moved on to the next region, observed it for a brief moment, and once again made his move.

Another impending transformation of heaven and earth was quietly extracted.

Not a single other cultivator even noticed.

Inside the Holy Embryo Xu Bai's cave heaven, another mutation took place.

Chapter 781: The Power of World Rebirth

The once-gentle stream suddenly transformed into a roaring river in an instant.

Along with it, the land within the Cave-Heaven rapidly expanded once again.

With the nourishment of vast amounts of river water, the vegetation within the Cave Heaven thrived even more. Trees rose from the ground, lush and verdant.

"The River of Heaven and Yu's Creation…"

Li Fan looked at the Holy Embryo Xu Bai and nodded with some satisfaction.

Then, he left the Cave-Heaven and resumed his journey through the Xuanhuang Realm.

Like a mortal traveler, he measured the land with his own footsteps.

Whenever he encountered a life transforming phenomenon that suited him, he would absorb it into his Cave-Heaven, just like gathering medicinal herbs.

At first, he was in awe, but after witnessing it so many times, he gradually became numb to it—it started to feel routine.

Li Fan had read many insights from Nascent Soul cultivators on how to advance to the Soul Transformation stage.

It is said that the changes about to occur in the world are like the meridians within a mortal’s body—without special methods, they are extremely difficult to detect.

Furthermore, once extracted, such phenomena would cause earth-shaking changes and attract great attention.

But all of these so-called "common knowledge" experiences failed to apply to Holy Embryo Xu Bai.

With just a brief moment of narrowed eyes, he could determine whether a "Heaven and Earth Life Transforming Phenomenon" was present.

Then, with a mere wave of his hand—like summoning a gentle breeze—it would silently become his.

As more and more transformative forces were integrated into his Cave-Heaven, it renewed itself day by day.

Mountains, ravines, plains, rivers, forests…

The Cave Heaven flourished with boundless vitality, resembling a small world constantly growing.

Yet, for the first time, Holy Embryo Xu Bai frowned.

"Something is still missing."

"This vitality is merely an illusion—it cannot sustain a perfect cycle on its own."

"If no external force replenishes it, this Cave-Heaven, which has grown unnaturally fast, will soon wither and return to silence."

Li Fan sensed Xu Bai’s thoughts.

Xu Bai, now hovering in midair, scanned his surroundings and gazed into the distance.

He continued looking for an entire day.

Then, a faint smile appeared on his face.

Without urgency, he took a step forward, heading toward his destination.

From Li Fan’s perspective, Xu Bai’s speed did not seem particularly fast.

He didn't even use his spiritual power—he was moving purely by physical strength.

Yet, to onlookers, he appeared to traverse thousands of miles in a single step, vanishing instantly.

"It’s not that he is moving—it's that the world itself is cooperating, shortening the distance for him."

"Shrinking the earth to inches, making travel effortless."

As Li Fan observed the shifts in space around Xu Bai’s movement, a flash of insight struck him.

"Though my body was borrowed for Xu Bai’s rebirth, this is, in fact, a great fortune."

"Each undiscovered 'life transforming phenomenon' represents an unparalleled treasure capable of creating a Soul Transformation powerhouse."

"Moreover, every action Xu Bai takes is in harmony with the heavens and earth—it can all be considered divine abilities."

"For example, the way he stimulates the Cave-Heaven’s vitality, the effortless way he extracts the Marrow of Heaven, or even his current use of Shrinking the Earth."

"With my comprehension, grasping even one such divine ability in a single lifetime would be an incredible fortune. But now, they are coming one after another."

"What's even more precious is that all these divine abilities are being cast through my body and senses—as if I were the one using them myself. With some refinement in the future, I may be able to replicate them perfectly."

"That is… if I have a next life."

Li Fan’s swirling thoughts came to an abrupt halt as Xu Bai finally reached his destination.

"This place… is Congyun Sea?"

Li Fan snapped back to reality, startled.

Nearly ten years had passed since Ink Death’s world-ending massacre.

Although the place still bore the marks of a post-apocalyptic wasteland, the once-violent lava flows had begun to cool, solidifying into a hardened black stone.

The space fissures, gnawed away like woodworms, had unknowingly healed completely.

At first glance, the former site of the Congyun Sea remained utterly lifeless.

Yet, upon closer sensing, a peculiar force seemed to be gestating.

Of course, this was something only Li Fan could perceive, thanks to the unparalleled innate talent of the Holy Embryo, Xu Bai.

If another cultivator were to arrive, they would likely only sense waves of deadly peril and would flee in terror.

The Holy Embryo, Xu Bai, gazed at the ruins for a long time. Before stepping into the Congyun Sea, he first glanced in the direction of Yuandao Prefecture.

A surge of resentment and dread instantly welled up in his heart.

For the first time, a trace of negative emotion appeared on Xu Bai’s face.

With a cold snort, he turned away and strode into the Congyun Sea.

Unlike the emotions that arose when he glimpsed Yuandao Prefecture, walking through the ruins here evoked an exceptionally complex feeling in Xu Bai’s heart.

It was a fusion of many emotions, intertwining and merging.

For a moment, even Li Fan could not discern the exact nature of this feeling.

However, his attention soon shifted to Xu Bai’s actions.

Clearly, the purpose of his journey this time is to perfect the [Change of Impending Life] within the vitality of his own Cave-heaven.

Unlike before, when he acted effortlessly, this time he was visibly solemn.

Using his hand as a brush, he moved swiftly through the air, drawing a boundary between reality and illusion within the heavens and earth.

The line extended continuously, from the western edge of Yuandao and Shilin Prefecture’s coastal borders to the farthest reaches of the Endless Ocean.

In just half a day, he had enclosed what was once the general territory of the Congyun Sea.

However, its contours were bizarrely shaped, and the enclosed area was significantly smaller than the original Congyun Sea.

When the boundary was finally sealed, it flickered once before vanishing into the heavens and earth.

Xu Bai then took a deep breath, reaching out to grasp the invisible loop of energy before gradually pulling it tight.

As the boundary was drawn in, something within the Congyun Sea seemed to be slowly extracted.

Li Fan remained intensely focused, unwilling to miss even a single detail.

The Dao Deviation Stone within his mind radiated a brilliant blue glow, meticulously recording every insight emanating from Xu Bai.

At first, Xu Bai reeled in the energy with ease. But as he progressed, the resistance from the void grew stronger.

Each successive pull required his full strength.

The once-intangible thread in his hands gradually became solid—its texture as gentle as a spring breeze, yet as chilling as ice silk.

Xu Bai’s gaze was unwavering, his resolve absolute.

As he extracted more and more of the boundary, the once-calm ruins of the Congyun Sea suddenly underwent a dramatic transformation!

Boom!

The previously dormant black-red magma erupted once more with terrifying intensity.

Countless wriggling black voids, like swarms of tiny insects, appeared in a dense mass!

The ominous aura of an impending apocalypse instantly descended.

"This is…" Li Fan’s pupils constricted.

"The soon-to-be-revived Congyun Sea is turning back into a dead land!"

"What he extracted… was the force driving the world's revival!"

The world around them reverted into a living hell, yet Xu Bai's actions remained unhesitating.

His expression bore neither sorrow nor joy.

Chapter 782: Taiyan Dao Deviation Stone

Three days later.

The Congyun Sea had reverted to the state it was in when Ink Death had annihilated everything.

Lava raged, and the ground was riddled with holes.

Meanwhile, the coil in the hands of the Holy Embryo, Xu Bai, emitted a brilliant white light before vanishing from the Xuanhuang Realm.

It reappeared within his own personal Cave Heaven, transforming into droplets of spring rain that fell upon the land.

Thus, Li Fan witnessed a remarkable sight—within the Cave Heaven, mountains, rivers, lakes, and forests began to show signs of animal life.

Without any prior warning, fish, birds, and beasts suddenly emerged from various places.

With the arrival of these living beings, the Cave Heaven finally started to display true vitality.

Under normal circumstances, such an evolution would take hundreds of thousands or even millions of years to occur.

However, with the power of world revival, it happened in the blink of an eye.

"This technique... is truly divine," Li Fan couldn't help but sigh in admiration.

In his past life, even the vast Five Elements Cave Heaven, which had been nurtured for an unknown number of years, was still dominated mainly by plant life. It was still far from becoming a fully developed world.

Yet, Xu Bai's Cave Heaven had accomplished this feat in such a short period.

After leaving the Cloud Sea, he did not stop his efforts to gather the world's life transformative phenomenon.

However, his work now resembled more of fine-tuning and mending, rather than causing earth-shattering changes.

Subtle transformations were quietly taking place in unnoticed corners.

"I can't replicate this... I simply can't." Li Fan kept replaying the memory of how Xu Bai extracted the power of revival.

Even though he had witnessed the entire process firsthand, he remained completely baffled as to how it was achieved.

This was clearly beyond his current level of comprehension.

"Ordinary Nascent Souls rely on their Cave-Heaven as the foundation of their cultivation. But someone outright devouring a small world? I've never even heard of such a thing before."

"When he truly advances to the Soul Transformation Realm, I can’t begin to imagine how powerful he’ll become."

"And which Spirit of Heaven and Earth will he choose to merge with in his Dao Integration?"

Li Fan found himself looking forward to the answer.

As Xu Bai traveled across the Xuanhuang Realm, another matter puzzled Li Fan.

Logically speaking, with Xu Bai’s extraordinary appearance and temperament, he should have attracted attention wherever he went.

Not to mention, his continuous absorption of the world's transformative energy should have drawn intense scrutiny.

Yet, strangely enough, every cultivator he encountered along the way completely ignored him—as if they couldn’t see him at all.

Hiding in plain sight, under the bright sun!

"This kind of divine ability… it would suit me perfectly," Li Fan thought.

"It seems as if he has completely merged with all things in the world..."

After pondering for a long time, Li Fan's expression turned thoughtful.

Meanwhile, as Xu Bai was on the verge of advancing to the Soul Transformation Realm, Li Fan himself was also about to refine the "Emperor Beast".

All the frozen exotic beasts had been placed into the Sealed Life Treasure Box.

Li Fan had even added Red Nine-Headed's flesh and blood and Kunpeng's essence blood.

"Boom!"

"Boom!"

Above the Myriad Phenomena Furnace, all the beast patterns erupted with dazzling radiance.

The metal furnace trembled violently, producing creaking sounds from all around.

It seemed as if it could collapse and explode at any moment.

"Another technique is ready."

Li Fan swiftly pressed his hands together, setting up an formation around the Myriad Phenomena Furnace to temporarily seal it.

Afterward, he stored it inside a separate storage ring.

Then, he took out some materials and, following the method from Tianyang’s memories, began refining mechanical puppets.

"The Chaos Character is the only method I have to potentially disrupt the vision of the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign."

"Moreover, it seems that the Longevity Realm experts of this world are highly interested in the Chaos Character. So when the time comes, I won't just cast it myself—it will also erupt simultaneously in different locations."

"As the saying goes, ‘The wind rustles, and the crane's cry startles the army; every tree and blade of grass seems like an enemy soldier.’"

A sharp gleam flashed in Li Fan’s eyes. Within just a few days, a rather crude-looking, pitch-black puppet was completed.

It had no intelligence to speak of, and its function was extremely simple:

At the critical moment, it would execute its predetermined orders without being influenced by any external forces—not even Li Fan himself!

"The Chaos Character is incredibly difficult to execute, even for my true body."

"Let alone these puppets."

"I can only divide the word ‘Chaos’ stroke by stroke. When the time comes, the puppets will assemble it into a complete divine ability."

"If it were the full-power ‘Chaos’ mantra, splitting it apart would likely be beyond my ability. But I don’t seek its full power—I only need to imitate its chaotic aura, which should be feasible."

Li Fan multitasked, monitoring and recording the activities of the Holy Embryo Xu Bai while continuously refining more puppets and contemplating how to deconstruct the Chaos Character.

Fortunately, with the secret technique of [Transformation into Divine Dao], despite the numerous tasks, his mind remained orderly.

...

Longevity Valley.

Jiang Yushan unleashed a powerful slash of black fiendish energy at the newly reforged Medicine King True Cauldron, but the cauldron's surrounding black radiance effortlessly neutralized the attack.

Jiang Yushan furrowed her brows slightly, while Fang Zaiji was brimming with pride.

"Sect Master, what do you think of my craftsmanship? This new cauldron is extremely sturdy! Even if the three of us joined forces, we might not be able to inflict any damage on it."

"And that’s only considering its inherent material strength. If we activate its internal formations for full defense, it might even be able to withstand an attack from the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign!"

"It’s all thanks to your generosity, Sect Master—you spared no expense on rare heavenly materials. I’ve never had such luxurious resources for artifact refining in my entire life." Fang Zaiji sighed with emotion.

Xu Bai, who had just tested the cauldron’s durability, was very satisfied. "Thank you for your hard work, Elder Fang."

"I heard that the small world where the Taiyan Sect is located has recently been formally integrated into the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance. To set an example, the alliance is even allowing its cultivators to visit freely. Elder Fang, since you've been working hard on refining artifacts, why don’t you come with me to take a look and see how things stand?" Xu Bai said with a smile.

As he spoke, he ignored the side glance from Liu San and casually stored the now-darkened Medicine King True Cauldron away.

"Taiyan Sect, huh…" Fang Zaiji hesitated.

"They aren’t easy to deal with. Back in the day, I was constantly hunted down with no peace, and it was the Taiyan Sect disciples who calculated my hiding spots and exposed me."

Xu Bai chuckled. "That was in the past. Now that they've joined the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, and there’s no longer any personal vendetta between you, why would they bother chasing you now?"

Hearing this, Fang Zaiji became a bit eager. "I’ve heard that Taiyan Sect has a treasure called the ‘Stone Mother of Dao Deviation.’"

"It supposedly contains an illusion so lifelike that it has nearly deduced an entirely separate real world. I’ve heard of it for a long time, but I’ve never had the chance to see it…"

Xu Bai’s gaze flickered. "Haha, I’ve heard of it too. That item is the Taiyan Sect’s most prized treasure—it won’t be easy to lay eyes on."

"Whether we get to witness it or not depends entirely on fate."

Chapter 783: Simulated Path of Dao Integration

Xu Bai turned to look at the silent Liu San and suddenly asked, “Elder Liu, will you be coming with us? You are knowledgeable and well-experienced, which makes you the perfect person to assess the situation. We need to determine whether surrendering to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is truly reliable and whether the Taiyan Sect might be colluding with them to deceive us.”

Xu Bai’s sincerity was evident.

However, Liu San remained silent for a moment before shaking his head and declining. “Young Master, you and Old Fang should go. In terms of insight, he is no less capable than I am. Given the turbulent times, someone must stay behind to look after the disciples in Longevity Valley. Although the entrance is concealed by the Endstone Disc, there is still the possibility that an unsuspecting cultivator might stumble upon it.”

“You finally said something reasonable, Old Liu.” Fang Zaiji appeared somewhat pleased with Liu San’s affirmation.

But soon, he scrutinized Liu San suspiciously. “You’re not just using this as an excuse to spend time alone with Yushan, are you?”

“Nonsense!” Liu San snapped angrily.

After some playful banter, Xu Bai and Fang Zaiji departed from Longevity Valley and headed straight for the Taiyan Sect.

The entrance to the small world was located in Taihua Prefecture. Along the way, they saw numerous cultivators who had caught wind of the event and were also rushing to witness the spectacle.

Surprisingly, members of the Immortal Alliance’s internal system were stationed along the route to guide visitors, a rare occurrence.

It was clear that the Alliance intended to make the Taiyan Sect’s submission a model case for propaganda.

Taihua Prefecture lay in the eastern region of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, not far from the Congyun Sea.

A vast mountain range spanned its territory, with a thousand towering peaks.

Among them, nine peaks were the most prominent, collectively known as the Nine Veins of Taihua.

Once, there had been ten peaks, known as the Ten Veins of Taihua.

However, one of them, Mount Taixu, suddenly collapsed and disappeared from people’s memory, leaving only the nine remaining peaks.

In a previous life, He Zhenghao had once considered going to Taihua Prefecture for advanced training, but under Li Fan’s influence, he ultimately chose Tianyun Prefecture instead.

Following the guides, Xu Bai and Fang Zaiji arrived at Mount Taixuan.

“This entrance is well-hidden—it’s actually inside the mountain itself? Completely natural! If the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance hadn’t opened this passage, getting in would have been quite the challenge,” Fang Zaiji remarked in astonishment.

They followed the winding tunnel inside the mountain, reaching the end of the passage.

The spatial gateway had already been stabilized and permanently opened.

At the entrance, several Taiyan Sect cultivators stood in formation, seemingly welcoming visitors. However, their gazes kept sweeping over the arriving cultivators, as if searching for something.

“They wouldn’t still be looking for those little brats from back then, would they?” Fang Zaiji secretly wondered.

Noticing the hesitation on Fang Zaiji’s face, Xu Bai immediately understood his concerns.

Clearing his throat lightly, Xu Bai took the lead and stepped forward.

Seeing this, Fang Zaiji had no choice but to follow closely.

As soon as the Taiyan Sect cultivators saw Xu Bai approaching, their eyes lit up, and they surrounded him.

“Fellow Daoist, please wait a moment!”

“Would you be interested in joining the Taiyan Sect?”

“If you enter our sect, you’ll never have to worry about cultivation techniques again, and you’ll even receive a mid-grade Dao Deviation Stone for free!”

They spoke enthusiastically, voices overlapping.

Their excitement quickly drew the attention of other cultivators.

“Hey! Taiyan Sect cultivators, what about me?!”

“I want to join the Taiyan Sect too!”

“Why are you only focused on him? Just because he looks good?”

The other cultivators voiced their dissatisfaction, but the Taiyan Sect members paid them no heed.

Their attention was fixed solely on Xu Bai.

Xu Bai neither agreed nor outright refused.

Instead, he probed for information about the current relationship between the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Taiyan Sect.

The Taiyan Sect cultivators were quite forthcoming.

“We’re just using the name of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, and every year, we send a Dao Integration elder to the alliance headquarters as a representative. Other than that, nothing has really changed.”

“Within the Taixuan Realm, the Taiyan Sect still has full authority. The alliance doesn’t interfere.”

“Think about it—there are countless hidden realms and small worlds under the jurisdiction of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance. One more or less makes no difference to them.”

“On the contrary, with the alliance’s Tianxuan Treasure Record and Tianxuan Mirror, our daily cultivation has become much more convenient.”

They saw that Xu Bai seemed somewhat interested, so they intensified their persuasion.

They even took the initiative to lead the way, guiding him on a tour of the Taixuan Small World’s scenery.

Vast fertile lands stretched for thousands of miles, where countless mortals resided.

In the distant clouds, a floating city hovered above the sky.

Faintly, one could see numerous cultivators moving about within the city.

“The spiritual energy in this small world is already comparable to the ordinary regions of the Xuanhuang Realm.”

Fang Zaiji said with a hint of envy, “I can’t believe you all managed to find such a great place to take refuge back then…”

The cultivators of the Taiyan Sect were momentarily stunned.

Only then did they realize that when Fang Zaiji mentioned “back then,” he was referring to the time when the Great Calamity of 'Incompatible Cultivation' descended.

“Of course. We excel in the art of divination. Naturally, we were able to find a sliver of hope amidst the crisis of destruction.”

In truth, judging by the ages of these younger disciples, they likely didn’t know much about what had happened back then.

They were simply exaggerating in an attempt to persuade Xu Bai to join their sect.

“Logically speaking, with such favorable recruitment conditions, your Taiyan Sect shouldn’t be lacking in disciples, right? Then why did you all become so eager the moment you saw me…”

Xu Bai deliberately asked, “Could it be… that it’s really because of my good looks?”

The Taiyan Sect cultivators exchanged glances before an elder among them finally spoke up to answer Xu Bai’s question.

“Our Taiyan Sect does not accept just anyone. The most important criterion is that one must match one of the Dao Deviation Stone Mother’s chosen appearances.”

After briefly explaining the Dao Deviation Stone Mother, he continued, “According to the Stone Mother’s divination, those who match the designated appearances will either become the core pillars of our sect’s future, the key figures in its revival, or the unparalleled leader who will lead the Taiyan Sect out of its crisis…”

“In short, it is an opportunity with countless benefits and no drawbacks. The divination never makes mistakes!”

They spoke with absolute certainty, showing their firm belief in the Dao Deviation Stone Mother’s predictions.

“Oh? This so-called Stone Mother sounds quite extraordinary. I wonder if I can see it with my own eyes?” Xu Bai followed along with their words and asked.

“As long as you join the Taiyan Sect, you will have the opportunity to meet the Stone Mother in person. Moreover, you might even receive a chance to undergo a simulation!” The middle-aged cultivator pounded his chest in assurance.

“Simulation?” Xu Bai narrowed his eyes.

Even Fang Zaiji was momentarily captivated.

“We’ve mentioned before that within the Dao Deviation Stone Mother, there exists another world—a near-realistic divination realm. If one gains its approval, they can harness its power to create a personal virtual world.”

“In this virtual world, you will experience everything you are about to face in the future.”

“Although it cannot guarantee absolute accuracy, possessing foresight and preparation allows those who undergo the simulation to avoid countless pitfalls.”

The middle-aged cultivator’s tone was filled with admiration.

“Unfortunately, I failed the trial last time and lost a once-in-a-century opportunity.”

“You mean to say that this Dao Deviation Stone Mother has actually developed sentience?” Fang Zaiji asked in shock.

Chapter 784: Not a Single Person in Taiyan

"Listen to yourself…" A Taiyan Sect cultivator glanced at Fang Zaiji.

"So many years have passed, even a monkey would have gained wisdom by now. Let alone our [Dao Deviation Stone Mother]."

They scoffed at Fang Zaiji's doubts.

However, Fang Zaiji subtly signaled Xu Bai and transmitted a message:

"Sect Master, something feels off. I remember that back then, the Taiyan Sect was extremely wary of the [Dao Deviation Stone Mother] developing self-awareness."

"After all, a cultivator's lifespan is limited, while the Stone Mother’s lifespan is infinite. If it truly gained sentience…"

"Who really holds authority in the Taiyan Sect would be uncertain. We should be cautious." Fang Zaiji warned.

Xu Bai nodded slightly but maintained a calm demeanor.

Feigning curiosity, he asked, "To be honest, since we traveled here from afar, we do have some understanding of your Taiyan Sect."

"Taiyan Divination is said to be able to deduce the future through immense computational power. However, it still requires initial data as a foundation. You’ve been secluded in the Taixuan Realm for thousands of years, cut off from the outside world. The Xuanhuang Realm has undergone immense changes. How can you ensure the accuracy of your predictions?"

The middle-aged cultivator from Taiyan Sect was visibly surprised by Xu Bai’s words. Then, his face lit up with excitement.

"So, you have some knowledge of divination? It seems you are truly fated with our Taiyan Sect!"

"As for your concern…"

With a smug expression, he said, "Who said our Taiyan Sect has been isolated for thousands of years? In reality, at regular intervals, our sect sends out special envoys to gather intelligence on the Xuanhuang Realm, allowing us to constantly refine and correct [the Stone Mother’s] predictions."

"Otherwise, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s conquest of the various worlds only happened recently. If we hadn't foreseen it in advance, how could we have reacted so quickly?"

"Correction, I see…" Xu Bai nodded thoughtfully.

"Alright, enough talk. Are you willing to join our Taiyan Sect or not?"

By now, they were approaching the floating city in the sky. Among the Taiyan Sect disciples, a short, hunched cultivator finally lost patience.

"I must admit, I am a bit tempted." Xu Bai stroked his chin.

Fang Zaiji immediately shot him a glance.

The Taiyan Sect disciples brightened at his words.

"However, I still have some concerns. Actually, before coming here, I already joined another sect. And due to certain special circumstances, I cannot leave. Would that be an issue for you?" Xu Bai asked sincerely.

"Huh?!"

The Taiyan Sect disciples collectively froze, momentarily halting in midair. They turned to stare at Xu Bai.

"Are you messing with us?!" The short cultivator erupted in fury.

Just as he was about to take action, the middle-aged cultivator raised a hand to stop him.

"Senior Brother’s instructions didn’t explicitly forbid this." He pondered for a moment, carefully assessing Xu Bai before gritting his teeth and saying, "I can’t make this decision myself. Come with me to the sect first! Whether you can join or not, Senior Brother will decide."

Xu Bai hadn’t expected the Taiyan Sect to be this eager to recruit disciples—to the point of tolerating such conditions.

However, he had no reason to refuse and simply nodded.

Upon reaching the floating city in the sky, Xu Bai finally noticed that the entire city was encased in a layer of transparent crystal for protection.

As the crystal reflected the middle-aged cultivator’s face, a familiar blue glow flickered across its surface.

In the next instant, the middle-aged cultivator transformed into a streak of blue light and vanished into the city. The other disciples followed suit.

"You can enter directly," the middle-aged cultivator said from beyond the crystalline barrier.

Seeing this, Fang Zaiji hurried ahead of Xu Bai and flew into the city.

As he approached the transparent barrier, it was as if it didn’t exist at all—allowing him to pass through without any resistance.

Fang Zaiji looked around but did not notice anything unusual.

Only then did he signal Xu Bai that he could proceed.

The moment Xu Bai leaped through the crystal wall, it felt as if he had passed through a space composed of countless mirrors.

He saw numerous versions of himself, each seemingly experiencing different events.

In an instant, he returned to reality.

"Let's go. I'll take you to see Senior Brother," the middle-aged cultivator glanced at Xu Bai and said with a smile.

As they walked through the Floating City, they could see many cultivators from the Taiyan Sect around them.

Their cultivation levels varied, ranging from Qi Condensation to Soul Transformation.

There were even one or two white-bearded cultivators, causing Fang Zaiji to show a solemn expression. Clearly, they had reached the Dao Integration stage.

These cultivators all seemed quite at ease—some were whispering to each other, others were calculating something with their fingers.

Some were even toying with an object in their hands, resembling a Rubik's cube. Judging by the constantly shifting images on its surface, it seemed similar to the Heavenly Lock Treasure Box that Li Fan had once found in the Yixing Tomb.

As Xu Bai and his group passed by, these cultivators only cast a casual glance before withdrawing their gazes.

No one paid much attention to Xu Bai’s unparalleled beauty.

Even stranger was that when they greeted the ones leading the way, they addressed each other solely as "Senior Brother" or "Junior Brother."

Even those white-haired Dao Integration elders were addressed in the same manner.

Xu Bai couldn't help but furrow his brows slightly.

"Sect Master, have you noticed anything off?" Fang Zaiji quietly transmitted his voice.

"It is a bit strange. The strength of the Taiyan Sect has been preserved too perfectly. Just from what we've seen along the way, there were no fewer than ten Dao Integration cultivators, right? Does the Taiyan Sect really have such profound foundations?"

"Moreover, Dao Integration experts addressing Qi Condensation cultivators as brothers…"

A look of intrigue appeared on Xu Bai’s face.

"No, that’s not it!" Fang Zaiji's voice became slightly urgent.

"When I first came in, I didn’t realize it. But after observing for a while, I finally noticed..."

"This place is eerie!"

Xu Bai’s footsteps paused slightly. "Eerie? Elder Fang, what do you mean?"

"Sect Master, look carefully at these people again. They aren’t actually real!" Fang Zaiji's voice trembled slightly.

"Even this city beneath our feet might be an illusion!"

Hearing Fang Zaiji's reminder, Xu Bai’s eyes sharpened.

As he continued walking forward, he carefully observed once more.

With his unparalleled talent, one of the greatest under heaven, Xu Bai soon detected some abnormalities.

Every cultivator in this Floating City, from Dao Integration down to Qi Condensation—

The faint aura emanating from them was exactly the same!

It was as if they were all the same person!

Only their faces were different.

At that moment, the middle-aged cultivator leading the way seemed to sense Xu Bai’s reaction.

He suddenly turned his head, revealing a sinister smile. "What’s wrong, fellow Daoist? Do you have any doubts?"

Chapter 785: Outside the Variables

However, perhaps it was just Xu Bai's illusion.

That eerie feeling vanished in an instant. In the blink of an eye, when he looked again—

The other person's face had once again returned to its previous warmth.

"It's nothing, it's nothing. I just didn't expect that your Taiyan Sect still has so many Dao Integration cultivators. I was just a little startled." Xu Bai feigned a look of great shock.

"As expected of a sect that was already renowned in ancient times. Its deep foundation is truly unimaginable." Xu Bai clicked his tongue in admiration.

Flattery is something everyone enjoys hearing.

As soon as he said this, not only did the cultivators leading the way ahead react favorably, but even the bystanders along the road cast satisfied glances in his direction.

Yet, this only further confirmed Xu Bai and Fang Zaiji’s suspicion that something was off with the Taiyan Sect.

Because they all showed the same expression of "satisfaction"—at the exact same moment!

"Mr. Fang, do you have any confidence that we can escape from here?" Xu Bai asked Fang Zaiji in a quiet voice while still chatting and laughing with the Taiyan Sect cultivators.

"Rest assured, Sect Master. I'm working on it. This place is extremely stable in terms of spatial structure. If we want to break through and escape, it'll take some effort," Fang Zaiji replied solemnly.

With life and death on the line, the usually carefree Fang Zaiji had finally turned serious.

"No rush. Let's first see what exactly is going on with this Taiyan Sect." Xu Bai reassured him.

As they exchanged thoughts, they had already been led by the Taiyan Sect disciples into the center of the city, arriving at a uniquely designed building.

The entire structure was composed of a translucent blue crystal.

From the outside, one could clearly see that the interior was divided into numerous rectangular spaces.

Inside each space, a cultivator was busily engaged in some task.

"This…" Xu Bai and Fang Zaiji exchanged glances.

"Come on. Senior Brother is waiting for you inside," the middle-aged cultivator leading them said casually.

The experience was similar to when they had entered the Formation Hall of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance. As Xu Bai stepped into the blue crystal building, he felt as if the space beneath his feet was shifting.

At the same time, the transparency of the surrounding walls gradually diminished, making it impossible to see the rest of the structure.

Simultaneously, the decorations and furnishings within the space continuously changed.

Only Xu Bai and his group remained unchanged.

When the crystalline walls had completely transformed into solid walls, a translucent blue figure suddenly appeared before them.

"Greetings, Senior Brother Chen!"

The Taiyan Sect cultivators who had led them there immediately bowed in respect.

The blue radiance gradually solidified, revealing the true form of a rather handsome man.

"Chen Tianhai?!"

As soon as he saw the man’s face clearly, Fang Zaiji involuntarily exclaimed.

Everyone present was momentarily stunned.

Chen Tianhai, however, merely glanced at Fang Zaiji, showing no surprise at his presence.

"You did well on this mission. You may leave now. I have some words to exchange with this old acquaintance."

He dismissed the Taiyan Sect cultivators with a simple command.

Whatever rewards they had received, those cultivators left grinning from ear to ear, quickly departing from the space.

At this moment, Fang Zaiji had also calmed down somewhat, but the shock in his eyes had yet to fade. He kept scrutinizing Chen Tianhai carefully.

"It's really him. There's no mistake… I can't believe he's still alive…"

While murmuring to himself, Fang Zaiji transmitted his voice to explain to Xu Bai, “Chen Tianhai was once the top direct disciple of the Taiyan Sect and the designated successor to the next Sect Master. However, for some unknown reason, he was later stripped of all his status. He then disappeared without a trace and was declared a wanted fugitive by the Taiyan Sect.”

“Back then, some disciples of the Taiyan Sect participated in the hunt for me, making it impossible for me to escape. It was this young man who stepped in to save me, allowing me to take refuge safely within the Medicine King Sect.”

“When I heard about what happened to him, I even felt regretful for a moment. But I never expected…”

“Are you surprised to see me?” At that moment, Chen Tianhai spoke with a smile.

“It has been many years, yet you still look the same. No, for us, it has been several thousand years. But for your Medicine King Sect, it must have felt like only a brief moment.”

With these words, Chen Tianhai directly revealed that the Medicine King Sect had traversed the Immortal Ruins and journeyed through millennia.

“So, you knew that the Medicine King Sect’s attempt to escape with the True Cauldron was nothing more than a path to self-destruction?” Fang Zaiji narrowed his eyes.

“I only found out afterward. Otherwise, with my temperament back then, I would have insisted on going with you.”

Chen Tianhai’s response caused Fang Zaiji to pause slightly.

“Going with us?” Fang Zaiji asked with some confusion.

“That was the Immortal Ruins! Do you not wonder what lies within? Are you truly not curious?” Chen Tianhai countered.

“In the entire Xuanhuang Realm, how many people have had the chance to witness such a phenomenon and return safely? You, Fang, are one of the rare few.”

Fang Zaiji shrugged. “Then you might be disappointed. Not long after entering the cauldron, I fell into the Great Dream of Spring and Autumn Formation and went into deep sleep.”

Chen Tianhai nodded slightly. “That’s something you would do. You’ve always been carefree.”

At that moment, Xu Bai suddenly interjected, “You seem very interested in the Immortal Ruins? Actually, we recorded our experiences back then.”

Hearing this, Chen Tianhai finally looked at Xu Bai with a more serious expression.

“Mysteries beyond fate…”

He muttered to himself in a low voice, and a hint of excitement flickered in his eyes.

“As expected, this variable originates from the Medicine King Sect!”

“Old Chen, what are you mumbling about?” Fang Zaiji was puzzled by Chen Tianhai’s words.

“Fang, who is this? You haven’t introduced me yet.” Chen Tianhai asked.

“Ah! This is…” Fang Zaiji glanced at Xu Bai.

Receiving Xu Bai’s silent approval, he then spoke truthfully, “This is our current Sect Master of the Medicine King Sect—Xu Bai!”

“Hm?” A flash of astonishment crossed Chen Tianhai’s eyes.

Then, he stared intently at Xu Bai, as if he had turned into a statue.

Only after Fang Zaiji called his name several times did he finally regain his senses.

His interest in Xu Bai grew even stronger.

“The Sect Master of the Medicine King Sect actually wants to join our Taiyan Sect? You really don’t have any good intentions, do you?” Chen Tianhai shook his head slightly.

“The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is preparing to sweep through the Xuanhuang Realms. Whether it’s the Medicine King Sect or the Taiyan Sect, in the future, all will be integrated into the alliance. There will be no distinction between sects anymore. If we’re being honest, as long as the benefits are good enough, I wouldn’t mind joining your Taiyan Sect either.” Xu Bai said calmly.

Chen Tianhai was momentarily speechless.

“You’re not wrong. The era of sects is over.” He sighed with some melancholy.

“However, you joining our Taiyan Sect…” Chen Tianhai paused for a moment.

Then, he shook his head again.

“That won’t do. We cannot accommodate someone like you.”

“Besides, the price of joining us…”

“You might not be willing to pay it.”

Chen Tianhai’s tone carried a strange ambiguity.

Chapter 786: The Theory of Information Indestructibility

Xu Bai gazed deeply at the other party.

Chen Tianhai’s words carried profound meaning.

Did he see through Xu Bai’s clone's origins?

However, he didn’t expose it, maintaining an air of mystery. This left Fang Zaiji somewhat puzzled.

“But you were right about one thing earlier. Our Taiyan Sect is indeed very interested in scenes beyond the Immortal Ruins.”

“To be precise, any records from outside the Xuanhuang Realm are of great importance to us.”

“What do you want in exchange?”

Chen Tianhai abruptly shifted the topic, speaking bluntly.

This caught Xu Bai slightly off guard.

“I want Dao Deviation Stones—the higher the quality, the better.”

However, he quickly regained his composure and decisively made his request.

“Dao Deviation Stones…” Chen Tianhai pondered for a moment before shaking his head slightly.

“We no longer have any individual Dao Deviation Stones within the Taiyan Sect. You might have better luck searching within the Xuanhuang Realm.”

“Choose another request.”

Fang Zaiji was displeased upon hearing this.

“Old Chen, are you underestimating our Sect Master just because he’s young? The person who brought us in earlier clearly said that joining your Taiyan Sect would earn us a mid-grade Dao Deviation Stone for free.”

“So why do you claim there are none now?”

Chen Tianhai glanced at Fang Zaiji and smiled.

“Brother Fang, there’s no need to probe any further.”

“Just as you suspected…”

“We now exist solely by relying on the Dao Deviation Stone Mother.”

Even though Fang Zaiji had vaguely speculated about this before, hearing Chen Tianhai confirm it still sent a shiver through him.

“You…”

In that instant, Chen Tianhai’s body once again turned blue and transparent.

“To maximize the power of the Dao Deviation Stone Mother, we gathered every Dao Deviation Stone we could find back then. Since then, we have never separated from it. That is why we truly have none to give you.” He looked at Xu Bai and stated this matter-of-factly.

“Relying on the Dao Deviation Stone Mother to exist…”

Xu Bai wasn’t particularly disappointed.

He simply observed Chen Tianhai’s body in silence.

After the initial shock, Fang Zaiji boldly stepped forward and reached out to touch Chen Tianhai.

As expected, like light projection, there was nothing there.

His hand passed right through.

“A dignified cultivator… and you’re willing to exist like this?” Fang Zaiji was still struggling to accept it.

“There’s actually not much difference. Instead, it comes with many conveniences. Would you like to try?” Chen Tianhai asked indifferently.

Fang Zaiji was so startled that he quickly retracted his hand.

“Your entire Taiyan Sect—what exactly is your current state? From what you said, the whole sect has become an illusory existence. Then what about that Dao Integration cultivator who went to negotiate with the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance? Wasn’t he real?” Fang Zaiji asked in confusion.

“We shift freely between reality and illusion. Most of the time, we exist in an illusory state. If necessary, we can manifest physical bodies, making us no different from actual cultivators.”

Chen Tianhai explained truthfully.

“However, doing so consumes a vast amount of resources and the computational power of the Dao Deviation Stone Mother. Unless necessary, we won’t do it.”

“On normal days, we only maintain the real form for a dozen or so disciples.”

Fang Zaiji clicked his tongue in amazement.

“You can do that?”

“This is the solution you came up with for the Great Catastrophe?” Xu Bai asked curiously.

“Isn’t the cost a bit too heavy? You’re eternally imprisoned within a stone. And if it shatters, you all face collective destruction.”

Xu Bai didn’t hesitate to voice his skepticism.

“The Great Catastrophe?”

A sinister smile once again crept onto Chen Tianhai’s face.

"If you want to safely overcome the calamity of [The Technique Cannot Be Cultivated Together], our Taiyan Sect has dozens of methods."

"But that is not what we seek."

A transparent blue figure stood with hands clasped behind its back, and a sudden surge of heroic spirit emerged in its tone.

"What we, the Taiyan Sect, truly desire is genuine [Transcendence]."

"Even in the face of apocalyptic calamities such as the collapse of the Immortal Ruins or the destruction of the Xuanhuang Realm, we must remain unfazed in our [Transcendence]."

These words sent a shockwave through Xu Bai and Fang Zaiji's minds.

Fang Zaiji couldn't help but retort, "Just with your Dao Deviation Stone Mother? You may not fully understand the terror of the Immortal Ruins..."

Chen Tianhai, however, unceremoniously waved his hand, cutting Fang Zaiji off.

"I know. The suction force of the Immortal Ruins is strong enough to distort time and space."

"But that is its limit."

"It has not yet reached the point of completely annihilating time and space."

Chen Tianhai lightly stomped his right foot on the ground, and a ring of blue light spread outward from beneath him.

Moments later, the walls once again turned transparent.

At the same time, the entire building—along with the entire floating city—suddenly became like Chen Tianhai himself: blue and transparent.

Upon closer inspection, countless flickering scenes could be seen within the blue hue, as if entire worlds were constantly being created and destroyed.

"This floating city… is the Dao Deviation Stone Mother?" Fang Zaiji finally saw the truth of his surroundings and reacted in shock.

Chen Tianhai did not answer.

Instead, he continued speaking, "As long as time and space are not destroyed, information can exist eternally. And as long as that remains true, our Taiyan Sect will always endure."

"Dao Deviation Stone Mother? There is no such thing anymore."

"At that moment, we became one with it."

Fang Zaiji opened his mouth but was at a loss for words, clearly once again shocked by the sheer madness of the Taiyan Sect.

"Time and space remain intact, and information persists forever. Truly an unprecedented and ingenious idea. And you Taiyan Sect actually managed to realize it. Impressive." Xu Bai couldn't help but applaud.

"Although ordinary methods may not be able to destroy you completely, within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, there exists your natural nemesis."

"The Tianxuan Mirror."

"With the power of the Tianxuan Mirror, it may not be able to erase you outright. But trapping you within it for eternity… that should be possible."

Xu Bai mused, "No wonder you surrendered so quickly."

"Survival is nothing to be ashamed of. Besides, even if we were to fight, it wouldn’t be easy for 'It' either. Right now, Its priority is to complete Its ascension. Naturally, It has no reason to target us. And since there is no conflict of interest between us, It simply accepted our surrender." Chen Tianhai admitted without hesitation, speaking indifferently.

"Well said. But I have a question." Xu Bai stared directly at Chen Tianhai.

"How exactly did your Taiyan Sect determine that the [Immortal Ruins] cannot destroy time and space?"

"What if the suction force of the [Immortal Ruins] has been gradually increasing over the years?"

"Just because it cannot now, does not mean it never will."

Xu Bai's voice carried a deep, eerie tone.

Chapter 787: The Rising Power of the Immortal Ruins

Boom!

As soon as these words were spoken, they seemed to create a massive shockwave—not only for Chen Tianhai but also for the members of the Taiyan Sect within the Dao Deviation Stone Mother.

In an instant, all the blue phantom projections within the Floating City froze in place, simultaneously turning their gazes toward Xu Bai.

It was as if the entire city had fallen into absolute silence, with only the deep blue hue continuing to flow imperceptibly.

A moment later—

Chen Tianhai gently stomped his foot again.

The once-transparent walls of the space turned opaque, cutting off the view between the inside and outside.

Chen Tianhai also reverted to his ordinary cultivator appearance.

"Given the current situation, we cannot entirely rule out the possibility you mentioned."

His tone became notably heavier. "In fact, among the few entities that could pose a threat to us—"

"We have conducted multiple derivations regarding the possible internal state of the Immortal Ruins."

"But first, the known intelligence is too scarce. And second…"

"Every attempt to probe into the Immortal Ruins has yielded no results. None have returned. As such, we cannot verify the reliability of our derivations."

Chen Tianhai explained while looking at Xu Bai.

Xu Bai smiled. "But you no longer have any Dao Deviation Stones left, so what are you going to trade with me?"

"Do I look like the kind of person who would generously hand over benefits for free?"

Chen Tianhai seriously examined Xu Bai from head to toe, then nodded. "From your appearance, yes, you do."

"However, we never place our hopes in others."

"I believe there is something you might be interested in."

Chen Tianhai extended his left hand and directly plunged it into his own head.

Fortunately, there was no gruesome scene of brain matter or blood spilling. The moment his hand touched his brain, it transformed into a phantom.

At the same time, his head seemed to split into countless small, flickering blue square fragments.

The sight was rather bizarre.

After a moment of searching, Chen Tianhai finally withdrew his hand.

He opened his palm, revealing something to Xu Bai and Fang Zaiji.

"This is…?" Xu Bai narrowed his eyes slightly.

A miniature version of the Floating City quietly hovered in Chen Tianhai’s hand.

Unlike the Dao Deviation Stone Mother, which exuded a deep blue hue, this miniature city was like crystal-clear glass—radiant, delicate, yet fragile.

"A one-time replica of the Dao Deviation Stone Mother. It was inspired by the Tianxuan Treasure Record from the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance—a relatively independent entity that still retains some of the Stone Mother’s abilities," Chen Tianhai explained without any emotion.

"What is it used for?" Fang Zaiji's eyes lit up, and he reached out to grab the miniature Floating City.

But his hand grasped nothing but air.

Both Chen Tianhai and the Stone Mother replica instantly became illusory and untouchable.

Fang Zaiji smacked his lips in annoyance.

"The Stone Mother replica contains all the information of the original, along with enough energy to power a single simulation."

"Through this simulation, you can experience the future that the Dao Deviation Stone Mother has derived."

As if responding to Chen Tianhai’s words, the Stone Mother replica in his hand suddenly erupted with a dazzling light.

Within the white glow, countless images seemed to flash by at rapid speed.

"A simulation? Is this even reliable?" Fang Zaiji, clearly hearing about this for the first time, appeared skeptical.

Meanwhile, Xu Bai stared intently at the Stone Mother replica, deep in thought.

The brightness of the white light gradually diminished, and the rapidly shifting scenes inside began to slow down.

"Huh? Why do I see myself and the Sect Master in there?" Fang Zaiji noticed something unusual and asked in surprise.

"According to the results of this simulation, you are expected to accept our trade offer."

As Chen Tianhai spoke, he crushed the Stone Mother replica in his hand.

And just moments later—

Everything unfolded exactly as he had predicted.

The scenes of Xu Bai trading with them immediately appeared before everyone’s eyes.

Although, upon closer inspection, some details still differed slightly from reality.

Yet, witnessing one’s own "future" with their own eyes still made people feel uneasy.

"This is really a bit too confident. Sect Master, let’s not be fooled by him." Fang Zaiji seemed rather annoyed as he spoke.

Xu Bai glanced at Fang Zaiji indifferently. "Mr. Fang, are you sure you're using your provocation technique on the right person? Looks to me like you're just greedy for this thing yourself."

Exposed on the spot, Fang Zaiji let out an embarrassed chuckle.

"However..." Xu Bai gazed at the ever-changing scenes before him.

After a brief silence, he suddenly asked, "The Tianxuan Treasure Record enters the body and reveals every secret of a cultivator. It sees through everything without exception.

"This Stone Mother Replica… isn’t the same, is it?"

Chen Tianhai smiled. "That depends on you."

"The closer the data is to reality, the more accurate the simulated results will be. We've been secluded in this Taixuan Cave-Heaven for thousands of years. Though we periodically calibrate the deduced results of the Dao-Deviation Stone Mother, in truth, we can only ensure superficial accuracy."

"The Xuanhuang Realm holds many secrets. Even the Immortal Ancestor wouldn’t dare to claim omniscience."

"The Stone Mother Replica does not have the all-seeing capabilities of the Tianxuan Treasure Record. Instead, it requires the user to supplement their own data. If someone deliberately hides something, they can—however, the deduced results may deviate accordingly," Chen Tianhai said calmly.

"The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance once said the same thing. That the Tianxuan Treasure Record could be treated as an independent entity, not connected to the Tianxuan Mirror. That cultivators could use it with complete peace of mind."

"And yet, what happened later?" Fang Zaiji sneered.

"Our Taiyan Sect is different," Chen Tianhai's expression suddenly turned extremely serious. "Here, lies are absolutely forbidden."

"The world within the Stone Mother is built upon real deductions. Any false information could lead to the collapse of the subsequent simulated world." Chen Tianhai explained this only briefly.

"You may not believe it, but that does not change the truth."

Hearing this, Fang Zaiji's face showed suspicion, while Xu Bai simply nodded. "I believe it."

"Then let's trade."

His decisiveness greatly surprised the two others present.

"Sect Master…" Fang Zaiji hesitated to speak further.

After a brief moment of astonishment, Chen Tianhai quickly extracted another Stone Mother Replica from his head.

Xu Bai, seemingly prepared in advance, took out a Projection Stone from his storage ring.

In an instant, the exchange was completed.

Chen Tianhai immediately played the recording from the Projection Stone—an image of the Medicine King True Cauldron fleeing from the Xuanhuang Realm, only to be drawn toward the Immortal Ruins.

He replayed it three times.

As the projection faded, Chen Tianhai's expression turned grim. "It seems you were right."

"If the data you provided is accurate…"

"Then the pull of the Immortal Ruins has indeed been steadily increasing over the years."

Chapter 788: Li Fan’s Resolve to Die

Chapter 788: Li Fan's Resolve to Die

"The images recorded by the Medicine King True Cauldron—how could they be fake?" Fang Zaiji snorted.

His gaze flickered toward the Dao Deviation Stone Mother replica that Xu Bai was playing with. When Xu Bai finally put it away, Fang Zaiji couldn't help but feel a tinge of regret.

Then, with a bit of curiosity, he asked, "But you said the pull of the [Immortal Ruins] is indeed growing stronger. How did you determine that?"

Chen Tianhai did not conceal anything and explained, "Based on the deviation in the trajectory and timing of the Medicine King True Cauldron after it left the Xuanhuang Realm."

"As I mentioned before, over the years, we have also sent people to explore the Immortal Ruins. Although they found nothing of value inside, they recorded a lot of useful information."

"According to our calculations, the pull of the Immortal Ruins is now more than twice as strong as when the Medicine King True Cauldron first encountered it."

"That's actually quite terrifying. Doesn't that mean that, given more time, the entire Xuanhuang Realm will be swallowed by it?" Fang Zaiji clicked his tongue in wonder, though his face showed no trace of fear.

"Those so-called Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereigns—who knows what they're even doing."

"Anyway, if the sky collapses, the tall ones will hold it up," he muttered under his breath.

"Placing hope in others is not the way of the wise," Chen Tianhai disagreed with his attitude.

After learning from the Dao Deviation Taiyan Sect that the Immortal Ruins' pull was indeed growing stronger, Xu Bai also fell into deep thought.

"When the Immortal Ruins were first discovered, the major forces of the Xuanhuang Realm did not immediately choose to flee. Instead, they tried to resist it by capturing other Cave-Heavens and small worlds…"

"Perhaps it was because the Immortal Ruins back then were not as terrifying as they are now."

"And now, the Xuanhuang Realm has little time left. In my previous life, after the unification of Xuanhuang, the plan to push it away was implemented immediately."

Xu Bai's thoughts flashed by in an instant, and then he asked the final question of this trip:

"The cultivators in the city—are they all transformed from the disciples of the Taiyan Sect over the years? I've also heard that the Dao Deviation Stone Mother itself has gained sentience. Do you know if it has ever created a human body for itself?"

Hearing this question, which seemed unrelated to their previous discussion, Chen Tianhai was slightly surprised.

However, this was not classified information, so he nodded and said, "At first, out of curiosity about [humans], the Dao Deviation Stone Mother did indeed create a human body to analyze and study."

"But now, it rarely appears in human form anymore."

Receiving the answer he expected, Xu Bai nodded slightly.

Then, he bid farewell to Chen Tianhai.

Chen Tianhai hesitated for a while but ultimately allowed Xu Bai and the others to leave.

When Xu Bai and Fang Zaiji disappeared into the depths of the Taixuan Cave Heaven—
