A figure, entirely azure in color with indistinct facial features, suddenly appeared beside Chen Tianhai.

"You just let them go?"

"That Xu Bai—he may be hiding many secrets."

"An anomaly… perhaps something brought back by the Medicine King True Sect from beyond the heavens. Or maybe—he originates from one of those existences that powerful beings have deliberately erased." The azure figure's voice was neither male nor female, its pitch fluctuating unpredictably, making it sound incredibly strange.

Yet, this did not hinder its conversation with Chen Tianhai.

"Deliberately erased? Are you suggesting a supreme expert has been reborn?" Chen Tianhai's eyes flashed with sharp insight.

"According to the results of my deductions, it's highly possible. Xu Bai has never appeared in any of our calculated timelines. His existence may simply be a coincidence… But Fang Zaiji calls him 'Sect Master'…"

"This suggests that we are missing key information, which has led to an error in our deductions," the azure figure explained rapidly.

"There are too many unknown variables at play. Forcibly pulling him into the Taiyan Sect would be too risky."

Chen Tianhai pondered for a moment before nodding slowly.

"What do you think he meant by his last question?"

The surface of the azure figure rippled like water.

A moment later, it finally responded, "Deduction failed."

"However…"

The rest of the words were left unsaid as the azure figure gradually faded and disappeared before Chen Tianhai.

However, Chen Tianhai seemed to have heard the unfinished words, a look of intrigue appearing on his face.

In the Longevity Valley.

Fang Zaiji was recounting his experiences to Liu San and Jiang Yushan.

"Who would have thought that the once-mighty Taiyan Sect would fall into such a miserable state? Compared to them, our Medicine King Sect is actually quite fortunate." Fang Zaiji sighed repeatedly.

Clearly, no matter how much Chen Tianhai boasted, he could not accept the so-called concept of "Indestructible Information."

Liu San also showed a look of lament.

His divine sense swept over the daily cultivation routines of the disciples within the Longevity Valley, observing a scene filled with vitality. His expression fluctuated, lost in thought.

At this moment, however, Xu Bai had already entered a secluded chamber.

Before him hovered a dazzling white replica of the Dao Deviation Stone Mother.

"Simulation..."

Xu Bai let out a cold snort but did not attempt to connect with it using his spiritual sense to engage in the so-called simulation process.

"Nonsense about how Taiyan Sect cannot tolerate lies."

"Nonsense about how the replica and the Stone Mother itself are unrelated."

Xu Bai did not believe any of it.

Grand Preceptor Li was naturally suspicious, and ever since he obtained the supreme treasure [Truth], he had become even less inclined to trust anyone else.

"Once I use it for a simulation, there are only two possibilities—either I immediately use [Truth], or I am at the brink of life and death, forced into desperation."

"In any case, if I must use it, I must be prepared for [Truth] to be exposed."

Xu Bai stared at it for a long time before deciding to store it away for now.

"According to Chen Tianhai’s explanation, though the simulation may last for hundreds of years within, only a moment passes in reality."

"Perhaps it can be used in a critical moment to find a sliver of hope."

"I just hope that I will never have to use it in this lifetime."

Suppressing these thoughts for the time being, Xu Bai solemnly began an important task—writing his last will.

"To fail before even entering battle is to invite defeat."

This world was full of dangers. Even though Li Fan had made numerous preparations, there was still no absolute certainty of victory.

If...

Just if, he could not escape the lingering influence of Mr. Bai’s resurrection—

If, in the end, he perished, his soul extinguished, and was completely replaced by Mr. Bai—

Then, with Li Fan’s nature, how could he possibly accept such a fate?

"If I die, the existence of the [Truth] must be spread throughout the world."

"You want to replace me? Even if I die, I won’t let you have an easy time!"

A hint of darkness flashed across Xu Bai’s face.

One could imagine that if the cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm discovered that such a miraculous treasure as [Truth] existed in this world—

Even if its next wielder was a being as powerful as a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign, they would never have peace again.

This was Li Fan’s final countermeasure.

It would only be activated if his consciousness was completely annihilated.

However, if Li Fan somehow emerged victorious, he would erase all traces of this plan with a single thought.

Chapter 789: Uncertain Fate, Uneasy Heart.

"To activate [Truth], an established anchor point is required. The three current anchor points are all set before Mr. Bai’s resurrection."

"Even if he could forcibly take [Truth] from me, he wouldn’t be able to return to a time when he never existed."

"Any new anchor point he uses must be established after obtaining [Truth]."

"Therefore, all I need to do before I die is spread the existence of [Truth] across the world. That alone would be enough for my revenge."

As Xu Bai prepared his "final testament," he imagined what the world would look like after his death.

It had been a long time since he last experienced this kind of feeling.

Ever since he awakened [Truth] upon the brink of death in his first life, he had rarely thought about the day he would eventually face death again.

Perhaps because that moment had not yet truly arrived, he felt little fear in his heart.

Instead, his emotions were a complicated mix, even carrying a faint hope that he might somehow escape his fate.

It was simply the uncertainty of the future that made his heart uneasy.

In the past, no matter what crisis he faced, he had never wavered.

Even if the situation was utterly hopeless, he could always tell himself: "At worst, I’ll just use [Truth]!"

The study where he once lived as a mortal and the peak of Jieli Mountain had always been his safest refuges.

But now, a sea filled with treacherous reefs and hidden currents stretched beyond his safe harbor, barring his way.

A single misstep could shatter him to pieces.

…

As his thoughts wandered, he completed the first "final testament."

In truth, these "final testaments" were modeled after the phenomena that occurred when cultivators perished—instantaneous, large-scale projections across the sky.

They also carried a trace of his consciousness, which would serve as the trigger for either activation or destruction.

"I need to bury them deep across different locations in the Xuanhuang Realm, even in places I myself don’t know."

"That way, even if the resurrected Mr. Bai tries to stop it, he won’t be able to."

"Hmm, I need to find someone trustworthy to handle this task."

A series of faces flashed through his mind.

Soon, he made a decision.

After crafting 108 copies of the [Memorial Portraits], Xu Bai left Longevity Valley and made a brief return to Tianliang Prefecture.

There, he sought out his former superior—Nangong Shirong.

At first, Nangong Shirong thought Xu Bai had changed his mind and was ready to return to his old position.

However, Xu Bai’s actual request caught him off guard.

"A Soul-Tracing Order? What do you need that for?" Nangong Shirong eyed him skeptically.

The Soul-Tracing Order was a unique item used by the Rebirth Hall, capable of tracking a cultivator’s reincarnation based on objects stained with their lifeforce.

It was not available for public exchange among ordinary cultivators.

Its purpose was primarily to prevent individuals from "maliciously committing suicide" to evade rightful punishment through reincarnation.

"The Rebirth Hall operates independently. Even as the governor of a prefecture, I don’t have much sway over them," Nangong Shirong said, hesitant.

Xu Bai remained silent and simply handed over a storage ring.

Nangong Shirong took it with some suspicion, but the moment he peered inside, his vision almost blurred from the overwhelming radiance of high-grade spirit stones.

A quick scan with his divine sense revealed that if these spirit stones were converted into contribution points, they would amount to no less than three million!

Nangong Shirong couldn’t help but take a sharp breath.

Even with the advent of the White Mist Expansion Era and the Era of Interworld Conquests, which had led to a significant increase in contribution points circulation and rising prices within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, three million contribution points remained an astronomical sum.

Even for a high-ranking official like him, it was still a fortune.

After all, if he wanted to climb even higher in power, he had to manage many relationships, and his personal funds were not exactly abundant.

Without showing any expression, Nangong Shirong swiftly pocketed the storage ring and solemnly said, "Rest assured, leave this matter to me! Within three days, I will definitely give you an answer!"

With that, he hurriedly left.

Three days later, Xu Bai departed quietly with the Soul-Tracing Order.

From beginning to end, Nangong Shirong never asked him about the purpose of the Soul-Tracing Order. After all, some things are better left unquestioned.

Leaving Tianliang Prefecture, he met with Li Fan’s true body halfway.

After handing over the Soul-Tracing Order, they exchanged glances before parting ways again.

Xu Bai returned to Longevity Valley, adopting a strategy of responding to change with constancy.

Meanwhile, Li Fan began his final preparations.

First, he contacted Dongfang Yao.

This man was indeed someone who valued loyalty and righteousness. Li Fan had almost completely forgotten about Huangfu Song.

Yet, all this time, Dongfang Yao had never given up on searching for a way to reincarnate Huangfu Song.

However, getting involved with the Rebirth Mansion was truly as difficult as ascending to the heavens.

Thus, after such a long time, he still had no results.

The two had been apart for a long time, but when they met again, Dongfang Yao still greeted him with enthusiasm.

However, upon receiving the Soul-Tracing Order from Li Fan, he was slightly puzzled.

"What is this?"

When Li Fan explained its specific purpose, Dongfang Yao's body trembled. "This…"

"I know you've always been troubled by Brother Huangfu’s passing. I feel the same way and have never given up all these years."

"This item was not easy to obtain. Keep it safe. When Brother Huangfu reincarnates, you can find him yourself."

Dongfang Yao never expected that it would be Li Fan who fulfilled his long-cherished wish.

He was both shocked and overjoyed.

As he felt deeply moved, he glanced at Li Fan again and suddenly noticed something unusual. "Hmm? I should find him myself?"

"What about you, Brother Li? Why won't you go with me?"

In an instant, he understood. No wonder something felt off—the way Li Fan acted seemed like a final farewell.

His expression changed slightly, and he immediately asked.

Li Fan's face turned bitter as he spoke honestly, "I have provoked a powerful enemy, and my life is in grave danger."

"I may not even have the chance to reincarnate."

Dongfang Yao was shocked upon hearing this.

If this enemy was powerful enough to threaten even a Heavenly Sovereign, one could only imagine how terrifying they must be.

However, he hesitated only for a moment before decisively speaking—not to ask why Li Fan was being hunted, but to offer his help.

Yet, Li Fan shook his head and refused.

"It would just be a pointless death. Dragging you into this—I simply cannot bear it."

Dongfang Yao wanted to say something but hesitated.

"However… if you truly wish to help me, then…"

As he spoke, Li Fan handed over a storage ring containing 108 Memorial Portraits.

"Take these and bury them separately underground, near the major Heavenly Cities of each prefecture."

"Be extremely careful. Do not let anyone discover them."

"If you do this, I might have a sliver of hope for survival."

Li Fan transmitted his instructions telepathically.

Realizing that this concerned his dear friend’s life and death, Dongfang Yao took it extremely seriously.

After a reluctant farewell, he immediately set off toward the nearest Heavenly City.

"Even if Mr. Bai has my memories, by the time he finds Dongfang Yao, extracts the locations of the buried Memorial Portraits from his mind, and destroys them, it will take some time."

"That should be enough for me to execute my plan."

Chapter 790: The Transformation of Xuanhuang

Li Fan sensed the departing figure of Dongfang Yao through his formless killing intent and pondered.

"That man, Dongfang..."

"Not bad."

Retracting his gaze, Li Fan quietly arrived at a desolate stone forest.

This place was located in Zhuhuai Prefecture, an area barren of resources. It had already been explored and confirmed to lack entrances to small worlds or cave heavens, making it a rarely visited place for cultivators.

Perfect for Li Fan.

Like Dongfang Yao, he too needed to set up contingency plans across the Xuanhuang Realm in the coming days.

Descending three thousand zhang underground, he carved out a small space.

Then, he took out a pile of broken puppet parts.

These resembled the guardian puppets once found in the Tianyang Cave Mansion—scattered like shattered porcelain, with a black and red exterior.

Upon closer inspection, the red threads on each puppet fragment seemed to form part of a written character.

This was precisely what Li Fan had conceived—the method of dismantling the Chaos Character Technique!

He laid down a formation and placed the puppet's core at its center.

Then, he randomly scattered the puppet fragments throughout the formation.

"When a specific condition is triggered, the formation will activate the puppet's core, instantly reassembling it."

"The Chaos Character Technique will be complete."

"After that, the puppet will self-destruct, serving as energy for casting a divine ability."

With this thought in mind, Li Fan finished scattering the puppet parts.

Thin strands of silver light within the formation connected the fragments like nodes, linking the entire array together.

With a gentle tap, the formation fell into silence, with not a single trace of energy leaking.

"This site is set up."

"Although it’s a bit crude, that makes it even harder to detect."

Satisfied, Li Fan nodded slightly and, without even placing a concealment formation, quietly left.

After all, he had crafted no fewer than a thousand of these Chaos Character Puppets.

Even if some were discovered, it wouldn’t be a significant loss, nor would it affect his overall plan.

Upon emerging from the underground, Li Fan scanned his surroundings to ensure he wasn’t being followed.

He then buried more Chaos Character Puppets in two other locations across Zhuhuai Prefecture.

Once he was done, he headed towards the neighboring Shouyi Prefecture.

His goal was to plant three or four puppets in every Prefecture controlled by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

"When the chaos erupts, even the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign will be forced to take notice, diverting their gaze."

Li Fan moved swiftly.

By the time he had methodically set up formations in thirty-five different continents...

He suddenly paused.

"Finally... Are you finally about to advance to Soul Transformation?"

Li Fan looked into the distance.

At that moment, Holy Embryo Xu Bai had reached the final step of his journey across the Xuanhuang Realm.

The last world transforming phenomenon piece he absorbed into his personal Cave Heaven was the [Heavenly Spirit Flower of Impending Birth.]

"I once thought that, tainted by baleful energy, the Heavenly Spirit Flower would never bloom again."

"But it seems that the Xuanhuang Realm’s self-recovery ability is truly remarkable."

Li Fan mused.

As Holy Embryo Xu Bai absorbed this worldly phenomenon, a spring-like vitality spread through his Cave Heaven.

Flowers bloomed in succession, creating a breathtaking spectacle.

Even Li Fan, countless miles away, seemed to catch a faint whiff of the fragrance emanating from Xu Bai’s Cave-Heaven.

It was as if the final piece of a grand puzzle had fallen into place.

The entire Cave-Heaven had finally ascended to the level of a Small World.

A peculiar energy circulated within the Cave-Heaven.

From the sky, to all living things, to the very earth itself—

Flowing in an endless cycle.

A deep rumbling came from the depths of the land.

The sound of rain, the whisper of the wind, the chirping of insects and birds—all fused into a grand symphony teeming with life.

Li Fan could almost see the future, where the Cave-Heaven would continue to expand and evolve.

In the Tianling Prefecture, Holy Embryo Xu Bai stood in midair.

Though no other cultivators sensed his presence, the subtle changes in Tianling Prefecture did not go entirely unnoticed.

For example, Sun Qi, who was reporting his progress on the [Reverse Evolution of Heaven and Earth Record] to Sun Liancheng, suddenly stopped speaking.

He lifted his head and gazed at the sky outside the building.

"What's wrong?" Sun Liancheng followed Sun Qi's gaze but found nothing unusual.

Sun Qi furrowed his brows and, after a long pause, shook his head slightly.

"Perhaps it was just my illusion."

"For just a brief moment, I seemed to sense the revival of heaven and earth."

"But it was only for an instant."

"Now that feeling has completely disappeared."

Sun Qi spoke slowly, emphasizing each word. Yet, from the lingering hesitation in his eyes, it was clear that it wasn't as simple as a mere illusion.

"The revival of heaven and earth..." Sun Liancheng narrowed his eyes slightly, lost in thought.

Meanwhile, through the Formless Killing Intent, Li Fan perceived the scene from Sun Qi’s perspective. His heart grew heavy.

Only he knew that Sun Qi’s intuition was correct.

The transformation caused by Tianling Prefecture’s revival had been extracted by the Holy Embryo Xu Bai and infused into his own Cave-heaven.

Without this transformative power, it would take a long time for Tianling Prefecture to regain its former prosperity.

The revival force of Tianling Prefecture was somewhat different from that of Congyun Sea.

Congyun Sea underwent a process from life to death, from destruction to rebirth—a cycle of creative transformation.

In contrast, Tianling Prefecture’s change was a transition from desolation to flourishing, a return to the normal cycle of vitality.

With this additional transformation, the Holy Embryo Xu Bai’s Cave-Heaven had now completely evolved into a Small World.

Since they shared the same body, Li Fan could now clearly observe every detail of this newly born Small World.

His spiritual sense swiftly scanned the vast and thriving land below.

A sudden wave of familiarity surged in his heart.

"This terrain layout..."

"I've seen it somewhere before."

To confirm his suspicion, he quickly pinpointed several distinctive mountain ranges and water systems.

"As expected. It's exactly the same."

Li Fan was deeply shaken.

"This is..."

"The landscape of the Ancient Xuanhuang Realm?!"

Through Ximen Yu’s writings, Li Fan had learned about the differences between the ancient and present-day Xuanhuang Realm.

By removing the White Mist Barrier and reassembling the fragmented zones, the resulting form was none other than the original appearance of the Ancient Xuanhuang Realm!

This was precisely what the Holy Embryo Xu Bai had been doing all this time!

"Ordinary Soul Transformation cultivators rely on the transformation of a single state or a single phenomenon."

"But the Holy Embryo Xu Bai has transformed through..."

Li Fan’s heart trembled.

"The transformation of Xuanhuang’s rebirth!"

"Using his Cave-Heaven to simulate the changes that will soon occur in the Xuanhuang Realm!"

"A process untainted by cultivators or Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereigns, allowing the Xuanhuang Realm to evolve naturally!"

"This..."

The more Li Fan thought about it, the more shocked he became.

"Without the embodiment of the Heavenly Dao and the direct support of the world itself, this would have been impossible!"

"Even with the power of [Truth] and if i kept attempting, it would still be unachievable!"

Li Fan understood this completely.

Although Xu Bai had ascended to the Soul Transformation stage, his aura remained unchanged.

He stood quietly in the void, as ordinary as a mere mortal.

Chapter 791: Distorting the Principles of Heaven and Earth

There was little time to rest.

Just after breaking through to the Soul Transformation realm, Xu Bai made another move.

And this time, it sent Li Fan, who was still immersed in shock, into a state of rapid heartbeat and suffocating pressure.

It was well known—

In the Xuanhuang Realm, ever since the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor established the new cultivation method, achieving the Dao Integration realm required sacrificing the Spirit of Heaven and Earth.

Previously, Li Fan had speculated on the possible paths Xu Bai’s Sacred Embryo might take to step into the Dao Integration realm.

Crimson Flame, Azure Wind, Black Swamp…

Or even the immensely powerful and world-ending force of Ink Death.

However, at this moment, as Li Fan truly perceived what was happening to Xu Bai’s Sacred Embryo, his understanding was completely overturned!

Xu Bai’s Sacred Embryo stood silently in the air, motionless like a stone-carved statue.

Yet, it felt as if something was descending from the heavens—

Falling upon him!

Boom!

A flash of imagery streaked through Li Fan’s mind.

A vast and fertile land, brimming with vitality. A vague figure descended, and in an instant, an ice age spread for a thousand miles. Everywhere the eye could see was plunged into absolute silence and death.

Spirit of Heaven and Earth: Hoarfrost!

A streak of frosty white suddenly appeared in Xu Bai’s previously jet-black hair.

Although it quickly returned to normal, this brief transformation shook Li Fan to his core.

Because in that moment, through his own perception, he realized—

Xu Bai had already seized control of the power of Hoarfrost, the Spirit of Heaven and Earth!

The Spirits of Heaven and Earth are born in accordance with the heavenly laws, each possessing unique powers.

When a cultivator kills and sacrifices one, they can instantly steal and command the power that originally belonged to heaven and earth.

This is why cultivators of the new Dao Integration method are generally far stronger than those of the old method.

But now, something had happened to Xu Bai that seemed to defy the ironclad rules of the new method.

He had not slain the Spirit of Heaven and Earth, yet its power had still transferred to him!

And this was only the first one!

Without a sound, a second wave of power arrived, seemingly crossing millions of miles.

It descended upon Xu Bai once more.

Another vision surged before Li Fan’s eyes.

A barren wasteland stretching for a thousand miles, plagued by monstrous insects, devoid of even a single blade of grass.

Suddenly, drizzling rain began to fall.

The once-desolate land was nourished and gradually became fertile. Meanwhile, the monstrous insects, as if encountering their mortal nemesis, let out despairing screeches.

Their bodies slowly melted, washed away by the rain, dissolving into fertilizer for the rejuvenated earth.

Spirit of Heaven and Earth: Daiyu!

Xu Bai’s hair seemed to grow slightly longer.

Li Fan’s heart stopped for a brief moment.

Because in that instant, Xu Bai had also gained control over Daiyu’s power.

In mere moments, he had already absorbed two Spirits of Heaven and Earth.

Yet Xu Bai was not satisfied.

He closed his eyes.

Facing the sky, he stretched out his arms, opening himself to the heavens.

From east to west, from south to north—

The Spirits of Heaven and Earth came forth, one after another.

“Damn it!”

Li Fan cursed inwardly, instantly snapping out of his daze and quickening his movements.

“At the speed he’s reaching Dao Integration, I won’t have time to set up puppets in every state.”

“I can only target the ones with the most cultivators.”

“Once it’s done, I need to return to Longevity Valley as fast as possible.”

While flying toward the nearest Heavenly City, Li Fan continued observing everything happening to Xu Bai, his mind racing.

"Without slaying the Spirit of Heaven and Earth, one can still obtain its authority."

"This is [Distortion of Heavenly Principles]…"

"Even for an incarnation of the Heavenly Dao, this is simply too outrageous!"

"Ordinary cultivators can inherit the power of the Spirit of Heaven and Earth by slaying it, thanks to the blessings of the new Heavenly Sovereign law."

"But what Holy Embryo Xu Bai is doing…"

"This isn't about offering sacrifices to the Spirit of Heaven and Earth—it’s about becoming the Spirit of Heaven and Earth!"

In an instant, Li Fan understood Holy Embryo Xu Bai’s plan.

Even with the innate talent of a Heavenly Dao incarnation, attempting to reverse the principles of Heaven and Earth was not something that could be achieved overnight.

In fact, from the eavesdropped conversation between Sun Liancheng and Sun Qi, he had already learned that the deeper one was favored by Heaven, the harder it was to reverse its principles, and the stronger the backlash would be.

It was very likely that Holy Embryo Xu Bai would never be able to reach the Longevity Immortal realm.

However, after his resurrection, his opponents would inevitably include those Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereigns.

The difference between Dao Integration and Longevity was like the difference between heaven and earth.

How could he possibly stand against them?

There was only one way—to push the power of Dao Integration to its absolute limit.

Each Spirit of Heaven and Earth equaled the power of a Dao Integration cultivator.

If one Dao Integration cultivator was not enough to match a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign, then what about ten? A hundred?

Various Spirit of Heaven and Earth, each with different powers, fused into Holy Embryo Xu Bai’s body.

With every fusion, his aura ascended to another level.

The vision that Li Fan was sensing also gradually blurred—

From the initial feeling of being there in person, to watching through a thin veil, to seeing through a mist.

Li Fan was losing his absolute control over Holy Embryo Xu Bai.

Which could only mean…

Mr. Bai was awakening!

Li Fan seized this final opportunity to extract as much information as possible from Holy Embryo Xu Bai.

"So that's how it is…"

"He hasn't absorbed the power of the Spirit of Heaven and Earth in a way that erases them from the Xuanhuang Realm."

"Instead, through [Distortion], he has temporarily transferred the power that originally belonged to the Spirits of Heaven and Earth onto himself."

"Countless different types of energies are interweaving—yet there is no rejection at all."

"This method… other than an incarnation of the Heavenly Dao, no one else could withstand it. No matter how high their talent…"

"No, this isn't a matter of talent at all."

Li Fan also keenly noticed something else.

As more and more of the Spirit of Heaven and Earth’s powers were transferred to him, Holy Embryo Xu Bai's physical form was subtly changing.

His height, his silhouette—gradually becoming more like the ethereal projection of the Spirit of Heaven and Earth itself!

The pressure grew stronger and stronger, and Li Fan felt the overwhelming weight of impending doom upon him.

Fortunately, when Holy Embryo Xu Bai had transferred all the power of the free-floating Spirits of Heaven and Earth in the world…

His Dao Integration process began to slow down.

Because up next, it would be time for those Spirits of Heaven and Earth that had never existed in this world before—those that only descended in critical moments—to appear.

The skies over Tianling Prefecture suddenly darkened.

An almost imperceptible shadow attached itself to Holy Embryo Xu Bai’s body.

BOOM!

It was as if his brain had been struck by a hammer.

Li Fan, who had hurriedly finished his preparations and was rushing toward Longevity Valley, nearly stumbled and fell straight out of the sky.

Spirit of Heaven and Earth: Phantom Shadow!

Sensing the information pouring in, beads of sweat slid down Li Fan's forehead.

Not out of fear.

But because sharing the same body with Holy Embryo Xu Bai was already exerting immense pressure on him.

To put it simply—"Who do you think you are, using the same body as me?"

The vision flickered in and out.

Li Fan sensed that somewhere within Tianling Prefecture, yet another immensely powerful Spirit of Heaven and Earth was descending.

"PS: The so-called distortion refers to transferring the numerical attributes of one item to another item."

Chapter 792: The Descent of Mr. Bai

The aura emanating faintly from that embodiment of Heaven and Earth was not unfamiliar to Li Fan.

It was none other than the Spirit of Heaven and Earth—Ink Death!

The pupils of the Holy Embryo, Xu Bai, instantly turned darker and more profound, as if they could pierce through the barriers of ten thousand miles and lock onto Li Fan directly!

Boom!

Li Fan, who had just flown back to Longevity Valley, felt as if he had been struck by a heavy blow, his body wavering unsteadily.

This anomaly immediately caught the attention of Liu San.

Meanwhile, the three cultivators of the Medicine King Sect—Fang Zaiji was engrossed in refining Qi, Jiang Yushan was fully focused on cultivation—but Liu San was the one most concerned about the sect’s development, his spiritual sense covering the entire valley, constantly monitoring the movements of the sect’s disciples.

Thus, he was the first to notice Li Fan’s abnormal state.

“Young Master, are you injured?” Liu San teleported instantly in front of Li Fan, his expression somewhat tense, not appearing to be feigned.

“It’s nothing, just a slight mishap in cultivation. A short rest will do.” Li Fan, having gradually regained his composure, waved his hand dismissively.

Seeing that Li Fan’s aura was stabilizing, Liu San slowly nodded, though his eyes still carried a trace of doubt.

Li Fan did not offer further explanations. After dismissing Liu San, he went alone into the sect’s secluded chamber.

First, he checked on the situation of the Memorial Portraits.

As expected, Dongfang Yao was efficient and swift in his work.

All 108 Memorial Portraits had been completely set up.

“This is merely a contingency plan. Hopefully, I will never have to activate it.”

Li Fan only took a cursory glance before shifting his focus elsewhere.

Instead, he continued to observe the situation of the Holy Embryo Xu Bai in Tianling Prefecture through their increasingly vague shared resonance.

It was as though a thick white mist obscured everything, allowing only occasional glimpses through fleeting gaps.

He could no longer sense the exact movements of the Spirit of Heaven and Earth, but he could clearly tell that more and more of its power was concentrating on Xu Bai.

And as Xu Bai’s form grew closer to that of the Spirit of Heaven and Earth, the oppressive might radiating from him became impossible to conceal.

From all corners of the Xuanhuang Realm, countless gazes turned toward him.

However…

Even with his near-perfect state of Harmony Between Heaven and Man, even a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign would take some time to discern the origins of this never-before-seen Holy Embryo Xu Bai in the Xuanhuang Realm.

At that very moment, in the skies above Tianling Prefecture, dark clouds suddenly rolled in from nowhere.

The sun was obscured, and in an instant, all of Tianling Prefecture was plunged into darkness, as if night had fallen.

Not only was vision engulfed by darkness, but even all forms of divine perception were abruptly severed by this sudden pitch-black phenomenon.

Within Tianling Prefecture, countless cultivators were filled with fear at this inexplicable event, believing that some great calamity was about to descend.

Only a few Dao Integration-stage powerhouses abruptly stood up, gazing at the sky with shock on their faces.

“Daoist Jiao, is everything ready?”

In Longevity Valley, Li Fan used a Communication Talisman to contact Jiao Xiuyuan.

“I must remind you—I will only take action at the most critical moment. Whether it succeeds or fails, whatever happens afterward has nothing to do with me.”

“Oh, and I made sure to modify the puppet clone I'm sending out to resemble you. It has nothing to do with me whatsoever. So, don’t even think about using my name to intimidate others.”

Jiao Xiuyuan’s reply came swiftly, clearly showing his apprehension about this deal. However, the price Li Fan had offered was simply irresistible, compelling him to take the risk.

After confirming with Jiao Xiuyuan, Li Fan said nothing more and disconnected the communication.

His gaze fell upon the eighty-one Chaos Puppets standing rigidly in the secluded chamber.

Each puppet bore an incomplete inscription of the Chaos Character, and together, they formed a rough depiction of the full Chaos symbol.

However, their core components were still gathered at the center.

The final assembly had yet to be completed.

"If I’m not mistaken, once the Holy Embryo Xu Bai achieves Dao Integration and Mr. Bai fully awakens, the first thing he will do is come for me—to seize [Truth]."

"There is no escape, no way to avoid it. I must wait for him here—only by facing death can I seek survival!"

Seated in meditation at the center of a group of chaos character puppets, Li Fan refocused his attention, attempting to sense the situation on Xu Bai’s side.

That heaven-shrouding cloud seemed capable of disrupting even the mutual connection between their true bodies.

The connection was already intermittent.

Most of the time, he could not sense anything.

Only during brief gaps could he vaguely glimpse fragmented images of Tianling Prefecture.

There was no longer any distortion of the Heavenly Dao, as if the complete power of all the world’s essences in the Xuanhuang Realm had been gathered.

The appearance of the Holy Embryo Xu Bai was now vastly different from that of his clone.

He was likely still adjusting to his new body, standing motionless in midair.

The immense aura he had exuded during the process of distorting the Heavenly Dao was slowly dissipating.

Returning to simplicity, he now appeared as ordinary as a mere mortal.

Suddenly, as if sensing something, he slowly raised his head and gazed at the sky.

His sight pierced through the dark clouds, beyond the firmament, reaching beyond the Xuanhuang Realm.

Li Fan’s pupils suddenly contracted.

Through his shared connection, he clearly saw a colossal hand descending from above!

At the final moment of his vision, he seemed to witness the massive hand colliding with the clouds over Tianling Prefecture.

The hand was unstoppable.

The black cloud barrier formed by the will of the Heavenly Dao was as fragile as porcelain, shattering upon impact.

And yet, the Holy Embryo Xu Bai simply stood there, watching as the massive hand descended upon him.

There was no trace of fear on his face.

As the vision faded, Li Fan silently counted in his heart.

Three breaths later—

He felt the ground beneath him violently tremble.

As if experiencing a great earthquake, the shaking persisted for a long while before gradually subsiding.

Li Fan knew that what he had just seen was not an illusion.

This earthquake was the aftermath of the clash between the colossal hand and the black cloud barrier.

Longevity Valley was located in Luoyan Prefecture, nearly half the territory of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance away from Tianling Prefecture.

Yet, even at such a distance, the impact was still so intense.

This collision might have even affected the entire Xuanhuang Realm!

"Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor?"

The name flashed through Li Fan’s mind.

The dark clouds of Tianling were a manifestation of the Xuanhuang Realm’s Heavenly Dao, meant to buy enough time for Mr. Bai’s descent.

And without a doubt, the only one capable of so effortlessly destroying it was—

The Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor!

Although the Immortal Ancestor’s attack had shattered the Heavenly Dao’s cover with ease—

The Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao had already achieved its goal.

Because—

The Holy Embryo Xu Bai, or rather, Mr. Bai, had vanished!

All traces of his aura as an immortal cultivator had disappeared.

He had completely merged into the Xuanhuang world.

Like a drop of water falling into the sea.

Even if the Immortal Ancestor’s divine sense could instantly sweep across the entire Xuanhuang Realm—

It would still take some time to locate Mr. Bai.

Before completely losing the ability to sense the Holy Embryo Xu Bai, Li Fan saw that Mr. Bai was rapidly making his way toward Longevity Valley!

Chapter 793: Chaos in Longevity Valley

It seemed as if he was locking eyes with Mr. Bai’s deep, unfathomable gaze.

Li Fan’s heart stopped abruptly.

"As expected, my guess was correct! The first thing he would do after reviving is to seize [Truth]." Judging from his own perspective, Li Fan's spiritual intuition screamed in alarm.

Thinking about the approaching powerhouse—whose strength was equivalent to countless Dao Integration cultivators stacked together—he felt as though he was facing dark clouds engulfing a city. The immense pressure made it difficult for him to breathe.

He took a deep breath, forcing himself to calm down.

His Dao Deviation Stone crystal within his mind operated at full capacity as he carefully considered whether there were any gaps in his preparations.

But he knew that, in the face of such an overwhelming disparity in strength, all strategies ultimately depended on luck!

"My fate… must not end here!"

Standing at the precipice of life and death, with no [Truth] as a safeguard, Li Fan surprisingly found his nervousness gradually fading. His mind became crystal clear.

All distracting thoughts vanished.

He calmly analyzed possible countermeasures.

"Although I lost my shared sense with the Holy Embryo Xu Bai, this kind of 'loss' might only be one-sided, a mere suppression."

"I can’t rule out the possibility that Mr. Bai can still perceive my situation through his clone Xu Bai, or even through contamination from his main body."

"So the first step is to get rid of the clone Xu Bai, to attempt to sever or weaken the connection between us."

"Otherwise, any plan I come up with will be as transparent as glass before him."

"And next..."

Li Fan furrowed his brows, deducing and considering the possibilities of what was to come.

At the same time, he waited for Mr. Bai’s arrival.

However, it seemed that Mr. Bai was moving much slower than anticipated.

A full incense stick’s time had passed, yet there was still no sign of him.

"Could it be that he went to find Dongfang Yao first, eliminating those [Memorial Portraits] before dealing with me?"

Li Fan's mind stirred. He checked but found that Dongfang Yao and the Memorial Portraits were unharmed.

"Then where did he go?"

A trace of doubt flickered through his heart.

However, he soon deduced a possible answer.

With Mr. Bai's current strength, he could have easily teleported past all spatial restrictions and arrived at Longevity Valley instantly.

But one must not forget—above the firmament, the Immortal Ancestor was watching and observing the Xuanhuang Realm.

Such an overt move would undoubtedly expose himself.

Thus, Mr. Bai had likely chosen a method that would avoid attracting attention: "walking at a steady pace."

Of course, this "steady pace" was only relative to "instant teleportation."

"No matter what, he should be arriving soon." Li Fan sat calmly at the center of his cultivation chamber.

Meanwhile, his clone Xu Bai quietly approached the entrance of Longevity Valley.

Li Fan's guess was correct.

Not long after, the sealed spatial passage suddenly opened.

The disciples of the Medicine King Sect standing guard were stunned.

As they stepped forward to inspect, they found that no one had entered.

Just as confusion clouded their minds—

A figure had already appeared within Longevity Valley.

Before he could even take a firm stand or utter a single word—

Thousands of black killing auras erupted like a swarm of countless flying insects.

In an instant, they transformed into a storm of flying swords, slashing toward Mr. Bai!

Each strike carried enough power to severely wound a Dao Integration cultivator!

"Yushan?!"

Liu San’s shocked voice rang out.

The countless black swords were unleashed by Jiang Yushan.

It was her ultimate technique—[Ephemeral Unbound Sword].

The boundless sword intent, tainted with an overwhelming aura of slaughter, had the power to annihilate both body and soul in a single strike.

Under normal circumstances, Jiang Yushan could at most release a thousand sword intents at once—already her absolute limit.

Yet at this moment, she had clearly exceeded what her body could endure.

Wounds split open all over her body. Even blood trickled down from the corners of her eyes.

Such injuries might not matter to cultivators who practiced the new path. But for those who followed the old path, they were already extremely severe.

But Jiang Yushan cared not.

Her relentless storm of black swords continued to strike—

Unyielding.

Unstoppable.

Until death.

Although he didn't know who this mysterious figure was, upon seeing Jiang Yushan fighting so desperately, how could Liu San possibly stand by and do nothing?

"Fang Zaiji!" he shouted angrily, waking up the old Fang, who was still immersed in refining artifacts.

At the same time, he struck out with both palms toward the green radiance.

One stream of green light surged toward Jiang Yushan, healing her wounds.

Another stream of green light instantly transformed into thousands of silk-like threads, attempting to bind Mr. Bai.

Before the green threads could reach Mr. Bai, a massive black hammer, as large as a mountain, materialized above his head, poised to strike down with immense force.

The three Dao Integration cultivators of the Medicine King Sect launched a coordinated assault—this was Li Fan’s first move.

Jiang Yushan had taken the initiative to attack first because of the effects of the second True Temptation Fruit she had consumed earlier. Following Xu Bai’s instructions, she launched an all-out assault, a battle of life and death.

And as long as Jiang Yushan was engaged in battle, Liu San would never stand by idly. Fang Zaiji, too, was highly likely to join the fight.

With just a single True Temptation Fruit, three Dao Integration cultivators were drawn into battle.

Although the three Dao Integration experts from the Medicine King Sect were somewhat weaker than the present-day Dao Integration cultivators, their combined strength was still a formidable force.

However, Mr. Bai seemed to have anticipated their attack.

He wore a gentle smile.

His figure flickered and vanished from the encirclement of deadly energy, green threads, and the black hammer.

In an instant, he appeared next to Liu San and the others, moving at a speed that no one present could perceive.

Extending his right index finger, he lightly tapped.

The three Dao Integration cultivators immediately froze in place as if all their abilities had been stripped away. They slowly descended from midair to the ground.

Only then did Mr. Bai turn to look at the impending Dao Integration strike that was still suspended in the air.

With a slight clench of his right hand—

All the divine power fluctuations collapsed like a tangled mess of silk threads and were absorbed into his palm.

Without any visible means of neutralization, the small energy sphere, containing terrifying power, was effortlessly drawn into his body.

Liu San and the others remained unharmed.

They landed safely on the ground, staring at Mr. Bai, who bore an uncanny resemblance to Xu Bai, the sect master’s clone. Their minds were blank with shock.

With just a simple gesture, he had subdued them with ease.

Such power far exceeded their comprehension.

"Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign? But why does he look exactly like the sect master’s clone?"

Countless doubts surged through their minds.

Yet before they could ponder further, another drastic change occurred.

A massive metal furnace, appearing out of nowhere, came hurtling toward Mister Bai at high speed.

The surface of the furnace was already covered in fine cracks.

The moment it approached Mr. Bai, it exploded with a deafening roar.

Shards of the furnace scattered in all directions. However, before they could fly too far, they were consumed midair by a mass of distorted, pulsating demonic flesh.

"ROAR!"

A colossal mass of flesh emerged, covered in thousands of grotesque beastly faces, contorting and shifting without end.

Countless eyes, filled with madness and destruction, glared out from the writhing mass.

From the moment it was born, the first thing it saw was Mr. Bai.

The Emperor Beast let out a bizarre, enraged howl and charged at him with brute force.

In an instant, countless tentacles sprouted from its body.

Each one carried an aura of demonic energy, whipping violently forward.

Chapter 794: Seeking Life Amidst Chaos

Mr. Bai's smile gradually faded.

In its place was a flicker of solemnity in his gaze.

Under his piercing stare, the once wildly flailing and ferocious Emperor One Beast suddenly froze in midair.

Then, as if an invisible flame were scorching its body, it began to melt and vanish.

Hollow voids appeared one after another.

The Emperor One Beast let out sharp, crazed shrieks of agony.

But Mr. Bai showed no trace of pity.

His eyes grew even deeper, as the searing, formless invisible blazing fire relentlessly tormented the Emperor One Beast like a brutal form of torture.

In Longevity Valley, those who witnessed this scene trembled in fear.

Although most of them could not discern Mr. Bai’s true strength or cultivation realm, the terrifying pressure exuded by the beast—one born from the Myriad Phenomena Furnace—was something everyone could feel.

Even a Dao Integration cultivator would struggle to contend with such a monstrous creature.

Yet, before Mr. Bai, this horrifying beast had no ability to resist.

It could only endure the torment, gradually fading from existence.

Li Fan, who had personally refined the Emperor One Beast and was well aware of its power, never expected it to pose even the slightest obstacle to Mr. Bai.

In reality, just like before, the beast was merely a distraction.

The true mastermind was not in the Xuanhuang Realm but had remained hidden within the Longevity Valley’s secret domain.

Thus, Senior Brother Zhang's Grand Aspiration Dharma Body arrived slightly late.

Only when the Emperor One Beast had been reduced to a tenth of its original size did a streak of purple aura gracefully descend.

A dazzling purple divine radiance erupted, manifesting into a towering figure that stood as if supporting the heavens.

Ignoring everyone present, it fixed its gaze solely on the trapped Emperor One Beast.

The Purple Heaven Divine Thunder condensed into a long spear and struck down violently.

Mr. Bai looked up at the celestial apparition but did not stop Senior Brother Zhang from attacking.

However, at the very moment the Emperor One Beast was struck by the divine lightning—

Its remaining parts self-detonated.

A thick, ominous, and eerily terrifying blood mist exploded outward, instantly spreading in all directions.

Even the Purple Heaven Divine Thunder, known for purging all demonic and evil forces, was shrouded in its darkness.

And for the first time, Mr. Bai—who had remained composed all along—showed anger.

Because…

During the process of refining the Emperor One Beast, Li Fan had added something extra.

It was none other than the Ten Thousand Souls Blood Essence, collected from a past life and stored ever since in the [Truth] space.

The moment the Immortal-Mortal Miasma erupted, even Mr. Bai had to momentarily retreat.

Meanwhile...

In an underground chamber, Li Fan abruptly opened his eyes.

"It's time!"

With a single thought—

A third of the Chaos Puppets buried across the Xuanhuang Realm detonated simultaneously.

A wave of ominous and terrifying chaotic energy erupted across multiple locations.

Every cultivator in the Xuanhuang Realm felt an overwhelming sense of impending doom.

A deep, inexplicable terror surged within them, their hearts racing uncontrollably.

Yet, none could pinpoint the exact cause.

One after another, vast divine senses swept across the Xuanhuang lands, trying to locate the source of this turmoil.

Even the sky itself darkened, as if some unseen presence was drawing closer, watching.

The effects of the Chaos Character exceeded even Li Fan's expectations.

Although the detonations were scattered, when they all erupted at once, they formed a mysterious, unseen connection—

Transcending spatial boundaries, merging into one.

Without deliberate effort, the chaotic disturbances naturally coalesced into a massive, distorted "Chaos (亂)" character across the lands of the Xuanhuang Realm.

As strange phenomena unfolded everywhere, Li Fan’s goal was finally achieved.

Mr. Bai was the manifestation of the Xuanhuang Realm’s Heavenly Dao itself.

His power came from the realm.

Now that the Xuanhuang Realm was thrown into chaos by the Chaos Character—

For a fleeting instant, Mr. Bai's actions came to a halt.

That instant—

Was the one and only opportunity for survival that Li Fan had been waiting for.

At that precise moment—

Every preparation he had made exploded into action.

First—

His clone, Xu Bai, appeared before Mr. Bai.

The two locked eyes, staring at faces eerily identical to each other.

Yet, neither spoke a word.

The clone Xu Bai did not hesitate at all. In an instant, his cave-heaven collapsed with a loud crash.

Xu Bai—ended his own life!

Although the Holy Blood Embryo Transformation Technique allows a new clone to be born, the death of the original body does not directly affect the newly created clone.

However, since they originate from the same source, there is a mysterious connection between them.

The demise of the original body inevitably leaves some lingering, indelible effects on the clone.

This is a natural limitation of the Holy Blood Embryo Transformation Technique.

Even with Mr. Bai's current level of cultivation, he still could not avoid this consequence.

Thus, his brief moment of rigidity was extended once again.

As soon as the clone Xu Bai vanished, Li Fan immediately sensed that his connection with Mr. Bai, which existed in the unseen realms, had been significantly severed.

He tried to check, and although he could still open the [Truth] Verification Panel, he was still unable to confirm its status.

Without hesitation, Li Fan took his next move.

With a single step, he instantly left the secluded cultivation chamber.

As soon as he departed, the eighty-one Chaos Puppets hidden within the chamber detonated simultaneously.

The power of Chaos instantly enveloped Longevity Valley.

The sky was obscured by a hazy force.

A great disorder descended.

Like bamboo shoots sprouting after the rain, countless withered yellow branches suddenly emerged from the ground throughout Longevity Valley.

As they shimmered with light, these withered branches transformed into humanoid figures.

Looking at their faces—it was shocking!

They all looked exactly like Li Fan!

Each one of them displayed an eerie smile at the gathered crowd, then quickly shrank back into the ground and disappeared.

Everyone present, including Mr. Bai, had their attention drawn to this bizarre scene.

In the next moment, an even greater upheaval erupted.

The remaining two-thirds of the Chaos Puppets exploded simultaneously, unleashing another massive shockwave.

Mr. Bai’s body once again fell into a state of rigidity.

Meanwhile, during this chaotic moment, when no one was paying attention—

A pitch-black small cauldron suddenly shot into the sky.

It was attempting to break through the secret realm and ascend to the celestial heavens of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Even though this movement was concealed, with so many powerful individuals present, someone still noticed the escaping of the Medicine King True Cauldron.

A startled exclamation immediately drew everyone's attention.

But soon, their expressions changed even further.

Beneath the Medicine King True Cauldron, countless human figures were suddenly hurled in all directions like discarded trash.

Liu San's body trembled violently, and his expression changed drastically.

Because he recognized them—

These were the slumbering disciples of the Medicine King Sect inside the Medicine King True Cauldron!

They were all cultivators of the old path, physically frail, and still in deep slumber.

At such high speeds, if they were to crash into the ground like this, most of them—except for a few exceptionally strong individuals—would either die or be crippled!

“Save them!”

Liu San shouted urgently.

The disciples of the Medicine King Sect immediately reacted.

However, the number of fallen cultivators was too great, and they were being flung in all different directions.

Furthermore, Longevity Valley was still being affected by the Chaos Power, making it difficult even for the cultivators themselves to fly—let alone rescue others.

With their own lives at risk, saving others was even more impossible.

Liu San’s eyes turned red with desperation.

Even though he exerted himself to the fullest, he was only able to save a dozen or so people.

Just as despair was setting in—

Mr. Bai, having recovered from his moment of rigidity, extended his hand.

He caught all the falling cultivators, gently placing them onto the ground.

Even though the Chaos Power had not yet dissipated, Mr. Bai still managed to accomplish this feat. However, his right elbow twisted in a strange way, as if it had been broken.

Although it quickly returned to normal, he still frowned slightly.

“Many thanks, Senior, for saving them!”

After briefly checking that none of his fellow sect members were in life-threatening condition, Liu San flew forward and clasped his hands in deep gratitude.

Mr. Bai did not speak.

He simply gazed at the Medicine King True Cauldron, which had already disappeared into the sky.

And at the hundreds of Chaos Puppets that had fled thousands of miles away.

And at the lifeless body of Li Fan, lying on the ground.

Shaking his head slightly, he let out a helpless smile.

Chapter 795: Master and Disciple Establishing the True Foundation

Mr. Bai had already guessed it—Li Fan had abandoned his physical body, transferring his [incarnation] into an object.

The Ten Thousand Spirits withered branch puppets scattered in all directions, and the Medicine King True Cauldron soared into the sky.

Even any object present at the scene might still contain a trace of Li Fan’s true spirit.

The best opportunity to determine his whereabouts had already passed. Now, even Mr. Bai himself could not discern where exactly Li Fan had gone.

Fortunately…

That was never his primary goal.

With a wave of his sleeve, a surge of power emanated from him. The chaotic fluctuations that had spread across Longevity Valley gradually subsided.

Mr. Bai flew into the valley and approached a group of pale but determined children.

Clearing the ruins from the ground, he did not bother with formalities and simply sat down.

A gentle and kind smile appeared on his face.

"Come over here, children. There isn't much time left."

His calm and warm demeanor made them momentarily forget the calamity they had just experienced, allowing them to relax involuntarily.

The children exchanged glances and obediently sat down.

These children—including Gu Xinghan—were the ones whom Fang Zaiji from the Medicine King Sect had abducted and later granted the Building Foundation Establishment Through Oneself Method.

Fang Zaiji possessed a secret technique that allowed him to identify talent with keen perception. Thus, these children had terrifyingly high potential—not inferior to Zhang Haobo or the cultivators of the outer world.

Originally, Li Fan had hoped to use them to comprehend the Building Foundation Establishment Through Oneself Method and unravel the mysteries of Self-Realization. This, in turn, would allow the Endstone Disc to fully shield against the Tianxuan Treasure Record.

However, things did not go as planned. The world had changed too rapidly. Upon realizing the anomaly within himself, Li Fan was terrified of Mr. Bai. His only thought was to flee for his life, unable to wait for one of the children to succeed.

Fortunately, Mr. Bai, who had synchronized with Li Fan’s memories, was also aware of this matter.

"How is your progress with the Building Foundation Establishment Through One Self Method?" he asked, softening his tone as much as possible.

Like students being tested by their teacher, the children grew nervous.

No one dared to speak first.

Encouraged by Mr. Bai’s patience, they eventually began to hesitantly share their insights, speaking over one another.

Mr. Bai listened carefully, nodding slightly from time to time.

Then, he examined each child's physical condition, his expression turning thoughtful.

This scene fell into the eyes of the three Dao Integration cultivators of the Medicine King Sect.

Not long ago, after Mr. Bai dispelled the chaotic fluctuations, their cultivation had fully recovered.

Yet, intimidated by his terrifying power, they dared not act rashly.

They had dismissed all unrelated disciples and obediently waited on the side.

Exchanging uncertain glances, they observed Mr. Bai earnestly conversing with the children, puzzled by his intentions.

"Old Fang, you've seen a lot. Can you explain what's happening?" Liu San glanced at Li Fan’s lifeless body and transmitted a message.

"Isn’t it obvious? The Sect Master provoked someone he should never have offended and was hunted down!"

"He exhausted all his means, yet he couldn’t resist in the slightest. To prevent the Medicine King Sect from being implicated, he nobly chose to die as atonement…"

Fang Zaiji sighed. "I’ve seen this kind of situation far too many times."

Jiang Yushan remained silent. Liu San’s face twitched.

"Perhaps it's better that he died like this," a thought flashed through Liu San’s mind.

Regardless of the three Dao Integration cultivators’ private thoughts,

Mr. Bai seemed to have truly forgotten everything else, patiently discussing the Foundation Establishment Through One-Self Method with the children.

He did not belittle them for their age.

Every question was met with a response.

His attitude was warm and approachable.

As a result, within a short time, the children grew fond of Mr. Bai.

They shifted from passive listeners to eager participants, chattering away about the difficulties and insights they encountered while practicing the method.

Upon hearing their detailed accounts, Mr. Bai carefully provided each child with thoughtful guidance.

Encouraged by his words, they eagerly resumed their cultivation.

Soon, the children all closed their eyes, entering a state of practice once again.

Mr. Bai's eyes never left the children, carefully and cautiously observing every subtle change in them.

At present, the Heavenly Dao of the Xuanhuang Realm follows the principle of "Using the Wonders of Heaven and Earth to Establish the Dao Foundation."

By using oneself method of Foundation Establishment, it may seem to align with the new cultivation system.

But in reality, it has already broken free from its shackles—it can be said to be an act of defying the heavens.

Thus, before long, the children who were attempting cultivation once again opened their eyes one after another.

Their cultivation efforts had once again ended in failure.

However, Mr. Bai was not discouraged, as he had expected this outcome.

Patiently, he questioned each child about the new difficulties they encountered this time.

After checking their physical conditions, he quickly proposed further improved cultivation plans.

Watching this unfold, Liu San and the others were deeply shaken.

"Teaching according to aptitude, treating all beings as equals."

"This..."

As elders of ancient sects who had reached the Dao Integration stage, their knowledge was naturally vast.

And they immediately recognized how astonishing Mr. Bai’s actions truly were.

Being able to cultivate oneself and being able to teach others to cultivate are two entirely different concepts!

Moreover, this mysterious and extraordinarily handsome powerhouse did not appear to be someone incapable of cultivation at all.

The three of them still dared not interrupt.

Fang Zaiji suddenly had an idea—he took out a Recording Stone, intending to secretly capture the scene of Mr. Bai’s teachings.

Of course, this small action did not escape Mr. Bai’s keen eyesight.

He turned his head slightly and cast a glance.

Liu San instantly held his breath, fearing that Fang Zaiji’s actions might anger this mighty expert.

Fortunately, Mr. Bai chose not to pursue the matter.

He simply continued teaching the children.

"He... is both teaching and learning."

Jiang Yushan, who had remained silent, seemed to have realized something.

A flash of shock appeared in her eyes as she transmitted a message.

"The 'Foundation Establishment by Oneself' method..."

This mysterious Foundation Establishment technique had originally been passed on to these children by Li Fan before his fall.

Recalling the details of the method while attentively listening to Mr. Bai’s explanations, Liu San’s eyes gradually began to shine.

And so, Mr. Bai and this group of gifted children...

They became each other’s teachers.

Using a total of thirty-five children, each with different physiques, as test subjects,

They continuously experimented and refined the "Foundation Establishment by Myself" method.

This once extremely difficult, heaven-defying cultivation technique was being updated at an unimaginable pace.

Time slowly passed in this process.

Finally…

The first child successfully established their Foundation.

A mysterious aura descended upon the scene.

Gu Xinghan suddenly stood up, examining his transformed body with excitement, his young face filled with joy.

"Sir..."

Before he could finish speaking, the entire Longevity Valley suddenly trembled violently.

Mr. Bai’s smile faded as he shielded the children behind him.

Looking up at the sky, he spoke calmly:

"So... you've finally come."

Chapter 796: Bai’s Confrontation with the Immortal Ancestor

The Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor—truly worthy of being the supreme existence, reigning over the Xuanhuang Realm with unparalleled might.

Even with Mr. Bai’s strength, he could evade for a time.

But ultimately, he could not hide forever.

Once he had fully perfected the "Foundation Establishment Method Through Oneself" and successfully validated it in practice...

The Immortal Ancestor still managed to track down Mr. Bai based on the slightest traces.

"Buzz..."

It was as if the air had been instantly sucked dry, creating an immense pressure difference that left everyone in the Medicine King Valley clutching their heads in unbearable agony.

Cracks began to spread across the sky within the secret realm.

As if the secret realm itself could not withstand the overwhelming power, it seemed on the verge of shattering.

Longevity Valley trembled violently, like a lone boat struggling in a raging storm, teetering on the brink of collapse.

All of this happened in an instant.

However, the Immortal Ancestor had not personally descended.

It was merely His gaze, cast down from the heavens.

Mr. Bai walked out slowly, ascending into the air with a light step.

The cracks in the sky of the secret realm gradually repaired themselves.

The violently shaking Longevity Valley also calmed down once more.

Those who had barely recovered from the oppressive might of the Immortal Ancestor were all deathly pale, their bodies trembling uncontrollably.

Even the Dao Integration trio was no exception.

Before the Immortal Ancestor, ordinary Dao Integration cultivators were no different from those at the Foundation Establishment or Nascent Soul stages.

They gazed at Mr. Bai, who stood alone in midair, bearing the full brunt of the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor’s oppressive might. Their expressions were complicated.

Mr. Bai’s robes billowed despite the absence of wind, rustling softly.

"Take care of the children."

"Without them, the birth of the 'Foundation Establishment Method Through Oneself' would not have been possible."

He did not look back, simply leaving behind these words.

Then, Mr. Bai tore through the void and departed from Longevity Valley.

"Mister!"

From beginning to end, the people of Longevity Valley never knew Mr. Bai’s true name.

They only referred to him as "Mister"—just like those orphans who once lived in the ruined Xuantian Temple in Ningyuan City.

Now that His target had finally been locked onto, the pressure of the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor gradually withdrew from Longevity Valley.

Not disappearing.

But rather, focusing entirely on Mr. Bai.

As Mr. Bai tore through space and headed toward the Xuanhuang Realm itself...

Perhaps influenced by the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor’s overwhelming power, or perhaps intentionally left by Mr. Bai himself...

The sky over Longevity Valley did not fully return to normal.

Instead, a massive rift remained, through which one could clearly see what was happening in the Xuanhuang Realm at that very moment.

Mr. Bai soared into the heavens, his figure growing larger and larger.

In the blink of an eye, he had become like an enormous celestial giant, standing tall and mighty between heaven and earth.

With His target appearing before Him, the Immortal Ancestor wasted no words.

From the sky above, countless black vortexes suddenly emerged.

Like gaping voids, they unleashed an infinite pull toward Mr. Bai.

Or perhaps, like a multitude of cold, emotionless eyes, they locked onto him unwaveringly.

Due to the presence of the Devouring Essence White Mist Barrier, only Luoyan Prefecture and Lueying Prefecture, where Longevity Valley was located, could witness this world-shaking confrontation.

And every cultivator who gazed upon those swirling black vortexes above...

In that instant, their expressions turned vacant and dazed.

Some, unable to resist the pull, flew directly toward the sky.

Like moths drawn to a flame, they chased after the ever-shifting black holes.

That pull was nameless, unknowable.

Yet, it seemed to surpass even the allure of the world's essence to cultivators.

And this was merely the external manifestation of those black vortexes...

Mr. Bai, who had borne the full force of its power, stood tall, his figure towering between heaven and earth. Yet, in an instant, his silhouette seemed to distort slightly.

Explosions erupted continuously, occurring inexplicably across different parts of his body.

And this was merely the initial stage of the Immortal Ancestor.

What followed next was the true beginning of the spectacle that left the children of the Medicine King Valley gasping in astonishment.

A strange, eerie shade of purple suddenly and silently took over the skies of the Luoyan and Lueying regions.

It veiled the heavens, replacing the blazing sun.

Under the illumination of the purple glow, Mr. Bai’s robes, hair, and even his pupils seemed to be tainted by this eerie hue.

Boom!

A mass of flesh and blood burst from Mr. Bai’s body.

Then, as if a humanoid shadow had dissipated mysteriously, it drifted away and returned to the heavens.

Had Li Fan been present at this moment, he would have immediately recognized this as the phenomenon of the world’s spirit being stripped from Mr. Bai—an effect of the deceptive conversion.

Boom! Boom! Boom!

The deafening sound of explosions echoed through the universe.

And the subsequent steps of the Immortal Ancestor unfolded one after another.

Countless thin black threads, resembling writhing earthworms, densely surrounded Mr. Bai. Like a pack of ravenous hyenas, they swarmed him, madly devouring his essence.

At every moment, an uncountable number of these black threads drained from his body.

They were absorbed and assimilated into the writhing mass, becoming part of the greater entity.

The actions of the Immortal Ancestor had long surpassed the realm of ordinary spells and divine abilities.

There was no dazzling brilliance, no earth-shattering display of might.

There were only bizarre and inexplicable phenomena.

The force that triggered these phenomena was undoubtedly an unfathomable power beyond the comprehension of cultivators.

The cultivators of Luoyan and Lueying, who witnessed this spectacle, were left utterly speechless.

Before the relentless might of the Immortal Ancestor, Mr. Bai seemed to have no means of resistance at all.

He merely stood there in silence, passively enduring the assault.

Just when everyone thought this was the case, Mr. Bai finally moved.

He extended both hands, and his long sleeves billowed, instantly piercing into the White Mist Barrier, which stretched across the world, dividing the Xuanhuang Realm’s regions.

Then, a tremendous force surged from his arms.

Boom! Boom! Boom!

A deep, thunderous rumble roared, as if echoing from every corner of the heavens and earth.

"That is…!"

"Look! The White Mist Barrier is moving!"

Very quickly, the cultivators noticed something amiss, exclaiming in shock.

The White Mist Barrier, which had remained unchanged for tens of thousands of years, standing still since ancient times, was now shifting.

The roaring sound grew increasingly deafening, and the mist’s movement accelerated.

Its flow was being drawn toward a singular source—Mr. Bai’s arms.

A massive suction force radiated from his hands.

The dreaded Devouring Essence White Mist, which cultivators feared and avoided at all costs, was now being frantically absorbed into his sleeves.

From a gentle trickle to a rushing stream, and then into a surging, torrential river!

The white mist, which enveloped the entire Xuanhuang Realm, was being extracted at an astonishing rate, cascading toward Mr. Bai.

And this act seemed to have finally provoked the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor into true anger.

From the eerie, violet-hued sky, a vague, looming face appeared.

Then, two enormous fingers, like celestial pillars supporting the heavens, descended from above!

In an instant, the sky turned dark and ominous.

A bone-chilling wail, like the howling of ghostly winds, resounded across the two regions.

Thunder roared alongside the storm, and cracks of void-like rifts spread like a spiderweb.

Within mere moments, the spatial fractures stretched from the skies down to the earth.

Everything unfortunate enough to be caught in their path was instantly reduced to dust—no remains left behind.

Even those who narrowly escaped death were crushed beneath the immense pressure brought down by the two descending fingers.

Their bodies were frozen in place, unable to move a muscle!

Those unable to withstand the pressure collapsed onto their knees, trembling in terror!

Chapter 797: The Departed Never Die

Deep ravines spread across the land.

The ground in the Luoyan and Lueying prefecture was forcibly pressed down several meters.

With just two fingers, the Immortal Ancestor had unleashed a terrifying force!

Yet, as the massive fingers descended upon him, Mr. Bai remained unfazed.

Instead, a long-awaited look of relief and satisfaction appeared on his face.

His motion of extracting the white mist barrier momentarily paused, causing the originally surging mist to abruptly freeze.

Then…

Swish!

Like countless beams of light, the brilliance illuminated the dim, eerily purple sky.

In an instant, beneath the two fingers of the Immortal Ancestor, an enormous net densely woven appeared!

Formed by devouring mist, compressed in an instant!

Even from high above, it radiated an aura that made cultivators' hearts tremble.

Blinding white light surged toward the descending fingers.

A deafening, world-shaking roar resounded through the heavens and the earth.

The sound was so overwhelming that it turned into utter silence for the cultivators who heard it.

Moments later, cultivators across the two provinces realized blood was trickling from their ears.

Covering their ears in shock, they were filled with terror.

Crack… Crunch…

Though blocked by the Devouring Mist Net, the force of the two fingers did not halt.

After merely a brief pause, they continued pressing downward.

Although the white mist was being rapidly consumed, Mr. Bai continuously extracted more from the barrier to replenish it.

For a time, the battle reached an eerie stalemate.

Cultivators with sharp insight could tell—

The Immortal Ancestor was not using his full strength.

For some reason, he seemed to be holding back.

Across the Xuanhuang Realm, the white mist was being drawn by Mr. Bai to resist the attack.

Gradually, cultivators across the various provinces began noticing a strange phenomenon.

The thick, lingering mist that had shrouded the world for tens of thousands of years… was dissipating.

Their once-limited vision was becoming clearer and more expansive.

With that clarity, they caught glimpses of the strange occurrences happening in Luoyan and Lueying provinces.

Standing tall upon the land, gazing over the entirety of Xuanhuang,

Mr. Bai, realizing the mist was receding, revealed an imperceptible smile.

Then, raising his head toward the looming fingers, his expression grew solemn.

In the next moment—

Clouds churned throughout the Xuanhuang Realm.

The world's spiritual energy, as if suddenly thrown into chaos, erupted uncontrollably.

At an unimaginable speed, ignoring distances spanning dozens—if not hundreds—of provinces,

it converged upon Mr. Bai in an instant.

His already towering figure expanded several times over.

He now occupied nearly half the sky, making him visible from every corner of the Xuanhuang Realm.

"Apologies."

"But for now, Xuanhuang… is my world."

Mr. Bai spoke calmly to the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor above.

Then, he grasped the raging white mist surging from across the world—

And slashed upward.

The boundless white mist instantly solidified.

It transformed into a celestial blade, splitting heaven and earth!

As if countless suns had risen simultaneously, the radiance of the White Mist Celestial Blade illuminated the entire Xuanhuang Realm!

All living beings instinctively shut their eyes.

There was no earth-shaking explosion.

When they reopened their eyes—

The two fingers of the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor had vanished.

Across the sky of Xuanhuang, an amber-like crystalline barrier had unknowingly formed.

Fragile, yet unyielding.

Beyond the golden crystal, colossal shadows loomed and shifted.

This magnificent and surreal sight had never before appeared in the history of the Xuanhuang Realm.

It captured the minds of all cultivators.

"Alright. We can finally have some peace."

"Now, let’s begin the lesson."

Mr. Bai gazed down at the countless beings of the Xuanhuang Realm, smiling as he spoke.

"In the past, the Heavenly Sovereign’s method was:

‘To borrow the wonders of heaven and earth to establish the Dao Foundation.’"

"Now, I too have a method."

"Without relying on external objects, one must see their own heart, illuminate their true nature, and discern their own being."

"It is called: ‘Establishing the Foundation by Oneself.’"

"Although humans are mortal beings, they are born from heaven and earth, embodying the mysteries of yin and yang and the transformations of creation."

...

Mr. Bai spoke every word with unwavering confidence.

The countless beings of the Xuanhuang Realm listened, utterly captivated.

Yet, his actions seemed to have completely provoked the wrath of the Immortal Ancestor.

The yellow crystalline barrier enveloping the entire Xuanhuang Realm suddenly trembled under a violent impact.

It was as if countless bolts of thunder erupted across the sky.

The previously unbreakable amber-like crystal now showed a faint crack.

Mr. Bai, however, remained completely unfazed, continuing his teachings without pause.

His voice seemed to possess a special power, capable of calming the hearts and minds of all who heard it.

Even as the deafening rumbles continued to echo from the heavens, they failed to distract the people, who remained entirely focused on Mr. Bai’s lecture.

After thoroughly imparting the "Establishing Foundation by Oneself Method" to the beings of the Xuanhuang Realm, Mr. Bai did not stop.

He went on to expound upon the path one must take after achieving this foundation.

The so-called:

"Primordial Golden Core"

"Fleshly Nascent Soul"

"Mind-Manifested Soul Transformation"

Mr. Bai also candidly admitted that these concepts were only his hastily deduced theories.

They might not be perfect and could contain numerous flaws.

Moreover, this path currently only reached the Soul Transformation realm.

As for the higher levels of cultivation under this new system—one that did not rely on external forces—practitioners would have to explore them on their own.

Despite Mr. Bai’s selfless teaching, the fact remained that his path was completely at odds with the Immortal Ancestor’s doctrines.

The reactions of cultivators across the world varied.

Some were skeptical, some were overwhelmed with excitement, some were deep in contemplation, and some harbored ambitious thoughts...

The myriad attitudes of the people were all different.

Yet Mr. Bai paid them no mind.

After he had finished imparting all his knowledge, he fell silent.

His figure returned to its original size as he looked up at the amber crystal barrier, which was now on the verge of shattering completely.

Faced with the inevitable retaliation of the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor,

Mr. Bai’s face showed no fear.

He remained calm, waiting in silence.

At that moment...

He suddenly sensed a figure rapidly approaching him.

The figure was somewhat aged, trembling slightly, yet overflowing with emotion.

"Mr. Bai..."

The old man flew toward him, unable to suppress the emotions in his voice.

His appearance bore a striking resemblance to Mr. Bai, except that his face was covered in wrinkles, evidence of countless years of hardship.

On his back, he carried a black coffin, adding an eerie aura to his presence.

If Li Fan or Xiao Qing had been there,

they would have immediately recognized this elder as none other than Xu Ke, from many years ago.

Reuniting with the reborn Mr. Bai after all these years should have filled him with immense joy.

And yet...

At the very moment he saw Mr. Bai,

his expression froze in confusion.

Then, an overwhelming sense of disappointment took over his face.

"You are not Mr. Bai..."

Xu Ke muttered in a daze.

"Mr. Bai" looked at the elderly man before him, who resembled himself almost exactly, and gently patted his shoulder.

"Indeed, I am not him."

"The dead are gone—someone who has truly perished cannot simply be resurrected so easily."

"I am merely a mark, an imprint he left behind in this world."

"In the words of cultivators like you—"

"I am what you would call... the ‘Soul of Heaven and Earth.’"

Chapter 798: The True Might of the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor
