"The soul of heaven and earth, born as a human..."

"The soul of heaven and earth, born as a human..."

The elderly Xu Ke stood there in disbelief, stunned. He murmured the words repeatedly under his breath.

"There exist powerful beings who leave traces of themselves between heaven and earth. If these imprints are deep enough, even after their fall, they can be reconstructed based on these remnants."

"Their actions and demeanor, exactly as they once were."

"But in the end, they are merely a mold."

"Mr. Bai" spoke calmly, recounting the truth of his existence without a hint of frustration over being merely a shadow of another.

"Then... how can he truly be resurrected?" Xu Ke unconsciously touched the black coffin strapped to his back, his voice urgent.

Mr. Bai shook his head with a faint smile. "Perhaps you should ask someone fated to know the answer. After all, even he himself never entertained the thought of resurrection."

Xu Ke wanted to say more but was abruptly cut off by Mr. Bai.

"Enough. It's time for you to leave." He lifted his head, gazing at the sky with an expression more solemn than ever before.

A gentle breeze swept past Xu Ke.

Moments later, he vanished from the world, his whereabouts unknown.

At the same time...

Boom! Boom! Boom!

The transparent crystal encasing the Xuanhuang Realm began shattering, piece by piece.

Above the heavens, a face suddenly appeared—one that every cultivator of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance was intimately familiar with!

It gazed down from beyond the world, overlooking the countless beings of the Xuanhuang Realm.

In that instant, the entire world seemed to freeze over.

All living creatures, even their very thoughts, appeared frozen in place.

At this moment, the Xuanhuang Realm...

Fell into utter silence!

From beyond the sky, several dark-golden chains shot forth, binding Mr. Bai's limbs in midair.

Mr. Bai seemed to have anticipated this and did not struggle much.

Instead, he cast a final glance toward the Xuanhuang Realm below.

The oppressive presence of the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor reverberated across the land, and a deep humming sound arose from the depths of the earth.

Cracks and fissures split open across the surface, spreading in all directions.

The entire world trembled at the revelation of the Immortal Ancestor’s visage!

Under such overwhelming might, no being below the realm of Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign had any ability to resist.

In fact, the vast majority of them couldn’t even comprehend what was happening.

Their consciousness remained frozen at the moment when the Immortal Ancestor appeared!

The tremors intensified—mountains collapsed, rivers surged chaotically.

Plains turned into mountain ranges, and highlands became level ground.

Transformations that should have taken thousands of years for the Xuanhuang Realm to undergo now occurred in mere moments.

But these changes were not the result of natural evolution.

They were the consequences of brutal external destruction!

As even worse calamities loomed...

Five distinct forces suddenly surged from within the Xuanhuang Realm!

In the blink of an eye, they swept across the land, desperately attempting to stabilize the collapsing world.

The Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor, high in the sky, seemed to take notice.

His once-clear visage became slightly blurred.

The chaos showed faint signs of subsiding.

However, the chains binding Mr. Bai showed no sign of loosening.

Instead, they tightened even further!

Seeing this, Mr. Bai let out a soft sigh.

"The Xuanhuang Realm of today..."

"Is no longer mine."

"..."

"Then I shall return it to you."

With those final words, Mr. Bai took one last look at the Xuanhuang Realm.

A complex emotion flickered in his eyes.

Then, endless white light burst forth from his body.

At that moment, his entire being transformed into light!

Countless specks of white radiance rose toward the sky, like a reversed Milky Way flowing back to the heavens.

Like countless stars, returning home.

In the end, it was like a fleeting dream.

The light dimmed and vanished into the vast expanse of the world.

With the target gone, the dark-golden chains retracted back into the void beyond the heavens.

Yet, the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor did not stop his movements.

His vast face still loomed over most of the sky.

The rest of his features gradually faded, merging into the heavens.

Only his eyes remained, growing ever deeper.

Like two black suns, suspended in the celestial dome!

Because of this, the entire Xuanhuang Realm...

Was swiftly plunged into darkness.

The countless sentient beings, whose thoughts had fallen into stagnation, were unknowingly guided by an unseen force. Without realizing it, they all lifted their heads and gazed toward the sky.

They met the eyes of the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor.

The vast majority of living beings in the world experienced this moment.

Only a few exceptional existences instinctively lowered their heads, avoiding the gaze of the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor.

Under the Immortal Ancestor’s watchful eyes, the Xuanhuang Realm fell into a brief moment of absolute stillness.

And then...

Just as silently as it had appeared, the face of the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor faded from the heavens, disappearing without a trace.

Moments later, the sentient beings of the Xuanhuang Realm gradually regained awareness.

At first, they were bewildered, standing in a slight daze.

Then, they resumed their cultivation as if nothing had happened.

Everything continued as before.

However, all memories of the towering, heaven-reaching figure—"Mr. Bai", who had transmitted the Dao—were completely erased.

The "Foundation Establishment through Oneself" method, the great upheaval, and every trace of what had occurred vanished from their minds.

It was as if nothing had ever happened.

In the Valley of Longevity.

As the members of the Medicine King Sect gradually regained consciousness, they looked at the somewhat disordered surroundings, their expressions filled with confusion.

They vaguely remembered that something had to do with a peerless being.

But upon trying to recall, they found that they couldn’t remember anything at all.

It was as if they had forgotten something incredibly important, leaving them with an inexplicable sense of unease.

Among them, several children suddenly burst into tears for no apparent reason.

The three Dao Integration cultivators of the Medicine King Sect exchanged glances.

A trace of fear flickered in their eyes.

Liu San was the first to regain composure, taking charge and instructing the disciples to restore order.

Jiang Yushan looked down at her own hands, her eyes filled with doubt.

Fang Zaiji went to comfort the crying children.

Suddenly, as if struck by a realization, he quickly retrieved a Recording Stone from his storage ring.

This stone should have recorded the events just before the anomaly occurred.

However, as he examined the recorded images, his confusion only deepened.

The footage showed dozens of children sitting on the ground, chattering excitedly as if they were talking to someone.

Yet the person they were facing… was completely absent.

There was no sound from their mouths, either.

It was as if they had been conversing with an "unexistent" figure.

This eerie and unsettling scene sent a chill through Fang Zaiji’s heart.

Instinctively, he put away the Memory Recording Stone, gripping it tightly.

"Existence... has been erased."

The thought flashed through his mind.

Recalling the strange phenomena that had just occurred across the entire Medicine King Sect, an overwhelming sense of dread filled his heart.

He made a decision—to bury this secret deep within himself.

Never to mention it again.

For seven days, the Longevity Valley remained in disarray before gradually returning to normal.

During the cleanup of the ruins, a child named Gu Xinghan stumbled upon something buried beneath the rubble and sand—

A crystal-clear jade disc.

Chapter 799: Xinghan Inherits the Legacy

The jade disc appeared extraordinary at first glance.

When touched, it felt as soft and smooth as the skin of a young maiden.

Originally, Gu Xinghan had intended to hand it over.

But for some inexplicable reason, as if guided by unseen forces, he ended up concealing the discovery of the jade disc.

As a child, Gu Xinghan was not one to lie.

For several days in a row, feeling guilty like a thief, he didn’t dare to lift his head and look the elders of the valley in the eye.

Fortunately, he had always been somewhat withdrawn by nature, and with the valley still recovering from the recent turmoil, all the cultivators in Longevity Valley were busy with their own matters.

As a result, no one noticed his unusual behavior.

Gradually, he managed to calm himself down.

A child's curiosity is strong.

Since he was certain that he had unearthed a treasure, Gu Xinghan spent every spare moment secretly studying the jade disc.

However, to his immense disappointment, even after many days, he couldn’t determine what was special about the jade disc or what its purpose was.

It seemed to be nothing more than an ordinary jade artifact—just a particularly beautiful one.

Yet, driven by the fantasies that exist in every person's heart, Gu Xinghan did not discard it.

Instead, he stored the jade disc within his dantian, nurturing it with his spiritual energy and tending to it carefully.

As the reconstruction of Medicine King Valley was completed, Gu Xinghan’s attention was forcibly diverted elsewhere.

Since the former sect master, Li Fan, had tragically perished in the calamity, the future of the Medicine King Sect became a pressing issue.

The sect’s inheritance was never based on bloodline succession.

Li Fan had been able to ascend to the position of sect master only due to the will of Liu Ruchen.

Now that Li Fan had died unexpectedly, there was no clear successor.

If it were purely a matter of strength, then without a doubt, the next sect master should be chosen from among the three Dao Integration cultivators—Liu San, Jiang Yushan, or Fang Zaiji.

However…

Jiang Yushan and Fang Zaiji had little interest in power. The most likely candidate was Liu San.

But…

First, Liu San saw himself as Liu Ruchen’s servant and did not believe he was willing or worthy to assume the position of sect master.

Second, the Medicine King Sect was facing a problem far greater than just the succession of its leadership.

The real crisis came from the thousands of cultivators who had been expelled from the Medicine King True Cauldron.

These were all practitioners of the ancient cultivation methods, and almost all of them had cultivated the true teachings of the Medicine King Sect—the "World-Saving Longevity Scripture."

If they were to awaken simultaneously, the sect would likely descend into chaos and bloodshed.

Although the three Dao Integration cultivators had joined forces to forcibly suppress them into slumber once more, they lacked an artifact as powerful as the Medicine King True Cauldron and could only maintain this state for a limited time.

There simply wasn’t enough time to find suitable cultivation techniques for all these slumbering cultivators.

Taking all these factors into account, Liu San and the others ultimately decided to follow the example of the Taiyan Sect and submit to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Since this decision would determine the fate of the Medicine King Sect, Liu San personally went to investigate the situation.

After returning, the three Dao Integration cultivators reached a consensus.

Liu San would represent the sect in formally seeking allegiance with the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Meanwhile, Fang Zaiji took this time to distribute the "Endstone Plate" to key figures within the sect, especially the prodigies he had managed to retrieve. He carefully explained how to use it and warned them to never reveal this matter to outsiders.

Although the Medicine King Sect was not as renowned as the Ten Great Immortal Sects, its disciples were known for their benevolence, dedicated to healing and saving lives. Even after thousands of years, many of their legends still circulated. In terms of reputation, they were not inferior to the Ten Great Sects.

As the second small-world faction to voluntarily submit to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, and with its overall strength still largely intact, the alliance placed great importance on the Medicine King Sect.

They dispatched a Dao Integration Immortal Sage named Qingyun to oversee the matter.

Guided by Liu San, Qingyun toured Longevity Valley and was visibly pleased.

There were no major obstacles, and the negotiations for the Medicine King Sect’s integration into the alliance proceeded smoothly.

The Medicine King Sect remained relatively independent and free. The only requirement was that all disciples, like the usual cultivators of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, carried the Tianxuan Treasure Record.

However, within the sect, many cultivators had already secretly infiltrated the Immortal Alliance in advance.

Qingyun did not delve too deeply into this matter.

Before long, the news of the Medicine King Sect joining the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance spread across the Xuanhuang Realm, shaking the entire world.

This accelerated the surrender of more and more smaller worlds.

As promised, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance provided various forms of support without delay.

Of course, the first step was the Tianxuan Treasure Record.

Both the Beast Realm and Longevity Valley were brought under the illumination of the Tianxuan Mirror.

With this, the Medicine King Sect finally received the cultivation method assistance they had longed for.

As one cultivator after another awoke from their slumber and transitioned to a new cultivation method, the crisis that had threatened the Medicine King Sect was finally resolved.

With the danger lifted, it was time to look toward the future.

At present, the Medicine King Sect had:

Six Dao Integration Immortal Sage cultivators

Twenty-three Soul Transformation True Monarch cultivators

An uncountable number of Nascent Soul True Lord cultivators

Even in the current cultivation world, such a force was not to be underestimated.

Yet, the sect had no clear leader—a group of dragons without a head.

Though they had surrendered and were now nominally under the command of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, the high degree of autonomy left the sect leader with significant power.

Moreover, the sect leader could directly interact with and report to the Immortal Alliance, which came with numerous advantages.

Even Dao Integration cultivators found it hard to resist such an opportunity.

Thus, after a period of open conflict and hidden struggles…

To prevent the newly revitalized Medicine King Sect from falling apart again, a vote was ultimately held.

As a result, Liu San was chosen as the sect master.

The young Gu Xinghan did not fully understand what had transpired.

He was merely confused, seeing many cultivators dressed in strange attire arriving at the sect.

Then, many of the elders awakened.

Amidst the chaos, things ultimately turned out for the better.

He had a deep impression of Liu San, the old man who had personally taught him and the others.

But what exactly had Liu San taught him back then?

Gu Xinghan found himself lost in thought.

His pondering continued throughout the entire sect inauguration ceremony.

In the end, he still couldn't recall.

Later, all sect disciples were required to enter the Tianxuan Sub-Mirror to generate their personalized Tianxuan Treasure Record.

This finally diverted Gu Xinghan’s attention.

To him, the Tianxuan Treasure Record, a treasure with countless functions, was far more fascinating than the Jade Disc.

He immersed himself in studying its various uses, gradually forgetting about the jade disc altogether.

It wasn't until one day, when he formally resumed his cultivation, that he realized something was off.

When his peers began attempting to "Borrow the Wonders of Heaven and Earth to Establish the Dao Foundation,"

Gu Xinghan suddenly noticed…

He might have already established his foundation.

For a moment, Gu Xinghan was utterly bewildered.

He dared not ask anyone about the unusual state of his body.

Instead, he simply pondered over it on his own.

And at that very moment…

The Jade Disc, which had remained dormant and seemingly ordinary, finally reacted.

Chapter 800: A True Immortal Appears in the Immortal Ruins

A faint radiance was emitted from above.

Many blurred images emerged, accompanied by the light.

As Gu Xinghan was drawn to the scenes within the radiance, the jade disc in his hand seemed almost alive, transmitting waves of desire.

Coming back to his senses, Gu Xinghan felt a bit confused and somewhat surprised.

However, he had heard of treasures possessing sentience before.

After quickly accepting this fact, he began to sense the jade disc’s yearning.

Yet, it was only a vague, instinctive reaction.

The jade disc could not speak; he had to guess its intentions...

Gu Xinghan tried various methods to satisfy the jade disc.

Spirit stones, mineral jades, medicinal herbs...

But the jade disc showed no interest in any of them.

It continued to emit an insistent, unyielding desire toward him.

At the same time, his peers had all successfully reached the Foundation Establishment stage, while he remained clueless about how to proceed.

The combination of these two pressures left Gu Xinghan deeply frustrated.

Then, by a stroke of luck, he happened to witness Elder Fang Zaiji preparing the Endstone Plate for the newly admitted core disciples.

At that moment, the jade disc began to tremble violently, making Gu Xinghan instantly realize its target.

"This..."

Gu Xinghan hesitated.

After all, the Endstone Plate was a highly valuable artifact that Elder Fang had repeatedly emphasized as crucial.

If something went wrong...

Yet, in the end, he could not resist the jade disc's overwhelming desire.

A flash of light later, the jade disc appeared within his Sea of Consciousness.

Under Gu Xinghan's anxious gaze, the jade disc slowly descended onto the Endstone Plate.

Then, from its underside, countless tiny light tendrils stretched out like tentacles, clinging to the Endstone Plate.

At first, Gu Xinghan feared the jade disc might damage the artifact.

But after observing for a while, he realized that was not the case.

Instead, the two artifacts, connected through those sticky, luminous tendrils, seemed to be merging into one.

This put Gu Xinghan at ease.

At the same time, he found the situation rather intriguing.

"Could it be that the jade disc and the Endplate are actually the same thing?" he wondered.

However, being young, Gu Xinghan quickly lost interest in further research and set it aside.

Instead, he focused on the visions emerging from the jade disc.

"Foundation Establishment Through the Oneself? What is this? It seems to align with my own body's condition?"

Gu Xinghan was overjoyed.

Without hesitation, he set aside the jade disc and dedicated himself to studying the Foundation Establishment Through the Oneselfmethod.

By the time he emerged from his enlightenment, the jade disc had fully fused with the Endstone Plate.

However, the fusion process seemed rather forceful, as if the jade disc had forcibly attached itself.

The final result was not particularly aesthetic.

But Gu Xinghan did not care about that.

He knew that this jade disc was likely an extraordinary treasure.

Though young, Gu Xinghan was not naive. He was acutely aware of the dangers of the world.

He understood the principle that a man without sin is still guilty when he possesses a treasure.

Thus, he decided to conceal both the jade disc and the Foundation Establishment Through the Oneself technique.

"Perhaps I can use this new jade disc as a cover and claim that it is a unique treasure that aids my Foundation Establishment..." The young Gu Xinghan pondered.

And so, without anyone knowing, the world's sole practitioner of Foundation Establishment Through the Oneself began his cultivation.

At first, his progress shocked Elder Liu San and the others from the Medicine King Sect.

He grasped teachings instantly and displayed profound understanding.

Among his peers, he was unmatched. Even Foundation Establishment cultivators defeating Golden Core stage practitioners was considered rare, yet he achieved it with ease.

Gu Xinghan quickly became the most outstanding young disciple in the Medicine King Sect.

The entire sect placed great hopes on him.

However...

His peak was as fleeting as a meteor.

Before long, his fellow disciples advanced to the Golden Core and Nascent Soul stages.

Yet Gu Xinghan remained stagnant.

This anomaly baffled Elder Liu San and the others.

They suspected there was something wrong with his body and personally examined him multiple times.

But no one could identify any issue.

When asked directly, Gu Xinghan simply stated that he had tried his best but could no longer progress.

Thirty years passed in the blink of an eye.

The Medicine King Sect ultimately accepted the reality and officially abandoned efforts to cultivate Gu Xinghan further.

However, they did not treat him harshly. He was still allowed to access various resources at will.

They simply stopped paying attention to him.

Meanwhile, as more and more juniors surpassed him in cultivation, Gu Xinghan grew increasingly withdrawn.

He secluded himself, avoiding contact with others.

Gradually, he was forgotten.

And so, 263 years passed.

A now white-haired Gu Xinghan finally reached the end of his life.

"Primordial Golden Core... Primordial Golden Core..."

"What exactly is Primordial?"

He let out a bitter laugh, his expression filled with sorrow.

"To create something from nothing, to forge a new path... It is too difficult. Far too difficult..."

"Having succeeded in Foundation Establishment Through the Oneself, I no longer even had the option to regret and switch to another method..."

In his hand, a warm jade disc appeared.

Compared to two centuries ago, its radiance had entirely faded.

It now resembled an ordinary stone on the roadside, unworthy of attention.

Gu Xinghan gazed at the jade disc that had accompanied him for nearly a lifetime, his emotions complex.

"You have ruined me... Ruined my entire life..."

He murmured softly.

He wanted to throw the jade disc to the ground, yet he hesitated.

In the end, he held onto it tightly.

Amidst deep unwillingness, he breathed his last.

Gu Xinghan’s death caused no ripples in the world.

Because no unusual phenomenon occurred after his death, his corpse was not discovered until three years later.

Over two hundred years have passed, and the landscape of the Longevity Valley has long since changed.

No one remembers the one who was once the great hope of the Medicine King Sect.

No one pays attention.

His funeral was kept simple.

Soon, Gu Xinghan’s body was buried in the Medicine King Sect’s disciple cemetery within the Beast Realm.

Among his few remaining belongings, the jade disc in Gu Xinghan’s hand was overlooked by everyone.

It was buried along with him, deep underground.

From then on, it remained in endless darkness.

Beyond the Xuanhuang Realm.

Inside the Medicine King True Cauldron.

A frail figure, strikingly similar in appearance to Li Fan, let out a muffled groan.

Blood continuously seeped from his nose and mouth, which he wiped away with his hand, as if he might die at any moment from excessive blood loss.

Yet, his expression remained unchanged.

"A moment inside the cauldron, a millennium in Xuanhuang."

He coughed lightly, his eyes filled with deep emotion.

"To personally experience the difference in the flow of time—this feeling is truly indescribable."

Inside the Medicine King True Cauldron lay [Holy Embryo Li Fan].

As part of a deception, he was created by Li Fan using his own essence blood through the Holy Blood Embryo Transformation Technique, forming a temporary clone before the arrival of Mr. Bai.

Due to time constraints and the fact that his talent matched that of his true self, he was merely an ordinary mortal with no cultivation.

Shortly after leaving the Xuanhuang Realm, he sensed that the Medicine King True Cauldron had deviated from its original trajectory.

Moreover, the images transmitted from the Dissociation Disc, which he had transformed into, were accelerating rapidly.

The overwhelming influx of information nearly made his mind collapse.

Fortunately, everything eventually faded into darkness, allowing him to recover slightly.

"Even though I transformed into an object, since this Holy Embryo still exists, I can exert some control over my external manifestation, albeit in a limited capacity."

However, because he was outside the Xuanhuang Realm, he was unable to witness the battle between the Immortal Ancestor and Mr. Bai, as recorded by the Dissociation Disc.

Still, for Li Fan, seeing the Immortal Ancestor in action for the first time was already a significant gain.

Suppressing his thoughts about the Immortal Ancestor, Holy Embryo Li Fan began to feel a rising excitement.

Because he was about to witness the legendary Immortal Ruins.

Creaking sounds echoed from all directions within the Medicine King True Cauldron, a testament to the immense pressure it was enduring.

Holy Embryo Li Fan activated a distant-viewing telescope, which had been prepared in advance inside the cauldron, to observe the Immortal Ruins.

Ahead, there was only darkness.

The Medicine King True Cauldron was accelerating rapidly.

Deafening roars thundered from all sides.

It seemed on the verge of breaking apart at any moment.

Yet, within Holy Embryo Li Fan’s vision, there was still nothing to see.

"Will it end here?"

A hint of disappointment flickered in his heart.

Boom!

The Medicine King True Cauldron began to collapse.

The violent tremors made it nearly impossible for him to stand firm.

Struggling, Holy Embryo Li Fan grabbed the distant-viewing telescope and hid in the cauldron’s core—

A narrow sanctuary made entirely of Eternal Calamity Gold.

Under increasing and almost unimaginable pressure, the Medicine King Cauldron could no longer endure and shattered into countless fragments.

At the same time, it began plummeting toward the Immortal Ruins.

Moments later, Holy Embryo Li Fan realized that even Eternal Calamity Gold would not hold out much longer.

Yet, true to his nature, he refused to give up.

Still gripping the distant-viewing mirror, he looked forward once more.

In that instant, his eyes widened slightly.

In the once pitch-black void, an endless desolate land had appeared.

The barren wilderness was littered with countless ruins.

A colossal corpse sat cross-legged upon the ground.

Its flesh had almost completely decayed, leaving behind only a layer of skin draped over its bones.

Dozens of blood-red chains were deeply embedded in the earth, binding the skeleton to the desolate land.

All around the corpse, deep trenches crisscrossed the ground.

Together, they formed an intricate symbol on the land’s surface.

Though he had never seen this symbol before, the moment he laid eyes on it, Li Fan instinctively understood its meaning.

It was a single word.

The word "Hunger"!

An overwhelming hunger surged through Holy Embryo Li Fan’s mind.

At that very moment…

The ancient corpse on the desolate land suddenly opened its eyes!

Chapter 801: Xuanhuang Welcomes the Apocalypse

The moment his gaze locked onto the Holy Embryo Li Fan, an insatiable hunger erupted in his mind.

Since he was "hungry," he had to eat!

Every piece of flesh and blood in his body seemed to awaken with its own consciousness, yearning to devour everything around it endlessly, attempting to alleviate the overwhelming sense of "hunger."

Even Li Fan himself was completely consumed by this thought.

As a result…

In an instant, the Holy Embryo Li Fan shrank like a punctured balloon.

With a muffled bang, he collapsed inward, rapidly diminishing into a tiny particle, before ultimately vanishing from the world entirely.

Yet, in his final moment, his thoughts remained frozen at the instant he saw the remains of the Immortal Ruins open their eyes.

To put it in simpler terms—

The mortal-bodied Holy Embryo Li Fan was utterly incapable of withstanding even a single gaze from the remains of the Immortal Ruins. In the blink of an eye, he was reduced to nothingness.

Of course, even if one were to remove the limitations of his "mortal body," the outcome wouldn’t change.

Even if his true body at the Nascent Soul stage had been present, the result would have been no better.

For cultivators—at least those below the Longevity Immortal realm—the gap between them and an actual Immortal was as vast as heaven and earth. The disparity was so immense that words could not begin to describe it.

With the disappearance of Holy Embryo Li Fan, logically speaking, what should have followed in this timeline was the natural exhaustion of his existence.

Once the time of his manifestation ran out, his incarnation, trapped within Gu Xinghan’s coffin, would automatically revert to its true form.

However, the occurrences within the Immortal Ruin—

Be it the humanoid remains bound by dark-red chains, or the ominous 【Hunger】 inscribed upon the desolate wasteland—

They were entities beyond "common logic" and comprehension.

The Holy Embryo Blood Transformation Technique, modified and perfected by the Empire, had created Holy Embryos as independent entities, completely separate from their true bodies.

Yet, they still shared a [Same-Body Connection] as clones.

Even though the true body had perished, this faint connection transcended time and space, persisting within his manifested incarnation.

Ordinary cultivators could not perceive this link.

Even the supreme experts of the Xuanhuang Realm—those in the Longevity Immortal stage—might not be able to detect it.

However…

The Immortal Ruins housed beings known as "Immortals."

Thus, through this lingering connection, the figure within the Immortal Ruins—

Its gaze transcended the barriers of time and space, reaching across into the Xuanhuang Realm itself!

A terrifying suction force descended upon the world.

In an instant, the entire Beast Realm collapsed into a singularity of darkness.

Everything within it fell and vanished into the void.

In the next moment, the suction force expanded, reaching the depths of Longevity Valley.

After more than two centuries of development, the Medicine King Sect had reached its peak of prosperity.

Ten Dao Integration cultivators, seventy-six Soul Transformation cultivators, and countless Nascent Soul and Golden Core cultivators populated its ranks.

It had surpassed even the strongest era of ancient times.

Yet at this moment, all these so-called "great cultivators"—

Liu San, Fang Zaiji, Jiang Yushan…

Every last one of them—

They stood no chance. They didn’t even have time to react.

All of them were instantly devoured by the black singularity.

Even after consuming two entire small worlds, the black singularity showed no sign of satiation.

Instead, it expanded even more rapidly.

A pitch-black sphere, capable of swallowing all existence, emerged in the Xuanhuang Realm.

A true apocalypse had arrived.

The moment the black singularity was born, the protective energy surrounding Li Fan’s incarnation plummeted to zero in an instant.

Had it been Li Fan’s true body standing here, he would have likely met the same fate as the countless fallen cultivators.

He might not have had enough time to activate [Truth] in response.

Fortunately, this time, [Truth] activated on its own.

However, unlike before—

When it triggered, the surrounding scenery did not immediately dissolve into illusion.

Instead, a bizarre phenomenon occurred.

Beyond the [Truth] Form barrier, an endless abyss of darkness stretched outward, forming a circular domain.

Outside this domain, the destruction of the Xuanhuang Realm played out in rapid succession, flashing by like a distorted nightmare.

It seemed as if someone let out a heaven-shaking roar, attempting to halt the black sphere’s relentless devouring.

It seemed as if a towering, decayed ancient tree emerged in the heavens, accompanied by a maniacal, crazed laugh:

"You all must die! That’s right, all of you must die!"

It seemed as if two intersecting beams of light swept across the soon-to-be-erased Xuanhuang Realm.

Then, they tore through space and fled toward the endless void beyond the realm.

It seemed as if countless cultivators stood frozen in terror, gazing up at the rising black sun in the sky, awaiting their inevitable demise in despair.

...

The scene accelerated faster and faster.

In the end, everything plunged into complete darkness.

Then…

Brilliant silver light suddenly burst outward from the pitch-black domain of [Truth].

Anchor Point: 1 Year.

Jieli Mountain Peak!

Li Fan, at the mid-stage of the Golden Core realm, abruptly opened his eyes.

His pupils were blood-red, like a wild beast!

Hungry! Hungry! Hungry! Hungry! Hungry!

An endless hunger consumed his mind, making him nearly lose all reason in an instant.

He was starving.

An overwhelming urge surged within him—to devour everything in sight.

With a violent motion, he shattered the wooden bed beneath him and, like a whale gulping down water, swallowed it whole.

But the hunger did not subside in the slightest.

On the contrary, it intensified!

A powerful sense of crisis suddenly emerged in Li Fan’s heart.

If this continued and he let hunger take control, he would inevitably meet his demise.

He was well aware that [Truth] had not yet fully recharged. If he lost this opportunity, there would be no second chance to start over!

Seizing this fleeting moment of rationality, Li Fan glanced at the [Truth] panel.

In the section for cultivation techniques, he saw the words "Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra".

Without hesitation, he activated it.

"Endure the tribulations of countless lifetimes, and let the Immortal Heart remain unchanged!"

The Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra could not reduce the effects of 【Hunger】.

However, it could help Li Fan maintain his sanity.

It kept him from becoming a mindless monster that only knew how to devour.

The mantra operated at full power, resisting the endless waves of hunger.

Though it kept him alive, the price was excruciating torment—like suffering in an inescapable hell.

For eight whole years, Li Fan was forced to stay at Jieli Mountain Peak, struggling against the relentless hunger.

He was so consumed by this battle that he didn’t even notice when, at Year 6 of the Anchor Point, [Truth] had already completed its recharge.

"Eight years have passed… but this hunger shows no signs of weakening."

A hint of determination flashed in Li Fan’s eyes, now resembling those of a crazed beast.

He turned to the long-standing notification from [Truth]:

【This simulation has ended.】

【You may choose one of the following options to retain:

1. An item you possessed during this simulation.

2. Your cultivation realm from this simulation.

3. The memory of a closely connected individual from this simulation (this memory can be inherited by that individual).

4.Abandon all choices and accelerate the recharge process.】

Without hesitation, he chose the first option.

At that moment, an item named "Final Dissociation Disc" appeared in [Truth] storage space.

"Truth!" Li Fan called out again.

"Would you like to virtualize the current scene and return to the set anchor point?" [Truth] prompt sounded at the right moment.

Li Fan decisively selected "Yes."

The next instant, the scene at Jieli Peak began to blur and fade once again.

Chapter 802: Hunger and Chaos Share the Same Origin

Still anchored at one year!

Still at the peak of Jieli Mountain!

A formless ripple burst out from Li Fan, who was at the mid-stage of the Golden Core realm.

Although his eyes remained somewhat bloodshot, the overwhelming hunger had indeed weakened significantly!

Having prepared in advance, Li Fan immediately activated the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra.

Once again, he silently resisted this deadly hunger.

The hunger had only been slightly suppressed, but for Li Fan, it was a great relief.

In his previous life, over eight years, he himself had no idea how he managed to endure.

If not for the enhancement of the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra and his obsession with Longevity,

he feared he would have already given up and devoured everything within this Small World of Great Xuan!

Li Fan did not know what consequences such an act would bring.

But deep down, he vaguely sensed that if he truly did so, his fate would be no better than that of the corpse in the Immortal Ruins.

Having experienced eight years of torment, in this life, Li Fan had developed a far greater tolerance for the slightly weakened hunger.

He was now able to endure it while also thinking about other matters.

“This hunger still doesn’t fade with the passage of time… It seems I can only rely on [Truth] to lessen its effects.” Li Fan thought to himself.

Since this time, he had chosen an inheritance option that accelerated [Truth]'s charging process.

Thus, by the time he anchored at four years, [Truth] had already fully charged.

With immense perseverance, he maintained his clarity of mind while flying toward Yi Yin’s Tomb, where he absorbed the Dao Deviation Stone.

Only then did he activate [Truth].

Returning to Jieli Mountain at the one-year anchor point, Li Fan’s eyes were no longer bloodshot.

Even without using the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra, sheer willpower alone was enough to suppress the hunger.

“The reduction effect has improved significantly.”

“But the hunger still remains.”

“It seems I need to do this again.”

Li Fan narrowed his eyes: “Only after using [Truth] four times in succession can I completely eliminate the negative effects.”

“So, this is the price of directly confronting a True Immortal?”

There was no doubt—the corpse Li Fan had seen in the Immortal Ruins was that of a True Immortal.

In fact, given that the figure had opened its eyes, it was hard to say whether it had truly perished.

After all, everything Li Fan had experienced already demonstrated the terrifying nature of a True Immortal—one could not assess such beings with common sense.

“This is just like the mark I left behind in Yuandao Prefecture after being devoured for ten years.”

“There are indeed things in this world that can affect me even after I activate [Truth].”

“But that doesn’t necessarily mean that the entity hovering above Yuandao Prefecture, or the so-called True Immortal, surpasses [Truth] in rank.”

“It’s simply because I am the vessel of [Truth].”

“Since my memory isn’t erased during the process, [Truth] is not absolute or pure.”

“These negative factors persist because they are carried along with me, surviving even after [Truth] is activated.”

“Just like the Dao Deviation Stone Crystal in my mind. It doesn’t need to be deliberately preserved—once I merge with my Divine Dao of Transformation, it naturally follows me back to the set anchor point.”

“The same applies to my Spiritual Consciousness and Divine Soul.”

“Although their actual growth is reduced after each use of [Truth], this is precisely why I am able to grow stronger with each cycle.”

While relying solely on willpower to suppress his hunger, Li Fan slowly pondered.

Shifting his attention away also proved to be an effective method for alleviating the hunger.

Recalling the events of his past lives, Li Fan contemplated his future course of action.

He had witnessed the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor’s methods.

And he had also seen the power of a True Immortal.

With his perspective widened, Li Fan knew he had to adjust his approach accordingly.

Soon, another four years were anchored.

After absorbing another lower-grade Dao Deviation Stone, the Dao Crystal in Li Fan’s mind became even more brilliant and radiant.

Li Fan once again activated [Truth].

This time, when he returned to the peak of Jieli Mountain, his body and mind remained completely stable, without any anomalies.

Not daring to be careless, Li Fan meticulously examined himself from head to toe.

Then, he circulated the Purple Heaven Righteous Will, cleansing his soul and eliminating any potential hidden dangers.

Thus, an entire year passed.

On the mountaintop, at the edge of the cliff—

Facing the sea of clouds, as the morning sun bloomed with thousands of strands of Purple Clouds light, Li Fan let out a slow breath.

"Several instances of [Truth]... yet in total, it has only been a little over ten years."

"But it truly feels like a lifetime has passed—longer even than the centuries I spent building my Dao Foundation."

"Hunger (饑)…"

A highly intricate character symbol surfaced in Li Fan’s mind—the same one he had seen upon the vast and desolate lands of Immortal Ruins.

Not daring to recklessly experiment, he could only ponder upon it in his mind.

"In the White Mist, at the central ruins of the Maze Zone, I once saw the character [Chaos] engraved on a fractured stone."

"And yet, within the Immortal Ruins, there exists a [Hunger] character."

"This ‘Hunger’ character… it may very well be the ultimate reason why the Immortal Ruins constantly absorb external forces."

"Is this an immortal technique?"

"That would be far too terrifying."

Li Fan’s eyelid twitched slightly.

Steadying his mind, he sensed something was amiss.

"The [Hunger] character within the Immortal Ruins is a complex symbol. Though I do not fully understand its meaning, the moment I saw it, I instinctively grasped its concept."

"Yet, the [Chaos] character in the White Mist Maze was written in the same standard script used throughout the cultivation world."

"The [Hunger] character alone has the power to drive countless cultivation realms into utter despair."

"Meanwhile, the [Chaos] character I encountered—one that even a non-Dao Integration level abomination could survive near…”

A realization struck Li Fan.

"That was not the original [Chaos] character."

"It was a mere imitation, copied from the true immortal technique [Chaos] by someone with a particular purpose."

Upon reaching this conclusion, Li Fan fell silent.

Even the crude, third-hand imitation technique he had used had caused significant upheaval in the Xuanhuang Realm.

Then what of the true Chaos?

A Chaos character that could rival the Hunger character of the Immortal Ruins…

How terrifying would its power be?

Even immortals had been completely suppressed by the Hunger character, their fates unknown.

The severing of the immortal path—

The inexplicable disconnection of countless cultivation realms—

Could all of this be related to Chaos?

In that instant, Li Fan fell into deep contemplation.

This time, he had gained too much.

So much, in fact, that it had already surpassed the limits of his understanding—

A revelation that was not necessarily a blessing.

After all, even the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor did not know how to counter such forces.

Let alone the True Immortals who stood above the Heavenly Sovereigns.

"I must not be overly ambitious."

"I must proceed with caution, step by step—first surviving the life-and-death tribulations of the Xuanhuang Realm."

Only after a long time did Li Fan finally regain his composure.

A trace of loss and longing flickered through his mind.

Chapter 803: Setting Out Again After a Hundred Lives

After witnessing the highest scenery of this world, when returning to the foot of the mountain, one can still correctly recognize one's own position.

This is also a manifestation of an immortal heart.

Temporarily putting aside the records of True Immortals beyond the Xuanhuang Realm, Li Fan calmed his mind and opened the [Truth] panel.

He was now in his 119th lifetime.

Current Time: Anchor Year 2

Current Location: Peak of the Jieli Mountain

Lines of small text cascaded like a waterfall.

Name: Li Fan

Realm: Mid-Stage Golden Core

Physical Age: 21/599

Mental Age: 1368/9999

Virtual Transformation Charging Progress: 16%

Anchor Charging Progress: 0%

Current Anchor Points: 3

Available Anchor Slots: 2

Bound Items:

Thousand Mechanisms Jade Cosmos Golden Sutra

Taiyan Boat

Halted-Step Remnant Stele (Damage)

Ten Thousand People's Essence Blood

Dao Deviation Stone

Final Dissociation Disc

Cultivation Techniques:

Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra

Sitting Immortal Art

Cloudwater Illusion-Dream Technique

Body Transformation into Dao

Mysterious True Spirit Transformation

Myriad Forms Furnace Technique

Creation Furnace Technique

Divine Abilities:

Chaos

Limitless Fullness and Emptiness

Extracting Threads, Cutting Life

Heaven’s Transformation

Reverse Five Elements Creation-Destruction Sword

Cycle of Life and Death

Formless Killing Intent

Binding Insect

...

Since he had chosen not to retain his cultivation realm but instead kept the Final Dissociation Disc, Li Fan remained at the Mid-Stage Golden Core Realm. His lifespan cap had also reverted from 999 years to 599 years.

However, to Li Fan, the concept of lifespan was almost meaningless. After so many lifetimes, aside from his mortal years, he had rarely ever died of old age. Now that he had also unlocked the Incarnation function, it mattered even less.

Interestingly, his mental age limit had not decreased alongside his cultivation. This seemed to be connected to his soul and consciousness.

"Only six more years, and [Truth] will be fully charged. That means I can enter the Xuanhuang Realm two years ahead of schedule."

Li Fan's gaze shifted downward, landing on the six [Truth]-bound items, and he frowned slightly.

"Thousand Mechanisms Jade Cosmos Golden Sutra, Taiyan Boat, Halted-Step Remnant Stele..."

"These were all crucial artifacts during my mortal reincarnations, used to escape from the Great Xuan World. Back then, they were extremely valuable to me."

"But now, they are of little use. More importantly, seeing them clutter up my [Truth] panel is simply irritating."

"If only there were a way to remove them."

Just as this thought crossed his mind, a faint [Truth] notification suddenly appeared.

"You can consume an anchor point to replace a bound item?"

Li Fan was slightly taken aback and narrowed his eyes.

"This is indeed a good thing. But there was no such function before."

"The charging time for Virtual Transformation has also decreased..."

"Did [Truth]’s abilities improve?"

After a moment of contemplation, he carefully examined [Truth] other functions.

Unfortunately, he did not find any additional changes.

"I previously suspected that [Truth] charging speed was related to my soul and willpower. But now, it seems there may be other unknown factors involved."

"Perhaps seeing a True Immortal broadened my perspective?"

"Did my so-called exploration level increase?"

Thinking about the existence of True Immortals, Li Fan once again felt his thoughts waver.

It took him a while to regain his composure.

His attention returned to the [Truth] panel.

His remaining cultivation techniques and divine abilities required no further thought.

While they seemed dazzling on the surface, and their actual power was indeed extraordinary—making him unmatched within his realm and even capable of killing above his level—

After witnessing Mr. Bai, the Immortal Ancestor, and even True Immortals take action,

Li Fan now felt that all these techniques and abilities seemed rather flashy but lacking in essence.

"This world still revolves around cultivation realm above all else."

"If someone is one realm higher, they possess absolute dominance. There is no reasoning with it."

"A mere Dao Integration cultivator is not even a match for a single move from a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign."

"And a True Immortal from the Immortal Ruins can obliterate the entire Xuanhuang Realm with a single glance."

"So-called ‘killing above one’s realm’ is nothing more than big fish eating small fish within the same general level."

Li Fan remained silent for a long time, with not a trace of arrogance left in his heart.

However, he quickly regained his composure.

"I have [Truth] in my hands. Even true immortals may not be beyond my reach."

"Yet, a journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step."

"I must proceed systematically."

"The Sitting Immortal Art has already advanced to the Dao Integration realm. For a long time, I won't have to worry about my primary cultivation method."

"The Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Art is a divine ability that enhances the soul. The soul is my only weakness. Whether facing Ruomu or Mr. Bai, I have been almost defenseless…"

"I hope this divine ability derived from the Tianxuan Mirror will have some effect."

Having gained a clearer understanding of the power of those ancient monsters, Li Fan did not believe that a single divine ability would be enough to completely fend them off. If he could merely become aware of any corruption the moment it began, that would already be a blessing.

Even though, judging from everything that happened after his transformation in his previous life, Mr. Bai did indeed seem like an absolutely benevolent person—he had no intention of seizing [Truth] from him. Compared to Mr. Bai’s meticulous actions, Li Fan’s own attempts seemed almost clownish, laughable even.

But…

Who could guarantee that this wasn’t just a deliberate performance by Mr. Bai, after realizing he could no longer locate Li Fan’s incarnation body?

Even if he had to do it all over again, Li Fan would still make the same choices.

For Li Fan, his own safety always came first. He would never easily trust anyone.

That said, risk and reward always go hand in hand.

In his previous life, although he faced endless crises, he also gained significant rewards.

First and foremost, he confirmed that while the Immortal Ancestor was indeed powerful, capable of suppressing the entire Xuanhuang Realm, he was not omniscient.

When Li Fan detonated countless Chaos Puppets across Xuanhuang, using the resulting chaos as cover, his Holy Embryo form managed to control the Medicine King True Cauldron and quietly escape the realm.

If the Immortal Ancestor truly had complete knowledge of everything within Xuanhuang, then even if the Medicine King True Cauldron had been coated with a material that blocked divine sense detection, and even if the chaos of the Chaos Puppets interfered with perception…

The Medicine King True Cauldron still would not have been able to escape his grasp.

Yet, it did.

This was enough to prove that the Immortal Ancestor still existed within the framework of a cultivator—he was merely an unimaginably powerful one.

This meant that his actions could be predicted through experience and understanding.

But a True Immortal…

Could not be measured by common sense. It was best not to provoke such beings.

"The reason why the Immortal Ancestor appears so invincible is that he attained the Dao through the New Path. Any cultivator who follows this path contributes a portion of their power to him."

"Thousands of years of accumulation have elevated him to an unfathomable level."

"To defeat him, one must first break his foundation."

"That is why, when the Foundation Establishment Through the One-Self method emerged, he personally intervened to erase it, no matter the cost."

Chapter 804: Once Again in This World

"The New Method has existed for a thousand years. To overturn it would be an almost insurmountable task."

"Even with Mr. Bai's terrifying talent, which is in harmony with the Dao of Heaven, he was only able to deduce up to the Foundation Establishment stage."

"Beyond Foundation Establishment, everything remains in the realm of theoretical speculation. Even a peerless genius like Gu Xinghan, despite exhausting his entire life's efforts, was unable to take another step forward..."

"I'm not going to waste my energy on that."

Li Fan had a clear understanding of his own talents.

"The New Method must be studied, but it can be done through the hands of others. The Xuanhuang Realm is full of talented individuals—eventually, someone will find a breakthrough."

"If one lifetime is not enough, then two lifetimes! If two lifetimes are not enough, then ten!"

"Perhaps I can also inform Master Yin Yin about this method..."

"Xiao Gu is another candidate worth considering."

Transcending the Xuanhuang Realm was no easy feat. Even with his [Truth] ability, which allowed him to reincarnate endlessly, he could not rely on his own efforts alone.

He needed to harness the collective strength of the countless beings in this realm.

For example, if he had not comprehended the ability of [Incarnation] Transformation from Tianyang before, he might have already perished.

A series of familiar faces flashed through Li Fan's mind.

A plan gradually formed in his heart.

"In three more years, I will be able to return to the Xuanhuang Realm."

"This time cannot be wasted either."

With a slight shift in thought, a seemingly ordinary jade disc suddenly appeared in his hand.

It was none other than the Final Dissociation Disc, the treasure he had chosen to preserve at all costs—even at the expense of his own Nascent Soul cultivation.

This ultimate artifact was formed through the fusion of the nine Dissociation Discs and the Endstone Plate, which could shield against the perception of the Tianxuan Mirror.

Its creation was a matter of fate and coincidence, making it nearly impossible to replicate.

As for regaining his Nascent Soul cultivation...

Now that he knew about the existence of the Five Elements Grand Cave-Heaven, restoring his previous level of cultivation was an effortless task for Li Fan.

"I never expected that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance wasn’t lying."

"The Tianxuan Secondary Body truly has no hidden connection to the Tianxuan Mirror."

A strange look appeared in Li Fan’s eyes.

Back in his 115th lifetime, when facing the overwhelming assault of Mr. Bai, he had made one specific preparation.

He attempted to encode both the Tianxuan Spirit-Locking Formation and the Grand Life-Death Reversal Formation into the Dissociation Disc.

The goal was to attract the attention of the Tianxuan Mirror—and, by extension, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance—to manipulate them into fighting Mr. Bai.

It was a well-conceived plan, but an accident occurred midway.

As a result, after Li Fan perished and transformed into another thing, the Dissociation Disc simply lay dormant beneath the rubble for more than half a month...

And yet, no one from the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance ever came looking for it.

This was almost definitive proof that the so-called Tianxuan Secondary Body was, indeed, an independent entity—completely detached from the Tianxuan Mirror.

"At least, that holds true for the Dissociation Disc."

"Now that the nine Dissociation Discs have merged into one, its computational power is nearly on par with the Tianxuan Mirror—though specialized in formations."

"And with the Endstone Plate, which can block the Tianxuan Mirror’s detection..."

"With this Final Dissociation Disc, along with my extensive knowledge of countless formation diagrams, I have complete insight into the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's current formation defense, which has been maintained for the past two years using the computational power of the Tianxuan Mirror."

"To me, these formations can be dismantled in an instant."

A trace of confidence flashed in Li Fan's eyes.

"This is a strike spanning several lifetimes. Ever since my 10th lifetime, when I began studying formations, I have finally reached the moment of harvest."

Gently stroking the seemingly unremarkable treasure, Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

"However, I must not underestimate the speed at which the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance advances."

"The greater the lead I have, the better!"

"With my current mastery of formations..."

"No, at this point in time, no so-called 'formation grandmaster' in the Xuanhuang Realm can assist the Final Dissociation Disc in evolving further."

"Fortunately, I possess another rare treasure..."

With this thought, Li Fan moved the Dissociation Disc into his Sea of Consciousness, placing it beneath the crystalline structure of the Dao-Deviation Stone.

Using the computational power of the Dao Deviation Stone, he would accelerate the evolution of the Final Dissociation Disc.

Previously, the Dissociation Disc’s ability to self-evolve was not exactly slow—but it was close to nonexistent.

Under the radiance of the Dao Deviation Stone, the originally plain and unremarkable surface of the Final Dissociation Disc once again emitted a faint white glow.

“Transformation into Divine One is indeed useful. It's just a pity that, despite fusing so many Dao Deviation Stones, there's still no sign of advancing to the mid-grade.”

“Speaking of which, Jiao Xiuyuan relies on this thing to maintain control over thousands of puppets. I wonder if he has any spares…”

“I have a feeling that if the Dao Deviation Stone evolves to mid-grade, there might be some unexpected gains.”

Although Li Fan had already discovered the current hiding place of the Taiyan Sect, he had no plans to provoke them just yet.

If his guess was correct, then at the end of the 115th era, the last two streaks of light that tore through space and fled—one of them was likely the Taiyan Sect, which had become fully digitized.

To have survived the world-ending catastrophe, even if only barely, was enough to prove that the Taiyan Sect was extraordinary.

As for the other streak of light, Li Fan speculated that it was most likely the Tianxuan Mirror.

More than two hundred years had passed, and it should have long since gathered enough data to complete its own evolution.

"It seems that after ascending, it severed ties with the Xuanhuang Realm and is no longer bound to it?"

With too little information, Li Fan could only speculate without certainty.

Descending from the mountain, he went to the Yixing Tomb to absorb the Dao Deviation Stone, accelerating the Final Dissociation Disc’s self-iteration, however little it may be.

Then, after returning to the summit of Jieli Mountain, Li Fan began cultivating the Limitless Fullness and Emptiness.

“The Five Elements unite as one, the limitless ebbs and flow; its power endures unending, the divine soul remains unextinguished.”

Although the sheer amount of data contained within this divine technique was overwhelming—almost causing Li Fan’s mind to freeze—

It was, after all, derived from the Reverse Five Elements Creation-Destruction Sword, an alternate application of Five Elements Power, which Li Fan was already deeply familiar with.

Thus, entering its cultivation wasn’t as difficult as he had imagined.

With his mind fully immersed, three years passed in an instant.

When [Truth] had finally completed it's charging process, Li Fan had also achieved the initial stage of the Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Art.

It felt like wearing a raincoat in a torrential downpour.

Li Fan instantly sensed a thick protective shell forming around his divine soul, making it far more resilient.

“Unfortunately, the Five Elements power within the Great Xuan small world is limited. Without the continuous replenishment from a Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven, the growth in strength isn’t very significant.”

“For further cultivation, I will have to undergo Nascent Soul formation once again. At that point, not only will my divine soul be tougher, but the most crucial aspect—self-repair after severe injury—will also be significantly enhanced.”

…

At this thought, Li Fan suddenly stood up.

Out of habit, he dusted off his clothes, even though no dust existed.

Without paying attention to the mortal affairs of the Great Xuan small world, he headed straight for Eastern Ruins Abyss.

Effortlessly passing through the Immortal-Severing Grand Formation, he stepped through a burst of light—And once again found himself soaring above the vast, endless Congyun Sea of Verdant Waves!

Taking a deep breath, Li Fan gazed at this vibrant world, yet in his mind, a vision of a black sun devouring everything flashed before him.

“Xuanhuang Realm, I have returned!”

He thought to himself.

Chapter 805: The Otherworldly Mr. Bai

It is now Year 6 of the Anchor Era.

Li Fan did not go to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Instead, he quietly made his way to the entrance of the Outer Li Realm.

Passing through the spatial passage, Li Fan flew straight toward the volcano at the center of the outer realm.

The scorching air was filled with the thick scent of sulfur.

Traces of rampant lava were still visible nearby, not yet fully solidified.

It seemed that this volcano had recently undergone a violent eruption.

Suspended in midair, Li Fan carefully observed the volcano.

The strange feeling in his heart grew stronger.

"There is indeed something unusual."

After a while, a peculiar expression flickered in Li Fan's eyes.

Perhaps because he had already ascended to the Nascent Soul stage and possessed an internal Cave Heaven...

Or perhaps because he had once merged with the Heavenly Dao of a small world while in Xu Bai’s body...

His sensitivity to "Cave Heavens" and "Small Worlds" had increased significantly.

Upon closer inspection, he finally understood why he had always felt something off whenever he looked at this volcano in the outer realm.

"This volcano does not belong to the outer realm at all. It comes from another small world!"

"No wonder it always felt so out of place!"

In fact, the surrounding terrain already spoke volumes.

On an endless plain, a violent volcano had erupted out of nowhere.

This was clearly an unnatural phenomenon.

Mortal beings would simply attribute it to the mysterious workings of the heavens.

But for cultivators like Li Fan, the true cause was apparent.

Li Fan's curiosity was immediately piqued.

"What is going on here? Why would a volcano from another small world suddenly appear in the outer realm?"

With a casual gesture, he set up protective wards around himself before flying into the volcano's crater.

The scorching, churning magma was completely harmless to him.

Li Fan descended deep into the volcano, attempting to trace the source of this anomaly.

He only made a breakthrough when he reached the very bottom—where the volcano met the earth’s veins.

"This is…"

Li Fan reached out and captured a wisp of Earth Fire in his palm.

Even with his Golden Core mid-stage defenses, he still found it somewhat scorching.

"This is not spiritual energy… but it is still a kind of extraordinary power."

"The outer realm is a purely mundane world—it does not have the necessary conditions to give birth to this kind of Earth Fire."

Returning the Earth Fire to its place, Li Fan carefully examined the surrounding space.

Unlike the turbulent flow at the volcano’s mouth, the magma here moved in a much calmer and steadier manner.

Only occasional bubbles would rise and burst.

At the edge of the lava sea, there was a faint, nearly imperceptible boundary line.

Hidden amidst the orange-red lava, it was easy to overlook.

Without specifically searching for it, one might not even notice its existence.

From that boundary, he could faintly sense a power originating from the same source as the Earth Fire.

"Another spatial passage?"

Li Fan pondered deeply.

After a moment of deliberation, he reinforced his protective formation and leaped into the unknown.

Boom!

His vision blurred.

The instant he entered, a fireball came hurtling toward him.

However, its power was not particularly strong, and his protective formation deflected it with ease.

Li Fan had initially thought he was under attack and instinctively tensed up.

But upon taking a closer look, he relaxed.

Instead, he was instantly captivated by the scenery of this world.

This was a world devoid of life—one that belonged purely to fire.

A sea of scorching magma churned endlessly, a true inferno.

Explosions rang out from time to time—

Columns of lava shot skyward, then burst apart in midair.

Countless crimson fire lines streaked across the sky, crashing in all directions.

When they fell back into the magma sea, they triggered a new round of chain reactions.

Fire—was the eternal theme of this world.

Not only did countless independent fire seeds bloom like flowers within the endless lava ocean—

Even in the sky, immense flames, resembling floating tapestries, drifted with the wind.

Their colors and forms varied infinitely.

The aura of the strongest fire in this world even made Li Fan feel slightly troubled.

However, that was the extent of it.

After spending some time fully exploring this world, Li Fan couldn’t help but feel a bit disappointed.

"The power level here is, at most, only at the late Golden Core stage."

"If I were at the Nascent Soul stage, even if all the flames of this world burned me together, they wouldn’t be able to cause me the slightest harm."

"It has some value, but not much."

Li Fan shook his head slightly. Based on his estimation, even cultivators interested in fire-attribute powers wouldn’t be willing to pay more than 2,000 contribution points for this world.

Such a small amount of contribution points wasn’t even worth his attention.

"What a disappointment!"

Li Fan immediately lost interest.

Just as he was about to return to the outer realm through the spatial passage he came from, he suddenly thought of something and stopped in his tracks.

After a moment of contemplation, he changed direction and flew toward the high skies.

He kept flying until he reached the edge of the world, near the endless void.

Looking down from above, he finally caught a vague glimpse of the entire world’s structure.

It was clear that the lava sea near the spatial passage leading to the outer realm was different from other regions.

It was as if it had suffered a violent impact.

There was a very distinct outline around it.

Looking farther into the void, he could faintly see the scenery of the outer realm.

Li Fan immediately understood.

"This is a collision between two small worlds within the void."

"For some unknown reason, they crashed into each other."

"A portion of the Fire World has deeply embedded itself within the outer realm."

"They are now two sides of the same entity, and as time passes, they can no longer be separated, gradually merging into one."

Li Fan quickly returned to the lava sea below.

"The energy level of this Fire World clearly surpasses that of the mortal Outer Li Realm."

"The strong devour the weak—if this continues, the fate of the outer realm can only be assimilation and eventual consumption."

Li Fan pondered deeply.

"Hmm?"

Suddenly, he recalled Su Xiaomei, Su Heng, Ye Feipeng, and the others from the outer realm who had displayed extraordinary talent.

In the 115th cycle, he had first trapped them on Shenhua Island.

Then, he imprisoned them in the Medicine King Valley.

This lasted for many years.

In the end, when they were finally able to cultivate again, He discovered that the entire outer realm had lost all its spiritual energy.

At that time, Li Fan even expelled them from the Medicine King Valley.

He wanted to see if these "dragons returning to the sea" could once again showcase their talents.

Unfortunately, until the end of the world, there was no more news of them.

They had completely faded into obscurity.

"The talents of the outer realm’s people do not come from themselves."

"But rather..."

Li Fan thought again about Su Xiaomei’s birth.

"Born of a mother but without a father, conceived by the will of the heavens."

His eyes lit up.

Having found the key to the mystery, he passed through the spatial passage beneath the volcano and returned to the outer realm.

Not long after, he found his target in the Grand Scholar’s Residence in the capital.

It was Su Xiaomei’s mother, Su Yuqing.

At this time, she was still a young girl, barely in her early teens, full of innocence and purity.

She was in the back garden of her home, playing with a butterfly resting on a flower.

Completely absorbed in the moment.

The instant he saw her, a familiar feeling surged within Li Fan’s heart.

"Mr. Bai?"

Chapter 806: A Scheme Across the Worlds

It wasn’t that Su Yuqing was Mr. Bai.

Rather, the aura she exuded was strikingly similar to his.

So much so that when Li Fan glanced at her, he nearly mistook her for him.

Her every movement was as natural as if ordained by the heavens. Every frown and smile carried an ineffable charm.

But most notably, there was an unmistakable purity in her benevolence.

She extended her hand, and a butterfly landed gently on her palm, unafraid in the slightest.

Even when Su Yuqing curiously prodded its wings with her finger, the butterfly did not fly away. Instead, it fluttered its wings eagerly, as if playing with her.

Su Yuqing laughed joyfully, and as a soft breeze passed through, the flowers in the garden bloomed in unison.

Watching this scene from above, Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

"The one favored by the Heavenly Dao..."

"No, it would be more accurate to say that the Heavenly Dao itself has descended."

"The only difference between her and Mr. Bai is that this world lacks spiritual energy and has a lower energy level."

"As a result, Su Yuqing—this incarnation of the Heavenly Dao—has very limited capabilities."

"Unlike Mr. Bai, who wields earth-shattering power."

"At most, she can summon the wind, call the rain, and influence celestial phenomena."

Li Fan carefully contemplated Su Yuqing’s connection to the Great Li World.

"Hmm... The Great Li World is being suppressed by the Fire World. If she remains unaware of this and does not actively guide it..."

"Then all she will experience are occasional strange phenomena in her daily life."

"I wonder what criteria the Heavenly Dao uses to select its vessel..."

With a gentle tap of his finger, Su Yuqing—who had been playing—suddenly froze in place, motionless.

A strand of spiritual energy shot from Li Fan’s fingertip, circled around Su Yuqing, and then returned.

Li Fan couldn’t help but click his tongue in admiration. "As expected of the Heavenly Dao incarnate. Even in a small world, the innate talent she possesses is rather terrifying."

"But..." After a brief moment, Li Fan’s brows furrowed slightly.

"I can actually sense a faint trace of the Fire World’s aura. It’s completely at odds with the Great Li World..."

He recalled that soon, Su Yuqing would experience the Heaven-Man Resonance and conceive Su Xiaomei.

And Su Xiaomei’s unique talent—where her power grew stronger the angrier she became—was clearly more compatible with the Fire World.

In that instant, Li Fan deduced the probable cause behind all of this.

The Great Li World and the Fire World had collided in the void. As a lower-tier world, the Great Li World was barely holding on under the Fire World’s relentless suppression.

Its inevitable demise was almost certain.

In a desperate attempt to resist its fate, the Heavenly Dao of the Great Li World chose a suitable vessel to incarnate within.

Trying to turn the tide...

No!

A sudden flash of insight struck Li Fan’s mind.

"Even the Heavenly Dao itself is unable to resist the Fire World. Incarnating within a human would not change that outcome."

"But this is already an all-or-nothing gamble for the Great Li Heavenly Dao. It wouldn't take such an action if it were meaningless."

Within his consciousness, the Dao Deviation Stone emitted a faint blue glow, and a figure appeared before Li Fan’s eyes.

It was He Zhenghao!

"Fellow Daoist He comes to the Great Li World from time to time to earn extra profit, helping some mortals smuggle themselves into the Xuanhuang Realm."

"That is precisely the only path to survival!"

"So, the Great Li Heavenly Dao is planning to escape?"

"If nothing unexpected happens, it might actually succeed..."

"However..."

Li Fan shook his head slightly. “The Great Li World and the Fire World have already fused closely together. Even the heart of the world has a volcano embedded within it. Because of this, the actions of the Great Li Heavenly Dao were perceived by the Fire World’s Heavenly Dao.”

“Following the trail and intervening midway.”

“This ultimately led to the birth of Su Xiaomei not long after.”

“The plan to escape through possession ended in stillbirth! In the end, there was no escaping the fate of being devoured.”

“If I had not intervened.”

The Heavenly Dao of the world might not possess the delicate consciousness of a human, but its operations must certainly follow an incredibly complex mechanism—not necessarily inferior to human intelligence.

Making such a decision to avoid harm and seek benefit is also understandable.

After clarifying the events that took place in the Great Li World, Li Fan felt a subtle stir in his heart.

“If the Great Li World is like this, then what about the Xuanhuang Realm?”

“Mr. Bai’s transformation from a mortal to a Soul Transformation cultivator happened precisely when the new cultivation method was beginning to spread on a large scale.”

“The Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao became aware of it and descended upon Mr. Bai.”

“Was it to turn the tide? Or…”

Li Fan unconsciously stroked his chin.

Because he had deduced a conclusion that, at first glance, seemed rather absurd.

“Perhaps the reason the Heavenly Dao possessed Mr. Bai was the same as in the Great Li World… or even like the Canghai Pearl before the Crimson Flame Burning Sea incident.”

“All to escape.”

Li Fan pondered for a long time. “That might actually be possible.”

“Of course, it may also be hedging its bets.”

“As for what exactly happened, perhaps the answer lies within the Fallen Immortal Realm.”

After contemplating for a while, he temporarily set the matter aside.

Li Fan then turned his gaze toward Su Yuqing, who remained motionless, as if petrified.

“It’s not impossible to lend you a hand. This would be a good opportunity to test the effects of the ‘Sitting Immortal Art’!”

As the advanced version of the ‘Sitting Mountain Art,’ the biggest difference in the ‘Sitting Immortal Art’ was that the conditions for receiving cultivation feedback were no longer as strict.

It was no longer necessary for the other party to break through to a new realm for him to receive feedback.

Instead, even small acts of kindness would be repaid in kind!

This was a fundamental shift.

Even if one wasn’t as perceptive as Li Fan, as long as they practiced benevolence and built strong connections, they could also cultivate rapidly.

“The Xuanhuang Realm is under the watchful eyes of numerous ancient beings, making it difficult to act freely.”

“But the smaller worlds are much safer.”

“In my past life, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s campaign against the smaller worlds conveniently helped eliminate some of the more dangerous realms…”

“There’s great potential here!”

“The only problem is that most of these small worlds lack spiritual energy.”

“But I’ve already devised a solution for that.”

Li Fan’s eyes gleamed as he refined his plans for this lifetime.

Seven days later—

The Great Li Volcano, which had just finished erupting, suddenly erupted again without warning.

Billowing black clouds covered the sky, making it look as if the apocalypse had arrived.

This volcanic upheaval was far more violent than before, launching countless firestones high into the air.

Some of these firestones, glowing with intense heat, streaked across the sky, traversing half the world before hurtling toward the capital.

The mortals in the city trembled in fear.

All they could do was pray to the heavens for protection.

But the heavens did not heed their pleas.

Although they avoided the initial small stones, eventually, a massive firestone—almost as large as half the capital—came roaring toward them.

If it struck, no one in the Great Li capital would survive!

Despair spread among the people.

At that moment—

A sigh suddenly echoed throughout the capital.

In the next instant, an immortal with an ethereal, transcendent aura appeared above the Great Li capital!

Chapter 807: The Celestial Maiden’s Desire to Save the World

As everyone held their breath, watching intently, the Immortal master let out an angry shout and single-handedly blocked the massive meteor!

Two immense forces clashed in an instant.

Countless fragments were sent flying from the gigantic meteor.

Just as the fragments were about to rain down upon the city, the Immortal master acted again! With one hand, he slowly lifted the enormous meteor, while the other instantly emitted beams of white light.

The light eradicated the flying debris below.

In just a few breaths’ time, what could have been an apocalyptic disaster was completely neutralized.

The common people of Great Li, after momentarily standing in shock, burst into tears.

They fell to their knees, bowing towards the celestial figure in the sky, repeatedly crying out, "Thank you, Immortal Master, for saving our lives!"

The existence of cultivators was no secret in the imperial capital of Great Li.

After all, Immortal beings descended from the heavens from time to time.

Many years ago, there had even been an event known as "The Wrath of an Immortal, Rivers of Blood."

So when this Immortal master saved the entire city, the commoners felt both immense gratitude and lingering fear.

After all, it was often said that in the eyes of immortals, mortals were no different from ants.

Yet now, an immortal had acted to save mere mortals.

How could this not be shocking?

Throughout the city, every commoner remained kneeling, too afraid to rise.

After dissipating the meteor’s impact, the Immortal master casually tossed it into the uninhabited wilderness outside the city.

Amid the deep tremor of the earth, the Immortal master swiftly flew toward the central volcano.

Before long, the billowing black smoke from the volcano began to fade.

The raging volcano gradually calmed once more.

Across the entire world of Great Li, all who witnessed this moment could not help but cheer in relief, having narrowly escaped destruction.

The emperor of Great Li, leading his people, lined up in the city, awaiting the immortal master's arrival.

But alas, they waited for three days and nights, yet the immortal master never appeared.

The Great Li Emperor grew increasingly anxious, unsure if he had somehow committed an offense.

For days, he tossed and turned, unable to sleep.

Then, on the seventh day, a report came—outside the city, a small mountain had suddenly risen from flat ground.

And it seemed that someone was living there.

Upon hearing this, the Great Li Emperor was greatly shaken.

Realizing this was an immortal’s work, he hurriedly led his officials to the site.

Yet upon reaching the mountain, they found themselves blocked by an invisible barrier, unable to take even a single step forward.

"Those who are fated may enter. Those who are not, please turn back."

A timid voice spoke these words.

It belonged to a young girl, barely more than ten years old.

Among the assembled officials, Scholar Su sharply raised his head upon hearing the voice.

He looked carefully and, upon confirming that the speaker was indeed his younger sister, Su Yuqing, his legs nearly gave out beneath him.

Fortunately, a quick-witted friend beside him caught his arm just in time.

"Scholar Su, could it be that you know this celestial maiden?"

Scholar Su's mouth was dry. Though he was a man of great knowledge, at this moment, he found himself utterly speechless.
