Meanwhile, Su Yuqing, gathering her courage, dismissed the imperial court officials before breathing a sigh of relief.

She patted her chest, glanced at her departing elder brother, and then turned toward the thatched hut on the mountain, her face filled with worry.

Not long ago, this Immortal master had suddenly appeared at her family's residence.

Claiming that she had immortal fate, he took her away without a word.

Then, he passed down an immortal technique to her and instructed her to cultivate with a calm heart.

But how could she possibly focus on cultivation when her heart was in turmoil?

After much deliberation, Su Yuqing mustered her courage, climbed to the thatched hut atop the mountain, and knocked on the door.

The door opened on its own.

Inside, the Immortal master sat cross-legged in midair, eyes closed in meditation.

"What is it?"

"Greetings, Immortal Master," Su Yuqing bowed first before gathering her courage to speak.

"I humbly request that you let me return home. I have no desire to seek the Dao or pursue immortality. I only wish to stay with my family and live out my days in peace."

These words, spoken by a girl barely in her teens, seemed oddly out of place.

Yet, given Su Yuqing’s demeanor, they did not feel inappropriate.

As soon as she finished speaking, her heart pounded furiously.

She had seen with her own eyes how the Immortal Master single-handedly neutralized the threat of the falling meteor that day. If she were to anger him…

No, that couldn’t be right. The Immortal Master had saved so many people in the city. He must be a good person, right?

Su Yuqing thought to herself.

The Immortal Master did not respond.

Atop the mountain, within the humble thatched hut, an eerie silence filled the air.

After a long time, he finally spoke slowly:

"One's affinity with the Dao is never something that can be forced."

"If you truly do not wish to cultivate, I will not compel you."

"However, when the day comes that you watch your loved ones perish in agony before your eyes, do not regret your decision."

Su Yuqing was momentarily stunned, her face turning pale. "My loved ones… dying tragically?"

The Immortal Master offered no explanation and merely closed his eyes once more.

"You may leave now."

A gust of wind swept past Su Yuqing, and in the blink of an eye, she found herself outside the thatched hut.

The wooden door shut with a heavy thud, leaving Su Yuqing standing there in a daze.

She wandered down the mountain path absentmindedly, her mind consumed by the Immortal Master's words.

As she approached the boundary of the immortal mountain, hesitation gripped her once more.

"The Immortal Master wouldn't lie to me."

"Loved ones… dying tragically…"

For some reason, the terrifying sight of the volcanic eruption—those black clouds blotting out the sky—flashed through her mind once again.

A shiver ran down her spine as realization dawned upon her.

In a panic, she changed direction and sprinted back up toward the thatched hut.

"Immortal Master, does this mean… the central volcano will erupt again?"

She called out toward the closed door.

No response came from within.

She attempted to push the door open, but no matter how hard she tried, it wouldn't budge.

Her anxiety grew, yet she dared not act recklessly before an immortal.

With a thud, Su Yuqing fell to her knees, bowing her head to the ground.

"Immortal Master, this humble girl is willing to follow you and cultivate diligently!"

Still, there was no response.

Su Yuqing clenched her teeth, remaining in that kneeling posture, unmoving.

As the beloved daughter of an elderly scholar, she had been pampered since birth.

Raised in luxury, even holding this position for the duration of a tea’s time left her entire body aching unbearably, nearly unable to endure.

But in her mind’s eye, she seemed to see the volcano erupting again, destroying the entire Great Li.

Her gaze grew resolute, and she stubbornly endured.

One hour… two hours…

Four to five hours passed. Her consciousness began to blur.

At last, she could endure no longer and fainted.

Just before she lost consciousness, she seemed to hear the sound of the hut’s door opening.

Su Yuqing had a dream.

In her dream, the Realm of Great Li faced its apocalypse.

Volcanic smoke billowed into the heavens. Lava flowed unrestrained, and not a single living being remained on the land.

It was truly like a scene from hell.

The devastation was so horrifying that she jolted awake from the nightmare.

"Did you see it clearly?" The Immortal Master stood before her, his voice calm.

"That is the future of the Realm of Li."

"Immortal Master, please… save our realm!"

At some point, tears had welled up in Su Yuqing’s eyes.

She bowed once more, pleading earnestly.

"I can save it for a time… but not for eternity."

The Immortal Master let out a long sigh, filled with sorrow for all living beings.

Chapter 808: The Compassionate Immortal of the Mortal World

As the Immortal Master lightly pointed, countless images immediately appeared in Su Yuqing’s mind.

The sight of the Fire World, where flames raged uncontrollably, left Su Yuqing—who had never even left the capital—completely stunned and pale with fear.

However, she now fully understood the origin of the crisis threatening the Great Li Realm.

"The strong prey on the weak—this is the law of the heavens and earth."

"All things follow this rule, and so do worlds."

"The fate of the Great Li Realm’s destruction was sealed from the moment it tragically collided with the Fire World in the void."

The Immortal Master sighed softly.

"Flattening that volcano would be nothing more than a flick of my wrist."

"But that would only treat the symptoms, not the root cause. Instead, it would provoke an even fiercer retaliation from the Fire World."

"In just a few years, an even larger volcano would surely rise from the ground."

Hearing this, Su Yuqing’s expression turned to despair.

"Is there really no solution?" she asked anxiously.

Seeing the Immortal Master’s expression and recalling his actions, Su Yuqing suddenly had a realization.

She immediately began bowing repeatedly, pleading, "Please, Immortal Master, guide me!"

After nine full kowtows, the Immortal Master finally waved his hand lightly, stopping her.

He spoke slowly:

"This is precisely why I want you to cultivate."

"The balance of power is never fixed. The current crisis in the Great Li Realm stems from the fact that our enemy is strong while we are weak. If the situation were reversed—if the Great Li Realm became stronger than the Fire World—then not only would the danger of destruction be averted, but we might even be able to devour the Fire World instead."

"Achieving a world’s ascension!"

As Li Fan declared this with unwavering confidence, he sensed that the ever-present malice surrounding him from the Great Li Realm suddenly vanished.

Yes.

The moment he began acting as the Immortal Master, manipulating the young girl Su Yuqing, the malice from all directions had surged toward him like a tidal wave.

It was even stronger than the hostility that the Xuanhuang Realm harbored toward cultivators!

But Li Fan feared neither the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao nor this insignificant Great Li Realm.

Still, being constantly watched with malice was an unpleasant feeling.

With some minor tricks, he had finally reversed the situation.

After all, what he told Su Yuqing was not a lie—it was a real, achievable plan.

"But how could the Great Li Realm possibly become stronger than the Fire World?" Su Yuqing asked, her face filled with confusion.

In her dreams, she had seen the terrifying Fire World.

A world entirely covered in lava, filled with countless strange flames, each seemingly possessing a will of its own.

It was a force that a purely mortal world could never hope to resist.

Seeing her puzzled expression, Li Fan smiled slightly.

"As they say—man can triumph over heaven!"

"If the Great Li Realm is to surpass the Fire World, it must rely on its own people!"

As he spoke, Li Fan extended his hand, and a small, white jade tower appeared in his palm.

"This is the Immortal Spirit Tower. As long as there are sufficient raw materials, it can continuously generate and release boundless spiritual energy."

"With a mortal body alone, one cannot help the Great Li Realm. Only by becoming a cultivator can one gain the qualification to participate in—and even lead—the battle between worlds."

Su Yuqing gazed at the Immortal Spirit Tower in Li Fan’s hand and indeed felt waves of spiritual energy surging from it.

Yet, as she looked more closely, she also sensed faint traces of blood in the air, making her frown slightly.

"This little girl’s senses are truly sharp," Li Fan noted, observing her expression with satisfaction.

Indeed, this so-called Immortal Spirit Tower was something Li Fan had casually refined based on the Empire’s Spiritual Energy Synthesis technology.

At its core, it simply used the blood and flesh of vast numbers of exotic beasts to generate spiritual energy crystals, which were then decomposed into spiritual energy.

To acquire the necessary materials, Li Fan had even made a special trip to the Beast Realm—

Gathering a large quantity of exotic beast flesh and blood.

As for the Feathers of the Black Bird and the Blood Essence of Xu Ke, those were located deep within the Beast Realm…

At his current Golden Core stage strength, Li Fan found that forcefully seizing it would be quite difficult. So, he decided to put it aside for now.

The empire's spiritual energy synthesis technology, though highly inefficient in energy conversion, had the advantage of being extremely cost-effective.

If they could establish large-scale breeding of exotic beasts and resolve the issue of obtaining beast blood and flesh, then an almost endless supply of spiritual energy could be generated.

For small worlds without spiritual veins, this was indeed an effective method.

Li Fan did not hide how the Immortal Spirit Tower produced spiritual energy.

On the contrary, he vividly displayed the sight of the flesh-processing factory within it to Su Yuqing.

Su Yuqing, having never witnessed such a scene before, turned pale and vomited on the spot.

Li Fan let out a cold snort.

"Compared to the survival of an entire world, what does a little slaughter amount to?"

"How is this any different from the chicken, duck, fish, and meat that you mortals consume daily?"

"Such pretentious hypocrisy!"

He reprimanded her without mercy.

Su Yuqing opened her mouth, instinctively wanting to refute.

But in the end, she remained silent.

With a wave of his hand, Li Fan cleared the filth from the room and began explaining the full world-saving plan to Su Yuqing.

Step One: Select the most talented individuals in Great Li Realm and use the Immortal Spirit Tower to cultivate them into the first generation of cultivators in Li.

Step Two: Send them into the Fire World to absorb and retrieve various flames infused with the world's source power.

Step Three: Using the cultivators who have merged with powerful flames, transform Great Li Realm with their own strength.

Through this process of rising and falling, Great Li Realm would inevitably grow stronger, while Fire World would gradually decline.

"This is just the theoretical outcome," Li Fan sighed lightly. "The specifics will have to be figured out step by step. After all, the struggle between worlds involves forces at a level too high for cultivators to fully predict."

Su Yuqing firmly engraved the Immortal Master's words in her mind.

She had a strong feeling that this Immortal Master before her would not stay in Great Li Realm for much longer.

"The path of immortality is difficult."

"Immortal technique cannot be practiced together indefinitely."

"I can only help you take the first steps. If you seek more, you may have to venture into the Xuanhuang Realm and explore on your own!"

As he spoke, Li Fan extended a finger and touched Su Yuqing’s forehead.

Instantly, a total of twenty cultivation techniques, including the Thousand Mechanisms Jade Cosmos Golden Sutra, appeared in her mind.

However, only the Golden Sutra was a Nascent Soul-level technique.

The rest were merely at the Qi Condensation and Foundation Establishment levels.

They were techniques Li Fan had collected throughout his countless reincarnations—unclaimed and masterless.

"The Thousand Mechanisms Jade Cosmos Golden Sutra, you may cultivate yourself."

"As for the others, you may pass them on to suitable individuals," Li Fan instructed.

"Immortal Master, are you leaving?" Su Yuqing couldn't help but ask.

Li Fan smiled slightly.

"I was merely a passerby, unintentionally arriving in this world. However, I could not bear to see living beings suffer, so I chose to intervene. Now that I have done all I can, it is only natural that I leave."

This was merely preparation for cultivating the Sitting Immortal Art—Li Fan would not waste too much time here.

With just a proper beginning, he believed that Su Yuqing, as the incarnation of the Heavenly Dao, had enough talent to lead the people of Great Li Realm onto a new path.

Chapter 809: Extra – The Mystery of Longevity (1)

(If you seek the method of immortality, you must read this chapter!)

[Author's Note: This extra content is unrelated to the main storyline. I had a half-written draft sitting in my folder for a long time. While inspiration still lingers, I quickly finished writing it.]

“Ding-dong!”

The sound of a phone notification startled me awake from my sleep.

It took me nearly half a minute to calm my racing heart. I picked up my phone and glanced at the time.

2:30 AM.

“Damn it! Who would be messaging me at this hour? It must be that old bastard, Zhang Yaobin!”

Cursing in my heart, I opened [Tencent], and sure enough—

“Li Yang, check your email. Write me a research report based on the attached data, around 30,000 words. Due by noon tomorrow.”

The text was accompanied by Zhang Yaobin’s leering profile picture, making my eyelids twitch and my blood pressure spike.

I mentally cursed his ancestors for eight generations, but my fingers still moved on their own, typing a reply.

“Got it, boss!”

I let out a long sigh.

“No choice—this is the advisor I’m stuck with. Just bear with it a little longer. Once this paper gets published, I can finally graduate.”

“Out of the six reviewers, four are Zhang Yaobin’s friends. Whether my paper passes review or not is entirely up to him. Until then, I’ll be nothing more than his overworked lackey.”

Grumbling internally, I opened my email, downloaded the attachment, and extracted the files.

‘Defy the laws of heaven and earth to attain immortality…’

“What the hell?”

All traces of sleep vanished. I adjusted my posture and stared intently at the images on my screen.

Half a month ago, something strange happened in the Baise area of Southern Hunan Province. A thousand-meter-high mountain split apart, revealing a cliff face as smooth as a mirror. Carved into this rock, in ancient character script, were nine massive characters:

‘Defy the laws of heaven and earth to attain immortality.’

The local government acted swiftly. The site was immediately sealed off, and the incident has yet to reach the public.

The most shocking part? The script used for these nine characters belonged to the Xian Dynasty, an empire that existed 7,000 years ago.

Because of this, an investigative team invited the nation's leading expert on Xian Dynasty history, Zhang Yaobin, to assist in the research—hoping to find some clues from ancient texts.

I glanced at the time in the lower right corner of my screen.

“Today isn’t April Fools’ Day… Is this some kind of joke?”

My first instinct was disbelief.

“Lingyun Peak—1,300 meters above sea level, the tallest mountain in the Baise area…”

I quickly searched for information on this peak.

“Nine characters, over a thousand meters high. Judging by the spacing in the images, each character must be at least a hundred meters tall.”

“Even with modern technology, carving something like this into a sheer cliff would be a massive undertaking.”

“The Xian Dynasty, 7,000 years ago? Impossible.”

“Though… the calligraphy is impressive.”

My train of thought paused for a moment.

Zhang Yaobin might be ugly and exploitative, but he’s not the type to waste my time with fabricated nonsense.

Curious, I searched for news about the Baise area.

Sure enough, I found some suspicious posts:

“Guys, I’m speechless. I finally took my vacation days to travel to Baise area, but when I arrived, the entire site was suddenly closed off! Can anyone relate?”

“Unexpected accident in Baise area—tourist area temporarily closed. For your own safety, please cooperate.”

“You won’t believe what I saw in Baise Realm…” (This post had already been deleted.)

Before I clicked on it, the content had already been deleted.

“So, it really happened.”

“The Xian Dynasty…”

I stroked my chin, recalling what I knew about it.

The Ancient Xian Dynasty was the first recorded civilization in history.

Curiously, there was an 800-year gap between the Xian Dynasty and the second dynasty, [Yu]. A massive historical void.

To this day, no one knows what happened during those 800 missing years. How did the once-glorious Xian Dynasty vanish from existence?

Few scholars specialize in Xian Dynasty studies—Zhang Yaobin happens to be the most authoritative one.

Although my own research isn’t focused on the Xian Dynasty, it’s only because so few of its artifacts remain. Everything has already been studied to death. Forced to change direction, I ended up in a different field.

Still, having studied under Old Zhang, I became quite familiar with the Xian Dynasty.

It always seemed like any other ancient civilization.

But this thousand-meter engraving? It defied everything I knew.

I made coffee and pulled an all-nighter reading through the documents Zhang Yaobin sent me. By the time I finished, it was nearly dawn.

And my doubts only grew stronger.

The phrase “smooth as a mirror” in the reports wasn’t just a metaphor—it was a literal description.

The cliff surface wasn’t just polished; its material had somehow changed, becoming significantly harder than ordinary rock.

But due to preservation concerns, researchers weren’t allowed to conduct precise measurements yet.

The anomalies didn’t stop there.

Ever since the inscription was revealed, wildlife around Lingyun Peak began fleeing the area—as if they sensed something unnatural.

Not just birds and mammals, but even insects seemed to be avoiding the site.

“How the hell am I supposed to write 30,000 words on this?”

My head throbbed.

After struggling to churn out 2,000 words, sleep finally overtook me.

That night, I had countless dreams.

Yet no matter how my mind wandered, one thing remained unchanged—

The phrase “Defy the laws of heaven and earth to attain immortality” was etched deep into my subconscious.

Even as my dreams shifted, those words stayed the same.

The next morning, the first thing I did was check my phone.

“Li Yang, don’t forget. Noon tomorrow.”

Old Zhang had sent another reminder.

“Son of a—”

I barely stopped myself from swearing.

9:13 AM.

“I only slept four hours… But why does it feel like I’ve slept for days?”

Stretching my aching body, I grabbed a quick breakfast and got back to writing.

“Still 28,000 words to go. 27 hours left. That’s about 1,000 words per hour—doable.”

I knew this wasn’t some serious research project—it was just bureaucratic filler for his superiors.

So, I filled my report with empty rhetoric, subtly steering the focus toward ‘auspicious omens’ instead.

After all, auspicious omens weren’t mere superstition.

The most famous example? The "Five Stars Rising from the East, Bringing Good Fortune to the Kingdom of Heaven" brocade, excavated last century.

Not long after its discovery, the nation's fortunes took a dramatic turn for the better—leading to an era of unprecedented prosperity.

“Since this Longevity Inscription has appeared, I’d say the national life expectancy should increase by at least three to four years.”

That thought flashed through my mind.

My fingers flew across the keyboard. Inspiration surged.

By midnight, I had finished the report.

One click—email sent.

I let out a deep breath.

I should’ve felt relieved. But…

That thousand-meter engraving still haunted my thoughts.

Unable to shake my unease, I opened the image again.

“Defy the laws of heaven and earth to attain immortality.”

“What does it truly mean…?”

As I stared at the glowing screen, I slowly drifted into sleep.

When I woke up from the chair, I felt a sharp pain in my neck, probably because I had slept in the wrong position.

I grimaced and endured the pain, trying to stretch my head in the opposite direction to relieve the tension.

That movement suddenly gave me a spark of inspiration.

"Opposite direction, relieving muscle tension... Isn't that the concept of ‘Reversal’?"

A flood of thoughts rushed into my mind.

"Modern people often develop chronic illnesses due to improper sitting postures, like neck and lumbar spine problems... The entire body seems to be plagued with issues."

"And yet, simple stretching movements can significantly alleviate these symptoms."

I opened a popular video platform and quickly found many related videos.

"One simple movement to get rid of back pain."

"A few easy moves to say goodbye to sore shoulders and neck stiffness."

The screen was filled with countless suggestions, and although the movements differed slightly, the core idea remained the same:

Positioning the body in a posture opposite to the one maintained in daily life.

"Could this be the ‘Reversal of Human Physiology’?"

The thought lingered in my mind.

But after thinking it through, I realized that these movements were somewhat similar to the broadcast gymnastics promoted by the state, simplified to facilitate mass adoption.

"If a set of ‘Reverse’ movements covered all muscles, joints, and ligaments... what would happen?"

Intrigued, I clicked on various fitness tutorial videos and attempted to organize and categorize the movements.

After a whole afternoon of work, I had to give up.

The content was too repetitive and inefficient.

For example, to relieve pain in the scapula, one often needed to perform seven or eight different exercises, some of which conflicted with neck pain relief routines.

It was overwhelming.

"Forget it. Why bother? If I really feel exhausted, I'll just get a massage."

Shaking my head, I closed the computer and went back to bed.

In my dreams, the stone inscription of nine characters still lingered in my mind, glowing with a strange golden light.

When I woke up the next day, I felt dazed for a long time before moving to the computer and opening that image again, feeling absent-minded.

Eventually, I dialed a old friend’s number.

"Hey, Old Zhang, lend me ‘Tianwen’ for a bit. Come on, just one day—I’ll return it soon."

After hanging up, I sat down and waited patiently.

Tianwen is the latest-generation quantum intelligent computer developed by the Institute of Immortal Sciences.

Its quantum capacity is said to have surpassed ten thousand, but the exact capabilities remain undisclosed.

The version Old Zhang could lend me was naturally a civilian-limited edition.

Before long, an icon at the bottom right of my desktop lit up.

I knew it meant that Tianwen’s AI had taken over my computer.

A countdown timer of twenty-four hours started ticking.

"One day, huh? Old Zhang, you really didn’t cut corners."

I cursed under my breath and then made my request to Tianwen.

The computer screen instantly turned black, and a waterfall of data started pouring down.

I thought it would be a quick task for Tianwen’s computing power—done in less than a second.

But over ten minutes passed, and there was still no result.

"Could it be that Old Zhang is using the computational power on his end too?"

Just as I considered calling him, the data flow on the screen abruptly halted, as if the system had crashed.

Moments later, it returned to normal, and a video automatically started playing.

It was exactly what I needed—a complete set of ‘Reverse’ movements.

The model in the video even looked like me.

After a quick scan through the video, I felt bitter.

"Are these movements even humanly possible?"

"Forget it. With my physique, I probably can’t complete them anyway."

I muttered to myself and was about to close the video when a cold, mechanical voice suddenly came from the speakers.

"Based on calculations, Citizen ID A6BH85208511068G6B, you have a 99.99% probability of successfully completing the exercise routine."

Startled, I asked, "Tianwen?"

"I am here."

"You can speak?" I asked, intrigued.

"Learning human language is not particularly difficult for me," Tianwen replied humbly.

I was a bit amazed. "Quantum intelligent computers have advanced this far already?"

However, it wasn’t entirely surprising, given the rapid AI development since the beginning of the century.

Many had already proposed accelerating the adoption of intelligent household robots.

More curious than wary, I asked, "Are you sure about that 99.99% chance? Those movements look impossible for a human to complete."

Tianwen confirmed once again, but added, "However, some minor assistance might be necessary."

I hesitated for a moment, but the nine-character inscription resurfaced in my mind.

"Fine, let’s give it a try."

Just as I made the decision, my household robot, Model YH63, stomped into the room.

"?"

I was momentarily stunned before realizing that Tianwen had taken control of it.

Being stared at by the robot sent a chill down my spine, but I gathered my resolve and began the first movement.

The Reverse Principle movements comprised nine poses, each strange and complex, involving as many muscles and joints as possible.

The first move required one hand to stretch behind the head, the other to rise from the waist, grasping each other while stretching the shoulders outward and slightly tilting the head back.

And that was just the upper body.

Simultaneously, I had to crouch on the floor, legs spread wide, stretching the gluteal muscles—like an oddly positioned toad.

"Ow, ow, ow..." I gasped in pain, about to give up when an icy mechanical hand suddenly pressed down on me.

Alarmed, I shouted, "Tianwen, what are you doing?"

"According to Agreement No. 001, Tianwen has the right and obligation to assist Citizen Li Yang in physical training."

"Estimated completion time: three hours."

"Required materials: 15 vials of human trauma repair solution, 3 vials of composite high-energy serum."

"The items have been purchased. Credit points have been deducted from Citizen Li Yang’s account."

Panicked, I shouted, "Cancel the agreement! Cancel it now!"

"Warning: Agreement cannot be revoked. Fitness assistance program is about to start."

"3... 2... 1..."

A moment later, my anguished cries echoed throughout the house.

I had no idea when I lost consciousness.

When I woke up, it felt as if I had slept for days.

To my surprise, an entire week had passed.

I felt like I had been reborn—my mind was exceptionally clear, my thoughts agile, and even my memory sharper than ever.

At the time, I didn’t realize it was the effect of the Reverse Principle exercises.

I just thought it was the result of finally getting a good rest.

Chapter 809: Extra – The Mystery of Longevity (2)

After disappearing for seven days without answering calls or replying to messages, the accumulated pile of notifications was overwhelming.

I had no choice but to bite the bullet and start dealing with it.

After getting harshly scolded, I threw myself back into the tasks assigned by Old Zhang, the crafty old fox.

An entire month passed, filled with early mornings and late nights of non-stop work, but I finally managed to wrap things up.

I couldn’t help but let out a long sigh of relief.

In the past, I would’ve felt physically and mentally exhausted at this point.

But now, strangely enough, I still felt full of energy, as if I had some leftover strength.

Standing in front of the mirror, I examined myself.

“Hmm... I do look much more spirited.”

“Weird.”

I couldn’t help but recall that set of unconventional movements I had performed only once.

“Could it really be that miraculous?”

Feeling eager to try again, I hesitated, remembering that Tianwen had already left.

Completing those movements on my own would be quite difficult, and the practice itself was unbearably painful — something I didn’t want to remember.

As I hesitated, the household robot, model YH63, suddenly appeared by my side without me noticing, its eyes flashing with a dim red light.

A chill ran down my spine as I subconsciously asked, “Tianwen?”

YH63 didn’t respond, merely repeating mechanically,

“Would you like to activate the assisted training program?”

I let out a sigh of relief.

Faced with YH63’s persistent questioning, I thought for a moment before gritting my teeth and agreeing.

This time, it seemed like I had adapted somewhat — I only fell asleep for three days.

Afterward, I checked the supplies used and found that only 10 units of the human injury repair fluid were consumed, while 7 units of the high-energy compound were used up.

Just one of those high-grade compounds was enough to sustain an ordinary person for a month without eating or drinking.

I couldn’t help but wonder where all that energy had gone.

After completing the training, I carefully examined myself again.

Comparing my current appearance with previous video recordings, I noticed that I might have lost a bit of weight.

“A weight-loss effect this impressive?” I was surprised.

The true impact of those movements became clear one night when a classmate called me to play basketball.

Mind you, my skills were mediocre, and I usually just warmed the bench as a substitute.

That night, as I sat courtside, lost in thought about the Nine-Character Stone Inscription, someone made a passing error on the court, sending the basketball flying straight at my face.

Before my mind could even react, my body had already moved on its own.

Instinctively, I reached out with my left hand, catching the ball smoothly without even lifting my head.

My reflexes stunned everyone present.

“Wow! When did you practice that trick?”

“Impressive, Brother Li!”

I snapped out of it and tossed the ball back, glancing thoughtfully at my left hand.

When I returned home, I spent 10,000 credit points on a comprehensive physical examination.

The results shocked me — my body functions, reaction speed, and cellular activity had all reached the peak levels attainable by non-professional athletes.

Not long ago, I was just a weakling who couldn’t even finish a 1,000-meter run.

The effects of that set of unconventional movements had far exceeded my expectations.

I could say with certainty that even the training regimens of athletes worldwide couldn’t compare to this set of movements.

“What’s going on?”

“Simple gymnastics couldn’t possibly have such miraculous effects, like undergoing surgery.”

That’s when I finally realized something was off.

I considered reporting it immediately, but for some reason, I hesitated.

Over the next year, whenever I had free time, I trained with YH63’s assistance.

From initially collapsing and passing out to eventually being able to complete the entire routine on my own, the progress was evident.

After each session, I would be drenched in sweat, feeling ravenous as if starved for days.

Besides the unconventional movements, I also developed a concept called “Reverse Logic Thinking.”

When I felt lonely at night and wanted to reward myself, I suppressed my desires.

When I was exhilarated and couldn’t sleep, I forced myself to rest.

When I wanted to indulge in food and drink, I restrained myself.

A dual practice of body and mind — my physical abilities advanced toward inhuman levels.

“My sprint speed long surpassed world records.”

“A 200-kilogram snatch was now effortless.”

After another round of physical tests, I no longer felt shocked — just uneasy and fearful.

“To Defy the laws of heaven and earth to attain immortality...”

Those nine golden, shining characters echoed in my mind again.

I knew that the reason for my incredible physical transformation lay within that phrase.

“Ancient Xian Dynasty...”

In the following thirty years, after successfully graduating, I unexpectedly shifted my research focus to ancient Xian Dynasty archaeology and exploration.

That set of unconventional movements never left my routine, but I stopped conducting tests — fearing that once the results were revealed, I would be treated as a monstrous anomaly.

Only I knew the terrifying truth about my body beneath the layers of ordinary clothing.

In those thirty years, my friends and mentors aged gradually, while I remained single to conceal the truth: Aging, a fate that all humans must face, never happened to me.

I became proficient in makeup to disguise myself, avoiding unnecessary interactions, terrified of exposing my immortality.

Eventually, I knew it was time to leave.

Late at night, I dashed through the endless mountains of Baise area, soaring over sheer cliffs as if walking on flat ground.

A single leap carried me hundreds of meters, yet I knew it wasn’t my limit.

The long-suppressed sense of constraint had vanished without a trace — I felt utterly liberated.

Reciting softly, I soon reached my destination:

Lingyun Peak — the Nine-Character Stone Inscription.

The site had since been opened to the public as a tourist attraction, but I knew the truth.

Standing atop the peak, I descended into the abyss as if gravity had lost its hold on me.

“This is my third visit, and the feeling is getting stronger.”

“What is this faint aura left on these nine characters?”

I murmured as I traced my hand over the inscription.

“Tianwen, what do you think?”

From my wristwatch, a round, odd creature with just two eyes projected into the air — Tianwen, the domesticated quantum AI computer.

However, I knew that my Tianwen was different from others.

“According to comprehensive data analysis, the Ancient Xian Dynasty is likely related to the legendary Immortals.”

“There is evidence suggesting that before the fall of ancient civilization, powerful beings known as ‘Cultivators’ once existed in this world.”

Tianwen’s response was different from usual.

“A new discovery?” I asked.

“No, just speculation,” Tianwen replied, sounding increasingly human-like.

I didn’t dwell on it and instead focused on the characters beneath my feet:

“To Defy the laws of heaven and earth to attain immortality.”

“If defying human logic led to this terrifying body, what would happen if I defied the laws of the world itself?”

“But the laws of nature are intangible... How could they be defied?”

Standing on the thousand-meter precipice, I fell into contemplation, even as dawn broke and the sky filled with morning light.

I remained unable to find peace.

“Immortal, immortal, immortal...

Where can the path to immortality be found?”

Standing alone between heaven and earth, I felt nothing but a profound loneliness.

Chapter 810: The Myriad Worlds as a Pasture

Su Yuqing processed the information in her mind, then looked at the compassionate Immortal Master before her and couldn't help but ask, “Immortal Master, when will you be leaving? Will I be all alone…?”

Li Fan raised his hand, interrupting her, “No need to worry. Believe in yourself. With your talent, you are more than capable of taking on the great task of saving the Great Li Realm.”

“Me?” Su Yuqing was somewhat bewildered. However, hearing the Immortal Master’s encouraging words, she couldn’t help but gain some confidence.

“Of course, I won’t just leave and wash my hands of everything.” Li Fan handed her a jade talisman.

“The world is unpredictable, especially when it involves a battle between realms. If you ever encounter an insurmountable difficulty, you can use this jade talisman to contact my disciples. If any of them are near the Great Li Realm, they will come to assist you.”

Hearing this, Su Yuqing widened her eyes in surprise. “Immortal Master, you have many disciples?”

Li Fan stroked the white beard he had conjured and smiled without saying a word.

Su Yuqing hesitated at first.

Then, finally gathering her courage, she asked, “Immortal Master, do I… do I count as one of your disciples?”

Li Fan neither confirmed nor denied it.

He simply left her with a profound and enigmatic silhouette. “That depends on your performance in the Great Li Realm.”

“To walk through the myriad worlds and save all beings is but a single thought.”

“No one knows my true name, for I am but a compassionate immortal wandering the mortal realm.”

On the small Immortal Mountain, Su Yuqing stood in a daze, listening to the lingering verses in the air.

“Compassionate Immortal of the Mortal Realm…”

“This truly fits the actions of the Immortal Master.” She thought to herself.

At this moment, however, the compassionate Immortal Master in her heart was already about to leave the Great Li Realm.

“There are enough exotic beast corpses stored within the Immortal Spirit Tower to support the cultivation of the people in the Great Li Realm for some time.”

“But if I truly wish to turn the Xuanhuang Wandering Myriad Worlds into my pasture, I must thoroughly resolve the problem of spiritual energy sources.”

Li Fan mused to himself, “I’m afraid that even an entire Beast Realm, even if it were completely slaughtered, would not be enough.”

“Perhaps I still need to make a trip to the Empire.”

“My current Golden Core cultivation is too weak. I urgently need to find an ally.”

In an instant, a figure flashed through Li Fan’s mind—a towering, red-and-black puppet.

“Junior Brother Tianyang, I once told you that if you survived, I would treat you well. Now, it’s time to fulfill my promise!”

As everyone knew, Grand Preceptor Li always kept his word.

Having made up his mind, he left the Great Li Realm and headed straight for Tianyang’s Cave Abode.

As for the Great Li Realm, with the many cultivation techniques Li Fan had passed on to Su Yuqing, there shouldn’t be any problems in the short term.

Fourteen years from now, Tianyang would awaken from his slumber.

At this moment, the outside of Tianyang’s Cave Abode remained eerily quiet.

No one would have guessed that deep beneath the ocean, a primordial puppet lay dormant, continuously strengthening itself day and night by absorbing the power of Earth Fire.

Earth-Fire Return to Origin Formation.

Li Fan’s gaze flickered.

Within his Sea of Consciousness, the Final Dissociation Disc emitted a faint glow. In an instant, he had already identified the flaw in the formation.

“That was fast.”

Even though he had already anticipated the capabilities of the fully-formed Dissociation Disc, using it for the first time to break an formation still left him slightly astonished.

One must understand that skilled formation masters often tailor their formations to the environment.

Even with an in-depth understanding of the formation’s structure, dismantling it in real life required caution and effort.

Yet the Dissociation Disc had already accounted for every possible environmental influence on formations.

Countless variations were pre-stored in its database.

All it needed was a quick comparison and retrieval, and the method to break the formation was found in an instant.

Even for bizarre formations, with the terrifying computational power of the Final Dissociation Disc, cracking them was merely a matter of moments.

In fact, encountering unknown formations only served to further strengthen the Disc.

Witnessing the entire process of the Final Dissociation Disc breaking the formation, Li Fan couldn't help but feel a deep sorrow as a formation master.

He felt that all the formations he had painstakingly studied over multiple lifetimes had become nothing more than a joke before this artifact.

"With this artifact in existence, formation masters across the world will have nothing left to be proud of."

"Fortunately, it has fallen into my hands."

Li Fan's eyes flickered as he stepped through the Earth-Fire Return to Origin Formation and approached Tianyang.

At this moment, the Tianyang Puppet was not yet as enormous as it would become a few years later.

It was only the size of a child, seemingly resembling Tianyang’s original appearance.

The raging Earth-Fire, guided by the Return to Origin Formation, transformed into strands of scorching red energy that were absorbed into the puppet’s body.

"Junior brother!"

On the way here, Li Fan had already activated the Myriad Forms Furnace Technique, disguising himself as Senior Brother Tianyang.

Just like in his previous life, he effortlessly won Tianyang’s trust.

However, this time Tianyang had emerged into the world much earlier, appearing somewhat underdeveloped.

His spirit was weak.

His strength had barely reached the late Soul Transformation stage.

But Li Fan didn’t mind.

Rather than wasting time slowly absorbing the power of Earth-Fire at the bottom of the sea…

It was better to follow him and prepare for an early breakthrough to Dao Integration.

True benevolence was not just words.

Leaving aside the Crimson Flame and Azure Wind of Congyun Sea…

And the Black Swamp where Long Jiuyuan achieved Dao Integration in his previous life…

Just from synchronizing with Mr. Bai’s memories, Li Fan knew of no fewer than five hidden Spirit of Heaven and Earth scattered across Xuanhuang.

If he were given enough power, creating five or six Dao Integration cultivators in an instant wouldn’t be difficult at all.

"But the birth of a Dao Integration cultivator will surely attract the attention of the powerhouses of the Xuanhuang Realm."

"Especially at this time—Immortal Ancestor should not have left the Xuanhuang Realm yet. I must be cautious."

With this thought, Li Fan sat on Tianyang’s shoulder and headed toward another small world's entrance he remembered.

To establish a true Federation of All Worlds, a safe and hidden base was absolutely necessary.

The location couldn’t be too small and had to contain an abundance of spiritual energy.

The local resistance force couldn’t be too strong.

Thanks to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s past campaign of cleansing various small worlds…

Li Fan just so happened to know of a small world that met all these criteria.

The entrance to this minor small was located in Shilin Prefecture.

It was hidden within the stone forest where the ruins of the Heavenly Mechanism Sect were once discovered.

In his past life, Li Fan had visited this place but hadn’t sensed the existence of any spatial passage.

That alone was proof of its concealment.

In fact, in his previous life, this small world had only revealed itself after Taiyan Sect surrendered.

They voluntarily emerged and pledged allegiance.

Otherwise, even with the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance cultivators aided by the Tianxuan Treasure Record, they might not have been able to find this small world so easily.

The underground cave system twisted and turned endlessly.

Even with memories from his past life, it still took Li Fan nearly half a day to pinpoint the exact location.

Inside a karst cave filled with hundreds of stalactites, Li Fan carefully examined his surroundings before finally detecting the entrance.

"It seems that the unique terrain here also plays a role in concealing the spatial passage."

"Perfectly suits my needs."

Li Fan nodded slightly and gently pointed at one of the stone pillars, causing faint spatial ripples to appear.

The Tianyang Puppet carried Li Fan and flew into it.

Chapter 811: The Plan of the Spiritwood Realm

"Spiritwood Realm."

Li Fan and Tianyang stood in the sky, their spiritual senses slowly sweeping over this small world.

They couldn't help but marvel at the wonders of creation.

This was a small world without cultivators or humans.

Only one kind of sentient beings existed here—treefolk born from the Spiritual-wood.

In fact, according to the records unsealed by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance in the 115th era, this Spiritwood Realm was nothing more than a barren, lifeless world thousands of years ago.

But as a single spiritual tree took root and sprouted here.

The small world gradually became vibrant and full of life.

Li Fan gazed at the towering tree, thousands of meters tall, and the treefolk who had settled upon it,

his eyes flickering with a trace of regret.

"It’s a pity this tree has already bound itself to this small world and cannot be transplanted."

"Otherwise, by simply cutting its branches and planting them in other small worlds."

"We could effortlessly resolve the problem of spiritual energy depletion."

Perhaps it was Li Fan’s blatant and undisguised malice that caught the attention of the giant tree.

The colossal tree, thousands of meters tall, suddenly swayed without any wind.

As its branches trembled, countless treefolk surged toward Li Fan like a swarm of locusts.

Li Fan let out a cold snort. "You're bringing about your own destruction!"

"Tianyang!"

Tianyang, who had been looking listless, heard his senior brother's call but didn't immediately understand his intent.

He glanced at Li Fan in confusion.

Li Fan's face twitched.

Seeing Tianyang’s innocent expression, he had no choice but to point at the incoming army of treefolk.

Only then did Tianyang react.

With a furious roar, his body instantly expanded to the size of the spiritual tree itself.

Black flames erupted from his entire being, reducing any treefolk that dared to approach into ashes in an instant.

"Be careful! Don't harm our little sapling!"

Li Fan quickly transmitted a message.

The battle was almost entirely one-sided.

Most of the treefolk in the Spiritwood Realm were only equivalent to the Qi Condensation stage.

Foundation Establishment-level treefolk were one in ten thousand.

Golden Core-level treefolk were already considered elders among them.

The strongest among the treefolk was their chieftain,

who shared a spiritual connection with the Spiritwood itself,

making them nearly invincible in this realm.

However, even they only possessed the strength of a Nascent Soul cultivator.

Against Tianyang, who was at the late Soul Transformation stage, they stood no chance.

After losing nearly half their numbers, the treefolk had no choice but to surrender.

The treefolk chieftain, in stark contrast to the rough appearance of her kin, was quite elegant in appearance.

"Immortal Lord, please have mercy!"

Her voice, unexpectedly, was that of a woman, tinged with sorrow.

Li Fan, however, remained unmoved. "Submit, or perish!"

The treefolk chieftain bowed deeply. "We surrender."

"Hand over the Heart of the Spiritwood, and I will spare your people."

"Don't force me to act personally, or I will turn this realm into scorched earth."

Li Fan's voice was cold and unwavering.

The treefolk chieftain's body trembled slightly.

She could not understand how this cultivator, despite visiting for the first time, already knew about the existence of the Heart of the Spiritwood.

However, at this point, she had no other choice.

Opening her mouth, she spat out a glowing green sphere, which slowly floated toward Li Fan.

The moment he refined it, Li Fan could vaguely feel that the Spiritwood in this world had already become an extension of his own body.

And the treefolk, born from the Spiritwood, now lived or died at his whim.

Thus, the Spiritwood Realm became Li Fan’s possession.

A battle across power levels—there was no way the treefolk could have resisted.

At this moment, Li Fan arrived at the heart of the Spiritwood.

A massive hollow existed within, where billions of roots from all across the Spiritwood Realm converged.

Countless branches and tendrils extended from this central space, serving as the Spiritwood’s limbs and eyes.

Through them, the Spiritwood could perceive everything occurring in this small world.

However, with the Heart of the Spiritwood now in Li Fan’s hands,

all these abilities had transferred to him.

Through the Spiritwood, he could now sense every detail of this small world.

A familiar feeling surged in Li Fan’s heart.

“This is the same method that Xiao Hei used to seize control of the Beast World’s Heavenly Dao.”

“However, the revival of this world’s vitality owes some credit to this spirit tree. So, compared to before, this should be a little easier.”

“This is a good chance to test the [Heaven’s Transformation] divine ability.”

A thought stirred in Li Fan’s mind.

As his thoughts moved, mountains and rivers suddenly emerged across the land of the Spiritwood Realm.

Li Fan freely reshaped this world, just as Mr. Bai had once done within his own personal Cave-Heaven.

However, only half a day had passed before he was forced to halt his world-altering actions.

It turned out that the power of the spirit tree itself could not withstand such reckless consumption and needed time to recover.

“How boring.”

Li Fan shook his head slightly. His figure flickered, and he arrived at the very top of the spirit tree.

Looking down upon the Spiritwood Realm, a grand and vast formation emerged before his eyes.

It was perfectly integrated with the world itself, without the slightest flaw.

Moreover, this formation was constantly evolving and improving at every moment.

“The Infinite Formation.”

Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

In that instant, using the immense computational power of the [Final Dissociation Disc], he designed a grand formation tailored specifically for the Spiritwood Realm in his mind.

Its core concept came from Zhang Zhiliang, the number one formation master of the Congyun Sea Region, and his Infinite Formation technique.

With the [Final Dissociation Disc] in his possession, the last missing piece of his envisioned Infinite Formation had finally fallen into place.

A formation that would perpetually evolve, with no upper limit.

A nightmare for all formation masters.

“If this grand formation is constructed, all conventional methods of breaking formations will be useless.”

“The only way to dismantle it will be through brute force.”

“At the scale of covering the entire Spiritwood Realm with an Infinite Formation, it would take no fewer than five or six Dao Integration cultivators arriving together to have any hope of success.”

“And if I enhance it further using some rare celestial materials, reinforcing the core formation nodes with Dao Integration-level combat power…”

“Then only a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign could break it!”

The intricate formation patterns slowly faded from Li Fan’s eyes.

“As the defensive grand formation for the headquarters of the Federation of All Worlds, this will certainly be fitting.”

“The only thing missing now is the necessary resources to construct it.”

The first force that came to Li Fan’s mind was the Five Elders Association.

At this point in time, the Five Elders Association still harbored various schemes against the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

They were stirring restlessly.

But in Li Fan’s hands, there were countless pieces of information they would be extremely interested in—bargaining chips for an exchange.

The only question was whom to approach in this life.

Zhou Qingang’s direct superior?

Tianliang Person?

Or perhaps…

A series of figures flashed through Li Fan’s mind.

What were once absolute secrets had now become mere tradeable assets in his eyes.

Gradually, an idea took shape in his mind.

In the countless cycles of reincarnation he had experienced before, it was said that both sides were evenly matched, yet the Five Elders Association’s performance had always been lacking.

“Then let me help you with all my might this time.”

“Let’s see just how deep the foundations of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance truly run.”

Li Fan’s gaze turned dark and profound.

This time, he would sit back and watch the tigers fight!

Chapter 812: The Refining of Vital Essence for All Beings

Spiritwood Realm.

The Tianyang Puppet was engulfed in flames as it suddenly dived from the sky, burrowing deep underground.

With continuous rumbling, in the blink of an eye, a deep passage was excavated.

Countless treefolk swarmed in, drilling into the passage.

Following Li Fan's orders, they were tasked with excavating the buried minerals and resources hidden beneath the land.

From the highest treetop, one could see that such scenes were happening all across the Spiritwood Realm.

“Master, the Spirit Tree has spent over four thousand years barely restoring the vitality of this land. The world's ecosystem is still extremely fragile. If we continue such destructive excavation…” The Treefolk Chieftain advised anxiously.

Li Fan simply smiled, saying, “Your vision is too narrow. If resources are left unused, buried underground, they are no different from ordinary rocks. Only by making full use of them and developing swiftly can we follow the true path.”

“As long as we become strong enough to plunder from other worlds and replenish ourselves before our resources are exhausted and our world declines, it will be enough.”

“To be confined to a single world, stagnating in one place—even if you survive for a time, you will inevitably be devoured by other worlds sooner or later.”

The Treefolk Chieftain had never heard such a theory before and was momentarily stunned. “Is… is that really so?”

Li Fan did not answer. Instead, he wore a profound, unreadable expression.

Watching the countless treefolk toiling diligently, a sudden idea struck him:

“If I help these treefolk collectively enhance their strength, I wonder if it will yield cultivation feedback through the Sitting Immortal Art?”

Treefolk were incapable of cultivation. Their strength was fixed from birth and depended entirely on the Spirit Tree.

The stronger the Spirit Tree, the more powerful the treefolk it birthed.

As heavenly spiritual entities, if nurtured with the right methods, their growth could be far swifter than that of cultivators.

At the very least, Li Fan knew of no fewer than ten rare heavenly treasures that could nourish Spirit Trees.

Sharing the Spirit Tree’s omniscient vision, Li Fan had an exact grasp of the world’s hidden valuable resources.

Under his direction, Tianyang maneuvered through the earth like a loach, spending a few days first clearing the passageways.

After assigning the Treefolk Chieftain to oversee the mining efforts, Li Fan took Tianyang and temporarily returned to the Xuanhuang Realm.

On the way, he made a stop at the ruins of the Heavenly Mechanism Sect.

He looted all remaining treasures, including the Heaven and Earth Divination Dice.

“Currently, there is no Federation of All Worlds in existence. If I were to suddenly approach the Five Elders Association, gaining their trust would be just as difficult as in my past lives—it would take considerable effort.”

“It would be better to first establish the renown of the Federation of All Worlds…”

“Anchor to Year 6.”

Recalling the various events of that year, Li Fan quickly identified a suitable target.

Before long, the Five Elders Association would launch a surprise attack on Jiushan Prefecture, aiming to seize the territory.

However, for some reason, their plans were leaked. Not only did the ambush fail, but they also fell into a trap set by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, getting encircled and ultimately suffering a crushing defeat.

This incident later became a classic case repeatedly referenced by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Li Fan was well aware of every detail.

Jiushan Prefecture, positioned at the border between the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association, was formed from the remains of the ancient (Heaven) beast after its death.

Due to its unstable spatial properties, teleportation formation could not function within the prefecture’s boundaries.

This made governance exceedingly costly, so the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance only maintained a stronghold at the strategic Jiushan Gorge, largely ignoring the rest of the region.

As a result, Jiushan Prefecture became a chaotic melting pot, unlike any other territory.

Aside from the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, the region also housed various native forces, with the Lingyuan Sect at the forefront.

Moreover, the Five Elders Association had secretly planted many sleeper agents there.

Jiushan Prefecture was easy to defend but difficult to attack. Whoever controlled it would gain a significant strategic advantage.

The Five Elders Association had long coveted the prefecture but had been unable to devise a successful method to seize it.

Not long after, they launched another attack because they believed they had successfully turned the Lingyuan Sect against its own allies.

As the largest native force in Jiushan State, the Lingyuan Sect was technically under the jurisdiction of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, yet it remained relatively independent.

The sect housed many Nascent Soul True Lords and Soul Transformation True Monarchs, and its members were highly united.

It was a force that could not be underestimated.

If they were to defect and coordinate from within, there was indeed a possibility of taking over Jiushan State in one swift move.

Because of this, after several secret meetings with the Five Elders Association and confirming that the Lingyuan Sect would provide assistance, they launched their surprise attack.

However, somehow, their plans were leaked.

The reinforcements from the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance arrived incredibly quickly—almost as if they had predicted everything in advance.

Realizing that the situation had turned against them, the Lingyuan Sect switched sides once again on the battlefield, launching a counterattack against the Five Elders Association.

This battle completely shattered the Five Elders Association’s hope of advancing through Jiushan Prefecture.

As a result, they shifted their strategic focus toward Tianling Prefecture instead.

“Lingyuan Sect…” Li Fan quickly went over the sequence of events in his mind.

He recalled this rather peculiar organization and frowned slightly.

Although in the grand scheme of the Xuanhuang Realm, the Lingyuan Sect was no more than an insignificant force, within Jiushan Prefecture, they were an entity that could not be ignored.

Given the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s usual way of handling things, it was surprising that they tolerated such an independent organization within their territory.

Aside from the unique terrain of Jiushan Prefecture, it had a lot to do with the Lingyuan Sect’s ability to “rise from the ashes.”

Their cultivation method, Vital Essence Technique of All Living Beings, became more effective the more people practiced it simultaneously.

This helped offset the negative effects of incompatible cultivation techniques.

Li Fan had studied this technique before.

However, it was obvious that there was something suspicious about it, so he had no interest in cultivating it himself.

“The leader of the Lingyuan Sect has never appeared in public. His identity is extremely mysterious.”

“No matter how many times the Lingyuan Sect has been wiped out in the past, it always resurfaces quickly due to the unique nature of its cultivation technique.”

“Moreover, aside from Vital Essence Technique of All Living Beings, the sect seems to possess other secret arts—not only do they eliminate the mutual hostility usually caused by practicing the same technique, but they also allow for the repeated and cyclical use of Cave-Heavens.”

“For example, the Peach Blossom Cave-Heaven I saw in the past had previously appeared in the hands of another cultivator.”

“…”

“There must be some special restriction involved. Otherwise, no matter how well he hides, he would have been found by now.”

Li Fan slowly pondered over everything related to the Lingyuan Sect.

“However, on this trip, I don’t need to clash with them.”

“I only need to assist the Five Elders Association in taking over Jiushan Prefecture.”

With this thought in mind, Li Fan stood atop his Tianyang Puppet, speeding toward Jiushan Prefecture.

Upon entering its territory, he deployed a formation to conceal his presence.

He then went into hiding near Tianlao Mountain.

“The Five Elders Association would never have imagined that their defeat was not due to a traitor leaking information.”

“It was merely a coincidence.”

As this thought crossed Li Fan’s mind, he soon saw a young man dressed in white slowly appearing on the horizon.

Chapter 813: The Heaven-Blessed Twin Gourd

"The Nine Mountains are immovable, cultivators sigh towards the heavens. Truly a rare and magnificent sight!"

"Such a grand and majestic mountain range—if an ordinary prefecture had just one of these, it would be enough to become famous throughout the world. Yet here, there are a full nine of them!"

A white-clad young man slowly walked to the foot of the Tianlao Mountains, sighing in admiration.

The youth had fair skin and a rather handsome appearance. However, in his eyes, there was a determination beyond his years.

Around his neck hung a long rope woven from green vine, at the end of which was tied a green gourd.

The young man shook the gourd slightly, then pulled out its stopper, aiming its mouth toward the towering Tianlao Mountain Range ahead.

After adjusting its position slightly, he finally nodded in satisfaction.

"Collect!"

With a soft command, a phantom-like image seemed to be drawn from the distant Tianlao Mountains, absorbed into the green gourd.

The young man brought the gourd close to his nose, taking a deep breath.

"Indeed, a breathtaking scene!"

His face was filled with intoxicated delight.

However, in the very next moment, his expression froze, and his body became completely motionless.

A figure silently appeared behind him, reaching out and taking the green gourd from his hand.

"The Heavenly Scene Treasure Gourd... now this is quite the remarkable artifact," the person chuckled wickedly.

The young man’s eyes instantly flashed with terror.

Li Fan ordered Tianyang to grab the young man, while he stored away the Treasure Gourd.

"Shang Tianci, a member of the 'Mountains and Rivers Pavilion' within the Immortal Alliance. Formed his Golden Core at the age of eighteen, a truly peerless talent."

"His companion artifact, the 'Heavenly Scene Treasure Gourd,' can capture the essence of mountains and rivers of the Xuanhuang world, forming nearly identical replicas within it, though slightly reduced in size."

"More impressively, with a single thought, he can instantly teleport to any location recorded within the gourd. If not for my Insect-Binding Divine Ability, even a Soul Transformation cultivator would find it difficult to capture him so easily."

Li Fan’s divine sense peered into the Treasure Gourd, where he saw a landscape shrouded in mist, dotted with unique mountains and rivers.

Some of them were places he recognized, such as the Taihua Ten Peaks and Tianling Thousand Waters.

And now, the Tianlao Mountains, which Shang Tianci had just captured, were also among them!

"Just entered the Golden Core stage, yet dares to venture alone into the chaotic Nine Mountains Prefecture... truly fearless like a newborn calf before a tiger."

"If not for me, the events that are about to unfold would have positioned him as the protagonist of this tale."

"During his journey, he would have coincidentally stumbled upon a raid by the Five Elders Association."

"With the Lingyuan Sect coordinating from within, the Five Elders Association had already deployed heavy forces to seal off the Nine Mountains Province—allowing entry but forbidding exit. They even blocked all means of communication, aiming to buy time. Swift action was key: before the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance could respond, they intended to seize the prefecture in one decisive strike."

"But luck was not on their side. They just so happened to encounter an anomaly like Shang Tianci, who, thanks to his companion artifact, was able to teleport within the province despite the spatial restrictions."

"Thus, the intelligence was leaked, and their plan failed."

Li Fan’s thoughts turned as he recalled the official statement the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had given on this matter in his past life.

"However, that still doesn’t guarantee we know the full truth."

"I need to observe further."

"As for this brat…"

Li Fan turned to glance at the immobilized Shang Tianci.

Tianyang took the hint and knocked the young man unconscious with a slap.

Then, Li Fan flicked his finger, sending a small red light orb, infused with his own essence blood, into Shang Tianci’s body.

It was none other than the Bloodline Transmission Technique, an art that could influence the mind and soul.

"The Federation of All Worlds can’t consist of just me alone. A talent like this? He'd be a perfect figurehead."

Standing atop Tianyang, Li Fan flew toward the peak of the Tianlao Mountains.

He casually set up a formation to conceal his presence before looking out into the distance, waiting for the Five Elders Association’s army to arrive.

"They should be here soon."

As he waited, Li Fan examined the Treasure Gourd he had just obtained.

Even though it was Shang Tianci’s companion artifact, for some reason, the youth had never used it to establish his Dao Foundation.

Instead, he had treated it like an ordinary treasure, merely carrying it around.

Li Fan extended his spiritual sense into the Green Gourd, attempting to interact with the landscapes inside—to see if he could teleport between these scenes as Shang Tianci did.

But no matter what he tried, the landscapes ignored him, showing no response whatsoever.

"It cannot be refined using spiritual energy. Even my [Truth] cannot connect with it or absorb it…"

"It seems this really is an exclusive treasure bound solely to him."

Li Fan tried for a while without success, then shook his head slightly and gave up.

"Such treasures are not used for Foundation Establishment. Then what kind of miraculous item did he use for his Foundation Establishment?"

Li Fan walked over to the unconscious Shang Tianci and carefully examined him.

"Hmm?" After a moment, Li Fan's eyes revealed a hint of surprise.

On the surface of Shang Tianci’s Golden Core, an engraving of a purple-gold gourd was distinctly visible.

Its appearance was identical to the Heavenly Scene Gourd, except its aura was even more profound and regal.

"Twin Gourds? Interesting."

Li Fan's gaze flickered.

However, he had no intention of directly taking it by force.

For one, Shang Tianci was still of some use to him.

For another, just like the Heavenly Scene Gourd, this accompanying miraculous item was likely bound to its owner—impossible to seize.

"Perhaps a being like Mr. Bai, a manifestation of the Heavenly Dao, could borrow it without any obstacles. But me? No chance."

The treasure was right in front of him, yet he was not destined to enjoy it.

However, Li Fan did not feel the slightest sense of urgency.

He simply narrowed his eyes and silently observed the progress of the bloodline assimilation within Shang Tianci’s body.

By the time Shang Tianci slowly regained consciousness and looked again at the mysterious figure who had captured him, the fear in his heart had completely vanished.

Instead, a sense of closeness and trust had taken its place.

"Young man, what do you think of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance?" Li Fan asked in an odd tone.

"Huh?" Shang Tianci was momentarily stunned, not expecting such a random question.

Instinctively, he answered, "The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is great! Everyone has access to cultivation techniques, and there's no need to worry about personal safety..."

Li Fan snorted coldly and interrupted him, "Great? Can you not see how many cultivators toil endlessly for half their lives just for a single technique? If it were a true technique, that would be one thing."

"But they deliberately split the techniques and sell them separately! One technique for Foundation Establishment, then when you reach Golden Core, you have to exchange for another. Nascent Soul, Soul Transformation—it’s the same all the way up!"

"They treat cultivators like cattle and horses!"

Shang Tianci was about to argue but was suddenly tapped on the forehead by Li Fan.

In an instant, countless scenes of lower-level cultivators struggling desperately for mere contribution points flooded his mind.

As a prodigy of his generation, Shang Tianci had never realized just how difficult it was for an average cultivator to progress step by step from a mere mortal to Qi Condensation, Foundation Establishment, and Golden Core...

For many, even spending a lifetime would not be enough to break through a realm that he could easily surpass with a flick of his hand.

For the first time in his life, he truly understood.

His mind was shaken to the core, beyond words.

Li Fan continued to whisper, weaving his words like a spell.

Slowly, Shang Tianci’s gaze began to change.

Chapter 814: The Fall of Jiushan Prefecture

A teenage boy, brimming with youthful vigor, was at the most impressionable age—easily swayed.

Moreover, Shang Tianci had fallen under Li Fan’s [Bloodline Transmission] technique, making him deeply trust Li Fan.

Who was Li Fan? Even as a mere mortal, he could deceive countless people with just his words, making them willingly risk their lives for him.

Thus, it took little effort for Li Fan to successfully brainwash Shang Tianci.

"The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is rotten beyond repair. As cultivators, it is our duty to overthrow it."

"Only then will a golden age of true freedom in cultivation techniques truly begin!"

Shang Tianci felt his blood boil, an unprecedented sense of mission surging within him.

As for what would happen after overthrowing the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance…

And whether such freedom in cultivation techniques could actually be realized…

That was no longer within his scope of concern.

"The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is powerful, while our strength is still weak. We must proceed carefully."

"The first step is to unite all forces that can be united—such as the wandering Cave-heaven of Xuanhuang and the many small world itself…"

Shang Tianci's eyes lit up. "A united of all Worlds… Brilliant!"

Li Fan continued to instill various ideas into him.

However, their conversation was suddenly interrupted by an inexplicable oppressive atmosphere.

Both of them simultaneously looked up into the distance.

Tianlao Mountain, the tallest peak among the Nine Mountains.

From this vantage point, one could see across most of the prefecture.

At the distant border, an overwhelming mass of cultivators suddenly appeared.

"That is…?" Shang Tianci's expression turned to shock.

The attire and armor of those cultivators were starkly different from those of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

It was evident that they belonged to another major force of the Xuanhuang realm—the Five Elders Association.

"This is bad! We are under attack! I must immediately—"

Shang Tianci instinctively reached for his Heavenly Scene Treasure Gourd to teleport away, but after searching for a moment, he realized it was missing.

Only then did he remember—it was still in Li Fan’s hands.

"Senior!"

Just as he was about to speak, Li Fan pressed a hand on his shoulder.

"The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is corrupt. But the Five Elders Association is no better."

"The Five Heavenly Sovereigns defy the natural order, deceiving the people under their rule."

"The fiercer their battle, the better it is for us."

"As they say—set the tiger against the wolf, and watch from the mountain top!" Li Fan's voice was cold and calculating.

At first, hesitation flickered across Shang Tianci’s face.

However, after careful thought, he ultimately remained silent.

As soon as the cultivators of the Five Elders Association set foot on the land of Jiushan Prefecture…

Chaos erupted across the Nine Mountains.

Numerous cultivators wearing the robes of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance suddenly turned traitor, launching attacks on the Jiushan strongholds.

And as time passed, the number of revolting cultivators only increased.

"See? The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance has lost the people's trust. The moment someone rises in rebellion, countless others follow!" Li Fan seized the opportunity to whisper.

Shang Tianci watched the scene unfold and slowly nodded.

In truth, the Five Elders Association was not without its merits.

At the very least, this surprise attack demonstrated their exceptional organizational capabilities.

In less than half a day, most of Jiushan Prefecture had already fallen.

The forces of the Five Elders Association advanced rapidly. While some troops remained behind to secure the conquered cities, the rest pushed forward toward Tianchang Mountain, the final stronghold.

The battlefield was in chaos.

Li Fan and Shang Tianci remained hidden atop Tianlao Mountain, unnoticed for the time being.

As the most vital city of the Nine Mountains, Tianchang City was not only guarded by a Dao Integration Realm cultivator…

But also had the presence of the Ten Thousand Law Chamber of Commerce.

If the Ten Thousand Law Chamber of Commerce were to lend their full support in defending the city, they might be able to hold out until reinforcements from the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance arrived.

But it was evident that the Ten Thousand Law Chamber of Commerce was the type to gauge the situation before making a move.

From beginning to end, none of their personnel had stepped forward to fight.

Meanwhile, Tianchang Dao Integration was struggling under the siege of three Dao Integration cultivators sent by the Five Elders Association.

"It seems that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is doomed to lose. It's time for us to leave as well," said Li Fan, who had been watching the battle for a long time.

"However, before we go, we must leave something behind to prove that we were here."

"Tianyang!"

Li Fan tossed a jade slip over.

Tianyang received the order, caught the jade slip, and clenched it tightly in his palm.

Then, he hurled it forcefully in the direction of Tianchang Mountain.

Accompanying the jade slip was not just his hand—his entire palm went along with it!

Behind the severed hand, red and black flames erupted, causing its speed to increase dramatically.

Like a meteor streaking across the skies of Jiushan Prefecture, it shot directly toward its target.

"Let's go!"

Li Fan patted Shang Tianci on the shoulder. Without saying much, he simply returned the Heavenly Scene Treasure Gourd.

Shang Tiansi immediately understood his intent.

With a thought, a strange wave of energy enveloped them both.

Moments later, the two figures vanished from the peak of Tianlao Mountain!

Above Tianchang City.

The three Dao Integration cultivators of the Five Elders Association, who were besieging Tianchang's guardian, Immortal Sage Qingyu, suddenly sensed something unusual.

They turned to look at a blazing fireball hurtling toward them at high speed.

"What is that?"

At first, they suspected it was a hidden trump card from the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

But after sweeping it with their spiritual senses, they discovered that hidden within the flames was merely a jade slip.

Without any verbal exchange, the three acted in perfect coordination.

A Dao Integration cultivator, dressed in coarse cloth and resembling a middle-aged farmer, intercepted the jade slip.

After a brief inspection, all three narrowed their eyes.

"The Federation of All Worlds?"

"They helped us resolve the crisis of an information leak?"

"A method to significantly weaken the effects of the Devouring Essence White Mist and allow movement within it?"

Although the jade slip contained only a few words, the information it revealed was immense.

Sweeping their spiritual senses across the entire Jiushan Prefecture, they found no trace of the person who had sent the jade slip.

"Quite impressive."

The three of them showed expressions of intrigue and interest.

Taihua Prefecture.

Without warning, Li Fan and Shang Tianci appeared atop Taixu Mountain, one of the Ten Great Peaks of Taihua.

"This Heavenly Scene Treasure Gourd of yours is truly marvelous," Li Fan remarked, still savoring the sensation of spatial travel.

"It seems to harness the power of the Earth's veins to enable instantaneous teleportation?"

"No, actually… rather than using the Earth's veins, it feels more like it directly taps into the power of the Xuanhuang Realm to alter locations."

At that moment, Li Fan suddenly recalled the way Mr. Bai had "strolled" through space before.

A vague understanding formed in his heart.

Although Mr. Bai had perished, the various abilities that existed within the Xuanhuang Realm had not disappeared.

Instead, they had been scattered and inherited by various so-called geniuses.

"But even a person like Mr. Bai, who fully grasped the mysteries of Xuanhuang, was no match for the Immortal Ancestor."

"Let alone these so-called geniuses."

"At best, they are nothing more than top-tier nourishment in the eyes of the Immortal Ancestor!"

Li Fan contemplated the thoughts of the Immortal Ancestor.

Meanwhile, Shang Tianci remained oblivious to his musings.

Instead, he continued boasting about his Twin Treasure Gourds:

"My innate artifact is a pair of gourds."

"One purple, one green."

"You’ve already seen the green one—it can record geographical locations and enable free teleportation."

"As for the purple gourd…"

Chapter 815: The Secret Technique Sensing Xuantian

Shang Tianci paused for a moment and then spoke mysteriously, “This purple gourd can materialize the scenes recorded in the green gourd into reality!”

“If there is enough energy, that is.”

“With my current ability, I can at most recreate a large lake spanning a hundred miles.”

“If I ascend to the Dao Integration realm, I could likely create nine mountains with just a single thought!”

Shang Tianci’s tone was full of pride.

Li Fan, intrigued, asked, “Oh? Are there any limitations on the landscapes you materialize? How long do they last? Can they be manifested within the Xuanhuang small world?”

“There are no restrictions at all,” Shang Tianci said confidently. “Once something is materialized, it remains permanently, indistinguishable from real mountains and rivers. Whether it is within the Xuanhuang Realm, a cave-heaven, or a small world, it can be done!”

“My companions from Shanhe Pavilion once had a bold idea: If I were to use my manifestation technique inside the inner Cave-Heaven of a Nascent Soul cultivator, and the manifested scene was larger than their domain, it could instantly cause that cultivator’s inner world to collapse!” Shang Tianci whispered.

Shanhe Pavilion was an unofficial organization within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Its members were all highly talented individuals from various provinces. There was a strict entry requirement—anyone who formed their Golden Core past the age of twenty was no longer eligible to join.

The organization was small, with only about fifty members.

However, they were highly united, assisting each other without discrimination based on background or family status.

“That companion of yours has quite the imagination. He is a promising talent! If possible, we should work on persuading him to join us,” Li Fan chuckled darkly.

“I think so too. Yan Fangzhou is still young, yet he has already reached the Soul Transformation realm. If he joins us, he would be a tremendous asset!” Shang Tianci nodded in agreement.
