“Soul Transformation…” Li Fan’s breath briefly paused before quickly returning to normal.

He let out a sinister laugh. “Try to interact with him more and probe his intentions. In the end, I will handle things personally.”

Just as Shang Tianci was about to respond, an urgent alarm suddenly rang out from Taihua Heavenly City, echoing across the entire Taihua Mountain Range.

The moment cultivators heard the alarm, information automatically surfaced in their minds.

“From this moment, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is entering a Class-A wartime state.”

“All cultivators from the Martial Halls, Garrison Institutes, and Strategy Formation Halls in various provinces must return to the Heavenly City immediately and await orders.”

“Border patrols will be established across all prefectures—strictly guard against infiltrators.”

Li Fan smiled faintly. “The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance has finally reacted.”

Shang Tianci, however, showed a trace of concern. “I wonder how far this situation will escalate.”

“Don’t worry. The Five Elders Association will take time to consolidate their hold over Jiushan Prefecture. Meanwhile, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance won’t let this go—they will do everything they can to reclaim Jiushan Province.”

“For quite a long time, both sides will wrestle for control over Jiushan. It’s unlikely for war to break out in other prefectures…”

“Unless, of course, some unexpected factor comes into play,” Li Fan added suddenly.

Shang Tianci, though momentarily swayed by Li Fan’s words, was still young and kind-hearted.

The thought that his actions might have contributed, even slightly, to an impending brutal war left him feeling uneasy.

Li Fan did not console him, allowing him to dwell on his own thoughts.

“If my predictions are correct, the Five Elders Association should attempt to contact me soon using the communication method I left in the jade slip.”

“There’s no rush. Let’s keep them waiting a little.”

Li Fan was already contemplating how he could exploit the upcoming negotiations to demand a hefty price.

Just then, he felt an unexpected chill in his heart.

“Hmm?”

A sudden sense of vigilance surged within him.

“This strange feeling…?”

Li Fan narrowed his eyes and turned his awareness inward.

In an instant, he found the source of the disturbance.

It was the secret technique—Execution of Xuantian!

This was a technique taught by Jiang Yushan of the Medicine King Sect in his 115th lifetime. In ancient times, it was specifically used to identify the remnants of the Xuantian Sect!

Since he had been attempting to gather as much secret information about the Xuantian Sect as possible, he had kept the Execution of Xuantian technique active ever since leaving the Xuanhuang Realm in this lifetime.

Originally, he had no expectations regarding his own luck.

Unexpectedly, after randomly teleporting with Shang Tianci, he happened to encounter this place!

"Taixu Mountain."

Li Fan scanned his surroundings.

"One of the Ten Meridians of Taihua. Before long, it will mysteriously collapse and be forgotten by the world, turning the Ten Meridians into the Nine Meridians of Taihua."

"To think that remnants of the Xuantian Sect would be here?"

Li Fan couldn't help but become interested.

He was already aware that a Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect was currently in deep slumber beneath the ruins of the Purple Heaven Sect.

However, he had no intention of capturing him just yet.

At least, not for now.

As one of the most formidable forces of the ancient Xuantian Sect, the Dharma King’s strength was undoubtedly on par with an ordinary Dao Integration cultivator.

Moreover, the cultivation techniques of the Xuantian Sect were strange and profound. Li Fan had already experienced them in Senior Sister Zhao’s dream.

Even after slumbering for thousands of years, that Dharma King was likely beyond what Li Fan could handle at the moment.

If he failed to capture him and was instead forced to reveal his true strength...

No, it was better to be cautious.

The Dharma King wasn’t going anywhere.

Once the Medicine King True Cauldron was recovered and Li Fan had subdued powerful allies like Liu San at the Dao Integration level...

Perhaps then, he would give it a try.

Bringing his thoughts back to the present, Li Fan roamed Taixu Mountain, carrying the Execution of Xuantian Secret Technique in his heart.

The sensing range of this secret technique was not very precise.

Even after half a day, he had yet to locate the source of the anomaly.

"Senior, what are you looking for?" Shang Tianci asked curiously.

"Hmm. There seems to be some hidden secret within Taixu Mountain. Help me search for it."

Li Fan sized up Shang Tianci and immediately came up with an idea.

Without hesitation, he passed down the Execution of Xuantian Secret Technique to him—but he did not explain its true purpose.

After learning it, Shang Tianci joined Li Fan in searching the mountain.

Fortunately, due to the wartime alert, people were on edge.

Most cultivators had returned to Taihua Heavenly City for safety, avoiding unnecessary risks.

Otherwise, the sight of the two of them sneaking around would have certainly aroused suspicion.

After searching for most of the day, it was ultimately Shang Tianci’s superior luck that paid off.

He seemed to have discovered something and urgently transmitted a message:

"Senior, over here!"

Li Fan’s eyes flashed. With Tianyang in tow, he swiftly arrived at Shang Tianci’s side.

"How many chimes?" Li Fan asked.

"Two."

In the Xuantian Sect, the warning chimes from the Execution of Xuantian Secret Technique increased with the target’s rank.

Back when he sensed the Tianxuan Mirror, there had been three chimes.

Two chimes were less than that, but still not a minor figure.

"Interesting."

Li Fan could indeed feel the continuous warnings from the Execution of Xuantian Secret Technique.

He carefully observed his surroundings.

They stood in a deep valley nestled within the mountains.

It was eerily quiet.

It seemed as though no one had set foot here for a thousand years.

Chapter 816: Refining a Magic Treasure with Spirit Wood

“There’s something eerie about this place,” Shang Tianci muttered in a low voice.

Li Fan also sensed that something was unusual about this valley.

Tianyang took a quick step forward, blocking Li Fan’s path.

Li Fan followed closely behind, carefully observing his surroundings.

The valley floor lay beneath a towering mountain, shrouded in mist and never seeing sunlight. A miasma filled the air.

The flora and fauna here were unlike those found on Mount Taixu.

It was as if they had suddenly stepped into another world.

“This miasma… it can actually interfere with spiritual sense.”

Walking through the valley required caution. Their vision was obstructed, and even their spiritual sense couldn’t fully perceive the area.

Not long after moving forward, Shang Tianci suddenly stopped.

“The ringing sound has disappeared,” he said abruptly, turning his head.

Li Fan pondered for a moment. Based on the warning sound, he pinpointed a general area within the valley.

It was only about three meters in diameter, completely visible at a glance.

However, there were no signs of any remnants of the Xuantian Sect.

“Hm?”

Li Fan and Shang Tianci exchanged glances.

With a burst of spiritual energy, they cleared the area of weeds and animals.

After scraping away a thick layer of mud, a smooth stone slab was revealed.

“This is…”

Li Fan touched the stone slab, finding it oddly familiar.

A moment later, it hit him. It wasn’t something he had seen in the present world of Xuanhuang, but rather in the Fallen Immortal Realm, during the Ningyuan’s Longevity Fruit Incident.

Back in Ningyuan City, inside the small house of Mr. Bai, he had seen a similar stone slab.

The Dao Deviation Stone flickered with a blue glow as memories resurfaced.

Li Fan’s expression turned strange.

These two stone slabs weren’t just similar.

They were identical.

“The Absolute Immortal Stone Slab...”

“Could it be…” A thought arose in Li Fan’s mind.

He ordered Tianyang to lift the slab while he himself swiftly retreated to a safe distance.

After Tianyang entered the underground chamber, explored it, and returned without encountering danger, Li Fan finally descended.

The scene was almost identical to what he had experienced before.

The confined space held a faceless stone statue leaning against the wall.

Perhaps due to the isolation effect of the Absolute Immortal Stone Slab, a long brown wooden table stood in the middle, unchanged even after thousands of years.

Even the air still carried a faint, lingering scent of blood.

A wooden chest sat at the corner of the table, transparent ceramic jars lined the walls, and twenty-eight beast remains were buried in the ground at the room’s edge.

Every detail confirmed it—this was the very same underground chamber beneath Mr. Bai’s house in the Fallen Immortal Realm!

To see something from the Fallen Immortal Realm inexplicably appear before him…

The realization struck Li Fan with a bizarre sense of time and space twisting and overlapping.

“Could Mount Taixu have once been Ningyuan City?”

“If so, then wouldn’t the Purple Heaven Sect be nearby?”

Li Fan’s eyes flickered as he quickly compared the information from Ximen Yu’s Ancient and Modern Geography Studies.

“They don’t match.”

A moment later, Li Fan frowned slightly.

According to past-life intelligence from Jiao Xiuyuan, the ruins of the Purple Heaven Sect were now located in Linlang Prefecture, in the central region of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

That was far from here.

Yet back then, Ningyuan City had been within the Purple Heaven Sect’s sphere of influence. It couldn’t have been more than ten thousand miles away.

“It seems that there’s an error in Ximen Yu’s geographical studies.”

“Though, I can’t really blame him. Who would have thought that within the same prefecture, after thousands of years, two locations would end up worlds apart?”

“This isn’t just a natural change in geography. It’s as if someone deliberately cut and separated them.”

Li Fan had long known that the present-day Xuanhuang Realm was formed from the fusion of the original Xuanhuang world and several other realms.

“But now, it looks like there was more than just fusion.”

“There was modification as well.”

“What exactly was the Immortal Ancestor trying to achieve?”

“At the end of the 115th era, when the True Immortal destroyed the world with a single glance, that earth-shattering roar… Could it have come from Immortal Ancestor?”

“It seems that the Xuanhuang Realm holds a special significance for him.”

Li Fan slowly calmed his thoughts. To be cautious, he ordered Tianyang to dig three feet deep in this area to ensure that nothing was left behind.

"This Faceless Xuantian Divine Statue is entirely made of Absolute Immortal Stone. It is quite valuable."

"However, rather than selling it, it would be better to use it as a symbol of the Federation of All Worlds. After all, under the heavens, this might be the last remaining Xuantian Divine Statue."

Li Fan then thought of the Xuantian Sect's Dharma King, who was still in deep slumber beneath the Purple Heaven Sect.

"Perhaps it might prove useful when the time comes."

After storing away the divine statue, the mystical induction of the Xuantian Execution Secret Art also returned to a state of tranquility.

"Senior, what exactly is that statue? It looks a bit eerie," Shang Tianci couldn't help but ask.

"This pertains to ancient secrets. Its history is so distant that it predates even the rise of the Immortal Ancestor. You will understand in due time," Li Fan replied with a mysterious smile, revealing just enough to spark Shang Tianci’s curiosity.

As they were about to leave, Li Fan had a sudden thought and simply cut away the entire underground chamber to take it with him.

Shang Tianci was left utterly speechless at the sight.

Li Fan remained indifferent and later accompanied Shang Tianci back to the Spiritwood Realm.

On the way, they encountered patrolling cultivators while crossing the regional borders. Fortunately, Li Fan possessed the Sky-Shrouding Hand secret technique, which allowed him to evade detection.

"Little Shang, what do you think of this place?"

Standing atop the Sacred Spirit Tree, Li Fan asked Shang Tianci, who was beside him.

"It’s… good, but…"

"It feels too ordinary."

After much hesitation, Shang Tianci finally found the right word.

"Indeed. It’s mostly endless plains, with very few majestic mountains or breathtaking landscapes. Compared to the Xuanhuang Realm, which is full of natural wonders, this place simply cannot compare. That’s why the next step will depend on you." Li Fan spoke with deep meaning.

"Huh?" Shang Tianci was momentarily stunned, clearly unable to grasp Li Fan’s intent.

"That Purple Gold Gourd of yours, doesn’t it have the power to manifest the wonders of the Xuanhuang Realm? You should bring those sceneries into the Spiritwood Realm. Even if they aren’t as grand as the originals, it doesn’t matter."

"Let’s recreate the Xuanhuang Realm within this small world!"

"Imagine—when newcomers arrive, the first thing they see is the same breathtaking landscapes as the Xuanhuang Realm!"

"How magnificent would that be?"

Li Fan murmured excitedly.

Shang Tianci, too, found his breathing quickening with anticipation.

"I’ll get started right away!"

The straightforward young man pounded his chest in determination.

"Before manifesting the landscapes, make sure to plan their placement carefully."

"The Chieftain of the Treefolk Clan has lived for many years. If you’re uncertain about anything, you can consult her." Li Fan reminded him.

Shang Tianci nodded repeatedly.

"With Little Shang’s help, our Federation of All Worlds is finally taking shape."

"As long as the trade with the Five Elders Association is completed and we have all the necessary resources, construction can officially begin."

Li Fan felt a slight sense of satisfaction in his heart.

"I wonder… could I refine the Spiritwood Realm into a portable treasure?"

"If I replace its anchor point and bind it to [Truth], it could serve as a solid and stable base. Right now, that does seem quite important."

Li Fan couldn’t help but speculate.

Chapter 817: Li Fan Takes Over

[Truth] had countless advantages, but its only drawback was that each simulation allowed for the preservation of only one item.

The choice between cultivation progress and treasures often left Li Fan in a dilemma.

However, the newly introduced feature of bound-item replacement solved a major issue for him.

That said, anchor points were not easy to come by.

So far, no method had been found to increase their energy charge.

Thus, whether to replace an item or not required careful consideration.

"However, I already have an idea on how to create new anchor points."

"I just need an opportunity to test it myself."

With Shang Tianci working diligently, the once monotonous scenery of the Spiritwood Realm gradually transformed, displaying a myriad of breathtaking landscapes.

As various wondrous sights that should not have existed appeared, combined with the towering Spirit Trees within the realm, the world itself seemed to be undergoing some kind of profound transformation.

Having refined the Heart of the Spiritwood, Li Fan was highly attuned to these changes.

"This is essentially the equivalent of plundering external resources and using them to nourish this world."

"The Spiritwood Realm had already reached its limit, but if it receives a continuous supply of external energy, it might undergo what is known as ascension."

Li Fan carefully sensed whether this change was reflected in his cultivation progress.

Unfortunately, after a long period of observation, he found nothing.

Perhaps the world had yet to undergo a true transformation. Or perhaps, the concept of a world itself was beyond the scope of the Sitting Immortal Art.

However, another source of feedback was much clearer.

Upon closer inspection, Li Fan vaguely saw the figures of Su Yuqing and others who had left the realm.

"In an environment as barren of spiritual energy as the Great Li Realm, even within an artificially created cultivation field, they've already managed to break into the Qi Condensation Stage this quickly…"

"Not bad."

Li Fan nodded to himself.

"It looks like I need to pick up the pace as well."

After giving some instructions, Li Fan did not bring Tianyang with him. Instead, he traveled alone to Congyun Sea.

Compared to the tense atmosphere across the various prefectures of the mainland, Congyun Sea remained relatively unchanged.

The shadow of war had yet to spread here. Cultivators could still be seen coming and going swiftly between islands.

Concealing his presence, Li Fan silently flew toward the western-central waters of Congyun Sea, approaching an island known as Haixuan Island.

From afar, he could see a grand formation enveloping the island, radiating an unmistakable aura of killing intent, warning outsiders to stay away.

"The [Taihuang Eight Extremes Dragon-Slaying Formation]… It is said that two Soul Transformation formation masters were hired at great cost to set it up. Any cultivator below the Dao Integration Realm who steps inside will either die or be gravely injured."

Li Fan's eyes gleamed with insight.

Within his Sea of Consciousness, the Final Dissociation Disc emitted a soft white glow.

In an instant, the seemingly unbreakable formation before him was completely unraveled.

Without triggering even the slightest reaction from the formation, Li Fan slipped inside, transforming into an imperceptible black streak.

"Senior Ji, come on…"

From within Haixuan Island, the flirtatious laughter of several women could be faintly heard.

"What a fragrant wine! And such fragrant beauties!"

Alongside the laughter came the wanton, unrestrained voice of a middle-aged man.

Li Fan quietly hovered above a cave dwelling on the island, peering downward.

The master of Haixuan Island, a Golden Core cultivator named Ji Shaoli, sat in indulgence, holding two identical twin female cultivators in his arms.

Below him, seven more women of various enchanting physiques danced seductively.

Even with Grand Preceptor Li’s discerning eye, these nine female cultivators could at least be considered of above-average beauty.

"Ji Shaoli… the greatest winner in the history of Congyun Sea’s 'Fixed Fish' wager, a man whom countless cultivators envy."

"A mere Foundation Establishment cultivator, yet he already amassed five million in wealth."

"Unfortunately, he succumbed to a life of pleasure, and his cultivation stagnated at the Golden Core Realm…"

Information about the other party flashed through Li Fan's mind in an instant.

"For his own pleasure, he even built a grand harem on this island. Whenever he had free time, he would select beautiful women from among the mortals, train them in cultivation, and then indulge in them."

"To prevent outsiders from spying and to protect his own life, he even invited a Soul Transformation Formation Master to set up the [Taihuang Eight Extremes Dragon-Slaying Formation] on the island."

"A man who knows how to enjoy himself."

"Unfortunately, with the arrival of the Crimson Flame, he is doomed to perish."

Li Fan shook his head slightly.

Hidden above, he had been watching in secret, waiting for the fierce battle to conclude. Only after Ji Shaoli embraced his harem of female cultivators and drifted into a deep sleep did Li Fan descend like a phantom, appearing right beside him.

With a flicker of power, he activated the Binding Insect Divine Ability, instantly seizing control of Ji Shaoli.

At the same time, his Cloud-Water Illusion Dream Technique enveloped the female cultivators present.

When they awoke, they would only believe that they had fallen out of favor with Ji Shaoli and had been banished from the island.

As for Ji Shaoli…

Li Fan had decided to replace him with a clone!

Since he planned to sit back and watch the tigers fight, there was no need to join the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

However, without the Tianxuan Mirror, accessing information or conducting trade would be highly inconvenient.

After some thought, Li Fan came up with a solution.

There were many reasons for choosing Ji Shaoli.

The man was already immensely wealthy—within Congyun Sea, he could be considered a true tycoon.

This saved Li Fan the trouble of amassing resources from scratch.

Moreover, Haixuan Island, originally one of the many strongholds guarding Congyun Sea, had long since lost its strategic value due to the depletion of its natural resources and had been abandoned.

Ji Shaoli had purchased the island, restored it, and fully equipped it with infrastructure.

Now, it possessed everything necessary—a teleportation formation leading to Ten Thousand Immortal Island, a personal Tianxuan Mirror, and more.

Occupying this island would save Li Fan considerable effort.

"Before, I was wary that the Tianxuan Mirror might monitor the surroundings and expose my secrets, so I was always careful and rarely carried it with me."

"But now that I have the [Final Dissociation Disc] as protection, I don’t need to worry about that anymore."

...

Using the Purple Heaven Soul-Viewing Technique, Li Fan completely extracted Ji Shaoli’s memories.

He then took a drop of Ji Shaoli’s blood and used the Mysterious True Spirit Transformation to create a perfect clone identical to him.

Afterward, he crafted a stone coffin.

Just as he had done in his 115th lifetime with Zhou Qingang, he sealed Ji Shaoli away.

Out of generosity, he even used the Cloud-Water Illusion Dream Technique to keep Ji Shaoli permanently trapped in an illusion of endless pleasure.

Three days later, the female cultivators left the island with a few spirit stones, their expressions sorrowful.

Meanwhile, Ji Shaoli had already been suppressed deep within the Congyun Sea.

Without a sound, Haixuan Island had changed owners.

"Without the Dissociation Disc to disrupt formations and deceive the Tianxuan Mirror, without the Mysterious True Spirit Transformation to swap identities…"

"Even if someone conquered this island, they would never be able to seize his wealth so effortlessly as I have."

Ji Shaoli’s clone examined his current contribution points—6.78 million.

It was actually far more than when he had once won the grand prize.

"Hmm, judging by his transaction history, Ji Shaoli was quite a capable individual."

"He knew how to make wealth grow instead of squandering it."

"Compared to Fellow Daoist He, he’s much better."

Chapter 818: The Divine Manifestation on Yin Yin Island

"However, he cannot be compared to me."

Clone Ji Shaoli’s eyes flickered. Based on experiences from his past lives, he made a series of rapid moves, spending 500,000 contribution points in an instant.

He exchanged all of his contribution points for materials that were expected to appreciate significantly in the near future.

"Hmm, it seems that the fall of Nine Mountains Prefecture has indeed had some impact."

"The price trends of some goods have already changed. Some are surging ahead of time, while others are devaluing in ways that didn’t happen before."

The clone manipulated the Tianxuan Mirror, while a faint ghostly glow isolated the mirror, preventing it from sensing anything outside.

Spending another million contribution points, he made a massive purchase of commonly used items.

After storing them away, Li Fan quietly left Haixuan Island.

The clone remained in place but reached out to He Zhenghao.

That’s right—Ji Shaoli was also acquainted with He Zhenghao.

After all, Daoist He was widely connected, and since they were both in the Congyun Sea, it wasn’t surprising that they knew each other.

However, they had only met a few times and didn’t share a deep friendship.

"Daoist He, how have you been lately?"

"Would you be willing to come to Haixuan Island for a gathering?"

It wasn’t just He Zhenghao—the clone extended invitations to all cultivators with whom he had some connection in his memories, inviting them to a banquet.

"While orchestrating a battle between the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association, the research on [Foundation Establishment Through Oneself] must not be neglected."

"After all, this is what truly threatens the foundation of the Immortal Ancestor system."

After leaving Haixuan Island, Li Fan’s eyes gleamed as he made his way directly toward Yin Yin Island.

Upon arrival, he did not act recklessly.

Instead, he carefully observed his surroundings.

Faintly, he could hear the distant wails of mortals coming from the island.

Clearly, the mysterious study of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma was still ongoing.

A small dog with an eye embedded in its belly was running wildly across the island, a white rib bone clenched in its mouth.

It seemed unusually happy.

"Master Yin took three years to successfully establish a foundation through oneself."

"That was not long ago."

Li Fan pondered for a moment and decided not to act arrogantly. He transmitted a message: "Daoist Yin, are you here?"

The memories of his battles with Master Yin in past lifetimes were still vivid.

Even with his Nascent Soul cultivation and countless powerful mystical techniques, he had been unable to overcome Master Yin.

It was only by resorting to the Chaos Character that he had finally slain him.

In this lifetime, however, Li Fan would not use the Chaos Character lightly, as it could disrupt the Immortal Ancestor.

Moreover, he was relying on Master Yin to further develop the Foundation Establishment Through Oneself technique.

If persuasion could work, that would be ideal.

"I’m here. Please come in, Daoist."

The stone gate on the island rumbled open, and Li Fan descended.

The humanoid dog suddenly turned its head, fixing its gaze on Li Fan.

With a deep, threatening growl, its eyes filled with vigilance.

The moment it opened its mouth, the white rib bone fell to the ground with a clatter.

Li Fan’s eyes flickered as he summoned the bone into his hand.

This rib bone had once belonged to the first cultivator, Daoist Su, who had been infected by the Immortal-Mortal Miasma.

In his 115th lifetime, Li Fan had thrown this bone to divert the attention of a monstrous entity formed from countless corpses within the white mist, allowing him to escape with his life.

Seeing its beloved treasure taken, the humanoid dog’s gaze turned ferocious.

However, when Li Fan merely glanced at it, the creature suddenly recoiled in fear.

In an instant, it shrank back, its tail drooping, and scurried into a nearby building on the island.

Li Fan chuckled lightly and followed.

He was no stranger to this place and soon found Master Yin.

Just as in previous lifetimes, Master Yin was staring obsessively at a transparent cage, inside which a mortal subject was being tormented by his experiments.

He was muttering something under his breath.

Li Fan casually tossed the white rib bone toward him.

Master Yin instinctively caught it.

"This is…" He was stunned for a moment, then clenched the bone tightly.

“Just now, at the entrance, I found this little thing holding this in its mouth. I vaguely felt that this bone was somewhat extraordinary. It seems the little one was being mischievous and stole it to play with.” Li Fan explained with a smile.

Master Yin immediately understood and harshly kicked the humanoid dog.

He then put away the white rib bone.

His expression softened considerably as he looked at Li Fan and asked, “I wonder what brings you here, my friend?”

Li Fan glanced around and said, “This is not the place to talk…”

Master Yin was momentarily speechless.

However, he did not dwell on it and instead led Li Fan into an underground chamber.

As they walked past the corridor displaying Master Yin’s collection, he introduced the items to Li Fan.

To his surprise, Li Fan seemed to have quite a bit of knowledge about these objects as well.

From time to time, he could even continue the conversation with relevant insights.

This greatly pleased Master Yin, who had long struggled to find someone who shared his passion.

His attitude toward Li Fan became even friendlier.

Once again, he kicked the humanoid dog, instructing it to bring two cups of dark, swirling Spirit Qi Mushroom Tea.

Before Master Yin could say anything, Li Fan casually picked up the tea and drank it all in one go.

His expression remained unchanged.

“Good tea!” He even seemed to enjoy it, as if wanting more.

This took Master Yin by surprise.

“This chamber is quite secluded. My friend, you may speak freely.” He took a sip of his tea and said calmly.

“Master Yin, are you familiar with the ‘Foundation Establishment Through Oneself’ method?”

The next moment, Li Fan’s words left him stunned.

“Cough, cough…” Master Yin choked and coughed a few times before setting down his teacup. He looked at Li Fan with a strange expression.

“You came here for the ‘Foundation Establishment Through Oneself’ method?”

Indeed, he had spoken about this method to a few others before, but most dismissed it as absurd.

They merely laughed it off.

Li Fan, however, was the first to visit him so solemnly about it.

Feeling a sense of kinship, Master Yin couldn’t help but advise, “But from what I see, you have already achieved the Golden Core stage. The ‘Foundation Establishment Through Oneself’ method is still incomplete…”

To his surprise, Li Fan raised his hand, interrupting him.

The next words he spoke were like a thunderclap.

“When I first heard of your ‘Foundation Establishment Through Oneself’ method, I was astounded.”

“However, upon careful reflection, I realized it had major flaws.”

“Thus, I devoted myself to painstaking efforts, expending great energy and time, and finally completed it.”

“Overjoyed by my success, I came here specifically to share it with you.”

“I hope Master Yin can help me identify any remaining shortcomings.”

Li Fan spoke calmly.

Upon hearing these words, Master Yin suddenly stood up.

He stared at Li Fan, his eyes full of disbelief.

He even started laughing. “You completed the ‘Foundation Establishment Through Oneself’ method? My friend, are you joking with me…?”

However, as Li Fan slowly recited the method’s full formula, one word at a time…

The smile on Master Yin’s face gradually faded.

It was first replaced by shock.

Then by solemnity.

Then by utter disbelief.

By the time Li Fan had finished explaining the entire ‘Foundation Establishment Through Oneself’ method…

Master Yin’s body was trembling uncontrollably.

“How… how is this possible…”

“This… this is impossible…”

His eyes were filled with confusion, as if he were trying to verify the feasibility of the technique.

Yet no matter how he calculated it, there was only one answer.

It was flawless—absolutely perfect.

Master Yin’s legs went weak, and he stumbled, falling to the ground.

His finger pointed at Li Fan, trembling non-stop.

For a long time, he was unable to utter a single word.

Chapter 819: A Kindred Spirit by Fate

Li Fan's face showed a trace of surprise as he feigned curiosity and asked, "Daoist Yin, what’s wrong?"

"Could it be that there is something incorrect about this [Foundation Establishment Method of the Oneself] that I have derived?"

Seeing Li Fan's expression full of confusion, Master Yin opened his mouth but hesitated, ultimately choosing to say nothing.

After a long period of bewilderment, he finally stood up again.

He bypassed Li Fan and walked to a blank wall in the underground chamber. Using his hand as a brush, he inscribed the [Foundation Establishment Method of the Oneself] in one continuous, unrestrained motion.

Once he finished writing, he stood before it, utterly enraptured.

His expression continuously shifted—sometimes filled with amazement, sometimes with deep contemplation, and sometimes with regret.

Li Fan did not interrupt him but instead stood silently beside this peerless Foundation Establishment method, observing it as well.

No one knew how much time had passed before Master Yin finally regained his senses.

He turned to Li Fan, bowed deeply, and said, "If this method was truly comprehended by you, Fellow Daoist…"

"Then you are undoubtedly a peerless genius—far beyond my reach!"

"This version of [Foundation Establishment Through Oneself] is flawless. It can be passed down as a supreme legacy!"

He then let out a long sigh. "Had I been fortunate enough to obtain this method back when I established my foundation, I wouldn’t have ended up in my current state."

Li Fan feigned ignorance and asked, "What do you mean by that, Master Yin?"

Master Yin merely grinned before his body suddenly split open, revealing another version of himself within.

He then explained,

"Once the [Foundation Establishment Through Oneself] is completed, there is no opportunity for regret or to start over." Master Yin sighed.

Li Fan seized the moment and offered consolation, saying, "In truth, there is not much difference between the two. Both paths lead to a dead end, halting at Foundation Establishment."

Master Yin was momentarily stunned. "Fellow Daoist, you mean to say…?"

Li Fan spoke frankly, "This is another reason why I sought you out, Daoist Yin."

"When I first derived the [Foundation Establishment Through Oneself], I was overjoyed. I believed I had opened an entirely new Dao. Brimming with confidence, I intended to continue deriving the next stages—Golden Core, Nascent Soul, and beyond."

"But alas…"

Li Fan shook his head slightly, his face filled with bitterness. "I pondered for a long time, yet I couldn’t find the path forward."

"After establishing my foundation in this way, all methods converge upon the self. I reasoned that the Golden Core stage would follow the same principle, and based on ancient cultivation texts, I decided to name it [Primordial Golden Core]."

"But no matter how hard I tried, I could not determine how to achieve this perfect Primordial Golden Core. It was as if all inspiration had been exhausted, or as if some force was deliberately preventing me from exploring further…"

As Li Fan spoke, his expression became pained.

Master Yin, feeling a strange sense of resonance with his words, quickly comforted him.

"Fellow Daoist, to have unraveled the mysteries of Foundation Establishment Through Oneself already makes you a one-in-a-million genius—far surpassing ordinary cultivators. You shouldn’t be so hard on yourself!"

"As for this Primordial Golden Core…"

Master Yin pondered deeply. "This is a path destined to be even more difficult—truly defying the heavens."

As he spoke, something seemed to stir in his mind, and he abruptly fell into silence.

"I have a vague premonition… Perhaps, in this lifetime, I will never be able to progress further along this new path. That is why I came to find you, Fellow Daoist ." Li Fan looked at Master Yin with sincerity.

"To be the first to propose Foundation Establishment Through Oneself, your visionary thinking is surely far beyond mine. Perhaps you can take another step forward?"

Without further ado, he poured out all his insights regarding the Primal Golden Core in one breath.

When he finished speaking, he looked at Master Yin with great expectation.

Master Yin was utterly engrossed.

"Mm… Let me think, let me think." He seemed to have fallen into deep deduction, his expression turning dazed.

Only after a long while did he finally snap back to reality.

"This method is extraordinarily difficult, even more so than Foundation Establishment Through Oneself. It is not something that can be resolved in a short time."

"Moreover, I have other matters to research…" Master Yin hesitated slightly.

"I observed the conditions on your island, Daoist Yin. Does it have something to do with the Immortal-Mortal Miasma?" Li Fan asked.

Master Yin nodded and said, “Fellow Daoist, your insight is truly sharp. I have a premonition that within this Immortal-Mortal Miasma, a great secret of heaven and earth is hidden.”

"Then let me congratulate you in advance on unraveling this mystery! When that day comes, I hope you can share some of it with me," Li Fan laughed heartily, speaking in an entirely natural manner.

"Rest assured, Fellow Daoist! Since you have shared the perfect Foundation Establishment Through Oneself with me without reservation, I naturally will not keep secrets from you either," Master Yin glanced at Li Fan with delight and said, "I never expected to meet someone like you in this world—someone so like-minded."

"Before coming here, I never expected to get along so well with you either," Li Fan also smiled with contentment.

"By the way, I believe you don't need to worry that deducing Primordial Golden Core will delay your research on the Immortal-Mortal Miasma. Based on my experience, alternating between the two and progressing in parallel would be best. When one reaches a deadlock, turning to the other might spark inspiration." Li Fan enthusiastically shared his own "experience and insights."

Master Yin listened, his eyes filled with brilliance.

The two, feeling as though they had met too late in life, engaged in deep discussions on the island for three days and nights.

Before parting, Li Fan extended an invitation to Master Yin.

"This island is too shabby—how could it match your distinguished presence? I have a small world of my own, with breathtaking scenery and a serene, natural atmosphere. It is the perfect place for us to focus on our research. Why not come back with me?"

In the Xuanhuang Realm, those who possessed their own cave-heavens or small worlds were either extremely wealthy or held high status.

Hearing this, Master Yin's eyes flashed with a trace of surprise.

He hesitated for a moment but ultimately declined Li Fan’s generous invitation.

"Though this island is small, I have grown accustomed to it. Perhaps when I grow tired of it someday, I will visit your place and take advantage of your hospitality."

Li Fan was not surprised by Master Yin's response.

With a look of deep regret, he bid farewell reluctantly.

Before leaving, he handed over his communication talisman, saying that they must stay in touch and exchange insights often.

After turning away from Yin Yin Island and flying a certain distance, he suddenly stopped.

Looking back at the island, Li Fan hesitated for a moment but ultimately abandoned the idea of using Formless Killing Intent to lock onto Master Yin.

"Master Yin’s strength is somewhat peculiar. He cannot be judged by the standards of an ordinary Foundation Establishment cultivator. At this moment, I have already gained his initial trust through the Foundation Establishment Through Oneself. There's no need to be excessive."

"Although Formless Killing Intent is secretive, I cannot guarantee that he wouldn’t notice it."

After pondering for a while, Li Fan finally left.

Flying westward, he passed through the Congyun Sea and arrived at Shilin Prefecture.

Since the fall of Jiushan Prefecture, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had attempted several counteroffensives, trying to reclaim it.

However, the perilous terrain of Jiushan made each mountain seem like a natural fortress.

Every counterattack ended in failure.

Chapter 820: Sudden Change in the Battlefield

Apart from the treacherous terrain of Jiushan Prefecture—where teleportation formation are ineffective and cultivators below the Nascent Soul stage cannot fly across the mountains—another crucial factor behind the repeated failures of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s offensives was the complete defection of the Lingyuan Sect.

No one knew what benefits the Five Elders Association had promised the Lingyuan Sect.

Under the governance of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, this organization had been known for its wavering loyalties. However, once it came under the control of the Five Elders Association, it was as if it had undergone a complete transformation—becoming utterly devoted and unwavering in its allegiance.

They even went so far as to capture and surrender several envoys secretly sent by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance as a show of absolute loyalty.

With the offensive on Jiushan Prefecture thwarted, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance promptly adjusted its strategy—shifting from offense to defense.

They reinforced their borders, dispatching heavy troops to guard key territories.

Even the defensive formations were activated to the extent of enveloping entire prefectures.

"Tianyuan Transformative Formation..."

Li Fan looked up at the sky, now tinged with a dull yellow hue, and sensed the vital energy being siphoned away from his surroundings. Narrowing his eyes slightly, he muttered:

"The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's defensive formation is indeed well-crafted. Unfortunately, it is far inferior to the Tianxuan Spirit-Locking Formation. With my Dissociation Disc in hand, I can break through it in an instant."

A myriad of images flashed through his mind.

In the next moment, with a subtle movement of his fingers and a whispered incantation, a vacuum-like space formed around him.

The formation’s ability to extract the world's vital energy ceased to function in his vicinity—yet not a single soul detected anything amiss.

"Activating a grand defensive array—under normal circumstances, even the Five Elders Association wouldn't be able to breach it in a short time."

"The war may soon reach a stalemate, and over time, as people forget, it will slowly subside..."

"No, no! Let me lend you all a helping hand!"

With a light chuckle, Li Fan’s figure flickered like a phantom as he flew toward the border of Shilin Prefecture.

Instead of crossing enemy lines into Jiushan Prefecture, he stopped near the White Mist Barrier—at a small border town called Heshi.

Inside the town, a squad of cultivators from the Martial Hall of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance was stationed.

Heshi's garrison commander, looking tense, was personally overseeing inspections of the formation arrays, restrictive spells, and other defensive measures.

Without alerting the guards, Li Fan silently infiltrated the town.

Once the patrols finally dispersed, he stealthily sought out Heshi’s garrison commander.

The commander’s name was Yu Dayi, a recently promoted Golden Core cultivator.

He had a round belly and a kind-looking face—an appearance of utmost honesty.

Just as he was taking a break, sipping a cup of spiritual tea to recuperate, he suddenly noticed Li Fan standing before him—without any prior warning.

His expression changed, and just as he was about to shout for help, he noticed Li Fan scrutinizing him with great interest.

Something clicked in Yu Dayi’s mind, and he swallowed back the words that had reached his lips.

"Who are you?" Yu Dayi narrowed his eyes and asked.

"You should be familiar with the Federation of All Worlds, shouldn't you?" Li Fan spoke in an eerie, distorted voice.

Yu Dayi's face changed again, but he remained cautious and did not confirm anything.

Li Fan, meanwhile, continued to size him up, letting out a sinister chuckle.

"The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is riddled with infiltrations—its downfall is already in sight!"

With those words, the aura around Yu Dayi subtly shifted, becoming unpredictable and dangerous.

"No need to worry. Aside from our Federation of All Worlds, no one else is aware that you are a spy for the Five Elders Association." Li Fan glanced at him indifferently.

At this moment, Yu Dayi finally dropped his pretense.

Though he had no idea how he had been exposed, he maintained the composure befitting a spy and responded calmly:

"Since you've sought me out, what do you want?"

"Isn't it obvious? The Five Elders Association has greatly disappointed us."

"After conquering Jiushan Prefecture, you should have pressed the advantage—seizing more prefectures in swift succession. Why are you content to stop here and remain idle?"

Yu Dayi’s expression darkened. “Surely you don’t actually believe that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is easy to deal with? This successful raid on Jiushan Prefecture was the result of meticulous planning. Have you not noticed how heavily fortified this border is? Just the grand defensive formation covering the entire prefecture is not something that can be easily breached.”

“hehe... Weaklings always like to make excuses,” Li Fan sneered, glancing at Yu Dayi. “Or perhaps... you all are afraid of that Immortal Ancestor, which is why you’ve been hesitant to make a decisive move?”

Before Yu Dayi could respond, Li Fan continued, “That said, your concerns aren’t entirely unfounded. Now is indeed not the time for a full-scale invasion.”

“However, making some further advances and expanding our battle gains a little won’t be enough to force the Immortal Ancestor to take action.”

As he spoke, Li Fan tossed a jade slip over.

Yu Dayi reacted quickly, catching it and examining its contents.

His composure shattered. “The flaw in the Tianyuan Transformation Formation?”

He looked at Li Fan in shock. “This…”

“You’ll know whether it’s real or not once you test it,” Li Fan said with a sinister smile. “The only question is whether you have the guts to do so.”

Without waiting for a reply, his figure flickered and disappeared from Yu Dayi’s sight.

Yu Dayi gripped the jade slip tightly, his expression shifting unpredictably.

This so-called cultivator from the Federation of All Worlds had a mysterious background and an astonishingly bold demeanor.

Not only did he know about Yu Dayi’s undercover identity, but he was also aware of top-secret information, such as the defensive formation of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

"…"

Yu Dayi hesitated.

“Should I pass this information along?”

“The frontlines are heavily guarded right now. If I want to succeed, I’ll have to abandon this hard-earned identity.”

After weighing his options, Yu Dayi carefully reread the jade slip’s contents.

Then, he made his way to a secluded part of the city, facing the vast Tianyuan Transformation Formation that enveloped the prefecture.

A few hours later, his expression remained unchanged on the surface, but his body trembled slightly.

It was excitement.

“It’s real.”

Yu Dayi took a deep breath, suppressing his exhilaration, and carried on as if nothing had happened.

Three days later, seizing a rare opportunity, he found an excuse to leave Heshi City.

From the shadows, Li Fan slowly revealed himself.

“I hope the Five Elders Association doesn’t disappoint me.”

Yu Dayi’s sudden disappearance quickly caught the attention of the cultivators stationed in the city’s Martial Hall.

When they confirmed that he had indeed defected, they hastily sent out a border-wide alert for his capture.

But by then, Yu Dayi had already successfully returned to Jiushan Prefecture and rejoined his organization.

After only half a month of fragile peace—before the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance could even conclude its investigation into the Heshi City spy incident—a fierce storm of attacks from the Five Elders Association struck.

And it wasn’t just Shilin Prefecture.

Battles erupted simultaneously along the entire border.

The once-reliable defensive formation of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance proved completely useless, as if it had never existed.

Caught completely off guard, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance suffered catastrophic losses.

Within just seven days, news arrived that several prefectures had already fallen.

Only Shilin Prefecture, due to its heavy military presence, was still barely holding out.

The sudden shift in the war was beyond anyone’s expectations.

The alliance’s cultivators were thrown into panic.

Chapter 821: The First Clash of the Immortal Alliance

Just as everyone thought the battle was about to become one-sided...

Squad after squad of black-clad cultivators arrived at the battlefield through teleportation formation across various regions.

Their origins were unknown.

Yet, each of them was at least at the Nascent Soul Realm, with Soul Transformation cultivators as the backbone and Dao Integration experts leading them.

Their combat prowess was terrifying.

It had been centuries since the Xuanhuang Realm last saw a large-scale war.

However, these cultivators carried a heavy aura of slaughter, as if they had been battle-hardened through countless life-and-death encounters.

Their coordination was flawless, and their attacks were swift and ruthless.

A small squad of four to five Nascent Soul cultivators could surround and kill a Soul Transformation expert.

Meanwhile, the Dao Integration leader of these black-clad cultivators was so powerful that even the Dao Integration experts of the Five Elders Association were forced to retreat in succession.

The tide of battle shifted in an instant.

Hiding in Shilin Prefecture, Li Fan happened to witness the power of these black-clad cultivators.

What impressed him the most was, of course, their Dao Integration leader.

It was as if he had condensed the heavenly thunder into a silver spear in his hand.

In an instant, the entire Shilin Prefecture was illuminated.

The silver spear roared like a dragon, stirring the heavens and the earth.

Even though Li Fan was only observing from a distance, he was still affected. It felt as if he had been caught in a stormy sea, with the surrounding spiritual energy roaring in turmoil. His internal spiritual energy was forced into resonance, causing his movements to slow.

Before the attack was even unleashed, countless Five Elders Association cultivators were already plummeting from the sky.

In the end, a single wooden fan blocked the silver thunder, preventing the Five Elders Association from being completely annihilated.

“This technique... looks familiar. Wu?” Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

Before he could dwell on it further, an unexpected change unfolded on the battlefield.

Despite suffering a minor setback, the Five Elders Association immediately chose to retreat in an orderly fashion—without hesitation, as if they had anticipated this outcome.

It was clear they had a contingency plan.

Aside from the Dao Integration expert wielding the wooden fan, another individual, a man seated in a wooden wheelchair, calmly unfurled a formation scroll.

In mere moments, numerous formations were deployed across the battlefield, delaying and obstructing the Immortal Alliance’s pursuit.

The Five Elders Association’s retreat was precise and disciplined.

Within moments, they withdrew like a receding tide.

All that remained was the devastated battlefield, a silent testament to the brutal clash that had just occurred.

“This wasn’t an all-out war—it was a probe. If they could win in one decisive strike, all the better.”

“If not, they would withdraw immediately.”

Li Fan gazed at the battlefield, where the Immortal Alliance cultivators—having narrowly survived—still bore expressions of shock and fear.

Meanwhile, the black-clad reinforcements, rather than pursuing the retreating Five Elders Association, remained hovering in the air, wary of a counterattack.

Only after the frontline defenses were fully reorganized did they finally vanish into the night as streaks of black light.

Although the timely arrival of these black-clad cultivators had prevented a complete collapse of the battlefield, the sheer swiftness of their previous defeat left the entire Immortal Alliance furious.

First, all defensive formations across the regions were rapidly upgraded, replacing the Tianyuan Transformation Formation with the Ten Thousand Miles Mountain and River Formation, which was far more defensive in nature.

Then, the Strategy Formation Hall of the Immortal Alliance initiated a top-down internal investigation.

There was no doubt—the Five Elders Association’s ability to breach the Immortal Alliance’s defenses so effortlessly was linked to a security breach in the defensive formations.

Ordinary formation masters could only grasp a small portion of a grand formation.

But for someone to know every weakness and vulnerability of the entire formation...

It had to be someone from the upper ranks of the Strategy Formation Hall!

If this traitor was not eliminated, no matter how many times they modified their defensive formations, they would remain completely exposed in the enemy’s eyes.

The gravity of this matter was undeniable.

Not only at the Immortal Alliance headquarters, but in every regional Strategy Formation Hall, formation masters were being taken away for investigation.

Although the Five Elders Association had temporarily retreated, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance was plunged into intense turmoil.

Congyun Sea, Haixuan Island.

On Haixuan Island within Congyun Sea, Ji Shaoli was enthusiastically welcoming the cultivators who had come to attend the gathering.

Most of them were stationed as guardians of various islands, while others held official positions on Ten Thousand Immortal Island.

Even though they were not overwhelmed with responsibilities, given the tense circumstances of the current situation, they were still extremely busy.

The fact that they were able to make time to attend today’s banquet was already a great show of respect for Ji Shaoli.

"It's a pity that the Fellow Daoists from the Formation Hall were unable to honor us with their presence today," said Ji Shaoli’s clone with a look of regret.

"Haha, they are currently overwhelmed with various investigations and reviews. They truly have no time to spare," a cultivator immediately sighed in response.

"To think that even the top-secret [Defensive Grand Formation] could be sold out. It’s clear that the upper echelons of the Strategy Formation Hall have become thoroughly corrupt."

"I heard that, in order to quell this incident, the chief formation master of the Strategy Formation Hall, Lu Xichan, has voluntarily applied to step down. Tsk tsk…"

"In my opinion, it's not just the Formation Hall. The entire upper leadership of the Immortal Alliance…"

"Ahem, Daoist Zhang, be careful with your words…!"

Everyone present was employed within the structure of the Immortal Alliance. Ji Shaoli had merely brought up the topic, and it immediately sparked an intense discussion among them.

However, as the conversation progressed, the topics became increasingly sensitive and taboo.

Sensing the potential danger, everyone tacitly chose to drop the subject.

"By the way, Daoist Ji, have you changed your habits? In the past, your island was always filled with stunning female cultivators attending to you. But today, not a single one is in sight?"

"Haha, a while ago, Daoist Ji dismissed a whole group of them. I thought he had found a new love elsewhere, but surprisingly, even after all this time, he hasn’t taken action. That’s quite unusual!"

Faced with the curiosity and inquiring gazes from all around, Ji Shaoli let out a long sigh and said:

"Nothing more than growing tired of it all."

"After indulging in pleasures for so long, I eventually felt a sense of emptiness."

"Especially after the sudden outbreak of war not long ago… A good friend of mine from Shilin Prefecture suddenly perished, and it served as a wake-up call for me."

"Compared to indulging in entertainment, my own cultivation and realm are far more important."

"The situation is shifting by the day, and no one knows which direction things will head next. The higher one's cultivation realm, the greater one's chances of survival in the future!"

Ji Shaoli’s words immediately resonated with many of those present.

"Even though Congyun Sea is on the borderlands, it still shares a boundary with the territory of the Five Elders Association. Who knows when they might suddenly launch an attack? We must be prepared!"

However, others expressed concern, their faces filled with unease:

"Most of us are only at the Foundation Establishment or Golden Core stage. If a major war truly breaks out… we would be nothing more than leaves drifting in the wind…"

Ji Shaoli sighed at the right moment and said:

"Life and death are beyond our control!"

This single statement deeply moved the cultivators present.

Their expressions varied, each lost in thought.

Ji Shaoli then changed the topic:

"This is also one of the reasons I invited you all here today."

"You all know that I once won the grand prize from [Fixed Fish], earning a considerable fortune."

Immediately, all eyes turned to him.

Indeed, if he weren’t wealthy, these people wouldn’t have treated him with such respect.

Wasn’t it because they were hoping that, in a critical moment, they could borrow some contribution points from him to get by?

"Furthermore, I have some knowledge of investment. Over the years, despite indulging in extravagance and spending a lot, my net worth has actually doubled."

Ji Shaoli spoke with a hint of pride on his face.

Chapter 822: The Congyun Mutual Aid Association

“?”

As soon as Ji Shaoli spoke, the entire room was shocked.

It was already astonishing that the first-place prize of five million contribution points was beyond what most cultivators could accumulate in a lifetime.

And now, in such a short time, his fortune had doubled?

He Zhenghao was so stunned that he immediately stood up. “Brother Ji, you must be joking, right?”

Ji Shaoli’s expression darkened as he solemnly declared, “Would I speak nonsense about something like this?”

Realizing his mistake, He Zhenghao cupped his fists and apologized, “I was too abrupt.”

With Ji Shaoli personally confirming his words, the cultivators present began to look at him with a hint of fervor in their eyes.

At least ten million contribution points—not just in the Congyun Region, but even in the core central regions of the Immortal Alliance, such wealth was considered significant.

“Brother Ji, stop keeping us in suspense! Why did you gather us here today?”

“Yeah, surely not just to flaunt your wealth?”

The crowd murmured among themselves.

Ji Shaoli raised his hand, and silence immediately followed.

All eyes were fixed on him, waiting for his words.

“A great war is on the horizon, and the situation is uncertain. We must plan ahead.”

“One person's strength alone is insufficient to face the coming storm. That is why we must act together.” Ji Shaoli spoke with unwavering determination.

The cultivators exchanged glances, uncertain about what he meant by “acting together.”

“Mutual assistance, unity. Sharing information and standing together in times of crisis!” Ji Shaoli looked around, his voice firm.

However, the people present were not naive youngsters who could be easily swayed by mere words.

They remained skeptical, waiting for Ji Shaoli to elaborate.

“As a group, the stronger our members are, the more beneficial it is for us all. I know that some among you have been stuck at your current cultivation stage for a long time due to a lack of resources to acquire the right techniques.”

“And it just so happens that I have more than enough contribution points…”

At this point, some of the smarter individuals had already guessed what Ji Shaoli was about to propose. However, they still found it hard to believe and stared at him intently.

“So, for any brother willing to join our Mutual Aid Association, I will lend the necessary contribution points for acquiring cultivation techniques.”

“There will be no interest. You only need to repay it gradually over time. In fact, you can even reduce or eliminate your debt by completing tasks assigned by the Mutual Aid Association.”

Although it wasn’t a handout, an interest-free loan with no collateral was an offer too tempting for many cultivators to ignore.

“Since my current resources are limited, I must consider everyone present. For now, the maximum loan per person is set at 100,000 contribution points.”

“However, as members complete more tasks within the Mutual Aid Association, their borrowing limit will increase. There will also be additional benefits…”

Ji Shaoli continued to explain in detail how the Mutual Aid Association would operate.

“Joining the Mutual Aid Association does not require signing any binding contract. If someone wishes to leave, they only need to repay their debts to do so freely.”

“Borrowing contribution points also does not require any form of collateral or restrictions.”

“However, those who deliberately violate the rules will face the collective judgment of the association’s brothers!”

Ji Shaoli’s expression grew stern, and a faint killing intent surfaced.

Many of the cultivators present felt a chill run down their spines.

“I knew it—Brother Ji, you are no ordinary person. To come up with such a bold idea…”

“I’m in!”

The first to respond was Pei Tuo, a Golden Core cultivator and the guardian of Haitong Island.

In a past life, Li Fan had crossed paths with him once before.

This person had already reached the perfection stage of the Golden Core Realm for over ten years, yet he still hadn't accumulated enough contribution points to exchange for Nascent Soul cultivation techniques. Let alone finding a suitable Cave-Heaven to devour.

Wasting such precious time—how could he not be anxious?

Now, encountering such a heaven-sent opportunity, he did not hesitate and agreed on the spot.

Even if joining the Mutual Aid Association came with restrictions and constraints, he was willing to accept them!

If he could step into the Nascent Soul Realm just one day earlier, his entire future could be completely different!

Ji Shaoli clapped his hands and praised, "Refreshing! Fellow Daoist Pei, rest assured—since you are the second member of the Mutual Aid Association, I will not treat you unfairly!"

Naturally, the first member referred to Ji Shaoli himself.

Ji Shaoli's lips moved slightly, as if whispering something to Pei Tuo.

Upon hearing it, Pei Tuo's body trembled violently, his face full of shock and disbelief as he stared at Ji Shaoli.

Ji Shaoli merely smiled and raised a hand to interrupt whatever Pei Tuo was about to say.

However, the sheer excitement on Pei Tuo's face did not go unnoticed by the others present.

He stood up and sat beside Ji Shaoli, then turned to look at the remaining cultivators who had yet to make their decision.

Although everyone was extremely curious about what kind of benefits Ji Shaoli had promised Pei Tuo, they did not let themselves be swept away by impulse and rush to join the Mutual Aid Association.

After all, no one could be sure whether Pei Tuo and Ji Shaoli were simply putting on an act together.

Caught in hesitation, not a single person spoke up.

Ji Shaoli, however, remained calm. Instead, he spoke gently, "There’s no rush. Whenever you make your decision, you can come find me."

"But let me make one thing clear in advance."

"Those who join earlier will receive preferential treatment in various aspects. The later you join, what was once freely available may have to be earned through your own efforts."

Though his words were somewhat vague, they carried an undeniable sense of pressure.

By the time the banquet concluded that day, a total of six cultivators—including Pei Tuo—had chosen to be the first to join the Mutual Aid Association.

"Fellow Daoist He, are you sure you don’t want to reconsider?"

Ji Shaoli smiled as he looked at He Zhenghao, who was about to leave.

"Brother Ji, don't worry. I’ll give it some thought after I return. You’ll have my answer soon!" He Zhenghao promised confidently.

Ji Shaoli did not press further.

Once the other cultivators had dispersed, Ji Shaoli turned to the six who remained.

Two Golden Core cultivators, four Foundation Establishment cultivators.

He reactivated the Taihuang Eight Extremes Dragon-Slaying Formation, sealing the island.

Ji Shaoli looked at the group and nodded in satisfaction. "Excellent. You all are now the elders of our Mutual Aid Association."

"Fellow Daoist Ji, are you truly not enforcing any contractual restrictions within the association?" asked another mid-stage Golden Core cultivator, Xiang Xin.

Ji Shaoli chuckled. "What bond could be stronger and more reliable than shared interests? I’ve said it before—the purpose of establishing this association is mutual aid and mutual benefit, to overcome tribulations together."

Xiang Xin remained silent, merely nodding in acknowledgment.

The others also chose not to comment, neither agreeing nor objecting.

Only Pei Tuo, unable to contain himself any longer, spoke up.

After receiving a subtle nod from Ji Shaoli, he eagerly asked, "Brother Ji, about what you said earlier—the information on an unclaimed Nascent Soul Cave-Heaven…"

"Is it really true?"

Chapter 823: The Mysterious Origin of the Cave Heaven

As soon as Pei Tuo spoke, the others present were immediately shocked.

At the same time, they suddenly came to a realization.

No wonder Pei Tuo had lost his composure earlier—what Ji Shaoli had promised was actually an unclaimed Nascent Soul-level Cave Heaven!

It must be understood that for a Golden Core cultivator aiming to ascend to the Nascent Soul stage, such a place was a necessity.

Each unclaimed Cave-Heaven practically represented the rise of a future Nascent Soul cultivator.

Its value was immeasurable.

Unless one chose to pledge allegiance to one of the prominent families within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, the only alternative was to rely entirely on luck to find one.

Difficult, difficult, difficult!

Foundation Establishment and Golden Core cultivators in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance were as abundant as crops in the fields, coming and going in cycles.

But Nascent Soul cultivators? They were considered to have truly stepped into the higher ranks, holding key positions across various regions.

They were the backbone of the Immortal Alliance.

The gap between realms was truly like night and day.

However…

Ji Shaoli himself was only at the Golden Core stage—could he really provide information about an unclaimed Cave-Heaven for the members of the Mutual Aid Association?

Was that even possible?

A trace of doubt flashed through everyone’s minds.

It wasn’t that they were overly skeptical.

It was just that this claim was…

Too unbelievable.

Not to mention that Ji Shaoli was all alone, without any backing or powerful force supporting him.

Even if he were part of some secretive organization, possessing an unclaimed Cave-Heaven would attract countless willing followers.

Why, then, would he bother recruiting in the Congyun Sea?

Could it be… the Five Elders Association?

As soon as this thought emerged, the initially excited crowd suddenly felt a chill run through them. The more they thought about it, the more uneasy they became.

Ji Shaoli, however, could clearly see what was going through their minds.

He chuckled and said, “There’s no need to overthink. I can assure you, I am definitely not some spy from the Five Elders Association.”

“The unclaimed Cave-Heaven I prepared for Pei Tuo is also within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s territory.”

Only then did the crowd breathe a sigh of relief.

“The Mutual Aid Association is still in its early stages, so your doubts are understandable. However, facts speak louder than words. Once Pei Tuo successfully advances to the Nascent Soul stage, all skepticism will naturally vanish.” Ji Shaoli spoke with unwavering confidence.

“But before that happens, let’s resolve your matters first.”

Ji Shaoli clapped his hands lightly. Moments later, a projection of a faceless stone statue appeared in the grand hall of the cave mansion.

“This is the True Immortal of Compassion and Mercy in the Mortal World. All you need to do is sincerely pray to it and recite the membership oath in your heart. That will complete the initiation process.”

“After that, I will transfer contribution points to you.” Ji Shaoli introduced with a smile.

“That simple?” Xiang Xin asked doubtfully.

“Yes, it’s that simple. The Mutual Aid Association does not deal in mysticism.” Ji Shaoli affirmed.

Hearing this, everyone turned to gaze at the faceless stone statue hovering in the air.

It did not appear particularly extraordinary, but there was a faint, indescribable aura emanating from it.

Something about it suggested it was no ordinary statue.

With the temptation of an unclaimed Cave-Heaven before him, Pei Tuo had no fear. He was the first to step forward and silently recite the oath in his heart.

A moment later, he lifted his head. “That’s it?”

It seemed like nothing had happened.

“That’s it. Welcome to the Mutual Aid Association.” Ji Shaoli beamed with a warm smile.

Seeing this, the others followed suit.

It did not take long before the first six members of the Mutual Aid Association had completed their initiation.

Ji Shaoli kept his promise and immediately transferred 100,000 contribution points to each of them.

When they confirmed, through the Tianxuan Mirror on the island, that they had indeed received this massive sum of points, their expressions became dazed, as if they were in a dream.

“The strength of the Mutual Aid Association lies in quality, not quantity. So please, do not spread this information indiscriminately. However, if you have exceptionally talented friends or family, you may introduce them to the Association.”

Before sending them away, Ji Shaoli once again reminded them.

After the group departed, Ji Shaoli turned around and looked at Pei Tuo, who appeared somewhat impatient.

"I wonder, Brother Pei, what kind of Foundation Establishment rare treasure and Golden Core method you are using? And what kind of Nascent Soul cultivation technique are you planning to cultivate?" Ji Shaoli suddenly asked.

Pei Tuo hesitated for only a moment before answering in full detail.

"I achieved my Dao Foundation with the [Wall of Solid Rock] and formed my Golden Core through the three methods of Protection, Life, and Earth."

"I have set my sights on a cultivation technique called The Eight Directions Immovable Earth Sealing Art."

Ji Shaoli first praised him, "Your Foundation Establishment rare treasure and Golden Core method complement each other perfectly. Brother Pei, you are truly remarkable."

Before Pei Tuo could respond, Ji Shaoli continued, "I happen to know of a place called Thousand Rock Cave-Heaven, which aligns perfectly with your cultivation path."

"What do you think?"

"Thousand Rock Cave-Heaven? That would be absolutely ideal!" Upon hearing this, Pei Tuo was overjoyed.

However, the next moment, a realization struck him, and his body suddenly stiffened.

He looked at Ji Shaoli, who stood not far away, and felt an indescribable shock in his heart.

To be able to cultivate all the way to the peak of the Golden Core stage relying solely on his own abilities

Pei Tuo was by no means a fool.

He keenly sensed that something was off.

Ji Shaoli just happened to know of a Thousand Rock Cave-Heaven that matched his cultivation path perfectly…

How could there be such a coincidence?!

One must know that most Nascent Soul cultivators struggle to find a Cave-Heaven that aligns well with their Foundation Establishment and Golden Core methods.

After all, finding any Cave-Heaven to achieve Nascent Soul was already an extraordinary stroke of luck.

Aside from the core disciples of prestigious families, who else had the luxury of being picky?

And yet, Ji Shaoli had specifically prepared a Cave-Heaven for him—one that seemed almost tailor-made…

Either it was pure coincidence—

Or it meant that…

Ji Shaoli knew of not just one, but many different Cave-Heaven.

And after learning about Pei Tuo’s cultivation path, he immediately selected the most suitable one for him.

What did this imply?

Only the topmost factions of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance would be capable of such a thing.

A chill ran through Pei Tuo’s heart.

An image surfaced in his mind once again—that Faceless Stone Statue.

The True Immortal of Compassion in the Mortal Realm, Deliverer from Suffering.

Just who… was Ji Shaoli, really?

As Pei Tuo's mind reeled with unease, Ji Shaoli spoke again, "Brother Pei, what do you think?"

"If you have no objections, let us set out at once."

Pei Tuo hurriedly agreed without hesitation.

Afterward, the two of them traveled through a teleportation formation, first arriving at Ten Thousand Immortal Island as a transit point.

Then, they continued their journey into the heart of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

This eased Pei Tuo’s concerns somewhat.

"At the very least, this has nothing to do with the Five Elders Association," he thought to himself.

Upon arriving at Gufeng Prefecture, they exited Floating Sky City.

Ji Shaoli cast a secret technique to conceal their presence.

Then, they moved swiftly, eventually reaching a desolate Gobi Desert.

After scanning the surroundings and ensuring no cultivators were nearby,

Ji Shaoli pointed into the air and transmitted his voice quietly: "The Thousand Rock Cave-Heaven is right here."

Pei Tuo was momentarily stunned, then flew to the indicated location, carefully sensing the area.

Not long after, he indeed detected an unclaimed Cave-Heaven, and his joy knew no bounds.

At the same time, he could hardly contain his astonishment.

"You may ascend here."

"I will stand guard for you."

Ji Shaoli said calmly.

Chapter 824: Void Thought Completes the Body

Pei Tuo responded with a nod and eagerly entered [Thousand Rock Cave-Heaven].

Meanwhile, Ji Shaoli remained outside, concealing the fluctuations caused by Pei Tuo’s act of devouring the Cave-Heaven.

After all, this place was deep within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, and the current wartime situation was tense. Although both he and Pei Tuo were members of the alliance, it was still best to be cautious and avoid unnecessary trouble.

Just like when Li Fan had devoured the Five Elements Cave-Heaven, the process repeated itself.

From within his Golden Core, fierce and grotesque Roots of Heaven and Earth surged outward, frantically extending countless tendrils.

These tendrils, as if possessing their own consciousness, embedded themselves into every corner of the Thousand Rock Cave-Heaven, coiling and tightening.

Ultimately, the entire Grotto-Heaven was completely enshrouded.

The space trembled and roared, dissolving into countless motes of light, which then merged into Pei Tuo’s body.

This process lasted for a full three days.

After three days, Pei Tuo suddenly reappeared in the Xuanhuang Realm.

The aura of a Nascent Soul True Lord surged around him, unsettled and turbulent.

Having been trapped at the Golden Core Realm for so long, finally breaking through filled Pei Tuo with an overwhelming urge to roar in exhilaration.

However, Ji Shaoli’s cold voice snapped him back to reality:

"Move. Do not linger."

Pei Tuo’s aura instantly stagnated.

Even though he now surpassed Ji Shaoli by an entire realm, he did not dare to underestimate him in the slightest.

The [Mutual Aid Association]—the force standing behind Ji Shaoli—was undoubtedly a terrifying entity. Crushing a mere Nascent Soul cultivator like himself would be as easy as flipping a hand.

Thus, Pei Tuo obediently followed behind Ji Shaoli, keeping a low profile as they swiftly returned to Congyun Sea.

Meanwhile, when the members of the Mutual Aid Association, including Xiang Xin, saw that Pei Tuo had reached the Nascent Soul Realm, they were utterly shocked.

They finally confirmed that Ji Shaoli’s words were not false.

Some of them even regretted not joining sooner. At the same time, their gazes toward Ji Shaoli grew increasingly fervent.

After hesitating for a moment, Xiang Xin couldn’t resist and finally asked, "Daoist Ji, if we break through in the future, will the organization...?"

Ji Shaoli interrupted him with a smile.

"Rest assured, everyone. As the first batch of core members in the [Congyun Sea Mutual Aid Association], once you reach the necessary level, an unclaimed Cave-Heaven will immediately be arranged for you! So, your primary focus right now should be to cultivate diligently and advance as quickly as possible."

His words instantly filled everyone present with boundless motivation.

They quickly returned to the Tianxuan Mirror on Ten Thousand Immortal Island, dedicating themselves to relentless cultivation, sparing no cost.

When news of Pei Tuo’s breakthrough spread, it sent waves of shock among the cultivators who had attended the banquet that day.

Before long, a steady stream of cultivators came to Haixuan Island, seeking to join the Congyun Sea Mutual Aid Association.

However, Ji Shaoli chose to shut his doors to all visitors, refusing every single one.

"The Dharma must not be lightly transmitted."

Watching from outside the [Taihuang Eight Extremes Dragon-Slaying Formation], he observed the various expressions on the cultivators’ faces and smiled faintly.

No matter how loudly they called out, he simply ignored them.

Instead, Ji Shaoli turned back to the Tianxuan Mirror Market, continuing to trade for resources.

Though six million contribution points seemed like a large sum, they were still far from sufficient.

Before the Mutual Aid Association could fully develop, he needed to gather more resources.

Spiritwood Realm.

At the very moment Pei Tuo successfully broke through to Nascent Soul, a massive feedback of cultivation energy unexpectedly surged into Li Fan's dantian.

Instantly absorbing this energy, his originally mid-stage Golden Core cultivation advanced by a considerable margin.

"It truly works! By using the nonexistent identity of the statue [Mortal Compassionate Immortal] as a transfer medium, the ultimate beneficiary is still my true self!"

Li Fan took a deep breath, his eyes gleaming with insight.

The key lay in the so-called oath of joining the association.

The main idea of the oath was that all brothers within the Mutual Aid Association, under the witness of the Compassionate Immortal, must support and love one another. All the conveniences provided by the association were bestowed by the Compassionate Immortal. Members must always keep this in mind.

"At this rate, it won’t be long before I return to the Nascent Soul stage."

"I just wonder if, at this point in time, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance has discovered the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven."

After pondering for a moment, Li Fan summoned Tianyang and instructed him to make a trip to Tianling Prefecture.

He wanted to check on the situation there.

"Just gather intelligence; prioritize your own safety above all else," Li Fan reminded him.

Tianyang nodded sharply before transforming into a streak of light and flying out of the Spiritwood Realm.

"With Tianyang’s strength, even if he gets discovered, escaping shouldn’t be too much of a problem."

"But his current Soul Transformation cultivation is still insufficient. Once I return to the Nascent Soul stage, I might consider helping him reach the Dao Integration stage."

A series of figures from the Spirit of Heaven and Earth flashed through Li Fan’s mind.

After careful thought, he locked onto a target.

The Spirit of Heaven and Earth were practically equivalent to Dao Integration cultivators.

Back in the day, even Crimson Flame, who was merely a furnace worker, forced several Soul Transformation cultivators from Congyun Sea to use their full strength just to barely defeat him.

More importantly, the entire Dao Integration process had to be completed in absolute secrecy, without alerting other cultivators.

Otherwise, they could end up doing all the hard work just for someone else to reap the benefits.

Even with Li Fan’s assistance, Tianyang would likely struggle.

Li Fan couldn’t help but recall the three members of the Medicine King Sect.

"Unfortunately, it will still take some time before the Medicine King True Cauldron returns."
