Anyone who had witnessed the abilities displayed by Ou Daozi and his son in the images couldn't help but feel an overwhelming desire to claim such powers for themselves!

For a time, a frenzy erupted across the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance as cultivators scrambled to search for Ou Daozi.

Several influential families even offered enormous rewards—anyone who could provide information on the whereabouts of Ou Daozi and his son would be handsomely rewarded with top-tier Dao Integration cultivation techniques.

"No matter how well you run, no matter how vast the world is, there will be no place left for you to hide."

Li Fan, the mastermind behind all of this, watched the increasingly frenzied cultivators. He recalled the mocking expression on Ou Daozi’s son's face and coldly scoffed in his heart.

When nearly the entire Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance united in pursuit of the same goal, the efficiency was terrifying beyond measure.

The events of the 115th cycle—exploring the White Mist and the small cave-world—had already proven this point.

Less than five days after the release of the images, Ou Daozi and his son, who had been hiding deep within a forest, were found.

Although they managed to escape using strange and unpredictable techniques, it was only a matter of time before they were caught.

Now that they had been exposed, under the relentless pursuit and surveillance of the Immortal Alliance cultivators, their capture was inevitable.

What surprised Li Fan, however, was that the father and son managed to hold out much longer than expected.

And in the process, their abilities and secrets gradually came to light.

Ou Daozi's son was named Ou Shangtian.

The abilities of foreseeing the future and reversing the time belonged solely to Ou Shangtian himself.

Currently, it was speculated that these powers originated from some kind of innate mystical artifact bound to him.

However, the ability to foresee the future was different from the initial assumptions.

Ou Shangtian could not predict every detail of the future at will—his foresight was only triggered when his life was under imminent threat.

In simple terms, he could foresee countless ways in which he could die, allowing him to navigate danger and find a path to survival.

As for the power to reverse the time, it aligned with Li Fan’s original speculations—it was not true time manipulation. Instead, it allowed Ou Shangtian to rewind an object's state or energy to a prior moment in time, within certain limits.

Moreover, during this process, he could establish a mysterious connection between himself and the affected object.

For instance, Ou Shangtian had once reversed dozens of attacks aimed at him and even absorbed the power of one particular technique, using it to annihilate an entire squad of cultivators before vanishing without a trace.

However, the power to reverse the time was not limitless. Each time Ou Shangtian used it, he needed a period of rest before he could use it again.

Once the truth became clear, many cultivators were deeply disappointed and abandoned the pursuit.

Indeed, while these abilities were formidable, they fell short of the legendary power to truly reverse time itself.

Still, a significant number of cultivators persisted.

After all, cultivators with such rare talents were usually absorbed by major factions and granted immense prestige. Now, with the opportunity to strike down a fallen genius, how could they let it slip away?

With a clear understanding of Ou Shangtian’s abilities, the cultivators coordinated their strategies during the chase.

Instead of going for the kill, they aimed for a live capture, rendering his foresight ability largely ineffective.

They refrained from attacking all at once, opting instead for continuous, wave-like assaults, wearing down his power to reverse the time.

As time passed, Ou Shangtian found it increasingly difficult to escape.

Finally, on the tenth day after the images were released, the father and son were cornered, with nowhere left to run.

Chapter 835: The Immortal’s Remnant Hand Bone

At the moment of crisis, Ou Shangtian erupted once again.

A dazzling yellow light enveloped an area spanning tens of thousands of meters.

All the cultivators caught in the explosion found themselves reverted to the moment before they had surrounded Ou Shangtian.

By the time they realized what had happened, Ou Shangtian and his son had already vanished without a trace.

Enraged, they continued their pursuit, only to discover that only Ou Shangtian remained on the run.

He put up a desperate resistance for half a day before a fortunate cultivator named Xie Xiantao finally captured him.

Faced with the covetous stares of other cultivators, Xie Xiantao made a swift and wise decision—handing Ou Shangtian over to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance in exchange for a bounty.

In truth, during his escape, Ou Shangtian had slain no fewer than a hundred cultivators of the Immortal Alliance.

Though it had been an act of forced self-defense, it still violated the laws of the Immortal Alliance.

Ou Shangtian had long been classified as a major criminal of the Alliance.

While the officials had previously remained uninvolved, it did not mean they had not been paying attention.

Sure enough, the moment Xie Xiantao publicly declared his decision, a squad of black-robed cultivators arrived on the scene within moments.

They swiftly took him, along with the critically wounded Ou Shangtian, away.

Thus, the grand manhunt that had shaken the entire realm had finally come to an end.

Yet, the other key figure in this incident, Ou Shangtian’s father, Ou Daozi, had seemingly been forgotten by all—except for Li Fan.

Luoyan Prefecture, In a Dark Jungle.

Deep within a shadowy forest, Ou Daozi lay concealed beneath layers of fallen leaves, grievously injured.

Yet, as he recalled how his son had overdrawn his own power and risked everything to lure their enemies away just to protect him, his heart felt as if it were being torn apart.

"Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance..."

His bloodshot eyes flickered with hatred as the faces of those who had participated in the hunt flashed through his mind.

His heart was filled with nothing but resentment.

Yet at this moment, he dared not move, fearing discovery.

He silently tended to his wounds, waiting for an opportunity.

“Sigh...”

A sudden sigh echoed through the forest.

Ou Daozi’s entire body tensed in shock.

He wanted to flee, but it was already too late.

Three familiar figures had silently appeared beside him.

“It’s you!”

Seeing Li Fan, the mastermind behind his son’s downfall, Ou Daozi’s eyes turned red with fury.

At that moment, he was ready to go berserk and drag Li Fan down with him.

But before he could act, he was forcibly suppressed by Lin Ling and Tianyang.

Already weaker than them, and now gravely injured with most of his strength gone, Ou Daozi stood no chance.

In just a short while, he was completely subdued.

"Strange, why are you looking at me like that?"

Li Fan chuckled innocently.

“I originally just wanted to ask you to help design a building. But before we even met, you and your son fled in panic, even going so far as to plot against my life. If not for my good fortune, I would have died on the spot.”

"I haven't even begun settling accounts with you."

“Besides, it was the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance that hunted down and captured your son. What does that have to do with me?”

Li Fan spread his hands, feigning innocence.

“Outrageous!”

Hearing Li Fan spouting such blatant nonsense in broad daylight, Ou Daozi was consumed by rage.

The veins on his forehead throbbed violently, as if he was ready to fight to the death.

"You're thinking about this all wrong," Li Fan shook his head lightly.

With a kind smile, he pulled out a crystalline, translucent fruit.

"Here, open your mouth. Eat this, and you’ll understand everything."

A deep sense of foreboding rose in Ou Daozi’s heart.

"What... what is this?"

Li Fan didn’t answer.

Instead, he handed the Fruit of True Temptation to Lin Ling, who force-fed it to Ou Daozi.

As the fruit slid down his throat, Ou Daozi’s struggles gradually weakened.

His gaze toward Li Fan also started to shift.

“Tell me… don’t you want to save your son?”

"Although companion artifacts are usually impossible to transfer, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance has countless means at their disposal. Who knows what kind of suffering your son will endure?" Li Fan whispered.

"The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance!" Ou Daozi's eyes instantly turned bloodshot with rage.

"The Immortal Alliance is ruthless, yet its power is vast. If you wish to destroy it and rescue your son, we must proceed carefully and strategically."

"Our Federation of All Worlds was founded for this very purpose!"

...

Under the influence of the True Temptation Fruit, Ou Daozi’s will was quickly rewritten.

He joined the Federation of All Worlds, dedicating himself to the destruction of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

From then on, he regarded Li Fan—someone who shared the same ambition—as a true comrade.

Through Ou Daozi, Li Fan learned the secret of Ou Shangtian's companion artifacts.

"My son has two companion artifacts," Ou Daozi revealed.

"One, I have known about since his childhood—the Book of Ten Thousand Deaths, which allows him to foresee the manner of his own death."

"But the other, the Kun-Qian Bone Hand, capable of reversing the forces of yin and yang, awakened two years ago when Mount Guiyuan collapsed."

"At the time, he had only just entered the Qi Condensation stage, yet he suddenly found himself facing such a catastrophic disaster, with his life hanging by a thread."

"In that moment between life and death, his potential erupted, activating the latent power of the Kun-Qian Bone Hand for the first time."

"The mountain collapsed, then reformed—such an astonishing event! That brat even kept it a secret from me all this time."

"It wasn’t until recently that he came to me in a hurry, urging me to leave. He said he had foreseen the arrival of a truly terrifying group of people..."

As they journeyed to the Spiritwood Realm, Ou Daozi recounted the entire series of events to Li Fan.

Li Fan remained calm. "Infinite futures, infinite possibilities. What he foresaw may not necessarily come to pass."

"If I truly intended to strike, with just these two by my side, you would already be powerless to resist."

Ou Daozi's gaze wavered in confusion before he let out a long sigh. "A mere misunderstanding... yet it has cost me the chance to see my son again..."

"There will always be another chance." Li Fan changed the subject, pointing toward the bustling construction of a small world. "Fellow Daoist, what do you think of my Spiritwood Realm?"

"Tsk, tsk, tsk..." Ou Daozi observed it for a while, shaking his head repeatedly with a look of disdain.

"The place is decent enough, but the design and construction plan are simply subpar..."

"It doesn't quite live up to the reputation of the Federation of All Worlds."

Hearing this, Li Fan showed no sign of anger.

Instead, he cupped his hands and said, "Then I shall trouble you, Fellow Daoist, to take charge and refine it."

Ou Daozi squinted his eyes before nodding in agreement.

As someone deeply passionate about such matters, he quickly became engrossed in planning and designing the improvements.

"Feel free to proceed as you see fit. If you need anything, you may speak directly with the Treefolk Chieftain of this realm," Li Fan added.

With Li Fan’s approval, Ou Daozi temporarily set aside his grief and devoted himself entirely to the construction of the Spiritwood Realm.

"Although it took some effort, the initial objective has been achieved."

"The Kun-Qian Bone Hand... the Book of Ten Thousand Deaths..."

Li Fan frowned slightly.

According to Ou Daozi, Ou Shangtian had yet to fully grasp the power of the Kun-Qian Bone Hand.

During his escape, he seemed to sense that even greater potential remained hidden within, yet to be unearthed.

If given more time, he might truly unlock some form of temporal reversal.

However, this was merely Ou Shangtian’s speculation.

The true nature of the artifact remained uncertain.

The most critical detail was that the Kun-Qian Bone Hand was, without a doubt, the hand bone of a certain existence...

Chapter 836: The Ancient Immortal Extinction Mystery

It is well known that the wonders of the Xuanhuang Realm are, for the most part, the remnants of fallen cultivators.

This is what is referred to as the wonders of man.

However, the wonders of the earth and the wonders of the heavens are essentially manifestations of the fundamental Dao of the Xuanhuang World.

The Kun-Qian Bone Hand on Ou Shangtian's body, capable of reversing heaven and earth, has clearly surpassed the realm of human wonders, reaching a level close to that of the wonders of heaven.

Yet, it still retains the form of a human hand bone.

This raises an intriguing question.

Think about the heavenly wonders encountered in the past—what did they look like?

The [Derivation Law Jade], the [Sword],

As well as the [Dao Pattern Compass], [Yin-Yang Jade], [Primordial Qi of Heaven and Earth], and so on.

All of them are entirely heavenly creations, devoid of any 'human' characteristics.

"The bones of man, close to the wonders of heaven."

"Perhaps only the legendary Immortals could achieve such a thing..."

Li Fan couldn't help but think.

Moreover, the shape of the hand bone displayed by Ou Daozi seemed somewhat familiar...

A flicker of blue light shimmered across the Dao-Deviation Stone, conjuring a memory.

It was the White Bone Pioneer Realm, which had once been used to deceive the people of the Li Realm.

Back then, among the many advanced realms available for lease, Li Fan had specifically chosen this one because of its uniquely shocking scenery.

Unlike other advanced realms, which depicted picturesque celestial paradises, this one was built upon a colossal left hand made of white bone.

The surroundings were filled with endless darkness and eerie silence, with the giant white-bone hand floating in the boundless void.

It exuded an aura of profound mystery, eeriness, and unfathomable depth.

According to Immortal Zimiao, who sold this White Bone Pioneer Realm, the inspiration for this scene originated from the legendary "Immortal" who, with a single thought, had created the entire Fallen Immortal Realm.

Li Fan compared the two images.

A perfect match!

A chill ran down Li Fan’s spine.

This was no mere coincidence.

Anything related to Immortals was now of extreme interest to him.

After some thought, his clone Ji Shaoli contacted the cultivator who called himself Immortal Zimiao, using the excuse of renting the White Bone Pioneer Realm.

Rather than using an anonymous alias, he directly revealed his identity as Ji Shaoli.

Unlike before, when Zimiao had been indifferent, this time he was extremely enthusiastic.

"Senior, have you heard of me?" Ji Shaoli asked with curiosity.

"Heh, since I do business, how could I not investigate the potential clients across all the regions of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance?" Zimiao replied with a chuckle.

"After all, there aren't many cultivators willing to spend vast amounts of contribution points annually to lease a advance realm."

Ji Shaoli immediately understood.

Originally, just winning the Fixed Fish Head Prize with a few million contribution points wouldn’t have been enough to attract Zimiao's attention. It was likely that in recent times, his clone had been exploiting foresight to speculate wildly in the market and amass wealth, which had drawn Zimiao’s notice.

Ji Shaoli, however, was not the least bit concerned. Instead, he put on a show of being extremely interested in the White Bone Pioneer Realm.

He immediately proposed leasing it for a century or even purchasing it permanently.

Zimiao’s enthusiasm grew even more.

He was now almost completely forthcoming, answering nearly every question Ji Shaoli asked.

Thus, Ji Shaoli gradually came to understand the origins of this White Bone Pioneer Realm and why it bore an almost identical resemblance to Ou Shangtian’s [Kun-Qian Bone Hand].

"A True Immortal's Molted Remains?" Ji Shaoli asked with keen interest.

"Precisely," Zi Miao replied enthusiastically. "The Immortal Sage, in his elder years, was fortunate enough to have seen an illustrated record of the [True Immortal's Molted Remains] before the Great Catastrophe. The images left a profound impression on him, so much so that even after thousands of years, he could not forget them. Hence, when creating this Pioneer Realm, he imitated its form and essence."

Ji Shaoli continued to probe for more information about the True Immortal’s Molted Remains.

"Before the Great Catastrophe descended and the path to immortality was severed, the Xuanhuang Realm still maintained communication with the Immortal Realm. Not only did the great immortal sects receive celestial artifacts bestowed upon them by the Immortal Realm,"

"But also, a set of True Immortal's Molted Remains had circulated in the mortal world. The exact person who came into possession of them is now unknown, but the truth of their existence was indisputable, with various clues confirming it."

"This bone hand is one of those immortal remains. In addition, there were also the Immortal's Body, the Immortal's Skull..."

Zimiao’s narration was filled with mystery, but suddenly, his tone shifted sharply.

"Up until just before the Great Catastrophe, there were still rumors of the True Immortal’s Molted Remains appearing in the world. However, once the catastrophe struck, not only did those remains vanish, but even the sects' most treasured celestial artifacts disappeared without a trace!"

"The resulting chaos was unimaginable, further accelerating the downfall of the immortal sects."

Ji Shaoli was momentarily lost in thought. "The immortal remains and celestial artifacts... all disappeared?"

Zi Miao sighed. "Indeed. Even now, it remains an unsolved mystery—no one knows where they went. However, in today’s Xuanhuang Realm, the only place still linked to ‘Immortals’ is likely the Fallen Immortal Realm. Because of this, many cultivators who are aware of this matter believe that the missing remains and artifacts are hidden within the Fallen Immortal Realm."

"Otherwise, why would so many Dao Integration cultivators persistently explore that place?"

"The Fallen Immortal Realm, huh…" Ji Shaoli murmured thoughtfully, nodding to himself.

After this, Zi Miao no longer provided any particularly useful information.

Following a round of bargaining, Ji Shaoli ultimately purchased the White Bone Vanguard Realm for 800,000 Contribution Points.

It was evident that it had been a long time since Zimiao had encountered such a wealthy client, as his tone was filled with excitement. He even promised a hundred years of free realm maintenance and offered future discounts should Ji Shaoli need to purchase another advance realm.

The process of transferring ownership was carried out smoothly and required no further mention.

Returning to Li Fan’s true self.

"The person behind this account is likely not Immortal Sage Zimiao himself."

"To be able to carve out a space within the void, even among Dao Integration cultivators, is no small feat. Such a person wouldn’t be so materialistic."

Li Fan then turned his attention to the connection between the True Immortal’s Molted Remains and the [Kun-Qian Bone Hand].

"The True Immortal’s Molted Remains ended up in the Xuanhuang Realm."

"The power of heaven and earth cycles through all things, seeking to devour and refine such remains, integrating them into its own laws."

"Judging by the appearance of this [Kun-Qian Bone Hand], it seems that this process was at least partially successful."

"But what about the rest of the True Immortal’s Molted Remains—where have they gone now?"

"The Derivation Law Jade, the Dao Pattern Compass—could they also be related to the True Immortal’s Molted Remains?"

"The most critical question is this: whether celestial artifacts or immortal remains, they are treasures of unfathomable value. The great immortal sects would have safeguarded them with the utmost vigilance. And yet, under such circumstances, they still vanished without a trace..."

"Interesting."

Li Fan’s eyes flickered as he pondered possible explanations.

However, such ancient secrets could not possibly be unraveled with his mere mid-grade Dao Deviation Stone alone.

Before long, Li Fan had no choice but to set aside his speculations with a hint of regret.
